There's nothing special or big about it but whatever they're trying to tell, it delivers. The movie is very emotional I kept smiling and sometimes cries a little because of the nostalgia it brings (even though I'm not growing up with the original). The movie pays homage to the original extremely well.The Dogfighting sequences are one of if not the best in any action movie. The actors are literally inside the F-18 Super Hornet and F-14 Tomcat up in the air with cameras in front of their faces. But they aren't actually controlling the planes except for one guy (you know who that is, yes, it's Tom Cruise but he only flew the P-51 Mustang by himself in the final scene) and the camera placement around the aircraft is perfect making the sequences look intense. The cinematography is beautiful as well.I don't need to talk about the new soundtracks, they're just as iconic as in the original. Top Gun movies have one of the best opening scenes of all time.(SPOILER SPOILER)RIP Tom "Iceman" Kazansky, he's one of my favorite characters in the franchise.

Loved this movie! Went to go see it a few times in the theaters! I loved the first movie, but the second one... WOW... JUST WOW! It was incredible!!!! Loved the choice of soundtrack, it was more fast paced and didn't have a long drawn out and slow love story. For a sequel made 30 years later... outstanding job!

reviews.review_title: No one would understand the word "cheesy" until they've seen "Top Gun: Maverick"
reviews.content: I saw "Top Gun: Maverick" with my cousin during a 4:00 p.m. Thursday Screening. I thought while "Top Gun: Maverick" has mighty wings and isn't boring, it didn't take my breath away. Before I explain, I wasn't fond of the original "Top Gun" at all simply because I didn't get to feel the need or see it through the gay way. Mainly I didn't get the chance to grow up with the 80s or be a massive fan of the 80s stuff as many others did. However, due to the positive word of mouth, I wanted to give it a chance because I like to give movies chances and I am open to surprises. Here's my takeaway:It's definitely not a bad film, that's for sure. It also ain't no cinematic masterpiece or something that is considered cinema. It's just a fun-time popcorn nostalgia-fest flick that's all.There are many impressive visual and production sets displayed throughout. The advanced technical moments when the jets are flying are impressive and the effects on the flight sequences are well done. Those moments were the selling parts of the entire film and I applaud the production, sound, designers, and stunt workers to make great action sequences. Just like the Mission Impossible action sequences, it really did help to grab the attention. Gets you to feel the need and run into the danger zone. The camerawork is also pretty good. There are many good wide shots of the environment, good shots of the jets, and some well-done camerawork once the jets are flying up in the sky. All the performances are good, but nothing really wowing. Tom Cruise is good as usual as he puts lots of effort into his work. He plays well as a pilot and military-type person. Miles Teller, Jennifer Connelly, Jon Hamm, Ed Harris, Lewis Pullman, Glen Powell, Val Kilmer, and everyone else did their job to play well. No bad performances.But that's pretty much it since like the original, it's just another basic military action drama movie that is really really predictable. Every moment felt like something you have seen already a million times. Like you already know what is going to happen next, you already know what this character will do, what the next scene will be, and many pieces you can just easily pick up on. At times it really almost felt like a rehash of the original film but with updated technology and new characters that's all.But hey, that's what it is. Top Gun: Maverick is for nostalgia purposes and just pure food popcorn entertainment. Just to have fun. Nothing to care about in the plot. It is mainly impressive for the action and visual moments or for some people, only to see the famous celebrities rather than the narrative itself. The purpose is for nostalgia, that's all. Nothing to find anything new but to gain nostalgia or simply be entertained. I didn't really care about any characters at all. You got some of the original characters back and they are there. The loveable characters are back but in my opinion, I didn't connect with any of them as many others were able to. I didn't find Maverick likable or anyone else since the characters were bland or annoying.The original soundtrack I enjoyed but this new soundtrack was just alright. Hans Zimmer, Lorne Balfe, and Faltermeyer's scores were just alright. Lady Gaga's song for this movie just didn't work for me since I am not a fan of her music. Some of the dialogue was pretty bad. The directing was alright but nothing stands out besides the visual parts. Director Joseph Kosinski is good with visuals and CGI works as it provides with his previous films like "Tron: Legacy, Oblivion, and Only the Brave" Even tho I thought Only the Brave was fine and Oblivion and Tron: Legacy were disappointing, undeniably, Kosinski is great with what he does.Don't get me wrong. It's not a bad movie. I understand why people love this movie and why the original holds a special place in their hearts. A lot of people put their efforts and talent into this film. But at the end of the day, this movie wasn't my cup of tea. It's more for nostalgia purposes and for fans of the original. It really felt like I was watching a 2-hour military ad that is trying to tell me "Hey Kid! Join the Navy! If these people can do it, so can you!". At the end of the day, Top Gun: Maverick is an impressive visual fest but nothing too special. But I still enjoyed the flight sequences but that's all.But if you love this movie, that's great. I'm just a terrible person who didn't get to experience it like everyone did (I'm being sarcastic) and I'm glad you enjoyed it.

reviews.review_title: I hope this means we are finally turning a corner.
reviews.content: Finally, a movie that does what all great movies do, tell a story, keep you on the edge of your seat, make you root for the central characters, and do it all without shocking you with gore our outlandish vulgarity. Not to mention no obligatory "woke" forced characters or content. Let's hope this is a sign we are turning the corner on all of that.

'Top Gun: Maverick' shows the flying acumen of the title character, Pete 'Maverick' Mitchell (Tom Cruise) about 30 years after the events of Top Gun (1986). He is once again called back to the flight school, but this time, to teach a handful of new Top Gun graduates how to fly a seemingly suicidal mission against a secret uranium enrichment facility in the mountains. Included in the team of special trainees is Goose's son, Bradley 'Rooster' Bradshaw (Miles Teller), with whom guilt, resentment, and tension are thick.The film is excellently shot; similarly done to the original film. Multiple perspectives from the air combat scenes create a realistic story for the characters. Acting is great and the plot flows nicely, with decent character development overall. There are a few faults, such as the trainees who are introduced and then never really seen again, but it doesn't distract too much from the main narrative. The other note to mention is that, aside from Tom Cruise and Val Kilmer, none of the original cast members are in this film, save for some previous footage of Anthony Edwards' Goose character.Worth a watch!

reviews.review_title: Expected nothing got all I wanted
reviews.content: This is so good I felt like home. No politics, pure story and good writing to actually honour the original movie. Whole Hollywood should see and learn from this. I have nothing bad to say except for Kilmer teeth, what was up with them? However this is great writing, casting, actors and has nothing to do with the trend today. It's pure entertainment as movies should be. I understand why this making a huge money, it deserves it. Watch and learn.

reviews.review_title: Nice ingredients for Tropic Thunder sequel .
reviews.content:
Where to start from ?To make it short :
This was a nice nostalgic long video clip to follow up on the original movie, with amazing sound and realistic flight scenes, close to reality parameters and fighters performance ( although certain G force numbers are out of any standard and are exclusive to Tom Cruise)There was no story , no twist , every thing is predicted( the reaction on their face when they found out the guy from the bar is the legendary teacher , really? , and the worst was the classic heroic sound track which I thought no body will ever use again , but unfortunately they did ..This movie would be a rich material for Ben stellar to make ( tropic thunder 2) .
I love this movie for its stunts acting and more but the script is nostalgic which is fine I still love itI recommend to anyone who watched the first top gun.8.5/10.

reviews.review_title: Awesome flying with double cheese in top but just Star Wars 4
reviews.content: Only watched for the planes and flying sequences which are excellent. So bored of the bar machismo and stereotypical character - Jon Hamm being particularly awful. You know how the whole movie will pan out. In fact the movie could just be a video game with loads of cut scenes plugged in. Some serious plane hardware on display which means I can give it 5 stars. However the whole mission just seemed to be a Star Wars rip off - trench, tiny target, fly casual. As with Avengers no feeling that anything bad is going to happen to anyone so you just have to sit back with plenty of beer and let it wash over you. Really don't get all the 10/10 reviews - this is not a classic movie.

Miles, Stinkity dinkity didly done, Teller.No but seriously this movie was really really good, both visually and story wise. I really appreciate movies that have good cinematography, and ones with a great story and character development as well, then I'm sold! Defiantly will be watching this again.That beach scene though....

reviews.review_title: This is why we love Tom Cruise!!???
reviews.content: Sequel to Top Gun (1986), Top Gun2 was in making ever since 2012. Initially, Tony Scott, who also made the original, decided to start. However, after his death, the project was shelved, eventually taken up by Joseph Kosinski who took over in 2018 and after 2 years of delay, Top Gun 2 saw the light of the day.The sequel starts with #TomCruise returning to the role of Maverick which made him a household name. This time he will not just be flying the planes but also training the new bees who have been selected as the "BEST OF THE BEST" pilots in the word, to destroy the uranium setup at the enemy base.From the director of brilliantly made Tron Legacy and Oblivion, Joseph enhances the franchises with more adrenaline pumping flight sequences. The movie opens with a bang where Tom Cruise uses his swag, wearing his famous jacket and sunglass as he zooms past into the center where he flies the Mach 10 super sonic flight. The sequel delves into the crux of the plot - getting new joiners onboarded where we get introduced to new actors joining the cast.While the training sessions are engaging, it is the main mission on-air flight sequences which is an absolute masterpieceb that should be watched in theaters for ultimate cinematic experience. Kudos to the action choreographer and his team as each and every frame has been synced up well with almost actors actually flying the plane 😃Few scenes were a typical filmy, everytime somebody is always present at the enemy lines to save Tom Cruise and his fellow actors.Tom Cruise ages gracefully as he brings the charm with his impeccable performance. As usual, he does all the stunt by himself, proving that no one can be like him, as he puts his passion and effort to give the best. Rest of the cast are fine.

I have to admit this sequel is a better movie than the original one.Very refreshing and thrilling at the same time. So much fun watching this movie. I love the vibes. 10/10 tom cruise never failed us. Miles Teller and Glen Powell are also great too. Love all the components, I can find so many references to the original.I anticipated this movie, afraid this movie just rebooted the original one, but I was wrong. Maverick, his character development is very good, and we can still have flashbacks from the original movie scenes that can deliver this movie greatly till the climax.This movie broke the curse that every sequel movie always flops 😳😳😳. A great watch!!

This film was so good. Everything about it worked. Top Gun was a great film, but man... Top Gun Maverick blew it out of the water. This is a fantastic film, that everyone who loved the original will surely find some awesome things in this movie. There are lots of easter eggs and lots of homage to the first film which is cool. There are even some cameos that are fun as well. Overall this is a fun, emotional, action packed movie that screams America at the top of its lungs. Its a fun film that people should definitely check out.

reviews.review_title: Tom Cruise Delivers The Gem , As always !!!
reviews.content: IMAX Experience Of this movie , was just top of the world. Just WOW !! Very Well made , this sequel connected to each and every emotions shown in part 1 , Great Direction And Cinematography , Fantastic Jet Sequences Best Movie Of the year so far .. Definitely Worth Watching In theatres Specially In IMAX for once...

reviews.review_title: After failing long awaited Sequels/soft reboots a million times, Hollywood finally got 1 right!!! And this is that 1!
reviews.content: After failing long awaited Sequels/soft reboots a million times, Hollywood finally got 1 right!!! And this is that 1! Fail a million times, you are bound to get a great try eventually. And it's mostly thanks to Tom Cruise, he produces most his movies and he clearly has an EXTRA HUGE passion for what he does, and it shows! Love or hate Tom Cruise, it's extremely respectable what he does. He goes the extra mile by doing all his own stunts, used real jets in this movie to minimize CGI, but most importantly, the story here was ON POINT!The movie surpasses the original Top Gun in fundamentally every aspect. I never was a huge fan of the OG Top Gun, of all the big 80s classics, I always found it one of the lower tier ones. The sequel vastly improves upon pacing, character development, emotion, action scenes. I almost cried multiple times during Maverick.You don't really need to see the original to follow and get super invested in this movie, but it does help a little but. The movie is basically a super well-executed build up, with an amazing payoff in the third act. It's been SO LONG since I seen a movie's build-up done this well, and when it finally gets to the big pay-off, not only does it deliver, it KNOCKS IT out the park!!! It is one of the most edge-of-my-seat thing I seen in a movie in a VERY LONG TIME.My only 2 minor complaints is it's a bit formulaic, but that isn't bad at all when everything else is constantly knocking it out the park. My 2nd minor complaint was the love interest was just decent, but not bad at all.This movie is everything what a big blockbuster should be. A huge action movie spectacle that isn't braindead at all like most big action movies. If you love action movies, you'll most likely love this. If you are in the military, you'll way most likely love this! If you like amazing movies, you'll most likely love this movie! I cannot recommend this movie enough! I hope this movie makes a ton of money, because we need more like it.

reviews.review_title: Entertaining flight scenes, but little else
reviews.content: I had high expectations for "Top Gun Maverick", considering the hype and an IMDB rating of 8.5. But it became all too apparent within the first few minutes of the opening scenes, that this "new" film was basically a rehash of the original Top Gun, with updated aircraft and a lot more focus on Tom Cruise. The dialogue was mostly average, and often cringeworthy, and very cliched. But it's not all bad news either. The fighter jet scenes are nothing short of exhilarating, and you can see that a lot of effort went into filming them. Sound effects of the jets in action add to the immersive experience of this film. All in all though, I came away with the sense that I'd pretty much seen it all before (I just re-watched the original with my daughter before watching the new film), and the outcome was ever so predictable. I have no idea why this film is currently rated as the 58th greatest movie of all time. That's an insult to some truly exceptional films which are ranked well below this one. For a film to be ranked in the Top100 of all time I think it needs to be more than a mere 2-hour entertaining diversion, it really needs a solid script, engaging characters, and a story that that we might still be thinking about long after the hype dies down.

Very precisely processed - does not offend anyone, attacks against anyone, music, very good action of maneuvers, no intrusive quotes, no political statements - nothing is offended, legendary film - the legend remains.-repeated for pointless 600 chars-Very precisely processed - does not offend anyone, attacks against anyone, music, very good action of maneuvers, no intrusive quotes, no political statements - nothing is offended, legendary film - the legend remains.Very precisely processed - does not offend anyone, attacks against anyone, music, very good action of maneuvers, no intrusive quotes, no political statements - nothing is offended, legendary film - the legend remains.

Go see it on the biggest screen with the highest quality sound. Tom Cruise (and everyone involved in this film) understands not just his audience but cinema audiences in general. I laughed. I cried. I experienced anger and fear, sadness, and joy. It's got action and it's got heart. During the final act I found my heart pounding like I was running up a steep hill. This movie is a cinematic action masterpiece put together by maybe the definitive movie star of film history. I'm not getting into a breakdown. Just know that this is why we go to the movies.

This movie has you at Mach 10 from the get go. Another man versus machine idea, but this movie focuses on bringing an 80's classic into the 21st century, and it does it brilliantly. It had all of the adrenaline, machismo, and simplicity of the first movie, but with all the flashiness that new movies have to offer. Every time a character takes flight the audience flies with them and it will put you on the edge of your seat! The movies starts off a bit cheesy, but hits full speed once we return to Top Gun. Miles Teller does a great job as Rooster and Tom Cruise steps seemlessly back into the role of Maverick. There are plenty of look backs at the original movie, but the new crew feels fresh and new. Buckle up, because once Maverick takes flight, you will too!

Tom Cruise is a symbol of Hollywood movies.It was a great movie full of challenges, friendship and love.After watching this movie, you will feel a mixture of nostalgia and freshness.It's a two-hour movie, but it's exciting all the way through and never gets boring.Recently, with the advent of social media, more people are watching short videos, and fewer people are watching movies.However, movies are memorable and life-changing because of the long-term immersion and concentration of music, images, and stories.Top Gun: Maverick is definitely one of the best movies of 2022.I was able to spend a good time watching a movie after a long time. Thank you.

reviews.review_title: AWWWE.SOME.... A RIDE that GRIPS you
reviews.content: This was well worth the price of addmision. A total visceral joyride. I was literally off the edge of my seat IN A WAY i dont remember ever being watching a film like this... Ita captured the essence and then some...

I've seen Top Gun: Maverick three times since its release and can't get enough of this epic sequel that pays homage to the 1986 classic with superstar Tom Cruise in the lead. The movie is filmed in IMAX cameras, which gives fans the most exciting movie experience as they find themselves in the cockpits of those powerful F-18 Super Hornets and with zero CGI. The storyline is perfectly written and we witness Captain Pete "Maverick" Mitchell who lives on the edge as a test pilot and refuses to retire until he's given orders by the Navy to train new pilots, including Goose's son for a clandestine mission. Once again, Tom Cruise proves that he's a versatile actor, who gives 100% in every film while perfecting his stunts and even flying his own plane. Jennifer Connelly and Miles Teller are brilliant in their roles respectively. Top Gun: Maverick is the Summer's best blockbuster and it's the movie we've been waiting for.

reviews.review_title: Went expecting Independence Day resurgence; I got instead The Godfather part II
reviews.content: I honestly didn't have much expectations. This was a sequel I didn't ask for, that I didn't want ... and apparently that I didn't know I needed it this badly. Color me surprise, this movie is not just my favorite film of the year...it might be my favorite one of the last 10 years.... I had no idea going to the theater I was going to find this relic.Top Gun 1986 was okay..not my favorite from that year by any stretch of imagination, so why would expect this 2022 film to be any good. Boy I was wrong.
What can I say absolutely loved it, superb acting was impeccable great scenes and Tom cruise always always pleases. Absolutely fantastic you must go and watch it.

The best sequel in recent times after Blade Runner 2049. Tom Cruise in his late 50s is still the biggest movie star in the world for a reason, he doesn't need a franchise character to achieve stardom, he is the FRANCHISE. Tom Cruise has always been underrated as a performance actor due to his action work overshadowing anything else. In Top Gun Maverick we see a glimpse of Tom Cruise we used to see in his earlier movies.Top Gun Maverick is the perfect summer blockbuster you would be seeing this year, the movie surpasses the original by having a more relevant plot and better choreographed action sequences. Miles Teller does a decent job as being the "prodigy" but this role required someone like Lucas Hedges or Will Poulter to square up against Tom Cruise.It was great to see Val Kilmer again, but his role was nothing more than a cameo. Jon Hamm and Jennifer Connelly are very good casting choices who were able to measure up to Tom Cruise and play their parts convincingly. In an ideal world, movies like this should be in contention of winning awards too.

reviews.review_title: No BS, just straight action, heart and acting
reviews.content: Just got back from my second viewing. Fantastic movie. I haven't felt this satisfied coming out of a movie in a while. It still baffles me how they filmed this.The action isn't the only great thing about this movie. It actually makes you care about the characters.This is what happens when the creators care about a movie!

This is not only a great reboot/sequel, it is also a great movie. It doesn't rest on nostalgia and fan service. It tells a new engaging story that intrinsically weaves nostalgia and fan service into this new and better story. Tom Cruise gave his best performance to date in this one. Bravo!

reviews.review_title: Better and more believable than the first one
reviews.content: Maverick is a sequel that's better than the prequel. Maybe because of the passage of 36 years in between films, the second one has less glossy, more serious approach. The Cold war machismo was replaced by a more reflective (although no less action-oriented) attitude. Tom Cruise, playing the title character, has supplanted delovee3d here a nuanced performance. In Top Gun, he was preening. Here, he's acting. The differences relate also to the screenplay, with less testosterone and to the tone, that is more grounded.

What a great movie! So many callbacks to the OG. Cinematography was superb. So fun to watch. Love movies that put in the effort to make the movie worth watching. I think there was 15 minutes in this movie that is the most intense I've ever seen. Fantastic.

Its one of my favorite Movies, the Movie just feels so realistic that it gives you the feeling that you sit in the fighter jet. The story was good and it fittest to the first movie well. There wasn't a possible better start than starting the movie with "Danger zone". More than just a great Movie.

What a wonderful movie with solid Content and awesome cinematography. Realistic visuals and effects. And most important Tom cruise action scenes.I wanted to give 10/10 but unusual love story and slow beginning pulled me to 8.

I was 14 years old when Top Gun came out. Man, what a great f-king movie. It was great then and it's great now.Top Gun was peak 80s blockbuster and undoubtedly, peak Tom Cruise. Don't even get me started on Val Kilmer and the beach volleyball scene.However, for as good as Top Gun was, and again, still is, I was okay with Too Gun being Top Gun and leaving it alone.Honestly, I had zero desire to see Top Gun: Maverick and even though no one I knew who saw it would shut up about how good it was, I kind of took it with a grain of salt.That is, until I watched it tonight.I've never been more glad to have been proven wrong than I am right now. Top Gun: Maverick was as close to perfect as a movie can get. The script, the cast, the soundtrack, the nostalgia, everything about it. My only regret is that I didn't see it in the theater.

I didn't understand why this movie is so celebrated, nor why it was the highest grossing movie of 2022. It certainly does seem to be the case that "old is the new new" - the second highest grossing movie of the same year was a Jurassic Park flick.It could be that this is one of those movies that you need to see on the big screen to really appreciate. I watched it on my computer.It was exactly what I expected: lots of fancy footage of aeroplanes spinning around and flipping over, and a totally quotidian plot when we get back on the ground.I just couldn't get interested in it. Why is it supposed to be so good?

I know now after seeing this movie that I will never be a Tom Cruise fan. However, my initial impression of this sequel has definitely changed. I saw the first one in the theater in 1986. Since then I've seen it enough times to be pretty sick of it AND it's star. So when I heard that they were making this sequel I wasn't looking forward to it. That being said I'm proud to say that I REALLY enjoyed this movie. The filmmakers went above and beyond my expectations to create one of the best sequels I've ever seen.Cruise will always be a celebrity (not an actor) to me. Although this film has earned my respect for him and it's legacy.

reviews.review_title: Tom cruise!!! Wonderful and one of my best actors.
reviews.content: This movie is wonderful, perfect and truly interesting.I mean starting you could tell the movie was going somewhere, you just can't rate this movie below 10/10.

reviews.review_title: Knocked it out of the park
reviews.content: This film is pure nostalgia, and it would be very rare, I think, to find someone who doesn't feel this film dod justice to the first. My friends and I were on the edge of our seats the entire way through the journey. It may be cheesy all the references back to the first movie but I simply loved it and actually think I may prefer this one... which I never think of a sequel!!!

reviews.review_title: Sets a whole new bar for practical effects
reviews.content:
I didn't find the original one from 1986 too appealing, sure it was groundbreaking when it comes to the camera work in coordination with the pilots, but that was the only thing going for the movie, the story wasn't that rich and was filled with an over the top nationalism.Maverick is without a doubt a superior movie, which is not easy to do on a sequel - the obvious praise is of course the practical effects, the actors went through a great deal of training to prepare to withstand being on a jet plane during insane maneuvers while still acting for the camera. The results are worth it, no matter how good the CGI is your brain makes that connection immediately so when you see something real it's always refreshing, specially in action movies.For me that's the highlight of the movie, fantastic action sequences, breathtaking scenes (literally) during the plane fights, it's one of a kind and one of the best practical approaches I've seen for an action film.The story is not bad, they manage to design a good plot however, it has two major problems for me, it relies heavily on the story of the previous film (not necessarily a bad thing but also not original) and in all honesty it's not
that great of a story, it's engaging enough to not make the movie all about flying jets but a bit dry.It's hard to make a connection with the characters because there's not much back story and for me personally I wouldn't be emotionally invested mostly because, although they don't emphasize on the theme of war at the end of the day this is what these pilots are trained for, so all that risking their lives and having to do their mission, I don't agree or see the appealing in real life war, I understand the comradery between the individuals that fight but war makes no sense to me specially since most of the times soldiers are fighting for the interests of powerful people and for them to become even more rich, rather than actual interests for their country and its people.With that aside it's a great cinematic experience and highly recommended to watch in the cinemas!

First of all it is so refreshing that this film has not caved into the woke culture that is prevailing and spoiling the TV and Movie business currently. The cast are brilliant. So poignant to have Vil Kilmar and Tom Cruise characters meeting as older men - this scene had me in floods of tears as it mirrors real life to a large extent. The soundtrack is exhilarating and nostalgic - loving the Lady Gaga contribution too. The dog fight scenes were so realistic my tummy was turning over. Watched it on big screen - think that's a must. A sequel that wasn't really needed but we are all so glad is here- a masterpiece.
This movie restores my faith in the cinema. Many thanks to Tom Cruise and the whole crew for making this pure cinema experience. Best in years! Go see it, go see it now!!!

Wow. I've just come back from the movie theatre, and I'm trying to write a review, but the words just won't come out. I am speechless.If you, like me, watched this movie so many times as a kid, you're embarrassed to say how many. If you, like me, grew up with idolizing Maverick and you wanted to be a naval aviator. If you, like me, waited for a sequel all these years....You're going to love every moment of this movie. It leaves you breathless, on the verge of tears, basically the entire time. It's a tribute to the original, but also does its own thing in its own way. It has action, emotion, dialogue, amazing shots, script that just flows on its own, and actors that seemingly lived the characters they were portraying. It has everything, it is all you hoped for from a sequel, and then some. It is, simply put, what a movie is supposed to be. What art is supposed to be.Even if you have little or no relation to the original, you're in for a ride you'll remember as long as you live. It will show you why we all love Tom Cruise so much, and what he can do on the big screen.At almost 40, I thought nothing more can surprise me, blow me away, I was convinced I've seen it all, and boy, was I wrong.Thank you, Maverick, for giving me the goose bumps I haven't felt from a movie in a long, long time.Now, time to watch this one until I learn the entire dialogue by heart, which is something I may or may have not done with the original.
Top Gun Maverick is a spectacular movie. It deserves to be seen in the movie theater. The story, flying scenes, music is all perfect. Don't miss seeing this wonderful sequel in the movie theater.

Tom Cruise did a good job portraying Maverick like the 80s egomaniac he would of been.Plot pretty predictable. Checked all the PC checkboxes and made all the main pilots minorities, including one that continuously passes out mid air. Besides a few "that's would never happen" and cheesy scenes, it was entertaining.Flight screens were awesome and Val Kilmer's appearance was really touching.

reviews.review_title: Top Gun Maverick is easily one of the best movies that I've ever seen.
reviews.content: I thought making a sequel to Top Gun wasn't a great idea until I saw this. Top Gun Maverick is easily one of the best movies that I've ever seen.First of all, this movie doesn't make jokes at the expense of it's predecessor, pays tribute to the original in all ways it can , manages to keep the spirit of the original alive and yet surpass all expectations.It is well written, good acting by all the supporting actors, great background score, beautiful action sequences, great direction and the movie teaches valuable lessons about life.This will be one of the few movies I watch for a second time.

reviews.review_title: Exceeds the original film in every way possible
reviews.content: "Top Gun: Maverick" is the sequel to the 1986 action drama film "Top Gun". Directed by Joseph Kosinski ("Tron: Legacy", "Oblivion", "Only The Brave") and starring Tom Cruise, Val Kilmer, and Miles Teller, it exceeds the original film in every way possible by delivering a follow-up worthy of being considered one of the best sequels ever made.Thirty-six years after the events of the first film, pilot Pete "Maverick" Mitchell (Tom Cruise) still remains in the rank of Captain due to him intentionally avoiding promotion, which would result in him being grounded. Under the orders of his friend and former rival Tom "Iceman" Kazansky (Val Kilmer), Maverick is given the job of training a group of newly graduated members of the "Top Gun" program to undertake a dangerous mission. Upon meeting the young pilots for the first time, Maverick notices that one of them is Bradley "Rooster" Bradshaw (Miles Teller), the son of his deceased best friend "Goose" (Anthony Edwards). In spite of the initial tension he has between Rooster and the rest of the pilots, Maverick eventually earns their respect in the air as a skilled tactician capable of leading them through enemy lines.If you are ever required to name movies that define high-octane 80s action to a tee, I'm sure "Top Gun" would be fairly high on many people's lists. This is because it was able to appeal to virtually all audiences, with some great fighter jet stunts for the guys and a love story for the girls. Though the film was far from perfect, it managed to blend all of these tropes together so harmoniously that it rightfully cemented its status as a part of pop culture. I think Roger Ebert summed it up best by saying that "...the good parts are so good and the bad parts are so relentless". This belated sequel, which was 36 years in the making, is so entertaining that to merely call it better than the original would be a huge understatement.What I think separates this film from other sequels that capitalise on nostalgia was its ability to stand on its own without too much reliance on the original. In the first film, the plot was simple enough to follow that you could basically ignore most of the dialogue and watch everything unfold through its groundbreaking action sequences. Later, things would be counteracted with some cringe-inducing 80s clichés like the soundtrack blaring loud synth rock over a love scene between two characters. Here, the film keeps its 80s roots to a minimum by presenting a more modern look at how much naval technology has advanced over the past three decades.One scene in particular shows Maverick flying his old fighter jet, complete with all the archaic bells and whistles, alongside the high tech present-day jets piloted by the younger crowd. Despite being a technical dinosaur by today's standards, Maverick is able to manoeuvre his jet through the air with relative ease, showing these young folk that he is still a force to be reckoned with. In most sequels that feature an older version of the original protagonist, we tend to see them in a more vulnerable state, where they would believe they're in danger of being bested by the current youth. Here, on the other hand, Maverick is still just as confident and level-headed as he was in the first film, which is a refreshing change from that old formula. It's almost feels as though he's been in suspended animation over the past few decades and has now been thawed out for our own enjoyment.Taking over from the late Tony Scott, Joseph Kosinski steps into the director's chair to deliver a workmanlike, streamlined film that will make any doubters realise that this is a sequel we never knew we needed. As previously mentioned, the film doesn't play too much into the audience's assumed nostalgia for the original but it has just enough of it to remind us of its overall significance. Like "Tron: Legacy", another belated sequel directed by Kosinski, there are enough flashback scenes and minor Easter eggs to spark the memories of fans of the original while simultaneously informing newcomers of any back story they need to know. With that said, it isn't entirely necessary to have seen the original to understand the full scope of the sequel's story, except for one major thing.In order to fully grasp the importance of Maverick taking Rooster under his wing (pun very much intended), you need to be familiar with Maverick's close friendship with Goose in the first film. Since Rooster is Goose's son, the audience needs to know why Maverick is so insistent on ensuring his safety. The use of selected flashbacks to remind viewers of how close the two were would have been very helpful here, not just for the uninitiated but older fans as well. Unfortunately, the film only briefly glances over this, so some of the emotional impact will be lost on anyone who hasn't seen the original. Aside from that, everything else in the film is conveyed very effectively, especially with how Maverick is able to have remained such a skilled pilot after so many years.I'm sure many will agree that one of the best things about the original film was its brilliantly shot dogfights. Even today, they still stand out as some of the best choreographed, best edited aircraft combat scenes in cinematic history. But if you thought it would be impossible to outdo such exhilarating moments all these years later, you'd be dead wrong. This film takes what made each of those scenes so memorable in the first place and triples their entertainment value. The third act alone is one of the most exciting, nail-biting climaxes I've seen in recent memory. Planes pass through beside one another and flip upside-down with such jaw-dropping precision that you'd swear it was done through CGI. But no, according to some research, there's not a single bit of CGI used during these flight scenes. Instead, it is all real manoeuvrability pulled off by highly skilled pilots coupled with an equally skilled cinematographer. And best of all, there isn't any use of shaky cam to ruin the whole experience. Reportedly, these creative decisions were made at Tom Cruise's insistence so we have him to thank for that.Even after more than three decades, Tom Cruise is more than capable of delivering another exciting performance here that, like everything else in this film, is better than the original. His take on an older Maverick is quite satisfying to watch, showing that despite the whole world changing around him, he has remained true to himself throughout even the worst of times. It amazes me that this man is almost in his 60s but can still hold his own both physically and mentally alongside much younger cast members. Regardless of what you may think of his personal life, you've got to hand it to someone this committed to giving the audience exactly what they want.I also liked Miles Teller as Rooster, the young and ambitious son of Maverick's late best friend Goose. When he was first introduced, I half expected him to be arrogant and unlikeable given the hostility some of his fellow pilots initially show towards Maverick, but for the most part he tries to remain respectful. As the movie progresses, you really get the sense that Maverick and Rooster are forming a surrogate father/son bond, which makes their interactions so much more interesting. Without giving away spoilers, the film's final act makes great use of their teamwork, especially when things seem at their lowest point.In this growing age of nostalgia-based sequels, it is a pleasant surprise to see one that not only eclipses the original in mere entertainment value but also redeems it of some of its faults. Many years from now, people will look back on "Top Gun: Maverick" as a textbook example on how to do a sequel right, from the action scenes to the character motivations. Companies like Disney should take note because there's a difference between expanding upon an old story and milking a dormant franchise until it's completely dry. I can't help but wonder if there will be more belated 80s film sequels to look forward to in the future, because this one has truly taken my breath away. Regardless, I'd say things are looking pretty good.I rate it a solid 9/10.

reviews.review_title: Bravo U S NAVY and Tom Cruise!!
reviews.content: My husband and I loved the original. We took our parents to see it in 1986. They loved it!This time, 2022, we took our 25 yr-old son. We all loved it!We did the IMAX and it was sold out, no one got up, no one left for the entire movie. We were Spellbound!! So much Fun!!

reviews.review_title: TOM CRUISE AT THE TOP OF HIS GAME
reviews.content: Superb movie. This movie makes you want to run out and join the Navy. Excellent and truly realistic fighter jets scenes. This movie even had a little romance. Can Tom Cruise get any better?

reviews.review_title: One Of The Best Sequels In A Long Time
reviews.content: Top Gun: Maverick is how to do a sequel. I wasn't expecting much from a Top Gun sequel but this blew me away. It has some of the most intense action sequences i have seen in the cinema and really is some of the best action scenes period. The choice to use as much practical work rather than CGI is there to be seen and makes it so much better. Callbacks, ranging from the music to certain characters are worked really well here and shows Hollywood how to make a proper sequel.

What a rush. This movie was just so much fun. So much heart. So many thrills. Edge of your seat moments. Rare you get all of these things right. I had a blast watching and cannot wait to watch again.Every shot is iconic. You could pause this movie anywhere for a classic movie moment to frame. There's so many things to admire and soak in.Tom Cruise. Enough said. The man will go down as a movie legend. Already was, but this movie shoots him into the stratosphere. His persona throughout, his guidance to the other actors. He's a real movie star. Up there with James Dean, Steve McQueen. A legend in his own right.The effects, if you can even call them that, are insane. I've never had so much fun in a cinema. You feel like you're right there in the cockpit because the actors really are. Makes such a difference to know it was all shot for real. Will make it very tough for other airplane movies moving forward. Just breath taking stunts.So it's an instant classic. One you'll want to share with everyone you know. Take your kids, grandkids, so they don't miss it on the big screen. Like Jurassic Park, it's a moment in film history to enjoy being part of! A must-watch, movie event of the year. Worth the wait! Thank you Mr. Cruise. Keep the hits coming!
Unbelievably good movie. I was blown away and shocked by how great it was. It never felt cheesy. The jets, the acting was great. First time I've enjoyed going to the movies in years.

reviews.review_title: Top Gun: Maverick is an unforgettable experience that should be experienced at the cinema - My Ultimate Review
reviews.content: Did Top Gun: Maverick meet my expectations? Yes it did and I'm so glad I got to experience it at the cinema, it has to be one of the best cinema experiences I've ever had. The big reason being Tom Cruise who served as producer along with returning as Pete "Maverick" Mitchell. At the insistence of Tom Cruise, there are minimal green screen and CGI aerial shots in the film, and even the close up cockpit shots are taken during real in-flight sequences. This meant that much of the cast had to undergo extensive G-force training sessions, to withstand the physical demands of the G-force pressures during flights. That's the main reason why the experience was so epic, the jet sequences were top notch and sounded perfect. Overall, Top Gun: Maverick is superior to its predecessor in every way. With the aerial flight sequences and emotional weight being better by miles. I also need to praise the cinematography, it was visually a stunning looking movie.After more than thirty years of service as one of the Navy's top aviators, Pete Mitchell is where he belongs, pushing the envelope as a courageous test pilot and dodging the advancement in rank that would ground him.The cast includes many well known and recognizable actors, names like: Miles Teller, Jennifer Connelly, Jon Hamm, Glen Powell, Lewis Pullman, Ed Harris and Val Kilmer.Top Gun: Maverick was directed by Joseph Kosinski and written by Ehren Kruger, Eric Warren Singer, and Christopher McQuarrie, from a story by Peter Craig and Justin Marks. I found the writing to be such an improvement than the previous film, with it feeling more mature and just succeeding better with its themes. The direction was also quite great. The sound design, musical score and soundtrack was brilliant, the two latter ones being what made the first Top Gun iconic. With songs like Danger Zone returning, the addition of Slow Ride and Won't Get Fooled Again is used perfectly. The editing is another highlight.Though the film is similar to other action movies, maybe too similar to the first Top Gun. I still feel like it was an unforgettable experience and extremely entertaining, and at the end of the viewing, my high expectations were met. Tom Cruise was the reason this film worked for me, making the first film to have actors flying and doing all the aerial sequences. Just wow. Tom Cruise personally designed a 3-month aviation training course for the new actors to become ready to handle riding in an F-18. It made the film stand out like no other film. Another thing that stood out was how it was shot entirely on IMAX-certified Sony Venice 6K full frame cameras, specially developed for the film in order to shoot the cockpit sequences. Top Gun: Maverick will most likely go down in history as a box office hit and also a brilliant action film.
Legit masterpiece. Very few come close to this. This has got to go down in history as one of the best action movies and sequels ever made. Watch it on the big screen it deserves it.

This is one of those rare movie happenings.Where the sequel is better than the original.It happened with Terminator.It happened with The Dark Knight.It happened with LoganIt happened with Good,Bad,Ugly.IT HAPPENED WITH TOP GUN.9/10
I will not spoil anything.I will encourage everyone to watch the 1986 first.This movie is a light in trying times.Tom Cruise FTW.

reviews.review_title: I never liked the first film, but THIS was STUNNING!!
reviews.content: For fans of the original 'Top Gun' there certainly is a lot of nostalgia here. I've never seen the first movie. I mean, I've tried - three times! I just couldn't. The film was completely ruined by the childish love (lust) story. So much so that I never finished watching that film.I therefore wasn't really interested in seeing 'Top Gun: Maverick'. Boy, am I glad I decided to give it a try! I actually can't believe how GOOD this movie was! So much so, in fact, that it is one of the best movies I've seen lately. There was just so much here I enjoyed!Tom Cruise reprises his role as Pete 'Maverick' Mitchell. The film is set 30 years after the events of 'Top Gun'. Maverick is a Captain in the navy and one of the best pilots. He is ordered back to TopGun, where he is to instruct twelve elite Top Gun graduates for a dangerous mission. Their target is an underground uranium plant in a canyon, which has to be destroyed before it becomes operational.The first two acts follow Maverick guiding and teaching the graduates, and it was pure excitement all the way. He found ways for them to bond as a team, so they could work together. I actually enjoyed this part of the movie. But, by golly, was that final act exciting!!! It was breathtaking with stunningly good action sequences. I mean, jaw dropping! It was insanely good!!I also loved the fact there were no annoying comic relief characters. In fact, there were NO annoying characters. No silly one-liners. No attempts at humour. It was excellent, believable storytelling. Tom Cruise gives an emotional performance. Penny (Jennifer Connelly) allowed for the romance interest. Unlike the 'love story' in 'Top Gun', here it was beautiful and realistic, and above all romantic.The aerial stunts, photography and cinematography are amazing, and the film also has a beautiful score. 'Top Gun: Maverick' was just the perfect movie in every way. This was STUNNING!

Top Gun: Maverick (2022) directed by Joseph Kosinsky is a surpringly original sequel and takes a highly successful retro step to Hollywood film making.The story is set 30 years after its predecessor, and follows Maverick's return to the United States Navy Strike Fighter Tactics Instructor program (also known as "TOPGUN"). The plot is very simple; here, he must confront his past as he trains a group of younger pilots, among them the son of Maverick's deceased best friend Lieutenant Nick "Goose" Bradshaw, to eliminate a uranium target. That's it. But the sheer finesse and bravour with which Cruise, Connelly, Teller and Kosinsky pull this off is impressive.Spectacular action, stunning cinematography, a great score paying homage to it's original predecessor Topgun (1986), is all perfectly executed, and that justifies its cheesy style and simple plot. Highly recommended!

Top Gun: Maverick is the truly epic blockbuster we needed this year and it's everything that a good legacy sequel needs, it's one of the best movies I've seen this year and it's absolutely a movie that needs to be seen in theaters, you're missing out if you don't.Top Gun: Maverick is the reason you go to the movies, it's filled with outstanding action, incredible cinematography, riveting action, brilliant acting, and a solid heart beating at its center, Miles Teller, Tom Cruise, and Jon Hamm are all absolutely amazing here and it's got a truly epic 3rd act, it's a truly hilarious and heartwarming film that absolutely can be viewed on its own, the film reaches new heights and immerses you in the entire experience, similar to sequels like Blade Runner 2049, another absolute banger, I had an absolute blast with this film and I think it'll go down as one of the best legacy sequels of all time.I'm gonna give Top Gun: Maverick an A.

reviews.review_title: Classic Action Movie - something modern cinema lacks.
reviews.content: I never believed a Top Gun sequel could work without Tony Scott but I was proven wrong. I enjoyed it and unlike most legacy sequels, it didn't deconstruct and destroy the previous main characters in favour of the new.It was refreshing to see a straightforward action movie in the modern era that used mostly pracitcal effects that gave the scenes some weight and real depth as you knew it was really there. It was a simple concept well executed and didn't overcomplicate things like most modern films and ended when it needed to end.There were a few cheesy moments but I guess they're consistent in tone with the original Top Gun. So it didn't feel out of place or like it lived in a different universe like a lot of legacy sequels do.

I've seen the first TOP GUN in 1986 and was thrilled. This sequal had the same effect! More over, I was pleasantly surprised that I had the feeling that this version of 2022 was even better. The story of the 1986 version is possibly a bit more raw and harsh. Still, the story of the 2022 version was created very smart and the special effects were even more stunning. Guess that old geesers like me that did see the 1986 versions will be fulfilled equally as young guys that haven't seen the 1986 version. Before going to the cinema I've watched the 1986 version to compare. Tom Cruise is very believable in both and I was sincerely touched by the when Maveric & Ice met after all those years.

reviews.review_title: A clockwork work, full of formulas.
reviews.content: Ok, this movie is very weird, because it's one of the most formulaic movies I've ever seen, but everything works. Absolutely everything. The rebel hero despised by his superiors, but who always achieves his goals; the old love that is like wine; the scorned relative of the deceased, who finally manages to forgive after a heroic action; an impossible mission that is only achievable by the protagonist; moments of ultra hopelessness where all is lost, but are saved at the last second by the friend you didn't expect to come to the rescue; And so I could go on and on, but like I said, everything works in its right place and in its right time.It is a predictable film, but it manages to surprise you with everything it offers you. The visual effects are incredible. The sound editing is as flawless as the visual effects. The pace is totally dizzying, which keeps you on the edge of your seat. The performances do not demand great skills, but due to the good cast, they manage to fulfill what the script asks for. In short, it's one of the great action movies of recent times, there is no doubt about that.Totally recommended to watch on the biggest screen you can and with the best sound system you have at hand.

reviews.review_title: Hollywood Movie made for the Big Screen
reviews.content: This movie restored my faith in Hollywood. Kind of like Maverick, there is still a place for old fashion movie making. No unrealistic CGI, simple entertaining storytelling and minimal gratuitous wokeness. Go to a Theatre, grab some popcorn and enjoy.
WOW! What a breath of fresh air this movie is. Your standard good'o classic movie. The ones we use to get more frequently from Hollywood before the 2020's.

As much as I enjoyed the original, the sequel is simply a tired copy somewhat updated for the times. That having been said, if you are looking for excellent cinematography and great stunt flying, this is your film.But the times have changed since the original was made. Whereas star power and Tom Cruise's charisma still are worth their weight in gold at the box office, and although this film has a heart, it is lacking a soul.In times such as these, much more turbulent than the relative calm of the late 20th century, movie-goers should want and expect more from a feature film.This was simply eye-candy for those who enjoy films pitting the United States against an evil adversary. We all deserve better than this. We need film-makers to produce films that have a soul as well as a heart.

reviews.review_title: 80's Classic Cheese Adds a Classic Sequel
reviews.content:
So many films have had sequels which have totally lacked originalitye.g. Independance day 2 (just a re-run of the original) and don't get me started on Disney Star Wars disasters.So I had no great expectations and was very pleasantly surprised.This is a really good film in it's own right (it doesn't re-run the previous 80's classic) but it does pay homage to the original .It has the right blend of original story in todays world and continuing the story of Pete Mitchell.Would I watch this again ? Definitely 8.5/10on the direct x screen is amazing and I gather the 4x is even more so.Got home from the cinema and pre-ordered it (I almost never do this ! ) Yes I thought it was that good................................
I actually went and saw this film again but this time in 4DX with all the moving seats etc I have to say by the 2nd half of the film I was getting irritated by the seat movements. It should compliment the film and I definitely began to find all moving about just an annoying gimmick. There's a short scene with snow and the racket the snow machine made in the ceiling totally destroyed any benefits of for a few seconds it was snowing inside the cinema. You don't go on a roller coaster to watch a film. So I would not recommend the 4dx and certainly never pay the xtra for it again.I recommend the ScreenX as to get maximum enjoyment.
This has everything that a movie should have, superb plot, nice twist, not at all predictable makes it almost a perfect movie. Tom cruise shines throughout.

This is an old school movie. It's whole point is to entertain you for about 2 hours. That it did indeed. Well done. There was no bigger "message" that needs to be spoon fed to us normies. There was no needless "inclusivity". The cast was diverse without it being forced or mentioned every two seconds. They were just people. Just a good story to entertain us and forget about our daily lives for a few hours. Tom Cruise is one of the last old school movie stars around and this was one of the better movies made in the last decade.Well cast, well acted, some good action. It isn't a perfect movie, but in this day and age it's still one of the better movies made in the last 10 years or so. Say what you want about Tom Cruise and his personal life, but he's one hell of an artist and puts all he has into his craft.I saw the first one a ton of times on vcr and tv when I was a youngster. I was a bit scared at first about them making a sequel. With most sequels nowadays being awful and all. This was however the exception to that rule. More of this and less of "superhero movie number 135".
It was really good. I particularly liked the bit with the planes. There were certainly very many interesting and exciting scenes as well as a storyline involving several ideas.

This is so good. The plot is simple but the execution is what matters. Great writing, good pacing and beautiful cinematography. There are some key heart-pounding scenes that tied together the entire movie but overall, this is a sequel that is honestly better than the original.

With the charm of Tom Cruise and the character, this movie is really enjoyable. No complicated drama, no complicated strategy and action plotting, everything are just so simple to enjoy. Well Done.I leave the theater with a big smile and so happy.

This movie is the best movie I've ever seen in this genre. It deserves to get 10 but I gave it a 9 because of 2 reasons:1- When enemy saw Maverick tried to shoot him but in real world nobody does that. The guy is like a pure gold, they capture him and get all the information they need.2- The make up on Iceman guy was terrible. Is your makeup artist a little kid???????But Overall it's worth of watching and I'm sure I'll watch it again.

"Don't think. Just do."Top Gun: Maverick is such an invigorating and riveting film. It is packed with action, humor, and has a ton of heart. In addition, the film packs an emotional punch, and tackles the main conflict with sincerity and pathos. Top Gun: Maverick has quite a simple narrative and can be followed fairly easily. This was definitely a memorable and a once-in-a-lifetime cinematic experience (at least for me). It's veered in suspense and excitement. I was utterly enthralled by the amazing visuals and earth-shattering soundtrack. Lady Gaga deserves a Grammy for her hit song "Hold My Hand" which is featured in the film's end credits. This song fits perfectly to the mood of the film. My favorite scene is when Rooster and Maverick steal a plane from the Iranian military. Also, the opening scene where Maverick tries to reach Mach 10 is quite chill- and anxiety-inducing. The cherry on top is that some humor is sprinkled throughout the film which makes the viewing experience even better. The film is immersive from the get-go and maintains its momentum till the credits roll. I was left in awe and could not leave the cinema until the credits were over. I liked the idea from the producers and director to include flashbacks of the original 1986 film. As someone who hasn't seen the first film, this stylistic element helped to understand the context behind Maverick and Rooster's strained relationship.Final verdict: 9.7/10.

reviews.review_title: What a great ride and amazing Movie!
reviews.content: Amazing! What an awesome movie.. and especially in the theater. Just blew me away. So fun to be back in the skies with Maverick and the new gang. Everybody did a really great job and the sequences in the jets were just heart stopping. Such a fun ride. My only wish was that we got to know the characters a bit more.. mainly the new ones. The movie was really tight.. and I think it could have used a bit more room to breathe in between the action scenes.. and with the characters so we got to know them a bit more. But a great ride and I'm looking forward to seeing it again as soon as possible. So fun!I also really appreciated the filmmakers dedicating the movie to Tony Scott. Another legend that we lost way too soon. RIP Tony.. we miss you.A great movie from start to finish. Way to go!

Most people who watched the first movie could have at least guessed the storyline of the second, 20 years ago. The dialogue is probably dated three years before the first movie, and makes 1950s movies sound contemporary. The only thing that saves the movie is the music. Why make something so predictable? There isnt one surprise or twist or intriguing detail or thread. Even the visuals aren't new? Yet another film where everyone is a secret super hero, flying planes, sailing boats, riding bikes, cars etc. Hollywood hasn't any ideas anymore.....it gave up on new ideas 40 years ago. This film is the pinnacle of the final drop.... Hollywood is dead.

I'm writing this review after my second viewing on the big screen and lets just say it was even better the second time. Arguably the best movie I've ever seen on the big screen and one of the best movies I've seen in a while period. In what I think is Tom Cruise's best movie, he shows how much he's matured as an actor and how far he'll go to bring the audience a realistic movie void of any over the top cgi which seems to plague so many modern movies today. I'll admit I didn't want to see it a second time even though I really liked it the first go around, I did it because my Mom wanted to watch it again and so I went with her and my Dad. As I said before I loved this movie, not only the great, realistic plane sequences, but the story and the characters, every single one of them. I think this is the movie that finally cements Tom Cruise as not only one of the greatest action stars of all time, but the best in my opinion. Top Gun: Maverick reminds me of one simple fact. There's nothing like a good action movie, even better when it's a sequel that far surpasses the original.

reviews.review_title: Worth buying for your movie library
reviews.content: Or in other words, it is definitely worth watching over and over again.There's so much going on in this move that every time you watch it, you catch something that you missed previously.The story is good. The characters are believable and relatable. The dialogue has plenty of lines worth quoting later. And the visuals are fantastic during the flights scenes.The part I personally liked most, as someone who knows a lot of military, former and current, was that the movie also showed those who support the flyers. It also showed what jerks a lot of pilots can be (personal experience). So parts of the movie were realistic even if it didn't always follow the laws of physics.

reviews.review_title: Top Gun returns and is well worth the wait
reviews.content: 30 years after the events of the first film Pete "Maverick" Mitchell (Tom Cruise) has purposefully avoided advancement in the Navy and continues to operate as a test pilot even in the face of pressure from the pentagon to shift focus to unmanned drones. Following an incident where Maverick takes a prototype jet passed the limit, Maverick seems poised for a discharge however thanks to the intervention of Maverick's former wingman Tom "Iceman" Kazansky (Val Kilmer), Maverick is instead transferred back to TOPGUN to train a batch of 12 pilots for a mission to destroy a uranium enrichment facility in a hostile nation-state before it can be activated in three weeks' time. Of 12 fighter pilots, Bradley "Rooster" Bradshaw (Miles Teller) has a history with Maverick as Rooster still carries animosity towards Maverick over the loss of his father and Maverick's wingman Goose and the fact Maverick pulled Rooster's academy papers and derailing his career. During this time Maverick also rekindles his romance with an old flame in Penny (Jennifer Connelly)Undeniably Top Gun is one of the biggest cultural benchmarks of the 80s as the film was not only the highest grossing film of 1986, but it's also responsible for launching the careers of Tom Cruise as an A-list leading man and director Tony Scott as a uniquely identifiable hand behind blockbuster filmmaking with his high-speed editing and magic hour photography influencing an entire generation of filmmakers. Despite being Tom Cruise's first major blockbuster, Cruise had initially expressed no interest in doing a follow-up as he said as much during a press tour for Born on the Fourth of July in 1990. During 2010 however negotiations began with producer Jerry Bruckheimer, director Tony Scott, Tom Cruise and Paramount about a follow-up to Top Gun addressing the end of the dogfighting era and rise in drone warfare, but the development was curtailed with the unfortunate suicide of Tony Scott in 2012 leaving the projects fate in doubt. Eventually the project regained traction in 2017 with Oblivion director Joseph Kosinski reteaming with cruise as director and the film began production in 2018 but was delayed from its original 2019 release due to the complexity of the aerial sequences and became the poster child for Covid delays as Top Gun: Maverick much like the James Bond film No Time to Die went through a cycle of release dates and reschedules as offers from streaming were rejected by Cruise who insisted it be released in theaters. Once released the film became the biggest of Cruise's career making nearly $1.5 billion against its $170 million budget and has earned rave reviews from both critics and audiences to boot. Top Gun: Maverick is not only a worthy sequel to Top Gun, but in many ways it exceeds its predecessor while also revisiting everything that worked about it the first time.As with the previous film, Top Gun: Maverick is a showcase for some incredible aerial photography. What really helps sell the illusion is that the actors actually were in the jets for interior shots during filming giving authentic reactions to traveling at those speeds while for exterior shots actual US Navy pilots flew and to see some of the elaborate aerial sequences and know they're done without CGI is truly a sight to behold and really shows the enduring appeal of Tom Cruise as an action star because he dives (quite literally) into the action. Top Gun set the standard for how to approach aerial photography and despite attempts by imitators such as Fire Birds, Iron Eagle, or (heaven help you) Stealth, no one has surpassed that standard until now as Maverick features some of the most intricate and engaging aerial dogfights and sequences ever captured on film with the editing and filming making you feel as though you're in the seat of the action.Of course, if Top Gun: Maverick just delivered on the spectacle it would just be an above average actioner, but the movie does give some solid story and characterization that was lacking from the first film and allows Cruise to deliver one of the best performances of his career. With Cruise's approach to Maverick, it's very much a reflective piece as like Maverick Cruise is getting up in years and he's still the best at pulling these dare devil stunts (such as in his Mission: Impossible series) but eventually he will have to let go despite his best efforts to do otherwise. It's undeniably the character interactions that have made this movie as resonant as it has been as like many modern "legacy sequels", we do have a fresh faced batch of recruits playing against the veterans of this IP, but they're much better written than you typically see in this type of film and especially in Miles Teller as Rooster who's the emotional core of this movie. With Maverick and Rooster there's something of an estranged father/son dynamic as Maverick still carries the weight of Goose's death very close and has tried to respect Goose and his dead wife by protecting Rooster even if that means Rooster hating him, it's emotional scars like this that really held me with the movie, but easily the biggest was with Val Kilmer reprising his role as Iceman who has been dealing with throat cancer (like the real life Kilmer) and despite Iceman's presence in this film being mostly via text, it's the buildup to the major scene where Kilmer and Cruise come together one final time in a scene that was heavy with emotional resonance especially if you know the off camera animosity between Kilmer and Cruise that came during Top Gun and there's something cathartic and emotionally cleansing about this scene that's already good in its own right but adds even more when taken into context for the real life undertones.Despite the strengths of Top Gun: Maverick I do have some criticisms. I personally didn't feel the romance with Jennifer Connelly's Penny was all that developed and it felt a little unnecessary given all the other elements on display. The fact that Penny is an "old flame" of Maverick's also struck me as a little odd as it seemed like maybe there was an initial draft where this character was Kelly McGillis' character Charlie but now it's a wholly original character, but it doesn't feel like we have the attachment to this character that we should. Connelly is perfectly fine in the role, but this is more a hiccup of the writing. I also felt it was rather humorous just how far out its way the movie went to keep its antagonist faceless because the enemy nation state is never given a name (not even one of those fake names with the "istan" suffix) and even in the climax where we get a look at the ground there's absolutely no identifiable markings, language, or even geography to identify where we are relative to the rest of the world so our antagonist is basically a faceless swarm of missiles and jets. I will say at least the movie is built up to this climax as opposed to the original where the climax was tacked on, but the lack of a tangible antagonist does seem rather odd but given the importance of the international market I understand why they did this, and there have been instances like this all the way back to the 1950s such as with Captain Nemo's "Hated Nation" from the Disney adaptation of 20,000 Leagues Under the Sea.Top Gun: Maverick delivers on the thrills of the original film and exceeds in the story and characters and making for a more enjoyable sit. While I did have issues with the film such as the lack of an antagonist character and the Penny character feeling slightly extraneous, the film works well where you expect it to and delivers the action and entertainment that has become synonymous with Cruise. I don't think I agree with this being Cruise's "best" movie as I personally think Live Die Repeat and Mission: Impossible 1,4,5 & 6 are more entertaining on the whole, but this is still really solid blockbuster filmmaking.

While reaction to this 36-years-later sequel is overwhelmingly positive, it is inevitable that there are cynics who characterize "Top Gun: Maverick" as not more than an ample collection of cliché. However, if cliché can be made to look so good, keep them coming!People who watched the original "Top Gun" 3 decades ago may find their memory somewhat vague (or not). It would have been the same for me had I not made an effort to watch it again recently (and still felt the excitement). Those who tell you that "Top Gun: Maverick" can be seen as a stand-alone are only half-right. The moviemaker have indeed made every effort to give the audience a complete "what happened before", through dialogues and flashbacks. But the emotional pull is not the same as having recently watched "Maverick" (1986). To those who have never seen the original, my advice would definitely be to see it prior to watching the current sequel.This nostalgia trip recreates and repackages scene and moments from the original, in a way that is both familiar and new. Pete "Maverick" Mitchell (Tom Cruise) is still here, some thirty years older, but with the same dauntless spirit. His best buddy Goose who died in the originally is represented by his son, the cute little chap we saw briefly in the original, now a top-notch pilot "Rooster" (Miles Teller). "Iceman" (Val Kilmer), rival and friend, is still around, but an invalid. For romance, while we have a new character Penny (Jennifer), the tender love scenes reminisces those with Charlie (for Charlotte) in the original. Even the beach volleyball scene is replaced by a beach "dogfight football" scene (offense and defense lumped together) that involves all the 12 potential candidate for the final team of 6 for "the mission" (I'll come to that). As to the hair-raising circus in the air, those looking for nostalgia from "Top Gun" (1986) will not be disappointed. If they are also Star Wars fans, there is an additional bonus.Here's how things goes. Picking up from where we left off, using dialogues and flashbacks, Pete stayed as Top Gun instructor for only two months and returned to the field (including Bosnia, Iraq). With proliferation of decorations, he "should have made a 2-star admiral" but remains a captain to-date. "Your kind is heading for extinction" comments Rear Admiral Chester Cain (Ed Harris) who has summoned him to tell him that he has been posted back to Top Gun on a critical mission. Realizing that this is likely the opportunity for his last hurrah, Pete is a little disappointed to find out that he is there only to teach the team but not to take part in the actual action himself. Still he throws everything he has into this challenge.A word about this "mission". The thing that wouldn't escape your notice is that while in the original there was a clear adversary, the Soviet Union (it was the Reagan era), this time the absence of any geopolitical reference is conspicuous. The strike target is a nuclear plant but the location, and thus the power behind it, is vague. Enemy aircrafts look generic. During the dogfight scenes, enemy pilots' faces are entirely wrapped in black helmets. It may as well be Darth Vader behind the mask, or a Martian, for that matter.Throwing himself completely into the task, Pete starts by dumping the inches-thick playbook into the garbage can. "I'm sure you all know it inside out" brings a round of mixed cheers and jeers. "So does your enemy", he crisply adds. "What they don't know is you limits, which I'll keep pushing in the next 3 weeks", he concludes he opening speech. This promise he makes good, relentlessly.Upon his first encounter with his class, Pete messages Ice (whose strong recommendation had landed him this job) "they are not ready". "That's why you're here" comes the reply, without missing a beat. Later, we witness a most poignant scene, Pete visiting Ice for support and advice when things get tough. Because of throat cancer, Ice can hardly speak but uses typed messages to communicate. Finally he struggles to whisper his encouragement. Their parting banter brings back bitter-sweet nostalgia. Ice: "who is the best pilot, you or me?" Pete: "This is a nice moment, let's not ruin it." The heart-wrenching poignancy is that Ice's excruciatingly painful ailment, while scripted, reflects the actor Val Kilmer's predicaments in real life. That Kilmer courageously accepted this role brings tears to one's eyes.What does this team comprise, these cream of Top Gun graduates? More diversified than Pete's time, that's for sure. There are initially twelve from which six is to be selected, with the remainder as reserves. The most notable among the selected are "Hangman" (Glen Powell) the updated version of Ice (no relations though), "Phoenix" (Monica Barbaro), with looks to kill but obviously not selected for her looks, and nerdy "Bob" whose uses his real name for his call sign. And, of course, forget aforementioned "Rooster", son of "Goose".The best way to describe the mission is: the gauntlet-running climax in the original Star Wars, plus a few additional bells and whistles. Its successful completion requires "two miracles" and that doesn't include bringing the team home alive. THAT depends on something called the "coffin corner", their success in negotiating it. The Top Gun in-charge "Cyclone" (John Hamm) explains to Pete that "every mission has risks and they accept that". "I don't, sir", Pete snaps back. He wants to push the team to unimaginable limits (the only way to succeed in the mission) AND have all of them back home alive. At this apparent horn-locking, Cyclone debates with himself whether he should fire Pete or, "shall I risk my career and appoint you team leader?" At which point the second-in-command enlightens Pete "I think it's a rhetorical question".Top Gun: Maverick's success can be attributed to the synchronization of all the key cinematic elements: cinematography, background music, editing and sound (especially sound, for this movie). However, at the end of the day, it's the cast.There are solid veterans such as Harris and Hamm, particularly the latter. Watching Hamm's "Cyclone" as the full embodiment of military authority, it is difficult to imagine him as the over-the-board outlandish crook, Buddy, in "Baby Driver" (2017). Watching Kilmer, as mentioned, is heartbreaking.The two key supports both shine, in different ways: Teller and Connelly. While young, Teller is already quite a veteran. His most riveting performance today is in the TV series "The Offer" (2022) where he is the lead, portraying Albert S. Ruddy, the producer of "The Godfather". If you like Teller's in "Top Gun: Maverick", "The Offer" is highly recommended. Connelly has never turned in a bad performance in her 53 acting credits. Here, she radiates charm, and more charm. While there is little background to her character other than Pete's old flame, the chemistry between Connelly and Cruise is captivating. Kelly McGillis in the original Top Gun is a hard act to follow. Connelly has filled in the vacuum splendidly.At the end of the day, it's Tom Cruise. Critics have written plenty in his praise, just for this movie. So, all I am going to say here is that Cruise is testimonial proof that stardom is alive and well.

Tom Cruise did a phenomenal job, and I could see his hand throughout the whole movie. He does things to a superior and unmatched level. What blew me away most in this movie was how REAL it was. The footage of the aircraft carrier, the footage of the birds (F18's and other aircraft), the realistic plot and storyline, the emotion and relationships, the unpredictability, and the humor and drama.
