Every element was REAL.Every bit of Top Gun Maverick is moving, and thrilling! I went back and forth from the edge of my seat, to nearly crying from emotion-evoking scenes, to gut laughing along with the entire theater; all of these things I did MULTIPLE times. I loved all the humor and comedy, which was so expertly written into the screenplay and then wonderfully executed through prestigious acting.

reviews.review_title: Still entertaining for me who didn't watch the first
reviews.content: I didn't get the chance to watch the first when it came out. However that didn't hold me back when it came to appreciating the acting, flight choreography, dialogue, etc., in this sequel.It is really good to know it was not CGI, but real flight scenes. That does make a difference to drawing out positive anticipation and making welcomed trips to the memory lane.Would not go rewatch but if you are a fan of the actors, the combat flight scenes, this is one where I would say go for it. Your time won't be wasted.After all, we don't know if there are any more sequels like these even if some of us want it.

reviews.review_title: What an awful rehash of the old movie
reviews.content: I waited so long for this sequel and my honest opinion is that it is pure garbage (they made a 2022 version of the old Top Gun movie). Half of the movie is stupid internal conflicts and a love story with a bad bad actress. The other half is similar but worse than the original Top Gun training movie. I can't believe they re-included the beach volleyball scene. One could seriously edit down this movie to 45-50min and make it snappy to keep the audience hooked.Tom Cruise looked like a used car-tyre throughout. His eyes and body language indicated to me that he wasn't even keen on doing this movie. Everything was so predictable (US "good" army guys will take down the threat of a hostile foreign nation. Yeah we all saw what you did to Iraq and its oil). I stopped watching at a little bit over halfway mark. I just couldn't care if the newly trained team would be able to accomplish the 5-7G manoeuvres to take down the nuclear facility.

reviews.review_title: Prepare to profusely stress-sweat through the second half
reviews.content:
Instantly iconic, and built very similar to the first Top Gun. And just like that one, it works very very well. Tom Cruise is on point as always, and the Rooster / Hangman rivalry is almost a perfect parallel to the Maverick / Iceman dynamic in the first movie. Good humor throughout, some
of the most intense action I've seen in a movie of the past 10 years, and a good underlying message about breaking the mold. Loved it, will probably see it a second time soon before it's out of theatres.

reviews.review_title: "The TOP filmmaking that time forgot". McQuarrie and Cruise bring Mission Impossible's astounding stunts while blasting Hans Zimmer's glorious nostalgic soundtrack
reviews.content: I have no words to describe this movie. And I believe most of the reviewers don't either. I hope I am not overstepping when I say this movie is the spiritual and, in some ways, superior successor to its predecessor. The fact that most of the plane scenes and stunts were filmed in real life, the cinematography was reminiscing yet breath-taking, the music beautifully composed and the characters engaging and charming; elevates the movie to the stratosphere.What Top Gun brought to the 80s when it came out, this movie brings to an updated era (today) that desperately needed this kind of movie. A movie that even though it's one of those "yet another sequel to revive (or start) a franchise", dares to be great. Where sequel movies from franchises like Terminator, Ghostbusters and Matrix, fail to relaunch the franchise; this one passes with flying colors and with great action filmmaking to back it up.The callbacks and soundtrack pushes the emotional moments of the characters forward while establishing new arcs for them in a brilliant concise way. It's not trying to be a deeply layered movie, it delivers a great emotional core and conflict for the main characters while keeping all the flying scenes enthralling and impactful. Even more so than on the first one. Perceived today as a "love letter" to the 80s movies, Top Gun was a simple charming blockbuster movie with a very young Tom Cruise to drive it entirely as he navigates through the parade of archetypical characters and a cheesy (yet endearing) romance. Elements I enjoy quite much but which now perhaps wouldn't work for a modern audience. However, this movie makes it work. It plays with archetypes to establish strong emotional connections, relationships and quips that feel charming and amusing.IN CONCLUSION, The movie overall delivers what everyone liked about the original but through an updated lense, new characters; emotional, visual and musical references to the past while building a strong concluding future; and finally and most importantly, while delivering an enthralling and gripping actions stunts and mission very reminiscing of those "Impossible Missions" of the latest Tom Cruise involved MI. I went in with no expectations at all and left with a changed heart. I may have forgotten the first Top Gun, but I for sure would never forget (and probably would revisit) this one. A bombastic, chilling, real-stunt-made, old school blockbuster movie that delivers great action, music and character work. I'm glad to learn I can still be surprised, glad to learn not all old-franchise-reviving-sequels have to be (only) a cash grab.

What an experience!The first one is a classic and I was doubtful this would live up to the expectations, and even thought they shouldn't have attempted a sequel, but boy, was I wrong! This is a masterpiece and one of the finest films I have watched.Tom Cruise goes on to show why he is still one of the best in the business - everything about this movie was great - the cast, the story, the humor, and the bonding - all so well done. But above everything else, the scenes with the jets in the air, the formations, the attack, the maneuvers are stellar! It was such a joy to watch!This will, in my books, go down as the best sequel ever made!

This is so much better than the garbage being produced by directors girlfriends, it's true action, inclusive without being cheesy or pat about it and it includes real women holding their own, not marrying men to have careers. Finally an awesome movie from Hollywood.

Great movie. Ties in well with the first movie without the dreary, clumsy and forced situations that other sequels use. Excellent effects and storyline. I don't know where the time went which is probably the greatest compliment.

Toxic masculinity is back. In a good way. It has been far too long, that movies were allowed to show clear hero characters + an according dramaturgy. All of this worked for decades, before some post-post-structuralists decided to dismantle it. It seems like, they didn't win for gods sake. It's also amazing how the team managed to transport the vibe of the first instalment to this second iteration without making it feel dated. I just really wish, that directors and producers will pick up on this success story and apply this winning formula onto modern-day topics as well. As the movie pointed it out: You have to let go. But the basic principle of heroes actually succeeding without annoying the audience with "the dark side of the character" is a winning principle, that will hopefully be applied to many other topics as well - not just action movies.

reviews.review_title: Just walked out of Top Gun: Maverick
reviews.content: I just walked out of seeing Top Gun: Maverick, and this movie... is AMAZING! This might be one of the sequels ever made. The visuals, the story, the characters, everything about this movie is a plus! THERE ARE NO NEGATIVES! It does everything right, while being an amazing, airplane pilot story! Tom Cruise gives it his all in the movie, and you can see that being expressed! Maverick is a compelling character with motivations and character development, and it's a perfection arc. The film does a very well job at pacing its story, and not rushing anything while being hella entertaining!It does a good job at everything, and balances everything super nicely. I'm still unpacking everything I just saw, and am seeing it again this Wednesday, I might edit this review and add more Positives, or even some Negatives! But, as for my Out of the Theatre Review, this movie is a huge win in my book and I found it to be way superior over the first movie, doing everything right!SECOND VIEWING: Perfection. Tom Cruise is perfection. The visuals are perfection. The sound quality is perfection. This movie deserves all the success it's getting. Get Maverick to a Billion at the Box OfficeCurrently at 9/10- Subject to Change.

reviews.review_title: A film that knows exactly what it is and executes to perfection
reviews.content: I came into this film not having seen the prequel, expecting it to be your run-of-the-mill action film. A "popcorn film" as a friend would say. As I was watching this, however, it became apparent that this film is anything but mediocre. The pacing, the characters, the dialogue and the action are all done incredibly well, making this film an absolute recommend for anyone slightly into action films!

reviews.review_title: You have to be a mean spirited low life to hate this
reviews.content: To be honest, I only thought this was an 8 at best. I knocked off 1 for the star wars plot and one for the layers of cheese in the movie.But then I remembered how it made me feel and how much I miss great blockbusters like this that dont send you 'the right message' that is a prerequisite for any modern, inferior and unprofitable movie, but DO the main thing they are supposed to........entertain. Bravo Tom.

Whatever one thinks about Tom Cruise as a person, he knows how to make good action movies that draw an audience. In this woke and agenda filled age, it's refreshing to see a movie that doesn't hit one over the head with those things. Instead, we get timeless themes about camaraderie, friendship, and family. I like how Val Kilmer's real life throat cancer was incorporated into the story, producing poignant moments. I was surprised how emotional I was at the end of the movie. Well done.The other important element of Cruise movies is the verisimilitude of the action sequences. The man is amazing in his willingness and ability to do practical stunts. How many actors would insist on REALLY getting catapulted from an aircraft carrier? You KNOW you're in the cockpit with these people, instead of having everything green screened.

reviews.review_title: Absolutely great movie. Felt like an old school blockbuster.
reviews.content: I just want to say it's so impressive how real the movie looks and feels. All the scenes in the cockpit and of the planes themselves flying look 100% real. There are only 2 CGI shots (exterior shots of the laser guidance rocket system) where I felt like I was looking at CGI. The rest was totally immersive.The story, as you may imagine it's not some deep meaningful thing, although it has some more deep and thoughtful moments here and there (again not to much) it's a pretty straightforward gig but it works and it's good, solid.The actors do turn in some good performances particularly Miles Teller, I must say, Glen Powell also does a good job and Monica Barbaro and Lewis Pullman are breaths of fresh air, nothing over the top but they are good and bring something new.Overall it's a summer blockbuster popcorn action movie, but a damn good one.

After more than 30 years of service as one of the Navy's top aviators, Pete "Maverick" Mitchell is where he belongs, pushing the envelope as a courageous test pilot and dodging the advancement in rank that would ground him. Training a detachment of graduates for a special assignment, Maverick must confront the ghosts of his past and his deepest fears, culminating in a mission that demands the ultimate sacrifice from those who choose to fly it.

Enjoyable...it was just enjoyable. It stays in line with the original, it's a good follow up for so many years later, and it's just fun and enjoyable. Great job to everyone involved. It was also a tribute to so many involved with the original who are already, sadly, no longer with us today. Again, great enjoyable sequel. I think, this probably calls for at least ONE MORE!!!!

reviews.review_title: My take on why this film worked so well.
reviews.content: I was one of those guys that had no plans on seeing this film before it was released. Was never a huge Top Gun fan, but then the reviews and buzz started and I changed my mind.I am a huge Mission Impossible fan. The next two films coming out are in my top 5 on my watchlist over the next year. (May have to wait a bit longer on the second.) But why Maverick worked so well, is that it is essentially built around the Mission Impossible structure. Christopher McQuarrie has written the last two and the next two MI films and he was also one of the writers here. Since he also wrote my favorite film of the last 25 years, "The Usual Suspects" I think I can call him my favorite film writer. But think about how this film unfolds. It is exactly like the MI films. There is a mission that is planned for and is almost impossible to complete. Our hero develops a top notch team with unmatched skills and pulls it off. We are prepared for what the dangers are and when they are encountered we are on the edge of our seats. My favorite film of the year. And I think Christopher McQuarrie needs a special shout out , for what he undoubtedly did to help make this film so special.

reviews.review_title: The best thing in theaters now
reviews.content: I've been a Joseph Kosinski defender ever since seeing TRON: Legacy, and it's nice to have some vindication seeing the acclaim Top Gun: Maverick is getting. (I think most Kosinski criticism comes from failed wanna-be's, jealous since they never got a big blockbuster thrown into their laps). This is now the second home run for Kosinski when it comes to reviving an 80s product, modernizing it while still retaining respect.I wasn't even necessarily the biggest fan of the original Top Gun (Tony Scott is essentially a lower budget Michael Bay) but it was still decent. And despite TG:M being one of those dreaded 'legacy sequels' we have too many of these days, it can stand on its own cinematic feet without support from the original. (Again, much like TRON). Tom Cruise deserves much of the credit here-much like the character Maverick he's pushing the actors to their limits, to the point of using real planes for the aerial sequences, and you will certainly be able to tell as the pilots' heads are twisted around and their faces visibly pummeled with the gravitational effect. Add that to a story well told and the movie is an unexpected success, confounding the 'movies are dead' streaming simps and illustrating William Goldman's iconic summary of the movie business: 'Nobody knows anything'.Side Note: It's so nice to watch something that doesn't involve actor's heads transplanted on CGI cartoon bodies. The movie still isn't the most terribly realistic, but then neither was the original in some ways.Side Note: Again, I think Kosinski is really the only Hollywood heir to innovative greats like Robert Zmeckis, James Cameron- -even George Lucas (at least in terms of unique sound design). If you read about Tron Legacy or Oblivion you can find out how both these films were way ahead of the curve technology-wise, and now TG: M shows a similar skill in practical effects. Fingers crossed for his upcoming film Spiderhead, though that is on Netflix and we all know how standards are there.*Actually, James Cameron is returning this year with another long-delayed sequel. Time will tell if he's still got the goods.

reviews.review_title: Mixed feelings...but I didn't hate it (first one still better though)
reviews.content: I was a teenager when the original Top Gun came out in 1986 and it was spectacular. I do believe that it has really stood up well to the test of time. It had a wonderful cast...Val Kilmer (my crush at the time), Tom Skerritt, Meg Ryan, Anthony Edwards, Kellie McGillis, Tim Robbins, and it really launched Tom Cruise's career. The film also had a fantastic soundtrack that was lead by Berlin's "Take my Breath Away"and Kenny Loggins' "Danger Zone". The story was tightly told and worth every penny of my hard earned money to see it in the theater. If you haven't seen it.... I highly recommend it.Now for this sequel...I went in thinking the original was perfect, why do we need a second film? I will start by saying that I really appreciated the effort made to resurrect the character of "Ice Man" and use the original actor Val Kilmer, who was my personal favorite in the original film. Along those same lines, I am disappointed that no effort was made to include Meg Ryan's original character as the mother of "Rooster" and wife of "Goose" or Kelly McGillis' character as the feisty flight instructor "Charlie". I am guessing they wanted a "younger" looking female to pair with the resurrected character of "Maverick" (Tom Cruise), which is why they picked Jennifer Connelly who is not only 10 years younger than Tom Cruise...but 13 years younger than Kelly McGillis. It saddens me as a female that Hollywood does not allow women to age and perpetuates the older man/younger woman relationship. Bit of a double standard. I have nothing against Jennifer Connelly, but I found her character confusing and out of place. I don't know if it was intended to be confusing, but between the implication of a previous relationship, the motorcycle and the house that looked identical to Kelly McGillis' character Charlie's...I felt like they were trying to just slip her in as the same person which created confusion for me and took me out of the story. The sailing humor...and the boat trip was really out of place, sealing the deal that Penny was no Charlie.I appreciated the story and the wonderful flight footage, great for any thrill seeker, but the best part of this film is the actor Miles Teller who plays "Rooster", the son of "Maverick's" deceased wingman "Goose". It was a nice tie-in to the original film and if it didn't exist might have made this film a pass for me...but it's existence and the flight footage keep this film as a recommend.Rough plot aging navy pilot and loose cannon "Maverick" (who has learned nothing in the thirty years since the last film) is brought back to Top Gun to train the best of the best for a super secret but necessary mission to destroy an unnamed enemy's nuclear site. It is an impossible mission and Maverick is the only one who can do it...cue the dramatic music, beach football (personally I preferred the beach volleyball in the original film...a must see for the ladies), and amazing flight footage.This film was very testosterone heavy (you either like it or hate it)...the women were forgettable and almost an afterthought, not like in the original film where you have such memorable scenes as Meg Ryan shouting "take me to bed or loose me forever" and who could forget motorcycles, white sheets and Kelly McGillis. This film distinctly lacked the sexiness of the first film and the overall female touch...which makes the film very unbalanced towards the testosterone, but if you are ok with that...the rest of the film is good.So my highest compliment is, I didn't hate it.

reviews.review_title: Top Gun: Maverick Doesn't Just Meet Expectations, it Soars Past Them
reviews.content: With it's enduring popularity and influence in pop culture, I always wondered why they never churned out a sequel to Top Gun. After reading a little bit about the behind the scenes of this movie, some of it had to do with Tom Cruise's dissatisfaction of how the original Top Gun was shot. I walked into the theatre hoping for some eye-popping and thrilling stunt sequences and Maverick certainly delivered on that front. The action was breathtaking to see on the theatre screen, leave it to Cruise and his team to bring some juice to the acrobatics to help re-invigorate the franchise for modern audiences. I can't speak to the technical specifications or how much of the movie is accurate to real life but nothing felt outlandish enough to shatter the illusion of the movie. The dogfighting and aerial manoeuvring will have you dipping and dodging in your seat and Top Gun: Maverick and even if you're not familiar with the previous film, it will keep you engaged while you get to know the characters.Transitioning to the character, we join Pete "Maverick" Mitchell at the tail end of his career. He's satisfied with his current assignment (he's working as a test pilot) but he's still haunted by the events of the first movie. Over the course of the movie, he has to confront both his past demons and his career arc when he's ordered to start training pilots at Top Gun again. Val Kilmer also returns as Tom "Iceman" Kozansky, who has been acting as Maverick's shield, keeping him in the Navy after all of his shenanigans. While TG: Maverick is very romantic when calling back to the original, the returning characters all were treated with care and their arcs feel organic from where the first one finishes. I also really enjoyed most of the new characters; Phoenix, Bob, Hangman, Payback, Coyote and Fanboy all are distinct and fun characters to watch develop. Rooster's conflict with Maverick is earned considering what's transpired between them. The only character I had a problem with was Cyclone who is just very one dimensional as the disapproving chief that's always on Maverick's case.Tom Cruise is a complete enigma off the screen but you can count on him to bring his 'A' game whenever he's starring in a big action movie (other than The Mummy..... but let's not talk about that). He's great as Maverick again, he nails both the "wild card" nature of him flying but also the emotionally conflicted man off the tarmac. I was pleasantly surprised by both Jennifer Connelly and her character of Penny. Penny looked like a throwaway love interest for Pete in the trailer but Connelly is so smooth and at ease in Penny's shoes and she is every bit as good as Cruise (although in a smaller role). Miles Teller is up to the task as Rooster, I haven't always been his biggest fan but he gives an intense performance with a couple of moments where he's allowed to be charasmatic. It was nice to see Val Kilmer again as Iceman, they do their best to fit him in with his limitations (he is almost unable to speak now) but his character's relationship punctuates Maverick's need to grow so well that I couldn't imagine the movie without him. Jon Hamm is fine in the movie, his character was problematic but that's not the fault of his performance. Bashir Salahuddin, Monica Barbaro and Lewis Pullman were the standouts for me in the new supporting players but the entire cast performed capably and nobody stuck out as being off key with their acting.If there's any fault to find in Top Gun: Maverick, it's that the movie is so jam packed with nostalgia and love for the original film. If you're a Top Gun superfan, this will be a positive as most of the call backs are done in an almost sweet way. But if you're part of the uninitiated, it could be a little grating. The sentimental/cheesy slant of the first one has carried over as well and one of the friends I saw this with was rolling her eyes consistently. I think the movie walks a fine line without being too corny but perhaps not everyone will feel that way. My last nitpick is that TG: Maverick can't seem to decide when it wants to wrap up, I thought the movie was steering towards wrapping up at least a couple of times but it just kept going.I was so pleased when I saw the box office numbers later in the same week for Top Gun: Maverick. It's a throwback that borders on too sentimental but with the awesome action set pieces, solid acting and good enough story about letting go of your past and learning to live with your demons, it's going to make my list of my favourite theatre experiences this year. If you haven't seen it already and are interested in a more old-school action blockbuster, this isn't your standard entry in the genre, it's exceptional and well worth your time.
Excellent storytellingGreat group of cast membersTrue Americana, NAVY Air-fighter culture on the big screenBetter than the first Top Gun IMOA story that tells every guys dream.

reviews.review_title: The Ending cost it a few stars
reviews.content: A fun movie with some, like the original, great flying scenes. Tom Cruise was excellent returning to the role that really make him a superstar and the supporting cast is great. The story worked with a an older, somewhat wiser Maverick getting sent back to Top Gun school to train others to take out an UNKNOWN ENEMY'S (but we know it's Russia) Uranium cracking plant. This avoids some of the silly plot tropes usually in these movies, but the ending, when Maverick and Rooster are shot down, walk onto an enemy base and steal an old F-14, is just silly. He also shoots down two fifth generation enemy fighters in this old, retired plane. Why did the enemy have one? Because: Plot. But it was fun. It would have ended better had Maverick sacrificed himself for the completion of the mission.

This is what I call cinema. Edge of your seat stuff. The way they gave us the old top gun movie vibes it was truly classy and very emotionally touching. I could feel like I knew all the charecters from heart. And the flight sequences and the action scenes they are just out of the world. And about the ending,well Tom cruise is an expert in giving goosebumps worthy memorable endings,in my opinion this was his best one till now.

reviews.review_title: Rocky V, Beverly Hills Cop III, Indiana Jones and The Crystal Skulls, Jaws 2,3D, and the Revenge, Wall Street: Money Never Sleeps, etc.
reviews.content: Top Gun. The original. Came out in '86. HUGE. Didn't see it till a few years later. Great movie. For me to this day, not a remote drop. But it is iconic. Great scenes, good actors, good story, quotable lines. 35 years later, Maverick.It starts with a tad of intrigue and nostalgia. I'm on board. That's when engine 1 flames out. The Lazy Susan spinning of nostalgia, establishing character and story, poor casting, poor script, shallow story, anchoring through nostalgia with near and HUGE misses delivers a huge budget box office bonanza straight to DVD smoldering, festering STAR WARS prequel disappointment.Tom Cruise knows how to make a good movie. Tom Cruise knows how to make a great movie. Tom Cruise knows how to act. Tom Cruise didn't know how to make this. The final product is an insult to the term slap-dash. Each side story amounts to nothing more than a Dear Diary entry based on over hearing 5% of a conversation.Miles Teller and Jennifer Connelly, who the hell is Penny?, are wasted. The connection between the first movie and this are wasted. Low hanging fruit is not harvested but wasted in the interest of watching Tom Cruise actually do his own death defying stunts. Incredible to watch. He is a marvel doing that. However it plays more like a YouTube video than an actual, well, you know, movie.

reviews.review_title: Tom Cruise takes You! inside the cockpit into the air
reviews.content: Top Gun: Maverick is the sequel to the first Top Gun movie from 1986. This sequel is directed by Joseph Kosinski, the director of Oblivion and TRON: Legacy. In the film, Pete "Maverick" Mitchell (Tom Cruise) is called back by the Navy after more than thirty years of service as a Top Gun pilot. Here he is asked to train new Top Gun pilots for an important and dangerous military mission. During these training sessions, Maverick tries to train the young pilots in his own ways, so that they can push their own limits. In this way he hopes to send them more successfully on this mission and to be able to see them alive again at home base. Due to the difference of generations and the clashing arrogance between Maverick and the younger pilots, this is just not as simple as Maverick had hoped.After about thirty years, they manage to present this second Top Gun film in a modern, yet also recognizable way. There are many moments in this new film that fans of the first film can recognize and appreciate. Furthermore, there are also enough moments to make the film more approachable for the younger generation. So young and old can both enjoy this film. It's nice to see Tom Cruise now in a leadership role teaching younger pilots. Compared to the first film, for example, he has now changed from student to teacher, who tries to do everything in his own way. Because of this, he sometimes gets into trouble with the people above him, but he tries to stand his ground for a successful end result for himself and his students. They have beautifully portrayed this sequel and actually filmed it all at the request of Tom Cruis. For example, no green screen or CGI recordings were used. Thanks to improved filming techniques and this way of filming, the film feels more realistic as if you are actually in a cockpit during these aircraft training sessions and missions. For this realistic feel and way of filming, they used real airplanes. A large part of the film cast also had to meet many physical demands such as undergoing real G-force training sessions. As a result, most new members of the film cast deliver better and more realistic work during their airplane scenes. Only a few have used a stunt double, but fortunately this is not reflected in the film. The actors who play the pilots in training come across well as a joint group of students. Because of the script, the film also focuses on other things besides their group, so that the group does not always come across as strong as a joint group. Things went a bit better with the older group from the first film. With this new group you only really get to know the students who eventually go on the dangerous mission. In addition to the training scenes and final mission, the film is also about Maverick trying to work on a new romantic relationship with Peggy Benjamin played by Jennifer Connelly. Tom Cruise and Jennifer Connelly have good chemistry with each other in the film, but it just isn't as strong as the chemistry Tom Cruise had with Kelly McGillis in the first Top Gun film. Kelly McGillis is unfortunately not in this sequel, because the director and writers couldn't really think of a role for her character in the front of this sequel. Kelly McGillis herself has indicated that she probably has not been asked back either, because she has grown older and did not want to train herself again for the role. Returning actor Val Kilmer has more of a cameo in this film, as due to his declining health he is unfortunately no longer able to do much acting.

reviews.review_title: The best action movie ever made
reviews.content: I was kind of expecting the movie to be great but words can't describe the way this movie made me feel. Every flying scene was so intense and beautifully made that you were on the edge of your seat from start to finish. This is just what Cruise wanted us to see, a love letter to aviation.Also if you are going to see only one movie this year, it is most certainly this one!

I don't have much idea into fighter jet detailing and all and the ranks but I saw top gun and I loved it. And then I saw maverick and must admit that the sequel was brilliantly done. Tom looks as good and reckless as a trainer. And Jennifer looks ravishing. The other cast is good too. I don't have any complaints or any critical feedback for this movie. Watch it!

reviews.review_title: The best film I have ever seen
reviews.content: Tom cruise at his peak ... again ! From start to finish the nostalgic arcs back to the original and a thoroughly entertaining story line . Who says that sequels can't be better than the originals ! The football scene too * chefs kiss *

reviews.review_title: Can't believe how bad this is
reviews.content: After all the rave reviews I was expecting this to blow me away. Instead I am amazed at how mediocre it all is. The first movie is in another league to this entirely. This film is far too jokey and self-satisfied, everything is cliched and none of the characters are remotely likeable, even including Maverick this time around. I don't know whether it's the direction but everyone seems to be acting self-consciously and seems uncomfortable. It's just really cringeworthy.The film itself has no reason to exist, the plot is paper thin and is basically a retread of the original, except done far worse. Right from the beginning intro which makes the hairs on the back of your neck stand up during the Tony Scott version, here it is bland and forgettable, even with the movie technology having moved on 35 years it's been done worse.It's a major disappointment, I was looking forward to this for a long time. What a shame.

After thirty years in the Navy Pete "Maverick" Mitchell finds himself back at top gun training the best of the best to fly a mission that has never been flown before.This is so far one of the best films this year, and easily beats out the original. From top to bottom this film is exciting and visually stunning but the unexpected addition of a few elements is what pushes it over the top.The relationship between Tom Cruises Maverick and Miles Tellers Rooster is what makes this movie so great, just as the relationship between Maverick and Goose was in the original. But the relationship that really improves is the romantic one between Maverick and Jennifer Connelly's Penny. The original film had a relationship but it took up too much screen time and didn't feel real, this time around the relationship is much more subtle and managed far better.The entire cast of students is great and you can really feel the sense of a team growing during their training.The flight scenes are incredible, every shot is picture perfect and you can feel the urgency throughout the entire film.In terms of gripes there really aren't many. The only thing I would have like to see more of was the relationships between the students. Like I mentioned you can feel the sense of team throughout but individually I would've like to see a bit more.Overall this film is incredible it is top to bottom fun and the added elements of quality characters make for a very meaningful film.9.5/10
A+

So, I haven't even seen the first one (or if I did, it was so long ago I can't remember it), and it has taken me awhile to bother watching this one...not really a genre that interests me. But what is not to like about seeing jet planes shooting through the air at Mach 10.... WITHOUT the use of CGI, but the real thing. And wow, you certainly can tell.The thing that impressed me most was the lack of "The Message" being shoved down my throat - Hollywood take note, this is what people want, not what MCU/Disney is churning out now...forced diversity and all that nonsense. Just a good ol' fashioned story. I am hoping that the "Woke Go Broke" message is finally getting through to the studios - it ain't what people want.Anyway, back to the movie. Tom Cruise is, well, Tom Cruise. I always love a bit of Jennifer Connelly, and I thought Miles Teller was excellent in War Dogs - I am surprised he hasn't become more well known...well he certainly will be now! It was great to see the real thing on the screen, rather than CGI - it really does make a difference. I am a bit annoyed with myself for not getting my act together and seeing it at the Waterloo IMAX theatre in London - I kept meaning too. However, seeing it on my massive TV still did the trick, but I can imagine it would have taken the movie to another level seeing it with IMAX (is that "with IMAX", or "on IMAX", or "in IMAX" ...?)So if you are like me and not really a fan of gung-ho action movies, turn off ya brain and go see it anyway - it's a blast!!
I'm not sure if I've ever seen a better movie. Truly. I'm left speechless. No movie had more climatic moments than this one. Just go and see this please I beg you. I'm writing this from the theater.

Movie Top Gun: Maverick directed by Joseph Kosinski is exceptionally great from start to finish. This movie has to be seen on the big screen to enjoy great cinematography. Tom Cruise appears at the start of movie thanking audience for coming to theater to see the movie.Tom Cruise as Captain Pete "Maverick" Mitchell is perfect in the role of a teacher with vast experience and an excellent motivator . Maverick teaches the way he flies and is a great pilot. Miles Teller as Lt Bradley initially with anger towards Maverick because of the loss of his own father which then turns to respect because of Maverick's approach to flying and his passion for perfection. It was good to see Jennifer Connelly as Penny Benjamin. Maverick's love interest. Penny understands and recognizes that Maverick is great at what he does and encourages him with her trust in his talent. Great movie. Excellent cinematography. It is truly awesome to see Tom Cruise great as always. Really worth 130 minutes spent in front of a big screen . Awesome.

1. All thanks to the King of Hollywood, Thomas Cruise Mapother IV, for making a sequel to another one his box office success after 30+ years and made it more charismatic and thrilling than the original. I loved how they included Top Gun Anthem and Danger Zone to feel closer to the original and the brilliant choice to bring back Val Kilmer for this and gave him a satisfying and emotional ending.2. All thanks to the King of Hollywood, Thomas Cruise Mapother IV, for making a sequel to another one his box office success after 30+ years and made it more charismatic and thrilling than the original. I loved how they included Top Gun Anthem and Danger Zone to feel closer to the original and the brilliant choice to bring back Val Kilmer for this and gave him a satisfying and emotional ending.

Rarely does a sequel equal the original in a movie. This is one of those exceptions. The movie is extremely well done and the lengths that Cruise, et.al. Went to to insure authenticity shows. My only real authenticity complaint is the initial scene where Maverick ejects from his hypersonic plane as it begins to disintegrate at Mach 10.5. Any person who ejects at that sped would immediately crushed by the force of the wind (even thin atmosphere) slamming against his body. Maverick would have been dead right there. But getting over this is easy with the excitement of the plot, the excellent acting and superb directing. Great job guys.

reviews.review_title: Excellent. Best movie I've seen in FOREVER
reviews.content: I don't think I would be the only one to say that the movies Hollywood has been churning out recently for the most part have been pretty terrible. This was amazing. It was worth the 30+ year wait. This movie by far was better than the first. The story and action was so much better. No crappy CGI. All of the scenes were very realistic. The actors were great and Tom Cruise looks amazing. I was on the edge of my seat the entire time. Also, no politics that Hollywood normally loves to pour into everything. If you are going to go see a movie and don't want any of the nonsense this is it.

reviews.review_title: Roars far more vigorously than the first film.
reviews.content: It certainly helps that Top Gun: Maverick actually has a plot with a beginning, middle, and ending that we can follow, unlike its meandering predecessor.The story sets up a mission with clear-cut stakes and impossible odds very early on, and the threat and pressure felt by these pilots was felt by me for almost the entirety of the film.After a clunky first act with VERY cheesy, expository dialogue, the story really gets going with interesting characters, extremely well shot and edited action sequences that put you in the center of the action, well-intentioned humor, and a romantic subplot that is a lot more believable and relevant than the one in the first movie.Plot-wise, there are certainly several elements that don't make sense and can't stand up to logical scrutiny. Jerks like me on the internet will likely have a field day picking apart all the implausible material in this film.But the filmmakers present this story in a way that oozes sincerity and care for all the characters both old and new, and with a passion for entertaining the audience with pulse-pounding action set-pieces.This is an immensely satisfying film. Not just as a sequel, but as a film in its own right.Color me surprised. It was worth the wait.

This is a great fun movie - leading on from the original.There are a few call backs to the original but I didn't find it overpowering.If you haven't seen the original it is all explained for you in a few short flashback scenes.There are some interesting dynamics between the various pilots and Maverick gets to confront the mess he created between the films.The action scenes are great and get the blood pumping.The depiction on the Iranian military is overly hyped for dramatic effect (it looks like they are attacking the Death Star rather than an Iranian bunker) but this isn't a documentary - this is all about fun.I am not a huge fan of Top Gun but both me and my fiancée found this really entertaining.

This movie came with little hype but it was a big hit at the theaters and entered the billion club.A good action entertainment movie
Tom Cruise proves once again that age is only a fraction of the cost to make this list of the best films of his career I've ever seen.Best action and epic scene climax another level
This is the movie that I really enjoyed in theatre
I saw top gun marvek first season but i like them the second season the jet driving scene is very well done
The action scene is shot in a very good way. It is a top grossing movie of this year. Tom Cruise is one of my favorite actors.

Tom Cruise knows how to construct a movie by now and this proves how good he is at it. I was expecting less and instead got more, a very pleasant experience. It covered all the bases a movie should include and what is outstanding is it is a decent script acted out reasonably well. It is not a movie I would see twice but rewarding the first time around as there are no memorable scenes. Also, it is one of those flicks where the ending ends it for good! Worth the price of admission and the time to view. Good job to all involved. To Tom Cruise: Keep up the good work. Forget Hollywood! Give me entertainment! I will continue to pay you for your efforts.

reviews.review_title: Top Gun: Iron Eagle 2 a new hope!
reviews.content:
Save yourself the bother of watching this one and watch the original movie it blatantly rips off, Iron Eagle 2.Or just watch the original Star Wars movie instead
Because this movie is a scene for scene remake of all 3 movies combined.Not only does IE2 have better acting and a better cast but the dog fight scenes are also much superior.Both movies have the same plot and practically the same script. The difference between the two is the references to TopGun shoe horned in to Maverick.It's a nostalgia cash grab that offers nothing new to an audience.The US navy launch a missle strike on a runway to coincide with the mission."Missles are a direct hit. Runway destroyed"
"That will stop them launching fighter planes"Yet, some how Maverick manages to steal an F-14 Tomcat (the planes used in the original movie. Though why it's there when every other aircraft is an FA -18F I've no idea) and successfully take off from said "destroyed" runway.

I like the original Top Gun, but there was still room for improvement. Top Gun: Maverick keeps everything good about the original and fixes pretty much all of its problems. It's still cool, occasionally homoerotic and full of stunning flying, but now with a clearer goal and action scenes that can actually be followed.It takes the original's emotional core (Maverick's friendship with Goose and his relationship with Iceman) and develops it in extemely moving and satisfying ways, not only making for a great watch, but also making me appreciate the original a lot more.

reviews.review_title: Best sequeal movie of all time
reviews.content: We are so use to be disappointed by squeals not living up to the expectation especially sequels with long gaps in between. Top Gun: Maverick is an outstanding movie sequel which respects the first part and is also a standalone in a kind (yes, you can watch the movie without watching the first movie, but do catch the first one later which is equally good). The stunt sequence can be tricky for some but can be understood if it is carefully followed. I will one day watch this movie with my son as one the best movie of my time. It is highly recommended you watch this movie in IMAX.

Top Gun Maverick is exactly what you were expecting.It has it all, from an amazing cast, beautiful planes, a simple yet enjoyable story and amazing action! Oh and did I mention the planes?!You get to see F-14's, F-18's, The Darkstar and some Su-57's, though they remain unnamed in the movie. Even Miles Teller who I don't really like that much does a great job so props to him.All in all a beautiful, plane action movie. Gets a well deserved 9/10 from me!
Just WOW. For a moment I thought I was flying. This movie is one of the best I've seen in my life. Quite an experience. Everyone deserves to see it. Tom Cruise is a GOAT. Amazing!!! 20/10.

This movie is going to find reviewers split down the middle between those who grew up in the late 80s, and those who did not. Even if your parents made you watch the first Top Gun twenty years after it came out; the nostalgia has to be different from those who experienced it first hand. THAT nostalgia is what makes this sequel so much fun. We've been waiting a very long time, and they definitely delivered. It's as action packed as the 1st one, they didn't stray from the original music, and the cheesy factor is all there. However, if you were never invested in the first movie; if you don't quote lines to this day from the original script, then you may find this movie not in your top ten. For me, it was like going home.And a huge shoutout to Miles Teller. He nailed his role as Goose's son. He didn't do an impression of Goose, but he played it with such convincing mannerisms that you had to wonder if he really is Anthony Edwards' son.

You all know, not here to say much, but man, Tom Is our Last action hero!You willing to do this king of movie challenge is for praise, he cooked it for years and I enjoyed every second of that photography that rawness that simple story but so effective.Dont want to talk about story in details and stuff all said above is enough.

An excellent sequel to the legendary film from the eighties.Tom Cruise returns in the role of Pete Mitchell, who has to train pilots for a dangerous mission.This is one of those sequels that managed to convey the atmosphere from the previous film, and that in itself is a success. The film is full of fun and tense scenes of fighting in the air, it has emotions as well as nostalgia.The film is a big hit precisely because viewers want fun, they want an escape from reality, when we go to the cinema we primarily want to have fun.The director and screenwriters really managed to do a great job, delivering the viewer good old-fashioned entertainment. In a film like this, we're not looking for reality, we want fun and likeable characters, and Top Gun has just that.The film was excellently directed, and the soundtrack again fitted perfectly into the film.Top Gun: Maverick is definitely the movie that deserves the highest ratings.

reviews.review_title: Best movie I've seen in a long time...
reviews.content: Tom Cruise is just a master at making movies people love to watch and this is one of his best.Great cast, story, soundtrack and amazing action sequences with a lot of nostalgia thrown in.The biggest negative of streaming platforms is quantity over quality and the lack of big blockbuster movies made for the big screen.This movie is so refreshing and is one of the best movies released in a long time. It's hard to think of any negatives or how it could be improved.It was a huge risk making this sequel so long after the iconic first film, but I think it even surpasses the original, which is an incredible feat.

reviews.review_title: Total thrill ride and a great sequel
reviews.content: Like many, I was skeptical this would be good but I came out of the screening absolutely buzzing. First time in ages.The film's primary strength is its phenomenal aerial sequences, which are (incredibly) way better than the original. Whatever CG is in use in the film, it's sparse and extremely well hidden.The main plot is a total rip off of another rather well-known fighter pilot movie but it works SO well as a homage rather than a rip off.And unlike so many films these days, I did end up caring about the characters. It wasn't just a load of cartoonish nonsense and fake emotion.No, it's not serious or intelligent. Yes, it's brilliant.

After over thirty years in the US Navy, Captain Pete "Maverick" Mitchell is still flying. He should be an Admiral by now but that's not how things have worked out. When a country antagonistic towards the US builds a uranium enrichment site with the aim of creating nuclear weapons, the Navy devises a plan to bomb and destroy the site. They call Maverick back to Top Gun to train the pilots for the mission. One of the pilots is Lt Bradley "Rooster" Bradshaw, the son of Maverick's former Radar Intercept Office, Goose, who died while flying with Maverick. Rooster still bears a grudge against Maverick.An action-packed sequel to Top Gun (1986). The plot is quite cheesy, contrived and unrealistic and also quite predictable in many ways but the action more than makes up for this. Some incredible flying sequences, all done using actual aircraft rather than CGI.Tom Cruise does what he does best, be an all-action hero, and does it very well. Of the original cast, only he and Val Kilmer are in this one and Kilmer only has one scene. Jennifer Connelly fills in for Kelly McGillis as the love interest (one of the more predictable sub-plots within the film). A host of young stars, lead by Miles Teller as Rooster, put in decent performances as the new breed of Top Gun pilots.All in all, it's basic and predictable but highly entertaining.

reviews.review_title: Action level way higher than (disappointing) acting level
reviews.content: Defenitly not an 8 star movie, maybe just for the Tom Cruise fanboys (pun intended).Action packed, no doubt. But the level of acting is poor. The political correctness is painful. The characters are not build to any level. It's one long "tribute" to the original movie but doesn't come close. I was disappointed as I saw the 8.5 rating on IMDb before seeing the movie.I'd give it a 6.5, just for Jennifer being gorgeous as always I'll make it a 7.

Tenet accidentally found itself charged with saving cinema as the first big post-Covid release out of the gate. For all its technical excellence, it tied itself up in knots and was nowhere near fun enough for the job. Top Gun: Maverick waited, and waited, and waited some more. Release dates kept being pushed back until we thought it was something they were trying to hide in embarrassment. How wrong we were. It's a blast and one that perhaps only someone like Tom Cruise could deliver with his ridiculous work ethic and innate understanding of what audiences want. It's exciting, spectacular and a whole heap of unashamed fun. If it glorifies the military-industrial complex too much, then some of us may need to remember that it's possible to enjoy a piece of art for what it is and not buy into its undergirding principles. This is a film that arrived precisely when we all needed some big-screen fun and is perfectly crafted by a group of people who innately understand just how to deliver that. Love it for what it is.

Hard to imagine a better sequel. It makes the 36 year gap between the two films feel like a brief intermission. (Remember when they used to have that at the movies?). If you loved the original - and who didn't back when it came out - this is like coming back for seconds with extra gravy.

I'm a huge Top Gun fan, the original is brilliant but with some flaws and mediocre bits thrown in.I couldn't wait to see Maverick and it didn't disappoint, I saw it twice at the cinema and now have the digital copy at home.It's simply brilliant and better than the original which is something that doesn't usually happen.I've already watched it at home numerous times and it is still brilliant.Cruise is awesome as Maverick and the whole film and story is ace, its funny in places, very serious in others and with Val Kilmer making an appearance after his health problems it's very poignant.Get yourself a copy crank up the sound and be prepared to be blown away.

reviews.review_title: One of the best sequels ever
reviews.content: Excellent from start to finish. Ties perfectly with the first one from almost 40 years ago. The casting is excellent and Tom Cruise once again "aces" the role of Maverick.This is an instant classic that cinema needed so desperately with so many underwhelming films being produced these days.

Only Very Mild Spoilers!I anxiously anticipated the release of Top Gun Maverick, which for anyone who did, made for an even-higher bar of expectations because of the films' multiple covid delays. I don't know how much of that(if any) was calculated, but in hindsight, I suspect it only helped the film at the box office.Only a week removed from another nostalgic sequel, Jurassic World Dominion(5/10), I had become even hungrier-for(and more wary-of)something like this.No worries here.Maverick is an action film-lovers' delight. The flight sequences are beyond amazing, and the film doesn't skimp at all in this regard. The film has other strengths as well.It's kinda nice to not use or need as much CGI in a blockbuster action flick. The pacing and spacing of the action sequences is also well-balanced. The film never drags, and at the same time, it isn't sensory overload(think Transformers). It also borrows some things from some other action/aviation films; Firefox and Iron Eagle come to mind.Of course the film is very nostalgic, with many nods,references, characters, and plot continuations from the first film, but unlike Force Awakens, World Dominion, and others; Maverick takes very good care of most of these nostalgic moments. One nostalgic scene with Kilmer is deftly handled, and a love scene(or a lack of one) with newcomer Jennifer Connely(newcomer to TG anyway) is tactful. The last 30 minutes of the film is nonstop exhilaration, and the film is worthy of repeat viewings. That's not to say that some scenes aren't a little too "safe", because they are, nor to say the film doesn't have it's fair share of unrealistic moments, it does. Either way, the audience will be having way too much fun in the cockpit to care. Some of the emotional chords do ring true. Solid performances all-around never hurts.Miles Tellers "Rooster" is a perfect continuation of the maverick/goose storyline, but perhaps my biggest gripe with Top Gun Maverick is that Teller and his undeniable talent are perhaps under-used, and the film is one or two emotional scenes involving Rooster away from a 9/10 for me. It's very close to 9, and I may revisit after another viewing.Overall, I can recommend Maverick without hesitation - it exceeded already high(and even-further elevated) expectations. It shares some of the same strengths and weaknesses of the first film, but it's in that very rarified air where the sequel surpasses an already good original.83/100.

reviews.review_title: Top Gun meets Mission Impossible meets Star Wars
reviews.content: Top Gun Maverick is a wash rinse repeat formula right from the opening title, so much in fact that I had to double check I was watching the right film and not the first one again.The yet another love story was less intrusive and more appreciable, especially with the sublime Jennifer Connelly and while Val Kilmer is back don't hold your breath.Tom Cruise is off to Top Gun again, but to teach recruits a Mission Impossible previously seen in Star Wars IV: A New Hope where the Rebels had to follow a perilous path in their one shot to blow up the Death Star.I'll spare the details but eventually they get a mission accomplished. And while I was satisfied with this sequel and denouement, I wanted more before the credits starts to roll, and oh boy did I get more. And after I could I could take no more. I still GOT MORE. I was in awe, at the edge of my seat, speechless and mindblowned.The IMAX 4k + insane manoeuvres, flights and stunts were incredible. That one scene where one enemy pilot avoid a missile by doing a spiralling-dead-butterfly-I-don't-know-what manoeuvre will stay with me for a long time and I almost started rooting for him afterwards.Yes Top Gun Maverick is a little on the nose and predictable but I had a blast watching it. I was originally gonna rate it a 8 but I'm bumping it to 9 out of 10.

Actually, it is. I think for the fighter-pilot enthusiasts among us it is truly a must see and a worthy sequel to the original Top Gun. It includes the old heroes and some of their family members, but in a realistic historic way. Maverick is still Maverick and he will do "whatever it takes" and a true hero we can all root for. Val Kilmer is there in spite of his medical condition and the movie is done around it and a respectable way.The aviation hobbyists between us will appreciate the sky-high fighting actions, which are phenomenal and shows many kinds of planes and flying styles, all in-between constant action and solid progression of story-line. The movie-lovers will appreciate the solid character building, the dialogues and the quick pace up to its final conclusion.On topic of diversity and inclusion, there is a defensible representation here, but not in a 'woke' way, which is way too common in recent Hollywood productions. I feel many directors can learn from this movie how to appreciate women, and women of service in particular, without having to make the white male an immediate enemy.Overall very recommended, possibly this summer's greatest movie! I can see how a fan of the franchise will score this a '10' but for us, mere mortals, I feel it is a very solid 4 stars. Exact score: 82 / 100.

reviews.review_title: Honest review of Top Gun Maverick...
reviews.content: It's not often that I'll call a movie 'Perfect' but Top Gun Maverick is a perfect movie. Even more impressive, it joins a club of very rare movies whose sequels are actually better than their classic originals.As far as returning cast, Val Kilmer does so much with so little and leaves an indelible mark on the movie; likely his last.Charles Parnell's Warlock and Bashir Salahuddin's Hondo were great additions to the continuing story and played wonderfully alongside Tom Cruise, adding levity and sincerity with precision.Jennifer Connolly is simply stunning and endearing as Maverick's love interest. How she manages to look better with each passing year... one of life's greatest mysteries *wink wink*The young Top Gun class is as vibrant as they are diverse and echo the original class mightily. Their similarities are not hackneyed however, as said similarities allow us to see them through Maverick's lens as instructor, which informs his evolution and self-awareness. Watching the original movie recently certainly helps with this.Miles Teller shows again why he's one of the best actors of his generation. His range is on full display here and there are moments where he remarkably captures the essence of Anthony Edwards' Goose.This movie has everything... drama, love, nostalgia, action, comedy, wit, tear-jerking... I mean, EVERYTHING!The subtlety with which the nostalgia is dealt with is the masterstroke. Many directors/writers try to pack too much in, especially with massive gaps between installments... some get so caught up in wanting to recapture the spirit of the original that they end up doing an accidental remake; not this movie... as I said, it's perfect.RUN, don't walk, to the theaters to catch this on the big screen! It's definitely worth it!10/10.
Some of the dialogue in the air was corny but all the flight and combat scenes made up for that. Very entertaining. Tom Cruise still has it. Respect to pilots that actually fly these supersonic jets.

reviews.review_title: Everything you want from a summer blockbuster
reviews.content: Top Gun: Maverick is absolutely worth seeing in theatres - don't miss it! It's been a highlight of my summer and one of the best theatre experiences I can recall. The storyline is satisfying for fans of the original as it calls back to it many times, but the stunning element of this film is the epic flights, sound design. I was in the edge of my seat!It's also quite funny in a few moments and definitely emotional too. It surpasses the sequel in every way. It's an uncomplicated, wildly entertaining romp that will make you want to go experience it in the theatres again and again. Turn your brain off and enjoy Top Gun! 🇺🇸🇺🇸🇺🇸

Holy balls this was insane!! I loved every minute of it and was on the edge of my seat the whole time. I'm scared to say it but I think it was better than the original which is so tough! It was terrifying.

reviews.review_title: A masterpiece of a film, delivers exactly what you could hope for and more, Tom Cruise has still got it!
reviews.content: It's very rare to walk out after a movie both in awe and in pure joy. But that's what Top Gun 2 did!!!It was flawless, not a moment or scene wasted, it paid tribute to the original but did not try and redo, not try to be super smart or modern or different. Just delivered a great experience. And this film was an experience, emotionally of highs and lows, and an adrenaline rush I'm still feeling after driving home with a smile on my face.Tom Cruise as Maverick has hardly aged a bit and still has more charisma than most of the human population combined. Great to see some of the classic characters back but the new ones hold their own, especially Rooster the son of Goose, Hangman and Bob. The relationships between all the characters are believable and grow well through the film.The action scenes are edge of your seat stuff, something to be said for not using CGI?Sometimes you wonder what is the point of sequels, this time I'm glad sequels exist just to see this outstanding film. Just watch it.

reviews.review_title: It's my first 10 and truly deserved
reviews.content: What a movie. No spoilers here.Excellent references to the original. Top, top acting. Insane emotional rollercoaster.I saw the ending coming but it still wowed.Incredible.

I'll admit I'm not a huge fan of the original Top Gun. I thought the cheesy story and feel good atmosphere just doesn't age well into today. So i inaccurately assumed that the sequel would just carry that over. I went to the theatre mostly for the Jet action sequences. What I got however was a movie that had a well-written story with emotion that I wasn't expecting. This was a pleasant surprise and I strongly encourage everyone to go see it.

reviews.review_title: See this on the biggest screen available
reviews.content: Action thriller (delayed release due to the pandemic).The first Top Gun was the most 80's of 80's movies.I was very excited about this sequel, especially after all the hype and as I haven't been to the cinema for over 2.5 years.Picking up over 35 years after the original Top Gun, this film follows Pete "Maverick" Mitchell (Tom Cruise), who is now a test pilot recalled to the Top Gun academy, this time to be an instructor of a bunch of hot-head graduates. The training takes the new best of the best for a near-impossible strike mission, reminiscent of the Star Wars plot, a virtual suicide mission that only the best pilots in the world would ever contemplate. All of them are taken to their breaking points.One of the graduates is played by Miles Teller (who portrays the son of 'Goose,' Maverick's old flying partner). There's an obvious and justifiable atmosphere.Almost all the airborne sequences were achieved with practical effects, no (or very little) CGI and it really shows.Not a complicated plot but, like the original, it didn't need to be. This film retains the spirit of the original and is everything you would hope for and kept me engaged from start to finish.

I did not want to go see this as I'm not a fan of action movies but my family dragged me along. Boy was I surprised! This kept me on the edge of my seat to the point where I forgot to take a single bite of my popcorn! It was constantly interesting and the relationship between Maverick and Rooster was very cool to see. The flying scenes were perfectly intense and the cast was good too. Tom Cruise never ages! Loved loved loved this film! Also saw Everything Everywhere All at Once recently, and that sucked! This was awesome!

reviews.review_title: Top Gun: Maverick is simply the "Top Gun" of movies of the last decades (pun intended).
reviews.content: I've been waiting for 30+ years for this sequel and wasn't disappointed at all, as the movie delivered on everything I was hoping and expecting from it.A big thing that you just can't overlook is how they used the past "nostalgia factor" to the maximum, where it brought me into a roller coaster of emotions and it clearly paid off. The movie didn't just explore the present era but also used the past to connect the two together in a masterful way. The story was good and believable plus the fact that no CGI (except for the enemy fighter jets which are SU-57 NATO designation "Felon", Russia's 5th Gen aircrafts) was used for the flight/dogfight scenes, definitely made the movie to be in a league of its own. The only reason that they had to use CGI to show off the Russian SU-57 "Felon" fighter jets was that I am sure Russia would not have permitted the use of their own best new 5th generation aircraft for an American movie where their aircrafts are blown out of the sky by 4th generation American fighter jets.The work these actors including Tom Cruise had to go through to capture the reality of all events was simply masterful and you see why Tom Cruise delivers again and again as a box office draw, even after decades of movies. Anyone who saw the 1st "Top Gun" 1986 movie have to see this movie because it's beyond a cult culture movie. I know this sequel is the last "Top Gun" movie and it saddens me because after watching this movie, I was left wanting. But, as the saying goes "All good things must come to an end". And this movie had it all, from start to finish. It gave me shivers and the nostalgia factors made me choke at times. That's how good this movie brought out emotions from the viewers who were of age to see the original 1986 movie when it first came out.Nothing in this movie was overboard, everything was carefully measured so that it would have a multitude of moments that touched every chord of emotions. I remember when the first Top Gun movie came out, the military had an incredible influx of men/women wanting to join the military's every different branches, some wanted to be pilots, some infantry, Army, Marines, Rangers, some special operators and so on. I wonder if this sequel will have the same effect of patriotisms that the first one had?Bottom line, if there's only one movie you could/would see out of all the other movies that are out and coming out right now, "Top Gun: Maverick" is the movie to watch. There's never been a movie like this and nor will there be another movie like it ever again. It's perfect in all its multiple facets and worth every penny to watch. So, if there's only one movie you can watch this summer, "Top Gun: Maverick" is the one to watch. I've already seen it 3 times.

What can I say. In 1986 I was 17 years old. Lean and fit. My eyes already towards the sky thinking about a career in aviation. Everything good ahead of me. Hope. Fun. Exploration. Discovery. Learning. A year later I would be studying and flying to earn my Private license.My recollections of my youth always seem a little fuzzy and without crisp clarity but I wont forget how Top Gun (1986) left me feeling. It was a spectacle like no other I had ever seen. Everyone was young and beautiful. Cool beyond words. But those machines I fell for the machines. Since that time I have been a fighter jet nerd. Models, RC models, simulators and a career in civil aviation.Top Gun Maverick was setting up to be a complete failure as my outlook on such similar projects had be set by other failures of this nature. Supposed grandiose sequils/prequils ended up in flops. I have seen every aviation movie there is to see and I with few as an exception I have ended up just sitting there counting Hollywood's mistakes in their portrayal of flight and the endless minutia that surrounds it. I still have the expectation that things will be accurate. Really accurate. But mostly I am disappointed. You would think that with all that money they would hire at least a private pilot to consult and tell them which way the ailerons should move when a plane banks right.Within 5 minutes I didn't notice that my hands were clenched, and I was tensed up, a clear sign I had bought in. Not everything is perfectly correct, but Tom Cruise made sure that as much realism landed on film to lock in on the nerds like me. The number of flares before exhausted the manual pitch override lever to over G the airframe. Bullet count and difficulty in hitting a target.Another point. They didn't need to oversell the female fighter pilot idea. They didn't need to "She Hulk" this woman. She was short and stout, just like you want them for high G tolerance IRL. She worked just fine in the film. A smooth seamless fit.A wonderful movie. I can't remember when the last time I screamed at my monitor and clapped my hands "F#%K Yeah!" Who does that anymore?Nice work Tom. Those of us in the know understand it was your consultation that made this movie what it is.

As a fan of the original Top Gun, I was thrilled when it was announced there'd be a sequel. The critics were right: thanks to actual flying (no, Tom Cruise was NOT allowed to actually fly multimillion dollar government assets!), a wonderful opening scene, excellent writing, and characters with emotional impact, it's much better than the original. I loved how 'real' everything felt, and the fact that the late Goose was still very much present throughout the whole film. The scene between Maverick and Ice made me cry.I've giving this a 9 out of 10 because of any and all mistakes, errors etc. Even though there's no such thing as perfection, this film comes damn close!

reviews.review_title: Uncompromisingly FUN! I'm 46 years old, and this movie stunned me
reviews.content: I am speechless. This may have been one of the, if not THE best movie-theater going experience in my whole life. Keep in mind I watched Empire Strikes Back at the theater in 1981 and the Lord Of the Rings Trilogy in the early 2000s, and since those experiences, I don't believe I felt anything close to this.Especially for having my two most special people along with me for the ride. And guess what? My seven year old, who I kind of dragged along begrudgingly with me, also stated it was the best movie he ever saw. My daughter also had a blast, and she's only ten.The 2 hours and 10 minutes of running time went by unnoticed, and it was the first time my youngest did not leave his seat for a restroom run.I am stunned.I will pre-order the Blu-Ray as fast as possible.

Top Gun: Maverick takes place more than thirty years after the events of Top Gun(1986). Capt. Pete 'Maverick' Mitchell(Tom Cruise) continues flying fighter jets, as one of the Navy's best aviators. He pushes all the boundaries, while doing so. Maverick makes sure he doesn't get a promotion as this would not allow him to fly anymore & would keep him grounded.Top Gun: Maverick is a jaw-droppingly excellent film. Director Joseph Kosinski has given us a movie that has all the elements that made Top Gun(1986) a classic & cranks it up several notches. This results in a feel-good, action-packed & nostalgic adventure. The action/flying set pieces are phenomenal. What's super impressive is that all the actors actually shot the film inside real fighter jets & no CGI is used. These flying sequences are the highlight of the movie. Tom Cruise is spectacular as Capt. Pete 'Maverick' Mitchell. Cruise effortlessly steps back into the role that defined his career. Jennifer Connelly is superb as Penny Benjamin. Miles Teller is outstanding as Lt. Bradley 'Rooster' Bradshaw. Jon Hamm & Charles Parnell are excellent as Adm. Beau 'Cyclone' Simpson & Adm. Solomon 'Warlock' Bates, respectively. Bashir Salahuddin, Monica Barbaro, Lewis Pullman, Jay Ellis, Danny Ramirez & Glen Powell are fantastic as Wo-1. Bernie 'Hondo' Coleman, Lt. Natasha 'Phoenix' Trace, Lt. Robert 'Bob' Floyd, Lt. Reuben 'Payback' Fitch, Lt. Mickey 'Fanboy' Garcia & Lt. Jake 'Hangman' Seresin. The supporting cast is great. Top Gun: Maverick is a must watch for Top Gun(1986) & Tom Cruise fans. Watch it on the biggest screen possible, preferably IMAX. This will make you feel like you're a part of the action!

I am in the minority here. I was looking forward to watching this because of all the raves with which the critics & fans have greeted it. Also, I remember the original quite fondly, and I was eager to see Tom Cruise defying the natural deprivations of others his same age.On the last score, only, I was not disappointed. Elsewhere I could not go along with the overly lavish heaps of praise. Mr. Cruise's feats and the aircraft's stunts were impressive, but I could hardly tell one plane from another in the super-rapid editing, jumping from one wing of fighters to another in breathless, jumping-bean cuts.The closeups of pilots in their cockpits were framed alike, adding to the difficulty of following the aerial dog-fighting, and my attempts to read helmets for call signs were defeated much of the time by the choppy cutting.After a time, I just gave up, rested my eyes, and let auu major attraction of the movie-the meaningful movement of aircraft-go right over my head.I wanted to get into the characters' relationships. The parental legacy, in the person of the son of our hero's former flying buddy, was intriguing. But the complexity of real and undeserved guilt was never resolved in therapeutic detail. Instead, it-and far too many other issues of male bonding-were blurred, one guy couple to the next, in repetitious & predictably firm handclaps accompanied by long, silent eye contacts, deep soul-to-soul stares between macho buddies.I know guys are supposed to be long on the physical and short on the verbal, but couldn't they have some variation in the physical?Jennifer Connelly provides a welcome relief from all the maleness. She gives some real depth to her under-written character. I would have appreciated more development in her character's line.

TL;DR Corny. Clichéd. Totally exhilarating. 4.5*It's a Tom Cruise Top Gun film and it delivers exactly what you expect, and exactly what you want.Reprising his role as Maverick, Tom Cruise is ordered back to the Top Gun School by Admiral 'Iceman' (a short cameo from an ailing Val Kilmer) to train the current generation of super pilots for a near mission impossible. Dramatic tension is inevitable with one of the pilots, Rooster Bradshaw being son of Goose, Maverick's wing man in the iconic 1986 film of which this is the sequel.The plot is completely derivative and predictable, the characters two dimensional. But you know that before the film begins. Don't whinge about it.The flight photography is constantly stupendous and never confusing; the story rips along, very well paced by director Joseph Kosinski. There's a few meta jokes pertaining to the first film, again as you'd expect, and the soundtrack is superb.The film's main flaw, such as it is, is its casting imbalance. Tom Cruise dominates throughout; with one notable exception toward the end, none of the supporting cast ever really get a chance to shine. I guess this is near inevitable, however, when you're one of the greatest film stars of all time and also the film's producer. No different to Hamlet though.This is a beltingly good action movie which will disappoint very few who enjoy this genre of film. And who doesn't?

One of the best action movies of all times and clearly better than anything of that movie type Hollywood has produced in the last 20:years.Just perfect cinema fun with unbelievable flight scenes and of course reminder of the childhood in the eighties. Amazing.
How films used to be before the woke infected Holywood with lazy remakes and thinly veiled identity politics. An absolute classic. Just sit back with a beer and enjoy the action.

reviews.review_title: Thanks for the sequel.. BRILLIANT it WAS!
reviews.content: This sequel brought back a lot of memories to me of the first 'Top Gun'. It was a great ride back to the beginning and a great ride into the new. My daughter and i enjoyed every minute of if. Congrats to Tom Cruise and everyone involved in this film. BRILLIANT AND THANK YOU!

reviews.review_title: THE sequel that we waited for!
reviews.content: I went to an early evening screening on a Wednesday evening here in Ireland and to the delight of my friend and I there was only one other person in the Cinema. This is the norm, before 19.00 here. The story started off with some slow moments, kicked into gear & delivered in punches. I enjoyed the original, a lot and it's one of the films of the 80s my friends & I loved and quoted, often. But as it got older the story was okay, a little introductory, laced with sadness. This one has a more intricate & interesting story with a cracking cast, like the first one. There is some antagonism with bravado & stunning cinematography. There was a dip in the story in the middle, maybe late in the film but it unfolds quickly as to why. This is a must see in the Cinema. Miss it at your own peril !!

reviews.review_title: It doesn't get any better than this!
reviews.content: Compared to the 1st Top Gun movie, this did not disappoint. Hands down, the best movie out there right now to see in theatre (and a must see in theatre)Seeing the chemistry between the actors and actresses is also what made this movie great! Not gonna lie, expected a different ending but it did not disappoint. Tom Cruises signature of a movie!

Cool action, nice cinematography. Entertaining and never boring. Of course the storyline is thin, but that's expected with these movies. Too be honest it was a long while ago since I watched the previous movies and I don't remember much of that, but that didn't really matter for this movie.
A great movie. Don't intellectualize or analyze, just sit back and enjoy the ride. I've been waiting for an action movie of this caliber for a long time.

As a woman that is Tom's age, I obviously am a fan of the original Top Gun, having seen it opening weekend back in the day and periodically throughout the years. I have to say I am NOT a fan of sequels, when something is that good, leave it alone!!!I was wrong (in this case). Absolutely stellar film and performances, mixing nostalgia with modern day. It has everything the original had and more. Loved every minute and the time flew too quickly. Kudos to everyone involved in bringing us back in time-in a most modern way. Tugged at the heartstrings of everyone in my group, female and male. I loved being transported back to The Danger Zone. :))
