I was very impressed.I appreciated the current flying techniques, seeing the different types of aircraft, & following a mission.I was also happy to see Mav find another love interest (and who better than Jennifer Connelly).His tension w/Rooster was palpable & the Hangman/Rooster relationship mirrored his w/Iceman.If I were to make any critiques, they are minor. I wondered during the span of the movie where all of Maverick's bravado & cockiness went. He was so sure of himself & arrogant about his flying ability in the original & deservedly so. I was so happy to see Val Kilmer in the film! I wish they didn't have him die, though. I kept hoping I'd see Slider, Cougar, Hollywood, & Merlin come back for the funeral. That was a bit disappointing, but overall, high marks for Vol ll of the Top Gun films.

Top Gun: Maverick is an exciting sequel to an 80's classic combining brilliant cinematography, amazing action, an entertaining plot that isn't hard to follow, and excellent performances from everyone. You don't even have to watch the first Top Gun to enjoy this, so don't worry about watching the first movie beforehand, I didn't and I still loved it. So to put it shortly: give it a watch. I doubt you'll be disappointed.

Pretty awesome sequel with Tom in awesome form. Unbelievable action sequences and interesting story that balances nostalgia, new ideas and the expected hokiness. Teller is a great actor, and successfully matches the Cruise intensity. Shameless money spinner, but we greedily lap it up, as this film reminds us of how good films used to be. 8/10.

reviews.review_title: Perfect Sequel Thats Better Than the Original
reviews.content: I genuinely cannot think of a criticism for this movie that isn't a tiny nit-pick. Obviously, the flight sequences shot inside actual F-18s are breathtaking, and everything is just masterfully done. The plot line with Rooster, the son of Goose, pulls on the heartstrings just enough without coming off as overly sappy. Tom Cruise gives his best performance of the last decade. The music is outstanding, and the use of songs is much more in control than the first. Unlike the first movie, where the final battle comes out of nowhere, this entire movie builds up to this impossible mission, and the finale has so much tension and pay off. This is far better the the first Top Gun, and is the best movie of the year so far.

reviews.review_title: WOW! JUST WOW!! Rare Cinematic Combination of Action Footage and Excellent Story!
reviews.content: See this movie on the largest screen possible, be it XD or IMAX! This might be one of the greatest action movies ever! Seatbelts should be required in the theater.When I heard that this project was greenlit, I must admit that I rolled me eyes. I thought too much time had passed, I thought for certain that the script would be weak. I thought it would bring great shame upon the original.It did not and I was wrong. I am so happy that I was wrong. This is sequel that is as good as the original.Go to the theater now.

reviews.review_title: It was a complete flood of emotions.
reviews.content: I was in my teens when the first movie came out. At that time, there was no social media, internet and mobile phone as there is now. I remember like it was yesterday that I was mesmerized when I watched the movie "Top Gun" in the cinema and even hung a poster of the movie in my room. A lot of my friends (including me) started to dream of being pilots. I sewed crests on my denim jacket. Years passed. Some of our elders, who took some of us to the movie, have passed away, some of us now have young children.I was excited when I heard that a sequel to the movie that left such a mark in our youth years would even be shot. Even when "Danger Zone" started playing in its very first scene, I was shivering.It would not be a lie if I say that the film is an invaluable blessing for a fan like me. A lot of effort and time was spent. If possible, I think it will be very enjoyable to watch in 4dx screen. It is definitely a movie worth the money you will pay to watch it in the cinema.

reviews.review_title: Terrific entertainment - but take your brain out!
reviews.content: Well Tom Cruise is still able to convinces with his charm and his smile that he is the Top Gun but you really need to take your brain out for this film. The plot is really daft but then you don't go for the plot. Just to say the graphics and the action really do sweep you away and take you out of your seat. They are absolutely phenomenal. Must be seen on the big screen but I wouldn't recommend it in 3-D if you are prone to seasickness! Just take your brain out and sit back and enjoy the spectacle!

36 years later, Tom Cruise returns as Maverick in the sequel to Tony Scott's Top Gun. Though, with the addition of Miles Teller, Jon Hamm and the inclusion of Val Kilmer; director Joseph Kosinski undoubtedly felt the pressure to turn up the knots, and match the original through utilising the pre-existing history, and writing its newest chapter. It is worth noting that Top Gun: Maverick is dedicated to Scott, who died by suicide in 2012. He had been developing his own sequel before his death.After more than 30 years of service as one of the Navy's top aviators, Pete "Maverick" Mitchell is where he belongs, pushing the envelope as a courageous test pilot and dodging the advancement in rank that would ground him. Training a detachment of graduates for a special assignment, Maverick must confront the ghosts of his past and his deepest fears, culminating in a mission that demands the ultimate sacrifice from those who choose to fly it.Through a cleaner lens, Kosinski captures a slick Tom Cruise suiting up with his iconic shades and leather jacket before speeding through Los Angeles open space as the sun sets in the background. A fitting scene to translate: Maverick is back. The film runs at a fast-pace, much like that of a fighter jet, many scenes set in the sky add to the production's brilliance, allowing for humour and comforting exchanges, in fact, three of the six new actors threw up every day when filming in the jets.A carefully crafted picture that times well when to refers to the past, allowing fans of the original to remain invested in the story, though also providing context for those who hadn't seen. Cruise and Teller master their art in difficult roles. Cruise as an authoritative character who must show his experience and transmit his wisdom to the next generation, Rooster (Teller) is very much a copy of his father, caring, fun and a god damn good flyer.Allusions to the past help facilitate the forward direction of the plot, though, they also offer scenes of nostalgia, particularly in an exchange between Kilmer and Cruise, the former, whom suffers from throat cancer, ensured he encapsulated the respect and integrity of his famous name 'Iceman'.Sensational cinematography makes the film as celebrated as it still is today. The detail of the aviation school and the task-in-hand is extremely thorough in making certain that the movie strengthens its authentic feel.A fitting display for all Top Gun fans, however, also a job well done in the making of many new. If that's still not you, despite being released in May, Top Gun: Maverick is still on in UK cinemas today!

reviews.review_title: This is what going to the movies is all about! A milestone movei!
reviews.content:
I laughed, I cried, I was thrilled! This is what going to the movies is all about! It was beyond entertaining! It was epic in every way! The action sequences were stunning and knowing the actors are in the planes made it even more incredible. Tom Cruise is not only a master at making incredible movies,
I have seen several interviews and he is humble, respectful, dedicated, extremely hard working, generous, genuine and one of the nicest and most professional beings on this planet. All the rest of the actors were absolutely great in their own way and is also what made this movie so good. Lastly, the scene with Ice Man and the emotion that Val Kilmer conveyed was very moving. Definately will be seeing this again!

reviews.review_title: Are these reviews being bought by the military industrial complex?
reviews.content: Went with an open mind. Didn't expect anything from the movie. Hadn't even seen a trailer until the reviews were claiming it was a masterpiece, so I decided to check it out. Predictable plot, no stakes, CHEESIEST dialogue you ever heard, piss poor character development, boring plot, etc. This movie is such a waste of time. Was rolling my eyes at Tom Cruise's cheesiness. And Jennifer Connelly's character was so embarrassingly cringe. Also why was the edgy Air Force guy smiling throughout every single line of his. Again, the best way I'd describe this movie is cheesy. What a ridiculous movie.

reviews.review_title: Edge of my seat! That hasn't happened in years!
reviews.content: Just saw this in a theater and it did something that very few movies have done in years, made me feel like I was on the edge of my seat. I was actually left breathless by some of the action scenes. If you haven't seen this movie yet, watch it soon. It's damn good!

Just a good old-fashioned thrills movie, but with good character development and off-thrills moments. What this doesn't have is stale dialogue, crappy CGI, meaningless deaths, hidden agendas, and filler time to make it run 2:45. All the actors are great, it's just a wonderful movie. And that's all I need to say.

reviews.review_title: Maybe the Best sequel ever made?!
reviews.content: This is a movie that can only be watched properly in theatres, it's truly a ride and the practical effects are amazing I like to think of this movie as a once in a decade movie it hardly has CGI in it, it's not woke (thank god), it uses mostly practical effect and that makes the Scenes with the Jets all that more compelling and cool to know that all of the stuff that was on camera really happened and the soundtrack, oh my god the soundtrack I have never felt goosebumps as much as when Harold Faltermeyer's Top Gun anthem started and then Kenny Loggins Danger Zone right after it right at the start of the movie this movie deserves all the praise it gets Highly Recommended P. S. Don't be a loser and wait for this to come on streaming SEE IT NOW spend the money and see it.

Growing up, the original Top Gun was a movie that my father and I bonded over. My obsession with planes fueled my love for this movie, not to mention that killer soundtrack... and beach volleyball.Top Gun: Maverick was a perfect sequel to the 1986 original movie, maybe even superior. My favourite thing about this movie is the vast amount of practical flight scenes. The flight scenes are by far the best cinematic flight scenes in history. The story had a surprising level of depth to it and even resonated for people who hadn't seen the original.I truly felt transported to the DANGER ZONE!!

Top gun maverick it was worth it watching it in theatres the action was great. It had it sad moments and funny moments but overall it was great i loved but i have seen the first one... i really recommend watching it you'll love it my rating was 9.3/10.

reviews.review_title: A Stretch but Still Very Good
reviews.content: Okay, it's Maverick so you'll see some things here that will make you say, yeah right. And let's just get away from the fact that the opening scene is from the movie The Right Stuff. And forget about the main theme being a total remake of the original Star Wars. It's got great action, it's light on the love story between the older and wiser Penny Benjamin but that's okay, it hits the right notes. The Iceman scene is great and touching. If you like the original you'll like this one. Is it better? Eh, maybe, but they are both high on action and this one was worth the 3 year wait. I finally got to see it and it was a really good movie worth the time and money. Go see it.

reviews.review_title: i do not understand these reviews
reviews.content: If you're taking into consideration all great films this is a 6 at best.The first 2 minutes are fun then it immediately gets boring and predictable. Instead of using the new characters to drive the plot they make us revisit tom's character who hasn't grown since the last movie and we throw goose's son in to move him forward except it's not well done it's just cheesy and boring.All the time spent in the planes is absolutely sick and 10/10 action. But the other 60% of the film is about a 3/10.The plot was predictable and very 'destroy the death star with 2 rockets'. I can think of 4 plots more interesting than what they went with. They should've focused on the younger characters but instead they spend 20 odd minutes on the worst stuff with cruise and connelly.I get it's a fun good summer film. But everything everywhere all at once is a 9/10 and on the same scale this is a 4/10. Criminal for people to be rating it as high as they have.

reviews.review_title: Screw it - I saw the first one in the 80's
reviews.content: If you don't like it that's on you, I saw the original in 1986, yes it's that good, it picks up 30 years later. If you have a heart beat then you will love this film if not there's nothing I can say to change your mind. It is a 10/10, anything less and you were not there in the 80's and this film is not for you.
We were left quite speechless as this film is totally outstanding!Amazing! Clever, great nods to ironical film, great acting, emotional, funny, and thrilling.
The movie would be a 8 or 9 at home but for sure a 10 in Theatres. The cinematography is absolutely fantastic and the nostalgia from the original is a continued pervasive part of the film.

reviews.review_title: Top Gun: Maverick is the return of pure, nostalgic blockbusters, instantly becoming one of this year's personal favorites. Superior to the original in every way.
reviews.content: If you enjoy reading my Spoiler-Free thoughts, please follow my blog to read my full review :)"Top Gun: Maverick is the return of pure, nostalgic blockbusters, instantly becoming one of this year's personal favorites.The best aerial action sequences ever amaze even the highest expectations, not only due to the absolutely insane real stunts but largely because of the flawless contribution of all filmmaking elements.The surprisingly emotional screenplay helps Tom Cruise deliver one of the best performances of his career. Perfect editing is essential to creating such realism, as well as raising the tension levels for one of the best final acts within the respective genre.And, finally, the memorable score loaded with epic tracks makes the theater experience the only way this magnificent work should be seen.Superior to the original in every way."Rating: A-

Top gun Maverick is by far the best cinema experience I've had in the last 3 years and one of the best I've enjoyed in my life . Especially if you watch it on Dolby cinema or IMAX . Man I came out of the movie wanting to be a pilot the movie is that good trust me . You know what I didn't even watch the first movie but of course I will soon . For me there was no boring minute in the film .

It makes a refreshing change for a film to reach pole position and not be related to DC or marvel ideas it's a good film not without its cheesiness which helps it along in a strange way.mr cruise dies what he does best with a big dollop is nostalgia,fair play that he wanted to keep the film in the cinema and not gone the route of quite a few features,citing COVID as the excuse.well done.

Doing a legacy sequel to a cult classic 36 years later can be a risky thing to pull off. Doing so could prove to be a highway to the danger zone.I remember liking the original "Top Gun" (1986). It wasn't high art, but it was good cheesy pizza. Going back to watch that film again recently, sadly it has aged about as well a cheese pizza that has sat out for over 30 years. The film has lost that loving feeling, I hate it when that happens.Top Gun: Maverick brought back that loving feeling. It is undoubtably BETTER THAN THE ORIGINAL. The film is well paced, focused and full of good character decisions.The film does not reinvent the wheel by any means, it follows a tried and true formula, but it does all these classic hits very well. The new characters also aren't as interesting as Tom Cruise. They aren't awful, just underdeveloped.But the show stealer of the whole thing is the aerial action. The dog fights and flying sequences are second to none. They use real planes and real G's, and it feels real. It is filmed with clarity; it communicates to the audience exactly what is going on and why characters are doing it.Filmed with skill, what a thrill. Goodness gracious great balls of fire!

reviews.review_title: All the original was and more..
reviews.content: A few times in my life I have been really eager to watch a sequel. Lord of the Rings is a long time ago now but those were highly anticipated.In later years "Avengers Endgame" is the movie I kind of hyped the most before its release and personally it was a slight disappointment.Then "Top Gun Maverick" is a movie I have really looked forward to for years now since it has been delayed so much because of the pandemic.Usually such high expectations can only result in a disappointment and I still have to say that if the genre is not for you you won't like it anyway.But all this said, this exceeded my expectations.. in its genre as an entertaining blockbuster it's an absolute masterpiece which kind of gets every little detail right.. the characters, the soundtrack, the story.Also, the first movie was mostly about how cool it is. Of course the sequel still has that element but it focuses more on how difficult and challenging it is. Which makes it even better.In its genre this is as good as it gets.As I said, even better than I anticipated.10/10.

I initially had apprehensive feelings going in, since the cheesy one liners in the trailer were not great. But, as soon as the the film starts, it pays homage to the original, and really brings back the nostalgia in full force. This sequel has its own original story that grabs your attention from the start and then takes you on an intense ride. With plenty of laughs, and ecstatically good flight scenes, this is a truly top blockbuster.

Be fair, I have no reason to deduce any single star out of the 10. So it's 10 outta 10.I think the only minor plot hole is fighter they stole from the air base. That's more crazily ridiculous than having Top Gun 3. But anyway, I still buy it as an action movie.

Story, direction, acting.... everything was fantastic.... can't complain about anything.... definitely a must watch movie... Part one was good
and part 2 beyond expectations.......

reviews.review_title: Oh Mr. Cruise I wish we could turn back the clock on you, so we could have more movies like this!
reviews.content: From start to finish this movie displays the top notch hardwork done by all the actors in this installment. The technical part will have many reviews if they're accurate or not. I'm to talk about the superb acting they put up. Even without any words val kilmers screen presence was so remarkable so meaningful that I kept on looking if I missed something? Jennifer Connelly looks ravishing in this movie but didn't overdo it, and the main man in the middle of all of this Tom cruise cruised through the movie like a breeze, like he was keeping himself prepared for this role for the last 30 years. I feel that this movie has boosted up the production value of the first one as well by leaps and bounds. This is what good movies do, they pull up the less fortunate ones to greater heights!

I can't believe the amount of fan boy reviews but then, looking at the quality of entertainment coming our way, maybe I can.What's good:
Great (and I mean GREAT) action flying scenes. The actors must have had a ball filming them and the cinematography was excellent. Very little CGI but that's about all that was good.What's not
TC being called an old man when he looks 20 years younger (or more) than his actual age. Not really believable, The excessive testosterone on display. The beach football was straight out of 1986 and looked awkward at best, Anyone else notice the oiled up actors? A little bit odd and uncomfortable. Jennifer Connelly would have been 16 in 1986 so age appropriateness for actresses is still not a thing? I wasn't sold on the love interest with TC. Their was no chemistry and it felt forced. About believable as her making enough money from the bar to own a Porsche. TC stealing a fighter to show off and being given the Team Leaders role. Aw shucks, ya fly so good you can have the job. Reality? He'd be locked up and face a court martial. Attacking a country on their own soil? A bit too far regardless of who it is. The story was entirely predictable when there should have been room for something new.So a 5, I did enjoy the movie overall but keep asking myself, is this as far as movie making has come in 35 years?

reviews.review_title: Feel the Need to See this on the Big Screen
reviews.content: I am not a huge fan of the original but Top Gun: Maverick blew me away. Pulling off a wildly entertaining summer blockbuster that will have you on the edge of your seat one moment and cheering the next.

Taking place 36 years after the first Top Gun film, this sequel follows Captain Steve "Maverick" Mitchell as he confronts his past and returns to Top Gun as a trainer. He is to train twelve young pilots to prepare for an urgent and deadly mission. One of the pilots he must train is Bradley "Rooster" Bradshaw, the son of Maverick's deceased best friend Goose. Maverick faces the grievance of losing Goose again as he tries to find a way to make sure that Rooster and the other new pilots do not die in the new mission.What I like the most about Top Gun: Maverick is that above all else, it is a movie about dealing with a loss and letting go of guilt. Maverick is still racked with guilt over Goose's death 36 years ago and with Goose's son about to enter a life-threatening mission, Maverick hates the idea of even allowing Rooster to go the mission. However, it is shown that all he is doing is holding Rooster back. All it is doing is making the son of Maverick's best friend resent him even more. It is a good way of showing how pushing others back is not the answer.Maverick's guilt also bleeds into the training of the young pilots. In some of the training sessions, Maverick will emphasize the loss of a pilot's life by asking his trainees what they would tell the victim's family and friends. How would they deliver the tragic news? This is a powerful moment to not only show the dangers of aerial combat, but to also emphasize Maverick's motivation: to complete the mission with zero deaths. How will he complete that goal? He trains them to think outside of the box by using tactics the enemy pilots would not expect. If they learn unexpected ways to retaliate, they could get the upper hand against the enemy and there would be a chance to succeed without any casualties. The training sessions show that in spite of his rather insane methods, Maverick cares about all of the pilots and he does not want any of them to die or to feel the weight of losing each other. The theme of guilt and letting go of it is tackled professionally and it gives a humane layer to the story of the film.Performance-wise, Tom Cruise is at his best here. He is a much more mature Maverick here while still carrying the risky and fun personality from over three decades ago. The scenes where he is training the pilots are where he shows his chops the best. You can tell that this movie and this role means a lot to him as he takes his character in a new and interesting direction. As for the rest of the cast, Miles Teller as Rooster is great as the son of Goose, Lewis Pullman is memorable as the shy, but skilled Bob, Monica Barbaro is really cool as Phoenix and Glen Powell is enjoyably cocky as Hangman. Val Kilmer has a small scene as Iceman, but it is one of the most memorable scenes in the film. It was a sad scene, but Kilmer crushed it. Oh and Ed Harris is incredibly intimidating for the few minutes he is there. The cast is fantastic, but there is one minor weak link.Jennifer Connelly is fine as Penny, but the romance feels a bit out of place here. The chemistry between these two is better here than in the chemistry between Cruise and Kelly McGinnis in the first film, but even with that, I feel this was a missed opportunity to bring McGinnis back and develop the relationship between Maverick and Charlie. I think the romance could have replaced with more scenes of Maverick and Rooster's interactions.And now, for the dogfights... they are outstanding. I felt the rush of flight sequences from the moment Maverick flies a jet to a speed objective. I felt like I was there. The flight sequences are visually stunning and beautifully shot. None of the action scenes feels cluttered or difficult to follow. Most importantly, they are a blast to watch. The aerial combat is dynamic and the final set piece is one of the best and most intense I have seen in a theater. When I say the flight sequences are intense, I mean it. Not even the training flights pull back punches to how dangerous piloting these planes can be. This movie is worth seeing on the big screen for the flight sequences alone.Even outside of them, the movie still looks great with slick cinematography featuring some memorable shots. The sound design also becomes part of the experience as the planes sound pretty realistic which pulls you into the experience even further. The soundtrack is awesome too with the return of some classic songs such as Danger Zone and a great musical score by Harold Faltermeyer and Hans Zimmer.As someone who was not a fan of the first Top Gun film, I really like Top Gun: Maverick. I like it a lot more than the first film. It is fresh, action-packed, surprisingly deep in its themes and most of all, it's a ton of fun. Also, it is very funny. I laughed and chuckled several times throughout the movie. This is the kind of movie I love seeing on the big screen. It tells a great story while delivering on the action. I think Top Gun fans will love this movie. See it on the biggest screen possible.

reviews.review_title: Entertaining aerial action with a good plot and exciting finale.
reviews.content: An excellent movie that captures the style and magic of the original whilst bringing it up to date. The plots follow similar beats and themes to other films, but are told well and with a light touch, whilst also being a respectful memorial and entertaining. Great acting, good characters, iconic music, stunning aerial action scenes and an edge of your seat exciting finale.
Somehow better than the original, you feel like you are there. The plot line holds very well, little to no cheesy scenes, good laughs and some heart tugs thrown in for good measure. Phenomenal.

reviews.review_title: Emotionally Brings Closure to the Story and Characters
reviews.content: If you loved the original movie, then you really need to see "Maverick", and you should see it on a big screen. "Maverick" exceeds the original in all aspects. Even though this movie is doing really well in the box office, and I really liked the movie, I hope they are not tempted to make Top Gun 3. They ended the story so perfectly in "Maverick". Another sequel would mess with that story closure perfection.

reviews.review_title: The feel good movie of the year!
reviews.content: Top Gun: Maverick has got to be the most rewarding movie of the year. Tom Cruise returns about 36 years later in a sequel to arguably the film that launched him to superstardom.The story is simple and engaging and is a strong highpoint, it needed to be to connect new fans who may be unfamiliar with the original and keep it up to date for the current generation. It does this in spades I think.The cast is absolutely terrific, alot of new actors to the franchise and you can tell they are happy to be there (fans of the first Top Gun for sure). Jennifer Connelly, Miles Teller, Glen Powell, Jon Hamm and Bashir Salahuddin are standouts. Tom Cruise as cool and relevant as ever breezing through this movie like silk in his awesome aviator sunglasses. He is the key to the whole thing, his presence drives this movie just like the F18's he flies.And if you're a big fan of fighter jets, and the navy well what else can I say? This movie has it all for you. The ending is extremely satisfying and is emotionally uplifiting in every way.Best feel good movie of the year? I say HANDS DOWN! You'll love it!

reviews.review_title: This is the best way to give The finger in every single to cancel culture and every kind of political correctness today
reviews.content:
Woah this movie's great,
This is the magic of Hollywood's golden age being reborn.This magic had been kept alive until now thanks to the MCU. But couldn't hold it long on its own. But now it's reborn
This Movie is for everyone.It's a love letter to classic blockbusters that entertained the previous generations(and this is coming from a gen z 14 year old kid) and it's perfect in so many ways.The movie knows that people have got tired because of the whole political correctness issue, with making strong female characters, adding always an LGBTQ+ character and it shows the way to "the movie" that is for everyone and goddammit it's a great story with great messages and a great film as a movie.If I hear a complaint about something like toxic masculinity in the film, I'll know that as a society we are destroying art and any kind of beauty that is nowadays changing.

The whole film is a masterpiece. End of. Best film I've seen in ages! Subtle amounts of everything. No over done cheesiness. Nostalgia done in the best way without over repeating. Great characters. Epic film. Going to go to the cinema and watch it again on my next day off!!!!
Watching this movie felt like the first proper movie theater experience I have had in years.Better than the original. Neatly balanced action, humor, Nostalgia, sentiment, and shirtless scenes.

reviews.review_title: So good! The best of Tom Cruise!
reviews.content: It outshine, outgun & outstage the 1st TG!It's better than expected! It's awesome & puts you at the edge of your seat!Worth the wait!,Loved it!You haven't watch it, do it! Highly recommended!

I enjoyed Top Gun Maverick more than the original. It had a story which had a lot of potential and director used it very well. After you watch the movie for a while, the story will fade but the feel and the mode of the movie is what keeps you interacted. The soundtrack was nice and aircraft scenes were nicely shot. The movie at some times feel little bit long but the action sequences cover it all. This is movie which you may enjoy at cinema but not that at home. The action scenes are of next level when you experience it in cinema.Overall, you should give this movie a try especially those who love airforce.

reviews.review_title: It's not the plane. It's the pilot.
reviews.content: The sequel delivers and how. This is not a small feat to achieve to make a follow up movie after 36 years and still manage to make it this entertaining. With a solid story and knock out performance by Tom Cruise, Top Gun:Maverick takes us through the fantastic ride through nostalgia while having a captivating story to tell.Captain Phil Mitchell aka Maverick is assigned back to Top Gun, this time as a teacher to train a bunch on a supposed suicide mission and they include Rooster aka Goose's son. As Mav makes it his mission to bring back all of them safely while achieving the mission's target, all of which needs to happen within 3 weeks. As they run against time, the training sessions give enough high moments whereas Mav & Penny's relationship adds onto the emotional quotient.The tension between Mav & Rooster, the bond between Mav & Ice, everything is so balanced, kudos to the writer. Not once did the film felt like it was dragging even when it was taking cinematic liberties in the final act, just couldn't stop rooting for Maverick. The message it tries to convey is once again that of learning to let go and it hits hard.

reviews.review_title: One of the Best Movies of All Times
reviews.content: Do you know how you can easily tell if a movie is awesome?The proof is in the pudding, right? Is it about winning awards?Some great movies can win 13 Oscars and you still don't want to watch them over and over. So is it really THAT great if you just want to watch a movie ONCE and never watch it again? I don't think so.You know movie is truly great when you want to watch it over and over again every year whether by yourself or with your friends and family.Top Gun Maverick (TGM) is the kind of movie that you will want to watch over and over and over again every year either by yourself or with your friends and family.The formula for a great novel/story/TV/movie is the same. You must have a great SETTING, CHARACTER DEVELOPMENT, PLOT, CLIMAX, RESOLUTION. We learned all this back when we were kids in school.Now the PLOT can be simple and straightforward, but it can still be good. It needs to be clear and not confusing as hell.TGM has all these elements. It's directed by Joseph Kosinski, whom I think is one of the smartest directors. No wonder TGM is such a awesome movie.In terms of story, TGM has more story than TG. Basically TGM has more of everything- more action, more story, just more.Which movie is better? It's difficult to beat nostalgia. TG was 30 years ago when many of us were just kids. And that's what TG was about - kids.Now TGM is about being adults.It's a tough call, but I would say that TGM is better than TG in every way, except for the nostalgia factor.

Like the title says, it's just a cliche. You won't see anything new here, no new concepts, no nothing! They just dusted off an old recipe and gave it a modern and nostalgic look. And that's exactly what we needed! Damn man, they just threw some makeup on an old concept down to a letter! And it works! We can finally say we saw a GOOD movie! I can actually say i liked it! After such a long time! Yeah! And A sequel at that. This really is a top gun movie, the best of the best! Or maybe i am just a bit too generous after all the crap i had to see, but still, this made me smile.

Hollywood loves to make sequels that nobody asked for, pushing forced plots with characters nobody cares for all for that sweet paycheck. But don't worry, this is not one of those dumpster fires.Top Gun Maverick is one of the best movies I have seen in theaters in a long time. The action scenes are truly epic without relying heavily on CGI. The plot is immersive, paying tribute to some of the main characters while at the same time further developing their character arc. The new characters are great as well, positively contributing to the story rather than stealing the spotlight from Cruise. I liked the original movie but this film builds on it and delivers a smart, gripping story from start to finish. See this one in theaters, you'll be happy you did.

36 years in the making. Who would have thought it would ever come out. What a spectacle. Plot is questionable but the action is edge of the seat stuff, the opening scene and the test course is hair raising. Cruise makes it happen, even after all these decades he is spectacular. There's a few telling quotes in there about time running out, but fortunately for us it was indeed, not today. Appreciate this once in a generation actor while you can and feel the need for speed.

I haven't been invested in a movie in a long time on theaters. I had quite a bit of fun!Even if the structure and several elements make it a tad predictable, it's a goddamn spectacle worth watching on cinema. Specially since the sound mixing is very high quality, and the impressive stunts that I couldn't tell if it was real or CGI.Can't complain about anything else, not when it has a great script, a lot of charisma/charm, action, a bit of nostalgia, is quite tense and satisfies your thirst for good cinema.

"Top Gun: Maverick" is an entertaining movie, with great action and that works much better than the original. However in its structure is very very similar to the first one (too much in my opinion), but actually in this case with better dialogues, characters interactions, direction and editing. Indeed even if the plot is nothing complicated and with surprising twists, I found myself on the edge of the seat for the large majority of the film because of the fantastic action scenes. The fact that they were real and not all CGI makes them better, more impactful and engaging. The length is also perfect for a movie like this, telling a simple story without dragging it for too long like other action movies do nowadays. In conclusion "Top Gun: Maverick" is a solid watch, but nothing crazy. Maybe I was wrongly hyped up too much by the stellar reviews, but still it's super enjoyable and suggested.

reviews.review_title: A Sequel to Get Excited For
reviews.content: When it was first announced that Top Gun would be getting another movie, I was confused and pretty surprised Paramount would take a shot at an addition to a classic from almost 30 years ago. But they did. And as I sat down in the theater after hearing such good reviews, I was a little excited. But also scared that it was getting too much hype. And boy was a wrong to be scared. The elegance this movie has is something I have never seen before. There was not a single moment where I was bored. This movie starts, shoot off from the beginning, and made me wish it didn't have to end. This is the feel-good movie of the summer, and I doubt anything will top it. And let's not forget the amazing, James Gunn-like soundtrack. Tom Cruise is clearly starting to look his age, but still gave the performance like he was still living in 1986. The student became the teacher and did a great job doing it. And Miles Teller hammered down and gave us a raw, memorable character that persisted throughout the movie. And while Jon Hamm wasn't the most vital performance in the movie, he still gave a great one. This movie hopefully revived the franchise, because after such an Oscar-worthy one like that, Paramount would be crazy not to give out more. I hope to be sitting down, excited for the next one in a few short years from now.

reviews.review_title: What a way to start the summer!
reviews.content: If you are looking for a movie to bring back some memories (if you remember the original) and blow you away, this is the movie for you!! Tom Cruise does not disappoint, neither does the supporting cast.From what I have read and heard there was substantial commitment from the actors and the Navy involved in the film. Some of the piloting is just nearly unbelievable. I am going to see it a second time soon. Breaking sales records and closing in on a billion dollars already.I do like that the enemy the U. S. faces is un named and doesn't fuel any current conflicts. Really does set up the next generation of pilots to take over the job if Mr. Cruise decides to step away. A touching nod to Val Kilmer's character lends to the turmoil Maverick faces as an aging pilot.Worth the price of admission and going to be one that hits top marks for summer blockbusters.

They kept the storyline simple, and didn't involve Hollywood politics. Pure entertainment! I also like the fact they brought back Val Kilmer. Tom Cruz is the star but this movie would not have been complete without Val.

There are many all time greats and all time hits, which people watch and watch again.Tom Cruise has finally reached the mark of awesomeness with this one. It is just splendid piece of work, a work of an art.The movie will give you a ride of the summer, it will take you down the memory lane, hit you with all the nostalgic moment, a pure work of excellence and Tom has just played it superbly magnificently amazing.Nothing more, you don't need any reviews, you don't need any update, you don't need any opinion. Just watch this, watch and be entertained. Pure entertainment.

reviews.review_title: Well, this may very well be a perfect movie
reviews.content: After waiting for 30 years for a sequel, the Cruise Team got it right. The story was perfect and the aviator filming was unlike anything we've seen before, and the twists were genuine. My favorite Tom Cruise movie to date.Pete Mitchell loves to fly, and fly fast. He has grown up, matured and still has a the twinkle in his eye.The respect for the story, Navy pilots, past and present characters and friends really shines here. You can tell a lot of thought was put into this blockbuster sequel.Last I heard this was Tom Cruise's first billion dollar movie worldwide. Credit where credit is due. Pure cinema magic!

reviews.review_title: The true classic Hollywood summertime movie is back!
reviews.content: Tom Cruise just re-asserted himself as the top global superstar of blockbuster movies! This was an awesome movie and you could argue better than the original, which is a tall order.The plot paid homage to old characters of the past in a touching way. The action scenes were awesome. This is a movie that needs to be watched on the big screen. We watched it in IMAX and it was great.10/10. Thank you Tom Cruise for bringing summer back to the world!

reviews.review_title: Made a grown man want to be a pilot
reviews.content: I never felt like flying a fighter jet until after I left the theater. I got into my car, and I just felt like I was in a cockpit. The theme song was playing in my head. I felt like traveling at the speed of light. That's why I rated this movie so highly.Two things that made the original better was the love story and the other pilots. There are no technicial criticisms of the love story in Part 2, it's just that it didn't affect me like in the original (except for one quick 3 second scene). The other pilots in this movie seemed to have all the same personality, except for Bob. Or at least, something about them seemed the same.

"Who's the better pilot? You or me?" "It was a nice moment, let's not ruin it."
it was incredible amazing perfect flawless masterpiece from beginning to end i left the theater smiling so hard. The cinematography, sound design and the soundtrack was godtier. The beach scene me smiling so hard under my mask😭 also the humor and the love story works really well it's well balanced from the plot.The movie really hits different when you've seen the first one the emotional core works really well even if you haven't seen the first one.The action sequences were literally breathtaking it got me at the edge of my seat everytime and it was really made to see in theaters and the sound design in dolby atmos will bless your ears.

reviews.review_title: About half of it isn't bad
reviews.content: I don't get it! All the money that this has pulled in and especially all the acclaim that this has received for what is basically a very similar film to the one made in 1986. I guess if that one thrilled you, so will this one, but I didn't get that one's popularity either so I am just out of the loop on this. That's not to say that I hated this as the last 45 minutes or so does have some exciting moments and is well filmed, until the sappy finale, but a lot of the rest is a retread with nearly as many clichés as the first with numerous stock characters. It also contains another love story with two actors that have absolutely no chemistry whatsoever without a moment of realism in any scene together. I'm also lost on the female character. There is no one in the first film that I am aware of named Penny, though her daughter warns him not to leave her again. Again?! This is over-the-top macho heaven once more and while no one is bad, though Connelly comes close, there is not an outstanding performance in the large cast. Cruise is just Cruise and not at his best, but his best as an actor seems far in the past. He seems more a stunt man in recent years. The Val Kilmer scene is touching and sad to watch. However, I am in the minority here, to put it mildly, so enjoy the show. Cruise and I couldn't be more different. I've absolutely no interest in how fast any kind of vehicle can go.

reviews.review_title: The best of the best - just a classic
reviews.content: Just finished the movie and me and my partner are still speechless! The best movie we have seen in years! Very good playing of every single actor, every moment of the movie keeps you interested and waiting to see what next. We already want to rewatch it!

reviews.review_title: The Most American movie I have seen - ever.
reviews.content:
This is just one big America Propaganda movie with watches like a computer game. As a Dutch person it almost made me puke a few times. What a piece of garbage. I have to admit, the flight
Scenes were cool but the rest... blegh.

reviews.review_title: One of a few rare movie sequels that outshines the original
reviews.content: After a few years of less than remarkable movie releases, watching Top Gun: Maverick feels like you finally get to eat cake and ice cream on your cheat day after decades of chewing on bland chicken and broccoli. This movie spoils the audience in more ways than one: the abundance of fantastic cinematography, perfect use of tension, and stellar actor performances; which all culminate in a satisfying tie up to the story of Maverick.I remember watching the original Top Gun and having a few moments where my attention would go elsewhere and my eyes wandered from the screen. This did not happen once during this movie. Even while following a somewhat predictable plot structure, Top Gun: Maverick never fails to capture your immersion from the first minute. Additionally, a few lines of dialogue in the movie felt cheesy just from reading the subtitles, but the actors involved really sold these lines to make it all but imperceptible.Writers for this movie understood our protagonist and what makes him click with the audience, and were able to incorporate this into the story masterfully. Unfortunately this cannot be said for the vast majority of tv shows and movies regurgitated by mainstream media today.

reviews.review_title: Traditional escapism for long-time movie buffs
reviews.content: Just when it seemed like it had rendered itself completely irrelevant with its obsessing over superhero franchises and remakes, Hollywood threw out this lifeline to the fast diminishing population of adult moviegoers. And it was immediately rewarded with incredible box-office numbers. Unlike so many films in the action/adventure genre of recent, Top Gun: Maverick is a proper movie - traditional escapism for long-time movie buffs - which is as enjoyable to see as it is a relief. Granted, we are talking about a sequel here, but it's a sequel that stands firmly, independently and confidently on its own feet as an apolitical, unironic, straightforward movie made with aesthetics and thrills in mind. And one of the reasons the action works so well is that it feels organic. CGI is used as a tool, not as a foundation, which makes a world of difference for how the flying action looks. From the minute Pete "Maverick" Mitchell is reintroduced, and once all the nostalgia has quieted down, Top Gun: Maverick gets into its slick, well laid out setup of fighter jet training, an exhilarating real-life mission, and only a semi-vapid romance between Maverick and Penny, played with a perpetual pose by Jennifer Connelly. Tom Cruise, on the other hand, looks amazing and gives one of the most compelling performances of his career. When Maverick is told by his old pal Iceman that "it's time to let go" and Cruise replies "I don't know how", the actor looks to be tapping into more real emotion than he has ever done before. I, for one, believe that Cruise might not know how to let go, but luckily he has no need to just yet.

reviews.review_title: Aerial sequences were great, but lazy plot and story could have been so much better.
reviews.content: Ariel sequences were great, but the lazy plot and story could have been so much better.I think the problem is that Maverick was a 2D character, and one of those dimensions hung on being young, cheeky and good-looking. Thirty years on only the risk taking fighter pilot dimension survives and so to bring Top Gun back, they borrowed far to many themes from the first movie; Hard-ass superiors, Maverick on his last chance, best of the best, hard deck, cocky pilots, pilot rivalry, mysterious enemy. There is really nothing new here, Even for the sentimentality they lazily just relied on the Goose sub-plot line.

This movie was so refreshing! Top Gun: Maverick is everything an action movie should be. The premise is simple, there's a team with a simple yet challenging task. No extremely high stakes, no confusion; you actually believe what's happening. The writing was solid, which is a lot to ask for these days, add in the excellent acting and special effects and you got yourself a movie!

Top Gun Maverick is a captivating and bona fide experience. This sequel of 1986 film Top Gun waves it magical wand and charms you all over with its cinematography, sound design and characters. Tom Cruise's earnest and sincere performance, backed with mesmerizing aerial aviation action and a heartfelt callback to its predecessor makes Top Gun Maverick a close to perfect film. The emotions , the nostalgia of past characters and friction between Tom and Mile's characters have such a warm representation that you just cant stop but admire.Definitely one of the most engrossing films of this year, Tom Cruise's flawed protagonist character grows on the viewer and they can't stop but root for him throughout. His fight against his own past and whether he will let go or not is all the film about. I might have dropped a tear or two during the end credits, which for me in all means is blockbuster cinema and easily makes my money worth.

reviews.review_title: Watched it twice and will watch it again and again
reviews.content: The first Top Gun was already cool for me. But not like this one. It it felt like you were with them the whole time!Plus, my boyfriend is a Navy Vet. Was told that he was on the ship where they shoot Top Gun and has been wanting to watch the movie ever since. So I watched the movie as as support for him being a vet and also to other vets out there.Everything is just mind blowing. It honestly kept me in the edge of my sit.If there will be a third one, count me in!

This movies main quality is it's very fun. Critically it's not great. I see in alot of these reviews it's like a burger from fast food, and I absolutely agree with that metaphor. But really it only has that fun, feel good bits at the end. The rest of the story is very eh, some good parts. I feel they didn't do the relationship between rooster and maverick well, I think by the end it should be all good but in between it should've been more focused on them. But In the actual story it doesn't focus on that much at all. Also the actor for Peggy looks nothing like she did in the original which is very off-putting. And casting choice in this movie is a problem in general, it has heavy amounts of a list syndrome. I liked jon hamm in this movie, but he didn't play the part he was supposed to well, and I don't think he's a good pick. Neither with all the graduates, they all were fine, especially in action. But I didn't believe they were navy pilots. And the camerawork in this film is hit or miss, parts it's awful, way too many close ups, and not even good ones. But at times it was really creative, sometimes good. The flying shots really show this, they work very well. And that's really the main part of this film, the best part. They're very fun and engaging. Maverick isn't as weird as he was in the original, it's clear he's grown up, but he's still a bit weird and I don't feel his relationship has any chemistry still. Though I felt she was an actual human more then the first movie, she still totally switches up though. The only other part I'd say was good besides the flying portions, specifically the end is the planning of the mission, and the build up there which was done pretty decent. The music in this movie was done far better then the original, and actually usually fits the mood of the scene. Alot of the sets for this movie feel so cheap, like alot of things about this movie Do. They just feel so lifeless and even fake sometimes. Over all though, I think this movie was well done over the original, but It leans too much into the 80s style and references. Which I feel is kinda cliche and boring with some of them. As well reusing the same 80s music and even the shots feels like with alot of this they're just nostalgia baiting. Who took that picture of mav and Iceman anyway? That's never explained but it's just everywhere. Also it feels like mav didn't grow too much, still reckless and almost gets people killed. How they explained the last 30 years is good though, I think that was decently done, not making it too obvious but not hiding it. I do struggle to care about mav though, his acting is worse in this then the original. And stuff just happens, randomly out of nowhere at times. This movie also feels like navy propaganda, I don't know if they were funded by them but it feels like it, as well not only that but just feels very American, stereotypically much.Over all score for me though is a 6.7
Very fun, not critical, but does flying parts well with a decently engaging mission plot. Even if most the characters aren't well done.

So refreshing! Tom cruise killed it with this movie. I hope he continues to keep making more movies unaffected by the liberal progressive woke movement. 3 generations of pilots went to go see this movie and from 80 to 50 to 25 each of us loved this film. My grandfather has been to the movies twice probably in 30 years, he likes clean movies with good morals and characters. He picked a good one to Go to !

reviews.review_title: Have to be an enormous Tom Cruise fan
reviews.content: You have to be, in order to watch this. It was hard to get beyond the first ten minutes of this. And Cruise guilt tripping with an announcement, at the beginning, does nothing.

reviews.review_title: Miles teller is the best part of the movie alongside Tom Cruise.
reviews.content: This movie was like the first one but somehow was much better and awesome. Tom cruise did not aged at all how???. The Story was amazing eaven tho it felt like the first film same concept almost same story but better. The Visual amazing. Camera moving also good and Tom Cruise and Miles Teller acting and chemistry was so good. Literally made me love eaven more the movie. This my first time seeing a movie where Miles teller is acting and I need to say he was amazing in this role I. Scenes were he needed to get angry or scenes were he was happy he nailed it outstanding performance by him.The Beach scene is my favourite part in the movie after the ending part.Go watch by yourself in cinema or digital and see through you eyes this another masterpiece of a movie of 2022.

When Top Gun was released in 1986, it made quite the impression upon audiences. People flocked to cinemas time and again to watch groundbreaking flying scenes interspersing a particularly juvenile version of the hero's journey. The hero in question was Maverick, played by Tom Cruise, and the original Top Gun was very much his film. It is therefore fitting that the sequel be in the same vein. Top Gun Maverick provides us with a lot more flying and a lot more Maverick. 36 years later, one can see how updated technology, of both the plane and camera variety, would make fresh flying scenes appealing, but surely, three-and-a-half decades later, Tom Cruise as Maverick can not be the same heroic figure that he once was. Well, no-one told Tom Cruise that and nor should they have. As a film star, he still has the presence and the bravura to remain front-and-centre of this hyper-charged vehicle.Of course he is much older now, although, in fairness, he really doesn't look it. In fact, Tom Cruise has defied the aging process much more successfully than the original Top Gun film. Technologically, Top Gun Maverick soars miles above its predecessor. Gone are the miniature model plane shots and scenes filmed in aircraft simulators. This film sees its characters genuinely taken into the skies, and it's a marvel to witness such adrenaline and action captured on the screen. The poor pacing, uneven tone and unbridled machismo of the original film is also improved upon in the sequel. The pacing is helped by having a much more developed plot, which provides a narrative context for the copious flying scenes. Each of the scenes is needed to move the plot forward and shows how the crack team are progressing towards their final mission. Taking the lead from the 2nd half of the original film, the sequel is suffused with a sense of loss and a need for redemption. Rooster (played by Miles Teller) is the son of Maverick's late best friend, Goose, and his character provides this redemptive arc. Rooster is both a surrogate son and a potential best-friend-in-the-making to Maverick. It's their complicated relationship and their shared connection to the late "Goose" that forms the emotional core of the film.As to the previous machismo, this time the film has a much more nuanced emotional palette. Maverick is much older in years and he has become wistful and reflective over time. The best scenes in the film, for my money, are at the beginning, when Maverick is surveying the generation of fighter pilots who have ostensibly replaced him. For a few brief moments, he's a good-looking older guy at the bar watching the young bucks cavorting and performing in the exact same way he once did. Maverick is a man who has seen all of his former colleagues either pass away or age out. He alone is clinging to the rigors and audacity of a youth that belies his actual years. But, of course, this is the world of Top Gun, and in this world Maverick is always the hero. The higher the stakes, the more heroic Maverick will become. Just as speed and space are no object, neither is time. It doesn't matter that Maverick is now twice the age of all the other hotshot Top Gun pilots, he'll outpace and outperform them because that is what Top Gun requires, the hero must prevail at all costs.There are many flights of fancy and there is a general sense of unbelievability regarding significant portions of the plot but there is always just enough risk so that the film never quite lets go of its emotional pull. Thus, it does enough to immerse you in the fantasy and provide the emotional catharsis that comes from a sense of triumph earned amidst the genuine possibility of tragedy. In this sense, the film has an old-fashioned feel to it. It takes its audience back to a time before the rules of big budget actions films changed. It holds to sacred formulas of heroic triumph and ultimate redemption that are no longer fashionable in this genre. It taps into a pureness and simplicity that audiences still clearly yearn for but which is now extremely difficult to deliver in a manner that is convincing and satisfying.More generally, both Tom Cruise and Top Gun Maverick represent a generation of Hollywood which is out-of-step with current trends. The film emphasises practical effects in an industry increasingly dominated by computer technology. It champions a white male hero in the face of 3rd-wave feminism, intersectionality and critical race and gender theory. It depicts ultimate triumph in a world which no longer believes in absolutes. And, yet, it finds a way to succeed.This film demonstrates that old formulas can still work. If it's daring, it is so because it is so wedded to an artistic temperament that long preceded its release. To paraphrase the film, movies of this kind may one day be obsolete, but not today.

One of the best movie I watched in my life. The best in 2022 for sure. Worth every penny. Must watch in theaters to appreciate how well they made the movie (especially the flight scenes). My ever time favorite actor with my my ever time favorite actress, Tom Cruise - Jennifer Connolly combination was another reason to love it.. overall, I like this one even far more than the previous one. First time, I rate a sequel better than its predecessor. Yup, they nailed it. Go and watch today itself...

Wow, I don't think I have ever been so impressed by a sequel before and there we are. This film is unbelievably nostalgic to the first Top Gun film and truly a head nodder to everything that film was and still is. Top Gun: Maverick became something that everyone needed and truly became something that was nothing short of a dream. I can only imagine kids seeing the film and wanting to become pilots themselves as this film makes you imagine being a pilot and flying. This film makes you dream and go back in time, while at the same time focusing on what can happen in the future and all that pilots have achieved. This was a beautiful sequel that was done with outstanding music and and outstanding cast and storyline. This was the film of the decade that truly does show that you do not need CGI to make a great film, you just need a great story and even greater people to tell it.

Can't understand the good reviews. This is such a shallow movie, shallow stereotypical characters, boring romance and extremely predictable storyline. You can pretty much guess accurately what's coming next. The ridiculous so called "mission" was far-fetched and unrealistic. Why not send a long-range missile and take out the target? The only surprise is that Tom is getting old but too vain to grow grey-haired. Other than that, this movie comes with absolute zero surprises. I must say though that the flight scenes are quite good and partly convicting but won't cover up for the pool story, bad acting and the cheesy macho jargong. The only positive thing was to see Val. Unlike Tom he grown old with dignity. To my defence I've never been a Cruise or Top Gun fan.

reviews.review_title: Absolutely amazing - you have to watch it
reviews.content:
Simple review, blew me away, so great on its own but as a continuation of the original film it's truly gripping, emotional, amazing and just plain stunning. The plot is so good and keeps
You gripped from the outset and with some great twists.Character strength is top notch and even with so many new characters you bond with them all as the film progresses.I would happily watch this over and over again and recommend it to anyone who has the time and access.If you want a treat watch it back to back with the original.The use of music is also excellent, the new songs blended with the old work so well, and they provoke so much emotion.

What an epic movie in such an uncertain time we're living in right now. The world needed this. What a stupendous cast, crew; with Tom Cruise at the helm we all knew this was going to be the greatest & the most watched movie in the year of 2022..
A rare nostalgic film that lives up to its expectations and even surpasses them. I wasn't a big fan of the original movie, but I really enjoyed watching this sequel.

reviews.review_title: What an incredible surprise even coming in with high expectations
reviews.content:
Emotion and heart by the bucket load - INCREDIBLE cinematography and effects - did I say incredible!, beautiful soundtrack full of so much nostalgia I was choking with proud memories all the way through - memories of all the awesome film art I was privileged to grow up with including Top Gun which has grown on me over time.Tom Cruise was perfect and he is not my favourite personality ...... but spitting on the haters - no one else could have pulled this off...... Jennifer Connelly was such a good counterpart for Tom Cruise and Miles Teller really stepped up big time in my eyes..... and Greg Tarzan Davis played the arrogant but talented fighter pilot to perfection - I have met a lot of his soul mates among fighter pilots.....Finally, can I go on Linked-In and get a clone of Bashir Salahuddin for my work team? He was everything we hope for in colleagues who add so much magic to our teams.....This film is exactly what a sequel should be....
Joseph Kosinski you are brilliant and a true artiste!

reviews.review_title: This is What Movie-Going is About!
reviews.content: Return to the magic of movie-making! Top Gun Maverick has it all - a compelling story, characters with dimension, a well-rounded cast (even realistically diverse), strong gutsy women and men. Most of all, a hero that we can get behind and cheer for. America needs more films and television shows like this.

reviews.review_title: Everything you would expect in a top gun sequel and then some
reviews.content: Great film, Tom Cruise does not overplay his part at all and it is so refreshing to see a true blockbuster film that has heroes in it that don't have superpowers.

reviews.review_title: Absolutely lives up to the original
reviews.content: A bit of a story here to get started:After my mom gave birth to my brother she couldn't sleep, so she would rewatch the original Top Gun repeatedly on VHS. This carried over to us growing up, so by the time I had gotten into my teens I had completely memorized the entire movie. So I know the original front and back.Tom Cruise not only lived up to the original, but the new Top Gun adds on to the legend by not only tugging on our emotional and nostalgic heart strings, but surpassing it with INCREDIBLE action sequences. I can't put into words just how breathtaking the fighter jet scenes are. Just seeing the stress on the actors faces from the huge Gs they pull puts you directly in the cockpit with them.This is truly one of the most epic movies I've ever seen, and I wouldn't be surprised to see the US Navy get a big uptick of candidates just like when the original came out.

I had high expectation for Top Gun: Maverick considering all the rage I heard from people, and I was not disappointed. It had the perfect combination of originality while staying true to the first movie in many different aspects. I love that they included some of the music from the 80s film, it just felt so nostalgic, and because I adored those songs, I loved hearing them again. This was my first movie theater experience where I was the only one in the theater and I was actually amazing. I awed and kicked the seat and cried whenever I felt like it (and yes I did cry, mostly because I was emotional at the time, but also because the storytelling just naturally moved me). The ending was stereotypically heroic and joyful, but well deserved. And I drove out of that movie theater like I was flying a plane.

reviews.review_title: Great action yet a little slow replica with exciting ending
reviews.content: I loved the original Top Gun and it inspired many of us to buy a Ninja rocket and feel the need for Speed.This film is very entertaining and Tom Cruise is still hanging in there looking good at his age and Jennifer Connelly is the perfect 80s leading lady - even if her part is not very well developed and rather pointless.The film has fantastic action in the beginning and then sort of peters out in the middle with melodrama yet makes up for it in the 3rd act and has a wonderful ending that always is most vital to an action film. Joe Kosenski does a fantastic job directing the film.The only complaint is that the film easily could have been 110 mins like the original and the 2nd act felt tired and the writers hit us over the head too many times doing the Rooster/Goose to the point of exhaustion.And as many have mentioned the plot was completely stupid with the cruise ship missiles only taking out the airstrip and not the mountain top SAR missiles. And the 5th generation planes with stealth mode fighting in visual mode against a 1970s F14 is laughable. Like a Tesla trying to race a tricycle with trainer wheels.But hey its Tom Cruise and the only part that was really missing was his motto of "I feel the need for Speed". .Otherwise it is a fantastic film and loved seeing the old relic pushing Mach 10 at age 60. And of course the Navy could not ask for a better promo ad to get more kiddos in the seat of a fighter jet. Too bad nowadays the F35 is a nightmare failure and most pilots are flying Drones inside a metal box in Nevada.A solid 8 and surely it will make loads of money yet sure hope there is no more sequels. Great Balls of Fire!!! Enjoy the film with low expectations. Old 80 school fun!

Maverick gives you what you want: another Top Gun movie. This film follows the same formula and general flow as the first and does it credit. They didn't try to reimagine / reinvent / freshen / 'politify' or any other such shenanigans we've seen in other late-coming sequels of recent past.It wasn't broke, so they didn't try to fix it. What a novel approach, right?Aerospace geeks like myself will balk at some of the physics involved in the movie. No spoilers, but we start off doing a few things that I wouldn't even try getting away with in a cartoon - but it looks great on screen, so - just go with it!There is appropriate fan-service rendered throughout the film without it coming off as a nostalgia piece. Well balanced!I think the cleanest way to sum it up would be (and sorry for the cliché, but): if you loved the first one, you'll love this one too.

reviews.review_title: A superb story that doesn't lean on the first movie to be engaging.
reviews.content: This movie is the perfect example of how to bring back a long dead IP without relying too heavily on nostalgia. In a world with an over-saturation of superhero, fantasy, and "one-man-army" movies, this film is surprisingly human. It is a perfect blend of emotion, team-building, humor, tension, and the idea of facing your demons, both past and present. There was not a single moment in this movie where I was bored. The characters and the story beats included the typical tropes we see in media, but the execution was perfect.Strangely this movie introduces a threat to America, but never gives that threat a name, which felt somewhat cheap. Also, more time could've been spent with characters other than Maverick.

I simply love the way it patterned from part 1, as you feel the classic layout as a whole and added a new style for this flick! It's a totally engaging film from start to finish, and literally as my subject says, tons of adrenaline rush! Go see it on the big screen, it's extremely worth it!

The time past since the first movie. The gap between the second and first is perfect. We all loved the first and I think we all NEEDED to see this part. Everything was there. Lots of émotions and lots of actions. The actors are perfect. Rooster, Goose's son, all this movie is about him and that makes it so nice to watch.

reviews.review_title: As Near a Perfect Film as Could Be!
reviews.content: This movie is nearly perfect in every way. Top Gun: Maverick is a masterpiece, from the pacing to the acting to the cinematography to the character development to the casting to the writing. I can't think of a single thing that didn't blow me away. The intensity and intentionality of the action were magnificent and balanced with heartfelt moments of character growth and story. Tom Cruise's best movie in a career filled with memorable and exceptional films.Overall : Best movie of 2022 so far, and I don't see what could possibly top it!

reviews.review_title: Just the type of movie we needed in 2022
reviews.content: No agenda, practical effects, straight forward and well made old school action movie that leaves you uplifted and happy to be in a movie theater. Take note, Disney.

reviews.review_title: As good as it could get in present day
reviews.content: Original was US Navy draft add but blow up because of music and stile like a hallmark of the times. There was no point to sequel except usual motives ($) and as sequels go this is a very smart movie in regard to how it was constructed. They new exactly what people want and would like to see and gave them exactly that. But they also know not to overdue it with nostalgia. So, a good mixture and as title goes its a movie centered on Tom and he is again that character, so no passing the torch thank god. Most of other characters are ok but bland and forgettable.Main dramatic conflict of the movie is lame but you have to have something. That is also a big problem for me, this movie is even less realistic and more silly then the first one. "The army" is not strict at all and is all "hugy" and "feely". It has no ideological preaching sub context almost a given for present day and that's a good thing. Its not even a draft add like the first one, there is not as much "America, yeah!" moments as you would expect.Biggest disappointment in the movie for me are highly praised flight scenes. They are not that impressive with just identical closeups from front and lots of fast passed shaky cam. Arial shoots of original in my opinion are far more impressive and believable. End mission is also silly and unbelievable but that doesn't matter. The point of this movie and what audience wanted to see is Tom Cruise being Maverick again and kick ass and in that regard it completely delivers.

reviews.review_title: A nostagia filled thrill ride from start to finish
reviews.content: Wow! What a movie! Edge of the seat action, emotional, an amazing piece of cinema. Definitely worth the wait. Don't miss this on the big screen. The minimal use of CGI is a rare treat for a modern action movie, especially considering the complexity of the flight scenes. Sequels of this nature can often be disappointing, this one is not. Go watch it!

reviews.review_title: Top Gun Maverick is something special
reviews.content: Heart pumping, eye popping adrenaline rush. Sit back and just let yourself be entertained by this spectacular movie. It was worth the wait. Easily one of the best action movies of the year, let alone the last years. To be fair though, the movie is more than an action movie. That would not do it justice. Tom Cruise fits the role like the jacket he wears in the movie. The guy is just that good in his role as Maverick.The filming in the cockpit of the F-18 is beyond mind boggling. You really start to appreciate what these pilots can do in these planes. The way they went about filming this in the way they did, is a true testament to how committed the producers were in getting this just right for the audience to see. For my wife and I it was a great night out. Fully entertained. Go see it....it's good.
Absolutely loved this, even more the original. The final hour is so great, I watched it twice in two days, but I won't spoil it. Thank you Tom Cruise for making this for us!

Finally a good movie. I loved this movie, good action, good special effects and Tom Cruise at his best as usual. Good all American and no woke BS. We needed this right now and please bring more of these type of movies back. 10+.
Very rarely does a sequel match upto its predecessor but this actually surpasses it. Exciting,emotional and nervy masterful rollercoaster, Soooooo worth the wait!

What. A. Flipping. Film.God himself made this film.I would give it a 12,13 even 15 out of 10 if I could.Not a single mistake.I have no words.The rest of this response is because I need to write 600 words so I will also say;Maverick (the guy) is the flipping GOAT.Cinematography, storyline, action, dialogue, nostalgia, pace, direction, acting, "edge of seatness", emotion, the music, the elite level of film capture... everything. Well done to everyone involved. You made the whole movie, cinema and picture fan base proud to be in love with film.I only have 85 characters left and I just want to end it saying Top Gun: Maverick will stay in my heart forever more.Elite... elite.

reviews.review_title: Epic made for the big screen - Tom is a Maverick
reviews.content: Better than the original, because it had to be. Everything about this movie is a 10! It left me feeling emotional and melancholy for the life I was leading in 1986, it was a different world that saw the original as a fun, adrenaline rush like none we had seen. The harshness of the world meant this movie was going to be darker. And it is. However. It was a far superior movie to the first Tom has aged with grace and has an attention to detail that I appreciate as a movie goer. Yes, there are references to the first movie, but because it needed to show that while everything changes, nothing really changes at all. No spoilers here. Just a huge TC fan who has seen it twice on opening weekend and will go for a third before it leaves the theaters. Thanks for hanging tough during the pandemic and demanding this open in theaters, Mr Cruise. Go see this movie!

After entering the new era of blockbuster/action movies where most scenes are filmed inside a green screen room, top gun not only reprised its role surpassing the original movie but also providing a breath of fresh air. I could almost feel the plane scenes in the cinema, the skill of Tom cruise perfecting his craft as a stuntman enhanced the experience providing a sense of realism behind the screen.

reviews.review_title: The epitome of American military forces pathos, but highly entertaining at the same time
reviews.content: "Top Gun: Maverick" is an American, no THE American, movie from 2022 and this one runs for minimally over two hours if we don't count closing credits as you can add another ten minutes for those. The director is Joseph Kosinski and this is not the first time he has worked with lead actor Tom Cruise, but we will get a little later to cast and characters. In any case, Kosinski is not new to filmmaking, but also not extremely experienced. He has worked on a few films that also include American hero characters since his breakthrough in 2010, so him being picked for this one kinda makes sense. The key writer is Peter Craig. He is maybe the bigger name with his involvement with the Hunger Games franchise, the newest Batman movie and also The Town, maybe the best he has come up with so far. In any case, the parallel between him and Kosinski is that they both had their big breakthrough ten years into the new millennium. There are two other writers credited and these come from the original Top Gun movie from 35 years ago approximately. You can check their names if you like. One of them is still alive and I wonder what he thinks about the quality of this new film and if the high praise it has received so far is justified. Director Tony Scott died about a decade ago and you can read his name also at the end of the film. A few more words on the crew you could say here, namely on the music department: The names Harold Faltermeyer, Hans Zimmer and Lady Gaga in the same movie sure make for something unique. I must say I am not a Gaga fan though and her song towards the end also did almost nothing for me. We will see if she can score another Oscar nomination with it. I hope not. So yeah, for me as a German, there is surely more focus on the two Germans I have just mentioned. Now, let's look at the cast: It really from beginning to end all about Tom Cruise. Oscar winner Jennifer Connelly plays the love interest. Miles Teller (Whiplash) plays the protagonist's former wingman's son. Mad Men's Jon Hamm plays the closest to an antagonist. Val Kilmer is I think the only one (except Cruise of course) who reprises his role from the old film and he looks a lot like Jon Voight here. No Meg Ryan. There's others. Of course here you can also check out the list yourself if you care.As for the film, I am not sure I have ever seen more American pathos in one movie.
