The consequence was unfortunately that pretty much every single character felt fairly stereotypical. And yet, somehow it all went right. I would not agree with the raving reviews or extremely high average ratings, but I was genuinely entertained here from beginning to end. I mean I am probably biased because I like most of the cast members. Huge fan of Cruise, his personal life is none of my business. Miles Teller is one of the younger actors I really like and Jon Hamm is always a joy to watch. Simply love Mad Men. But also the ones playing smaller characters are totally fine. Glen Powell is the best example. He seemed so familiar, but maybe it is just the face. I could not really say where I saw him before. There was also the possibility his character could end up as an antagonist, but eventually the opposite is the case. Maybe the coolest moment of the film when he shows up to save the two more central male characters and what he says there. And it fits. It is all about how people in the military stick together and they are really one team, one unit, so they could not have one of them become a true antagonist or so. If you can maybe criticize the characters, then it refers to the female characters. Not a great deal of depth to them. This applies to Connolly's role for sure, but maybe also to Monica Barbaro's character, even if she is super easy on the eyes. Then again, she is just one of the military characters that do not get a lot of screen time and even less elaboration. Despite making the cut. Most of the time, she is just there to admire Cruise's character. Admittedly, to move a bit away from the gender talk, you can also say that Bob does not have too much screen time either. He just creates laughs when he is introduced with his military (non-)nickname. Just like some others when they initially do not know yet who it is they are carrying out of the bar. Next day, the rude awakening happens. Oh yeah, Barbaro's character also had that moment when Hangman is criticized for being anti-female, another reference where you could think he is maybe a bad guy, but he is just cocky and that's it and also some of the others do not like him as much as Teller's character for sure. They want the latter to be their team leader.I do agree with those saying that perhaps the last half hour is the highlight here. They kept the mission pretty simple. Early on, it still seems almost like a casting show, but this is not what it gets to be about. Eventually, the focus is on the mission itself: What they have to do exactly, namely hit two precision shots from up above to destroy radioactive substance belonging to the enemy. At the same time, they do not only have to make the shots, but also be very quick and get out safely afterwards. This is emphasized especially on one occasion when Cruise's character (the film is fittingly named after him) talks to Hamm's. Oh and by the way, the enemy is not explicitly stated. They are called a rogue state or rogue nation and that is it. We do not see the bad guys' faces either. The one thing we do know is that it is rather cold in said country. Honi soit qui mal y pense. If you know what I mean with politic events in 2022. Okay, the film was made before that and let's not get into detail on this now. Focus on the film instead. What we must get into detail on is how gimmicky this film felt at times and how it was almost too much and sometimes crossing the fine line between being entertaining and being simply over-the-top. This applies to almost everything involving Connelly's character. How we literally see her fall for him. How her daughter tells Cruise's character not to hurt her again. That was maybe the funniest moment from the film when she sees him there jumping from her mother's window. The words he tells Connelly's character one one occasion were also fairly gooey.There are more scenes that did feel on the awkward side. I mean I like Cruise, but people who don't could really struggle here. Also when Hamm looks at him in the end and finally accepts his greatness. How Kilmer's character dies on one occasion. How Maverick at the beach makes sure the gang becomes a team and shows us his great topless body as well and that he is easily in strong enough shape to take on these youngsters. Like he did before during the training. There are so many other moments. Of course, I must mention the scene in which Cruises's character pretty much loses his job and then shows everybody what he is capable of and that it is possible to get this mission done. In the process, he steals a priceless plane as well. Hamm's character's words there, his reaction was also so entertaining to watch, even if a bit exaggerated, but he made the most of it. The actor I mean. And was there ever any doubt that Cruise's character would fly the mission himself and not just be a teacher? Probably not. I mean I had some doubt if he would make it out alive in the end. Everybody knew the mission would be a success and also that Teller's character would live, but you could always think Cruise's Maverick would die a hero here. Eventually, he did not. It happened in another big franchise recently and that was enough, so good that they let the guy at the center live this time.I must also totally mention the flight sequences. They are nothing short of spectacular and the heart and soul of the film. Of course, the landscapes with all the snow are a true highlight towards the end, but also what they called the dogfight in the end with the evil pilot guy was a true highlight. This they had to use to really show that it is all about the pilot when it comes down to man versus man and not about the (potentially inferior) plane. Also pay attention to the recurring idea of "Don't think. Just do." This was also quite on the edge between cool and too much. But it's all good I'd say. Just like when Mach 10 extremely early on wasn't enough yet for Maverick. But I take it with the "Where am I?" "Earth." quote. That was hilarious. Maverick surely survives really many of these critical situations up in the air with his plane coming down fast. The drama coming from flocking birds or characters losing consciousness because an elephant is metaphorically sitting on their chest was nice entertainment too for sure. Surely, a lot more I could mention. Oh yes, Ed Harris in the prologue. How could I forget about him!? I also think they established some nice ties to the original movie. Good job there. I suggest watching that one right before you see this one here. But it is not a must-do of course. You will nicely understand the story in here as well without even having heard of the film from the 80s. Not a requirement to know or have seen that one. So yeah, I give "Top Gun: Maverick" surely a thumbs-up and to be honest I almost felt myself at some point as if I was sitting in a flight simulator because the cockpit scenes were so convincing. By the way, could one say anything negative about this film when Cruise himself shows up at the world premiere in a helicopted he flew himself? Doubtful. Coolest guy ever. And right man for the role. Do not miss out on this quality film before it disappears from movie theaters. At home, it will not be half as spectacular, even if admittedly you can play a little drinking game with your friends where one has to take a shot for each cringeworthy moment and you will be pretty drunk when it's over. Not gonna lie. With this film, you get what you came for.
Brilliant and spectacular film again. Tom Cruise sir again done magic with his skills. This film is meant to experience in the big screens. The cinematography and background score was stunning.

reviews.review_title: A rousing sequel to a cult classic Action franchise!
reviews.content: What makes Tom Cruise the biggest name in action movies worldwide is the daredevil persona he has carefully maintained over the years, combined with his almost vampiric ability to delay the ageing process. Making a sequel to an era-defining film like "Top Gun (1986)", 36 years after the original would have been taxing on any other actor but this man makes it seem like a walk in the park. When "Maverick" takes to the control of that fighter jet, you are sucked in again to the mesmeric, fast-paced world of "Top Gun", with the adrenaline-pumping and goosebumps-inducing narratives only strengthening in this brilliant sequel.We rejoin Captain Pete "Maverick" Mitchell (Cruise), a daredevil fighter pilot who still refuses to play by the rules and keeps turning down promotions that would see him grounded instead of being in the air where he belongs. Tasked with rejoining the famous "Top Gun" Naval Fighter Pilot academy, this time as a trainer, the movie follows his journey as a highly unconventional teacher, teaching a bunch of rag-tag hotshots that it is not the plane, but the pilot that makes a difference in high-stakes air combat. Director Joseph Krasinski stays true to the vision and world building so painstakingly done by the original film's director, the legendary Tony Scott, by paying rich tribute to some of the most memorable motifs and elements used by his accomplished predecessor.Miles Teller is expectedly terrific as the troublemaker from the class of students, while Glen Powell and Monica Barbaro ably play the other cadets that "Maverick" has to beat into shape for a crucial real-world mission. The fighter plane dogfights are painstakingly filmed, with the perfectionist in Cruise insisting that each member of the cast portraying a pilot in the film mandatorily fly in one of the fighter jets built by Boeing Co. So they could fully comprehend the physical and emotional duress undergone by a pilot operating under the strain of immense gravitational forces.Despite losing his voice to throat cancer, I loved the way the makers still managed to include Val Kilmer back in his iconic role of "Iceman", Maverick's bête noire. Jennifer Connelly is enthralling and captivating in equal measure as Maverick's love interest and I'm glad the director went an age-appropriate way in the romance than pairing up the 59-year-old Cruise with a young actress.The iconic BGM and the music of the original, composed by the legendary Harold Faltermeyer can never be matched and the makers smartly recreate the same with minimal changes, to doubly recapture the blend of soul-stirring music, bone-crushing action and exhilarating aerial combat sequences that made "Top Gun" such a cult classic action blockbuster.The cinematography from Claudio Miranda captures every dip, swerve, dive and turn with panache and realism, so much so that you feel all the tension and anxiety of the protagonists on screen. While the screenplay follows a familiar road, hitting all the feel-good high notes and redemptive arcs you would associate with such a movie, the "Top Gun" junkie in you can forgive the makers as they more than live up to the credo of this mother of all action franchises, that still makes you scream "I feel the need, the need for speed", 36 years on! Highly recommended! Catch it on the biggest screen possible because Maverick, he is back baby, in all his legendary glory!

Wowwwww! I did not expect to like it but I ended up LOVING IT! If you feel like you need to see the first one, you don't. I have never seen number one and followed along with ease. Such an amazing movie. So loud but in a good way and has major 80s vibe to it. Very enjoyable from start to finish!

A beautiful surprise! A something is always happening suspenseful movie where you couldn't stay relaxed and follow the story, you had to assume the playing serious fifa position to continue watching the limits pf the scenes. Brilliant! The music, the stunts, aircrafts moves where like in perfect sync, you are catching yourself saying wow! Or well done! Many times. The cast was great, the story even greater, it had, of course, the nostalgic vibes and sendings to the previous one, but you could understand what mostly happened even if you you didn't saw it, like I also didn't. Definitely going to watch the previous one. Many things to say, but as a conclusion, this movie is really deserving what it has: praises and box office records, it deserves some Oscar nominations, I haven't seen a better movie this year yet, so, please consider. More movies like these please! Peace&Love!

It's been a while, a long while, since I've looked as forward to seeing a movie as this one.It's been an even longer while since I came away as delighted as I did with this one.I trust no reviews including the ones surrounding me here. I dislike how Hollywood and the industry have devolved into woke crap and fx-a-thons.I think Tom is a champion. I don't care if he worships at a golden calf. None of my business - or yours. He's a hell of an actor, charismatic beyond belief and a thorough pro.This movie is timely. The US needs it. The industry needs it and I needed it.Thank you for restoring my faith that it's still possible to make a gem of a movie.

I'm over 50 and I hadn't seen the original in all it's glory.I had seen the Berlin music video and bits and bats of scenes here and there but never the film.That was because I was an insecure young man and really didn't get the macho bravura of the top gun men.Years later, the sequel arrived.I decided to watch the original in preparation for taking my wife and daughter to see the sequel.I watched it on my own and quite enjoyed it. Surprisingly, the original hasn't dated. It's still a good film. Kelly McGillis looks gorgeous, sassy, fun. The Cruiser (tm) hasn't changed a bit. That winning smile still doing it.So, anyway, we went to the pictures and watched TG Maverick that night. Everything still fresh.My wife and I really enjoyed it. My teenage daughter and her friend said they were bored. They didn't understand what was going on. I suspect it's their own fault because the film is far from boring. She did say she wasn't paying attention.It is what popcorn cinema should be. Full of action, wittiness, oozing sexiness....and above all thoroughly entertaining.Cruise still has that smile and it's still working.Miles Teller is good in this too. Quite a transformation from his roll in Whiplash.Some very touching, tear inducing, scenes in there as well.It's a lovely homage to the original.One other mention, Jennifer Connelly effectively takes over the love interest from Kelly McGillis.She's my age and God she looks fantastic. Beautiful, full of charm and wit and has a great onscreen chemistry with The Cruiser.TBH, The Cruiser looks amazing for his age.Anyway, this isn't going to win any major oscars. We know that but as post pandemic entertainment goes, it's great fun.

reviews.review_title: What a sequel to a classic blockbuster should be.....
reviews.content: I am a huge fan of the original 1986 Top Gun. I was 16 years old when I first saw it and have watched too many times to count since. Is it a cinematic masterpiece? No. But it is what it is. A fantastic summer blockbuster with great action, music and at least a couple of characters we care about. It was rock n roll in the sky and I love it.When I first saw the trailer for Top Gun: Maverick over 2 years ago I was really excited and was hoping it would at least meet my expectations. Of course it was delayed like a lot of films because of COVID but the hype machine has been in full overdrive for the last couple of months. Well for me and seems for most people the wait was worth it. I just saw it today and it met and in some ways exceeded my pretty high expectations!!! The story is simple just like the original but as with it coming so many years after their needed to be more drama and true in to some of the conflicts in the first film. Of course Maverick if still a captain in the Navy but still loves flying and breaking the rules. It's really not a spoiler but Maverick is called back to Top Gun to train some new hot shot pilots for a very dangerous real world mission. He is actually called back by his old nemesis/friend "Iceman" played of course by Val Kilmer. And also something that was already know is that Val Kilmer would be back for this film. His presence is really effective in this film. In fact he is part of what is the best scene in either of the Top Gun films. The main part of the story is that one of the pilots that called to Top Gun is Bradley "Rooster" Bradshaw. The son of Goose, Maverick's rear and best friend who died in the first film. Rooster is played by Miles Teller. He has conflict with Maverick about things in that past that held his career back. Maverick tried to protect him and he lost opportunities in the Navy and Rooster resents him. It isnt hight sophisticated drama but this film dies pay more attention to the emotional parts of the story more the the first film.Of course the aerial action in the film is spectacular. There was obviously slot more budget for this film so the flight scenes are longer and more complex visually. Like the first film most of the action was done with real jets but this one does have some CGI involved but the they work. I will say that even though they are like the first film they arent a fast cut and frenetic. Tony Scott didn't have the budget for longer scenes so he replied more on fast editing and the soundtrack to create the sense of speed and danger. This time director Joseph Kosinski does much of the same but the scenes are longer and more elaborate.The truth is that the success of the film hinges on it's star Tom Cruise. And he delivers. His performance is very good. Even though he i almost 60 the guy looks as young as the actually younger cast members in the film. He is just a movie star. He is one of the last true Hollywood movie stars He might be a kind of crazy character in real life but he is just one of those actors with the star power to carry a film. He does hereEven though the film relies on our nostalgia for the first film it isn't all just a carbon copy. . There are call backs to the first film but because the new aspects of this sequel mostly work I really enjoyed the winks to the original.I saw it in a packed theater and it was obvious that everyone was into the film. There is no better way to watch a film like than in a full theater. I missed that for the last couple of years Top Gun: Maverick is what a sequel should be. It recreates the feel of the first film but it's good enough on its own. That is rare these days!!!Grade: A.

reviews.review_title: Why Top Gun is a 10/10 movie.
reviews.content: Top Gun is one of the best movies I have seen because of its realistic scenes, the roles of each character, and its action sequences. In this film, the planes are real and specifically designed for each set which creates a realistic scenery for the audience. Top Gun Maverick builds on the characters from the original to create dynamic charters in the sequel. Each action scene was thought out thoroughly adding vivid details including explosions, plane shootings, and the beautiful background which tops off special effects. As I started this movie I was automatically hooked from the beginning to the end.

reviews.review_title: Yes it is as good as you've heard
reviews.content: Story build in this one is so much better than the first. Music is blended in perfectly and the flight sequences are unreal.Best film I've seen in a while.
This is such a good movie, and it is even better on the big screen. This is one of the best movies made for the theater in a long time. A film that truly beats the original. A must see.

Yes, the script isn't great. Yes, the dialogue is cheesy and sometimes cringeworthy. But wow, that third act was awesome. The practical effects in the combat scenes are some of the best ever put on film! Congrats to Tom Cruise for delivering edge of your seat entertainment.

reviews.review_title: A worthy sequel, 30 years in the making
reviews.content: Maverick has lost the swagger and replaced it with doubt. Not doubt about his ability to fly with the "best of the best" (although he is clearly a cut above the rest even some blow hard 3-star admiral), but the burdens of unresolved issues that come with the passage of time.When Cruise was asked what type of movie the sequel was on the red carpet of the USS MIdway, he did not say an action picture. The military aspect of the plot was a rip-off of Star Wars IV. The majority of the movie focused on interpersonal relationships and how all of it came together to take the viewer from the past to the present with a deft touch.Cruise deserves accolades for this picture as a well blended vehicle. I suspect that he will be denied for purely political reasons. If not, he will have to be content to rake in much $$$.I don't think Maverick can wait another 30 years for a follow-up. But, I am sure Cruise doesn't feel any need.

reviews.review_title: 2:11:18. Twos hours n 11 mins of GREATNESS
reviews.content: Delightful a TOM CRUISE MADNESS AT PEAK. THOSE WHO WATCHED PART 1. Or not. Nothing matter go for it you wont regret instead a feel good movie. AND LAST 30 mins are instense and wonderful.

It goes without saying this movie is 10 stars. I got chills every time I saw the Taiwan flag on the jacket. This movie just makes you feel proud to be an American again and Tom Cruise personally greeting you before the movie is such a novel thing that is so sweet of him to do. You can tell the cast, creators, everybody loves the fan base and this is truly the only flawless movie I've seen in my entire lifetime. I saw it 11 times in theatres and got goosebumps every time. Simply. STUNNING. Loved how they incorporated Penny into the movie. I thought she did a phenomenal job. The scene with Val Kilmer will move even the toughest person in the world. Tom Cruise has made one heck of amazing film year in 2022 with this movie and I cannot wait to see his next MI movie.

So i've watched the first one just before watching this one. This Movie is similar to the first one. I don't know if they made it that similar on purpouse or not, but i liked it, it was entertaining.Nice characters, good action, realistic everything, and tom cruise.

I must criticize the lack of excellence by Tom Cruise. This is a high speed movie for which high frame rate is not only appropriate but DEMANDED in the 2020's. The scenes were shot on the Sony Cine Alta Venice 2 camera with 6K sensor -- that has the capacity for 59.94p at all aspect ratios.Basically, Tom Cruise put everybody through rigorous training camp, just to distribute and project 90 year old technology of 24 frams per second (FPS), for supersonic subject matter. Well guess what... for distribution at 24FPS, the editors must cut countless hours of excellent rapid motion material that was too fast for 24 FPS.When Tom Cruise says that the movie is best viewed in IMAX -- he is fraudulently lying to your face (or ears).And actually Tom Cruise is referring to "LIE-MAX" since true IMAX film is 18K resolution, or 130 cycles/mm at 30% response (Kodak D96 developer, ANSI Standard PH2.39-1977 (R1990) -- EASTMAN 2366 datasheet.LIE-MAX is like 64kb/s audio on an iPod. Few people actually care about REAL quality, and are bamboozled by marketing hype.A movie like this, shot at 6K resolution, looks only slightly better from an IMAX 4K Laser video projector, as it does from a standard Christie 4K projector.My advice: Wait for the High Frame Rate UHD release, and watch it at home.

Go watch this movie. Just as awesome as the first one if not better.I always have this feeling at some movie that they could have done it better but not this time. This movie nails it.Might just have to watch it another time with a buddy who hasnt seen it just to experience it through their eyes!

I've never been a fan of the movie "The Best Shooter". The picture somehow passed by and was remembered for a good story at one time with several significant moments and a completely passing plot. However, the announced sequel to the film and the ardent interest in Tom Cruise's new work attracted my attention. The picture became even more interesting when it began to bypass large-scale blockbusters at the box office one after another. That's when I decided to watch this movie to personally verify the quality of the proposed sequel. And I really liked the picture.The film boasts an impressive budget of $ 140 million and an excellent box office, which is close to $ 1.5 billion. Such figures are not amenable to every mastodon, of which there are a lot only among movie comics. What impressed the viewer so much with the second "Maverick"? I won't say for everyone, but for me it became a high-quality large-scale action movie, where drama and full-scale shooting are successfully intertwined. When viewing the latter, they are somehow noticed by themselves. Verified shots, dynamics in flight scenes, unusual angles - all this really attracts and does not look somehow hackneyed in our modern era of blockbusters, where such scenes have become the norm for a long time. It is in this film that action scenes are especially memorable.I consider the close connection of this project with the first film to be important. An excellent and even somewhat cunning move on the part of the creators. The writers and director skillfully play on the emotions of the audience, who are repeatedly sent to the events of the first part, which happened more than 35 years ago. They do it both cheekily and cleverly. I, as a spectator, understand this, when here and there they tell and show what is connected with the first picture, but at the same time the success and sincerity of the previous film respond with a kind of longing for the past, when the main character was young, and my generation, along with the film, was just born. Now we are older, and Maverick Cruz managed to raise his friend's child, protecting him as best he could. Decades have passed, but the hero is still with us. Don't know. It's a strange feeling, but it's like you've lived your whole life, and for Maverick and Cruz, these 35 years have passed, he's back with us, his story continues, and you grow up with him. The more interesting for me was the appearance of Val Kilmer in this project. The actor has been fighting laryngeal cancer since 2015. In the film, this moment is played out interestingly.Some scripted moments look controversial. For example, I was little convinced by the storyline just with the son of a Goose, a Rooster (in the original, the call sign Rooster). The conflict between Maverick and Bradley, that's the guy's name, looks somewhat far-fetched and even implausible, given that Maverick did what he did, and the young guy himself could not influence it.The line with the heroine Jennifer Connelly was also weak. The actress played perfectly, demonstrating Maverick's long-standing love interest, but it seemed to me the whole movie that the girl was introduced here simply because the actress Kelly McGillis refused the original role of Charlie from the first film (I don't know the true reason for her non-participation, just an assumption). It would be wiser to develop this line, especially considering that the creators made so many important references to the first picture. In general, the heroine Connelly Penny fit well into the picture, her story with Cruz was revealed, but there was clearly a certain alienness of this narrative.The film itself looks dynamic and with interest, despite the high duration of the film. Director Joseph Kosinski did a great job, managing to present aerial combat scenes to the audience with unusual visual solutions, convey the same recognizable camaraderie that the first film was imbued with and competently depersonalizing the main antagonists of the picture. There is dry information about the "enemy base" that needs to be eliminated. What kind of enemy it is, why it was recorded there, is not discussed. And for good reason. The audience should be focused on the story of the pilots, their flight and the approaching attack. Competently, without any political agenda, this will suit everyone.The film is not replete with technical data so that it is clear which plane and what is better. However, through dialogues, it is easy to understand who has the advantage, why it is impossible to fight with some planes against others, and which of the air vehicles are more maneuverable than the others. There is no confusion and by the beginning of the final act you clearly understand what the advantages of the team are, and what awaits them in case of an error.The picture is remembered by several twists, but I was more impressed by the visual component and the music. The creators were able to transfer that spirit of the mid-1980s into modernity and at the same time do it, successfully combining it with the current rhythm of the narrative of the paintings. The scenes of flights and aerial shootouts are very impressive, and Cruz once again proves that he doesn't care when he is masterfully flying real planes even in his 60s."Maverick" came out as a worthy sequel with a new and interesting story, excellent visual and audio sequences. The picture is designed to remind of the past, to show modernity, to reveal the old problems that still oppress the heroes, and also to give a couple of fascinating hours to the audience.9 out of 10.

reviews.review_title: The best movie I've seen in a decade
reviews.content: I liked Top Gun as a kid. I was a little worried that this 2nd film would only make money off the back of the 1st film. This was not the case! Tom Cruise is so awesome. The film pays respect to the first but then goes above and beyond in its own story and edge of your seat entertainment. Val Kilmer is the man! It's so nice to see a reflection of honor in our military in a 1980s fashion. No agendas or subtle political messages, just good old fashion entertainment that makes me proud to be an American and shows love towards our pilots. Thank you thank you for making a great film I could watch with my family!

I didn't even love the first Top Gun, thought it was an okay 80s movie. But Maverick is what cinema halls are made for, edge of the seat stuff! The last 30 mins of the movie was some of the best action sequence I've ever seen in my life. Tom Cruise an absolute weirdo in real life, but the ONLY true movie star left. Like fighter jet pilots, he's a dying breed.

reviews.review_title: Manly tears ran down my face
reviews.content: If you're 40+ years old and saw and loved the oroginal top gun movie back in the day, prepare for lumps in your throat and wet eyes - the nostalgia is that palpable!You mustn't question everything - logically. But if you can get over 1 or 2 illogics, you'll have an amazing time and get your money's worth - the sequel is definitely better than the original - even if you haven't watched the first top gun.Instant classic!

Top Gun Maverick is the best remake of a film I have ever seen. The classic music, the humour and Tom Cruise. I never thought that anything could live up to the original, I was wrong. One mission, newer technology and bigger stunts: Maverick has returned...

After a long period of development, production finally started in 2018. After filming was completed the following year, the release was postponed several times for post production and Covid-19 it finally saw release in 2022...and was worth the wait.After a fun prologue, the film has a fairly straight forward plot-Maverick training a younger generation to pull off a mission- but the writers do fit in a good character arc for Maverick (dealing with his aging and his relationship with Goose's son) and similar to McQuarrie's work with Mission Impossible work, the mission has it's own complications, especially in the extended climax. While a little cheesy at times it succeeds in being very entertaining and surprisingly very funny at times.Cruise put a lot of energy into promoting the film and is clearly having fun reprising the role. The character is very enjoyable and pushing him into a mentor role he's clearly not comfortable with leads to some great character moments. Miles Teller is great as Goose's son who's journey-while predictable at times-is convincing and well performed. The rest of Cruise's team are a likable bunch and get an extended scene together acting as an introduction but in a film running only slightly over two hours, it's perhaps inevitable some of these parts are a bit thin. Jennifer Connelly is very charming as Maverick's old flame Penny (a character mentioned but not scene in the original) though it does feel like the role was a re-cast. Val Kilmer gets a short cameo as Iceman which, in acknowledging his real life health issues-is very touching and the emotional high point of the film.As to be expected in a belated sequel to a beloved film, there are plenty of call backs (especially a very similar opening/credits sequence set to 'Danger Zone' again), with some 80's nostalgia. There is lots of good use of action with some stunning plane sequences. Joseph Kosinski previously collaborated with Cruise on the visually stunning 'Oblivion' and the film looks fantastic, especially with the use of desert in the training and snow at the climax.There are flaws-the opening sets up a 'humans vs drones' idea which-other than to establish Maverick and 'Top Gun' itself as out of there time doesn't get much further exploration and it can be a bit predictable at times but is fun enough to ride out the cliche's.Ending with an enjoyable Lady Gaga song [if not quite as memorable as 'Take my breath away', this is a really fun time. It would have been easy to cobble together a rushed sequel/rehash back in the day but this, while respectful of the original, is a great film.As for Tom Cruise, he seems to be at the receiving end of some very bitter, cruel and vile comments at times, especially due to his private life. Yet he has an acting career nearly spanning five decades. All he has done for me is entertain with some brilliant and at times incredible films, especially with the last few Mission Impossible films where he has taken stunt work to a whole new level to give the cinema audience the best experience.Although he's approaching 60, I hope he has a few more films left in him like Top Gun: Maverick which is without a doubt my film of the year so far and one of the best sequels ever made.

Tom Cruise to be is one of the best actors of his generation. While he has played in some bad films (The Mummy, Cocktail, Losin' It), I still believe his movies are some of the greatest any actor has produced in the past 40 years. I thought Top Gun(1986) wasn't one of Cruise's best films. I would reserve that for Rainman, the Mission: Impossible movies, Jerry Maguire, A Few Good Men, and Minority Report. Though Top Gun(1986) is not without its merits. It has excellent Cinematography, Visual Effects, Sound, and a great Soundtrack. When they announced this movie, much of me wanted to be excited. Though at the same time was worried that it would be like many recent remakes and not be necessary. To my surprise, I was proven very wrong.Usually, I don't make many trips to the theaters these days unless I am super excited about a movie. This was not a movie that I was super excited about, so I decided to skip it and wait for it to come out on DVD. When I began to read the reviews; and see the box office receipts for this movie, it almost blew me away. A sequel to a film made in 1986 is on pace to make over a billion dollars & it's critically acclaimed. At that moment, I just knew; that I had to go see the movie in theaters. The cherry on top is that I didn't even have to pay for a ticket. My mother, a huge Tom Cruise fan, won some tickets in a raffle.Top Gun: Maverick is perhaps the best Tom Cruise film I have ever seen. Tom Cruise is clearly the top-billed actor in this movie, but it wasn't just cruise's performance that helped this movie "soar." Miles Teller (Rooster) of Whiplash fame gives an excellent performance as Goose's son. Teller makes you feel the emotion that he's putting into his character. While also being the son of an iconic original character, you can't not root for him. Glen Powell (Hangman) is a good antagonist (not villain) character for this movie. Monica Barbaro (Phoneix) showed that she is a future star as well as her WSO Lewis Pullman (Bob) played "Bob," a funny goofball character. The performance by these young actors and actresses is some of the best parts of this movie, but you cannot forget the veteran actors. The veterans include franchise veterans Val Kilmer (Iceman) and Ed Harris (Hammer). Kilmer, whose battle with throat cancer led him to lose his ability to speak, had his voice digitally remade for one line in this movie, and it was worth it. Kilmer was the reason I got into Biographical films with his portrayal of Jim Morrison from the Doors in The Doors (1991) and Doc Holliday in 1993's Tombstone. Ed Harris, who has been in so many great films that it might take me a paragraph to write about, is in very little of this movie though he gives off the same "Hard-A*s" vibe from the original film. Two veteran actors new to the cast Include Jon Hamm (Cyclone) of Mad Men fame and Jennifer Connelly who I've liked since she was in Labyrinth. Which coincidently was released when the original Top Gun came out in 1986.When I write a full review, I always try and explain my favorite and least favorite parts of the film's plot. I would hate for someone to click on this review and have the movie spoiled before they see it, so I'm writing a review without giving away any plot details.This is one of the best films that I have seen all year. I would confidently say that I am giving it a 10/10.
If you really want to enjoy this movie, watch in 4DX-2D. Plane scenes are really insane.Loved the cast and story line.Please go and enjoy this movie in theatre.

reviews.review_title: Exactly What You Want from a "Top Gun" Movie
reviews.content: TOP GUN: MAVERICK (B) is a solid extension of the Top Gun franchise. Tom Cruise slips comfortably back into the character of Pete "Maverick" and is supported rather than hamstrung by a sequel script that is able to fin a way to center the things we liked best about Maverick and the first film, without simply replaying the hits. It's cheesy stuff at times, it isn't immune to giving us a bunch of fan service, but where it counts - providing thrilling jet sequences filled with beauty, stakes, and tension - it thrives. Absolutely incredible aerial photography, a finale action sequence for the record books, and a revived Maverick make this an action film worth catching.

I was afraid of having to much expectations but this movie feels awesome. Yes there are similarities but overall it's just unreal footage from the crème de la crème of the movie industry. Actors Tom and Jennifer are just part of our life as we get old and it is so nice to see them creating such top level movies.And the theater experience, as we see a lot on our home cinema you almost forget how sound has got a BIG influence on the movie (wow!).Oooh this is just real good stuff!!!! I wanna be a fighter pilot... AGAIN! 🙌😁

This film is very awesome and great There were times I was watching this film and thought how on earth did they do that! I can see why this film is such a hit ! You will be very happy and emotiinal. There are a lot of twists and turns that this film takes.

The film exceeds expectations on ALL levels! Tom Cruise has done it again. The story and cast chemistry was exceptional. The movie had everything you would want in it. Definitely worth the watch and buy when it is available for purchase. Wow! Was left speechless.

I find this film pretty good, but after the initial raving reviews and opinions it's a bit disappointing that it does not quite live up to the hype. The best for me are the sound design and music. The script and direction are just ok.

reviews.review_title: I'm very confused about the high ratings
reviews.content: This was yet another sequel of an old classic that nobody really needed. I was really looking forward to this movie by the way, until I started watching it.Acting feels very forced, robotic, and has zero realism to it, the same with dialogue, incredibly cheesy and it made me cringe. The entire film seems more like an ode to Tom Cruise who appears to want to prove that he still got it (lots of shots showing his arms, chest, putting t-shirt on, playing shirtless on the beach etc). Tom, you're a legend and you don't need to do that.What I'm super confused about are the multiple reviews giving this film 10 out of 10 and people reacting with anger whenever some critic (there are very few of them) dares to say they didn't like it. It's a very similar situation to Black Panther which was a b class /straight to DVD movie but got critically appraised because of political climate.I expect more big flashy productions with zero substance coming out as theatres need people to get back to the cinemas.

reviews.review_title: Its been a while that an actor could both show love scenes and action in a great way
reviews.content: Joseph Kosinski did a great job film does have some love/kissing scenes but its mixed in a excellent way that u dont get bored from it or it doesnt take away action scenes flying scenes are also excellent. Tom Cruise might be 60 years old but hes still handsome and a great actor both Miles and Tom Cruise were awesome.
I had doubts about 2022 movies until I saw top gun Maverick. This movie beats all my expectations. I enjoyed it from Start till finish.Review too short....

We watch a movie for cooling our heads and this was it... No complicated issues, no connect to last 10-15 movies that you keep guessing and binding the wires and 2-3 end credits to wait for another 10-15 mnts...
Just start the movie, watch it with all adrenaline rush and finish smiling, little bit emotional. That's called a simple story and perfect implementation. Mind blowing. Just watch it to make your day.Tom cruise and all the characters, justified their roles to perfection. When you start the movie, it looks very casual but when you finish it, it's all smiles and Kudos.The effects were so real that we feltlike flying ourselves and felt inside the fighter jets. It cannot get any better...

reviews.review_title: Best movie I've seen in a long time.
reviews.content: Never gone to the movies thrice to watch the same movie for three consecutive weeks, that's just how good this was. I was glued to the screen from start to end on all three instances. Would highly recommend this to anyone.
Story line was seamless- thoroughly enjoyable from start to finish! Loved the way the characters resolved past issues! Three cheers! Glad it was on the big screen!

reviews.review_title: This movie had me from the first take off... Movie industry is still alive!
reviews.content: To begin with this movie is a blast from the past but more enhanced than the past, I remember watching Top gun 1986 in late 90s or early 00s, I enjoyed the movie then, it was a good action dramatic sparkled with enough amount of romance and humor. However, it is rare and I underline the word rare!! To find a sequel that outruns the orginal 80s movie, specially in this era that is filled with much of political tensions, and PC stuff that are risky to cross in the making of any production, nevertheless, Top gun Maverick managed to ensure a secure come back and to deliver a great movie.Concerning the movie, I wont say much, so that this won't be considered a spoiler review, but if you are seeking that enjoyable heroic adrenaline nostalgic rush that was felt in late 80s and 90s and the early 00s movies such as die hard, brave heart, that these type of movies managed to deliver, in a beautiful romantic package, then this movie is indeed the cup of tea you need to be sipping.Top gun Maverick is very enjoyable nice movie that was directed in a great matter and detailed very well, it also contains the healthy right amount of masculinity that had gone in absence in most of the last decade cinematic productions, and yes it might have some exaggerated moments and allowing the hero of being a hero, but comen isn't that what movies are meant to do, setting role models and encouraging us to exceed our selves... Finally if this movie was made in early 00s I would give it 6 or 7, but due to the fact that it brought back the hope that motion picture industry is not dead yet, and still enjoyable good movies are still manageable despite all the barriers that the social and political atmosphere throws in todays world I give it a rating of 9.P.s Tom cruise is a great actor I always respected his acting and his ability to deliver dramatic and romantic performance while remaining the action figure he managed to be.

I genuinely didn't think I would leave the cinema feeling like I did about this film, but I can honestly say that this is up there as being one of the best films I've seen in a while. It had EVERYTHING.They've literally pulled it out of the bag with this one. Incredible theatre experience.

THIS is the way Hollywood should be making movies! START with an excellent story team and make STORY number one!!! What an absolutely awesome ride! And the very many, many exciting, hair-raising jet sequences, the awesome dialogue, the killer casting, the way they honored the original and Val Kilmer... kept me engaged throughout the film. Watch this movie! You will leave feeling very satisfied. I would go as far as saying it was the best movie of the year. Hollywood, this is a message to you: PLEASE make more movies like this! This is the way movies should be made! And bring back theatrical releases! Direct to streaming is ruining cinema!

Truly impressed by this movie.A true blockbuster, and no forced diversity, woke politics and the lot!! At last I should add, a movie that concentrates on..the movie.It is hard to surpass the magic of the original, especially when as an actor you are some 35 years older.Yet this was somehow achieved.The only thing that I did not particularly like about this movie was the romance part. I felt it was underdeveloped and kinda just put in place cause it had to be there. It felt more organic in the first movie, but again, different times, younger actors.The acting was on point, the cinematography, the score, the directing, all the references as well. The script, well thought out, and at last all our heroes redeem themselves, each in their own way, as the "purposely vague" enemy is defeated. People were clapping as the credits rolled.I will not say much more cause there is no reason to and I don't want to create spoilers.Just go watch it. You will not be disappointed.

reviews.review_title: An era defining movie - An experience to live
reviews.content: This is not a 1.5 hours time movie to see for entertainment . This is an experience that will stay with you for much longer. I remember seeing Top Gun in the 80s. I was 11 years old and I remember it defined an era. When I became a a teenager , I wanted to dress and be like Captain Pete Maverick Mitchell. Seeing this unbelievable sequel 36 years later , leaves me speechless.Distinguished, distinguished , distinguished ....yet, here we are , it is only rated 8.6 why is that?

As a 37 year old female, Top Gun is an undeniably classic film that influenced several generations on multiple levels. The OG, outlaw, fighter pilot film, Top Gun effected the views and opinions on everything from love & loss to Navy fighter pilots impromptu Righteous Brothers karaoke. Naturally, when I heard a sequel was coming I was terrified. Top Gun Maverick may be the best sequel I've ever seen. The writers did an excellent job of merging the old story with the new one, maintaining character credibility, progressing the storyline, and dropping some Easter eggs here and there only superfans of the original would catch. They do all of this whole keeping it entertaining. Tom Cruise surprised me...I wasn't expecting Maverick to seem just like his old self with some years on him...but Tom was that good! Miles Teller is brilliant as Rooster, with credit earned for his amazing control of character. Kudos to costume & makeup for the little details contributing to him looking and feeling like Goose's son. Tellers' performance is perfectly executed, blending but not over shadowing scenes with Cruise.

reviews.review_title: Way better than the first one
reviews.content: Unlike the first movie, this one has a true storyline. The plot is pieced together very well. The dialogue is much better and much more believable (fortunately Tom Cruise's acting skills have improved since 1986). And the Hans Zimmer music is selected perfectly to fit the emotion in every scene.

reviews.review_title: Great flight scenes but basically silly
reviews.content: The flight scenes and air combat flying is fun to watch, ( I was a pilot), but he storyline and especially the ending gets very silly. The final flight in an F14 Tomcat gets very far fetched. Just a basically fun air combat movie to watch. If you liked Top Gun original, this will be OK for you to watch. I need to write more to get it to qualify so keep reading. I minimum of 600 characters are needed to count as a review. In other words, don't go out of your way to see and in my humble opinion, don't buy this movie. A disc purchase would be way out of bounds unlesss there is a massive amount of extras.
Without a shadow of a doubt one the best sequels ever made. Not just relying on Nostalgia. Surpassing it with a really strong cast and a excellent story top gun maverick scores a 10.
This movie checked all the boxes in all the right ways. OMG IT WAS AWESOME! I will definitely see it again. GO SEE THIS MOVIE! You will be on the edge of your seat.

I thought at first this movie would just be a cash grab, however i was quite wrong. This movie goes over the life of maverick after he left top gun, only to get a job there again to train the other young people like he was in the first movie. This movie has intense situations and a very good build up to the main mission. However i felt the build up was a bit too long, and all the scenes covering it felt the same. A very good movie.

reviews.review_title: I was exhausted by the end of the film
reviews.content: I was exhausted by the end of the film. I felt.like I'd been flying an F/A-18 Super Hornet for two hours. More impressive than the film itself is the physical fitness Tom Cruise has maintained.There is not much to say that won't be a spoiler, so all I will say is, if you enjoy the original, you should love this movie. If you are too young to have seen the original in the theaters, no matter; it is still an incredible piece of movie making. See it in IMAX if you can, but for sure see it on the biggest screen you can, with the best sound system.

For anyone who was a fan of the original Top Gun, and I was a huge fan, this movie is so good. I absolutely loved every minute of it. People who didn't have a big love of the first one will not understand the unbelievable nostalgia that came with watching this one. For any other old folks out there that did love it, watch this. It was everything I was hoping it would be. Yes, it definitely did follow the formula to some extent of the original, but that's what makes a sequel so good. The casting was good, the action was great and I thought the chemistry between all the characters was as good as the first one. I was so happy with this one!

Hi,
I am a Gen-z teen from top to bottom. Love to watch movies and series in free time, at home or in the cinemas.80s movies are one of my favorite movies to watch as their not full of CGI and ALWAYS have great storylines. I have to thank my parents for that as they introduced me to Top Gun 1 and some other movies, when I was a kid.And now, for me 5 years later, Top Gun 2 comes out. What a time to be alive! So without hesitation, me and my parents, bought tickets as soon as the movie was released (in the Netherlands)...One word: AMAZING! I truly understand why the Top Gun movies are my parents favorite movies and I think they're not the only ones. The movie was so good that even my dad (who normally falls asleep while watching movies) was awake!Definitely would recommend this movie to everyone! And if your new... go watch Top Gun 1 first.Have a lovely day! :)

When I first saw the original Top Gun, I really wasn't all that impressed. I found it to be incredibly cheesy and uninteresting. I continued to think negatively about it throughout the years but recently gave it another shot before the release of Top Gun: Maverick. I'm more than happy to admit when I'm wrong about something or when my mind changes, and I have to do that here. The first Top Gun is actually glorious for all the 80s cheese it has and the aerial scenes still hold up today. I actually had a good time with the original upon rewatching it. I was curious about this sequel, but I recently became very excited about it. After having seen it now, I can very happily say that Top Gun: Maverick is the definition of the word awesome. Here's why, even with everything working against me enjoying it over the last number of years, I highly recommend seeing it in theatres.Picking up over three decades after the events of Top Gun, this film once again follows Pete "Maverick" Mitchell (Tom Cruise), but this time he is brought back to the Top Gun program to be an instructor for graduates. Training the best of the best for a near-impossible mission, this film is filled with training sequences, all of which are thrilling. You don't go to a film like Top Gun: Maverick for the story, but it also delivers on that front. With just enough substance, a likeable cast, and some terrific performances in some very key scenes, I was engaged with this film from start to finish. My only issue with the film overall is the fact that it does feel like an updated version of the original (in all of the best ways possible though).From the same musical queues to very similar scenes involving familiar characters, this film borrows many of the classic moments from the first film. It also has a similar structure to the first film and even some of the cheesy dialogue is present as well. Everything else about this sequel is so well done though that these moments all felt like they were intentional and they worked in the context of the film. Sometimes it's a little too on the nose, but I forgave that, simply because this cast sold every moment of it. This new crew that Maverick has to work with has charisma for days.Ever since I saw Glen Powell in Everybody Wants Some!! I knew I was going to seek out anything he did next. He has the capabilities of being a real movie star and I hope he becomes more of a household name in the future. His performance as the cockiest pilot in the group really worked and his banter back and forth with Miles Teller (who portrays the son of 'Goose,' Maverick's old partner) also does a very good job here. There are many scenes between Cruise and Teller that made me tear up. The emotion is real in this film and that's why I felt so much for these characters. With that said, it's the aerial scenes that make these films stick with you and wow does this film deliver.Every moment these planes are in the air felt real and authentic. I never once felt like I was looking at an effect. That's obviously due to the fact that this cast was in the planes as much as they were allowed to be. From the incredible sound design to the engaging action that has real stakes, my heart was pounding and my eyes were glued to the screen. This is the most thrilling, big screen Blockbuster I've seen in a while. If you're able to see it on the biggest screen possible, I suggest doing so. This movie is great, but the theatrical experience will make it so much better. Top Gun: Maverick is a true thrill ride from start to finish and I can't wait to see it again.

reviews.review_title: Few times sequel are better than the original.. this is that time.
reviews.content: Tom cruise should get some awards for his work in this movie. Guy can act, from start to finish keeps you engaged.The jacket, the glasses and that ninja.... The reason I got into bikes...Well done sir!

reviews.review_title: A film that makes you think "This is what cinema was made for"
reviews.content: A pure, simple, solid story, high octane action and great visuals. Characters who are interesting, unique and talented create a piece of solid cinema which isnt muddied down by a high portion of trivial crap and unnecessary sub plotting. It's a film about real human interaction, redemption, emotion and of course gripping action.I'm sure this would only be enhanced if I had actually seen its predecessor, but nonetheless it was still thoroughly entertaining.

This film is one of the best films in the last ten years. Every scene is amazing and fun. Tom Cruise once again proves he is one of the best movie stars and producers. The fighter jet scenes are so good that you feel like it is real and you are inside a jet. Also, the acting is good; every character feels like a real person. Besides, the story is interesting and well written. My problem with most stories these days is that the stories are so lazily written and boring. Also, the story line of Rooster (Miles Teller), son of Goose, is so good and shows us how the kid from the first movie ended up.
I just watched this movie, it's amazing movie ever. To be honest its Tom Cruise's first movie which cross 1.2+ billion dollars. Congrats to the great actor Tom Cruise 👏

reviews.review_title: surprised by how much i loved it
reviews.content: I went to see it because I love miles teller and think he is the hottest man alive, but ended up really loving the story and really wanting to watch the first one (I know I did this backwards and I'm sorry).Really amazing movie and amazing soundtrack!

I started watching without any, or with a very low expectations, without even watching the trailer. I was expecting it to be just another ruined classic by a sequel, BUT I was well surprised.After watching it for a second time, I have noticed some details that didn't catch my attention the first time: This whole movie was about, and only - Maverick.It wasn't about the best new pilots of the program Top Gun, it wasn't about saving the world from enemies, it wasn't about his old love, or about the new stealth-super-plane, it wasn't about Goose and his son - it was only and about Maverick and his Mission Impossible.They didn't payed much attention to any other character, not even to Phoenix and her co-pilot after they crashed their plane. They've been sent to hospital for some time, but that time skipped directly and they returned to action as nothing has happened.The whole action goes easy by, in the same way as it is a Mission Impossible movie - well packed action, straight to the point, tension scenes, no time for chit-chats, job done, lets all go home.Accompanied by the well known soundtrack and some other famous tracks.There wasn't anything that's missing and that makes this movie one of the best of the year. Maybe the CGI wasn't the best for year 2022, but still...Only one thing I didn't liked, something not typical for any other movie - they didn't say who are they attacking, what country or continent that was. That really wondered me. I guess it's all because of the so modern
nowadays "geo-political-correctness"?Despite its simplicity - it was very well executed and I'm sure all the "old fans" will be happy. I know I was.It's an easy 8/10 from me.

reviews.review_title: Shows just how good Top Gun 1986 was
reviews.content: The FX weren't that much better than 1986 nor was anything else. Why try and fix something that wasn't broke? Jennifer Connelly loked amazing, thought the young guns were a bit meh, and the beach football scene a bit obvious!
I really can't say anything others haven't already said, so I'll just say thanks. Thank you for making a great movie, great in all the ways that matter.

It's been almost Thirty-six years since we saw Pete "Maverick" Mitchell on big screen. Tom cruise has redefined age, accuracy , & expressions. You will instantly fall in love within first ten minutes of the movie. Especially the background score is one again proven to be mass appeal to the audiences. I had to watch Top Gun 1986 one again before this movie which feels connected. So my advise is to watch both of the movies chronologically. Its saying that best movies are based on best books. This one is prime example of same which is said to be based on magazine article with the same name. So it's a GO....

reviews.review_title: True cinematic action movie. Enjoy your popcorn and don't think too hard.
reviews.content: Lots of great visuals and action, which is what you want for a tentpole Summer blockbuster...first "feel good" movie post Covid. The action was great and the acting and directing were serviceable. Tom Cruise is his usual, totally committed, bad arse self.The story/mission and its parameters are ludicrously improbable. But a plausible story wouldn't have been as entertaining.No real surprises, but still entertaining. I can't understand the point to the beginning, it was very silly and bizarre. If it were real life, I'd want Maverick dishonorably discharged....after spending a couple years in the brig.

Waited so long for this film over lockdown and man, it delivered!!The action sequences were so, so good. The story was pretty believable ... I mean, not ludicrous. Casting was inspired - especially for Goose's son, who bears such a great resemblance.They even had me fooled that Maverick might actually be killed off and the rest of the movie be about the rest of the team having to fight their way home using all that he'd taught themOk, it was formulaic in parts - the love interest, the redemption with Goose's son, the hard-ass pupil who comes around, the last second saving the day,etc. That didn't spoil the fun and immense pleasure though. A film can stick to the formula but if it's this well done then that's absolutely fine.Perrin thought they'd put the original film reel in by mistake when it started - all carriers and 'danger Zone'. Brilliant!And how in the heck does Tom Cruise still look so good at almost 60 years old...!??97/100.

This movie topped all my expectations. For an eighties' child who was 6 years when Top Gun was released, this was such an emotional and entertaining experience. Loved it, wouldn't change anything. Kudos to Tom Cruise who never stops to amaze me. Wow! A must see of this summer.

reviews.review_title: Look at the people that write the bad reviews
reviews.content: Look at the people that wrote bad reviews. Most of them only write bad reviews. And for me if someone only writes bad reviews I ignore their review. I enjoyed the movie. It was nice seeing something without pushing an agenda. My family of four all enjoyed it. And I'm not a big Tom Cruz fan.

It really is shockingly good. It should fail on paper, but everything comes together in glorious fashion. Perfect mix of throw backs to the original while never over stepping the historic line, the right amount of cheese, amazing cinematography, brilliant sound mixing (there's some mega, mega deep bass in places, the likes of which I've not heard my sub pump out before) and a soundtrack totally honouring the original while still standing on its own. Feel good vibes in abundance, excellent casting, it never feels too long or too short. Simply one of the best "simple" movies Hollywood has put out in many, many years - if you want to be thoroughly entertained from start to finish and not preached to, this is the movie for you. The credits will roll and you'll have a big old smile on your face like the old days.

Unlike the original, which was not trying to be cheesy and just mahifested that way and fits with the era of the time, I felt like this time the cheesyness was purposely created. And it didn't work for me.I mean, it follows the original film (which I like) so closely that it would be hard not to compare them together. The beach scene, the hug my comrade scene, the ride my bike scene, the fly my plane upside down scene, the play the piano and sing great balls of fire scene...For me it comes down to 2 things:
Flying sequences are entertaining.The acting scenes are not.I know Tom was playing a character that was carrying past trauma but I felt that he looked tired and sad.The original film is my favourite.

What a pile of crap. With this cast, this much money to produce a movie, and then this as an end result... I know a lot of people like this movie. But I seriously dont understand what they like about it. The whole plot is lame, lines are cheap and the acting is terrible. It doesnt come close to anything in the real world. Sorry, I like it when it has any credibility. Details are wrong and well I can go on and on. It is a waste of time and money to see this movie.

Every sec every min of this movie I was having an orgasm...man oh man what a feeling it was... outstanding...🤤🤤🤤
For me this the best of 2022. Finally something worth to watch after Endgame..
More of the same which is exactly what it should be. Epic. Trully epic. We need to give night hoods to non UK citizens. Sir Tom I applaud you. Film of the decade.

Worth getting a babysitter! Will have you hanging off the edge of your seat the whole time. Only flaw is Roosters age being the son of Rooster as it works out he would have been much older in this film. Also really wished the daughter if Jennifer C was in the plane ride the end as this would have made it for me.

reviews.review_title: Mind blowing stunts and visuals mask a dated ordinary story
reviews.content: Before moving to the meaty positive parts, let me tell you the things I didnt like cuz you will hear everyone saying the good things first. First, the story is extremely ordinary and dated. I don't know how many times I have seen a film where an ex teacher comes back to business to train a bunch of unorganized students to accomplish a mission. Guess the makers wanted to invest less in the story so they went in with an easy one. Top Gun 1 had a much better story involving personals. Second, adding to the previous point, this time the students have no characterization whatsoever except Rooster. You aren't attached to any one of them. This is again because makers wanted to invest more in the stunts. Third, the romance in this film does not work and is forgettable.Now coming to the part which you must have read everywhere, the positives. I watched it in 4DX and had an absolute "out of this world " experience witnessing the stunts and this is where I give this film brownie points. Everything is real. No CGI, nothing. With 4DX, the stunts were feeling so realistic that I got completely immersed into the climax. The 45 mins climax is a treat for cinema lovers. Heres a little spoiler without spoiling much- there is a sequence in the climax that is a total rip off of Tom Cruise's own MI 7 (the last one which came out in 2018 with only difference that in that film, it was helicopters). Just breath taking. From next time, if a film releases with 4DX , i am not settling for anything less than 4DX.Tom Cruise, man how does this dude look exactly like he was back in 1986?? XD. Nevertheless he's done a terrific performance. His chemistry with Rooster only gets going in the climax. Others have done a good job as well. ICE has a small sequence.Overall, a movie only to be witnessed in theaters and that too, try 4DX . If you miss it in theaters, don't even think you will enjoy it on TV.

Beautiful, dramatic, epic and funny.I liked the love line between Cruise's and Connelly's characters, it doesn't look like cliche. The whole movie made in the best traditions of blockbusters, but at the same time it looks like something new and fresh.I hope that «Top Gun: Maverick» will change the rules of the game and we'll get rid of that awful CGI and green screen in the movies as soon as possible.Tom Cruise once again proved that he is a legend.

I Love This Movie,, I never watched Top Gun 1986 but I can follow the story easily,, this drama doesn't touch my heart much but the action is really spectacular, I watched this movie like I was flying in the air in a plane with the actors ...
I also love the soundtrack, the music and lyrics are so beautiful...
Tom Cruise always surprises with beautiful and amazing action Movies...Highly Recommended Movie..

reviews.review_title: It was too short. I want more.
reviews.content: I do not know how this movie is experienced by younger viewers, but I was in my early teens when the original came out. It was one of the defining moments when it came to "cool" and "macho" ideals. The visuals, the music, the scenes. All of these are present in this sequel, and are perfect...my mind is blown and I am still stuck in the twilight between who I was when I saw the original and who I am now. No movie did that to me, ever.Second, the flying scenes were so intense that they too were mind blowing. You could feel what the pilots were going through, heck even the machines. There was no movie that even came close to this.The narrative was great, the story simple.... And I wish it was at least a miniseries, not a single feature.
In my opinion actually better then the first one .... great action and awsome cinematography... realy enjoyed it very patriotic and show of the great ability of fighter jet pilots.

reviews.review_title: Good movie despite the soulless direction
reviews.content: This movie is excellent mostly because of the visuals, real life depiction of dog fights and realistic action.... but the Director us NOT a filmmaker, he is an architect by trade, he is never being to film school and therefore his movies feel empty and without human touch, lets not forget his Tron that was boring and without soul, then he did "Oblivion" a movie that feels cold and without a heart... in other words... Top Gun: Maverick is so good thanks to Tom Cruise...not his robotic director.

reviews.review_title: Hammy. Over the top. Barely believable. Brilliant
reviews.content: No spoilers :Glad to see that this was done properly. Absolutely banging action movie in the same way the first one was, and in my humble opinion, holds it own against it.Exciting watching from start to finish, as you'd expect, but some really poignant nods to the 1986 movie almost bring a tear.This isn't a cash in. It's done properly and really natural sequel to the first film.Oh. And Jennifer Connelly is just ridiculously easy on the eye.Enjoy - we did. A 9/10 for the shameless need for speed.

reviews.review_title: Finally. A real old school blockbuster
reviews.content: Thank you Maverick. In an era where most movies are just ticking politically correct boxes a film emerges that is just pure pleasure and fun and sadness and.....everything. I loved this movie. Men are men and Women are women and all are equal and it is fantastic. The action is edge of the seat and the emotion comes in waves. Fantastic Director and Hans Zimmer doing what Hans Zimmer does best. The acting all round is excellent and every person is perfectly cast. Just go and see it and enjoy.

What an amazing film, the action flight scenes, tension, visuals were stunning, its funny, heartwarming and honestly the story line is better than the original.. and I still know the original off by heart.. so many nostalgic references. Miles Teller is perfectly cast and i loved the parallels of the new team vibe vs the old original film team...
Tom Cruise hasnt had the best press in recent years but this film has given him a break in my opinion, I went the cinema to see it and watched it every day since its release on Paramount.. it had everything, such a good film from start to finish. I loved it.

Everything about this movie seemed perfect. I really wasn't expecting this movie to be as good as it was. I'll just say that if you liked the first Top Gun, you'll like this one just as much, maybe even more.

Tom Cruise told his film crew on the set of Mission Impossible 7 last year. Well, Top Gun: Maverick once again confirms just that.Like many others in my circle of friends, I thought the original Top Gun was nice, but never special. For a movie about airplane dogfights, the action in the air is very hard to follow and the editing is often confusing. Of course, Top Gun was huge in its day, but nowadays it seems rather just a bit dated.Thus, I didn't have extremely high expectations for Maverick, but the curiosity was there, as Tom Cruise and Christopher McQuarrie advanced to become the pinnacle duo of the action movie genre in the last decade.And my goodness did they demonstrate that again here. Maverick is nothing less than one of the best sequels and action films ever made. Normally "being on the edge of your seat" is a metaphor, but here I was literally leaning forward, mouth agape, and constantly beaming with excitement. Before this film, I had the attitude that airplane maneuvers in movies couldn't be nerve-wracking. Thanks to the visceral editing, tangible, incredibly immersive practical effects, clearly existing dangers, and clearly established dramatic issues, my attitude has changed dramatically.The film spends a considerable portion of the second act preparing for the myriad dangers of the near-impossible mission for the third act.... and it pays off with one of the strongest third acts ever.It's a masterful example of storytelling where all sorts of conflict points, tensions and desires converge to create dramatic moments that literally take your breath away and move you to tears. It's the brilliant visual power of Fury Road combined with the visceral and surprising thrills of Fallout and the driving momentum of 1917.Despite all this, there is room to breathe; the film's greatest strength is the beating heart at its core, which is full of masculine vulnerability, an acceptance of aging, and a very realistic and grounded relationship between two adults in their 50s.I couldn't help but grin as I realized in the first five minutes that the plot of the film is emblematic of Tom's career. Maverick is an aging pilot who keeps choosing to do the riskiest things to advance aviation. He is said to represent a dying breed of pilots in a world that is increasingly turning to artificiality and
automation. It's a pointed critique of Hollywood's move away from truly risky blockbusters - and it works because the film gives Tom's Maverick a genuine human tenderness that he completely lacked in the previous installment. The relationship of Maverick and Miles Teller's Rooster makes for wet eyes more than once in the third act.Top Gun: Maverick is a prime example of a perfect sequel: terrific pacing, exciting build-up, cool surprises in both plot and characters, and stylish use of nostalgia. Tom Cruise is truly Hollywood's last superstar.Cinema.

reviews.review_title: A Jem in the crown of Tom Cruise
reviews.content: Now that's what you call a perfect movie. The casting, music, dialogues, action scenes, storyline, acting, direction each and every component just fits perfectly in this art called Top gun maverick. Soul touching creation for all the tom cruise and top gun fans out there. The experience is further enhanced if you watch this in theatre. Spine chilling and refreshing. Beautifully crafted piece worth watching, especially in theatres for sure.

I really enjoyed this movie. It was worth waiting for, and worth watching on the big screen.As sequels go I found it to be pretty much on point, with good connection to both the original movie and the real-world industry and individuals involved in making it.As modern movies go, I enjoyed the various nods to other movies, including (but not limited to) "I'll just call you Bob", and "the mission" itself. (Some reviewers have indicated they don't like this, so decide for yourself).The effort related to cinematically capturing the real flight sequences comes through, real G-forces, real reactions and (mostly?) real maneuvers.Enjoy.

This was an Epic awesome movie! We saw it while on a cruise ship so watching this movie and swaying some from the ocean made it even better! It has a lot of nostalgic moments which were awesome but even without that it had such a wonderful storyline. We came out of the theater feeling like we could take on the world. It is one of those movies that just gets u pumped! Haha. A must see for thrill seekers and anyone looking for pure epic news and a bit of throwback to the "good ole days" Don't miss this one even if u haven't seen the first. Our son had not seen the first one and he still loved it and it made him want to see the first one.

reviews.review_title: An Accomplished Movie; On Par With The Original
reviews.content: Well there's not many late 50 year olds (time-of-acting) that can really get away as a Top Gun pilot apart from Tom Cruise that can really pull it off without the aging and sagging body. I don't know if he had to do extra routines to be in shape but he's part of the rare breed of Hollywood iconography which seems to age better than Bordeaux.Incredible camera work. Great close-ups. Lovely use of CGI. Great close-ups of action movements. Stella soundtrack. Great American theatre has come home. It's a blockbuster and it's served full and the audience has lapped it up.I am very glad that they did this despite my reservations. Somehow it's less cornier than the original and the action scenes are better because of the technology improvements and the MACH training is a fun addition to the film's agenda which I didn't expect but was a blast.It's acted very well. The script-writing is sound. The atmosphere is incredible. The dialogue is touching and the romance is there and it's a really nice homage to the original movie.In fact I think I prefer this to the original. Yep it's that good. They excelled themselves. Excellent. The hype lives on!

reviews.review_title: Knocks it out of the park
reviews.content: I went into seeing this movie with strong reservations. The original Top Gun some 35+ years ago was of a different time and climate all together. Perhaps a tad too roo-ha and full of machismo. Maverick, although having some of these same elements delivered the same story , but from an all together different angle. It does a fine job exploring the vulnerabilities of its characters and consequences while still bringing top notch action and FX. Cruise is an undeniable powerhouse to watch. I very much liked this flick.

I have never seen the original so if you haven't either don't let that put you off watching this one.The movie is fun, the minute I see Tom Cruise on the poster I immediately want 2 things, a crazy stunt and a big explosion. I got all of the above in this !!Firstly what I liked, most of the movie to be honest. I thought every single character was played perfectly, I thought the action was great and I guessed I would be bored of watching them fly around but I was completely wrong, knowing most shots were 100% real in the plane drew me in so much. The story was okay, the pace was pretty good and there were some very nice hearty momentsNot much I didn't like, you can just enjoy a movie without it being a masterpiece, I would have liked a little more in plane time but other than that I can't complain!!I can see myself watching it again some time, an 8/10 for me.

reviews.review_title: GEN-X: Here is your nostalgia movie on crack
reviews.content: Amazing! Yes, yes, yes....better than the first but in a diffrent way. You get to relive the excitement of your youth with an upscale action movie and no terribly sappy love stories. OMG. 10/10.
