Top Gun: Maverick is an adrenaline-fueled thrill ride that delivers on all fronts. Tom Cruise once again proves that he's the blockbuster king with his incredible performance as the iconic Maverick. This sequel manages to capture the spirit of the original while also bringing something fresh to the table.The writing is top-notch, with a strong story that keeps you on the edge of your seat from start to finish. The acting is equally impressive, with a talented cast that brings their A-game to every scene. But perhaps the biggest standout of the film is the breathtaking stunt work. The aerial dogfights are some of the most impressive action sequences ever put on film and will surely leave audiences cheering.It's also worth noting that Top Gun: Maverick is a true cinematic experience. This movie deserves to be seen on the big screen, and Tom Cruise and the rest of the team behind the film have done an excellent job of creating an immersive and thrilling experience that will surely please fans.In a time where comic book movies seem to dominate the box office, it's refreshing to see a film like Top Gun: Maverick succeed. This movie is a testament to the power of excellent writing, acting, and filmmaking, and it's a reminder that there's still plenty of room for original stories in the world of cinema.Top Gun: Maverick is a must-see for fans of action movies, Tom Cruise, or just great filmmaking in general. It's a true crowd-pleaser that delivers on all fronts, and it's a movie that will have you cheering from start to finish. Tom Cruise has truly saved cinemas with this one, and we all owe him a debt of gratitude for sticking with a cinematic release.
Good Action, an interesting story, fun characters. Some people may think this is a guys movie only, but watched it with my mother and sister who loved it. Would recommend.
36 years later, the 60 year old Admiral of L. Ron Hubbard's Scientology fleet is back in the saddle again. How does he do it? Baby placentas? Tom Cruise looks better than ever!

What a movie ,,, it's feels like audience are moving with the jets, the making is that much wonderful. It's a perfect masterpiece of the makers. Background musics are really cool. Cinematography was amazing.....

reviews.review_title: Shut up and take my money Mr. Cruise
reviews.content: This is what going to the theater used to be all about. No, you are not going there to be challenged about geopolitics, global inequality or climate change. You want escapist fun, a thrilling joyride to forget about it all and feel a rush of adrenaline without actually putting your body on the line.I have a personal connection to Top Gun in that it was the first movie I ever watched at the theater, back when in was six years old in 1986. So it was very difficult to disappoint me to begin with. But I was still pleasantly surprised by the quality of this product, the rewatch potential is almost 100%Mr Cruise is pushing 60 but hits all the marks perfectly. Perfectly I tell you! He puts himself in the foreground, as expected, but gives the right amount of space to the younger performers. Jennifer Connelly is pitch-perfect as the love interest and they even allowed themselves a few self-deprecating jokes.I have enormous admiration for this cinematic achievement, for the engineering prowess behind the creation and construction of the planes on display and for the almost unreal skill of the pilots involved. This is such a treat - if, like me, you are an X-Gen old-timer, this will be right down your alley, trust me!

reviews.review_title: I'm not a pilot boy... Honest review
reviews.content: 1st I prefer it to the first film which always bores me.... I have a love hate relationship with the film... It's very 80s and how I remember the decade, the soundtrack is unbeatable and Scott made a very stylish film but I just don't dig the story line... I do like Cruise, he has made some great films but there is better 80s films then TG.With today's society and generation I'm really shocked to see TG2 has grossed a Marvel gross considering it's not part of the new cinematic experience. It's a product of the 80s, it's not all about cgi heroes ect yet it's managed to make that impact and I will give it credit for showing when made correctly and older film concept can still make a big impact. Much same with Terminator, that could still work with the big man but in the right hands... And one thing TG2 has done is made Tom Cruise the biggest movie star of all time, literally. We have had names since the 1920s that are legends that have made an impact but Cruiseman has been a consistent player since 1983 and always maintained a huge status.... But with the gross of TG2 then it makes him the no.1 actor star of all time over every single man/lady to grace the screen.

I originally watched top gun 1 during the pandemic time, I was impressed by the way the movie showed jets & high speed air combat. When I saw the the trailer for Top gun maverick on YouTube I was so hyped and the movie live up to the hype. The main 3 scene were that of Maverick doing it alone, the coffin corner scene and F-14 scene all were just edge of the seat kind of stuff that gave me a awesome theater experience from an Hollywood movie after spider man no way home.

reviews.review_title: Thank you Tom, Thank you Film Industry
reviews.content: Man what can i say, Tom Cruise is making his way to an all time movie legend. (if he is not allready) This movie had everything without exaggerate something. It was just perfeclty set up. There is nothing, just nothing which seemed staged. Its a brilliant mix between a movie that maked the movie Industry big, with new CGI. I just loved it. This movie makes you happy, after leaving the cinema hall you have the same Top Gun feeling after the first movie.

reviews.review_title: 7.5 for how the action scene at the end got me
reviews.content: So I'm someone who doesn't typically go for military type movies- and the original top gun was a film I slept through when I was a kid. I definitely had prepared myself to fall asleep again through this sequel, and I should note that I also lost a bet over what movie we would watch to my boyfriend, so overall I was not happy about seeing this movie (cue laugh track).Then it starts. And I was like huh, okay there's something here. Then the training parts came and I go- huh, okay there's some comedy and some thrill- not bad. Then there was a good chunk of boring (sorry I just had a hard time paying attention), and the romance scenes were not as romantic as I would have liked (the bf didn't complain).Then it happened.The action everyone was waiting for.The chase, the thrill, and the drama!And I was completely engrossed.The last 30 minutes of the movie had me glued to my seat, chewing my nails, and holding my breath.So overall, not a bad bet to loose, and I left the movie theater telling myself to go see other films I wouldn't otherwise see. 7.5 stars.

Tom cruise yet again showed that how well he understands the cinema and audience. Every thing about the movie clicks, the music, the character, the nostalgia factor and the love for planes.It has the soul of original film wrapped in with the experience and technology of today, topped by Tom's performance.The casting was impeccable, every actor is the face of the character and they do justice to the role. Be is iceman or ed haris with screen time of less that 5 mins.Music is another dimension where the movie excels. Every time you hear the clannnnnng sound, it runs from your head to toe. Background music is appropriate and demands you to experience it in the movie theater.I must have watched the trailer more than 15 times and was waiting for this eagerly and believe you me. This does not disappoint. And it shows why Tome cruise is sitting on top of the pyramid.It is indeed a love letter to aviation.

I have to admit that I found this film somewhat better than the original. That is probably because it actually had more of a plot than the first film, which was basically about a bunch of hot shots going to a training school for elites, and then having a bit of a battle at the end. Okay, one could argue about the first film being about how a hot shot is humbled (or like Tarantino, claiming that it is a film about a man coming to terms with his homosexuality), but in the end, as far as I could tell, it was just an advertisement for the US Navy.Okay, one could easily argue that about this film as well, and in part you are right. However, I did feel like that it had more of a plot, and there was much more to the battle at the end than it was in the original. In fact, I was somewhat surprised that once the mission was completed, there was more to the film than I expected.There are two elements to this film though, one being that it is about an older fighter pilot struggling to maintain his relevancy, but also about a man who is struggling to deal with the ghosts of his past. In fact, one thing that is pointed out at the beginning is that Maverick has pretty much stagnated in his career. Despite the fact that he is a highly decorated officer, he still basically flies planes. However, his response to that is quite good, namely that he likes to fly planes.It sort of makes sense though because there is so much talk in the modern world that success if measured by how far up the ladder you climb, but the reality is that there are actually quite a lot of people that don't want to climb the ladder. I have worked with a number of people who are really, really good at what they do, however they have no interest in moving up the ladder, or as other say 'progressing their careers'. This is the impression that I get from Maverick, that he is happy where he is, and that is flying planes.Apparently Cruise was insistant that he did not want any blue screens in this film, which basically meant that all of the shots in the planes were actually filmed in the planes, the same being with all the stunts and maneuvers that were performed (though I'm not entirely sure whether Cruise can actually fly a jet, though he does know how to fly). Another thing that stood out is that in part the film still followed the track of the original film, which included a scene where everybody is playing ball on the beach. Though the interesting thing is that at the bar scene at the beginning, instead of being amongst the young people, he is sitting alone at the bar watching on. In a way, these two films seem to bookend Maverick's life, with nothing in between, despite the fact that we are given an idea of what went on between the two films. However, one thing is clear that while he has aged physically, he hasn't really matured all that much.As I mentioned though, compared to the original, I felt that there was a lot more meat to this film than the first one, which was just about a bunch of flyboys going to a training camp, and then fighting some MiGs at the end. This one, there was more urgency, and more of a plot, and more depth to Maverick's character than the original. Mind you, it was also quite interesting that they used the opening credits for the first film for this one as well.

reviews.review_title: If you want a great time at the movies, go watch it.
reviews.content: Just came back after watching it. I was absorbed the whole time. Was never bored. Had a really really good time. I would absolutely recommended in a heart beat.

reviews.review_title: This movie proves time travel is possible.
reviews.content: I walked into the theatre as a 40 something, but as soon as the lights dimmed and the music started...I was in my teens again 😁From start to finish, I could find no flaw in this truly cinematic masterpiece.Cruise, playing an older and "wiser" Maverick is just as entertaining and charismatic, if not more so than the first time around.The supporting cast, including Connelly and Teller are exceptional.The storyline is simple yet solid.The music is perfect.The cinematography is truly mindblowing.I am sitting writing this review back in my house a few hours after watching it, with a happy, nostalgic grin painted on my face.10/10.

Everything every man wants to be. The hero gets the girl does not come close to describe this cinematic masterpiece. If you can't be the hero navel aviator Top Gun Maverick lets you live vicariously through Maverick, Rooster, Ice, Honda, Cyclon, Warlock, Phoenix, Fanboy, and of course every man's crush Penny. Tom's attention to detail, the cinematography, even the mission was authentic and never done before. Bravo Mr. Cruise of should I say Maverick for a sequel well worth the wait. Most men would never get be a
Hero naval aviator but we all got to live it with this excellent film. Great soundtrack as well. Best action movie in a decade.

Think of all the cliches you might have seen in Top Gun, mix them up a bit and Hey Presto, a new film,
Some decent flying scenes, but interspersed with the 'This'll cost you your job', 'You're the best' and 'This is the modest superhero you need to look up to" speeches, together with My Hated Colleague is Now My Best Friend and We Are A Great Team Which We Weren't When We Met plots, and you have Maverick. But it all works out in the end as the All American Hero saves the planet. Again.I really like Tom Cruise, love Mission Impossible films, but this misses the target for me.

reviews.review_title: Top Gun Maverick - A giddy cocktail of - adrenalin rush, emotions and nostalgia !! 😊
reviews.content: As per the storyline, Tom Cruise here is not 'the man' on the mission, but a test pilot (read super pilot) who trains a batch of recent graduates for a special and dangerous assignment.Given the fact that the protagonist here is an aging star (almost sixty) and reduced to playing a trainer and not the 'man of the mission', many of us (including me) got the impression that the movie would be sans the Tom Cruise magic (read death defying stunts) and more of an encashment of his brand as the last hurrah.But please get rid of all such notions, as it's an out and out Tom Cruise movie, made very intelligently with proper business acumen and amazing special effects. Also, not once does the star appears old or jaded.Herein, he is a maestro of supersonic fighter jets who can test them to record breaking speed and manoeuvre them like a toy with impeccable strategy to meet the concerned mission's need.Alongside, he also teaches his unconventional albeit highly effective flying methods to a new batch of military graduates bursting with youth, super confidence and passion to do something out of the ordinary.And he battles the ghosts of his past and rekindles an old flame.As an exceptional dancer makes the toughest of steps appear like a child's play, the combo of good direction, acting, cinematography and special effects in the movie, ably simplifies the world of supersonic jets, their architecture & manipulation and their limitation on different terrains and altitudes !!Everything is easily understandable and this is no mean feat.You will find the movie thrilling & entertaining and around midway, you will start predicting it's end, but it will surprise you with an interesting climax.In spite of woven around a top class military assignment, the movie is not gruesome to watch, as the bullet and bomb firing scenes are more on the lines of a hi-tech video game.Also, it's a family entertainer with no nudity or intimate scene.Top Gun Maverick is a 'Tom Cruise Special' giddy cocktail of - adrenalin rush, emotions and nostalgia, which needs to be watched in a theatre for full entertainment of the senses.Please don't wait for it's OTT release.Last but not the least, though the movie is a sequel of Top Gun (1986), a huge commercial hit by Tom Cruise and team, it can be watched as an independent film.

reviews.review_title: From a reviewer that doesn't like action!
reviews.content: I'll preface my review by disclosing that I normally dislike action movies. I find them boring, predictable, and catering to the lowest common denominator. I have no interest in watching back and forth gunfire and/or car chases. This however is NOT your typical action movie, and I was surprised by how much I liked it. Good story, well made, well-filmed, no gratuitous violence nor gratuitous sex. Yay!!I may disagree with Mr. Tom Cruise's personal views, but there's no denying he's a very strong actor, and he definitely comes through here, as does the rest of the cast.I never saw the original, but Maverick did a fine job with filling in the missing pieces.The story develops nicely and logically, and the build-up is steady and gradual. It will obviously please aeronautics fans, but there is also a healthy - but not overboard - dose of drama, sentimentality, and even romance. So ladies if you think this is one to skip, you might just be surprised like I was! There something for everyone here.I was also pleased by the ending. I don't like depressing endings, nor ones that leave you hanging, and Maverick had neither of these issues. I could actually watch this one again. Highly recommended!!
I can't believe that some psychopaths hate this film, if you still haven't seen this master piece, stop wasting you time on tik tok and just watch this.

reviews.review_title: Go to the Cinema! DO IT!
reviews.content: This is the movie experience, cinemas were made for! You are doing your self a disservice if you are waiting for a home release. Do yourself a favour, find the biggest screen in your area, preferably with dolby ATMOS and go see it.To the review of the movie itself? The second Top gun takes everything I enjoyed about the first movie and improves it while fixing some of the issues that I had to overlook in the firs one. Let's get those out of the way first. The plot of the first movie always seemed sort of crudely constructed, but it never bothered me as it was not the point of the movie. What I mean by crudely constructed? Fun areal exercises, a bit of drama and then a mission out of no-where just so there is a 3rd act with some stakes. Crude, but it never bothered me. So how does the second Top Gun fix this? The plot is still simple, but it is focused with well defined stakes. The team is preparing for a specific mission and the 3rd act is about executing that mission. The viewers understand the parameters, the dangers and the stakes, so you are engaged the whole time.My second issue used to be that the dogfights were always somewhat confusing. Boy oh boy does this movie improve on that front. The movie was shot in real F-18s and it shows. They set out to make you feel like being in a figher jet and they achieved it marvelously.Sprinkle on top of that some character conflicts and resolutions. Some callbacks to the original movie and some heartfelt moments that had me tearing up a bit and you have yourself an excellent time. Do yourself a favour and just go see it, I'll probably go rewatch it this weekend.

Okay, Tom Cruise, you crazy maniac. Doing this in your 60s is incredible and they even showed us in the theater the trailer on M: I 7 and - yeah you get the point. So, is this movie any good, does this movie bring us some nostalgia alongside some fun new characters and an intriguing plot? Oh yeah, it does, and it does it quite smoothly and incredibly riveting. I mean, the whole bunch of action scenes in cockpits and the last 40 minutes of this movie - flawless cinema, absolute brilliance of work, and easily the best action blockbuster this year yet. We need more movies to use these machines because it's just too cool to not use them - I was at the edge of my seat the whole time. A bit of criticism here and there, maybe the storyline with Connelly is - is fun, but not certainly most interesting stuff in the world, and maybe some pilot deserved some more exposition but - I mean, it's nothing. When we're in the air, it's amazing and I love this movie very much. Can't wait for M: I and I gotta say - Tom, you crazy old-timer, thank you for the beer.

reviews.review_title: This is what in 2022 we want from hollywood
reviews.content: The secret to make a film realistic? Make real things.In this time of cgi for EVERYTHING this film show how hard work and dedication to make real footage is pay off insted of use cgi for everything.Cgi like in this film need to be use like an accessory not a think to create a film.Like LOTR 20 years ago they use cgi for minimum, for example all the orcs were real people with make and costumes. .Hollywood restart from this. People are bored of a nosense fly/explosion and monster that looks so fake like a videogames .

Full disclosure: I HATED the original Top Gun. There was no plot whatsoever adn I was bored out of my mind watching that mvie.So it took me a while before I streamed the sequel and in a way I wish I had seen it in the theatres. It's really good.Mainly because it actually has a real plot. Yeah Cruise is looking old but the movie is very well done.There are a few emotional scenes and I was very glad to see. Val Kilmer in a short but poignant segement. I think he's an underrated actor and it's sad that he had throat cancer and now has some problems speaking (he's on Cameo, believe it or not!)Anyway the movie kept my interest throughout and I thoroughly enjoyed it!

reviews.review_title: You told me not to think
reviews.content: Maverick Skywalker (Tom Cruise) ends up teaching a dozen aces how to hunt bump rabbits in a canyon and shoot a target down a ventilation shaft in order to destroy Death Star. Seems an unnamed rogue nation has build an underground facility to enrich uranium. The US is going to commit an act of war against them by attacking the facility protected by surface to air missiles and superior fighters. There is some human drama.I was not overly impressed with Val Kilmer. His relationship with Penny is rekindled. Otherwise, good characters, unbelievable plot.

reviews.review_title: This one is for us, the lost generation
reviews.content:
If you are reading this, before I write about the movie, I want to take a moment and thank @TomCruise
for this masterpiece. My father would have loved it (he was a pilot, may he rest in peace).When I was a kid, my father took me to see the first Top Gun movie. I remember I wanted to be like my dad when I grow up.3 years ago, I promised him I will take him to see the new Top Gun movie when its out. The movie got delay, and Covid-19 took my father's life.This week, I went to the cinemas 3 times, alone.Every time i (re)watched it, same emotions, same pain, same love.This is is by far the best Masterpiece Tom Cruise was ever a part of. Its a rollercoaster of emotions, too many flashbacks with just the right amount of humor and sarcasm.Everyone says how the first movie is actually better than the second one. Not in this case, as TG:Maverick outshined its prequel and put a closure on the life of Captain (highly decorated) Pete Mitchell. Yes, he is still a captain, a highly decorated one.The way the flight sequences were filmed is remarkable. Imagine a 60-year old Tom Cruise being crushed by actual G-forces in a jet fighter. Tom has aged a few years over the past 36, and this movie will be his legacy.Will I watch it again in dolby and in Digital, and on Bluray? Most definitely.

The original movie was the single biggest recruitment tool in Navy history it changed a generation. This movie manages to recapture that lightning in a bottle and add to it. A great movie that teaches rugged American individualism and exceptionalism. This movie comes at a great time I suggest telling your kids to put down Karl Marx and show them something positive for a change.

I was a little sceptical about a sequel to a movie made back in 1986 but I was blown away, loved the story, loved the script, loved the directing, loved the acting, loved the cast, loved the soundtrack, loved the filmography, loved the cinematography, loved the nostalgia - brilliant!Tom Cruise and Jennifer Connelly make an incredible couple in the movie. Glad to see Maverick finally found his family.

I just had to make my first review for this one. I´m 31 years old, and over the years I have tried to rate every movie that I have ever seen to keep track of how many movies I have seen in my lifetime, I´m at 860 titles, and this is hands down one of the best movies I have ever seen, if not THE best! Throwbacks, pinched to the chair, uncontrollable emotions, plot twists, amazing soundtracks, it had everything you could ever want in a real action movie! And it still exceeded my expectations. I even got emotional for seeing something that great of creation.Do yourself a favor and go to the theater to get the whole experience, you don´t want to miss out on this one, trust me! Even my girlfriend loved it and she usually just watch swedish drama films.

This movie is 10G, MACH 10 insanity. You see what a fighter pilot goes through and why they are elite. I don't know if i have ever seen a bad Tom cruise movie. You don't have to watch the first to understand this one, although recommended.

Almost the perfect sequel :) including some of the original soundtrack was mega, what makes it a 9/10 for me is that the new music is meh.Storyline is brilliant, it's a movie folks it's escapism and it's great with loads of nostalgia. People complaining about plot holes, need to stop watching movies and switch to documentaries:)
Film is absolutely amazing. And also nostalgic I was 9 years old when I saw this film. Tom Cruise nailed his role. It was the best experience of my life of watching this film in IMAX.

reviews.review_title: Maverick is Top of its Class
reviews.content: This is one of the rare senerrios where the sequal was even better than the original. Overall, this is a very fulfilling film and also should be viewed on an imax or an evelilieant large cinema screen. That should also do the film justice as well.

I had mediocre expectations for top gun. This movie was fantastic, not only did it play back great with the nostalgia and well rounded storytelling but it was believable and I was sitting on the edge of my seat. Super excited that this second movie was not a complete disaster. Hollywood often does a fantastic job of ruining sequels to movies. This movie was a home run hit out of the park.

Great sequel to the original and will go down as a classic. My favorite flic this year and a perfect summer blockbuster at that. Don't be cheap and wait for this to hit streaming services - see this on the big screen!!! Now.

Very nice movie only in the end is a little bit far-fetched. I mean maverick is good but no one is that good to pull this off. Also if someone wants to see how a real operation is done the movie provides a pretty legit way of how things are done in a military airborne mission .The acting is good and the movie brings you a sense of nostalgia about the old movie making you wanna see it again .

After more than 35 years, Tom Cruise has still got it! I enjoyed this film immensely, and will definitely purchase the DVD when it is available! Although the ensemble cast is great, as the cast in the first one was, again it is really Cruise that carries the movie!Having Goose's son in the movie was a great touch, as was showing the dying Val Kilmer. Kilmer was terrific in his short but epic appearance as Iceman. I don't want to take anything away from the terrific performances of the other cast members such as Miles Teller and Lewis Pullman, but I feel I have to pay homage to Cruise and Kilmer.
This movie is a perfect homage to the first one, I enjoyed every second of it, every reference to the previous movies, connection, charachter development and the story itself. 10/10 for me!

I rarely give a 10 to a movie, unless it's one where I would watch over and over again. I usually keep my 8s as top score 9 and 10 for exceptional movies.Went to the cinema to see this and it was outstanding. Better than the first one, although the first one is good.A cross between Mission Impossible and Behind Enemy Lines. Truely amazing.

reviews.review_title: Best movie in a very long time!
reviews.content: No preaching just pure entertainment! The first movies I have ever watched twice in the cinema!It stays true to the original while also bringing something new. There are many references to the original movie but they are subtle and doesn't feel forced. Was afraid how they'll handle Valkilmer but Iceman got all the respect he deserves!This movie is pure fiction and it doesn't try to hide it. "'it's not the plane it's the pilot" ^_^AND it is beautifully made all the aerial scenes!

As someone who haven't watch Top Gun (1986) , I was really focus and into the storyline. Everything was so cool and nervous when they are being attacked and when they are training. Definitely will search to watch the 1986 movie too. Have to watch if you haven't!

Can't believe I'm writing this, but Top Gun: Maverick is actually better than the 1986 original. The work and effort that went into the flight sequences is spectacular and refreshing that much of it is free of CGI. Hats off to the actors who trained for months to be able to sit in front of cameras in the back of proper F-18's at incredible g-force. The continuity in plot was nostalgic enough to please fans of the original, yet with enough depth to thrill those new to Top Gun. This also extends to the Hans Zimmer score and while not his best work ever it nonetheless stayed true to the original and blended very well with the original Georgio Moroder elements. Thoroughly enjoyable.

The second episode after 36 years! (Is it a record?)Tom is still handsome and charming! He was employed by Top Gun again to train the pilots imcluding son of goose (Miles really look like goose anyway) The fighting scenes are so exciting and real, and realize Tom is really flying but not using green screens! Surprising Val is involved though minimal, and Jennifer is still pretty! The last scene where they fight using F14 really amazed me, and love Miles saying 'Dun think otherwise you're dead!' Hope can watch again soon!

Top Gun Maverick is epic on every single level, the action is next level exciting and sets a bar that will be hard to beat. This film is also filled with emotion and sits in perfect conjunction to the first film. Well done Kosinski, Cruise, Bruckheimer and all the cast and crew, you made lightning strike twice and also made it strike twice as powerful. Absolute must see film.
Great movie with amazing depth. Enjoy every moment of the movie make u doesnt want to move from your seat.Action, thrill, graphic, script, character all in perfect order.Thanks for the great movie.

This is my first review, and probably only review. Ever. But this, this is something else. Im writing this when in euphoria, so please take my words with a grain of salt. But...
It's probably the best "go-watch-this-on-a-big-screen-movie" I have seen in a long, long time. The feeling. The nostalgia. The music. The characters. The sound of F18's. Tears of joy. Tears of sadness. Goosebumps. Roosterbumps. Damn. Everything was amazing.Last words?I feel the need. The need for speed!Update: Just saw it the 2nd time on a smaller screen and less sound. Go watch it on the biggest screen with the best sound you can find. This time my heart wasn't jumping out of my chest from the jets </3.

reviews.review_title: Thanks to everyone involved in the creation!
reviews.content: I am not going to spoil it - go and watch it in a cinema, you will not be sorry. I watched it twice and going for a third time as it is one of the most beautiful cinema experiences there could be. It is just excellent. Going for to watch it for a third time, I don't think I will ever again have a chance of such a cinema experience.

reviews.review_title: Very enjoyable. For people who say this is unoriginal, I beg to differ. There are almost no films like it out today, and thats a shame.
reviews.content: Is this intellectual? No. Why would it be? However, there are no obvious plot holes either. Is the flying part of it realistic? Not particularly. But then, I just watched a really awful film about a 100 pound woman beating up a Predator who can kill scores of large men. With a rope and a hatchet. So, I have certainly seen less realistic things in movies. In fact, I haven't seen a movie that I would call realistic on any level for at least 7 years now. The dialogue was quippy. Kind of like you would find in a superhero movie, and its meant to be. These aren't very realistic situations, so why would there be realistic dialogue. The characters are endearing. Its a movie best seen in theaters, because of the effects, but its fun to see on the small screen too. I know Ill be rewatching it as soon as I can.
Wow!! Just wow!! Best movie in years!!!Must see!!!Someone I know....should have went & saw it instead of Minions!! #missedopportunity#ilovejetnoise.

Glorious! What a wonderful, uplifting film! Why does one go to the theater? Why is there theater? To escape the dreary world of reality and be uplifted - ideally by a story that is ultimately...human...
Cruise is masterful in portraying an aging pilot (or, simply, an aging male human) who has witnessed much....enjoyed much...and suffered much.He remembers his youth, and is mindful of the wisdom he has accumulated from his life experiences...
His Life is based on principle...loyalty, honor, courage... and the three D's of Dedication, Determination, and Discipline...
In this last hour...not of his Life, but of his career, where he has the most opportunity to pass his Wisdom on to the next generation, he seeks to impress upon the young ones his Life's meaning...

Fantastic movie the only downside is that I couldn't watch it with this amazing girl bella so that's why it's not a 10.Now I have to add enough words so that this can count as a review which makes absolutely no sense to me but I guess I'm gonna do it. I don't really think anyone else other than you would see this bella so I think I'll just chat about you. You're pretty fantastic, you always find a way to make me happy and smile. I think your presence makes everyone you happy too. I think we get along super well. We may not have all the same similar interests, but I think that's so cool bc we'll just keep learning about each other and really understand each other and that's so exciting. You make me want to make you laugh and be happy which I think is really good for me too like I feel like I'm growing with you to be better. Who knows what the future holds but it's awesome being with you.

Absolutely loved it. Cannot understand why anyone wouldn't. The low reviews talk about it being cheesy, one liners , all about Tom, lack of character development, same as original and all I say to that is yes yes yes yes, exactly what we all wanted. The action sequences alone are worth the watch, no CGI here , just planes , speed of sound, missiles , flares and good music. We saw it at the cinema and 100 people walked out raving how good it was and simply put it is. A worthy sequel to an 80s classic.

What an outstanding film. Not just as a sequel to "Top Gun" but as a stand-alone masterclass of filmmaking. Every scene was so well thought out and had strong emotions. Every performance was so... real. Speaking of real, those plain scenes have set an example of practical effects work. You could feel the power and speed of the planes and the effects it had on the pilots. I was on the edge of my seat watching the dogfights and wondering "will he/she die?" Tommy Cruise shows his dedication to his craft and his commitment to realism. The conflicts between characters has SO MUCH depth and intrigue. These gut wrenching conflicts deserve heartwarming pay offs right. Well then go experience "Maverick" to see for your self.

A feel good movie without any intrusive preachy teachy message. I liked the music, the action, the characters, the relationship tension between Rooster and Maverick. Good training scenes and combat scenes. I felt there was maybe a bit too much reflection of the original Top Gun movie, but just a little. However, one does not need to see Top Gun 1 to follow this plot, even though relationships and the characterization of Maverick himself do build on the first movie.Favorite scene - two guys, behind enemy lines, up on the cliff, looking down at the enemy base and deciding what to do next. Funny.Oddity: With that Drone Happy Commander (Ed Harris) appearing early in the film and with his judgment call, I was expecting the plot to build on contrasting abilities vis-a-vis human fighter pilots and drones. But that went nowhere. I feel this was odd, perhaps even a lost opportunity.

If you watched the first Top Gun (1986) then you have definitely to watch the new Top Gun version , Maverick.This movie has fantastic music and all the visual effects are real .The plot is very simply to understand and it's for all the family.It's the best movie to see on a Saturday night.

reviews.review_title: Shortie made it, an action thriller worth a 11.11*
reviews.content: It worth the wait, no doubt. I went to the theatre not knowing what to see in advance. I saw Maverick had some seats available and thaught "meh, what the hec, first one wasn't that bad an action-drama-romance. How bad can the sequel be?". Well I tell you one thing. It contains scenes of explicit thrillness and joy. Don't lose your coke cups. YOU'RE GONNA WET YOURSELVES, THE GOOD WAY AND IT KNOWS JUST THE PATH. 8.6 at the time I'm writing this is undarating. It's THAT good. Clichées are bare minimum. You'll keep asking for more and more....And you'll feel it like no other. Just tell at the ticket post to shut up and take your money. Go see that no matter what. It's like they fine tunned what they had to perfection.

Didn't know we could get a nearly perfect movie in 2022 but with Tom Cruise nothing is impossible. A mind boggling, epic, thrilling sequel, even better than the first one. Over two hours long but worth every second of it. Tom's great as usual, all other characters have done great job as well. The epic score of Top Gun (1988) just adds to the greatness of the movie. You wouldn't regret going to the theatre to see this blockbuster, your time will get passed in a jiffy. Don't have any more words to describe this epic flick, just a perfect movie to watch with your loved ones. Even though, I am from Pakistan, but this movie gave me goosebumps. Lovely and outstanding!

reviews.review_title: Best Theatre experience of my life
reviews.content: SEE IT IN IMAX!I chose to see this movie in IMAX for my first showing, and I was completely blown away. This trumps every theatre experience I've ever had in my life, and as a career pilot and flight instructor, I couldn't have been more pumped. My expectations were exceeded in every way.What a high quality, practically shot, woke-free, patriotic film. The characters and writing are great, the effects are breathtaking, and the NOSTALGIA!! It's incredible. It's a love letter to aviation and the military, seen it twice in theatres already and will definitely be going back.

"After more than thirty years of service as one of the Navy's top pilots, and evading progress in a rank that would elevate his position, Pete Maverick finds himself training a group of Top Gun alumni for a specialized mission they have never undertaken at all".More than 36 years later, Top Gun returns to us with a new look and in an innovative way different from the first part ..A very beautiful experience and becomes more beautiful when you watch it in cinemas, as I said earlier that movies for me do not differ from them, whether I watch them on mobile phone, laptops or cinema, but the evaluation can vary slightly and the experience is somewhat and such films that rely on visual and auditory effects. It is necessary to experience it in cinema and in the best theaters ..A special thriller drama movie, although it has some expected and repeated scenes, but this is what the viewer wanted, like the viewer's habit, wishes that things would end well and that the hero would win, not this dilemma because that's what we want, but I wished there was at least one victim in the movie other than the flashback that we saw with ..At first I expected the flight scenes to be CGI but was surprised that they were real and the actors reacted real about flying in the air and having this unique experience, except Tom Cruise because he is used to these risks ..I liked the story of the film from its first part, but when I watched the first part, I wished they had done one with the same story in our time with technical developments, because the first was catastrophic other than its technical disasters. There were artistic disasters in the performances of the actors and the story, thank God they did the second part in our time because the second was very beautiful and the same as what we wanted ..Tom Cruise as usual restrains skeptics of his abilities, as Tom Cruise is an actor of action-action movies and the like, every time he proves himself and responds to them while at this age mastering his roles and poetic drama scenes, a creative actor in every sense of the word ..The cast selections were great, especially Mils Teller, in which he is very similar to his father's role in the movie Guss in this thing, but Joe introduces you with the movie as well as let your mind connect the topics automatically ..Maverick's and me's nice relationship has increased the film's aesthetic and I'm surprised by some people who didn't like their relationship on the contrary. It was very nice, sweet and appropriate with Maverick's personality, it was when he hesitated to take a decision to resort to it ..Spontaneous comedy dialogues always give a great mix to the viewer and in this movie we have seen a lot of them ..I was never disappointed in the movie except the point I mentioned in the beginning and the experience as a whole, I mean ..My favorite scene in the movie when Maverick was kicked off the bar and saw Roster playing and reminded his classmate of the profession, it was a sad and expressive scene and we delved deeper into Maverick's character .((Performance is not according to the plane specification. But with the skill of the pilot))My Rating : (9.0/10)

What a FILM.. in this day and age it's the film we all needed. Action packed, took me back to how films were properly made, I couldn't find one fault with this film, It really took me on a journey of emotions. This deserves multiple Oscars.... I am tearing up as I write this. From the Soundtrack to the acting was all 10/10. Tom Cruise really nailed this one and the supporting cast, can't wait to get to work and tell people it's a MUST watch.... If I was 20 years younger this would make me join the Navy detailing Top Gun inspired me, if there's any reason to want to fly a fight jet then this would be it.

reviews.review_title: This is what a sequel should be
reviews.content: While some aging hollywood power players are remaking dated song and dance numbers from 80 years ago, these guys are taking material from almost 40 years ago and expanding it. I don't want to give much away except to say go see it. It's what a theater blockbuster movie is supposed to be.

Nice Best Awesome ✨ 10 ✨✨ best movie Awesome ✨After more than 30 years of service as one of the Navy's top aviators, Pete "Maverick" Mitchell is where he belongs, pushing the envelope as a courageous test pilot and dodging the advancement in rank that would ground him. Training a detachment of graduates for a special assignment, Maverick must confront the ghosts of his past and his deepest fears, culminating in a mission that demands the ultimate sacrifice from those who choose to fly it.

It's amazing how they managed to transfer the feel of the 80s movies in 2022. This movie is exactly what we all expected and more. Action-packed fun 150 minutes I will gladly repeat many times. I'm so glad that in today's decline of Hollywood there are still movies made that can make me hopeful about the future of movie theatres.

Year 2022,couldn't have been better without it. Tom cruise and team kept it simple with great visuals and some amazing Air combat.Maverick couldn't have found a better ending after 30 years of service. Each actor got there fair share of screen timing where they portrayed with great ease and amazing.Top gun: Maverick is a worthy re-watch.

A good sequel doesn't tarnish the original and makes you happy you watched it. An amazing sequel outdoes the original and makes the original even better! Top Gun: Maverick does just that. For those of us raised on Top Gun, this new installment feels like home. I found myself teary-eyed from the opening titles with the anthem, and many times throughout the movie. With its real flight scenes, amazing cast, and familiar but re-energized script, this is the blockbuster we've all been waiting for. I have never been one to clap in a movie theater, but if any movie will make you want to clap and cheer, it's this one. Tom Cruise easily became Maverick again, and Miles Teller was the perfect choice for Rooster. I loved every second of this movie, even the slight cheese they throw in here and there that feels nostalgic. I've seen it twice, and I hope to see it in theaters again. Don't miss this one while it's in theaters!
Great story line, amazing flight scenes, what more could you ask for. Best movie I have seen in years.Complements the original nicely.Some of the original music.

reviews.review_title: People who hate on this movie may be right on some things but...
reviews.content: They don't know how to have a good time and just relax about details. This is a fantastic movie to see in the theater. The sights and sounds will bring you to the edge of your seat and get your heart racing. The fact that these scenes were shot using real jets and pilots is a testament to the skills and dedication brave men and women have put into becoming skilled aviators. Go and enjoy while you can people it's worth it.

reviews.review_title: An excellent continuation on a classic!
reviews.content: I grew up watching this film with my dad and was so thrilled to go see it in theatres on Father's Day with him, and we were not disappointed! When I say this is one of my favourite movies, my dad and I literally know every word, and I'm pleased that this film had enough of its own story as well as nods to the first to make it an exciting walk down memory lane. The premise was great, acting was great, stunts were amazing, well chosen actors, I could go on. I only give it 9/10 for the romance scene with penny benjamin, just a little awkward and goofily filmed. I did like the idea that they pulled this character out of a quick joke in the original and made a loving reunion and happy ending to the film. It was exciting, dramatic, funny, and a great sequel to a beloved film. Well done, good to see you back as Maverick again Cruise!

Tom Cruise returns to his popular role of Pete "Maverick" Mitchell, arrogant but goodhearted and incredibly talented navy fighter pilot of the original 1986 film, now some 30+ years later much the same thank goodness, though he hasn't risen above the rank of Captain and is currently a test pilot when he is ordered back to the Top Gun program to teach prior top graduates on a secret and dangerous mission to destroy a rogue uranium plant in a canyon on foreign territory, and deal with the estranged son of his late best friend "Goose" killed in the first film, and now a pilot himself. Jennnifer Connelly plays his current love interest Penny, who was mentioned in the first film, and Val Kilmer returns briefly as "Iceman" now a respected Admiral nearing the end of his life.Surprisingly superb sequel surpasses the first in every way, though pays its respects to it most satisfactorily while still telling its own story and introducing interesting new characters who could possibly star in future installments, if this turns into a franchise. A huge blockbuster hit that troubled Hollywood could learn many lessons from, as this film is most exciting and emotional, not preachy with the "message", but an old-fashioned patriotic feel-good adventure that hasn't been seen for far too long. Not at all surprising story wise, but well-acted and directed (Joseph Kosinski) picture hits all the right buttons.

reviews.review_title: Top Gun is back and ready for more
reviews.content: When I first heard about this film I was skeptical, Hollywood hasn't done a good job of late and so I was concerned that this would be some agenda driven drivel but was pleasantly surprised. However, with that said, I was only further surprised when there was no agenda at all from beginning to end. It was incredible, Hollywood made an actual film again?! For Entertainment?! Wow. Bonkers.Never the less, this film was everything you should expect from a sequel so many years later. It offers interesting story from the original that didn't skew off into some absurd difference, it was as if they had this planned all along - maybe they did, just took this long to achieve it.Still the cinematography was on point, just like the original Top Gun, and the passing of a torch was successful here where it has failed in so many other Hollywood films. Why? Because it never once took a crap on the originals. It never once disgraced the fans, or the original films. Instead it was more like Logan in that it was also about getting too old to keep doing this, but having enough fight to still get in there and get it done. Well done to the crew of this film, on point in a film that could've gone so much worse.

reviews.review_title: The Sequel We Didn't Know We Needed
reviews.content: Sequels are a slippery slope to potentially hindering original movies, however Top Gun: Maverick succeeds where most sequels fail.The movie emphasizes on the relationship between Lt. Pete "Maverick" Mitchell and Bradley "Rooster" Bradshaw (Goose's son). In most 80s action movies, the audience never gets to fully understand how certain deaths of side characters affected the future of main protagonist. The choice for this emphasis in the sequel makes you truly care for Goose's character. The audience can feel even after 30 years how Maverick has been burdened by the death of his best friend. This movie however emphasizes on the idea of forgiveness. By getting Bradley's forgiveness after a series of events, Maverick was truly free from the weight he has been having to carry along with him in a very heart warming way.The film's tone is very tense when it needs to be. In high-stakes situations there is a good constant tension and a sense danger, but the directors do a magnificent job at not making this 'tension' exhausting for the audience. It was very suspenseful, and just when you thought it couldn't get better, it does.In terms of stylistic features, and other artistic choices, Top Gun Maverick is a clear example on why film can be such a breath-taking experience. From the high speed chases, to low-altitude flying environments, the movie is incredibly beautiful and very cinematic (I really want to point out a specific shot of Rooster thinking about returning to enemy lines to save Maverick). The choice for so much practical effects shot in real planes should definitely give the film the credit it deserves.Ultimately, Top Gun: Maverick did an impeccable job at continuing the story from the original, despite it being totally unnecessary plot-wise (which is a magnificent accomplishment on its own). Bringing back key characters was the icing on the cake for most fans and the frame that dedicates the film to Tony Scott was heart warming.Three words to describe what the film develops on is limits, instinct, and forgiveness.

reviews.review_title: Its a top notch treat for the eyes
reviews.content: I have watched Top Gun then watched this sequel back to back and I can say only one word about this: WOW!! The feeling while watching the Jet plane parts are truly original and amazing. It can reveal how well all those actors acted. Their did so so original. All those sequences are nail bitting stuff. And those who watched this beauty in IMAX, they felt heavenly I can say that. The direction of Joseph Kosinski is just outstanding.I seriously cannot find fault with this movie. Every element was well thought out, down to the music, the camera panning, the scene transitions, the lengths of the scenes, every word in the script, and the incredible footage of the birds (aka aircraft) from the air.If I had a chance to say one sentence to Tom Cruise, I would say this: "Maverick is the most phenomenal film I've ever seen; thank you for making it the most unforgettable, moving, and thrilling motion picture ever to set foot in movie theaters."

reviews.review_title: Orginal All Time Favorite to New All Time Favorite!!
reviews.content: Im sure everyone has said it all! I've seen the movie three times in 10 days!!! You will NOT be disappointed. The lack of over-the-top CGI as well as a movie not pushing over-the-top agendas was refreshing as heck!Prior Air Force combat vet. Not in the Navy however Top Gun definitely had something to do with me joining and service for 6 years!

Top gun is a movie about the top gun, elite pilots team who have a hard mission to do. There is so much action, it doesn't leave a place to brief, but it's extremely entertaining and I encourage everyone to watch it.
This movie completely blew me away. I went in expecting alot because of the great reviews and it absolutely delivered. I was literally on the edge of my seat in the theater. Great movie!

There's really nothing bad to say about this film. It hits every bit of fan service without being gratuitous and the story beats are pretty much perfect.It hits the mid-point and everything is going wrong... and without spoiling things, Mav rescues the situation and it all plays out awesomely.Into the final act... which again is almost perfect. It stretches a little with one attempt at fan service (those who've seen it will know what I mean), but at this point I didn't care. I was just enjoying the thrill ride.I'm sure there's an element of rose-tinted glasses here. So many films have been disastrously bad in the last few years. This one represents a major return to form.Thankfully the money its raked in is showing that. It's been an enormous hit. It should be pretty embarrassing that a return to a style of film from 30+ years ago was needed to show filmmakers the way forward. I how the money men are watching... get back to crowed pleasing.Make films that people want to watch. Not full of politics you want to preach.

'Top Gun: Maverick (2022)' is, in many ways, exactly what you'd expect it to be. It's an earnest, almost cheesy ode to the American military that places emphasis on human pilots (as opposed to drones) who are able to disobey orders when necessary and never seem to get properly sanctioned for doing so. All the themes you'd expect - such as pilots vs officers, humans vs drones and Tom Cruise vs ageing - are here, although the picture is disappointingly decidedly less gay than its predecessor (to an almost revisionist degree). It's jingoistic, albeit slightly less jingoistic than the first flick, and clunky when it comes to everything other than its high-flying set-pieces. It's predictable and it gets off to a pretty rocky start, too. Eventually, though, you realise that you're not thinking about its problems, that they're not even relevant anymore. You realise that you're having a blast and that, ultimately, that's what matters. Every single time the characters get into their cockpits, the film transforms into an invigorating and expertly choreographed action extravaganza. Though the fact that they did most of this stuff for real doesn't inherently make it good, it's undeniably far more effective than any visual effects method of achieving a similar result because it never once requires suspension of disbelief. There are, of course, special effects involved in some of the sequences but they're so seamless and secondary to the overwhelming practicality of it all that they feel just as natural as that which was really present on set. The effects do what they're supposed to do: enhance rather than replace. In an era where some films can't even convincingly put five people together in a single room, practicality like this is even more important than ever before. Even if you aren't actively thinking about the very real ground whizzing past the very real people in the very real planes flying at very really dangerous speeds, you feel it on a subconscious level. There's nothing quite like seeing gravity yank an actor's face so much that they're almost unrecognisable, or two planes dance with each other like ballerinas in the sky. It's incredibly exciting, and credit has to go those involved with transforming arial stunts into actual action scenes. The flick had to be incredibly bad for the environment, though, which is obviously a major downside. It's worth noting that Tom Cruise is actually kind of great in a couple of the dialogue scenes, genuinely delivering a brilliant performance in the piece's most emotional moment. He may be known more for his apparent willingness to die for his craft, but he's a solidified star for a reason and it's important to remember that his earlier roles relied on his acting abilities more than his action abilities (and, in a way, aren't they one in the same?). In the end, the movie is a ton of fun that's simultaneously generic and one-of-a-kind. If it had a better story with more focused character arcs, it could have been one of the all-time greats. As it is, it's an incredible achievement that's often enthralling and deserves most of the praise it's been receiving.

reviews.review_title: Now THAT'S what escapism should be.
reviews.content: This is what entertainment should be.Characters you care about, quickly established plot, action, friendship, some call backs, some sadness and a touch of romance. Pretty great ride and a ton of fun.No message to preach to us, just keep us following along and on the edge of our seats.Jennifer Connelly looked great btw. Not sure if planes were actually flying (they looked real) but it seemed real.Sorry, your review is too short. It needs to contain at least 600 characters. Sorry, your review is too short. It needs to contain at least 600 characters. Sorry, your review is too short. It needs to contain at least 600 characters.

reviews.review_title: Fake Imdb reviews artificially upping the ratings for this boring movie.
reviews.content: Almost 90 percent of all the reviews have a 8, 9 or 10 star rating! That's almost the same as for "The Godfather" (1972), which is a brilliant classic. It is simply IMPOSSIBLE that Top Gun gets the same critical praise as "The Godfather" (1972). Ridiculous amount of fake reviews!Mind you, I am a big Tom Cruise fan, I have seen all of his movies and I dont even hate this movie, I merely think it is a bit tedious. I blame the director (same as for "Oblivion").This movie has got 75 minutes of talk, talk, talk. The first half is a talking heads movie. We see Tom being a teacher talking to his students about FEELINGS and we get to see Tom talking/flirting to his former ex lover Jennifer Connelly. BORING.Skip the first 75 minutes, because only the last 45 minutes are non stop flying action.BUT... even the action is not very thrilling, because everything is so PREDICTABLE. I knew beforehand that every fighting scene Tom Cruise did, was gonna be successful. And it was. There is no thrill in that!The biggest hype of this movie was about the real life flying scenes of the actors. These flying scenes were pretty looking indeed. But did it blow my mind? No, it was even a bit underwhelming to see Tom Cruise with a helmet and mask on, trying to "act", without seeing much of his face. His face looked a bit bloated in his helmet. That's not great cinema...How they achieved to make such a predictable, tedious movie about fighter jet pilots, with so much money available? Well, that's Hollywood for you. Hurrah for Hollywood.

That all the producers of the big blockbusters see this masterpiece and know that it is possible to make a great action movie with a deep story and
good script.

Finally a movie everyone can enjoy without getting hit with politics left and right. Pun intended. Although it's always more left. This should be a template for how to make a good movie. We used to see movies like this before writers and directors thought we cared about what they think. Maybe they'll get the hint but I doubt it. Great job on making it pro America as well.

You might guess what this movie review is gonna be like. I totally understand why as well, this was after all Maverick's story since the beginning.I gotta first tell you that I'm not from the generation that experienced Top Gun when it first came out in the 90s, I'm a millennial. I saw Top Gun for the first time five years ago and I thought it was magnificent, a very period piece type of movie that works amazingly in all of its elements- actors, music, setting... and it is so iconic even I can understand it even if I didn't live during that time when it first came out. Fast forward five years and the new Top Gun is here! The reviews have been amazing, many saying that this is the rare case when a sequel surpasses the first movie and that everything is perfect. I totally agree with these aspects but there was something that lost me a bit in the movie.I understand that this is all 100% Maverick's movie but a lot of the characters needed further exploration and development- I know they tried to make the secondary characters I.e. The team that Maverick teaches as distinct as possible but the plot doesn't really have time for any of them which is a shame as I would've loved to see all of these new pilots get a team working relationship and try to overcome the task at hand which we don't really get, we get glimpses of this- after all this supposed heist is done in three weeks but due to the plot it gets shortened to two weeks which is a shame- I know they did this to heighten the stakes but a lot of the character development gets sacrificed... instead we get a lot of conflict that never really gets dissolved until after the heist which feels so forced. I was really bugged that we didn't get more scenes with Rooster, Hangman, Phoenix etc. It's not that Maverick's story isn't compelling per se, it is the emotional core of the story after all but goddamn could this movie have been better with further exploration on the other Top Gun crew, just like in the 80s movie. At least we got a hunky beach scene lol!The music is fantastic, very great use of the older tracks from the movie and the older score vs. The new one which is good! The Lady Gaga song is really awesome as well!All in all it is a good movie, not my favourite but it is good- I understand the praise but it needs a bit more work for me before it can be called amazing- nevertheless I had a fun time at the cinema! Which is all that counts really!

This is a nearly flawless propaganda movie that fits in the 2020s. Its a clean advertisement for lockheed martin and the military aircraft industry. Comparing it to the first Top Gun, there are some differences: The military is now woke and not only consists of white men, but also of other ethnies and women, though they are only allowed in the second row. The sexualised relationship in the first movie is toned down and replaced with family values and also hints of homo erotism between the male characters. The enemys are never shown as in the first movie, you never see their faces, its just briefly mentioned, that this is a nato operation against a nuclear plant - you could also argue that this is an aggressive act of war, not covered by the UN. But politics are not discussed, the military is just a tool - and the heros just work for the hegemonic position of the usa and dont bother committing a war crime. But as the soldiers the viewers are not allowed to think about it, because if you think, you are dead. Thats the main message of the movie.

Tom Cruise is my favorite actor of all time and just based on his amazing track record in cinema, I was probably more then halfway sure that TOP GUN:MAVERICK was a good movie. All of the endless hype and praise is not enough for me to decide if a film is good or not. I've seen unbridled praise for overrated movies before and I'm sure I'll see it again. The last major film that I even liked was Joker from 2019 and that movie is now in my top films and performances of all time. So that's been a lot to live up to in the last 3 years and virtually every major new movie I've seen in the theatre or streaming has left my sorely disappointed. I waited for the general release of Top Gun Maverick and the wait was worth it! The original Top Gun from 1986 is iconic, an entertaining, thrilling testosterone-filled 80s summer action saga with rocking music and a plethora of memorable moments (Mav's serenade to Charlie, Goose's finger, Iceman's teeth bite, the volleyball scene, the fly-bys) and adrenaline-filled aerial combat sequences. But Top Gun is very much a "style over substance" film. This sequel reverses that by building on the rather thin characterization and relationships established in Top Gun and heavily being influenced by mega-star's Tom Cruise's expert acting ability that he's perfected over the last 3 decades. At the time of Top Gun in '86, Cruise became a movie star, but he wasn't taken seriously as an actor. Within 3 years, he received critical praise for Rain Man and got his first Oscar nomination for Born on the Fourth of July. Within the next decade, he would score 2 more Oscar nods for Jerry Maguire (for which he should have won) and Magnolia while jumpstarting the Mission Impossible series in '96 with in my opinion still the best film of the franchise. Within 5 years after Magnolia, Cruise delivered his best performance ever in the masterpiece Collateral, for which he should have won the Best Actor Oscar. Getting overlooked so often probably made Cruise opt to focus mostly on action movies the rest of his career. It's ironic that Cruise has been making MI sequels nonstop for the last 25 years when this film Top Gun Maverick may be better than all of them. Regardless of being passed over for the elusive Oscar prize, Cruise is one of the best actors in Hollywood. Dare I say it, but the insane popularity of this film might just score him his long overdue 4th Oscar nomination. Longshot, but here's hoping.The exceptional sequel opens up with Pete "Maverick" Mitchell (impeccably reprised by Cruise) at his current assignment station somewhere in the Midwest where he is the test pilot for an advanced stealth jet with the ability to push Mach 10. As a result of pushing it too far, the program is shut down, but Mav gets immediate re-assignment as a training instructor back at the Top Gun program in San Diego. The mission commander (excellently played by Jon Hamm doing his classic Don Draper delivery) tasks Mav to train the "best of the best" pilots for a dangerous mission in enemy territory where they must destroy a secret energy cache and they must hit the target to implode the base (pretty much a Star Wars Death Star attack). The movie boasts a cast of young stars in the making playing the mission pilots. The de facto main character among the young guns is Rooster (stalwartly played by Miles Teller). Rooster is Goose's son and Teller looks very much like Anthony Edwards, who was a scene-stealer in the original film. But in this one, the mood is more somber as Rooster is angry with and at constant odds with Mav, but not necessarily for the reason that people think. Of course there's a love story in this as Mav re-connects with the infamous Penny (effervescent Jennifer Connelly), the "Admiral's daughter" that got an early mention in the '86 film. But the absolute best part of the movie was the emotion-filled scene between Mav and Iceman himself (Val Kilmer making a memorable appearance). Cruise and Kilmer really acted superbly in that scene. This is where I feel that this sequel may possibly top the classic original, because the heart in this movie feels more palpable and real due to the history and gravitas that Cruise brings to his role this time. In '86, both Mav and Cruise were cocky stars-in-the-making. In 2022, they are smarter, wiser, world-weary veterans who have mastered their respective crafts. Also, there's all the aerial stuff! Lol Pretty impressive that the actors actually trained to fly jets so these sequences look as authentic as possible. But where Top Gun Maverick succeeds that so many modern movies fail is that it focuses on the heart of the story underneath, so all of the action is just icing on the cake.

The Top Gun has everything you are looking for: engaging, great story, amazing acting, moments of laugh and moments of sadness. Tom Cruise look in inspiration at his age and in love with an example of a "true" man! Bravery all the way!

reviews.review_title: Maybe I saw a different version?
reviews.content: Don't get me wrong this is a perfectly enjoyable film.... record breaking blockbuster... nope.Special effects were great, sound effects spot on. The whole plot, writing, predictability of scenes not so great. I was really looking forward to watching this film especially with not one bad word said about it but for me it was Meh to say the best. Honestly not worth the £20 to go and see and not above any of the original productions from the 2 big streaming services either.This is just my opinion, I'm not a qualified critic just a paying punter and I feel I've been over promised and under delivered. You on the other hand may very well enjoy it way more than me.

reviews.review_title: YES! a PERFECT 10!!! ... finally a movie without all the lecturing.
reviews.content: The sequel revolves around Pete "Maverick" Mitchell being brought back to Top Gun flight school to teach pilots on flying a secret mission to take out a soon to be nuclear base somewhere in a rocky moutainess terrain. The flight scenes are truly amazing, there were moments I was on the edge of my seat. Tom Cruise is pure perfection, he is Maverick personified. That smile, those rugged good looks and that natural talent is electrifying. This man is pushing 60 and is clearly at the top of his game. Bringing in Miles Teller as the son of Goose was genius. The relationship between them is contentious at first but the end result is well worth it. It was awesome to see Val Kilmer again, so touching to see him. That was one of the top moments in the movie. I also loved Jennifer Connlley as Penny, she is always wonderful and her chemistry with Tom Cruise is a great match.This movie was amazing... totally worth the wait. I was 16 years old when I saw the original on the big screen and I have forever been a hard core Tom Cruise fan. The original takes you back to a time where patriotism was celebrated and you knew we loved our country. Ahhh nostalgic good times. Well this film takes you back there too even though it is +35 later, the film takes us to a good place and it felt good to watch. For those 2 hours it was pure goodness. A sigh of relief that I didn't feel lectured about what I should feel or do, I wish every movie could be this refreshing. This is a movie I plan to watch in the theaters a few times. Thank you Top Gun Maverick... for giving us Americans what we have been hungering for!

The man the myth the Scientologist, he's done it again. My boy Miles had a good performance as well. The movie was worth watching in the cinema the sounds were insane. Has good replay value I Will watch again when on streaming services.

It's better than the original and it's rare. Awesome, adrenaline-filled flight sequences. The ultimate summer blockbuster, and with a ton of emotional beats. Everyone is attractive in the San Diego sunset. Tom Cruise is so good in this, and I liked him better in this than the original. He's still the bona fide action hero, but aged with grace. There's a lot of emotional depth in his performance. His chemistry with Jennifer Connelly is great, which is not that common for Tom Cruise lol.The last part of it was not very realistic, even through a lens of a popcorn movie.Embrace it without cynicism and you will enjoy it thoroughly.

reviews.review_title: Worse Then The Original (If that's Possible)
reviews.content: My review is based upon the first 20 minutes of this very poor remake. I did not like the original, except for the excellent sound track) and this version did not even have that. Want great flying scenes? Take a look at 1980's The Final Countdown or 1966's The Blue Max. If tickets were 10 cents I wouldn't spend it on this piece of junk.

Having loved the original Top Gun, this was a must see. A little unrealistic (how does one survive a mach 10 disintegration of a plane without a scratch?) and the plot with Rooster was just so obvious, but the flight scenes were just amazing - enhanced by the fact that the cast really did experience that flying and a year of training. I did wonder why they fired Tomahawks at the airfield and not the SAM sites and why the countermeasures against radar-guided SAMS were flares and not chaff - would have made it so much easier to do the mission - but hey - it would have made a less-exciting film. A thoroughly enjoyable watch.

I am a huge fan of the original top gun movie. I must admit, I did not expect much. Especially watching the previews for the future movies that are coming out. They just do not make good movies anymore.This sequel was everything you want if you're a top gun fan. Besides the fact that there are not many actors that are in it from the original... it's action packed, it has a great storyline and the action scenes are phenomenal.

reviews.review_title: Motivational family action drama - worth every cent
reviews.content: Is Top Gun Maverick worth the hype? Yes. It's one of those movies where there is next to nothing bloodshed, vulgarity and woke nonsense yet takes your breath away. Highly motivational. A fast action drama film. It's a well-made closure to the first Top Gun. You feel relieved how everything turns out.Top Gun Maverick parental guidance - Can be watched with family, kids. Just one off swear word or may be two but right when you are too engrossed in the dramatic action.

reviews.review_title: For my 15 year old fan girl self !
reviews.content: I have been waiting for this movie since 1986 when the first one came out.It exceeded my expectations. Plenty of references to the original without being cheesy .. and introducing new characters and situations that give it a new feel.Its was great seeing Val on the screen again ...One of Tom's best ...

Top Gun: Maverick is just a movie. It's fun and exciting and sad and loud and dumb and brash and outrageous and moving. It's perfectly flawed.Top Gun: Maverick is just a movie in a world where movies try to be so much more. This film will cause other films to be made.I fell like this is the best movie that I've ever seen and I know that it's not. Highly recommend.

reviews.review_title: They don't make like this anymore, this is a truly special movie
reviews.content: This is probably one of the best movie in recent years, I can't remember a movie as good as this since Batman The Dark Night. The dialogue in this movie was incredible and it goes back to old film making where we don't need characters talking every second or explaining the plot to us. The cinematography is incredible with the footage of planes and you can really appreciate this isn't all CGI and that Tom Cruise is actually flying that plane, if you even look at his face in the scene's. The music chosen in this movie conveys all sorts of emotion and makes you really invested in characters and feel the tension. Tom Cruise brings traditional cinema into the present, this movie will belong with the all time greats of cinema. You will show this movie to your sons and daughters and go "they don't make them like this anymore".

reviews.review_title: Emotionally gripping and breathtaking old-school thrill
reviews.content:
Positive:
breathtaking and virtuosic flight scenes (without visual effects!)quick and clear staginggood balance between flight scenes and interpersonal drama / despite character drama a real "male" action filmgood balance between nostalgia/homage and reinventionpowerful images and soundNeutral:
politically neutral, but still military propagandaNegative:
a little too much egomania by Tom Cruise; the film doesn't have much else to offer besides him and the aerial spectacle.

reviews.review_title: A polished sequel to the original, yet too reliant on fan service and modern technology
reviews.content: I didn't like the original Top Gun, I gave it a 5/10. My issues were largely to do with the characters, I found Maverick insufferable and the story was not captivating enough to make up for that perceived shortcoming.I found it odd when this sequel was announced (some 35 yrs after the original) and was surprised to see the strong anticipation from fans. That said, I think this movie did what it set out to do: make a sequel worthy of Top Gun. And even though I personally don't think of that as a high bar, I can appreciate that TG: Maverick is an improvement on the original.Good things: the action, in particular the aerial shots, were particularly great. Great stunts and a few jaw dropping maneuvers sprinkled in. I think Miles Teller is a bit of an idiot, but even so, he's a good casting as Goose's son in this movie. Callsigns in this movie aren't significantly better, but they seem to have a better background now. I especially like the origin of Hangman's nickname and I thought the inscription on his helmet (H_NGM_N with a noose) was a nice touch. By and large, the second half of the film is where the going gets good, and overall, very entertaining.But all these good things don't erase the fact that this film is still overrated, largely for the script and the continued need to make Maverick a larger than life character.Plot points that didn't need to be plot points were quite annoying. Like the film opening on Cruise taking an unsanctioned flight to save the flight program against unmanned drones (definitely not cliched not at all like the first half of Green Lantern). Not a big issue in itself, but when the plot later mentions that they need to run a mission where the parameters require they pull maneuvers hard for humans to withstand and get a mission done within a certain time limit with no room for failures and no casualties, it becomes increasingly unclear why they introduced the concept of drone airships that only served as confusion over why no one thought to use drones, which are almost purpose built for those wildly arbitrary mission parameters. Moreover, the movie sort of brushes over some of the other options they have available, like, idk, maybe a missile strike on the very exposed SAM sites, or 5th gen fighter escorts. Whatever the case, the failure to present other options is something I'm willing to overlook (rule of cool) as long as they don't make an effort to shoot themselves in the foot, which they did by introducing the elements of drones without any tie in.Another issue, larger than life survivability that we're supposed to write off. Surviving a flight control critical failure at Mach 10 and surviving with no issues (sure), surviving a F-14 Crash with no parachute visual, low altitude, and no injuries (sure), multiple ejections with no major aftereffects so we're not dealing with the weight of the Plan B consequences (sure).
