These are things fit for a Mission Impossible film, item's I'd usually be willing to overlook if this weren't a de facto 2 hour recruitment ad for the Navy / Air Force.Character dynamics also were strange. Maverick walks into a town he hasn't been to in 30 years. Immediately rekindles his relationship with Penny (who wasn't even in the original film I'm just finding out, actually this might be acceptable in that case, we don't know the terms they ended on). Unclear what happened between Rooster and Mav, because they seemed to made things up immediately after no large action was taken. Idk, other things like Hangman just being antagonistic for no good reason (he's a poor echo of Iceman).One more thing, the mission itself (staying low, flying through a canyon, firing into a ventilation shaft to stop a WMD with no margin for failure, trusting your instincts instead of a guidance computer/laser targeting) was awfully similar to the Star Wars run. Not the worst thing to happen, but kinda strange that happened)In all, way better than the original, though this had the benefit of modern filming and VFX technology to rely on. A very shaky start with zappy one-liners amidst a larger array of cringe dialogue and a poorly cobbled together plot. Ultimately a decent 2nd half packed with incredible action and relatively strong ending. Top Gun Maverick is what the original Top Gun wishes it were, but don't be fooled, while this action flick has great action, altogether, this is at best, a good movie.

You could call this movie "Tom Cruise: Maverick" and it would not be far from the truth. A lot has been said about the real planes, practical effects, Tom Cruise being the last true super-star etc.But I want to share my ideas about the film. Hear me out.The story or plot is just functional, it is irrelevant in the face of flying airplanes and machismo.There is a token female pilot, other than that, the women work to make Tom look manly. I do not think it will pass "The Bechdel Test". Who cares right?Also, they went with the whole "unseen enemy" thing - there is no enemy, or the enemy is just in our imagination.Finally, the last thing is that the plot hinges on the fact that the enemy has better weapons than the elite US marine air force pilot (whatever is the technically correct term here).If you look beyond these problems however, this is pure cinema. Sights and sounds, cuts and camera. I am sure it will go down in history as one of those films they teach in film school.Masterful!

This movie is why people will continue to watch in cinemas over streaming subscriptions at home. This is my first Tom Cruise movie in a theatre and the only one I've watched from start to end in one sitting. Now it's not because I don't like the Scientologist, but because Action isn't my genre as much. I'll be honest, I had a long day and was pretty tired by when the movie started, things were slow, I hadn't watched or heard of the original Top Gun, hence had zero context, and 15 mins into the movie thought this was going to be a 2-hour long snooze fest. Boy was I wrong. Once the plot was laid and homage was paid to the original, the movie just kept climbing up the roller coaster, hitting a new peak every time. I now have a burning desire to be in a fighter jet or frankly any kind of combat aircraft. (May the Lord grant me this wish.)
Every time a jet came on the screen, the director had me on the edge of my seat. It felt real, I felt entirely invested in the movie and time just flew by. It felt so real that I can't even say what was CGI and what wasn't, to me, who knows zero facts about this movie, I'm going to believe Tom Cruise and the rest are trained pilots. The supporting cast did a fantastic job too. The movie made me feel patriotic and proud and oh, it made me swoon over Tom Cruise. The old man hasn't lost his charm since Jerry Maguire. It was also exciting to see new kinds of action scenes over the car chases, fight scenes, and random missile combat scenes most movies serve.I'm glad I watched this and someday when I have a big enough screen and a great sound system, I'm going to watch this Masterpiece all over again.

Loved love love this movie! The original was amazing! However, this one could be a close contender! Loved the action,music and actors. Never had a dull moment that is for sure! Very well done which many remakes aren't! Highly recommend.

I don't write reviews much, but I don't understand why this movie got such a high rating. It's predictable and Tom Cruise is pretty much the same character in all his movies. The whole premise with Goose's son going from angry at old guy to understanding him has been done in so many other movies. The beach scene is useless except to show everyone's muscles. The "admirals" are generic bureaucrats that could've been played by anyone. The ending action scene was not surprising in the least. Sure some of the flying moves were great, but how many times do we need to see Tom Cruise fly upside down? I get the nostalgia, but man, besides liking the fact that they gave Val Kilmer a scene, it was really disappointing.

reviews.review_title: Best action movie of all time
reviews.content: I'll add in a counter to all the Anti Male, testosterone haters in the comments, suck it. Ur fragile pathetic agenda will never beat the masses. Their shoebox life styles can't comprehend that alpha males work in the armed forces and get sht done. Ain't no room for snowflakes here. The aerial stunts will never be topped and the fact they used as little cgi as possible gives this movie the GOAT status, Tom Cruise is keeping movie magic alive with these realistic shots and stunts. Brilliant.

Every bit as exciting, thrilling and adventurous as the original. I was so excited to hear that this movie was coming out. But I was worried that it would be tainted to today's politics. Which thankfully it was not, it actually holds up to today's standards as a stand alone movie. Great story, great characters, great ending.

reviews.review_title: The True Definition of a 10 out of 10 Movie
reviews.content: In Top Gun Maverick, everything is literally perfect. The performances, story, emotional weight, sound effects, cinematography, nostalgic soundtrack, direction, screenplay, pacing, happy ending, and production value all deserve 10 out of 10, doubtlessly.Also, what is great about this movie is that it lets us sympathize not only with Maverick, but also with the pilots whom he trains and the character of the four-star Admiral Tom "Iceman" Kazansky who is ill, especially when the person knows that the actor who plays this character (Val Kilmer) is also ill. Also, this movie shows us how dangerous, risky, and challenging the career of a fighter pilot is.Concerning the flaws, to be honest, I can't find any flaw in this movie. From my point of view, this movie is the movie that deserves to be called "perfect". So when it comes to the score, I gladly give Top Gun Maverick 10 out of 10.

reviews.review_title: An Overhyped Sequel Of Vastly Inferior Content Compared To Its Predecessor of 36 Years Ago!
reviews.content: People are so easily swayed with advertisement releases of hyped up propaganda promising much; the main reason we have so many Sheeple' these days, but offering far less than promised!I honestly found this incredibly dull and I was totally disappointed with the aerial scenes...of which so much had been promised.The plot of this was not original; I believe it was based upon the real life Israeli attack on a nuclear installation from a few years back. By the time Cruise was sent back to the Top Gun school I was already quite bored with the goings on. The mission lead up of training etc was so dreary, dull and forgetful that I had to force myself to watch the film in its entirety.I watched an Asian air force fighter pilot action film a month or so back and, it had some of the best aerial scenes and action capture since the 1968 Battle of Britain film.I am in awe as to why a great many people think that Cruise is a top notch actor. He is not, but he is seemingly clever enough to co star with people who are and thus make him look good. His action films are all special FX driven with CGI etc and his films as Jack Reacher are a joke, as the Jack of the books is 6 feet 5 inches in height and Cruise is what?....5ft 7 or 8 inches.Not worth the 36 year wait but the good news is that he won't be doing a third as he is way past the age barrier for a fighter pilot; a bit of welcome blessed relief for those who are in agreement with my thoughts on this drivel! 😄

A well made sequel in which it surpasses its predecessor . Top Gun 1986 was a commercial hit , eventhough it had weak plot and was not much engaging . But this time it's different , in this movie right from first movie had proper goal and traveled towards the goal . Plot was pretty simple a asusual Team on mission story , but way they build tense around the mission by showing its difficulties makes more intresting . Joseph Kosinski's as director done a spectacular job . Cast wise each and every cast gave their best . Tom Cruise doing this role after 36 years delivered marvelous performance . Miles Teller playing as Roose ( son of Goose character in Top Gun ) was literally show stealer . Jennifer Connelly done her part well . Relationship between Roose and Maverick was emotional . Each and every action sequence with flight jet was very well made , especially last 30mins literally gave me a seat edge experience . Only drawback I felt was romance track . They missed to explain the absence of Charlie's Character . Overall a must watch movie . PLEASE DON'T MISS IT TO WATCH IT ON BIG SCREEN .

reviews.review_title: Glad to see Hollywood making great movies again
reviews.content: I originally saw the original Top Gun in 1986. It was a fun but cheesy movie.Not this time though. Top Gun Maverick was DEFINITELY worth the wait and the price of admission. Tom is back again as LT Pete Mitchell along with a new crew of pilots.The flight scenes are breathtaking. And the new pilots nail their characters personalities and add so much to this masterpiece.Do yourself a favor and go see this movie at the theaters as home viewing will NOT do it justice.Also, I thought the intro from Tom was 100% class.

The original Top Gun was a classic, one of those pieces of movie magic from the 80's, so coming into the sequel I had a lot of reservations about how good it was actually going to be.Could it capture the same magic that the original managed?The answer is a phenomenal YES ! Everything about Top Gun Maverick was sensational, from the jaw dropping flight sequences, to the brilliant pacing, the emotional connection between the past and the present through characters like Iceman and Rooster.I'm not ashamed to admit that I had a tear in my eye towards the end of the movie when Maverick and Rooster embraced on the deck of the ship, and that's exactly what good movies are supposed to do!! Draw you in and make you emotionally invested, Top Gun Maverick did a superb job at hitting the feels.This is a spoiler free review, so if you are reading this and haven't yet seen this piece of cinema gold, go right ahead and book your tickets !! What are you waiting for.

Holy cow, this movie should be the bechmark for every modern sequel made after a classic.The music, the vibe, the throwbacks, why change a winning formula? This movie doesnt, and it works!The last 45 minutes of this movie gave me permanent goosebumps, fantastic to see real aircrafts in real dogfights, it beats the hell out of greenscreen scenes that too many movies are made of!Only two things i dont give 10 stars, the whole lovestory-thing with tom Cruise and Jennifer connoly doesnt add anything to the movie and is just a bit typical Hollywood romancejibberish.. the second thing is the opening scene when maverick ejects from an aircraft doing mach 10 and surviving.. i mean, Come on! Imagine a body ejecting into the air resistance of mach 10 without getting hurt..Still the greatest sequel ive seen, Even better than top gun!

Obsolete F14 tomcat found conveniently on foreign base which protagonist uses to take out not one but two new state of the art enemy fighters!Add that Cruises character - a relic - would have been retired from active service years before!As I said: total bloody nonsense which takes nostalgia gullibility to new levels of ridiculousness imo.Who came up with this minimum 600 character review nonsense as people invariably will just write a load of jibberish in order to meet the criteria - as I am now,doing to get around this ludicrous arbitrary requirement.Personally, Ive lost my loving feeling for top gun. But then I've never been much of a tom cruise fan.

reviews.review_title: Together with T2 the best sequel ever!
reviews.content: And at the same time the best Tom Cruise movie so far. I do not really care what he believes in in his private time. He is the cinema God and we should all believe in him! He proves time after time the passion for true action cinema and reality of stunts and this movie tops all before it by a mile. Must see. Thank you Tom, you are one of the all time Greats.
The Intro was worth the Ticket price. Goosebumps everywhere. Today, the Navy calls it Fighter Weapons School..... the flyers call it:TOP GUN.I don't think I've seen such a good sequel before.

We are not talking about a masterpiece, but certainly a well done sequel. The plot is quite obvious, even if until the very end it makes you remain in suspense, for example for the fate that Maverick and Rooster could have, that in the end they will both get a ransom on the other and save each other .Some references to the first film are a must, and they are also put with the right dose. Therefore a basic plot, which however is overshadowed by a work of mistral direction, with jet scenes (F-14,F-35, ...) made without CGI, with an apt photograph. Great work by Kosinski, and great courage by Tom Cruise and the other actors. Beautiful working moments surrounded by moments of leisure and love. Not bad.

Truly a pleasure to watch. Good storyline, great acting and great background music as well. It's one of the few well made movies in recent times that I enjoyed watching in the theatre and didn't realise how the time flew by.

Tom Cruise returns as the " Maverick " in this sequel after over twenty years it marks a record of cinematic feet in propelling this piece as it has been most anticipated. The rivalry of the best as earlier seen in the prequel by Iceman ( Val Kilmer ) Pete " Maverick " Mitchell is been played by a new set of " kids " played by new characters they are nurtured under the tutelage of Maverick.Long lost love is found again this could be split into two Maverick's love for flying and finding his former love. The meeting between Maverick and Iceman is an emotional meeting, the pain is real as we notice Val Kilmer's inability to deliver his lines because of his speech impediment but he pulls through.Following the same direction cum cinematography as applied by the late Director Tony Scott we are been reminded of his classic work. And when the sun comes sun we see " In memory of Tony Scott " once again our emotions are been touched. Joseph Kosinski direction may be fascinating but not original as earlier stated it is a derivative of Tony Scott. The stunt coordination excellently fantastic, this movie is a really great score for Producer Jerry Bruckheimer.Most energy in this film is mostly in the jets as they glide in the sky, will they be caught by enemy power or not ? That's what causes tensions in our hearts but as all good stories the heroes must always prevail. So come and join this ride of wide entertainment.

reviews.review_title: Tom strikes again...his sequels R better than OG.
reviews.content: Wow...(Axel F & TG Anthem) Harold Faltermeyer (FootLoose & Danger Zone) Kenny Loggins & Hans Zimmer R bak...cruising with Tom; the impossible is possible...wow the sound effects R just amazing...but TBH, the new LG soundtrack, didn't take my breath away... in remembrance of the Greatest Genius Tony Scott (bro of the legendary Sir Ridley Scott).... Tom Cruise is Phenomenal...a Living Legend...can't wait 2c his new MI.

reviews.review_title: As Good a Top Gun film as they could have pulled off!
reviews.content: A strong sequel 36 years after the original. Bigger, Bolder, faster!The film opens up in the same manner as the originally with an 80s soundtrack blasting through. The opening scroll explains what 'Top Gun' is at which point you'll be forgiven for thinking they've put on the original film.From there on out it's a perfect mix of old and new. Whilst the story introduces a bunch of new characters and uses a familiar story beat from the original, it separates itself from the from the likes of The Force Awaken and Jurassic World as it doesn't rely on the previous story beats to drive the central narrative nor does it try to beat down previous characters just to push the new ones forward.The story continues the journey of Pete 'Maverick' Mitchell, 36 years later, giving you some insight on how's he's dealt with the repercussion of the original 'Top Gun' and things that have and haven't happened since!After receiving a call from an old friend, he's forced to confront all of this again. This, alongside the introduction of a particular character, played excellently by Miles Teller, adds emotional weight to Top Gun - Maverick and is nicely balanced amongst the action.Speaking of action, Top Gun Maverick has a lot of it and it's good. There is only so much you can do with with these planes but the nature of the training/mission really helped to notch up the intensity during the flying scenes. This is another check in the W column for Cruise as he continues to prove himself as one of the last real actions stars in Hollywood.It's not all perfect, the romantic elements didn't have much time to develop and the focus on Maverick meant that we didn't get an in depth look at many of the new characters but it was a worthwhile sacrifice.

Tom Cruise holds something rare that was lost many years ago in the film industry - the winning formula of real great blockbusters, and the main reason is that he brings everything he's got from within himself, you feel it in every single scene, it's not fake, it can't be staged, it's pure. The older he gets, the better he gets as well as his films. Cruise brings magic to the screen, an impossible mission only he can execute, and boy he does. The plot simple, but the execution is outstanding. This movie corresponds with the original from 1986 in many levels and in such a perfect way that it's like a miracle, you watch it, you see it, but it's almost hard to believe how good it's done. I wish there were movies like that but I doubt it, my only comfort is that as long as Cruise makes movies the magic will continue (so I'm looking foreword to his next MI projects). If you lived in the 80s and watched the original, it will also bring you back in time and back, which is another miracle, making this movie a masterpiece. 10/10, if I could make it 11/10 I would.

reviews.review_title: It's a bloody shame if you didn't watch this in a theatre
reviews.content: Everything was blockbuster. Storyline, music, cinematography, epic scenes, action, romance.. and what not.Well, can't encourage you enough to sing top gun anthem one more time.

This is a fun sequel with all of the original elements either faithfully reproduced or (usually) improved upon. The action is better, the story, too. I genuinely missed Kelly McGillis, and would have liked to have seen her acknowleged at least, and I think it was cowardly and a bit comical to not name the enemy country (presumably to keep China, Russia, and/or Iran happy and those markets in play) but it was a fun movie, a good movie, and if you enjoyed the first one you'll probably love this one.

A blockbuster that manages to reach many age groups, many different tastes and opinions from critics but always with unanimity of its quality . We are in a film that touches us, puts us in a big crowd, makes us hold the couch and put on our seat belts.We have a romance until cliché , but who has the personality of maverick ( tom Cruise ) in which after venturing into his whole life and even continuing with that impetus, he thinks about forming a family. A very well and slightly placed comic relief, usually in maverick responses in his sarcasm or when he runs out the window and comes face to face with Penny's daughter ( jheniffer connelly ), or when a boy answers maverick's question saying he is on Earth after ejecting himself .The direction very well placed, already attracting us close to maverick and seeing his personality in a stunning sequence, quick editing when needed An absurdly beautiful photograph of takes in Golden hour of the desire to see several times.Round script even with the twist plot being barely predictable we have a mind-boggling experience so get ready that it will be two hours flying!

reviews.review_title: What is happening to the movie business?
reviews.content: Top Gun Maverick had so much potential, but I came home with a pounding headache from all the terrible cliches, sappiness, thin plot, and annoying melodrama. If anyone in the movie business cares anymore, please stop making crap and charging $20 a ticket for it. The only good parts were the actual action. But when the mission suceeded in the third act, it just fell into trite formula. And where was a new musical score? And why bring back the 1980's music in 2022? Didnt they budget for this issue? I digresss.

Went because my girlfriend made me.Stayed because the movie was phenomenal.I had no interest in watching this movie but my goodness I'm glad I did because it's PHENOMENAL.Not going to spoil anything but this movie is a must see but make sure you watch the 1st Top Gun before you go see this new one!!

reviews.review_title: The Only Film to Make my Most Anticipated Films of The Year List Three Times
reviews.content: This was definitely worth the wait. In my opinion this surpassed the original Top Gun. The flight sequences are incredible, I saw this in IMAX and it really enhanced the experience. Tom Cruise is as usual great and clearly had so much passion for this project. It could've easily just been a cheap nostalgia-bait cash grab, but it wasn't. It had emotion and heart. My only issue with the film was Jennifer Connelly's character. She was nothing but a bland love interest. Regardless this film is a great example of how to do a sequel and is without a doubt one of the best films of the year so far.

reviews.review_title: The movie we have been waiting for
reviews.content: Instant classic. I have not been to a big-budget movie in years where I could just sit down and enjoy the show without feeling like I was being talked down to. This movie shows diversity in an authentic way that lets the viewer feel like they are a part of the great things that come with change, without talking down to you and calling you deplorable for not being even MORE progressive.All that aside, it is an outstanding movie. Well-written, terrific characters, and maybe the best action in a movie, ever. It has the perfect blend of nostalgia and modern themes that come together to make a damn near perfect movie.A true summer blockbuster that we have waited for and wanted for so long.EDIT: After reading several of the negative reviews, I love this movie even more. Comments like "It's cheesy and boomers will like it because of its happy ending and all that sucks." I just want to say...thanks. Yes, that is exactly why we like it. We enjoy...joy. Something the current generation has not yet embraced. They think the more causes they support and the angrier they are means more social media clout. We don't live for clout. We live for the joy of living. May you all understand that someday.

This movie pulls on your heart strings! It was an Emotional, action packed roller coaster. Without any spoilers I suggest that you watch "Val" Val Kilmer's bio documentary before seeing this. Well made sequel! Thanks Tom, you nailed it sir!!!

reviews.review_title: Top gun has finally reached the airfield
reviews.content: Tom is back as maverick. The filming is the same as the original. The story takes place after goose died . But the legacy will keep going and top gun will continue his life training rooster to be the best air force trainer after he dies . I hope they'res a top gun 3 .Val Kilmer it's great to have him back. Jennifer was the right woman for this movie . I have a feeling this movie is gonna reach the box office.

Action packed, logical action packed, I didn't notice no plot holes
This bangeeed
Like they got all the emotions just right, direction was awesome, nothing felt out of place.Compared to the top gun which is a great movie, this sequel is just dead on target I'm going again to see it 100%;
Unless you got a home theater go see it in the Theaters, it's going to be a completely different experience.

reviews.review_title: An action movie that exceeded expectations
reviews.content: I was thoroughly impressed by this movie because it never slowed down for even a second. The emotional parts were moving, the funny parts made me laugh, and the action kept me on the edge of my seat.Watching this movie in theaters was the best part of the experience because the surround sound was so exciting.A lot of parts at the end were way too predictable though so that docked it a point but I loved it still!

First movie I enjoyed in the cinemas for a long time. I give it a 10, not because it is the best movie I have ever seen but I really liked it. Predictable? Yes! But proper entertainement and two hours of good fun.

That is how you make a sequel. Respect the original characters. Respect the original story. Respect the fans. Do not push your agenda into the movie.Kick ass action. Great soundtrack. A manly man movie.Thank you Tom Cruise and crew for making this movie, we desperately needed it after so many disappointing movies and TV shows lately.9/10.

reviews.review_title: Brilliant, best viewed in a cinema
reviews.content: I'm glad they resisted the temptation to put the film straight to on demand during covid, as this film is amazing and best viewed at the cinema, in my opinion this is just as good if not better than the original.

This movie is an absolute masterpiece. Beginning to end, it was perfectly captured and left the whole cinema on the edge of their seats.My partner and I will be in every bit of a rush to go watch this for a second time; and I urge you if you haven't already, to go watch it!

reviews.review_title: I expected just fun not an action masterpiece
reviews.content: I am 39, i loved the original as a fun manly cool movie, this film is an experience! I watched in an average cinema and the sound edition was so great that the chairs were shaking every time a plane was around... You might dislike Tom, but do not make the mistake of missing out this one, is an excellent film, there is not a single thing i would change.Best action in years, drama, fun, everything well done, last 30 minutes i couldnt move and it felt like the movie was one hour, great pace, two pop corns can testify that. Enjoy!

This movie was amazing. I loved this movie and the script
It had very strong content. Tom Cruise is a man of difficult times.One of the best movies I have seen. I hope to see more games from Tom. I have seen many movies but this movie shows something else. One: being a team, being strong, acting, motivation, spirit in teamwork. The leader of the group did a great job and made a great choice. Penny turned out well and I really liked what she did
Disrespect does not go unanswered. Emelia coped very well
He trusted his teammate and it ended up being an amazing movie for me.I am very grateful to the producer of the film
I am from Iran.

reviews.review_title: If you can work out the entire plot of a movie within the first 5 minutes is that necessarily a problem? Top Gun Maverick lays down a pretty good argument that it's not
reviews.content: If you can work out the entire plot of a movie within the first 5 minutes is that necessarily a problem? Top Gun Maverick lays down a pretty good argument that it's not. The main reason for watching is obviously thje electrifying flight sequences which may be the greatest ever put to film due to choreography, editing and actors actually in the seats, which allow you to genuinely follow the flights instead of standing witness to meaningly jump-cuts. However Maverick also has its tender moments especially the relationship between Maverick and Rooster (Teller, son of Goose) which grounds the film and fills in the emotional beats throughout which were only present in the 3rd act of the original. Cruise rightfully is getting many plaudits for this continued dedication to the role of action star as he approaches 60s but Teller really shines here and this may be the movie which pushes him into the true superstardom which anyone who has seen Whiplash knows he has been destined for for almost a decade. This movie is a rollercoaster, you know it'll be safe and where you'll end up but it's exhillerating if you get onboard and allow yourself to be taken for a ride.

What an amazing movie. Don't usually pen down reviews. But I had to for this. I watched the first part (1986) out of curiosity before 2 hours going to the cinema to watch this newest edition. Have to say I was in awe of this movie. The visuals and everything is just stunning and beautiful. One of the best movies I have watched this year for sure.

reviews.review_title: Tom Cruise's love letter to Cinema
reviews.content: "Top Gun: Maverick" is nothing short of an INSTANT cult classic and a much-needed cultural phenomenon for the modern cynical age!While the trailer looked surprisingly impressive, Tom Cruise in a movie about an ageing jet pilot didn't exactly scream relevance. Boy was I wrong! This is not a competently made cash-grabber, "Top Gun: Maverick" is what happens when people who love what they do put their heads together to try and make a great movie for the audience.The last time a movie made me leave the cinema in SUCH GLEE was way back in 2012 when "The Avengers" took their deserved center stage. I can only conclude that (the living icon) Tom Cruise, (the always on-point) McQ, and the (never again) underrated Joseph Kosinski have MASTERFULLY HACKED into the collective subconscious and gave the world EXACTLY what we didn't know we so desperately NEEDED.The entire cast and crew achieved the impossible and not only made ONE OF THE BEST SEQUELS EVER (!), but the movie itself is a LIVING EXAMPLE of everything that we have been missing in movies for the last 10-15 years: viscerally real practical effects; a delightful throwback into simpler, saner times; and unapologetic fun.Hollywood will undoubtedly take notice, but only a handful of smart copycats will fully comprehend that this movies's magic formula is ANYTHING BUT EASY. "Top Gun: Maverick" is so darn good PRECISELY because it was NOT easy to make, because the cast and crew had to invest real-life sweat, blood, and perhaps even tears to bring it to life, because it doesn't pander to the audience.It looks like the effort will be rewarded as Tom Cruise's love letter to cinema is on track to become one of the biggest box office blockbusters of all time. I couldn't be happier!Yes, the movie that had no right to be very good turned out to be phenomenal. I just might revisit the local cinema.

In an age where the Woke mind virus has polluted and destroyed so many franchises this could be an important cultural moment. The sucsess at the box office suggests that.Brilliant story respecting the original, great cinematography, and an all round fantastic piece of non preaching pure entertainment. Don't think, just see it.

reviews.review_title: One of the most perfect films
reviews.content: Imagine an emotional callback movie (like Spider-Man No Way Home) that also have Blockbuster entertainment (like Avengers Endgame, Inception), while also having a cinematic appeal of the highest quality (like 1917, Dune, Dunkirk, Inception) and edge of the seat thrill and action (like MI, John Wick, James Bond, Jason Bourne, Inception)... Now add an aging superstar willing to fly actual fighter jets for realism... and you get TOP GUN: MAVERICK.It's one of the most PERFECT films of all time (like Back to the Future, Inception, The Dark Knight, Inglourious Basterds, etc.)Top Gun: Maverick (2022 movie) is a GREAT film for various number of reasons including the Action, Irony ("your kind is heading towards extinction"), Realism, Message, Stunts, Dedication, Emotions ("it's time to let go") and saving old style Hollywood cinema ("Not today").All the above things may divert one's attention to assume that it's being loved for wrong reasons like Spider-Man No Way Home, but don't let this divert you as well. It is ridiculously good despite all that and being entertaining. It is indeed one of the most original movies while also being thrilling, entertaining, engaging at same time.It's third Tom Cruise movie of this sort after Minority Report (2002) and Edge of Tomorrow (2014), which may not have anything wrong with it at all. Like a video game, with being something more realistic, entertaining, complex and original.

Absolutely stunning camera work. The ability to really experience what pilots go through was breathtaking. I wish i could have watched this on IMAX.The story was pretty good. The acting and production was great. Definitely a blu-ray buy and rewatch!

reviews.review_title: The force remains strong in this one.
reviews.content: Top Gun: Maverick is essentially an unashamed Cruise ego-trip where the 80s icon gets unfrozen from the preserved state his character seems to have remained in - only to outdo all the youngsters and somewhat revitalise cinema in the bargain.Cinema goers in the 80s were spoilt for choice when it came to great films, such that, for myself at least, the original 'Top Gun' wouldn't even feature in my top 100 movies from that era. I've never been a fan of Cruise, the manic stare and slightly psychotic grin are suggestive of a man who is trying too hard, but it can't be denied that his determination to succeed have resulted in some memorable movie roles and he doesn't seem to be slowing down with age.The action sequences are well handled - they're over-the-top, sure, but that's what we'd expect. The story is more or less non-existent and the main mission bears an uncanny resemblance to the original attack on the Death Star from Star Wars, including some faceless enemies, multiple turrets, a long gulley attack run and a seemingly impossible shot. (Although a little too young in 1977, maybe Cruise feels he should've been cast as Skywalker? Not something I'd want to ponder on for too long. Having said that, I think he might have made a better stab at the remakes.)I couldn't remember much from the original movie - so the 'emotional' bits where Maverick meets the old crew didn't mean a lot to me, plus you couldn't help wondering why he hadn't bumped into them before (if they meant that much to him).It's pretty much all surface, but worth watching for those action scenes alone and if you're a Cruise fan, or into homo-eroticism in general, you do get to see him play beach volleyball with the boys.

reviews.review_title: If you don't like this, you don't like action movies
reviews.content: Stunning movie. Simultaneously manages to be a classic blockbuster in an honest-to-goodness old-school sense and yet breaks new ground in terms of visuals and thrills. You can't really improve on the concept of special effects which actually aren't effects at all. The flight sequences are breathtaking and are worth the price of admission alone. Add in a satisfying plot which leaves no emotional stone unturned, successfully addressing all the baggage of the first film, and you have, quite literally I think, the perfect sequel. I can't think of a better one to any movie I've ever seen. May have to see it twice...

My wife and I watched the original Top Gun for the first time this week. The hype around Maverick and the trailers really intrigued me, but I didn't want to see it until I had seen the first one. I have to say, I wasn't all that impressed with the first Top Gun. It was a bit cheesy and hard to follow in my opinion. However, Top Gun: Maverick is an awesome movie! It was much easier to follow than the first one and had so many more intense scenes. I was on the edge of my seat! Usually sequels don't supersede the first installment in a series, but Maverick easily surpasses the first one. It's a must watch!

First of all, I really appreciated the fact that they didn't try to indoctrinate the audience with left wing some propaganda. I'm assuming they understood that their audience would be 45+ year old white males and didn't want us walking out of the theater. The movie did a good job of ENTERTAINING the audience which is what we pay for!!! The plot was realistic while sticking to the typical high drama of most Hollywood movies. I would definitely recommend watching this high quality film in the movie theater as a normal tv screen will not do it justice. Just as in the movie Midway, there is just too much action in the skies not to see this on the big screen.

Go see it. GO SEE IT! You will not be sorry. Such a masterpiece, everything was done perfectly and emotionally. It's definitely action packed and has a sense of humor, people will get it!Highly recommended! **** stars!

reviews.review_title: A great sequel to an iconic classic.
reviews.content: Amazing. Top Gun: Maverick builds on everything that made Top Gun great and delivers an immersive and riveting experience.Top Gun is a classic movie for the ages. Filled with amazing fighter sequences, bombastic characters and a burgeoning romance.Top Gun: Maverick takes all these elements and builds on them in a new and fresh take on the TOPGUN program and the Top Gun film formula.There's incredible, load, roaring jets dogfighting on the big screen. There's a love interest for our hero. There's that iconic soundtrack containing tracks like Danger Zone and yes, there's a "volleyball" scene too.Top Gun: Maverick is simply a must-see.

reviews.review_title: Was as good, if not better than the original....
reviews.content: Finally a decent movie. Seen some rubbish lately. This is a proper red blooded man film film (like they used to be) - no woke nonsense - or not that was shoved in your face anyway. Even the wife enjoyed it - probably for the eye candy. I would go as far as saying it was probably better than the original. The fact that Tom Cruise said no to CGI makes the scenes more believable.

An absolutely amazing sequel especially considering it's been 30 years AND it was far better than the original. The story line was much more clear cut and the action was exceptionally better. Teller and Cruise crushed it but I will say my only con was literally every other actor who played a pilot was bad. Great movie though.

reviews.review_title: This felt amazing to watch, ive missed this feeling.
reviews.content: I saw this last night and had to get some thoughts down as i walked out as the cinema i was buzzing and i haven't had that feeling in years.It was wonderful to sit and enjoy a film that wasn't trying to force some political agenda down my throat.They have created a wonderful story, not ruined the legacy Characters at all while still introducing new ones that all bring value to the story. I felt invested in them all, yes even Hangman!It honored the original but still felt fresh, it just wanted to entertain and it exceeded expectations.The appearance of Val Kilmer was very touching regardless of his IRL illness, it was very moving.Thank you so much to the writers and rest of the team for getting this film out to us with none of the nonsense we are forced to watch these days.I can see me watching it in decades time like i have watched the original many times.

reviews.review_title: The need for speed - amazing stunts with fighter jets at high-speed
reviews.content: Growing up with Top Gun, the music and the aura, this movie throws you back into this spirit. This film does its best to recreate the jingoistic feel of that 1980s classic, albeit without everyone sweating bullets or the Berlin song "Take My Breath Away".Pete "Maverick" Mitchell (Tom Cruise) is ordered back to Top Gun upon the request of his former teammate and wingman, and now commander of the U. S. Pacific fleet, Tom "Icemen" Kazansky (a starkly diminished Val Kilmer). Maverick's task is to train the best fighter pilots of the US Navy for an urgent mission to destroy a nuclear power facility of an enemy nation. Among those young pilots is Bradley "Rooster" Bradshaw (a bullheaded Miles Teller), the son of Pete's best friend and co-pilot Nick "Goose" Bradshaw in the original. Their relationship is more than complicated and one of the underlying plots following us throughout this action-loaded movie, with incredible highspeed stunts with F-18 Fighter jets.The crowd of young pilots has a similar dynamic to the team of Top Gun, with the rivalry between "Hangman" (Glen Powell) and "Rooster". Also, the modern age is reflected in the Navy, with the female fighter pilot Natasha "Phoenix" Trace (Monica Barbaro) who is a bad-ass Top Gun cadet. Overall, this movie is great to watch on the big screen, loaded with stunts and action! A must-see of 2022 for everyone who likes a little thrill and action. The perfect movie for the Memorial Day weekend.

reviews.review_title: Seen twice in cinemas. Action and story line felt.
reviews.content: Absolutely fantastic. The story line, the filming, the action, the realism of how close you feel to the action and emotion. I walked away feeling great and not inadequate many movies achieve.

reviews.review_title: As good... or BETTER... than the original
reviews.content: Back in the 80's Top Gun was HUGE. Add to that 3 decades later, and Top Gun is a legendary movie. The chances of any sequel topping Top Gun were slim to none. Well, I am pleased to admit that Top Gun Maverick DID top Top Gun.A fantastic film all around. The casting, dialogue, the story, and wow, the flight sequences are all extremely well done. Tom Cruise, i salute your awesomeness!

Loved it. Lots of homage to the first movie. Simple straightforward no bulls**t storyline. But the aerial jet scenes are outstanding..........no CGI flight scenes, absolutely spoiled....wow!! Acting is great. Big time impressed with the guy playing gooses' son, we'll be seeing a lot more of him. Very well put together movie. Cast must have enjoyed making this. Massive respect to Cruise, he helped deliver a thoroughly enjoyable return to Top Gun, my inner child and older self was blown away. My head was spinning leaving the cinema, action scenes were that real and intense. Definitely will have to watch again. A real treat!

Sequels are rarely this good. Seamlessly blending nostalgia into a visually impressive and genuinely engrossing action film. The story, acting and script all succeed in delivering a modern day Top Gun film which will appeal to all ages.Not much to fault with this film and even if you've not seen the first one, you should still enjoy this.

Theres something so nice about a sequal thats been so many years and yet still maintains the charm that the original movie had. You could say that its probably not as great as the original but it still had the same great songs, awesome vehicles and othes that are nice to look at. There is some new cast up this time around following cruise and kimore. A new love interest jennifer connely is here and its always lovely to see her in films. We also have ed harris, john hamm and miles teller as one of the new recruits to mavericks training program. They get off to a rocky start but after understanding who he is they are alright. So overall it was a great action packed sequal that had a lot of heart but was sad aswell.

reviews.review_title: What an action movie is supposed to be.
reviews.content:
Simple but very well done.You can never tell what's CGI and what's real, the action is breathtaking. Great characters, even better cinematography and amazing score.--Mild Spoiler--
It was all good but, doesn't it feel like the first Star Wars?

reviews.review_title: This was the blockbuster to kick offf
reviews.content: So good! Amazing references to the first movie . Wow just wow. Definitely movie theater worthy.Great new story . Miles teller as Goose's kid amazing.Wow just wow. Tom cruise bravo.

reviews.review_title: Wow/ excellent and made for us
reviews.content: Tom Cruise is the last great movie star - and started off by telling us he made this for us. It shows in how well made and great sequel with fresh homages to the previous film while sticking to a good loud action packed fun popcorn movie - a must see on a huge screen with great sound. Saw at our local theater on a 70ft screen in 4K with Dolby sound- heard IMAX is great too. My kids also liked it -

It's very possible this movie is better than the original. Tom Cruise is one of the last few true superstars in Hollywood. His energy, passion and charisma shine in this film. I don't believe another actor can bring all of those things to the degree that he can.It's refreshing to see a movie without the typical woke garbage that Hollywood normally produces. Maybe they can learn and make more movies like this.Looking forward to watching this again!

reviews.review_title: Great Tom Cruise movie in every aspect 9/10
reviews.content: Worth watching IMAX screen. Totally worthEach and every Navy sequence with fighter Jets with that adrenaline Rush. And Tom Cruise flying all the fighter jet is what i call pleasure to eyes and ears. At the age of 60 Tom Cruise is as fit as ever can be. He is F*ing insane. Who does those action scene at that age!!!It's pure out an out 80's style action movie with Brilliant Cinematography and Direction.How they installed multiple IMAX camera on Fighter jets while shooting that blows my mind.I grew up watching almost all Tom Cruise movies till date. I must say each and every year his movies been escalating to pure quality of work. I think he is the only Actor who is a Star as well. He is one of those legendary actors who is too dedicated to his work.Coming to supporting caste, Miles Teller, Jennifer Connelly, Jon Hamm were great. Other supporting cast were not that impacting characters. May be this is the only thing i think needs improvement. Rest of everything were Literally great. Can't ask any more.Final act (30-40 Min. Of the movie) Is pure 100% mind blowing adrenaline rush action sequences.Story wise, its the simple 80's movie story line which we miss now days.By the way all the action sequence in Fighter jet are real. No green screen or Blue screen were used unlike Marvel movies.
Not a perfect movie but it will get you pumped. My family walked out the theater talking over each other describing their favorite parts. Can't wait to see this one again.
Didn't Luke do this many years ago? Where's the imagination gone? This was just basically another mission very difficult but obviously not impossible.

reviews.review_title: I feel the need for speed!
reviews.content: This was a flat out adrenaline rush packed with nostalgia and a lot of new stuff as well. Good, story, good music, fast planes, it had everything the original had and tied up some loose ends. I was worried about Val Kilmers role and how they would make that work, but they nailed it perfectly and very respectfully.

reviews.review_title: AN OLDIE BUT STILL A GOODIE!!
reviews.content: One of the rules of screenwriting is "Something old but in a New Way!"This is something old done in the same old way. But it's still a great movie!I watched this movie in an actual theater - the first time I've been to one since before the outbreak of the COVID pandemic here in the United States. Because it was "Top Gun" my wife & I splurged on luxury cushioned reclinin seats. In preparation, we rewatched the first "Top Gun" movie.This was MUCH MORE of the SAME - but perhaps a TIGHTER FOCUS as Maverick and his hand-picked crew were training for an actual real-time war mission fraught with dangers at every turn: fifth generation enemy fighters, scads of air defense missiles; an almost unapproachable target.The fighters taking off & landing on American carriers are ALWAYS THRILLING! As were the mock dogfight and real dogfight scenes.And yet through it all I was certain Maverick wasn't going to make it back. And I was happy, VERY HAPPY, when he did.EVERYONE LOVES & DESERVES A HAPPY MOVIE ENDING THESE DAYS!Especially when we're still being hammered by COVID, along with a new real war, and an economic downturn.I have to admit I found the scenes with Val Kilmer a bit depressing. I know why he was included in the movie - after all, he was the Iceman. But I still found it depressing.This is another movie I will add to my permanent collection. And I'll enjoy watching it over & over again.LONG LIVE MAVERICK!

I totally agree with some of the previous comments and reviews. This is one of rare feats where the sequel surpasses the original (The Godfather 2, Terminator 2, Aliens etc). For all those 40-50 something year old fans who grew up watching the original waiting for a decent sequel well here it is and it's SUPERB. In my view the movie has been well worth the wait as Tom Cruise has gone all out pushing himself and his team to the next level. Rather than rely on lame CGI like other movies (eg MARVEL) Mr Cruise has actual shots of fighter jets and superb aerial scenes with the actors themselves flying those jets, like no other movie.The makers have also kept very true to and paid homage to the original with the opening titles, the background music, the Danger Zone song and bringing back certain characters from the original. It also kind of has an 80s feel despite being set in modern times.The movie is surprisingly (for a commercial blockbuster) very well acted and has a good star cast. Although the story is very simple it's not as cheesy as the original and has a fantastic build up. The last 20 minutes or so are simply breathtaking. I have no idea how they shot those scenes but I can't wait for the behind the scenes/ making of documentary.In a nutshell the makers have made this movie FOR THE AUDIENCE and have kept in mind their fan base and not focused in on just cashing in on the Top Gun name / legacy. This is a worthy sequel and was worth the wait although I just wished Tom Cruise was a little younger not because he ruined anything but because i know he he is capable of so much more. Take a bow Mr Cruise. You are truly the last of the great Hollywood movie stars!I highly recommend this movie for fans of the original and fans of commercial blockbuster movies. This is a fine example of how you make an entertaining movie for everyone without compromising on quality.

I was rather impressed with this. The flight scenes are awesome, and the aerial combat is some the the most realistic I've seen. Both my grandfathers were Naval aviators in WWII, so I've always been interested in military aircraft and dogfighting. It was so cool to be able to predict what they were going to do and then see them do it because dogfighting hasn't changed much since WWI, other than the aircraft are faster and more maneuverable.What was most surprising was how good the rest of the story actually was. A mature Maverick was a take I didn't expect. The writers chose to have him evolve into an adult who still flaunts authority,but isn't the one note joke he was in his 20s. The baggage he carries and the relationships he rekindles and works to repair are head and shoulders above what we saw in the original.The only reason this isn't getting 10/10 is that the mission bears an extremely close relationship to let's just say a film from 1977 in the science fiction genre.Tribute to Tony Scott at the end made me tear up. He was a truly talented director and is sorely missed. Thanks for that Tom. I'm sure it was tough having done two films with him, both of which are some of my favorites. He was done proud.

They continued the Top Gun legend very well. I enjoyed every minute of the movie. I also enjoyed watching Top Gun 1986. No matter how old the image quality is in the first movie, its place is very special to me. The birth of the legend was so beautiful. Both action and suspense are at their peak. So my rating is 10/10. Let the viewers watch without hesitation. It would be a real loss to miss a movie like this. One of the rare good movies released recently. Of course, Tom Cruise also contributed to the beautification of the film. The man really does his role very well, he is a very high quality actor. Oh, he doesn't age at all :)Amazing movie!

reviews.review_title: holy sxxt this is the epitome of the true cinematic movie
reviews.content: I never write a review on any websites but I need to this time.I liked that it's on the marginal line of cliches but never crossed it. Just enough for the story to unfold, and enough to enjoy this amazing cinema.I never watched Top gun 1 and didn't really need to as the second one did a good job of recapping in a way non-top-gun fans could also enjoy.I'm going to watch it again in D-box.

Before deliberately channeling the STAR WARS Death Star trench run, TOP GUN: MAVERICK mirrors THE RIGHT STUFF with a breaking-the-barrier sequence that even features Ed Harris, playing the first of two uptight authority-figures, frowning and scowling at anything our returning hero does...The thing is, Tom Cruise's MAVERICK really doesn't break many rules, sent back to the familiar TOP GUN headquarters to train a group of youngsters for the Lucas-inspired mission: a single plane (flanked by guardians) needs to strategically drop a bomb into a perfectly tight space to blow-up an entire villainous compound...Before that, Maverick reconnects with a bartender ex-girlfriend, who seems to have existed in a parenthetical second movie while we're watching the third. And of the young hot-shots, only Miles Teller as Goose's son Rooster has any distinguishable purpose... though mostly forced from either standard exposition or winsome glances at 1980's photographs in-between long, awkward, pin-drop silences when there's no bombastic aerial noise...Concealing an extremely weak plot that finally kicks into gear with a behind-enemy-lines twist, perhaps explaining the ridiculously high scores and glowing reviews: But that kind of last-minute-saves-the-picture stuff deletes any worthwhile rewatchability factor: Basically, once you've seen TOP GUN: MAVERICK you've seen it all.

Finally a proper sequel where the original story is not ret-conned and the original hero's fell victim to their new representative woke counterparts. This movie plays homage to its roots and the story is kept as relevant and believable as possible. CGI is kept to a minimum and the actors gave their best to elevate the story. Top marks, well done Mr. Cruise!

30 years later and tom Cruise is still the Box Office top gun! This had all the throwbacks to an age gone by where action movies were just man and their machines. I loved that Tom Cruise still does his own stunts and I can only imagine how much he would have loved making this movie. Jennifer Connelly is ageless. Fun flick. Worth watching on the big screen.

I cant really remember the part 1 but I really enjoyed this movie and I will watch the original again. This movie was worth the wait and I think all of its fans will enjoy it i would be surprised if i see any negative reviews on this movie.

Despite the great usere and professional reviews, I went in with low expectations. As a young adult, I'd seen the original at least 6 times but even at the time, I felt like Top Gun was an above average popcorn flick. I felt it was entertaining but it wasn't life changing (lol)! We all needed a feel good movie this year and Maverick totally delivers. The acting, action sequences and cinematography were impressive. And yes...you should definitely see this movie at the cineplex. Highly recommend!!!

⚓ TOP GUN: MAVERICK is one hell of a good movie, a straight up Anti-WOKE / Anti-LIBERAL movie. This is lTOM CRUISE at his finest. The movie is literally pissing the WOKE / LIBERAL culture off with it's Patriotic Pro-AMERICAN overtones. Reminds a lot of when I served in the U. S. Navy. It is so Conservative that some MainStream Media outlets are denying that it is. I just get a kick out of watching LIBERALS cry. God Bless America & God Bless the United States Navy. 🇺🇲#TopGunMaverick
#USNavy.

This movie was delayed for so long because of Covid and Cruise could have easily had this moved to streaming. Thank God he didn't!This was a solid sequel to an old movie which doesn't happen very often!I actually don't care for a lot of the work Cruise has done for 20 years now but this one was solid! Not going CGI, THANK YOU! I really hope many other movies follow suit if they're able to.The story was ok, nothing special but who cares, you're not watching a movie like this for an in-depth story! Great job on this one!

reviews.review_title: Wow! Just wow! Best movie in over a decade
reviews.content: I'm trying to decide should I watch this 2 or 3 times at the theater. What a story! Everyone will love this. Even if you haven't seen the original. The audience actually clapped at the end. I have never seen that before.

reviews.review_title: One of the best sequels ever!
reviews.content: How do you give this a fair rating? It starts well and connects to the first movie right from the start. The story is quite okay, not the best piece of the story but light and easy to understand. The characters are the best part, and the special effects are significant. Adding the great music to that creates a cinematic masterpiece. In the end, it lacks a bit of reality with the old unguarded plane in the hangar, and it's too easy to lift on the short and damaged runway. But other than that, we were glued to the IMAX experience.I am looking forward to seeing it again at my home cinema.

Finally a movie that's just unapologetic fun American excellence. The aerial sequences are stunning, it's obvious they aren't CGI and it is incredible, especially on the big screen. It's actually a good movie with a good plot structure and the right amount of fan service.

How do you make an iconic film from the 80's 37 years later.Here how, the first 5 minutes were goose pimples and set you up for an exhilarating next few hours.Having been one of the lucky ones who attended one of the premiere's, I am excited to see what the rest of the world think.I have booked the whole family in to see it again this weekend to share the love.Enjoy everyone, amazing director, music and feeling...

My number rating is a bit lower than others I am seeing here, but don't get me wrong- I REALLY enjoyed this movie. It was a blast, and I was on the edge of my seat the entire time. The cast does an excellent job, and I was touched by the care they took with it, particularly the scene between old friends (you will know the one when you see it), which I did not expect at all.The downsides to this film are 2. First, in many ways it is beat-for-beat of the original. That's understandable, but a little bit of a disappointment. In particular, one of the headscratchers of the original is that it portrays an international incident with no consequences. So does this one. It's fun though, so I guess it's ok.The bigger downside is the timeline. Goose's son in the original is my age and would be about 40 now (38 had it released on time). He could easily be a Navy captain in his own right by that age, or at least a CAG. The explanation that Mav somehow held up his papers in the academy for 4 years both doesn't suffice and doesn't hold much water. Unfortunately, that realization takes me out of it a bit.On the other hand, the real strength of the film is Tom Cruise's portrayal of Maverick. In the original, Maverick is arguably the closest thing to a villain. Ice constantly says he's dangerous, and he proves that, and his inability to follow rules, over and over. He puts people at total unnecessary risk. In this film, he still takes massive risks, but he does so in order to better his team. He's learned how to be a team player, and more than that, a leader and teacher who really does care about the people around him. The level of maturity and responsibility (and feeling) that Cruise portrays here is the movie's greatest strength.See it in theaters. It's meant to be a spectacle, and it's a great one as long as you don't think too hard about it.

reviews.review_title: Definitely NOT a Tom Cruise fan. BUT....
reviews.content: This movie was EXCELLENT. Great story, good acting, stayed true to the original, very little CGI, no politics or agenda-driven messages. Just a damn good movie. All the great things a movie should have. Not something we're used to seeing these days.Just remember to watch the first one before going to see this one.

Top Gun Maverick was absolutely bonkers. A sequel done in a perfect way. Everything about this movie was phenomenal: acting, dog fighting, training flying scene, storytelling, Hans Zimmer's music, brilliant way to use old characters, how to build tension. Whole movie was super fun and fully action packed. I was on the edge of my side in second half. 10/10.

reviews.review_title: THE BEST MOVIE I'VE EVER SEEN !!!
reviews.content: After I went out of the cinema, I couldnt believe what I had just seen. The action scenes alone were great. Also the humour was perfect. The experience while watching the movie was outstanding and Tom Cruise's performance was great. I would give it 11 stars if that were possible. You need to watch this movie right now!!!

Don't want to say much about it, I'm just a guy coming from a generation seeing disappointing sequels and franchise reviving cashgrab pieces of garbage for almost two decades now, and I'm here to say with top confidence that this is one of the best sequel to an old classic movie put out on this planet called Earth ever. It not just being worthy to wear the badge reading TOP GUN but also surpasses on some levels over the original. A rare gem to see in movie making history, and in the history of dear cespool world of Hollywood, a rare quality of honoring given licences, art, creations, and adding something to the table, not pulling anything from the table top, not smashing it, breaking it, but holding it dear, and adding things there where it is needed. THAT is how it's done today, and should be done. This is the way sequels, reboots, remakes should be ever done.SO let this be the milestone, a reference of modern, mainstream moviemaking to every producer, creator, studios out there! Maverick showed us all that it is possible! So... just freaking do it this way everybody!Thank you for reading. Have a nice day!

reviews.review_title: The way sequels should be made
reviews.content: Top Gun Maverick was my antidote to Thor Love and Thunder I saw the day before. The dose of stupidity was saw big I simply needed some immediate treatment. So me and my 14 year old son selected Top Gun. And it was a very good choice. My son said: Dad I am not a fan of planes but the movie was made so well that I enjoyed every minute of it.Funny thing is that the movie is predictable yet give lots of joy. It takes much from original Top Gun yet it does not require that you know it. Rather makes you intrigued to watch it or watch it again.The movie surprised me several times and I had some open mouth moments. This is what what "HOW" is all about. The story is very simple and it is told in a very good way. Tom Cruise is a very good actor and producer and I really respect his hard work on things he gets involved in.Very good casting of new faces. Some cliche moments do not spoil pleasure of watching the whole thing.And there are lots of nice surprises. You think you see the end of action scene while you get another even better.And on the top of it they play "and old man" card very well exploring Tom Cruise's coming to maturity.All played well, great pleasure watching and you simply like all characters.I wonder if they plan to continue the series because this is a very good character to base some more plane stories on.

Now this is how you make a movie, no nonsense, just good old fashioned entertainment. Cruise is brilliant in this and the writers did a great job. Amazing sequel especially in today's climate where hollywood is more interested in social politics than good stories and characters.

Rarely does a sequel equal or surpass its predecessor. There are some exceptions, such as The Godfather Part II, and now this. Maverick shows what Hollywood is capable of when it honours the fans and ditches the tiresome woke agenda that is strangling creativity. Being officially old, I have great memories of seeing Top Gun back in the 80s. This is a brilliant film and the tonic we need, after two years of pandemic hell. If you only see one film this year, make sure its Maverick. You will love it.

reviews.review_title: Note to Hollywood: This is how a sequel is supposed to be done!
reviews.content: This movie is why you go to the theaters. And in 2022, after two years of not having this kind of excitement, it rejuvenates the movie-going experience and shows why we love movies in the first place. As someone who was obsessed with the original movie when I was a kid, I have to say they remained truthful to the original while bringing new elements and technological advancements into the mix.Top Gun: Maverick does an amazing job of being a continuation and celebration of everything we enjoyed about the first movie and then some. Yes, there is quite a bit of fan service at the beginning of the movie, but that goes away pretty quickly and we're introduced to the new characters and the plot of the new movie as soon as that stops.The only reason why I'm not ranking this a perfect 10 / 10 is because if you're familiar with the Youtube channel Cinemasins, there's a lot of "He survives this" and "this works" types of moments. You will notice these things pretty quickly. But they don't really detract from the main plot too much or don't seem that overly out of place for what the characters are going through in relation to the story.Overall, this is one of the best movie sequels and will definitely go to show how future sequels should be made.

I saw this in IMAX and it was well worth it. The training/combat effects were excellent. The acting was above average except for Tom Cruise. He needs to receive some lifetime achievement award for the longest lasting, believable (sorry Liam) action star of our generation. The story was a bit derivative of A New Hope but better as airplanes do not have inertial dampeners. A bit predictable towards the end but the action more than makes up for it.

reviews.review_title: As good or better than the first
reviews.content: It is an instant classic. Good story, well developed. Well directed. Good acting. And great special effects and action. Not over the to p, just right. So the plot is not totally realistic or believable. It is cx a fun and wild ride that leaves you wanting more. All 10 people of all age groups that I went with, loved it. Ages 12 through 60. 2 had never seen the original.

reviews.review_title: The need for speed never dies 8/10
reviews.content: Top Gun: Maverick is a great movie, one of the best movies to watch now in theaters so go watch it! It is a great love letter to the original one and gives a nice closure to the story of Maverick.I kind of anticipated from the first trailer that Maverick (Tom Cruise) will be taking the position of training pilots. Not just regular pilots but the best in the U. S. Navy.The main struggle and conflict of course is between Maverick and Bradley Bradshaw, A. K. A "Rooster", A. K. A Goose's son from the first movie who died. Goose was Maverick's co pilot and best friend who died and ever since, Rooster has been blaming Maverick. So you know there is a lot of tension between them. Especially when Maverick is supposed to train Rooster and the other pilots for a mission they might not come back alive.The other pilots are also very interesting, I found much interest in them as I found in Maverick. My only concern that thankfully didn't came true was that they would be annoying characters that won't cooperate. But they have proven to be great pilots with great skills, their cooperation with Maverick was truly awesome to see near the end of the film.Of course the final battle sequence was amazing, a bit to Hollywood type of ending but for now I'll pass over it.Overall I'm really happy with this film, I'm glad my hype didn't die during the whole two-year wait and that I'm satisfied with the final product. Go watch it now and thank me later.

The first movie I've ever gone back to the cinema to see twice. I loved the first Top Gun but this one's even better - much better I'd say. The action sequences are so good they immerse you completely and I left the cinema feeling sky high. The opening sequence takes you back to 1986 again . It's so good - see at the cinema while you can.

A sequel 36 years in the making, and delayed for the past 3 years. The anticipation was huge, and 'Top Gun: Maverick' delivered in every way.To be clear, 'Top Gun' is my all time favourite movie. But I felt very confident that it's sequel would not disappoint. In the hands of Cruise and Joseph Kosinski it simply could not fail. It had the perfect amount of nostalgia and fan service. It followed the same blueprint as the original but still brought in new and exciting elements to the table. A near perfect sequel.The young pilots acting with the exception of Miles Teller was average. The chemistry between Cruise and Teller was very good, and you could really feel the tension of their relationship. Jennifer Connelly was excellent, and it was great to see Val Kilmer again.The star of the film... the jets. The aerial shots in this movie are like non other. It was absolutely outstanding. Breathtaking would be another apt description. The climax was one of the best movie experiences I have ever had, it just kept getting better and exceeding expectations. It's very rare that I have the desire to see a movie in the theater twice. 'Maverick' made me want to watch it again immediately.
Usually the sequels are not that easy to follow. But this one did. One might argue that it is better than the 1st. I'm not a Tom cruise fan. But boy, he delivered. It is really that good.
As a Veteran this movie filled me with excitement. Best movie ever. Best feel good movie! I've waited 36 years to see this and it did not disappoint. Love Tom Cruise in this.

I feel like this film has a easy storyline with great characters and SO WELL executed. Direction, Plot, Music, Actors and Cinematography. Everything is great!! Action scenes felt real, packed with a lot of emotions. It's the perfect blockbuster, it's made for everyone and now that I've watched it after two weeks, I only think about going back to the cinema and watch it again. It's a 9/10 for now, and in the case I enjoy it more after the rewatch, then it will be a 10/10.
Went in with no pre-convieced expectations or spoilers and was mesmerized on an epic scale of how good the film was. This was maybe the best film i have seen in the cinemas in years, well worth it.
The movie met my expectations and beyond it has everything I wanted plus more. The producers the directors all the actors and of course Tom Cruise truly nailed it, this movie is a masterpiece.

Tom Cruise is just UNBELIEVABLE!!!!! The movie was really good and as a sequel to the class top gun it outturned the firs movie. The flying scenes were truly amazing. It delivered a true a great movie. I might as well say this is the best movie of the year. This is a must Tom Cruise movie. The man literally doesn't age physically for real. The soundtrack throughout the whole movie was also very good.

Such a great movie!! Nothing political, nothing woke, nothing sexiest just a great movie which is FUN to watch with a great story. Better than the original in every way while paying tribute to the 1986 film. GO see this movie and enjoy!!

Top Gun: Maverick is far superior than its predecessor. It builds off the original, grounding - to a degree - well known characters, and adding a maturity while getting rid of the corniness. Aside from the more fleshed-out characters, the action scenes are incredible. This is where the movie shines. The cinematography puts you in the thick of the action. If you can, see the film on the biggest screen possible, preferably IMAX. Maverick is a a breath of fresh air in terms of summer blockbusters. It's a technical marvel, that's also feel-good and fun.

This is exactly how every sequel should be made exciting, thrilling, dramatic, and extremely entertaining.But what shocked me the most is the level of intelligence from the crew, the cast, and the Director to create such a sequel to be fit and watchable for the newer generations.Not every story has to be sophisticated and complicated in order for to appeal to brainy viewers, in fact it teaches resilience, confidence, and team work.Tom cruise and the new young cast did an amazing job by showing how generations should connect with each other to create a better future for the ones to come.Love it and it had been added to my all time favorites.
I loved this film. It was a perfect balance between modern and oldschool elements. The music was nice, the screenplay was insane and I had goosebumps all the time while watching.

It has been 36 years ago since the rise of Peter "Maverick" Mitchel busted on the stage screen for the first time donning those flight medals and taking on mission after mission for the United States Navy. Now, Maverick must make a hard decision, in the 21st century, to give up the thing that he loves, or risk it all and save the nation.The first time I saw Top Gun, I thought ok, Tom Cruise, a young, overconfident, man - and yes, he was sexy at the time, I liked it. But now as he leads an all-star cast, I can honestly say that Top Gun: Maverick has left a reputation of honor to country, and dad to his best friend's son to take him under his wing and give him the future that he desires.Tom Cruise is no ordinary Joe; he is an American treasure. But the props of everything that this movie is about goes to only one man - the original "Iceman," Val Kilmer. Between Tom and Val, they both led an all-star studded cast - Jennifer Connelly, Ed Harris, Jon Hamm, Miles Teller - to teach that anything is possible when you put your mind to it and never think when you are flying a jet.Thanks to the talented musicians and the likes of Hans Zimmer and the ever-talented pop singer - Lady GaGa for an incredible score - this movie will go down in the books of anything is possible if you set your mind to it.

Honestly the movie was near perfect with all the thrilling action scenes, comedic moments here and there, great character development and fast paced. Although the main reason why I did not give this a full ten out of ten is simply because there were quite few scenes where they just cut to black and move on tot he next scene which in my opinion is quite cheap for a 170 million dollar budget movie. But otherwise I still think It's A Great movie for everyone to watch and the best part is that it easy to catch on if you did not watch the first one. I have personally watched the first one but the friend I went with did not but he still enjoyed it and caught on easily.

Awesome! Nostalgic, unapologetically pro-American, and absent of the typical Hollywood virtue signaling. The stunts flying feels visceral. Practical effects are hands down better than the cartoon fare being pumped out of the MCU. I hope Hollywood takes note and returns us to this type of filmmaking. This is the first movie in a long time I was pleased to see in the theater rather than stream at home.

reviews.review_title: A movie that takes you back
reviews.content: Top Gun 2 is from an era of practical movie making with stunts and excitement through camera angles, storytelling, and acting. In two bloated decades of CGI heavy blockbusters, fantasy sci-fi, and year after year of Superheroes candy pop movies. This is a rare gem that takes all the 80s, 70s, 60s child back to their youth again for one magical 131mins cinematic experience. They simply don't make movies like this anymore.It was an adrenaline pumping movie with a story that pulls the heart strings of both guys and girls, told by great acting, casting, nostalgia, and cinematic experience.The first movie made Tom Cruise the superstar that he is now. Since then, he made a lot of not so great movies and there are questions about his personal life since. This movie just redeemed him back to list of top actors on everyone's list again. It feels like they revived Maverick as the iconic character from the 80s to the 21st century, and Tom as the iconic actor at the same time.Well done and there are nothing I can criticise about this movie.I urge everyone to watch this in the cinema. It's a rare movie going experience that was lost in the last 30 years, and I think most in their 20s and 30s have never experienced so far. It's like an old rock band that comes back for one hell of a rock 'n' roll concert for all time sake.

My only real issue with the film is that they didn't use "you can be my wingman anytime" line at the end of the film. Also what an F14 was doing in an airbase that clearly only had modern aircraft (very minor complaint).I didn't like the original Top Gun all that much, this flick was far better while still feeling in line with the 80s flick's motifs and world. Very good screenplay and cinematography, above all, I think the best part of the film was the acting. Tom Cruise really sells Maverick and he's far more likable than I remember him being from the first Top Gun.All the callbacks were great, I only really had issue with them not using one of them, other than that, very solid film in the high 8 range (8.5-9.0)/10. I highly recommend this film even if you haven't seen the original because it really works.

reviews.review_title: This truly was a great movie!
reviews.content: It's funny, dramatic, action-packed, heartfelt. I appreciated the little introductory clip from Tom Cruise explaining about the authenticity of the film's production and welcoming everyone back to the theater. I thought Miles Teller did a great job (and quite obviously was cast/costumed/made-up very well) and that there was a nice balance of nostalgia and new characters. When we first arrived in the theater, I was worried it was going to be way too loud, but thankfully it got better. Also, the soundtrack is superb!

reviews.review_title: You'll feel the need for speed again!
reviews.content: What an amazing film. I didn't think it was possible but this even tops the original I think. Everything about it is just so well put together. The aerial shots are absolutely incredible. A few emosh bits in it too. Loved how they incorporated Ice Man. But damn how does Tom Cruise look so good at his age? Can't wait to see it again!

reviews.review_title: Top Gun: Maverick-Captivating, stunning, unique, adrenaline-pumping, and emotional film masterpiece! Tom Cruise proved again that he is the biggest in Hollywood!
