reviews.content: At first, when I found out they were going to make a movie like this, I thought it was unnecessary, but since Tom Cruise is one of my favorite actors, I still thought I would watch it when it came out! Then, I found out that it was delayed because of the pandemic, that there were changes, and I thought it would hurt the quality and the script. I even read that it could go straight to streaming, and I thought that would totally ruin the movie.Finally, after a lot of delay and Tom Cruise's stubbornness, the movie was released in theaters. It happened! The movie finally came out in theaters, and then I was very pleased and surprised at how everyone reacted to this movie. The movie became a legend while it was still in theaters! It brought incredible revenue and became Tom Cruise's highest-grossing movie, and I was extremely happy for him because he deserves it, because I think that Tom Cruise is one of the best actors I've ever seen, and he is extremely dedicated to making movies!I didn't watch it right away when it came out. I watched it on Blu-ray first, and I loved it so much. I fell in love with this movie so much that I went to see it in theaters (they were still showing it) and watched it five times within a month. It had not happened to me in a long time to see the same movie so many times in the theater! What can I say about Top Gun: Maverick that hasn't already been said? An absolute masterpiece of cinema. The aerial combat scenes are the best I have ever seen in a cinema! The acting is amazing, the actors are great, and Tom Cruise is unique as always.The movie is beautifully shot, filled with unique, captivating, stunning scenes, and the plot is very well made and polished, but the icing on the cake is the appearance of Val Kilmer as Iceman. This makes the movie great, and the meeting of Tom Cruise and Val Kilmer in one scene is extremely emotional, to such an extent that I would define it as one of the most emotional meetings of the last 15 years.I was extremely excited to see Val Kilmer after his battle with the insidious disease, and his presence is still as compelling and strong as ever. The film deservedly received such an incredibly high rating and brought in such revenue, I personally think that Tom Cruise should finally get his long-deserved Oscar, and for this movie he deserves not only an acting Oscar, but also for film of the year, as a producer!Tom Cruise once again surpassed himself and proved that he is one of the most dedicated actors and producers in the USA, if not the most dedicated to his audience! If more people were like him, there would be many more quality and stunning movies! If you haven't seen Top Gun: Maverick, definitely watch it, but the experience is even more stunning in a cinema, especially in Imax! Top Gun: Maverick is an enthralling, breathtaking, unique, shocking, adrenaline-pumping, emotional masterpiece! I would define it as the film of the year, and it is definitely in the top ten films of the last 15 years! Tom Cruise proved again that he is the biggest in Hollywood.

This is a type of movie you should watch in the theaters. Otherwise the goosebumps might be lesser.There is no introduction needed for the Top Gun: Maverick, it is the best, realistic and benchmark aviation movie to date, period.All I want to say is, all hail to Tom Cruise. Such a rare gem.Top Gun: Maverick, is proven that viewers not always needed some superhero movies with cracking jokes. (Eg: SpiderKid)

I have issues with the character Rooster. In the first movie, 36 years ago, he was 5 or so. Which means he now in this movie is 41, ehich is clearly not the case. Ow and a F18 cant do a cobra manouvre. Storyline was almost as thin as the first movie (almost). This said, my eyes were glued to the screen. I dont know how they did it, but some scenes really worked and were as accurate as it is doable without using cgi. They dont make movies like this anymore. Writing this I decide to give it an 8 instead of a 7 out of 10.

reviews.review_title: One of the best sequels of all time
reviews.content: Wow...Movies like Top Gun Maverick are what remind us of what cinema is about. Emotion, humor, and action all blended flawlessly into a perfect mix with this quintessential film. A fitting love letter to the original Top Gun Fans.

reviews.review_title: Tom Cruise was Actually Short in This
reviews.content: I'm so glad they let Tom Cruise not have to stand on the soapbox or where any lifts in the shoes. Absolutely great movie my son and I enjoyed it. Cried seeing Val Kilmer like that 94% easy.

reviews.review_title: Thank you for saving my summer
reviews.content: In a world that is so filled with bad news this movie saved my summer. Tom Cruise is truly the last action hero. Starting it with a thank you for seeing it in the theatre was a class act. There are not enough superlatives to describe this movie. It's not that the story is deep but it is the epic experience you want from Top Gun. Where I loved the original in the 80s Maverick manages to surpass it in every way which is saying a lot. I am so glad I saw it in the theatre.

Top guns fans were waiting this movie more than two decades and finally cinema goers can experience it at cinema. First of all, I can say that I'm not a big fan of the Top gun in fact I watched first movie around 5 years ago but it was a good movie for me overall. I always appreciated first movie's stunts with aircrafts so my only expectation from the sequel was getting similar stunts.I have satisfied with stunts and flying sequences in the air plus Hans Zimmer works as a composer in this movie what can you expect more because Tom Cruise is the lead actor too. Maverick's struggle after losing his best friend in the first movie continues in a way he is traumatized with the incident and this emotional weigh still haunts him so you can easily feel Maverick and Goose's bond. Maverick still feels responsible for Goose's family on the other hand, Maverick has some personal struggles too but his priorities change when he was sent to Top Gun school again as an instructor. The Story is a nice straightforward a success story mixed up with some amazing images. There is one more thing I want to mention Ice character could easily has been killed off because of Val Kilmer's real life health issues but he has been included in to cast and his presence elevated the movie without his scenes my satisfaction could be decrease.There are so little things to speak about the movie negatively but if the enemy country could be specified as a real country it could be a little better but the movie still works fine the way it is. In the 1st Top Gun movie rivalry in the Top Gun school was more effective but the sequel is okay too. Some characters like Maverick's love interest in the 1st movie has been completely removed from the sequel too.Some characters like Maverick's love interest in the 1st movie has been completely removed from the sequel . Although it is understandable there could have been mentioned the love interest. We can understand that the relationship didn't work but having a small explanation could have been better
Briefly, Top Gun Maverick is a very good movie whether you're a fan of the 1st movie or not. I suggest to everyone who likes the action genre to see it at a cinema. It's worth it but before you see it make sure to see the 1st one if you haven't seen it yet.

When something receives a general consensus of praise, the expectations can be high. I went to see Maverick right in the middle. Not expecting to see a bad movie, but also not getting my hopes up to be blown away. I'm happy to say this movie meets the hype. It's just really well done. And that's saying a lot for a sequel with a 36 year gap from the original. The film delivers a fresh experience while respecting the first film. It's a good thing when a movie doesn't depend on its predecessor too heavily, while simultaneously not forgetting what made it so good in the first place. There are callbacks to the original Top Gun, but it doesn't feel forced. It feels necessary. The new cast is very Top Gun-ish. Miles Teller fits perfectly in this movie. The stunts and special effects couldn't be better. The suspense and adrenaline. The soundtrack. It's just a good time. And that's the result of hard work and care for craft. Not some lazy cash grab. Which is clearly appreciated. I wish more late sequels were this good. Anyway, it's worth hitting the theater for.

2nd viewing here we gooo! In the aspirations section of my grade 12 year book bio I stated (half-truth like) I wanted to be an F18 fighter pilot, not because of Top Gun but because for a good chunk of my childhood I built and painted models. I researched and fantasized about the fun flying one of these marvels would provide. The speed and maneuverability just blew my mind. Alas, I never did go that path in life but thanks to this film I can witness exactly what I dreamed about. Incredible!

Watch it in a normal cinema at first and regretted big time! Then i went to IMAX thinking of having a better Tom Gun experience, but I wasn't satisfied! Decided to go for a 3rd screen play with MX4D and boom! The best ever aviation movie of all time!!!

Exaggerated maneuvers, exaggerated odds, exaggerated training, exaggerated timespan, predictable plot, way too much melancholy and...
... surviving ejection at mach 10!!????? Alien movie is more realistic.In case if this any explanation:
exaggerated training: 10 best pilots can't do it after practicing, but you do it in the first try; I mean, did you ever play a game? A sport? A song? Anything with a tough achievement? It makes no sense.exaggerated timespan: enemy planes at 1 minute approaching supersonic, after several minutes of valley crawling + 2 "impossible" maneuvers, they are still at 30 seconds approaching.maneuvers and odds need no explanation.The movie is average, of course, but I give a 2 in an attempt to counterbalance the exaggerated acclaim from the old pops' feeling young again.

reviews.review_title: Wow!! Watch it in dolby the sound and plane maneuvering is exciting
reviews.content: Wow!! Watch it in dolby the sound and plane maneuvering is exciting.. it gets you off ur seat.. nice one tom cruise you pulled it again i love this top gun.. simple story and yet its very entertaining.

In preparation for this, rewatched to first film again very recently - Classic if just slightly cheesy at times, wondered how they'd progress the 'story' after all this time.Well can understand why Cruise wanted to wait for it to be 'right' and yet again he proves why he's not just a top actor but a film maker. Nailed it.A good story, which includes obviously some hark-backs to the original, with Goose's story and great, moving cameo from Kilmer as Iceman, but certainly doesn't just play on that, and stands up in its own right. Good support cast too, especially Teller, but of course the heart is Cruise and still very much carries it off even 30 years later. But (again obviously) what takes this into the stratosphere is the many incredible flying scenes, which are just unbelievable, heart in mouth stuff.A great film which definitely surpasses the original. A credit to all involved and most definitely deserves it's success, critical and financial. Cruise is a force of nature in the Movie world, on screen and off.
There is no way anyone will make a sequel so perfectly executed ever again. As good as the original was, this one surpasses and expands on it in every way.

In a good way. I purposely went a month later than all my friends to see if the movie could back up the hype. It was an amazing movie with well thought out story, dialogue, camera work, everything. Will add this to my bluray wishlist. Ten times better than the first movie, which i consider okay.

How this got 8.5 out of 10 is beyond me. The script is hilarious, and not in a good way. The story line doesn't make sense, with obvious references to the original film but without context, especially in the first half hour. And it was just for the sake of it. Like the last 30 years never happened. The number of times we laughed out loud at the terrible script made it vaguely bearable. Pretty sure it didn't plan of being a comedy, but it's the only reason we made it to the end.A really disappointing "shouldn't have been made" sequel. Not following the rave, nostalgia blinkered reviews. An awful movie in its own right.
This movie was perfect. I wouldn't change a thing about it. The pace didn't drag at all. The jet scenes were breathtaking. Everyone should see this movie.
Top Gun is my favorite airplane action movie.Top Gun Maverick is huge success. There is much similar scenes from first movie, but it's doesn't seem to be cheap.

reviews.review_title: They don't make movies like this anymore
reviews.content: A beautiful love letter to good old fashioned ingenuity and cinematic dedication. It has been a long time since I saw a movie I can proud to love. The lack of CGI, the story, the acting and the lack of acting at the same time! I've never even seen the first movie and I fell in love with Goose and Maverick's relationship and cried in the theater. The amount of modesty was overwhelmingly refreshing as well. This movie is something that this generation can be proud to say "I went and saw Top Gun: Maverick in theaters."
With Tom Cruise the film is absolutely fantastic thanks for all players and crew excellent job i doubted when i was going to see but it was worth it espicially aircraft sceres.

reviews.review_title: This movie represents the kind of studio programming that Hollywood made in the 80s, 90s and even the 00s
reviews.content: Bring back movies like Crimson Tide, Gladiator. Forrest Gump, The Right Stuff, E. T. and The Untouchables!Moreover, there is a need for Hollywood to have stars like Tom Cruise and the writers, producers, directors and Hollywood Executives to make such movies.

reviews.review_title: The movie that had no right to be a masterpiece!
reviews.content: So my opinion on the first Top Gun movie is that it's not the greatest thing ever, but also not the worst. It's entertaining and fun, but really has no meat to the bone or anything. For Top Gun Maverick I have two words to describe this movie: EMOTION & HEART, two things that the first film lacked, but they are utilized to their fullest potential in the sequel. I already have massive respect for Tom Cruise as an actor, but with this movie, my respect for him has gone past 1000 because this is clearly one of his greatest works. Not only does he perform all these flying stunts for real, but this is definitely one of his most emotional performances of his career. Miles Teller is also great in the film playing Goose's son Rooster and you feel more the impact of Goose's death in this film than you actually do in the first movie and because of that you really feel the emotion and the dynamic between Maverick and Rooster. I also love the choice to have Jennifer Connelly play a past lover in this movie. You feel the chemistry and you sense the history between her and Maverick which is a romance storyline I can get on board with unlike Charlie and Maverick in the first which felt forced and unnatural. We are also introduced to new characters played by Glenn Powell, Monica Barbaro, Jay Ellis and many more and they managed to give these new characters enough personality to them to feel a sense of camaraderie. Every character instantly felt like family and they made us care in just a matter of 2 hours which is very impressive. The collaboration score Harold Faltermeyer, Lorne Balfe, Hans Zimmer and Lady Gaga is absolutely astounding. They just take the original Top Gun theme and amp it up to make it sound fresh and modern.Top Gun Maverick is a movie I did not expect to be good. I remember seeing the trailers thinking to myself why did we need a sequel to this and how bad this looks, but boy oh boy did it prove me so wrong! This is one of the best movies I've ever seen in my life and is my favourite movie of the year so far and I almost feel like no other movie will be able to beat it, yep beating The Batman surprisingly. I even almost teared at this amazing line at the end "Thank you for saying my life" "That's what my dad would've done" Top Gun Maverick is an absolute masterpiece in cinema!

I can't believe they spent 2 hours on a film and didn't help educate people on the evil of white patriarchy. I mean, it's 2022 people, and there are still movies that are so out of touch with the 3% of the population and their demands of inclusion and diversity?I mean 12 young top guns and not a single black woman pilot let alone a representation of the purple hair, nose ring, mustached transwoman? I just can't believe the producers and the directors could be this deliberately intolerant of some people's feewings.How can they even make money off this thing is the biggest question, when it is just 2 hours of nonstop action, beautiful scenery, and nostalgic '80s music? Who wants that? Who goes to the movie to be entertained? That's just ridiculous and wrong. How can a movie that doesn't cater to the demands of the few but loud ever make so much money? It doesn't make sense.So I say, if you are looking for something that will help move the progressive message, exploit human bigotry, so you can feel righteous about yourself, then don't waste your time on this film. It's 2 hours of entertainment you just won't get back.

reviews.review_title: The first successful sequel brought from the previous generation.
reviews.content: As Maverick returns to Top Gun, now as an instructor rather than an active fighter pilot, he must equip a group of the country's best pilots for an important, yet practically suicidal, task. He is forced to confront past traumas and make decisions bigger than himself. All the while proving to everyone yet again that "it's not the plane, it's the pilot.""Top Gun: Maverick" did something I have never seen. Kosinski and the entire cast took an iconic 1980's film and molded it into an equally iconic film for the next generation to enjoy. So many have tried: Rambo, Terminator, Ghostbusters, Jurassic Park, and even Star Wars (just to name a few) but they have each failed miserably and their only legacy is mediocrity. Everyone of these films has featured their same cast yet outdated, their same plot yet watered down, and their same idea yet clearly forced into a film that never should of been produced.However, "Top Gun: Maverick" did not fail. It exceeded; it entertained. It successfully brought the original "Top Gun" into the 21st century. It has you pumping your fists and cheering for the characters because you grow to love them so dang much. It honors the original film while also making a name for itself. It features original characters while also bringing relevant, fresh personalities onto the scene. It has an original, captivating plot that leaves the audience crying, laughing, and applauding. It is thrill-seeking, fast, epic, and intense, but also underneath, it is soft, sentimental, tear-jerking, and authentic.Watch it! Soak in the high flying jets, the leather jackets, and the rad sunglasses. "Top Gun: Maverick" is what cinema is all about.

Very good movie. Tom is playing here like in his '89.God bless Tom Scott,the director of Top Gun from the '89.Worth watch, of course.... Overall is entertaing especially with great sound.And much more, the combination with the old carachters and the new one's is another good thing to watch. Maverick is the pilot that can't be stopped. That's for sure. Is a carachter that put you with the thought that you can't forget who are and what You are. Also, a cry on some scenes. And that is another fact that this 2nd movie worth to watch. Excuse my poor english. I am Romanian. Dracula say "hi" to You all.

reviews.review_title: One of the best sequels in years
reviews.content: The original Top Gun was a fun film for what it was, with charismatic personalities and aviary action. I think it is safe to say that Top Gun: Maverick brings things to a whole other level. There's a lot of heart in the story this time around. It is rewarding for fans by giving them what they would expect while also building upon the legacy of the last film. It delivers on the action and the third act of Maverick made me feel tense at times. Speaking of the action, it's amazing what you can still do with practical effects, as most of the aviation scenes were just that. Without spoiling, there is one character that is brought back from the original film and I thought it was cool how they used them. For cons, there are some moments that can come across as cheesy and the love interest aspect I felt could've been stronger and more integral. You can tell a lot of heart was put into the production for this film and I think it will be worth the wait for those who have been long time fans of the original. If you want a legitimately fun movie experience, I can't think of anything better at the moment than Top Gun: Maverick. Verdict: 8/10.

The moment I saw the trailer I was skeptical about this movie. Top Gun: Maverick truly tops the original movie.The movie was about Maverick and follows the story of the original movie. Giving Tom Cruises character a development since he started Mission Impossible with Director Christopher McQuarrie.The acting, cinematography, and music were amazing. The best scenario were the training, Tom Cruise, the war fight, and the final.What amazes me on how I miss the feelings for action movies, and this sequel does its job! Bravo!

There is nothing wrong with this movie; it captures the spirit of the original and pays homage to it numerous times. It's an old fashioned action filled, chest thumping film that reminds you why you loved the first one and why you go to the movies in the first place.Go see it.

reviews.review_title: As an 80s kid what this movie meant to me
reviews.content: Yes I know this movie is not only for fans of the original Top Gun. I know this because I took my kids to watch it and they flipped and said this was the best movie they had ever seen. The thing is that I AM A FAN.As a kid that movie was my go to feel good movie. My older brothers would constantly watch it on VHS and blasted the soundtrack in the car as I went along for the ride.Watching this movie with my older brother in a movie theater was the most amazing experience. This movie was PERFECT. There is nothing it is missing. It was not IN YOUR FACE feminism or "forced woke". It just was. Nothing was forced here. Tom Cruise is my all time favorite actor and now I remember why. Because the guy gives fans what they want and didn't know they needed. I miss this in today's CGI world where it is all about flashy content and very little actual content. My review: A MUST WATCH AT THE MOVIES NOT AT HOME.

It's not a movie looking to transcend the source material, which is a good move. It's got every element fans of the original like and brings with it catharsis, the most incredible dog fighting ever filmed, and plays into the weakest aspects of the original, including melodramatic 90s acting. It might be the only sequel that also, somehow, feels like a spiritual successor at the same time.

reviews.review_title: A breath of fresh air that people who go watch movies really need.
reviews.content: So this is what happens when a movie is made with passion and they don't take the easy route, but break new grounds and raises the bar.After a decade of Marvel CGI greenscreen movies, the biggest superstar of Hollywood - Tom Cruise - decides to take actionmovies back to the days of practical effects and real stunts. Much like he is trying to with the Mission Impossible franchise.'Top Gun: Maverick' hits several emotional beats, and the plot is just perfect. The best action movie blockbuster I have seen since 'The Dark Knight' 14 years ago.

Really enjoyed this film from the very beginning to the last second. First film I've been to for about three years, because of lockdown, but more about a series of truly awful films that put me off going again. This great movie has ignited my interest. But it's a very hard act to follow.

reviews.review_title: A film worthy of your time!
reviews.content: I have been looking for a kind of film with a different plot, a unique one for a very long time. And in this, i found it. I rarely watch aviation related movies nor fighting jets i just dont have an ample interest in those but this!! This changes everything. The best of the best pilots! I love how the chemistry existed between Maverick and Penny. The two of em just fits so well and boy Jennifer Connelly really would never let you down.Aside from that, the character roles here of everyone just fits so well especially mav's. He's recklessness if that is really recklessness is just so good. A living legend.The soundtrack of this film fits so well also!! The way the songs were played each scene fits just right moreover the lyrics! No wonder the popularity and expectations of this film is so high. And yes, here we are very satisfied with the film.If ever there is a slight cons here, not sure if this is really a cons or i just really dont know how it works tho. One thing i notice is that the way they executed well the miracles and how they pass the coffin corner which they really have difficulty in the training is just quite smooth when it comes to the actual execution. Another is that there are almost no casualty, no deaths although the chances are always there especially when they are being chased by missiles and other jets. I dont know i just really expect that only half of them would survive or none in the mission lol.
Movie industry, I really hope you're paying attention to what the people love and want to see because this is it. Storytelling, action, heroes, friendship, love, family. It's not complicated.

reviews.review_title: You can keep your Fury Road, Top Gun: Maverick is the best legacy sequel of all time.
reviews.content: Many have expressed deep concerns about the future of cinema, including myself, over the past two to three years. COVID, the rise of streaming and the decline in the movie star are, according to many, going to inevitably contribute to the death of cinema as we know it. We will be ushered into an age whereby movies are watched on small screens and the age-old cinematic tradition of watching a film on the big screen with a crowd is soon going to be nothing more than a hazy memory to look back on.Tom Cruise has another idea.36 years after the original, which was nothing more than a shot of corny 80s adrenaline, Pete 'Maverick' Mitchell returns to headline a brilliant action film that beats it predecessor ten times over. Nope, that is not an exaggeration.Like many of the best sequels of all time (think, T2: Judgment Day and The Empire Strikes Back) its brilliance can be measured by how much it improves the first film or the films that came before it. Not only is Top Gun: Maverick the best action movie of the decade so far, it also elevates the original into something worth revisiting and revaluating.And from Miles Teller (Whiplash) to Jennifer Connelly (Requiem for a Dream), Tom Cruise is not the only cast member who gives it their all. Off the screen too, Joseph Kosinski brings his usual visual flair and this time accompanies it with a script that takes us on an emotional journey, not that long after life took us on one ourselves.You can keep your Fury Road, Top Gun: Maverick is the best legacy sequel of all time.

reviews.review_title: Maverick is a must watch blockbuster film that needs to be viewed on the biggest screen possible!
reviews.content: It has been 36 years since the original released (I wasn't even born when it came out). And to be frank, I watched the original just a week before and I didn't like it that much (it was made in the 80s after all). But the sequel is mind-blowing! Top Gun: Maverick is the kind of movie you watch at the theatres!Set around 30 years after the events of the original, Pete Mitchell aka Maverick is now a test pilot but his program is scrapped due to lack of funding. Having rejected promotions to continue flying, he gets called back to Top Gun as a trainer. He is tasked to train a group of Top Gun graduates to take down a uranium enrichment facility.The effort gone into making this film is astounding! Three months of training, which included aerial aviation and with cameras fit inside the cockpit, the actors having to direct themselves. The result is an experience worth viewing on the biggest screen possible (even if you haven't watched the original).Tom Cruise is the most prolific action hero we have had in the past decade. Maverick had to be special given Cruise's obsession with performing realistic death defying stunts. The casting is perfect with Cruise & Val Kilmer reprising their roles. Miles Teller (son of Goose), Jennifer Connelly, Glen Powell, Lewis Pullman, Ed Harris, Charles Parnell, Danny Ramirez, Bashir Salahuddin, Jon Hamm & Barbaro Monica co-star.Maverick is a must watch,🍿worthy blockbuster film that deserves your rapt attention. A film that has to be seen on the big (-gest) screen. Do not miss it!!And yes, the soundtrack is still great - Lady Gaga, One Republic, Hans Zimmer, Harold Faltermeyer.

reviews.review_title: An amazing sequel despite the fact that it was 36 years later
reviews.content: It was an amazing movie. The feeling you get when you walk in the cinema can't be explained. What surprised me was that it was way better than the original movie. Every character was well developed and they all had unique personalities. Miles teller did a wonderful job playing rooster. He brought back goose vibes. Phoenix was an amazing addition. Hangman's personality was similar to iceman's. He left his ego behind and saved the squad. It is an all time favorite for me.

reviews.review_title: Great film promoting International Peacebuilding, Love and Friendship.
reviews.content: Great film promoting International Peacebuilding, Love and Friendship - with just a very gentle breeze of American propaganda :)Nonetheless, this fine film gives a good insight what a US Fighter pilot can do - even in an old F14 - when vastly outnumbered by enemy forces :)I mean, sometimes you just have to go for it, regardless of the odds, and take a stand for Liberty and Freedom - just like our brave and courageous Ukrainian friends are currently doing - to liberate and free their country - and protect and safeguard innocent civilians and Children.This film also highly highlights, that when embarking on a cool and life-changing journey, it's important to follow through - and even go beyond Mach10, if necessary - to promote peace and human co-existence.This applies especially to the current situation between Russia and Ukraine, I think, since both nations have to find a way to live in Peace with each other other.In short, it is imperative that Diplomacy and Dialogue is restored between the Ukrainian government and the Russian government - so that Peace and Harmony can be restored in the International Community.

It's not meant to be complex and deep. Watch it for what it is, a 2-hour escape from reality and enjoy the ride.Was it a bit predictable? Yes. Could they have done without the love interest? Damn right.But, all things considered, I guess the ratings are really high not because it's a perfect movie, but because of how this movie makes people feel. I personally felt nostalgic and just plain happy watching Tom Cruise do his thing.Apart from the stunning visual & the thrill of the mission, this sequel (which is better than the original) just ticks all the right boxes. Great cast, awesome music. Just enjoy it.

I am not an American.............!!I am not really into planes.........!!Tom Cruise isn't my favourite actor.......!!However, this is officially my greatest movie of all time.......!!And I am a movie buff, that is very very critical normally......!!I absolutely LOVE Top Gun - Maverick (2022).To be completely honest, its got the best action, storyline (with nostalgia) acting, script, cinematography and well everything you need / want in a movie,
Honestly, the first time I saw it at the cinema (I've seen it 5 times now) I was not expecting much, but from minute one I was on the edge of my seat and totally engaged.It is so good, that at the end of the movie, the entire cinema stood up and clapped (this is in Europe, so not swayed by love for your country), I've never experienced that before, just really fantastic.If I could rate it higher than 10, I would....... best movie of all time.Well done Mr Cruise and all involved. AMAZING. I'll watch it again and again and again and again....!! INCREDIBLE!!!!!!!👍🏼

reviews.review_title: Never seen top gun yet I became an instant fan
reviews.content: Firstly - I've never seen the first top gun.I walked into this just to pass some time and I did not expect what I saw. Holy crap. What a film.Movies and entertainment nowadays often have too many fillers, hype, cheap thrills, gimmicks and are often catered to meet the demands of short attention spans. It's tougher than ever to hold attention and grab people's hearts and keep them engaged without constantly having something to keep people's attention by any means necessary. This often means lack of depth, presence, quality storytelling and the feeling of an "old school epic".This is the type of movie that gives a nod to what used to be but no longer is. An epic.Quality music, great pacing, incredible aerial shots without any CGI or green screen. I mean, Tom Cruise even demanded that all the actors go through G force training so no shots are shot with CGI or greenscreen and what we have is a visual masterpiece, with an epic tale that grips you and takes your heart and holds it gently as it carries it all through the end of this incredible movie at Mach 10.I walked out feeling great, so calm in my body because I was at the edge of my seat without all the flash, hype, noise and all the other distraction that jacks up the nervous system. Instead, all I felt was anticipation, excitement, inspiration and a feel good feeling inside me that I carried with me for the next 2 days.I have watched Top Gun Maverick twice. I'm going to watch the first one at home, then I'm going back to the cinema to watch it a third time.This has found a home in my top 10 movies of all time where it will stay forever.Incredible movie, incredible experience, so yourself a favour and watch it asap on the big screen.Then go watch it again.

reviews.review_title: Don't ask questions, Enjoys the ride
reviews.content: Let's be honest here, there are enough plot holes between this one and Top Gun 1986 to fill up the Grand Canyon which is why I only went as high as an 8 rating.That aside it is a very good, fun film to go watch, especially in a theatre. So don't get too hung up on the things that don't make a lot of sense and have fun!

reviews.review_title: Believe the Hype! Maverick Blows the Original Away!
reviews.content:
For fans clamoring for a modern & significantly better sequel to Top Gun, lo and behold, Maverick is the answer to our prayers. With one for the books kind of action sequences, this film completely blew away the original, a rare feat for reprised titles.Before we rave about the action however, worth to highlight that the casting done for Maverick was on point. The new faces were solid in their roles particularly Miles Teller, whose resemblance to Anthony Edwards was uncanny. Glen Powell & John Hamm as anti heroes, were perfect complements to Tom & Miles as the scenes they share were electric. To top it off, seeing Val Kilmer as Iceman sent shivers down my spine as it was surreal.As for the action, absolutely EPIC! Great work by Joseph Kosinski and Tom Cruise for producing an authentic "aerial warfare" experience that rivals that of Christopher Nolan's Dunkirk. Amazing that they weren't conservative with these scenes either, as these tension-filled & intense sequences were abundant, resulting to an edge of your seat experience that the original plainly lacked.My only knack in Maverick is the unavoidable cheese-fest. It does add substance to the storyline and I'm glad it was dialed down compared to the original, but yes, the drama is a tad predictable and a buzzkill at certain points. Nevertheless, the fun and excitement are impossible to be spoiled!Overall, Maverick has definitely cemented its place as one of the best action films of 2022. The hype and build up to its release was well worth it as it is really a well executed film, brimming with energy, authenticity and well intentioned bravado. Sorry for doubting you Tom
Cruise!

What a ride, what a film. This could actually be the greatest sequel ever made. Storyline is brilliant, visuals are incredible. Musical score 10/10.You won't be disappointed with this reboot of an 80's classic. Tom cruise has absolutely nailed' this performance.

Top Gun: Maverick (2022)Now that's how you make a sequel! Top Gun Maverick delivers spectacular action, retains the old bravado themes of 80s and pays a tribute to Tom Cruise's incredible dedication and passion as an actor. Despite getting old, Maverick never became affected by some post-modernistic disease that writers like to use for iconic characters. Instead, he remained a kickass pilot, an inspirational individual and most importantly a hero who isn't willing to take a back seat when facing a challenge.In this film, Maverick is recalled back to Top Gun to train the academy's best gradutes for a deadly mission. Being the only pilot with actual combat experience, he puts on his personal style of training that will push the students to the brink and mold them into true soldiers. While Tom's passion is the driving force of this film, what actually keeps it moving is the presence of a goal, unlike its predecessor. It is an absolutely nonsensical goal suitable for a James Bond or a Star Wars movie but nonetheless, it does the job of building up the narrative and delivering on the climax.Admittedly, the film does start in a slow way with lots of talking, but Tom's charisma keeps it afloat until the third act, which delivered the definition of a climax. Not only did I catch myself holding my breath, but I also had sweaty palms from the on-screen intensity. Because of the practical elements, the exhilarating action felt tangible and the realism on the actors' faces made me believe that they were actually inside the cockpit. The audio is second to none and i definitely regret not watching it in IMAX.Tom's passion and care for the film was visible in every gesture, emotion and action. The supporting cast was well selected and actually fit their roles without any nonsense, which is a rarity in modern cinema. It felt good to watch a non CGI blockbuster with heroic themes delivered by one of Hollywood's last stars. A huge upgrade on the original that deserves to be experienced on the biggest screen.Movies.shmovies on Instagram for honest movie and TV Show reviews.

reviews.review_title: Best film I've ever seen. 🎉 (10/10) Must watch!
reviews.content: Haven't watched the first one as it was before my time but after seeing this tonight with friends I want to see it because it'll fall into place. Regardless, the suspense, action was unreal. I was laughing, crying it was brill. X.
This sequel far surpasses the original. What's there to say beyond what has already been said in other comments. Go see the movie, you won't regret it.

Amazing movie especially in 4d. Worth the pricey tickets. Constant intensity and action, and amazing story. There's drama, action, and thrilling scenes. Absolutely loved it. Trust me, 4d is the best pick, it wont affect motion sicken people too much (from exp).
This is the reason I go to the movies. Shear entertainment from the moment it started. I'm going to go see it again. I have never done That. The Ariel scenes are just special.

Great acting, great directing, good mix of story and action. Very realistic dog fighting scenes, great cinematography, supporting actors all did a great job, deep believable characters. Just when you think you have it figured out, you do not, there is a new twist, a new wrinkle, a new direction full of unexpected adventure. The writers and directors did a great job of keeping you on the edge of your seat. Just when you think it cannot get better, it gets better and brings you to an extremely exciting and satisfying conclusion. This is not just a movie you want to see, you want to purchase it to watch iver and over again.

reviews.review_title: This is what movie theatres were made for.
reviews.content: "Top Gun: Maverick" is basically a 1940's B-movie about WWII flyboys, updated to present time, brimming with stereotypical characters and cliched dialogue and situations.So, why 9 stars? Because it's freaking entertaining, that's why, and that's what movies should be all about, not about preaching some socio-political message to a captive audience that just wants a little escapism and fun now and then. There's no "lesson" here, other than perhaps the idea that, yeah, the human element is still necessary in this age of ultra high-tech robotics and automation. Drones and unmanned crafts have their place, but you're always gonna need those guys who fly by the seat of their pants and can think on their feet...or, rather, as Maverick dramatically emphasizes.... DON'T think up there!And, you don't have to be a fan of the first movie to enjoy this one! In fact, I had never seen the original "Top Gun" until a relatively short time ago, after hearing about the upcoming sequel. That movie did absolutely nothing for me, and I remember almost nothing about it. After initially intending to skip this one, I decided to see it mainly for the aerial sequences, little realizing what a pleasant surprise I was in for!Yes, this is a welcome return to what we really want in a movie, and is well served by a big-screen presentation.So, what else is there to say?...go see it!

My husband dragged me in the movie theatre to see this one. I wasn't a fan of Top Gun - frankly, I thought part one was kinda ok but a bit boring.But this movie.OMG, it has all the feels.The story was sooo good, it was a rollercoaster of emotions; some scenes had me at the edge of my seat, at one scene I almost cried... This isn't a simple war movie, this is a drama and a romance and the young hero journey and "how to cope with getting old" story, all rolled into one, written so well that every one of these aspects is woven tightly with the others into a tapestry that is life.This may be the best movie Tom Cruise has ever made.We've seen it twice. We're definitely getting the BlueRay. It's a keeper.

reviews.review_title: Best movie in the past 30 years at least
reviews.content: Incredible movie that had everything: suspense, comedy, heart, nastalgia. Better than the original. This is one movie you need to see in the theater, and not just stream at home.

Seems just a hyped up re-run of the first movie with the assignment for this time to hit the weak point on the Death Star and destroy it. A better film about true heroes taking terrible chances is The Right Stuff. All this flick has lissome very good flight cinematography and Tom Cruise splaying the same role he usually plays, which is starting to get a little boring after all of ththese years. The scenes of the air craft carrier and the bar all of the pilots frequent also has better scenes in The Right Stuff while Sam Sheppard plays Chuck Yeager and the in that scene the real Chuck Yeager is bartender! Nobody can improve on that--the real hero who first went where no one had gone before is in the movie! This flick doesn't have a single original idea. What a disappointment!

Sequels to blockbusters don't always work, this one may actually be better. Even though this one's called Maverick, the story is focused on more characters than the original. That also allows for a deeper story. Cinematography achieved what they set out to do. Very impressed, well done.

reviews.review_title: This is how you how do a movie
reviews.content: This was one of the best movies of the year it was better than the original and it beats it by a mile, but the original was amazing. Every single scene shot was just pure and perfect.

reviews.review_title: Greatest movie I've seen in quite some time!
reviews.content: One word to describe this movie... epic, excellent, fun, adrenaline rush, nail biting tension,.. and the list goes on. One word simple can't do this movie justice. Rarely have I been so entertained and involved in a movie. This one has it all - and then some!

reviews.review_title: Utterly Forgettable Cliche-Ridden Formulaic Bombastic Schlock
reviews.content: Utterly Forgettable Cliche-Ridden Formulaic Bombastic Schlock - this is the best description of this awful movie. What can go possibly wrong here? I say - seemingly everything in thus eerie cheesy childish silly shallow jingoistic war-mogering too patriotic to be true effort. Tom Cruise is just him again - same look, same pathetic style. Not even a touch of good self-deprecating humor like he does in Mission Impossible franchise.The casting is OK...but the dialog is so bad, you cannot believe your own ears. Callous, dry, pathetic, kiddish and shallow. The plot is just a patriotic game to the excess. The aerial shots are the only great things here. The very utter impossibility of the whole premises seems laughable. Not even Jennifer or Val could save this from a bombing down utterly.Tom is wrong here, very wrong and on the false slide. Trajectory chosen is fairly silly. Watch it once and discard.

While I don't have a personal connection to the original film, it was a bit before my time even if I have seen it once or twice over the years, I quite enjoyed this one.On the ground you can feel the palpable tension between the egos of the various pilots, there are some touching call backs to the original film, and these segments are just the right length to feel effective while not dragging down the pace of the film. If I had any sort of "complaint" it's that as someone who doesn't have any particular nostalgia for the original film, some of this stuff probably didn't hit me as hard as it does for others.However the main draw of the film is the action in the air, and here it certainly doesn't disappoint either. It's energetic, exciting, and the climax is full of edge of your seat tension that's worth seeing on the big screen. It feels like they've commited an Ace Combat game to film, which is really impressive given all the practical stunt work that's on display.

I'm honestly lost for words. This is just a perfect sequel to a classic original..... I don't want to write any spoilers but it's one of those movies that stays with you after you leave the theatre.A perfect homage to the original.

reviews.review_title: Top sequel that outguns the original
reviews.content: Much much better than I was actually expecting. I find the original to be a very mixed bag, but this was a really great sequel. I was surprised at how much of an emotional punch this one had with Tom Cruise's character revisiting old characters and memories of his early Top Gun years, especially with Iceman. The flight action sequences are incredible and so well done I was hooked the entire time and on the edge of my seat. There's a few nods to the original too and the music still rocks. Honestly this might be the biggest surprise of 2022 for me so far.8/10.
A move that you and all can watch, minimum to no CGI.Tom is the 1 action actor period.Hard work real acting.No political or religious issues.I need to go back and see it again and again.

reviews.review_title: A great escape... with incredible jet scenes
reviews.content: Sure, many things were unrealistic. Sure, the plot was pretty predictable.BUT, it was en extremely entertaining film to experience. Love the fight scenes and feeling the power of the jets.Highly recommend if you like action, great soundtrack, and want to feel like you're flying jets.

Imagine this ...you're just a child, crazy about planes and fighter jets and then you get to watch Top Gun. From that moment on a standard has been set for fighter jets movies. More than 20 years has passed, while waiting for such a great movie/sequel to reappear, the expectations are so high it's almost not realistic and therefore chances are high to only be disappointed of such a movie/sequel, because Top Gun is simply part of your cinema foundation ...and then after +20 years comes Top Gun: Maverick ..even exceeding your expectations!Let this movie be THE example of how to make a proper sequel.
This will be a classic in years to come. An awesome film, great cast, and action sequences that will give you motion sickness.Watched this in IMAX for a full experience and it did not disappoint.

No one agonized over pronouns!There were no transgender people in this movie!There was even an implied heterosexual sex scene!I don't understand how a movie like this can still be made???Other than the above issues (very disturbing to our modern and enlightened sensibilities) this was a great movie!

reviews.review_title: A sequel well worth the wait
reviews.content: A sequel to "Top Gun" has been teased for at least a decade and was even meant to come out in 2019 but got delayed further until 2022. Now that the sequel has finally landed, was it worth the wait? I'd say the answer is a resounding yes.Tom Cruise returns as Pete "Maverick" Mitchell and assumes the role of flying instructor at his former academy, TOPGUN, where he has to train the next generation of jet pilot recruits for an impossible mission. Can Maverick train the new recruits to complete the mission successfully and make it safely back home? That remains to be seen.As a sequel to "Top Gun", "Top Gun: Maverick" packs an emotional punch along with plenty of tense moments to keep the audience on the edge of their seats where the flying sequences and sound effects alone make the film worth seeing in theaters. The action is great but there are also heartfelt moments involving Maverick's relationship to characters and events from the first movie, including the tragic loss of his wingman Goose. Although not many cast members from the original "Top Gun" reprise their roles in the sequel, Val Kilmer returns in a supporting role as Iceman and even though his cameo in the sequel is relatively minor, you can still feel Iceman and Maverick's strong bond from the original movie which further adds to the sequel's emotional core.Overall, "Top Gun: Maverick" is a fantastic sequel that retains the coolness factor of the original as well as delivering an emotional impact which makes it a sequel well worth the long wait.

This was by the best movie I have watched in a long time! Joseph Kosinski did a great job directing and the producers did a wonderful job making the movie come together. I feel like it is really hard to make a sequel to a movie better than the first one especially how far apart they were produced, but this movie surpassed the original. The flying scenes were amazing, there were times I felt like I was in the movie and was on the edge of my seat. The camera angle, dialogue and point of view really helped enhance the movie. As a viewer I felt like I was in this amazing action movie. Casting was done perfectly, the actors and actresses that the casting directors chose were perfect for each role.

Two main things:1) It was better than I expected - and I expected it to be good. I love the original and felt there was a lot to live up to.2) The best movie I have seen in years. And I don't say that lightly.My family and I love movies. We are also generally easily pleased. We like action. We relish humor. We appreciate great cinematography. We enjoy a good story line. And we love great acting.This has all aspects. The filming of this movie was done superbly well, if you know much about the original, in certain regards, you know that was not hard to do. But even compared to most movies these days, with their bountiful use of CGI, this was exceptionally done. You can really see the difference.I could ramble on and on and be a little fanboy but I won't. The cast did a great job. Before watching the movie I wasn't so sure but now, it was spot on.My wife and I both said the same thing - we could have turned right around and watched it again.I will end saying this: it is better than the original. Not something you can often say.

reviews.review_title: Testament of Studio Filmmaking in the Era of CGI.
reviews.content: Top Gun Maverick is a profound cinematic experience with marvelous actions, heart-touching emotions, and exceptional cinematography. This movie is a testament to what studio filmmaking should be all about in the era of CGI.

reviews.review_title: THE BEST SEQUEL SINCE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK!!
reviews.content: Every single part of this movie was perfect acting scenery sound effects music and so so so much more it respects the original and doesn't just use it for the cheap nostalgia like so many sequels of older movies.

reviews.review_title: Worth something a lot more than the hype
reviews.content: It's difficult to summarize a sequel to a film that's had mass following for several decades. It's one thing when it's simply a sequel that fits in - one where we can say "well, it's about damn time" - and another thing entirely when, well, no one was expecting it.The thing with this film is that, when it was announced, no one really spurred it on nor really advocated for it, despite it looking so good, but that's exactly the point: a film would have to be that much better to perform in that context, compared to any other, and that's exactly what Top Gun Maverick does.Such a visually stunning film, without forcing any agenda nor emotional connection: it simply creates itself as it's own sort of film with the right kind of nostalgia, making it... worth something a lot more than the hype.

reviews.review_title: And tha's how you make a great movie.
reviews.content: Top Gun is a successful recipe of nostalgia and action. Although it relies on a slightly altered version of the original Top Gun story, it still is a unique movie on so many perspectives. The surest thing is that Tom Cruise knows what the audience wants. People don't want fake airplanes and pilots acting like space cowboys. People want REALISM. They want it to be as real as possible. As few green screens as possible, as less CGI as possible. Actors struggling to breath, feeling the G powers on their body.I've seen lots of fighting airplane movies claiming to be the next Top Gun. None delivered this promise until this one. Yes, the next Top Gun movie is a Top Gun movie too! ;)
Epic movie this one. Real movie and stunt, we all has been missing this real people real story movie amongst all the 99% cgi-ed movies with rubbish storyline. Will watch again!!!!!

What else is there to say about this movie that a trailer wouldn't tell you? Is it a soft reboot of the 80's cheese and US NAVY commercial that is the original Top Gun? Yes. Does it wallow around in its own nostalgia? A little. Does this movie kick more ass then any other summer box office Goliath this year? Absolutely.Between covid stalling the release and a gimmick centered around real life cockpit shots of the beautiful insane man Tom Cruise and friends, as they pull--honest to god--real G's, thousands of feet in the air... it seemed like "Top Gun: Maverick" was going to a be a shallow cash grab of a homoerotic fighter jet classic. This movie is a cash grab, but every second of the jet engines screaming across the screen and the camera mounted inside and out of these angels of death, more then forgive the nature of the films inception.Cruise--the endless charisma magnet--does nothing but ooze personality in every scene hes in. Usually standing next to stock cardboard pilots on his air force suicide mission crew. Miles Teller as Goose's son (hilariously dubbed Rooster) does what he can with the role, and Jennifer Connelly puts in a subtle performance as a jaded bar tender. But the second Cruise gets in the cockpit, the film is his.Sounds are explosive, delivering thrilling shock and awe. Music is fine with requisite callbacks. Editing is fast paced, keeping you involved, while begrudgingly pumping the brakes for softer character moments not taking place in an F-18. And the effects flipping between real life fighters and the in-cockpit performances are seamless.The film is truly a shinning gem amongst superhero fatigue and animated musicals when it comes to mainstream box office fair. Its story is forgettable but its moments are one of a kind. But all roads come back to Cruise.He is an enigma. A film making supernova. An utter and complete maniac. What he does to draw your eyes to a movie screen is nothing short of magic. He is the life of the party. He is hitting red on roulette every turn causing the table to erupt. He is jumping between buildings, ACTUALLY flying planes, throwing his body out of cars."Top Gun: Maverick" solidifies Tom Cruise isn't done putting an excited smile on your face every time he steps in front of the camera.
Joseph really does know how to create a movie. He's such a great film director. Digs deep in movies. Love his oblivion and tron legacy. Every Joseph movie is amazing!!!

Thank you to everyone who made this movie, that's a real life of a fighter pilot!Beautifully put
Tom cruise big thanks for this movie!!!!!Must see for generations to come.That music! Ah! One cant begin To imagine the feel of that movie! Im sure it'll inspire youth to be a fighter pilot!Very inspiring and moving
Happy landings to all the fighter pilots out there
More strength to their family members!I felt this movie shoul never end
It must keep going on and on and on. Best actor ever, he has indeed all the Emotions in this one
Maybe he'll be admiral in other parts to come, haha!!Great team efforts
No words are enough for this movie
First was legendary but to keep that alive
This movie has done wonders
I thought maybe they'll not be about to live upto the expectations of the first one but that ain't true!It's a legend in itself
I'm watching it on repeat
Story line is marvellous, out of the box without hurting any countries sentiments.

reviews.review_title: Top Gun: Maverick Takes Off into the Danger Zone
reviews.content: Hey, Streamers, let's fly off into the Danger Zone. Yes, it's Top Gun: Maverick time. The sequel you have been waiting almost 40 years for, which was supposed to come out 2 years ago, is finally here. Now, I have never seen the original film, but I was keen to see what all the hype around this sequel was about. Tom Cruise has made good choices over the years and he's always going full tilt in these action roles, so I didn't expect for this to disappoint. Here's how it goes.Even though Top Gun: Maverick is a present-day sequel to the original Top Gun (1986), the movie really leans into that old-fashioned, 1980's action film vibe. Also, there is a big spoiler from the original film that is central to the story of this sequel - Maverick's wingman, Goose, died. Here, Goose's son, Rooster (Miles Teller), is one of the elite Navy aviators, who Maverick (Tom Cruise) is tasked with training for what's considered an important but impossible mission. There is tension between Maverick and Rooster because of their fraught history. There is tension between Maverick and his superiors because he is notorious for going rogue. Nevertheless, Maverick is the best and the mission requires the best. High-flying hijnks ensue.Top Gun: Maverick is the kind of movie that begs to be seen on a big screen. In my opinion, the story is not really great or innovative, so the actions sequences, stunts and camera work have to justify the price of admission. Luckily, they very much do. The aerial shots and all of the fighter jets flying have to be seen on a big screen to truly be appreciated. The rumble of the jets and the perceived danger add to the tension that builds up through the movie and explodes in the final sequences. While there is an attempt to build an emotional core to the film by focusing on Maverick and Rooster's relationship and also a slight love interest on the side, those relationships barely register and seem almost superfluous. Honestly, they could've cut the love story and the film would have been the same but 10-15 minutes shorter - that would have given them the ability to cultivate the Maverick and Rooster relationship, which would have been more impactful.Some of this movie is so retro as to be kind of corny. Glen Powell plays Hangman. He's one of the cockiest aviators in the Top Gun program. Powell plays it like the quintessential 1980's movie villain, which was groan-inducing at times, but some may love it. Tom Cruise is at his Tom-Cruise-iest, which isn't a bad thing. Movies need stars and Tom Cruise is still a movie star. He still has the charm to pull off Maverick's character. As the movie leans into the nostalgia, Tom Cruise makes it worthy of being on a big screen. This movie desperately needs that.Nevertheless, what was presented was certainly entertaining. There will be times when the flying will have you on the edge of your seat. That's why a movie like this is made. In that way, it is quite successful.Ultimately, Top Gun: Maverick is tailor-made to be seen in a movie theater. The feats of stunts and action are worthy of the big screen. There are times when you may be on the edge of your seat. Although the story is a bit lacking, the rest of the movie makes up for it and the 2-hour runtime flies by in a *wink*. Grab a box of popcorn and enjoy this spectacle on a big screen.

reviews.review_title: A movie that dares to be great in the face of modern mediocrity
reviews.content: There is an unspoken rule that sequels are almost always worse than the original, and, as you might expect, Maverick breaks that rule with style.This movie is a throw back to a time when most of the people involved in making a movie were in the business of entertainment and storytelling. It's fun, it's gripping, it's awesome. Practical effects return to show how much better they can be than soulless CGI. Legacy characters are respected and developed rather than being torn down. The audience is entertained rather than preached to or lectured.Movies like this have become an endangered species, and until bankruptcy starves out the media industry's current ideological infection, they are not likely to come along often. So, if you haven't already, treat yourself to this masterpiece, spend a couple of hours being reminded of what good storytelling can bring to the table, and enjoy that rarest of treats: a sequel that actually builds on and surpasses what made you love the original.

This movie fixed everything that didn't work in the first, and Significantly improved everything that did. It added real stakes - an extreme mission only someone crazy could pull off. The aerial scenes were extraordinary and memorable. The plot grips you, and the acting was excellent. It did real Justice to the original with its call backs and vibe. This is an excellent film. 92%

What can i say about this amazing movie which hasnt been said already. The things they are able capture in camera with little to no vfx with all the jet sequence is just breathtaking. Great music great vibes with spectacular stunts makes this movie one of the best of the this year and my second favorite movie right behind everything everywhere all at once. Must watch on big screen.

This movie is entertaining, jaw-dropping and with a very captivating story.The score was amazing (Hans Zimmer amongst others), the movie had some of the best shots i've ever witnessed inside of a theatre , and the story was enjoyable, it was refreshing to be transported outside our world for once, straight into a great story with great and well-written characters.(Honorable mention for Miles Teller, such a great actor).

This movie is an absolute blast from start to finish. I don't know that there is any way you could have expected more from this. I found myself asking multiple times, how could this movie be good? It's about 36 years since Top Gun came out, and all of the characters outside of the ageless Tom Cruise are pretty much out of the game, understandably so.The flight scenes are incredible. I can't compare it to anything really. They keep you on the edge of your seat and are breathtaking. The movie is funny. The humor is almost indirect, but it works so well. The new characters are really well done. They do a really nice job of honoring the first film. This is probably the first movie I have seen of this new wave of movies to arrive years after their predecessor, to actually serve the older main character well. Maverick is a badass, and it's obvious even as an older dude. A lot of times these movies have the older familiar face there just to introduce new characters (Star Wars is probably the worst offender off the top of my head), this is not the case with Top Gun: Maverick and I love it so much for that.The bottom line is: if you are on the fence about seeing this movie in the theater, you need to get there and watch it. It's phenomenal. It's emotional. I loved it. It's everything you want from a movie.

First one was directed by Tony Scott and among all the stories told on this second installment of Top Gun, the last thing which hits the bull's eye was the dedication to late director Tony Scott. Loved every single minute of it. All the appropriate sentiments were there at the perfect moments. It hit so many happy spots of my brain that I lost count. Sound effects and the music were fantastic. I don't even want to start with the arial shots, they are out of this world. There's not a single second of boring shot in this masterpiece of a motion picture. It gets a well deserved damn 10/10 from me.

reviews.review_title: best movie this year so far
reviews.content: This movie is just a masterpiece no one can deny that you will never get bored it 2 hours of absolute excitement the scenes in the box of the plane is just insane this movie will bring good cinema back absolute masterpiece we need to see more movies like this one music is good not that great but it's very good the plane scenes reminded me of interstellar a little bit but it's still so good tom cruise is a legend they have to make a 3rd movie with the same vibe it would be a shame if he didn't win an oscar the cast is such a perfect cast story is good I really recommend to catch this movie in cinema for the sound experience.

I was, and still am, a big fan of the original and when I heard this was coming out, I didn't think it could surpass the original. It did.It has enough to stand on its own as a film for today's audiences but enough nostalgia to take you back to the 80's watching the original.The visuals were stunning, action sequences were epic and also had a really good believable story to set up the final act. I'd easily pay again to watch this again in the cinema. And that opening sequence..... Dong!

reviews.review_title: An impressive technical achievement given the CG world of cinema today
reviews.content: You certainly don't see movies like this anymore, and Tom Cruise wanted to ensure if a sequel was made, it was done exactly to these specifications.The most impressive part of this film is just how much of it was shot live and not infront of a green screen. If you manage to watch the bonus features, you'll really appreciate the lengths not just Tom Cruise went to, to ensure these shots were truly real, but many of the other actors who participated as well. There are few actors who would go to such lengths for the sake of a movie's integrity and viewers experience, and this movie exemplifies his devotion to the craft.All of that being said, I do feel like the hype around this movie is more indicative of Hollywood and the woke culture lately. People have endured an intense malaise for over a decade, with a testosterone crushing level of man shaming and non-stop depressing stories that leave people walking away from the theatre with lower and lower expectations.I did think the picture overall was great and embodied alot of the characteristics we used to know and love in older classic films. There was however alot of stereotypical scriptwriting and many scenes were very predictable. I found myself several times finishing the lines before they were spoken.Although I didn't think it was as worthy of the grandstanding others seem to be giving it, we still have to recognize that this is a sequel, and when it comes to sequels, I can count on one hand the number of times Hollywood managed to make the second as good as the first. In some respects I would say this one was better, as you could tell Tom had alot more freedom and control over making it exactly how he wanted.

reviews.review_title: Best movie I'll watch all year.
reviews.content: This is a movie that hits every point exactly the way it should. There's nostalgia but you're not beaten with it and it doesn't seem forced or gratuitous. The personal conflict is great. The action is fantastic. Everything about this movie is spot on.
Pleasantly surprised! Not usually something I would usually be into or watch. But had to see what the hype was about and it exceeded my expectations. A fantastic summer blockbuster.

reviews.review_title: One of the rare legacy sequels that surpasses the original in every way
reviews.content: In an age filled with movies relying overly on computer generated imagery, it is refreshing to see a film that primarily utilizes practical effects to achieve even the most difficult of sequences, and the approach has clearly paid off. With Top Gun: Maverick, Tom Cruise and Joseph Kasinski delivers a thoroughly engaging, riveting and emotionally impactful sequel to a classic blockbuster, while simultaneously managing to improve upon the original in every possible way.There is perhaps no other actor other than Tom Cruise who has managed to consistently maintain the same level of global stardom and public relevance for over four decades. Nearly 35 years later, Cruise returns to his iconic role of Pete "Maverick" Mitchell, the role that solidified his global stardom. Cruise once again showcases his acting talents and his unparalleled dedication to the craft as he along with other cast members, perform complex and difficult flight/aerial combat sequences that is all done practically by the actors themselves, with little to no usage of CGI. The rigorous flight training undergone by Cruise and the other cast members totally paid off, as all the aerial sequences, particularly the entire third act, forms the strongest aspect of the film. The dogfight sequences are quite possibly the best ever put to film and are constantly engaging and thrilling and keeps you at the edge of your seats throughout, due to realistic and accurate portrayal of them.Another strong aspect of the movie was its emotional weight. The film has numerous callbacks and homages to the original film that manages to tug at your heartstrings particularly for long-time fans of the original film, as they manage to evoke a sense of nostalgia in them. However none of these come across as cheap nostalgia-bait or fan service, which has become common in many new Hollywood blockbusters. Instead, these are perfectly incorporated with the story and are even necessary for the development of Maverick's character. The impact of Goose's death in the first film is present throughout this film and the effect the event had on Maverick was perfectly portrayed. Maverick trying to be a surrogate father to Goose's son, played by Miles Teller and his subsequent relationship with him, forms the emotional center and the true heart of the movie. Val Kilmer's return as Tom "Iceman" Kazansky was a truly delightful inclusion and resulted in one of the most emotionally powerful moments in the film.The cinematography by Claudio Miranda was another noteworthy aspect as the film is filled with gorgeous visuals. The sequences are made even more powerful by the exceptional music composed by Harold Faltermeyer and Hans Zimmer. May it be a heart to heart exchange between two characters or an intense dogfight sequence, the music always manages to perfectly fit and elevate the impact of the sequences.With exceptionally crafted aerial combat sequences, beautiful cinematography, emotional weight, nostalgic callbacks and a spectacular central performance by Tom Cruise, Top Gun: Maverick succeeds at being one of the best legacy sequels ever made along with the likes of Mad Max: Fury Road and Blade Runner 2049, while simultaneously paying respect to the original film and further solidifying Cruise's unrivalled starpower.

reviews.review_title: Extremely well written, which makes for a seriously impressive story and movie. High octane action and the best most vulnerable and human performance of Tom Cruise's career
reviews.content: "Thirty-plus years of service. Combat medals. Citations. Only man to shoot down three enemy planes in the last 40 years. Yet you can't get a promotion, you won't retire, and despite your best efforts, you refuse to die. Yet here you are, Captain. Why is that?"For fans of: Top Gun, Tom Cruise, actionA perfect sequel in every way. The original is a classic but tbh it is dated now. This was no cash-in on past achievements or a trio down memory lane. This was an epic film in every way, which happened to be a sequel and also ties in narratively with its predecessor in such a smart way. 100x more high octane in-air action than was in the original. 100x more human and moving story about family, the passing of time, striving for great things, etc. Never has Tom Cruise been so humbling, human, and vulnerably endearing and acted out the full range of emotions. His best performance to date. So glad they waited and waited until this film was ready to be seen on the big screen.Immersion/Escapism: 10/10Length/Pacing: 10/10Originality: 9/10Characters: 9/10Acting: 9/10Substance & Themes: 9/10Emotional effect: 7/10.

reviews.review_title: Cheesy AF; a Cash-Grab; & 75% Boring, 25% Unoriginal/Predictable
reviews.content: One way of thinking about this movie is that a third of it is Captain Pete "Mav" (played by Tom Cruise) training other pilots, a third is Mav smiling with feel-good music playing in the background, and a third is the actual mission, a.k.a. The action part. The training is painfully uninteresting and cheesy. The smiling is fine because it's expected and creates a positive atmosphere for the viewer. It also makes the viewer more attached to the character when that character is in trouble later in the movie.The actual mission is the last third and I have the most to say about that. I should point out that it probably was not a third in terms of the actual portion of the movie that it covered. More accurately, it's probably about a fifth of the movie or less. This was the best part of the movie, but even this was not great or even that good. As mentioned, it's a fairly smaller part of the movie. But beyond that, the scenes are completely predictable. Now, just because something is predictable does not necessarily make it bad. The feeling here is that this action-part of the movie feels like watching the trailer over and over for 20-30 minutes. There is nothing that unique about the entire scene. The only positive aspect of it is that it's not boring.One last note, the storyline, it almost doesn't exist. The storyline is that there's a mission that has to be completed. That's it. In summation, the movie leaves a lot to be desired.

reviews.review_title: This is what an action movie should be
reviews.content: This movie was nothing ground breaking, and yet it's one of the best movies I've seen in theaters for years. This movie knows exactly what it is, and what the audience wants. There wasn't 500 different sub plots, no big lazar in the sky to blow up the world, no SJW message, just a simple story. That's all it needed to do, and it does it. They focus on having good characters who have their own weaknesses, yet grow and learn, and become better people by the end of the film. Tom cruise dose a great job. And we can't forget about the action. Freaking awesome. This movie will hold up for years because it's so realistic. Just amazingly captured action. All I can say is Bad a**

I've heard Top Gun Maverick described as a sequel to the 1986 classic. It is not. It's another chapter in the story, a story that has moved on 35 years. The 1986 film might have got a six if I was feeling generous. I still love it for what it was, but it doesn't hold a candle to this film.It's really hard to review without spoilers, so I'll only say this; if it had been made ten years ago I would have given it an eight. But it is now, and Maverick is the blockbuster for these times and for that it gets a ten. So does Cruise. Is he the last real Star? I think so.If you have any sense of pride, any patriotism, any love for the culture of your country go and see Top Gun Maverick, and be grateful that you still can.

I waited longer than I should've to watch this sequel, I was such a fan of the original, especially the nostalgia of that time period, think I was dreading a complete flop, but damn was this movie unbelievably good, had just enough of the original music/nostalgia sprinkled in with some of the most unbelievable shots of the jets in the air, loved Tom Cruise, he has made a modern masterpiece! The fact that the Iceman was in it too, wow really tugged at the old heartstrings! The whole last 20 + minutes of the movie is just pure adrenaline, trying hard not to give anything away, just go watch the movie and come back to thank me lol.

There is something something with uranium that needs to be blown up. No details. Tom Cruise comes to the rescue. He is better than the best young trainees 2 generations younger. Het gets the girl, and is hired to save the mission. The girl on the runway in her porsche, Tom with his motorbike and sunglasses driving through the desert with the wind through his hair. Cliche cliche cliche. 80's revival.Old memories pop up. There is something emotional from the past that needs to be solved. Emotional scene.Time for action. Nice visuals but you know what will happen.What a thin cheesy plotline and so predictable.
This movie, while great on its own, was a great Homage to the original. The opening evokes great memories and how they pulled in Ice Man was a great way to do it.

reviews.review_title: Learn from the Master of Sequels
reviews.content: I'm no fam of Tom Cruise, but he is the master of how to make good sequels. Top Gun Maverick is one of his most successful sequel, ever.Simply because he's not afraid being ridicule and always strive to make perfection. This ain't no perfect movie, but certainly has every aspect to be a blockbuster. It's not a copy but a step into extreme territory of high speed dog fight with some drama trickled in, own the character. Every actor was selected because they can own their characters. Admirals who stand their judgement ground, aeveral pretty girls who eyecandies the screen, actors who can copy but put some twists on their own.Very enjoyable and worth a place in Hollywood history.

It is about time a movie was made to entertain the audience and not preach to them. I highly recommend you go see this movie in the theater. They could not have made a better sequel that pays homage to the original and did it all with very little CGI crap. If you yearn for the glory days of movie-making go see this movie ASAP.
