If you were coming into this film expecting the same cheesy action flick like the first Top Gun, you would be sorely mistaken. The overall tone and story of Top Gun Maverick is more melancholic and intense than I anticipated. While there are dog fighting and training sequences that are definitely in the realm for a Top Gun film, the driving force of the story is the conflict between Rooster and Maverick as they come to terms with the past.¬¬But damn, the performances given in this film are just phenomenal. Cruise possibly gave his best performance ever as Maverick! I know right?! He brings Maverick's signature cockiness, but matches it with compassion that wasn't present in the first film. Miles Teller is a fantastic foil to Cruise, as well as being a good casting choice since he looks nearly identical to Goose's actor, Anthony Edwards. Rooster is the opposite of Maverick in every way and the amount of resentment towards his surrogate father figure is both palpable and understandable.Of course it would not be a Top Gun film without some jet-on-jet action. This not only elevates the action from the first film but it really keeps you on the edge of your seat, putting you in the cockpit with the other actors. Before I proceed further, I would like to mention that many of the actors, Cruise included, actually flew these fighter jets themselves. These ingenious stunt sequences lead to what I have to say are some of the most realistic and suspenseful sequences I have ever seen! They also lead to some brilliant cinematography as well; beautiful shots of the bright blue sky to the claustrophobic nature of the cockpit. It was something to behold.Top Gun Maverick is not just a great sequel to a classic 1980s film, but one of the best sequels to ever be produced, arguably up there with Terminator 2: Judgment Day. Phenomenal acting by the entire cast, gives tremendous weight to the atmospheric melancholy. And the action sequences are the best of the best, with gorgeous cinematography to help feel the dire and tense nature of a fighter pilot. Top Gun may have been entertaining with its cheesy popcorn action, but Top Gun Maverick brings more humanity and intensity than the first to make it possibly one of the best films of the year.

I'm not sure what is worse...
The acting, script, make up (dude, lay off the blush) or the fact that (imo) this movie is CRIMINALLY overrated. My girlfriend and I were literally shocked speechless at how stilted the acting was. And we are both fans of the original, so it has nothing to do with the subject matter.I think the disgustingly high rating is due to the overall "dumbing-down" of society in general. Mediocre has become the new high mark and a public that devours TikTok, Twitter and Snap like gospel deserves nothing better I suppose. This is the drivel that captivates the audience that enables "social media influencers".Tom should stick to his cult "religion" and, after this schlock-fest, Shia should stay in the WWII tank movie and drunk & disorderly arrest video wheelhouse.....and let the "down-votes" commence....

This movie brings audience back to an era of true cinema. Not theme-park type films we've seen from Marvel that has corrupted the box office. Top Gun: Maverick gives the audience what they want and what they had no idea they wanted along with so much more. An absolute must watch!!

You know....if I wanted to watch virtually the SAME film that I watched once in the 1980s.... I would simply just toss aside my intelligence and re-watch Top Gun from 1986 and then declare myself officially clueless.Sorry , but I thought the first one was bad enough, but to pretty much make the same picture with minimal differences...hey, why not just call the movie, "Another Top Gun Too" ?Or , "Top Gun : Never Ending Story" ?You want to save yourselves time everyone. Put on the first one,
and put a mirror in front of your TV and there you go! Top Gun 2. Certainly save you a lot of money and your TV will not have to be subjected to streaming Maverick later .I will say, at least on the new soundtrack, there is One Republic's ,"I Ain't Worried". Which handily beats the worthless 1986 soundtrack and even the one this song is on.I was an '80s teenager ...but I certainly don't miss that decade and the last thing I or anyone needed, was a reminder just how lame some of it's entertainment attempts could be.1 star.Tom ....stick to higher drama that actually speaks far better for your acting skills. This was no better than a reboot of a long gone TV series. (END)

reviews.review_title: Stunning blockbuster that surpasses all expectations with flying colors
reviews.content: In 1986, "Top Gun" changed American blockbuster cinema forever. Besides being a powerful military recruitment tool, the film captivated audiences with Tom Cruise's charismatic performance as Maverick, captivating aerial dogfighting scenes, and a now-iconic soundtrack. While that film is unquestionably a cultural touchstone of its era, I never have loved it the way that some people did. That said, as a fan of Tom Cruise's action films, I was most certainly looking forward to seeing the sequel. To my shock, the film is utterly outstanding and far better than it had any right to be--blowing the first film out of the water.The plot is relatively simple. Maverick is back as a flight instructor, and has to instruct a new class of fighter pilot recruits (among them the son of Goose from the first film) to take out an enemy nation's uranium enrichment facility. That may seem like a relatively simple or generic story, but the film's technical craftsmanship and emotional core are utterly superb and riveting throughout its entire runtime. The flight scenes are just impeccably shot, with top-notch cinematography, sound design, and editing. You truly feel like you're in the cockpit, and the results are utterly riveting, visceral, and thrilling. The sharp editing ensures that you can always keep track of who is who and what is what during these scenes, while simultaneously maintaining a strong sense of spatial awareness outside the aircraft(s.) It's been a long time--maybe even not since "Mission: Impossible--Fallout"--that I've seen action scenes filmed this well and wholly committed to technical filmmaking rather than CGI effects. Every single sound feels like it was carefully crafted to most accurately and authentically recreating the fighter pilot experience as possible.Any reviewer impressed by this film could go on and on about how technically stunning it is, but what else sets this film apart from other modern blockbusters is a strong devotion to powerful, emotionally impactful plot and character development-driven storytelling as well. Unlike many blockbuster franchises, this film manages to tell a thoroughly compelling and authentic story in the here and now rather than spend far too much of its runtime setting up a million sequels and spin-offs. Tom Cruise still remains as charismatic as ever as Maverick, but he's more thoughtful and wise this time. The new recruits are all very strong in their performances, especially Miles Teller; the emotional and dramatic tensions between him and Maverick over Goose's death feel realistic and believably raw. Jennifer Connelly is also great as Penny, a bar owner and Maverick's love interest. Val Kilmer's return as Iceman is also emotional and compassionate, helping solidify the impact of the film's stakes on the viewer. The screenplay is much sharper, tighter, smarter, and wittier than the first film, and never lets go of ensuring powerful interpersonal relationships between characters are felt to create a gripping and high-quality narrative. Unlike many other blockbusters that feel they could have been trimmed by 30 minutes or so, the film is practically immaculately paced--with no scenes that feel too long or too short to keep the audience thoroughly interested and entertained through its entire runtime of a little over 2 hours."Top Gun: Maverick" proves that you can have a summer blockbuster that manages to excel in the highest levels of technical and aesthetic prowess and never lose sight of a genuinely powerful, relevant, and thoughtful story--all while simultaneously keeping the audience entertained and thrilled from beginning to end. That's why I was so blown away by it, leaving the theater with a huge smile on my face. I hope others feel the same way too. 10/10Note: I saw the film in Dolby Cinema. Without question, this was an outstanding Dolby experience. The sound design utilized the Dolby Atmos system and bass incredibly well, and the rumble was utilized in tandem with increasing fighter jet engine noises. The picture quality, lighting, and color contrasts were excellent as well, and noticeably better than they would likely be on a standard screen.

reviews.review_title: Mr. Tom Cruise, thank you for making such great movies!
reviews.content: Back in 1986, when I was just 20 years old, I watched "Top Gun" at its premier. I was amazed by the scenes, the cast, the plot, and the adrenaline that the movie was transferring to me. Since then, I have watched this movie more than 100 times, and have been listening to its soundtrack non-stop. Even my children loved it! Top Gun never failed to amaze me! Now, 36 years later, I watched "Top Gun: Maverick", also at its premier. I was anticipating this moment since 2020, when the movie was first announced, but its distribution was cancelled due to the pandemic. I knew that Tom Cruise and his team would honour the legacy of the first movie and would try to surpass it. But you can never be sure. It is hard to beat the feeling of the "first time". About 2 hours and 11 minutes later the movie was over. And the question is: Did it manage to surpass the first one, or is it another desperate sequel? And my answer is: IT CERTAINLY DID! The movie is simply superb! The scenes, the cast, the plot, the connection to the past, the emotions and the excitement that it emits are unbelievably excellent! Mr. Tom Cruise, thank you for making such great movies! Thank you for letting your passion guide you, despite logic and criticism. I am more than certain that you deserve a place in the "Hall of Fame" of our heart.

reviews.review_title: Redeemed this awful year, what a movie
reviews.content: Top Gun Maverick is the best movie this year hands down. While it is not perfect, it truly does a grand stand job in allowing you to visualize and see the action in the air.I can imagine this is why the movie was so popular this year. Anyways, we have an atmos system with an oled and this movie really shines as one of the greatest movies for the setup now next to LOTR. The immersiveness and feel of the movie is top notch.Overall it beats all other movies this year. For improvement I think the ending could have been more epic if the US fleet had appeared, but maybe they are saving it for top gun maverick: 2.

reviews.review_title: I usually avert 1 or 10 review scores, but...
reviews.content: ... after such a long time from the original Top Gun and for what this movie was, how it was made, how it made me feel, how much I enjoyed it, I am hard pressed to think I could have been any more entertained. To expect that would be unreasonable from my part and I simply put sincerely loved this move.It says a lot that the nostalgia from the first one made me almost tear up from one single line, yet I don't feel like it was ever done in a "remember this" nostalgia baity way like a lot of other rehashed entertainment movies.Val Kilmer reprising his role too despite his real life health issues and it having been incorporated... It just made me want to give the man a standing ovation.This is one of the rare examples of a sequel done right.

An epic adrenaline rush created by some of the most unbelievable high-octane, real-life aerial sequences ever made. You feel like you've been in the jet the entire movie (prepare to sweat!). Calling this an action movie doesn't really do it justice - it's more of an immersive thrill ride.Top Gun: Maverick pays homage to its original on multiple occasions, filling you with nostalgia. A few of the characters are rather one-dimensional and some of the dialogue feels predictably simple, but the storyline delivers. Tom Cruise defies physics and his age once again, delivering on his promises of using real planes and no CGI.This is what a big blockbuster film can be! The bar has been raised and everyone else has been put on notice.Verdict: Watch it.

reviews.review_title: Loved it! It hasn't lost that lovin' feeling . . .
reviews.content: I was born in 1979, so 80 and 90s movies always bring me a bit of nostalgia. I loved the original Top Gun - it's definitely a classic in my book, so I didn't know where they were going to go with this storyline. I was worried in case it wasn't going to add anything original to the storyline, but was pleasantly surprised.For me, the movie had a really good mix of original script, awesome flight scenes and stunts, and the characters were really brought to life by the young bloods. If I'm being perfectly honest - it WAS clichéd in parts, but I don't think you can make a sequel like this without giving some nods to the original.*Spoilers*The "Goodness gracious great balls of fire" scene was predictable, and I think we could have got away without Rooster needing a moustache to know who his father was BUT the format from the first was followed and it's still a winning format in my eyes. We had the motorcycle racing the plane, we had the musical number, we had the romance, we had the loss of a fan favourite (but what a fantastic addition to the movie - we still love you Val), we had the beach scene (we ALL love a good beach scene), and we had the happy ending. If the ending hadn't been happy, then it wouldn't have been worth having.All in all I really loved this movie, and to be fair to Tom he's like a fine wine.

I regret not seeing this in cinema. I thought it was just overhyped and probably wouldn't be that be but it was just sooo simply enjoyable. Every movie has "clichés" but not every movie can pull them off and dam this movie does it so well I don't even realise.I was never a Huge fan of the original although it is good so I wasn't invested in it so much as a sequel compared to others and yet they still manage to give you that nostalgia with time cruise in blue Jeans white top with some classic vehicles and great camera work.I won't spoil the story but it sets itself up real nice so it doesn't feel too forced and whilst being a relatively simply story it doesn't come off that way.Just get some snacks and put your feet up.

The words can't express the feeling i had after walking out the cinema, i was shocked and amazed by this film.I had my expectations very low, but as usual tom cruise never fail you down with his films.I may say this is the best film this year no doubt.

reviews.review_title: MOVIE THEATER WORTHY, for the 1st time in years
reviews.content: Finally, we have a movie worth watching in theaters. Even considering the lockdowns for 2 years, truthfully their hadn't been a single movie worth watching in theaters in years. Besides the overdone superhero stories(because they've run out of ideas), what movie has been worth the outrageous amount of money we pay to watch in theaters? Any movie lover would agree w/ this.The movie was outstanding. Every character was well thought out. Considering the missing lead female character from movie 1, the female lead character was amazing. Honestly, she might have been better than the original female lead. Much more depth in her character.This was a movie that you "get into." I've spent years watching the same overdone CGI films w/ minimal story lines. Because of the realistic method it was filmed w/, I caught myself really REALLY getting into the movie. Each dramatic scene in the movie really catches you. You almost become emotionally involved in each character. Something I haven't experience in quite some time. Sighhhh of relief knowing my money was well spent.... for once.The last point is why the movie was as outstanding as it is. I can't say enough about how the movie draws you into each scene. Great from opening to close. Not much I can say in criticism. I'll have to watch it again to find those. May even go to theaters for a second dose of this one.

Watched it with my dad today. He saw it 36 years ago and bought the VHS for my brothers and I when it came out. It instantly became my favorite movie and that hasn't changed since I was a kid. I've watched it well over 500 times. I was moved to tears on several occasions with how well the movie was directed, scripted, and with character portrayal.The first one will always be my favorite movie of all time. My heart is full knowing it now has a sequel that's just as good and even better in some moments of the movie. Watching it with my dad brought it full circle for me. A moment I won't ever forget. Thank you, Tom and the cast, but specifically Tom. Your desire to never cheat the audience is supreme and second to none. I hope you know how much this second film means to those who are diehards of the first. Even at my age, I wanted to go to a Navy Recruiting depot and enlist as a pilot. Just as I did all those years ago after watching the first.10/10.

Fulfilled all expectations!! Made me feel like I was 14 again. Top Gun along with an Officer and Gentleman influence how my life ended up. Now 4 years removed as a retired Naval Aviator, I want to rejoin again.Thank you Tom!

I absolutely loved the first film, when I heard there was going to be a sequel I was dubious about how they were going to live up to the original. As let's face it, the recent sequels or remakes of older films have been more mediocre than wowing the audience's.This film was every bit as good as the original, if not better. The flight scenes were absolutely amazing, sound track had everyone singing in the cinema (especially the opening credits)Yes it was predictable and filled with a few cheesy scenes but who doesn't like a bit of cheese! Tom & Jennifer had amazing on screen chemistry! Rooster was cast brilliantly and the rest of the recruits were great additions to the cast as well.Was nicely done bringing Val Kilmer back as Iceman and how they incorporated his real life illness into the script.All in all this film is brilliant. If you haven't seen it yet, make sure you do. :-)

I watched it today with my dad and it was such a great time! Altogether I held my breath for at least 10 minutes during the movie and the 130 minutes literally flew by! It is good to know that there are still some people who can create such a movie without all the forced woke elements. Just good actors, a good story and breathtaking action! Thank you again for this masterpiece!

I was concerned that this sequel, like most sequels of classics, might hit wide of the mark. Well, I was massively wrong, this movie is great.Along with the adrenaline pumping, edge of your seat action, the foundation of this movie has heart, and Maverick's love interest side plot actually feels natural and not cheesy at all. It surpasses the original in every shape and form.Cruise's insistence on not having any CGI for the plane shots 100% pays off. Every plane scene is excellent, griping, and visually stunning. You truly feel that you are there with the pilots.This movie truly highlights why Cruise is one of the greatest movie stars of his generation. You will do yourself a massive disservice if you do not see this movie. This movie is probably going to end up being one of the best action movies of the decade.The callbacks to the original really feel you with a great sense of nostalgia, especially the opening song and Val's cameo, especially after recovering from throat cancer. After the opening song the rest of the score works perfectly, really adding to humour or seriousness of the scene.Overall the time will fly by, you will genuine laugh out loud at scenes, and by griped at the climax. If you can, go see this in an IMAX cinema as the visuals are fantastic.

All the actors in this did amazing! Loved the story and the flying scenes were fantastic, but the only thing was that I thought it was a little rushed. I get the movie was already long as it is but the scenes where they're practicing flying the course and they all failed, We literally watched none of them complete it and then maverick does it and the next scene is him picking people to fly with him even though none of them really completed it correctly. So I wish there were a couple more training scenes to make us believe that those pilots really are the "best of the best".The football scene was in there to show them how to work as a team and somehow, after that 5 minute scene, they're all best friends and working together perfectly?And lastly, I wanted a bigger moment between rooster and maverick at the end. They wrote a plot line where rooster hates him and is obviously somewhat blaming him for his dads death, and we never really get a conversation between the two of them about it. That could have been a good emotional moment of forgiveness and maverick being able to finally let it go.But overall this movie was so great! Everyone really brought their A game for this!
Boring, badly scripted and so horribly predictable.Lost the loving feeling during the first few scenes. Good special effects but most definitely did not Take my breath away.

reviews.review_title: Very cheesy, quite predictable and all awesome.
reviews.content: This film couldn't be anything but cheese and nostalgia, which is exactly what you get and it's fantastic. Parts made you roll your eyes at how dumb or obvious it was, but that's what we expected and that's what we wanted. Watch it on imax while you have the chance.For the guy who thought it wasn't realistic SPOILERS - it's just a film, not a documentary. Tom Cruise is just an actor..

reviews.review_title: Best Action Movie I've ever seen
reviews.content: I had high expectations prior to watching the film because of all the positive reviews AND THE FILM DID NOT DISAPPOINT IN THE SLIGHTEST. Through out the movie my heart raced, I cried, I laughed, and had goosebumps almost the entire time. This is what movies should strive to be like not cash grabs.

After watching this today in the cinema I can only say I left entertained, it is a great follow-on from the first and is by far the better of the two.The sequences involving planes have been aced.I'll happily watch this again, really looking forward to seeing the extra's and seeing how it was made!

Look I ain't gonna say it's flawless, not even close .Yet, it's definitely one of the best movies of 2022 and easily a worthy sequel !Cruise delivers one of his best performances and Connelly is simply outstanding .I'm not gonna state the problems I noticed because they're negligible in comparison to all the amazing things that happen in this movie.Highly Recommended !

reviews.review_title: Anyone not giving this a 10 needs their eyes checked
reviews.content: Will Top Gun, Maverick, win best picture? Probably not, but only because Hollywood seems to be filled with sycophants who hate humanity. This movie screams Freedom Rings from the first moment. The cinematography is unmatched. The lengths they went to in shooting the scenes in unbelievable. In a world where CGI has stolen the soul of cinema, Top Gun Maverick breathes the soul back into the film making process. You feel how special the movie is the entire time you're watching.Some people might scoff at the simplicity of the story line, but is my medium rare Angus Beef steak bad because it's simply seasoned with salt and pepper? Hell no! And you know what else it is? American, and amazing from start to finish. Just like this movie.Can I also say that nobody, and I mean nobody, can Tom Cruise like Tom Cruise does? It's seriously true. He has become a master of his specific type of movie. Edge of your seat, adrenaline pumping, thrill rides that keep your heart pounding from beginning to end. With scenes in his movies that you're sure have to be fake, I mean - there have got to be stunt doubles here right? Wrong. Why? Because it's Tom Cruise, and he's going to Tom Cruise it. Seriously, go look it up.And before you complain about the movie because, "You don't like Tom Cruise as a person" or some other such drivel, recognize that you probably know less than half of what you think you know, and even if less than half of what you think you know is true, who cares? Do I care whether or not the person who waits my table has the same political opinion as I do? No! I care if they get me my meal correct, on time and keep my cup full. Tom does all of that, and then sings you happy birthday and gives you a birthday present and convinces you that you've never had such amazing service in your life.So go watch this movie. In theaters. You'll have the rest kd your life to watch it on TV. Back to back with the original (which you will by the way, at least once a year. Probably more).

reviews.review_title: The only great film of the summer
reviews.content: While I was not a fan of the original film ( Too much 80's chesse for me), this Top Gun movie actually won me over. Its a much better film in my opinion than the original and Tom Cruise manages to give a lot of heart in this film (the best acting he has done in a while) as well as some of the best aerial combat ever on screen that really hit's you. Add a sentimental turn by Val Kilmer and much better acting all round with a much better cast and we have in my opinion The only great film of the summer, which is a god sent because of all the garbage that came out. Let's hope next year will be better.

This film is okay. The flight sequences are great. However, the story is much of a rehash of the original and quite predictable. Maverick just did not have the same impact on me as the 86 original, even with the superior filming etc. But is it worth spending money on to watch? Yes. Just tame your expectations, you may enjoy it more.

The original Top Gun was a fun, sexy and stylish. With emphasis on the camaraderie and rivalry than the jets. Maverick is ALL about the jets, with amazing flying sequences. IMO it was more like a Mission Impossible than Top Gun. The script was weak, unbelievable, and the characters two dimensional. This was definitely another vanity project for Tom to prove how talented and good looking he is.

Two hours ago I did not know this movie existed! So I went in with very little expectations about where this movie would take me. Damn, it is a really brilliant movie. I enjoyed every minute of it. Tom Cruise never disappointed us. The plot was well crafted. Acting was superb. Not only was it action packed; there were a few emotional moments that make this movie especially memorable. The plot reminds me of the early 2000s movie vibe for some reasons. This is one of the best movies I have seen in a long time. I applauded after the movie ended. Super recommended.

Repeating the cliché is not a masterpiece!!! The copied scenario with the exaggerated acting of Tom Cruise, as if he does not accept his role, but he is forced to play a role! I could not watch until the end! 1 star for other people work like camera crow or make up artist and...most of it is.computer programming for make Cinematic tricks! It is jut like watching cartoons! Thanks.

The first half of the film I actually found a bit grating/boring with so much nostalgia and setting up the premise. Every single line from every single character is delivered in an arch kind of way, with a smirk. However, the last half is heart-racingly good! The aerial dogfights and action sequences are terrific and there's a suitably triumphant and emotional ending. It's a bit silly and predictable, but ticks every box for great escapism. I defy anyone not to enjoy!

reviews.review_title: Dare I say it? Better than the original!
reviews.content:
To be fair,
I wasn't old enough to live through the 80's which was probably one of the best decades to be alive. Through the stories I heard this movie is and will always be a legendary icon for it's time. It's perfectly understandable that not many movies had ever come close to reaching the incredible success accomplished with the original from 1986.Fast forward 36 Years today and I finally got the chance to experience this thriller on the big screen! It had me feeling goosebumps from the sounds of the jets to the feeling of the G forces which had me pushing back on the theater's recliner chair with each take off.I honestly had low expectations coming in and was pleasantly surprised to find this sequel an even better experience when compared to the original which I love.Shoutout to Tom Cruise for sticking with his passion for a lifetime. His work is nothing short of legendary and a true testament to the legacy he has worked his entire life to achieve.

reviews.review_title: "The Beginning of the End of Cinematic Blockbusters"
reviews.content: There will be a time when Maverick's generation is obsolete because youth will fill in. There will be a time when Tom Cruise is no longer the face of franchises, and another poster boy will arise. There will come a time when stimulating blockbusters no longer exist to unite all types of movie-goers. The time when IP franchises dominate everything is gradually creeping upon us, but it isn't today. Top Gun: Maverick is one of the most cinematic widely accessible movies ever created. It is a beautifully paced, intense, dramatic thrill ride that anyone can enjoy. Whether you love him or hate him, Tom Cruise is singlehandedly saving the modern cinematic blockbuster.Ed Harris' character says this early on, "The future is coming, and you're not in it... The end is inevitable, Maverick. Your kind is headed to extinction." That is quite a bombshell to drop on Maverick and the audience so quickly. Although, I think it serves as more than that. Of course, there is a group of young guns coming up that will push out Maverick's generation altogether. Going further, there will likely be artificial intelligence to push out the younger generation when the time comes. This line, though, stands for Tom Cruise giving a nod of awareness that he is aging. There will be a time (hopefully not soon) where Cruise and his recognizable characters will no longer be a part of Hollywood. Whether he retires or dies while making a movie, which would be more fitting, eventually, everyone's time is up. Maverick is not really passing the torch and even refuses in some facets, but he's calling for the younger pilots to be just as good if not better in their own ways. Through the titular character, director Joseph Kosinski is calling for the next generation to strap up and commit to filmmaking as the greats have in the past. I hope this chapter in Cruise's career is long, but I believe it to be his last.Pertaining to the film specifically, the characters were extremely well-written and each was accompanied by a surprisingly great performance. This was the stand-out of the film. Of course, staple actors like Jon Hamm, Ed Harris, and Val Kilmer all played perfect supports to push Maverick in a certain direction. Hamm and Harris both beautifully portrayed stern, hardened alpha males in opposition to Maverick's ambition. Although, I certainly was not anticipating multiple young actors to have relatively great performances. Miles Teller brings his A-game, similar to what we have seen in the likes of his 'Whiplash' performance. Glen Powell, playing the cocky, uber-talented Hangman, absolutely steals the show. Powell just exudes charisma and demands your attention on the screen. Hangman is fairly unlikable for most of the film, but somehow you still love watching him. Glen Powell was certainly the biggest surprise for me, and I will be shocked if this doesn't boost him into superstardom. The aforementioned Val Kilmer also has an emotional part in the movie that was a fantastic tribute to the Iceman. The Iceman scenes in particular were turning points for Maverick in my eyes, and they allowed Cruise to show off acting chops of his own.It's impossible to talk about this film without referring to the cinematography of the flight sequences. Whether it was a laid-back first day of training or the execution of the intense main mission, the flights are filmed gorgeously. With cameras in the cockpits facing the pilots, you can clearly see them and everything behind the plane while moving at unreal speeds. It feels like you're seated on the nose of the plane facing the cockpit, and, needless to say, it will have you glued to the screen. Seeing this in IMAX format was easily one of the best theater experiences I have ever had. I encourage everyone to go see it in a theater and in advanced formats if possible.Top Gun: Maverick is a film that exquisitely executes the modern legacy sequel. It is infused with nostalgia without being bogged down by it. It perfectly blends characters we love with new ones into a story with real stakes. It is intense, action-packed, and littered with memorable moments. This film doesn't go back to catchy lines just for hollow callbacks (like someone lazily saying "feel the need for speed"). That would have been the easy way out, but Kosinski and Christopher McQuarrie bring an emotional story with real sustenance to the table. There are plenty of moments of fan service and nostalgia, but they all feel warranted. In many cases, sequels taint the first movie, and it would have been very easy for this to happen when the sequel is a 36-year successor. This film couldn't exist without the original Top Gun coming out first, but, with that said, it far surpasses the 1986 classic.Final Score: 92/100.

This movie has put a smile on my face that I don't think will ever go away. It took everything that was amazing about the first Top Gun and multiplied it by 10 G's. The film brought out about every emotion in me. I laughed, I cried, I gasped and I cheered. I really do feel sorry for anyone who doesn't have a joyful experience seeing this movie. Lastly, we all say what we will about Tom Cruise, but that man continues to raise the bar on what it means to make an outstanding, action-packed Hollywood blockbuster.

They nailed it with Top Gun Maverick!Staying true to the original film and focusing on what the fans wanted they have created another classic. Feel good, action packed, excellent acting and a great closure to the original - This was a much needed film. The saying goes "They don't make them like they use to" and that saying is true most of the time but Top Gun Maverick is definitely an exception...

reviews.review_title: You expect - and it delivers, on all fronts.
reviews.content: The good: Cinematography, action, sound, characters and their actors are all top shelf - flawless execution. The plot is simple but serves the film well - which leads me to my highest praise - the pacing. Weird, I know, but I was expecting the other parts to be amazing (and they were) but the pacing was incredible. The movie ebbs and flows with natural highs, lows and moments of tension and brevity right up until the end. Nailed it.The bad: 2 things (and it's light criticism). 1-the romance was lukewarm. Whilst it didn't grate me - it didn't have much purpose beyond being 2 people going all googly eyes at each other. It didn't overstay it's welcome but did very little for the movie - it could have been removed and (except for maybe one scene) you wouldn't have noticed. 2-Too much Tom Cruise (i know, the film is called 'Maverick') but the film puts him as the saviour a bit too much IMO. They could have altered some events to let the new recruits shine a bit more - whilst still giving Tom plenty of opportunity to kick ass.Should you watch it: Absolutely. It's big, it's fun and it delivers on it's promise of pure blockbuster cinema that can be enjoyed by a wide ranging audience. See it on the biggest screen possible. Highly recommended.

reviews.review_title: Perhaps it would have been better to see it at the movie theater
reviews.content: I absolutely cannot understand why this movie is being appreciated so much, but I would like to! Not having seen it in the cinema perhaps I missed the best part, which is the glorification of the flight scenes...but otherwise I don't feel it is a film that leaves anything behind, and for those who don't particularly like action, it is a tedious and difficult film to finish. It appeared to me a mere mishmash of stunts and annoying American clichés, not even missing the happy ending with the sunset. There is nothing memorable or noteworthy about this movie, but considering the aforementioned high praise perhaps it is really me who fails to grasp what should make it a good film.

reviews.review_title: It Feels Like Reagan Is In The White House...
reviews.content: Oh that 80's nostalgia! Back when we had an old man in the White House and the Russians were global bullies threatening to nuke their enemies. The more things change....Is this Academy Award material? Of course not. Is it really fun? Very much so! The first movie worked so well they basically made it again - which was fine by me. Aircraft carrier B roll, some hard-a** admirals stuck relying on Maverick, 80's tunes, amazing flying sequences and an evil empire to confront. Toss in bad guys that look like Darth Vader in superior jets with a Death Star trench run, and what's not to love?This movie was made to be seen in a theater and for the audience that enjoyed the original. It worked on me. Now I'm going to do something I haven't done since I was a kid... go see this movie in the theater a second time.
Perfect sequel. They couldn't have tied in the first Top Gun anymore perfectly. You're going to love it! One to take the entire family to see! The Tragedy Of Val Kilmer Is Beyond Heartbreaking.
Amazing experience watching movie in IMAX4D, must watch movie with amazing action screens, the story of the movie is predictable but not the ending. Love you Tom Cruise for this amazing experience.

Just saw this earlier today. I saw the 1st while on active duty in the U. S. Air Force global intelligence community with primary station in Crete, Greece. It was our rallying call then!!! This version is just as impressive!!! Don't miss out on all the fun. Mr. Cruise does what we all have come to expect - produce riveting, thrilling & extremely high quality movies. Also, exceptional to see Val Kilmer - love this sublime actor as well!!!

When I heard they were going to make a sequel to Top Gun I was excited by the prospect, but we no longer have the original director Tony Scott. Who we have instead is Joseph Kosinski, and I'd argue he's even better.As the name suggests, this film focuses upon Maverick. If you're a fan of the original you won't be disappointed to see what he's been flying since, or that he's still flying.And it's those flying scenes that are stunning. Far better than the originals, better not just because technology has moved on, but because the actors are in aircraft being flown. Real aircraft, being filmed under the stresses of flight.Kosinski's previous successes are Tron: Legacy, Oblivion and Only The Brave. If you've seen those three films you already know he's probably the best director working today. Yes, he's that good.Top Gun: Maverick works because the director, Kosinski, somehow manages to make you feel that you're part of the film, that you're right there with the people in the film. The pace is perfect, the action precise, and yes you'll be on the edge of your seat!Kosinski should be getting an Oscar for Top Gun: Maverick.

Nostalgia. Biggest movie going experience since two years. Tom Cruise. Maverick. The Jacket. The Bike. Don't know what to say. This is why movies are made. To mark your time in history. This is the closest you will ever get to experience being a fighter jet pilot. I am in awe of Tom Cruise more than ever before. Just love, respect and admiration for this wonder of a sequel after 36 years!! I mean I don't know how many good sequels are out there in movie history, but this is definitely a benchmark. Thank you Tom Cruise. I have nothing else to say. Top Gun got me returning to the theatres. No other movie could do that. I should do at least that for this marvel of a movie. And I know I will never get tired of it when it comes out on OTT. Loads of Love. Thank you.

reviews.review_title: Just when you have given up hope...
reviews.content: I thought I wouldn't see such a movie coming out of Hollywood ever again, just when I thought I have given up hope, this movie is the saving grace of most things coming out of Hollywood. This film touches, it inspires, it motivates, it unites and not divide people. No political nonsense, no pretense of any kind, just pure perfection of the every element that makes a movie great.It has the love, character, integrity, sacrifice, humility we all need in our lives in these trying times. I was struggling to hold back shedding tears while watching it. I wished it never ended. Tom is one of the actors I wished lived forever.

The last time I was blown away by a sequel was Terminator II. So imagine the rate joy I felt.They made a beautiful movie, plain and simple. The story works, the cast is a great fit, the images, the sound... everything just works. And what I appreciate the most: They didn't overload on action and drama. There were some missiles to shake and two enemy planes to deal with. They didn't let our hero pilots be overrun by an impossible enemy force. (And then, by some miracle, they would come out on top. I loved that as a teenager, now I can't stand it anymore.) Thank you for not overloading Top Gun Maverick. They kept it simple. No unnecessarily complicated subplots. Bravo!

reviews.review_title: Tom Cruise is a SAVAGE for pulling this off!
reviews.content: Top Gun: Maverick is an excellent sequel. It's as good as The Bride of Frankenstein, The Empire Strikes Back, or Aliens. This movie catches so much of what is missing from movies today. Not just well acted, directed, and written - but also life reaffirming. It's incredible that Tom Cruise pulled this off after so many years since the first one. What an absolute legend.

An absolute amazing movie!! It may even be better than the first one! The screenplay, script, and the cast are a homerun! Tom Cruise delivers big time!! The flying is the best in movie history since it's all real.

reviews.review_title: Nostalgic ride with mind blowing scenes!
reviews.content: If you are a fan of orignal top gun , I mean crazy fan and you know the movie byheart and all its dialogues & music then my friend you are in for a ride of a lifetime.I had a wow, smiling to edge of my mouth face throughout the movie.This is epitome of how to make a nostalgic sequel. Many references of orignal are there and you can find them as easter egg which can make the movie watching more immersive experience.Music is top notch as given my Hans zimmer so you know its awesome and some orignal tracks.Lady Gaga and One Republic's music track is amazing especially the One republic's "I ain't worried" which serves as perfect successor to Playing with the boys song of 86.Action scenes are smooth and mostly real you can feel the G force on actors inside the jets. A truely theatrical marvel.But if you are looking for some serious story content or character development of mainly co stars then there isn't much as whole movie is focused on Maverick and Goose's son Rooster.I would say watch it alteast once; its a perfect popcorn flick. It gives something to all age categories.

The original top gun is my all time favourite film. It maybe a homo-erotic cheese fest but I can still watch it over and over again. It also boasts the greatest soundtrack to any film ever made.When the trailer popped up on YouTube for top gun maverick in 2019 I nearly fell over. Ive never felt such excitement over a film in my life, I've also never been so scared of a film being bad.After release I couldn't believe the reviews, I was so happy people were giving it 10 out of 10,I booked my ticket for imax and watched it. When I left the cinema I felt like a kid after you've opened all your Christmas presents, a bit underwhelmed. Don't get me wrong,I was blown away by the film, it absolutely flew past (pardon the pun) and was visually stunning but it just wasn't the original.I waited a week and today I saw it again,I took my old man who's 63,he's not really a film person but he was loved it. He was laughing,ducking,shaking his head and even crying at the end. This film is without a doubt a 10 out of 10.If you're expecting a shawshank redemption or The godfather worthy storyline then forget it,that's not what this is. What it is is the best cinematic experience you will ever witness,the flying scenes are stunning,the acting is bang on and it is pretty emotional at times.This film isn't perfect,it still has unnecessary cheese and the sailing scene is utterly pointless. I would have preferred it to be more serious,I like heroes dying and sad endings but it is what it is.At the end of the day if you don't see this in a cinema through imax you are missing out. Anyone giving this less than a 7 out of 10 are idiots (it's worthy of that for the flight scenes alone)Absolutely amazing.

reviews.review_title: You Don't Want To Miss The Imax Experience.
reviews.content: 'Top Gun: Maverick' Is the best blockbuster action movie since 'Mission Impossible: Fallout'. Wonderful!! You don't want to miss this one, especially on the big screen.There is no doubt that Tom Cruise is the biggest movie star specializing in action movies and blockbusters in Hollywood history.

reviews.review_title: I feel the need for SPEED! One more time
reviews.content: This movie is a must see in the theater. Its a visual breathtaking experience. For me (at age 50) its gave me that nostalgic feel. The first Top Gun movie was a guilty pleasure. No more guilt this time. Just pleasure. There was an introduction from Tom Cruise that I thought was a nice touch. Jennifer Connelly is beautiful as ever. GO SEE THIS MOVIE!Talk to me Goose...
Movie from another time made nowadays.Extremely good characters and relationships between them, wonderful cinematography and airplane battles all the time.

reviews.review_title: Best Movie in a Long Long Long Time!!!
reviews.content: This movie was awesome from start to finish. The nostalgia was strong. No hidden agenda in this movie, just a lot of patriotism on display.I also loved that Val Kilmer was in this movie as well.Please keep making movies like this and people will watch them.

Sometimes, you just want to watch a movie that's fun. Nothing to over-analyze, or find fault with. Just good, old fashion fun. TG:M is that movie.The pacing was good, cinematography, editing, sound, all of it was on target. The diversity (while offsetting to some on the Far Right of things) was not the annoyingly in your face sort as the heroic moments are spread out evenly. Not sure about the chemistry between Cruise and Connelly, but both actors are experienced enough to make it work.Best things about this movie are the training runs, and especially the finale. Wow, the ending was incredibly exciting. Good watching here.8/10 - diverse cast, exciting scenes.

reviews.review_title: One of the best movies ever
reviews.content: I didn't even like the first top gun believe it or not. Was too young to understand or care about it and when I watched it later in life, not in a theatre, it didn't do much for me. This was nothing like that. Being in the theatre amazingly makes you feel like you're flying with them and it's freaking awesome! The story is really amazing as well. I really can't say much of anything bad about it. They even managed to make it not incredibly focused on some kind of social justice thing like all other movies and shows in the last few years. Bravo, people, please keep it up! We need these kind of movies again!

This is what blockbusters should be! It doesn't even matter it was a straightforward storyline that was often times predictable. The visuals were extraordinary, the music was such an enhancement to the film, and it just had so much heart. It was just such a great experience to see on the big screen!

reviews.review_title: Best movie of the year so far
reviews.content: Best sequel of all time along with T2. Tom Cruise at his very best. Best movie of the year even better then The Batman.Top Gun: Maverick is pure cinema. That's it, that's the tweet.No seriously, it's one of those rare flicks that reminds you how incredible a movie-going experience can be. Tom Cruise is a mad man, and I loved it.

reviews.review_title: All About the Vibes, Especially in IMAX!
reviews.content: This movie is exactly what I'd want most action movies to be. If you get to watch it on a big IMAX screen, you will truly experience how awesome the plane sequences are. Some scenes in it are definitely cheesy owing to the franchise's 80s roots but you really don't mind that as the story is actually involving and no cliche is overdone!

I was not a 'Top Gun' fan in 1986 when the original movie was released. I didn't become a fan even after watching this sequel called 'Top Gun: Maverick' directed by Joseph Kosinski. I like action movies when they are based on an interesting story, with characters that I can identify with as a viewer. In the case of the 'Top Gun' movies, the stories are boring for me, the characters are schematic and I can't identify in any way with the macho and militaristic culture propagated by these films, whatever the uniforms that the heroes wear. The 1956 'Top Gun' proposed to teenagers and young people of that time an amplified version of the fun things specific to the age before the Internet, mobile phones and virtual realities. It was a world fascinated by speed, motorcycles, cars and planes. Transferring some of its heroes to the second decade of the third millennium, 'Top Gun: Maverick' mostly relies on a retro effect despite the new aircraft models. Of course, the most precious retro element of all is Tom Cruise himself, an actor I admire for his past achievements in other genres, and for what he does in action movies (though I am finding the 'Mission: Impossible' series much more interesting) . The result, in my opinion, is a huge public success but not an artistic success.What I liked about this movie: First of all, Tom Cruise, the actor who manages to insuflate some life into action heroes, who looks at 60 like he's 40 and who makes this sequel look like it's done 10 years and not 34 years after the original movie. Retro elements (clothing, music, motorcycles and airplanes) that make the conflict between generations acceptable, which is one of the main themes of the film. The fine cinematography in some of the action sequences. The discrete romantic story between the lead hero and the heroine played by Jennifer Connelly, the only credible interpersonal relationship in the film.What I liked least: The militaristic atmosphere. The scene with muscular soldiers. The schematism of the characters. Predictability of the story. Pretentious dialogues - some serious, some that intent to be funny.What left me indifferent: the aerial combat scenes and the fact that the actors filmed in real planes and were intensely physically stressed. Pseudo-technical details of the aircraft or of the planning and execution of the military operation. Schematic sub-stories related to values such as friendship or intergenerational relationships. The bla-bla about discipline, indiscipline and initiative.At the end of the day, 'Top Gun: Maverick' is nothing more than a package for aerial combat scenes and another movie in which Tom Cruise defies the laws of ageing. There are many, many fans of these topics who have turned their enthusiasm into movie tickets and good grades for film. My opinion is that 'Top Gun: Maverick' is just another mediocre action movie. Luckily for the producers, my opinion is in the minority.

I don't think you are able to appreciate all the subtleties of this film until you watch it at least 3 times and in different formats (4DX, IMAX, etc.)This movie is an instant classic. I am leaving the theater with my neck in pain (again), they took the air scenes to a complete new level.There is a well-built story, likeable characters, constant references to the 80s flick, hey, we even discover that Tom Cruise can act...What else can you ask for? This guy has recovered the essence of what a true summer blockbuster is and should be.Thank you, it was about time.

They might as well called it the remake of the original movie because that is what it was. From the iconic scenes to the contests between pilots it's like watching the same old movie again. Expected a lot more but was disappointed.

Tom Cruise (Pete 'Maverick' Mitchell) appears in just about every scene, but he delivers the goods.After disgracing himself by destroying a test plane, he is reassigned to train elite fighter jet pilots for a near impossible mission. The enemy is never named but think secret nuclear facility and you can probably complete the picture.The young pilots are cocky and dismissive of their ancient teacher, but Maverick quickly earns their respect with a mix of testosterone and flying skill. One of them is the son of Maverick's old Wingman, who died in the first movie. The strained relationship between the two and the build up to the final few scenes is a major subplot of the movie.The two hour 14 minute time flew by (literally) with edge of the seat excitement and stunning visuals. Make sure you watch it on a big screen.
Tom Cruise and this movie reminded us what the cinema really is about. We lived the movie, all the stress and all the emotions. I really really recommend you to watch it.

In an age where movies are either pumped up costume wearing comic book characters, or really long, drawn out, serious 3 hour films of dialogue, this is what we needed. A proper throw back to classic 80s film making. It had what we want. Action. Emotion. Escapism. One of the best films to be shown at cinemas in years!

Loved the OG Top Gun when i was 20 for the F-14, Kawasaki GPZ, soundtrack and Kelly. I never expected something too big from this sequel. Especially a nearly 60 year old TC isn't making it easier. Too predictable, too similar, including some of the OG actors... some absolutely impossible maneuvers, some science fiction scenes or planes I didn't expect nor needed. Unfortunately just a 5 for me.

reviews.review_title: Been a long time we experienced a movie like this!
reviews.content: For entertainment value alone, I dare say the majority of normal cinema goers would not argue that this deserves an Oscar. I think cinema goers have been starved for something like this for a long long time. An epic thrill ride of a movie with tonnes of heart that marries so well with the original.There was an excellent balance between action and sentiment. This was not your run of the mill USA chest beating themed movie like most of Bruckheimer's movies. This carried with it a lot of heart where the hero's substance earned him more than what words could ever do.I was hesitant to pay full price for a cinema ticket to watch this initially but now want to go back and see it again!

reviews.review_title: See it in the cinema for the full effect
reviews.content: Really Really enjoyed this!The action sequences were something else here, as was the tension being built throughout the film... I actually felt relief when they were celebrating at the end. And that never happens to me!It's a rollercoaster of a ride and definitely one to watch on the big screen (with the superb visuals and booming audio). Go see it!

reviews.review_title: Best movie I have ever watched after a long time
reviews.content: Everything is perfect in this movie, great storyline, music, and best acting. Every second was thrilling and I barely felt that the time was moving. I would recommend anyone to watch this film despite their interest in different movie categories. It's more than an action movie in my view.

reviews.review_title: The most five out of ten film ever made.
reviews.content: If in 1986 you could have written a follow up to Top Gun? This is it.The dialogue is either hilariously tongue in cheek or the laziest, most inept piece of money-grubbing cynicism you will see.It is awful. Of course it is. You knew this before you even thought about watching it. I have not watched Cruise in a while, but I thought he was better at acting than this. He is awful (or hilarious, but I think awful).There are a lot of American flags on offer; which as a non-American I take as a bad sign. I was going to say that very little good comes from seeing an American flag, but then I could not recall a single example of any good being associated with an American flag.I am only half way through the film, but I think I know it from here. I think we all do.

I saw this movie knowing what to expect, and will say it was a mostly positive experience. I like writing reviews and have been posting them on IMDB since 2001. I am brutally honest about movies when I review them, and have to say in general that rarely does a movie rate a perfect 10. I have some appreciation for movies that are Oscar bound and are genuinely pieces of art. No one, ever, would rate this rehash of a sequel like this a 10. Tom Cruise will never win an Oscar.Like I said, I was satisfied with this movie because I expected thrilling action scenes, nothing else. But I still only give this movie a 6 out of 10 because there were moments where the script could have soared, but only to use the old fallback tropes. This is one of the most dumbed-down scripts I've ever scene. All the predictable exposition is spelled out so on-the-nose you think the intended audience is in the 4-6 year old age range.However, I'd like to take time in this review to comment about the obvious planted user reviews that all give this film a 10. This film is nowhere near a 10. To the movie industry people who are guilty of taking over a user review like this: When I am looking to find out if I want to see a particular movie or not. I will NEVER bother reading a review that gives it 10 stars. Each "review" is a short paragraph of nothing but fluffy praise.Which is too bad. This film was intended to be a summer "feel good" time at the movies. Many crowd pleasing tropes are featured. Written like a bad TV show, a conflict was created by including the son of a pilot that died while flying with Maverick. To make sure the audience gets it on the nose, the son is literally dressed up identically like his father, complete with moustache and flowery shirt. He even sits down at a piano to recreate a scene from the first film, with even the same song. Even with that telegraphing the conflict, it is mentioned over and over by the other characters throughout the movie.The dialogue and characters have no real gravitas, which I blame the director on. I have seen two of his previous films; Tron Legacy and Oblivion. Both of those films could not really connect emotionally with an audience. Same here. When we are introduced to the young squad of pilots, nothing feels real about them. That lack of emotional connection with the characters contrasts with the single scene with Val Kilmer. Much is made of his appearance and the stronger emotions involved, precisely because this is missing from the rest of the movie.So what makes this movie a pleasure for the most part? The superficiality of the script is what audiences (in our country at least) are looking for right now, having suffered the Covid restrictions longer than most could tolerate. There also are great fissures politically, along with the depressing events in Ukraine. Time for that good ole' American shoot-from-the-hip mentality.What will bring audiences to the theatres is the promise of a feel good ending in a world of worsening crises. Top Gun 2 delivers. But there is a lot of dull filler when it comes to watching what our main characters do outside training. This of course includes Maverick being confronted by the dead pilot's son. Then there are the run-ins with the higher-ups for Maverick's shenanigans. Eyes will roll at how flimsy these run-ins are, with Maverick usually getting promoted instead of getting reprimanded. Who cares, right? Let's get to the actions scenes.The action scenes deliver as promised. Sprinkled throughout in the first and beginning of the second act, the flying sequences are adrenaline pumping. Use of GoPro style photography, showing the landscaping whipping by, makes the flying sequences very immersive. The big climax involves a video game-like scenario, laid out to the audience using video game-like animation. As before, any implausibilities are glossed over. It is assumed the audience is not looking for a great amount of military tech talk, and just want the good guys to win.MINOR SPOILER AHEADThe climax delivers the goods, a foregone conclusion since the audience was telegraphed the expected results since the first act. Maverick's character demands it. Even the younger pilots all survive.END MINOR SPOILERSo there is your summer picnic. Corny plot. Cheesy dialogue and characters. And Tom Cruise hamming it up as Tom Cruise. "This is the only look I have" says the movie star. Go ahead and see it on the big screen anyway. Try to stay awake through the second act for the exciting action finale. But don't pretend this movie is anything close to a 10. I give it a six. I never cared for this machismo type of moviemaking, and Tony Scott's original film looked and felt like an extended TV commercial (which was his background). With the advantage of thirty years of improvements in moviemaking, the sequel, with it's hefty price tag, has earned it's merits to attract a large box office. But be realistic, this is no different than one of those dumb Fast and Furious movies.

This truely was the film we all needed right now after everythingwe have all been throughthe past two years. The cinema was packed with people aged 12 to 80 and everyone was excited to see it.A must watch!

reviews.review_title: Maverick, Iceman ....Top Gun is a great Epic
reviews.content:
I love it so much, after 36 years I still love the both of them.Maverick is the one who has believed in his abilities and skills without any limitations
Iceman with very short story but I felt the deep friendship between them.

First the plot and story is good and exciting, and the acting was magnificent specially in the emotional moments and it was reflecting every character feeling and emotions tom cruise did it well. And the most important thing in this movie is the fighting scenes its marvelous and outstanding, in every fighting scene I was holding my breathes tell it ends. A very good classic movie that presented with great care.
That was the best film I've seen in years. Tears rolling down my cheeks a variety of times, laughter and excitement. A truly thrilling ride.Totally brilliant.

Its like this ...Few years ago, i went out to watch Rambo 6 and Terminator. Dark Faith..
They were ok movies , fact is our heroes are getting real old now .. and movies are running out of ideads anyway..
So with that kind of mindset i went in to see Top Gun 2 .. and i have to say , that Top Gun blows away both of the movies mentioned!It had better acting, better producing, the scenes were done with more pation , and overall vibes are just simply better.The story is pretty good too. The jet fights and all were damn awesomely done !! The fact that this movie is a vibe even tho ive seen part one back in the days just says how pretty good they done here.Maybe the young viewers it will be even better.Now it aint better then part 1 .. but still better then i tought it would be.

On your mobile phone!Or your tablet!Or your laptop!Or on your PC!You might watch it in your home-theatre - but only when you have a decent soundsystem (and your neighbors can stand it)!This is definitely a movie to see on the big screen and feel the sound!I saw Top Gun in my early 20s and couldn't imagine a sequel which is worth to see. So I went to the cinema with some friends and low expectations, but learned a lesson: Don't underestimate what people can achieve wo really really love (and know) what they're doing!I enjoyed every minute of that movie and will definitely get it for my private collection as soon as I can get my hands on it!See you at the cinema!

It does well enough for nostalgia. I wasn't one who thought there was much need for a sequel, but the opening did put a smile on my face as it was nearly a duplication of Top Gun. Then to see Tom Cruise again as Maverick being, well, Maverick, was fun, with the iconic jacket and sunglasses and bike and being the same cocky guy.But after that, it starts to go downhill, first slowly, then right off a cliff until it reaches about mach 10 in terms of being a really stupid movieIt starts to go off the rails right about the time Jennifer Connelly shows up. Here I always thought there wasn't very good chemistry between Cruise and Kelly McGillis in the original, but this movie makes that seem like Romeo and Juliet. At least in the original, McGillis inhabited her own space, that is to say she was call sign "Charlie", she was a civilian superior to Maverick and all the rest. In the sequel, Penny is such an absolute throwaway character. I mean supposedly they have this complicated history, but from the first scene it looks like she's pretty much ready to jump into bed with him from his first grin. If it had at least shown like she had been hurt by him or had moved on with her own life, but no, it's not even close - I mean, you can't have a meet cute with him having to buy drinks when the assumption is they already met a long time ago with a lot of hurt feelings in between. Just bad.Then the rest of the team starts to show up and it's worse. I mean Hangman and Rooster, as I said I'm all for nostalgia but not a total re-tread. How are they not supposed to be Iceman and Maverick from the original? Just a really bad version of it, perfunctory and phoney.Then the whole thing between Maverick and Rooster. Again so phoney. Hard feelings because he held him back? Give me a break. Yeah, I get it, can't be because Rooster blames him for his dad's death, because that would be so cliche and obvious, so instead it's just some tepid and pathetic excuse, may as well just have said Maverick gave him a frowny face on his report card.It does pick up a little with the training sequences, an ok moment with Iceman, and then of course Maverick showing he is Maverick by doing the practice mission better than anyone.But man, does this movie get stupid in a hurry and pretty much stays there. First it's Star Wars with the canyon and the missiles (laser cannons), and the two meter target (a bunker buster wouldn't have worked?). Forget about talk to me, Goose, I was expecting Obi Wan to show up and say, use the force, Luke. In fact during the training, I could swear Maverick becomes Darth Vader for a moment, trying to kill Luke and his wingmen - the force is strong with this one.Then the mission happens and it turns into Rambo. Oh look, Maverick has to take on a super duper helicopter, I was just waiting to see the Rusky behind the wheel. If that isn't enough, then it turns into Forrest Gump as Maverick runs about ten miles through the snow in about two minutes, run, Maverick, run. Then it turns into some version of Spies Like Us, as Maverick and Rooster steal an old plane, I was just waiting for Chevy Chase or Dan Ackroyd to show up.Yes, again there is a pretty cool air fight, even though the enemy plane was way cooler. But then it turns back into Star Wars again. Yeah, I was wondering when Han Solo and the Millenium Falcon was going to show up and I didn't have to wait long, I can't remember, does Hangman yell Yahoo! As he gets rid of Darth Vader, I mean the bad guy?Again the nostalgia was the best part by far. It's not that the original Top Gun was a great movie, but there are certain movies and tv shows that just perfectly capture a moment in time, and I certainly would say Top Gun is at the top of the list in terms of the 1980's. It's iconoclastic in that sense, it captures the zeitgeist as well if not better than anything else done in that decade. Perhaps a few more examples for me would be Wall Street or Breakfast Club or Family Ties for a tv show; not saying they were the best of the era, but there's just something about them that captures the thoughts and feelings of the decade. Maverick, on the other hand, is a mild diversion at best, a movie that might bring back a few memories of that time but unlikely to ever create memories of its own.

I went into this movie completely blind. I have never seen the first Top Gun, nor had I known anything about the film before this one. I went with my boyfriend, who is attending flight school to become a pilot.This movie was absolutely incredible. One of my new favorites. It's nothing but entertainment. It's sweet, suspenseful, emotional, enthralling. It pulls you in. The stunts are incredible- CGI will never beat stuff like this. Tom Cruise is fantastic, with this and the Mission Impossible movies I've grown to really respect him.There's no underlying messages, no modern crap, just pure joy. Great acting, great score, great pacing. I love the fact that Maverick didn't sleep around with a bunch of women, and instead he stayed with the original one. It was delightful, a great change from the Bond-type player protagonist.The characters were all likeable. The action was insane. It made me very emotional, I cried several times. THIS is what it means to be a patriot. To love and fight for your country. Without loyalty and bravery like the pilots displayed in the movie, there is no hope for the future of this nation. (Not meaning to get super political, it's just a nice switch from the hateful content that's been spewed out recently towards the United States and the military).I'm going into brief SPOILERS for a moment to discuss:As I said above, I have never seen the first Top Gun and I had no idea who Val Kilmer's character was before this one. I knew nothing about him yet I still teared up when he was talking to Mav, and at his funeral. It hit me hard despite not knowing the characters, and that's how you know it was well done. The emotion was strong even when I didn't know him. You could feel his impact and connection to the characters. Impressive, and great performance. Apparently Val Kilmer is actually sick in real life. God bless him I hope he heals.This film was extremely intense. I was terrified during the entire mission sequence. It built up more suspense than most modern horror movies. I was so involved in the film that at the end when Rooster finds he can't eject and Maverick realizes they're going to die I started crying. I also cried once they landed safely and were embracing each other. A powerful, satisfying, fun movie. I watched it multiple times. Perfect for Summer.

A movie we watched with the whole family and we liked it. So bring your wife and kids, they won't be disappointed. The story is paper thin and almost the same as the previous Top Gun, the actors as well. The directors went to great length to get realistic flight scenes by strapping the actors in real F18's. That's an amazing achievement and you will love the flight scenes. But as an aviation expert I saw so many mistakes, I was cringing in my seat. The Hollywood sauce never tastes good. In the end an enjoyable movie, but not an epic masterpiece.

reviews.review_title: The best movie I've seen in 2022 so far
reviews.content: I was thrilled of that movie!!! The best movie I've seen in 2022 so far! I don't know where to start. The acting ? The filming? The story was so good to attract me as an audience to stay interested and excited till the last bit of the movie, and i loved how the ending didn't finish like any other typical movie of tom cruise dying in return for the death or roster father , or roster died in return to save maverick, or the both died , the movie made me very interested and excited to know how will it end, it made me feel nervous, i felt like i was in it with them haha , i give the movie 10/10 , and I didn't check the timing for the first time while watching a movie hahaha.

I read few a few reviews before I posted. I wanted to see if anyone left out anything significant. Nope. It's a great evening out. You completely get your money's worth, and then some. It exceeds expectations. It's why we go see movies. Tom Cruise, you and I both were never in the military, but I salute you.

reviews.review_title: It's more than what you will ever expect getting into the theatre
reviews.content: I'm not that old but I remember when I was kid hearing about top gun from my cousin, about that guy who hit on a girl on his way to his first top gun class to find out that she's his teacher, When I watched the movie , I couldn't believe how good it was with the fighter jet scenes , the bold impulsive risk taker main role done by tom Cruise !!Years passed and we couldn't forget the personality he perfectly performed in the first movie and we thought that it couldn't get any better or more interesting even as a sequel! But after watching the sequel , we were definitely wrong , I came out of the theatre with huge amount of feelings that is hard to feel or understand if you watched the first movie a day or two before you watched that recent sequel.Watching this movie after all these years is like putting your soul in a time capsule for 36 years and suddenly opening that capsule , Nostalgia at its best .It's definitely a sequel worth the wait .....

This is why movies were made!!!At times speechless absolutely stunned at a loss for words and at other times couldn't help but cheer shout fist pump clap lean back in the chair lean forward slide left slide right spill the popcornthe entire theater felt the same way I'm watching it again in a different theater in a different city super excited about the audience reaction because it's almost already sold outThis is why movies were made
thank you Tom Cruise!
10/10. I had high expectations being the original is one of my favorites of all time. It met and exceeded those expectations. I was on the edge of my seat the whole time. I'm going to see it again.

Just go see this movie. It is everything a movie is supposed to be, but rarely is. You will not be disappointed. Tom Cruise is at his best and even though Val Kilmer had limited time, he brought tears to many an eye. Was it worth a two year wait. Hell yes.

reviews.review_title: Even better than the real thing!
reviews.content: Best sequel ever and it's better than the original! I hate Tom Cruise but go see this film! You'll laugh. Cry. Get choked up but they covered every angle on this one! See it, now!
I love the story structure! The movie experience was immersive. It was a nice movie to enjoy an afternoon. I'd recommend it. If you can, watch it in the theaters while it's still playing.

Do yourself a favour and see it on the big screen. Merges with the original seamlessly whilst building a fresh and dynamic new storyline. I love a good action movie, but have never taken the time to review - this movie warrants a good review and I can see why Cruise delayed the release.

This is 10/10 Tom Cruise, America, fighter planes & old fashioned romance. Just what 2022 needed - would highly recommend!Simple but effective storyline, solid acting all round, GREAT music (some 80s bangers + some newer stuff), realistic flying/action scenese - it really does tick all of the boxes of a great film!

reviews.review_title: Outstanding cinematography and action, terrible cliches
reviews.content: This movie is epic and spectacular and deserves to be seen, but only because of the action scenes. I did not notice any CGI watching it and that is unbelievable. Acting is fine, no major complaints. The plot is pretty unbelievable, but all right, it's an action movie, can't expect them to go overboard here.But you could not fit any more cliches in this movie if you tried. Just one on top of another, the writing at times is on the same level as fan fiction, except someone has thrown tens of millions of dollars at it. The writing is not bold in any way, it clings hard to the first movie and the political correctness is up to 11. There are far too many "establishing shots", dull, predictable dialogue for me to really enjoy it.And if we rate the film based on what experience it gave us, then compared to, say, Interstellar or The Matrix, Top gun: Maverick cannot be rated nearly as high.Is this what we want the cinema to be? People rate it 10, saying it's the most epic blockbuster ever and throngs of people agree. Really? With such dull writing? Let's hope this doesn't become the norm.
Hell yeah. Fantastic. No spoilers just go see. Enough similarities and difference to the original to be great. Can really get into the film, the action scenes are sensational.

Im a huge fan of top gun and it was literally my childhood, it is my most hyped movie of 2022 and it lived up to it and it exceeded my expectation, truly one of the best sequel ever made, it is Tom's best performance in my opinion, the movie will show you everything, it will make you feel love, it will make you emotional, i will make you smile in happiness, the last 45 minutes of the movie was truly epic, in my cinema everyone was on seat edge for the last 45 minutes and the ending was perfect and satisfying, the technical department did a mind blowing job, the cinematography was insane, you will feel like you are in a jet, some vfx shots was breathtaking, overall this is how movie should be made and it is one of the best cinema experience i have ever had and became one of my all time fav, watch it on a big screen as possible for the best and immersive experience.

reviews.review_title: Heroic Fantasy of a Dying Man
reviews.content:
In all honesty I was never a fan of the original Top Gun mainly due to its over the top cliché ridden plot and is quasi homoerotic theme, but I did enjoy this sequel because the screenwriters were clearly channeling two classic films: Star Wars and Point Blank. Of the first, the reference to Lucas's film are clear, "trust your feelings" and the bombing/fighter sequences which even have the enemy as duplicates of the TIE fighter pilots. But to me more interesting is the use of the death motif from the later Lee Marvin / John Boorman film, where the obviously dead protagonist, whom against all odds, not only survives but returns to seek the revenge owed to him. In Maverick this fantasy plays out as the dead Pete Mitchell seeks redemption for killing Goose, finding a meaningful relationship with a woman and the possibility a family, and finally, making peace with Iceman.At the beginning of the film we see Pete Mitchell's life, living in a trailer located inside an airplane hanger and waking up everyday to see the photos of the man, Goose, and the family he destroyed through his pride and arrogance. We also see Goose's son Rooster, in a photo of a twenty year old navy cadet (more on this later). All Maverick has in his life is his job as a 60 year old test pilot and who is quickly reaching the end of his usefulness. At work he is informed of the cancellation of the project to break the existing speed record but he nevertheless pushes the team for their, and his, "last run". So against orders he not only reaches Mach 10 (a feat never accomplished in real life, the best ever has been Mach 9.4) and with fatalistic glee pushes his ship to it's literal breaking point.
