The result is expected, the aircraft explodes and the last we see of it is it's disintegration as it plummets to earth in a fiery meteor-type ball, no parachute in sight.Fade to Black (BTW the only Fade to Black in the film)But what's this? A lone man wandering a country highway, helmet still in hand, enters a diner and takes a glass of water and drinks it completely. But he does say "Hey I just crashed my plane" or "Can I use your phone", no. He s asks, "Where am I?"
Why?Because he really doesn't know where he is, physically or metaphysically.He is in fact dead.Or rather in Purgatory.Yes, Purgatory, that way-station between Heaven and Earth where the soul goes to purify itself before entering heaven.The next thing we see is Maverick in front of a dried up cadaver-looking like creature played by Ed Harris (Hades' crypt-keeper) who while wanting to drag him off to Hell, informs Maverick that for whatever reason "God and his Guardian Angel" have intervene to send him back into his past to Top Gun school. Once there he re-lives many of his past memories. He reconnects with a lover who just happens to be beautiful, single, rich and owns a bar (talk about a male fantasy) and Rooster, who not only looks like his father but actually acts, sings and plays the same tune on the piano. When he leaves the bar he has several flashbacks of his sins and regrets.Maverick's assignment is to train a group of youngsters for a mysterious MacGuffin mission against an unknown and never named adversary. Why the Navy doesn't use more experienced fliers is never explained, but this freshman lot includes such appropriate named cadets as Phoenix (the mythical reborn bird) and Payback (The name of the remade film of Point Blank). The key players though are the aforementioned Rooster, and a cocksure Maverick clone, Hangman. These two represent the ying and yang of Maverick, the cautious and the crazy, the civilized man and the animal, and of course they are antagonists to each other. Their names say it all.What is your first thought of a rooster? A wake up call.What is your first thought of a hangman? Death's executioner
So herein lays the struggle for Maverick's soul.On Rooster it should be pointed out, in the original film he is a 4 year old, which would after 36 years, now make him pushing 40. But in this death dream, Maverick is the narrator, so Rooster is still the 20 year old from the photo in his hanger.For that matter, throughout the film, Maverick has his balls pulled out of the fire by either his Guardian Angel represented by Iceman (his multiple insubordinate acts, his destruction of expensive and irreplaceable government property, his reinstatement to the team after stealing an aircraft) or a deus ex machina intercedence (a successful mission preformed with 30 year old technology, evading missiles and later a gating gun equipped helicopter, destroying superior aircraft, stumbling across and escaping in an enemy held F-15 with no security but gassed/armed up and ready to fly). One of the most obvious divine interventions is when Maverick and Rooster having exhausted all methods of evading the enemy in the final dogfight, unable to eject and facing certain death, are saved by Hangman. And what are the first words Hangman says? "I'm your Savior"
Yes, praise Jesus, Hangman, you are.In the end, Maverick and Rooster arrive back at the carrier and are welcomed as heroes, like Vikings entering Valhalla. But the curtain has yet to fall until we're back at Mavericks hanger, where he works hand and hand with Rooster (all sins forgiven) and meets up with his new love and her daughter (the family he always wanted). Together they take off into the sunset which in this case is a representation of the light at the end of the tunnel and his final passage to Top Gun Heaven.Unfortunately, the proper coda is missing from this film, and an add-on by the director would be simple. A fade to black after the credits, followed by the image of the burning remains of the hyper-sonic aircraft from the beginning of the film, with a slow close-up to a partially melted helmet with the name Maverick emblazoned across the front.

Well what can one say? USA does it again, not just a fighter pilot but a Top Gun instructor aged 59! Has there been a fighter pilot that age? This film is so bad ,so unbelievable it stinks. The scene when Cruise flies up and goes between the 2 jets....oh dear, come on..the film is just terrible.

I rewatched the first Top Gun (1986) before watching this one, to get in the mood, to remember the story even though that wasn't really necessary as I remembered most of it. I scored that one with eight stars as it was really impressive for the year it came out. When I saw Top Gun Maverick got an even higher score I was really wondering if it could match the first one, let alone being better. Well the verdict has fallen, it's indeed even better. The shots in the air are really impressive. I watched this movie on my television at home, on a pretty big screen, but I can only imagine the sensation watching it in the theater. The story contains some scenes that looked like a copy of the first movie, which was good for the nostalgic amongst us, but the major flying parts, certainly towards the end were different and in all honesty much better. I guess in 2022 we can achieve much more. I don't know the budget for Top Gun Maverick but it must be huge and it shows. As for the acting well let just say that Tom Cruise aged very well, his role as Maverick was really enjoyable to watch. The rest of the cast did a good job too, making this Top Gun movie a movie that will be remembered in the future. If you were a fan of the first one I can only recommend you give this one a go, preferably on a an IMAX screen.

Am I the only one who has noticed that this is basically a serious version of Hot Shots (which, in turn, was inspired not only by Top Gun but also by a certain Israeli mission)? You can find similarities in the overall plot, the mission parameters, the details both big (e.g. The connection to the death of the father of a team member) and tiny (landing with a highly damaged plane).Does it matter though? Not in the least - I love all three movies.

I only saw the original Top gun a week ago, my husband made me watch it so I could go to the cinema to watch Maverick with him.Top Gun was good. Maverick was AMAZING. I laughed I cried. I honestly could have sat and watched the whole movie again straight after it finished. That's how much I enjoyed it. Watching it in 4DX added to the experience.Never been a fan of Tom cruise but he pulls it off in this. It's exciting, heart warming, happy, sad. Everything you could want in a movie. Val Kilmer made it that little bit more special.Can't wait to watch it again.
Amazing flying sequences, great performances and good old fashioned nostalgia make this the best film of the year so far, one of the best sequels ever.Highly recommended.

I only have one thing to say about the movie I just saw today "Top Gun Maverick". Thank you Tom Cruise and the whole team.36 years ago I saw Top Gun with my mother, today I saw it with my father. Fabulous.

It is a rare occasion, if ever, that someone can say that a sequel might have been better than the original. Top Gun Maverick is a movie where I can say that. Top Gun came out when my mother was in high school, something her dad enjoyed, something I enjoy. We packed into the small hometown theater with the most amount of people I've seen in years, there were four generations in the theater that day, from young kids to great grandparents.Top Gun Maverick was able to be so many different kinds of movies in one, and it excelled at all of them. It brought back connections with old characters, and it brought in new ones that felt real. I can fully say that this movie is the best movie I have seen, ever.
I watched the first movie in 1986 and its worth the wait. Action from beginning to end, excellent perfomances, I will buy it when it comes to blu ray. Beleieve me no one will be dissapointed.

reviews.review_title: Not Better Than the Original but Still Great
reviews.content: I feel like the praise for this film is a bit overblown in how people are saying it surpasses the original Top Gun, which I find it surprising because to me they are meant to be different kinds of films. The first film is unashamedly pure testosterone and is very much a product of it's time which I mean as a compliment. It was simply just fun. This new one by contrast is quite sentimental with how Maverick still mourns the loss of Goose, questions his value in today's society and rekindles a relationship that he knows he took for granted in his younger days. It goes for more serious moments and these are mostly well done, just some of the dialogue is a bit clunky and some of the new characters aren't that developed.Of course where the movie truly shines is in the action and in this area it surpasses the original immensely. They really ramped up the speed and aerial maneuvers performed and it was exhilarating to see on the big screen. There is an action scene at the end which is incredibly over the top and cheesy, but the action is so fun that you can't help getting on board and having a good time with it.I would only rate this lower than the original as I have no detractions from that one. But as most modern movie sequels simply try to cash in on originals and rehash the same ideas, Top Gun Maverick is refreshing in that it honors the original source material and does enough new things to make it a great film on its own merit.

About as formulaic as you can get. It really is a burger, fries and pop film. I don't usually have a problem with American guys slapping themselves on the back and proclaiming their superiority, but this film took it to a whole new level. Pointlessly. Irritatingly. Maverick, the protagonist, was, you guessed it, the maverick! No real explanation why, he just is. And he railed against "the man", or the admiral in this case who, tried to shut down Maverick, but Maverick always won through by breaking the rules and... uhh so predictable, why bother? Val Kilmer had an exceedingly strange and pointless cameo. There was love interest and a teenager. The teenager did nothing, just kind of appeared said something meaningless and went. It was a long film with very little content. If you absolutely love planes whizzing around then you might find something here. If you want depth, story, three dimensional characters, look elsewhere. I was really looking forward to this film and just feel completely let down. I'd get more satisfaction reading the side of a box of diabetes inducing confectionary.

Predictable story, unrealistic, more like 2+ hrs of Cruise preening (like in the 1st one).No real military allows what Cruise's character does, nor would any responsible officer do. E.g. In the beginning he takes a test plane to a higher speed than it should go, ignoring the instrument danger readings, and for no real purpose (other than "he's Maverick!" I guess). Results in crash of a $ 100 mil plane (your tax money), which could have killed innocents. Even his call name Maverick is unrealistic (along with Iceman, Payback, Phoenix, etc), aviators/pilots are specifically not given cool names. Nor would they want one, as would sound pretentious to their peers (as if they're a Hollywood actor in a role).Central story is predictable soap opera re conflict with son of Goose who died in 1st movie. And seems honestly strange that Maverick's wall is plastered with pics of Goose 26 yrs later. (And Q Tarantino's take on TG's gay overtones coming to mind)Movie - finally - picks up some in last 25 minutes with a decently handled combat mission and escape. (Though bizarrely on an aircraft carrier full of planes and aviators they decide to only send one to protect Maverick's incoming plane from attack ?) One and only actor who stands out is Glen Reynolds (Hangman, in the semi antagonist role) he has a fun edgy energy.

reviews.review_title: High flying thrilling action in the sky!
reviews.content: Finally went and saw this latest long awaited installment of the "Top Gun" franchise, and I must say that "Top Gun: Maverick" did not disappoint the scenes and camera work were thrilling as the film was fast paced and exciting and a thrill ride of high flying fun. I saw the original as a kid in 1986, and liked it, as many young men had Tom Cruise as their idol.Now after 30 years Pete Mitchell(in a standout and classic performance from Tom Cruise) returns as a top Navy aviator and he's chosen to teach younger up and coming test pilots. The test is working with young Rooster(Miles Teller) the son of Pete's late friend. Plus watching I got a throwback legendary feel seeing Val Kilmer and Ed Harris also Jon Hamm is a good supporting cast member, and Jennifer Connelly is just fine as Pete's love interest. The flying scenes with jets are thrilling and stunning it has you pumped this "Top Gun" sequel was made well with passion and fun.

Neat camerawork, effective combination of practical and special effects, great sound design and a simple story told with gusto and emotional depth - this has been a surprise package. And definitely for a lot others out there this would definitely a nostalgic ride, a journey down memory lane for this sequel comes 36 years after the release of the original. The first film despite its flaws was a decent entertainer but 36 years later they have enhanced the flavour and definitely upscaled the experience. There's good amount of worthy performances and absolutely fantastic amount of thrilling chases, aerial fights, and training sessions.

Exactly what I hoped for.Lots of nostalgia and breakneck action sequences with a perfectly measured amount of emotional elements to tuck all the boxes. Watched via free Sky VIP tickets but with be going back to experience in IMAX as that will be the best way to do justice to this long awaited sequel!!!

I don't know how to put this nicely... In this movie, no one is trying. The screenplay is cookie cutter/completely predictable, the characters are all the same character (cocky navy dude-even Jennifer Connolly plays cocky navy dude), the mission is vague and the stakes are non-existent.Maverick is supposed to choose 6 pilots out of a class of about 16 for this bull's eye mission. Though, only 6 of them get any screen time. I wonder who he'll pick. The inclusion of two black characters and a Latino seems progressive until they total about 5 lines of dialogue collectively. Token, much?The best part is at the climax when the "acting" becomes secondary to the action. The plane stunts are cool. That's literally all I have to say about this movie though. So dull. I don't know who this is supposed to appeal to, but it isn't me.
I was blown away by this film, it was the perfect combination of nostalgia and new and exciting. I walked out of the cinema wanting to see it again and I cannot wait until it's streaming!

Say what you want about Tom Cruise and his action movies, but you can't deny it has to be the most thrilling experience you'll have all year. This movie just proved that once again. I knew the basic plot heading into the movie, so I thought I wasn't really going to care much about what happened on screen, but the movie just SUCKED me in. If you can watch this in Cinemas please do. The action just felt so real and had me invested all the way through. This type of movie only comes around every decade or so.Hands down my favorite action movie of the last 5 years.

reviews.review_title: One of the best sequels of all time.
reviews.content: Let's say this from the start, the plot isn't ground breaking, however what it does, it does perfectly.We join Maverick who is now a test pilot, who still lives on the edge but is still trying to come to terms with Gooses death.Maverick is recalled to Top Gun to train a bunch of graduates for a lethal mission, one of which is Gooses sim Rooster, who Maverick has tried to be a father figure to but they have had a falling out.The film is emotional, entertaining beyond belief and the aerial footage is spectacular and really gets the adrenaline going. Characters are good and seeing where Maverick is in life is also great.The movie pays homage to the original and it does it extremely well and is handled brilliantly.I won't give spoilers away, but this film is better than the original, I had goose (pardon the pun) bumps during the opening scene.I've seen the film twice now, first time within its first week in 4DX which was excellent and it was brilliant to see the cinema was sold out on every screening and in different locations and this was great to see as the atmosphere in the cinema was electric. This was a film that the world and Hollywood really needed, it lift spirits, was superbly entertaining, paid homage to the past and had some really emotional touching scenes.Go see it.Talk to me Goose.

reviews.review_title: Finally! but don't think too much
reviews.content:
About time we got this movie! And what a movie it is.But honestly.. don't think about it too much.It is pretty much copy/paste of the last movie, filled with all the cliche's..
Start, training, flying scene, blonde "nemesis", training, flying scene, tom meets girl, motorbike, topless volleyball, love scene, more flying scenes, mission, , kaboom, smiles, end. - filled with a bit cliche's and fan service.You are really going to tell me that the only.. possible.. way.. of destroying that base, was to fly a jet into the ravine. When they have smart bombs that can pretty much deliver one through your mailbox... from orbit.. or turn that mountain into a parking lot..
perhaps a little too many Star Wars vs Deathstar vibes.. But again, don't think about it too much. It's cool flying scenes and Top gun!Normally I cringe at the fan service, but here it actually turned out alright.. I mean.. sure.. isn't it a coincidence that the enemy has one F14 parked up for them to steal... yes it is.. did you see it coming as soon as they even mentioned that F14... oh absolutely!.. did it matter? No not really.And for some reason, none of that mattered. It's just such a great movie.. and you only care about how much fun you had in the cinema watching it.The flying scenes are amazing, the directing and camera work are amazing. The sound of jets blasting off is amazing.I actually really liked Miles Teller in this role. So did the rest of the cast.. it had some good acting, some great jokes, great music.Finally a "sequel" done right, and worth the wait.

reviews.review_title: Just... wow. See it in IMAX
reviews.content: Old school filmography under modern expectations. Everything the first one aspired to be but lacked to begin with. Kudos to Tom Cruise and his craziness. Keep 'em coming Tom.

reviews.review_title: This film is so good I love it.
reviews.content: Although is also good as well I love the scenes in the first one but this sequel is so good and amazing jets they used in film of top gun. I really love it so much and some scenes were funny and interesting the story of this film. This is the best sequel of the top gun movie series.

Like many of the other reviewers here, I was 19 when I saw Top Gun. I was in summer school in college, full of dreams and idealism. Seeing this now at 55 after being married with adult children and all the life experiences that has brought with it, all I can say is; thank you Tom Cruise, Jerry Bruckheimer, Val Kilmer, and basically everyone involved with the making of this film (and the original). The love, dedication and passion put into this movie is obvious throughout. You have restored my hope in Hollywood. I hope you are working to mentor a new generation of filmmakers, since they have some awfully large shoes to fill.

reviews.review_title: Surprised and Rewarded for going to see it.
reviews.content: Quickly immersed, tense throughout and highly emotional. Hit every thing I had wished for.There were moments that no popcorn could be heard chewing throughout the theatre.

Super Spectacular Realistic Footage of Fighter Jets with Super Sonic Speeds, Sound System, Directing, Edits, Production, Thanks to Tom the Legend and the whole Cast and Crew, Really a must see movie with super adrenaline and action popcorn movie, excellent work...one of the best movies this season.

(Watching Top Gun: Maverick in Hong Kong)During the epidemic in Hong Kong, the cinemas were not fully opened. Individuals rarely enter the venue, one epidemic is still there, and secondly, there are not many blockbusters.However, in middle age, although I have not achieved my ambitions, still love high-quality blockbusters.1. I watched the movie three times, two of which I took my son to watch (IMAX and MX4D) together. Before entering the show, I was afraid that the child was still young and did not understand the history of the original drama. Because the focus is on the air battle scene, and the characters have little dialogue, lucky that my son also love it.2. The protagonist's halo made himself survive many hardships, including crashing the aircraft twice and violating military orders, but the audience continued to appreciate it.3. The literary drama and the fighting scene are equally divided, but there is no toilet time, because the character dialogue is short, concise and refined (including the opening sentence of the child~~earth), even the supporting role is very stealthy (Fat Hondo).4. There is actually no heroine in this film (if there is, it must be F18), but they can do a lot of words, explain clearly, and have a clear character. Among them, the heroines Phoneix and Penny's daughter are especially obvious.5. It is recommended to go to MX4D or IMAX, because the air battle scene is real, giving the audience a feeling of being there: the former is constantly changing the seat angle to simulate the fighter seat, and the latter is wide-angle and wide-angle display beyond the normal screen.6. There are many supporting roles, but the characters are vivid and real: Ice, Rooster, Cyclone, Warlock, Hangman have all played their roles, you will always remember that Ice emphasizes friendship, Cyclone is dehumanized, only chasing the target, and every sentence of Warlock is the key point, can't find a nonsense wording...7. The F14 at the end of the film is believed to be a lot of people who will shout when they see it. It is not the memory of the previous episode in the film. Most of them are not able to land on the aircraft carrier when they are playing games, or their mom will turn off the video games when they play halfway...8. If you are not a parent, elder brother or senior, you may not understand why the protagonist often asks his subordinates to come back safe. People die in the war. However, if you have a teammate or a not-so-bad boss, or you are favored by others, you would rather minimize damage, because you don't want to lose a friend.9. Don't want to spoil the show, friends who haven't entered the theater may ask themselves, if 36 years later, would there be another movie like this?

WOW. WOW. AND WOW. THIS MOVIE IS BEAUTIFUL! Top Gun Maverick! I will start by stating that I have no special attachment to the first film like some but this movie really reels in the events of the first film and plays with what happened pulling on your heartstrings and upping everything they did in the first movie. An advantage this movie has than the first is it has a clear plot with them preparing for a mission and it's simple enough but the story, the acting and the way it's shot is all masterfully crafted to tell the story the best way possible. The whole cast is great in the movie, Tom Cruise of course is great as always and really brings in the action and his skills as being an expert flyer and then Miles Teller wow... he was incredible as the widely known Goose's son he really brought in the emotion and together with Tom he managed to bring in the story with his father and the redemption arc making them closer. I am absolutely obsessed with how this movie looks though. The colours really highlight everything on screen and the way the film is shot in every single scene helps tell the story and elevate it by having emotion with the shot. The cinematographers really work with the actors on this to highlight every little detail and bring the film to life. The call backs to the previous film and the Goose storyline being continued throughout making the ending of the film so satisfying and a resolution everyone can be happy with. I didn't cry but I felt everything within the film, the tension, the adrenaline, the heavy and heartbreaking moments. Thanks to everyone on the team for master crafting this film!

reviews.review_title: Sequel just for the sake of it ...
reviews.content: There are certain roles that actors shouldn't revive when they get to a certain age; Stallone in Rocky, Schwarzenegger in Terminator, Willis in Die Hard. Tom Cruise in Top Gun, what is it? 36 years on? He is showing his age.Okay, he does his own stunts. But it's old. I expected him to have a Zimmer frame and a hoist to get in the plane.The plus side? No CGI and quite a cracking soundtrack. Otherwise, predictable story and cheesy dialogue.Others may like it. But not my cup of tea. It didn't 'Take my breath away' like the first.
What an amazing movie. Great images, acting, screenplay, soundtrack. A solid 9/10. It is not 10/10 because a 10 is for Godfather and Lord of the rings.

Finally got to see this on Memorial Day with a good friend of mine. The truth is I've only seen the original twice. Haven't grown up with it! But I've always loved Tom Cruise from his acting and his intense stunt work. I went into this hoping to be entertained, and that I would feel. Boy oh boy, did this film live up to the hypeTop Gun Maverick is without a doubt the best film I've seen this year. Even if you haven't seen the first movie, guarantee you are still going to have a lot of fun with this. The story is so well written, and everyone acted so well. Everytime the jet sequences were happening, I feel like I'm in the jets and it's putting me on the edge of my seat. Tom Cruise shines as Maverick once again and this time, he's teaching the jet pilots to be the best ever. One more thing, I was crying through half of this film!That's my short review without spoilers. It's an A+ film! Highly recommend it. You won't be disappointed.
We absolutely loved this movie, despite the long wait. The story is great, the action phenomenal and the acting real heart. I loved Top Gun but I think this movie is even better than the first.

Not nearly as good as I expected it to be.And everyone said this wasn't WOKE. I thought several parts were.But I did appreciate some things like seeing an American flag in an American movie, that's pretty rare nowadays....sad but true5/10 not nearly as good as anticipated.

I am a huge Tom Cruise Fan,mainly because of his "Mission Impossible "Movies! I saw the first Top Gun which I thought was ok or mediocre! I mean how good can a sequel really be? My friends kept saying it is good,give it a try! Boy was I surprised, did not expect this whatsoever! The Movie is Fantastic and way beyond my wildest expectations! Loved it,just loved it a lot! JMake sure you watch the first one first,you need to know the history,the first one is relevant!You won't be disappointed! Can't wait for Mission Impossible next year!

Loved the movie. The action in the 2nd half was incredible. My only complaint... 30 years too late. Like F&F, we should have had 5-10 TG sequels 😄
Tom Cruise pretty much looks the same as he did in 1986. I'm certain he will continue to do so for TG3 releasing in 2058. 🙂
If you are a fan of the original TG then you must see on the big screen.

Thirty-six years in the making, 'Top Gun: Maverick' has finally arrived after being extensively delayed from its original July 2020 release date. Does this long awaited and highly anticipated sequel soar as high as its predecessor?1. First of all, I rarely ever give films a 10/10 rating, especially action flicks, but this one totally exceeded expectations. In recent years, superheroes and sci-fi fantasy blockbusters have ruled the box-office but the this year the crown goes to Tom Cruise. Not saying this film will break the bank but rather deliver something special that will surely resonate with fans of the original and those witnessing the glory of fighter pilots taking flight for the first time.2. Tom Cruise proves himself a legend above all actors of his generation and present day. He surely has immortalized himself as one of the greats that can never be touched in this lifetime. Cruise carries this film with the same charisma and enthusiasm as he did 36yrs ago. Regardless of the controversy or what people might think of him, his will to perfect his films and the respect he has for art of filmmaking is yet to be rivaled by another actor.3. It is no secret or spoiler that Val Kilmer appears in this film reprising his role as Tom 'Iceman' Kazansky, and despite his disability to speak, it never hinders the emotion he conveys when he's on screen. The new young pilots (who I thought I'd dislike) proved me wrong to the point where I actually felt for them and the dangers they found themselves in while flying. Majority of the weight falls on Miles Teller (Rooster) as he has the most screen time with Tom Cruise, and though their relationship may seem rocky at first, its the thing that truly is the heart of the film.I can go on forever as to how fantastic this film is but there just isn't enough words. I was overwhelmed with joy from start to finish and found myself weeping tears of joy by the last 15mins of this film. 'Top Gun: Maverick' is the definition of why we fall in love with cinema. This movie is special in its own right and has an indescribable uniqueness to it that ultimately warms your heart and makes you want to take flight again and again.
I've seen this twice at the cinema now and I'd see it again. Top Gun Maverick is a brilliant movie that is made even better by the links to the first movie. Love this movie.

reviews.review_title: Top Gun fan or not, you will love this film
reviews.content: I am a Top Gun movie ('86) aficionado and I must admit, I had some trepidations on how the original storyline would be weaved into this new one. Wow, I was impressed - it worked very well. Many tips of the hat to the original, but with updates that are sure to impress and satisfy the purists. The flight scenes are a spectacle and you will like the characters - nostalgia aside, the Maverick script is better than the original. Cruise is good in the film and his obsession with raising the bar with his filmmaking is apparent. I will see this one again!

reviews.review_title: How a great sequel should be done
reviews.content:
Honestly I was expecting a very weak make over of the first movie. The trailers suggested something like that if recall well, a trainer some young egotripping pilots fighting for a spot and fatal accident... yes even the romantic story the bike and the beach volleyball pffffff nothing new all the same elements just in a 2022 quality update
And actually is exactly that but I underestimated a couple of things. First I underestimated the level of quality that was put into the making of this movie, they simply did two times the extra mile on every freaking detail from video to audio down to the technical details secondly I underestimated the hard work of Tom and all the other actors, deamn Tom you blew me off my sox what a performance at your age I salute you! And third I underestimated myself and the emotional attachment to the whole topgun thing... I took 3 minutes to get me in tears. Yes this is a very emotional movie for dudes lol I warned you. This was what i was waiting for THANK YOU.

I thought "Top Gun: Maverick" was very fun. Better than the first to be honest. The dogfights were great. Tom Cruise still has it too. It's a very good action drama movie with a lot of heart. Nothing that'll knock your socks off but it's an entertaining 2 hours.
It just felt magical. Did not feel like yet another boring action flick. Action was great, no moment left my wandering off. Graphics great. Sound track great. Story great.

Well done!! What a ride! After thirty years, it still has the gut and bravado of the first one and even more heart. Not predictable, not cliché-just the best of Hollywood telling a great story. I was so glad to see some original faces play their parts. So worth the seat at the theater!
Top Gun was one of the first movies I watched with my Dad. Went into the cinema today with high expectations and didn't regret it afterwards. I loved the movie, it was nostalgic and amazing.

I thoroughly enjoyed this!!Watched the first movie a long time ago and I personally liked that but the sequel hits it out of the park.We the viewers expect a Tom Cruise project to be easily distinguishable from other action movies. His movies push the limits of many technical boundaries, are entertaining and almost never dull. And this delivers in all fronts.The aerial cinematography was amazing and the sound paired with that made the action sequences emmersive. This movie should be experienced in theater.The music was good, the nods to previous movie was done in a tasteful way. All the actors did their job very well.One can argue some of the plot might be unnecessary, some forced, some too optimistic but when all the small and big things come together this movie just feels great!!

I fell asleep before the movie even started, I had been up since 2:am as soon as I sat down in the new chair at theater that was it for me, 14 minutes into the movie I awoke, Best movie in a long time!!! We watched Top Gun the night before we went to the theater to see TG; maverick. My wife and I were glad we did it helped with the back story, so this movie was just great! I do not say this to very many movies 🍿🍿

reviews.review_title: This movie is constantly on point
reviews.content: Top Gun: Maverick had quite a legacy to live up to and it nails it. The movie avoids the sequel trap of destroying the previous movies' character growth while allowing for a whole new story to be told. Maverick is allowed to be the star of his own movie (take notes Marvel) and shines throughout even as he has some very real struggles. His interactions with Penny are pure Maverick but also reflect the interactions of a more mature couple. The casting is all around wonderful, with memorable new pilots introduced. The female pilots in particular were handled well, being "one of the boys" without being sexualized or turning into Mary Sue's. Nods to the previous movie were integrated smoothly and every detail matters. Iceman was particularly moving. Rooster nails the mannerisms of his late father. The only minor complaint is that Maverick can't beat the original soundtrack, and acknowledges that by using several songs from the original.

Just wanna mention two details missing from this great feel good movie. #1 Why not mention a real enemy? North Korea with Rocket Man Kim Jong-un is an available enemy. Tom decided to play it safe and doesn't hints who the enemy is. #2 ehhh, great music? Maybe half of the success of the original Top Gun movie was because it had a fabulous soundtrack with Danger Zone and Take my Breath Away becoming hits. Nothing new here (Lady Gaga sung what?, can't remember).

I had low expectations since I'm not too much of a fan of military films. But, that said, my mom and I enjoyed this film a lot, and I saw it twice. I grew up having to fly with my dad, so my appreciation of flight is a bit different than the norm. The conflicts between the guys was very realistic, as was the romance, (however the lead guy should get out of Scientology before thinking anyone would really want to date him). The flying was amazing and awesome, I loved it.

reviews.review_title: Awful pacing & overemphasis on nostalgia severely dampen earnest value
reviews.content: I recently rewatched 1986's 'Top gun' for the first time in at least twenty years. I enjoyed it more than I expected, and more than I remembered, but it's not without issues; frankly I think it's distinctly overrated. It struggles with bad pacing, weak narrative development, and mostly unlikable characters, and I also think action sequences are a little disordered as they present. Suffice to say that I've been skeptical of this sequel from the time it was first announced; significant critical acclaim, popular favor, and award nominations have still left me doubtful, and even as I sat to watch I found myself thinking "I can't wait to hate this." I was genuinely hoping to be proven wrong about this highly esteemed blockbuster. I'm confounded, and in some manner frustrated, that I think I was right: this isn't nearly worth its 130 minutes.I've heard other people describe 'Maverick' as purely a "nostalgia trip," and from the start the film does nothing to suggest otherwise. The opening moments are just as tawdrily schlocky as those of the 1986 picture (almost shot for shot at first), and early exposition emphasizes with excruciating exactness that protagonist Pete Mitchell is still protagonist Pete Mitchell. As if it were possible, the editing, direction, and initial plot development are even more overzealous and poorly paced than they were almost 40 years ago. Revisitation of the score from Tony Scott's picture feels overdone and out of place; while I like the original music in concept, even the unique themes to present to us feel like they're being rushed, in the process sometimes killing whatever mood they're supposed to impart. An early callback to a line at the climax of the predecessor is no more convincing here than it was there; later, a new variation on the somewhat infamous volleyball scene comes across as extra cheap, not to mention extremely On The Nose. By the time only twenty minutes have passed almost the entirety of the plot is laid before us - and speaking of "nostalgia trip," the mission that will be at the core of the narrative pulls directly from the first 'Star wars.'I love Jennifer Connelly, but her character's introduction is just about as weak and flimsy as they come, and Penny is written poorly; I altogether feel bad for Connelly, more than I have since Dario Argento's mediocre 'Phenomena' in 1985. That scene in which she first appears - also representing the introduction of most other characters to appear - is written, directed, and acted with such wretched precision, dispelling suspension of disbelief, that I found myself wondering if this wasn't actually a joke. Or were all on hand just taking inspiration from stage plays, and moreover taking that inspiration too far? Uh oh, here comes another Nostalgia Trip as a new character plays a particular song on a bar's piano. None of this is to say that there's no intelligence or cleverness in the writing, or no earnest effort from writers, director, or cast or crew. But as 30 minutes have blitzed past, all that possible value is subsumed by astonishing, aggravating velocity in the film-making and storytelling, and more apparent care for reliving the past than actually telling a story. As if to emphasize the point: I love the soundtrack, filled with classic rock; the sheer number and frequency of classic rock songs to greet our ears is plainly dubious. There are some worthy themes and story ideas broached in passing, including accentuation of the risks of the mission at hand, but they come and go so quickly and with so little active interest from the feature that we'd arguably be better off having not gotten a taste of them at all.Now, as before, action sequences are artificially embellished with curt editing and loose, disjointed cinematography that substitutes flash and bombast for earnest impact and excitement. (At least the course of events in regards to such action is more lucid than it was in 1986.) The romantic element rings even more falsely than it did before; there comes a point where I thought surely the scene playing out before us had to be a flashback, but no, it's the active narrative. 'Maverick' tries its hand at some sincere light humor or heartfelt scene writing, yet for as heedless as the picture launches itself forward at all times, the most honest writing nevertheless struggles to achieve its goal. With all this having been said, I can't say I think very much of the acting. The cast try, bless them. I admit I'm predisposed to liking Connelly, but even in her supporting part I think she might give the strongest performance. I know much as been made of Tom Cruise's portrayal, hailed in some circles as possibly the best of his career; I just don't see it. All the actors' best efforts are all but lost amidst the tiresome rapidity of the proceedings that dampens the drama.I see what this could have been. I recognize the strength in the story of Peter Craig and Jason Marks, and the screenplay of Ehren Kruger, Eric Warren Singer, and Christopher McQuarrie. The plot is compelling in the broad strokes, and the scene writing; in concept the dialogue and characters are ripe for rich storytelling. There are a handful of scenes scattered throughout that meet with substantially more success than the rest of the movie; though still less than perfect, if the whole had been approached with as much attentive mindfulness as such select moments were, this really would be deserving of all its resplendent regard. In concept, the climax is absolutely phenomenal. It's too bad that the pacing is agonizingly forced, if not outright reckless. It's too bad the writing shoehorns in every possible callback that it can, making sure viewers are reminded that this is set in the same universe as Scott's antecedent. It's too bad the writing is actually overfull, weaving in a surfeit of thoughts that mean every component part is both squeezed into a corner and watered down, while almost every character except Maverick himself is essentially just a set piece. It's too bad that one line, whose early repetition is questionable, gets reused again and again throughout; it's too bad action sequences are chopped up as much as they are. This could have far exceeded its forebear in every way; instead, it's no better than on par, and for all the many aspects that raised a skeptical eyebrow at one time or another, I wonder if isn't actually inferior.Factor in transparent boot-licking of the U. S. war machine, no better than the 1986 feature and maybe even worse, and this is a lot to take in - and I'm sad to say, not in a good way. 'Maverick' adopts a much more serious tone, which I think is to its benefit, but otherwise weaknesses in its craftsmanship drag down the result so much that it almost becomes self-parody. I include pretty much the entire last 20-30 minutes, which come across as extraordinarily common - though well done in and of itself, this could be any action flick of the past 50 years - and tacked on such that the film as a whole feels woefully overlong; imagine if the Battle of the Pelennor Fields in 'Return of the king' were extended by another thirty minutes. Was this an ego trip, in addition to being a nostalgia trip? The final action sequence might be the single best part of the title, the one instance when it was firing on all cylinders for at least a time, but by then it's some combination of "Too Little, Too Late," and "Too Much." There is a great deal to admire in 'Maverick' in and of itself; I see the hard work and earnestness that went into it. I also see an overabundance of flaws that weigh upon the end result so heavily that one must actively work to enjoy it.This should have been a genuinely great movie. It should have been fully deserving of all the praise that has been showered upon it. Unfortunately, in pretty much every way it possibly could be, 'Top gun: Maverick' is irritatingly overwrought, significantly diminishing its worth. I can at least say that my impression improved over the course of its runtime - but it was an uphill battle the whole way, at a very steep grade, to even reach the point of saying "okay." Despite everything, I wanted to like this more than I do. I suppose I'm glad for those who get more out of this nostalgia trip than I do, but on that note, maybe it's best recommended only for those who can't get enough of the 1986 movie. Everyone else can probably just move along.

Ok the aerials are extraordinary but I just wanted young Tom back, the sizzle of him with KMcG was *intense*....
This felt forced and spark-less!The whole narrative arc with the F18 was too stupid. Really. Tom is Mr Fabulous yes i love him but I just don't why this was made.Please god do not make a third.

I only watched the original "Top Gun" movie earlier this year, so my wait for this follow-up feature wasn't as long as it obviously was for its long-term fans.I must admit that I enjoyed the original with its mix of high-flying thrills, clichéd characterisations and situations on the ground and loud rock music and given that "Maverick" was pretty much more of the same, I'd have to say I enjoyed it equally as much.Tom Cruise returns as our hero Captain Pete "Maverick" Mitchell still flying dangerous aeroplanes in this man's air force, to and beyond their limits, naturally cocking a snook at authority in the process, which is of course why he's still only a captain 36 years on as he's constantly reminded throughout the film. That is, until he's suddenly plucked to train this year's intake of young fliers to carry out a dangerous bombing mission to take out a uranium plant in an unnamed foreign country. Of course, Mav's first instinct is to aspire to lead the squadron himself but in this he's thwarted, at least for now, by his censorious new C. O. played by John Hamm. Worse yet, amongst the wannabe pilots is the son of his late lamented partner Goose, handily called Rooster, played by Miles Teller and it's no great surprise to witness the simmering tension between the two.After numerous simulated training exercises with his young charges, Maverick has to choose just the select crews who will go on the near suicidal mission. Will Mav get to fly on this, his proclaimed final flying mission, will he win the respect of his not-quite-adoring pupils, will he find love with Jennifer Connelly's old flame bar manager at the airbase and lastly will there be a big man-hug between him and Rooster before the end?Well, you won't need a heat-seeking missile to direct you to how it all turns out, but it certainly does so in an exhilarating and highly entertaining fashion. Bar one new Lady Gaga song over the end-titles, the soundtrack is very much retro-rock comprising The Who, Bowie, T Rex and even Foghat which makes you wonder who locked these prospective fighter-aces up with their dad's record collections.Anyway, there's lots of double-speak technical talk, amazing simulated flying stunts and as you'd expect, tear-jerking catch-ups and look-backs at Iceman (a brave cameo by Val Kilmer) and Goose, with the recreated "Great Balls Of Fire" wig-out by his son, under Maverick's detached, baleful gaze.Cruise literally cruises through his part with his million dollar grin and glint never far away, the mostly young talent around him provide strong support and I liked Connelly as the love interest.Never mind that the film makes the viewer complicit in another highly covert U. S. military operation and instead rejoice that nobody dies this time, at least not in action anyway.Somehow I suspect it won't be another 36 years before old Mav flies into the great blue yonder again...

This movie is amazing. Hands down one of my favorites. If you loved the first one you're going to just love this one I guarantee. It's heartfelt and never really leaves you hanging on for too long. The action, adventure, and drama that takes place is honestly just the best. It's satisfying and yet leaves you wanting more or just to simply rewatch it for days. I honestly wish I could watch it as if it was the first time because every moment had my attention from start to finish. This movie has my heart.

reviews.review_title: Tom Cruise REALLY IS the Maverick of modern action cinema
reviews.content: Tom Cruise really risks his life on his films. He takes an active role in every movie not only as an actor but also as a producer and writer. Modern action movies are a spectacle of CGI, and yet, Tom Cruise still believes in practical effects, really learning skills for his roles and pushing his body and the rest of the crew for the sake of believability in his movies.

reviews.review_title: I never saw the original. But I'm easily old enough to have.
reviews.content: 'Top Gun Maverick' is all about its special effects. It's all about putting you in the cockpit with the pilot(s) and allowing you to see what they see, and to some degree, feel what they feel. And the film does this very well. Extraordinarily well, in fact. In fact, in setting up the details of the film's climactic scenes, the screen-writers did an excellent job. We, the viewers have been informed of the steps required for success, and so we know what steps and hazards still lie ahead. It's truly as if we're charged with flying the mission. And so we don't breathe easy until all the steps are completed.So then, Why only seven stars?Here's why.1. One sub-plot (Cruise has to instruct the son of an old colleague of his, a son who blames Cruise for his father's death) is complete melodrama. Making matters worse is the life or death struggle that pairs the two.2. Ed Harris and Jon Hamm play generals who are so 'by the book' that their characters are (a) indistinguishable and (b) robotic. How do you hire an actor as charismatic as Hamm and reduce him to playing an over-starched shirt.3. The Jennifer Connelly romance. Don't get me wrong, I love Jennifer Connelly, and liked her performance. But I needed to be filled in on how she and Cruise's character know one another; what was their relationship over the years preceding this adventure? I'm willing to say, Maybe I missed it. Or, It's explained in the original 'Top Gun'. But maybe not.4. Macho talk in the local bar; half as much would have been more than enough.Anyway, this film is a true 'One of a KInd'. In a good-special-effects way.So go and see it.If you haven't already.

It has been a while since I have seen a movie this good because of how genuine it is! In the world of CG, they did an outstanding job! The acting was on point, the stunts were real and outstanding. I would be really disappointed if Tom Cruise didn't win an Oscar for this movie.
Lacked depth. I really wanted to love this movie but it and the characters are shallow. You neither love or hate them, they are just people that you aren't invested in at all.
I won't repeat what others have said about Top Gun Maverick.We have been waiting 34 years and it was worth it.Stupendous and almost perfect (well, nothing is perfect).

reviews.review_title: Yes it's American propaganda but it's a good movie
reviews.content: Those who argue that this is propaganda are right, it would be ignorant to say that it isn't. If China or Russia made a movie where their special forces save the day like this, Americans would call it propaganda.That being said, it IS a good movie regardless. Well made, hitting everyone's nostalgia cords, and good acting.

Good heartfelt movie that we all really need every now and then. I really enjoyed it, it touched my heart, made me cry and made me feel good, I thought it was a really great movie! I saw the first movie so was nice seeing a follow up.Seems I need to say a lot more in order to submit this review. However, what more needs to be said? I thought it was a great movie and it's unfair that I need to say a lot of more words in order to submit this review!! I've run out of words!! What is wrong with a review that is short, sweet and simple? Why does everything have to be so hard? Seems 76 more characters required before I can submit this. Well I think I've met the requirements.

reviews.review_title: Hollywood, please learn from this movie
reviews.content:
Plot over character - check
(Crystal) clear plot - check
Slow build-up of suspense - check
No CGI - check. (CGI is to a movie what cosmetic surgery is to a face = depersonalizing)

I'm writing this after the Oscar noms, and I can't believe Maverick only acquired one nomination for best picture. Many actors deserve to be nominated...
That said, this story is played out so well, acting by all is realistic and excellent.The flight scenes the film is all about will have your heart in your throat!Very emotional, particularly scenes with his buddy ICE.I only wish I could have seen it on the big screen.This could be 10 stars, but note to producers, NOBODY wants to see a 60yo man getting it on.I'm pleased to see Tom in his real skin, it's refreshing! Instead of that permanent look of surprise so many have in Hollywood after facelifts.

reviews.review_title: 2 hours that reignited my hope for cinema
reviews.content:
This movie literally has everything I could want in a movie:
Suspense
Character development
Romance
Partnership & Team spirit
Technology and its impact on professionals
Life Lessons
A great score
Phenomenal visuals with discrete CGI
An actual storyMaverick shows the human side of a professional who has given everything to his job, not his career. Will he finally find a way to combine his sense of duty with love, life, and friendship?Tom Cruise and Jennifer Connelly enthrall us in a movie that reminds us of our teenage years when movies still were pure joy and unpredictable!I absolutely loved this!

reviews.review_title: A true sequel to its predecesor! Mindblown
reviews.content: I just came out of cinema. The movie blew my mind.They really did an a amazing job and they put efforts into making this one. Hats off to Tom Cruise for being the Maverick we all wanted him to be. I just feel so emotional right now...This is totally worth of endless repetition, just like the original Top Gun.

It can be said that this work has been created in parallel to the previous work! . The screenplay keeps moving us as a page of Maverick's beautiful love, a page of indescribable sadness at the loss of his friend, a page of training to master students. The director has given back the classic scenes, shots and light flow featured in the previous work! . The truth is that "Tom Cruise" continues to dedicate his body and life to his art without the slightest thought! . Make no mistake about going to the theater to see Jennifer Connelly's striped diamond eyes! .

Seeing the great Val Kilmer however brief made this fun look back special. Only wish Kelly McGillis or Meg Ryan had also been brought back. Aerial photography was almost too much for my fear of heights! Amazing.

reviews.review_title: Best I've seen in a very long time!
reviews.content: Bravo! Well Done! One of the best movies that I have seen in the movie theater in a long time. Thank you to the entire cast and crew for this clean...good hearted...positive...and exciting production on screen! Fantastic 😊😊😊

Better than expected! I've always wondered what a Top Gun sequel would be like if there ever was gonna be one. Thankfully after I brushed the thought to the side after so many years (mind you I was 5 when the first one came out) I was thrilled that one was in the making. Top Gun: Maverick had crucial elements that were necessarily consistent throughout and were complemented by much needed adrenaline rush all while paying homage to the original. An instant classic!!

reviews.review_title: Cheesy movie that relies too much on nostalgia
reviews.content: Be aware that the high rating for this movie is purely biased due to the fact that it is a rebooted addition to a nostalgic action hit movie from the 80s. It also took a few years before this movie finally hit theatres, creating a lot of marketing and hype. I myself am even scoring higher because of this, I'll admit.Objectively, it's a pretty basic, non-unique story of making amends and teaching courage. The scenarios in the original were already ridiculous, but this went even more over the top, turning it into a cheesy mess.Also, the weird side story with Peggy and Iceman felt like an after-thought (even though it was nice to see Kilmer given his health circumstances).I suppose, in a way, they were trying to stick to 80s-style screenplay writing with the surface-level characters that have no depth - instead rely on action. However, with today's films and TV shows providing both depth and action, it ends up making Top Gun Maverick look half-assed. Some of the dialogue was also legitimately cringey because of this.The intro was fun in how they tried to mimic the first movie with the set and music. As for the rest of the soundtrack, Hans Zimmer's over-played, gimmicky orchestral music throughout the film pulled away from the authenticity and made it appear tacky - like a lot of today's Hollywood franchises.If you're a millennial or late Gen X looking for some cheesy nostalgia, it's a good film to put on when you're not needing a lot brainpower and want a couple chuckles. If you're new to this franchise, don't think too much into it - you might be left feeling underwhelmed.

The first movie was pretty terrible but I absolutely loved it. And when Goose died, I cried. I still cry at that scene.As for the sequel? I felt nothing. Absolutely nothing. First you get to sit through Tom Cruise's hokey "commercial" at the beginning saying he did this for the fans. Was this to rehab his image? He's so creepy.I'm not sure what the problem was with Top Gun: Maverick. Lots of talky drama and Military politics. Blech. You have Jon Hamm playing a meanie admiral bureaucrat the same way he played Don Draper. Hamm shows a serious lack of acting range. The 2nd generation fighter pilots checked all the boxes as expected: the latina, the black guy, the nerd, the arrogant jerk. A few more thrown in for good measure.The first top gun was fresh and new. Perhaps the writers/directors/producers underestimated what needed to be done to make the sequel work? Their audience has since seen 35 years of schlock and formulaic and PC screenplays. What seemed novel in 1986 looks like laziness and boredom and stupidity in 2022.The only stand outs were two ladies. Jennifer Connelly as the Bond girl (I mean, Maverick's girl)...stood out by a mile. I've never understood why she hasn't been in more movies. And Jean Louisa Kelly makes a cameo as Iceman's wife. Both exuded warmth and depth. JLK was on the screen for maybe 3 minutes and she made more impact than any of the fighter pilots who monopolized all the other scenes. (ironically she stole the show in Mr Holland's Opus too. She's been doing it her whole career)Miles Teller isn't a bad actor, but in this movie, he's not likeable. At all. I didn't care about him at all. Goose was the heart and soul of the first movie. His son? The opposite. When you try to center a whole movie around an entitled, cranky, chip-on-his-shoulder son, you have Top Gun: Maverick.The only rewarding part was when Maverick humiliates the baby fighter pilots who think they have nothing to learn. He smashes their GenZ arrogance into a zillion pieces and it was glorious.

True to the original. Not a single second of lecture or identity politics. The female, cool and competent. Period. Same for the nerd. For all the criticism Cruise gets, he was great, the details were perfect. He is a gift, no matter what you think. The story was true, the call backs were perfect. It is so rare that we get just entertained. This. Was. That. My wife hates Cruise, loved this. Go. Enjoy. Revel in the good old days when movies had one goal. To entertain you. Very touching how they worked Val Kilmer in. Priceless. Thank you.

I have never reviewed anything in my 38 years yet this film....
This film I couldn't not say something to someone. Anyone. It was epic.Lots of reviews on here say to long, drawn out, even boring. What planet are they on?It has everything, action, emotion, humour, passion and amazing nostalgia with lots of nods to 1986. Even to the love interest having a Porsche like Kelly McGillis did in 86.Phenomenal work by Tom Cruise and the team.

reviews.review_title: Go see this movie you won't regret it
reviews.content: Would not lightly given it a10. In fact I don't even put reviews on here unless its amazing, this movie is why movie theaters exist, it's way better than the first and I'm huge fan of the first one. It hits all the nostalgic tones but then goes way beyond it. I saw it in dolby cinema sound but I heard it is even better in imax, the story is perfect and seemless blends the new and old without either one being intrusive on the other, if this is Cruise's last ride then he went out with a bang.

Thank you Tom Cruise for making such good movies, where there's no political agenda nor stupid unbeliveable plots. This is a fantastic one, action, emotion everything is there. I was stuck to my seat! You should see it in big screen. I will now watch the first one again! Thank you Tom!

"Top Gun: Maverick" is an Action - Drama movie in which we watch Maverick returning back to Top Gun in order to train some new pilots for a top secret mission. He has to face and confront his past demons if he wants to succeed.Since I had already watched the first "Top Gun" movie I was thrilled to watch the sequel of it and I was not disappointed at all. The interpretation of Tom Cruise who played as Captain Pete 'Maverick' Mitchell was simply amazing and for one more time he made the difference. Some other interpretations that have to be mentioned were Miles Teller's who played as Lt. Bradley 'Rooster' Bradshaw, Jon Hamm's who played as Adm. Beau 'Cyclone' Simpson and Glen Powell's who played as Lt. Jake 'Hangman' Seresin. Finally, I have to say that "Top Gun: Maverick" is an amazing action movie and I am sure that if you have watched the first movie then you love its sequel, too.

reviews.review_title: An ode to the 80s but also the world ahead.
reviews.content: All the stops have been pulled to make this film. The wait has been nearly 40 years, but they delivered and not by making a cheap sequel, too many of which we have seen in recent years as Hollywood aims for cheap cash grabs.This movie is an emotional roller coaster that is all about respecting and paying homage to the original. In multiple ways it even overtakes the original. The soundtrack and theme song by Lady Gaga is great (though maybe not as cool as the 80s songs), the flying scenes are the highlight of the movie and are just astonishing, making use of the latest technology. And finally Tom Cruise is magnificent in this movie as a middle-aged Top Gun instructor.All in all it is a recreation of the original for modern times, with a heavy dose of nostalgia, beach sport scene and all.The only negatives I see: Everything that is good about this film harks back to the 80s including Tom Cruise. But the younger cast, with the exception of "Rooster", is very forgettable. Iceman, Slider, and the others were much more memorable. There are also a couple dull scenes involving discussions between officers that somewhat slows down the movie and could have been done without.To sum up, the highlight of this film are the nostalgia, the soundtrack, and above all the flight scenes. I rarely say this but this film is one of the few that deserves to be watched in the higher-end rooms (Dolby Surround, etc).We sadly do not get 80s quality films from Hollywood often, this is one of them and without a doubt film of the year. Fly on, Iceman & Maverick! *Pumps fist in the air*. Thank you Tom!

reviews.review_title: I went in knowing I'd be disappointed, I was so wrong!
reviews.content: No spoilersI'm of an age where I remember the first film coming out, I didn't feel that it needed a sequel, and I generally don't like sequels or revisits, but I went out of curiosity.I was blown away immediately, the carrier deck scene at the start was amazing!As a young man I fancied myself as a young Maverick, a rule breaker that got the job done, and at heart I still am. But as a veteran I've left friends behind and it still scars me and I'm so glad that Maverick is having the same issues and it's dealt with sensitively, and meaningfully.The flight scenes in the original were what made the film though, and this is no less spectacular. It has really pushed the envelope with what can be achieved and seamlessly blends live action and CGI. You can really see the g effects on the actors and it adds a lot of realism.The soundtrack was fantastic too!They just got everything so right!

reviews.review_title: Brings back times when films were meant to entertain!
reviews.content: Extraordinarily made, fun to watch, birngs back good old times and memories.I laughed, I cried, I was thoroughly entertained.Cannot recommend it highly enough. Practical special effects and the whole cinematography brings it home.Honestly it is a refreshing experience that takes you back at least a few decades. If only more films today came even close to this...If you are still on the fence and do not believe the hype, trust me and go to the cinema now 😊Great watch!Thank you Tom and friends. 😊Solid 10/10.We need more of that type of pure fun, excitement, and real entertainment.
Absolutely amazing, from start to finish this is the epitome of a blockbuster, glad they waited and refined the finer details. Kick the tyres and light the fires.

reviews.review_title: HOLLYWOOD NEEDS TO GO BACK TO THIS!
reviews.content: WOW, What can I say!!! Hollywood, drop this Marvel wannabe action CGI Crap and go back to making action films like this!I grew up on film with live action shots and real acting... this ticked all the boxes apart from the new age millennial cast who all had weirdly small faces...I'm 39, watched all genres growing up, all top 100 imdv films..plus many more.The way this was filmed, it's pace, it's story, it's action....kept me on edge of my seat but the realism of it...was all worth it...Well done to all involved with this film.... Kudos to you all and Tom for making this the way it should of been done...

reviews.review_title: Best movie I've seen in a long time!
reviews.content: This sequel evoked the perfect amount of sentiment necessary to draw you into caring about the new cast of characters by linking them to the original film. There was also amazing suspense and action sequence. When a movie is all action without character development, I don't care who wins, because I'm not vested in the characters. Maverick made you care, and then had you on the edge of your seat rooting for them to succeed. I can't wait to see it again!

reviews.review_title: Big ol flyin chunk of cheese
reviews.content: I am old enough to remember the original (average) Top Gun movie coming out, old enough to not be able to remember all of what happened in it (That's how memorable it was lol), curious enough to check out the new Top Gun and wise enough to know what to expect from it.Well, I got what I expected, which was a cheesy script, predictability, action and entertainment with some great actual in cockpit footage.So switch off your brain and enjoy.That's about it...wait is that not enough?...more characters required to submit review...ughhh. Blah blah blah lots....of.....dots....wait still more?...come on we don't that much to...oh wait that's enough...enjoy :D.

reviews.review_title: Expected a poor cash grab, left with an amazing movie.
reviews.content: I honnestly thought going in I would just see a poor cash grab of a movie, with no substance, plot or actual writing. But this is an amazing movie. Truly one of the most entertaining pieces of cinema I've ever seen. And I truly encourage you to watch this, as it is filled with humour, emotion and action.

reviews.review_title: There goes Tom Cruise redefining blockbuster cinema again
reviews.content: I went in with no expectations, not having seen the original, but being familiar with it from references and articlesThis movie took my breath away. The dialog was contrived, simple, predictable and silly at times, but it absolutely worked for some reasonNone of the actors shined in this, although it was nice to see Jennifer Connelly in a thing again. Tom Cruise gave exactly the same performance he gives in literally all his movies, and it works somehowI think the direction, the careful building of tension, the kitschy mood and campy attitude occasionally met with genuine stakes, the simple, yet relatable story, redeemed what was otherwise would have seemed like a parody of action moviesGenerally, I would say, stunts don't make a film. In this one, however, they end up being the icing on this icing-heavy cake that ultimately just works.

Absolutely loved the fast pace of the movie. Though cliched and completely unbelievable in the last half hour, it kept me thoroughly entertained and it was good to see the new generation of recruits. Did not expect to like Tom Cruise but his wooden acting was definitely better and Jennifer Connelley was a more appropriate match as his love interest. Very good watch.

I know this movie was pushed back a couple times because of Covid but you need to see this in the theater. This is NOT a streaming movie. Incredible sequel, other franchises that try to make a sequel after so much time has passed and fail miserably. This one soars.

reviews.review_title: My mom would have her thumbs up
reviews.content: My mom passed last Feb. We often spent movie times before. Such a wonderful view if after she said good movie. She would, yes she would have for this Top Gun: Maverick, she would smile with her two thumbs up, one more thing, we could see tears left on her eyes and cheek.Simple drama packed in never ever action scenes. We hold our breath several times. There wouldn't be dead heroes, I knew it, it is modern film with classic touch, 80's touch to be precise. Awesome!Miss my mom so much.

Tom cruise effortlessly did good in this movie and a top nurture on how the young actors where brought in to this sequel which with all looks of thing will have a sequel even without Tom cruise in it. This is the Hollywood classic we have all been missing for a while and I hope other directors and script writer can take a look at this and see how we don't need to bring world vices to entertainment.

This movie is a great example of how to make a movie. Tell an amazing story, keep the action pertinent to the story. Keep out all the woke political BS. This was amazing! Cant wait to see it again and again!

With support from him old pal and now fleet commander Iceman (Val Kilmer), Cruise is sent back to Top Gun to train another bunch of cocky pilots to complete an impossible mission. He questions his ability to do this when he finds out that the son of his old mate Goose is one of the fliers and who isn't keen on him.Markedly better than the first film, although to be fair it was of its time. Whilst the flying and action sequences are breathtakingly done, it is the presence of and the performance given by Cruise that holds all this together. Because Cruise has spent so long making impressive action films, his ability to stretch himself on the acting front hasn't been seen much lately. He shows here what a terrific actor he can be, he's subtle, witty and charming and holds this exciting, touching and sometimes quite funny popcorn movie together with great support from a strong supporting cast, including a clearly unwell Val Kilmer. Good stuff and a cinematic treat.PS - You will simply not get the most out of seeing this unless you see it on the biggest screen with the best sound system that you can.
I didn't think I will like it but what a movie. One of those you will watch more then once. There was like 0 chemistry between Cruz and Jennifer but whatever that made no negatives on the whole.

All the waiting was worth it!!! Very good movie and very good sequel! After I saw the intro I already knew is going to be a good movie! All the references with the first movie are great! The music is also great! Go watch it in the cinema!!!

reviews.review_title: A movie that will inspire many generations!
reviews.content: This movie has a great balance between action, emotion and nostalgia. When this happens, it becomes more than a movie. Knowing how the original Top Gun inspired the generation of its time, this one will surely motivate not only this generation but future generations as well.When the original Top Gun came out, I was only a child. After 36 years, as I get older, while struggling in life to achieve something that hopefully transcends my generation, seeing Top Cruise on the screen with the same Maverick character trying to achieve the same thing as he struggles in life touched me deeply at a different level. I felt the feeling of getting older while struggling to continue to be the best of the best despite all odds life brings. What Tom Cruise did on the screen to tell the remaining part of Maverick's story literally after 36 years, as he gets older, was no acting, it was real. And that's why this movie is unique and definitely worth watching.

reviews.review_title: A trip back memory lane. A fantastic blockbuster
reviews.content: Joseph Kosinski and Tom Cruise created one of the best blockbuster films of all time. With insane stunt work and dazzling visuals this is the closest you'll get to actually flying in a fighter jet. (except if you have i dunno)...

reviews.review_title: Unbelievably GREAT sequel to one of the BEST movies ever made!
reviews.content: This will NOT disappoint!! We all got nervous when they said a second Top Gun was coming.....how can they follow up such a classic movie???Well, they did!!! Possibly the best sequel ever made. Tom Cruise is amazing and surrounded by a great cast. BRAVO!!!!!!!!

reviews.review_title: Excellent fun movie.....and no stupid marvel nonsense!
reviews.content: Hadn't seen the original but really enjoyed this. A simple but strong story and not too far from the believable. The flying scenes are brilliant and seemed realistic- so the special effects were almost invisible. Not too dark, no gratuitous sex scenes - a great old fashioned upbeat popcorn movie for the family. Let's hope it leads the demise of the endless gloomy, dark films and superhero rubbish.

One of the better films of 2022. What a movie! Worth all the hype that it has been getting.Tom Cruise was absolutely spectacular in the movie and so was Miles Teller. The movie had its moments from the start to the finish and the ending is a roller coaster ride.The video editing was impeccable and the score was beautiful as well.

Best filme of the yer because of multiple reasons. I just want to list here 2 observations that i consider to b minor errorsis a brief scene there is a picture written TJG where it was supposed to read LJG(i figure that it was the rank, Lieutenant Junior Grade)there is a picture of Iceman dressed with a four star admiral coat, and below the picture is written commanderi would like to understand this.

reviews.review_title: Finally a movie that's worth it
reviews.content: Finally , a movie that's worth it, a movie that makes you stay and enjoy it, a movie that doesn't make you check what time it is. Everything is done correctly as it should without trying to force something in your troat. The characters, the story, the pace, the enemy. It kind of look like a movie from another era done with modern era technology. Movies decades ago had this amusing factor, they were enjoyable for kids and adults, and this movie is just that plus modern CGI and cinematography. It's not a typical pop corn movie, it's a movie that deserves a reward.
Finally a movie's movie again. This is not filled with sociopolitical commentary like so many others. This one is action packed and better than the first one. Well done.

reviews.review_title: You can be my sequel anytime
reviews.content: Let's turn and burn! Not very often is an extremely high expectation met or exceeded but this particular sequel is part of the 'top 1 percent'. The action sequences, the camaraderie, the character arcs, the planes! All top marks. You can tell it was lovingly and painstakingly put together. Do yourself a favor and see it in IMAX. Glen Powell is a starrrrrrrr.

I first saw the original Top Gun only about a two years ago, and I had to watch it a few times to move past the cheesy 80's nostalgia to appreciate the actual story. Needless to say, I didn't walk into this movie with any real expectations and really didn't know what to expect. But WOW. I was at the edge of my seat the entire movie, cried about two times, and left the theater remarking over and over about how that was one of the best movies I had seen in a very long time! I often find movies very predictable, but this plot kept me saying 'Oh wow I did NOT see that coming!' throughout the entire movie. Visually it was very exciting, and the raw emotion brought back from the original story into this new chapter made this a very powerful sequel to an already great classic. I have not stopped recommending this movie and really want to go see it again!!

Tom Cruise should be made a saint. He absolutely pulls this one off. But then, should anyone ever have been surprised. So many nods to the original. And Miles Teller and the whole cast did a fab job too. Thank you for not ruining one of my favourite ever stories.

reviews.review_title: I FEEL THE NEED, THE NEED FOR REPEAT...!
reviews.content: Tom Cruise returns to the role that arguably put him on the cinematic (I would say '83's Risky Business got there first) map. Looking like the ghost of Tony Scott (who directed the first film) & even in the opening title crawl we see Don Simpson's name (he was Jerry Bruckheimer's partner back in the day), who's been dead for more than 25 years, we appear to have never left the world of Pete 'Maverick' Mitchell, still behind the stick as he's test piloting a new stealth fighter hoping to break that magic Mach 10 speed barrier. No sooner does his superior, played by Ed Harris, steps foot on the base, we know Maverick is up to his old tricks by breaking all the rules in order to win the day. Deemed a success but a failure (he crashes the plane) he's demoted (sideways?), to return to his roots so to speak & become an elite fighter trainer where one of the cadets in his rank turns out to be his old wingman's (Goose, Anthony Edwards) son, Miles Teller, who w/a number of others have been selected to run a treacherous mission to destroy a plant that has nuclear weapons in Mother Russia. Tension brews during the training between Cruise & Teller (over Cruise hindering his career's momentum in order to protect him) w/the outcome of the final mission never in doubt as Cruise's determined pearly whites & ray banned facade assure us all along. Never having been a fan of the original (remembering back in '86 watching it on home video muttering to myself 'I don't get it!"), but damn, this film does everything right when it was so easy to get wrong. Bringing back Val Kilmer as Iceman was definitely a step in the right direction even though he & Cruise have only one scene together, his presence (& his real life hardships as a throat cancer survivor) looms in the background so large that if the film ended after he & Cruise's tete a tete, I would've been satisfied but even the mission itself is a popper (even though the final movements might be too much icing on the cake).

The movie was good. Tom cruise is was pretty cool in the even in this age. The story of the was awesome and new. And it is different from other movies. Movie made had many moments when they made me both cry and laugh
