The movie is about Maverick overcoming the death of his friend goose.

Former aerial hotshot Captain Pete Mitchell is still in the Navy, but his career has plateaued so he can remain where he belongs: in the air. He's pushed his superior's buttons for the last time, until high-level intervention gets him recalled to TOPGUN where he's tasked with training a young, elite group of aviators for a critical mission. Just two problems, first: his unique track record and unorthodox methods draw the ire of his new CO, who's blunt about the fact that Mitchell wasn't his top choice to lead the squadron, but second (and much more important): the team includes the son of Mitchell's late best friend/former RIO. Whether you're a big fan of the first one or not, it's hard to deny that more than three decades later this exceeds expectations with spectacular, pulse-pounding action in the air, good music, and an ideal blend of nostalgia and human drama to give it the rah-rah quality that it really needs. Cruise still has the charisma to carry this type of film, and he's aptly supported by a steady group of actors who are ideally suited to their roles. ***

Top Gun: Maverick isn't your ordinary blockbuster; it's more than that. Tom Cruise is great as always, the flight sequences are very intensive (especially because they're practical) and the story is pretty interesting. This movie is made with love and probably one of the best movies of the last few decades. No doubt that Top Gun: Maverick will reach the 1 billion at the worldwide box offices; as it should be.

reviews.review_title: A Real Big Budget Turkey of a Film
reviews.content: This film has obviously had no expense spared regards to budget, but dollars spent does not equate to a great movie. The movie is so dull, I'm writing this review half way through the film. There's plenty of aircraft, training routines, shouting over comms and Tom Cruise smiling routinely or looking serious (seemingly the only two emotions he is capable of acting well) but sadly that's it. Over hyped and over rated is the story here. Very disappointing movie.How the hell is anyone rating this a 10/10?!

reviews.review_title: The nostalgic, the 80's feel, the aircrafts, Tom Cruise in his prime and everything else that related to the first one, what a movie experience.
reviews.content: Tom Cruise is one of the greatest actors living among us and he made Top Gun in 1986 and now we got to see the sequel. It had so much that reminded of the first one and everybody who got together to made this movie, they have a nostalgic sense to the first one. There is so much that I loved about this movie and I will have an emotional feel to this movie along time.I was waiting and waiting for this kind of a sequel that gets the first ones feel and emotion and nostalgic correct. It's also a little bit better than the first one, because of the emotion and throwing me back to the 80's movie.
What else can be said. A truly outstanding film.Edge of the seat, thrill throughout. A film I completely enjoyed. Maybe a bit farfetched at the end, but I can forgive it.See it on a big screen!

This movie relies on great story telling and great acting. The action scenes just put it over the top. It's been a long time since i could say something was this heartpounding. The kind of movie we need more of!

Oh wow , one of the best movies i saw in a long time .Kept me on the edge of my seat all the time .Excellent nostalgia moments , perfect soundtracks , and sweat and endingTruly truly legendary movie .

One of the best sequels. The script is much better than first Top Gun and has a reasonable involvement with the first Top Gun.Top Gun maverick portrays the magnificent cinematography, editing, sound mixing, and especial effects. Tom cruise plays one his best acting in Maverick and hoping that academy have a deep look on this performance,

reviews.review_title: Meant to be Watched on the Big Screen
reviews.content: I truly got comfortable watching movies and TV shows in the comfort of my home after the pandemic struck but when I first saw the new trailer of Top Gun Maverick which was released a few months ago I knew this was something that was meant to be watched and experienced on the big screen only.I stepped inside a movie theatre after more than two years because I just couldn't resist Pete Maverick. I knew what to expect from the movie, I knew it'll be incredible and I was 100% correct. The movie Top Gun Maverick is not a movie, it's an experience that can be attained only on the big screen.The awesomeness of fighter planes and the enthralling adrenaline rush a pilot feels while flying these powerful inventions is superbly felt watching the movie. The storyline is not particularly different, or great, it's a simple story with a simple to comprehend mission but extremely complicated to execute which is what makes the whole movie standout. The movie delivers magic and if it took decades to come out with this second instalment, after seeing how good it is, the wait is justified.I would've said this movie is a must-watch but that will be an understatement. It should be watched on the big screen and not once but more than once. Go hit the theatres and experience Maverick!

reviews.review_title: The best movie I saw in years
reviews.content: This is the best movie I saw in years. Packed with action, so intense and emotional. It's a true love letter to aviation. Tom Cruise is at his best and the fact that the movie was directed by the most innovative, visionary and best director in Hollywood in modern days, Joseph Kosinski, this movie even shames it's predecessor.There is nothing in the current days that can top this. No Marvel property is able to beat this and I do believe that this movie will be studied for years in how to do an action movie. It will take a time to Hollywood understand that CGI is not the only solution for stunts and special effects and I hope this movie is used as a baseline. Kudos to all the actors, producers and cast that was involved in this project. A very big THANK YOU.

reviews.review_title: The most fun I've had at the movies in forever!
reviews.content: If you love Top Gun for all its overly cheesy-macho amazingness then you will have so much fun watching this movie.The story is solid but nothing ground-breaking, but that doesn't stop it being one of the best movies I've seen in a long time. Cruise and cast obviously worked so hard to create aerial action like we've never seen before, the cinematography is incredible and the soundtrack is on point.Get to the cinema enjoy a big bucket of popcorn and walk away smiling.

reviews.review_title: One of the best tom cruise movies ever
reviews.content: The movie is amazing all the jet stunts and my man Tom cruise doesn't age at all he still that same old Tom cruise who does all the stunts by himself he is a true legend.

reviews.review_title: It was exactly what it was supposed to be.
reviews.content:
This movie was a blast. The flying scenes alone are seeing twice. Even as a stand alone it worked. You go to see Top Gun and your cup runneth over with Top Gun.It as good, and ridiculous, as it needed to be. Just like the original. I especially enjoyed the back third of the movie as it went off into a cra-cra James Bondian mode
I will see it twice!

This really is a superb film. Great cast, strong female characters who don't need to constantly snipe at or belittle the male characters around them to "prove" how strong they are, incredible action sequences that aren't ruined by CGI, a captivating, believable plot with multiple threads running through it and no moral lecturing or propagandising and no fixation on the diversity of the cast members. It's a celebration of courage, strength, positivity, self-reliance and humility encapsulated within a gripping and heartwarming story that treats the original with the rightful respect and nostalgia that it deserves.

reviews.review_title: Loved This Film !! A Real Blockbuster !!
reviews.content: Don't usually like sequels but both myself and wife really enjoyed this film, full of action and drama, the action scenes where brilliantly filmed. Believable characters and well acted, my wife said after about an hour she starts looking at her watch but not with this film, she said can't believe how quick the time went.Highly recommend this film and it must be watched in the cinema on the big screen to fully enjoy it.

reviews.review_title: Why did they do this ? So much drama
reviews.content: Im one of those who didn't like this movie. It's a fan service movie to milk $$.Giving 2 stars for the amazing flight scenes. Otherwise way way too much drama. Geezus.

Even though I hadn't watched the first Top gun before watching this and missed the first 15 to 20 minutes, this one did not disappoint - was worth every minute and the money.What went well:
-The problem to solve or Mission was engaging, the flying scenes were exciting and the experience was exhilarating.-Every scene in the movie(of the 2 hours I did not miss) has a purpose and you realize that as the film unfolds. It is crisp, well written and performed.I went for the cinematic experience and trust me, it does not disappoint. Watch it on the big screen and you will love it. Worth every minute.What did not go well:
The end was a bit exaggerated. But this was not based on real life and hence the creators did capitalize on taking creative liberty, which at the end was satisfying.Some people may not find this entertaining, may be because of non-familiarity with defense/aviation movies due to related jargons/lingo used. Stating that since the couple beside me left at Intermission and I was shocked. I would not leave this one mid way.Overall, a must watch if you are a Top Gun or Tom Cruise fan. Also, a must watch if you are someone who loves action thrillers, this is a different kind but worth it. If you are enthusiastic about the defense forces, missing this would be a sin! And yes, Must Watch in Theaters for the experience.

We saw this in an imax theatre and the visual and sound experience made it a marvellous experience.The storyline is straightforward, the emotional pull great, the relation to the original perfect.The master stroke for me was the dog fights in the air and STA's, the filming of which I thought was outstanding.Totally recommend watching this true action.movie.Praise to all of the actors who made this work so well.

reviews.review_title: I guess it is possible to make a perfect movie
reviews.content: In this age of political divisiveness, wokeness, and hollywood requirements to make every movie conform to "equality," you would think it is impossible to actually make a film that allows the audience to actually enjoy a film. Somehow Tom pulls it off. I left this movie just happy. I actually enjoyed every minute of it. It wasn't super original, it didn't send a message, it didn't break new grounds in technology, but it was just damn great. I have not seen a movie in which my only complaint was that it ended in a long long time. Thank you to all those behind it, thank you.

Its a marvel and a tribute to the 1988 OG. The intro gives you goosebumps as it takes you back to the OG, same opening sequence with Danger Zone throttling through your veins! That line aviators call it TOPGUN! Shivers!!! Chills!!!However, Tom Cruise takes this one to an another level. He is old, he is greyed but boy he has not lost his style! He carries the film on his shoulders. Be it the air sequences or dialogues or acting! This is Cruise's film. The support cast though delivers a solid performance.The air sequences are just Wow! A special callout to the opening sequence: the Mach 10 and the climax sequence. The climax giving tribute to the OG by bringing in the F-14 Tomcat. There was hint early in the film that the Tomcat could make an entry. But one couldn't be sure!As a fan who grew up seeing the OG on VCR, DVD multiple times. This was a fitting closure to finally see the TOPGUN on big screen!May Maverick live long enough to make a sequel!!!!
Possible one of the greatest films I've ever watched. Everything about this film is perfect! Sequels are usually not that good but this...this is bang on!

Wow I'm shocked by the love given to this shallow plotted, cliche ridden movie! I must have seen a different movie than most of you! There is zero chemistry between characters, the plot is stupid and ridiculous and I just don't get these reviews praising this movie as the gold standard! I just canceled my order at Amazon after watching it because imho, it has zero repeatability viewing! Maybe I expected too much given the reviews but I didn't expect to come away so dissapointed at how mediocre it truly was!Wow I'm shocked by the love given to this shallow plotted, cliche ridden movie! I must have seen a different movie than most of you! There is zero chemistry between characters, the plot is stupid and ridiculous and I just don't get these reviews praising this movie as the gold standard! I just canceled my order at Amazon after watching it because imho, it has zero repeatability viewing! Maybe I expected too much given the reviews but I didn't expect to come away so dissapointed at how mediocre it truly was!Wow I'm shocked by the love given to this shallow plotted, cliche ridden movie! I must have seen a different movie than most of you! There is zero chemistry between characters, the plot is stupid and ridiculous and I just don't get these reviews praising this movie as the gold standard! I just canceled my order at Amazon after watching it because imho, it has zero repeatability viewing! Maybe I expected too much given the reviews but I didn't expect to come away so dissapointed at how mediocre it truly was!

reviews.review_title: Hats off for such a class act!
reviews.content: Don't have words to describe how good the whole movie is made. Its simply a masterpiece. You don't watch it, you live it with Captain Pete Mitchell aka Maverick. Hats off.

There's not many sequels better than the 1st film but I thought this was one of them. It was a great story with top class acting by Tom Cruise and the rest of the cast. I wasn't expecting it to be that good. Great film.

reviews.review_title: It Is What It Is. Appreciate It.
reviews.content: The ending events pretty much suck, but the first hour and a half are tear-jerking, emotional nostalgia for the 80's original, which I loved. I'm very critical of movies of the last ten years, so it's all relative when you say this is a good movie. It has elements of it like patriotism, popcorn entertainment, romance, and nostalgia that I loved, but the hyped up reviews by critics are baffling. It's a fun sequel, but it's not great nor better than the first one; there simply is not enough depth and the ending devolves into suspension of disbelief and deux ex machina. Also, there are no songs except for Danger Zone from the original soundtrack. But did I love the thrilling and nostalgic experience? Yes. Was it a happy ending? Yes. Do I think it was worth the price of admission? Yes. Could it have been better? Yes.It's really a solid 6/10 movie, but because it's Top Gun, an 80's classic, and one of the greatest movies ever made (if you were not born before 1980 then you would never know that), I round up my score to:7/10Just have fun and leave your critiquing brain at the door. It's summer popcorn fun just like the original, but just not as good. Part One is simply underrated and greatOne thing that needs to be pointed out to everyone: Tom Cruise is a "movie star", not a social media "attention seeker", a "movie reactor", a "TikToc star" or a "reality TV star". He earned his fame when talent was required, as well as dedication. For this current (hopefully shortlived, C Eye A controlled world of Dopamine Hit- Vanity Projects of "wannabe" fake stars and fake-fame seekers through the Federal Government controlled social media narcissistic attention seekers) moment, Cruise got famous when "talent", true talent was required. And yet, he never would've gotten famous today because it's not about real talent, but vapid narcissistic attention seeking losers.

After 36 years, Tom Cruise reprises his role as Pete "Maverick" Mitchell where his iconic character continues to push the envelope as a test pilot and then becomes an instructor to a new generation of fighter pilots. Everything about Top Gun: Maverick is sublime from the script to the breathtaking cinematography and aerial sequences with no CGI or Green Screen that would keep fans on the edge of their seats. I believe Tom Cruise, Joseph Kosinski, Christopher McQuarrie, Jennifer Connelly and the entire cast have done a brilliant job and it is worth the wait. Top Gun: Maverick belongs on the big screen and it'll take your breath away.

Top Guns Maverick far exceeded my expectations, I tip my hat 🎩 to every single person that help this movie come to fruition. If you Love the first movie, then you'll Love this one even more. Everyone in this movie from the Movie cinematographer to the choreographers brought their A game. I don't want to spoil it for anyone, other than the fact that when you walk out after seeing this epic coming-of-age action masterpiece, you just might have some pep in your step!

reviews.review_title: An altogether really great movie. Just a fun movie and nothing lacking.
reviews.content: An altogether really great movie. Just a fun movie and nothing lacking. Loved this sequel. Even better than the first one. Lots of new characters and faces but with the same great flavor. You feel like from the beginning of the movie you never left and have been there the entire 30 years between episodes. New plot line and action sequences great. New characters are great and it is a very classical "feel-good" film that leaves you wanting to see it again. I am sure over time this will become a classic just like the first one. Hopefully they make another one, or a few others, but even if this were the last, great way to leave the story. Loved it.

I will give it 8stars for the visuals and cinematography.The characters and plot were so rushed and predictable, if you just want to enjoy a film where everything goes so well for the main cast and in the end, everyone in the lead is happy, then this movie is for you. If you think too much like Rooster, then you're not going to enjoy this that much. I believe that is the point of this whole film.One of the prominent nitpicks I have, because I'm not a fan of happy go lucky films, is that the mission should be impossible to accomplish even for an elite fighter pilot. It's only possible because Maverick is too talented for his own good, and throughout the whole film he is risking the safety of every normal and sane person besides him because he mistakenly believes, if he could do it, everyone else can. Not to mention, he has a strong plot armor that prevents him from dying after crashes, that takes away the tension and adds predictability to the plot.This is a film made for a broad audience because of its simplicity and action packed entertainment.I like that part, it's beautifully shot, but I doubt I will rewatch it for the story and characters.

I had a lot of fun watching this in theatres. It was a classic blockbuster and I hope more film makers go back to this formula because it's what the people want. Not every movie needs to relate to current political/social climate or leave us deep in thought when we leave the theatre. Sometimes we just want to see some really good looking people in action sequences, with a dash of romance and redemption.Plus, getting to see Val Kilmer on screen again warmed my heart.

Help me help you to take the highway to the danger zone...I even rode into the danger zone just to bring you this review of "Top Gun: Maverick".Well truth be known I was in a comfortable movie seat and the only danger I faced was running out of drink & food before this over 2 hour movie marathon finished so I started rationing my snacks while some of the best dog fights zoomed across the big screen in XD.This has to be some of the best aerial photography of fighter jets I've ever seen.However manage your expectations with a script that isn't as good as the original and a bar room scene that drags on past its use by date.This Top Gun took 36 years to finally be exclusively released in cinemas thanks to its star & Producer Tom Cruise strongly recommending it not go straight to streaming in a Covid-19 world.The late Bob Hawke was Prime Minister of Australia and Reaganomics was rife in the USA the year this story of a Naval Academy Flight School for elite pilots first came to light.Tom Cruise has been acting for 40 years and has once again strapped in to play the beloved Lieutenant Pete "Maverick" Mitchell in this Top Gun sequel.One of the running gags is at his age, nearly 60, he should be an Admiral by now, but he's a bad boy who doesn't play by the rules.I guess you could call him a Maverick...oh that's right they do.From being a shirtless arsonist in "Endless Love" to a shirtless ball playing pilot on the beach in "Top Gun: Maverick" he's gone the full circle.That's right there is no homo-erotic Volleyball scene in this movie, but don't worry Director Joseph Kosinski managed to film a scene where Cruise gets to flex his middle age pecs.This time he's teaching the next generation of aviators, including Miles Teller as "Bradley Bradshaw" aka "Rooster" aka the son of "Mavericks" best friend "Goose".He teaches them how to let their egos write cheques their bodies can't cash.The MacGuffin that propels this story along involves going into combat training on a level no one's ever seen, not even "Maverick".Also watch out for other characters Maverick butts heads with including Vice Admiral Cyclone played by Jon Hamm and Ed Harris as a Rear Admiral.Keep the tissues handy when Val Kilmer's "Ice Man" returns as an Admiral with throat cancer, the same disease afflicting Kilmer in real life.Guess who isn't back in this sequel?Kelly McGillis as his love interest "Charlie" instead Jennifer Connelly steps up as "Penny Benjamin" who's character only got a mention in the first "Top Gun".By the way if you are playing Top Gun Bingo the word 'dangerous' could win you the game...again.Your mission, should you accept it, is to see this movie on the biggest screen near you, because this film doesn't just complete me, it completes the Top Gun journey.

reviews.review_title: You could watch this movie in 50 years and it wouldn't be outdated
reviews.content: This movie is by far one of the best movie I've seen in years! Is it the great story? The great characters? The fact they used practical effects as much as possible? No, this movie is fantastic because it doesn't concern itself with identity politics, feminism and all that other cr*p, unlike so many other movies being released in the recent years. This movie is simply telling a story. There is no female army officer putting the toxic white male into his place. There is no female pilot (of color) which is the bestest ever and puts all the toxic white males into their place. This movie simply has characters and they just happen to be male, female, black, white etc. This movie was absolutely refreshing to watch, which is weird since everything you see isn't new at all. It just stands out in today's political climate. This movie was made for the fans and for people who don't want to get lectured in their entertainment. I'm not interested in army stuff, I don't care about jets or war or any of this stuff, but I really enjoyed this movie and I applaud this movie for just being a movie. Well done! The fact that this movie was done with practical effects as much as possible, is just another reason why this movie won't be outdated. You could watch this in 50 years and it still would hold up. That's how you make a movie!

This has to be my favourite film of all time for such a long time. I don't think I've ever been to the cinema & had a tear in my eye on a few occasions.This film is absolutely fantastic on all levels. Tom Cruise has definitely put 200% in to making this sequel & it damn shows it. My first words after getting out of my seat at the cinema at the end credits were "wow, now that was a very god film"!11/10 for this one!

Not much to say here really, the action and visuals are stunning, alone for that you should go and watch it in cinemas. If your really only here for a good story you should skip this one. Its story was, for me at least, forgetable and boring. The action clearly came first, which isin´t a bad thing in this case.

reviews.review_title: Overrated and Predictably Boring - Top Gun: Maverick
reviews.content: This film has all the elements of a Hollywood formula movie; A top name, a sequel to a financially successful film, and a guaranteed audience of double-digit IQs who think this kind of film can pass for a credible action film. In order for an action film to be credible, the situations that the hero finds himself in should be realistic and filled with a degree of tension. This film lacks both of those qualities. No one believes the phony-tough persona of Tom Cruise as a military man because he has never been in the military; that is fairly obvious from his behavior. We quickly get bored by his life and death struggles with one challenge after another that he miraculously escapes from. It doesn't work that way in real life. But then again, this character has little no relation to real life. Better off going to an air show.

Top Gun (1986) is a classic slice of feel-good cheese but it's also very dated; and I was always skeptical of this sequel before release. Maverick however, is totally awesome and is a hell of a lot better than it has any right to be.At nearly 60, Tom Cruise still knows a thing or two about making an exciting, purely old-school summer blockbuster and Maverick delivers and more. If ever there was a reason to see a film in IMAX this is it: the stunts, aerial combat scenes and cinematography are undoubtedly impressive, more so I think than Christopher Nolan's Dunkirk.Everything is bigger and louder for sure but Maverick still retains the heart, emotion, thrills and feel-good spirit of the original whilst being superior to that film in every way possible. All of the characters are likeable, too, and there's also a touching cameo with Val Kilmer's Iceman.I've seen this three times now and I cannot recommend seeing it enough. It's like slipping on an old leather jacket before riding off into the sunset on your vintage Kawasaki motorcycle. It's just a damn cool film.

Everything about this movie was great. Tom is one hell a actor. This movie must best sequel yet of all other movies out there.They CGI in this movie was amazing, the fight scene god, so good. And the acting into it.Only down side I hade with this movie, was little more dogs fight, I think the scene could be little bit longer. However I'm also fine with the current one.The soundtrack was also good, but not that great.I give this movie 10/10 because it was entertaining to watch and I only hoped that there had been a bit more fight scenes, between the different jet planes.Looking forward to releasing the third one after 35 years. Let's go!

Direction=9/10
Screenplay=10/10
IMAX action sequences=10/10
Cinematography=10/10
Score=10/10
Performances=10/10
Charismatic and grounded performance of tom cruise and Cameo apperance of Val made the movie whole.

It's Saturday night and its Tom Cruise times. A smartest looking hero who would hit 60 this year just before US Independence is out here flying all over the SKYreen Cruising on Top in his most stylish and energetic look . The expectations on TOP GUN was way too high considering it to be a sequel for the one that got released 36 years ago. The plot is quite understandable and easily guessable. Unlike many other sequels this sequel doesn't mandate any one to see the first part. For me the movie looked so much straight fwd and ended too soon . TOP GUN is definitely a Grandeur and a must see in IMAX for all the visuals with some great re-recording. The VFX and screenplay was TOP NOTCH and was quite exhilarating. The style and the class of Tommy's acting just didn't drop a bit . It takes very little effort for Tom Cruise to handle jet flights since he's been flying in real for quite a while now with real pilot licence . Val Kilmer , Jeniffer Connelly and many others extend their best performance to make this movie quite enjoyable .

reviews.review_title: Perfect blend of old and new
reviews.content: As someone who thought the first movie was good but nothing special, I didn't know what to expect. However, I think this movie does a perfect tribute to the first movie while still putting enough new storyline into the sequel to be interesting to new viewers. The action was amazing. I was on the edge of my seat; I cried, I laughed, I cheered.

reviews.review_title: So They Can Still Make Movies 🍿
reviews.content: Just finished watching this incredible rip roaring emotionally exciting amazing film !!!Had to write my review immediately. What a film , the kind of film you always hope you're going to see at the cinema but very rarely do .There's a trick that the writers in Blue Bloods use where the whole episode builds up to one poignant emotional moment, usually involving Frank(Tom Selleck) , where you get a lump in your throat and a tear in your eye . This only usually lasts a couple of seconds but I'm sure it's a deliberate story telling strategy. Anyway I felt like that for the entirety of this movie . Absolutely wonderful, would recommend to all .

I just watched this at home for the second time after seeing it in the theaters.Both times I have come out speechless.What an absolute work of art. Perfect sequel in a world full of garbage sequels and remakes. This thing hits on all cylinders and plays perfect homage to the characters from the 80s Top Gun.Visually stunning, action packed with a few twists. While some are a tad predictable, over all the story kept giving when the movie seemed to be over or could have ended.One I will cherish and watch many times.A must watch for all movie lovers. If you are an 80s child and grew up with the original, you'll get the most out of it. But you don't even need to have seen the original. But heck, go watch it first. Even if you don't, or don't even care for flying movies, watch it anyway. You'll love it.

reviews.review_title: Cheesy, formulaic and a ton of fan service but still fun.
reviews.content: It would be easy to complain about a lot of this movie, everything about it is almost a straight lift from the original. Half the soundtrack, half the cast, his bike and jacket, hell they even have scenes from the original in there and a pseudo beach "volleyball" scene of it's own.But there are only so many ways to take a film like Top Gun and make a sequel work, either you create an entirely new vision and story and risk alienating the original fans or you go the other way and make a Top Gun movie.The reason this works well as a sequel is because it very knowingly gives the same thrills and humour from the original. As far as the flying and actions scenes go, they are considerably better than the original due to the advances in technology and film making. Tom Cruise is still fantastic in the role as Maverick, Glen Powell as Hangman was an excellent choice to be the cocky rival, at times playing an inbetween version of Maverick and Iceman. He certainly wouldn't have been out of place among the original members.My only real gripe with this sequel is that it is a little too heavy with the callback and memory of Goose in the front end. While i'm sure younger audiences might not have known the character, they overplayed it a bit especially when Iceman is in the movie and has his own story within it which is a little glossed over by comparison.But in the end, the climax of the film and performance from Miles Teller as Rooster does win you over.

A great fun movie to watch, I can't help but think everyone (myself included) likes this so much simply because of the wave of dross "content" both at the cinema and streaming spaces we'd had to endure for the most part of 2022.So yeah maybe it's getting an extra star than it truly deserves. Honestly it feels like we've had nothing but hot muddy puddle water to drink and Maverick comes along and it feels like pure mountain filtered water and ice cubes.Anyway enough of the state of entertainment. This film is just fun to watch. The world and it's characters feel firmly planted. It's the flight sequences that really standout, going that extra mile to film these away from some greenscreen sound stage really comes across on screen. Quite the visceral experience to watch, the cinematography here certainly warrants an extra star.Some parts of the film just seem a bit over the top and too far fetched. In most, that's the earlier part of the film with the super jet Maverick is flying.You already know what kind of film you're going in to watch and it doesn't disappoint. You're not going to get any dramatic plot twists or character revelations, the story is your fairly typical popcorn-movie plot but it's all done and shot superbly.
Yes... it is a classic action and romance. But really good making, good movie like in the old days with not just action but makes you live with it.I recommend it.

reviews.review_title: Improves from the first movie but still copies from it
reviews.content: In my opinion, this movie is definitely better than the first movie, but I did notice that the story for this movie is eerily similar to that of the first. What I mean by this is that the movie might not be a shot-for-shot remake of the first, but upon close inspection, the story is beat for beat the same. The movie throws in some new stuff and changes a few things to try and cover this up and it does work to some extent but once you catch on to the similarities between the two it's hard to ignore. Despite the story being beat for beat the same the story for this movie is far from lacking and is an enjoyable one. Another element of the movie that helped make this movie enjoyable was the cinematography. Knowing that pretty much all of this movie was done practically, all thanks to Tom Cruise, helped the cinematography out a lot by having everything be natural which helps the viewers feel like they're a fly on the wall. The sound design for this movie is another element that helps bring the audience along for the ride. I can only guess that most of the sound design for this movie was filmed and recorded live, but even the non-diegetic sound helped the story out. The final element of this movie that hooks the audience and brings them in for this ride is the acting. All of the actors in this movie are giving it their all in their roles and making these people feel like real people. The standout performances for me were Tom Cruise, Val Kilmer, who plays Iceman, Miles Teller, who plays Rooster, and Glen Powell, who plays Hangman. In the end, Top Gun: Maverick takes what made the first one iconic and improves on it for a more modern audience. I just wish they included, "Danger Zone".

What a fun, emotional, action packed joyride!! I might be biased because I loved the original so much much, but I absolutely enjoyed every minute of this movie. This is a must see movie and probably the best movie I've seen in many years. Loved it big time!!

reviews.review_title: Best action movie surely for the last 10 years, probably longer
reviews.content: Really, title. I was 23 when the original came out and I loved it. Well, I am 59 years old now and I loved this one too because emotionally I can relate to many situations and moments the movie captures in a well-crafted, tasteful and mature way. Plus all the action sequences are thrilling and engaging because they were mostly done with real planes in the real world. Everybody involved in this production can be proud of what they achieved. Thank you for this great movie!

Excellent entertainment which, after two years of a pandemic away from theaters, reminds us of the unparalleled power of the big screen.With its devilishly spectacular flight sequences, Top Gun: Maverick allows Tom Cruise to question his own legend to better affirm that he is the best. An honest, generous, and classy artisan blockbuster.I'm not going to dwell on this wonderful movie with just incredible effects. A Tom Cruise more beautiful and better than ever and releasing a movie with incredible actions and acting at its height, that is to say magnificent and all the other actors on the team were also great.

I don't often post, but felt balance was needed for the 10/10 reviews on here.I found this movie to be very over hyped and derivative.Strong Star Wars vibe and Cruise channeling Yoda when telling his Padawans "do not think, do".Predictable plot, average acting but some good flight scenes.Really hard to suspend my disbelief.Not a great movie - but ok if you need to pass some time.Glad we won free tickets for this.

While a decent good movie with SOME great action, I feel that (1st) there wasn't a need for a sequel to the original, and (2nd) waaaay overrated. This movie was not a 10. I guess I'm in the minority or something because even not being a huge TC fan, it was just a good movie, not great though. Even boring in some parts. Can't believe all the 10's. Solid 7 for me.

The original Top Gun movie was the first I ever saw in a theater, and is still one of my favorites of all time (having watched it countless times). This sequel does an excellent job of giving its original fans what we wanted.It has a large number of great callbacks to the original, including an entire romance with a character that was only mentioned in the 86' version. It leans heavily into the aftermath of Goose's passing, so much so that it almost feels like he is still here with us. The action is fantastic, with the best flight scenes that have ever been filmed. Although the plot is not something that writes very far outside the typical lines, it does show character development, explores the human reaction to loss, and contains a cohesive story that ties the old and new movies together believably. The acting from nearly everyone who is over 30 is great, particularly from Cruise and Connelly.The negatives: 1) It would have been better to get a re-make of Danger Zone rather than a new original from Lady Gaga - her song feels out of place. 2) The new pilots' acting, outside of Rooster and Hangman, feels forced and generic; more subtlety would have gone a long way. 3) Jon Hamm seems to play the same character in each project he is in, and this character should have been made more 3-dimensional rather than being so angrily flat. 4) The writing could have found a few more opportunities to inject humor into its scenes, as that was a heavier staple of the original.

There is a certain buzz when you go to the movies to see this. Whether it's the nostalgic feeling you get from the recognisable vocals of Kenny Loggins or the visuals of fighter planes, this movie paints a picture in your mind that you can't get out. Getting a story so right 36 years after the original was going to be a tough task but they got it right, while some may say this is just a stunt to get money out of a dying concept, this is movie making and story telling at its finest. What makes a movie a good movie? The combination of sound, story, characters and visual composition make Top Gun Maverick one of the few movies that made me want to instantly go and see it again. I've seen this twice in the movies and no doubt there will be a third and forth time, this is not just a love letter to aviation but a love letter and an instruction manual to movie making. What a movie!

reviews.review_title: Great Escapist fare entertaining and well done
reviews.content:
My Review - Top Gun - Maverick
My Rating 8/10This genre of movie is right outside of my usual must see list but after hearing many good recommendations about the long awaited Top Gun sequel that took 36 years to reach the screen I decided it must be worth a look .I'm one of those probably in a minority that would prefer " a lamb roast than dinner with Tom Cruise who stars as the under appreciated hero Captain Pete 'Maverick 'Mitchell in Top Gun.Aviation films have had held an honoured place in movie history in fact the movie to receive the very first Best Picture of the year at the 1929 Oscars Ceremony was a Silent movie titled Wings . Wings also won Best Effects for
its spectacular aerial shots which were choreographed using 60 planes and 3,500 extras . Why I mention the movie Wings is that unlike Top Gun Maverick that movie showed the brutality of War and its power to destroy lives as we see only to clearly in every news report today.Top Gun Maverick has no message at all and doesn't attempt any it's all about perceived American Global Superiority, testosterone and super achievement .In fact I found it interesting that not once in the entire movie do we find out who the enemy is just that it's America fighting a rogue State much like StarWars or any Science Fiction movie with the emphasis on fiction.Top Gun Maverick is entertaining and the aerial fighter scenes are certainly spectacular . Tom Cruise now 59 definitely doesn't look his age his and I give him top marks as I'm sure he is the main reason this movie succeeds .A accomplished pilot himself he insisted on only minimal green screen and CGI aerial shots and personally designed a 3 month aviation course for the actors to become ready to handle riding an F-18 aircraft.Miles Teller who just recently impressed me in the series The Offer as Godfather producer Albert S. Ruddy. Plays a major role in Top Gun Maverick as Lt. Bradley 'Rooster' and is very impressive in this role also.He was reported as saying that 3 of the 6 new Top Gun actors threw up every day of filming.The testosterone certainly flows on the beach in the shirtless football scene which Tom Cruise insisted be reshot after the actors had been on a night out on milkshakes and fry's . He didn't think they looked ripped enough so they all were ordered back to the gym then the scene was shot again.Top Gun Maverick is certainly great escapist entertainment spectacularly filmed with a good script and cast . The audience can see where the estimated 170 million USDollars were spent and the film has already made 886 million USDollars so it's a huge box office hit World Wide.I must say though Tom Cruise these days to me seems more like an avatar from a video game however he deserves top marks for his dedication to Top Gun Maverick.

An amazing incredible movie from start to finish!! What a thrill ride! Being a massive fan of the original I was a little dubious of whether this was just another money spinner bit theres so much love put into making this movie and it's simply a masterpiece! A must see for anyone who loves top gun and even those who don't!

The last Cruise movie I saw before this one was the tragically awful remake of The Mummy. Don't think I need to explain any more there. But this movie proved that Tom Cruise has still got it! The seemingly never-aging superstar got back into the cockpit as he teaches a newer generation of pilots to fly a dangerous mission. I hadn't watched the first movie, but this one fills in all the required information you need: Maverick used to fly with Goose, who's dead, and now Goose's son, Rooster, is in Maverick's new class. Meanwhile, another old buddy of Maverick's, Iceman, is very ill (to fit along with actor Val Kilmer's inability to speak due to throat cancer). The movie was entertaining and full of good action and not lacking in stakes and conflict. However, I do feel this movie may have been slightly overhyped, with many people calling it the best movie of 2022. Despite that, it's definitely worth watching!

This has got to be one of the best movies in years. Reminds me of movies from decades ago. There is no messaging,no politics and is just plain fun. The lack of CGI and all done with real action makes it amazing. The little details of flight,like when taking off the deck really add to the film. Don't fret the plot,it's simple and just the way to show off the action.Can't remember the last time I walked out of a theater with such a smile on my face.A must see.

There has been no movie in my entire life that after every time I watched I would still be thrilled. The plot was well written and the visual was such a remarkable and unforgettable masterpiece.The breath was unstoppably taken but the mind was fervently excited, even after several times of watching at theaters, especially my two times visiting the laser IMAX theater.The enjoyment of watching this film at IMAX theater has no predecessors that could give.

reviews.review_title: Best movie I have seen in a long time
reviews.content: I am 19 years old and decided to see this movie only after the high ratings came in. In order to get the most out of the movie, I saw the original Top Gun before going to the theater. You don't have to do it that way, as the film makes it very easy to follow for those who did not watch the original.Tom Cruise (Maverick) is a Maverick, not just his call sign, but his flying is very unorthodox yet brilliantly effective. That unorthodox style of flying from the original movie is exactly what the navy needs to succeed in this more modern yet dangerous mission, which is the main climax the movie leads up to. I found that whole premise to be fascinating. Miles Teller (Rooster) got a lot of attention for his beach scene, but he does an excellent job at his portrayal of Rooster, the son of Goose, who died in the original Top Gun in an accident involving Maverick. The dynamic between the two characters is made clear, as well as their conflict with one another being understandable on both sides. Maverick being tasked to prepare the pilots for this mission made for some hilarious and entertaining flight scenes before the climax. The mission itself had me on the edge of my seat. I found the ending to be more "satisfying" than "predictable" (some reviews say). Overall, I was happy to see it in theaters. I did not plan to ever see this movie, but I am really glad I did._____________________Side Note: This movie doesn't have any obvious "woke" elements in its story. It doesn't push anything on the viewer, which I found to be very refreshing and a great move by the movie makers!

What an experience! Top Gun (1986) was not bad for being an 80s movie, but Top Gun: Maverick (2022) really pushed the limits of today's modern movies. The flying scenes were unbelievably amazing, which literally gave me goosebumps! The visuality, the sound and the music together are a real masterpiece. I didn't know if I was going to smile or cry of enjoyment during watching. You can't get any better action scenes from a movie. The actors were mostly good - especially Tom Cruise. I have to say that the story was kind of the typical, American military story, and some of the dialogue scenes were a little too long for my part, but the flying scenes made up for most of it. Anyway, strongly recommending for every action-movie lover!

Just saw this a couple hours ago and was blown away. I never leave reviews, but I felt like I needed to on this one. This has the pace and feel of the original Top Gun, but on steroids. There is some pretty strong character development and a lot more jet action. Tom Cruise nails it as usual and so does the rest of the cast, which is definitely diverse but thankfully void of any kind of wokeness. There is one f##k dropped towards the end, but it's pretty clean besides that.As of late I rarely see an action film I enjoy, but this met and far exceeded my expectations. I wouldn't say it's a groundbreaking story, but everything else about the film is great. From the nostalgic stuff to the score, action and acting, this makes me want to go to the movies regularly like I used to do when I was a kid. I haven't been to the theater since 2018, and I'm so happy my friends and I ended up going tonight. When this film comes out on DVD, I will definitely be buying it.I just want to thank all the individuals who worked on this film, and all the actors/actresses. You should all be very proud of yourselves. Bravo!

Hands down the best sequel for any film ever, in the history of filmmaking.. There is simply no argument. Anyone who has given this film a rating of 1 or 2 is simply trolling. Anyone who has given this film a rating of less than 8 missed the point completely in my opinion. This is without a doubt the best film of the year and is a tour de force for one of Hollywood's all time greats. Regardless of what you think of Tom Cruise you should at least appreciate what he has done for the film industry and that he just seems to be getting better and better with age. The man is unrivalled. The only reason I didn't give it a 10 was because they were far too close to A New Hope in the mission plan for my liking. That aside it was a hell of a film and if I could I would go back and watch it another 10 times in cinemas.

Wow what a ride! What an absolutely masterpiece!It's everything you want from a movie, compelling an emotional journey, action.. laughter... Sweat & tears, all the tropes from the first movie and scenes that were played out like the original was a great touch.Tom Cruise is a fantastic actor, gives it his all and the movie still remains grounded.No cgi, all arial shots at lightning speed, so much adrenaline... Will be buying Too Gun 4k blu ray boxset for sure!
Amazing cinematography, score and action. Not the most complex plot but didn't need to be. Overall really enjoyable experience and shows Cruise is only getting better as time goes on.
The tensions were high, the stakes even higher and The jet fighters needed to stay low! One hell of a movie! So glad we got this sequel in the nick of time.

reviews.review_title: It is very popular in Japan.
reviews.content: I was in high school when the last Top Gun film was released.The moment I saw the opening, I was taken back to my high school days and had tears coming out of my own eyes. Has anyone else had the same experience?Many people visit movie theaters in Japan to see this movie every day. Not only old men and women of my generation, but also their children (children about Amelia's age in the movie) are watching it.All the people who have finished watching the movie seem to be enjoying themselves. I also felt very good after watching it. Anyway, it is fun without any reason.The coolness of the fighter planes, the non-CG action scenes, and the fact that the heroes win in the end are great to watch.It was No. 1 in the Japanese movie ranking for a while, but one day it lost to Dragon Ball. However, it came back to No. 1 the following week. In Japan, there are many people who watch it over and over again. I saw it three times, twice in IMAX and the third time in 4DX. 4DX is especially perfect for this movie. I would like to see it as an attraction at an amusement park.

This film is great fun but it is not a great film.It is bolted together like a Liberty ship.If you are not in a critical mood you will love it.I liked it a lot,if you like armed forces buddy movies or aviation you will love it.I was surprised how good the performances were from the junior cast members,they were well chosen.Ideally we would not have films pandering to bully foreign powers ,we should see the Taiwan air force patches on the jacket.British viewers like me might wonder if the US air force has a publicity department,this film is a hymn to the US navy.Anyway I suggest after viewing this people watch The Right Stuff,Wing and a prayer,Appointment in London (Dirk Bogarde,us title is different) and The Dambusters.

reviews.review_title: Had reservation about watching part two!
reviews.content: Had reservation about watching part two! Top Gun is a movie icon, and usually part two comes out flat after watching a movie Classic. I remember watching Temple of Doom after the classic Raiders of the lost Arc. I was wondering if seeing Maverick would be Deja vu again? Well Maverick starting out kind of woke. The odd white guy, the white jerk, over macho female character and fill in the blank other blank characters, (I thought oh no preachy non relatable movie characters) but Maverick got out the tail spin with believable/likeable characters. Maverick has believable characters, with Pete being the test piolet push the envelope guy with personal demons. Gooses son is a tribute and a crux of the story a younger Mitchel character from the last movie. Hangman is the new Ice character. The gamer which make us understand the new skills of a modern military with the calming ebb and flow of the rest of the characters for the military machine. There is a recruiting part with all the new state of the art air craft, which mixes with a star wars story line. But un like Star Wars there is a few good plot twist with homages from the old Top Gun and a homage to Iceman. I left Maverick actually feeling good, with out having a woke or Hollywood formulated movie hang over. Well directed, written, and original script. 8 stars, best summer movie so far!

reviews.review_title: 9 stars flights, 6 star rest of the movie
reviews.content:
As the title says : the movie itself seemed to damn cringy and cheesy, but the scenes in the sky make up for it all plenty. Here is why I say it's cheesy and cringy - first of I don't remember the first top gun entirely, as I watched it as kid, and when tried rewatching it couple years back I turned it off because it was just too gay ..lol . Thinking about it made me wonder if all the gay jokes about navy within other branches have started with the original top gun movie. Back to this one - it's also mawkish at parts in the same way. Also there is too much crying and unnecessary drama by old looking yet too polished characters (actually everything that they show on the ground is too polished).HOWEVER, as I said before all of that doesn't matter the moments the mission in the movie starts. The mission the dog fights, all the shots in the sky are so damn good, totally delivers!I will get this movie on video edit and cut out all the fly material and save it that way to rewatch, and then it's a strong 10 star )))
So if you late to theater for the first 30 minutes of top gun I don't miss anything. Well done.

Given the current US political landscape, it seems disingenuous to tout America as the savior and arbiter of world peace. TGM is trite, derived and without the passion that made the first one an instant classic.

The original top gun movie was my favorite movie of all time. So when I saw that they made a second one I was really nervous if they were going to completely mess it up or make it epically amazing. And they sure as hell never disappointed! Goose's son looked just like him in every aspect. I love the fact that it not only had action but it had a great story and then we knew Penny Benjamin was in this one and you got to know more about her and Mavericks relationship. I just love this movie and I hope they keep going with it because I heard that they were talking about it and I hope Tom Cruise does agree to keep going with it cuz they are destroying at the box office and they are the most successful movie by far this year even in the last few years.
Top Gun Maverick is like chewing a basic gum, it's repetitive, pointless and after the flavour goes away fast,you can forget it,throw it away and never remember it anymore...
Nutpick all you want. From the classic theme song in the opening shots aboard the carrier Lincoln to the callbacks at every turn, this is a Hollywood movie. And sometimes that's a good thing.

reviews.review_title: A thrilling ride in the skies
reviews.content: Full of fist-clenching fight scenes that always manages to exceed the previous one, this movie is wave after wave of intense fighter jet combat that is absolute pure adrenaline, starting and ending on a high note without a dull single moment.

reviews.review_title: It's like medicine to our spirits
reviews.content: Ok here's the thing; there are movies that we watch and enjoy but do not take us to that certain level where that movie sort of talked to your soul - those movies are usually ranked around 5.5 to 6.3 or thereabouts on IMDB.Then there are movies that are ranked between 7 and 8 but when you watch them all you are left with is your sorry self wondering why you wasted your time watching themAnd then there is this movie Top Gun-Maverick which takes you into the movie itself and journeys places with you till when it ends you feel like your life has been changed, wherever you go you feel the movie around you2022 was kind of a disaster in the film industry especially with many production houses having suffered enormous blows from the covid pandemic, and yet TopGun Maverick surpasses the average level of the expected recuperation from the pandemicThis movie is a must watch!!! Screenplay - awesome, Sound and Motion Effects - amazing, Script - just what my generation neededI REPEAT, STOP WHATEVER YOU ARE DOING AND GO WATCH THIS MOVIE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!You will thank me later.

reviews.review_title: They don't make movies like this anymore
reviews.content: Nostalgia, thrilling, dramatic, passionate, and blasting.Best movie since 2020 and an guaranteed best picture nominee.Tom cruise movies are never a disappointment.

The aerial scenes alone are enough to recommend this film. Add in the emotional story and fine performances and you have yourself quite a cinematic experience. Seeing this in IMAX with all the blaring sound, incredible visuals and death-defying stunts right in front of you was *chef's kiss.*I honestly enjoyed this much more than the original. The score and music are excellent and the callbacks to the original are played perfectly. Cruise is the star of the show and gives the people what they want. There are plenty of surprises in the story and I genuinely wasn't sure what would happen. The film is the perfect high quality summer blockbuster that we needed.

I've been waiting for this movie to come to theaters since it's original release date. Usually when my expectations are so for so long I tend to be let down. Not with Top Gun Maverick. The movie delivers a well paced, well acted and thrilling blockbuster. Every single flight scene (and there are many) is fun to watch. From beginning to end you will be entertained.

God! I miss the kind of movies, for 2h i'm back to my childhood again, i won't it end, oh totally amazing, totally you can't think about anything except what will be done and how is it done
Everything is perfect in cinematic and music every single thing is so amazing and this kind of movies and how much we impassioned and live with what's going on, we all miss this
Thank you and we still ever remember what we feel and what make us go back and remember all good times we spend in our lives
And a lesson we can learn be in place you belong to be, be a CAPTAIN!Don't waste your life, follow your passion and don't listen to anyone listen to yourself and what you want.Perfect Experience.

Pure testosterone mixed with love and laughter and inclusive of all genders to boot.Will pay for another ticket in a few days. Wow. Tom Cruise has proven himself as the only person making 10/10 action movies in the past 5-10 years.Better than original. Or at least, a PERFECT sequel.

reviews.review_title: Cheesy theatrics, nothing to do with realism
reviews.content: I had low expectations to begin with but sadly it still manage to disappoint.Just the low realism, the complete disregard for physics. But nobody watching this cares for that anyway.The you have extremely lame, ultra high EQ military, never happen and never will. The first movie showed that much better and much more realistically.The flight scenes, which made the first movie a success are not that much better, and obviously lacking originality.Third, invading Iran with kids in training school, must be a joke. Oh, and with ancient planes.Sorry, but it's just a pile of nonsense, and even more sadly, what keeps people interested is reminiscing about the first movie. It's sad to watch.

This review only has info from the revealed in trailersThis film is masterful. Totally understand why it was made!!! I'm bias because Tom Cruise is my favourite actor but, he puts on that jacket like he never left the role it's marvellous to watch him and all he's done with this movie. The rest of this cast are truly remarkable and totally believable in this world. Miles Teller goes an extra mile with convincing the audience that he truly is "Goose's son" I thought that the story was masterful and the action and flying, although sometimes seems at little inaccurate, THRILLING. This film will be a film i will watch every year after watching the original before it. I watched it with some DBOX seats (seats that rumble and move to the action of the movie) and Truly was Immersed it was awesome. Top Gun Maverick Truly lives up to the Name. So yes "I felt the Need, The Need For Speed."

I was excited for this one but only a few minutes into it I was worried. The dialogue and story is predictable and the cringe moments come fast and often. I would rate it 6.5 only for how the action is shot which was great. If this movie came out in the 80s it would be fantastic but movies need a solid plot along with the action these days for me.

reviews.review_title: A good film in its own right
reviews.content: This film is so much of a copy of the original, but without the cool factor of the original. That one you walk away humming the theme tune or danger zone, this one?The action is really good, exhilarating and thrilling. The story again is very much copying the original, thus cliched. None of the actors are very likeable, there is no chemistry between them.in all I think this was a sequel that didn't need making and if it did 30 years is far too long I to wait.Oh and the actors did NOT fly the jets as many seem to think. Though they were in them.Definitely a film to see in the theatre/cinema to appreciate it more.

I was born in 1988 and first saw Top Gun as a child. So I have waited my entire life for this sequel and I was so devastated every time it got pushed back. The only thing I can say is that Tom doesn't disappoint (does he ever!) and it was worth the wait!!!Packed with nostalgia and great action. Nothing these days would come close to doing what this movie does. And it gives you an ending you deserve after all this time.

They knew just how to dial up or dial down the throwbacks (leaning into soundtrack, but actually helping us understand the mission this time). They knew just when to dial up or down the realism (showing hyper-accurate flight sequences initially before releasing all pretense of feasibility over the last third). And perhaps most importantly, they knew when to let Cruise shine and when to make this ensemble (Hamm, Teller, Connelly) the star. Nobody's life will be changed because they finally released another Top Gun movie, but that doesn't stop it from be an absolutely perfect summer blockbuster.

An outstanding film. One which will make you cheer, laugh and walk away feeling proud and patriotic. Tom Cruise gives a rock-solid performance and the support cast is equally solid. It is a fitting follow-up to the first Top Gun movie.You must see it at an IMAX theater.

This is one of the best movies I've ever seen and likely the best sequel ever.I've seen the original, of course. After watching Maverick this evening, I'd say just like so many others, that it was "well worth the wait".Top Gun - Maverick is majestic film making. The director Joseph Kosinksi went over the top. This may go down as Tom Cruise's finest film.

I am a bit surprised by the high ratings the movie has received, given that it is a pretty standard action flick. Given that though, I would recommend it for action fans as it delivers in terms of entertainment. The flight scenes are quite thrilling, with the cinematography and high level of production making you feel the tension and danger of flight in such high speed jets. The actors do a good job generally, although nothing spectacular in my opinion. The plot is certainly lacking with the climax and conflict revolving around personal issues in the characters histories that I did not find appealing. The movie has a normal highly expected happy ending where everyone lives despite the odds. All of that can be excused as the movie is simply fun to watch, with a few laughs and thrills along the way. It is quite refreshing as well to see the bad guys as 'a rogue state' developing atomic capabilities without highlighting them as Muslim terrorists, Russian spies or foreign gangs of some kind. However the movie is lacking in terms of political or social message and has no real depth or substance beyond the entertainment.

I really don't understand this high ratings, one of the worst movies I have ever watch, every thing is so damn predictable, if it's so easy to shoot the mighty 5th generation planes why so scared to face them, and walking to steel the f14 plane hhhh was a killer for me, I mean come on at least get one of those plane American fighters injured.

reviews.review_title: I got my no 1 fav movie of all time.
reviews.content: This is the movie you can't miss by any means. Amazing👌👌 .Every moments of this movie is just perfect . The storyline,music,direction,acting is great in all aspect.AS A TOP GUN FAN ... "DONT THINK, JUST DO IT " 😎😎 .

reviews.review_title: Best flight scenes in a movie by far!
reviews.content: This sequel is worthy. Best flying scenes I've seen in a movie thus far and I've seen most of them.My daughter is hard to please but she was waving her hands in excitement several times throughout the movie.Two Thumbs Up!!

Watches in a UK Cineworld Screen X with pictures to your left and right too. Really immersive and this movie was great for it. Loved it... it's entertainment and it's good. Although I do feel American military stuff rather over the top but that's America... they love this and I don't dislike it.

This was the most exhilarating theatrical experience I'd ever had the pleasure of being a part of. Top Gun: Maverick outdoes Top Gun in every conceivable way, and is the single best legacy sequel of all time, bar none.The premise revolves around an aging Maverick, who is called yet again to instruct new recruits at Top Gun.Joseph Kosinski does a masterful job of directing this movie. He puts in just enough elements of the original to retain adequate nostalgia, but not too much so as to overpower the potence of the sequel. A lot of legacy sequels like Ghostbusters: Afterlife and The Matrix Resurrections make the deplorable mistake of adding way too much callbacks and references to the previous movies; so much so that the sequel itself feels more like a lazy rehash than a worthy continuation and/or conclusion. The movie corrects many of the original's problems, with a more grounded premise and graver performances. Fighter Weapons School finally feels like an actual military academy rather than a mere high school for adrenaline junkies.Tom Cruise is quite literally the greatest movie star of all time. He's starred in classics since he was in his 20s and is STILL pumping out his best stuff, as proven by this movie alone. I love how his character of Pete Mitchell has expectedly grown more nuanced and complex over the last 30+ years. He appears tortured by events from the first movie, and his dynamic with Bradley Bradshaw (cast and played excellently by Miles Teller) is undoubtedly the film's most riveting aspect.Jennifer Connelly has an astonishing amount of chemistry with Cruise, and I don't think people give their on-screen relationship enough credit. Once again, the childish romance from the original was greatly improved upon, with a moderately approached but genuinely heartfelt new relationship. I love the way Val Kilmer reprised his role as Iceman, and the few short scenes he was in did the actor justice and gave his character a truly beautiful role to play.The filmmakers somehow succeeded in making the new recruits to Top Gun interesting characters by themselves, instead of just cloning the original movie's cast. Monica Barbaro, Lewis Pullman and Jay Ellis all give distinguished performances, and so does Glen Powell (even though he's technically this sequel's version of a young Iceman). Other pedigreed actors like Jon Hamm and Ed Harris, and lesser known ones like Charles Parnell all play their characters in memorable fashion.Maverick is also absolutely hilarious, and I can probably remember about 15 times when the audience around me burst into hysterical laughter (including myself, no doubt). The dialogue is unexpectedly smart, the jokes feel anything but forced, and the scenes of humour are so well set-up that they never feel manufactured or out of place.But of course, what really sets this movie apart from and above other legacy sequels is its brilliant writing. The screenplay packs so much emotional punch and payoff that it's virtually impossible to unpack all of it even in a single spoiler review. The callbacks and moments of nostalgia are never in there for the sake of it, and strictly serve the plot. Every single narrative decision made for this film was perfect, with a believable and realistic story that is unexpectedly mature and thus way more engaging.With all that out of the way, it wouldn't be a proper Top Gun review if you didn't talk about the action. And Jesus Christ does this film have some of the most astoundingly intense and mind-bogglingly entertaining action sequences in film history. Seriously, the final act alone is on par with any of the recent Mission: Impossible movies (also starrimg Cruise), and even Mad Max: Fury Road.Maverick veritably dethrones the original movie's all time greatest aerial fight scenes with even better ones. The cinematography, visual effects, editing and soul-shattering sound design during the training and dogfight sequences is so incredible it can barely be put into words. Some segments of this film were so edge-of-your-seat thrilling that I'm surprised no one (especially me) got a heart attack or at the very least, passed out.The end product is so well presented, it's rather difficult to pinpoint where the CGI ends and Tom Cruise's stuntwork begins (although, knowing him, I'm willing to bet he played his part in some of the stunning aircraft-mounted shots).On top of that, the production of the non-action scenes was done well too, just like in the original. I certainly enjoyed the restrained use of the first films music and score, incorporating some pretty good original songs like "I Ain't Worried" by OneRepublic and Lady Gaga's spectacular "Hold My Hand".Top Gun: Maverick exceeded all expectations by a light year and a half. It is the type of legacy sequel every classic blockbuster deserves, and the monumental sendoff all legacy sequels aspire to become.And if it isn't also one of the century's best action movies, then I have no idea what is.Edit: So apparently none of the flight sequences used green screen, and the actors went through flight training to film all those insane shots practically. Can I love this movie any more?!

This is an exception to that particular rule !For a kid growing up in the 80's, movies, imagination and minimalistic joys, we're all we had.Top Gun was a classic. You talk of top 10 80's films, that bad boy is up there. It had everything you could want from that era.When modern day cinema tampers with the fabric of cinematic innocence from the 80's and tries to re-create, re-boot or "modernise" it, it usually falls foul.....by a long way.That was until Top Gun : Maverick graced us with its presence on the big screen !The world, as we know it today, is horrible. Everywhere you look it's a place with not much joy but for just over 2 hours, Tom Cruise and it's wonderfully collective cast gave us this absolute gem of a film.It probably won't win any Oscars but my god it gave us the film of the year hands down so far and will go down as a great. Better than the first in my opinion.Going back to top 10's of the 80's.......this bad boy goes in to my top 10 OF ALL TIME !!!!I didn't think with this review.... I just did !

If your not a fan of Top Gun then maybe avoid this but still it's great imo
All the nostalgia you want with a refresh, new relationships to navigate old blood history potentially repeating itself...? But Please don't watch this on a tablet or a phone! If you still can get at your local cinema then go it's made for a big sound system and a big screen, if not turn off the lights and turn up the volume and you'll feel the need....the need for speeed!

reviews.review_title: The best action movie of ALL TIME!
reviews.content: I frickin' love this movie! I have maybe a half dozen movies or shows that I've ever given a 10 star rating and this is definitely one my favorite movies of all time.As an avid movie watcher, this one has it all...a great well-written story, phenomenal action scenes, laugh out loud moments, tear inducing scenes, excellent acting and fantastic music. It was very easy in the theater to get deep into the story and feel the tension of the situations and characters. It's a true masterpiece.I'd take the opportunity to see this in the theaters because I don't think any average TV will do it justice. I'll likely see it in the theater a second time and I've never done that with any other movie. If you don't watch this movie (and in the theater) you are truly going to miss out.

reviews.review_title: Solid story, strong characters, STUNNING flight scenes
reviews.content: Ok, there are many elements that go into a movie. A great movie can be weak in certain areas if it is exceptional in others. What we, the viewer, look for in a movie is highly personal and subjective. Objectively Top Gun Maverick has the most amazing jet fighter action scenes ever filmed. The combination of incredible cinematography, tight editing and bombastic sound effects make these jet fighter action scenes absolutely visceral and riveting. The scene where Maverick successfully completes the near impossible training run in his F18E was among the best 10 minutes of cinema I have ever seen. I was totally gripped in my cinema seat. For this scene alone I give the movie 10 stars. Whilst I am sure some CGI was used in places (particularly the fictional Mach 10 spy plane in the opening scene), a large majority of what you see is real footage, either in cockpit, from aeriel vantage points, or land vantage points. Tom Cruise is great, again. The rest of the cast is very strong. The story is entirely predictable, but with a clear direction and purpose, and serves to move the movie from one incredible action scene to the next but with meaning. The characters are a little 2D, but have sensible arcs and growth that increase emotional investment. The original movie had great action scenes with iconically cheesy dialogue and beautiful cinematography and great direction. Top Gun Maverick has less cheesy and less memorable dialogue but still very humerous in places, beautiful cinematography throughout, INCREDIBLE action scenes and tight direction. Both movies blend a lot of fantasy with reality, but they are movies, not documentaries, so that's fine by me. Anyway, if you are remotely interested in the idea of a navy jet fighter action movie, watch this movie on IMAX. It will blow you away. Watching this movie was one of the most memorable and enthralling cinema experiences I have ever had. I can't even tell you what the run time was, it seemed like 5 minutes as the movie just flew by (pun intended).

After 3 years of delay, the much awaited Top Gun sequel is finally here. I've never really been one of the die hard fans of top gun but I thought it was a fun watch with some memorable moments. And I enjoyed this sequel just as much. If you're a top gun fan, you're probably going to love this. Though, I don't think it is as much of it's own movie, it does a good job tributing and celebrating the 1987 Top Gun.I like the direction. Action-wise, this feels like a modernized top gun. While there is more use of CGI, the shots are wider and you get a clearer view of the dogfight scenes. I also found the final mission and the environment pretty cool. I liked most of the characters but some of them are just there for you to forget, and some feel like exact replacements from the original. There were also plenty of jokes and it's a fairly light-hearted and fun movie, which I didn't expect. Tom Cruise is, well tom cruise, and that's enough. The rest of the actors did a good enough job too.I loved the first half. It felt fresh and I loved the direction it was heading. The second half goes pretty much exactly as you would have thought, which was a bit disappointing. Though the second half has some great action scenes and crowd cheering moments, it's also predictable. And the final act has many similarities to the original. Like there are scenarios that felt exactly like certain scenes in top gun. The story in the second half is very similar to the original. That, I thought, could have been better.But in the end I walked out happy. I enjoyed this movie and I can understand the hype. If, even after 35 years, you get a sequel of your favourite movie, it would certainly be a special feeling.

reviews.review_title: First sequel filmed decades later that actually lands
reviews.content: The thing that I really enjoyed about Maverick is that it took what made the first Top Gun so likeable and just built on that. All the new characters are fun and the story line is so simple but it works great.I wasn't a huge fan of the opening scene where Tom Cruise hits mach 10, but the rest of the movie was super enjoyable. My favorite scene had to be where Maverick proves that their sequence can be done and does it in 2:15 cementing his pilot dominance.The final mission was a great mix of intense and satisfying when you see all the moving parts coming together that we saw during the training montages and scenes. I especially liked the Rooster and Maverick dynamic there at the end of the movie.No politics or unnecessary messages. Just a simple story with awesome shots of F18's and a cool mission.Really my only gripe was the first scene, it wasn't horrible or anything. It just felt a little out of place maybe?9/10.

reviews.review_title: Welcome back to the danger zone. Buckle up and let Maverick take you on the ride of your life.
reviews.content: As any avid cinephile will tell you, a film's original score or theme song has the power to ground that film into a classic. Top Gun from 1986 has this distinction, not just from making that film a classic, but because the theme song went on to be called Top Gun Anthem. It starts with the synthesised but faint chime of a church bell, before the melody escalates into a crescendo of 80s instrumental rock music. As symbolic as it sounds, the church bell here is a dual tone for both grief and glory.Calling Maverick a sequel would only be half-truth. From the moment you hear that synth church bell in the opening sequence, you feel like the last 30 odd years didn't happen. It even begins with a frame-by-frame recreation of the original film's iconic intro on the decks of an aircraft carrier. We see the silhouettes of navy personnel dispatching and receiving warplanes against a low-lit but vivid sky, followed by a familiar text caption explaining the US Navy's weapons school programme.
