This sequence is more than just the cool beginning of Top Gun: Maverick, this is the start of an instantly familiar feeling that will immerse you into nostalgia for over 80 percent of the film's running time.Making this umbilical connection to such a beloved film in the first few minutes, especially after 35 years, is both risky and rewarding at the same time. Part of that nostalgia also includes flimsy one-liners and corny jokes among characters, but also a half-baked and implausible story. And part of that is an inside joke as to why Pete "Maverick" Mitchell is still Captain, while most of his colleagues are either top brass or have retired. Only Tom Cruise can answer that question with the cocky recklessness but Godlike flying skills of the legendary Maverick. Which is why Maverick has to now train a bunch of crème de la crème navy pilots for a daring mission that is pure suicide. Although the "enemy" country is never mentioned, encountering a Mi-24 SuperHind and fifth generation MiGs during the mission tells us the objective is in Ivan's backyard. But sending navy pilots without hardened combat experience in last generation F/A-18 Hornets against the aforementioned enemy, in a mission impossible mission, is like taking a knife to a gun fight. Implausible narrative silliness, but who cares, right?Then comes the remaining 20 percent with fresh content - grief and glory, and a lot of closure. One of the advantages of such a long gap after the first film, is that screenwriters can now fill in the blanks. One is the introduction of "Rooster", son of "Goose", who Maverick lost to an accident in the first film. Prepare for some emotive tantrums and chip-off-the-shoulder baggage between Maverick and Rooster (Miles Teller). The other is probably the most genuine, bitter-sweet, heart-breaking moment in the entire film and easily the best, and this is when Maverick visits and old friend - Iceman. I won't say anymore. Glory is reserved for the last 30 odd minutes and it's a high octane adrenaline rush for the audience as well as Maverick and his team. Even if it's big bucks CGI, it just feels real. Unlike recent blockbusters with mind-numbing visual effects and eye-popping camera angles (looking at you Marvel movies), Top Gun: Maverick has some of the best white-knuckle air combat displays ever seen in a film, and it all feels real. Tom's cruising charisma does the rest. All you have to do is sit back, buckle up and enjoy your supersonic flight with 100 percent fan service.

I, like so many others, thought that a sequel to Top Gun would be a bad idea, especially considering how horrible Hollywood is at making movies these days. I waited to go see it, there was no possible way it was going to be a good movie.I couldn't be more happy to say I was dead wrong. This was an absolute delight of a movie. It's been years since I've gone to the theater multiple times to see the same movie, I will be doing so for this one.

An interesting thing to know about the Top Gun 2 movie review is that many people say that this movie is more about the actors and stars than it is about the fighter pilots. Because as we said, Tom Cruise is the main role in this movie and acts as an avatar. Watching this fascinating movie is like watching 37 episodes of Silicon Valley at once without even getting up from the couch. But are such films really needed? Another issue that must be considered in the Top Gun Maverick movie review is its direction. This movie was directed by Joseph Koshinsky and managed to show the invasion very well. This famous and successful director has also directed the movie Tron: Legacy and has a brilliant record in this field. For this reason, the making of such an attractive film by this director does not seem so strange. Some people think that Tom Cruise might not be able to play this role well; Because his age has increased and naturally he cannot be attractive and clever like when he was young. However, what we observe is the opposite of this. Even though Tom Cruise is approaching 60 years old, he is still as smart, charming and intelligent as the boy he was in the 1980s, and he manages to present himself as a skilled person.

reviews.review_title: The Top Gun Movie Top Gun Wished It Was
reviews.content: Maverick's hype is well earned. I'm glad I watched the original first, despite really not enjoying it, because otherwise so much of Maverick's nods would've been completely lost on me, but Maverick stands in its own right as a solid action movie. This is some of the best dogfighting ever caught on camera. The authenticity of every shot is through the roof and goes a long way to really selling the intensity. Top Gun sought to put the audience in the cockpit with the pilots, Maverick actually does while also capturing some breathtaking stuntwork at the same time. They could've built a mock cockpit in a studio in front of a green screen and filmed the actors normally and CGI'd the planes in the sky, but then they'd be missing the real effect of those Gs on the actors faces, they'd be missing the palpability of flight at those speeds, they'd be missing all the little imperfections impossible to recreate. Tom Cruise deserves all the praise for this movie's monumental success, financially, critically, and artistically. He offers that which action movies have been sorely lacking for decades - authenticity. While I'm not quite at the point where I'd put it on the same pedestal as Fallout or Fury Road, it definitely has a strong claim. I give Top Gun: Maverick an edge-of-your-seat 8/10. This is definitely a movie I could see myself rewatching before the end of the year.QyrosMovies.

It is hard to beat the original Top Gun when it has the nostalgia behind it. For an 80s movie, it was ahead of its time. TGM incorporates the nostalgia without putting in too much where this movie could stand on its own without it. It makes you like this movie so much more with it and truly helps it be the sequel it needed to be. Call me indecisive, but it is hard to pick which movie is better. They both are unique but the flying alone makes TGM superior. You don't want the movie to end and wish there was more everything that makes Top Gun, Top Gun.Most sequels out there flop and this proves them wrong. Heck, this movie currently has an 8.7. It was not a lie, the plot does include Star Wars and I laughed when I figured out what those reviews meant. It didn't matter at the end of the day. I can't wait to see it again and get the DVDThis movie hits all the boxes. Go see it if you haven't and watching the first one will make you appreciate this one more.

reviews.review_title: Best movie of the decade. Period.
reviews.content: Well, that's it folks. Best movie of the year by a long mile, and for me best movie of the past decade. Not something to try to impress someone, but just expression all the way. Not trying to correct something or sending a meta-message between the lines, but pure, well organized simple gold storytelling and character drive movie.The old guys playing old guys, the young guys playing their roles. Every cast fits their role. It's believable. It's top notch and top tier of film making.There's a strong story. There's a past. There's fear for the future. This is not a movie, this is called life.

reviews.review_title: This is why I go to the cinema!
reviews.content: Great story and acting. It's awhile that we go to the cinema. Lately the movies are not really attractive and still waiting for "the one" it is. Heard a lot about this movie by friends and thought let give it a chance. Watch it on a 2D screen and I regret that. This movie needs to be seen on the best screen the cinema have!! I want to set it again on 4DX scherm with all the special effects. I think it say enough how good I think this movie is. 😆

The original movie was a huge hit in its day, and a sequel had apparently been on the cards for several years, but it was held up by the tragic suicide of original director Tony Scott, and later by the COVID-19 pandemic, so I was hoping this highly anticipated follow-up would be worth the wait, directed by Joseph Kosinski (Tron: Legacy, Oblivion). Basically, over thirty years since the previous events, Captain Pete "Maverick" Mitchell (Tom Cruise, also producing) has avoided promotion and continues serving and flying as a U. S. Navy test pilot. Rear Admiral Chester "Hammer" Cain (Ed Harris) is threatening to shut down the hypersonic "Darkstar" scramjet program to fund other drone programs. Maverick decides to take the Darkstar prototype and reach its Mach 10 speed objective before Cain shows up. Cain arrives just as Maverick takes off, and he watches as he does the objective. But Maverick cannot help himself and decides to push further into high-hypersonic speed, resulting in the destruction of the prototype. Maverick survives the crash and is threatened to be grounded by Cain for his recklessness. But instead, he is sent to NAS (Naval Air Station) North Island, back to Naval Fighter Weapons School, better known as TOPGUN, to be an instructor, under the orders of Maverick's friend and former rival, Admiral Tom "Iceman" Kazansky (Val Kilmer), the commander of the U. S. Pacific Fleet. Maverick is ordered to train a group of elite pilots assembled by Vice Admiral Beau "Cyclone" Simpson (Jon Hamm) and Rear Admiral Solomon "Warlock" Bates (Charles Parnell). The pilots will be trained to fly Super Hornet for an urgent mission: to bomb a uranium plant in an unnamed rogue state that is considered a threat to the United States by The Pentagon. The plant is located deep in a mountain pit at the end of a canyon and is defended by numerous air missile defence systems and a base filled with fifth-generation fighters. Maverick plans an attack with two pairs of Super Hornets, which will fly through a canyon and destroy the plant, while also exceeding the Hornet's limits. Maverick is initially rebuffed by the pilots, particularly by the self-confident Lieutenant Jake "Hangman" Seresin (Glen Powell) and by Lieutenant Bradley "Rooster" Bradshaw (Whiplash's Miles Teller), the son of Maverick's late best friend of co-pilot Nick "Goose" Bradshaw. As the pilots train for the mission, friction develops between Hangman and Rooster, who resents Hangman's cavalier attitude towards his wingmen, while Hangman criticises Rooster being cautious. As the pilots observe Maverick's skill, they reassess and begin to respect him. Meanwhile, Maverick reunites with former love interest Penny Benjamin (Jennifer Connelly), who reveals that Rooster's now-dead mother Carole made him promise to keep her son from flying. It turns out that Maverick blocked Rooster's application to the Naval Academy, setting back his career for a few years, hence why he had a disdain for him. Maverick later meets with Iceman, who has throat cancer and communicates by typing on his computer. He reassures Maverick about teaching the pilots and says he needs to let go of any guilt he has for Goose's death. Iceman loses his battle with cancer and passes away days later, with Maverick and the pilots attend his funeral. With Iceman gone, Cyclone removes Maverick as mission trainer. He takes over the training of the mission, setting new parameters with a less risky route to the uranium plant but would mean more chance of being spotted on approach. However, Maverick makes an unauthorised flight of the simulated course with the original parameters he planned, with a demonstration of the targeted bombing, and proves that it can be done. Cyclone is convinced, and reluctantly appoints Maverick as strike leader. Maverick chooses the mission pilots and is paired with Lieutenant Natasha "Phoenix" Trace (Monica Barbaro) and her WSO (Weapon Systems Officer) Lieutenant Robert "Bob" Floyd (Lewis Pullman, Bill's son), while Rooster is paired with Lieutenant Reuben "Payback" Fitch (Jay Ellis) and his WSO Lieutenant Mickey "Fanboy" Garcia (Danny Ramirez). Hangman and the remaining pilots are put on standby. The team launches from the aircraft carrier USS Theodore Roosevelt while the cruiser USS Leyte Gulf fires Tomahawk cruise missiles to destroy the air base near the plant. The team reaches the plant and following the planned route and successfully destroy it. But the team are attacked by surface-to-air missiles and a pair of patrolling Su-57 fighters. When Rooster runs into trouble, Maverick sacrifices his jet to protect him and ejects. Maverick is believed to be killed in action, so the remaining aircraft return to the carrier. Against orders, Rooster turns back to rescue Maverick from an Mi-24 helicopter gunship. He is shot down by another surface-to-air missile and ejects nearby. The two reunite and head towards the destroyed airbase hoping to find an aircraft that has survived the bombing. They find and steal an old F-14 Tomcat and head back to the carrier. Maverick and Rooster shoot down two intercepting Su-57s, but a third arrives as they run out of weapons and countermeasures. The third Su-57 is shot down by Hangman arrives from standby, and the planes return to the carrier, with everyone praising them, and Maverick and Rooster reconcile. Sometime after the mission, Maverick and Rooster work together on a P-51 Mustang at a hangar near the test facility where Maverick was previously stationed. Penny arrives with her teenage daughter Amelia (Lyliana Wray), and Maverick takes her for a ride in the aircraft. Rooster walks to a photo board and acknowledges a photo of their mission's success, alongside a photo of his late father and a younger Maverick. Also starring Greg Tarzan Davis as Lieutenant Javy "Coyote" Machado, Jean Louisa Kelly as Sarah Kazansky, Iceman's wife, Bashir Salahuddin as Chief Warrant Officer 4 Bernie "Hondo" Coleman, Manny Jacinto as Lieutenant Billy "Fritz" Avalone, Jake Picking as Lieutenant Brigham "Harvard" Lennox, Raymond Lee as Lieutenant Logan "Yale" Lee, and Kara Wang as Lieutenant Callie "Halo" Bassett. Cruise still looks good and remains likeable as the rebellious pilot turned trainer, Teller is cast well as Goose's grown-up son who wants to go all the way, Connelly is alright as the new girlfriend (Kelly McGillis was apparently not approached to return), the other supporting pilot characters are all cast well, and despite his poor health it is good to see Kilmer back. The original is perhaps a little dated and cheesy at times, the only faults I could find with this follow-up was the romantic element being less interesting and the silly return of the highly gay topless beach volleyball scene. This sequel is much more sophisticated, with a much concrete story, the mid-air dogfights and high-speed flying sequences are highly exciting, with many genuine cockpit shots, and the soundtrack included the return of composer Harold Faltermeyer, joined by Hans Zimmer and Lady Gaga, the return of "Danger Zone" by Kenny Loggins, and new song "Hold My Hand" by Lady Gaga, I think it is better than the original, a thrilling action drama. Very good!

reviews.review_title: Well done, entertaining "Top Gun Anniversary" celebration!
reviews.content: Excellent moviemaking! Some fun for nearly everyone. Story of a man who is the undeniably the GOAT, proving that he's still got it and whipping the young bucks into shape to be the next generation. They should NOT make more, but this was great.Some quick "is this worth it?" math... Tom Cruise running? Check. OK, we're good. Because everyone knows - Tom Cruise has *never* made a good movie where he wasn't running.All the obligatory TC "Man of Action" requirements are met: authentic stunt work, motorcycle, planes (obvi), some form of PG-Rated PDA with the girl... all set to a good soundtrack.Ample homages to the VHS source material as well (so much so that you don't need to re-watch it, thank you) without insulting anyone's memory of intelligence - yay!Some genuine tear-jerking moments here (Val Kilmer, man), a well as some uniquely military-based fun, a "dad" moment or two and a weird "immortal grown teenager" scene that made me laugh for lots of reasons and it's a wrap: traditional old-school movie gold, truly.Oddly enough, the best thing TG:M did here was to advertise the next Tom Cruise movie - Mission Impossible 146 (or whatever). I now can't WAIT to see that.Bottom line? Go see it in the theater and get popcorn.

Slipstreaming off the nostalgia of the first one just enough to allow it's engines to fully fire up, this sequel truly flies high. Cruise's devotion to great blockbuster film-making that avoids green screens and focuses on true practical effects shows in every frame and is all the better for it! Very few films have ever conveyed the feeling of speed and the sickening g-forces on it's characters as this one does. Then, masterfully, it unifies both films to form an immensely thrilling and emotionally impactful climax. TOP GUN 2 is mach-10 and then some,- a perfect sequel to a beloved classic that somehow manages to hit every single target.. including the return of that unforgettable soundtrack!

reviews.review_title: Amazing!! Even better than the first film.
reviews.content: I was expecting to be disappointed but how wrong I was. Top Gun complete beat all my expectations. I also can not believe that all the flying scenes are real!!

Shallow romance, shallow character work, extremely predictable, how did Tom Cruise even survive at the start, literally no stakes, mission is extremely vague, no one who worked on the film clearly has no understanding of planes and this is coming from an actual pilot. I hate this movie and everyone who liked it.

Nostalgic, no cgi , astounding sound track - citing the original is kept and a solid visual appeal.It ticks all the boxes you want from an entertainer and Mr. Cruise never disappoints.He's such a good actor it's a pity that besides being the box office king for 4 decades now they have shunted him at the Oscar's.Theres enough of joy and brilliance for everyone and the dog fights are absolute cinematic marvels citing there's no computer at work here .....Best movie of the year so far.
Top notch is what was expected and thats delievered. Great camerawork, breathtaking first 5 minutes and spectualar climax. Highly recommanded. Should owe 4k as soon as its released in blueray.

You cant deny this .. he is closer to Hunt than to Maverick.The way he talks . His impressions ,his looks . It is not developed from the first movie , it is changed . Still we love it.Tom is remarkable.

One of the best, if not even The Best Tom has ever done. And that says a lot.Great story, spectacular stunts and just amazing music. This is the best movie this year in my opinion. A part of me is hoping for one more movie just because this was so good and I want to see more. But the same time, this one summarized everything perfectly, so just let it be.I'm heading to the theatre to see it again :)

reviews.review_title: Top Gun: Maverick (2022, Joseph Kosinski) While all the stuff in the air is first rate the story on the ground is not as solid
reviews.content: 1986's 'Top Gun' is an iconic, bombastic 1980's film that seemed to inhabit exactly the right place at exactly the right time. Over 35 years later a sequel to that film finally emerges after being tossed around in Hollywood for the better part of ten years. This film has Tom Cruise reprising his role as Pete 'Maverick' Mitchell as well as Val Kilmer returning as Tom 'Iceman' Kazansky. There are numerous new additions to the cast including Miles Teller, Ed Harris, Jennifer Connelly and Jon Hamm among others. Joseph Kosinski directs and while he hasn't had a plethora of directorial experience he did work with Cruise before on the film 'Oblivion' and as history has shown us Cruise tends to enjoy working with the same collaborators. Originally scheduled to be released in July of 2019 the 'Top Gun' sequel become one of the longest delayed films primarily due to Covid-19, but there were also production challenges. The film finally opened in May 2022 to widespread acclaim from both fans as well as critics.The action in this film swirls inexorably around Captain Pete 'Maverick' Mitchell. While his contemporaries are long gone or Admirals by now he has remained a Captain in order to keep himself a pilot which is all he really wants to do. At the film's outset he is out in the Mojave desert working as a test pilot on project "Darkstar" which is designed to take manned flight to mach 10. An admiral arrives played by Ed Harris to shut the project down, but instead of being forced out of the Navy Maverick is ordered back to Top Gun school in Miramar, CA to be a special instructor. The Navy has assembled a best of the best of recent Top Gun classes for a specialized combat mission, and thanks to the events of the first film, Maverick is one of the only pilots to engage the enemy and therefore is deemed an appropriate person to train the mission. While most of the Navy seems to hate Maverick Iceman maintains an affinity for him and has been able to ensure he stays gainfully employed by the Navy all these years as he has attained the rank of Admiral and serves as Commander of the US Pacific Fleet thereby in a perfect position to be a guardian angel for Maverick. Among the crop recruits is Lt. Bradley 'Rooster' Bradshaw, played by Miles Teller, who is Goose's son who tragically died in the first movie. He bears a grudge against Maverick not only for the death of his father, but Maverick blocked Bradshaw's ability to enter the Naval Academy delaying his career. We get more than a few sequences learning this new crop of pilots, and as always there is an overly jerky one called Hangman played by Glen Powell. The mission they are set to fly seems impossible until in a last ditch brash move Maverick flies the course and in the process becomes the team leader of the mission as if no one saw that coming. The last portion of the film is the mission itself which could have gone a few ways, but in the end 'Top Gun: Maverick' takes about the most basic and obvious path they can with Maverick saving the day as well as Rooster, and everyone lives to tell the tale and even the royal pain in the ass 'Hangman' has a redemptive moment before they all live happily ever after. Maverick and Rooster make amends and bond, while Mav also has a love interest that solidifies over the course of the story.This film is quite good. First and foremost of note are the exceptional plane sequences that look amazing on a premium movie screen. Those sequences alone are worth the price of admission. This film has had universal praise heaped upon it, but the story itself is not without its flaws or at least some questionable plot decisions. I loved seeing Kilmer back as an Admiral and it made sense that he could have been a guiding and sheltering benefactor for Maverick over the years. It was not difficult to see that character's death coming in the story yet it still resonated. What surprised me is that it was the only character death in the story. I felt the whole mission lost a little something by not having at least one of planes and its crew go down. The film enters a bit more of the action hero genre at that point rather than a more rational, realistic narrative. I was fine with most of the nostalgic throwbacks they tossed in the film, however, one I couldn't get behind, and it is small and perhaps petty I admit, but having Goose's son play 'Great Balls of Fire' in the bar was too far. It was enough he was playing the piano and had the glasses, but with no explanation it is incredibly farfetched to think he would be playing that exact song, and it just bothered me. Also when we are introduced to Maverick we see his little shrine to his lost partner which makes sense, but there is nothing else? You are telling me in an almost 40 year career he hasn't had anything else meriting remembrance? It is like the film picks up all that time later, but the character has just treaded water for 35 years which is simply not plausible, but it is done that way because it makes it convenient and easy to tell. Compounding on this is the whole love interest angle which is my biggest problem and the movie's biggest flaw. At the end of the first film it seemed like 'Maverick' and 'Charlie' were going to be a happily ever after couple. All that time has passed and she is gone as Maverick returns to Miramar and finds off again on again love interest, Penny, played by Jennifer Connelly, who I believe is supposed to be the admiral's daughter from the story in the first film. I understand the want for nostalgia but this story element is unnecessary and is just nostalgic pandering. It didn't really serve the characters and was only done for a rapt audience to go, "Ahhhhh, I see what you did there." Then you combine that with the very public fact that Kelly McGillis was not asked to come back to the production and going a step further they don't even leverage one line of dialogue to explain why she isn't around? She could be dead. She could be in Washington. Maybe things just didn't work out, but it seems like so blatant an omission because, as we have seen, this is a character that appears to be stuck in the 1980's. The easiest answer would have been just don't give Maverick a love interest. The love interest is basically just superfluous to the story and doesn't really do anything except eat up run time, and take away from what we really want which is the pilots and the planes. I thought the discussion of drones vs. Human aviators was going to play a larger role here, and unless I missed it I don't recall them ever addressing why this super important mission could not have been accomplished by drones. I thought that discussion would have been more prevalent throughout the film and outside of the initial scenes when Darkstar was shutdown it wasn't addressed at all. Finally I found it very bizarre to make the major static between Maverick and Rooster this Naval Academy thing, if you even believe renegade Captain Mitchell has that power rather the more glaring, easy and sensible conflict that is the death of Bradshaw's father, but that actually is somewhat secondary to a more cumbersome way to get essentially the same conflict.I know in reading that it sounds like a lot of negative and a lot of bashing, but despite a few glaring flaws in the story I actually had a great time with this movie. Everything looks and feels like 'Top Gun' so they were doing a very good, if obvious, job of channeling the original film. I did love the dynamic of Maverick so many years down the road now the wise veteran teaching essentially varying versions of himself. Hangman seems to be a loose version of Iceman although clearly just written with a much more antagonistic slant. Cruise continues to defy age and look like he belongs in these roles, and he certainly excels at reprising one of the roles that has defined his professional career. Besides Cruise and his star power the fabulous flight sequences are what drive the film. The writer and director realize this and jam the film with about as much aerial maneuvering as they can get, and it is a hefty amount, and all of the sequences are great to watch from the Darkstar intro to the training maneuvers to actual mission sequence and all that entails. While the film does have its flaws, which more people might admit after the new car smell wears off, and the film does enter the action hero genre by the end, it is an intensely exhilarating thrill ride with technical camera work that makes the film amazing all on its own. I am torn in the final evaluation as the technical merit of the film deserves an A whereas the story lands in the C to C- range.Eric's Grade: B.

reviews.review_title: Typical Rah, Rah, America First Nonsense
reviews.content: Best Picture? Seriously? Gimme a break. This movie uses every single stereotype that they could come up with. Blaring music, high speed planes, motorcycles, boats, the death of a beloved character, missing man flyover at a cemetery, high-tech gadgets, America first, etc. And let's not forget the inevitable love story between Tom & Jennifer Connelly. In today's hyper-political society, this movie appeals to the typical non-college, right-wing, MAGA Nation cultists, who believe that America can do no wrong and that everything we do is justifiable, no matter who gets hurts, or remain on the fringes. I rather take the time to watch movies which take a more realistic and honest approach of our military and not try to push this America First down our throats.

reviews.review_title: BEST MOVIE I HAVE EVER SEEN IN MY LIFE
reviews.content: I was five when the original Top Gun came out and this blew any and all expectations out of the water!!!! I cried the entire time. I have never left the theater feeling so incredible after a movie. I WAS BLOWN AWAY. 11 stars out of 10.

From the very first scene to the very last I was hooked! Not often the whole audience is transfixed & quiet, actually taking in all the scenes and enjoying every minute. There were lots of funny moments and the flashbacks scenes were emotional and nostalgic. The training scenes and real world combat scenes were amazing! Storyline was perfect and the supporting cast and characters in the top gun academy were great choices. Miles teller as goose's son, wow!!! I've never sat so still and excited watching a movie in a cinema for a long time, can't wait to watch it again!
Best thing I've ever witnessed in an iMax. Go see this movie if it's the only movie you watch this year. Negative reviews are invalid! Nostalgia at its very best.

This movie has been met with near universal acclaim, and while enjoyable, I'm failing to see what makes this so special, much less better than the original.Firstly (and this is more of a personal preference towards me being able to enjoy a film), plausibility. Something grounded in its fiction I find to be much more engrossing, relatable to the characters, plot, and overall more gratifying to the telling of its narrative than something that takes plot extravagances and liberties that, while fun in the spectacle and humorings they afford, renders the plot underpinning it so absurd and contrived that my suspension of disbelief falters.The ending of this movie, for one example, was beyond stupid and implausible to the point of utter laughability.....hijacking an old F-14 with Goose's son from an enemy base and taking out two modern fighters on the way back to the carrier? Unlike the original, the plot was so contrived and artificial feeling I was left rolling my eyes the majority of the time, feeling the literal hands of the script writers intruding upon a narrative (one that should've been flowing naturally) to work to satiate that 30+ years of nostalgic buildup we've had. Which the film does, again, and again, and again. From the opening crawl and Kenny Loggins, to the bar scene and "Great Balls of Fire" (played by Goose's son, Rooster, no less), to hard deck scoldings, to homo-eroticism at the beach, to racing the plane on the bike, to even having Rooster saying "Talk to me, Dad!" before finding his courage to scream in and save the day. All the way to, yup, Maverick in a Tomcat again.It was as if the filmmakers had a nostalgic bucket list to check off before even having a general narrative arc in mind, and this "new" plot was beholden to the past at all costs. This is what creative bankruptcy looks like, but apparently this is what audiences want, as people LOVE it and it's getting rave reviews everywhere I'm looking.I for one crave some originality in my films.

Just watched Top Gun Maverick. Very impressive sequel. I had watched the original a few weeks back to rewind my memory.While the original itself was really good for those times, the sequel is a far better product. The script itself is great. The handling of the script is more mature. Great story, acting and presentation. Packs in action and emotion in good quantities. All the actors have done a great job, especially Tom Cruise.Actions scenes are well picturized. Full package after a long time. Great watch for the full family. Take your kids to the theaters to enjoy the fireworks.Double Thumbs up.

You cant say this about many movies, but this is a fantastic sequel. It flowed nicely and the cinematography was top tier. If you have the chance to watch it in a Dobly or IMAC theater definitely do it. You can feel the intensity as if you are actually there. The story was well thought out with many references from the first movie. I also very much appreciate how it was filmed. Truly an awesome experience. Definitely recommend as a must watch.

reviews.review_title: Plenty of excitement as ace pilot Tom Cruise leads a fighter formation in a dangerous mission
reviews.content: Movie heroes are ageing fast. Couple of months back it was Daniel Craig as James Bond who appeared old and tired and no surprises that he was replaced by his bosses with a younger agent 007. Now we have Captain Pete Mitchell ( Tom Cruise) of "Top Gun" fame who is back after 36 years , older and wiser with a new call sign "Maverick". He still has the enthusiasm to fly a fighter plane to its limits at a speed of Mach 10 and beyond. He also employs unorthodox methods to meet stringent task requirements. So naturally he is asked to train a group of young pilots for a dangerous mission. He motivates them to give their best for the mission. The movie is definitely a thrilling IMAX big screen experience with scenes of Navy aircraft taking off from an aircraft carrier and edge of the seat, nail biting scenes of aerial combat. It has all the ingredients to excite audiences of all types. Needless to add that fighter pilots ,young and old will especially identify with the story and presentation of the film.All credit must go not only to the director Joseph Kosinski for his admirable work but also to the cinematographer, editor, music composer and VFX/SFX creator for their splendid contribution in the making of this movie. The super thrilling climax of the combat mission has been filmed superbly. How a pull of 10 times the gravity physiologically effects the fighter pilot has been shown realistically. There are a number of nice quotes/one liners and interesting conversations to keep the audience engrossed. Also there is fine balance of leadership and team spirit shown. The bonhomie among the pilots is picturised well. Tom Cruise is on familiar ground and makes the best of this much loved character.

reviews.review_title: I wanted to say this was at least 9.5 but there's not way this movie is anything under 9 starts.
reviews.content: This movie is awesome. I've seen a few times in the cinema and for a 30 year old movie to gey a sequel and blow it out of the park.... just wow. Definitely top movie and I've seen many movies in My day. The way the story rolled off almost seamlessly with the oringal film was very clever writing, I recommend this move as it holds a strong and new standard of Hollywood big budget movies to follow. Well apparently as acorded by this website my review must must contain six hundred characters and I've already stated this movie is highly worth watching, especially without giving any spoilers so please do yourself a favour and go watch it!

Was kinda meh about seeing it , but was the only thing left I haven't seen .Well I'm glad I did go and watch ,Story line was great , acting was good and total nostalgia moments with maverick and the crew.

reviews.review_title: I was engaged from start to finish!!!
reviews.content: I only went to see this film as last minute plans with 2 friends, I'd never seen the original Top Gun and had to have the story explained to me during the car journey to the cinema.I walked in the theatre with low expectations but can safely say it's one of the best films I've seen in a long time and I'm very picky, particular and critical of movies.It was corny and cheesy but in the right ways - great action sequences where you're genuinely on the edge of your seat, great storyline, acting was brilliant and character developments I actually felt invested in. Even a few comic relief parts were corny but it suited the vibe of the film (I'm looking at you Disney Star Wars). You didn't necessarily need to have seen the original because top Gun Maverick sets the movie up in a way that explains what happened previously but could have easily been a stand alone film because it goes in its own direction.9/10, loved it!
Booked in for IMAX. To see this film. Brilliant !Well thought out carry on from the first film, with original actor stunts, not seen in a film before , yes, they really did fly.
The movie was well filmed. It was funny, exciting and overall good. I had no negative experience.I suggest TopGun to anyone who likes action films. Like movies Made by DC and Marvel.

reviews.review_title: Movie for the big screen .. indeeeeed it's
reviews.content: One of the best movie I have ever seen in the cinema great action drama movie you will not be disappointed,Tom as always if he is making a movie he will try his hardest to not use cgi and do his stunt by him self and that's what he did and not just Tom but also the actors that was with him just amazing, and the music is amazing lady Gaga and Hans zimer just the perfect mix and let's not forget onerepublic just great and this wouldn't have happened without the great direactor and the writers 👏👏👏

Wow! What a fantastic spectacle! Not only perfectly paced and shot, but also brilliantly acted and directed. Joseph Kosinski has once again made an enjoyable, heartfelt, and exhilarating movie (see "Only The Brave"), only this time it's for a much more demanding - and large audience.Top Gun: Maverick is one of the most enjoyable films of the decade, and works both as a rare fulfilling sequel that also surpasses its predecessor in many ways, and a straightforward action film. Tom Cruise is fantastic, as are Miles Teller and Glenn Powell; the supporting cast is equally impressive.For the stunt sequences alone, the film is worth checking out. It feels authentic yet pays loving homage to the original in dutiful fashion. Overall the best film of the summer thus far.

reviews.review_title: Best movie of the 21st century so far
reviews.content: I'm just incredibly thankful for this film. The flying and stunts are jaw dropping. There has never been such a daring movie before Top Gun: Maverick. I was on the edge of my seat for 2/3rds of the movie. The drama and dialogue actually felt meaningful. The opening scene had me floored! It's no secret that Tom is the king of action but Miles Teller's performance stole the movie for me. 10/10! I will be watching for decades to come.

The original was great fun but the ultra realistic cinematography is amazing.Watch films for pure entertainment, amazing stuff!! Top Gun! Another action movie in this year. The deployment of flares and the missile scenes and the sound effects associated with those really boost that thrilling factor.There's just too many superhero movies these days but here Tom cruise who absolutely drives this movie with his passion and energyI loved the music, excellent action scenes and A surprising twist towards the end of the movie which I didn't expect.So yeah overall I definitely recommend that you go and watch this movie because it is just amazing.I have to say, Tom is in great shape for 60 years old.

First of all i would like to say thanks to the director Joseph Kosinski for directing this entire masterpeace and Tom Cruise simply perfect, this movie is the best sequel ever made.The music is like a disco inside your head, thank you really, god bless you.

reviews.review_title: So stupid that it insults a viewer's intelligence
reviews.content: I had heard that 'Top Gun: Maverick' was good. Then I watched it. It's terrible - filled with technical errors and cardboard characters.However, if you think that comic book movies are worthwhile, or are 12 years old, you may like 'Top Gun: Maverick'.

reviews.review_title: Tom Cruise and Kosinski Know How To Make You Love Going To The Theatre, Again
reviews.content: My wife and I absolutely loved each and every minute of this film (Imax). Right from the goodbumps giving theme till the last few scenes, the film is really fun.However, I still think that the old one was a tad better and the reasons are 2, casting and overall time.The second one is easy to describe - various sequences needed to be delved into. They packed in so much of the stunt scenes that the non Cruise cast got a lot lesser time to show off any of their acting skills. The film should be 15-20 mins longer.The first part, the casting, could have been a lot better. The entire team, with the exception of Miles Teller, was not up to the mark. They should have gone for a lot better cast. Connelly was definitely awesome and could have used a few mins more of screen time, but Jon Hamm was badly used. He just looked like he was going to have an aneurysm throughout his few minutes.That being said, had the film been another 15 mins longer, it may have allowed the actors to show off their skills. In the first movie, they did it well.However, if there is a TOP GUN 3, I would definitely see it and only in the hall.

After 2 plus years away from the cinema; we finally got tempted back to the IMAX to see Top Gun Maverick. And we were not disappointed. A touch of romance, compassion and a massive dose of action that wasn't over laden with CGI ensured we had a great experience and a reminder that our 4K 55" TV isn't the answer to all our movie dreamsTom Cruise and cast brought together emotion and great acting that was not overshadowed by the exciting visual content of real life action. Don't get me wrong, I appreciate CGI and the worlds that it opens, but the raw energy of seeing real jets in action and Tom Cruise in the cockpit adds dimension that takes the film away from what might just be an elaborate computer game. I have no doubt CGI was incorporated, but I could not see where it was added, other than they didn't blow up the aircraftWhilst it is great that everyone has different views, I do not understand some people giving this film 1 or 2 stars. If that's how they felt after watching the film, surely they should have read the synopsis before they went. I can only think these people don't like action movies at all and should have saved their money in the first place, rather than bleating that they were ripped offThankfully the vast majority of people enjoyed themselves and this movie will help save the cinema and get people back into seats. IMAX viewing isn't cheap, but we came away feeling we got value for money and I for one, hope the movie receives well deserved Oscar nominations.

I saw this movie with my son and we had a great time at the movies. Top Gun: Maverick is everything you expect it to be - and nothing more.The military action is top-notch - tense and technical, and the flight scenes are thrilling and very well choreographed. That's why 90% of the people are there to watch the movie.As a movie fan however, one does wish there had been a little more character development. We know nothing at all about any of the characters- even Maverick. The two African American characters exist merely to stand there and nod grimly, or smile, or hold a football. All of the students except two have no lines at all; at the end when we go through the role call, I was thinking, "I don't know these people at all."
The one hotshot student had a few obvious lines that were never challenged, and there was a huge opportunity to have some drama between he and maverick, but that simply... passed. The dialog was silly and predictable.With a better script and a little more character development, this might have been a great movie. Think about the group of soldiers from the movie "Aliens" ... through a few lines of simple dialog we got to know and care about those people. Any good movie about a military team - even a comic book - establishes the characters and camaraderie better than this movie.I will forgive the "one in a million shot to destroy the Death Star" parallel because those sequences were so brilliantly shot, and because once again- that's what the people (including me) wanted to see.6.8 rounds to 7 outta 10. Good Summer flick.

It is rare these days that you go into the theater tense about yet another franchise attempt to improve itself these days, and COME OUT SMILING!!! What a success story, and a great send off to one of the cinema's greatest characters (no not Maverick!). Kudos to the director, actors, but especially the unsung script writers whose job was to get correct all of the technical jargon necessary to make the plot believable. I won't spoil it for those who have not yet seen it .... but, SEE IT!! IT'S THE NEW FEEL GOOD MOVIE OF THE SUMMER!!! GLEE :)

reviews.review_title: A lot better than the original, because it's not really a sequel
reviews.content: Top Gun is something that shaped a generation, but it was a pretty silly movie, from the premise to the plot, the characters and the love scenes, the dogfights and the navy terminology. Top Gun: Maverick, on the other hand, is surgical. Everything that can be problematic is removed, while the action is focused on the flying.Can we bring back Kelly McGillis? No. She is 9 years older than Cruise, which makes her 65. So we'll go with Connelly, who still looks stunning at 51. Would it be weird to show Maverick wooing a woman the way he did 36 years ago, following her into bathrooms and what not? Of course. Let us say they were already a thing from before, just estranged. Could people get their panties in a twist because women are allowed to be pilots now? Sure, so let's add a female pilot that does absolutely nothing the entire film except participate. Same with some black folk. Make one an admiral and the other a pilot and give them two minutes of screen time. Can we show dogfight scenes like in the first movie, where everyone who knows anything about flying would laugh out loud? No. Let's montage everything from short sequences showing Maverick is the best of them all. Should we name the enemy country who went "rogue" like they detached their territory from the Earth and are trying to fly away? No. Let's not call it Iran in any way. And when we show a coordinate on a screen, let it make it the most neutral place in the world! Not Switzerland, but the pole of inaccessibility.So instead of characterization, setup or any portrayal of an actual human being, it's a film made of significant cutouts who suggest what the story is, without an actual one. The plot is super silly, also, basically one of those "so crazy it might just work" ideas combined with the "old man who can do it better than the young'uns" concept and sprinkled with the Star Wars attack against the Death Star. But it works. It is entertaining, lacking any controversy, depth or moral. After feeling good for a second, you will forget the film ever existed.And just so we can call it a sequel to a completely different film, let's call back Cruise and Kilmer (for a few minutes, too), use the same music, bring in the son of Goose (who is somehow a Rooster?) and use some of the same lines in Top Gun, so we can pump up the nostalgia. But it's not a sequel, only a color neutral reimagining of a similar concept, lacking the impact that the film had. And released now, when Iran is not as much an enemy as Russia and China are, it shows how much the world has changed in three years.Bottom line: It is worth watching both Top Gun films back to back just in order to feel how much things have changed (and how much they stayed the same). It's a well produced and executed film, but it has no real soul. Entertaining, but without impact. I doubt young people will climb over each other to join the Navy after this film.

That Gong!!! As a retired Sailor in the American Navy, I have to say this film is an 11 out 10. The intrinsic value of this work of art is the way it was filmed. All of the work put it into it, is a testament to its essence. Tom used the phrase "a love letter to aviation", as I watched this film, one word constantly came to mind--Love. And I don't mean a romantic type of love, but a love that my brothers and sisters demonstrate on a daily basis, first off, for each other and for their country, no matter what its present condition. Although I never flew, I was part of the flight deck ground support on various flat tops. This film is a tribute to ALL of us; and I did feel that--Love. I could be wrong, but based on Lincoln bobble head and Hangman's "Give 'Em Hell", I'm sure this was shot on two different carriers--Abraham Lincoln and the Harry S. Truman (I had not researched this information prior). This film unified U. S. back in 1986 and I hope it unifies U. S., again today. This film has it ALL.

reviews.review_title: Nostalgia advertisement made for Cruise's ego
reviews.content: Basically, this a mindless, yet entertaining advertisement for Lockheed Martin. The flight scenes are exciting to watch but basically nonsensical if you know anything about physics. The film is loaded with nostalgia from the first film, except it was mean how they totally disregarded Kelly Macgillis' character. It was nice that Val Kilmer got to briefly reprise his role while he is still living with the real world effects of having survived throat cancer. They also made sure to completely depoliticize the movie by having a somewhat diverse cast ( but not too diverse) along with a token woman pilot, but more obviously the "enemy" is completely nameless, faceless with no flag and no indication of what country they are. Of course they need to satisfy international audiences, and most people around the world view the US as the evil empire these days, so it is what is.The biggest flaw though is that we are introduced to all these young hot-shot pilots who are supposed to be the best, but they are only shown failing Until the end, all to make a maverick into an inhuman superhero version of a pilot.Basically this film was made as an excuse for Tom Cruise to indulge his own ego, and fly some really cool planes so defense contractors can show us how cool these toys are and the brainless audience will continue to blindly accept throwing billions and billions at these war profiteers.
Waohh, what a rollercoaster and thrilling 2 hours from start to end. It's another masterclass from Tom as he never disappoint. The performance from all cast is amazing with powerful storyline.
It's not often a long awaited sequel to a classic movie meets expectations, but this does, and to me, it exceeded them.It's simplistic, fun and emotional, everything a proper blockbuster should be.

The movie and the music were amazing, you sat on the edge of your seat the entire time. I hadn't watched the first Top Gun so I thought that because of that I wouldn't be able to know what was going on, But I did! Aside from all the action, this story also had heart in it, this made it to me even better.

Yes there are things wrong. No - the mission/planes are not what would happen. Sure Tom would not still be a captain.Thing is... none of this matters. This is a loving and fitting sequel and with a touching cameo from Ice Man. F14 saves the day ... Honest - there is nothing to not love. If you grew up watching the first you will love this. If you were not born when the first one came out and found it later in life - you will love this one.Only advice I would give is watch the first one then enjoy.

reviews.review_title: Must see in theatres - for young and old
reviews.content: Lofty expectations? Met. Worth the wait? Yes. I don't remember a non franchise movie that had this much anticipation. You have your Star Wars, Harry Potter, Marvel, etc but Top Gun. That's a special movie for a lot of people. And none of them will be disappointed. Maverick breaks off more than it should be able to chew but does it anyway. There are Easter eggs for the diehard fans but you don't lose a lot if you miss em. The rest of us mere mortals will just enjoy a continuation of a childhood favorite or getting to enjoy what our parent did when they were young. The cast is great, the action is intense, and you feel like your in the dog fight or in the plane at all times. In a world of CGI being all the rage, Tom Cruise wanted to make this as realistic as possible. And he did so. Though at times it feels like a redo of the original Top Gun it doesn't actually end up being that. Every character's actions has consequences. Though in a small role the moments we get Val Kilmer on screen with Tom are beautiful. All in all you can't find a better sequel to a movie. I'm not one to tell you that you MUST see a movie in theaters but this would be it. A long movie but it's not like The Bat Man or the new Matrix movie where you could have chopped out 20 minutes and made a better movie. See Maverick as soon as possible and as many times as possible.

Growing up in the air cadets and seeing top gun I only wanted to be in the airforce, one of my favourite films as a kid growing up. Probably the most anticipated sequel I've wanted to see ever as a massive movie buff. Honestly for sheer entertainment I genuinely don't think films get any better and better than the original with no doubt. Action and flight sequences are amazing and worth the long wait, just hope for another if they can keep this standard up.

reviews.review_title: Greatest movie experience of my entire life
reviews.content: I've always wanted to be a fighter pilot and this film is everything I ever wanted in the Top Gun sequel and more. I genuinely think that this film is easily the best of the year and might actually be the best and most exciting blockbuster of the decade and I say that with ZERO exaggeration.From the films intro that seems to perfectly remake the old one to a modern version, dazzling flying sequences that will leave you daw dropped for the entire scene. Moments of intense action that you can't possibly take your eyes off, cinematography that looks amazing right down to the way that technical aircraft systems have been limited and simplified to provide the audience with not to much information to not be boring but rather a solid idea of what the real thing is like.The writing was well done, the cast was absolutely phenomenal, and the film's ability to capture this F/A-18 Super Hornets (as well as other aircraft) on these IMAX quality cameras as they dance across the sky was absolutely phenomenal as they all train in numerous air combat manoeuvring scenarios specific to a new kind of mission they must prepare to take on despite nothing like it ever being undertaken by any other group of fighter pilots.Despite the fact this film is an absolute thrill ride, their were moments where the mood would change to a more emotional way and this made for excellent contrast in the film. When you see everything in this film, you are going to want to see it in the biggest screen that is available to you. IMAX if have that option.The way this film was put together was absolutely without a doubt just breathtaking. I am forever grateful for the cast and crew and everyone involved as well as the US Naval Fighter Weapons School/TOPGUN who had brought the same joy from the original film and reenergised it for the modern generation. This is absolutely a film for anyone who wants to have an amazing time and if anyone is reading this review and hasn't seen it, GET OFF UP AND GO SEE IT NOW!Everyone, I've never praised a single movie anymore in my entire life as I could talk about this one forever and believe me I will be. I really do think that even for those people who don't find themselves interested in aviation and combat sequences (the majority of the audience) will absolutely love this film and I can't wait for everyone to have an amazing time in the theatre as they gain a greater appreciation for those driven in life by aviation just like me.Please don't waste your time, go see this film now because your going to want to see it more then once without a doubt, and strap in for the most amazing film experience you can possibly find!

This movie is a very average movie at best and I'm not sure what people are hyped about. I'll give a breakdown of the main elements of the movie and what I thought about them.Screenplay: Incredibly standard. If you've ever done screen-writing or know anything about screenwriting, this movie follows the very generic basic outline of what a screenplay should be. It doesn't take any twists or turns and does exactly what you expect it to do. There's no "wow, I didn't expect this to happen" or any real interesting narrative choices in the movie. Everything that happens in the movie happens almost exactly minute per minute the way a generic screenplay outline is constructed and in the most obvious ways that one would expect it to happen. To make matters worse, the vast majority of the movie is told through montages and I felt like every couple of minutes there was another montage. The movie seems to be afraid to actually have characters interact in real time and decides to rely on montages to move things forward.Characters/Dialogue: There are a few good moments here and there, but everyone is a cliche cut-out of a character with no real interesting characteristics or personality traits. The vast majority of this movie's dialogue is predictable and on the nose to the point where it just feels like everyone talks in exposition: "Hi, I'm the character that wants to shut-down the mission" "Hello there, I'm the character that is nerdy." "Howdy, I'm the character who doesn't want to talk to you." There's no subtlety in the dialogue nor intrigue in what is said. Good dialogue should make us curious and invested in the characters and the relationships between the characters, not inform us as to what role they fill in the screenplay. Going back to the montage issue, the movie really seems afraid to actually spend time on characters doing "character things" and only ones to rush by on the bare minimum of what is required to make a character.Cinematography: The beginning of the movie has some neat shots with an experimental plane taking off and there are some cool moments here and there when the planes are flying, but the dialogue scenes look like they were all shot in a weekend. EVERYTHING is told in over the shoulder shots or simple Shot/reverse shots. Why can't there be any scenes of all of the characters interacting? Why can't there be any wide shots of characters talking to each other that slowly leads to an increase in tension as the shots get closer? Why does this look so cheaply shot? Everything that involves characters talking to each other is shot with the least amount of artistic intrigue possible with no level of creativity or personality.Editing/Sound design: This is where the movie really works. The editing in the flying scenes is very good and impactful. While I think the movie does rely a little bit too much on lots of quick editing to make things feel more exciting, I think that might just be due to a lack of footage of wide-shots of planes flying, so everything had to be reduced to close-ups of planes or interior shots only. That being said, I still think the editors did a great job on this film. The sound design is also top-notch and should be applauded for really evoking the power behind a jet engine.All in all, I'm a little confused by the amount of praise this movie is getting. It's not offensively bad, but it's also not a great film by any means due to shortcomings in the vast majority of the core tenets of filmmaking. Maybe I'm just a nitpicky jerk, but it feels like audience standards have gone downhill since COVID started and now any movie that is functionally competent is seen as a masterpiece in filmmaking.

reviews.review_title: Independence Day... on the sea and in the air?
reviews.content: Let's start with positives:1. Acting and the cast are good, I had my doubts, but I was wrong.2. Editing is, to be honest, amazing.3. Sound design and sound effects are great. Most probably they will be nominated for an Oscar. As for the Oscar predictions, this film could be the film for which they will give an Oscar to Tom Cruise, as an actor or the producer of the film.4. The film length is just as it should be.5. No woke propaganda. They did not disrespect the original cast, which was surprising. That is the power of Tom Cruise for ya!6. No military US propaganda against one or multiple foreign powers. "The enemy" is successfully hidden throughout the film.As for the negatives:1. It is a remake, but with soul at a basic degree.2. Corny, smells like 80's.3. Some nostalgia bait, but I was surprised not to see Meg Ryan in the film.4. Jennifer Connelly was, I think, 14 at the time of the first film. I mean, come on!5. The theme and dialogues are corny, as well.6. There is some military propaganda: you know, fighting against faceless enemy. Literally.7. 40-year-old fighter jet... flying?! Faster than current ones?!8. VFX is insufficient despite being seamless mostly throughout the film.9. Mostly 2-dimensional characters.10. Familiar plot with familiar plot points, but they work mostly.

Top Gun: Maverick is a highly anticipated action film that is sure to thrill audiences with its heart-pumping aerial sequences and compelling storyline. The film follows the character of Pete "Maverick" Mitchell, played by Tom Cruise, as he returns to the Navy's elite fighter pilot program and faces off against a new generation of skilled aviators.The film boasts impressive special effects and breathtaking action scenes, making it the perfect choice for a night out at the Cue-cinema's Maximus screen. The Maximus screen is known for its top-quality visuals and sound, providing moviegoers with an unparalleled viewing experience.Tom Cruise is an iconic actor who always delivers captivating performances, and his role as Maverick is no exception. His charm and charisma shine through in every scene, making him a fan favorite.Overall, Top Gun: Maverick is a must-see film that is sure to leave audiences on the edge of their seats. And when paired with the exceptional screen quality of the Cue-cinema's Maximus screen, it's the perfect combination for a memorable night at the movies.

I watched this and the action scenes made you feel like you were actually flying the planes, others in the cinema were moving there heads in unisense, the film was gripping and actin throughout. Brilliant film.

When I heard that a sequel to Top Gun was in development, I was a little bit unenthusiastic because I really loved the first film and I didn't think it needed a sequel. However watching the trailers and clips slowly won me over and now I can purely say, now that I've seen the film, it's very, very good.It's set years after the first film, and Maverick is back at Top Gun, teaching new recruits for a deadly mission. There are loads of references and parallels to the 1986 film, which I'm sure fans will love. The cinematography was amazing and the actors actually were flying the planes to give them an authentic feeling. Great acting from the new addition to the film such as Monica Barbaro as "Pheonix" (the first female pilot) and Miles Teller as Bradley Bradshaw.But the real star is of course Tom Cruise, for not only playing the character as the rebellious and arrogant person that we all know and love, but also shown tenderness and vulnerability as he must face the ghosts of his past.I forgot to say the soundtrack is brilliant, such as Lady Gaga's song for the movie, "Hold my Hand".A solid 9/10.

Worth a view on the big screen for the action scenes but boy were things predictable.Cruise was his usual charismatic self, but let down by a cliche-ridden script that felt like it had been written by AI as well as some lukewarm support.Continuity errors and plot flaws were many, which is a shame and unnecessary when you consider the budget.Worth a trip to see on the big screen for state of the art special effects, but I'd have hate to have sat through it at home where a decent plot is more important.

reviews.review_title: Faithful to (and maybe even better than?) the original
reviews.content: I took my Dad to see this as an early Father's day gift and WOW! We were absolutely blown away. For context, my dad is not a frequent moviegoer like myself, but as a fan of the original, he was highly anticipating this movie, which did not disappoint. Personally, I thought the first film was a fine action movie, but as a younger viewer, I lacked the emotional attachment and nostalgia that the previous generation has for it. To the few people that read this, I will ABSOLUTELY have that nostalgia for this movie and plan on showing this to my children in the future. Maybe we'll even see Top Gun 3 in 2058!In my humble opinion, this movie actually improved many aspects of the original (such as the storyline, action, humor and romance/love interest element), which is why I argue that this movie surpassed its predecessor in quality. While viewing this movie, if you find yourself wondering if you feel the same way, the climax (a visually stunning culmination of the two hours that just flew by) will definitely convince you. The phrase "on the edge of my seat" is flaunted about quite often, but this was one of the few movies to literally keep me on the edge of my seat. Easily one of the best 3rd act action sequences I've seen in recent years coupled with a nice rapport between Tom Cruise and Miles Teller (who channels his "Whiplash" acting here). The latter portrays Rooster, the son of Goose from the first Top Gun. Kudos to the makeup department for creating an impressive Goose look-alike.Speaking of legacy characters, it's well-known that Val Kilmer appears in the movie (for crying out loud, his name is in the opening credits!) Without spoiling anything, I felt that both the character and actor were done justice by the story. It was so satisfying to see him return (albeit briefly) to the role that arguably propelled his career. Last but far from least is the titular Maverick. Tom Cruise was in top form here, even at nearly 60 years old, delivering a great performance, this time as instructor of Top Gun (not a student) and a distant yet caring father figure to Rooster. The class which Pete taught contained a variety of welcome additions to the cast. I also quite enjoyed the aspect of Pete's romance with old flame, Penny Benjamin (the admiral's daughter referenced in the first movie).Despite my fear of a 35 year-old sequel, Top Gun: Maverick met and exceeded my expectations. Everyone, do yourself a favor and check this one out. Even though I loved The Batman, I have declared a new winner for best movie of 2022. There's a reason this movie got a five-minute standing ovation at the premiere and has a near perfect score on rotten tomatoes, where I will soon release a copy of this review.

Top Gun didn't need a sequel and I honestly thought after 36 years it would be totally lame. I started hearing some of the reviews and really wanted to see it. It was amazing that there wasn't any CGI, everything was real. It was also so refreshing to see the mature adults with fine lines and natural faces, not all botoxed with obvious plastic surgery. I've always liked Jennifer Connelly and she made Penny fit seemlessly. They really honored Val Kilmer, I wasn't sure how they'd fit him in. We want to see it again, all the theaters with fancy screens were sold out and this was a Friday at 4:15. I can now understand why Tom Cruise is so proud.

reviews.review_title: Solid, predictable, worth seeing in theaters
reviews.content: Dramatic in the typical way of this type of any action movie (e.g. Every conversation sounds scripted & not realistic). The immersive experience that a movie theatre offers make it very much worth it-visually impressive and the music/sound make it a fun sensory experience.Easy for someone to follow who hasn't seen or barely remembers the original. This movie sort of gives away some major spoilers of the original so recommend viewing in order of release if possible.

I couldn't wait to see it. I even saved it for Christmas Day. Loved the Easter eggs, brought back great memories, loved the fact that Goose's kid is in the story. Didn't care for Jennifer Connelly, I thought there was a lack of chemistry. Absolutely adored the scene with Val Kilmer, I cried like a baby. It actually needed more flying. It was a little sappy, and even though I like that, they really poured it on thick. I don't care for Tom and his personal life but he makes a hell of a movie. John ham was perfect for the role. No politics, none of that distracting stuff where we pick sides or start being offended by anything. Just a good, solid, entertaining action movie with an old fashioned plot.. I admit I loved all the references to the first movie, it made it special for those of us who were crazy over it the first time. Not sure if it will mean as much to the new crowd. A good job. I wouldn't give it a 10 like most people have, it's missing something, but all in all a well-made movie to keep everybody interested in entertained.

reviews.review_title: Substance & style, heart & heat, flight & grounding
reviews.content:
IN A NUTSHELL:
Wow. Just wow! Producers Jerry Bruckheimer and Tom Cruise know how to create a fun summer blockbuster. Many are saying this one is even better than the first. I completely agree.After more than thirty years of service as one of the Navy's top aviators, Pete Mitchell is where he belongs, pushing the envelope as a courageous test pilot and dodging the advancement in rank that would ground him. Paramount Pictures has already earned a 100% score on Rotten Tomatoes, thrilling fans and critics alike with this high-octane action flick. That's quite a feat, even wilder than a jet racing through the skies! This is the summer blockbuster we wanted...and needed it to be!Do you feel the need for speed? I do!THINGS I LIKED:
Tom Cruise. Hello, Maverick! Welcome back! This classic character and classy actor have got what it takes to excite fans who have waited a VERY long time for this sequel! (36 years to be exact) Tom Cruise is 60 years old and looks fantastic. We see him riding his motorcycle next to the airstrip as he did in the first movie, and you almost can't tell if you're watching a clip from the first movie or if this is new footage...he looks THAT great. One thing I love about him is that he NEVER phones it in. He always gives more than 100% in his films and his growing skillset is super impressive. He's a true movie STAR.The new cast members also include Miles Teller, Jon Hamm, Glen Powell, Jay Ellis, Monica Barbaro, Charles Parnell, and Lewis Pullman.One question I have is when is Jennifer Connelly going to start aging? She looks amazing.I'm so happy to see returning cast members Ed Harris and Val Kilmer. The scene with Val Kilmer was especially touching.Try to watch this on the biggest screen you possibly can. The aerial acrobatics are absolutely breathtaking.I'm super impressed with director Joseph Kosinski for many reasons, but especially because this is only his 4th feature film ever! He's on the map!This film has substance and style, heart and heat, flight and grounding.There are a lot of respectful nods to the past that fans will love, including pictures on walls and video clips from the first movie.Lots of humor and Tom Cruise awesomeness.Tasty tension.The musical score is perfect.If you were to create your own call sign, what would you pick?There were rumors that the studio was going to remove the Taiwanese flag on Maverick's classic jacket for fear of losing the Chinese market. I was amazed and surprised to see that it's actually on his jacket in the final movie's release!It was completely refreshing to watch a movie come out of Hollywood that doesn't put America down or have a political stance of apologizing for being America, you know? It's not identified in the film which country the fighter pilots are going up against, which I thought was wise.THINGS I DIDN'T LIKE:
It's pretty predictable, but still doggone fun.It would have been nice to see Meg Ryan make a cameo appearance.I watched an interview with Kelly McGillis, saying she feels old and fat, not wanting fans to see her like that.There's lots of military jargon, but you can absolutely still enjoy watching this.TIPS FOR PARENTS:
Some profanity
Dangerous behavior
Pre-marital relations (we see unmarried people in bed together)THEMES:
Tenacity
Brotherhood
Past, present, future
Respect
Obedience
Protecting others
SacrificeYou can see the full review on the Movie Review Mom YouTube channel.

Miles better than the original 1986 film and one of my favorite sequels of all time. God this film is just awesome. That's the best way to describe it; awesome. The flying is awesome, the characters are awesome, the music is awesome, and the action is awesome. Tom Cruise's dedication to making realistic action films with little to no visual effects has paid off incredibly well here. The flying scenes were filmed practically but they look amazing. Some of if not the best shot sequences of the year so far. I absolutely adore how they look and it's amazing that the actors were able to act in those conditions. They all do a great job acting. Tom Cruise, Miles Teller, and Glen Powell are all standouts here and their respective characters and journeys were really well done and even compelling at points. Val Kilmer did a great job as well under his own personal circumstances. The film handles Kilmer's medical condition and character incredibly respectfully. It's a great handling of his character. The action here is awesome. It's incredibly well thought out and intense. You could know or predict the outcome of a scene and you could still feel your heart beating out of your chest just because of how well done the action is. It's genuinely some of the best action in a blockbuster that I've seen in a long time. The final action scene itself is probably my favorite action scene of the year. It's absolutely amazing and so much better than the final fight in the original film because it's actually set up. The music here from the original Top Gun composer, Lady Gaga, and Hans Zimmer is great! The soundtrack itself isn't near as good as the original 86 film but it's still great here. I can't wait to see how Cruise breaks the mold with action again in the future. This is a must see from me for everyone. This film deserves to break $1 Billion at the box office so go see it now!

Maverick is not just a sequel nor just another action flick of Tom Cruise
The film in itself holds close the soul of the original while surpassing the prequel in visuals, action, screenplay and the emotional involvement.This is definitely a true '"mission- IMPOSSIBLE" film where the makers achieved the impossible with grace.Jerry Bruckheimer films are always the pinnacle of production quality and they did prove again that 4 decades hasn't faded their dedication.The fighterjet sequences on big screen was a audio video visual treat which we don't see much nowdays in the CGI pile pumped out every year.A not to be missed sequel perhaps a better film.The best of Tom Cruise in a decade.

reviews.review_title: An emotional roller coaster with jampacked action.
reviews.content: Tom Cruise sir proves he is still the best action hero of all time even at 60. The chemistry between Jennifer Connelly-Tom Cruise and Miles Turner- Tom Cruise. Rest of the cast and crew are also very fantastic. This is arguably the best of 2022 along with RRR and Everything Everywhere All At Once.

Disclaimer: Like so many others, I generally do not like Tom Cruise as a person. However, I typically always like and appreciate his movies. From the Mission Impossibles to the Jack Reachers. He just stars in, and produces great and entertaining movies.This movie, unfortunately was one of the cheesiest and corniest I've ever seen. At the same time, it felt like a Disney production. (Not my cup of tea.)It was predictable, stupid and cringe worthy at times. I have zero idea why the reviews are so good. I felt like it was insulting to my intelligence.I hesitated to watch this movie for months because I expected it to be bad, but in the back of my mind I was hoping that I might be wrong about my expectations.Expectations confirmed! Garbage movie. Tom needs to retire!

First of all the soundtrack wow, it fit the whole movie perfectly sometimes when you was so focused you completely forgot the idea og the music which says it all, the comparison from the 1st one to this one is wow, there is so many and they fit the movie well. BUT the flying wow everytime there was a scene in which they flew i was on the edge of my seat "litterally" so yeah 10/10 ez.

What a breathtaking movie. Backed up by great backstories. Great acting. Likeable characters...humour. Fun. Stunning practical flying sequences. It's not a cgi heavy superhero movie. .It's just a brilliant summer blockbuster.

The day before seeing the sequel I watched the original to get up to speed (very late I know!) so I'd go into the latter viewing well aware of the back-story.This film is probably the best I've seen in my life, so far.Cruise absolutely smashes it outta the park, from the soundtrack to the characters, action scenes, quality and flow of the story is incredible. Some serious thought & design was poured into this effort and it's not often sequels overtake originals. From beginning to end was on the edge of your seat stuff! Very enjoyable, ended up going to see a second time - definitely deserving of an Oscar.

What a wonderful movie! A masterpiece! It had everything in it: great plot, interesting story, love connections, nostalgia, phenomenal acting, the music. Everything worked. There was no agenda, no wokeness. There was a nice homage to the original Top Gun. It was good to see Val Kilmer as well. It made you laugh and cry, get nervous and sympathize with the characters. The ending couldn't have been any better. I think everybody came out of the movie theater teary eyed. Thank you, Tom and the team, for showing us how great our military used to be. It's nice to reminisce and be proud of our past times.

Simply, awesome! Every 100 movies, one's worth it ! This is that, one. Cinematography, especially the aerial, at its best. No enemy country is mentioned. No eastern european, asian or latin american dictator. Well done! Just a mission to destroy a target.For anyone who was young like myself when the original came out, it blew us away. This one, did the same and more. Bravo to all involved!

Fighter pilots are trained to complete an impossible mission.I liked this more than I thought I would, especially for not having seen the original. Yet, I could still follow the story very well, and I found the action truly gripping in a way I had not experienced before. Also, the technical cinematography was perfect. I think every single camera shot could be framed as a photo in its own right.

reviews.review_title: What every sequel should aspire to be.
reviews.content: Maverick was dope and was what every sequel should aspire to be. Just the right amount of nostalgia, bigger and better action, deeper character building, same pacing format as the original, passing the torch to the next generation and properly concluding beloved characters.

reviews.review_title: What more can you ask from Top Gun Maverick
reviews.content: Honestly, what more can you ask from this movie?Nostalgic and classic but still fresh. Breathtaking camerawork, on point acting, and good plot line.
