I'm not even gonna to talk about the score which was just phenomenal.Honestly if you're gonna make a sequel to an 80s movie, this should absolutely be the golden standard. Taking the best from 80s nostalgia and adapting it to the 21st century in the most seamless well. A must see, and impossible not to give it a 10/10.

reviews.review_title: Best movie i have seen for awhile!
reviews.content: After years of declining quality of movies, a real worth watching movie is finally on screens! Hard core work done there realistically rather than CGI films that we are fed up with. Real people, real hardware, real cinema that we used to love. Tom cruise made his masterpiece that crown his unprecedented carrier. Lately we see a whole movie about one or 2 guys out with surplus computer work and that's it! We miss the real cinema like independence day, Armageddon, Godzilla, Jurassic park, private ryan and so on. I can't wait to see mission impossible. I just hope this movie wins the prizes it deserves.

All the elements are here.Corny lines. Loveable rogue who doesn't play by the rules. Love interest. Personal conflict. Regret. Tons of action. Humour.It's great fun, if completely predictable in every way.

This should never have been made. I watched just to say I saw. That is a terrible thing to say about watching a sequal., and will forever down, how good the original was.The premis was good, the exectiion was terrible. The movie was a virtual copy of the original. A nice way to rip off the public who love the original.The so called training and execution of the mission? It's been used for the past 60 years. It's based in England (Wales) and called the Mach Loop. Check it up. Oh, the actual concept of the bombing raid is based on a movie called Mosquito Squadron.There are too many problems and faults with this movie, I shall withdraw. I will live with the memory of the original movie, whis was excellent. The sequel is only a money maker, it has no story or soul.

reviews.review_title: Not a scratch on the original
reviews.content: Absolutely hate this new Top Gun. Pathetic plot and acting and everything in between. The original was a great movie for the times, with an incredible sound track: This is just a poor copy of the original. I had to go to the toilet with 30 minutes to go.....I didn't go back in, just kept walking and shaking my head. Don't believe the hype.

Haven't seen a good summer movie like this in the last 10 years. Best arial footage I have ever seen. NO CGI. Story was very moving. Cast was great. Funny, sad, har pounding. Not very often a squel is better then the original.

reviews.review_title: Pure movie, no political statements for a change
reviews.content: Everything about this movie is enjoyable. Its not perfect, and not the best movie ever, but it sure made for my number one movie experience ever. The action sequences is some of the best in movie history, and I believe it can only be fully appreciated and experienced in IMAX.I especially loved the fact that the movie did not try to force any political statements or sentiments onto us. No woke agendas, and even the enemy remained nameless and faceless.

reviews.review_title: I did not think Hollywood was capable of making a movie like this anymore.
reviews.content: Top Gun is one of my favourite movies, so I was very nervous as I waited for Maverick to begin, I knew from long and bitter experience that Hollywood has no intention of making enjoyable movies, instead preferring to make bland generic Marvel movies or deconstruct the movies that people actually enjoyed.My only hope with Maverick was Tom Cruise and knowing that he is not the normal actor, instead being a genuine movie star who wants to entertain his fans and produce the best movies possible.A couple of hours later, I emerged in total shock. Maverick did almost everything right (a bit of exposition could have been cut), it paid respect to the source material, even paying respect to the character of Maverick himself. The supporting cast were all excellent and likeable. The pilots were selected because they are the best of the best period. There was no attempt to awkwardly and artificially insert a message or tick boxes, they had earned their place and were believable and likeable as a result.Then comes the plane combat...wow. It is visceral, the practical filming shows just how intense and brutal pushing yourself to the limit is. Seeing the actors genuinely trying to remain conscious during high g turns is something that could only be achieved with them in the air experiencing it.This is how a sequel should be made. If only Spielberg and Lucas would step aside and let a good director such as Joseph Kosinski give Indiana Jones fans the sequel they deserve, not the sequel that is about to be forced on them by directors who no longer know how to make a good movie.

reviews.review_title: Intense! Especially in IMAX at Movie Theaters
reviews.content: Instant classic sequel that doesn't disappoint. Obviously no expense spared making this movie. Of course it includes some outrageous Hollywood fantasies and mystical flight maneuvering to its script but remains squarely within the story line. I like the way it demonstrates how human and mechanical performance are pushed to the absolute limits and beyond on some missions and the preparation to accomplish them successfully. The cast & crew did an amazing job throughout. It is a credit also to our great military members and our national values. Genius movie making, Loved it.

Although the original is incomparable, this is a good movie but more CGI then original and those lights in helmet, Only gen-x will be able to appreciate, The storyline could've been better if relationships were carried forward from the original. Top Gun anthem and those aviators on pilots are awesome. Tom Cruise was damn good at 25 and he is damn good at 60. Best movie of recent years. The screenplay always sticks to the storyline. Very good footage of naval aircraft.

reviews.review_title: It's amazing how good a film is when you keep all the political agendas out of it
reviews.content: It's amazing how good a film is when you keep all the political agendas out of it.This film reminded me of 80s and 90s action movies and Tom Cruise as normal is on top of his form.It's been awhile since I've been to the cinema and not felt that I've wasted two hours of my life in fact this film felt particularly short because I was actually entertained for a change.

I was a big fan of the original seeing it as a teenager and didn't know what to expect with this 2nd installment, have to say it was really enjoyable.Likeable cast and decent story catching up with Maverick 30 years later.The action scenes in the first movie were awesome and with the camera tech we have now this movie moves that up another level.The action sequences are absolutely amazing, this movie is a wild ride. I watched it in IMAX and 4Dx and both are highly recommended. So great to see effects that were not all CGI.

reviews.review_title: A truly sad example of the state of today's blockbuster cinema
reviews.content: First, the good things:The runtime is not overly long, compared to the numerous other movies that try to compensate their poor script with a 3 hours runtime.Tom Cruise is great, although lacking chemistry with any of the other co-stars. Never thought I'd give him credit, as I didn't like him as an actor in earlier days; but since Edge of Tomorrow my respect for him grows, due to him being an actor that just delivers regardless of the material he's supposed to work with.The visuals of the dogfights are - expectedly - looking great.And that's it. The story is an absolute bore - just as an example, in the first minutes my girlfriend predicted everything happening (e.g. In the hangar "now he will surely ride on his bike). It delivers all the cheesy tropes of its predecessor and at times feels like it's been a remake and not a sequel.The chemistry of the actors - all the drama is just filler material between the dogfights, and it exactly feels that way.The realism of the main plot is completely absent. From the overall scenario over mission details, to the looks of the SAM batteries which look like how a kid would draw them (on mountain ridges without any nearby radar systems), it's just bad.I won't criticize it as a negative that at times it feels like a promotional movie for the Navy, only because it's exactly following the footsteps of the original flick here.It's sad considering how much budget and hype went into this movie, which, as others put it perfectly, doesn't provide anything memorable a few days after watching it. It's just a complete recycle of the concept of the first movie, with decent visuals and an OK pacing, but the rest is completely unmemorable. Probably the fun is also ruined through the movie taking itself somewhat serious, in contrast to blockbusters like Pacific Rim that deliver exactly the ridiculousness that you would expect from their setup, and are perfect popcorn cinema, with visual grandeur on top.Top Gun Maverick is a bloodless rip-off, which just exists because of it's IMAX visuals, its established name, and the studio's need for moneyprinting. In the end, a real IMAX documentary about fighter pilots, with some Hans Zimmer background music, would have had the same or even better entertainment value.

I'm reading so many articles from the woke media and even DoD/military saying that it's not realistic blah blah blah. It's a MOVIE it's not claiming to be realistic. 90% of the media are looneys and it's fun to see them get so outraged from this Pro America movie. They are not happy unless race sex gender topics are shoved down your throat. This movie was great!!!

reviews.review_title: This Is How Movies Are Made
reviews.content: The last several years have been a disappointment for a lot of movie goers. Felt like movies were being used as another propaganda tool. Storylines had to push an agenda. Made you miss the good old days when the goal was to deliver a product to entertain. Top Gun: Maverick just brought me back to those good old days when I can just sit back and enjoy a movie and boy was this a great one! I suggest you watch the original before seeing this one. It'll make the experience all the better.

reviews.review_title: A blockbuster that lets you breathe
reviews.content: While I never got the chance to see the first top gun in theatres, the sequel delivers on blood rushing thrills that were promised. In addition to this, it delivers something that has but disspeared from modern blockbusters. Giving you time to breathe, Maverick does as such without ever losing your attention and focus. All in all an expectational action blockbuster.
One of the greatest movies to be released in a long time. Excellent production on all fronts. This film is also a perfect sequel so I do suggest to watch the original top gun either before or after.

reviews.review_title: TOP GUN, TOP FUN, TOP WATCH, TOP ENJOYMENT
reviews.content: Lately i rarely gave out high rating to movies, but im so glad i can finally give a 9/10 to this one, because simply its just an awesome movie, cohesive story, breathtaking action fight scenes, if you havent watched this in the movies then you my friend have missed out big time.

We are a family of four, two boys 12 and 15. We were all truly amazed by the perfectness of this film hero movie. Mr. Cruise OWNs the genre. And I must beat the record as I breathed heavily and rapid , laughed out loud, cried, and smirked, smiled, jumped in my seat, whatelse? The movie had it all. What a fantastic movie, best sequel I have seen so far!

reviews.review_title: Top Gun: Maverick (2022) - Talk to me Goose......is it any good.....??
reviews.content: Tom Cruise knows how to make a blockbuster and my hat has been well and truly doffed to someone who is a total and utter master of his trade.Yes you have to park that part of your senses that says "really" because you have to allow a bit of, let's call it poetic license, but it's absolutely 100% worth it.The original was great fun, but the added magic of this sequel, is the fact that it delivers the action you hoped for (and some!) but with some emotional heft as well.It truly does pay proper homage to its predecessor whilst delivering a great action pic and also telling a story that absolutely tracks through from the original.Well worth a watch.

Wow wow wow. This is a movie we've needed for a long time- real, masculine men, no political agendas forced down your throat, no wokery, just a fantastic piece of escapism. Tom Cruise has played a blinder with this one. It's way better than the original and with some surprisingly poignant scenes. I had a smile on my face the whole time. Go see this masterpiece in what filmmaking SHOULD be about- entertainment.

reviews.review_title: Where exactly were the military advisers to point out the obvious flaws?
reviews.content: Nostalgia is awesome and reliving fond memories is always a treat. But a return to 'Top Gun' is just laughable. Have you ever walked into someone house and noticed how everything is pointed at their television? Make the TV Tom Cruise and everything in the house the "supporting cast", and there you have this production. It's unemotionally sad. I don't expect quality from a Jerry Bruckheimer production, and God knows I've never heard of this director, but this was far below the nadir of my expectations. A little reminder, 'Top Gun' was a blockbuster back in its day, but it was never brilliant, edgy, nor even memorable as a good movie. It was a guilty pleasure for the revved up 1980's crowd of excess to feel proud about during the 4th of July. Needless to say, it was a huge action film for anyone chanting "America" at fireworks. The point of its longevity belongs to the gay subtext Quintin Tarantino famously describes. The bashing of how-bad-a-film it was is legendary and continues on several social media sites. Today's tech-savvy sophisticated audience will never believe (reading the 10 star reviews) that this is the "greatest movie ever made". The plot was absolute garbage. It's a script that is pieced together from catchphrases, old panning shots of military aircraft, recycled aerial footage from 'The Transformers', and most notably the 'Star Wars' trench run. Seriously, they took apart the original 'Top Gun' (sans the homoerotic subtext) and pretended it was something fresh for today's audience. We have Pete Mitchell as the oldest test pilot in history still going by the callsign Maverick after 30+ years. The unnamed enemy jets introduced in the last frames because real writers would put production over budget. It's just a gross mischaracterization of entertainment. Where exactly were the military advisers to point out the obvious flaws? In my opinion; this is a film with a lot of cash thrown at it to feed the vanity of someone who can't get enough of themselves. I need not play Devil's Advocate here and point out this film was made to ego-stroke a bad actor who wishes he could be Robert Redford.

reviews.review_title: One of the best films we will experience in our lifetime
reviews.content:
I don't even have words... This breaks the boundaries of what a masterpiece is...
This is simply the best action movie that has ever been made if you talk about the stunts and cinematography... It has completely reimagined how you can make a movie.I'm just completely blown away.And the fact that all flying is done for real and by the actors on screen is just beautifully insane and really makes this a experience you will never forget.And for the love of all things on earth, GIVE YOURSELF A EXPERIENCE OF A LIFETIME AND WATCH THIS IN THE THEATER preferably IMAX as it was shot with those cameras. And also the sound.... I mean you do NOT want to miss that!Well goodbye now, I'm gonna buy myself a home theater to watch this every week for the rest my life.

Long-awaited soaring sequel from Joseph Kosinski with great purposes for its plot and characters. New faces grabbed our attention in both ancienty-inducing moments and emotional sides. Cruise never lose sight of his role as mentor, lover and fighter here.

I was a 15 year old girl when the original film came out, an impressionable teen with a love for science and speed. I went on to do science A-levels, engineering at uni, was sponsored by British Aerospace and began work on anti-g suits, helmets and g-related arm pain for the EAP (development aircraft for the Eurofighter) My friend and I once got chatted up by some guys in Greece who claimed they flew Tornados but when I asked them IDS or ADV they ran away!I also met my now husband at BAE so to say the first film influenced me is putting it mildly. To now be able to tail off this with the current film is a privilege and I loved every second of it. The flight scenes are amazing, the emotional heft is well balanced and whilst the plot is tenuous, it doesn't detract. There is great representation and whether you love fast jets or not, you should go see it!

One of the few movie stars that have still not lost his edge , great movie , you will not regret it , i don't mind watchin it againmy comment is maybe it would've been more intense or more drama if one of the cast had died.

Outstanding.And I don't write that lightly. This film really delivers. I wanted to watch it again immediately.Solid but simple story line.Great cast. Amazing flight sequences. Action. Humour. Sadness. Love.Just a great blockbuster movie . To be honest I've missed this sort of cinematic experience.This all being lead by the unbelievable , incredible Tom Cruise. Who truly puts himself on the line for the film goers. A true artist. One of the last real classic film stars.This film has all that you need. Will it win Oscars? Probably not. But will you get your money worth? Absolutely.In my humble opinion, This is such a better movie than the first, even though I still love that movie.I was gripped within the first opening minutes. My heart did not stop beating at high rates in anticipation of every moment. I was not disappointed. It's been a long long time since I've experienced that rush and enjoyment watching a film.I recommend anyone to go see this film. You will not leave disappointed. ( I hope).

reviews.review_title: Best Movie in a long time
reviews.content: I agree with so many of the reviews here. For me this will be a short review. This movie is the reason to go to the cinema, I simply said when I left the theatre, that was pure fun, and that's what is was, escapism, cinematic genius. More like this please rather than the woke drivel that we have to watch.

reviews.review_title: One of the Nice movie of the year
reviews.content: The story is OK, special effects good, Directorship good.I can recommend this at cinema watch with 8.8/10 and one of the best movies this year.Althpugh not much suspense and ideas ilke sci fi movie but it still catches the audience.

This film gets everything right. Good pacing, great balance of introducing new characters whilst exploring original ones. Miles Teller is great, all the cast are great to be honest. The visuals are stunning and there is a good build up of tension and suspense. All the new characters were enjoyable to watch, and their interactions matched the fun nature of the original. Also, this film packs in some emotional weight which gave it a lot of depth.The plot is fairly simple, but still engaging. Overall, a brilliant sequel that is arguably better than the original. Best film I've been in a long time.

reviews.review_title: Spectacular Action Movie Delivers As Expected
reviews.content: I am not a big action genre fan. I prefer realistic action scenes when they are needed in plot. Such as Heat or TDK. This one is easily the best movie of 2022 so far.Tom Cruise deserves an oscar nomination just because he is killing in those non stunt F-18 scenes. Just wow!Story is formulaic. There are some cliche characters and expected plot twists but acting and chemistery save it all. I can't complain for cliche dramatic character arcs. TopGun Maverick is all about crazy fun and thrilling action.You shouldn't miss this one if you like classics because this one is already a classic! 8/10.

reviews.review_title: Its approachability makes it far superior to the original
reviews.content: The original Top Gun wasn't a movie I enjoyed very much. I have never been fascinated by planes and jets, so watching a movie that existed simply as a way of showing off how cool jets were wasn't enough to do it for me. And that was Top Gun's biggest flaw. The story existed only to tie in the cool jet moments together and served no greater purpose. However, in its sequel almost 30 years later, all its flaws have been rectified.Top Gun Maverick is so much more approachable a film than the original Top Gun simply because there was a story with actual stakes despite the jets and the aviation jargon, that feels universally relatable. We feel the clock ticking and we feel the pressure mounting. And while the jets are still integral to the movie, they no longer feel like an excuse to make a Top Gun movie, but merely tools through which a great story is told. And that's what makes Top Gun Maverick a more enjoyable movie experience.This movie also benefits from being a sequel in that it carries a lot of history and built up conflict that we can immediately recognize, that over the course of the movie are resolved on screen, and resolved well. I had a lot of fun watching this movie, and I think its approachable enough that anyone could go into this move and have a great time!

First off, I have never written a review before, even though I am a huge movie fan and have used IMDB for many years. I HAD to write a review for this movie. So, my teenage girls and I decided to go watch this movie, even though they had never seen the original. So we sat down and put the first Top Gun on. They were laughing and got bored half way through. They said it was super cheesy, which it is, but a classic! So we make our way to the cinema and sit down to what I thought was going to be another cheesefest. Omg, I was soooooo wrong! We were literally on the edge of our seats! It has to be one of the best movies I have seen in YEARS. It was made supremely well. No tacky or silly scenes that were unbelieveable. I can't recommend this movie enough, even to a massive horror fan like myself. Everyone will love it!!

If you are a star wars or mission impossible fan, you will like it.The Death Star will be blown again. The script is very simple... so simple that it hurts... Sometimes you think that you saw these dialogs and scenes in more than 50 movies...
But the sound and images was great, action was intense. There was some jokes that was amusing.Overall, just relax, do not think and enjoy the movie.

The fighter jets were cool. The score very 80s. So was the cheesy story. It's better than the original by far, but it somehow felt dated. This must've felt familiar for older folk, watching Top Gun in theatres while the cold war is raging again. Jennifer Connely is always a pleasure to see though. Don't expect any cinematic highlights, an okay popcorn movie. 6.5/10.

reviews.review_title: Decent blockbuster, 1 point added for nostalgic reasons
reviews.content: See the first top gun movie before watching this one and you'll enjoy the nostalgic flashbacks and use of the original score. The flight action scenes are awesome, and executed well. The inner turmoil of Maverick and the dynamic with Goose's son is done quite well, and I guess there had to be a love interest in the story, although the story could hve done without. If you are a fan of the original movie, you'll love this one. If you are new to Top Gun, it is a decent enough action movie to go see.

I actually don't expect that much from old franchises. But this was good!! Better than expected, a movie like they don't make anymore. Everything was good about it! I was feeling good for 2.11 hours and that's what you go for on a movie.No political messages no wokeness, just a movie with nice characters and a history.. a good one.

reviews.review_title: Flies high above Hollywood storm. Respects viewers. Pays off fans.
reviews.content:
Tom Cruise just solidified his name as one of Hollywood's greatest powerhouse of all time.That is not an exaggeration.Watching top gun Maverick three things bleed through in the finished product:
1. Cruise cares deeply for his characters, scripts, screen play and fan experience
2. He places these standards above profit goals, people pleasing or brown-nosing anybody in Hollywood. His projects command respect and lack preferential treatment
3. If he gives preferential treatment to anybody on his projects, he does it tactfully and under the aforementioned standards. Yes it's possible to draw these conclusions from one film and YES, it's possible to create a diverse, inclusive, nostalgic and moving film that is still exceptionally executed to deliver an effective action movie experience that pays off the promises it makes at the start of the film whilst also rewarding the audience with ample, organic fan-service, Easter eggs, winks and nods, without ever becoming repetitive, predictable or on the nose in the lessons or messages the script brings to the table.Remember Red Dawn? Classic. Exceptional? No. Neither was OG Top Gun.Remember red dawns sequel? Me neither.Remember the Michael Douglas' Wall Street starring Shia Lebooferton? Nah. Creed? The Karate Kid(2011)? The Hobbit? Yeah let's not.They are what happens when you don't put the story first, cast according to social movements and allow a studio to meddle and check their boxes.I don't give away anything in my reviews. So don't expect plot points in this one. What I can say is that I only leave reviews when a film is either exceptional, exceptionally terrible, or so mediocre it catches me off guard. Top Gun Maverick rushes expectations and should be seen in IMAX.Please let your voice be heard when you see films like this. This is what respecting an audience looks like.

reviews.review_title: It's all about flying but it is not the plane
reviews.content: Top Gun came out at a time when smart phones only existed in science fiction and computers were more expensive than cars. Relationships didn't start with swiping right on the screen, and teenagers left hand written notes, not Facebook messages, for those they had a crush on. The world was a very different place without the suffocating abundance of technology.So, what have we got in Top Gun: Maverick? We got drama, we got rivalry, we got romance, we got some funny moments, but above all, we got character. I couldn't help but notice the similarity with the recent Bond movies, where an aging Bond is considered obsolete and to be replaced by technology. In one scene, Tom Cruise's superior tells him Tom wasn't his first choice for the given mission, and he couldn't fathom what Tom might have left to give. Again, I was reminded of a scene from the Dark Knight Rises, when Selina (Catwoman) begs Batman to come with her. She says, you don't owe them (the people of Gotham) anything, you've given them everything. To which, Batman says, not everything, not yet.Tom Cruise was 24 in 1986, and in Top Gun: Maverick, he shows how much he appreciates what we no longer have in the midst of all the things we have. He takes us on a journey on which the things that make us human are on full display. The cinematography is outstanding, the story not outlandish, and although there are a few moments where a willing suspension of disbelief is required, those are precisely what makes the movie stand out from the daily grinds of life. It's about flying, and for a change without a cape, but it's not the plane, it's the pilot.Go watch it; it'll take your breath away.

And the fact that I had goosebumps more than five times in the movie, as a veteran that I was almost brought to tears several times, this movie demands more attention. To say it was awesome is an understatement.

I honestly did not expect the film to be this good. A real emotional adrenaline ride. It was worth waiting 36 years for the sequel to be filmed. Visuals and V/SFX were breathtaking, and the camera work IS EPIC ..

Wow. A proper blockbuster with proper cinematography.Great plot, great acting.Please Hollywood, take note. Haven't been on a high after exiting the cinema for ages, but this was just right.Action, just enough comedy, emotional, enough links to the original for us who saw it the first time to re-play the original soundtrack (which is the only thing better about the first time round).

IT WAS AWESOME!! A direct follow up to the 1st film. The action sequences to the cast from Miles Teller, Jennifer Connelly to Glen Powell & Monica Barbaro was incredible!For Tom Cruise, he has made his iconic character stand the test of time including a bittersweet reunion with Val Kilmer's Iceman that is one for the ages.This film was 2 years worth the wait & the one that is not to be missed.SO GO SEE IT!! You're in for a massive treat!!! 😎🔥🔥10/10!

Even though I was looking forward to this movie, I didn't believe the hype. Hollywood's movies have been disappointing for a while now and I can't remember the last time I saw a movie worth paying for in theaters again. I was happy to be proven wrong.I never leave reviews, but this movie was too good to say nothing. It has everything, and hits all the right notes. The nostalgia, the delivery, the ending... Everything about Top Gun: Maverick made me feel alive, inspired, and brought me back to a place I didn't realize how much I missed. This is the best movie I have seen in years and I felt like I witnessed something historical when I saw it over and over again. Believe the hype.

reviews.review_title: Not possible to make a better action film
reviews.content: Exceptional writing and directing. Nothing original in the plot of course. Borrows a lot from the original obviously and surprisingly a lot from New Hope. Flawless based on what it set out to achieve.

Tom Cruise is getting richly deserved credit for putting this together, but what makes this movie a 10 instead of a 7 for me is the supporting cast. In particular, the crew of Lewis Pullman, "Bob", and Monica Barbaro, "Phoenix". I cared what happened to them and the rest of the crews. Miles Teller was great as Rooster. I could go on and on. It is being covered how amazing the action and nostalgia is, but the casting took it over the top for me.

Great movie, I think Tony Scott would be proud of this sequel.I was 15y when I saw To Gun and 34y later it's still one of my favorites. And I'm not a Cruise fan.Miles Teller is one of my favorite actors and he delivers.P. S. - Don't miss him on The Offer.

reviews.review_title: Adrenaline ride. Not a disappointment. Well worth the wait.
reviews.content: From the opening soundtrack to the undisappointing plot and ending this movie is vivacious, stunningly beautiful and fulfilling in every way. Continuing on from the first installment every respect is given to the story, the theme and the power of this Top Gun franchise.

reviews.review_title: One of the greats for Cinema
reviews.content: This film is one of which must been seen in Cinema. The storyline is good. Visuals, music; very compelling. The blasting surround sound and wide screen makes the experience even more enjoyable. I forgot about life and everything around me for a good 2 hours.

After a long time, your action taste will be satisfied quite well. Tom is amazing and admirable at this age: full of energy and inspiring.My first feeling was a wish for the world without any conflict among politicians who sacrifice lots of lives for their own greed.However, as they say, cinema is a lie and in this movie, it is for expressing some dreamy attack to a country that doesn't have Alaskan landscapes esp. Near the sea or oceans.They, like in Vietnam,etc., want to persuade the audience on their country's fake right to invade other countries.They have spent a lot of time and energy to make it one the bests but if they had confessed on the idea from The H-3 airstrike 1981, they could claim it is based on a true story. Yes. In reality, genius and courageous Iranian pilots did it with bare hands but faithful hearts to truly defend the oppressed ones.

reviews.review_title: Thank you for bringing back Top Gun!
reviews.content: I saw this movie yesterday and I can't stop thinking about it. I thought the original Top Gun was a great movie and it was a big surprise that 35+ years later, a sequel was made.The sequel is based on the original Top Gun and takes the movie to new levels that are astonishing in many different ways. Obviously, the action scenes are completely amazing. Beyond that, this is a movie very much about relationships. Relationships about teams and relationships focusing on 1-1 dynamics. Painful history with a lot of hope and suspense to see how it unfolds.In the end, the most significant aspect of this movie is Tom Cruise's performance. He truly inhabits the character Maverick. Tom Cruise is one of the best actors of the 20th and 21st century and he proves it again and again in this movie.Hint: Watch/Re-watch the original Top Gun, then run out to see this movie.

reviews.review_title: Very good film from start to finish.
reviews.content: Great film from start to finish. This was an outstanding sequel to the original which fits very well. Good story and good connection with backstory. No special interest agendas other than overt pro US Navy theme. Thanks to all US service men and women. Very refreshing and devoid of controversial topics allowing one to truly get lost in the film. There was one aspect of the mission in the film that could be considered reminiscent of the original Star Wars plot. I don't know if that was intentional or coincidence, but I was a little put off by it; otherwise, I would have given it 10 stars.

FINALLY! A great movie! I felt like I was back in the 90's where movies focused on a great story, great score, great acting, great casting, great FX. This had it all! Oh and did I mention there is no wokeness that is incessantly pushed by Hollywood? What a breath of fresh air. I like the first one but found this one to be even better. If you can see it in IMAX do it! Such a treat. Great movie. 10!

It is a cinematic piece of art. It is a tribute the original. It's funny and it's a great story. What i felt it lacked was a real development of the characters. I wanted to know more about Rooster. I wanted more backstory of Penny Benjamin. The love story wasn't believable for me. They have chemistry and she looks fantastic, but there just wasn't time in the movie to really build that past making their relationship now meaningful.

reviews.review_title: A perfect, edge of the seat action film.
reviews.content: Is it the best film ever? Probably not but that is not why I scored this a 10. It is simply put an outstandingly excellent experience that needs to be seen the first time in the cinema.For those 1 star reviews criticising the perceived pro USA stance and the like try and put that to one side. It is hardly the most bloodthirsty flag waving jingoistic film ever made. I have seen it twice now and have seen the original Top Gun several times. The performances and emotions displayed by Tom Cruise especially are subtle but importantly what I would expect a man to act like after several decades in the military. His performance underlined the emotions and losses that occur over time to those that serve. Still confident and determined but appreciative of the "dying of the light" that comes with age.Even the hot shot younger pilots in this are not obnoxious and the direction I felt was excellent reflecting the carefree youthfulness whilst also considered in the possibility of such a fraught mission being their last.I will own this on DVD when it gets there. Watch it, enjoy it and be glad it was delayed on its release as it was worth the wait.

This is one of the rare cases that a sequel is better than the original. Maverick absolutely blows away the original. The story has much more depth. The acting is better overall. The flight scenes are insane. Great diversity in the cast. I did not expect to enjoy this movie as much as I did. Most of these nostalgia films have no business existing, but this one actually justifies itself well.
Loved every minute of it! Hopefully this movie will kickstart good movies coming back to theaters. All star team of actors and actresses led by the 🐐 Tom Cruise.

reviews.review_title: One of ther few plane action movies I love
reviews.content: This is one of my few airplane action movies I saw. An epic, spectacular, awesome movie. Way better than its predecessor from 1986. Awesome acting, amazingly made with real jets.Absolute recommend!!
Amazing camera work and one of the best of Tom Cruise film. Now in my Fav List. Best action film. Best Story and best in all other aspects. Strongly recommended to everyone.

Recently rewatched the original Top Gun and it is as good as it was 25 years ago. A classic. So I don't expect a lot from Top Gun: Maverick as most sequel tend to disappoint. Boy, was it wrong. It is better than the original.The storyline is straightforward, bringing Maverick back to train the young Guns for a difficult or impossible mission. You have the typical competition among the team and so on.The flying scenes are incredibly well done, the IMAX clarify, the sound, the cut on/off the aircraft carrier, low flying over the desert, ocean, and mountain terrain are superbly done.What make this Top Gun better than the original is the human element of it. The Ice Man (Val Kilmer) scene is sad and emotional. I teared up watching it. And the relationship with Rooster (Goose's son) is a big part of the story. Lastly, I find his relationship with Penny is loving and genuine. It is funny to see Maverick doesn't know how to sail as a Navy man. It makes Maverick a human. Plus the fact Penny has a teenage daughter give us a view what Maverick life will be like after retirement.All in all, a great movies in my book. The fighter jet and boy-boy scenes are to be expected. But seeing Val Kilmer plays Ice Man one more time is priceless life. And see Maverick's life to be give me a lot of peace and closure of a beautiful ending of this beautiful story.

reviews.review_title: I can't believe I enjoyed it
reviews.content: This movie is soooo cheesy. I was on board an aircraft carrier 2 years after the original, and we used to make fun of that movie so much. I mean we liked it but the original was only fairly cheesy. This sequel is dripping with cheese.Normally, I can't stand movies like this. I can't stand when a movie is so cheeseball that predictions are easily made. But even though I knew "hangman" was going to save "maverick" and "rooster" at least 5 minutes before he did so, the scene still inspired a tear out of my eye.I am at a loss for why I enjoyed it... But I did.

A poorly constructed rerun of the original Top Gun. There is romance here but 0 chemistry. It starts of in a promising fashion with a very high tech piece of aircraft with all the advanced avionics but soon puts the characters back in the ancient F-14 that were in the original, with the advanced aircraft never to be seen again. Tom Cruise's Maverick is a spoiled brat who disposes off expensive equipment as if they were toys at the expense of the hard working tax payer.

Over that last 5 or so years hollywood has produced few decent films. Even the decent ones are full of intersectional politics and enforced diversity/inclusion. What we have here is a great film which is naturally diverse and inclusive due to great writing. I'm not a Tom Cruise fan, but damn he knocked its out of the park. He plays the part well and the story doesn't feel forced. I enjoyed it enough to go back and watch it again. Definitely worth a 9 out of 10.

reviews.review_title: Love it or you're brain dead
reviews.content: This movie is fantastic. There's no other way to say it. The story is good, the action is spectacular. Makes you feel great to be an American. The use of US and foreign jets is phenomenal.

The film has a very beautiful story and the performance of the actors is amazing. The duration of the film is two hours, but when you watch it, you really do not feel the time. It's one of the best movies I've seen.

This was simply amazing. Pure entertainment , no more or less.. Loved it...Writing was in top and acting and characters. Loved the action .. It has been over 30 years and no one really asked for this so it was a big and great surprise it came...

The original "Top Gun" was my "famous movie I never saw" until recently, and It was pretty average when I finally saw it. Meaning this new one was likely to be superior, and it more than is.The main appeal of the movie is the flying and stunt work which is as amazing as you'd expect from Tom Cruise since his mission impossible movies. But the story is also better. I couldn't get into the Maverick vs Iceman stuff or the love story of the original. But the redemption story here works so much better.There's a great cast and the movie plays on your expectations while there are also touching and funny moments reflecting the original. I thought the original felt half done, but this one piles on the action and is edge of your seat stuff. Even if you weren't a fan the 80's nostalgia here should win you over.Cruise gives the audience what they want and delivers something you can't really get anywhere else these days of too much CGI. Meaning you should definitely check this out on the big screen.

All action, all testosterone, no woke. I'm surprised to see Holloywood can still make movies. I'd given up on that. Cruise is looking a little long in the tooth but the entire adventure works brilliantly. I will actually pay to see this againThank God for that.

Bathed in the glow of a setting sun every cast member can show of their perfect - and extremely white - teeth and clench their jaws in perfect harmonious tension.Because can this be done? Nobody knows. Except Tom Cruise off course.Plot doesn't make sense but who cares.It's the perfect summer blockbuster with a nice mix of nostalgia and groundbreaking cinematography.
Waiting 35 years for part 2? Not a huge TC fan but I have to give it to him he does know how to put a great movie together.Highly recommend this NON WOKE movie.It's just so good...

reviews.review_title: Funny, thrilling, entertaining, and above all nostalgic.
reviews.content:
Top Gun: Maverick not only pulled off the rare task of surpassing the original film, but it did so in beyond epic fashion. From the storytellingto the actors. From the camera work to the music, and even the comedic moments were on point.Everything fit in perfectly and far better than in the 1986 film (in my opinion). Gave me a series of thrills that I don't often feel while watching a movie. And it is for that, that I must proclaim this as easily among my favorite movies ever, and despite it just being July, I am calling it right now for this to be the film of the year.Love him or hate him, Tom Cruise certainly
knows how to put on a good movie.

Jerry Bruckheimer, Tom Cruise, and other cast & crew of this movie did an amazing job. I believe this movie can satisfied most of Top Gun (1986) fans, although the fabs have to wait for 36 years for the sequel.Actually, what really amazed me is not the story of this movie, but the production of this movie. Knowing that all fighter pilot cast had a real experiences to flew in the real fighter jets are wonderful. This movie has its own style and values when no other movie can give those kind of experiences for the cast and crews.It's just I still wonder about who are the enemies in this movie. Is there any kind of separatist or terrorist who owns a F-18 Jets, SAM Sites and Bunkers just like in this movie? It would be really threatening if they have kind of these facilities. If US Naval pilots really infiltrated the enemy's territory and blow up their missile facilities, I believe it will caused more problems to the US as a country and it can be a national issue, not to mentioned to plan and carry out the mission will required an executive decision, from POTUS, which in this movie were no dialog or lines that mentioned about this mission was approved by the president.

reviews.review_title: WOW!!!Tom Cruise has reached MASTER status in his craft
reviews.content: I remember when it started to buzz around the internet that it was going into production. That was 2 years ago at least. I knew it was going to be good but I never thought it would be sooooooo good i want to watch the original again to go and watch the sequel again. The line in mens bathroom was a 10 minute wait after the end credits.

reviews.review_title: This review is not your typical pretentious/critical review and it is written straight after watching Top Gun Maverick...
reviews.content: First things first. I don't know if we have anyone as awesome as Tom Cruise in Hollywood. He is badass. He delivered. He's a superstar. Did somebody say he's 60!?!Top Gun Maverick is supersonic. You can't get bored watching it, you'll have your mouth gaping open one minute and will be crying real tears the next. This movie is everything I remember movies were in my childhood/adolescence: the actors were heroes, the action felt real, the effects were not CGI overload, and music was just right. Top Gun Maverick delivers in every aspect, actors are awesome all of them filled in their parts so well, the excitement is there, magnificent stunning flight sequences, flawless directing, fun, camaraderie, jokes, breathtaking visuals. I absolutely loved this movie, it's up there with the best of the best in action genre. I'm not sure they can ever top it with another Top Gun but I think they shouldn't even try. Just leave it as intended an homage to the directing of the past, where action and fun were more important than compromising with political correctness police. This movie is raw, as in didn't feel like they tried to social engineer the audience, you get what you see. It's entertainment at its best. I won't get into details, reveal what the movie is about all I will say is - just watch it. 10/10 absolutely.

In these rather somber and worrying times, what better than to resurrect a hit formula from the 1980s? In fact, this 'sequel' to one of that decades biggest hits outdoes its predecessor massively in every respect, however, it still feels oddly stuck in that previous and perhaps more reliable era. The plus points here are the aerial sequences, which are stunningly well done, a coherent plot and a good cast, including Tom Cruise as good as before, and its also a film that doesn't take itself too seriously. Yes, there are some obvious cliches, but this is solid big screen feel good entertainment.

Well it's been a long time coming.Not just the time between Top Gun and Maverick, but in the fact it was on hold until after the pandemic.But it's been well worth the wait.The entire movie wasn't just a trip down memory lane, it's an incredible, seat of your pants, non stop action movie.

reviews.review_title: A very well-made blockbuster, it's the most realistic air force movie I've seen
reviews.content: This movie is a masterpiece. I'm not a big fan of millitary movie but I can't get my eyes out of this for a second, espesically, I gotta hold my breath many times in the last 30 minutes of the film. This one is so realistic, they consider many key features when flying in those "supersonic" aircrafts: the G-force, the safety distance from ground (I don't remember the term for it), the speed, the mental and physical health of the pilots, etc. In here, I feel like I'm actually living the movie. If you still doubt what I see, just watch it. You'll know what I mean.Besides all of that, the number one thing to success in every mission is the bond between team members, even the most arrogant guy will become the most helpful guy because they have one goal, one mission. Just watch it, you'll thank me later.Enjoy!!

Top Gun: Maverick is a flawed improvement. Its story is straightforward, which works. Maverick has one last mission, his relationship with Goose's son is complex, and his romance has baggage. None of this is inventive, but it's enough to fuel the climax. However, Top Gun: Maverick changes paths and loses steam. A dramatic peak is nicely set up, yet the film backtracks on that, introducing a new layer to the mission. This second climax is action-packed, but also fatiguing and muddied. Had Top Gun: Maverick kept its bittersweet climax, it would've been more meaningful. Instead, its emotional mediocrity feels like a missed opportunity.Meanwhile, Top Gun: Maverick has solid filmmaking. First, visuals are polished (utilizing focus, lighting, and mounts), acting meets the material, and the tone is clear. The soundtrack balances nostalgia, and the production is authentic. Plus, the editing employs montages, dissolves, and energetic action. Next, the sound design mirrors emotions, using symbolic echoes, silence, and J-cuts. Finally, the effects are the star of Top Gun: Maverick because its stunts are impossibly real. Overall, Top Gun: Maverick advances its drama and thrills, but still lacks a core message. Unfortunately, without a conscious theme, it feels like war glorification.Writing: 5/10
Direction: 6/10
Cinematography: 7/10
Acting: 7/10
Editing: 8/10
Sound: 9/10
Score/Soundtrack: 8/10
Production Design: 8/10
Casting: 8/10
Effects: 10/10Overall Score: 7.6/10.

This is a phenomenal sequel and exactly the kind of summer blockbuster we needed! It paid homage to the original characters, it introduced new ones, gave you an adrenaline rush, and brought true emotions into play. Thank you to the cast, directors, and everyone else who helped get this made. Also - the first 30 seconds were classy and say a lot about the actor.

reviews.review_title: Original didn't blow me away but this one did
reviews.content: I honestly wasn't a big fan of the original movie and many might just disregard my opinion on that alone. However I thought this one was incredible, it had stakes that meant something to me, characters that felt real, and stunts/effects that I think set new bars for action films to come. There were exaggerations and the penny storyline felt added just to make us care more about maverick making it back but beyond those minor gripes I loved it. Highly recommend seeing this one on the big screen where the audio of the jets really feel like they're coming above and beside the audience. I personally haven't been to a theater in years and really didn't care to go again but I'm really happy I did.

reviews.review_title: Probably the best movie of the year
reviews.content: I have seen it twice and I would see it again. You need to go to the cinema to see it. Tom Cruise has outdone himself. This movie single handedly restored my faith in the cinematic experience. It's rare that a sequel surpasses it's predecessor, but this one surely did.

reviews.review_title: Not as good as they say it is
reviews.content: I have seen better, is better than the first movie, but is not great, its merit is that it is not a woke film which draws audiences by the millions, considering no one wants to pay money just to watch the next feminist's sheet telling you how bad you are, even the first ironman was better than this I am glad I didn't saw it at the movies, the good thing is the action, at least this time Maverick has to survive on the enemy grounds.Definitely, Behind the Enemy Lines 2002, without all that weird photograph was better, perhaps Top Gun Maverick needed more development to be better, with better characters, and a deeper story.

The movie is a thrill ride from start to finish.lt has great character who you immediately fall in love(Even Hangman 😂). Tom cruise brings out one if his best performance as an actor. His chemistry with Miles Teller and Jennifer Connelly is spot on .Hands down this is by far the best movie of the year. This needs to be watched on the biggest,loudest screen. Oh and the third act was just jaw dropping, a true masterpiece which gives you all the thrills and edge of the seat action. The scene where maverick meets Iceman was just so emotional that it really got me and I was quite surprised that I cried.
What a great movie, even when I had glinches from the 1st one (not neccessary thou). Great story. Tom Cruise, the last one of the movie super stars. In the era of superhéroes, Tom makes his way.

They somehow made a movie, a sequel to a 36-year old film mind you, that was consistently amazing and fun! The film is packed with real stunts, fantastic writing, great dialogue, and no "cheap" moments. If I said anything else, I'd spoil the movie. Get some friends, eat some popcorn, sit back and watch one of the greatest films of the 21st century.
Amazing movie. It had a few slow parts, but for the most part it was an excellent film. It really feels like you're flying in the jets. Great film! Love Tom Cruise!

Do yourself a favor and watch Top Gun again, or for the first time, which will tie up very smartly for this movie. The adventure in the first movie continues in this fast moving action-packed plot, making this film superior, knowing the background of the characters and enhances the enjoyment. A thrilling experience to be consumed, which in my books is the second movie earning 10 stars for this reason.

Whoa.I'm a big TC guy. Everything he does is entertaining, top line and worthy. Even during his couch jumping phase, he still put out rock solid films.TG: Maverick was a roller coaster. The nostalgia, the flight scenes, the emotion. A work of cinematic art. Edge of your seat stuff.The scene with Val and TC was the best in the film. It was emotional and real. Such a beautiful moment.

reviews.review_title: Quite literally one of the worst films... ever
reviews.content: I don't understand how this movie is highly rated. Not only was the dialogue so cringe that it caused physical pain, but the realism (which is a selling point of the movie, straight from the mouth of Tom Cruise) was hilariously absurd. If you understand nothing of aviation and enjoy "Murica, best ever!!!! F-14 can take down Su-57!!!!!," then this is a wonderful film. If, however, your brain is fully developed, it is awful.My friend wanted to leave 30 minutes in.

reviews.review_title: It is a veritable mix of nostalgia and refreshing sequel take
reviews.content:
I was really apprehensive about this movie. I mean how do you too what was an entertaining movie back in '86? The story was straightforward and honest about what it was.After watching this movie, the first thing I liked about was pacing. The movie was very careful linking the first movie and the references contained therein. The second thing are storylines were intertwined very well without becoming convoluted and just ridiculous. I thought the cinematography was very good and allowing the audience feel like they were in the cockpit with Tom and the view was outstanding. Another thing I especially enjoyed was the main plot of the movie. You could consider the movie formulaic but it worked here. The esthetics of the movie were spot on and easy on the eyes
Now the content of the movie was a tearjerker and pulled at my heart strings. The movie was a continuation of the first one but was darker on a lot of levels. First Mitchell was an old man. He obviously still maintained his rebellious streak that cost him his job at Top Gun thus directly affected his relationship with Charlie from the first movie. He knew he was coming to end of the road and faced the realization time catches everyone including Capt Pete Mitchell. The movie was deliberate in providing clues of Mitchell's old age. The calendar with his appointment in telemetry a day before flying his experimental plane.Another good thing was Mitchell's conflict with getting away with stuff because Iceman had his back. Iceman was promoted and looked after Mitchell like an older brother who understood him and his need for speed. Another point to add another layer of depth to Mitchell's character was the realization that he was no teacher. He decided at one point in the movie to give a graduate level training and those "top of their classes" weren't as good.I looked at the movie as though it was me. Not because of the stunts Pete has pulled at work but I, just as Maverick did, know things are changing and they will pass us by. The thing we can do is to pass on what we know and guide those younger than us. I really loved the movie but on another level it was a reminder that our movie "heroes" get old and we get old. It forces us to realize our own morality.

First I'd like to say I like Tom cruise films.and this OK,then is great.but predictable. The plot holes annoyed me. The total lack of discipline of the flyers is not realistic of the best the navy has to offer. The love interest was two dimensional and unnecessary. The young flyers would all know who maverick was.The flying scenes were good and having val killer in the film despite his I'll health in reality. But the main story was a bit odd. Who was the enemy. How did they not notice a aircraft carrier off the coast. Or four fighter planes racing towards their target. And the helicopter shooting at maverick why? They would want to capture him and interrogate him. Ludicrous. I give this 6 for the flying scenes. I enjoyed it a bit.but don't want to see it again.

My husband and I watched the first Top Gun and really enjoyed it, we heard great things about Top Gun: Maverick but had no idea what to expect and wow just WOW our non existent expectations were over the moon exceeded! We love that they stayed with the same cinematography as the first one. The movie was just perfect and entertaining as hell! I haven't watched a movie that made me feel good and happy cry in a long time. It's my moms favorite movie and now it's our favorite movie and this movie will always be a part of all us for a very long time. If you haven't watched it, I mean look at the other reviews, it's very rare when a sequel comes out after 36 years to be this great! WATCH IT!

Great movie. Great script, emotional, great special effects. Above and beyond.Tom Cruise best movie ever. Now it made more than 1 billion dollars. Everyone that I know loves this move. I expect this movie since 2019 when they were still filming. So after 3 years is worthy.

reviews.review_title: Last act of Star Wars: a New Hope!! almost shot for shot/word for word!!!
reviews.content:
Seriously guys!?! This was the best you could come up with, literally click, drag and drop the last act of SW a new hope!!??!!THE EXHAUST SHAFT FOR THE UNDERGROUND URANIUM PLANT (THATS BUILT INSIDE A STEEP CRATER) JUST SO HAPPENS TO BE ANGLED PERFECTLY IN THE DIRECTION OF THE TRENCH SO A JET CAN FIRE A MISSLE INTO IT!OMG HAHAHA PARODY 'HOT SHOTS' LEVEL WRITING GUYS!!Seriously face-palm inducing cheese in the script and dialogue.They kept cutting to the 'go pro' camera angles inside the jets to sell the whole 'this was filmed for real!'. Was jarring and pulled you out of the story.ONLY POSITIVE POINTS:
1. Great (meaningless but very cool) cinematic jet fighter action if you're in the mood for it.2. Tom (the Legend) Cruise is in it.

Top Gun: Maverick ticks every box... it delivers a long belated sequel which captures the nostalgia of the first whilst giving fans something so wonderfully new. The chemistry between the leads is outstanding, and anchored by a standout performance by Tom Cruise, this movie was a smash hit. Get to the cinema to see this one... it is sure to be a great time.

I'm not sure what movie others were watching but this is not even close to bettering the original. It lacks the soul of the original. From the
one liners that people still remember today the cast of over the top egotistical characters who are larger than life. The great soundtrack that strikes up at the right time. This movie has none of it. It try's to ride on the coat tails of nostalgia and falls flat. It won't take your breath away. Infact if anything it's lost that loving feeling.

It has been quite some time since I've seen such a gripping entertaining movie, and I go to the cinema quite a lot. This movie was enthralling from beginning to end. Heart pounding. I had to remember to breathe. Great acting, exceptional story line and totally engaging from start to finish. Definitely no falling asleep during this film. Hope they make another one .

reviews.review_title: Incredibly well shot plane action scenes
reviews.content: But the training was more dangerous than the actual mission? Clearly no one was prepared for it in training and everything just goes smoothly in the actual mission. It ruined the movie. I think its an insult to the people who worked on the visuals and action parts of the movie. All those beautiful realistic plane scenes ruined by forced happy blockbuster situations.

reviews.review_title: Finally a good action entertainer from Tom Cruise
reviews.content: Just watch it. Don't apply too much login and mind. It's an out-and-out entertaining movie. As expected Cruise outshines everyone. Visuals we're really good.

To me, the amount of effort, intelligence, and heart put into the making of this movie was evident from the beginning to the end. As one of those who stood in line to watch Top Gun when it came out back in 1986, the stakes were clearly high. So many sequels are made that do not quite capture the magic of the first one so, although I was excited to see this trailer, I will admit I did brace myself for disappointment. I have never been more pleased to stand corrected. Easter eggs all over the place. Appropriate homage made to the original, with improvements to really showcase actual flying. I can only begin to imagine the amount of preparation and creative out of the box thinking it took to accomplish this. Watching this with knowlege that there was limited CGI kept me awestruck, engaged, and impressed the entire time. Story line was great - some things predictable but in a good way as it was the only smart way to move the story forward appropriately to make sense. I highly suggest watching the first Top Gun again closely before seeing this to refamiliarize or familiarize yourself with details and story line, give yourself the chance to catch on to those easter eggs, and allow yourselves to join us in what we have known for over 30 years - Top Gun is iconic for a reason and this sequel story needed to be told. All of this together made for a wonderful movie experience - I saw and appreciated all of it. Was it worth the wait? Goodness, Gracious Great Balls of Fire, Hell Yes.

reviews.review_title: If you want a carbon copy of the first film....
reviews.content: ...together with slightly better aerobatics, no real character development, parallel plot lines, no real love story or anything of substance other than the TC show, then it's fine.It's mostly fine for nostalgia and that's it.As a stand-alone film it's nothing more than okay.It gets a 6 just cos it has enough wow factor but I am being generous. I probably won't watch it again.

reviews.review_title: My new favorite movie of all time!
reviews.content: I loved the original, but somehow Maverick surpassed it by far! I legitimately can't think of a single thing the this movie missed on! So yourself a favor and watch it on the big screen! It's definitely worth it!

This was so well done! Such a blast to watch in the theater. I don't want to spoil anything but it does a fantastic job with balancing callbacks to the original and introducing new characters and emotions to the story. It's a straight-forward story but so well executed! See it in a theater if you can! Also, the soundtrack has all the feels. It was updated well but still retains the old Top Gun theme.

A common template, patriotic soldiers having to risk their lives for an impossible mission. We've seen this before in many movies. But not many of them actually get it right. Everything in this movie is done right.This story is more than about completing the mission. This movie has a deeper meaning. What?Find out,
strongly recommended to see in theatre.

I watch this on a random whim after watching the first one the night before. I wasn't expecting much but I was expecting a lot. This is a must see in theaters, it is amazing. Just the sound quality and videography of the planes is amazballz! It's true to the character and story arc of the first movie!There are a few contextual and factual errors in the movie but no need to ruin an excellent movie.

I thought the movie was outstanding in displaying how far technology in cinema has come in 36 years. I felt like I was in the F-16 with the pilots stunning and adrenalizing! For those who have seen Top Gun part 1, we knew how the storyline would go in Top Gun: Maverick to a degree of a mission and a bit of romance I was not disappointed with touches of the nostalgia from Top Gun part 1. The movie soundtrack is impressive as well! 110% all around for everyone involved. Bravo! ( WELL WORTH THE WAIT! )

I expected this movie to be good, but not this good. It was so well done that I didn't want it to end. This was such a balanced film. It had the perfect amount of drama, comedy, romance and action. It really did the original justice. The action scenes were unreal! Definitely check it out on the big screen.

You must go and see this at the cinema!Maverick ticked all the boxes, the cast and crew absolutely nailed it and it's probably the best sequel I've ever seen!Tom knows his audience and doesn't disappoint! I liked how Maverick reminds the audience of the original, the wait and nostalgia are off the scale here.From the moment the film starts until the closing credits you are taken on a fast paced journey that gives you a back seat swirling cockpit view which at times, had me clinging onto my seat! Some of the scenes and roar of the engines are worth the price of admission alone!There maybe some who may say the plot or occasional dialogue are a little 'off the mark', personally, it's everything I wanted it to be, and more!Maverick sets a very high standard here, and shows how a sequel should be done, taking the viewer to a place that lets us forget, for a couple of hours, all the mayhem in todays world.Give yourself a break, an easy watch and a truly thrilling ride!

reviews.review_title: Gritty, realistic and best REAL action scenes
reviews.content: The movie was built around the real planes, real flying action, filmed with real Gs. Beautify storyline and Tom Cruise played it so convincingly. The pain in his eyes, the cast's energy and well paced story telling.My whole family enjoyed and my kids asked me to bring to back to watch again! Never happened with any other movie, ever! Made me so proud.

This movie delivered on everything you want in a movie. It didn't try to be the original, but homaged it perfectly. It never dwelled. Never tried to be more than it was, and in doing so it surpassed what I was allowed to ask for in a movie! Can't wait too see it again!

Boring, full of cliches, predictable plot and every dialogue in it.Heard so many good reviews on this film and was disappointed to see what I saw. Nothing new. Pure American action film full of repeats you have seen and heard a thousand times before. Typical American movie for typical American movie lover. Literally nothing more to say here.I adore Tom Cruise as a man. I wish I could do what he is doing in his years...
The only new thing it's a Tom Cruise in a fighter. If you are a fan of planes or like to play some War Thunder - this movie is a must for you. Other than that - skip for your own good.

The amount of goosebumps I had while watching this!What an amazing movie! Great acting, great writing... I can't tell you a bad thing about this. It's better than original imoz Just watch it if you haven't already!!!Action movie in a form it should be. We've lost movies like this, thank you for bringing it back! Tom Cruise proved once again why is he our favorite action movie hero since forever.Love casting... Well everything about this.WHAT A RIDE!!!P. S. Best movie since A quiet place.

reviews.review_title: Better Than the Original Top Gun
reviews.content: As usual Tom Cruise is always at his best in what he is supposed to deliver as a lead actor in any movie offered to him. It is so unbelievable that even at 59 he looks hell young as someone of 45 years, or even lesser. His down to earth attitude with a smart personality is always a winning point.For those who haven't watched 1986's masterpiece and original Top Gun, I strongly advise you to watch it, because it has emotional and eventual connection with this sequel. Val Kilmer's short yet impactful role of Admiral Iceman, now a sufferer of throat cancer, shares emotional bonding with Pete in a part. Role of young pilot trainees and graduates played by Miles Teller, Glenn Powell and Monica Barbaro are outstanding and performed exceptionally brilliant.Last but not the least, Jennifer Connelly deserves a strong applaud for her performance as Pete's new love interest Penelope and a single mother. Her presence alongside Tom adds a slight comfort and helps in moving the story forward.Overall, this one is a highly recommendable sequel and more powerful than the original.

To be honest, this is not a difficult sequel to be filmed. Prepare a cool air force mission, add a bit of nostalgia, some teaspoons of dalliance, bromance, inheritance, and sprinkle the whole thing with naked Tom Cruise - there you have it, Top Gun: Maverick.The action scenes are sublime, whether stunts, cinematography, or pacing, all flawless. With spot-on camera work, every turn and climb of the planes tightly steers the audience's heart. On top of that, Tom Cruise utilizes his Mission-Impossible-ish valor to further increase the intensity, making every gunshot more soul-stirring, and every cheer more convincing. Also used in the prequel, the golden color layout provides reminiscence and warmth, which contrasts directly with the white snow of the final battle. Just for the bombards and dogfight, the movie is at its summit.However, despite the hot-bloodedness, there are a few confusing aspects. Penny was never introduced in the prequel, nor is she relevant to the Top Gun community before Pete's arrival, making her existence serve nothing but a scripted, unnecessary relationship. Furthermore, the last part when the protagonists steal enemy aircraft is just too dramatic to be real.Other than these minor issues, the film is spotless. Distinct two-line narrative, solid storyline, and perfect display of air fights that excel the prequel. Definitely an ideal sequel.

This is the kind of film that will save the movies. And that will save the movie studios from themselves.Can't wait to show my whole family. This was so much fun. It was just fun and fast and cheesy but in a good way. Everyone was hot and the music was nice.Lady gaga song was a let down but still got some of the original soundtracks.Had fun, would and will see again.

Didn't want to see it. Now one of my favorite movies I've ever seen. The best opening to a movie, I was speechless. I don't know if it's just me but Tom Cruise did one of his best performances. I have so much more respect for fighter pilots. It was really neat to see how aircraft carriers launch and land these jets... Just amazing. I can't wait to watch it again when it's available. Best movie I've seen in a while !!

reviews.review_title: Flying quickly to the top of 2022
reviews.content: If you enjoyed the first one, you will have no issue loving the sequel. Great acting throughout by the whole cast and nail biting action that will keep you puckered tight and on the edge of your seat.Would highly recommend as this must be the best cinema for 2022 so far.

This is another attempt to "remake" a classic movie. Pure BS. Hollywood is brain dead, nothing original, just remakes. This movie is nothing but feel good BS. In this movie there are so many highly unlikely scenarios it is an insult to anyone with an IQ over 75. It is a cross between a flashback and wishful thinking. The characters are 30 years Maverick's junior and are testosterone jocks who play games with one another. They may be serious pilots but act like juveniles. All uniforms are ridiculously tight, no uniform fits like a glove on people of different body shapes. The flying parts are okay but lack originality. Nothing but car chases with airplanes. Although it contains some "entertainment" value, generally IMHO it isn't worth the time to watch. I think watching paint dry or the grass grow has about the same value. The original movie was okay, but this is an insult to that movie. This reminds me of the Rocky or Rambo movies. Remake after remake. After the first iteration, the remakes are disappointing. Same here.

reviews.review_title: lacklustred re-hash. Last 25% saves it from disaster
reviews.content: Doesn't bring anything new to the table: stars are 2 old now; the only music tracks which are good, were stolen from original; doesn't pull of the romantic or buddy elements, which made the original such a much loved movie; rivalry between Cruise & Kilmer is absent with little to replace it; doesn't have as good a script as original, which had some memorable one liners; Ed Harris is generally wasted and its more of a cameo. The last 36 min is ok action though, and you get an idea how the technologies have advanced. It is hard to see how audiences rate this as a superior movie to original. Both are propaganda movies, and I certainly feel the only reason the movie was made 35 years later, is due to rising military tension. For nostalgia purposes, sure, give it a watch.

reviews.review_title: One of the best films I've seen in years!
reviews.content: Top gun Maverick was amazing. The movie hit on all cylinders from emotion, nostalgia to excitement I was clapping one minute and crying another. One of the best I've seen in many years highly recommend it.

reviews.review_title: Will appeal to those with memories of the original , but may leave others feeling hollow
reviews.content: STAR RATING: ***** Brilliant **** Very Good *** Okay ** Poor * AwfulCaptain Pete 'Maverick' Mitchell (Tom Cruise) defies his superior's orders during a test flight, and breaks the sound barrier flying at super sonic speeds. Despite his recklessness, those same superiors decide he's the best man to train a group of best-of-the-best fighter pilots who've graduated from the legendary 'Top Gun' Academy, in a mission to take out a uranium plant in an Iranian oilfield . Along the way, Mitchell reunites with faces from his past, including ailing former rival Admiral Tom 'Iceman' Kazinsky (Val Kilmer) and former love Penny (Jennifer Connolly), while clashing with Lt. Bradshaw (Miles Teller), upon whom he honours the memory of a fallen comrade.Even before the time of COVID and the current cost of living crisis, before cinema chains had to recoup their losses in a big way, the industry never broke out of the recessionary mindset and were only willing to take a chance on 'sure things.' And so sequels to long dormant franchises remained the order of the day. All the same, the producers of Top Gun: Maverick were still taking a massive gamble, getting behind a sequel to a thirty six year old film that has more miles on its clock than most of the modern cinema demographic. However ingrained it may remain in the pop culture sphere, if a guy my age approaching forty has never actually seen the original, a younger generation would be even less likely to have had it cross their radar. Nevertheless, the film has still broken box office records, emerging as the highest grossing film of the year so far, owing in no small part to a massive publicity campaign on TV and in the media. And you can't argue with success.It certainly hits every mark on authenticity, with lead star Cruise reportedly insisting (and paying for) all of the younger cast members to train with real life US fighter pilots to ensure a degree of accuracy on screen, which pays off. It recreates a sense of 80's style as well, that original director Tony Scott magnified from all of his films (this is meant as a tribute to him), especially the sense of glorified machismo from that time. The big problem, especially for a film stretching over the two hour mark, is that it's largely been designed to cater to fans of the original, from the soundtrack (minus, oddly, Berlin's Take My Breath Away) to the nods to the original, which, not having seen it, were lost on me.It's all technically very impressive, and well made, but it required me to connect with a sense of nostalgia that I didn't have, and what remained really wasn't strong enough to carry it for me. ***

reviews.review_title: Masterpiece of all time - blue print of a Movie
reviews.content:
*german with subpar english writing skills hereI not liked or forgot Top Gun 1.I was entertained by Top Gun Maverick ALL the time, something i NO WHERE else experienced yet.I had overwhelming feelings into gosebumps and tears a lot.Everything i saw looked, sounded and felt like the best of best people were responsible for the details. The regie, cuts, picture, soundstage, the cam, the playbook.I was so impressed, for me tgm is out of a scale to vote for or it should be a 9.8 at least.Im very critical/picky in general in like every topics in life.NEVER EVER i saw everyone!! In a cinema stay on there seat, not even moving an arm or so, like if it is forbidden, watching into the end screen.NEGATIVE
not used the original themes more often, especially in the end there is a lot room to push the intense feelings even more with stronger music.@tom cruise
i never was a fan of ur movies. This one made u stick forever with me. I was in cinema 2 times, made 6 people go watch it and even already hat cards for a 3 visit.Thank u for the tears!

reviews.review_title: Finally a sequel done right! Tom Cruise has truly outdone himself yet again!
reviews.content: What a story, what a thriller ride without any cheesy CGI, it felt real, it felt authentic, and story stayed true to its predecessor. Tom Cruise hasn't aged a day, just as young and fit as the first one and yet again has outdone himself. Excellent character builds, great lines, kept you hooked from first second till the last. If sequels good sequels will take 36 years in the making, then it's worth the wait as long as it's made right like this instead of cash grabs. Well Done Team Top Gun!

reviews.review_title: Back in time, and not, but wow
reviews.content:
Epic movie. I just liced the original Top Gun, know every line of text by heart. Saw it over and over again
I am amazed and thrilled by this sequal. It has the right mix of better action, emotions, and heritage. It is magnificant.I had trouble watching the screen because of the constant flow of tears in my eye.

I absolutely loved this movie. I think it's the best movie of the year. I went home and watched the first top gun and it's still a great movie. I'm planning on seeing this one again. Gotta go see it on the big screen for sure!

reviews.review_title: Best Superhero movie since original Superman
reviews.content: Remember when action movies left you cheering at the end? TGM is full of heart and thrilling action sequences. Great father son movie with Mav and Rooster, great buddy movie with all the action and team work, and great date movie with Mav and Penny.

reviews.review_title: Great action, awkward acting and rushed storyline - no magic left
