reviews.content: Music ok but not memorable. The action scenes of the final 45 mins are great, but the movie has an empty, toned down atmosphere and awkward acting by usually great actors. The dialogues felt unnatural and half-heartedly with no intensity and little chemistry, as if the actors felt intimidated or just focused on remembering their lines rather than acting. Storyline rushed, not enough character development even for an action movie. Forced rivalry within the group that isn't built up enough to be believable. Even though the action scenes may have been of higher quality on the sequel, the magic of the first movie was mostly gone. It had all the ingredients but just poorly executed. Screen writing, directing and editing all should have been better.

reviews.review_title: Most fun I've had watching a movie in a long time
reviews.content: This is a must to see in theatres - I never write reviews but it was so refreshing to have this experience I felt obliged to share. Aside from the love interest in this one I think I even enjoyed "Maverick" more than the first Top Gun and that almost never happens with sequels. Bravo to the team and TC for making this happen.
Yes. So much yes. More yes than a barrel of yes. In the specific context of yes - yes. If your answer is not yes, the answer to you is not yes. Choose yes. Moreover; yes. In closing - yes.

reviews.review_title: On March 3, 1969 the United States Navy established an elite school for...
reviews.content: I just came back from the Lido cinema here in Singapore, the same cinema that, in 1986, me and my classmates sat there, wide-eyed and amazed by Top Gun. Now, in 2022, with my family tow, we sat in the Lido again, seeing these these iconic words flash across the screen, that unstoppable rush of nostalgia gushes out with palpable force from the very first frame of Top Gun Maverick, and what a fantastic movie it has been! Gosh I have waited 36 years for this movie, and man, the wait has been worth it. This is one of the few rare sequels where it's better, no, make that way way better than the original. The people behind the movie, Jerry Bruckheimer, Joseph Kosinski, Tom Cruise et al have made this a labour of their love. Every scene, every shot and every interaction is masterfully woven with intricate care and detailed planning. The action sequences are top of their class, surpassing that of the original by a country mile. With the passing of time comes emotional maturity, and dear me, the emotional segments, especially that brief reunion scene between Maverick and Ice Man reaches deep into your memory and pulls out those bygone feelings which has been buried deep in your heart for so many years. For the first time in many years, I feel like 17 again.

Obsolete and boring. Definitely not my cup of tea... Where is the fun in all this hyperactive much ado about absolutely nothing? I like once in a while testosterone driven actions on screen. But this? Please.

What a fitting closure for Maverick. Such a spectacular movie that can be rightfully called a great sequel! Goosebumps and tears shed for this movie. Thank you for giving my generation a film that we could see in theaters when we couldn't see Topgun in theaters!

Don't get me wrong the movie has it's moments especially the flying scenes but the rest was pretty ish. The soundtrack was absolutely awful and missing. Compared to the original, the music was much more important and made a lot of the scenes much better. The script was a typical hollywood script not that I expected more but it could've been better. Overall the movie wasn't really impactful and it is getting way to much praise this isn't a 10 star movie at all.

What more need be said? A blockbuster that doesn't suck and is original? It can be done!The positive. Let me start by saying that that was an amazing theatrical experience. The action scenes made it epic and they were so realistic. It was like I was there. Honestly couldn't tell it was green screen or CGI or whatnot.To see Tom Cruise on the big screen is always a pleasure. He's mostly known for doing his own stunts, but we mustn't forget what a great actor he is. That counts for the whole cast, everyone was amazing. Even the smaller characters had great acting.The characters, amazingly written. You want to root for these characters. At the same time, they all have some type of pain. Some element in their personality or past that doesn't make any of the characters one-dimensional. Makes them interesting. They grow, evolve, change.The story is good and easy to understand. There is a mission. Mav has to train the best pilots to prepare them for the mission. They go on the mission. Quite easy, but everything that happens in between is integral to the succes or failure of that mission.The callbacks, the oneliners, the flashbacks, the action,... I can go on but it all just works.Yes, there are some 'negative' elements but don't worry, it's not a lot. As I said the movie is original, but some cliché's still sneak through. Some plotpoints happen to make the story fit and in some degree, the story is quite predictable. But that's the HollyWood formula right? It's worked for them over the years and it works for them now.Amazing film and a great experience altogether. Go see it!

reviews.review_title: The movie itself was the priority, not woke nonsense
reviews.content: This is what movies used to be like. Not some agenda that Hollywood forced on its writers and producers, but to just focus on making a damn good movie. It's like a breath of fresh air, what movies used to feel like. Amazing movie.

Someone needs to ground Tom Cruise so he can't make any more movies. I came into the movie with no nostalgic false memories about the first movie so I was able to see this in it's true light. Some of the action was good but after the first five minutes, you need a good story and this wasn't it. Might have been good as a two episode tv show.
This movie is so incredible I can't even explain it. The cinematic shots and angles are just beautiful. Every part of this movie is amazing and I love every part of it.

reviews.review_title: Great action movie for sure, talented cast but not a masterpiece
reviews.content: It is a great action movie -no doubt- but a masterpiece it is not, sorry. It's a mix and I gave it solid 7, so bear with me.First, things I didn't like: this movie is incredibly predictable. I knew step by step what is gonna happen next, I knew Hangman will save the day in the end because he was basically the younger version of Maverick and they did exactly the same thing at the end as they did in the original movie. We had Rooster vs Hangman just like we had Mav vs Iceman in the first one. We had obvious sentimental callbacks to the relationship between Mav and Goose, and of course that - and Goose's death - translated into the relationship between Mav and Rooster. If you have half of a brain you knew they are gonna clear the air and bond with each other in the end. They were never going to die and anyone who knows typical big-hero American movies, knew it, so there was no surprise. People who claim there were in shock and didn't expect this finale, hm, lets put it lightly - are not very bright.Also, for me, it was pretty lame that we didn't even find out who was the enemy. If you are making a movie like that when the mission is the center of the action, how could you not explain who is the powerful enemy? It's like making a war movie and not saying who the other side is. Ridiculous and lazy. So again, genre-wise, it was a great action movie. But nothing more. Do you know what a masterpiece is? Godfather. Or Thin Red line by Malick.However, despite all of the bad, there is also a lot of good in Top Gun 2. The cast is def talented and very, very charming. Miles Teller is a perfect choice as Goose's son and his talent is on full display, same as the talents of the rest of the young crew. Glen Powell is probably the most charming of them all, he has great charisma and million dollar smile. I have to say I enjoy his Hangman the most. The evolution of his character was obvious and not subtle at all but Glenn is such a scene-stealer that you just can't help to enjoy and like him.Top Gun: Maverick is simply very entertaining and we need that and not just movies that make you want to kill yourself. It's a big popcorn, classic Americana movie very well made, just like Ford vs Ferrari was in 2019. Both have a lot of similarities - both are classic Americana, heroes , dad-son movies, each celebrates technological and engineering breakthrough worlds that have not only allowed the human race to achieve amazing things and push boundaries, but to live a more comfortable life as well. One focuses on the aviation industry, the other on the cars industry. Both have no CGI but real, practical effects and were filmed as real as possible with help of the insiders.So, all in all, Top Gun Maverick is nothing new, and the plot could have been better - less predictable but if you want to relax, live a real big cinema experience, have fun and watch a movie that makes you feel good, like comfort food, it's for you. It's def the action movie of 2022.

reviews.review_title: The Whole Is Greater Than The Sum Of Its Parts
reviews.content: The movie played out more like a tribute to Top Gun and its cast than a sequel. The plot was pretty light as expected. The flight scenes were top notch, I felt every G as if I was in the planes myself. Great dog fight scenes also.Overall, it was a very nostalgic film but it just didn't hit the after burners as much as I hoped. If I broke each scene down I would be very critical of the acting and the boring story.The flying action scenes obviously stole the show and seeing Val Kilmer in his current state broke my heart. If you're a Top Gun fan this movie will fill the 36 year void! For all the faults I could find in this movie I'm recommending it!

I would have never thought that a film made 36 years after the original, and a sequel nonetheless could be this good. I heard a lot of praise for it, and it was the only movie of the year where I was actually hyped to watch it, and oh boy it was fantastic. Believe all the hype, the movie doesn't need any description, it's just fantastic in its own.Acting, filming, storyline and the best of all maybe - the soundtrack that builds all that hype. A perfect combination. This is what I hope for in every movie that I watch yet so few deliver it. Fantastic movie.Good job Mr. Cruise, very good job.

reviews.review_title: Cardboard characters, and surprisingly slow-moving... till the comic-book finale
reviews.content: I went to the theater with high hopes. I love planes and military hardware in general and thought I'd at least get a rousing patriotic charge from this movie. But in fact patriotism is pretty far from its mind.Instead, we're offered the thinnest of cardboard characters involved in various strained relations with one another, and we're presumably supposed to care about them. But not a single character felt real.There's the guy who's always smirking and bragging about being "the best." (The actor, Glen Powell, told an interviewer that he'd realized, with understandable uneasiness, that he was playing "the biggest dick on the planet"; but in fact his entire character consists of no more than his pasted-on, clichéd smirk. He's like some boastful rival in a children's book, and you know he's going to be taken down a peg.) There's the Miles Teller character, who holds a manufactured grudge against Cruise. There's a nerdy guy -- with glasses, no less! -- on a fighter pilot! -- and a handful of obligatory minorities, and a woman pilot who's given a couple of mild wisecracks. (Note: We're told that all these people are "the best of the best.") There's Jennifer Connelly, who's conveniently available but who doesn't want to be "hurt" again. (The love scenes were SO treacly and boring that I felt like a little kid, tempted to duck out to the candy counter.) Throughout the film, various stiff-necked officers berate Cruise for being such a rebel, for not following the rules, blah blah blah. These contrived conflicts were so fakey and formulaic that I found myself, at times, looking away from the screen in embarrassment at the things actors like Jon Hamm were forced to say. In truth, all the assorted subplots are silly and predictable, and you know they'll be resolved by the end.Outside of the flying scenes, the film moves with surprising lethargy, in a sticky, sentimental, weirdly reverent way -- reverent, that is, toward the earlier "Top Gun" -- with huge screen-filling close-ups of Cruise and the other cast members, all of them speaking very slowly, with lengthy silences between their sentences. You have to wait an awfully long time for the big-deal bombing mission. When it finally comes, it just seems like comic-book stuff, with a lot constipated grunting and heavy breathing on the sound track in an effort to generate suspense. As I watched, I kept comparing the movie with "Zero Dark Thirty" and "The Right Stuff," both infinitely better.One final complaint that will resonate with no one but the most pedantic of English majors: There's a missing comma in the opening text on the screen. (It belongs after "1969.") This is an increasingly common mistake, especially here on the net, but it's annoying that a Hollywood blockbuster wouldn't even find room, in its gigantic budget, for a decent copy editor.

Probably one of the best movies of the last 2 years. Brought back the good feeling of going to the theatre to a a quality movie. No politics or any agendas shoved down the audiences throats for once! So refreshing!
This movie was a great movie from start to finish. Doing a perfect job with ice man, and rooster. It was a edge of your seat movie that the intense bits will blow your mind.
This is the kind of movie I like to see. Lots of action, characters you can bond with, a feeling of nostalgia, and a heavy dose of patriotism!Doesn't Tom Cruise ever age?

reviews.review_title: Tom Cruise pulls off yet again! Simply Epic
reviews.content: Never never never easy to make sequels that can still maintain the charm of the first for any classic movie. And it was Top Gun of 1986, one of the milestones in the Hollywood that marked the stand of Tom Cruise. After 36 long years, he returns with a sequel that beats the first in every way. Using the technology to its best yet not relying completely on it, the whole movie was perfectly executed. The BGM was well blended pushing the movie a notch higher. Wouldn't be wrong if I say, the best of everything was in the movie.Tom Cruise! As always raises his bar in every movie he makes. When we just think, he has reached his limits, comes Top Gun Maverick! Aw... his charisma, unbeatable. It is such a delight to just watch him on the big screen.Watched it in the IMAX and all those spectacular scenes will be etched in my brain for many more years to come. A movie worth admiring, and not just watching.

reviews.review_title: What Movies Are Meant To Do...
reviews.content: Wow, this was fun. I haven't had this much fun watching a movie since I was a kid. Gripping. Awesome. Fun. Nobody makes movies like Tom Cruise. He tops what he does every time out and hardly ever misses. Even his upcoming trailers are better. The trailers that came before Top Gun started were like eh, then Tom's trailer for the next Mission Impossible came on and it looked awesome and epic. No agenda. No woke crap. Just good ol' awesome movies doing what movies are meant to do - ENTERTAIN.

reviews.review_title: This is why we go to the movies!
reviews.content: It's been soo long since I felt This way about a movie, I feel like a teenager seeking for interviews and watching red carpet from premieres of Top Gun, listening to the soundtrack over and over!Everything about this movie is fun and entertaining!Even my kids who are teenagers loved it!Definitely one movie classic for the new generations.Thank you for bringing back pure fun movies!

Just can't get by the question - why would the military draft a 60 something year old veteran to train other pilots, and assume a combat role flying multi million dollar aircraft? Grew up riding motorcycles - we Never rode our bikes with our leathers unzipped - that scene was a travesty. Why did Cruise make this "sequel" in the first place? Hoped this film would actually accomplish something. Corny dialog, story and characters. The kids that Cruise was training were mostly wrong. I've met the real top gun and combat pilots and spoken with them - they are decorated senior officers, with degrees and manners, that don't act/look anything like these Kardashians. Also, Top Gun fighter training is Not in San Diego anymore. Basically identical plot to the first film - which I did enjoy. Have to admit the action scenes were well shot. Was really hoping for something new and different from the original - just didn't happen. $170 million budget for this? Only giving it a few stars for the technical achievements otherwise - very little praise. L. Tom Cruise - time to hang it up.

Great sequel (after 36 yrs) for those who were inspired by the 1986 Top Gun in their teens. A well made tribute for the fans and includes some of the original movie sound track.Action movie for the big screens. A feel good Tom Cruise movie showing that he's still got it and he is the mega movie star of our time.

reviews.review_title: This is what hard-work in movie-making looks like
reviews.content: Tom Cruise went above and beyond with this sequel and everybody did their part the same way. I really admire Tom's skills and his appetite to push his limits. The best of the best!

Been quite a while since I've seen a movie like this done with so much thought, grit and caring. That all of the actors were willing to put themselves in the cockpit of fighter jets pulling many Gs and not rely on stunts really gets to the heart of why this sequel feels so much more special than you'd expect. Honestly nothing about this movie disappointed me and the honorable way they worked in Val Kilmer unexpectedly moved me on many levels. Kudos. See the movie. It feels like a movie you want to support.

reviews.review_title: What a magnificent piece of art
reviews.content: Truthfully speaking, even a rating of 10/10 doesn't do justice to this film. This was totally worth the wait. So rare for a sequel to outdo it's original. TC is at his best. I cannot wait to see him shine in MI 7 and 8 as well !!

Hollywood, take notes, this is how you "remake" a classic movie for modern audiences, this is how you diversify your casts, this how you tell your old audiences to be aware of how time has changed, this is how you should do it!Classic yet modern, sad yet hopeful, Top Gun: Maverick proves that the old 80's movie formula still works in the middle of woke ideology messaging in the modern western entertainment. In the middle of fresh and young faces, Cruise almost does not waste his time telling the young kids he's still the boss around here. Though I have to say that by coating it with the vibe of his Mission Impossible series, I'm afraid his action flicks for years to come would bring nothing new to the table. Still, I hope for Dead Reckoning Part One and Part Two, he'd deliver something special as a love letter to long-time fans the way this movie does, or the way Infinity War and Endgame did for MCU fans.8.5/10.

From the trailer I thought this would just be a descent movie, but boy I am glad I was wrong! You can tell how much love and care has been put into this movie, every line feels perfect, the acting was emotional, plus amazing action. Top Gun might be the best film of the year!

reviews.review_title: Hollywood - This is how you make a cinema experience
reviews.content: It's been far too long since we got a movie that the audience actually wants and this film delivers that in spades.Truly remarkable experience that will leave you on a high when you leave the cinema.

The action just never stopped. I was very scriptural going in, considering how iconic the first movie is. However right from the get go the plot just keeps rolling and rolling. The action scenes are gorgeous and extremely real. Some of the dialogue was iffy but overall i genuinely was on the edge of my seat.

Top Gun: Maverick is the long awaited sequel to the 1986 film starring Tom Cruise. Cruise returns as Maverick, but the film also stars Miles Teller who plays Rooster, the son of Goose, Maverick's former wingman. The basic story is that Maverick is reluctantly hired to teach a bunch of cocky young pilots how to complete a very difficult mission while he also repairs his relationship with Rooster.I don't have much nostalgia or love for the first Top Gun mainly because I didn't see it until several years ago. I think it's a fine movie that does what it sets out to do. It's extremely cheesy, but a fun time nonetheless. When Top Gun: Maverick was announced many people were very excited. I wasn't. In a world were many unecessary prequels/sequels are being made, this just felt like another addition to that collection. I was wrong. This movie has no reason to be as good as it is. It improves upon the first film in literally every aspect. The acting and writing is ten times better while still keeping a smidge of that original cheese factor. The cinematography and directing are really what makes this film shine though. The shots of the interior and exterior of the jets as they are moving at reall high speeds are unlike anything I have ever seen before. You really get a sense for how fast and dangerous they really are. The decision to use real jets instead of miniatures or CGI made everything feel authentic and it added several more layers of intensity to every flying scenes. If I absolutely had to find some things I didn't like about it, I would say that I could have done without the romance altogether. It felt a bit too forced for me, but the resolution of it was worth it. Also the last act or so of the movie felt a bit out of place compared to the rest of the film, although I found it very enjoyable.Top Gun: Maverick surprised on all levels. It's one of the first new movies I've seen in a long time that I can easily say deserves a 10/10.
This was an amazing sequel. It had many of the components the first one had. Some where better some wasn't. All in all they evened out. I still have it at a 10 while the original an 11!!

When it comes to action I say "Tom cruise"
Waiting for his next movies
Hope he makes in Marvel Universe
Many Marvel fans are waiting to see him in MCU.

reviews.review_title: Brings back alot of good old memories, this is what we call a great movie
reviews.content: When the movie started with Top Gun anthem, followed by Danger Zone, man, it really gave a goosebumps to me (& i bet a lot of Top Gun fans feel the same). Then to the story line, where Maverick try to save the program over the Drone Project, it was so touch & cool !!Is great to see that this story doesn't go after Ice Man, but instead, focusing in The late Goose younger son, it was amazing, especially when Maverick saw Rooster playing the "Great Ball Of Fire".Love the performance of other actor/actress too, especially Jennifer Connelly, is really an icing to the cake.Overall, perfect movie, thanks for making this great movie, & also brings back to good old memories...

reviews.review_title: I think the Admiral is asking a rhetorical question.
reviews.content: Conceptually I understand that Top Gun was an iconic film, and while emotionally I enjoyed it I never thought of it as something I'd rewatch. From that frame of mind, I can say that Top Gun Maverick is a great sequel. Understandably, it leans on nostalgia, retreads, and while some pieces felt forced, most of it was appropriately in the background and enjoyable. Tom Cruise is unquestionably one of the last true movie stars, or at least the only true movie running stars (how he worked that into a movie about fighter planes is beyond me). The cinematography was jaw dropping, even more so when it's clear this isn't a green screen heavy movie. More so than the original, there's definitely a visceral sense that the audience is in the cockpit with the pilots. Overall, Top Gun Maverick is why we have movie theaters.A shout out to Miles Teller. I remember stumbling into some of his early work ... teenager type roles. I'm not sure whether it's because he was cast in a string of very similar roles or he was just playing himself, but I remember being very unimpressed. It was all roles where he was always a cocky jibber jabber character. It's the same negative reaction I have watching Vince Vaughn ... an instinctive desire to cringe and change the channel. But color me impressed in his execution here. Maybe it's because the nature of his character here requires him to anchor his performance on an existing character (Goose) or maybe it's just age and maturity. But this is the first time I've thought: this actor has range. I'm not qualified to speak to his acting skills so all I can say is I believed in his character and I no longer feel the urge to punch him in the face. I mean that in the nicest way possible.

After a long long time , in the times when there are only fantasy movies everywhere , a masterpiece by legendary TOM CRUISE .. Excellent in all categories .. Sound effects are amazing .. All in all just like its predecessor The Top GUN , i can watch this movie again n again forever.

I highly recommend old and new fans of Top Gun (1986) to go see Top Gun Maverick. The movie is amazing start to finish. The flight sequences are amazing and will get your adrenaline going. Anyone interested in fighter jets or aviation should def see this movie.

reviews.review_title: better than you would expect for this type of movie
reviews.content: Man, this movie had no business being as good as it was. In preparation for watching this, I went and watched the original, which I don't believe I had seen since around when it came out, and it didn't hold up very well. I probably wouldn't have gone to see this one in the theater if I hadn't heard it was getting such a good reception. Totally worth it. Sure, the plot and the characters are pretty predictable, and they certainly went in on the nostalgia (but not too much), but it's all done so well, you're totally taken along for the ride. The flight scenes were so well done. The humor was surprisingly good. There's more than a few moments where you'll likely get choked up. Overall, very well done.
This movie was great. It stayed true to the original and was just fun. The visuals were awesome. Definitely an excellent sequel. I would highly recommend seeing it on the big screen.

reviews.review_title: Good movies are few and far between these days
reviews.content: Hollywood has really lost its groove over the last 5-10 years. The quality of movies has gone down, too much political stuff is inserted, and they are always just finding movies to redo (poorly) or making another installment of a dead franchise.This movie, however, shows that there is still hope in Hollywood for a decent movie to be produced. Top Gun: Maverick was nostalgic, well written, action packed, and well acted. Politics and social justice issues were left at the door and a good movie was allowed to be made. You won't find movies like this made that often anymore. Definitely worth a watch, maybe even more than once! If you liked the first Top Gun, you will absolutely enjoy this one.
Top Gun has so strong nostalgia if you come from 80s loved it with so much of mixed feelings!!! Must watch for everyone... feed good movie!!! Will watch at-least two times in theater.

Best theatre experience I have had since Rogue One in 2016. Just the spectacle and the hype was real. Rare that sequels that come out decades later top the original. And yes, I said it. This one is better than TG 1986.

reviews.review_title: A fun movie, which is all we want and expect
reviews.content: People are obviously not going to this movie for a cerebral experience. They are going, to have fun. Top Gun: Maverick does this with flying colors. They give plenty of nods to the original, with flashbacks, music and scenes that pay homage to the first. The characters were well developed and the story satisfying. MILD SPOILER: My only complaint with the film is it's use of Deus Ex Machina. It is a story mechanism that I have always disliked. Feels lazy. Despite that, this movie has great action and is incredibly fun.
If you have even an ounce of patriotic spirit left in you, GO SEE THIS MOVIE IN THE THEATER. It will renew your spirit. The drama and heroic action blow you away.

reviews.review_title: Even after 26 years the sequel of this movie has come but the magic of this movie has not diminished even a bit.
reviews.content: The story and screenplay of the movie is simply amazing. Very entertaining movie. One after another scenes of the movie are very good. Special flight training and the final mission of flying the plane gives goosebumps. The movie's vfx, locations and flying stunts are excellent. Everyone should learn the secrets of how to stay fit and young at 60 from Tom Cruise. The background score of the movie has been kept earlier due to which it also gives goosebumps. After 26 years the sequel of this movie has come so it is definitely a must watch movie for those who have seen the first installment movie. People of all ages can enjoy this movie. Many thanks to the director and those who are responsible for making this movie. Must watch movie. Don't miss this movie at any cost. If the next movie is made then I will wait for it.

All I'll say is they pulled it off! Pandering to fans works when done very, very well! Everyone in the theater applauded at the end.They really brought back that feel of the original in a relatively fresh way without taking the focus off of what we are all there to see: awesome dogfights. Tip: see it in IMAX!

What else is there to say .. watch it! If you could make a wish you'd end up with this movie. Everyone brought their "A" game to the screen and delivered. Guaranteed if you even liked the first movie .. you'll absolutely LOVE this one. I refuse to put any spoilers to even slightly reduce the movies impact.
Seriously? Much rehash, predictable and mediocre acting. Compared to hundreds of great movies over the years, this gets an 8+ ? Critical reviewing is now without reference.

reviews.review_title: Classic action movie that you missed in these days!
reviews.content: Great music, great cinematography, great acting, great plot, classic values in life and love. This really brings back the bar that movie should be built. Will definitely rewatch this soon!

This film is basically the original top gun but better in every way.The stuntwork and acting is phenomenal along with the jokes and characters.The connection between rooster and maverick was done very well although I would've liked to see it a bit more.The film is one of the best looking films visually of all time along with the last jedi and kong skull island.The buildup to the final battle is awesome and so is the battle itself.It pays homage to the original in very nice ways while just being better.Overall just easily one of the best films of all time and easily the best film about flying and planes of all time.

Life often goes in cycles. So it was great to see this mavericks' life revisited and come full circle 30 years later.Clever nod to technology, the future and also a chance to relive some of the Topgun moments from the past. Thrilling from start to finish.A must watch!

Thanks tom cruise and the team for bringing a good old Hollywood movie back. It's been a while. This movie has all the ingredients to go down the movie history as a CLASSIC. The storyline is beautiful. The acting is amazing. The Music elevates every shot. The final act immerses you in the screen and Elevates your heartbeat. But the best part is the aerial scenes. The authenticity of the flying in the movie, makes you stick to the edge of the seat and makes you part of the movie rather then being a disconnect. This is a refreshing breather after all the cgi based mediocre movies that are fun to watch but lags artistic filmmaking,

reviews.review_title: I'd give it a 9.7 if I could..... worth the wait!
reviews.content: I saw it in IMAX and it was very very intense. Predicable at times and a lot of similarities to the original. That being said if you liked the first one, you'll love this. The aerial footage and effects are incredible. Great to see Iceman make an appearance. I'm sure I'll see it again at the theater.

The only film the wife has on her iPad is Top Gun
in the near future she will be adding Top Gun Maverick
It tickled all the boxes on all fronts for the nostalgic period on how films should be
Don't know if I'll be here in 36 years to see if it stands the test of time
I think it will
Thank you Tom.

reviews.review_title: I'm gonna be honest with everyone...
reviews.content: After the first 30 minutes I was thinking "I already don't like this." Wanna know why? Well alright I'll tell you; then I'll tell you why I'm still watching this...1. We do not have Mach 10 piloted aircraft, not yet...2. 55 or older pilots would not be flying said Mach 10 aircraft, I don't care how fit they are.3. I felt really cringy about rubber stamping dialog from the original movie and modifying it ever so slightly to sorta fit into a new movie...it really felt like they were using the loss of Goose as a kind of back story to maybe revisit the original and justify this one......Then something strange happened, the back story wasn't in the back anymore...it became the reason this movie exists. Maverick still carried guilt from so far in the past, and had to get past that, because Goose's son is now at Top Gun for the "Very special mission"Then something even stranger happened...Top Gun Maverick got real exciting for the remaining 3 hours (yes it feels that long)...Yes the movie is total fantasy from start to finish, but the damn thing is totally entertaining, which is my number one rule for reviews...stick it out folks...it may be fantasy on steroids, but by the end of the movie you just don't care...Well done...very well done...and don't forget to notice those flying sequences, they are outstanding...

reviews.review_title: Just a mission yet full of thrills.
reviews.content: The way it's connected to the previous movie is awesome. Simple story but every second is full of excitement and thrill. I'm gonna call it Masterpiece :Returned.

reviews.review_title: Was gladly surprised by the outcome..
reviews.content: I was on a plane and just looking for an ok movie to pass time. Honestly I've seen the first movie a few years back and, probably because I was too late to watch it, I wasn't impressed that much though I believe it's still a good picture. So I figured I'd watch the 2nd movie without having to pay too much attention and not caring even if I would dozed off.However, I'm not sure if it was the low expectations but I totally loved it. I was constantly at the edge of my seat throughout the movie. I can't remember the last time I gave an action move 9/10 rating but I did it for this one with no regrets at all.

Not a big fan of big blockbuster action movies but this really surprised me. Yes it's cheesy at moments but it's a really fun watch and surprisingly intense. The action is edge of your seat good and seeing it in IMAX was such a great experience. Would recommend, especially if you're a fan of, or nostalgic of the original.

reviews.review_title: Attack on Death Star with jet fighters and Tom Skywalker.
reviews.content: I understand that some type of people enjoy watching dumb movies (such as Rambo), where US heroes invade, bomb other countries, invade places, infiltrate and kill people, massacre everyone and it's a happy ending with a celebration, all cast hugging each other with smiley faces etc.. Full of cliches and entertainment for simpletons.I like almost all of Tom Cruise movies, (especially science fiction ones), but this one is a total cringe. I've seen more plausible events in Tiny Toons cartoons.2 stars for the CGI. (standard quality VFX stuff, nothing new or extraordinary)
Not much to say. Enjoyed every bit of it. Absolutely great to watch and a true, lately hard to come by cinema experience. It was definitely worth the waiting.
I'd rather go to a descent airshow than pay to see this rubbish.The opening 20 mins, Ejecting at Mach 10 lols.Storyline is ridiculous , why didnt they use Stealth bombers.

Pinned to my theater chair all along!! Thrilling, touching, the music lifts you up and bring back so many memories. The cast is just AWESOME. Tom did it again!!! The jets, the flying scenes are OUTSTANDING!!! Will watch it again and again!!! Simply a 10!!!!

Story, the act, the excitement I loved it. You don't need to watch the first part , and it shows you that you need to be a role model for your team. You need to do the things first to feel them and support them instead of being selfish , stupidly giving orders.

reviews.review_title: Maybe if you have not seen the 1st one...
reviews.content: If you have not seen the 1st TopGun, you might like this. My problem is I did see the 1st one.1) The awe of seing jet fighters filmed like that for the 1st time is obviously not there.2) This version is almost a scene by scene copy of the first one, and every duplicate scene did not give me nostalgia, it annoyed me. Leaving me saying to myself "this is a copy of this and that scene" time and time again. It's just waaay to obvious, lile following a recipe.3) The whole mission felt purposely designed to make and release a videogame, and felt very unrealistic.4) The "beige" caracters never really take shape like the original and you don't really care about them.5) The writing is very basic, even for such a movie.If I compare this to Star Wars, none of the subsequent movies could reproduce the wonder inspired by the 1st one, but at least, they had different plot that took you somwhere else, and the brought interesting new caracters. TopGun Maverick does not do that, unfortunately.

reviews.review_title: Cruise made wing men of us all.
reviews.content: They went formulaic in the best sense of the Hollywood tradition. The Top Gun: Maverick film makers took paint-by-the-numbers moviemaking on an exhilarating Mach 10 ride. They made wing men of us all putting the sonic boom in a ride that felt fresh in all its familiar barrel rolls. Tom Cruise was at his best making the hero pilot's story feel as if he invented the formula. His was the brilliantly measured performance that made this sequel feel even more real than the original.

reviews.review_title: Words can't describe the tension of this film
reviews.content: With this in mind, I can say that I haven't watched a marvelous and stunning film in the cinema since Joker (2019). Normally, going to a movie that has lots of airplanes you'd think that you'll leave the cinema extremely dissy, but this is nowhere near that feeling. Instead, you will feel the tension, a magnet will draw you to the edge of your seat. Not only this, but lots of emotions: joy, sadness, excitement, frightened, surprise, anxiety, trust, and many more.The power of teamwork, friendship, and reconciling with others are some of the fundamental messages that makes this movie spectacular. Tom Cruise, Miles Teller, and Jennifer Connelly give their hearts in this film. They understand the past movie and try to live up the same scenery, environment, and vibe that was given to this franchise 36 years ago, especially director Joseph Kosinski.If you dive deeper into the sweat and hard work that was put into the movie, you'll be amazed. Tom Cruise literally had everyone (including the director) re-shoot a scene because he found it could be better. This process consisted of everyone going to the gym to achieve its full potential. Plus, as many may known, he would only participate if the aircraft shots were made with REAL aircrafts.Said all this, I'm glad this movie took its time instead of rushing it due to matters of COVID. It deserves a 10/10. A movie that will give you adrenaline, tension, and an inevitable smile. Worth your time and money.

This is how movies are made. I hope Hollywood learns a lesson. Drop all the political propaganda and cgi madness. Focus on quality. Bravo Tom Cruise and everyone who made this movie possible. Zero wokeness. Zero propaganda. Pure, raw and epic awesomeness.

I have watched probably over a thousand movies in my lifetime, and I honestly can't think of a better movie. It has it all and will invoke all the feelings in those few hours.If you liked the original, then you will love this one. If you have not seen the first one, you will still love this one, and I guarantee that you'll drive home fast to watch the original on Netflix or HBO.This is what movies should be about; take your parents, take your kids, take your friends, and enjoy an epic type of movie that we rarely see these days!I am 100% going to rewatch it in theaters!

reviews.review_title: That's how you make a sequel!!!
reviews.content: I was hesitant to watch this at first, but I ended up enjoying this from start to finish. After all, Hollywood doesn't have a great track record when it comes to making sequels. For starters, I liked the nods to the original. I also liked that this wasn't just a copy and paste, retelling of the first movie. While being respectful to the original, nostalgia wasn't the main focus here. The script simply builds on the events of the first movie. No preachy dialogue, unnecessarily vulgar language, gratuitous nudity or ridiculous plot twists either. Just great storytelling from start to finish. The writers really poured their hearts and souls into this and they ended up producing a superb movie. This movie is a work of art and a nod to a time when movies didn't solely rely on excessive CGI and explosions to tell a story. Sadly, that's what's lacking in the majority of modern day movies. In plain language, this is why people go to the movies and this is what entertainment is all about. Top Gun: Maverick captures what Hollywood once was, and what it still should be.

reviews.review_title: I had to see it twice.
reviews.content: What a great movie. I had to see it twice. Visuals are beautiful. Good acting. Filmed with real fighter jets. Also the sound and soundtrack are awesome.

reviews.review_title: Best film I've seen in a long time!
reviews.content: Just recently watched the original Topgun, so it was fresh in my kind for this coming out and honestly, Maverick is 10 x the movie the original was. The F-18 scenes are absolutely fantastic and the lack of special effects are a welcome change from the movies of late. It was also brilliant and heartbreaking at the same time to see Val Kilmer back in action, and very clever how the story mirrored his own life. Bruckheimer actually said Cruise refused to do the movie unless Kilmer was in it. There are very few movies I would watch twice in the cinema, but this is one I definitely would!

reviews.review_title: Everything I Wanted And More Than I Expected
reviews.content:
I just got out of the cinema after watching this...
I absolutely love the first film, it's one of my all time favourites.I never saw it in the cinema though, as I was only 2 when it came out. But I've lost track of how many times I've watched it now. I've owned it on VHS, DVD and Blu-ray. I know it pretty much word for word. So, I was both excited and nervous about going to see this one. I knew the action scenes would be great, but wasn't expecting much else. I was pleasantly surprised though. It had nods to the first film, without going over the top. Whilst adding to what came before and not just redoing the same story.If you're on the fence and unsure whether to see it... Don't be, it's great. It's the first film in a long time that I've actually been excited to go and see at the cinema and come out feeling like it delivered everything I wanted and more than I expected.

reviews.review_title: Something rare-a sequel that is better then the original
reviews.content: I had heard that this was better than the original Top Gun from 1986, so before going to the big screen, I watched it on Amazon Prime. After watching it, I thought that will not be hard to beat. I was much more impressed 36 years ago. That said, this movie is outstanding. If you have not seen the original or it has been a while, rewatch it. There are many flashbacks and references that you do not want to miss.The plot is good, but extremely predictable. That does not take away from a superb cast, great visuals and just a good movie. Well worth your time.

On the very rare occasion, it can happen that the sequel is better than the original. And that just occurred. It shows that they put in the effort to make sure this movie kept the same magic as the original all while keeping it fresh. It's a wonderful film and it brings me back to how movies are suppose to be made.I have a tremendous amount of respect for Tom Cruise. Holding his ground so that this movie is exclusively in theaters. As well as not relying on cgi green screen effects.

A film with action, romance, thrill and why not after all it's Tom Cruise's film. Cinematography was excellent I don't know how they could manage to shot in that kind of circumstances. Though I haven't watched the first part but understood the plot watching this, but I would suggest people to watch first one then this and that's how you can get the actual storyline and can dive into it.

This movie is basically about Tom cruise having fun. There is no real story. No character development. Forced unnecessary romance. Very little conflict for the hero. His mission movies are way better.

A lot of sequels equal or even truly improve over the original, as for instance Aliens, Alien3, Star Wars 2, Star Trek 2, Ghost in the Shell 2, The Bourne Ultimatum, Die Hard: With a Vengeance, Beverly Hills Cop 2, Friday the 13th Part 2, Evil Dead 2, Nightmare on Elm Street 3, The Exorcist 3, Return of the Creature of the Lagoon, Critters 2 etc, etc...Of course, some people will disagree. And there always will be. Cliché brand marked as they are forever. And for all those eternal sceptical now comes Top Gun: Maverick by Joseph Kosinski, Tom Cruise & Jerry Bruckheimer.This overwhelming, touching, supremely well directed CGI free IMAX experience proves once again that a movie is once and for all a very intimate odyssey into people's mind & soul, sequel or not.As a matter of fact, when it has a true and unique director's vision (Joseph Kosinski did Tron Legacy, Oblivion, Only the Brave... need I say more?!!) in his core, his elevation (as the actor's in their cockpits flying for real!) over mass-production and his impact on true movie lover's minds may be a gift nobody can honestly refuse nowadays.In this sad, over Marvelised and CGI overloaded world, movies like Top Gun: Maverick are this fresh refill of clean air we all are so deeply in need of.The general idea why this movie has been made? Just for money? Then take two minutes to think about the beautifully integrated Iceman/Val Kilmer character and this last movie shot after 2 hours and 11minutes of captivating beauty, power and delight: An airplane crossing the sky, free as possible from the ground' basic rules of gravitation. Pure magic in the same sense than this other vibrant homage to pilots and sky adventurers: Hayao Miyazaki's The Wind Rises. Tears in my eyes. Love in my heart.Thank you Tom, Joseph, Tony & Jerry!

reviews.review_title: The best movie I have ever seen
reviews.content: This review took me 2 months to write, due to my initial speeclessness.I am, unlike the others in this review section, very young, and remember seeing the first movie just a couple of years ago when my mother urged me to, stating it's a classic you simply can't miss. I honestly enjoyed the original, and for me it's the perfect «old school» action movie, that you can put on to pop out of our high-tech low-social soeciety for a while (please excuse my wording if it's regarded offensive in any way). The story and action were truly amazing.However, Top Gun: Maverick was the sequal we never knew we needed. It fullfills the story to a tee, and is the perfect ending to a legendary story. I can honestly, wholeheartedly say this is the best movie I've ever seen. And that's saying a lot. The story, the action mixed with nostalgy and reminiscence is balanced perfectly, and is a true masterpiece. After I saw the movie the first time, I immidietly googled it, and learning the efforts and love Cruise put into the movie just made me love it, if possible, even more.I'm shocked and honored to have witnessed this tribute and love letter to the original Top Gun, and am moved to say, this movie is the absolute best I have ever, or will ever, see.

reviews.review_title: Probably the only modern film I will ever truly give a 10/10 to
reviews.content: This was amazing. Especially in IMAX.Everything about this movie is perfection.It lives up to the original and even surpasses it in many ways.I have been a near lifelong fan of the original, and has high hopes but had kept me expectations reasonable.Then I strapped in for the thesaterical experience of s lifetime.The air combat and flight sequences are engaging, edge of your seat and intense. The story is moving and well planned. The execution is perfect.I cannot recall another movie that made an audience, in the very large and packed theater, reacts in the ways this one does. There were people laughing, clapping, cheering and at the end, many stood and clapped.Everyone outside in the lobby was raving about what they had just seen, and I felt it too.It was like many of us had been teleported back to a normal pace in our collective childhoods that we might have forgotten. Seeing our heroes of the first film, back on screen, doing what made us love the original, and doing it bigger than before. I was 8 years old again, suddenly. I felt like I did when I was sitting in that musky old theater with my dad on a Saturday afternoon in rural S Carolina, back in the late 80s and that is what is really special about this movie.Then there is the scene with Val Kilmer, which just stops the show. In a good way.. his presence on the screen with Cruise, just captures you and lends weight to all that is said.This may or may not be the best thing I see all year, but either way, it's one of the best theatrical experiences that I have ever had.If you are considering going to see it, do it now. And, if you have the option, pay the few bucks extra to experience it in IMAX. It's worth every penny.

Tbh i was surprised when i heard they were making the second Top Gun and boy was i wrong...
I enjoyed it from start to finish, the perfect movie for thursday afternoon.Good acting, good cast...it's a movie you must see!

reviews.review_title: Far and few inbetween, a classic for generations.
reviews.content: It's been a long time since i felt cool watching a movie!Thanks for great acting and amazing effects! The plotline and a few scenes were flirting with overdoing the nostalgia and it ends up working perfectly. I have a keen sense of picking up the slighest of wiff of cringe - but this cast, these actors played out the scenes perfectly and the reward is moviemagic.I loved it, emetional on a level every man can relate to.Hey, and thanks for making a movie without politics, without pushing an agendy, thanks for making a movie intented to just captivate us and give us a 2 hour break for our every day lifes and just be engulfed in this riveting story! Great job.

reviews.review_title: Finally a movie worthy of a blockbuster title
reviews.content: My first review here was in 1999, but I lost access to that email. What I mean is, I'm a movie buff but rarely write reviews. I've given up on movies in recent years due to Hollywood making trash for most part. This movie was finally something good. Better than good. It was excellent. Top of the line, no pun intended. 10 stars across the board.

reviews.review_title: How Not To Botch A Sequel
reviews.content: Step 1 - Sell outrageously the idea of America. Ride a hog, sail with your flame, aviator sunglasses on, cool wind in your hair and you have yourself a Polo Ralph Lauren poster. Don't forget that shirtless beach football contest. It'll come in handy for the trailer.Step 2 - Pass the baton. Do not monopolize the screen. Keep calm and watch emerge the new class. Spot a younger, cockier version of yourself, and chuckle in silence. Take a trip down memory lane but don't linger. Kick ass when you have to. You're still the alpha male, although you see no need to advertise it.Step 3 - Throw in the tried and tested, universal gender equalizer, hormone harmonizer, common denominator theme out there. A beautiful love story. Now go ahead and American pie it a little bit.Do all of the above, and you got yourself a solid sequel to a classic and easily one the best movies of the year.As far as I'm concerned, Tom Cruise is the real Captain America. I'm even willing to overlook his jet black hair at age sixty. Can't say as much for Val Kilmer. Why he elected to resemble his counterpart at Madame Tussauds is just beyond me.

I've been watching several movies on the big screen lately, and of all of them, this wins. Movies these days are tending more and more to unnecessarily squeeze politics into them, this movie is the ultimate proof that you can make an amazing film with nothing of that. Simply, amazing movie, got hooked since the start.

Take your whole family to see this fun thrilling joy ride movie. I love that is was only about telling a good story and just fun experience in the movie theaters(The sound and feel is a lot better in theaters). Also the clean story-telling for the family and shows major respect for the brave army culture which is great for everyone to enjoy. The ending is so unexpected (no spoilers here) definitely watch til end to find out how a wonderful joy ride keeps you inclined to see what happens....................................... ................................... ................................... ................................... ...................................

#TopGunMaverick is a great ball of fire, especially if you're a fan of the original, recognize the references and parallels - guaranteed to take you through the highway to the danger zone! Talk to me, Goose! Perfect (5/5Scales)

reviews.review_title: Amazing Movie and I've Never Seen The First One
reviews.content: Originally I had no plans on watching this movie because I never saw the first movie and just wasn't that interested. However, my mum and a friend of ours wanted my opinion and review for this movie. I had my reservations because I've never seen the first movie and thought I wouldn't be able to try and enjoy this one if it made strong connections and references to the first movie. Luckily I was proven wrong, this movie is fantasticWhile the movie did bring up a connection to a new character who happened to be a son of a character who was tragically killed during the first movie and I presume was a friend of Tom Cruise's character, Marverick who felt guilty for what happened. Luckily for me, I didn't need to stop and go back to watch the first movie to fully understand before going back to this one. It went straight to the point and very easy to followThe plot was fantastic and engaging with Maverick nearing the end of his career who is recruited to lead a new team of pilots for a mission, training them up, getting them to work as a team and eventually helps them carry out the mission. His superiors don't like him especially the character Jon Hamm played, always at odds with Maverick. Along the way Maverick meets an old flame who obviously had history in the first movie, Penny. It was kinda obvious even to me they would hook up againThis movie is perfect for people like myself who have never seen the first Top Gun movie whether they are asked to for their friends and family without getting confused during the course of this particular movie and even make new fans of the Top Gun movies in the process. I loved the themes they played with from Maverick passing the torch so to speak to his students, him getting over his guilt and grief of the death of his friend by letting go of the past, redemption and trustAbsolutely fantastic and despite Tom being in a whacky religious cult is a damn good actor. I haven't seen much of his films so this in itself was a treat.

reviews.review_title: No country stands a chance against American aviators . . .
reviews.content: . . . documents TOP GUN: MAVERICK. Just as it's said that T. Woods could win a major golf tournament during his heyday playing with a shovel, TOP GUN proves that U. S. Airmen can outwit, out-fly and totally bamboozle rival air defenses with one wing tied behind their back. Though some publicity flacks have hinted that the Real Life counterpart to TOP GUN's target zone is North Korea, China knows that this warning shot is aimed directly at them, which is why they've banned this story every way possible. However, TOP GUN has these pernicious Reds quaking in their slippers, knowing that their jig is up.

Just as dull, crap, and boring as the first piece of rubbish.Another tom cruise snooze fest. Fails to get off the ground.Sadly no hilarious death scene.Definitely not worth watching. Should have stayed unmade.
One of the best thriller Love you watch the sound of the plans uff what a movie.Must see in a big screen and you will be surprise when your hands on your heart beating so fast.

reviews.review_title: I disagree with all the opinions in favor, I'm sorry.
reviews.content: Maybe I'm writing this because I'm still a fighter plane pilot, I don't know. But it is notorious that Tom Cruise never flew a plane. The book of "The daredevil, the authoritarian and the pretty lady" is repeated (all the companions of Tom must be pretty?). Anyway, if it helps, I couldn't finish watching a movie that struck me like a déjà vu all the time.
This movie really takes you back, it feels like you're watching an old school 90s flick. I don't write reviews usually, but i was so impressed with this, it was just perfect!

reviews.review_title: Take Note Snowflakes That's how to make a film
reviews.content: Well i heard it was good but that was the best film I have seen in years. BRILLIANT and so good because makeing a sequel that is not cheesy and looks like a desperate money spinner is very hard but this was excellent. Went with the family and all the emotions are there the girls were crying the lads were on the edge of the seats and everyone said how good it was when we walked out. Really Really refreshing to watch a film that is just a good film with lots of action and not some modern pathetic diversity message being shoved down our throats like the last spiderman which was pathetic.Effects were amazing and maybe you need to have served in the Armed Forces to understand the pride and honor aspect.Brilliant film with great salutes to the 1st and the fine outstanding men and women (like Me) who stand up to protect their countries from Evil which allows the meek to sleep safe in their beds at night.

reviews.review_title: The best compliment to the Russian aviation ever made
reviews.content: Compare for yourself:"Top Gun" movie of 1986 shows us very arrogant American pilots literally giving "fingers" to Russian MIGs. Any viewer sees the pilot characters, who OWN the skies at that time with the most modern and indisputably superior aircrafts in the world.What do we see in "Top Gun: Maverick" of 2022 apart from the undisputable cinematographic superiority shown to us? First of all, the total change of core tonality of the film.... Now the characters are literally scared to death of old(!) Russian anti-aircraft systems and SUKHOI warplanes... Now it's not some "Top Gun" school flights, including "teaching" MIGs how to fly, but some reality check...That is why, all that bravado and the "finger-giving festival" had gone now... Nothing to say about the real development of the combat-approved (not only test) planes in the USAF...And I'm sorry to "bust someone's bubble" or whether someone likes it or not....The Russians definetely didn't waste their time... since their defeat: the USSR collapse and the US victory in the Cold War, declared at the US Congress on January 28,1992 by G. H. W. Bush himself. (Make your own fact-check, if needed)And BTW, those Russian "4++" and 5th generation planes are not some test-ones at present. They are the mass-regular-weapons of the Russian Air Force, whose pilots are not just Hollywood dummies still playing giveaway games so pleasing for the audience... Though, I am sure, every real pilot in the world enjoyed the cinematography of the movie as well as everyone else....So, the Maverick movie is not only the perfect cinematic experience for "Top Gun" fans, but also, as already mentioned, a "reality check" for everyone who is able to think and can add "2 plus 2"... Impeccable unchanged winning on screen is one (very pleasant) thing. Winning in battle including the real-plane-technology-development is totally different one. Because, the deceived in 1991 (with false peace&liberal propaganda) people of the "defeated" USSR have learned their bitter lesson well, I guess...("You have no idea of what I'm talking about, I'm sure..." - as Lester Burnham said in the end of "American Beauty" movie (1999) - "But don't worry... you will... someday..." This quote is none even hint of a threat to anyone; it's just a sincere wish to let a reader grasp someday the point of that Deception since Mr. Gorbachev has "ended the Cold War", sacrificing his country for "World Peace" and "New thinking" brotherhood era...)And again, the acting job of the pilot-team in the movie is the "cutting edge" of the Hollywood industry. No doubt.

reviews.review_title: Just as good as old days
reviews.content: Normally, re-make films do not satisfy me but this one was really great! I highly recommend everybody to watch the first version (1986 made) to connect better with this new one. There are some stories that should be known in order to fully feel and understand the new film. Great one! Recomended.

....Tom Cruise thought it would be irresponsible to make another topgun movie due to it possibly propagandizing war. I guess things have changed. Regardless, the military's own documents show that this movie is pure war propaganda. Sure, there are fans that simply enjoyed the original and are happy to see the second after all these years, and that is legit if it is simply that shallow. But there are plenty of kids and adults that will see this and feel sympathetic to the war machine, and want to take part even. Just saying. I bet no military influence was had on this 8.5 rating, ROFL!!!!! In any case, do a ^&OGLE search for "topgun maverick propaganda", and read the government's documents for yourselves.

reviews.review_title: Take me home or lose me forever
reviews.content: Best film by far this year!!!!I've been twice to see this film and cannot wait to own it. All the characters are fantastic, story brilliant. It had everything a film should have.Well worth the wait. Tom Cruise certainly puts 110% into everything he does.This has to be his best film by far. My only criticism, well not criticism just observation is why does Tom love to run in every film he does. Every time I see him run I can't get out of my head Forrest Gump.Well done to everybody who made this film absolute masterpiece and you should be very proud of yourselves. GO FORREST GO!!!! 👍

Genius pilot Maverick is sidelined by the Navy for insubordination. When a suicide mission arises, he is tapped to train a team of pilots, including Rooster, the son of his former radar tech, who was killed decades prior during a training exercise. Can Maverick pull off the mission and bring his people back safely? Can he overcome the ill feelings of Rooster, who resents him for delaying Rooster's pilot training and failing to save his father?The movie does a great job of evoking the aesthetic of the original. In the opening moments, it hits you with the music from the first movie and sunset-tinted footage of jets taking flight and you immediately feel like you're back in the '80s. The nostalgia is never that high again, but it occasionally throws back, like with the beach football game evoking the beach volleyball game of yore.There is a repetition of the formula, "Maverick needs to breaks the rules to meet his goals and does so and gets away with it because he's a stud." This is done with the demonstration of the stealth fighter's top speed in the beginning, the violation of the minimum flying altitude during the first fly with Rooster, and the proof that the simulated mission could be completed within the ambitious time limit.Major Star Wars vibes from this one, given the similarity between the mission - traversing at high speed a narrow corridor flanked by anti-aircraft guns while under threat of intercept in order to strike a small target with guided missiles - and the trench run against the Death Star.

reviews.review_title: It delivers all that is expected
reviews.content: A near impossible air raid on an illicit nuclear site in a no-name country requires America's best pilots... and someone to teach them how to be better. The mission: bulls-eye a target not much bigger that a womp-rat after a tortuous flight through a heavily defended canyon followed by exiting near-vertically into enemy airspace at a plane-bending 10 G. This sequel to the action-classic 'Top Gun' (1986) is exactly what you would expect: a politically neutered plot that's implausible to the point of ludicrous, good-looking fly-persons, dialogue that is mostly cool bro-banter and alpha dog barking, outstanding cinematography of outstanding (and real) aircraft, and a tousled, grinning age-defying Tom Cruise. Subtle it's not, and painfully predictable (there is not one but two last minute explosive salvations and numerous 'I respect you after-all' epiphanies ), so don't think about it - just enjoy. There are few stars as devoted to the craft as is Cruise and even fewer with the 'pull' make a movie their way.

If you liked the first Top Gun, you'll probably like this one. More Maverick, more fighter jets, more macho pilots, and more cheesiness. It sticks to the formula and was a nice callback to simpler time. It's a fun ride, and the new characters are enjoyable. The fighter jet sequences are amazing. I definitely recommend seeing it on the biggest screen you can. My only issue with the film is that I wish they'd have made a sequel 20 years ago so more of the original characters could've been included.

reviews.review_title: Better than the original - by a long shot
reviews.content: And one of the best movies I've seen in a long time. Writing, direction, casting, and cinematography- all 10/10 highly recommended. Would see it again.

reviews.review_title: I'm so confused... did we all watch the same movie?
reviews.content: What is all this hype about? The movie is full of clichés and banal lines. It is exactly the script you would expect from a movie called "top gun"... it is about guns... on planes. It's predictable. The soundtrack of this movie sounds like the Spotify today's top hits playlist. And the woman love interest. How is she always there? Why is she there? Just so cliché.I am positively surprised by Tom Cruise though. His acting is great in this movie.

reviews.review_title: Hit all the feel good buttons
reviews.content: This movie is so much fun. It has a lot of the elements of a superhero movie in the sense that Maverick is so much larger than life.There are efforts to tell an emotional story and with some success, but what most people will remember is Maverick's total domination of everyone and everything, even when he is getting dressed down by the Admirals. The story with Rooster is nice, but totally predictable. It took me a while to sympathize with him at all because the source of their friction wasn't fully revealed until well into the story. I also wish I understood what was going on with Penny. Was I supposed to remember their history. (I assume not.) There wasn't time, but without fleshing that out more, that part of the story was not flattering to Penny. It was a little too much like another Tom Cruise conquest.

First off, this movie far exceeded the expectations I had for it so that's great. The acting was full of macho cheesy one liners and the whole movie felt like a recruitment add for the navy. But I am please to say the action was a lot of fun and intense then I thought it was going to be. The fact that a lot of the flights where real I think added a lot of suspense that big cgi moves just cannot emulate. I am sure seeing it in the theaters added to the enjoyment for me as the big screen lended itself well to the action.In the end I have it a 7 because I would never see it again but I would recommend it to people who like action movies.

Just a very small and clear review.This movie is so good that it makes the original pale in its comparison.Cannot have any other word for it other than Outstanding. Go to the hall if you havent seen it yet. Dont miss.

I was a bit skeptical when I heard about this sequel. I mean, how are you going to top "Top Gun"?Yes, It's predictable as hell, following a lot of the same template as the first one. We still don't know who they are fighting and why, but that's just like the first one. They really managed to capture that "Top Gun" vibe again.It delivered everything you would expect from this sequel with excellent sound an fighter scenes. On one way you also realize how good the first one was considering Its time, on the other hand also a clear improvement.Definitely a movie worth to see in the cinema. I do however really suggest you'd watch the first one first though. I think It really helps If you know the history of Maverick, Goose and Ace to get the full experience.

Sequels can be hit and miss and this one was a hit. As an individual film it is every bit as good as the original if not better than. The nostalgia element will appeal to the older audience, but the younger audience will be just as happy. I suppose it helps that modern-day films have better cameras and sound equipment to add to the atmosphere.At no point was I bored or twiddling my thumbs as the runtime necessitates quick storytelling. Yes, it's quite similar to the original but is that a bad thing? I don't think it is to be honest in this instance. A film that lives up to the hype.

Justified continuation that is more than crude machisimo. That lady from the first in gone but they have created another as the romantic interest so...whatever.A poignant story of old grudges being reconciled wrapped around an intriguing narrative of disrupting some kind of factory. Before the end it becomes a quite exciting escape adventure cast against sylvanian snow with the quote unquote enemy all around.Again, they're classy about it and manage to be the only thing this year to not be russophobic.There's a fine sense of humor but it did annoy me when they Tom Cruise buy people drinks for a bogus reason.Hardcore fans and casual viewers alike should find this more than passable.

It's rare you get what you pay for at the cinemas. Not this time. I'm going again!I wasn't a fan of the old Top Gun except for the music. Too much love story.But this was good throughout the whole movie.It actually feels like an 80's movie but with stellar effects and sound.

Perfect balance of nostalgia with new storylines. Just when you think you know what is coming next, you don't. Great callbacks all over the place, touching storylines (Iceman!!) and amazing action sequences. I'm sure there was some CGI somewhere, but I don't recall it. Best of all, no woke garbage.... Will see again.

Without a doubt the best movie I've had the pleasure of watching since... ever. It is insane how good Tom Cruise managed to get this movie to be, cause I'm sure he wouldn't agree with starring in anything less.Can't think of anything that was out of place, or wrong in any way. Acting was amazing all around. Directing out of this world. CGIs (i suppose the movie had them..but couldn't really tell), and cinematography just pure genious. The script just wow with references to the original movie executed brilliantly.One of the few sequel that managed to give the original a run for it's money, and end up winning (maybe). I'm torn.

The flight combat scenes are amazing and there are plenty of them which is great. You really get behind the characters during these scenes. The cheesy acting is as good as i remember from the original, and they only really concentrate on the relationship between Cruise and Teller, Conelly is a bit of a side show. However, portraying american fighter jets as the underdogs when they have a larger miltary budget than the whole of europe combined is laughable. Also, they dont generally carry out operations for the good of mankind. Had they been fighting for oil or resources it would have been more believable.

reviews.review_title: Is it fair to say it was better than the first?
reviews.content: I sat down in the cinema with an open mind. So long after, I thought. I sat on the edge of the seat throughout the film. The entire emotional register followed the entire film. It was a simple plot, good characters, really retro humor and fantastic action scenes. In fact, I walked out of the cinema thinking this was one of the better movies I've seen in a long time! 10 out of 10 easy!

reviews.review_title: Feel the Need for Speed with Maverick!
reviews.content: Always thought the original TOP GUN (1986) was a wonderful coming of age story about a young fighter pilot securing his manhood by conquering his past so that he can soar off through the Danger Zone into the future! Director Tony Scott skillfully shoe-horned you into the cockpit with the cocky hot dog aviator Pete Mitchell so that you could get a tense grip on his misgivings and feel his need for speed. There was a great camaraderie between the students in the TOP GUN class and later in scenes at the bar or on the beach. The antics of Tom 'Iceman' Kazansky as played by Val Kilmer and Anthony Edwards as Nick 'Goose' Bradshaw come particularly to mind as memorable. Kelly McGillis as astrophysicist Charlotte 'Charlie' Blackwood is also easy enough on the eyes so that you don't lose that 'lovin' feelin'.Flash-forward then thirty-six years to now. Captain Pete Mitchell is still his authority defying self even though he has been maneuvered into instructing and prepping a group of TOP GUN graduates for what appears to be an impossible mission. Yeah, I know, I get the reference, too. The influence of Tom 'Iceman' Kazansky, now an Admiral in charge of the U. S. Pacific Fleet, swoops in to save Maverick's bacon on more than one occasion when he's in conflict with his superiors over flight strategy and aerial tactics. But the mere fact that Mitchell can walk his talk, or should I say fly past their reasonably assessed objections, proves to be a winning point in more than a couple of suspenseful encounters.This film also makes important points about instructing and teaching as its principal actors soar beyond the horizon. Sometimes the best instructors and teachers do not teach so much what they KNOW as what they ARE. The mission on paper that Maverick prepares his TOP GUN graduates for appears logically undoable. The look of consternation on their faces all say the same thing, such as '-so why are we even talking about this?!'. But Maverick is able to demonstrate through his exceptional flying ability during an unauthorized test run that what they thought was impossible and undoable, is in fact barely possible and doable. All that is left for the TOP GUN graduates is to duplicate his energy frequency as team leader. This is something that both Einstein and Jomo Kenyatta have spoken about albeit from different cultural perspectives, but I am sure would heartily approve. Jaime Escalante's assertion that students will perform up to the level of the teacher's expectation also comes to mind. But there is no doubt that Maverick's expectations of his crew of pilots perhaps raises the bar to places no man or woman has gone before in a cockpit.While the technical wizardry is dazzling and more than confirms the notion that Cinema has more to do with its ancient ancestor The Circus than The Theater, this film also scores a few points in the human dimension with its characters. Maverick's rekindling of his romance with Jennifer Connelly as Penny Benjamin and his poignant reunion with Val Kilmer as now Admiral Tom 'Iceman' Kazansky are particularly elegiac. But his scrambling on the run in and out of harms way with pilot Bradley 'Rooster' Bradshaw as played by Miles Teller, resentful son of the late Nick 'Goose' Bradshaw in a kind of hastily improvised surrogate father and son relationship keeps the narrative justly going at breakneck speed. This mixture of an enlarged human interaction between the characters with state of the art visual and aerial effects and stunts is what makes this sequel an improvement on the original.Where I would qualify my praise for this film has to do with the confrontation of this team of aces with a nearly faceless enemy whom we never get to see grappling with the effects and aftermath of its high-tech victimization. This is something that I groused about regarding PULP FICTION (1994) and THE WOLF OF Wall Street (2013), and is even an issue that can be raised obliquely about THE BIRDMAN OF ALCATRAZ (1962). But many would simply regard this as nitpicking, as these three films certainly have won the love of its audiences around the world. Pete Mitchell, AKA Maverick, an engaging boy-man one notch above a comic book hero as the poster airily suggests, may one day have a Yeager-like catch with his son or not. But Tom Cruise showed the guts to play this character at warp speed, warts and all, and who knows that one day he might take Penny up in his mustang only to barely hear her declare that she's pregnant with his child!Stranger things have been known to happen in the Danger Zone as I am sure you have witnessed.

I watched the movie and never got a single moment of boredom
This movie is recommended to everyone to watch
The first such meeting is with Rear Adm. Chester Cain, a weathered chunk of brass played by Ed Harris, who has an impressive in-movie flight record of his own. (Without "The Right Stuff," there would have been no "Top Gun.") He seems to be telling Pete that the game is over. Thanks to new technology, flyboys like him are all but obsolete.military hierarchy can be a treacherous political business, and Maverick is anything but a politician. In the presence of a superior officer he is apt to salute, smirk and push his career into the middle of the table like a stack of poker chips.Please visit my website link in bio.

Now I totally understand why they didn't sell the movie to streaming services. This has to be seen on the big screen! I have really been hyped for this but boy it delivered. There are not many sequels to big hits that even come close to the original but Maverick does it and to me it outclassed the first one by an order of magnitude. All while still being true to the old movie and even referencing it in all the right ways.Don't miss it in cinema. It's worth the ticket price!
