Just a well done to everyone involved. You can feel it was a Labour of love making this movie. I just wanna watch it again! Bravo! I missed a real old fashioned blockbuster and I got that here and then some!

reviews.review_title: Good movie elevated by excellent climax
reviews.content: Top Gun is a fine example of movie making for the type saying if it's not broken don't fix it. I didn't get the exceptional rave reviews for the movie at first since the start and middle is basically a lot of training and nostalgia and if you are not into nostalgia based on first movie it's nothing exceptional despite the detailed training exercises. It's not a nonstop thrilling movie like the exceptional MI Fallout.Again like first movie role of the love interest serves no real purpose to Maverick as it hardly helps the story. Still it's sweetness and romance is bound to attract the female demo.Where the movie really kicks off is last climatic scene which is probably one of the best exciting action scenes ever done in a movie which will give you goosebumps and Tom Cruise is exceptional in it. It escalates the movie from a average movie to a very good movie and leaves you happy, entertained and satisfied. It's a movie that worships the hero and gives the happy ending he deserves going off to sunset with the girl beating the villains in a exciting spectacular fashion which shows you don't need to kill the hero or do something different to please audience. I'm looking at you No Time to Die which messed up badly trying to make Bond something he's not and ended up been worst divisive Bond movie in recent times.So let this be a good note to filmmakers that you can worship the hero and have a happy ending while giving a great movie as well. Top Gun Maverick is a movie that must be seen in theater for sure.

reviews.review_title: Was really expecting better, come on Tom...!
reviews.content: I feel like I'm betraying my childhood here.Like all teens I loved the original, but lets be honest it was a pretty ordinary war movie propped up by a couple of rising stars, a huge score and jet fighters like we'd never seen before. It worked and it's a classic.It looks like they really intended to do more in this one but ended up just going through the motions.The action was great, flying sequences are out of this world, however the acting was twice as bad as the original (and that's saying something) the story was odd and fragmented and then poorly executed.A lot of it was reminiscent of the cheap top gun knock offs from years gone past.You will enjoy it but don't expect that old feeling.

reviews.review_title: I could watch it, again and again and again.
reviews.content: Although, yeah I love both war/military movies and super sonic fighter jets, this film has knocked it out of the ball park!The acting was excellent, especially by some of these lesser known actors and actresses, and the ageless Tom Cruise was at his brilliant best. He is an absolute master craftsman. The addition of his personally owned P51D Mustang fighter was a nice touch too.The only minor let down, very minor, I would have liked to see a bit more of Val Kilmer (aka Ice Man) in this sequel.The cinematography and scenes shot in the cockpits of the aircraft are absolutely sensational. You can definitely tell it is real life scenery and not CGI or green screen. If you liked the first film in this franchise, then you will definitely love this latest addition. Best movie I have seen for a long time. Can't wait to see it again.

reviews.review_title: One of the best legacy sequels
reviews.content: The composition of each shot, the stellar cast, and incredible flight sequences make this a must see in theaters. This is one of the best legacy sequels ever made and my personal favorite film of 2022 thus far.

Just seen this in the Imax and was very pleasantly surprised at how good it is. This is the kind of movie that makes going to the cinema a great day out for the family. My 11 year old loved it and held my hand tightly through the brilliant crazy jet flying scenes. Also hats off to the writers for not only tying in old story lines with a clever song monologue but for also giving us a brilliant high impact movie without any unnecessary sex , violence, swearing or killing. Just a breath of fresh air and adrenaline rush for the whole family to enjoy.

Took my whole family. The original made hubs want to join the Navy (he ultimately did not), and son loves the original soundtrack. Everyone loved this one too. As others mentioned, the aerial sequences are amazing. But at the heart of this is a father/surrogate father - son story. No surprise it worked, with Kosinski at the helm (who did, successfully I thought, the underrated Tron: Legacy - also a father/son film). Very well scripted, and story moves along with pace. All the old folks in my peer group loved it, but so did my teens. Enjoy!

reviews.review_title: A sequel to a film that is a masterpiece!
reviews.content: Mostly movie sequels are worse than their predecessor and resort to the nostalgia of their predecessor to get as much money out of the pockets as possible. With Top Gun: Maverick, however, it's a different story. The film is not only good, but a true masterpiece. No real villain or bad guy, just Maverick, planes and emotions. Finally, another film that doesn't politicize everything to tell "tHe MeSsAgE". That's what makes cinema fun. Here's a film A film where you can see an exciting story for two hours through a window into another reality. This movie should serve as a reference for many filmmakers and also show that action can be done without CGI (this is a message directed at Marvel). You can think what you want about Tom Cruise, but there is only one opinion about this film: Simply wonderful.

reviews.review_title: Son of a bish, they did it!
reviews.content: Watched it 2 days ago. It's beyond impressive. Legitimately one of the best action movies I've ever seen. The third act is incredible. I loved how the movie really drills the route into you, so when they do it for real you can follow along perfectly without characters explaining exactly which part they're at.

Ahhhhhh a movie which just tries to entertain. Such a breath of fresh air unfortunately.Similar story but nice little twists n turns from original.We all walked out, with a smile on our faces n small tear in our eye.

reviews.review_title: For me it is a no.
reviews.content: I didn't like the first Top Gunn as a film, this second one the same, a tribute to guns and violence that I don't like. We are not quite there. Top Gun is not for me sorry.

Top Gun Maverick is the cheesiest film Ive seen in years. I guess it was intentional and they wanted to give it an 80's filmmaking vibe but it's a bit much.The unnamed and never seen enemy kind of irritated me. I feel like you need to know who the bad guy is. Even if it's a fictional country, we need someone to rally against.The final action sequences are solid and bump the rating up a couple of notches.

For the record I was born in 1997 and I didn't watch the original Top Gun until 2022. With iffy pacing and 80's corniness, I had a great time and it had more heart than I expected.MAVERICK on the other hand was beautiful.Great score, amazing cinematography, Tom Cruise, Miles Teller and everyone else did a great job. Unexpected STAR performance from Glen Powell.From start to finish I had goosebumps. Please see this in a theater, and if you do try to see it in IMAX or EMAX. Whatever type of local MAX you have lol.Side-note: Val Kilmer is in this movie, and if you're a fan of his you know he can't really speak now. But this film and production team handled the Val situation very well and professionally.This movie will stand the test of time as does Tom Cruise and Jennifer Conelly.10/10.

Spoiler warning provided when there are, rest is freeI decided to watch this movie after seeing its high ratings. I hadn't watched the original, but I had seen people say you don't need to see the original before seeing this movie, so decided to roll with it. Turns out not only do you need to watch the original to get any enjoyment out of this movie, but you need to watch it 30 years in the past too. I was thoroughly disappointed.The movie is about jet fighters. It's supposed to be a "turn off your brain and enjoy" kind of movie. I'd imagine whoever wrote it would know this too, but the pull of mediocre drama and soulless romance must've overcome their rational thinking as the movie is full of that stuff. Save for the initial action scene that exists for the sole purpose of preventing the audience from walking out {1}, the first quarter of the movie is pretty much entirely human drama. So instead of watching jet stunts, you get to watch Tom Cruise being disliked by everybody around him for no reason other than to make them like him at the end.Spoilers in the following paragraph.Higher ranking officers disliking Tom Cruise has no effect on the story whatsoever. Actually, NOTHING in the movie has any effect on anything. Characterless pilots go on a demonstrably possible mission to destroy the non-operational uranium processing plant of an unnamed country, and nothing surprising happens until they're done. Maverick even predicts the patrol planes. That's it. No tension. No backup plan (even though he's totally not going on the mission, it's not like Tom Cruise is going to fail right?). Just a single off screen death that gets overwritten in 3 scenes but none within the main cast, not even a lasting injury. Maverick and the mustache dude apparently have a resentful history that the movie could make its emotional and dramatic focal point, but it just has to also have infighting within the pilots, and also a conflict between maverick and the commanders, and what movie is complete without a rushed romantic subplot? Instead of having a single fleshed out conflict and main duo/trio, the movie takes its sweet time making caricatures of amazing and totally interesting characters such as the guy that can't fail, the jerk, the love interest, the girl, the black guy, the Bob (get it? His name is also his callsign🤣), jerk commanders #1 and #2... Anyways, even after the first arc of boredom the story still failed to match my heavily readjusted expectations.But that's all irrelevant because as I said, this is a braindead type movie. So long as it has good action scenes and the speakers are loud enough to wake you up when they begin, it's a good movie. Thankfully the action scenes and sound design have a special something that makes seeing them in theater indistinguishable from seeing them on TV, so if you haven't seen the movie you can just watch compilations on social media without sacrificing anything.In case it isn't obvious, I'm not very impressed by the action. It is admirable for the actors (or just Tom Cruise?) to learn how to pilot jets, but that adds nothing to what you see on the screen. In the age of cgi sci-fi movies, real life jets doing almost real life stunts didn't do it for me. Not only is there no oomph factor, but the action that exists isn't captivating neither. I would pass out if I were in a real fighter jet. All the movie needed to do was to convey that to me. In fact, I think that was the number one thing this movie was supposed to do. But that doesn't happen when the camera is always pointed at pilots and the pilots aren't showing much emotion. I get that they're concentrating and all but this is a movie. It needs to do something to give the feelings of speed and excessive g-force. Numbers on screens don't count.Well-made action wouldn't be enough to save the movie, but at least it'd live up to its premise. To be a good movie that deserves its current 8.6 (!!) rating on IMDB (and 96%-99% RT scores!!!) it'd need to have some resemblance of tension, and to have tension it'd need to have an actual story with actual characters. It's astonishing how safe this movie plays with its "story". It goes in a straight line as long as it can and only diverts when...well never. And it's even more mindblowing that there are people that like this. It's like the fighter jet footage and Tom Cruise fan club ran out of things to watch and this movie was a saving grace for them.The bright side to all this is that I saw the movie on discount day and got to keep 25 cents in my pocket. Which seems to be more than the story budget this movie had. At least it has real jets tho 2/10{1}: Spoiler: The fact that nobody talks about the supersonic prototype plane for the rest of the movie makes me seriously think that scene was an afterthought. If you show a gun in a movie, it has to go off. If you show a prototype plane in the beginning of a movie, it has to do something by the end (besides blowing up in an extremely zoomed out shot). Unless you already wrote the entire plot that is.

Better than the original Tony Scott film (MHSRIP). Love Tony and what he's done for cinema. This film has all the right ingredients as we all rated it highly. It is a blockbuster with enough panache for an art film just wonder if it will get nominated for golden globes and even the academy awards. Miles Teller has not been exciting to watch since Whiplash. But here he brought the hig guns with his reputation. However Tom Cruise Mapother carries the whole thing on screen. He is magnanimous, debonair and with him at 59 at the time this was filmed takes the lead and the story to another level. This project was a worthwhile wait. I loved the action sequences, the acting, the music, cameo roles by Ed Harris and Val Kilmer made contributions to the overall character arcs for MAVERICK to get back into Top Gun as an instructor, rekindle his love for Penny, remedy the past and again lead the charge into a heroic display with an aerial dogfight that outdoes the first Top Gun film. The 5th Generation fighter jets swung the advantage towards the mysterious terror state developing a nuclear program. Our heroes lucky escape again just goes to show that the USN is very resilient. I thought Glen Powell brought about a resurgent arrogance of ICEMAN as HANGMAN.This is a must watch!

reviews.review_title: This movie should be considered for a best picture Oscar.
reviews.content: We waited 36 years for this movie and it was worth the wait. I know the Academy usually nominates fluffy, intellectual, eclectic movies for best picture but this is one of the best movies I've seen in decades. Dare I say perfect. An adrenalin rush that will leave everyone happy in the end. A visual masterpiece with a compelling story.

I was born in the 80s and have a HUGE sentiment for the original Top Gun! Some of the songs from the original still give me goosebumps remembering the iconic scenes so I was a bit anxious before seeing this one. Will it be another complete miss? Butchering the original (like the remake of Roald Dahl's Witches for example). It did not! It's not perfect - it often tries a bit to hard referencing the original, some stupid one liners, some cliches - of course.But overall - absolutely amazing. The flying sequences blow your mind! There is drama, there will be tears, it will keep you on the edge of your seat.I am rewatching the original and seeing the Maverick again!

As of today, I'm 51. I saw the first one in a tiny theater (compared to yours in the US) in my country, Luxembourg. Back then, I was in awe.TGM now: I was in double-awe (bad English, I know, don't know how to enhance it).The pace, the cast, the flight scenes, the score... What can I add to continue?Personally, for me, one the best and brightest for 2022, for sure. I'd given 12 out of 10 if possible.You've read the story, no need to repeat it here. And I will spoil exactly zippo.Greetings from Luxembourg.

Entertaining and fun, and amazing airplane action (which btw is not CGI) but a bit too predictable if you have seen the original. Of course there is a plane which crashes during training, Maverick get thrown out but comes back, he will fly the mission and get shot down.Fun fact: The actor who plays Goose's son is about 6-7 years younger than Goose's son would have been - born 1 year after the Original was made).

Better than the first. I highly recommend seeing the first before this one. Brings back great memories. Much better than the first: more action, Tom at his finest, and Val Kilmer...old dogs are still the best lol. Highly recommend this one.

Could say a lot, but will only say , a job well done on every level. Recommended see on IMAX for full experience. The actual real work, transcended to picture on the most realistic thng you will see, a digital trained eyes little will find to point..
Even not having a epic soundtrack as the original classic, doesnt bother at all, because you get glued to the seats on the intensity given on action scenes.Also have the comic reliefs time to time,very carefullly planted.A long awaited sequel, that will not disapoint.

Love or hate Tom Cruise, you must admire his efforts to heighten the authenticity of Paramount Pictures' long-awaited sequel "Top Gun: Maverick," co-starring Val Kilmer, Ed Harris, and Miles Teller. Cruise stands front and center for making "Maverick" not only entertaining but also as realistic as possible. For example, when the pilots are in the cockpit, the actors and the actresses are actually airborne! They're riding in the rear seat, typically occupied by the Radar Intercept Officer (RIO), while an actual Naval aviator flies the supersonic Boeing F/A-18 Super Hornet. The cast weather genuine G-forces. Ultimately, whether or not you enjoy "Top Gun: Maverick," the movie serves as both a triumphant Naval recruiting endeavor as well as an example that touts the Navy's combat capability. Primarily a mission-oriented actioneer with minimal comic relief, "Top Gun: Maverick" depicts intrepid Navy aviators dispatched to obliterate a target which poses a threat to world security. Incidentally, Paramount Pictures never reveal the identity of the "rogue" adversary whose uranium enrichment plant is the target. Nevertheless, the signs are unmistakable that the enemy is Iranian since they're the only country which still flies F-14 fighters. Pay close attention to the hopelessly, far-fetched "Maverick" finale if you've any doubts.In his informative SLATE. COM article, "A Quite Serious Military Analysis of Top Gun: Maverick's Tactics," aviation expert Fred Kaplan ridicules "the whole thing" as "crazy." According to Kaplan, "F/A-18s don't have the range to pull off this stunt, especially at fuel-draining high speeds. But more than that, it would have been much easier simply to send a couple of B-2 bombers at very high altitude-beyond the reach of the enemy's surface-to-air missiles-and fire a handful of GPS-guided smart bombs. Or if there was a chance the SAMs could shoot down a B-2, their radars could be blinded or tricked in a cyberattack." Alas, armchair aviators need not feel cheated. Nobody should confuse Hollywood heroics with real-life heroism. Basically, Kaplan's sensible scenario wouldn't have drummed up much drama. Audiences want to ride the edge of their seats while the heroes risk their necks. This is where the Gee-Whiz forces of adventurous storytelling come into focus! Cruise, Kosinski, and Oscar-winning lenser Claudio Miranda of "Life of Pi" (2012) deserve kudos for hurling us headlong into the skies for a tumultuous rollercoaster ride of a lifetime! The only thing more sizzling than real life is spectacular storytelling, and "Maverick" keeps its audiences clinging to a wing and a prayer throughout its' brisk 131-minutes of PG-13 rated havoc!Insubordinate Navy Captain Pete Mitchell (Tom Cruise) is the only aviator qualified to train the best pilots for the rigors they'll encounter on this critical mission. Admiral Tom 'Iceman' Kazansky (Val Kilmer of "True Romance") runs interference for Mitchell. Were it not for 'Iceman,' Mitchell would not have been ordered back to Top Gun. One of Mitchell's contentious superiors, Rear Admiral Chester 'Hammer' Cain (Ed Harris of "Appaloosa") roasts him not only for his aerial antics but also for his failure to wrangle a promotion. Irritably, Cain complains, "Thirty-plus years of service! Combat medals! Citations! Only man to shoot down three enemy planes in the last 40 years! Yet you can't get a promotion, you won't retire, and despite your best efforts, you refuse to die! You should be at least a two-star Admiral by now, yet here you are. Captain." When he arrives at Top Gun, Mitchell thinks he'll be leading the mission, too. Admiral Beau 'Cyclone' Simpson (Jon Hamm of "The Town") crushes any such hopes. Simpson makes it clear to Mitchell that the latter is the last man he would have chosen for this assignment.Naturally, "Top Gun Maverick" bristles with callbacks to its predecessor. Kilmer and Cruise are the only original cast members to reprise their roles. The opening aircraft carrier scene with crews hustling to launch jets ranks as a nostalgic homage to Tony Scott's unforgettable "Top Gun." "TRON: Legacy" director Joseph Kosinski designed this opening scene to recapture the essence of the first film. One aviator struggling desperately to make the cut for the mission is Lieutenant Bradley 'Rooster' Bradshaw (Miles Teller of "Only the Brave"), the son of Mitchell's former Radar Intercept Officer (RIO), Lieutenant, J. G. Nick "Goose" Bradshaw. "Rooster" bears a grudge against Mitchell. Pete refused to recommend him for the Naval Academy, torpedoing Bradley's plans to become an aviator. Nevertheless, Pete had a legitimate reason. Meantime, Kosinski recycles flashbacks of Goose (Anthony Edwards of "Zodiac") and his wife Carol (Meg Ryan of "The Women") cavorting with Mitchell. Furthermore, the sequel draws on dialogue exchanges about an original "Top Gun" character that we finally meet in the flesh, Admiral Benjamin's daughter Penny (Jennifer Connelly of "Blood Diamond") and her relationship with Pete.Not surprisingly, the attack on the uranium plant in "Top Gun: Maverick" generates heart-thumping suspense. The pilots must wing their way along a meandering trench, like the one in the Clint Eastwood warplane epic "Firefox" (1982), to avoid surface-to-air missiles. Afterward, they must soar over the crest of a towering mountain range, plunge precipitously toward a barren arena of flatlands that conceal their underground target, drop their ordnance, and then throttle up for a vertical, spine-tingling ascension over an even higher mountain! Clearing this craggy gauntlet, they wind up exposing themselves to both missiles and enemy aircraft. Mind you, Mitchell has barely three weeks to train them. Our heroes must complete the flight through that treacherous trench in 2 minutes flat! Anybody who craves aerial combat epics will spot the resemblance between "Top Gun: Maverick" and "633 Squadron" (1963) with its suicidal bombing run where a squadron of plywood Mosquito fighter bombers assailed a heavily defended Nazi factory. Happily, "Top Gun: Maverick" emerges as a charismatic escapade about gallant aviators, not a tragic World War II epic about heroic pilots who sacrificed their lives to pull off an impossible mission.

Nostalgic, respectful to its predecessor, A great mix of old and new cast to support TC, a believable and touching plot, sensitive to modern day warfare, action scenes that literally made me hang on to the edge my seat and a leading actor who completely and utterly TAKES THE ENTIRE THEATRES BREATH AWAY!!!Love him or hate him - there is not one other actor who could ever play Maverick and sizzle on screen as him. He took 36 years to do it - because he didn't want to damage the first masterpiece - and my god he knocked it out of the park.Don't overthink it, don't pick it to pieces and just enjoy a movie that cinemas across the world must be so grateful for.Take a bow Tom Cruise - this a masterpiece that will keep us originals indulgently happy AND well and truly reel in a new generation of fans with eyes wide open to its brilliance.Top Gun Maverick is not only a brilliant sequel - it's a franchise immortalised.

reviews.review_title: This is the greatest IMAX movie experience you can imagine
reviews.content: Yes I am Tom Cruise's biggest fan but beyond that you MUST see this on the big screen. I saw this IMAX and I cannot overstate how jaw-dropping INCREDIBLE the camerawork in this movie is. This is true 21st century cinema. Do yourself a favor and watch this on the biggest screen possible.

It's so very good. I absolutely appreciated the time and attention the writers, directors, and producers took on this. They understood the assignment. They had a 30 year gap to span and still make it relevant for new generations today while also giving recognition to the loyal fans of the original. They hit it out the park. So many moments filled with big smiles on my face because I was just so happy they'd remember little details of the first and blend them well into this story. It's as good as the first.

Giving it a 7 just for the entertainment value. No real depth to any character, theses young actors are as charming as donuts, no sexyness allowed these days apparently. John Hamm has the presence of a sea cucumber, couldn't they just have Ed Harris as the admiral. C- to the casting department. This movie, with all its faults, is still better than 99% of the generic, woke garbage that's released these days.
A hugely fun and highly satisfying sequel. Superb action, great pacing, and cleverly weaves in elements from the original. You would need a heart of stone not to enjoy it.

First of all great applause to Tom cruise and team for making a sequel to much beloved Top Gun that too after these many years.There aren't many films which makes the audience engage so much as if they are in the film. Both Top Gun made this with ease.The jet flying scenes and the mission scenes are so engaging that audience might actually tensed to see what happens next.Definitely a theatrical film which deserves much more love and appreciation.Not many films are filmed with this much of passion towards the outcome instead of using CGI crew went into real life sceneries which is insane.It would have really difficult for actors to film their portion by themselves really hats off to the crew.

Came in with low expectations but left feeling nostalgic and satisfied. Great flick! The flying scenes are absolutely incredible! I haven't been in a theater to see a movie since early 2020 because of Covid and there really wasn't anything that pulled me to a theater. This movie did and was well worth it! Go see this movie people!

If you love the original Top Gun, I will say, hands down, Top Gun Maverick is even better! One of the best movies I've seen in years! And the scene between Maverick and Iceman was very very moving. There were satisfying twists I didn't see coming, and nods to the original which really made the movie overall a great night out. Movies are back!!! This one has to be seen on the big screen.

Even if you over hype this it'll still hit anyones expectations!Nostalgia points 10/10
(The Feels 10/10 side category)
(the score/soundtrack)
Plane Jet Space craft Movie 10/10
Tom Cruise movie 10/10
(Jumping on Oprahs couch was a 0/10 for me)
Zero Wokeness 10/10
2022 Movie 10/10
Predictability 8/10
🍿 🏆 NGN stamp of approvalNever have I given a film w these marks 💪🏽

reviews.review_title: Unnecessary hype, not an Oscar worthy
reviews.content: Had seen the movie on OTT, It is descent, but action sequences with fighter jet would have been much better. Emotional acting by Tom cruise is not upto the mark. The action sequences were not intriguing enough. Less detailing on action sequences. Tom cruise looked less like a leader, not sure what exactly he had taught his team, nothing was clear on his teachings much, it was lacking on detailing. Visual effects would have been better. The plot was not intriguing. Tom cruise looked much older, and old enough to drive a fighter jet, and there is no energy on display. I could not see the glimpse of mettle which normally any United States Air force pilot would have.And definitely it is not oscar worth..

Going to the movie theater has been one of those things for me recently where I am truly conflicted. The convenience of sitting at home and enjoying from the comfort of your place is so nice. However, this film made me feel like I was 10 years old again and made me wonder why I'm not seeing more films in the theater. I got goosebumps a few times and it is one of those experiences you simply don't want to end. One of those rare occasions where people clap, families aren't arguing but talking about their favorite parts, and everyone walks out of the theater with a smile on their face. A push to bring more of our American woes and political issues on screen has been dreadful and films like this that allow us to escape from reality for just a couple of hours make it all worth it. Tom Cruise is the man and deserves all the praise for this project. Mach 10/10 baby!

reviews.review_title: Top Gun Maverick..what a blast, edge of the seat experience, Tom Cruise Aces It!
reviews.content:
Top Gun Maverick is a movie that needs to be seen in the big screen cinema to do it the justice it deserves.Tom Cruise reprises his role as Pete "Maverick" Mitchell in a fast paced well written story and he really aces it in his character acting.In some ways a sequel to the original Top Gun but with new characters, this is a better story with no boring bits with less lovey dovey mush and more edge of the seat action.CGI and VFX is fantastic and you feel like you are in an F18 cockpit with the pilots as they dog fight, fly through treacherous valleys almost scrapping the ground, dodging mountains, holding on by the seat of your pants.I rate this film 10 out 10 for story telling, acting and visual effects and you leave the theater at the end with the feeling "wow what a rush!'
One of the best movies of 2022 and a better follow up to Top Gun with no boring bits, action galore and some tongue in cheek humour go see it and have an enjoying time out, don't wait for it to come out on Blu ray, needs to be seen on the big screen and loud to knock your socks off!

I've watched Top gun once many years ago in my teens, so i didnt go into this film with rose tinted glasses.This sequel was better than the original and the fact that all this footage was filmed in real planes makes it even more impressive. In the times of CGI it was refreshing to see practical effects. I personally am not the biggest fan of Tom cruise, but he killed it as Maverick with an excellent performance by him. My partner also thoroughly enjoyed it despite not seeing the first film, it definitely helps if you have seen the first film but you don't need to see it to watch this.This film is simply incredible, Tom cruise knows how to make an action film. Films like this make it worth going back to the cinema.

reviews.review_title: This is how to do a sequel years later
reviews.content: This film has just the same right amount of nostalgia mixed with new aspects and a better story than the original. It's a breath of fresh air in a see a movie like this on this scale, that isn't a comic book movie. I'm kinda burned out on comic book movies and wish cinema was more like the 80's and 90's. This film is a must see in theatres.
This film is definitely one of the best films of 2022. Start to finish, this is a master piece. The action is spectacular, this is definitely a big screen experience.
I am truly not a Tom Cruise fan.And lots in the film is just technical nonsense.But the acting, the directing and the digital stuff were just great.

reviews.review_title: The grown up version of Top Gun.
reviews.content: Maverick is a film where the writing takes a more serious swipe at Naval Aviation even though everyone knows Air Force pilots are far superior 🛩 😎. The writing also adds real substance to the character Pete Mitchell-Maverick. No spoilers here because it is a film that has to be experienced. And with Jerry Bruckheimer you will feel it! Tom Cruise shows why he is one of the worlds most bankable actors. You add the likes of Jennifer Connelly and Ed Harris and along with Val Kilmers touching role and you have the makings of something rather special and terrific. And let us not forget the rest of the actors and actresses in this movie. Their roles and performances are nothing less than superb! The decision to have these actors actually go through some of the training pays off. There should be many more of these rare breeds of film where the actors do such a top notch job.I grew watching Tom Cruise movies as well as Jennifer Connelly. I also can tell you that Jerry Bruckheimer is a huge selling point for me. Jerry Bruckheimer rarely let's you down and when you watch his films you actually feel it as well. Tony Scott was great but Jerry Bruckheimer like Tom Cruise and Jennifer Connelly as well as Ed Harris are all at the top of their perspective crafts.Tom Cruise being an accomplished pilot helps his role here and it runs off on the others around him. Ed Harris is one of my favorites. I place him up alongside of actors like Sir Anthony Edward's. Btw Jennifer Connelly is the perfect actress to take the place next to Tom Cruise. Talk about her timeless beauty as well as her acting capabilities which makes her a Top Gun in her own respects. Yes I know she is married...Dang it! Haha!Val Kilmer, make no mistake this is and will be considered one of his most iconic performances.I have gone back a few times and watched it again. It is extremely rare to watch the same film multiple times and still come away with both something newly discovered and yet feeling like it was your first experience .I did see the first Top Gun when it came out. And although it was good.. It also wasn't great. It kinda stuck with me as another one of so many action movies of its time. Just enough to keep you from falling asleep and you walked away with some conversational pieces. In my opinion the original Top Gun was well kinda like Days of Thunder. Great action and a ever so unnecessary love story thrown in. Maverick on the other hand blended its story lines beautifully .All I can say without spoilers is if you haven't seen it you should. If you are expecting just another Top Gun then you will be beyond surprised. This movie as far as I am concerned brought in the right target audience. A more rounded and mature audience. May I say we are great judges of character. Age does that , we have the experience. And some might say a far superior intellect! Haha! Just kidding kiddos.Also I gave this a perfect 10. Reason why? It far exceeded my expectations. And I really couldn't find fault . At least not as a action movie or even as a yucky love story. Military aviators can tell you personally have a bit of fun and laughs at the same time. And yet it didn't disappoint.Go watch , and have a blast! Last bit of advise. Go to a theater that has one kick @$$ sound system . 😎

reviews.review_title: Perfect! Better than the original. Rare thing
reviews.content: I've just seen it with my 17yo son at IMAX. I cried, laughed, felt motivated and nostalgic. Exceeded my expectations. I'm so happy now! Congratulations to Tom Cruise for keeping it respectful. Such a joy of a film. It's contrasting so much with the murky movies that are made these days. Well done!

Wow, see this movie. An epic we so desperately needed. In the days of short attention spans, the sight of a 2+ hour run time will make you groan at first. This is a sequel like no other.Action packed with great back stories and the perfect touch of comedy. Beautiful visuals & likeable cast that you want to root for all the way through.Not as predictable as most movies seem. You can't leave the Hangman docked, cmon! Is what I was yelling out. I love the new pilots call signs, just as cool as the original.Maverick shows you the true meaning of old school cool & earns the respect he deserves. Especially in the F-14, an older, but still totally badass plane.Young or older, give yourself the liberty of enjoying this thrill ride, and have a laugh or two.
Great blend of nostalgia, great action and story. One of the most awesome, suspenseful thrillers that have hit the theaters in a while. This is a MUST SEE.

I didn't watch the first episode, but it didn't influence me to have a great experience of the movie.The movie has a good balance between talking part and acting part, even if you guess right the plot of movie, you still won't be disappoint by the story.

reviews.review_title: You don't think, you just do
reviews.content: I never seen anything like this movie before. The story is original and the cinematography is insane. Although it's best to watch this after watching top gun, because there are a lot of references they drop from the first movie.

Worth every second of the 36 years since Top Gun.This movie delivers on all levels and does so flawlessly without having to fill in much of what occurred between then & now.Now let's get to the true star of Top Gun Maverick, the in flight scene's...WOW, TRULY INCREDIBLE!

Top Gun Maverick joins the ranks of The Empire Srikes Back, Aliens, T2, and The Dark Knight as a sequel that surpasses the original film. I recommend seeing it on the biggest and loudest your screen cineplex has to offer. I expect it to recieve Acadmy Award nominations/ wins for Cinematography and other techinal categories at the Oscars next year.

I swear i don't understand all the hype, maybe because i saw it on 55 oled lg tv ??? It didn't feel like IMax experience but the movie was ok not good or masterpiece level but watchable that's it nothing more or less.

He gets what we want. We want escapism and to have a fun time at the movies. I love how this is actually realistic too. It could've been some typical 2022 female empowerment nonsense. Yet instead there's only one women which is the reality of the Air Force. Are there women? Sure. But NOT MANY. There's no forced messages here. Just pure fun. Seriously miss movies like this and bravo to Cruise for giving it to us again.
Everything about the movie was amazing. The storyline, the soundtrack, and the actors. I highly recommend going to see it. Everyone who worked on the film did an amazing job.

reviews.review_title: This is probably one of the best cinematic films I've ever seen.
reviews.content: So far this film has done better than the original which doesn't usually happen when a sequel is produced. That says something.I love how they took their time with writing the story, it was so well done and such an incredible plot. The film was delayed like 2 years if I recall, I remember watching the trailer years ago. But I can tell you that it was well worth the wait.Everything about the flying, cast, cinematography and visuals were stunning and mind blowing. I don't think any film will be able to recreate such a masterpiece. The camera work was perfect and I had never felt so immersed in my life!The screen time didn't feel short either and what I love is how the second half was un-predictable and not expected what so ever. My heart was racing and the thrill feeling was incredible. My friends Apple Watch was literally warning him to lower his heart rate!!!!Overall, It's a masterpiece. A well made film that I would happily watch anytime. Yea Avengers Endgame is good but not compared to this cinematic experience. Top Gun: Maverick definitely deserves higher reviews.
Tom cruise proves once again that age needs no boundaries. Top gun is definitely Top gun. Mind blowing stunts.Maverick Character speaks of its own. Aerial sequences are great. Recommended to watch.

I still haven't seen Top Gun. Yes I know pathetic right. But this film is amazing. From start to finish it's a great movie. It's really great. You won't be disappointed. You realise just how much work Tom Cruise puts in to his movies when you watch making of Top Gun maverick which are on you tube. He puts 100% into this. So many sequels to old movies don't work. This one does and it has a stellar cast. Go watch it . Even if you haven't seen the first one !😲
Pretty cringe and corny at times but the action was fun. Over rated for sure since there is very little depth. A fun watch for the family on a quite Sunday but don't expect a complex story.

It's mind blowing. Top Gun is bank for the buck. Tom Cruise's range is undeniable. The man is truly special. Top Gun Maverick doesn't ride on the nostalgia. It's on it's own. It is so so so amazing. I cried at the ending. It's one of the best action movies y'all will ever watch. It's a love letter to aviation. To cinema. Tom Cruise's dedication to this craft is unparalleled. This movie is a theatre experience. The sound design of this movie is so amazing. It'll invest you as a viewer. The cinematography is unlike any other movie. As the name suggests, Maverick is the sole focus of this movie but the supporting cast is amazing too. Miles Teller and Monica Barbaro. Jennifer Connelly is a smokeshow. The exceptional action cope up for the inconveniences of this film. The intro of this movie is iconic. Top Gun Maverick is better than the original. It has high octane, informed and stylized Dog Fights. You wil not believe Tom is turning 60 this year. It is awesome. AWESOME!

WOW...Iam so grateful Joseph Kosinski made this movie. Very nice soundtrack, which was inserted well. Picture and sound harmonized super in the cinema. Watching it there, a must!Miles Teller, the right choice to portray Goose son acted well and gave the film a special and youthful touch. The story itself is nothing new or impressive but the realization was perfectly perfect. There were many parallels to "Top Gun" which shouldnt disturb the spectator but much more connect the two movies and they did it in a fantastic and nostalgic way. The love story falls short, what doesnt bother me personally and also they were few jokes that were well inserted and successfully arrived at the audience. It is a great action movie which is entertaining every time I watch it. Truly deserved 10/10.

reviews.review_title: One of the most fun theater experiences in a long time
reviews.content: Preface, I have not seen the first movie. A few of our friends gave us the spark notes version at dinner an hour before. That's all you really need to not be lost.Top Gun had no business being as good as it was. I had low expectations going into the theater, but was thoroughly impressed. In a world of CGI monstrosities, Top Gun comes across as genuine and refreshing. Everything feels so real.... because 99% of it is. The actors' and production team's commitment to the vision is remarkable, and it comes across in the end product. This is a movie worth seeing multiple times in theaters.

Grew up watching the original and the sequel absolutely does not disappoint! So glad they incorporated Harold Faltermeyer's epic score. It was fantastic fun and completely ticks the boxes for fans old and new.

I haven't seen the first part, I kept putting it off, after watching the first part, it's worth picking up this film right away and just enjoying it, because the acting team and the images shown, the consistency of the story, the film is really captivating and exciting and there's no time to get bored.both parts of the TOPGUN film are closely related, this only strengthens the sentiments, but the sequel surpasses its predecessor in everything.

Definitely the movie I was hoping to watch in a last few years! Worth waiting and watch it on the Big Screen! The first movie in theory didn't need any sequel, but the job was so well done that the sequel was definitely better than the first one after 30 years gap! For sure the best movie in the last years! Congratulations to all those who were involved in this project!
I felt like more of a man after watching this movie. Absolutely unbelievable. First time in a long time a sequel has lived up to, if not exceeded, the legacy of a classic original.

This is the closest thing I'll get to seeing an Ace Combat movie. The valley mission, straight out of an Ace Combat game, is portrayed in all its dangerous glory with high G-forces, practical effects, sunlit cinematography and thrilling training sequences that show just how much is at stake. As a cinematic experience, these action-packed flight sequences make the audience feel like they're right there in the cockpit and that anything could happen.However, this isn't an Ace Combat movie, it's a Top Gun movie, so how does it compare with the original? It blows its predecessor right out of the water with a more compelling character arc that continues right from the original story but adds so much more. The legacy of Goose's death is something that weighs heavily on Maverick as he has to tutor his son Rooster. The whole film is about Maverick coming to grips with how to protect and encourage Rooster, all while doing his duty to the overall mission. Compared to the thin machismo of the first Top Gun movie, Maverick is a more compelling and original experience.

reviews.review_title: Good sequel, but in the end too inconsequential, and dumb.
reviews.content: Tom Cruise, and the rest of the crew, went out of their way to give us an unparalleled amount of realism when it comes to parts of the movie recorded in the cockpit, and then they did complete 180*, and created a story, and air combat which are idiotic, and borderline science fiction.The story itself is fundamentally flawed, because the whole story is propped on an idea that the enemy uses GPS jamming, so the target can't be hit by GPS guided munition. OK... so how the hell did enemy radars which guided the AA missiles were working if the area is flooded with jamming signals? Or how did E-2 Hawkeye had not only no problem performing overwatch, but also had tactical map working via GPS with all SAM sites locations being displayed without any issues? As far as movie goes, there was so jamming of any sort in the area where they were attacking.What was much better was the level of interactions between the characters, and the amount of respect being paid to the first Top Gun. This part I enjoyed completely.In the end, I did enjoy the movie, but it could be so much better if they go through with most of the movie being somewhat realistic, because realism can be even more dramatic, and emotional that made up stories. Just look at the case of Air Force Major E. T. Tullia who was flying F-16 during Desert Storm, and successfully defended from 6 Iraqi SAM missiles in relatively rapid succession, while his automatic countermeasure system wasn't working. If real life can create amazing stories, why can't you?
Tom cruise is a nut! In a good way! He learned to fly and they got actors who actually flew the planes no CGI. Great story line GREAT movie! I absolutely LOVED it! Watch it! 10/10.

What a waste of time this movie is. I was yawning most of the time watching this garbage, how it gets such a high rating is beyond me, people must have been watching a different movie to the one that I was watching. About 10 min of 'action' and over 2 hours of Buddy Buddy movie, sentimental claptrap. Script was probably written on the back of a napkin in a restaurant, it's that well thought out. Characters are all pathetic 'Jocks' who swill beer and and are loud and obnoxious, and indulge in endless 'bonding', and we are supposed to 'feel' for these imbeciles. We watch them bonding in the bar, we watch them bonding on the beach, we watch them bonding in training.....Yawn. When the characters lean forward in their chairs then that is when we know that we are supposed to feel tension, the problem is that we don't feel anything but boredom. There is one laugh out loud moment when an enemy plane comes alongside and the Americans are pretending to be friends, but Tom Cruise has 'Maverick' written in large English letters on his helmet, presumable the enemy think this is their own language. It you want to spend two hours hearing people telling each other that "You can do it", then waste your time watching this movie. And by the way Tom cruise is far too old for the leather jacket and motorbike stuff.

WOW. I had high expectations for this film to begin with, and it still managed to surpass them. I'm a part of the younger generation that was shaped by the original movie, in all of its cheesy-80's nostalgic glory.Top Gun: Maverick is all of the nostalgic, none of the cheesy. I was in tears the moment it started. It would be a sore mistake to not see this one in theaters. Don't walk; don't run; FLY.

I have to say that when I first heard there was going to be a part 2 I said "why" as the first one is just above average on the scale, but holds up well for an 80s movie, but this one...WOW!It is hands down amazing. No "message " or SJW Woke trash...it's straight up a man being a hero and passing it on to other Americans. It is Pro America and unapologetic to the 2% that would cry about it.... I would say that if you watched it you would enjoy it as it also hits the nostalgia marker perfectly.Great action, really good writing, the bad guy is evil and America wins while showing how people actually interact in this country instead of the lectures and propaganda.One of the few that I would watch again....and that list is small and ranges in genre.Enjoy!

This is definitely a film that everyone has to watch. The film features intense action and emotional scenes. The whole movie is basically like a rollercoaster!!! The movie brought you back to where it all started, the music, the scenes... You'll find so much classic scenes that make you think about the first film. The dogfight scenes and Maverick flew solo are just sooooooo damn realistic and fantastic. The interaction between Mav and the young top gun pilots is dramatic! It is definitely a film that you should watch it twice!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.review_title: We don't see movies like this anymore. Quality content as rarely seen these days
reviews.content: I am not a fan of planes, battles, US army and so on but this movie is trully exceptional. My pulse was up the entire movie. The story is well written as well as the lines, the light, the music, the action is fantastic. 0 swearing, 0 nudity, 0 explicit sex scenes, 0 exagerated special effects and guess what, the movie is absolutely spectaculous. It is genuine, smart, powerfull, a reference for all action movies.I was born in 88 so pretty young for the first movie. Still, while watchig the actors now I was struck by our efemerity and the limited time we have in our life. Seing them now growing old and becoming seniors, watching the young having fun the old fashioned way ( playing pool, listening to good music, having fun playing the piano and singing a classic created some sort of nostalgic feeling about my own youth from my 20's.This movie proved that the audience does not need sex, CGI, robots and crazy fancy exagerated special effects to create a masterpiece and the public badly needs good quality content, not just eye candy images.I would watch it again no doubt.Recommend it 100%.

reviews.review_title: If I could give this 11 stars, I would!
reviews.content: High energy, funny, exhilarating to say the least. All the technical elements combine perfectly. I think I might prefer this to all the other blockbuster re-boots, and that includes SCREAM, which I adored. I don't want to give a single thing away. Trust me, it was worth the wait. I saw it in IMAX, it blew my mind and exceeded my expectations.

Been waiting for a long time... watching more than 100 times the first one. And now... I think I'll watch this one at least 10 times.Good story, great characters, best filming and a lot of candy from the old movie.Keep it up.

I think I'll go out on a limb here and say I enjoyed the original film immensely more. Perhaps it's the nostalgia speaking or perhaps I was expecting a lot more substance from this instalment. Don't get me wrong, some of the special effects were excellent but I'm the type of filmgoer that needs real substance, an intriguing storyline, a complex narrative and twists and turns to keep me wholly interested. None of those elements exist here. The movie ticks all the conventional boxes but leaves the objective viewer strangely unsatisfied. Are audiences numbed to Hollywood action saga cliches? Perhaps. But I think the problem lies in the lack of daring and imagination that one finds in contemporary film making. The film was a box office success, undoubtedly, and for the stakeholders, that is all that matters. But if a few extra risks had been taken, and the script given a daring and risky turn or two, this could have been a true masterpiece. Alas. Not to be. This film will be forgotten soon enough.

This is the best movie ever... 100x better than marvel junks they've been feeding us over the last decade! If you don't watch it, you are doing yourself a disservice! Go to the theatre and watch it now!!!!

I do not know where all these high marks are coming from, this sequel lacks any kind of originality. A thin plot line typical of a quick cash in. Dazzling cinematics and gimmicky g-force effects alone are not enough to carry this feature. I found my self dosing off repeatedly, keeping one eye open so I can watch the clock. Luke Skywalker did it better 40 years ago .

I will right up front in saying, i never saw the first movie. To be perfectly honest, i was in my twenties at the time, and i was not a huge fan of Cruise.But i digress. Fast forward to 2022, and on a hunch, i decided - after watching a composite trailer/interview with Cruise and the film-makers, that the movie seemed compelling enough to watch.Honestly, i have to say, i think NOT having seen the original added an edge of complexity mixed with being the only one in the theater who didn't know the back story. Consequently, i was on a steep learning curve about the background characters.Overall Conclusions:(1) Top Gun - Maverick is clearly an epic enough story, in and of itself, to a point where you needn't have seen the original movie to appreciate and "get" the storyline and whole drive of the sequel.(2) If you're going to try replicating real-life, jet fighter combat ...heck! Any combat, Top Gun Maverick has well and truly set the new benchmark by which all other future movies of this ilk will struggle to match.(3) If i had to hazard a guess (seeing as i'm in the absolute minority of one - having not seen the first movie), this sequel not only crushes the original for storyline and atmosphere, but also has clearly got to be light years ahead of and improving upon air combat replication and special effects.(4) The believability factor for TG Maverick is huge, and really cannot be understated. It's quite frankly breathtaking and genuinely awe inspiring what the director, cinematographers and live action production crew have accomplished in this instant movie classic.Lastly, the nod for story telling and screenplay adaptation is masterfully constructed - as it doesn't follow the expected and dross cliches of similar action movies based on a military theme (and its predecessor is in that number). The significance in saying that, lies in the believability and original nature of the main character interactions throughout.All told, any movie worth watching once, must surely be worth watching again (and even again). Top Gun Maverick is that great a yarn.

Possibly ever better than the first "Top Gun".I was riveted! Wonderful movie full of top jet stunts and great acting throughout! Tom Cruise ads as always, charisma and maximum excitement and humor to this hot action film. I'm sure I will see this movie more than once. 🍿

I was skeptical at first, but now, after watching it, I can confidently say I absolutely loved this film!I love how they brought back old characters, as well as introducing new ones.And I absolutely love the father figure dynamic with Maverick and Rooster. The actor who played Rooster did an exquisite job! Rooster is exactly what Maverick needed to finally let go of his past and to forgive himself.Though, as amazing of a film I think it is. The romance between Maverick and Penny was rather unnecessary to say the least. We know barely anything about their past together, and it kinda just makes no sense. I would have preferred if those romance scenes were cut out all together, since it quite literally did nothing to progress the story forward.But other than that. Amazing film, 8/10!Would recommend if you haven't seen it already :)

I loved the movie. The action finally felt real again and you really have to honor Tom Cruise for being kinda the last bastion of handmade action. Of course some parts of the movie are kinda weird, but the action and the chemistry between the characters really makes up for that. Great movie.
Really enjoyed it. A couple of holes can be forgiven but well worth the price of the ticket. It's a big screen movie so don't wait for it to hit TV. He is a top class actor in this one.

Wow now that's what a sequel should be. Just brilliant nothing else needed other than Tom cruise is the last real action hero and he and the rest of the cast deliver what will surely be the movie of the year and we'll worth wait!
The movie was so so good. I haven't seen a movie that good for a while. I really recommend watching it. Watching the movie will let you feel that you are in the movie.

reviews.review_title: Great way to kick off summer.
reviews.content: Very very good movie great action great storyline great acting this is what we need in the week of all the tragedy that we have in the world great movie to sit through enjoy laugh at see again you need to see this on the big screen to thoroughly enjoy it please don't wait to stream.Tom cruise fantasticMiles Teller. Excellent.

reviews.review_title: best action movie of the decade
reviews.content: I loved every second of this movie. It reminded me why I love cinema. Some slow moments but the action entirely made up for it. Can't wait for the next Tom Cruise movie. The guy is fully dedicated to his craft.

I was going to give it an 8 because I have a valid criticism: the movie adds nothing new to the table AT ALL....but I love it soooo much it has to have a 9. 10 doesn't exist.I grew up loving aircraft. Top Gun the original was my "happy place". When they announced a sequel I was disgusted...why? And more importantly how?? Another milking monster??But apparently... Tom Cruise had the same worries. It took so long to make a sequel because he wanted to maintain the integrity of the title as such that he refused until there was a valid opportunity.Not a Cruise fanboy but after seeing Top Gun 2, 'egads to him.Top Gun 2 is fan-service as an ART. There might have been some cringy scenes but most of the time I had a huge smile on my face. As I said it doesn't add anything new to the movie scene at all, but what it does is it takes Top Gun 1 with all bells and whistles and succesfully and lovingly takes it into 2022. Once more Top Gun is an adrenaline rush of a cool-sunglasses movie with a MUCH more thrilling action-packed endgame.I can't really say much more, I always go spoiler-free. It follows the same beats as the original so you won't have any big surprises (this sounds bad, but trust me, you want the original Top Gun feeling. New-comer or old-timer). Maybe I can add that the obligatory romance bit was a bit much (just like...in the original movie).Can't believe I'd ever say this, but thank you mr. Cruise!

reviews.review_title: I had to recover before leaving the cinema after watching!
reviews.content: So Tense! But somehow they've managed to lead on from the iconic original and not ruin it! Loads of hidden (and obvious) references to the first movie, I thought it was really clever. My new favourite film!

An enjoyable but highly predictable linear storyline movie. Absolutely nothing more than that and I very much doubt it that there will be a rush for second viewings. Interestingly enough this sequel's scores are much higher than the original movie. Tom Cruise, as always, is very good and looking exceptionally youthful. Truly Epic, Real Cinema Experience, Perfect Gift, etc... 10 star reviews, beg questions of seriousness and over-rating. But then again, a movie, like everything else in life, is a matter of taste.

reviews.review_title: The best "mindless" fun at the movies I've had since the 90's
reviews.content:
The movie no one knew they wanted but Hollywood (with its 21ts century wokeism) most definite needed it.From nods to the first to poignant moments between maverick and the original cast (one on, one off screen), top gun: maverick succeeds at everything Hollywood has failed in these divise era of "The Message"Proving once again, that no, the Pecking order of the Hollywood blockbuster action heroes does not star and end with marvel. It actually starts and ends with Ethan Hunt, Pete "Maverick" Mitchell, and a myriad of roles from the guy whose smile still sells tickets.But here, without forcing or cheesing it up, Thomas Cruise Mapother III, turns down his wattage, to craft a sequel that succeeds and dare I say exceeds the classic. Working again with his latter-half-of-his-career pal Chris McQuarrie, Cruise preoccupation with details, and perfectionism, materializes one of the best, most testosterone filled ode to the honor and the triumph of the human will.Wokeists will hate on the lack of "representation" which actually means patronizing, but here the single female best of the best understands she's pierced thru the boys club and rather than womensplaining the men she gives as good as she gets, and earns her stripes every step of the way.And at last the "good guys" win by disobeying the pre-supposed safe plan, willing to sacrifice its own skin not just for country but for each other.And for those who believe movies like these "have no place in our current climate"
I think Maverick's perceived over the hill captain response to Ed Harris barking suits just fine:"Maybe some day Admiral. But not today"

reviews.review_title: A riveting sequel that surpasses the original in every sense
reviews.content: From the get go, Maverick keeps you on the edge of his seat whenever he is in the air. I don't want to give too much away, but you HAVE to watch a movie like this on the big screen. Cinematography is great, Cruise and Miles Teller deliver excellent performances, and there are several poignant moments that connect the original to this incredible sequel.People have been raving Tom Cruise is the last remaining movie star and although I wouldn't go that far, he may be the greatest action movie star ever. See this movie immediately.

reviews.review_title: VIEWS ON FILM review of Top Gun: Maverick
reviews.content: "I have the need, the need for speed!" So do moviegoers. That's why so many are gonna flock to 2022's Top Gun: Maverick. Wanting to see the sequel to the original Top Gun amidst its many delays, I was one of them. May seemed like the perfect month to get my Mach 10 on.More stunt-packed than the first Top Gun and probably more tech-savvy, "Maverick" at times readily lets you know it's a follow-up with fan-made propensities and fan service directed at Tom Cruise's legendary persona (Lt. Pete Mitchell). At the same timetable, Top Gun: Maverick also announces that it's cinematic spectacle and not much else. See it on the biggest screen possible but be forewarned, you won't be quoting any of its lines any time soon.Tom Cruise stars in "Maverick" (duh). As Lt. Mitchell, Cruise acts and talks differently than he did in '86. I don't know if it's old age or wisdom but Mitchell is now the consummate professional. Back then he didn't say much. He just acted cocky and kicked butt in the air. I mean in Top Gun: Maverick I thought he said he wasn't fit to be an instructor. Could've fooled me."Maverick" flies by even at a running time of 137 minutes (no pun intended). And director Joseph Kosinski can stage action while providing a stellar attention to detail (love those gadget zoom and POV shots). But if you're looking for nostalgia and dramatic heft a la Tony Scott's sun-soaked vision, don't look here. What's worse, you don't know who the enemies are that the pilots are fighting in "Maverick". The aerial, high-flying stuff is just for show and for well, "whoa".Top Gun: Maverick is its own movie but it shouldn't force you to forget what transpired effectively 36 years ago. The original Top Gun was (and is) a pop culture artifact, a time capsule put forth, and nearly the first of its kind. "Maverick" lacks Top Gun's revered characters, its devil-may-care banter, and its two iconic endings. The late "Mother" Goose would abide.

Top Gun-Maverick did what a lot of others failed to do... Be as good as the original or be as good as a remake as the original and meet ir beat expectations... when I was a kid I remember seeing the original in the theater... I'm that guy that knows every line and would annoy you sitting next to you watching it.... Maverick was almost as good as the original... Story, cast, mix of action, drama, comedy and of course the jet sequences. Just intense the movie flew bye and paid great homage to the original. I teared up and can honestly say I the two people on either side of me
cried. Walking out of the IMAX everyone was talking how amazing of a movie it was. If Iceman and Goose weren't in the original and played amazing by Val and Anthony this would surpass it... so it's a 1b to a 1a.Tom you did it and you make movies enjoyable and I wish there was a fountain of youth because you give the fans everything they want... I know you turn 60 in a few mths so I'll just keep enjoying your art as long as you can do it! You are an amazing entertainer and do it the right way on screen! Thank you!

If Tom Cruise was not in this movie, there is no way it would get the reviews it is getting. The writing is stupid, and the acting is bad. People are getting all hyped up because they love Tom Cruise and they love fighter jets apparently. The only reason I'm giving this as high a rating as I am is because I watched it with my wife on our anniversary trip, and that made it worthwhile.

In the interest of full disclosure, I must confess to backtracking on a statement I made on social media when this film was first released. At that time, I had said I wouldn't see this movie because I believed it to be little more than a veiled recruiting vehicle for the US military and that it was something I couldn't support. However, awards season accolades for this offering backed me into a corner, essentially forcing me into having to see it to remain informed and credible about the unfolding of these events, so I reluctantly relented. Unfortunately, after having watched it, my initial assessment was borne out. This overblown, testosterone-dripping, clichéd, corny, predictable 2+-hour ad for the US Navy lived up to all of my expectations. This tale of an aging fighter ace-turned-test pilot (Tom Cruise) who's tapped to train a team of young flyers for a virtually impossible bombing run to take out a plutonium enrichment plant in Iran (no enemy stereotyping here, ahem) follows a formulaic script with trite dialogue and plenty of sly macho winks and nods. To its credit, the film features superb aerial camera work and editing, making for a number of visually thrilling dogfight sequences (a major "cool, dude" aspect of the picture's underlying military marketing intentions), and it manages to slip in a few "sensitive male" story threads to show that modern-day enlisted men can be at least superficially politically correct (a changing-of-the-times narrative adjustment from the film's original). But, even with these admirable attributes, I genuinely fail to understand how so many critics and viewers don't see what's really going on here. To say that director Joseph Kosinski's latest is truly worthy of the honors it has received thus far - such as a Golden Globe nomination for best dramatic film and the National Board of Review's award for the year's best picture - is clearly an overreach, especially in terms of what it's really all about to begin with. In my view, it's yet another example of the decline of the American movie industry and how willing audiences are to settle for it.

reviews.review_title: Fantastic movie. Bring back my childhood memory 10/10
reviews.content: Still remember when I was 10 years old when I watched this movie. This movie really created my interest on fighting jet. And after 20+ years, I glad that I would able to watch Top Gun 2 with no disappointment. Truly recommend everyone should watch this movie. 10 out of 10, thumb up for the movie creator teams.
After long, I loved this movie. I loves the scenes and have lots words to describe more.I would recommend watching in a theatre before it comes on small screens.

reviews.review_title: Great movie... brought me back to the theatre for the first time in 5 years!
reviews.content: A great movie... made me laugh and cry... watched Original Top Gun and then saw it... I want to see it again and I haven't felt like that in a long time!

reviews.review_title: One of the most hyped films of the last decade... It delivered!
reviews.content: I've been waiting for this film my whole life. I was born in 1984 and saw Top Gun for the first time when I was around 10/11 years old in the mid 90's.It instantly became my favourite movie of all time. Fast forward 25 years and nothing has changed since then. I've seen the original at least 20 times. I prayed this film would live up to my expectations. So many sequels fall short.But within 10 minutes of this movie, I knew it was going to be exceptional and I wasn't disappointed. The action sequences blew me away! Tom Cruise was magnificent supported by a stellar supporting cast.I know I'll watch this one at least 20 times again in the years to come! But the best thing this time round was I got to see this one at the cinema - the way it should and needs to be seen!Believe the hype! It's even better than you imagine!

This movie was made with a sole purpose so aging Cruise can flash his fixed teeth and fill his galactic ego. If we count a few in-cockpit scenes, there isn't much you haven't seen in the last 20 years in numerous other movies. And the last 20 minutes...I mean, it's on par with Star Wars and not in a good sense. Everytime I now see a movies was endorsed by DoD I loose all interest. I wonder who the target audience for this movie is. Grown up men? It can't be, it just can't be. Teenagers? Maybe a twele year old would be impressed.All in all....unless you fall for the Absolute American cringe, diabetes inducing corn i cannot recommend this.

reviews.review_title: The best movie in the last 10 years or more
reviews.content: I was very excited about this movie and it exceeded my expectations. Very good plot that keeps you engaged and wanting more. And omg the flying scenes are incredible and realistic. Overall it is a very good movie and I will see it again.

reviews.review_title: Blockbuster movie is a real blockbuster
reviews.content:
In no small words Top Gun:Maverick is the blockbuster we've been waiting for. It has all the Ingredients from the acting to the story and how this all combines to make one great film
Tom Cruise oozes class and style and his support cast don't let him down..your attached to the film throughout
This is a must see.
If you like far fetched action movies with awesome jets, and a actor that never ages this movie is for you, the story was well written and paid homage to the first one well.

reviews.review_title: One of the best Tom Cruise movies ever!!
reviews.content: Top Gun 2 has got to be one of the best movies of Tom Cruise. The adrenaline rush during the aerial scenes from the start of the movie was sensational. The kinda tribute to the prequel was nostalgic at moments like the background music, the first few scenes, etc. As far as the actors are concerned each one of them did a fantastic job especially Tom Cruise and Miles Teller. Considering everything about the movie, it was a great movie. One more thing, please don't do injustice by watching this at home. No TV in the world can do justice to the amount of hard work the film crew has put in that's why experience it in your nearest theaters.
I am not time cruises biggest fan but I have to give the man credit he knows how to act.Really good film, great storyline and very tense atmosphere.Would definitely recommend.

I wasn't sure about this one. But I saw the Original as a kid and this one was great. Brought back people I did not expect to be in it. A great surprise. Tom cruise at 60 still can act with the best of them. Val Kilmer was great to see again acting. I took my girlfriend who never saw the original movie. I told her alittle bit of the back story and she still thought it was awesome. I must see on big screen. Even teared me up. Great movie.

reviews.review_title: Reminds Us That The Big Screen Is Cultural Heritage!
reviews.content:
Top Gun: Maverick. Thoughts...More than an ode to (military) aviation, it is an ode to cinema. To classic nineties & noughties movies that us Millennials & younger Gen-Xs grew up on.Makes sense, because it was made by that generation's action god Jerry Bruckheimer.(On the topic of Bruckheimer: The use of The Who's "Won't Get Fooled Again" in the first dogfight training scene was an exquisite tribute to another one of his wildly popular shows CSI: Miami.)Being crafted using classic nineties/noughties action formulae, Top Gun had its fair.Share of cringe. But what makes it stand out as an exceptional piece is that Cruise & Bruckheimer used the crème de la crème of world cinema.Look at the filmography of the film's producers and you'll see what I mean...Editing: Kingsman
Production Design: Zero Dark Thirty
Art Direction: Grand Budapest Hotel
Casting (immense cast): Saving Private RyanAnd the primary feature of the film...Cinematography: Benjamin Button & Life of Pi.It's writing let it down. Dialogue was weak and kitsch, with a painfully thin plot. But that's expected for Bruckheimer (never my favourite movie producer).If decent effort had been invested into the screenplay, this could have been a masterpiece. Instead, it was outstanding.A cinematic marvel. Right up there with some of the best cinematography to grace the big screen (think Revenant, Tree of Life, Avatar, Blade Runner, 2001, Psycho etc.)It's unfortunate that such a marvel couldn't be served a better script.But what do Bruckheimer & Cruise care?They don't. It's done its job. It is one of the most successful films of all time, and deservedly so.But for those who appreciate a little more than just eyegasmic experiences and seek provocative inspiration, it let itself down. And for that reason, there is not a chance.It will be nominated for a Best Picture Oscar.Cinematography? Highly likely. Along with all of the other disciplines I listed above. Heck, even Cruise MIGHT get a nomination for his intense military training for the film.When it comes to acting, the overall cast was, as mentioned, immense. Besides John Hamm (or perhaps his character?) letting the whole team down, the acting was extremely solid, with Jennifer Connelly absolutely stealing the show.This was a movie that I would gladly see again in the cinema.In a world overrun by miniature screens, Top Gun: Maverick reminds us that the big screen remains an important part of our cultural heritage.

reviews.review_title: Top Gun: Maverick is a sequel faithful to the original, but just much more epic.
reviews.content: I have seen this movie twice now, and it was just as good the second time as the first. The directing is magnificent. The writing and story is awesome. The action is great. There is good character development, and it is also a very emotional movie. I cried both times I saw this movie. I actually thought that either Maverick or Rooster or both would die in this movie, I could not predict the outcome, which is unusual for me when it comes to this kind of movie.I did not have that high expectations of this movie when I first watched it in the theaters, which made me completely blown away after watching this. Top Gun: Maverick is a sequel faithful to the original, but just much more epic.
Seriously just go see the movie. No woke stuff, just a great movie with everything well balanced. Certainly makes justice to the original movie, and, I would argue, exceeds it in many way.

reviews.review_title: It will be disappointed if Tom cruise and this masterpiece not in list for nominated for oscars
reviews.content: Truly epic , go siege the moment that you can only get in IMAX.epic dogfight scene.as well as stoline. And tom cruise performance in this movie is massive phenomenal . You can believe he is the only one legendary pilot .The Maverick , it contains the experienced that you can only grab it from watching it with all around 4dx with epic scene sound and story.

reviews.review_title: Weak script. Thin story. Lacking substance.
reviews.content: I went to the danger zone of boredom. Some good actors and solid production can't make up for a script that should have been thrown away or at the very least, rewritten. What a waste. I walked out of the cinema after an hour and a quarter. A waste of$70 and time.

I kept my expectations very low for this film as almost every reboot in the past decade has fallen short of any redeeming qualities. Top Gun: Maverick has shown every other producer in Hollywood how to revive a classic. It was the perfect mix of nostalgia while creating deep connections with the new cast that the audience can relate to. The film pays homage to the best parts of Top Gun. Above all else though, this film has filled the void in the movie industry that has been lacking for a long time.

reviews.review_title: GREAT BALLS OF FIRE! It's A Worthy Sequel!
reviews.content: If you loved the original Top Gun, you'll definitely love this one. In many ways, it mirrors many of the original's famous scenes, but done in a creative and nostalgic way. I won't mention any to avoid spoiling it for viewers. Besides they're like Easter Eggs in the movie waiting to be discovered, and there are plenty of them (Easter Eggs). But the scenes were nicely done. Sorry ladies, no shirtless volley ball scene though.Top Gun Maverick has turned up the action and FX several notches higher compared to the 80s original. While the original was highly entertaining and a huge box office hit, it was somewhat regarded as a popcorn movie. Top Gun Maverick however, has great action sequences, better dialogue, and a much improved storyline. The corniness of the original has gone.Special effects are first rate. Using excellent CGI renderings for enemy planes, rather than simply using US fighter planes painted with adversary markings and camo schema. Seeing the Russian made Sukhoi SU-57 Felon - a 5th Gen fighter plane - used as the enemy plane made it more engaging to watch. Just don't be too critical on how inaccurate some of the operations were carried out in the movie compared to how the US Navy would really conduct them in the real-world.VERDICT: Top Gun fan or not, Top Gun Maverick is a "must watch".

What a movie! Well worth the wait. The attention to detail in every scene is evident. Even the sounds coming from the cockpit are very realistic, especially during Maverick's simulation of the mission. All the details add up to an one-of-a-kind cinematic experience.

First movie I have even wanted to see since 2019, this is just as good if not better than the original, the only bad things I can say is I don't know how "penny" is tied to him, I do not remember her from the original. But a damn fine movie!
