This is just an all around great movie. It's got laughs, tears, and gripping action. Tom Cruise is one of the best actors when not speaking of all time. He says so much with his facial expressions alone. "It's the only look I've got." My only qualm with the movie is how Rooster parrots way too many motivational lines back to Maverick. He could've stopped after one or two. Other than that, the F18 scenes are epic and a thrill ride.
I've just watched one of the most amazing movies this night , literally two hours of action two hours of Tom cruise madness .... Love it. The songs also are amazing and just in time.

Ok - entertaining movie. I would have rated it higher but.... Why do they not want to name the enemy? - even if they came up with a fictitious country? And their fear of 5th generation fighter planes from this unknown adversary is just ridiculous. Plus Maverick is 60 years old with nary a gray hair... The movie itself is very reminiscent of the original Top Gun. The action sequences are well done and generally it is a good time. So that is all I have to say but I had to add in this last sentence in order to get to the minimum amount of characters for a review to be accepted - seems like a strange way to vet reviews but okay I guess.

Whatever your views are about Tom Cruise, it's evident that he WORKED HIS ASS OFF on this film.I could go on about the film itself (technically speaking), but by the end I had an odd feeling that I've just "watched my last real movie".. and by real, I mean that the whole film is completely devoid of any woke nonsense, or other overt BS social/political agendas that are being pushed on the world today.It almost felt like Tom Cruise was saying "I hope you really enjoyed this, because.. it may be the last one you'll ever see".Time will tell.

Absolutely fantastic movie and that's how a sequel is done. So many trips down memory lane during the movie and left me feeling nostalgic. I had the pleasure of being a teenager when the first one released and it nailed us then as this one does now.

reviews.review_title: Wow, just Wow!! TC you are the best!
reviews.content: I went into the movie having watched half a dozen marvel type cgi movies and I longed for a film where you saw raw emotion and a tale of simple flawed good guy tries to help others who are also flawed and through hard work and dedication they finally pull together to make it happen. Along the way the guy gets the girl and he slowly rebuilds flaws and improves his character to a point that he becomes the hero we all knew he should be. I am sure in the 90s and 00s there were films like this every month that were different but also had a story arc and a moral to the story (that's why I prefer watching movies from that era rather than the new marvel trash) but this film really had it all, nostalgia, character development, story arc and. Action. Tom Cruise might just have saved Hollywood but I suspect not.

reviews.review_title: This is what a movie is called
reviews.content: Best movie in the nearest decade. Everything is perfect. The script,bgms,songs,conflicts between characters...It makes your jaws drop down every single second during this film. I went into the cinema with a normal state of mind. It is incredible to make a teenager to love this film with just two hours. I have never watched top gun(1986)before. This is a movie that everyone an fully enjoy and take a rollercoaster ride with Tom Cruise.

reviews.review_title: Amazing Movie And A Great Visual Spectacle
reviews.content:
"It's Not The Plane, It's The Pilot."
Top Gun Maverick What an Amazing Movie Loved it . A Great Visual Spectacle with Great Background Scores, TomCruise is Amazing , Kudos to others too.

reviews.review_title: After years of so so movies this was better than I could have hoped
reviews.content: I love movies, I really do. I've been a film fan since middle school, love most genres. I don't believe you can judge most films outside of there given genre, it's just not fair. For example I have Maverick a 9, but Godfather and Casablanca a 10, is there only 1 star difference? No, the previously mentioned two are much better, but they are films that transcend their own genres and to me go onto a different tier. Maverick isn't on that tier, but it's the best fighter jet movie by far I've every seen, and a excellent overall action film. Tom Cruise just plays his natural personality as usual but does it well, the supporting cast is excellent, the story has a major plot hole but it had to be there, I'm sorry with the day of guided missile and smart bomb here that can strike anywhere including underground the days of the suicide bombing run are pretty much over. That being said if you accept the plot for what it is it works. The flight scenes are astonishing, and it was a great walk off home run for most of the original cast.

Now this is movie making! Good old fashioned (80s), movie making.There's so much focus on character building, absolutely fantastic photography, wonderful fast paced action sequences, just the right amount of humour at the right times, and no political correctness nonsense.Sure, some of the action is a little silly at times, but that's just fine.I think I smiled through this entire movie.Thank you so much for taking me back to my childhood!
This is how you do a sequel Hollywood, despite there being 36 years since the last movie.Amazing shots, sounds, story, character arcs, everything is just 10/10.

Overall the film was brilliant. 36 years after the original you think it's a bit too late will the sequel would be a money grab at old glory. The development of the characters both old & new, with the subtle references to the original top gun were perfect. Maverick has done it again.

This is a movie you have to go to the movies to see. I enjoyed it all and its been a long time I haven't seen a non-stop movie like this. Way to go Maverick!I did rewatch the old one just two days before and it was a good reminder. I don't know if I would have enjoyed it the same if I didn't remember much from the old movie.

reviews.review_title: Best film sequel of all time!
reviews.content: The film is exciting and nostalgic. Watching the film amazed me with how the score was composed, acting and visuals were accomplished. I like the drama between Maverick and Rooster, showing the two never let go of the past but eventually accept what has happened had happened. The scene between maverick and Iceman was great and sad to see. The scenes in the F-18's are above satisfying to watch and I loved the enemy dogfight sequence where the SU57 misses the missile and surprises Maverick, showing the enemy is more than a challenge to compete against where Maverick risks to even the odds. The ending of this film is one of the most unique conclusions to any film I will ever see in my lifetime. To all the crew and cast of the film well done to what you've accomplished, bringing an amazing sequel packed with action, drama and nostalgia along with a gripping story that demands for attention.

reviews.review_title: Outstanding blockbuster film that exceeds expectations!
reviews.content: It's Awesome. Top Gun Maverick takes you on an emotional nostalgia filled thrill ride that will have you on the edge of your seat. I was genuinely sweating just watching the incredible action sequences which should be on track for cinematography awards aplenty. There are plenty of quips relating back to the first movie which is served up as pure fan service but the structure of the movie is good enough for complete newcomers to still enjoy.It's Awesome. Top Gun Maverick takes you on an emotional nostalgia filled thrill ride that will have you on the edge of your seat. I was genuinely sweating just watching the incredible action sequences which should be on track for cinematography awards aplenty. There are plenty of quips relating back to the first movie which is served up as pure fan service but the structure of the movie is good enough for complete newcomers to still enjoy.

I came to Cinema with my girlfriend to Watch new Top Gun Maverick. I thought why in the hell Are they making a sequel of Top Gun, Like why, I don't see the benefits of doing it but when I watched it, my mind was like- man making this sequel does not making any sensen but its literally AMAZING, the script, sound, picture, plot... just AMAZING. I'm not a Fan of the first movie though i think it's classic with historic influence but the sequel is on steroids in every good Way. My warm recomidation for everyone- Go to Cinema and enjoj!!!!

This film deserve appreciation. Not just because this movie is good, its because how rare Hollywood make movie like this. Total dedication, and strong finish.Very entertaining, very thrilling.Love it so much.

Top Gun Maverick is a stunning sequel that improves on everything of the original while remaining respectful of everything that came before. Tom Cruise is at his best while everyone else is just playing catch up it feels, much like in the movie itself. Maverick owns the skies and Tom owns the action movie box office yet again. Go see it, it's absolutely worth your time and should be celebrated.

reviews.review_title: Maverick sends Rooster among Goose. Top Shot
reviews.content:
"Lt. Phoenix - Everyone here is the best there is. Who the hell are they going to get to teach us?Adm. Warlock - Your instructor is one of the finest this program has ever produced. His exploits... are legendary. What he has to teach you may very well mean the difference between life and death. His call sign: Maverick. "
Top Gun Maverick is an outstanding sequel to the legendary original. Tom cruise goes overboard with his gravity defying skills and overachieves in the book of overachievers. He makes you fall in love with Pete Mitchell aka Maverick all over again with his ridiculous exploits and breath-taking flying manoeuvres and makes you wonder how can somebody pull this off even at his age. There is very strong emotional pull resonating throughout which tears into layers of Maverick-Goose relationship. Combine this with mesmerising aerial sequences and a legendary final act - what you are left with is an inexplicable feeling of awe, admiration and respect. As if a flight simulation is luring you into a world of dogfights with those mesmerizing F-18 machines.It almost took 36 years for the sequel of Top gun to come out and no wonder it has arrived in all its magnanimous glory and grandeur. The sequel soars high and is a perfect summer blockbuster. It not only recreates what the original stood for but also breaks barriers and reaches new heights in the arena of filmmaking especially on the stout and able shoulders of Tom cruise.Go for it. Highly recommended!.

Please watch and see for yourself why I rated 10!!! Tom Cruise is still the best actor of all time. This movie gave me mixed feelings. Excitement, nostalgia, awe and all good emotions there is! Kudos to all the casts for doing a job well done. Better than Top Gun 1! 👏👏👏

I feel the need for speed - again... Yep, some 36 years after the original 80s blockbuster, Top Gun gets a sequel, and "it's good, it's very good"!...An absurdly ageless Tom Cruise (60?!) re-appears from his cryogenic chamber (no doubt sponsored by the Church of Scientology) as Captain Pete 'Maverick' Mitchell, this time heading back to Top Gun in order to train up a new batch of annoying, jingoistic ego-maniac fighter pilots for a mission impossible (doh) against the world's common -unnamed- enemy... and so we take flight once again to destroy some dastardly world destroying hidden nukes (with many updated nods to the original film, including music).Typically, the Cruiser lights up the screen throughout, aptly co-piloted by an on-point supporting cast headed by lovely Jennifer Connelly, Ed Harris, Val Kilmer and stand-out Miles Teller as his old buddy Goose's disgruntled son (you have to suspend the reality that he would be in his 40s now though!).The real star of the show however are the spectacular non-cgi plane sequences, and there are plenty of them! It's a real rocket ride of adrenaline as the 2 hour runtime literally flys by and the need for mindless, nostalgic blockbuster popcorn munchers proudly rises like a Super Hornet in overdrive.Much like the first flick it's big, cheesy, over the top, full of improbabilities... and one helluva 'mach ten' fun ride. A refreshing and much needed change from the overplayed Marvel-verse et al, Top Gun Maverick is one summer blockbuster (and by far the biggest earner of the year) that has and will thrill film fans old and new...So strap yourselves in, disengage brain and enjoy your long awaited flight back into the Danger Zone, you won't regret it.

reviews.review_title: "It's Not the Plane. It's the Pilot."
reviews.content: Let's give it up for Tom Cruise. No matter what one thinks of his politics, social life, or general Tom Cruiseacity, the man's career is undeniably one of the most successful in the history of Hollywood. Cruise has helmed some of the profitable films in existence, starting his career with Top Gun and journeying through the Mission: Impossible franchise.His career comes full circle with Top Gun: Maverick, a follow up to the original film which provides exactly what one would expect from a sequel to Top Gun: some fairly mundane melodrama, a new cast of useful idiots, and a stellar gallery aerial combat, sans CGI or digital wizardry. Cruise and director Joseph Kosinski set out to make a blockbuster reminiscent of yesteryear, and their passion is evident with every flight.The film follows Maverick as he's called back into Top Gun to train a new class of recruits for a top-secret and extremely dangerous mission. He must grapple with inflated egos, resistant superiors, and past demons in order to give his new students an opportunity to accomplish their mission and live to see another day. The film is wisely vague about what the actual mission is, focusing instead on the students' journey and learning curves.The film's charm and novelty begins and ends with its aerial scenes. Though they're fewer and farther between than they should be, there are enough to keep the momentum moving and string the extremely thin plot along. They're also completely breathtaking, using real aircraft from the U. S. government and showcasing the latest military technology the States has to offer.The sequences are filmed with clarity and intensity, perfectly kinetic yet easily followable. Cruise performed his own stunts, and the realism is left on the screen, as is the budget. Everything is as big, fast, and loud as an audience could possibly hope for - don't be surprised if recruitment rates spike.Of course, there's a deeply unsettling and stomach-churning truth to these scenes, the film, and the U. S. military as a whole; this technology exists almost exclusively because of the budget allocated to the Pentagon, a budget which is more than $500 billion dollars larger than China's, the next closest. The U. S. military received $801 billion in 2021, compared to just $293 billion by China and $76.6 billion by India, the third largest spender. The U. S. also accounted for thirty-eight percent of the world's military spending, which amounted to $2.2 trillion.These are absolutely staggering numbers, and twice as depressing, as general costs of living in the United States has accelerated at alarming rates. Millions of Americans struggle to afford basic necessities such as food, housing, and healthcare while the military industrial complex bleeds Congress' purse dry. The taxes meant to improve the conditions of life for all flow directly to the top, accumulating in the hands of a corrupt, insatiable few. Top Gun: Maverick doesn't exactly glorify the military, but it consistently shows off the unbridled military fetishism of the United States, which leaves one with a hollowed out feeling in the mind and stomach. What a waste it all is.Casting aside the reality of a country on the verge of eating itself from the inside, Top Gun: Maverick is an alright film. This follow-up is as simplistic and superficial as the original, but wisely casts aside that film's overwrought mood and frantic filming style, though it can't match its full-bodied, stellar soundtrack. One subtle yet nagging problem with the film is the greater sense of its world, which is unconvincing. When Jon Hamm stares out the window on a stormy night, you can hardly hear the rain.1984's Top Gun feels locked into its era, incredibly cheesy and desperately eager to please the gaggles of teenagers who flocked into the theaters. This film feels similar but in a different way; it aims to please that same gaggle of kids, but understands they've aged and, perhaps, matured. It's not as hot-headed or rebellious as the original but stays true to Maverick's freewheeling and arrogant characterization.Although the film is all but guaranteed to win over crowds and produce at the box office, it probably won't satisfy those looking for a more challenging or complex study. The script is lean and focuses heavily on the story of the original film, taking no risks in terms of new characters or ideas. Like any belated sequel, there's an assumption that, although forty years have passed, characters have made little to no progress in terms of dealing with past mistakes.The conflicts and complications which haunted Maverick still haunt him here, a dour reminder that the man exists solely in the context of Top Gun as a franchise, and not as a living, breathing character with his own interests and life story. And here he is called back, to once again take up the mantle for continued corporate profits.Like every character in cinema today, Maverick is not simply allowed to be his own man - he must be, first and foremost, the ideal Company Man. Like the ties to the U. S. government, this line of thought is not in the foreground, but it does exist, and it is depressing, in a nihilistic, existential way.Top Gun: Maverick is a throwback to the films of old, in all of the best and worst ways possible. It's likeable and makes some ostensible stabs at emotion but is wildly conventional in every element except the flights, which I guess are the real point of the film anyway. There's no denying the artistry and craft on display when the jets are in motion, but the film's story is forgettable and the reality of its production, its explicit ties to the government, are best left forgotten. The film has already done tremendous business in its opening week and will have impressive legs. If, by some miracle, Top: Gun Maverick is the film which harkens in a new era of practical effects, than perhaps audiences won't have to wait another forty years for the completion of the trilogy.

reviews.review_title: Perfect Blend of an Ecstatic Cocktail
reviews.content: I watched this movie in Dolby Atmos sound at Imax. The experience was phenomenal. Most movies coming out by actors who have been around for a while, have been mediocre at best; however Tom Cruise has debunked the fact that you cant make classics when you are old...From the onset, the movie sets up a story; it appears to be slow but at the same time captivating. As the story unfolds, it then becomes exhilirating with every scene, leaving you holding tight onto your seat waiting to see whats next.An action movie that graps your emotion, perfect even for those who are not action lovers. I myself do not love movies with overly romantic scenes, but the romance depicted here is more nostalgic and at the threshold of being full of heart, almost seeming to be like a true life story.The stunts, visual effects, acting, extremely pulchritudinous.Arguably, this is probably the best movie of 2022 so far, and the best movie so far in a while, when you consider every aspect of a movie in whole.

reviews.review_title: This is how a movie should be
reviews.content: One hell of a ride. This is how a movie should be. Great entertainment, good story, strong characters and great execution. People needed this sort of old school action flicks badly after all these lame movies in the last few years.

reviews.review_title: My Love for Movies is Back!!
reviews.content: It's one of the best feel good movies I've seen in years. I was not bombarded with sarcastic remarks or catch phrases from annoying characters and I was not preached to by an holier-than-thou Hollywood script writer. It was just inspiring all the way through. I came out of the theater feeling elated! It's one of the rare times I didn't feel cheated after paying for a movie. I haven't done that in a while but I will definitely go back to see it again!In Imax this time!

That's one way to describe the movie. I haven't seen the prequel so I didn't know what to expect going into this. But wow was it spectacular.Two things that I noticed off the bat were the cinematography and the directing. They are so well done and those two make up 50% on why the movie was so good for me.The characters and story were solid I guess. I haven't watched the prequel so I wasn't enthralled that much by the characters but were good enough it made the movie more enjoyable. The pacing and consistency of the story were well done and benefitted the characters nicely.Overall it was an enjoyable movie.Memorable: No Rewatchable: Unlikely..

reviews.review_title: Great Character study of top gun pilot with Visually thrilling experience.
reviews.content: Top Gun 2 is one of the best if learn to about the top gun program as entertainment material the biggest strength of this movie is how practically they shot the movie there are some minor CGI. But its possible. Top Gun maverick is what you expect from the tom cruise movie. The biggest selling point of this movie they let you experience what is like to be Top Gun pilot.Marvel and DC should learn from Top Gun and try to shoot their movies as practically as can. You find CGI in almost all the IP properties.Top Gun Succeeds by different them selves from these movie and put the audience into the shoes of top gun pilot.

reviews.review_title: Pretty close to a perfect movie
reviews.content: My 27-yr old son said that to me as we were walking out. We had watched the first one a few days prior to seeing this and he said, "This is pretty close to a perfect movie." I couldn't agree more. Hey, Hollywood! This is how you make a hit movie. Character development and writing was excellent. I actually FELT something during the movie. Maybe I've seen too many Marvel movies, but it's been a long time since I genuinely felt something besides annoyance and disappointment during a movie.Imagine SEEING characters develop on screen as opposed to some monologue TELLING about it. There were no wasted scenes. In fact, there were a few scenes that could have been extended. Pacing was fantastic, there was actual heat/chemistry between main characters, soundtrack was familiar enough for nostalgia, and I actually got "the feels" many times. Best movie I've seen in years.I used to scoff at the AMC intro with Nicole Kidman talking about how movies do this or that thing and how feelings are awakened. "Maybe in the past," I would say to myself. After seeing Top Gun: Maverick, I don't think she's so crazy.

reviews.review_title: The movie, the music, the emotions...WOW WOW WOW!!
reviews.content: I have been a huge Topgun fan since I watched the movie in my early 20's. I doted on the character and name ICEMAN ever since!!When the sequel was released with more emphasis on Maverick, I guessed this would dampen and ruin the Topgun series. But NOOO.. this sequel was much, much bigger than the earlier epic.One can make out that a LOT of HARD WORK was done in all aspects - story, screenplay, cinematography, acting, stunts and the most important I believe to be the BACKGROUND SCORE which sets your adrenaline racing!!! WELL DONE - the director, the actors, the musicians..A COMPLETE 10/10 movie after a LONG DARN TIME!! WE NEEDED THIS, HUGE WAVE OF POSITIVITY!

I thought the intro to the movie was EXACTLY what was missing in the former. You really get to appreciate the relationship of pilots and their planes and really just the overall beauty and power of the navy. With that being said, the overall movie was excellent. Point blank period. However, cinematically, I had a few personal judgements. SPOILERS: The scene where Maverick saves Rooster from getting shot down. I loved every second of it, but that's the problem. It was just a second. I felt that moment especially should've been more monumental. Maverick sacrifices himself for his former copilot's son. Continuing on, I just felt the choice on some aspects of lighting were just off, the use of split lighting was overused and even misused. Instead of dramatic it just felt less personal. Moments where actors are crying, I can barely see them. At the end of the day I would absolutely watch it again, but I do question how some of the shots were taken. Incredible action scenes though.

Non stop edge of ur seat action from min 1, great storyline, brilliant cinematography the plane footage is out of this world, top acting from cruise u see a side to him I don't think we've seen before can't wait to see it again.

reviews.review_title: Truly the #1 movie from now on
reviews.content: I'm having a hard time findig words to describe how great this movie is. Acting, story and production are a masterpiece. From tears, laugh to sweaty palms, everything is there.

I originally gave Top Gun 2 a 9 but I up'd it to a 10 because it's the first movie I paid three times to go see in the theater. I took my 79 year old mom on the third trip and she actually stopped talking...as in she remained quiet and glued to the movie throughout. My mom never stops talking so that was amazing by itself. Mom left the theater crying because she was so moved by the film. Great acting, story and action. A great feel good movie with no political tones. No sex and very little foul language. Great!!

Perfection-wouldn't change a thing! Top Gun Maverick was very much worth the wait-it delivered and exceeded expectations. Tom Cruise was phenomenal as was the rest of the cast and storyline. This sequel had so much depth, heart, action/suspense along with a great chemistry/romance between Maverick and Penny (loved the Jennifer Connelly/Tom Cruise pairing). Highly recommend this movie-it's truly one of the best!

reviews.review_title: Very good, but not better than the original.
reviews.content: If you born in my generation (1974) , I'll have a hard time believing you liked this better than the original. It's still a very strong movie. It lacks character development, and some of the big names are just throw aways. It dives right into the mission and there isn't much else to the plot other than that. It's the Tom Cruise, Miles Teller show. If they stuck to the formula of the original I could have cared more about the supporting cast, but they are nobodies. But I can see every generation outside of my own thinking it's better than the original. 30 years later.

The movie is entertaining and the flight effects are impressive.The problem is the obvious military propaganda.Who made the US the world police to determine what other independent countries could do? Over the past two administrations, we all see the problem with this concept. At least, the rest of the world does.They were careful to never name this 'evil' opponent. That allows them plausible deniability.So go see it if you want. Just see it for what is actually is.

I watched the original one the night before I watched this and it was one of my great decisions! The scenes and how the filmed was constructed was amazing. And ofc- Miles Teller?! Did he just become a man over night?! Loved it. MUST WATCH.
No words to say it's tom cruise. The co actors and Tom have done a mind blowing job. All are for real and that's what makes me come back again and again to the piece of cinema.

Let me start by saying the film looks good, it's entertaining enough and pretty much everything you expect from a Tom Cruise film.You don't need to to have seen the original Top Gun to enjoy this one but if you have, you'll get added value and nostalgia with the flashbacks and the appearance of Val Kilmer.But... If you have seen the original, you won't fail to notice the strong similarities between the films. More like a reboot than a sequel:
Maverick is still defying orders and getting away with itThere is still a bar with piano playing, singing and a pretty lady "will they won't they" love interest"Students" once again don't realise they're dealing with their teacher until the next day's slight embarrassmentHangman is Iceman 2.0.Topless beach handball is now topless beach rugbySomeone almost doesn't make it during an exercise and again Maverick gets them back on track and to base.I liked this film enough, especially the second half of it, but think the first installment had more charm.Top Gun Maverick is not a 10/10 or masterpiece but a good 7/10 worth your time.

5th-generation fighters visible on radar, SAMs following planes for seconds close on, flares defending against radar guided SAMs, stealing of a F-14, everything happening in close proximity so that Maverick could find Rooster and then even getting to the the airstrip and the hangar and so on. Ofc, the typical US pathos and psychological problems from the past troubling the characters and the happy end on the carrier, everybody loving everybody, one reunited happy family as it's supposed to be. So we even have a copy of the original Top Gun. But...at least some good action and a no more cocky young Tom Cruise.

Incredibly well crafted! Technically, visually but also in regards to story, script, actor performance and the way it handles time and nostalgia. One of "those" sequels that outperforms the original. Quite an achievement!! A true cinema milestone!

The first Top Gun is one of my all time favorite movies. So this a movie that i have been incredibly excited about to see.And first Off all, before a star the review i just gotta say that this was one of the best cinematic experinces that i have ever had.Soo, what did i think about this movie? "Top Gun Maverick" is a very good movie, slightly better than the first one, and it did have some nice callbacks to the original.Top Gun is a little cheesy and the script in these kinds of movies isn't always the best. But that doesn't really matter, beacuse Top Gun is doing everything else amazing. It's got a great soundtrack and soundmix, the fighting and the flying sequences is just on a whole other level, you can really feel that this is the real deal. And it has a lot of good drama/emotionell moments, especially between Maverick and Rooster (Goose's son) it was also nice to see that Val Kilmer cameo it was a very heartfelt moment that brought a tear to my eyeTop Gun: Maverick might not be the movie of the year, but it's definitely the blockbuster of the year.
Amazing story with full of emotions, action, excitement and everything you need for a top tier movie. It doesn't happen often but this for sure beats the original/first movie.

After 30 years plus, Tom Cruise still giving us an high flying sequel. This how a Blockbuster movie feels like after watching it "Top Gun Maverick", The character Maverick was exceptional, Maverick is Navy captain, who was given an impossible mission, To train young cadets on an impossible Mission.

reviews.review_title: A true to original sequel, but better.
reviews.content: An exhilerating film, with top-tier action sequences, incredible cinematography, a perfectly-paced plot, with an engaging biuld up, leading up to an amazingly intense and breathtaking finale. The beautiful visuals and extraordinary sound design made for one of the best theater experiences of all time.

reviews.review_title: Like shooting womp rats in beggar's canyon
reviews.content: In 1996, a disgruntled Brigadier General Hummel and a group of Marines took over Alcatraz Prison the hopes of forcing the government to pay reparations for men he lost lasering targets during Operation Desert Storm. 25 years later and this time Ed Harris is a Rear Admiral, who believes Maverick is a relic, which considering the original Top Gun was released 10 years before the Rock would seem likely.The main bulk of the film is about the same mission Hummel was doing in Desert Storm, and constructing and training a team to carry out that objective. Yes, compared to the original film, it's as contrived as Luke Skywalkers attack on the Death Star, but part of the contrivance is to provide some wonderful flying shots. Tom Cruise has gone all out on providing aerial action, and there's plenty of reports regarding the boot camp training he put the other actors through to give the viewer the sensation of being there. And it helps that Sony developed Imax compatible cameras small enough they could fit six in a cockpit. Watching on a big screen, with a full Dolby Atmos setup - another suitably stirring soundtrack from Hans Zimmer - is a joy.I think the only disappointment was how much the peril was telegraphed. The set piece scenes flowed beautifully, but predictably, though that was to be expected going in.
Me = Old Retired Math TeacherTop Gun Maverick = TOTALLY AWESOME! Grade A+ (plus some bonus points for throwbacks to the original movie)It lives up to the hype, completely and unequivocally.

This movie was just incredible. It was one of the best movies I've ever seen in my life. It felt so good, like it was just absolutely perfect as it is, and nothing should be changed.The characters are one of the more interesting parts of the movie. There was a fantastic balance of dominating and quiet personalities, big egos and humility, hotshots and not-so-confident pilots. I loved seeing how they developed and grew to work together, with characters becoming closer and closer to both each other, and their goal over the course of the movie. There was a real sense of teamwork and unity among the main cast, and it was a fantastic feeling to see them achieve their victory through teamwork and communication, inspiring each others, saving each other, it was so touching. Every cast member was special, unique, and added beautifully to the balance of the characters.Tom Cruise did a phenomenal job, and I could see his hand throughout the whole movie. He does things to a superior and unmatched level. What blew me away most in this movie was how REAL it was.It's just Such a high-quality and entertaining movie, I really loved it. 100% must watch!! This easily deserves 5 stars.

reviews.review_title: Connection to Top Gun inhances Maverick
reviews.content: The are so many references to Top Gun that brings back memories. I remembered Penny from Top Gun but most could not. There were lines from Top Gun that were repeated in Maverick. The way they brought back Pete Mitchel was in line with the character featuring Maverick at his best. They there are the flying scenes that exceeded the original.

reviews.review_title: A worthy sequel but a tad bit overrated
reviews.content: I have a confession to make. I'm not a massive fan of the original Top Gun. I think it is an ok movie but I don't think it is as amazing as it is as great as it is made out to be. Nevertheless for some reason I get the urge to rewatch it from time to time.Now, 36 years later, there is a sequel. Tom Cruise is back as Maverick with Jerry Bruckheimer as producer along with Cruise and Joseph Kosinski taking over as director from the late Tony Scott. This time we see Maverick returning to Top Gun this time as an instructor for a new group of recruits which includes the son of Maverick's deceased friend.The flight sequences in this movie are enjoyable, in fact more than they are in the first movie. I really liked the interactivity between Maverick and Goose's son Rooster and the reasonings behind it. The friction between Maverick and the Top Gun instructors also added to the movie. It was also nice to see Val Kilmer as Iceman and the scene where they reunite was heartwarming.The movie does however have its downsides. The storyline is a fairly simple one. And I didn't find it as thrilling or as impactful as it is made out to be.Overall it is a worthy sequel that is enjoyable and actually better than the first one although if I'm being honest, I don't think it is as great as it is made out to be.

reviews.review_title: Well Done with no Agendas or Politics
reviews.content: This was a great movie done without any Agenda or politics or Woke ECT.... The movie had a good storyline and the was done in a tasteful way. The actors were awesome with good mix of action and emotions. I like how they reminisced on the original movie but shined a new light on the new crew.

reviews.review_title: Please go see this film in the imax again and again until it stops
reviews.content: Best movie i have seen in yearsWhat an unbelievable experience, Top gun Maverick was even better than i thought it would be.I dont rate many films ten out of ten but this has got it with flying colours pardon the pun..Brilliant cast and fantastic performances along with a great script.Must be some oscars for this surely:-)

"Top Gun: Maverick" is an entertaining time in the vein of an old summer blockbuster but it definitely didn't need to be made. There's nothing really essential here or that additive, but I'm not mad they made it or anything. I think it is a fine film and will probably make a lot of money, but it feels like a remake or rehash of the first film at times more than a sequel. It's almost a shot for shot, scene by scene remake, which just makes me want to go back and watch the original, since a copy is never as good as the original. I also didn't feel attached to the characters or like I knew them well. But the strength of this film is the cinematography which was better than I expected, especially the in-flight sequences. So, I rate this one a 7/10, on par with the recent "Jurassic World Dominion."

Classic but epic. Better watch at the cinema!Tom never disappoints (you're cool man! Maybe it's appropriate if you were Iron Man).After all, this is a classic movie as we all know but it's nice and epic!
Do not, fall for the hype, of this crumby movie. It was TERRIBLE! The effects were cheesy, everything was cheesy! DO NOT FALL FOR THE HYPE!!! Sorry not sorry!

reviews.review_title: They turned it into a family friendly movie
reviews.content: Just going to come out and say it, without Tom Cruise this would have been more quota meeting netflix fodder. He single handily carrys the entire film from start to finish, and was basically the only draw.The rest of the actors are kinda meh, bad one liners, low skill, uninteresting and boring netflix actors.The story is somewhat dumb, dont think about it. Many plot points will come along, and will be...so dumb, just dont think about it. Writing is also ok, no 1000IQ-everyone-is-a-comedian-adderall-yay stuff.Low CGI, great visuals.But this was a family film...thought it would be a bit more adult orientated but no...you were supposed to take children to see this one or something...?The movie is still quite watchable, but only if youre into super family friendly, hi 5s all around, friends forever super cheese.

reviews.review_title: Manages to be dull and full of plot holes
reviews.content: The mach 10 ejection is ridiculous. The main plot is ridiculous, why not just use cruise missiles?Mainly though it just lacks the spark and fun of the original.

I watched this movie at 150% speed, increasing every time pacing felt off. And it was still slow.The message seems to be: even old "planes" can still perform.Almost as if it was made for older conservative American males.When you consider that, and it sure continues the Top Gun tradition, it checks all the boxes: token/trophy women, machismo, utterly faceless antagonist posing a vague nuclear "threat", utterly silly numbers going brrr (Mach 10, 9 G etc.), machismo, barebones plot laid out in detail in advance so to not shock the viewer, hostility towards novelty, military advertisement, and machismo.At least the airplanes aren't CGI, mostly, allegedly.

reviews.review_title: Really good but an emotional punch in the gut.
reviews.content: The movie was fantastic. The dog fights and flight calls were on point, it's sound track was amazing, there was a lot of depth, and it continues amazingly. I just wish the other characters like Bob and Hangman were more fleshed out. Hangman seemed like he changed pretty quickly, even with Maverick's "proof of faith". And Bob seemed like he had a lot going on but nothing to show for it. As for the emotional part, it's one of those movies that you get attached to not pinky for nostalgia and because it's great but because of daddy issues and really identifying with the feelings from it. All in all, amazing movie. Really nice closure for everyone from the original too.

reviews.review_title: Tom Cruise is more than an Actor. A tough lad and a remarkable hustler which makes him a great competitor. He deserves an Oscar for sure!
reviews.content: Tom Cruise will always be my favourite actor. Damn he's a slick who's difficult to compete at any given point of time. Well he's worthy for an Oscar for every movie he makes as he performs his stunts on his own and limits the use of CGI, that's insane my friends. Every movie of his, is like a vacation you really desire to achieve in life like his stunts, his personality, his acting and a finisher in every movie that Hollywood definitely relies on. Well, I'm a huge fan of Tom Cruise and I hope I meet him someday. What an awesome movie I've watched in 2022! Lucky to be a part of this day. This is the best movie this year for me no matter what. Hope he reads this. Going to watch it again...thanks man 🙌

I'm amazed from the great success this movie had and by the so many positive reviews, there are movies that are 100 times better than this that not receive a similar treatment, i think something is wrong in people capacity to judge about when a movie is good or not.This movie was entertaining, that's ok, the combat air scenes were good, that's true, but the overall plot and acting was something mediocre.I never been a great fan also of the old Top gun movie, but even that was probably a bit better than this, at least that one got a masterpiece song in it.I'm not even brutal as other reviewers and i still gave this a six stars, but i honestly don't think it deserves anything more than this.

That is how to make a movie, movie is something what take you inside of the history make you feel part of it and the heroes always win, take his lovely girl and have a happy and.Heroes don't die, don't fight other heroes they help each other's. That is what top gun is about not obout politics like a lot of other movies has been made.

reviews.review_title: Genuinely impressed - watched it twice at cinemas
reviews.content: First review- not a huge fan of Tom Cruise but his acting in this is great. I loved it so much that I went again to the cinemas. It has all of the thrills and action we needed, it's very unusual for me to like a sequel better than the original but it was just the right amount of nostalgia.

It doesn't happen very often that the sequel to a beloved and iconic film is better. I'd say that Top Gun: Maverick is arguably better than its predecessor for many reasons.Firstly I'd add that my opinion of the 1986 original isn't the same as most people. I didn't grow up with the film it was made 9 years before I was born, I didn't actually see it until I was in my twenties. I liked "Top Gun" although I had my issues with certain story elements. Basically I don't have the attachment to the characters or film that someone who was alive when it came out and loved it !For "Top Gun: Maverick" I was hoping for more up to date action and aircraft used, more modern story and less of the cheesy romantic elements. That for me, bogged down the original! For the most part I'd say yes that this film lived up to the hopes and expectations I wanted from it, however I do still have issues with it!Tom Cruise and Joseph Kosinski have teamed up yet again and delivered an incredible rollercoaster of a film. Cruise has dominated the blockbuster genre his entire career, arguably starting with "Top Gun". At last the technology has caught up to the story that is being told. The original had its hands tied with what action it could shoot for its time.........this film blows not just that film but majority of action films out of the water! Heart-pounding, realistic, slick and jaw dropping from start to finish. Every action scene must have taken months and months of planning for to be executed in this precisely! Hats off the Cruise and Kosinski for breaking barriers technologically to shoot parts of this film.The story is more modern and up date! Hints at what the future holds, that manned aircraft will be a thing of the past soon. (There is a video I saw that explained how the film and Lockheed-Martin teamed up to create that futuristic aircraft at the start of the film, super cool 100% check that out). Gone are the F-14 Tomcats of the original film, with the F-18 (pretty sure its the Super Hornet) taking centre stage! (Although itself being replaced by the F-35 these days). Facing off against the new Su-57, which was awesome to see! The mission is simple but effective and give us the chance to get behind a new, young team to take on this task....that seems almost "mission impossible"...haha get it ....its sad I find that amusing!The cast for the most part are great, really bounce off each other and gel really well. Every single character gets a little moment to shine, however some more than others. One of the biggest highlights for me was the cameo of Val Kilmer as Iceman. It as handled incredibly well considering the health issues Kilmer has suffered in his life. Once again showing us a new technology to get around an issue, giving Kilmer his voice back......gave me goosebumps!Cruise, Directing, action, majority of the story and most of the characters worked for me!I have a few negatives, firstly Miles Teller! I dislike this guy more and more every time I see him on screen. Now finding out that he isn't the most likeable person to work with in the world either isn't a surprise. His performance for me doesn't work, feels forced and wooden at times.....Secondly Jennifer Connelly. I love Jennifer as an actress, always brilliant in everything she does and she is good in her role in this film. However for me, the character or relationship with Maverick is not needed and doesn't really achieve anything for the story! I think it was just put into the film to nod back to the original film that had a love story thread! It easily could have been taken out of this film and not been missed!Lastly the ending! Maybe I'm a sour person haha but I was really hoping for a sad ending. I think the story was hinting at it throughout but never payed it off. Maverick dying to me would have done the character justice in the circumstances of this film. Handing the torch over to a new generation of pilots! It would have been bold and worked well.........sadly they went for the easy option ! Although even I'll admit that seeing the F-14 Tomcat at the end was a cool !75% out of 100 ! I would watch this over the original if I was given the chance, not saying the original is bad but this has more going for it in a modern context!

Watch it on the big screen, it needs big picture to enjoy all this flying. And You will hear all those engine sounds next to you.Have You seen Tom Cruise smiling before? Well, You will see it a lot here, a lot.Sometimes a bit too patriotic but this is mandatory for such a movie.Story is too linear and minimal number of surprises.Best Acting Award I'd like to give to Miles 'Rooster' Teller."You told me not to think."

reviews.review_title: Tom is a true movie star.
reviews.content: Really enjoyed the new one. Well produced! Great acting... perfect summer theater movie! Nice surprise seeing Tom's personal intro thanking his viewers for coming into the theater to see his movie. Nice touch!

Tom Cruise is back as Maverick in the sequel entitled "Top Gun Maverick". I was not a huge fan of the original film but I thought it was a very good, entertaining movie when I saw it on videotape back in the eighties.This sequel is just as good as the original film and is worth seeing on the big screen. The cast includes Jennifer Connelly, Ed Harris, Jon Hamm, Miles Teller and Val Killer. The film is well made and well acted. If you liked the first film you will probably enjoy this one too. The story is simple but there is never a dull moment. I hope you enjoy "Top Gun Maverick".

reviews.review_title: definitely better than the original even if predictable
reviews.content: The movie is done right on so many levels and I can tell the huge effort put into it. The skill put into work is outstanding - visuals, sound, directing and acting. The movie follows a similar formula as the first even if obviously up to modern day and age. Whoever did Tom Cruise's make up deserves a special award. That man does look 40 at most. The movie is really enjoyable and the only downside is that is actually quite predictable.

reviews.review_title: OK But Way Over-Rated Sequel (36 Years)...Same & Lame Macho Mayhem Muscle Tech
reviews.content: Over 35 Years in the Making. Relying Mostly on Nostalgia.The Design of the Dog-Fighting, and Technical Expertise Doesn't Look Any Different when Screened Along-Side the Original,So What the Only Thing that can Account for the Extreme Over-Rating of this Rather Routine Formulated Flick, is Nostalgia.But that is a Rather Iffy Explanation for the Buzz that this Mediocre Military Recruitment Exercise has Generated from this Generation of "Americans".Because They weren't Even Close to Being Born When the Original "Top Gun" Dominated as the Year's Most Popular Movie, So Take Nostalgia Out of the Equation.It Seems Flag-Waving Nationalism as the "No-Room-For-Mavericks in This-Here Man's Military.Disciplinarians, who are Consistently Up-Staged and Out-Smarted by a Hot-Shot Rouge 30 Year "Captain", Never Goes Out of Style.Because, You-Know 'They Can't Handle the Truth", Blinded by Rules and Regulations and Have No Tolerance for Anyone No Matter How-Highly Skilled and Effective that Strays from the Herd.The Movie is Just Another "John Wayne" Rebel-Rousing Spine-Tingler for the New-Breed of Gung-Ho Types that Live to Die for Their Country and Then Some.It's a Slightly Above Average Military Movie that has All the Money to Make it All Entertaining and Easy on the Eyes.But One has Only to Look at the Mission and Anyone that has Seen Luke Skywalker's Buzzer-Beater as He Drops One Down the Chute, will Know that the Core of this Film is Based on an Unacknowledged Rip-Off of a Movie that was Even More Popular than Tony Scott's Original,It's a Popcorn Movie that is as Dumb as Dirt.Packaged in Shiny, Loud, Obnoxious Wrapping,that Stuns and Numbs the Senses into Submission and Turns Critical Faculties into Mush.Failing to Recognize this Empty Vessel that is Delivered as a 2 HR Escapist Video-Game that was Dated a Decade Ago.It's Probably been at Least That Long Since a Movie has been This Overrated.With Very Low-Low Expectations it's...Worth a Watch.

Loved the flying scenes but movie DRAGGED down with all those tedious close ups of Cruise with that same facial expression. To a much lesser degree, same for Connelly. Getting rid of these narcissistic tedious useless segments would have cut AT LEAST 20 useless minutes from the film and improved its poor pacing.
I can't let this film sit at a 8.6 when it's really a 7. It's a good movie bit that's about it. Not every deep. Been done before. Kinda boring. Still worth one watch in my opinion tho.

reviews.review_title: Look around - have you seen a movie to be scored 10/10 by so many people?
reviews.content: We've been starved of proper action movies for long. Sure marvel movies are action movies in own respect but majority of them won't hit you high as this one. This is a movie you will want to watch it again and again. It's simply that good.

This movie is classified a masterpiece of how to do a sequel of classics, so good with a nostalgic reference of the first one. I just came off the theater with a incredible and simple sensation that I just watched a good movie.
It was great to see this film in theaters. The acting was superb, as was the story. It captures the magic of why you must see certain films at the cinema.

reviews.review_title: - both the story and the action scenes do not disappoint
reviews.content: I got my hopes up a bit too high when I saw it had an 8.6 on IMDB. I'd put it at more of an 8.2, which is still a really good rating. Overall, this paid homage to the first film and expanded on its themes in a more mature manner.Pete Mitchell AKA Maverick goes from an ambitious, self-absorbed, flirtatious (well, he's still all of that)... but the point is he had more of a character arc than the first film. He wants to make peace with Goose's son Rooster (who acts towards Maverick with hostility) and he needs to forgive himself and move on. He's torn between Penny Benjamin, who rekindles his motivation, and Adm. Simpson, who justifies an end to his career. Miles Teller's Goose must forgive his father's friend's decision to delay his training and is influenced by Phoenix and Hangman (reminiscent of Ice from the original). It's an adequate arc for both characters (but mainly Maverick) to ground the aerial sequences. I was surprised how many non-aerial scenes I enjoyed. The bar scene, the Iceman reunion, and Pete's visit with Penny all added emotional weight compared to the lackluster story of the original. From a plot perspective, the story and pacing Maverick isn't dramatically different from the original: starting with a semi-perilous aerial scene, transitioning into numerous training scenes with a romantic side plot, and concluding with a combat scene. It's just the filmmaking for Maverick was more successful in just about every way. The Hans Zimmer score immersed me and inspired me in a way I haven't felt since watching Interstellar. It wasn't all electric guitar and rock music. The authenticity of the cinematography and VFX is undeniable. There are interior shots, exterior shots, extreme close-ups and pan-outs. The original didn't lack these qualities; but, due to the dialogue and the capabilities of modern technology, the action scenes were much easier to follow. The final half hour of the film really ramped up the VFX and suspense to a Mission Impossible level; and, I can't help but admit how fun it was to watch those scenes in the theatre. The ending was certainly feel-good (if not a bit cheesy) with Maverick and Goose coming home alive, reconciling with one another, and Maverick going off with Penny. The message of letting go of the past is nothing new in cinema; but, it was the center of a strong story aimed at completing Pete Mitchell's character arc from the first film in a satisfying manner. Complex characters, a cohesive story, and some of the most immersive and suspenseful action scenes in recent times prove that Maverick soars above the original.

reviews.review_title: Another successful collaboration between Tom Cruise and Christopher McQuarrie
reviews.content: Although the original characters have been created by Jim Cash and Jack Epps, the story writers and screenplay writers have turned the Top Gun story to the next level.The audience is invested in the main characters and knows clearly what's at stake at the different moments in time. The stakes may change but they all build up to this final moment. This movie has all the good things from other Cruise-McQuarrie movies like Edge of Tomorrow, M. I. Rogue Nation and M. I. Fallout.This is the summer blockbuster we have been waiting for: one where the amazing action ADDS to the story but is not the sole cause of tension.This is how it's done. It's rare to see it, but this is how an action movie is done.

Can honestly say well worth the 36 year wait. Tom Cruise at his best. After watching the original the night before I can honestly say the sequel is far better with a much better storyline and the plane sequences are far superior. Amazing movie and well deserved of its 10/10 review!!!!

reviews.review_title: One of the best movies you'll ever see.
reviews.content: The direction is brilliant.Action scenes spot on. Just like the precision maneuvering required thru the grand canyon at Mach 10. No more, no less.Would hav given it a 10 if there was a little more counter from behind enemy lines.Worth every second and every penny, nonetheless.

Top Gun Maverick will not become a classic as the 1986 version.Never less, the flying scene are absolutely stunning and amazing. Your stay glued to your seat with those action packed moments. Even more when you know those are not computer generated images.

reviews.review_title: Decent sequel to the superior original
reviews.content: I was worried about a Top Gun sequel. It just seemed like a bit of a cash grab. But I think this does a decent enough job of entertaining the audience. Although, the top marks being given to it by IMDB reviewers and professional reviewers is a bit over the top.The stand-out part of this film is the aerial cinematography. It really does look fantastic. I saw it at home but I think I would have been blown away by it if I had gone to the pictures to see it. The action scenes really are exciting to watch. All this nice action cannot cover up the problems elsewhere. Also, it was lovely to see Val Kilmer.The plot is basic. There's nothing fresh or original about the plot. The love story sub-plot between Tom Cruise and Jennifer Connolly is totally unnecessary. It seems pretty obvious this role was written for Kelly McGillis but she must have refused to return for this film. In that context, it would have made more sense. It should really have been cut from the film.Ejecting from a jet at Mach 10 and not dying? Nonsense!The Top Gun pilots are all as dull as dishwater. Not the larger than life characters we had in the original. The 80's cheesiness is missing. There's very little character work beyond Miles Teller and Tom Cruise's interactions.To sum up, it's a good film that is worth a watch, with beautiful action in the sky but that's all. It's no masterpiece.

reviews.review_title: My god what an awesome action moofie
reviews.content: Realistic flight scenes, wizzo or Rio's blacking out as they pull the g's and cool sequences.Not a terrible story, a little out there, but we are certainly all perturbed by a nation that wishes to make nuclear weapons.So its not implausible. The f14 bit at the end is a little implausible, but real cool. As for the pundits canning the f14 simply being blown from the sky by the suukois, they weren't squawking so they are unlikely 2 simply blow it out of the sky they would close to make contact and comms but would b suspicios. So not completely implausible.

If you loved the original you will love this. The flying in this movie and watching the F-18s was stunning. I got choked up, it was a movie that brought me back to my childhood but also spoke to a different age where unmanned aircraft is becoming more common. It was entertaining, had a decent storyline and it definitely didn't loose that loving feeling. Very much enjoyed it and was happy to go to a theater to see it not just for the stunning jet scenes but to experience it with other fans.

Unbelievable, ridiculous, predictable, stupid, patriotic, unlikeable characters, stereotypical, illogical, full of macho posturing. The action is irrelevant.Anyone who can simply switch off here for 2 hours and enjoy the nonsense is already very undemanding. A generic action film from the bar with heart and soul.

This is without a doubt the best film I have ever watched and the hype did not disappoint. We got to see hidden characters from the original film, as well as copied scenes with never equipment which makes it feel like you're watching the original all over again. Cinematography was outstanding, I'm not saying the acting and plot were amazing either but by god when some scenes of those aircraft came I was taken back by the beauty. In my eyes this film was perfect but maybe that's because I'm an aviation enthusiast. Perfect for anyone into aviation.

Went to see this one yesterday.Left the cinema double hearted. On the one hand, The movie is well made. Beautiful pictures, Nice flying scenes, and lots of action. And that music adds very much to this movie. It all breathes 'eighties' again. Which, according to my own opinion' was the era when the most rocking films were made. Somehow films nowadays lack something, even though picture and sound get better and better.But on the other hand... I could not help but get a flashback to Iron Eagle. The story actually is very thin. The recruits weren't ready when Ice died. And suddenly, within a week, they go on a successful mission. They couldn't hit the practicebox laser guided, but on the mission Rooster, hits the target just by hand. I mean, thrilling action, but it's lacks every sense of logic.Also, the relationship with Penny, just seems added because there 'has to be some love in it' It does not add anything to the story, just like their sailing trip and the jumping out of the house.(To be honest, she ís important at one moment, but I won't spoil everything ;-) )Especially of zero importance are the scenes when the missions done. Suddenly Rooster and Mitchell are working in a hangar filled with bikes and a P51 which is his. Where did this come from? What happens then are just poster moments.So this movie leans on action, beautiful fighting scenes and the fame of it's predecessor. Yet it was entertaining. I would give it 6 starts, but since I freaking LOVE that guitartheme, I add one extra star for the music. So 7 stars. Brilliant movie? Hell no, but entertaining? Absolutely, preferably on a big screen and loud speakers of at least decent quality.

reviews.review_title: So wrong but yet so right...
reviews.content: Let me start off by saying that throughout my life, as a someone who enjoys both art-house as well as blockbuster movies, I've always had a difficult relationship with Tom Cruise.Cruise is a man who many just love to hate, and to some extent for good reason, ranging from his oddball religious viewpoints and quite memorable borderline insane Oprah appearance to movies like Far and Away and Jerry Maguire (yikes!).And however inclined I may be to understand those who dislike the guy for the above mentioned reasons, there is also another Tom Cruise, namely the actor who is pretty much the nicest to moviefans, doesn't get involved in abuse, addiction or other kinds of trouble and, most importantly, is one of the few people in Hollywood who just understands great filmmaking.Because great filmmaking is exactly what Cruise has shown quite consistently over the past two decades with, dare I say, Top Gun: Maverick as his Magnum Opus (for now at least).I, a 40-plus year-old, saw Top Gun: Maverick with my teenage sons and all three of us just loved it. It is honest, exciting and compelling from start to finish and unites contemporary filmmaking with the type of films many of 'us' enjoyed during our early child- and/or adulthood.So, despite of all of his shortcomings, I can only conclude that Tom Cruise is just quite simply the KING of blockbuster cinema.9 out of 10.

Top Gun was a culture defining phenomenon in the 80's that ultimately was spoken about for decades. The odds of having a sequel to something and it being even halfway decent is on the brink of impossible when you consider the track record of sequels. Ladies and gentlemen, Top Gun: Maverick is to Top Gun as Terminator 2 was to The Terminator...What Cobra Kai was to the Karate Kid. There is a reason Tom Cruise received a 6 minute standing ovation at the Cannes film festival.What this movie has shown is no matter how much time has passed since a previous film, greatness can always be achieved if the right talent is behind it and the passion is there. Joseph Kosinski, the writers, supporting cast, and of course Tom Cruise hit this out of the park! It was beautifully filmed, well paced, and had some breathtaking action sequences all throughout. The same magic that made audiences obsessed with fighter jets and the Navy/Air Force from the first film was achieved here but in an even greater scale if you can believe it.The film made me appreciate even more the limited scope of time when I saw elements of my childhood on the big screen and it gave so much brilliance and justice. This is one of Tom Cruise's greatest achievements in which he declares I AM STILL ONE OF THE GIANTS. This film at times brought tears to my eyes. It will be the "!" to bring people back post pandemic to where movies really matter, the big screen!! Thank you so much to everyone involved and the work that went into this. This film is a masterpiece and boy does it ever pay homage to the original. Many think it's better than the original. You be the judge and don't watch this on anything less than a premium screen such as IMAX or GPX!

I have no words. This movie feels perfect in every way. I honestly wouldn't change a single thing about it. I was speechless after the movie, only able to just keep saying how good the movie was.I have three different groups of people that I told about the movie and they want to go see it. I will go see it with them, each one of them, and cherish the movie over and over again.Well done on this cinematic masterpiece. Next up, IMAX experience.

reviews.review_title: A solid upgrade to the original
reviews.content: I did watch the original in 1986 and then re-watched it more the 10 times on different medias throughout the years: VHS, DVD and now Bluray.A sequel that it is not a superhero movie, not a unimaginative Disney's IP's... Overloaded with CGI (watching you, Marvel)Thank you Mr Cruise, the cast and the team behind the camera. John Kosinski delivers a brilliant tribute to the original but with current technologies. And Tom Cruise and the flying cast put us inside the cockpits of the planes.Kudos to the "young" cast who was subject to real flying conditions at the request of Tom Cruise.As they say in interview : maybe this movie will be one the rarest to be shot practically. The areal scenes are impressive and make the original "obsolete", or Midway (2019) a real piece of cr...I had a great time watching it. And can wait for a Bluray full of behind the scenes.
Not a Tom Cruise fan, but I really enjoyed it.Despite the fact that it was predictable, it had lots of action and stunts.There were several laughs and throwbacks to the original along the way.

What an awesome movie. Great plot, and I was about to give this 9 stars but the ending wrapped it really well. There were a few details that were unrealistic but overall most audiences wont notice them. Go see it!

I hate Top Gun. I think it's boring, pointless, cringey, and cheesy, and not the good kind of cheesy. It also doesn't help that I hate Val Kilmer. Halfly because of some scummy things he's done and the other half is I think he's a bad actor. (Who the hell thought it was a good idea to cast him as Batman?)However, what everyone gets out of Top Gun I get out of this one. It still has cheesiness but it's the fun kind of cheese.

....THIS is how you do fan service, The Last Jedi.The only bit of trepidation I had before going into this was then Luke Skywalkering Maverick. But, I'm happy to report that that's not the case. Yes, the dialogue is a tad corny, of course it's more than a little cheesy in places, but that's EXACTLY what we (the 80's kids) wanted.Thank you, Tom Cruise. Thank you, Joseph Kosinski.
When I go to a movie, it just has to entertain me. And this one did in spades. The flight scenes alone will have you glued to your seat. Brilliant sequel!!

Wow wow wow ,,that is first word that came out from my mouth a moment that seen this epic movie ,,after waiting for 36 years this is perfect sekuel for me again wow ,,wow ,,wow ,,lot of emotion ,,lot of thrilling,,lot of dramas that make this sekuel is beyond with its original film back then in 1986 (i was five years old that time now 41 yo)but i had saw this original film for many times ,, because i like scenes of dog fight plane ,,althought i did not yet understand what they saying in film ,,get back to sekuel ,,tom cruise ,,ahh my fav actors of all time ,,seem his never changed for this 36 years ,,as always he did great job for this sekuel to happen ,,salute to other crew members film,,and ice ,,he just stunning actors ,,and the aircraft ,,whoa that is no animation there ,,that is scene real war aircraft and tom it self fled it ,,another great job he did ,,this film is worth oscar in every angle of filming ,,great job tom cruise and friend ,,waiting for top gun 3 ,,maybe i 65 yo later ,,peacee.

I went to the theater with a very high expectation and left without any disappointment, but with tears and joy. This movie is just so fantastic in any ways - the nostalgia, emotions, excitement, music, less CGI, and of course Tom Cruise's (Maverick) charm and chemistry with other pilots, especially Rooster, coming from the comnection that Maverick once had with Goose 36 years ago. All in all, this is the movie to be seen on big screens, IMAX if possible.

Exhilarating action sequences, and nostalgia, are the main event of Top Gun: Maverick since its formulaic plot and side characters that seem generated by algorithms aren't really left much to be desired.

9.6/10
The movie is amazing! The plot, fighting scenes, Tom Cruise's acting, nostalgia, amazing plane scenes and so on. I can go on and on about this movie. This is the best sequel I have ever seen (on par with Terminator 2: Judgement Day). It is worth the wait. Everyone in the cinema was mesmerized by the movie. What a treat!Tom again defies age and expectation. He is truly a Hollywood legend and deserves an Oscar (for what he has done so far). What an actor and he will be missed tremendously when he'll retire from acting.An absolute must watch movie! You won't be disappointed.

I had really been looking forward to this film, the trailers made it look amazing, but alas, they're the best part of the film.If one ignores the implausible start of Maverick surviving his plane disintegrating at hypersonic speed, the rest of the film is almost a shot for shot remake of the original film is, albeit with the Star Wars "canyon run" scene at the end.From the nauseating scene in the bar with the new recruits not realising it's their future instructor they are taking the micky out off, to the obligatory topless volleyball scene, I thought the copying of these iconic scenes from the original was unnecessary.To add drama to the film they pretend the American fleet airarm (the most technologically advanced in the world) is somehow outgunned by a nameless enemy using 5th generation fighters.As I said before, the ending is a ripoff of the climatic end to Star Wars, so is completely predictable.Not a bad film, particularly if you haven't seen the original or Star Wars, but I was expecting much better.

reviews.review_title: I got the Need! The Need for Speed!
reviews.content: After 36 years, we are finally able to watch the sequel to the 1986 Top Gun. I was a little baffled when they announced they were making a Top Gun sequel as I wasn't fond of this idea of making sequels to really old movies for the sake of banking on nostalgia. The first film was pretty great and I just didn't feel like the sequel could be as good as the first one. So is Top Gun: Maverick a cash grab or a worthy sequel?Firstly, the flying scenes are breathtaking! All of these sequences make you feel like you're in the cockpit and air with them. This is because they did it practically by actually having the actors be in these jets for real. The director fitted cameras into these cockpits and attached them to the side of these jets. This allows for some downright amazing shots and makes the scenes feel more believable. The action scenes are just intense and exhilarating with it having me on the edge of my seat. This is especially noticeable in the final act which is one of the best I've seen in recent memory. Additionally, the music score by Harold Faltermeyer, Lady Gaga, Hans Zimmer, & Lorne Balfe is very good. I love how they incorporated those 80s tracks into the film while giving more modern and fitting music as well. Furthermore, their music score during the intense action scenes are well done and helps to make the scenes tenser.Tom Cruise is still great as Maverick even after almost 30 years. He still embodies the character perfectly and does feel like a natural evolution of his character from the first film. I genuinely believe that this is what Maverick would be like in 30 years. Miles Teller is also great as Rooster, Goose's son, and he has great synergy with Tom Cruise in their scenes together. Jennifer Connelly plays the new love interest for Maverick, Penny, and she is also great in her role thanks to her great chemistry with Tom. Glen Powell plays the rival to Miles and he is very good at being this overly cocky, hateable guy. Likewise, Jon Hamm plays the commander that is antagonistic to Maverick and he also does a good job at being hateable as well. Val Kilmer is one of the few actors from the original to return and I was interested to see how they would handle his throat cancer situation in real life. Thankfully, this film handles it respectfully and probably results in one of the most emotional scenes in the film. The rest of the supporting cast, including those who play the recruits, all do a good job as well.Moreover, the story itself is also surprisingly enjoyable. The first Top Gun was a cheesy action flick but this one is a very down to earth, character-driven story. Maverick is a lot wiser now thanks to the character arc he got from the first film when he was a student. However, now he has to be the teacher and this is a great antithesis to the story in the first film. The conflict he has now is having to train these recruits to do a suicide mission. He is struggling with the idea of sending other people to their death. It gets worse when one of these recruits is the son of his once best friend. The conflict between Maverick and Rooster is the emotional core of this film. This family dynamic is the most engaging aspect of this film and where the heart of the story lies. Seeing Maverick still trying to cope with the death of Goose and having to deal with the fact that his son could also now die is just captivating stuff.Nevertheless, I do have some minor nitpicks with the film. I do find the dynamic of the recruits never does quite match the dynamic of the recruits from the first film. I never felt as strong of an attachment to the recruits and this is probably due to the film focusing on the teacher Maverick. There is also a romantic subplot with Maverick and Penny that just feels very superfluous. It never felt like the romance part was even connected to anything in the main plot. Heck, you could take this romance subplot and Penny out of the film and the main story is still the same. It just felt like the romance plot just took away screen time from the interesting stuff. I am also a little annoyed that there is no dialogue or line to explain why Maverick isn't with Charlie from the first film anymore. Especially, considering how relevant that character was in the first film.Overall, Top Gun: Maverick is better than the first movie in almost every aspect. It has more amazing action sequences and a more interesting character-driven story. In a world where CGI seems to always be the go-to solution, we then get a rare movie like this where the majority is practical and it is all the better for it. This is not only a worthy sequel but also an amazing accomplishment in movies.

I just loved this sequel, it feels like i waited for 36 years for this movie to release and grap the box offce. Although i am 24 years old.The cinematics and hats off to the crew and kudos to the tom for performing all the stunts for real.

Damn entertaining!It has more or less the same GREAT script as its predecessor, but that's what we expected. A long ride into the past that really thrilled me and shows how much Tom Cruise (and not just him) cared about making this film.A love story with us the audience that I will never forget.

Are we so bombarded by bad movies and TV that when one that is competently done comes along, viewers and critics go gaga? I'd been surprised by the high RT score for this, and the praise it got from friends, so I finally watched TOP GUN REDUX. It's competently done homoerotic military porn and nothing more, without even the courage to explore the political and cultural implications of billion dollar death machines. Maverick (played possibly by a deep fake of Tom Cruise -- who knows at this point?) inexplicably flies into a time loop and repeats the events of his life from decades ago, except this time the lovely Kelly McGillis is played by the lovely Jennifer Connelly, and there may have been some other cast changes but that doesn't seem to matter. Somehow a mustache is involved. John Hamm continues in his mortgage-paying role as uptight company man.

reviews.review_title: Great entertainment, albeit cliched and predictable at every turn
reviews.content: Top Gun Maverick is great entertainment, with an emotional story and outstanding special effects. It gives us one of our first post-COVID chances to get together and root for real, human heroes in a deep release of built-up tensions. The story is also cliched and predictable at every turn. It plows through anyway, and so it should, because its focus is on creating a nearly impossible task for our hero and his team, against the rogue military enemy and against the bureaucratic one. We feel the crescendo of tension, the wins and losses along the way, and if the story had only been a bit more realistic we might even have believed that our hero could lose. But no, that is not going to happen, and he triumphs in glorious fashion: against the enemy, against the bureaucracy, against age, against the smarmy attitude of youngsters ... a great, wonderful triumph indeed.

OK if you know the slightest thing about planes, radar, missiles, chain of command etc then you are going to find this movie stupid, really really stupid. The 'plot' could have be written by a child (who'd just watched starwars - seriously)There is no chemistry at all between tom and jennifermost of the film is a shot for shot remake of the original, just small details change - american football instead of vollyball for instance.Val Kilmers part was painful to watchThen 3/4 of the way through something very odd happens, they decided to make a totally different film, akin to the A-Team or something. Just so happens the 'enemy' have an old f14! Worklng and ready to roll, and by luck a pilot knows how to refuel it, prime it and start it, with no ground crew at all!! And wow, would you believe it the 'enemy' even had it fully loaded with weapons so our heros can make their escape, but I suppose if you believe a pilot can survive a plane crash at mach 10+ then you've already turned off your brain to watch thisThe USA can also use missiles to take out a whole runway protecting the target but it seems the 'gps' jammers somehow stop them bombing the target ?!?!?!?!??!
