Not sure whoever wrote this trash did a lot of research (ie NONE)so in summary - its fun, tom is ageless, the action is top notch, but its dumb, so so dumb, fell head first into the hollywood sequel trap - bigger is better.

My second 10 this year after No time to die. What a remake? The previous users said it all. No words needed for this ultimate blockbuster. Tom is ageless!!!The icing on the cake is the special appearance of Val Kilmer.

That a Top Gun 2 happened twenty years later highlights that it was never a necessity in the first place. There's nothing new or worthwhile to the venture, and cheapened by weaving in political sub-plots to today's world. The Top Gun 'universe' is not better now than before.It just emphasizes the continuing ways that Hollywood is struggling from a creativity and production standpoint. The big time lone producers with guts and vision replaced by a conglomeration of financial backers and boardroom analytics who don't value the daring and creative scriptwriters and ideas people. Opting instead for employees who'll follow instructions. Or something like that.

reviews.review_title: Good movie, but not that great.
reviews.content: This was an entertaining film; the flight visuals were terrific, and were by far the highlights of the movie. Otherwise, the plot was unrealistic (training for a mission of that complexity in a few weeks?), and the story line was pretty pedestrian. Worth watching for 2 1/4 hours, and I didn't fall asleep, but the rave reviews seem a bit overblown.

reviews.review_title: Now that's how you make a sequel baby. Don't retread; expand. Don't copy the original; contrast it. And if it's a blockbuster, for the love of god make that action sing!
reviews.content:
'Maverick' achieves it all. As a spectacle it is an easy 5/5. Producing set pieces of unprecedented beauty. Sequences sent straight from the heavens (or maybe a deal with the devil?) Not too mention the scale, the GODDAMN SCALE!In short, action cinema soaring high on a level of its own making.Buut, this movie gives just as much time to its characters when they're on the ground and here, it's a mix bag of well rounded development and nauseating cheese.Miles Teller gets the better end of it. A rich character with plenty of heft behind him to compete with Cruise's already guaranteed hero statues. Some of the strongest scenes involve only the two of them.The worst is Jennifer Connelly (a great actress), who while everyone else gets to soar in the sky, receives 'unoffending female love interest'.This would be a minor issue if she weren't given a mountain of screen time, and the scenes between her and Cruise ...just need to go! Just cut, it's okay. No one cares. Get to the jets please! (They might as well be playing brother and sister with that lack of chemistry)
Also that's a really stupid rule for a bar...

Top Gun was one of the new releases I was least excited about, primarily because I didn't particularly enjoy the first one. This one was surprisingly good. This sequel is the rare occurrence where the sequel supersedes its predecessor . Started off a little slow but had a great last hour. I do think the movie would be better watched in theaters opposed to streamed because you need the big screen to take in the shots of the terrain, close ups of the pilots, and the sound of speed to make the movie a little more exciting. All in all, pretty good.

This was great, we're there problems? Yes, does it really matter? No. Am I hoping this helps Hollywood change all their recent, last 5 years, antics? Yes. Hollywood does much better entertaining people than putting them in reeducation classes.So for that reason alone, I have to love this film. That is just pure entertainment, no reeducation.

reviews.review_title: A worthy sequel, but a military dud...
reviews.content:
The movie is a worthy sequel to the 1986 original, it pushes all the right emotional buttons and occasionally brought a lump to my throat. I like the film and would see it again.But while the flying scenes are thrilling, you could not help get the feeling that something is being rushed or missed here.The following, which appears elsewhere but is likely to be poorly shared, explains it all:"While very entertaining to watch, there were several issues with the way the mission was planned and executed that
would likely have played out very differently in real life.In the film, Maverick assesses the operational problem based on a quick survey of some photos and determines the method for destroying the target almost instantly. In real life, an entire cell of joint planners would analyze the problem for days if not weeks and come up with multiple courses of action that could achieve the goal, and the decider for a target such as this would probably be the President (since the enemy is very clearly supposed to be Iran).Maverick airily assumes away the stealth capability of the F-35 (as well as Air Force assets such as the B-2), and immediately assesses the job can only be done by F/A-18s for reasons unexplained. There is no discussion of using electronic warfare aircraft and/or cyber attack to shut down or at least hinder the enemy's integrated air defense system.The Navy uses cruise missiles to strike an enemy airfield to keep additional enemy fighters from taking off but does not seem to consider striking the enemy surface-to-air missile systems, radars, and command-and-control nodes by the same method. There is no combat air patrol (CAP) of F-35s to engage enemy fighters and protect the strike aircraft on egress from the target (even if we agree with the basic assumption that F/A-18s were necessary for the strike, F-35s, not more F/A-18s would be the clear choice for the CAP).There is no reason why the strike aircraft would be loaded exclusively with flare countermeasures instead of chaff when the threat was clearly understood to be radar-guided weapons.Finally, the strike aircraft were loaded out with laser-guided bombs requiring a diving delivery, high-G pulloff, and spotting of the target with a laser from the wingman; GPS-guided munitions could have hit the target with a higher probability of success and lower-risk level delivery over the target.All of the above issues added more drama and action onscreen but also severely eroded the military realism."

This movie relies very heavily on two things: one is an immersive and authentic experience of flying jets and the other is nostalgia of the previous film. While it may stress the realism and even succeed in some ways in others this movie is pretty distant from reality. The characters are some of the most recalcitrant and disorderly members of the military.Though it tries so hard to tie the two movies together, going so far as to recreate scenes, it doesn't really need that. Who knows exactly how we would feel if it was simply a stand alone film but I think most could enjoy it just as much. It might even be the extremely rare(if not only) occasion where the sequel is better than the original.I still think it is overrated by word-of-mouth but for once you have a film that knows what the appeal is and just gives you that. Top Gun: Maverick isn't extraordinary but it's a good old fashioned movie.

I can say it's quite rare to find a sequel that is as good (or even better) than its predecessor.While the 1st movie focuses more on the drama and relationships of pilots in the Top Gun academy, the 2nd one is packed with more action and intense maneuvers.Top Gun: Maverick has managed to exceed expectations.

I don't give 9/10 ratings lightly. If you just want to see a good movie with convincing acting, solid, sensible plot, great cinematography, and suspenseful action, without all the nonsense we get in a lot of movies today, then you'll enjoy this movie.The things in seeing people complain about is mind boggling..Was there 80's nostalgia? Yes, but you can easily forget about it once the plot progresses. Some have issue with the military aspect of the film. Top Gun is about pilots in the Navy. So you not expect them to show the military? If you can't enjoy the movie because you're not a fan of Tom Cruise, then that's a personal problem.In the end, Top Gun Maverick is one of the best films this year. It made a billion at the box office for a reason. For every complaint you see about this movie, simply ask yourself, "is that issue REALLY something that will make this movie not enjoyable?" You'll find that it's not. This movie was great for all the things it's supposed to be. I wasn't big on the love interest plot, but you know what? The rest of the movie washed it over for me.

reviews.review_title: Worth The Wait, This Was Actually a Really Good Movie
reviews.content: I had doubts, I really did expect to be disappointed. But, I was in for s great movie, a movie that was worth the wait. I really have not watched a movie in the last 10 years that has been this good. Thanks Tom.

In a lot of ways Top Gun original is far superior. In TG2 The so called never seen before aerial scenes much vaunted by TC in promoting this film amounted to a fizzer compared to TG1. Some of flight scenes I dare say were embarrassingly boring. Basically it's just showing the pilots body swaying left to right while moaning and breathing heavy. The hillside or mountains in the background doesn't really portray how fast or how dangerously low the plane is flying so it's a dismal failure with all the cameras in the cockpit. In some ways it's a bit like the Emperors new clothes. Camera crew were probably too scared to say in front of TC, umm I don't think the scene or shot works...some of the dialogue was cringe worthy cheesy. None of the magic in TG1 has been replicated unfortunately. I think this movie would have been a lot better if TC was just the leading actor not also the producer.

reviews.review_title: The summer Hollywood blockbuster is finally back!
reviews.content: I watched this in a cinema with motion enhanced seating, three generations of movie goers sitting side by side. Safe to say we were all literally blown away - including our 60+ year old nanna.This is by far the best feel good Hollywood movie or Sequel I watched within the last 6 years easy! Respectful to the original characters, the movie introduces a new set of compelling characters without demeaning their older and beloved predecessors. Star Wars, Kathleen Kennedy, and Rian Johnson could learn a thing or two here - this is how you create a sequel.Go watch this - twice if you can.

Masterpiece. All I can say. Every minute oozes nostalgia, excitement and adrenaline. Well thought out storyline and good mix of characters. Coupled with breathtaking stunts, it flew past its predecessor in every way. A great tribute to the original movie.

reviews.review_title: Somehow even better than the original
reviews.content: The original Top Gun was a true classic. It oozed cool, had great camerawork and characters, and featured real F-14s. Top Gun: Maverick is that movie, but better in every way.The camerawork is easily some of the best in modern cinema, nearly all of the effects are practical (there's little to no CGI), and the F-18s are badass. Cruise made the cast go through a 3-month boot camp so that they could actually be in the F-18s for the scenes. It's that dedication to creating the most real, visceral experience of piloting a fighter jet that makes this movie shine. The plot is more than serviceable and the payoff at the end is awesome. This movie has raised the bar on practical effects, and shown that CGI is not the only answer these days. Then there's the more lowkey stuff...The volatile relationship between Maverick and Rooster evolves organically throughout the film in a way that keeps you emotionally invested.There are numerous callbacks to the original film, most of which are wonderfully executed.All in all, this is a great summer blockbuster and one of the coolest movies you'll have seen in a while. Tom Cruise has done it again!

reviews.review_title: Ok after-boomer, go fly a kite at mach 10 and let those 10Gs sink in
reviews.content: I admit I was never a big fan of Top Gun. As a teen I enjoyed the video games but I didn't connect with those bragging brats. I had already discovered cinema through dozens of more substantial movies by then and I was not easily impressed by this Walt Disney actioneer for gen-X teens and late boomers.The sequel has much less bragging and smile-flashing, but all these moments are referenced in a continuous melancholy. Maverick is basically a teen that did not want to grow up, a big creative bias that cashes in on demagogy big time. No, he is not a loser, he is just a nice little bright soldier who stood his ground and did not want to assume bigger responsibilities, let alone become a politician.While the loser approach might have been interesting it is certainly not what people would have welcomed, whereas pure nostalgia of teenage years, with barely a couple of bad memories to put to bed, that is the easy way. As a result Capt. "Maverick" Mitchell is just a veteran teen who happens to still be nice and candid about everything well passed 50y.Bottom line: a sugary nostalgia designed for those with a sweet tooth; otherwise it is a boring actioneer replete with heavy references taking our breaths away for a very long exposition.

I have to say that being an 80's teen and watching the original Top Gun I was trying to figure out why make another one. But now I am like why didn't they do this sooner!! The new Maverick Top Gun is so amazing. I am in awe of how well this was made the action in this movie blew me away. I love feeling the jets take off under my seat. I will pay to see this again. A must say I like this one much better than the original, yep I said that out loud.

reviews.review_title: I feel the Need the Need For Speed
reviews.content: This is a great blockbuster and a great sequel to Top Gun (1986) I love the way this honored the original film and the original Director Tony Scott and I loved the action and seeing the actors actually flying the real planes and I loved hearing some of the lines like talk to me Goose and hearing it from Roster saying talk to me dad and then flooring it and I also loved seeing the relationship between Maverick and Gooses son.

This movie was great. This movie has partly redeemed my faith that Hollywood has the potential to make good movies. The fact that it used practical effects just proves that modern movies don't need to rely on CGI to do amazing things. Thanks Tom, this movie was great.
Finally a movie worth going to see! Awesome. Action packed Top Gun , the new paying homage to the old. I loved the storyline, maybe Hollywood isn't quite done yet.

Wasn't a massive fan of the original. This movie was an improvement in every arena. Obviously, the special effects and cinematography is a step up, but also the acting and script etc.Great action movie with zero political nonsense involved which is rare these days.

reviews.review_title: This isn't a sequel, it's a remake
reviews.content: Having seen the original Top Gun in the theaters, and then again multiple times on video over the years, I was excited to hear about the sequel and couldn't wait to see it.I heard a lot about Maverick and how great it was. But when we went to see it (again, in the theater) I was incredibly disappointed. Perhaps it was my own fault, as I was expecting a completely new movie. Instead, what I saw was virtually a line-by-line, scene-by-scene remake of the original.Obviously the actors have changed, but the story has not. It's literally a remake, right down to the wardrobe and locations.If you never saw the original Top Gun, this will be a really decent movie to see. But if you did see it, be prepared to see it again.

I'll admit, I'm not really a fan of the original Top Gun film. I enjoyed it enough, but I thought that it was just okay, and I didn't see why this film was so beloved. And honestly, if Top Gun: Maverick was the original 1984 movie, I would totally understand the praise. Top Gun Maverick is a great film, and is one of the most tense in a while. While modern films use tons of CGI, the practical effects in this movie serve in it's favor, making it one of the most memorable theater experiences in a while. And it's not just that either.The characters in this film were also very enjoyable. The arc Maverick and Rooster went on, while a little rushed, was fleshed out enough to make it satisfying. Val Kilmer also did a great job in this movie. And the side characters, while forgettable, had their own charm to them.The story can also get a little predictable, but is still engaging from beginning to end, and had a solid amount of depth. One more thing I want to say is that the editing in it was also superb.Overall, Top Gun: Maverick is a great summer blockbuster with thrills, heart, and charm. One of the few films nowadays that you must see in a theater.

reviews.review_title: You come out of the cinema feeling good
reviews.content: See it at a IMAX if you can this film deserves the big screen. I hadn't seen the first one but I was aware of it through clips etc so I didn't know if this was my kind of film. I'm so glad we went to see it, the story galloped along so well there was no gaps with boring plot filler, the arial action scenes were so good you felt you were there with them. I won't mention the ending so as not to spoil it. My way of defining a good film is would I buy it and watch it again and the answer is a resounding yes, I would!

Objectively this is ridiculous. As a piece of cinema it is good. As a sequel to the original Top Gun it is nigh on perfect. If you enjoyed the original all those years ago and now you're on your mid forties like me; you must watch this.

reviews.review_title: Easily the best movie I have ever seen on the big screen.
reviews.content: I have never been so engaged at the theatre before. This is saying a lot for me, as I have sat through many mainstream action movies just checking the clock waiting for it to be over. I don't even have the words to express how well made this movie was. The humor and character development as well as the impeccable dog fight scenes (made with an impressively minimal amount of special effects) made this movie truly exceptional. I made an account JUST to give this movie 10 stars. Definitely worth the watch. Loved it!!!

This is like taking the original top gun script and storyboard and auto merging it with star wars. Shallow story with boring characters relies on recycling, identical shots, scenes and lines and fitting them into somethething where writers obviously couldn't decide whether it is supposed to be remake or sequel and they try to patch it with a nonsense mission. Pretty much anything that happens in the movie is just a massive overcompensation. The real jets footage is impressive, unfortunately it's extremely long, repetitive and boring as they don't really have much of a story to tell and just try to glue the old familiar (like "talk to me, Goose") into something to juice more money out of top gun.

reviews.review_title: A gorgeous remake of the first one.
reviews.content:
So here we go, I just saw Top Gun Maverick nearly alone in a big cinema ... before I start .. I love riding superbikes with shades too, and I could not get a F14 seat due to Covid neither a F18 so the ticket is F15 but I sat in F14 ;) ... nerdfun in a restricted world ..
and the movie .... is it great, no ... it is gorgeous,
Well a bit too gorgeous, every scene looks gorgeous, the bokeh is gorgeous, jennifer looks gorgeous, tom looks gorgeous, the pilots look gorgeous, the camera work is gorgeous, the music (except Gaga) is gorgeous, the end scene is gorgeous, the bikes and cars are gorgeous they even perfected the product placement... and so on hehe ..
Is it better than the first? .. Definitely not but close, I give it a 88/100, while the original got a 95.No wonder all people these days love this softened remake more than the old one. It fits perfect to the IG/Toktok 2022 generation where everything has to be beautiful and so is the movie .. romantic, beautiful, gorgeous everything is good looking, no good guy dies in battle, it can't be a better fit in modern times .. cheesy predictable, amazing popcorn cinema .. well done .. they delivered imho a gorgeous softcore version of togun. I still prefer Lenny to Lady Gaga, and a GPZ900R to a H2.Still this movie is great entertainment and yes Everything Everywhere All At Once is nearly in every way better just not as gorgeous and good looking, well the IG generation gets what they deserve :) ..

Let's just say I have NEVER paid to go see a movie in theaters for a second time and I saw this movie twice in one week. Unreal. Do yourself a favor and read into the preparation these actors had to go through before doing this movie. Makes you appreciate the flight scenes that much more. So much work to make this movie happen and all I have to see THANK YOU MAVERICK!!!

reviews.review_title: Worthy sequel - watched it in theater twice within 3 days, this is how good it is
reviews.content: I am a big fan of the original movie, this sequel does not disappoint at all. It really has exceeded expectation in everyway.3 minutes into the movie it already had me cheered out loud multiple times. Lots of references and tributes to the original movie to reward the decade loyal fans.Be prepared to be touched by a few scenes and shed some tears.First I watched it in regular format, second time in IMAX (visual is outstanding but the sound effect seems so so). Plan to watch again in Dolby Atmos for the height sound effect and also DBOX/4DX for the motion seat effect.For old fans who grow up with the original movie, there might be a bit of a mixed emotion at the end - decades ago you might have lots of dreams and imaginations for your life through projection on the characters at the happy ending of the original movie, now decades have passed we see the characters lived and grew with closure which may make you reflect on your own life just a bit.

reviews.review_title: The pinnacle of the cinematic experience
reviews.content: I feel like IMAX was created with the sole purpose of hosting this film.This movie has everything you could want in a blockbuster like this, and more, much more.ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!Pro tip: Watch Top Gun 1.

I'm at a loss of words with how great this movie was. Miles Teller delivers a phenomenal performance and his appearance is uncanny to that of his late father. There is no bad acting at all, everyone was great. Tom Cruise really outdid himself on this one. The nostalgia that this one brings from the old movie, it really tugs on the heart strings. Val Kilmer's part was one of my favorites, the legendary Iceman! To all of the reviews that rated this movie low, stop trying to be professional critics, cause you are not. Anyone that thinks this was not a good movie needs to rethink their stance on cinema. Don't second guess it, just watch it! You won't regret it.

reviews.review_title: The usual tropes. Plus amazing action scenes.
reviews.content: If you're longing for another shot at the same story, go ahead. The same tropes, the same cliches, the same music even. Expected. But the action scenes were extraordinary.
Loved this movie, it changed how i felt about tom too. The GFX were wild.... and the acting was great. Well done to the whole crew. Can't wait for more.

This movie has one of the plots of today's films, even though it's almost like the first Top Gear. This time, however, Maverick is much better unrolled, with characters having emotional and gerational conflicts. Also, the plot approaches the man x machine question brilliantly, the human unresting desire for breaking his limits, the difficulty of getting old, the almost -like father/son relationship between some characters, etc. A simple but very effective plot, very well played and free of ideological chains. Perfect film to see with family or friends, wich is almost impossible these days. Thank you, Tom Cruise. You are one of my favorite actors in Hollywood since I was child.

What a fantastic movie. Tom Cruise is in a league of his own. What an incredible movie! Great from start to finish. I love the work and dedication Cruise puts into being a master of his craft. Had me on the edge of my seat the whole time.

reviews.review_title: It's only after watching Val, you'd realize just how sad this is
reviews.content: I remember watching the original like it was yesterday. And the new one is pretty much the same thing, except I have moved on some 25-30 years ago, no longer live behind the iron curtain, American black ops don't fascinate me as they used to and I'm probably not as naive as I used to be back then.That said, it was nice to watch a remake for entertainment purposes and it was all good until Val Kilmer came into play. It is only then you'd find out something is very wrong. I have only so often wondered what happened to his career and why it tanked in the second decade, but was never too curious to actually find out. And it is a week after watching Maverick, I got to watch Kilmer's own documentary on his life - Val. And that's a sad story to watch, mind you. And it is only then you'd find out there's more wrong in Cruise's 1000 carat smile that seem to not have aged a day since 1986, sitting right next to Kilmer, who looks barely alive. That comparison is grotesque in many ways.Now, I don't pity him by any means, nor am I patronizing one of the greatest actors. But in the light of said documentary, it feels like the movie does so. So I'm confused here. Movie's entertainment value is okay, it's a nice watch. And that paycheck will probably help Kilmer tie a couple of loose ends. It just feels like a goodbye pity se... you know, can't even say a regular word these days without getting flagged.

reviews.review_title: Finally a decent movie to see at theater....
reviews.content: Usually when movies like this one gets all the hype, it can be a big let down. Not this one. It is exactly what I would expect from a true Blockbuster Movie. It has everything. I'm not a big Tom Cruise fan, but I have to give credit where it belongs. He did an outstanding job on this film. Hats off to you Tom!Since I was in the military, there were a ton of scenes that wouldn't be true because of risk assessments and the interaction with superior officers. But then again, it is Hollywood. This movie did not disappoint. Unfortunately many movies are running out of material and they have to do re-boots of older shows, but not this one. Go to it in a theater!

reviews.review_title: Back to an age of unbridled fun.
reviews.content: Loved it, loved the newness mixed with nostalgia. Done perfectly. If you are picking fault with this movie, you clearly have no fun left in your life. Sit back, enjoy the ride. Mr Cruise delivers a near perfect blockbuster / popcorn , lose your worries for a coupe of hours gem! . I had been wanting to see this for ages and finally got round to it, and I'm kicking myself that it took so long. I was truly touched by it. I smiled, laughed, cried and held my breath. The care in which this pays respect to its origins while bringing us into the now is done beautifully and I cannot emphasise this enough! SEE IT, and feel the need, the need for speed one more time.

Wow.If this doesn't get awards then there's no hope in the world...
Absolute joy to watch, extreamely exciting action scenes, amazing.I'd be happy to have Top Gun 3, all action bits with more planes, missiles, flares, and all the g forces in the world to experience all this again.This is getting bought on release on blu ray.

Watched Maverick with my 11yo son, he and I had smiles on our faces all the way through. We were high fiving and engrossed for the full run time. He asked me to write this review. So I think that says it all, if you go back to movie making roots and don't try to push any political or woke agenda, you can get a young person to simply love a movie. Just how I felt when I watched the original with my father along with many other 80's action movies, simple memorable enjoyment.

I am an ordinary person, and I believe my feel would be typical of most ordinary people like you. An average, middle class person. I am well educated and in good career but I don't pretend to be high brow or snobbish. Nor do I care about what the actors, directors or producers say or do in real life. I go to the movies to be entertained, and how I feel after I come out of the cinema, is what my reviews are about. Honest, and I believe my reviews would resonate with most people. I hope my reviews would be a service to all you audience out there, to help you decide whether to go to see the movie or not.Top Gun Maverick is a great movie with great action and emotions. A feel of real America. 80s style with no nonsense of "half dark" characters or confused people or jarring action.It was after a long time that I saw a movie that is truly enjoyable (with exception of the fast and furious franchise which are always honest to goodness good and some of the mission impossible movies. Forget about the recent James Bond movies where bond is always unhappy to be 007 and always scowling!).Many would agree with me that in last 10 years, studios have forgotten to make movies that entertain without guilt. Hope to see more movies like this - go to the cinema and come out feeling good.

reviews.review_title: 8.6 rating is correct but behind THE DARK KNIGHT AND THE JOKER
reviews.content: TOP GUN one was my top 5 favourite movies of all time, until Batman, the Dark Knight and the Joker which both for me is a 10 rating while Top Gun the original was a 9.Top Gun maverick falls behind these 2 as well because there is not enough catching quotes.However it does fall into my Top 20 simply because of the wait , Tom Cruise (one of his best performances since a few good men) and the Hangman character which made me believe in humanity again.If you want Oscar performance worthy films watch 3 billboards outside but if you want a great summer movie to give you a throwback to the 80s this is the one!I gave it 10 star in order for it sustain the 8.6 star it deserves because I know some angry dudes will give it 5 or 6!

reviews.review_title: The best picture I've seen in the last 30 years !!!
reviews.content: WOW !!! This sequel is simply by far better than the original . I'm a Top Gun fan since 1986 I still remember the day my dad took me to the movies yo watch it !!! I was 10 years back then , it became my favorite movie instantly . Now 36 years later it still remains in my top 5 favorite movies at all time , seen the original more than 100 times , I can be sure Maverick will be the same thing , I've been to the movies twice already .This movie has the action we needed , the drama , the dialogues are just perfect , the humor when needed . A great soundtrack , the acting by all the characters is just perfect en every way . Tom Cruise is the best in what he does . Penny is just perfect beautiful and intelligent and sailor woman with a bar !!! The dog fighting scenes are so action pack , since minute 3 into the movie your already hitched . The nostalgia moments !!! Master piece of a movie . Definetly already in my top 5 with God Father I and II , Top Gun , Maverick and Scent of A Woman .Go watch it !!! Nothing better than this in a long time !!! Not in the last 30 year not in a near future.

reviews.review_title: Just Imagine - What could've been possible...
reviews.content: Maverick was kicked out of Navy, works as a pilot up North ferrying cargo and drinking alcohol. Ice and others don't talk to him anymore. US is attacked and Maverick wants to help. Somehow he gets back in Navy. He comes back with grit to makeup for his mishaps. But is asked to be a trainer not a pilot. He coaches and builds an exceptional team. His team goes to war but loses multiple pilots. Some even get court-martialed for stunt piloting. Everyone puts the blame on Maverick, he can never learn. Maverick goes back to square one or below. Now no one hires him. He somehow meets Ice and requests a review. Ice pity him and gets a mission review in place. Turns out there was a spy who leaked information and Maverick is considered a hero but he puts his team ahead as true heros.This plot, which I wrote in 5mins, would've still been better than this cringeworthy, nonsense, unrealistic, predictable, and overbudgeted drama that cleary has biased and paid reviews.

reviews.review_title: Improving on the original, but not in every way
reviews.content: This was a tough job for the whole crew. The original Top Gun is iconic for a lot of people born between 1970 and 1990, maybe even beyond!Honestly, I have never met a person that has watched the original and didn't like it.With Tony Scott's passing this sequel seemed like it would never get done, but step in Joseph Kosinski who had a relationship already with Cruise, who didn't want to do the movie. I could definitely see why Cruise signed up for this.Yes, the movie isn't perfect. Yes, the plot is a bit thin and there isn't a lot of (if any) character or plot twists, but the executions was something else.Cruise steps into the Maverick skin like he's never left it. Absolutely perfect here.The new roster of pilots aren't groundbreaking but some strong performances there and overall group chemistry pull it through.Lots of practical effects and real flight shots of the actors actually flying in jets (not piloting, naturally).A third act that was straight out of a Bond movie also spiced things up a bit.I really do hope they go on and make more movies like this one in terms of the production and using CGI only when absolutely necessary.Don't get me wrong, I am not advocating they continue reviving old franchises for sequel/prequels, but more make original movies set in these times and use more real props and locations.Over the last 20 years CGI has become so so overly-used that some movies border on computer games, and as much as people don't want to admit it, it still doesn't look close to real!Big thumbs up for the crew involved in Top Gun: Maverick and go see it in the cinema, you won't be be disappointed.

reviews.review_title: 1 Star removed ONLY for this reason!!!!!
reviews.content: They should have used Berlin's Take My Breath Away. The Lady Gaga song actually sucks. My friends said the exact same thing when they walked out of the movie. I don't know why I see a lot of postive hype about the Lady Gaga song when it doesn't go with the movie.

reviews.review_title: The movie that we've all been waiting for!
reviews.content: This is an awesome movie you can't miss.My eyes are filled with tears from the moment the music kicks in, I can almost smell the sweat and the atmospheric mist churned out by the exhaust and the boiling sun.I was particularly moved by the whole dialogue between Ed Harris and Tom Cruise, it perfectly captures what Maverick is about, it also captured what being a man is.The scene between Iceman and Maverick is also heart touching and of genuine humor, it summed up their relationship over the years, it's really a top notch line delivered by top notch actors.Top Gun: Maverick has got every bit of emotion we can ever want in a action movie, a man's journey never stops. Again, awesome movie!

Here is my instant reaction-Movie was predictable, plot was so so, acting was good.But so what? It's Top Gun, and like the original, the plot was a bit cheesy. But that isn't the point. The movie was about seeing high tech aviation in action as well as paying tribute to a classics 80's film at a time where patriotism was far more common and we didn't hate one another so much. In short the film made you feel good and proud to be an American.The movie had flying scenes, a lot of them which is precisely what we wanted. It had an an iconic actor who you kept thinking that guy is 60? For that matter his costar at 52 was no slouch herself...my wife has ordered me to do 200 push-ups a day.Is this same great movie to be remembered for years to come. Probably not. Its a movie that you see and say that was fun. It's a well deserved summer blockbuster. See it, enjoy it and when you come to those parts where you say that couldn't happen...the answer is it's a movie move on.

The main word for this movie is mediocre. While camera action is good and characters are somehow believable there's so many unreal military stuff in this movie that it is on par with Chuck Norris movies.It's basically another superhero movie, but with jet fighter pilots. I can not tell the exact silly stuff that happens because of spoilers but boy, there is a ton of them in this movie.Watch it only if you really really have nothing better to watch or in case you have zero knowledge of how planes fly, gravity and overall laws of physics work.How this movie has a close to 9 rating is beyond understanding.

Top Gun Maverick is equally great as it's first movie, i think this is the best movie of 2022! No dull moment also nostalgic! Sorry my review is too short. It needs to contain atleast 150 characters so i meed to add this, Thank You.

reviews.review_title: The creators can move you to the past with this film!!
reviews.content: While watching this film I totally felt that we're back in the 1980s. Good soundtrack in the 1980s style, manly and strong characters (toxic masculinity), army camaraderie and honoring of the heroes. God bless America!

To start with I'm a big fan of original classic by Tony Scott and I was waiting for this movie for a very very long time and when it was released it was one its kind experience. Maverick is man of focus ,commitment and sheer will. I honestly believe Joseph has done proper justification to the original classic by Tony Scott a proper sequel with no BS. Each and every character was honest with their roles and responsibilities. Val Kilmer will always be remembered as "Iceman" .Watch it in IMAX or on larger screen to get life experience .Lady Gaga sang "Hold My Hand" which plays during the film and was infused in the score as well will surely give you goosebumps. Let say our prayers were answered.

First off ignore the 1* reviews these people have no life and obviously trying to be relevant. This movie is with out the best film of the year. Hands down. It is absolutely amazing one of the best films I have ever seen. Its emotional, the action sequences are superb honestly I haven't a bad word to say about it a must watch. If you don't like it have a word.

reviews.review_title: It doesn't get better than this
reviews.content: I am not writing a full review as everyone else here has said it all. I have just watched it as a download in China on the 6th September . Nice to see the Taiwan flag back on the jacket. I just want to say that 10/10 is not enough I would gladly give it 12/10, it has been a long time since a movie made me feel this good. This really is Tom at his best with enough little reflections of the original movie to make you remember it all over again. I am 69 next month but this makes me want to get in that front seat for what has to be the best job in the world. For the guys that do this for real I am insanely jealous and you all have my deepest admiration.

reviews.review_title: Bigger, better but still memories of 80s cheese.
reviews.content: Loved the original and hoped Top Gun Maverick would pull it off - and it did ... at Mach10. 30 years on and Top Gun School is thankfully still around and in need of an instructor to teach the best of the best all he knows.Nostalgia with heaps of present day. Our 2022 Maverick is told that there are no place for pilots in the future with unmanned planes the next generation, so sit back and enjoy while you can.

reviews.review_title: A Great Follow Up to A Classic
reviews.content: Great all around movie. I really appreciate how it stuck to the feel of the original. Solid action, some badass pilots, and the soundtrack to match it.
This is what you are hoping for. Even if you heard spoilers, it does not matter. This will give you a trill ride like you didn't even know you needed. It is an almost perfect sequel!
Watched it in..sorry... Experienced it in 4dx .The only word which describes this movie in Incredible.This movie has the potential of bagging many oscars or atleast being nominated for many.

As Tom Cruise says in an intro to the movie, its entertainment made for us the audience. It passed my basic test: not once did I look at my watch.However, the movie does not have much of a plot: some bad guys are about to start up uranium enrichment, and we to blow them up. We can only do this with manned airplanes, and Maverick has to train the pilots.SPOILERS:If you think about it later:It was really fortuitous that Cruise and Teller crashed within a hundred feet of each other.It was even more fortuitous that they crashed within a short distance of the enemy air base. Like less than a mile over easy ground.Our carrier seemed to be sailing by itself, without the usual carrier group.And the admiral in charge of mission operations did not seem to have air cover; rather, he had planes all over the flight deck, pretty much like Yamamoto in losing at Midway. The usual captain and air boss on a carrier were nowhere to be seen.

This movie outdid the first one. I was excited the whole movie and felt like i was a part of the top gun team. The
Entire cast made me never want this film to end and there was alot of action. This was well worth the wait and i saw the original back in 1986 and this was just worth my entire time to see it in imax. My life is complete. Thanks Tom Cruise for making this happen.

.... same story line different characters, it's all predictable ... I think there isn't much creativity here, but the film rather relies on the theatrics and special effects of the real life US Navy pilots, who did an awesome job, in saving the movie. If you've seen the original you've seen the sequel. I believe much of the high ratings are a result of the "bandwagon effect" as well as the excellent marketing of the studios that made the movie. Sequels should never be made.
Best real blockbuster movie for a long time. Hats off to Tom Cruise for making it. I enjoyed every minute of it from start to finish. Fantastic action sequences and a real feel good story.

I never saw the original Top Gun until recently. It was better than I expected but still a pretty standard 80s Hollywood movie.I didn't expect Maverick to be much better. I was very pleasantly surprised. This is better than the original and one of Tom Cruise's best films. The character development really reaches back to the original film and carries through beautifully through the end of this one. Cruise's character is much more flawed here - still an amazingly good pilot but not good at much else. He never moved up the ranks and is still a Captain. He never got married or had kids. He does have a nice bike but, hey he's had a job all these years so it's no surprise he could afford a nice bike especially since he doesn't even seem to own a house or much of a wardrobe.The plot here is really great and the special effects actually work in the service of the plot, not the other way around. Of course the events lack credibility and the characters have plot armor but that's minimal criticism for a pretty standard Hollywood film. If Hollywood made more films like this they would be in a much better place. Please pay attention to why this film was so successful, Hollywood! Make good stories about credible, relatable characters that have flaws like real people. Don't shoehorn contemporary political messages/ideas into every story -virtually no-one wants that!Thank you, Tom Cruise for staying true to the purpose of entertainment and telling a great story here.

reviews.review_title: Update to: It lives up to the hype!
reviews.content: Long story short...it gets better every single time I watch this movie! I saw this on a small screen theater and smiled the whole time...i wanted to clap out loud in certain scenes or if something cool happened, but i contained myself so to not be that guy. I recently learned this was also shot on IMAX! I cant wait to see it again on imax format! If i thought it was great on a small screen i can't wait to experience it on the larger more inclusive imax experience!

There may be nothing more intimidating than trying to live up to the hype of an all time classic such as the original Top Gun. The fact that this was developed 36 years after the original block buster cult following classic put even more pressure on this summer release (props to waiting to a post-Covid summer). With a new director and cast of virgin "top guns", the pressure was that much more magnified. However, despite everything boated against this film... it delivers with enough G force to take your breath away! The backdrop, drama, conflict, and come-togetherness bring this film at the top notch of its class, I was so expecting to be disappointed and this was the exact opposite. It's almost better then original! The only negative comment is they did not have Berlin in the love scene! Otherwise... this is perfection. Oscar to Tom for the love of god and please more Miles Teller going forward.

reviews.review_title: The best movie of 2022 so far.
reviews.content: As stated above, this movie is the best of 2022 so far. It's as good or better than the original. The dog fight scenes were breathtaking and kick-ass and all of the actors/actresses did an excellent job. We are living in a world where Hollywood is driven by prequels, sequels and superhero movies and it becomes very redundant. In this case however, this sequel delivers at every angle. Go see it if you haven't already.

It is truly amazing how a movie, done right, can make you fly. Top Gun Maverick took us to new heights, quite literally. It took me away, just for a moment, and made me experience something that I will never be able to in real life. I left the theater feeling just a little bit cooler than I felt before, just for an instant, as if I were part of something bigger.Granted, I did not enjoy the original "Top Gun". But this sequel surpassed my expectations-of sequels in general, but especially as the sequel to a movie that I do not particularly enjoy.I especially liked how Maverick took the audience with the pilots into training to teach us something while toning down the "broness" of the original that I found so unappealing. Maverick is funny while retaining some emotional depth and gravitas gained from its source material. And the stakes in Maverick are still high. In this case it is not so much the anonymous enemy that keeps tensions high, but the fight against physical limits, the natural constraints that we battle against to reach our target. These are the qualities that make Top Gun Maverick a truly captivating movie to watch.Definitely would recommend.

Great paced action film without the.cheese ball effects you get in Bay or Emmerich action films. Likeable characters and very uplifting. Guaranteed not to get nominated by the Academy because it's not depressing, boring, or virtue signaling.

I was born the same year Top Gun came out. I never thought a sequel to a film that is as old as I am could surpass the original. After its nomination for the Oscars for Best Picture, I decided to give it a chance in a casual viewing.I was wrong! After thirty minutes, I had to remove the 'night cinema mode' on my home cinema just to have the full experience of this blockbuster! I was at the edge of my seat the whole time. I don't remember the last time an action movie gave me both an adrenaline rush and a heartwarming feeling at the same time.Over 2 hours in a film normally feels overstretched but Top Gun 2 left me wishing for more!

Pros effects were amazing, revisiting some "old friends" and finding out how their stories progressed, fun scenes, great action sequences.Cons pretty thin plot, undeveloped characters, just a little to formulaic for me. So many of the scenes were lifted right out of the first one and so little was added that I didnt feel like I was watching a Sequel so much as a remake. Tom's still out racing jets on his motorcycle, being a rebel, and daring to do what no one else can. But ultimately they take zero chances with this version of Top Gun preferring to stick to script and for that it's hard for me to rate it any higher.I do like to think Penny is "Penny the admiral's daughter" from the first Top Gun. Maybe that's a nod to the nostalgia I felt for seeing the Top Gun story being dusted off after so many years. If you are going to dismiss McGillis' character with zero fanfare then I would hope her replacement was waiting in the shadows so she has some connection to original.Ultimately a feel good movie that looks even better than the first, comes close to capturing the same magic, but like most imitations just isn't as good.

reviews.review_title: Top 3 movies of the decade and I am not a Tom Cruise fan
reviews.content: Wow. What an experience. In an age where more and more movies feels they were made for home streaming, Tom Cruise come along and throws the ball out of the park. I have always respected Tom Cruise for doing his own stunts and what he brings to cinema but I was thought he was overrated along with Clooney. This movie pushed me at the edge of seat a few times and realize what cinema is. Too much of Marvel's mediocrity and fans love for it has made me loose believe in people's taste. Only a 1 billion + in movie tickets sales would restore my faith in human taste.

reviews.review_title: Who said sequels can't be better!!!
reviews.content: I went into the movies with a hesitance to watch the sequel and I must say, it was bloody great!!! The acting, the action and the story supersede the original. This is one of my all time favourite movies. It captures you from the get go till the end. The soundtrack is also fantastic. Tom Cruise pulls it off once again!!! Miles Teller also does a fantastic job and has captured the character in all its glory. The fighter jet scenes are amazing and viewers are also in for a few surprises, surprises which will make your hair on your back rise. The beginning of the movie is out of this world. All I know is "don't think"!!! Superb movie.

There are few movies I would dub, "perfect." And while I don't believe in rating a film 10/10 or 100%, if I did, I would rate Maverick both. There is nothing about the film that is not perfect. It's as if it were made using a very specific formula. I can only think of one other film, a sequel, that I would deem perfect.This is a film where, if I had a dream of what the sequel could be, in all it's potential, utilizing imagination and storytelling at it's finest, then this is what the film could be, but even better.I can't imagine not seeing this film in theatres. Actually, I didn't want to go see it a second time because the first time was still fresh in my mind. But I cracked and went to go see it again. Wow. This movie is amazing. Everything. The story, the music, the acting, the emotion, everything. There is not a single thing wrong with this movie. It's scary.This is a big Hollywood movie. The kind of film every filmmaker wishes to make and every actor wishes to star. This movie is the reason we go to the theatre. This is the potential we are all hoping to see. At least for me.Do I ever deem a film perfect? No. Because I believe there is no such thing. But if there was a perfect film, and my skepticism would allow it, Maverick would be that film.In a world where movies have been increasingly taken over by green screen and CGI, Top Gun: Maverick has raised the bar for Hollywood films.

It is incredible the work done by the audio team, an excellent sound design that allows to have an immersive sound inside the film, each scene was very detailed sonically.The sound design work is always a challenge, however it is impressive how they manage to make you be part of everything that is happening.This just speaks of the impeccable work.

reviews.review_title: The Best Sequel EVER! May best Movie
reviews.content: Outstanding storyline and great performances from the Actors. Absolutely brilliant. Tom Cruise was excellent and exceeded expectations. Connection with the original movie was put together well and blended perfectly.

The worst movie in the history of trash cans. I lost my capacity to think after watching this. I can't find words to describe how bad this was, how useless were those two hours i sat at the theater. Just don't watch it. Silence, that's what it deserves. At least i laughed, but really just don't.

reviews.review_title: Top Gun Maverick : The need for speed
reviews.content: As someone who typically hates sequels, this is by far one of the best ones ever made. It pays homage to the original and elevates everything , and it hits you with the right amount of nostalgia. A thrilling summer blockbuster! Gorgeous cinematography, insane flying action sequences, thrilling .Watched twice in both the laguages hindi & english ... hindi dubbbing is good without any drama .

reviews.review_title: Top Gun Maverick Thrills and Entertains, but it Just Doesn't Quite Reach the Altitude Necessary to Be a great Movie
reviews.content: What I liked: Popcorn humor, it got off to a promising start, beautiful Jennifer Connelly, Iceman cameo, nerve wracking final mission, callbacks to Top Gun 1986, the cool fighter jet imagery when the anti-missile tech is released, and the very end was a nice happy ending that is applaudable.What I didn't like: The middle where Maverick comes out of nowhere on the radar while they are in class and they can somehow all observe him even though he was dismissed as teacher and his subsequently being brought back felt rushed and unrealistic, picking the 6 pilots felt rushed and slightly confusing for a big moment, the soundtrack was nowhere near as good and iconic as the 1986 original (it could've used Righteous Brothers "You've Lost that Lovin Feeling" at the end or somewhere), the tacked on "behind enemy lines" ending became cartoony and literally made no difference in the end other than for another deus ex machina (only because they didn't inform the viewer that Hangman was sent, which they should have) hero-twist, and even though this was an impossible mission not one pilot died, which made it lack drama and believability.This is a decent-good movie. It's like ripping out the cliff notes of a good book and only reading them, but moreso it's like the mission Tom Cruise led his pilots on: the mission was to vertically clear the mountain on the way out at the End of the mission in order to succeed, but for the movie during that ending, the aircrafts never quite cleared the peak to be truly great. It did reach the good range though, and for movies today, maybe that's the best they can do since it seems it's all been done before.6/10.

reviews.review_title: Original Top Gun 1000000 times better than this film
reviews.content: Top Gun: Maverick is a good film.They took far too long to make this film. The film started off very good with great music from the first film such as some Harold Faltermeyer tunes and Kenny Loggins tune 'Danger Zone'. The acting in this film was also great and the actors did very well. The air combat scenes, dogfights etc were great but there was no tension or powerful music used along with these scenes. The films soundtrack was not good but the tension surrounding the pilots such as Gooses son Bradley Rooster Bradshaw with the other pilots and Maverick was great. There were a lot of good things such as the air combat scenes, dogfights, tension, friendship with Maverick and Penny Benjamin etc but there could have been improvements in other ways. The acting by Tom Cruise, Val Kilmer, Miles Teller, Jennifer Connelly, Bashir Slahahuddin, Jon Hamm, Charles Parnell, Monica Barbaro, Lewis Pullman, Jay Ellis, Danny Ramirez and Glen Powell was excellent. As I mentioned this film is not excellent but it is in between very good and excellent.

reviews.review_title: The state of the art keeps getting better.
reviews.content: The original Top Gun is a great feel-good 80s films which hits all the right notes and has its heart in the right place.This sequel complements the first film, then goes on to surpass it in every way. Tom Cruise just keeps getting better and better as a screen presence. He is more than an actor now. He is part of our collective cinematic memory.and he clearly puts the audience front and centre when producing films.Likewise, Jennifer Connolly and Val Kilmer are absolutely superb and their characters seem to exist even when they are not on screen.The director, cinematographer, editor and composers manage to pay homage to Tony Scott's style and build on it to create the kind of sequel any fan of the original would be thrilled to watch. It's one of those few times Hollywood really got everything right.That final send off for Tony Scott could not have been judged more perfectly.Well done.

The actual pilots are the stars of this movie. What they can do with those flying machines is phenomenal. The dialogue is utter drivel.If I was to watch this again, I'd fast forward to the last 30 mins for the action.The romance element is totally unnecessary. The dialogue is vomit inducing & the acting is so amateurish & embarrassing.I'm a huge fan of Tom but when you compare the scripts from his MI franchise to this, you'll know what I mean.If you're a fan of the first, you'll enjoy this but too "naff" for me but the flying is worth watching. I'm more interested in watching the making of it.My 5 score is all for the pilots & action & the minus 5 is for the none action scenes. I would've walked out but I wanted to see the stunts.5/10.

Even after watching it the 3rd time, I cannot get enough if it. The first version has set the tone and created a certain flair, the second version continues with that special atmosphere and adopts it perfectly to the 2020s. Great acting, terrific selection of characters, unbelievable flight sequences and perfect score deliver goosebumps all over. Feelings of passion and joy while / after watching qualifies this movie to be seen over an over again! Thank you Tom Cruise, this is awesome!

Top Gun Maverick is a nice binocular: sink into your cinema seat with a Grolsch Blond. There are some nice references to the original Top Gun: Penny, the son of Goose, an Iceman who is now critically ill, sports on the beach and an old, discarded F-14. Furthermore, the action images of the F-18 are great, there seems to be little to no CGI used. For the rest it is a stereotypical American white tough man film: fast motorcycles, leather jackets, sunglasses, the yearning bachelor with daughter, whose father is as yet unknown. On the beach we see almost only bare muscular (white) male bodies. One of the few black men, a wimpy assistant, has to keep his t-shirt on, probably because of his tummy. The storyline is wafer-thin: a potential uranium deposit somewhere has to be defused. It is not known exactly where and who the conscious enemy actually is. This was probably done deliberately, so as not to disrupt any international political relations. Of course, the mischievous Maverick is the hero: he gets the job done and briefly shows how it's done. Tensions between him and Goose's son are topped off when Maverick is rescued by him by shooting down a number of aircraft belonging to the unknown enemy. Top Gun Maverick is the time-honored story of the Real American Hero, and the recent war in Ukraine may have provided the need for it. In 1986 we still had the cold war to fall back on, today we have a different setting on the battlefield.

reviews.review_title: "Top Gun" is a one of best action, dramatic movie. Superb (8.5 imdb)
reviews.content: My first word is don't miss this movie. Because this is a greatest movie in hollywood. "Tom" is a great actor and one of my favorite character. So I know he can do his best for any movies. And Music is good. Vfx is superb. They maintain screen type (Full Screen, cinemascope) with movie situation. That's good. Specially Final battle is amazing. That's a very positive point in this movie. So my last word is this movie is best of the best.
Tom did it. This is a fantastic film. Best film I have seen in many years. Seeing it again. Superb. There MUST be a sequel. You don't just make stuff this good once and leave us hanging.

reviews.review_title: This film is anything but a Maverick
reviews.content: Top Gun is stuck in the past.It's 36 years between Top Gun and its sequel. The characters have grown up, aged, and moved on. Goose's son is now almost 40. So much has changed... or so I thought.Top Gun: Maverick ties itself far too narrowly to its original, Top Gun. The time between films offered a fantastic opportunity to introduce character development and create something refreshing, but this opportunity was wasted to dogmatically follow familiarity at all costs. Whether its the music, the scenes, the characters, or the plot, Top Gun: Maverick tries to ensure that no deviation be taken from the original film. We're left with an identikit, unoriginal, and soulless piece of film.Watching both Top Guns is like eating a starter and a main and being disappointed when you find out they're the same dish.

The movie has a very strong plot and does justice to the character of maverick. You'll definitely enjoy the climax but it's kinda unreal at last. I mean you'll feel that c'mon this can't even happen in real dogfights.

I only watched Top Gun this year for the first time in preparation for Maverick. The first film I can see why it was so popular back then and Maverick really brings it into the 21st century. I'm not normally a Tom cruise fan but I did enjoy this even if it is basically the same storyline as the first.There are some cool call names In this (fanboy, payback, bob, rooster, hangman) and the aesthetics are brilliant. I love that they bring the old soundtrack back as well, some really iconic songs. It made an absolute killing at the box office (1.4 billion) and became the highest grossing film of the year. It's not the best film I've seen this year but I'm glad I watched it.

This movie is over kill and should've stayed OUT of the theater. Tom Cruise always save the day blah, blah, blah same old, same old tactics. The movie was very very very cliche. Stay home save your time and see it when it comes to a premier channel for free.

The flyingscenes are awesome. As are the excitement. And no one should say this isnt a big movie, specially with the massive prequel.But the storyline is cheap and hard to belive.As an actionmovie, great and cool scenes! But... dont think to much or you lose the feeling for it.

reviews.review_title: Lived up to the epic trailer
reviews.content: I regrettably arrived about 20 minutes late due to transport issues and Maverick was speeding on his motorbike next to a jet taking off. This seemed like a good intro on its own, but I'll probably have to go back and see what I missed.I went for IMAX, a few seats up from the front and it felt like you were right in the movie. Really awesome action, plot, dialogue, cinematography, sound effects, action scenes, the flight scenes, combat and dog fighting were amazing. I will go back for a rewatch I think. I had been waiting for this movie for ages but it kept getting delayed due to Covid. However it looks like they've used this time well to polish it up into the masterpiece it is.I am sure they used F/A-18s because none of the US's 5th gen fighters (F-22 or F-35) can take front and back seat pilots. Without the back seats there would be no film because the actors weren't allowed to pilot the real planes. However for someone with knowledge of fighter aircraft it seemed like it was shoehorned into the movie. Also the old F-14 was shoehorned as a throwback to the old Top Gun movies, but it was unrealistic because how did the Russians get a hold of one in the first place, also it would not reasonably have taken out so many 5th gen Su-57s. So some unbelievable aspects there. I think if there is another Top Gun sequel, maybe they can train real Airforce or Navy F-22 or F-35 fighter pilots to be actors, rather than actors to be Top Gun pilots. Food for thought. However Cruise can fly a plane for real and I want him in the sequel so he needs to be trained to fly these 5th gen fighters as well.

reviews.review_title: A must see this movie reminds you why you can't beat the the theater experience!!!
reviews.content: This movie is the reason why I still go to movies! Best movie I've seen in a long time! Edge of your seat thrill ride beginning to end!! Go see in the biggest loudest theater possible for the best movie experience!! The acting, the script, the flight scenes, sound effects, the style! This film is oozing with coolness!! Definitely one of the best movie experiences I've had in the cinema. In a long time!!! Tom Cruise Delivers!!

reviews.review_title: Adrenaline pumping Edge of your seat action... Go relieve your childhood
reviews.content: Rarely does any movie exceed your expectations.. this is such Cinema. Best Movie contender for sure this year. Adrenaline pumping Edge of your seat action... Go relieve your childhood.Tom Cruise Hats off to you. At this age he is doing such real stunts, when even Marvel Heroes are using Green screens. He is truly the Legend.Best thing if this movie is that it has its heart at right place. It gets emotional along with all the actions.Drop everything and go watch this movie. I bet this is going to be your best cinematic experience.

I am not a typical action movie fan with only fights, flights and flights. Storyline and story telling of the movie is the number one trigger for me to evaluate the quality of the movie. This film is unique in terms of the story telling. Everybody in the cast had played thier part well. It has action but also has a strong content with engaging story. I didn't feel that I was wasting time. Tom is a vesatlie actor and the movie itself shined with his role.

The short and sweet of Top Gun, Maverick: It's entertaining. The cinematography is outstanding, the story is relatively good, and the acting is also good but not Oscar worthy. It's a fun movie and for fans like me of the 1986 original movie, the story lines match up great.It's worth a second trip to the theater to be entertained once again.

Well, given this movie made so much money there will be another because Hollywood is that greedy. I didn't have any expectations because frankly, I love the 1986 original. Kelly, McGillis, Meg Ryan, Anthony Edwards, Tom Skerritt, Val Kilmer, Tom Cruise and the rest of the cast all worked beautifully and there was a fluid, high energy pace. Top Gun Maverick falls flat in the middle. While Jennifer Connelly is easy on the eyes her and Cruise have no chemistry. The rest of the cast is forgettable as well. Besides the fight scenes there's nothing original. If a sequel was going to be made it needed to be done 5 years after not 30 years later. A talented writer could have come up with a storyline and it didn't need to involve Goose or his family.

reviews.review_title: Best Movie in theaters I've seen in a while
reviews.content: For the years I've been attending movie theaters, this has to be the best one I've seen in a long time. Over the past few years, most of the movies I've seen in theaters have been unoriginal and predictable stuff that this generation of film has become known for. However, in this movie, the people involved in this film seem to have actually cared. From the opening thank you message from Tome Cruise, to real jet fighters being used instead of CGI. The movie also had a patriotic feeling to it as the American flag can be seen everywhere. The movie was tense, having you at the edge of your seat unlike the superhero movies with the same plot but new coat of paint. This will definitely be one of the best films this year.

Around 3 years after wrapping Top Gun finally arrives and the wait was worth it. Unbelievable film making. Pushing actors and filming to the limits. Rarely does a sequel outdo the original but it does here. See it in the cinema. See it on the biggest screen possible.

Yes, I was around for the first movie, at an age where young men would like such an action movie. I hated it. I didnt believe a minute of it. So now all these years later we get the EXACT same crap wrapped in 2022 wokeness. Just a coincidence that now the top gun class has one of each? Cast like one would cast a Lite Beer commercial.Had a crush on Kelly McGillis then, have a bigger crush on Jennifer Connelly now, but I didnt believe either of them had a thing with the Tom Cruise character.Look, the early reviewers are rating this like its The Godfather. Might be the aging idiots from my generation trying to relive the 80s, or kids used to Marvel superheroes.

As a person who has not seen the old Top Gun from 1986 I must say this movie is a brainless popcorn B-movie with probably extremely high budget.Everything they present the audience here is so far away from reality that it hurts.No, I am, not a Tom Cruise hater. He belongs to the top actors in the world and I can only admire and envy his shape and success.As said before, it is the silly story , the overkill in patriotism, the complete lack of realism concerning the aircraft handling, the complete lack of realism concerning the peoples action.Is this a movie made of about video game or something? That would explain a lot.

Awesome movie! Tom Cruise character: Maverick is one hell of a fighter pilot/aviator, he has more than 30 years in the Navy yet only holds the rank of Captain, nevertheless a very distinguished/decorated one. Maverick is courageous and lovable. He will have you rooting for him in no time! Top Gun is a must see!

reviews.review_title: Great movie. Excellent movie. It's perfect.
reviews.content: Great movie. Excellent movie. It's perfect.After 36 years (1986) Tom Cruise returns with the second part and THEY THROWED THE HOUSE OUT THE WINDOW. What genius. He has the perfect action and characters that make you yearn for the 80s.

Forgot to drop my 9/10 rating for Top Gun Maverick when we saw it during the premiere last week. Movies don't get much better than this. Music. Emotion. Action. Nostalgia - but still stands on its own. Respect.

This is my first review, and probably will be my only, but for this movie it deserves this kind of attention. I went to watch it with my friends not thinking that much of it, maybe thinking I would like it a little but I was completely wrong. I watched the first top gun in my English class, it was pretty good, but this movie takes it to another level. The relationship between the two main characters are amazing and it shows levels all the way till the end. Also the other actors amazing, the film imagines are top class. This movie really hits every emotion there is, you will not be going home unpleased. The end is amazing also may I add.

reviews.review_title: Fun with far fetched action and bad script
reviews.content: Concept was pretty good...except for an embarrassingly cheesy script and tons of plot holes. Full of predictable action with far fetched and non-believable situations, more even so than the original. The mission run for the target felt like I was watching a Star Wars rip-off run on the Deathstar. Only saving graces were the action that was still rather fun and the great cinematography though. Maverick and/or Rooster should've died. Would've made for a better more believable ending. Smh. And what a forced lame unneeded romance angle that fit in less than romance in the original. Please...no more sequels to this.
I loved it! Very well made! I've never seen a sequel that's better than the original and I love the original! Tom Cruise was epic and did an amazing job as always!

I saw this on opening night at the IMAX theater. It was amazing. Definitely lived up to all the hype it built over the years after being delayed multiple times. I loved the first one. And now I love the new one. They did an amazing job. GO SEE THIS MOVIE!

If you liked the first Top Gun, you'll probably like this one. Fighter jets, macho pilots, American jingoism and cheesy dialogue. In fact this one is almost a reflection of the original, same idea in many scenes. Even the theme music is the same
The high speed flying scenes were exciting, but that's about all.The more I think about it, the lower my rating goes.

reviews.review_title: Extremely well done sequel. Huge props to the entire team.
reviews.content:
Wow. So after seeing the movie twice in IMAX, I give it a strong 9/10. THIS MOVIE IS SO WELL DONE. Seriously everything about it is top notch:
The REAL F/A-18 Super Hornet footage was amazing, and the afterburner & flares sound effects shook the theater making it quite the experience.The acting was great. (Actors & Actresses looked great too!)The story and plot was new, interesting, and had me at the edge of my seat.It was emotional, which was very unexpected, but this made it so much more than just an action movie.The little technical details REALLY show how well this movie was done. Seeing the Rolls-Royce Merlin engine on the P-51, as well as the Skunk Works logo on the Darkstar secret aircraft, all the way to aircraft G limits and other technical specs was very impressive.The length and pace was spot on, it was entertaining the entire way throughout the 2+ hr film.There was a perfect amount of nostalgia. You'll find that immediately upon the opening scene...Talk about a feel good movie; the ending is pure bliss. After the pandemic, I think we all needed this...It's honestly better than the original, which I did not expect at all. My girlfriend, who isn't much into planes, may now be because she LOVED it! Possibly the greatest sequel in movie history thus far.CONGRATULATIONS TO THE ENTIRE MAVERICK TEAM! What a STELLAR movie!

Great movie, it was so worth the wait. It was nice to Val Kilmer back as well. Jennifer Connelly was a great addition to the movie. Miles Teller, was a great addition to the movie as well. So, much like Anthony Edwards. Wish they would have bought Meg Ryan back. I happy that they took their time with this sequel. But, I did notice that two actors in this movie played John Glen in 2 different movies. Ed Harris played John Glen in "The Right Stuff" and Glen Powell in " Hidden Figures". I was taken back to the first movie and the excitement I had with it. Being a U. S. Navy brat, took me back to those days.

If you like planes you will like to see this movie. If you like suspense, you will be very bored by the same movie.Nothing new on planet Hollywood there. Just planes and typical Tom Cruise. Flip and flop the plane, very long scenes of characters talking to each other saying nothing and you can predict everything from the 1st second to the last.I must say image is nice and landscapes are beautiful seen from the sky but this doesn't make you a story, a plot or any kind of intrigue.And what about feelings and tears? Empty.Have a nice day and watch another movie. This one is not worth 8+ stars. Unbelievable.
Long movies tend to have ups and downs. This one has the afterburner on from start to end.The nostalgia från Top Gun 1 mixed with the most epic flight scenes you can imagine.

*Top Gun Maverick**Top Gun Maverick*, an eight years long project in film making was completed in early 2020 and was to be released in July 2020 but due to Covid Pandemic the release dates changed 5 times. And finally the film hit the theaters on 27th June 2022. It was almost 35 years after the first film Top Gun released in 1986 which was my all time fav film and must have seen over a dozen times. The film had great actors' ensemble Tom Cruise, Kelly McGillis, Val Kilmer, Tom Skeritt, Tim Robbins and a special apperance of Meg Ryan. All wonderful starcast. To add a more spice to the fast paced movie, it had a wonderful soundtrack and music composed by Harold Faltermayer and songs by famous singers and rock bands like Kenny Loggins, Teena Marie, Cheap Trick, Miami Sound Machine, Berlin (You take my breath away) and of course the great Top Gun Anthem composed by Harold Faltermayer.With all this aspects, yesterday we went to see Top Gun Maverick, with so many questions in mind. Does the new film have all same starcast ? Except Tom Cruise and Val Kilmer. Was there any replacement of stars ? What about the soundtrack and music of the film ? How about the dog fight scenes in the films ? The excitement of watching the film was at its peak. Goosebumps all over during watching film. The film also gave a nostalgic feeling in the the opening credits and opening scene with same Top Gun anthem played as in the first film, Meg Ryan appears for some time in a flashback scene. There is a good and refreshing entry of Jennifer Connely and Miles Teller as the "Rooster". Tom Cruise the "Maverick" is fantastic as ever. Val Kilmer as the "Ice" gave brilliant and a small appearance. The dialogs between Maverick and Ice makes you emotional. There are fast paced and beautifully shot flight scenes of F-18 jet planes, partcularly the jets flying in the canyons and the dog fights and the ariel combats. The soundtrack of film is spendid and best part is that the original Top Gun Anthem is retained in the film. Hans Zimmer joins with Harold Faltermayer to compose the music, songs and the background scores of the film. All and all a wonderful experience to watch the film in the theater. For all those Top Gun fans out there, will find 3 types of Goosebumps, pre-movie, during the film and post-movie. A must watch film for all !!!!

This movie was one of the best movies I've ever seen. Great fighter jet scenes, great acting, I really believed that cruise and Connelly and the little girl all have known each other for a long time. Rooster, gooses son was excellent. Having that 80s music in there was a great choice instead of music from today. It would Have been good of cruise or one of the younger pilots did some type of karaoke/singing to someone like from the first one.

Nothing is new here, everything is repeated from many movies, America is hero repeated, Our A. F is superior repeated, that touch of side story with the main storyline repeated. I wasted my time please do not wast yours.

Just saw this and it was exhilarating from the start. The emotional moments and memories were what made it exceptional. The scene with Maverick (Tom) and Iceman (Val) was a tear jerker, especially knowing of Val's real life struggle with throat cancer. Then the emotional healing between Maverick and Goose's son (Rooster) was special too. The whole thing does not disappoint. Was sorry Meg Ryan wasn't in this sequel, she was always a favorite of mine. Overall, this was well worth the wait for the sequel.Hoping to see a third!

I loved the first Top Gun, and the next addition is just as incredible. They did an amazing job of nodding to the original while creating an entertaining stand alone movie. It had me engaged from start to finish, and I was rooting for the characters. There's so much more that could be said, but words don't cut it. Watch it if you haven't! I can't wait to see it again.

reviews.review_title: No engaging story here; just backseat cockpit footage...
reviews.content: This is the kind of cockpit footage you can get in real training and the theatre of war shown in many documentaries.
