Top Gun Maverick like Mission Impossible is strictly a money making venture; it has little entertainment or informational value and bears little resemblance to actual military activities.Fact: non-military personnel are NOT permitted to fly military assets. Tom Cruise was NOT sitting in the cockpit flying these aircraft as it appears in the movie! He sat in the back mugging the camera. You're better off watching the TV series Seal Team which at least includes some actual Seal members and a well informed and accurately written script.So, it's a Tom Cruise vehicle, people, little more. Set aside your TC idol worship and this is at best a movie about an unreal military operation with zero chances of success, until of course, the hero of the day comes out of retirement (unbelievably) and sucks up camera time. Kelly McGillis avoided this stinker, but Jennifer Connelly took the big money. Even the cameo from Val Kilner is dubbed as he is unable to speak. Did you wonder why Cruise, sitting thoughtfully speaking to the camera introduces the movie? Why is he out of character? This never happens at the beginning of a movie, right? He knew this was not a great movie and wanted, disengenuously, to thank you for donating to his production company and ingratiates himself to win you over. Did you think he really gives a s*** about your loyalty to sit through his movie? There are fine films out there that sometimes go wanting, that tell great stories and can be truly entertaining without insulting history, science, facts, or you, and it is a shame that their production companies cannot afford multi-million dollar advertising campaigns to promote quality film-making... and that truly is a shame. You as a viewer have to seek out hidden gems (and there are plenty) and support them. And every time you pay to see mega dollars being spent on TC closeups and totally unrealistic action scenes, you contribute to the making of further productions of this kind of chest-beating, Ra Ra, bomb-the-bad-guy-in-some-rogue-state mentality.Don't spend your post COVID money on this nonsense. And remember the ratings for this movie come from two main sources: young minds who are yet unable to see how transparent this movie is, and two, millions of dollars spent on promotion saturating TV, and print media extolling the virtues of the next fantastic TC movie (read: hundreds of millions spent, must be good, need to recoup investment).

Loved the first top gun it's a classic, was a bit dubious about there being a sequal as most never live up to the first movie! Well I enjoyed this equally as much if not a little more in some parts, was exciting, and unpredictable and definitely going to go and see it again! Had a great storyline with a lot of real action as opposed to the cgi they use these days. Definitely a film not to be missed.

reviews.review_title: flying scenes save this vapid effort
reviews.content: It is clear that Tom Cruise is aging and can't keep this up much longer. So in order to pad his retirement he made this film. It is a clear 'remake' of the original with a storyline that has countless references, direct and subtle.For Cruise to STILL be in the NAVY after being denied promotion or having rank reduced is simple not going to happen. Then to simply hop into an f-14 that is fueled, armed and ready to go is absurd to anyone who know flight operations. Then to have a Tomcat beat an F-35, or equivalent is equally absurd. (I wonder if the use of the F-14 was a jab at Iran, since they are the only ones who even use F-14s anymore.)The flying scenes are truly incredible and if you go for that alone, you won't be disappointed. (But spare me the Tom Cruise statement at the beginning of the movie that the F-18s and the 'Gs' ae real. The actors obviously didn't experience the high G's based on the skin on their faces not moving.)So the bottom line for me is the story is terrible, but the flying saves the film. Note to To: Get better writers.

TC does NOT disappoint with this epic sequel! Was lucky enough to see it in IMAX, and holy smokes! It is hands-down everything you want in a summer blockbuster! Just enough nostalgia to bring you back, and then takes off like a rocket; the way only a Tom Cruise action film can. Plus the sound track makes it even better. Simply put, this is a must see picture, but so yourself a favor and see it in the theater (especially IMAX)... you'll remember how great of an experience the can be!Oh yeah, and they show the new Mission Impossible trailer!

So this is Star Wars down to the T- includes a trench run, to make a miraculous attack on a 2 meter target causing a chain reaction that blows up like the Death Star and includes a last minute Han Solo-esque save by Hangman.Unrealistic, predictable, stupidity on a epic scale. Do people actually behave and talk like that at Top Gun?Every cliche in the book is here and its cringy AF.Does old geezers come out of the woodwork and take the trainees on corkscrew like death-defying moves like that?Does Iran have snowy, green landscapes like that?Can't they use unmanned drones or Tomahawks to take out the base?Couldn't they have taken out the SAM batteries as well as the runway with their cruise missiles?? LolWhy do the surface-to-air missiles arc back and follow their targets?Why don't the enemy 5th gen fighters have a name??The dialog, story and characters are written by ten year olds with the most predictable turns imaginable.Only saving grace are the amazing aerial action which is the only reason to watch this crap.Its stunning in IMAX.

Until a couple of years ago I had never heard of Top Gun movie. Then my friends started mentioning it and saying it was their best movie and I watched it two, three years ago. However I was not impressed. The film was very good to me, but nothing special in the sense that it was the best film I have ever seen. Yesterday i went to watch Top Gun 2 and i can say that this part impressed me. Flying scenes are SICK. Next week I'm going to see it once again in 4DX. All recommendations.
Everything movies once were and should be again.Makes me hopeful of the future after the trash Hokkaido produced in the last 5 years.Watch it even if you are not a top gun fan. It's so worth it.

reviews.review_title: An absolute PERFECT movie and sets a standard that Hollywood needs to LISTEN
reviews.content: This movie is beyond incredible. A total sequel masterpiece that goes beyond the greatness of the original. This movie has set the bar so high I'm sure most studios that only see $$$ signs will overlook how you make movies like this.This movie should set financial records at least this year. If anything can save movie theaters and Hollywood creativity... KEEP THEM COMING LIKE THIS GUYS.700 stars added to the limit of 10 to my review. I could watch this movie once a month and it would not get old. Just SPECTACULAR AND TIMELESS. An absolute masterpiece that deserves some Oscar's as well.

I saw this at the movies. Twice. I never do that. Ever. It was amazing and a long time coming. So glad Tom wanted to wait until after the pandemic for it to only come out at the theater first. It was worth the wait!!! It was very emotional both times seeing it. Such an amazing movie. You really feel the intensity in the flight scenes. I can't say enough about how great of a movie this is. I hope Tom gets an Oscar for this. It is time!!! Way overdue!!

Saw Top Gun - Maverick in the theater yesterday. Glad I did b/c it feels like I participated in a cultural moment. But, I doubt this movie will ever be ranked as a classic. Glad that Hollywood was able to produce something fun and non-divisive (no identity politics agenda), but there really isn't much about the story line that's compelling. Kinda cliche, actually: Cruise fighting against the end of his career; the manned fighter pilot program being phased out by drones; and a love interest who has zero depth.And, for all the talk of the amazing aerial footage, my favorite shot was the straightforward take-off sequence of Cruise's plane launching from the carrier ship. That was probably one of the least technical shots to film, but it looked (and probably was) totally real.Oh well, get your popcorn and strap in for an assault on your senses, complete with flashbacks and long looks at old photographs of Goose and Iceman...***SOMEWHAT RECOMMENDED***p.s. Why do theaters crank up the volume so dang high? We're not deaf!
Awesome story dramatical and adrenaline rush! Cruise you did it! What a way to launch another blockbuster. A remake of your decades old classic, a job well done!

reviews.review_title: A little cheesy as expected but fantastic production values
reviews.content: Well, a little cheese was expected and Top Gun was always going to be a tough act to follow. Ultimately, there are many similar scenarios but that is to be expected and fortunately they are not too obvious.The production values and effects are absolutely top notch and it's one of those films you really should see in the cinema, especially an isense theatre with the 4k screen and enhanced Dolby Atmos - it really blows you away.Despite many predictable scenes you are kept gripped throughout and it's definitely one to watch.

We had so much fun and really enjoyed this ride. The ending mission was truly exhilarating and kept us on edge of seat. The sound design, action set pieces were all great. Film was surprisingly really emotional as well. I didn't think it would affect me as much as it did. This is coming from someone who couldn't even finish the first movie amd didn't really care for it so it's enjoyable for new generation as well.truly a memorable cinema experience. We saw it in imax which did enhance the experience a bit.

I'm 21,I never watched the first movie. So, I've seen people said that this movie is awesome and all. So I watched this movie.This movie has a well done characters development, that has their own past, story and individuality. Each one has different mind construction and meanings. It just... the characters are unique.The action sequences are amazing, I don't even know how was the production for the action sequences, but, it makes difference in the narrative. Mostly for Maverick (Tom Cruise), that is the MC (obviously). Because it's him that determinate what will happen(mostly). It not just him, the other characters too, but a lot of time, Maverick chance the direction of the story.What I like the most was the cinematography, which is really subjective, focusing their emotions. This film don't make it really explicit what they mean, we know just for seeing their faces, expressions, movements and all.The direction was really good too for framed the sequences so well done. It was just like that this movie had a lot of wallpapers inside! But not only beautiful, but told a story.But this movie has some problems. Which are that the Maverick, for me, is perfect (in general), don't have many flaws, he just could make some impossible things without fail. I say that cause it makes more believable and reliable. Like "The Batman" (2022), which can fail a lot of times and even lose the battle. Top Gun Maverick don't have those flaws, Maverick just do the tricks easily, just for fanservirce (in my opinion). The flaws don't make it bad, it just exists.Lastly, Top Gun Maverick is a good watch, solid. One of the best movies of the year!!!!!

Top Gun: Maverick is just a fun movie, taking great lengths to ensure a truly cinematic experience, Tom Cruise's attention to detail and passion can be felt throughout. I'd never seen a Topgun movie before, but this just made me a fan. Maverick abandons the idea of capturing the feeling of a time period like how its predecessor did. OG Top gun is filled to the brim with 80's energy, while Maverick feels more timeless, harkening back to the past instead of living within it, and of course, it does, it's a sequel, that's what it's supposed to do.But without the focus on capturing any sort of period, Maverick has a lot more runtime to focus on other areas, and oh, does it use that time well. All Top Gun: Maverick centers around one mission, and builds up the tension and its characters to give the death-defying flying much more impact. This way of centering everything around a singular goal works well for Maverick, it gives everything a definitive reason for happening and gets the audience invested.(Something I feel the original lacked.). The plot is not perfect though, I feel that some characters were just forgotten about and their stories didn't end up going anywhere. However, the biggest flaw has to be the lackluster side-story.The relationship between Maverick and Penny is a low part, while it's not inherently bad, it just lacks when compared to whats around it. I enjoyed what it did for Maverick's character, and how it gave the tone and pacing a break so that the audience wasn't overwhelmed with action and high stakes. But some of the scenes just feel like they could have just been cut from the movie without changing much, these scenes don't move any plot points forward or connect back to the theme in any meaningful way. So that just leaves these moments empty and lacking compared to the rest of the film.Top Gun: Maverick has an air of quality and dedication to it. More So than anything it wants to celebrate the legacy of its predecessor, it doesn't get caught up in trying to replicate it, honor its fans of it with fake CGI recreation of past characters, or put too much emphasis on past ideas the original already explored. This is Top Gun put on another level, walking out of the theater I'm sure the emotions I felt were nearly identical to that of the audience of the OG back in the 80s. While I won't say Maverick feels "21st century" in the same way the original feels "80's", It has all the other things audiences love, now with the volume cranked up. Flying scenes are more energetic and dynamic, the plot tells an interesting story that is now better paced and written, and characters are more fleshed out without losing inherent appeal and instant likability. Most of the cast wasn't explored very much, but I still consider Maverick to have a superb cast, both because of the actors' top-notch performances, and the dialogue, which sets the tone and shows the characters' personalities perfectly.I loved how Top Gun: Maverick made callbacks and handled the source material in its plot, instead of overt and cheesy callbacks that feel out of place, Maverick instead slips in little continuities with the original that only fans will notice. In particular, I have to commend the writers for plotting around Val Kilmer's (Iceman) condition respectfully and realistically.Any complaints I can make amount more to missed potential than actual flaws which hamper the experience, Top Gun: Maverick is a movie that plays on its strengths and downplays its weaknesses to create a film that, while nowhere near perfect, will stick with audiences for years to come and change the perceived level of quality movies should have.

Watched Maverick in 4DX with Panoramic Screen and it was probably the best cinematic experience ever. Going into Maverick, I didn't know anything about the plot nor remember much from Top Gun, just the characters I temrmbered. But Maverick was entertaining from beginning to end. The story and mission was clear and Tom Cruise did an amazing job leading the young guns. I'm not American so must be honest and say it was very American lol, but didn't bother me much. Some characters were a bit cheesy, but the action was just so captivating. Now watching this in 4DX PANORAMA was just amazing. My seat was flying around almost literally, like seriously having to grip my arm rests to stay put. The 3 screen panoramic view came in to effect in certain scenes, especially plane scenes and it was just so perfect for this film. I found myself smiling like I was on a roller-coaster. Best film of the year!
Why does Hollywood just keep making forced sequels nobody asked for just for money? Why? The action was good sure but was it really worth it to make this film rather then a brand new movie?

If I could of done I would of watched it agai straight away. The flight cinematography was unbelievable. Great story was exhausted watching some of the flight scenes. Watch it before it goes off the cinema please.

This movie is a success in every way. It's truly something remarkable when a sequel is this good. Especially a sequel released 36 years after the original. The word of mouth was so good, I was afraid I would be going in with possibly too high of expectations. But in reality, my expectations were exceeded. It truly has it all. It'll have you laughing and crying and your whole body tense from the suspense. The jet action sequences are fabulous and thrilling. I was genuinely wowed a couple of times. I can't remember the last time a movie had me smiling so much. The interactions between the characters are often humorous and meaningful. Major props to Tom Cruise for still being such an impressive leading man. This movie makes you stop and admire what an awesome career he has had and how he's still going strong after decades of performing.The goal of the creators was to tell a compelling and impactful story, and they succeeded. It is very respectful of the original while still feeling very modern. It has just the right amount of references and throwbacks to the first film, and every one of these references mean something to this story. On top of all this, the music is beautiful and amps up the appropriate emotions throughout. As soon as I saw Hans Zimmer's name pop up in the opening credits, I knew the score would be wonderful. Top Gun: Maverick is truly a refreshing movie and stands out in a time when blockbusters have been underwhelming. I'm happy I was able to catch it on the big screen. The bigger the screen the better as the action sequences can be powerful with all the sights and sounds.

I've been waiting for this sequel for such a long time. I consider Top Gun as a never fading classic, a true masterpiece that will go through the challenge of time. So Maverick has huge shoes to fill and the shoes got filled alright!First, this movie breathes nostalgia especially regarding the brotherly relationship Maverick had with Goose. After all those years, Maverick hasn't still completely moved on from the tragic death of his best friend. It still haunts him to the high point especially now that Goose's son, Rooster, is following his dad steps and became one of the top pilots in the navy. The story between Maverick and Rooster is so rocky it breaks your heart as Rooster believes Maverick is preventing him from achieving his true potential while all Maverick wants is to protect him and be the father Rooster lost too early.Then you have the come-back of Iceman who has moved up to the ranks and became the commander of the US Pacific Fleet as a full fledged admiral. He has become Maverick best friend and has been using his position to protect him and keep him in the navy as he believes that the Navy needs Maverick. Watching Val Kilmer and Tom Cruise interacting with each other so sweetly and still joking around about who is the best pilot can't stop bring you a smile. It also breaks your heart when Iceman finally passes away as you cry along with Tom Cruise as he buries his wingman.Finally there is the F-14. The cherry of the top as we see Maverick and Rooster in one last epic dogfight taking on 2 Su-57 in this mighty aircraft. That scene alone is a blast, keeps you out of breath every second as it's so intense and breathtaking. The F-14 is still as gracious as it can be and that plane still can fly.Of course the F-18 is also as majestic. What a beautiful plane that is. I'm glad they picked that plane instead of the F-35 which is not as gracious on camera. I believe it would have taken a lot of magic off the movie if it was the F-35 on screen instead of the F-18.Finally I have to give one last special mention to Lady Gaga for her amazing song. I love it so much and it gives such a powerful ending to the movie with the P-51 flying around in the sunset. Such a raw talent she is.

Highly suggest going to the cinemas to see this movie. The scenes, camera shots and audio place you right in the aeroplanes cockpit. I didn't realise how emotionally invested in the movie I was until I found myself in an almost fetal position during some of the scenes. Not often you can say the sequel meets and possible exceeds expectations placed upon it by its predecessor.

Given a year after its release and a few more watches, this surprising success may just well be a 10/10. And I don't give those out too often. To Start, the Story does a good job bridging the 30+ year gap after the events of the also surprising success, Top Gun 1986. Maverick refuses to do anything but what he's born to do. He's a "Navy Aviator." Nothing more, nothing less. The movie starts off with him reaching Mach 10 in an X series aircraft despite Admiral Caine's orders to cancel the mission due to the shutdown of Mavericks program in favor of unmanned aircraft. The Navy continuously reminds Maverick that it sees him as nothing more than a relic of the past and not part of its intended future. But due to his "Guardian Angel" Ice Man, he's sent back to Top Gun to teach the modern elite navy aviators how to accomplish and survive a seemingly impossible Mission. In the the process of all this, he's faced with two other challenges, restoring a relationship with one of his former love interests Penny, and reconnecting with Rooster, the son of Mavericks best friend Goose. With the death of Ice, the Navy aimed to bury Maverick for good, until he proved to the Navy he was the only one who did a successful test run of the mission. Reluctantly, Cyclone makes Maverick the team leader. Maverick chooses Rooster as his wingman. After successfully bombing the target, the pilots are attacked by SAM missiles. After Rooster runs out of countermeasures, Maverick moves to protect him and gets shot down in the process. Maverick safely ejects. Rooster goes back for Maverick, and shoots down the Gunship trying to kill Maverick. After Rooster gets shot down by another SAM, Maverick regroups with him and the two Men go to the enemy Airfield that was previously bombed by allied Tomahawk Missiles. In perhaps my favorite part of the movie, Maverick and Goose(excuse me...Rooster) escape in a enemy owned F-14 Tomcat. They go toe to toe with two SU-57 fighters, and downed both of them after a hard fought and incredibly awesome dogfight. But a third one gets behind them and nearly kills them. But another one of Mav's students "Hangman" intercepts the tailing SU-57 and saves them. Mav reconnects with Rooster in the end and restores his relationship with Penny, and the movie ends with Maverick Flying his P-51 Mustang in the sunset. It's a beautiful story that concludes the legendary duo franchise in a unexpected big way. The Cinematography and VFX were good. But the big winner for the creative elements for me was the music by non other than Lorn Balfe, one of Hans Zimmers protégé's. This film was a delight to see and a smashing good time at the movies. I intend to edit this review in a years time with a 10/10 rating. Just until I figured out that my few and unimportant negative concerns that I will not disclose were just misunderstandings.

This movie makes me feel really bad. Bad acting from good young actors. A BS Storyline and nothing makes sense there. No action, no tense and no feelings. Most overrated called Top movie for a very long time.In a time of real war in europe it is really useless to bring up a war movie. Maybe in the USA the people can like it, because it is so full of patriotism, which the the world outside don't understand.The Music is also never on point.So and now I have to fill the last characters of 600 which is really silly if you can't write more about a bad movie. But here we go and we reached the end.

reviews.review_title: Now That's how you resurrect an old classic
reviews.content:
This was epic in every level. Literal eyegasm. That 2 hours + flew away like Maverick :D
Other studios should learn how to reboot something which is even better then the first one.Visuals is TOP tier, 10/10. Story is nice and continues good. There was not a single boring second. Starts epic continues epic and end classic.Worth the money. Well done.

reviews.review_title: Absolutely outstanding! What a real blockbuster is!
reviews.content: It's hard to overrate this movie, but I will try. This movie was supposed to be released right before Covid but was delayed and I completely understand now why they further delayed until we could remove our muzzles and enjoy cinema as it was intended. This is a real blockbuster in every sense. I have seen it 3 times in theaters because the home experience can't match it. I am so impressed with the effort every person involved with this film put in. It is absolutely beautiful in every way.. I can't make a single criticism. All characters are strong and with such depth and excellent writing and acting.. the cinematography legendary as anyone can see.. but wow the story! Wow the characters! Wow the acting! Wow the movie! So good so good soooooo good. Amazing job and bravo to you all. This is what movies can be.

reviews.review_title: Great experience! Thankful for the ScreenX viewing!
reviews.content: This is one of those films that makes you feel something. In this case it was nostalgia, adrenaline, suspense, and fun!Hangman is obviously an Iceman clone and some scene in the film feel very camp (the topless scene on the beach, the conversations with Jon Hamm). Also, some of the warfare strategy didn't make sense.However, I can highly recommend the ScreenX version of the film!

It's a good movie, but just ok. Filled up with lots of cliches, what makes it a good movie is the sense of nostalgia. But, it isn't, by far, an innovative or astonishing movie. It follows up all the "patriotic hero" which we are all used to, such as countless other movies from the 90's - same old narrative: the impossible quest, the renowned hero who doesn't follow the rules, the general who doesn't like him (at the beginning), the one who is always supportive and, of course, the beautiful lady who has always been enchanted by him and, at the end, stays with him (which is obvious, from the beginning, reason why I do not consider it a spoiler).Although, I still recommend it, 'cause, as I said, it does bring that sense of nostalgia and does do the job when it concerns to entertainment.But... be advised: do not expect to be shocked, amazed or fascinated. It does deliver entertainment, but that's all, in my humble opinion.

reviews.review_title: A Good Sequel to an Outstanding Action Film
reviews.content: This film essentially begins with Navy aviator "Pete 'Maverick' Mitchell" (Tom Cruise) now working as a test pilot on a project designed to evaluate the capability of a protype jet designed to travel at Mach 9. Problems occur, however, when a senior Navy officer named "Rear Admiral Chester 'Hammer' Cain" (Ed Harris) lets it be known that, unless the prototype aircraft can reach a speed of Mach 10, he plans on cancelling everything in favor of drones. Not only that, but it is also learned that he will be arriving at the test site very soon to make the announcement in person. To that effect, rather than allowing the project to be terminated, Maverick makes boards the protype with the stated intention of flying it at Mach 10-regardless of whether the airplane can handle the stress or not. Sure enough, he achieves his goal but, as is often the case, he recklessly tries to gather even more speed-which results in total engine failure and him having to eject in the middle of the Mojave Desert. Infuriated by all of this, Rear Admiral Cain considers ending Captain Mitchell's career but is prevented from doing so when orders come through transferring Maverick to the Top Gun school for a special assignment. When he gets there, however, he is disappointed to learn that, rather than being designated to fly on this top-secret assignment, he has been detailed to train several younger pilots instead. Not only that, but one of the pilots by the name of "Lieutenant Bradley 'Rooster' Bradshaw" (Miles Teller) has been nursing a personal grudge against Maverick for some time and, in the course of the training, it spills over for all to see. Now, rather than reveal any more, I will just say that this turned out to be a pretty good sequel due in large part to the excellent action scenes and a solid performance by Tom Cruise in the lead role. Admittedly, I would have preferred a bit more personal chemistry between Tom Cruise and Jennifer Connelly (as "Penny Benjamin") who has proven herself quite capable of handling a role in that regard. Likewise, the ending could have used a bit more realism as well. Be that as it may, while I don't consider this film to be quite as good as its predecessor, it was still entertaining in its own right, and I have rated it accordingly. Above average.

Anyone who carries a lot of nostalgia for the first "Top Gun" will probably slobber all over themselves and this sequel. Those who don't, me included, may think this is either a decently entertaining popcorn flick or a dumb piece of cinematic fast food. Or maybe it can be both those things at the same time.And let's call this what it really is. It's not a sequel -- it's a reboot. It nearly recreates the original movie scene by scene (we even have to have a character with a mustache!) when it's not ripping off the "Star Wars" Death Star trench run wholesale.Tom Cruise never ages, and that seems creepy to me. It's refreshing for once to see Jennifer Connelly in a sexy role, and boy does she try hard to be sexy. She practically licks Tom Cruise's face every time they have a scene together. You can tell this movie really wishes that nothing since around the year 2000 had happened and that the world still wants nothing but movies about macho white guys saving people. But it also understands that it has to at least pretend to be progressive, so hey look, there's a woman pilot! There's a black guy! How far we've come!Grade: B+

reviews.review_title: Top gun maverick was as good as the first but actually better.
reviews.content: I hadn't been to a film in 30 years decided to go see Maverick Top Gun this weekend. We loved it so much I will be buying the movie and watching it over and over.. It was as good as the 1st one if not better great movie love it.
This movie was amazing! I've gone to see it twice. It is shot with so much love. The visuals are better. The acting is phenomenal. I was on the edge of my seat.

This movie is exactly what you think it is and does it exactly as it should. A puffed-up paint-by-number predictable propaganda piece? Yes. And a rollicking good time carried on a huge wave of nostalgia, and so well produced. Best seen on the big screen.Also, Tom should wear a helmet when he's riding his motorcycle; be a better example to the kids.
Fantastic sequel, which really honours Top Gun. The story is absorbing and the action sequences will take your breath away. Go see in 4DX as you'll really feel part of the action!

I was very excited to watch this film as I loved the original and I had read some really positive initial reviews. I was hoping it would embrace the past but also form a new identity of its own rather than simply repeating the same story - to which it did not disappoint. The flying scenes were out of this world - I can't remember the last time I was so engaged with an action film. Casting is amazing, and I loved that van kilmer made a significant appearance. They handled his part so well and I felt their was genuine value to him as a character rather than just making a scene to fit him in. Love, laughter, tension and pure adrenaline. Please make sure you see this one at the cinema.

reviews.review_title: Leather Jacket, Aviator glasses, Bike, Tom Cruise, Background Score - Goosebumps!!!!
reviews.content: Well, the title of my review pretty much gives away what I felt about this one. 😊.Top Gun Maverick, is top notch entertainment, with Tom cruise at his finest.Everyone grown up in the 90s had become a huge fan of the movie and style when top gun came out. The 90s generation nor the current one will be disappointed with this sequel.There is nostalgia for the 90s folks, like I said with the music and cruises jacket and style. But there is more to maverick than just style and nostalgia. The plot is interesting and action sequences are brilliant. More than one hair raising moment in the movie!Entertainment all the way! Recommended!

reviews.review_title: In many ways this sequel is better than the original.
reviews.content: Thirty years after the first "Top Gun" (1986) took place Maverick has to do his thing with a new generation of Top Guns. He is tasked with training the new toppers to think out of the box on a mission where they encounter superior forces.Is he up to the task? Or will he be himself again? How will he handle the memory of his old team and still he be effective with the new team (if they are a team)?Every movie has a love interest. So, who will it be?Even though you know most of the actors by name it is still good that in the ending credits they place the face with the name.Be sure to watch the extras. If it is streaming without the extras, then it is time to buy the DVD.
Poor acting, cringy one liners. I was bored throughout!I had high hopes for this one but unfortunately it failed to impress. Didn't even come close. Original was so much better!

Like most people I enjoyed the 80s Topgun movie. It was fun. Yes cheesy at parts but fun. That's exactly what you get here. I think it's brilliant in that the whoever made this saw that the formula for a fun Blockbuster movie hasn't changed. Leave the political bs out. Leave the gender studies diatribe out. Just make a fun movie. Don't preach. Don't try to be a story in a story. Or more than you should be.
The first top gun is an awesome great cheesy film and Top Gun:Maverick does not disappoint , i enjoyed every minute there is a great cast proper cheesy story what's not to like ........8/10 ....!!!!!

I am not saying I hated this movie, but come on. The plot is exactly the same as Star Wars, A New Hope.Not just similar, exactly the same.My eyes rolled so far into the back of my head, I could see my arse.So, Maverick dies in the opening scene!! If you are in a plane that disintegrates at Mach 10, your organs would turn to liquid and your skin would peel off your bones. UNSURVIVABLE!Questions,Why couldn't they have used a precision guided bomb from altitude to get the job done?When Maverick was shot down, why did Rooster go back for him??? He couldn't pick him up, he was flying at the speed of sound!!When Rooster was shot down and somehow landed 3 meters away from Maverick, how were they able to just walk onto a military base which was on high alert. (Stupid)What are the odds they would find an old F14 which was fully operational? (A billion to one)Not only that, how did this ancient fighter plane defeat two next gen fighters with ease! (Ridiculous)They even said, barely anyone will survive this operation, yet they all made it, easily.What country were they even fighting?FYI, Nato also has uranium plants doing the same thing but nobody attacks us!Wait, wait a minute, are we the bad guys?However, the pilot and fighter plane scenes were incredible.If you have the IQ of a carrot this film could be enjoyable.If you are going to watch this OK movie, disengage brain first.

Tom Cruise has always been one of my favorite actors. This movie is definitely a love letter to Aviation. The original Top Gun was awesome growing up as a kid but this movie is going to motivate kids to become Combat Pilots.

reviews.review_title: SPECTACULAR; BEST FILM OF THE SUMMER.
reviews.content: I absolutely loved everything about this film - it was such an incredible story and the delivery by each actor was so heartfelt and passionate. The action sequences and even the lovely scene with Val; it was just laced together in a perfectly spectacular way and I teared up, and cheered up and loved every second of the ride. 10/10 HIGHLY recommend! My new all-time favorite Cruise film, hands down.

reviews.review_title: More of the same, but good.
reviews.content: It is a lot like the first movie but I liked it. Sure the grandpa / grandma acts weren't as convincing as the cocky young fighter jocks, but the Cruise missile is still making good movies. Where most new movies are a lame CGI version of their earlier versions, this one is actually a good watch.

reviews.review_title: idk why this has great reviews.
reviews.content: This movie is highly over-rated, the script I can imagine is only 2 pages long and that would have been a good thing...if the writing was at least decent and not full of cringe ass one-liners. Characters are the most boring and uninspired creations of recent cinema and it's a pain just to watch them interact with each other.Jet scenes are pretty cool to look at but thats just it....its cool to look at, nothing else, no substance, no plot, no nothing. I didnt expect anything good to come out of this film when I saw Joseph Kosinski in the directors seat and it came out to be exactly like his other films....uncreative subpar plots with massive holes that are just there to look cool. People think this is a great film cause of the 15 minutes for jet footage and somehow is a contender for film of the year? What a troll. Cinema is dying and films like this are the main reason the artform has losing its edge.Terrible.

reviews.review_title: So Sorry but I've LOST THAT LOVING FEELING!
reviews.content: Growing up in the 70s and 80s obsessed by military aviation and dreaming of being a fighter pilot the original Top Gun was literally perfect.It immersed you in an extremely realistic world of the, then modern, naval aviator with aircraft carrier action that could have really happened the next day in the cold war.Having heard amazing reviews and picked up on the interesting plot including the son of Maverick's dead RIO Goose. I was initially carried away by the first half of the movie.But then it happened... my suspended disbelief was stretched to beyond breaking point by an utterly unbelievable plot line. The concept of the mission was utterly ludicrous and there was zero development of the 2D characters such as 'Hangman'! Even Ice had a redeeming side?!Most if the reviews by critics don't seem ti relate to tge same movie.Sorry, but I've lost that loving feeling!!!Gutted!

Top Gun: Maverick promises the bare minimum, but delivers everything you could possibly ever want from a movie experience. The almost 2.5 hour runtime passes by without any signs of boredom as you experience seat-gripping action, nuanced drama and subtle character development that uses elements from the first movie to drive the plot depth further, while not being fully reliant on it's predecessor.The flight scenes in this movie is a sight to behold on it's own, but surprisingly what holds the movie together is the heart and the nostalgic classic twists and movie magic that are bound to get you teary-eyed. Tom Cruise is the last of his kind in the industry and it clearly shows as you see him struggle with the force of gravity as he pushes his bodily limits in a fighter jet. This movie is a must watch and one to be remembered for many years to come.I will definitely be revisiting it again...and again...and probably again over the next few years just to re-live the experience of watching this in theaters, and of course the entire theatre applauded when the final credits rolled in, which was for once, very much deserved.

If you enjoyed the original Top Gun film, then get ready for a fun and thrilling two hours. The film lives up to its hype and is arguably better than the original which is no mean feat. Probably the best action movie if the year.

Worth the 36 year wait. Best sequel ever made. I was 20 years old when I saw Top Gun and was excited to hear they were finally releasing the sequel. You have to watch this one on the biggest screen and best sound system to get the best viewing experience!!!

reviews.review_title: Added to my top 10 favorite movie list...3 of which already included Cruise
reviews.content: I've been (im)patiently waiting for Top Gun: Maverick to finally be released. I got goose bumps when the first trailer was released back in July of 2019 and was devastated when it was continuously postponed because of the (not so great) killer called COVID.Top Gun (along with A Few Good Men and Jerry Maguire) is in my top 10 favorite movies. I always hoped for a sequel, especially after my own time serving our country.Top Gun: Maverick not only didn't disappoint, but it greatly surpassed my expectations. I loved the ode to the original while creating and advancing a new story line. I loved how Pete "Maverick" Mitchell is just a more grown up version of his 24 yo self. I loved how they brought in Tom "Iceman" Kazansky and paid tribute to Val Kilmer's real life struggles. I loved how they made Bradley "Rooster" Bradshaw look so much like his "old man." I loved how they brought in "and one rear admiral's daughter"...Penny Benjamin and made the love story sweet and not gaudy. I loved the music...especially that first intro that mirrors the original. Finally, I loved how real all the flying scenes were. Holy cow! My head moved along with the jets and I felt immersed. I laughed, I cried, I smiled, I loved...I highly recommend seeing it on the big screen for your first viewing. Like the original, I plan to see it in the theatre at least 3 times and I'll likely rewatch it 100 more times as I continue to age.Way to go, Tom! You are the last great action hero left on the big screen. Thank you for making this movie!!!

reviews.review_title: More plot and character development than the original
reviews.content:
The first one was a testosterone battle between Maverick and Iceman. This one has a very dangerous mission to prepare for and gives the plot much more focus. Not as much young pilot egoism as the first but still plenty.Spoilers:
The F-14 they steal at the end isn't a plot hole. Iran got about 50 in the 1970's before the revolution and kept them in operation for a long time. It's not directly stated but the target nation is clearly Iran given the terrain, the illegal uranium enrichment plant and the operational F-14.

This was the best movie I have seen in decades!! The way they marry the past and the present was perfect. I just didn't know if they would be able to but they did! This movie has alot of heart. It tells the human side of things. The feelings the friendships the love. Pete mitchell is legend but he gets treated so badly by his commanders for what seems to be no reason. So we see the humble side of him. He gets to show the newbies how its done. He has dedicated his life to being a fighter pilot,an aviator for the navy. It's what he does so when he addresses them he says forgot about what you think you know. Tommorow I wanna see what you got then after that you can decide if you want to learn from me. Bam! So good. The scene where Gooses kid is at the piano really got me. It was so powerful cause that is the way we remember him and here is his son playing on that same piano. God, I cried so many times in this movie but that's a good thing. It means they brought out the real emotion and that is hard to do. I was emotional through the whole thing. That's why i said it has heart it tells the story and gets to the real emotions. I like the way they start the whole thing off with him on his motorcycle looking at the planes and riding. He did that in the first one if you remember. One of my favorite scenes. It's saying here I am same guy just many years later. There is alot being conveyed there.i wonder if people got that. He is saying I'm still a young man in my mind and I'm happy and right where I'm supposed to be. I remember a line from the first one that Tom Skerrit said when they were supposed to be mad at him for breaking the rules. He said If you were in a real dogfight who would you want up there with you? That is what Maverick is all about. Bending the rules ,pushing the barrier,pushing the envelope all to get the job done. Doesn't matter if it's never been done before or if someone approves or disapproves of it. Like he said you think up there your dead. He gets the job done. I do the same in my own job and he might have had something to do with that. I'm 51 so I was fifteen in 86. I had been a part of concert choir in school and we had rehearsed a song for six months to get it exactly right. It was in 85 in Plano,TX The song? You've Lost that loving feeling.yes that song. So I came out of my seat in 86 when they started to sing that.lol. I was like NO WAY! I could go on and on about how wonderful this movie is but I think I said the important stuff.

reviews.review_title: "Top Gun: Maverick" rewriting history of cinematic once again.
reviews.content: Firstly, I want to start off saying thank you for taking me into 2hours 10mins of indescribable journey. There were no words or vocabulary I could have think of to describe the experience I've felt watching this film. I didn't know watching a film could create enough adrenaline rush making my heart pound like crazy.This movie does not deserve an Oscar. Oscar deserves Top Gun: Maverick.

Watched this in top notch new theater with Dolby Atmos and 4K screen. It was a blast. I really enjoyed this. Action parts are the best, directed and shot beatifully. Sometimes the storyline is slow and there aren't that many good characters, but still you have to appreciate the action parts.

reviews.review_title: Exciting and Emotional, but still american "over the top" edge
reviews.content: Although at first you think: again a flat movie where tom cruise is a the cool badass underdog. But it has emotional and meaningfull parts throughout the whole movie which really keeps you invested continously, even besides the amazing action scenes. Also important is that they did not overcomplicate the "mission" in the movie. The mission is explained early on, and is deepened and elaborated on as the team gets closer to the end. So you really follow the characters in their journey. My only mark is that sometimes in the action sequences they tend to put the characters in the most impossible situations. If you think that they managed to just squeeze themselves out of a tight spot, there comes an even bigger threat. This filt a bit too much once in the film for me, but it was over quite fast again, so no big issue. But overall: a must watch!

Opening the reminiscence of a grumpy old man, that got a magnifying experience about how much the original one had on me. Captain tom doesnt look a year older, neither do i ...thats in my head...allthough the magnificent air rides and combat scenes at mucho macho bringing ahead the same nauseaus gutfeeling that i have at the funfair ''merry go around'', there are some deadzones that took parts of the show near the ledge of boredome, its okay with flashbacks but when goose is gone he is gone, and the romantics between jen and tom do feel daft, cause the lady aint the same as it used to be, and is tom the father of jens daughter...?Casting the roles bears signs of dignitary spacialmade contracts , among them are ed harris, my gawd there are 1000's out there that couldve done that caracter, so why him. Kilmer is another story, he's living on the latter days of his life, and had a main role in the original top gun movie, and therefore an honour to see again, i can recommend the biopic documentary about vals fight against the cancer, that is a superb piece of muggblood disfortune history when epiglotal cancer hits hard.Also some of the newbies couldve had other actors, but elaborating that makes this review far to long.So a riveting airshow, accompanied by goosebumpraising original score by zimmer and faltermaier made me bounce back to the glorious 80's, taking the big dive into the abyss when the end credits and aula lights came on and observing that i couldve been greatgranddad to 95% of the audience, my gawd what a backstroke that was. But my better half eased a bit of that feeling afterwards, i just wish i had those talents of mr krus.A must see in the theater movie it is, dont wait for the net-release is the grumpy old mans advice.

reviews.review_title: Just the way TopGun fans wanted it to be!!
reviews.content: I was 12 when TopGun was aired. Didn't get a chance to watch on the big screen however, for the love of Grumman F14, bought the VHS cassette and kept as collectible while my family didn't even had the color TV, what more the VHS player. This is how nostalgic the TopGun franchise to me for the past 35 years. Because of TopGun, i visited San Diego Kansas City Barbecue, bought a couple of T-shirts and baseball cap. I got the same Rayban aviator and navy jacket worn by Pete Mitchell. I got Kawasaki GPZ superbike but too bad i do not have Maverick's look. 3 weeks ago I got myself a ticket for today 1st show on local Imax cinema. I wetted my eyes through out the movie. There are too many sensible memories brought back from the original Topgun. It is a good thing that the movie trailers keep some of the hidden gems.. not exposing too much. If you know what i mean as most of us the TopGun fans were stressing our thoughts whether if "he" is coming back??? The air shooting with the intense facial expression simply astonishing! Tom Cruise and his team ultimately nail it. The old and new soundtracks and scores matched perfectly in this movie. The assortment of the story blended very nicely and i just could not find any flaw from the entire 120min movie runs. All the lead aviator younglings reflected just how exactly the US Airforce really mean business. This is my first time I rated a flat 10 for movie review.

Poor character development. Poor story. Bad copy of the first movie with soppy scenes of the old times gone. Flashbacks fail to make us feel anything. Nothing is developed, therefore the viewer cannot empathize with the character, or the story, or anything at all. Predictable and pathetic.Watch only if you like to see planes, jets, motorcycles and cars.

I never would have imagined they could do such a brillant job at the sequel. Everything is phenominal. Simply phenominal. Bravo and a standing ovation to all! The original managed such an impact on my life. I got all my rock and roll hair metal hair cut off and started a career. Yes, the movie was definitely instrumental in all of that. My kids think the original Top Gun is corny but for the time I just loved it. Now, this sequel brought back so many memories and it literally kicked me in the pants and didn't let up. Tom's best movie imho. Here are your six hundred characters. Asdfasdfasdfasdfasdfasdfasdfasdfasdfasdfasdfasdfasdfasdfasdfasdfasdfasdfasdfasdfasdfasdfasdfasdfasdfasdfasdfasdfasdfasdfasdfasdfasdfasdfasdf.

100% film of the year wow , edge of your seat heart ponding adrenaline ride which sun pass the original
Only one sequel did that for me and that was T2A MUST WATCH.

reviews.review_title: Best movie I've seen in a decade
reviews.content: 5 of us went to watch the movie last night and we all came out absolutely buzzing, a definite 10/10.Tom Cruise has really pulled it off. There wasn't anything I didn't like about the movie. There were no ups and downs, it was a full on 2+ hours of entertainment, just as Tom had promised.

I watch Top Gun 100times minimum and must say that thr first one is a movie all time classic but Top Gun MAVERICK is slightly a even better movie than original for my opinion. I really hope that we get another Top Gun movie in the future.All movies characters are brilliant but for me Rooster is the best in this movie.What a battle, what a movie sounds and must say what effects the movie builders provided to us.Thanks to all that build this masterpiece of a movie because i wait a long time to see a movie classic and when i watched today this must say a future classic i was speachless.My girlfriend still say that for her a original is better but no way. No way because this movie is beyond effect limits.

First of all, it was extremely arrogant for Tom Cruise to give the prologue. Who does that? The movie relies too heavily on lines from the original. "Talk to me..." is uttered at least ten times. There was zero character development. Revealing the pilots' call signs was the laziest exposition I've ever seen in a movie. "Here comes A and B and C!!" and then we never hear about them again. In the first movie, you learn their names from their helmets and from the training sequences. Who is the enemy? Ffs just say it was North Korea. "Fifth generation fighter" is used half a dozen times. You don't even have a name for the enemy jet? The pilots are joking around way too much in the cockpits. It felt like an Avengers movie with the heavy-handed jokes. The two main characters eject in enemy territory and just waltz right onto the enemy flight line and steal a plane. Ridiculous. This was just an excuse for Tom Cruise to fly in a jet one more time before he gets too old. It gets 2 stars cuz the action sequences were mildly exciting. This movie has no heart. No soul.

Entertaining movie in of itself. But:--"Top Gun" is not at North Island
--How could Maverick pull someone's service academy application?--Hangman is a poor replacement for Iceman
--The Penny/on and off again girlfriend story with what context? And of course the daughter knows Mav and Penny have hooked up again.--Jon Hamm's character was a complete wiener, who would want to work for someone like him? Completely uninspiring senior leader example.--What was the point of the two-star black admiral lackey? Started to feel like a Hallmark movie in that regard.--Convenient that an F-14 was sitting around ready to fly
--The age of Rooster doesn't fit
--Laser designators are iffy. How many millions have taxpayers spent on those devices if they fail with regularity as portrayed in the movie?Original Top Gun was much more "Go Navy" than Maverick. Maverick was more Mission Impossible: your mission, should you decide to accept it, is to fly an impossible mission.

I only watched the original "Top Gun" for the first time in the last couple of weeks, and if I'm honest, I didn't really care for it. I saw this follow up more out of a lack of something better to do, rather than any real desire - but I was pleasantly surprised about how much I enjoyed it.After years as a test pilot, Pete Mitchell (Tom Cruise) returns to the 'Top Gun' aviation school to teach a group of the Navy's best pilots. Rather than just general improvement though, Mitchell is tasked with getting them ready for a specific mission, to destroy an underground nuclear bunker belonging to a hostile force. The decision of which pilots to send on this dangerous mission is made more difficult when Bradley Bradshaw (Miles Teller) the son of his late co-pilot Goose (Anthony Edwards), is one of the class.Whilst I wouldn't go as far as to say that this is one of my favourite films, I don't think it's even the best film I've seen this week, I would say that Maverick redresses my two problems with the original film. There's an actual story to this one, rather than just a bunch of unconnected scenes. The film builds to an actual mission, which we get to see, rather than just a completely random encounter. The paying off of the relationship between Maverick and Bradley is alright and the interactions with Jennifer Connelly's character and the returning Val Kilmer are nicely done.The dogfighting scenes are much improved too. Real footage of the actors in planes is integrated with the exterior shots but everything is a lot more dynamic and easier to follow than with the previous film. The film in general really looks wonderful but those scenes in the air are really first rate.It's not much more than a better version of the original but it's certainly an entertaining time.

reviews.review_title: The Best Movie of the Year (not even close)
reviews.content: I watched the first Top Gun movie and it was good but it wasn't something that I would rave about later. I enjoyed it but didn't think much about it afterwards. I had heard that there was a Top Gun 2 coming out and it peaked my interest a little but not enough to go see it the week of release. Then I heard that it was an incredible movie, a must see, a Tom Cruze record breaking box office sales. That really peaked my interest and decided to check it out.... OH MY GOODNESS .... LIKE HOLY CRAP... not only was it an incredible movie it completely blew past my expectations. From start to finish my eyes were glued to the screen. The action, the heart, the real planes, the acting new and old actors, literally everything about this movie is amazing. I sat after the movie was over and just thought 'this is how you should feel after every movie'. This is how a movie should be made. Just jaw dropping and good entertainment. The best movie of the year if not longer. So good. So good.

reviews.review_title: If you don't like Tom Cruise
reviews.content: If you don't like Tom Cruise, then you are camped at my site with no port-o-potty. I don't care for the guy. He is an entitled, crazy, bonkers man. But the guy can make movies. If your perception of him, or political views, or whatever else keeps you up at night is keeping you from seeing this movie, you should put that aside and watch it in the theater while it's still there. Please. Do yourself a damn favor. He's going to be a millionaire without your money.

reviews.review_title: How refreshing: a classic blockbuster and a worthy sequel
reviews.content: This movie is not just a throwback to the original, it's a throwback to a better time when movies were made not to push a political message but instead simply to entertain the audience. And how Top Gun: Maverick entertains us!The film hits all the right notes: new characters and old tensions, homage to the original yet with a new story. The use of live action gives the film a visual weight, in contrast to the CGI-heavy snoozefests Hollywood has been pushing out for the last few years. Despite a couple of clumsy plot moments, Top Gun: Maverick takes you on a jet-fueled ride.This is a movie that deserves to do well at the box office so we get more movies like it in the future. I saw it in IMAX and it was great!

Plot wise its a modern take on The Dam Busters. Everything was good you can't really complain, its just something was missing. As best as I can describe the character interactions were lacking. Everyone seemed two dimensional, and their didn't seem to be any real stakes in the training nor any real peril during the mission.

reviews.review_title: EPIC! May save the entire theatrical business
reviews.content: While the Tony Scott original is hard to beat in terms of character development and story this sequel triumphs in it's cinematic spectacle and action.I was just entertained even though I knew I was watching an obvious plot with all the formulaic TOM CRUISE BEING THE HERO buttons.There was all this talk about real stunts and real airfield photography and I thought it was hype but this thing lives up to the hyper.This movie is fun, big and pure entertainment.It is why we go to the cinema. I watched it in IMAX which was pretty awesome because of the sound. It is probably not the same in a smaller theater.

I guess I'm the only one on planet earth who thought this film stank. The acting from the supporting cast was cringe worthy and so was the script. The plot was too sappy and annoying. Yes, we know, Goose is dead. Violins, sad music for 2 hours. No humor, no adorable characters to enjoy, No awesome sexual tension as was in the original TG. (Still love watching Cruz and Macgillis together) No incredible heart-thumping soundtrack. But everyone seems to just love it. I've never felt more gaslit in my life.
Obviously super great film!See if you can spot all the scenes from the original T. G. ALSO, several scenes that reference The Right Stuff. They had some fun writing this thing.

I did not like,at all,the original,finding it pretty boring on almost every level and have never,(..and never will..),watch it,again. Since then Tom has grown,(..not literally,obv..),to be THE NO1 CROWD-PLEASER!!...No contest..End of discussion. For us,this was the Absolute Zenith of Celluloid Entertainment and we loved every second of it. It seems to me that because Tom puts his battered and bruised body on the line,in every thing he does,everyone around him raise's their game,and usually does. There is no one in Hollywood like him,(..big shame..),staying well above all of the virulent,toxicity of (..anti..),Social Media,(..wisely,I might add..). The human fleas may snipe and curse but he his simply just too big to brought down by such Bottom-feeders. He let's his Films do the talking and Boy!,do they ever. Best flying scenes I've ever seen,immaculate seamless special effects,pulse pounding action and moments of tension...Just keep doing what you are doing,Sir...We love you and there is nothing you can do about it. MAGNIFICENT!!!!.....

This wasn't the second-coming of cinema all the fans promised (if anything, it takes itself a little too seriously while still being completely unbelievable) but the movie was a real homage to Tony Scott, whose voice is sorely missed in Hollywood. The thing really weighing the story down is the romance angle, which is contrived and forgettable. The cast, although able to shine when onscreen, takes a backseat to Maverick and his story of redemption, which is, frankly, a breath of fresh air considering the other rehash/reboot offerings coming out of Tinseltown. The last 25 minutes of the film were particularly over the top but, overall, Maverick is an enjoyable romp through the clouds at Mach 5 speed.

reviews.review_title: A Balls to the Wall thrill ride!
reviews.content: I've only seen the original Top Gun film on TV once or twice, so I don't really have much nostalgia for it. This film delivered on so many levels: the story, characters, and fighter jet scenes are all top notch! It's like an adrenaline rush via sight and sound, would highly recommend to any film fan!

reviews.review_title: Adrenaline rush, but is it Oscar worthy?
reviews.content: Definitely exciting and entertaining, adrenaline pumping through the veins while watching the movie. Incredible visuals during the flying scenes. However, it is still american heroes with good teeth, athletic body, snarky comments, winning yet another victory against evil forces of foreign countries. Our hero doesn't care for the mandatory army protocols and orders from his superiors and listens to his heart and this disregard is never punished. He does what he thinks is fit. This is a repeated cliche which has no place in an organization supposed to honor artistic motion pictures in my opinion.

reviews.review_title: It was like someone remembered how to make a good movie
reviews.content: It's about time someone remembered how to make a movie. The story matters and this movie delivers on a good storyline. Acting is top notch, story is top-notch, visuals are super. I wasn't bored and I didn't feel preached to. I was just able to have fun.

reviews.review_title: It's not the plane, it's the pilot
reviews.content: Within a very highly anticipated sequel, Top Gun Maverick sees new heights and a lot of expectations are met and more some. This sequel has a different tone than the original where this is more serious and well executed. The original felt very cheesy, campy and was filled with a lot of silly dialogue. Yet it has a certain nostalgia factor which many people seem to overrate it by. Maverick just feels more natural, from the characters to the writing and overall enjoyment.Miles Teller steals his scenes and the chemistry with him and Tom Cruise is one of the highlights.The visuals standout, the scenes involving the jets flying in the sky are well shot and the different camera angles are top notch.As a film and a blockbuster, can see why this has been as praised as it has been. It overachieved both in terms of box office success and critical acclaim.We just wonder if this is the end of the franchise or if there is an inevitable sequel. We can only hope it isn't 30+ years later.

Visually amazing, very committed actors, great scenario and ambitious production. Some holes in the plot make it a 9.5 but this is easily the best movie I have seen in the past decade. Highly recommend to watch in IMAX and if you have enjoyed, to play some of the games that added related DLCs (MSFS, Ace combat, DCS etc.).

Let me say I loved the action sequences. Mostly done practical and not with an overdosis of CGI, this was hugely impressive.I felt a missed opportunity was having a little bit more character development outside Tom Cruise.From the 12-people Top Gun team most of them felt like props with a face and strangely enough more screen-time (usually the opposite problem applies) would have allowed them to flourish a bit more with a backstory. Perhaps the group could have been made smaller to begin with. It felt a bit 'lonely' at the end even with the end being a positive outcome.I also thought it was strange the enemy had no face. Which country where they flying in? Canada, Mexico? They probably were under contract with the US Navy as a huge sponsor, avoiding to paint a picture of "us VS them", whoever "them" would be. But having a faceless enemy without a motive turned this film into something that felt like an advertisement for the US military.Also weird; no woman ended up flying the actual mission? Or did I miss anything due to the scarcity of dialogue during the dogfights? No biggie but it was a thing I noticed.

Would watch it again, enjoyed the experience in the cinema as the action sequences were great and didn't confuse me lol. Storyline was impactful and acting was good too. Would definely recommend people to watch this movie and it is definetly one of the best sequel/ remake of the original.
This is by far the best movie I have seen in a theater. It's not the best movie I've seen but it's THE ABSOLUTE best entertainment you can get in a theater... must see it n a silver screen.

Distinguished!!! Distinguished! Distinguished! Distinguished! 10 out of freakin 10! Goose...bumps pure! Payback to all haters!This film definitely roost...ed everything! 😜
Maverick out!Just go and watch it yourself guys. You don't wanna miss this movie!

I'll admit I was kind of skeptical about this sequel. I saw the first one in the theater 36 years ago. I wasn't sure how they were going to pull it off with the main character nearing 60. But they pulled it off.They. Pulled. It. Off. In a HUUUGGGEE way.Maverick has appropriately aged, a bit more responsible and subdued with juuuusssttt enough of the old rebel in him to still be interesting. Enough of the past was referenced without it just being a replay of the original (i.e. You can watch it without ever having seen the original).The cast is better, the dialogue is better, the fighter plane scenes are better, the PLOT and subplots are better.As a theater manager, I can watch movies pretty much when I want. I've seen this 11 times. So far.How ever good you think this movie will be, it's better.It exceeds expectations ten-fold.RUN, don't walk, to see this on the big screen.It deserves its place as the as the #1 movie of 2022.

reviews.review_title: This is what we want Hollywood!
reviews.content: Please wake up Hollywood! These types of movies are what so many of us are wanting. Please make more movies we can enjoy and escape the hard realities of our world. I go to the movies to escape from the hard realities of life, not to be reminded of how bad things are in so many movies made today. It is awesome, for me to find a movie like this that just made me feel good. Thanks to the makers of this movie for giving so many of us what we are craving!*Hint.... want to make a lot of money? Maybe consider making more movies like this which leave us feeling happy.... Just a thought... hmmmmmm.

What an absolutely tacky cheesy movie in every possible way. Tom and his over rated garbage once again. But it really brings in the money. Unreal. A good movie if you are taking flying lessons I guess..

This movie thrusts Maverick "Tom" Cruise back into action as an instructor who must lead a bunch of master-level trainees on an impossible mission that is actually quite... possible.The extended climax morphs Mav into Ethan for a bit with over the top action. For anyone turned off by its slippery slope of realism, though, I recommend focusing on the over the lip action - great mustaches in this movie.Thank You.

reviews.review_title: Ace Combat + Top Gun remake + Star Wars: A New Hope = Top Gun: Maverick
reviews.content: The first movie basically had no story. They just used all the cliches that Hollywood believes a movie has to have: A good-looking main character who is likable and a good-looking woman who will fall in love with the main character, pew pew pew actions and lots of explosions. Though it was a brave move to have the main character have a very close same-sex friend which seemed like they are gay. Perhaps they were but later they changed the script and that's why we saw that friend of his have a wife and a kid to make the audience believe they are not gay but I'm still not convinced LOL. TBH the first movie sucked hard but it was the only movie about modern military jet action to watch around and it has its wow moments (cobra maneuver scenes) but it doesn't make the rest of the movie good.So the 2nd movie is basically a modernized remake of the first movie that has a story this time but this time Maverick is the teacher. I don't understand why they ignored the ending of the 1st movie and changed Maverick's personality a lot. He was smart, full-of-life and confident. In the 2nd movie he is more like the Goose but his alternative universe depressive twin: Idiot, worrier, not confident but trigger happy and reckless. He is still the Maverick alright but not the full-of-life one so watching him being sorry about the past was cringy. I thought he did let go of the past in the 1st movie but why make him depressive again for no reason? Do they think negative vibes are necessary? In both movies Goose stuff was unnecessary and it killed the mood of both movies. And I have no idea why they exaggerated this Goose stuff so much.The first movie revolved around people who can do things and laugh at the face of death, in 2nd movie it's more like some emo stuff. People are about the cry if you had touched them a little LOL. There are only one character who saves the movie but sadly he doesn't take part in the actual story much other than annoying main characters in a few scenes.I especially didn't like the way Maverick intentionally made an idiot character to add comedy into the movie. Did you develop this movie for some 6 years old kids or old people who watched the 1st movie when it was popular back then? Yeah I get they wanted to develop a drama movie but childish comedy and old man depression don't mix well. If this movie had to be a drink and food combo it would be chocolate whiskey with hamburger LOL. It's like this movie written by the Top Gun 1 writer, a random kid and some emo young man LOL.Regardless of all the BS and when I considered this movie as some movie that takes place in an alternative universe of Top Gun in which Maverick is a different person made me enjoy how idiot he is and enjoy the story and as a movie it's not bad. For fan of military jets it's satisfying. But as a Top Gun movie it's bad especially because this is not the Maverick we knew. Yes, he is that dangerous pilot but he is not that Maverick. Also watching a movie that's basically like the first movie is boring. It bored me because I'm not a nostalgic person. Though there are some interesting scenes that save the movie from being a total waste of time.Story is like a video game called Ace Combat. There is the typical mission this video game series is known for. And imagine they wrote the story based on this classic Ace Combat mission, they added Top Gun plot on it and the key event of the movie is some rip-off of Star Wars: A New Hope's Death Star scene LOL.Plot and events doesn't make sense. The pilots are suppose to be best of the best but they are like they can hardly fly a plane so they require the basic education. I didn't understand what the hell is going on in the first event of the movie. They didn't even add a character that bothered explaining what's actually happening and what happened didn't make sense either. Also the mission didn't make sense. I don't understand why they just didn't use some high altitude bomber plane. I guess whoever wrote the story ain't aware bomber planes exist. I recommend them to read Catch-22 LOL.This movie had audio problem at the theatre I watched in which I couldn't actually understand what some women was saying, especially Jennifer Connelly. No I'm not making fun of the women or something. I guess in the theater there was some problem with the speakers in which some sounds that was between a particular range wasn't hearable enough or especially Jennifer Connelly has problem talking. For example I could perfectly hear what Tom Cruise was saying everytime even when he murmuring but I couldn't understand Jennifer Connelly much even when she was yelling LOL. It's the first time I saw this woman so I'm not sure if she have a problem talking or not LOL.To sum it all up; it's dissapointing as a Top Gun movie, satisfying as a military jet movie and not a total waste of time as a movie.

Well what can I say best film iv seen for long time
Great sequel and still has the 80s vibe
If u haven't seen it at the cinema I def recommend that you do.

reviews.review_title: A SUICIDE MISSION THAT NO ONE DIES::))!!
reviews.content: LETS START THAT TOM CRUISE IS A GREAT ACTOR. A TRUE HOLYWOOD LEGEND. THE MOVIE IS WATCHABLE. ITS NOT THE TYPE OF THAT WILL LAST IN TIME. THEY WENT IN A SUICIDE MISSION AND EVERYONE GOT BACK SAFE. THERE IS NO EPIC MOVIE WITHOUT LOSSES. TOM CRUISE SHOULD HAVE DIED IN THIS MOVIE AND BEFORE DOING IT UP IN THE AIR TELL THE TRUTH TO BRADLEY FOR WHY HE CUT HIM FROM THE ACADEMY AND ASKED FOR FORGIVENESS. INSTEAD HE SURVIVE,THEN BRADLEY CAME BACK AND SAFE HIM AND AFTER THAT HANGMAN SAVES THEM BOTH,!!COME ON HOLYWOOD!!

Just as we imagined and as we deserved it! Kudos to whoever had the idea of this sequel. Tom Cruise is timeless. A great cameo is ahead so be ready! Couldn't help to cry as I saw it, many memories of those great and so missed 80s came to mind! Thank you for this! After 2 difficult years, we really needed this! We enjoyed it and this was the first time we went to the movies after the crazy years we just had, and it was a great idea to release it now so we could see it in the big screen!

reviews.review_title: Best action film I've experienced and I thought the OG was corny AF
reviews.content: Just got out of seeing 'Top Gun: Maverick'. Granted, I'm of a certain age that 'Top Gun' (1986) had a dramatic impact on my 10 year old psyche. Yes, I know it's rooted in U. S. military propaganda, but so were 90% of American action films of the 80's (Cold War anyone?). As for the sequel, it puts its predecessor and all other American action films to shame.Exhilarating, perfectly cast, and executed to perfection; 'Top Gun: Maverick' is the greatest action film in existence from my perspective and has almost single-handedly won over this Tom Cruise skeptic. Definitely see it in a theater as it deserves to be experienced in one. 10/10.

reviews.review_title: A 80's feels with today standards. So manly, so epic, so good
reviews.content: The movie is like a 80's feeling nowadays. In a good way. Classic scenes, shots and also an amazing planes sequence.You go for an experience and get out with more beard or muscle and feel to be stronger to have survived a fight.It's an easy yet nice and simple story well written as well.I didn't really appreciated the first one but this is definitely a classic already.This is pure entertainment.As Agent coulson said in Avengers in 2012 10 years ago : " With everything that's happening and the things that are about to come to light, people might just need a little old-fashioned."

reviews.review_title: Tom Cruise is a true movie star!
reviews.content: I had tears in my eyes even in the first 2 minutes!And it lives up to the hype, the footage is amazing the story is great!Tom Cruise delivers another EPIC performance!

Been waiting for this for 36 years - I was 15 when it came out, and this film took me right back - except it is on another level to the first film. The film is so well done, fantastic storyline and amazing sequences. Absolutely blew me away, have already seen it twice! It is also fantastic how scenes reminiscent of the first film are brilliantly intertwined.

reviews.review_title: If you're just looking to turn your brain off for a couple of hours, many seem satisfied
reviews.content: I watched the movie Yesterday and i likes it. I would rate it 8/10. But i do have to say it wasn't a movie you need to watch in the movie theater. It was good i likes it, but it wasn't that Big of an movie experience in my opinion. Trust me, i love the movie. Its gorgeous and the acting is pretty good. It has been tough to watch so many great movies from more creative decades get these god awful or average at best sequels/reboots/remakes, I really hate this trend of sequels mostly focused on new characters that nobody cares about and they give the legacy characters pointless supporting roles. I don't care what anyone says, A Force Awakens should've had Han, Leia and Luke as the leads. Also who is the unnamed enemy ? Might as well call them Cobra from GI JOE. The ending would have been infinitely better if left two steps before its eventual last conclusion.

reviews.review_title: Pure entertainment like I haven't seen it in a long time
reviews.content: The new Top Gun delivers what every film should deliver: entertainment!That's the reason I pay to watch a movie. No political and social agendas that are part of practically every movie these days and that no one can take anymore.I hope this movie makes a lot of money and makes Hollywood's geniuses come back to deliver entertainment.

reviews.review_title: They sure don't make 'em like this anymore!
reviews.content: A lifelong cinema buff, I am finding it increasingly difficult to commit to a movie for more than 15 minutes. With Top Gun Maverick, I have literally prayed that it doesn't end - it is 2 hours and 10 minutes but not a minute too long. A cinematic masterpiece is a true gem of a film in which you would not change a single scene. Well, Maverick is the only one I have come across in years. You come out convinced that there is a reason why Tom Cruise is Tom Cruise. Top of the class acting, directing, screenplay and character development and - needless to say - truly unbelievable aerobatics. It makes you laugh, it makes you cry and it makes you cling to your seat - barely able to remember breathing. If you want to remember how it felt to genuinely enjoy a movie, please see Top Gun Maverick. A real tour-de-force.

What a movie, I saw it at 13 and loved the original, I never thought a sequel would be a good as the original but it was perfect, I saw it last week in the cinema and just wow, kudos to Tom Cruise and all who out this together! What a great movie !!!
