reviews.review_title: The most memorable sequel ever seen
reviews.content: As sequels go, this is one of the best if not the best, It is outstanding, the music is incredible, a tribute to the first film, a seriously good plot, the sound effects are the best I've heard at our cinema with speaker pops and the visuals are second to none. I cannot recommend this film more. Go see it at a decent cinema with up to date sound system and a big screen. This is one of the most memorable movies I've ever seen in the cinema, period. Absolutely brilliant!

This is my favorite movie right now! I've seen it on dolby, imax, d-box, 4dx, and I plan on seeing it on screenx very soon. I loved the flghter pilot scenes the best because I felt like I was sitting in the cockpit! Especially with the 4dx and d-box moving seats. I want to thank everyone involved in this film for trying as hard as they could to film with very few special effects and making the actors record their reactions up in the air as opposed to just green screening. This film is overall just one of the coolest experiences I have ever had at the movie theater.

reviews.review_title: This is why we go the cinemas.... This movie right here.
reviews.content: Top Gun Maverick is the reason why people go to the cinemas and theatres. This is why they were made, for movies like this. What an amazing movie. I enjoyed every bit of this movie. Tom cruise is an amazing actor and this movie is everything I wanted it to be and more. I honestly recommend watching this in Imax. Loved it.

reviews.review_title: Best cinema worthy movie since The Dark knight
reviews.content: The cinematography is stunning, a reason to go to the cinema alone. The story is an excellent continuation of the original movie. The only negative comment I can make is that the storyline has a massive plot hole. They never mention once who the enemy with the next gen fighter planes is. The only possibilities are Russia and China.

reviews.review_title: Borders on creative bankruptcy, 70% boring, 30% planes
reviews.content: In Top Gun 2 Tom Cruise plays the fastest plane man and he has to teach other plane men to be fast. He also goes to a bar like in Top Gun 1, has a romance almost identical to Top Gun 1, and plays sports on the beach like in Top Gun 1.What a thrilling experience, seeing a mediocre movie I've already seen after being told I'd see a new movie is just the best.This dull repetition of Top Gun starts right after the intro and continues all the way up to the climactic set piece, which to the movies credit is truly great and not just taken from Top Gun 1 (it's arguably taken from Star Wars but I think the massively increased technical detail of the mission elevates it over episode 4).Are the plane scenes fun? Yes, tons of fun. But they are a fraction of the run time. Don't come into this thinking it'll be like Mission Impossible where there are many interesting set pieces interspersed throughout a well paced movie, there are only 3. To make it worse the second one is repeated over and over and over and over again until they actually run the mission which is the last repetition of it. Fortunately the third set piece which follows is fresh and is also genuinely great, so the movie does end on a high note.

Well, just came back from watching Top Gun: Maverick and I absolutely loved it. The perfect movie experience for cinemas and so much fun.It has a strong message about second chances and how we are never too old to live the life we want to live and be our best version. It's going to hit hard with older audiences for sure. The action scenes are AMAZING. And the ending is great, very emotional. My best friend, who I've never seen him cry with a movie in cinemas, cried the whole last 10 minutes. Several other people clapping, cheering and crying too.Miles Teller and Jennifer Connelly are amazing in supporting roles, but it is Tom Cruise's show (and my favorite performance from him since Magnolia).Don't miss it!

It's just as good or better than the first anyone says different there a jerk all action doesn't stop couldn't take my eyes off the screen don't think I even blinked through the whole movie so like I said it's ##@#*@ AWESOME!!!!!!!

reviews.review_title: Not gonna lie, I expected it to flop
reviews.content: When I first saw the announcement of a Top Gun sequel, I chuckled a little bit. I didnt see how a sequel after more than 30 years could work. And many youtube channels predicted it would flop hard. I went to the theater wanting to see how terrible it was gonna be. I was completely wrong though. It's a perfect blockbuster movie. I liked the first Top Gun but never loved it. I LOVED this one. I was surprised to see Miles Teller's likeness with goose. And goddamn he's been working out. Unlike many sequels, Top Gun Maverick doesnt recycle its predecessor's storyline. Watch it. It's totally worth the price of admission.

Blown away. Just waiting for this release and it's settled, am amazing joy ride along the whole way! Action packed and great story with no hidden agenda or narrative!! Loved it and blows away the original.
Add another sequel that surpasses its 80s predecessor to the list. We don't get them often. Enjoy it while you can, before people on Twitter with "hot takes" tell you it's not good.

reviews.review_title: I saw this a bit differently
reviews.content: I see all of the 8+ votes and can understand that people liked this a lot. That is a pretty high score on this website. At 7 stars I'm clearly in the minority.I first was disappointed with the scenes of the high speed plane. They were asking us to believe this plane could take off, climb, and achieve an unbelievable airspeed. I think that whole sequence could have been cut out without impacting the story.The other thing I was disappointed about was they tried so hard to tie this movie back to the original Top Gun that I think it was overdone. Many of the scenes felt almost as if they took clips from the original and pasted them in as if nothing had changed in 30 years.Finally the pace of the non flying scenes were all a bit sluggish. There was none of that sassy attitude running through the movie. The director tried but in my opinion failed. I would have liked this movie to stand alone more than it did.The flying scenes (the whole reason for paying to see the movie) were good.I would rate the non-flying scenes at 4 stars and the flying scenes at 8 stars.Just my opinion. A Top Gun Maverick DVD won't be joining the other 300 DVDs in my cabinet.

This movie shocked me. It's amazing. The acting, the realism, immersiveness, EVERYTHING! This movie is perfect. My favorite movie BY FAR! I recommend this to everyone who loves action, or to anyone who liked the first Top Gun movie. 10/10, incredible work.

It was a bit of a let down that his character didn't speak. I was expecting some bants. Anyway the action is good although a little one sided and predictable. The nostalgia is heavy and the film kind of dragged in the middle. It referenced the first one too much. Goose is dead, we get it. Some of the new generation characters were lame. It was exactly the same formula as the first one really. Overall it wasn't bad but I was great either. Also Lady Gaga song at the end is not good. I am looking forward to the Top gun prequel, Top Gun 3: Golden Goose.
The movie sucked, in every way! It was overly long and boring with no Kelly McGennis and was too drawn out and long, I hated it! Don't watch this!1/10 stars.
Was not expecting much as second installments are usually bad and forced to, but it was ABSOLUTELY AMAZING! A movie you could watch over and over again. So much heart was put into it!

Just the fact that this film is not plagued by the wokeness madness is such a relief. They managed to recreate the ambiance of the 80's and make a very good sequel of a cult classic.Highly recommended.

reviews.review_title: The best sequel it could be for a movie!
reviews.content: I made IMDb account only to rate this movie!thats a shortcut of my review. Its a movie that had everything. Action,smart plot,more humorous moments than the first one.and deep character development. Its one of it's kind.

Yesterday I had my best cinema experience I've ever had.Top gun is a classic and always will be, knowing the sequel is a whopping 36 years since the first, it was always gonna go 1 of 2 ways, really good or really bad, it's safe to say it went the best way possible. All I can say is I urge everyone to get to the cinema to have the experience watching this on the big screen whilst you can. Top Gun: Maverick is a new masterpiece that will forever be one of my favourite's, don't miss out on this incredible ride!!
Made me excited to go to the movies again. Finally a good Hollywood movie that isn't preachy. I was so happy to see this twice. I want more films like this!

I found "Top Gun: Maverick" to be a thrilling and nostalgic experience. The aerial dog fights were incredibly realistic and the performances by Tom Cruise and Miles Teller were top-notch. Director Joseph Kosinski expertly blended nostalgia with a fresh and compelling story that adds depth and dimension to its predecessor. The filmmaking was impeccable, with clear and streamlined action sequences that made the spectacle feel fun instead of mandatory. The film serves as a reminder of the power of a great movie star, as Tom Cruise commands the screen and delivers a performance that is both nostalgic and emotionally satisfying. Overall, "Top Gun: Maverick" is a summer blockbuster of the old school that is sure to be remembered as a standout in the era of reboots.

reviews.review_title: A genuinly stunning and incredible sequel
reviews.content: I loved this movie, from start to finish, it managed to create a new environment of fast and intense thrills while still paying credit to the original. A love letter to any fans and of the 1984 classic, with lots of amazing moments. Great stunts, action, loveable characters played by great actors, amazing choice of music and lots of great cinematography. A thrill to watch. Would definitely recommend to anybody if they have seen the original or not. It's a spectacular film.

I agree with other fans that this sequel is even better than the original.I was surprised by how fast paced this action movie is cut. Breathtaking combat scenes with young talented actors. Each one did a good job. Recommended. Watch it in the theater on the big screen with its loud airplane sounds. 7/10.

Unfortunately I didn't get to see it in theaters. I don't like going by myself and I had a feeling it would be too loud for my son's liking especially serving on two carriers in my 20 year Naval career. I watched it the first day it was available to buy and I wished I saw it on the big screen. Everything about the movie was sensational. Miles Teller was a great casting for Goose's son. He even looks like Anthony Edwards!! Tom Cruise and Val Kilmer reuniting made my heart heavy. It was a great feeling for me that the carrier scenes were shot onboard the USS Theodore Roosevelt, my first ship in the Navy. I have watched this movie 4 times already and it still feels like the first time. Top Gun Maverick will leave you so emotional and wanting more.

Most incredible movie ever. This movie will go down in history as one of the greatest movies ever. The story line captures everything. The first Top Gun was amazing, but Top Gun Maverick hits new highs. This is a must see must match ASAP movie!!!

reviews.review_title: Best movie I've seen in some time.
reviews.content: I was reluctant, since sequels rarely match the originals, leaving a bitter taste - something that should have remained in our imagination. This one was surely one of the few that managed to match, if not be better than the original.The story glues nicely and doesn't feel weird, but makes sense. No bumps there, and they managed to fill the time gap smoothly.The beggining was a good surprise and immediately left me with the impression that was going to be a hell of a good ride. The sports scene was not the same as the first one, but that was something hard to manage. Still, pretty good, I must add.Sound is what we'd expect from Top Gun, no less!VIsual effects are stunning. Combat scenes are breathtaking. Thanks for not using CGI too much!Soundtrack? Something that for me rarely goes well. But it was a good surprise. Some twists from the original, but a good choice, I admit.It was nice getting those memories back and leaving the cinema wishing for more, and with a big smile on my face.

reviews.review_title: Eighties feeling all over the place!
reviews.content: There is not a lot of movies that brings back memories, but when you stumble at one from time to time, it remindes you of why we love movies. I've never thought I will see this kind of movie again, not in 2022. I know it's a new era of cinematography, but it's not even close to the 80s and 90s cinematography. This one here, it's a time machine and therefore it deserves all glory that it's getting. Oh, and Tom Cruise deserves an Oscar, period.

reviews.review_title: A lot of cliché, but still a good movie
reviews.content: I did not have high expectations regarding the movie, although it has a huge hype. The story for me was very basic. A commonplace purpose which have to be achived with a team full of rival. Some retrospection to the past, a love string and a happy ending without a loss of a good guy. Very predictable. Besides this I could really enjoy the movie. It has its unique vibe I have to admit. You do not care about the plot, but focus on a Tom Cruise show with nice stunts and machines and top-class visuals. I watched the movie at home, but I felt like I am in the cinema. Overall a feel good movie with a story you expect.

This may sound too soon for some people to hear......but THIS IS ONE OF THE BEST MOVIES TO COME OUT IN THE LAST 10 YEARS!!!!! Look I've rewatched this several times and have had some time to let the hype and emotions wear off, and I still feel like it's one of the best! Tom Cruis knows how to make action movies, and this is one of his best. Also it is perfect Film for turning on to forget real life for 2 hours and 10 minutes. I kinda get tired hearing about real life in films. Like a lot of times I watch films to drown out anxiety and fear. I do agree that there needs to be Movies that needs to make statements. But right now with how life is. This movie is sooooo needed. Not to mention everything else that is 10 out of 10 about it.

reviews.review_title: You're here for the action scenes.
reviews.content: I'm going to have an unpopular opinion here, but it's mine. It's overrated. People rating it 10/10? Why? Don't get me wrong, it's a good movie, is it a 10 out of 10 perfect movie? Nooooo. It's a great action blockbuster movie.When it comes to the story, everything felt like it was put together and rushed as to fit the time length allowed. I would argue the story they had in the original Top Gun was much better. This one had Maverick rushing in to teach a Top Gun school and pick up a team for a mission. That lead to some animosity with his best friend's son, who happens to be in that same class/school.From this point on, everything was rushed. There's a lot of cliche moments. One of those cliche moments is the diversity in this movie. A lot of it forced as they typically are these days. Hollywood needed to check it off on their list. The latina fighter pilot, black fighter pilot, latino fighter pilot, Asian fighter pilot lol. I don't have a problem with that at all, but maybe it's just me the way I saw it. I know what they're trying to convey is today's military is much more diverse, but truth be told, that's not how it is with the Navy pilots. I should know. I was in those hangar bays for nearly 20 years.Regardless of the fact, the bread and butter is with the flight scenes. They are top notch and honestly best I've seen since Dunkirk. If you're going to watch Top Gun Maverick for it's rich storyline, excellent dialogue and acting, you're going to be disappointed.

reviews.review_title: Cried, Laughed, Edge of my seat the whole way!
reviews.content: This was the most amazing movie sequel I've ever seen. I'm a kid from the 80's and TOP GUN was one of those movies that defined our generation's energy. Tom Cruise is fantastic in everything he does but this is his finest work. Go see it ASAP if you haven't!

reviews.review_title: Not great but amazing aerial action
reviews.content: Top Gun: Maverick is not a great movie, but it is entertaining. It is a sequel to the 1986 film Top Gun and stars Tom Cruise as Maverick, a hotshot fighter pilot who is struggling to come to terms with his past. He is ordered to train a new class of Top Gun pilots to run an impossible mission while dealing with the ghosts of his past.There is nothing truly original about Top Gun: Maverick. It is a standard Hollywood action movie with predictable plot twists. What is outstanding is the aerial footage and the dogfight scenes. They are amazing! Real pilots performed the stunts, and it shows.Like most Tom Cruise movies, the movie is all about Tom Cruise. He is the star, the producer, and the driving force behind the movie. And he delivers a solid performance. He may be getting older, but he can still play a convincing action hero.If you are looking for a deep and meaningful movie experience, you will be disappointed. But if you want to see some awesome flying and some good old-fashioned action, then you will enjoy Top Gun: Maverick. Make sure you see it on a big screen!

This movie was clearly well explained about how Maverick had to overcome his situations such as dealing with his ups and downs. Learning about the was past was interesting because one of the scenes showed old photos from the iconic movie. Now, there was no green screen for anything. Tom had to set up a 3 month training course for the actors to actually learn how to fly F-14. Miles Teller character "Rooster" became viral on Tiktok because of how hot he was. One thing that I want to say is that my neighbor had actually flown an F-16 fighter Airplane in real life.

The references (or rather in-jokes!) to Star Wars, Episode IV could have been spared, though.I'll get back to that later.To say that I haven't been waiting for this sequel would have been a lie, and not merely a lie, but a lie of dimensions. And the result is pretty good. The story is good, and the plot is decent. Except that it is not clear WHO the bad guy is.It is not a muslim foe - which is clear from the topography and the forestation and the nature of the enemy land.Thus, the only suggestion would be Russia - which makes it a question of propaganda. As there is not particular mention of any nationality - it is impossible to address this specifically, without speculation, so let's not dwell further on the issue here.Now, let's return to Star Wars.The comparison to Episode IV is evident.Ponder on this:"Do. Or do not. There is no try." The quote I am referring to is this:
"Your target is an impact point, less than three meters wide ... an exposed ventilation hatch"AND"Follow your instincts. Don't think! Just do!" which equals Yoda's statement "Do. Or do not. There is no try."Further than that, Jennifer Connelly is one hot piece, at 50. No teen, however cuddly, could compete.

reviews.review_title: Lacked character depth in-between action scenes
reviews.content: This movie was a major disappointment compared to the 1986 O. G. version of Top Gun. I felt like the storyline was rushed in many areas that needed further character development. The action scenes were great but lacked character depth in-between those scenes that left me hanging. The casting and makeup crews did an excellent job. Just needed a little bit more depth in character development for Penny Benjamin, her daughter and Admiral Solomon 'Warlock' Bates.

So sad when mavericks lost of the best partner in serie 1 :(...I watched the first one many times and I can't believe this just topped it by a huge margin. Tom Cruise will be written as the most passionate filmmaker in history. I mean to put a whole cast in a bunch of f-18 jets and act in a jet as well as film yourself is a huge deal.

The hype and hysteria surrounding the release of this sequel was overplayed for what was delivered. It appears the screenwriters just copied the format from the first installment and applied it to this one. Once again, the tentacles of the Pentagon were all over this, as is the case with all movies that the American military are portrayed. This is yet another extended advertisement for the US military machine to induce induction into their ranks.It didn't take long into this dramatization that the enemy du jour was the one supposedly enriching uranium to a degree that wasn't favourable to a key US ally in the region. (See: Iran and the Zionist entity) Although, when the mission moved into the landscape of "the enemy", it looked surprisingly like Russia or Canada, both with an abundance of natural resources that the US would salivate over coveting. Geopolitical wet dreams aside, the acting was humdrum and the lines predictable, although having Jennifer Connelly in a decent role was enjoyable. Also, the addition of Val Kilmer was a nice gesture given the debilitating illness he presently suffers from.My only concern about the propagandistic influence of this type of movie is that it might produce a third installment.

Just like his work on the Mission Impossible franchise, he knows exactly what this movie is supposed to be and he delivers accordingly. He plays the role to the perfection and supporting cast, directing, writing and absolutely thrilling action sequences all come together to make this a wild ride with just the right amount of nostalgia sprinkled throughout as additional fan service. For 10 failed reboots or remakes there's always the one exception that is very well done and Top Gun: Maverick is that one out of 10. I definitely recommend it, whether you've seen the original or not but let's be real... who hasn't seen the original?

This is what brings all the marvel CGI garbage to shame. Top Gun Maverick is a movie that actually cares about it's audience and gives them the sequel they deserved. I feel lucky I got to watch it in IMAX and it blew me away.. Only thing that could have been done better is the dialogue. There's no memorable line that you take home. The original had so many.
We really liked this movie. Kind of the same underlying theme of a lot of the underdog rising to the top that a lot of movies have but it was extremely enjoyable.

Top Gun has been one of my top 10 movies since roughly 1988, and I've wanted a sequel for so long. So when it was announced that it was being filmed, my excitement levels were on overdrive. However, I genuinely never thought the sequel would outdo the original. How wrong I was! It was 100% worth the wait, even when covid got in the way of its original release date. My husband and I had goosebumps as the opening song began, and from start to finish my emotions were all over the place. Goose's son, Bradley (Rooster), couldn't have been portrayed better than by Miles Teller. The similarities between them, are what makes the character of Rooster so believable. Having him playing the piano and singing 'Great Balls of Fire', was both heartbreaking, and a well thought out way to completely cement their connection. Especially when Maverick has the flashback to the last time they were all together, and Bradley (Rooster) was sitting on top of the piano, singing with his dad. I also loved that they both 'spoke to Goose', to help them get through any intense moments, and that they ended up flying together, with Rooster doing what his dad did. Their on screen relationship was electric - one cares unequivocally for one, the other is intensely angry at him, and when Maverick says he won't tell Rooster that it was his mum's dying request, and he'd rather Rooster be angry at him and not his mum, is such a beautiful and sad moment. He loves him like a father would, and you get to see how Rooster's feelings towards Maverick changes, and how Maverick finally sees Rooster as an equal, and not the boy he once knew. The acting by all cast members is of an extremely high calibre, the story itself is extremely well written, and the mission has your heart racing with you sitting on the edge of your seat. It was definitely better than the one in the original. Also, seeing Val Kilmer as Ice Man, really was the perfect touch. It's a film for everyone - a story of strength, power struggles, great flying scenes, heartache, saving lives, love, pride, faith (not religious), trust, and Tom Cruise still manages a flyby. The gratuitous beach football scene, is one not to be missed - if half naked, muscular/well defined men bonding, is your cup of tea. I certainly wasn't complaining... It's a movie to watch more than once, and the all the feels will still be there. 10/10 from me, my husband, and our children.

Was meant to see it at the premiere but ended up sick and missed it. Was a long 2 weeks to finally wait and see it, but the delay did not disappoint
Almost perfect in every way, yes predictable but still perfect.

Gotta give it to them on specially this. The emotions never felt overly done. The romance with Penny and the emotions with Rooster felt quite natural.The direction and dog fights were incredibly done. Since I watched it in D-box it felt even better. Like I was there flying in the box.The editing was perfect to me. Lots of action and in between were character development and story progression and emotions. Nothing felt like it's going on for too long. All the new characters blended in well with the tone of the movie. Shows the work they put into this movie.Overall, it was thoroughly grippy throughout. Didn't expect it to be this good! Hoping for more such flicks in the summer!

reviews.review_title: A Sequel that Surpasses in Every Aspect.
reviews.content: This movie works on EVERY. LEVEL.As far as big budget blockbusters go, this ranks among the very best. Where do I begin? Tom Cruise comes back to Maverick so naturally it's like he hasn't played the role in 36 years. Miles Teller is great as Rooster, this entire cast works, and each character is allowed to shine, and in the end you are completely invested in and care about these characters.The scenes in the air are honestly jaw dropping, I truly don't know how they filmed them, and what these pilots do in this movie is something to behold. They're exhilarating, exciting, and a joy to watch.The third act of this movie is one of the best I've seen in an action movie in a REALLY long time. You feel the stakes, and feel the sense these characters are in danger and could actually die, and you care about them, leading to an INTENSE final act.There's so much that can be said here. This movie must be seen on the biggest screen possible. It's one of the best blockbusters in YEARS, maybe ever.

A most enjoyable film even though the plot could have been written on the back of a matchbox. It's all about the charisma of the lead and the incredible cinematography. All of that said, this is, what it is. Enjoyable fluff and nowhere near some of the 10 ratings on here. It's a very good 7 from me.

reviews.review_title: Wow, what a brilliant nostalgic movie!
reviews.content: Just got out the cinema, watched it in 4DX. Best movie I've seen in a long time and as a massive fan of the original I am glad this sequel surpassed my expectations. I just wish it hadn't been so long to see it. Haha. Gave me goosebumps throughout, a few teary moments and plenty of laughs. Great action and story. I'm now going to grow a goose/rooster tash!

I was one year out of high school when Top Gun came out. I LOVED Tom Cruise. I had said goodbye a year previously to my (Tom Cruise lookalike) boyfriend as he went to the Air Force Academy to become a fighter pilot. So my new boyfriend forbid me from seeing Top Gun in the theater out if jealousy. Because I was an IDIOT, I honored that wish. I have always regretted that. I saw Top Gun eventually on VHS then DVD many times. So when Top Gun Maverick was being made I was STOKED. Hey Covid hit and I waited.... AND WAITED. Anyways, I was so afraid this sequel couldn't possibly live up to my expectations... WOW WAS I WRONG! This is a superior movie in every way. The writing, the cinematography, everything is perfect. The flight scenes are so exciting and immersive.... YOU MUST SEE THIS IN IMAX! The music, the callbacks to the original, all flawless. I came out of the theater PUMPED! Even my husband, who isn't impressed by anything, LOVED it. Tom Cruise really delivers and the young cast is also good. RUN to see this... it's so much fun!

RATED 8/10
Language: English
Source: Prime Video
RECOMMENDED.If you like the previous one, you will love this one.The theme song, music and Jet fights are as classic as the old one. The premises and the plot is more of less same. And the Jet scenes are bit more detailed one with more CG works.Just watched the first one again to get more connection to the new one. But they recapped well to not make any disjoint.I enjoyed this watch in big screen with good sound effect.--repeating again for 600 characters limit.I enjoyed this watch in big screen with good sound effect.I enjoyed this watch in big screen with good sound effect.

Great film, left the theater in high spirits. Tom Cruise proves he is a true star, accompanied by a fantastic cast of young pilots. The music and visuals were amazing. Highly recommend. Simple story, but a real gem! We need films like this, especially in these dark times.

This movie is awesome! Loved the realistic dogfights (it was quite obvious when it wasn't real at all or was faked)Score is freaking amazing. I mean they really tickle the nostalgia sensors here with the whole movie and everything, but the score puts this baby into the bedsheets. I just love how they (Faltemeyer, Zimmer, Gaga) reprized the core Top Gun themes. Its really ironic how refreshing this blunt dumb suspension of disbelief is conquering the superhero fatigue wave. Oh boy, I was laughing very hard on many cringe worthy scenes: with disobedience from Mav, "Talk to me Goose", the whole Akira Kurosawa "Hidden Fortress" Star Wars: The New Hope vibes... I mean, sometimes I really thought this movie indeed takes itself seriously. Oh boy and that very cringy Conelly and Cruise scene with "that look" OMG :DEven though above all these, this is a must see for anyone who is up for a thrill and chill, especially with over dramatic lemonade.... Cruise indeed the "XXXXXX men alive..." nobody else could carry on or get away with this much cheese to be honest.

reviews.review_title: Improving on the visuals and story of its predecessor.
reviews.content: The COVID pandemic delayed the release of Top Gun: Maverick (2022) for a few years. Having only watched the original a few days prior to seeing this in the theaters, it was definitely worth the wait to see something like this on the big screen. The trailers only hinted at the spectacle that could be achieved over 35 years after the original wowed audiences with great fighter jet footage. That's not to say that this film doesn't lean heavily on its nostalgia-or plots that come strikingly close to other famous franchises.Part of the appeal of Top Gun (1986) was all the footage of fighter jet acrobatics. Most civilians never get to see these things outside an occasional air show, so there's an amount of awe involved when seeing what these marvels of modern engineering can do. Over three decades of advancements in cinematography allowed this sequel to surpass the original. Cockpit footage of these actors actually in these fighter jets, combined with high-definition shots of amazing maneuvers, made this movie quite exciting to watch. These scenes shown in the trailers made me-a Top Gun skeptic-want to see this film. I was not disappointed.Plot-wise, Top Gun: Maverick felt slightly more developed than its predecessor. My favorite part by far was the experimental aircraft test at the start of the movie. However, the rest of the film's plot felt familiar, but not in a good way. About a third of the way through, I realized, "Wait a minute. This is just Star Wars (1977)." Don't get me wrong, Star Wars' climactic battle against the Empire is a cinema-defining moment. It just felt weird packaged in this way. Add to that a few moments of blatant nostalgia and it was clear this movie was at least in part made for fans of the original.Improving on the visuals and story of its predecessor, I give Top Gun: Maverick 4.0 stars out of 5.

reviews.review_title: What an anticipation....but boy, what a ride
reviews.content:
I must have watched the original Top Gun about 30 times....and allthough that was and is an awesome movie, this one is much better, much more realistic and the fact this has been done mainly with practical effects (not too sure about that one move from that *non Russian* plane) is mindblowing - you really feel as if you're watching real fighter pilots.... Mr Cruise was absolutely right getting all the actors real life experience and camera time in those fighter jets, pulling real G's....hell, a dream for many non-actors as well of course.I watched this movie in 4dx (moving seats - felt like a roller coaster - air and water features) which made it even more immersive....will watch it again (in 4dx of course) for sure....this cinematography is a grasp for us normal people to experience what it is to be in one of those majestic supersonic, g-force bringing beasts.Only thing I was wondering about....why F18's....while the 'enemy' is rocking US made better planes (I know the F35's were not available at the time and they needed planes with dual seats, but this was not what the US would do imho lol)
Also...5th and 4th generation planes? Call them by their names guys....everyone knows an F22, an F35, an F18 of F14...Not minding that too much...awesome movie, awesome dogfighting scenes (and not twice the same scene as in the original one with the planes twirling about), very realistic when it comes to the flying (not the mission of course) and good acting.... I will probably watch this more than the 30 times I watched the original one....4k and Dolby Digital or THX sound would be great.

reviews.review_title: Awesome cheesy and full of 80s blockbuster action
reviews.content: What an awesome movie definitely worth the trip to the cinema. I recommend screen x in Cineworld for a brilliant movie going experience. The movie is visually stunning it's very predictable but this is a movie you watch for the death defying action scenes. Quality am definitely going to watch it again.

reviews.review_title: Old-fashioned blockbuster at its finest - see it in the theater
reviews.content: Tom Cruise really knows what he's doing. If you don't care for the original, you probably don't need to watch this and give it a 6/10 on IMDb.This movie is unashamed fan service, nostalgic yet modern day, with high octane action that delivers in every scene. This is pure cinema, pure blockbuster entertainment (not Shakespeare) and the perfect sequel - tailored for Top Gun lovers.Sit back and enjoy (at the theater!)

I have low expectations for sequels especially ones that come out 30+ years later. I was born in the 80's, the OG Gun movie was a favorite.Sequels tend to be a letdown but this film restored faith in any doubt that it can be done.They just blew it out of the water.Do yourself a favor , go to the theater and see it for yourself.I don't even have anything I would say could have been different. It was perfect.I'm pretty sure Tom Cruise helped make sure of that. Great job.

I don't know what to say. Goosebumps, heartbeat, on the edge of the seat!I guess you generally wouldn't expect a sequel to be great (unfortunately), especially if the original was great, and yet this movie is even better!The storyline is great. It builds a lot on the old storyline and connects with it too, successfully, but also has new elements and twists which make it a great movie on its own.I'm glad they 'remade' the movie with modern technology and experience, that gave it so much, that gave it the edge. Plus the kind of 'redemption' in the story...You wished there were more of Top Gun back then, but it's not a sequel kind of movie, yet they managed to beat the iconic original, but such a success makes you crave for more, like another sequel although now it really seems hard to beat. (I wanted to rewatch the movie after walking out of the theater).

reviews.review_title: People seem to have been bedazzled by Jennifer Connelly
reviews.content: ... who is admittedly gorgeous and lights up the screen every time she smiles at her 'old flame'.But the story is basically another appeal to (or should that be portrayal of?) American hubris, along the lines of "Independence Day" or Captain America deciding nobody's going to tell him what to do (even if the massive collateral damage has persuaded the other Avengers that there need to be controls). We make the rules and will punish anybody who doesn't obey them! But we don't feel obliged to follow them ourselves, because we have freedom and independence and run the planet!

reviews.review_title: Feels like a tribute to a good film with a great film
reviews.content: This is definitely better then the first top gun movie and it just feels like a tribute at first anyway with it echoing every move of the first movie. Has much better flying sequences, much better comedy, much better near everything.

I adore Top Gun, and have seen it over 100 times, can recite it word for word, and is the reason I'm a pilot. I've never been so excited for a movie. Not even for Endgame or the collosal disaster; Die Hard 5.I saw this on the 21st May in Macau, 4 days before it's European realease.. ... Odd. Hence why it's the first review.I was excited / nervous for it to do well, but I had faith in Tom Cruise's dedication to his craft, and perfectionism.He delivered! And then some!A perfect sequel.. the opening had me giddy with glee, giggling and cheering and fist pumping the air in the cinema.The movie has everything. The flying is sooo amazing and real, with the actors really pulling those Gs in the aircaft. With Real character development for Maverick, some sad moments, and a beautiful inclusion of a not well Val Kilmer. A nice new personal journey for Maverick to navigate. It has So many links to the original, and the perfext balance is struck between nods and homage to the original film vs ripoff and copycat ala Hangover 2. It has everything.If you know the first movie well you will have alot of moments of 'oh that's just like that bit' and 'ooh is he gonna say that, or do this' a lovely experience to live.The finale had be squirming in my seat flying every twist and turn, clenched, excited, riveted and scared. It's almost like Top Gun meets Mission Impossible.. we also get the obligatory Tom Cruise running scene 😅.It doesn't repeat the story of the first one, but continues it into something else, that's entirely different yet very familiar. Maverick faces more challenges this time around on a personal level, and the love interest story is in keeping with a character his age who's lived his life. He is also more badass this time around.With characters like Rooster (have a think about that one) and Hangman, a kinda Iceman, Maverick rolled into one.. you get taken on a new journey for the movie, for them, and for Maverick himself in last chance saloon.It's obvious that it can't have the innocent 80s charm of the first one. That era is gone and making a retro movie would feel weird. But it's in its own era, it owns and embraces that, and makes the most of it too, with Tom Cruise and his mega productions to great effect. No using the same shot repeatedly ala Top Gun. Theyve got a tonne of flying and it's all concurrent.Eveything you want to happen happens. It's emotional, amazing, triumphant, sad, and fun (in no order!). A stunning movie, that could not have been better. Don't think this kind of movie can or will be done again. Stunning. Such and achievement.I will go again to the movies with my kids.. and feel like I should go a third time, to make it my most watched movie in the cinema over Endgame. Sit back, strap in, get some tissues, and don't forget to breathe!

This movie reminds me of when blockbusters were awesome. Some breathtaking scenes, the plot sort of takes a back seat to the visuals. I felt a bit weird about how ICEMAN a was used in the movie. I rewatched the original about a week before and the 2nd movie actually does a better job progressing through the story, and much better action sequences. The original was great for what it was but the second truly demonstrates what todays technology can offer. Even if it it was with older planes that what the military is actually using today.

I am not a fan of chaotic action movies. But I loved Maverick and was able to follow along the entire story. The reasons are threefold: 1. The mission is simple and easy for audience to relate to and care about 2. Characters are few, fun, and focal to the story 3. Action sequences are realistic and easy to follow even though the subject matter is complex. Needless to say it takes enormous hard work to make complex simple.On top of this the special effects and brilliant cinematography and dialogue delivery make this movie a masterpiece!

I was really exited to watch a film that would be a blast from the past for me. I'm not a westerner, but I was 5 when the first Top Gun film came out. I remember my brother bought the cassette and I still remember some of the songs. I haven't seen the film for years, but I remember it wasn't particularly good. Solid direction, amazing stunts, decent acting, but a teeny-bop love story that was just pathetic.So now we get number 2. In honesty, it looked well shot, awesome stunts, solid direction again, but I just can't get enjoyment out of watching a bunch of one language only, zero culture Americans flying around in planes that they usually use to bomb innocent babies and children in Serbia, the Middle East or Pakistan.What joy can any psychopath get from watching a bunch of one language ONLY, couldn't tell you the colour of ANY foreign flags, has no idea who we fought in WW2, couldn't recognise a foreign language if it slapped him, in a plane. Who can enjoy that?Americans use these planes to burn, maim, disable and destroy thousands of innocent children in tens of countries. What enjoyment do you get from watching that? I'd like to see a movie where China or Russia, use planes to nuke the USA. That'd be an interesting aerial battle. The Chinese could state they'd spare anyone who speaks a second language and all the imperial AngloGermanic one language ONLY clowns would be bombed like the children of the Middle East. I'd pay to see that. Otherwise, drop me out.

reviews.review_title: Absolute must see and definitely worth the wait
reviews.content: I loved every minute of this. The story was on point, the action was perfect, the nods to the original were great and will most definitely get you right in the feels.

I went to the cinema excited to see the Top Gun heroes one more time, not expecting anything spectacular, because Maverick already told his beautiful story almost half a century ago.And so, after 130 mins, I got out. It's hard to describe what I felt. But for a little while, I was somebody else entirely. I was feeling 36 years younger, fresh, full of energy, willing to climb the Everest right at that moment, not thinking about anything else, nothing mattered anymore.All the beautiful memories came back, new ones were created, but in ways I could never imagine. Everything was a perfect continuation of the past, but also opened up the present and made way for the future, like nothing ever really ended.I went to see a sequel of an old movie, but instead I've got the amazing life of Maverick and his friends, to feel their emotions, to be part of their adventures, like the past 36 years never even existed.

A popcorn movie - that's it - a literal amusement ride.... so if you like that sort of thing, then this movie is for you - I loved it!!! And will see it 6 more times.... Paramount will be happy the waited.
Could not fault this film. Tom Cruise has outdone himself. Breathtaking action sequences, great cast and fast moving plot. Movies don't get any better than this.

Just like the OG Top Gun film, Top Gun Maverick is going to be a classic. They don't make action films like this anymore. The heart, the suspense, the action and most importantly, THE COMEDY! This film made you feel every moment of its 2 hour run time. Cruise acts his butt off in this movie and props to Miles Teller for holding his own in this. Tom Cruise might just be "the last great action hero"! See this on the biggest screen you can find, it's worth it!

reviews.review_title: better than the original for sure
reviews.content:
For reference, i gave the original Top Gun a 6/10. I found it very boring. I know some of you will be upset by that.In Maverick, it was far superior because it actually had "heart" in the story, and I was far more invested in the characters and their success. Also, the original film didn't really have any convincing "stakes" (except for the Maverick & Goose ejection scene) because for 99% of the original, the consequence of failure was probably just they'd have to keep training / go home. I wasn't *invested* in the original like I was in Maverick.I do have some complaints:
i wish Kelly McGillis' Charlotte Blackwood could have appeared in this movie or at least been MENTIONED. Kind of sad what happened with Kelly / Charliei noticed some minor continuity issues. For example, there's one scene where a pilot goes from the aircraft carrier to suddenly being in the woods with a parachute behind him on the ground. They could've shown the pilot's trip into the woods with a few short clips.

reviews.review_title: Great and fun follow up to an already classic movie.
reviews.content: A ridiculously fun and entertaining follow up filled with great performances and breathtaking action. I know some may or may not have nostalgia for the original, but I do so that made it even better for me. Kudos as well for getting Val Kilmer to return even if for a small, limited role.

This is the movie which brings cinema buffs back to the cinema!Story full of action, excitement, decent back story, and of course, Tom Cruise!Do yourself a really big favor and watch this on the big screens, preferably in 3D to truly enjoy those spectacular aerial scenes.

After so much time I didn't think that the excitement and anticipation of the original Top Gun could be topped. This movie proved me wrong in so many ways. I won't spill any spoilers here, but will just say that somehow Tom Cruz has discovered the fountain of youth!If you loved Top Gun, you will be amazed with this movie. I promise! The special effects have come a long way since the original. You really need to see this with a good tv or better yet in a theatre.The one detractor from this film is that the story line was predictable. For me though, that wasn't enough to take away my absolute love of the movie! The casting is great and the score is as well.If this movie doesn't win some sort of academy award, I would be very surprised, and pissed.10 stars plus for this viewer!

This is one of the most boring movies you will ever watch. These 8 and 9 and 10 star reviews have to be fake. The action, what little there is, is only in the last 30 minutes. And even then it's lack luster and predictable. Almost all characters are not built up you don't care about any of them. The dialog is one cliche after another. Jennifer Connelly is just there for a female role and no other reason. Her and the kid playing her daughter should be removed.This movie was made for Tom Cruise's massive ego and wanting to relive some glory days.

reviews.review_title: The best action movie in a long time
reviews.content: This movie is what Hollywood used to be...an action movie without any political agenda and virtue signaling, just full of entertainment and a great storyline...I can feel this movie already become an instant classic for generations to come!!

reviews.review_title: I wanted to give this 9.5 out of 10 , what would have given it a 10 would..
reviews.content: ...have been, instead of a closing on a meaningless Lady GaGa song (come on dont you know your audience), if it had instead finished with Take My Breath Away on that plane... this movie would have been perfect....

reviews.review_title: Tom Cruise - The Greatest of all time
reviews.content: There's nothing I can critique or wish was better, as this gem was perfect in every way. Absolutely stunning, action-packed with a compelling and emotional story.Everything gone well, few new comers done there job quite nicely. I'm always being fan of Tom Cruise and he never disappoint his fans.Great fun to watch.Love you Tom.

reviews.review_title: The best movie I've ever seen
reviews.content: This movie soared beyond all my expectations. Truly the best blockbuster of recent times, and dare I say, of all time. This is the only movie in my life that I've paid for to watch twice in theaters and it's worth every penny! I was afraid that this would flop like the other sequels of classic movies like the Matrix and Star Wars. But this to me is on par and even slightly better than the original film. Everything from the cinematic shots to the acting and the score was beautiful beyond words. Quite possibly the absolute best experience I've had in theaters.

Go on, you know you want to watch it. Finally a decent Hollywood action film, without having too much of an '"agenda" shoved in your face like every other movie these days feels it has to do. It's good, solid fun for those who appreciate the old fashioned movies of the 80's and 90's, but great for the youngsters too - the sound effects and jet scenes on the Imax are awesome! Tom Cruise and the rest of the cast did this movie justice.

Thanks Tom! Thanks amazing crew! Thanks for this real, natural, old-school movie! I always wanted to see the continuation of Maverick's story and as I am already in my mid 40s, my inner child was really happy today! The movie has this great adventures feeling, actions scenes that make me want to see this in 4D, some details reflecting the first movie, sexier female actress than the first movie and F-14, one of the greatest fighters of all time.It is movie made not only for the profit, but also for the pleasure of doing it this way!I will be back in the cinema to watch it again!I felt bad for Val, he is a great actor.

reviews.review_title: Corny rewrite of the first movie
reviews.content:
Maverick misbehaving - check (the man is reaching 60 and never grew up?)
Angry commander can't believe he's sending to Top Gun - check
Motorcycle next to planes taking off - check
Love interest - check
Piano scene - check
Beach scene - checkAnd more I've probably forgotten. I don't even consider these spoilers, because you won't be surprised when they happen (they're probably in the trailer). This is not a movie you watch to be surprised or bemused. If I had to describe this movie in one word it would be: predictable.But that's OK. The amazing flying scene alone make the movie worth watching and if you've sat through the first half you definitely do get rewarded at the end. There'll be no surprises then either but certainly exciting to watch!

Maverick murdered cinema. For a movie that boasts ultrasonic speed, this death was slow and painful. Top Gun:Maverick the biggest disgrace of a movie I have ever watched. My brain ached halfway through, the amount of sodding cliches that this is built on is devastating, please don't do this to yourselves.This is not even close to a blockbuster, not even a pathetic remake. It is shallow, bland, tasteless, utterly devoid of any meaningful plot development. I will not even begin to describe the flippant implications it leaves about contemporary American power.It does not even do it justice to say this movie is Tom Cruise enjoying himself all the time? Yet, why Tom, why? What is there to smile about so much in all these inappropriate places? And I have always liked Tom Cruise. But it seems the whole point of the movie was to prove some middle-age-crisis induced point that Tom Cruise, being Tom Cruise, can pilot a jet.The problem is, if you do this to yourselves, you will never be able to see the original Top Gun with the same innocent, unspoiled eyes again.

reviews.review_title: A moving tribute to Tony Scott (RIP), Val Kilmer (Get well soon) and a mature Maverick
reviews.content: Finally, I have just discovered this cinematographic phenomenon, which continues to race ahead of all others at the top of the world box-office of the year, while waiting to be dethroned by "Avatar: The Way of Water".I don't understand the stellar early reactions, the overhyped critical acclaim selling it as one of the best films in cinematic history, or those who look down on it, claiming it's just another military video recruitment campaign disguised as a film. Because, in my humble opinion, it is neither."Top Gun: Maverick" (2022) is a good movie. Well written, technically flawless and performed with conviction while paying a fine tribute to Tony Scott's 1986 film.The best scene is undoubtedly the "Iceman scene", which is so moving because reality is larger than fiction and Val Kilmer partly plays himself. Those who have suffered from ENT cancer know this, and would not even want their worst enemy to experience such a journey through hell.What about the role of the US military? Well, I am the first to condemn the crimes of imperialism, but I also have the greatest respect for armed forces who defend their populations, and, of course, the greatest contempt for any invading force. Here I did not sense any heavy or silly propaganda, as I might have first feared based on some reviews.Hollywood is smarter than Washington and Wall Street, because "Top Gun: Maverick" had to toe the line when it came to casting its villains. Congratulations and thank you to the executives, crew and cast of the film for making a smart film devoid of political propaganda, which can be enjoyed anywhere in time. If only the majority of politicians and the media could have this decency and this intelligence.By the way, I know some "Democrats" who are unable to analyze the various shades of demonstration of human violence in Hollywood films, while supporting the jingoistic propaganda of some of their most powerful elected officials. Let's also not forget that President Eisenhower (R) warned against the military-industrial complex, while Truman (D) justified the use of nuclear weapons.The biggest weak point in my opinion is that Charlotte "Charlie" Blackwood, the astrophysicist and civilian instructor from Top Gun, played by Kelly McGillis, who was Maverick's primary love interest in the original film, isn't mentioned at all. "What became of her?" remains an open question when the end credits begin to scroll.In conclusion, the ethics and morality behind the use of force and the legality and morality of the mission in "Top Gun: Maverick" have been analyzed and voted on by the United Nations Security Council. It's a larger-than-life motion picture, and nothing else, which endears made-for-the-big-screen movies and delights aviation enthusiasts, while wishing characters with that kind of emotional and intellectual intelligence would deal with such important issues in the real world, which is unfortunately not always the case nowadays.

The writing, the photography, the actors, the directing and the music are out of this world. A sequel which truly lives up to any expectations. This sequel is fire. I have no more words, just WOAW! 10/10 movieGo watch it if you haven't yet and remember to enjoy.

This is an incredible movie. Respectful of the original however I believe it is actually better. The first movie was a great movie this is better.The sequel no one asked for, but one we needed even if we didn't didn't know it.

"Top Gun: Maverick" (released 5/27/2022 (Covid delayed 2 years), PG-13, 2hrs, star: Tom Cruise, Director: Joe Kasinski) was almost a scene-for-scene remake/update of the original, simply changing character names and actors for most, though keeping the same characterizations in place. This is mine and many, many others' chief complaint, but maybe after a 37-year (!) wait, they could claim it's really for the generation that never experienced Top Gun (1986) though that's not really an excuse given the VCR rental years, the DVD rental years, and the streaming years. However, the final 45-mins of the new mission raised this from a 5 rating to 7 or even 8. It was a great departure from the original and really broke new ground with amped up air combat. Yes, there was a LOT of implausible crappola after Maverick bailed out but it moved fast enough that you were kind of forced to accept it, part of the magic of movies. The final save scene was really reminiscent of 2012's "Battleship" so that kind of paved the way for this. But this kind of "yea US military!" seems out of place in today's world, though it's $1.5B box office will make it hard to dissuade producers of that.

Everything you want from an action blockbuster.It's been some time since an original "old school" Hollywood blockbuster hit the big screen and made my cheer, scream and cry. This movie has all the ingredients
The nods to the original is a nice touch.

reviews.review_title: The music sounded very vintage to me (small budget or artistic choice? Better be none of these options)
reviews.content: The music sounded very vintage to me (small budget or artistic choice? Better be none of these options), the plot was so Star-Wars-Death-Star-has-a-tiny-but-very-convenient-hatch predictable (I almost left at the 30 min and again 60 min mark), the dialogue ("Everyone here is the best there is, who the hell they gonna get to teach us?") and plot (I love you but you broke my heart... thrice...) so melodramaticorny (was it Hollywood-corny or Army-corny? I can't tell...) but, man! (no offense), the flight scenes were absolutely breathtaking (yes, I admit, quite literally so too... and OF COURSE, I would watch it again now that I know to start at the hour mark...)

reviews.review_title: go see it on the big screen - NOW
reviews.content: Better go see in theater now! I know I'm seeing this "late"- like three weeks after it's opening but when I was searching for movie times, it was barely in any theaters except at 10pm or later and you have to see on the big screen just for all the jet scenes. It soooo good!It was just really well done and not campy - the storyline was perfect - it was a great way to bring in all the fighter jet scenes. They did a good job of paying homage to the original without being super sappy. The scene with Iceman was my favorite - if Tom Cruise is going to ever get nominated for any acting roles, I would nominate him for that scene alone. In fact, if this movie doesn't get nominated for ANY categories, then Hollywood, why even bother making another movie?Prob the best movie sequel ever.

reviews.review_title: I doubted it could even touch on the original
reviews.content: I really enjoyed this. So much so, that for the first time in a long time I didn't check how long the film was going to last and didn't touch my phone during the film.No spoilers, it's a decent film, well directed, a great cast with impeccable acting.It's definitely worth a watch, I was very pleased I watched it at the cinema, the sound of the jets and the large screen made it an experience I recommend for all!

reviews.review_title: Tense action sequences and compelling character development, "Maverick" is an improvement under every single aspect.
reviews.content: A few months ago I watched the original 1986 first "Top Gun" and it is still today a solid movie, with amazing aircraft fights scenes and memorable characters such as "Goose". However, it had several flaws, such as the love story between Pete and Charlie that took way too much screen time, the ridiculous dialogues lines and the general cheesy American patriotism that was so beloved by the audience during the 80's. This sequel fixed all these issues and it is a way better movie. The action sequences are amazing and kept me on the verge, as the good guys are very often in difficult situations that are difficult to solve. Interactions and conflicts between different characters are believable. I loved how the relationship between Maverick and Bradshaw evolves along the way. The director played just the right dose of nostalgia with some sequences that were obviously quoting the original production.I feel that this movie achieved a lot: these were two intense hours and the payback for the audience is huge. You get to see a movie with a simple and yet entertaining story. The photography is phenomenal and there are some scenes that are truly breathtaking, especially if you watch them on a big screen. Cast members delivered some good performances, even though I was not very impressed by any of the actors, including Tom Cruise. He looked and sounded pretty average, I was expecting more under this department, especially from a star of this caliber. The music is always on point and there is a nice mix between rock classics, orchestral music composed by Hans Zimmer and some modern pop songs. I was pretty skeptical about this film, because usually sequels made several years after the original entry often disappoint me. Here instead, I was pleasantly surprised.

reviews.review_title: I didn't want it to end!
reviews.content: Total thrill ride, bought the 80's back with precision and great film making.Fantastic sequel, excellently executed. I did want it to be longer though in one part near the end but i won't spoil it.

First of all, the entire premise of this movie is completely ridiculous. I won't explain why, as that would give away plot details, but it's obvious if you spend 30 seconds thinking about it. So, don't think about it! If you turn off you brain and play along, it's a ridiculously good movie. The action and special effects are great, the acting is fantastic, and there are even a few awesome laugh-out-loud moments.Just for the record, I saw the original Top Gun in its theatrical release and thought it was pretty good, but to my mind, it was not super-duper-fantastic. I also generally hate sequels and remakes of any kind. So, when my wife insisted that we watch Top Gun: Maverick, I had low expectations. This movie far, far exceeded my expectations in every way. I can't go to 10 stars due to the logical incoherence of it, but I can see why a lot of the reviewers here feel that it's that good.

reviews.review_title: Who were the bad guys supposed to be?
reviews.content: Although I think the pacing, acting, plot structure, and flying sequences in this movie work extremely well, I can't help but have big questions about the nature of the conflict it revolves around. Both existing TOP GUN movies to me feel frustratingly unconcerned with the geopolitical situation leading to the climactic missions that everything else in the movies revolve around, instead to focus mainly on Tom Cruise's romantic life, rivalry with Val Kilmer, and his need to prove himself/overcome his inner demons that come from feeling responsible over the death of his friend.There's a few cryptic lines about the enemy country enriching uranium in a highly protected facility guarded by new 5th generational fighters, SAMs, and a few leftover U. S. jets. Well this would indicate that they are attacking Iran in a move obviously patterned after the Israelis and why they've been so keen on building bases in Azerbaijan. The writer probably thought just to replace Azerbaijan with a U. S. Carrier group and call it a day. However this has a few problems as there is no way an American carrier group would be operating out of The Caspian Sea (which is the only part of Iran with a tree-lined mountainous coast as depicted in the film). It's clear from the maps shown in the film that the planes fly North-East toward land (indicating they were flying out of The Persian Gulf) but the director changed the landscape so that it'd be more distinct from the deserts used earlier in the training sequences.All right, you might say the enemy country is kept amorphous because it could easily sub for Russia, China, or North Korea while conveniently not offending their audiences. However, all these countries get ruled out because they already have plenty of nuclear weapons and are not fielding large numbers of F-14's.I'm am little annoyed by the film playing things so safe, especially as it ended up getting banned in China anyway. As it stands, we are in a fantasy movie which in little way corresponds to the actual world. Personally, I would be much more interested in a little bit of back story as to what is going on in the world at the time, as I didn't find the interpersonal drama to be nearly as compelling. That said, the film maintains some small level of realism through the training sequences but relies on some pretty severe coincidences to move things along in the end.Overall, I enjoyed the film quite a bit for what it was, which was big dumb fun with a lot of extremely impressive aerial stunts and photography at play. Almost nothing looked too outrageously cheesy and computer generated outside of a few of the explosions and the Mi-24 helicopter. Cruise and Connelly both look good for their age, but remember that this film was shot 4 years before it was finally released. I can't help but wonder if a lot was left on the cutting room floor which would have tied up loose ends though, like whatever happened to Kelly McGillis's character and how & when his superiors change their minds on whether or not he'll fly in the mission. Perhaps we will find out if an extended edition ever gets released.

One of the best movies that I ever have watched. From start to end a great movie. Tom Cruise is an outstanding actor and make this movie so good. I recomend this movie at all cost. A tip from me is to watch the first Top Gun movie before you watch this to clear up what happened in the first movie.

reviews.review_title: Ace Combat the movie, and it's a good thing
reviews.content: Top Gun: Maverick is a Top Gun movie about Maverick. I know this sounds like a bot review, but it's exactly what it is. Top Gun formula is applied to a movie centred around its main character even more than previously.The mission which protagonists must overcome is basically Ace Combat's Cape Rainy Assault, Faceless Soldier and Bunker Buster mixed together in that sequence.It's a well done movie, slightly dragging its feet occasionally, but entertaining till the end. CGI is mostly good with couple of uncanny moments. Shots of air-crafts flying in the distance are biggest offenders. The 24 frames per second target just makes plane movement very jagged.

reviews.review_title: The best movie for 2022 so far! Perfect energizer for this summertime
reviews.content: I didn't watch the previous movie before, but this movie is legitimately realistic! U didn't need to watch the previous movies because almost the entirety of the chars is new. Right after I finished this movie at the cinema, I felt energized, stronger, and ready to kick in! All of these are because the movie is mesmerizing. Feelin' so real! The movie production team said this movie is really made by actors as a real pilot from special pilot course preparation. OFC, it seems "impossible" but plz remember, there is Tom Cruise, we mustn't use that word!The narration is about a legendary pilot, Maverick, forced to retire or do the last job as Top Gun Instructor for a confidential military mission. His personal life exp traumatizes him to take the job because he must become an instructor for the son of his dead pilot friends. Long story short, it's about time to narrate the movie with boys military & youth vibe, struggles, and romance.The pros are so many. Emotional, plausible, entertaining, and insightful for aviation military knowledge. From the beginning, the visuals, audio, costume, and sets are instantly bringing the audience to the movie. So real! The iconic look of Maverick style is still desired now! Pilot leather jacket and bomber jacket combined with Ray-Ban's aviator sunglasses, white tee, and blue denim through iconic Kawasaki bike. On the other hand, the acting performance and storyline are undoubted. Tom Cruise is still proving his perfectionism, perfect! The cons?! I'm sorry, I get biased with all of these pros HAHAHA maybe the romance is a lil bit okay, but it's still great!?In my personal POV, I'll guarantee for all of u, at least, You'll get positive vibes and force all of your negativity bias or depression to begone. This movie is so positive and a mood-booster. Currently, I still get overreacted euphoria of this movie lol. Don't miss it plz! Top Gun is considered the most iconic movie of the 80s era.

reviews.review_title: The Best Blockbuster of the Summer
reviews.content: I think 'Top Gun: Maverick' is one of the years best films. This is a sequel from the original 'Top Gun' in 1986, and it is Paramount's biggest blockbuster of the summer since 'Titanic.' Tom Cruise did a great job of his performance to played Capt. Pete "Maverick" Mitchell since the original 'Top Gun'. Miles Teller to played Lt. Bradley "Rooster" Bradshaw who the son of Maverick's late RIO and best friend, Lt. (j.g.) Nick "Goose" Bradshaw who played by Anthony Edwards, and Carole Bradshaw who played by Meg Ryan from the original movie. Also, Jennifer Connelly who played as Penny Benjamin who is Maverick's rekindled love interest, a single mother, and a bar owner. John Hamm who played VADM Beau "Cyclone" Simpson who is the commander of Naval Air Forces who kind of reminds me of CDM Mike "Viper" Metcalf who played by Tom Skerritt from the original movie. Val Kilmer who played Maverick's close friend and former rival Tom "Iceman" Kazansky from the original movie. In the sequel, the filmmakers were able to dub the voice over Kilmer's acting since he was diagnosed with throat cancer.If you guys didn't like the first Top Gun movie, then I suggest you guys could watch the sequel because it was a great story, fantastic visuals and special effects, and excellent cast and crew. The movie is directed by Joseph Kosinski who directed his big-screen directoral debut 'Tron: Legacy' and another science fiction film 'Oblivion,' and the producer Jerry Bruckheimer who payed tribute to his colleague Don Simpson who produced the original 'Top Gun.' This is one of the years best films, and this is the best blockbuster of the summer.

reviews.review_title: What a sequel what a movie
reviews.content: First off let me say this was in no way what you think a sequel should be it's just balls to the wall amazing every shot felt real every fight felt like a front row seat I might see this a few more times in imax cuz holy hell this was a movie.

TopGun Top Film!!!Thrilling
Heartwarming
Funny
Movie Music
CinematicThis is what Hollywood movies are made of, best film I've seen in a decade what a sequel!!

reviews.review_title: Last of the ACTUAL live action movies
reviews.content: Watched this movie twice at the cinemas. Can't remember doing that for any movie. In a world of green screen, this was a much needed film with actual action and actual stunts. I got my money's worth. Although it helps if you've seen the original, it works well as a standalone movie.
Has kept that vibe of Top Gun from first part. Tom Cruise as always at his best. Goose bumps in few scenes Overall movie not to miss and Worth watching.

We return to Tom Cruise's iconic character, the hot shot pilot Maverick. With the death of the original director Tony Scott this got pushed back a few years but director Joseph Kosinski has tried to make the film feel like the original all the same. The yellow sunset/sunrise tints are there, there locations, the music and some of the classic characters.However it doesn't quite catch the magic or great character interplay like the first. It does have great aerial scenes especially in the third act. All in all it's an acceptable sequel with good performances from Tom Cruise and Miles Teller but feels a bit hollow and limp when we are not in the sky.6.5/10.

My expectations were high, after all 1986 was a big year for movies for me at only 15, Top Gun, Dundee, Aliens and my firm love of cinema was born. I simply loved every moment of Maverick, it's opening nod to the original and numerous, often subtle, throwbacks to 80's nostalgia. I found myself smiling throughout and also quite emotional too, the Val scenes particularly got me after watching the doc 'Val' recently, if you haven't seen it watch it! It's just a great film, some deliberate cheesy moments but they're by design not accidental and firmly compliment what has to be one of my favourite movies in years, if not of all time. It's just pure entertainment and exactly what the big screen is meant to be about, if you can revisit the original movie first like I did, you'll notice even more winks and nods and you'll likely enjoy it even more, top marks, 10/10!

Any director, writer, producer or wannabe Hollywood moguel should watch and learn. This is how to make a sequel that honors the original, enhances what made the original special for the fans while adding some new neat touches. Deserves all the credit it gets. First movie to put a smile on my face in years at the movie theater.

reviews.review_title: I wish I could score higher
reviews.content: Incredible movie, everything you want from the movie experience! I will not spoil anything for you but!! Rooster is goose and goose is a bad ass!! So it follows that rooster is a bad ass. Go maverick!!!
If you loved the first top gun then you MUST watch the sequel!! Just as good if not better than the first the flying is awesome the plot is good and the acting is phenomenal. Must watch movie.

Thoughtful writing, gutsy action shots and cast of skilled actors break the 'sequels can't beat originals' mould. It was certainly refreshing seeing 'real' live action scenes creating an amazing display that CGI cannot replicate. I hope future blockbusters learn from Top Gun Mavericks success.
Just bad overall- every scene overblown and clichéd. Yes there's a nostalgic angle but its just a barrage of improbability and scmaltz. Disappointing.

reviews.review_title: Has its good sides and bad sides, but overall, a good sequel
reviews.content: The movie has an old style vibe to it, a late 80s American movie vibe. It starts cringe, with cringe dialogue and predictable sentences, it was full of clichés, many of the parts about the kid and the father were predictable.However, when the real action starts, it saves the movie. The action is top quality, gives an adrenaline rush in your veins.The actors played done their job very well, especially Miles Teller. Ed Harris and Jon Hamm is no surprise that they fit perfectly in their roles.I've read in many places that this sequel has surpassed the original, but I don't really agree. When Top Gun came out, it was something extraordinary, it remained a classic. This sequel is obvious that is somehow better, since cinema evolved since then, but times have changed and I don't see Maverick becoming a classic like Top Gun. There wasn't the same hype as with Top Gun. Maybe because we have higher standards today. It's hard to compare them, but it is indeed a good sequel.
Although I've seen Top Gun previously, this is really on another level. Everyone who watches this will be strongly affected by the action scenario and the extra effects.

reviews.review_title: Exactly what a Top Gun sequel should be.
reviews.content: The original movie didn't need a sequel, but this is the right kind since it got one. So many scenes do double duty, making this movie entertaining while bringing back great memories of the first movie. It feels like you hung out with an old friend and had a great time.
I am sure this movie will be the best movie on 2022.It wins without discussing.No fantasy include, No romantic story.Really exceeded my expectations and strongly earns more than 10.

Wow loved it ok it's cheesy as hell but it's
a thrilling boys own Action Man fun movie. Tom Cruise is a legend. I'm going to see if again. Fighter jet pilot what a fantastic job that must be.

This movie should have been called "I'm Tom Cruise - there isn't any room in this movie to shine but me!!!". 90% of the movie had Cruise in it, 90% of the movie was sooo predictable(parts where Cruise was made to look like a hero and was made to look cool/hip. Parts where Cruise seemingly was seemingly portrayed to be at a loss but it was just a ploy to make him shine). Tom still believes he's 28 years old. The other pilots looked like young guns and were cool and funny but they were NOT the focal point of this movie - it was ALL about Tom Cruise. The female pilot was awesome, Bob was cool, Hangman was egotistical but in a badass way and Rooster was awesome BUT they all had to take a back seat to allow Tom Cruise to steal the show with his "shoe lifts", his "presence" and his "old face". I thought Tom was going to be the badass captain and instructor - leading young men and women to be the "elite of the elite" but instead it was just about Tom wanting to be the spotlight at all times. There is NO WAY that this was better than the original Top Gun. Tom, you are 60 years old - you are NOT a young gun anymore. Let it go!!!! Act like a mentor, a leader or a badass father figure. Right now, you look stupid and its a total bore. Congrats on being able to do your own stunts but you are still NOT a young gun - it's time to just "pass the torch".

It's not a bad action picture but this is a sequel that is short on character relationships. Who is Penny? What's their history? Why is she at Iceman's funeral? Where's Charlie and what ever happened to her? Wouldn't there have been more dramatic interest with a couple of Carole scenes with Maverick and her son rather than killing off that character?Aside from that, the action is good. Much of the plot is similar to the original movie which should satisfy fans of Top Gun. Good performances all around but especially by top billed actors. The final sequence is quite fun and exciting. Great production values.

reviews.review_title: This is a great movie for people who like this stuff
reviews.content: Oh, so this is Top Gun. Look, this is a fun movie for people who like it. If you've never seen Top Gun (like me), it's kinda like Fast and the Furious but with planes, and it really makes you dizzy. It's fine! This is a great movie for people who like this stuff.

reviews.review_title: A maverick of a film - action, comedy, suspense and love
reviews.content: An absolute golden film. After a 36 year wait, I was doubtful this film would match that of the original. Yet it didn't it has absolutely blown it away like a missile hitting a toy plane.Top gun maverick will have you feeling every emotion with not a single dull moment you will go from laughing to sitting on the edge of your seat unable to take your eyes off of the screen.The new characters fit into the franchise superbly which you will fall in love with in no time.Their is just the right amount of throw backs so it doesn't feel like the original top gun.A must watch top 3 film of the year so far.
