I love the original 1986 film and I wasn't even alive when it was released lol. When I was younger I was pretty obsessed with movies (tbh I'm still that way with movies) and Top Gun was a movie I watched over and over until I wore out the VHS. My mom even nicknamed me Goose because of this movie. I was super skeptical when I saw they were making a sequel because most of the times they're awful cash grabs just trying to make money off the popularity of the original.That's not the case with this sequel. Everyone actor is on their A-game and the plot has a purpose. The action sequences are amazing and you can tell how much work they put into this movie to improve on the limitations of the original. I'm not a fan of Tom Cruise what with all the Scientology stuff but he brings so much emotion that I believe is very genuine. Miles Teller is perfect as Rooster, the similarity between him and Anthony Edwards is uncanny. Also, Miles Teller is an absolute stud and the beach scene of him shirtless is worth the price of admission alone.The only negative for me is the romance. It wasn't necessary to the story and if you weren't a hardcore fan of the first movie you wouldn't even get the callback to the Penny Benjamin that Goose mentions in passing at the beginning being this Penny.Overall, this movie is a 10/10 for me and will be an immediate buy once it comes to Blu-ray. I've already seen it in the theater twice and I'm sure will see it as least once more. If you're a fan of the first, you can't go wrong seeing this one.
What a movie. Already seen it twice, and thinking of going again. A sequal is always difficult to match the original. But they hit it right out of the park. Couldnt ask for more.

reviews.review_title: The best combination of practical effects with special effects in a long time
reviews.content: "top gun maverick", the continuation of the classic 80's feature, seeks to finish the dramas of the first and give another good dose of action to the fans and, in a way, even oxygenate the genre as a whole. Top gun maverick's script is simple, weak in some points, especially with regard to the deepening of the supporting characters - with the exception of Iceman - and some canastrous effect phrases that despite being strange are consistent with the proposal of the work and our protagonist, the script seeks justifications for Pete to return to the action and even forces a little connections between the characters, however, when the plane takes to the sky, any and all criticism of the film comes to the ground, because the mix of special effects with practical effects are spectacular, the viewer is transported straight to the cockpit of a fighter jet and suffers, pirouettes, is hit, dives, climbs and is shot down with the planes, these are really incredible scenes that are responsible for causing affection, emotion, tension and apprehension to those watching. , the sound mixing is amazing, the clear and clean photography blends in perfectly with the scenery composition. Other points, the supporting cast works well, nothing special, Tom Cruise is very good, and the actor understands his character a lot, it's a charismatic, naughty performance and even when he needs it, the actor manages to have a dramatic rage.. note 8 .5/10.

Top Gun: Maverick (2022) follows Maverick as he finds himself training a group of graduates for a specialised mission. This is a very fun and heartwarming film! I feel I would've liked it more if I had nostalgia for the first Top Gun, but this is definitely a solid film!The visual effects and stunts look very good, but I expected a little more from the cinematography. The action sequences are so much fun to watch, especially in the third act, this really adds the tension built up. The colour palettes are subtle, and there's some good camerawork and use of slow motion, but it doesn't feel imaginative.The soundtrack used is very 80s and really adds a lot of life to the film, and the sound design is fairly decent. However, the score feels a little basic and forgettable.There are some great performances in this film, and in my opinion, Miles Teller really outshines Tom Cruise. The actors have a lot of chemistry and contrast well with each other, and I ended up really caring for their characters! The dialogue is pretty good too, and there's some very funny lines.The film sets up the story well, however it is quite hard to fully get into and isn't immediately engaging. The plot does feel a little messy at times and I got a bit confused, but this really picks up in the final act which is incredibly tense and gripping!

reviews.review_title: Intense flight mission sequences and nostalgia make Top Gun 2 a summer blockbuster once again
reviews.content: I was a big Top Gun fan (as was mostly everyone I knew) back in the late 80's and early 90's. It was the highest grossing movie of 1986 for a reason. So I was very excited to finally get a chance to see this sequel a day earlier than the advertised release date. We went at the very first matinee and everyone in the theatre enjoyed it. It was fun and triggered lots of chuckles and laughs with subtle humor.I cried at probably at least five or six scenes, whether from nostalgia, heavy hearted references to either character deaths or character relationships, or the romance scenes. In addition to the humor and sad scenes, there was also some good drama and intense jet fighter sequences. The director and writers blended the concept of a difficult fighter jet mission with fun training scenes, romance, and callbacks to the original.I'm not going to lie- this is a good movie. I'm not exaggerating that I barely blinked during the entire run time of 2 hours and 10 minutes, with which most of the time when I wasn't being tear-jerked, I had a silly grin on my face or was chuckling at the subtle humor. However, I will say that if I wasn't a big fan of the first one, I might not have liked it as much as I did. That's because it was a great as a fan of the first one to have so many references to anything in part one.The ending was good, but it could have been even better, even though it was intense enough to have me sweating a little. But one of the biggest drawbacks of Top Gun 2 is also one of its strengths, in my opinion, in a way. I got the impression that ultimately this is a movie that is more made for kids and teens than adults, and what that means is that the content is mostly light and shies away from any kind of violence or sexuality, which would have made it feel more mature and realistic. For example, in the original Top Gun, it has heavy profanity, really intense romance and sex for a PG movie, a pilot dies depicted with a face covered in blood after ejecting, and the dialogue by actors like Tom Skeritt make the stakes seem higher and more realistic: "what we do up there is dangerous". Maverick's dad's fate in Vietnam is also discussed to paint a realistic picture of the stakes. Overall, it just felt more gritty, whereas "Top Gun Maverick" keeps it ultra "clean" considering the dangers of flying and the explicit nature of locker room talk and sexuality.What this means is you get a sequel movie that is much more appropriate for teens and kids than adults, yet being an adult I kind of wish the stakes would have felt as heavy as they could have been. It would have been sadder, but it also would've been more mature and realistic. It is what it is. It's still a good movie, but it could have been better.I'm glad that I saw it early. As a nostalgic, emotional, fun summer popcorn movie, it was a blast, but if you're expecting a Best Pic contender or something remarkably original and profound, unfortunately the writers and directors "had the shot, but refused to fire it", and for that the movie comes up a bit short in cliches, cheese, and yes even lacking believability at key moments. I think there was an Oscar-contender somewhere in this story, but the creators of it decided to go another direction, more into a "popcorn" and feel-good movie of the summer. That's fine and I don't blame them since the target audience was clearly younger kids, which makes it a nice, wholesome movie for a change.Jennifer Connelly, despite a small supporting role, was the key to this movie. Other than Cruise, who does have a few stumbling moments at times, her confident experience as an actor makes every look she gives and line she says add credibility to what is an otherwise rather superficial script for supporting actors. The other good role that stands out is Val Kilmer's pleasantly surprising (and funny at times) reappearance as Admiral Iceman. Then, Teller does a pretty impressive job as Goose's kid.At the end of the day, "Top Gun Maverick" succeeds and soars as a nostalgic, deeply emotional surprise triumphant action flick, with flight battle scenes so intense it'll make you sweat in your seat, while it also crashes into some of the mountainous cliches that have been built and established by Hollywood throughout the years. So grab a seat and some popcorn and take a trip back to the 80s and 90s, a much simpler time, with some updated special effects and tech upgrades.

I had high expectations coming to this movie... very high with so many people waxing lyrical and ten out of ten ratings.To me, ten out of ten says the movie is perfect. Couldn't be improved on in any way. Without fault. Ok, let's take the plot first. Well it's simple. Stereotypically simple, I don't think the writers put very much thought into it at all. 'Un-named' foreign power. Check. Developing nukes. Check. Violation of international law. Check. US can act unilaterally and without consultation. Check. Mission looks impossible. Check. Only one man can do it. Check. Deadline moved up a week. Check. Skeletons from the past, turns to bromance at the end. Check. Nick of time saves. Check. Leading man gets the girl. Check. Check! There is nothing about the plot or delivery that is original, it's just the same old ingredients, stirred up and fed to a wide-eyed audience. Yes, Cruise can fly a fighter jet and I take my hat off to him for that, but was this movie just an excuse for him to pull some stunts? Who knows because none of the characters seemed to develop beyond their immense egos. The one exception for me was Val Kilmer, no ego at all just the bittersweet true life story playing out in the movie. Perhaps a touching swansong and the only 5 minutes of the movie that felt real. I wasn't invested in any other character to be honest, as cheesey, predictable dialogue and action sequences just flooded the screen. As the action became more frantic, so did the utterly ridiculous strokes of luck. The whole movie seemed like someone had buttered 50 pieces of bread, thrown them all in the air at once and every single piece landed buttered-side up! Towards the end we were all shouting "please make it stop!" but no, more totally implausible US chest beating was delivered.Tom Cruise is a consummate actor and I have enjoyed many of his films but this was just a string of groan-worthy stunts.

reviews.review_title: DEFINITELY THE film of the last ten years
reviews.content: Absolutely brilliant, perfect sequel, never seen one done that was better. Perfect mix of nods to the original and new modern twist. Incredible stunts and filming, perfect cast, stunning music, great story line- LOVED every second of it. Thank you Tom!!

After giving this some thought, I can honestly say this was one of the best blockbuster action movies I've ever seen in a movie theater. Not since Independence Day and Terminator 2 have I walked out of a movie theater this satisfied (this is limited to action blockbusters before you roll your eyes). Every second of this movie was fun, enjoyable and/or exhilarating with the perfect mix of nostalgia. While it stayed true to the original, it surpassed it on just about every level. Huge credit to the director and editors that kept the pacing perfect and the remarkable score/sound team. I haven't heard a movie sound this great...maybe ever. It felt like I had a subwoofer in my seat which made the flight scenes even more immersive.Finally a mega budget production that seemed to care solely about putting the best possible film on screen rather than playing it safe and catering to as many demographic groups as possible. Oh and by the way, this movie has an outstanding cast that happened to be very diverse.Over the past two days, I had extremely high expectations for two premiers: Maverick exceeded those already high expectations beyond my wildest imagination. The other, Obi-Wan, made me nearly lose hope in the future of the Star Wars franchise.

I honestly don't think they could have done a better job with this movie. Perfect amount of action in the jets, very good story line with Maverick and Rooster, a few obscure references from the original movie, and a good conflict between the two new top pilots. I'll for sure be adding this to my home collection.
The fight scene is intense and make me focus the movie this movie is fan service it has the opening scene like the top gun1 the music is the classic one plane scenes are loud.

reviews.review_title: Not much different from the original Top Gun!!
reviews.content: The movie "Top Gun Maverick" contains everything a Hollywood movie expects to have. Lots of action, a charming and muscular hero who is fearless and defies superior orders, a beautiful girl who is there only to serve the hero, a mission that only the hero can accomplish, and a group of ace pilots who help the hero. Despite all these cliches the film is well written, with a good performance by Tom Cruise, beautiful cinematography, and soundtrack. This sequel leaves nothing to be desired from the original film. A drama with a lot of action and emotion but without much originality. It's just another movie to inflate Cruise's ego.

I pretty much got what I was expecting from Top Gun: Maverick. It's not meant to be realistic because its a film for entertainment purposes which is exactly what it delivers on. The cinematography is superb as are the flying scenes which are vastly improved from the original Top Gun. I thought the romantic element to the film was forced and wasn't needed as it did not fit in with the film. It was nice to see Ice Man make an appearance and of course there was some nostalgia with references to the original film but thankfully the 10 litres of baby oil used for the volleyball scene from Top Gun was scrapped for the sequel!

reviews.review_title: Tom Cruise has done it again!!!
reviews.content: I feel the need. The need for speed! Ooowww! That's right ladies and gentlemen, I finally saw Top Gun: Maverick today, and I really enjoyed every single moments in the film. Also loved the music and the score. Tom Cruise still plays the best legendary character from the original first movie. The first movie was really amazingly good and especially the second movie. Top Gun: Maverick is "a Must See" movie in 2022!! I totally recommend this movie for the number 1 entertaining movie of all time. Tom Cruise is a legend, and every moments brings back the original movie.10/10 of one of the best Tom Cruise movie ever made!
I've not seen any better movie than this!! Love it to the heart. The fighting sequence leave you stunning. Tom cruise and Jennifer are brilliant on screen.

reviews.review_title: Probably theee greatest movie I've ever seen.
reviews.content: Great conflict, great cast, great action, great plot. It never got me bored at all and I had no idea what I was walking into as I had never seen the first film. Even though I hadn't seen the first film, it made complete sense and still kept me intrigued.

reviews.review_title: Epic entertainment and the best blast I've had from a movie in years
reviews.content: This was a fabulous movie with a very reputable cast that would have only put their name to the movie if they knew it was good and it sure is. Sure it in a theatre where the bass from the aircraft was rattling parts of the theatre which made it extra special. The scenes are memorable and I had a smile on my face for the entirety of the movie. I suspect Tom cruise had a lot to do with its direction and writing as well, and he is terrific. A movie that ticks all the 80s 90s style of blockbuster movies- of which that style should be incorporated into all action movies nower days.

No idea how a film full of to the brim of cliche and cheese can be so good and so much fun, but it is, it just is. The key might be that it does it on purpose and never takes itself seriously. It should be an awful film, in many respects it is an awful film but it's brilliant fun and when I walk out of the cinema that entertained it gets a 10/10!!

I didn't like the original movie that much as I thought the story was boring and nothing really exciting happend, but this sequel was definitely better. I was intrigued right from the beginning and I liked the role of Tom Cruise's character of being a fighter pilot teacher. I liked the action scenes which were shot well and the fight scenes and explosions looked realistic. I thought the ending was kind of cliche, but it was entertaining nonetheless. I'm a bit surprised that the movie grossed over 1.4 billion dollars as it feels like the only movies that gross over 1 billion dollars are Marvel and other superhero movies, so this is a refreshing thing to see.

reviews.review_title: Does exactly what it says on the tin
reviews.content: If you go in expecting a completely over the top modern version of the original, you will not leave disappointed.The special effects, music and plot are all on point. The storyline had twists and turns but it's all quite predictable.Leave reality at the door and just enjoy the film.

An absolutely incredible film. It didn't follow other sequels, becuase this didn't fall flat on its face.In an era of dodgy classics being revisited like Star Wars and Star Trek, it's finally a breath of fresh air to see something done so fantastically right.This was a masterpiece. I'll definitely see it again.

First thing first, this is a movie about fighter jets. And that part is amazing - I don't think there is a better one. It's honestly amazing - the thrill of the speed, the impossible timing, the dogfights, the cooperation, it's all done brilliantly. The rest is really just extra - so what if the biggest adversary is time? (there's really no real villains, just a fairly generic "mission") So what if the plot is predictable? (it is, very much) So what if it's mostly about Tom Cruise looking good for his age? (There's a lot of him without t-shirt) It's a movie about fighter jets, and that's where it shines the brightest.

reviews.review_title: 36 years later and Maverick is back!
reviews.content: The original Top Gun is one of my all-time favourite movies and legacy sequels tend to go one of two ways. Try too little and don't stand out enough thanks to lazy references and pointless fan service, or they bloody nail it and make the already excellent original even better. Top Gun: Maverick went in the best way possible, it's meticulously crafted and respectful of Tony Scott's original. Over 36 years after its predecessor and in an IMAX screening nonetheless, this film bloody rocks! Joseph Kosinski and company, I take my hat off to you, I was in genuine tears by the end.

reviews.review_title: Out of the eyes of a military fighter enthusiast... Top Gun Maverick is not the movie we need - but the movie we probably deserve...
reviews.content: As said in the title - since a rather young age, I have been drooling and nerding about fighter jets.The first time I have seen the original Top Gun, I haven't been aware of what is realistic and what not. Yet even with this knowledge the original stays one of my favorite action movies - truly there are no particular great aviation movies out there..But did Top Gun Maverick improved on the original? Yes and also no...First of all - yes - the movie is just objectively better made. The flight scenes are absolutely stunning - and there are even mostly realistic planes flying (all of the main "protagonists'" planes are real types - not talking about the MiG-28 from the original movie). Except maybe the Darkstar.The problem is: there are also really massive issues.One is lazy writing. So kudos for Maverick to mention, that the F-35 would be the ideal airplane for the "main story mission". But lazy is, to take it out because of "GPS jamming"... really? It could be so easy to say, that the F-35C didn't achieved combat readiness before the mission... or something along these lines...?!But overall - the F/A-18 has nothing what the F-35 cannot do - maybe just, the experience of the SuperHornet sets it apart of the Lightning II.Then there is the issue that nobody really wants to say, that it is Iran. But Iran is the only country which still has F-14 Tomcats. What they don't have yet though are Su-57.And the whole "Felon" characteristics is simply nonsensical. The Su-57 doesn't really exist - as serial model (only about 15 demonstrators where produced - of those 15 - 2 pre-serial models - at least one of those has been destroyed. It is absolutely fiction, to expect that the Su-57 could be used for anti-air defense - especially not of Iran.Also the SAM defense could not be worse. You don't need to have every few km the same anti-air defense battery (one or two S-400 which look totally different are more than enough - plus maybe some short range systems).Also - the whole missile "thing" makes no sense. First: using "flares" against ground to air missiles which are normally seeking with radar makes no sense. Second: if a missile is close - there is no way you can avoid it with fancy maneuvers. And where is the enemy AWACS? If it is such a high value asset, there should be a form of AWACS... oh - and then: there would be definitely detection - even if the planes would fly very low.This makes me sad - because defending against air defense systems or against other aircrafts are far more like playing chess than than a "dogfight". With good writing and good cinematography it would have been possible to really catch the tension and the techniques a fighter pilot would use. But because of "action movie" - fantasy totally took over.So all action scenes were breathtaking - but like a Harry Potter attack. "Movie magic".Aside of the technical details: the "personnel" things were also not realistic. And focusing on dogfighting in the first "days" of training, while the mission mostly needed for ultra-low level flight? WTF...I do think, with a bit more input of real fighter jet pilots and ex-military conductors, the movie could have been far better.Instead of the "magic" Su-57, they could have used Su-30. This is a fighter jet Iran apparently really procured.The whole mission could have been far more realistic. No need for this "villain lair" in the middle of a volcanic crate.And to be honest: why should the Pentagon ask the Navy to do the job? If the target is so high value, a USAF B-2 Spirit could enter the airspace without the enemy having a chance of detection - and it would have far more payload.And even further - if the Navy anyway attacked the runway near the high value target - why not using loads of cruise missile to destroy the target?Some realistic S-300 or S-400 could have been used. And yes - the F-35C would have been also sexy - instead of the workhorse F/A-18 (let's face it - both the Super Hornet and the Lightning II are workhorses and not as sexy as the Tomcat in its time. But the F-35 is at least very modern and at the edge of technology - similar to the Tomcat, when the original movie came out).So no - the movie doesn't make any sense of a defense standpoint. This is sad, because the strategies and techniques are extremely interesting.So... did I enjoyed Top Gun Maverick? Yes for sure. Like an Avenger movie. If you turn off your brain, it is perfectly fine entertainment - with a slight dash of propaganda.What just makes me sad is: that it could have been just far better. But Hollywood is Hollywood I guess - and we are living anyway no more in a subjective reality?

This is pretty good sequel. I really hope more cast from part 1 acting in this movies. 1st half is quite slow but the 2nd half is really good. Storyline just typical OK. Of course previous Top Gun is the best!

Whoops, forgot to do my 'Top Gun: Maverick' review! I didn't particularly love or hate the original Top Gun and wasn't sure it warranted a sequel, especially 36 years later, but this is pretty fun. The plot's purposefully minimal - the U. S. Navy needs Pete/Maverick (Cruise) to train some new pilots to fight some unnamed foreign bad guys. Obviously, this requires him to sit in a cockpit and show them how it's done.The new pilots are Bradley/Rooster (Teller - the 'Whiplash' guy), Natasha/Phoenix (Barbaro), Jake/Hangman (Powell), Reuben/Payback (Ellis) and Bob (Pullman). The drama comes from Rooster being Goose's son and the animosity that Maverick has created between them. There's also solid cameos from love interest Penny (Connelly), Iceman (Kilmer) in one scene, and Warlock (Parnell) & Cyclone (Hamm) as the Navy bosses.Cruise is as charismatic as ever, with lots of jaw-clenching and trying to do the right thing, his way. The "new recruits" are good and provide some energy to the plot, but the interplay between Rooster and Maverick drives everything. However, as with the original, the stars of the show are the aerial aerobatics performed by the F18s and other planes and the stunts/editing that makes it so fun to watch. Predictable, if a bit dumb ending, and it feels a lot quicker than 2 hours.

This movie mades my day
The most amazing thing is the real shots on the jets and the cry max gets higher with the time line.Performance are good and the effects are amazing. Its been a long time never seen an interesting movie such like this.And... Tom ... you are amazing.

It's usually almost impossible to top the OG films, but this sequel managed to do just that. I found Top Gun Maverick to be significantly better than the original film! That final act had me at the edge of my seat. I was not expecting dogfighting to be so damn intense. I would give this movie a 10/10 masterpiece instant classic.

reviews.review_title: Consider this as the perfect film
reviews.content: Totally blown away after watching this Masterpiece.It excelled in every departments from storytelling, screenplay, Cinematography, Acting,Flight sequences, Direction and others.Hands down ITS A PERFECT FILM.

reviews.review_title: I like it more than the original
reviews.content: Honestly, I've never even fully seen the first Top Gun. TBH I only know the volleyball scene, I mean who doesn't right? So I did watch the first film a day before I watched this sequel. I did like the first movie but I didn't really care much about it.So I'm surprised to find myself LOVING this sequel. Like, I just got so much chills all over my body as I watched it. It's exhilarating and thrilling, with quite some moving moments as well. Acting is great, cast is fantastic. The cinematography is some of the best I've ever seen. Of course I wasn't shocked that the movie has very little effects knowing Tom Cruise and his MI movies, but I am really very thrilled knowing that it's the same case here.I thought this movie didn't deserve the Oscar nom for best picture, but after watching it, I felt like an idiot for thinking that. Definitely deserves the Oscars noms.

reviews.review_title: The Movie The Original Wanted To Be
reviews.content: The Good: As someone who despises the original Top Gun and thinks it's amongst the most overhyped films ever...color me surprised that I really liked Maverick. I feel like virtually everything was done better with this film than the original. The plot feels more purposeful and cohesive; there's a mission, there are stakes, there's a reason Maverick is brought back.The characters are more grounded and relatable. Yes, there still mostly clichés (the jerk, the nerd, the good hearted son-of-the-alum, the uh...girl), but they're not actively irritating, like the first one. Cruise is actually really, really good here. Unlike the first one, Maverick doesn't feel like an a******e. His arrogance feels earned, the way he acts is drawn from a legitimate (and selfless) place: he wants to ensure the young Top Gun students survive a dangerous (and almost impossible) mission. Miles Teller is also really good here; perfect casting as Goose's - hilarious named - son, Rooster.But of course, it's the flight scenes that steal the show. Plot notwithstanding, these are legitimately exhilarating and worth the price of admission alone. Again while i get there were technical limitations in the 1980s, the reason these scenes are better isn't the cinematography. It's that there's a better story and better characters involved. But yes, they're also filmed very well: you can tell what's going on, the scenes feel real, and they're unlike anything I've seen in a long while.The final 30 minutes of this movie are just pure awesomeness. It's great to see the mission built up this way and to see it live up to the hype. I can totally see why this film resonates with so many people. It has the spirit of an 80s blockbuster, with the technical and storytelling finesse of a contemporary film. It brings you back, but it far, far surpasses the original in every way (almost like the inaccurate memory of the original).The Bad: I thought, just like the original, the worst aspect of this movie is the romance. Cruise and Connelly are nice to look at, but they don't really have a genuine or well-developed romance. Cruise just sorta shows up and it's clear the script wants them to get together, but there's no reason they actually do. It just feels very half baked.I also have to acknowledge while the film is self-aware a lot of the time, there are moments when it leans a bit too much into the cheesiness. A bit to over sentimental, you know? The use of flashbacks was highly distracting and unintentionally funny at times. For example, when Rooster is playing "Great Balls of Fire" and Cruise is having Vietnam flashbacks about Goose doing so, I legitimately felt there was some cruel prank being played on him or something. That's at least how it felt.Oh, and I just have to nitpick here: did the final mission really have to have a video game esque "weak point" for the jets to target? Come on.The Ugly: So, as in the original Top Gun, the "enemy" country isn't revealed (for more obvious reasons today than back in 1986, honestly). However, unlike the original, where there's nothing in the plot that could possibly suggest who the enemy was, here we get tantalizing clues:Rogue nation developing uraniumMix of American and Russian fighter jets at their disposalUse of an air craft carrier to get the jets to the mission pointMountainous terrainIt's Iran. Definitely supposed to be Iran. That we're not explicitly told that is kind of reflective of the "good patriotism" of this film. It's obviously pro-American but it's not all up in your face with it.

reviews.review_title: Wish I would had seen this in theaters.
reviews.content: This movie is exactly what a sequel should look like. I can't even tell you what they did that was so different, but it feels like they really CARED about continuing on the story and legacy of the first movie. I absolutely can see why it's now the biggest block buster. Great job. Tom Cruise may be a weirdo in real life but he has a lot of passion for his work and it shows. Great acting all around and a little comedy/tearful moments all in the right place. Also: the guy that plays Goose's son was really the PERFECT guy.Honestly I really didn't think they were going to pull off a Top Gun sequel. Wow, I am happy to be proven wrong. I haven't enjoyed a movie this much in years.
Thank you for making a movie we can all love! So good! Can't wait to see it again!! Loved seeing this in IMAX with my whole family. Music was awesome too!

Wow. Just wow. I went into this thinking it would disappoint like so many Sequels do....... Was I wrong. Perfect mix of old movie and new plot. I never hand out 10 ratings but there wasn't one complaint.

Top Gun Maverick is a perfect movie. I do not say this lightly, as I reserve my 10/10 ratings only for the best of movies (i.e. Lord of the Rings, the Godfather, Alien, The Shining, etc.), but after having seen Top Gun: Maverick, I can say beyond any doubt that this movie did absolutely everything right. The past was given tribute without being heavy-handed, the new characters shined without overshadowing the legacy characters, the story was intense and emotional, and the action scenes were unparalleled. Every self-respecting moviegoer must see this film, and do so as soon as possible.

Liked movie a LOT. It burns my feathers though when "military" advisors in costume f-up something as simple as medals and ribbons.Officers DO NOT receive good conduct medal, admirals had 16yrs worth. (but young pilots none??)WHAT is purpose of numbers on ribbon bars???? Not authorized .Mav Character, Pilots DO NOT receive NAVY COMBAT ACTION ribbon, thats infantry units only. Pilots receive Air Medal with V, Dist Flying Cross, silv star, bronze star w/V, navy cross, CMH-NEVER Combat Action Ribbon.Great movie. Call me next time to get awards correct.

So I watched the original immediately before watching this, and honestly this was largely a carbon copy of the original except for the climactic battle. I thoroughly enjoyed the last third of the movie, but the first two-thirds were hard to watch. Just like alot of the recent remakes and sequels, I enjoyed the parts where they treaded new ground, and disliked the long list of homages to the original. I get it, if the movie strays too far away then fans will get mad. If it follows too closely then fans will also get mad. They tried to thread the needle and get a good middle ground, but I just wasn't feeling it.
Everyone loves Tom Cruise! He's handsome, and he was the best actor throughout the top gun movie series. Great shots from the F-18's! Miles T did a great job as actor Goose.

This isn't a movie.. This is an EXPERIENCE !!!Uff. You took my breath away yet again..
I can safely say this is the greatest entertainer of this decade and the best sequel of all times...
Go with your family, friends .. this is the best you will get from Hollywood ..
Thanks a lot Team Top Gun.And Tom Cruise inspires me every day !!! Thanks for all those memories from Top Gun to Top Gun Maverick .. You can't even imagine how much you shaped our generation.

All the scenes of the first movie rehashed and inserted in the right order.When it got to the ball game on the beach I had had enough.I give it one star for the flying sequences, and the beautiful P51 that belongs to Cruise. If you haven't seen the original, you may just suffer the whole film. If you haven't seen the original, go watch it.I tried to submit this review after finishing the last paragraph, but having wasted an hour on this movie already, I have to spend more time to warn would be viewers about it because my review character count is not enough. The overall rating currently stands at over eight stars, which I have to say is a very generous rating. Tom Cruise has made some great movies, this is not one of them.
Not as good as the original one. This one was bad. How can an old fighter generarion wins against the 5th Gen fighters?? :) I think the hollywood fighters do! Overrated for no good.

reviews.review_title: Falling in love with Tom Cruise all over again....
reviews.content: Wow... just wow. Blown away by this movie and the legend that is Tom Cruise. Pitch perfect movie from start to finish and mind-blowing action that leaves you breathless. Tom... you did it again, you took my breath away.

There were a few films today I would say are best viewed in the big screen, and this movie was one of them. What I liked about this film, aside from the marvelous cinematography and sound design, was there were no corny and overdramatic scripts and scenes. The first half was loaded with talking scenes, which I was not a big fan of, but the second half was like a cinematic explosion that was heard all over. The flying scenes were the among the best I have watched. The visual effects, cinematography and the score complimented with each other perfectly. I thought Tom Cruise's performance wasn't the best in this but only he can play the role the best.

Personally,I think Top Gun is one of the worst movies of all-time.I still don't really see the appeal.What that film lacked in substance, this movie had in spade's.It's not a work of art by any means, but it was a enjoyable summer-blockbuster, that was serviceable enough.Knowing that Val Kilmer had A. I. Speech training to deliver his line's was interesting. I think it's commendable of the filmmaker's to acknowledge this.He struggles with something that would be hard for most people, yet still gives a good performance.Overall,A decent effort for everyone involved.(B-)(5/10)

Pretty much perfect in every way. Great story (suspend your belief meter on the fact that the mission could have been done by missiles or drones rather than fighter jets),, great action, great integration with the original, incredible flying and cinematography. If there is justice in the universe Cruise will get a ln Oscar for it and we won't need to wait for the inevitable Lifetime Achievement award.

reviews.review_title: This made me question my career choice
reviews.content: Such was the adrenaline rush that I started questioning what I was doing in life if I wasn't flying a navy plane and daring all challenges. Its action packed, sensible, cohesive with part I, entertaining, tight and all actors are at peak of their performance. 26 years was definitely worth the wait and I think this is one of the best movies in last 5 years.

As sequels go, you don't get much better than this. Sure, you need to leave your brains at the door. There was some, but not too much, homage to original. Flight sequences were stunning - absence of CGI a definite plus. A smattering of genuinely funny lines. A true blockbuster well worthwhile watching.

Good movie but completely predictable. It is basically a remake plus a bit extra. I am glad I waited to see this instead of paying for it at the box office. I am also glad I took the time to watch it instead of not watching it at all. The flying scenes alone are worth watching. Far fetched as this story is it is enjoyable all the same. They do good building the suspense at the end but you still know what is gonna happen just like you had written the script yourself. I can almost feel the pen in my hand jotting down the words letter by letter until finally I reach the climactic ending on board the carrier!

I'll start off saying that I'm an older millennial who was not quite born yet when Top Gun came out. I've seen the original once years ago and then again recently to prepare watching the sequel. I'm not a huge fan but I liked it. I had so many emotions after watching the sequel, and my husband and I agreed this was one of the best cinematic experiences we've had. It had nostalgia without feeling corny, it had the romance without it being over the top and cliche, but the best was the visuals, the cinematography, the acting, those intense flying scenes. It was Top Gun on steroids. The casting was on point. I was going to give it 9/10 but it's perfection from beginning to end and actually lived up to the hype.

I can't believe this is the first my 10/10 rating, definitely worth it..At first i underrated this show because of mediocre the old film. And not my favorite genre.. Even after seeing the hype and ratings givens here..
Long time not seeing this type of movie, and suddenly, this movie, it is awesome..
I'm glad i had a chance to see this movie..I can't believe this is the first my 10/10 rating, definitely worth it..At first i underrated this show because of mediocre the old film. And not my favorite genre.. Even after seeing the hype and ratings givens here..
Long time not seeing this type of movie, and suddenly, this movie, it is awesome..
I'm glad i had a chance to see this movie..

reviews.review_title: A boring outdated mega advert for the US military
reviews.content: What can I say. This film is stuck in the 80s. Sadly, not in a "retro stylish aesthetics" kind of way. But in the usual "rebellious but super effective soldier" which is the military version of the "rebellious but super effective cop". I gave it 2 stars just because a production of that level deserves at least some recognition for technical work.But the framing and editing of dogfights are atrocious. Like: if you put the screen in an active dishwasher it might have made the frame more stable. Jeez.

reviews.review_title: A great belated sequel that either matches and/or tops the original
reviews.content: How to do you top the gold standard and quintessential fighter pilot film of the 80's? You honor and respect the source material while introducing a new generation of characters that earns the respect and love from its loyal fan base.

reviews.review_title: Best movie for the family in a very long time
reviews.content: Great cast, perfect to premiere Memorial Day Weekend where you left extremely glad and proud to be an American! One of the best sequels of all times and, quite honestly, better than the first. The movie score was very good, the cast was excellent and Tom Cruise never disappointed. The whole family can go to this one and not worry about having a 'woke' agenda shoved down your throat. It should get Oscar nod for best picture. Who knows, people might start watching the Academy Awards again.

I year old me just got a wake up kick in the feels. Watching this made me feel like a kid again - the same excitement and euphoria when watching the original Top Gun.That's the thing that I take away most from this film, it made me feel something again while watching a movie.It pays homage to the original, continued the story while not getting bogged down in the past. I miss the 80/90s simple approach to entertainment.The cinematography is on point. The action and stunts really are a step above. Acting is strong and compelling. The story is complete, a little vague on "the rouge state target". But who cares, there are fast jets pulling off insane maneuvers. If there's CGI, it's done well enough that it isn't noticeable. Practical effects for the win.Watch it, and have a blast reveling in what movies used to be like. Hoping that this kind of story telling comes back to revitalise the film industry.

I was in complete awe when I watched this movie. I never write reviews on movies, but I couldn't resist. This movie was so amazing!! It is very rare now a days to make such beautiful movies. This movie deserves every award!

reviews.review_title: Expected an original and modern movie.
reviews.content: How many cheap clichés can be used in a movie while keeping a straight face? Watch this movie.I know people who went to see this twice. Everyone I talked to raves about it.As a teenager the original seemed contrived, shallow and disjointed. Hoped for a proper movie this time with real acting, a good unpredictable plot and some fresh script offering the chance for proper acting.Every aspect of this film fell short. Even the flight scenes while better than the first movie were stretching time to fit in the dialog. The low flights near the ground unrealistic. The dangerous climactic moments utterly predictable and lacking any suspense.Really - I really wanted to like this and expected a fresh new take on the blockbuster with improved quality in all aspects. Instead we got another ten year old story by an actor who can make good films but usually wants to run about and blow things up and look cool.Taking off your sunglasses to look hip, only works once.In a few words, another cheap American embarrassment and a failure in almost all ways. Unless you're in your early teens perhaps.Too harsh?
How can such a fun movie be followed by such a bad sequel. Guess sequels are always bad. Yet that's not the case with Cars or Shrek... The problem must be Tom Cruise who is worst than Shrek :)
Felt like i was in 1987 all over again one of if not the best sequel ive ever seen especially considering the 35 year gap and its brought a new generation to love top gun.

reviews.review_title: A sequel done right: embracing the soul of the original
reviews.content: It was only 2 years ago that I watched the first Top Gun movie. I'm usually not interested in classic hollywood movies full of cliches and predictability, but rather movies with complicated stories, complicated personalities, unpredictability and moral dillemas. Despite that, I gave it a shot, as I felt the need for something simple and great. It turned out to be exactly what I wanted, and a wonderful experience.When I learned the sequel was coming out, I was thrilled but also skeptical, due to toxic ideologies destroying so many classics with political correctness.Eventually it came to the cinemas. I am very selective of what to watch in cinema, and upon hearing about good reviews, I decided Top Gun: Maverick was the perfect choice.The opening hits you right in the face with the energy that was dormant for over 30 years. The original Top Gun theme song so magnificent it tears you up. And then a burst of masculinity with classic rock music and playing with heavy machinery. The producers knew exactly what to aim at, recreated the soul in a perfect way and from the intro alone you know you're in for a treat.As the story starts to reveal itself, we learn about what happened in last 30 years with the main characters, and what their lives turned out to be like. They all keep their character and the actors portray them perfectly. We also meet new characters, young and cocky just like the previous generation. There is also a strong, but subtle enough mix of emotions in the movie, from romance, lust and friendly love to anger, sadness and grief.Obviously, the story revolves around the Top Gun and jet fighter pilots perfecting their skills and learning their limits before going to missions. The scenes are simply incredible, the filiming, the sound, everything is perfect. It really shows how the producers of the movie were eager to make it perfect in every way, and they succeeded.Despite being a hollywood movie with somewhat predictible outcomes, the story surprised me a few times, but what's important is the thrill of wanting to know how everything will turn out, and this movie certainly has it.The movie is incredible and I give it a solid 9. The reason I'm not giving it a 10 is because although it truly is a wonderful experience, when it ends, that's pretty much it. There's no philosophy about it, the story is simple, clear and all laid out, and there's nothing much to think about when it ends. In a way, that's the beauty of it, though - It's a movie where you don't need to think much, just relax and let the rush and emotions flow through you.

Almost walked out. Massive budget and an almost laughable story. It felt like a Star Wars movie in the air vs iIn space. Terrible acting. Terrible story. It makes me mad so many people loved this movie.

An extremely promising premise and a most satisfying conclusion. A well paced and a properly constructed story. Excellent use of music and visuals that goes hand in hand. Imaginative intro to set the tone. Good introduction to the characters serving the new audiences. A collective success! While Tom solidify the enactment of the veteran workhorse Captain, rest of the cast brings the energy and spirit. It's a collection of flawless performances. VFX is excellent supplementing this high octane thriller in a major way. A story about horsemen riding into the valley of death. So when the story is told right, it's always is a classic!!

"Top Gun Maverick - Screenplay"
"Top Gun Maverick - Cinematography"
"Top Gun Maverick - Sound"Nominations for Best Picture, Director, and Best Actor (Tom). It might pull off those last three, but it lacks the wokeness that Hollywood seems to love and cater to. This is a new classic that has surpassed the original 1986 film. It keeps the feeling and look that Tony Scott gave us, and matured it like a fine wine. Screenplay and direction made this work, a rarity for a sequel. The dialogue is tight, as well as the camera focus on the actors. The aerial shots and dog fights are incredibly well done - whatever CGI was utilized blended seemlessly into the background with the live action. The love story between Penny (Jennifer Connelly) and Maverick was mature and believable, nothing gratuitous about it. There's enough homage paid to the original to remind us again why we loved the 1986 film, without depending on it too heavily to justify the current version. I will say that the first 2/3rds of the film were perfectly crafted, in the Best Film category, but the last 1/3rd at times stretched credibility to where I said "no way" at least twice. Pretty dramatic shift in the action. But overall an amazing storyline well worth the wait. It's a roller-coaster ride of entertainment that almost everyone will enjoy. Go see it.

That's what IMAX was made for. What a thrill ride. I've just got back from Florida and that made me feel like I was back on the rides at universal studios.Cracking film some great nostalgic moments and a good storyline.This is one not to be missed at the cinema.

reviews.review_title: Too late for me, save yourselves!
reviews.content: I hate even rating this movie because there is now digital proof that I've seen it. I'm not sure what jet fuel costs, but it must have dented the budget so badly that they they couldn't hire writers. While the writing is bad, the acting is even worse. Continuing this downward spiral is the cinematography. The special effects are ok, and the only reason I gave it 2 stars. The only thing worse than the movie itself is the fact that I picked it, so now the wife will be reminding me of that fact until sweet death finally grants me a reprieve. Yes, though it's too late for me, at least I know that I tried to help others. Save yourselves and pick something else on movie night!

This was a long time to wait. But what a wait it was! Yet also felt it was only a short time after the first. Same feel same look at times. A wonderful follow on. A true sequel!9 star as the one little act felt a bit over the top, a little "mission impossible" but still a wow from me!

This is mind blowing movie. It will explode your heart and full fill your mind with some of the best actions sequences and great story telling. It is one of the rarest squeal movie which has not only surpassed but conquered the original movie. You have to see it in believing what I am saying.

I swear it was worth the over 30 year wait (I cant believe how fast it has gone) I truly had fun watching this movie. Tom Cruise is so goos, and everyone else is too. Its a fun ride from beginning to end and you might shed a tear or two.

reviews.review_title: Wonderful sequel to my favorite film of the 80s!
reviews.content: Nailed it!! I loved this sequel which brought me back to my first teenage crush of Tom Cruise as Maverick! Not only was it nostalgic of the original and very well done and exciting, but in today's horrible leftist Cultural Marxist dominated society it was so refreshing to see a film that did not pander to the "Woke" ideology!! So THANK YOU!! It was just the wonderful and positive masculinity of Tom Cruise and fast jets!! Exactly what America needs right now post-Convid totalitarianism.

reviews.review_title: Why do we need another top gun
reviews.content: I know a lot of people will disagree with me but why do we need another top gun movies it's just trying to repeat the first part the only good quality of this film is the title song but like I said why do we need another top gun movie Tom Cruise needs to make new movies and stop trying to relive the past.
One of the best films I've seen in a long time, I didn't even like the original top gun movie from the 80s much, but this was absolutely fantastic. Absolutely worth watching at the cinema.

reviews.review_title: Tom Cruise takes the franchise to new heights and broke all barriers
reviews.content: Top Gun maybe was all about style but Top Gun Maverick brings the series to a level it never thought it could reach. All thanks to one man the legend, Tom Cruise! It gives us moments of pure nostalgia, fills our heart with the feeling of true friendship. Not to mention the movie surpasses its predecessor in the technical departments too. While we are worried about spraining our necks by getting up too fast from our office chair, Tom Cruise is flying fighter planes for real in his age! This movie was made for the theater experience. And I was lucky to see it in 4D! All I can say this movie surpassed my expectations even when my expectations were high!

Just another tom cruise saves the world movie, same as always. It's a direct rip off of the original Star Wars movie, screaming down a canyon to an exhaust port that needs to be hit with precision munitions, the mechanics so fall back on faith, Luke Skywalker did it better. And what with using out of date F18's. There are drones out there that can do it cheaper and quieter, and the special effects weren't that great either, more blow'm up for super patriots and the characters certainly weren't credible, a bunch of high school super jocks overloaded on machismo.As has been said before, tom cruise never grew past 35
glad I didn't pay to see it, good way to waste 2 hours though.

This is what I expect from an action movie, perfect to watch in the cinema, good characters, pictures of fighter jets and that sound. Man, that was something!! And the story that relates to the old Top Gun that I watched as a kid back in the 80's - amazing stuff!! Jennifer Connelly looks stunning and fits well in the story. That stuff with bringing back Val Kilmer - my jaw dropped! You've made it! Please please make another Top Gun! Another action movie in this region. There's just too many superhero movies these days. This is the stuff public wants to watch and I believe the revenue made shows it big time!! Keep it up.

reviews.review_title: Larger than life sequel to the 86 masterpiece.
reviews.content: Tom cruise delivers big time. Awesome plot and superb delivery. Fight amd flight sequences are showcased perfectly.You would love every moment of this ..

reviews.review_title: Not sure what's all the fuss about
reviews.content: I went to see a movie in the theater after a long time. Big fan of original Top Gun movie. Found this movie to be quite a dud. Characters are stale and there is a huge amount of jingoism thrown in. There really was nothing that was worth writing home about. Perhaps I am getting old but I found this movie to be one big yawn.

This movie was TERRIBLE! I'm baffled by some of the reviews on here. "The Mission" is beyond stupid and the concepts you're supposed to believe within "The Mission" are childish in their simplest form. Jennifer Connelly and her "daughter" are complete strangers to the viewer and their characters are randomly dropped in the movie with no background and no character development. The relationship between "Maverick" and "Rooster" is forced and completely underdeveloped as well. The rest of the movie are scenes trying to draw your memories back to the original movie released almost 4 decades ago ( random shirtless beach scenes with characters you don't care about , singing bar scenes with characters you don't care about etc etc....) TOTAL waste of a movie in my opinion.

reviews.review_title: Breathtaking movie i have ever experienced in this decade
reviews.content: Just saw the old Top Gun and this continued as soon as i completed and this is an awesomely built showcase of inspiring stunts and a display of great valor presentation. I'm completely absorbed by this movie. Literally no words no wordss. Stunts performed by Tom Cruise in his age.......... Man, No one can match him. Not in this century atleast. Enjoyed every bit of it. Really hating myself for missing this action in theater. Blown away.

Just like the 1986 original, they didnt show the enemies point of view ONCE. We barely know what the mission is, im not asking for the same ol cliche russian villian, just a bit more info...The fighting scenes are great!

This movie is exactly what it was supposed to be. I haven't enjoyed a new movie this much in two years.My dad loved it and said it was a little corny. I knew it was going to be a little corny, so I loved that too.See this in the theater.

The best movie I have seen so far..I wasn't expecting this but man, You nailed it. This is more than 19 star. I give u 100 of it. Had to watch it ober and over and over again.. you really did justice to the part 2 of this movie.

reviews.review_title: Tom Cruise is the Tom Brady of movies........
reviews.content: From 1986 to 2022 boy has cinema changed, but I will say Top Gun : Maverick has restored a feeling that I have missed since I was 10 yrs old now that I'm 32 I had a smile for ear to ear from intro till the end you will praise the last action star of an undeniable movie era 80's movies were are foundation of what movies are today enjoy and indulge the " NEED FOR SPEED"

reviews.review_title: Awesome movie From a short attn span Navy Brat born in 1985:
reviews.content: So Top Gun has always been one of my favorite movies and one of my parents favorite movies. I grew up watching it multiple times and my mom would quote movie lines all the time.They are in their mid-60s now and they keep to themselves. So when me and my girlfriend saw it, I told them about it and they didn't know about the sequel. I knew I had to see it with them. So I saw this movie twice in three days and I could watch this movie over and over again just like the first Top Gun. I don't usually watch movies and the last few movies I did watch I fell asleep because certain parts of the movie were just so long and drawn out I stopped caring, but Top Gun Maverick is not like that. It's truly EPIC.I'm actually going to get a personalized license plate for my Kawasaki ZX6R that represents this movie and it's already reserved with the DMV for me! All the Maverick combinations are taken already though. I live in Virginia and they require a helmet but I think I'm gonna break the law today and wear aviator sunglasses and ride around the block, jk, or am I? Haha.Anyway this is a great movie and it makes me proud to be an American and it makes me wish I could've risked my life for my country but I never joined. Thank you all for your service.

reviews.review_title: Perfect score for this incredible movie
reviews.content: Astonishing! Tom Cruise really conquered his goal of showing the world the true passion of flying. This movie has revolutionized modern acting, mixing new technologies with real life experience of flying. It goes beyond participating on your own stunts, here actors had to fly a real fighter plane and feel the strong forces real pilots have to undertake because it's something you just can't fake, and still remember your lines. The movie keeps you on the edge all the way and although the story is not that great, it is the story this movie needed, nothing else. Congratulations to all the movie's cast, and a very special thanks for our Navy pilots who participated on the special maneuver scenes. God, they really can fly!

reviews.review_title: it is not possible to make the film more nostalgic
reviews.content: What kind of movie do you want to see? Quality or quantity? It's a movie you should not miss! It's good in every way so I have nothing more to say BULLSEYE 😎

reviews.review_title: Forget the first Top Gun, this film stands on its own.
reviews.content: To be fair, the first Top Gun was OK, but I never really liked it. Maybe because there was too much jingoism, a love story that didn't work or too much coolness that clouded the storyline. Or maybe because being an aircraft buff, I instantly knew the MIGs they were engaging were F5 Northrops, a far inferior aircraft to the F14 Tom Cat, which made the dog fight scenes unconvincing.But this one... WOW, out of this world. Convincing enemy, convincing goals. If it's meant to be a franchise, this story not only neatly ties together the first Top Gun, but gives added dimension to Tom Cruise's character, Maverick, his love for flying, his recklessness, and most importantly, his relationship to Goose's son, superbly acted by Miles Tiller. On top of that, the goals were made clear from the beginning and the challenges in completing the goal was drilled into the script, which gave the film extra tension and extra focus.Like the first Top Gun, it's real planes, real aerial shots. But unlike the first Top Gun, which was filmed in unconvincing cockpits and backgrounds, the actors here were in the real aircraft, in the air, going through the maneuvers and pulling the Gs.A very neat story and a visual extravaganza, this is a treat.

reviews.review_title: What a movie! Thank you Tom Cruise!
reviews.content: A must see in IMAX. Thank you Tom Cruise for an exceptional movie that brought back the memories of dog fights, intense air sequences and the Ray Bans!

I found the first Top Gun film cheesy. I enjoyed it, but just dripped macho 80s film.Top Gun: Maverick surpasses the original, with ease. This will be one of the surprises of 2022 in how good it is, and the Studio must've hated sitting on it for 2 years due to the pandemic.Genuinely exciting, captivating and surprising even through the predictable story.Also surprising was how good the acting was. Cruise was measured, and quite emotional at times. And don't worry, you do get a patented Tom Cruise run.

This is what going to the cinema is all about. The movie has nods to the original Top Gun for us older timers, but it also has its own story line. The final 30 minutes of this movie is where it comes into its own. Well done to all involved, a fantastic production.
I saw the original in theaters as a teenager and have great fondness for it. This movie surpasses the original in every way. I loved everything about it.

reviews.review_title: If the mountain won't go to Maverick...
reviews.content:
"I can go as low as you, sir, and that's saying something." - Bradley 'Rooster' Bradshaw
Aging-Lieutenant Pete 'Maverick' Mitchell (Tom Cruise) from Top Gun 1 is head-hunted from his day job crashing test planes to prepare a group of the best young navy fighter pilots for a suicide mission, because someone decided that only he can help them not crash.The student becoming the teacher is pretty much the only intelligent inversion in this film.Imagine the final act of Star Wars A New Hope, from the briefing to the trench run.Now stretch that bad boy out to two hours.That's Top Gun: Maverick.To be fair, it's also two hours of smirky macho one-upmanship. Great flying sequences, but maybe the combat training would go smoother if everyone stopped comparing their Johnsons every two minutes.Two hours of women used only as wise-woman emotional-support cheerleaders.Two hours of Maverick impulsively saving people from impulsive decisions by teaching them to act more impulsively. This recklessness - dare I say 'Maverick nature' - seemingly permeates the environment.The premise itself of using cadets to conduct a half-baked pre-emptive strike on a sovereign nation is impulsiveness on a strategic and political scale (WMDs, anyone?). Let's go full-meta and inquire as to where the decision to make this unasked-for sequel came from.Two hours of millennials dressing like their grandparents and rocking out to music made 50 years before they were born. We get it. It's a tribute. Please stop thwacking us over the head with it.The sad thing is not that so much was unthought-through.The sad thing is that impulsiveness led to so much waste.Jennifer Connelly is wasted as the torch-carrying single-mum.Glen Powell and Monica Barbaro are wasted as supposedly pivotal squadron members who are sidelined as soon as they spur the protagonists' character development.Ed Harris is wasted as the hard-ass Admiral, whose ominous drone program I swore would feature later on.Eight of the twelve pilots - including my fave Manny Jacinto - are wasted, as nothing they do matters, and the story only focuses on a few, especially Maverick's son-figure.The biggest waste was the potential for Maverick to pass the torch graciously to the next generation. (Top Gun Cinematic Universe let's gooooo!)Psych! He impulsively takes the torch and heads for the mountain.Ultimately, everybody loves Maverick, much as they snark about it. Admirals bail him out. Jilted exes float back. Juniors he betrayed risk their lives to prove themselves to him.The mountain does go to Maverick, our boomer aviator in aviators, almost proving that the world does in fact revolve around him.

'Top Gun: Maverick' was not on my radar at the start of 2022. I did not watch the original 'Top Gun', so I was not really invested in this universe. This all changed when it received critical acclaim. I watched it and I could not believe how GREAT it was.This movie is so exhilarating to watch. All the flight sequences felt so real and intense. This is mainly due to the use of real planes flying in live locations. Planes are often seen accomplishing complex maneuvers on rough terrain. All of this is accompanied by excellent music and sound design. This achievement is truly stunning and cannot be understated.Besides the great action sequences, this movie also has a surprising amount of heart to it. The movie mainly focuses on Maverick, played by Tom Cruise. He did a great job during some of the emotional scenes in this movie. All the supporting cast delivered great performances as well.As for criticisms, I would say the plot and characterisation are rather simplistic. However, this movie does not need a complex plot or a complex character for it to work. The stunning action sequences and the heartfelt story more than made up for the price of admission.I highly recommend watching this movie in the cinema, especially in IMAX. This movie is best viewed on the big screen. This is one of my favourite movies of this year, and I am glad to have watched it.

Saw this last night, what a terrific movie! References the original film and storyline without relying on it.Not a complicated plot but sucked me in properly to keep me glued to the film the whole time.The original Top Gun was a big flick for its time and I think this will be no exception. Where everybody nowadays is running to the computer nerds to do half the movie in CGI, we had real fighter jets in the skies, which made for absolutely incredible cinematography.Action was intense, issues based on the first movie were great, along with the spawn of a new rivalry. Tom Cruise, Miles Teller, and the rest of the cast did a great job.

Recently viewed Top Gun Maverick (2022) directed by Joseph Kosinski, starring Tom Cruise, Jennifer Connelly, Miles Teller and many more. This is my personal, detailed rating of the movie based on multiple key aspects that I believe define what makes a movie good or bad. I watched the movie in cinemas (Laser Ultra) with my family and we found it very entertaining. I didn't know much about the movie nor its predecessor, but I was pleasently surprised about the concept, adrenaline inducing action and filmmaking. Enjoy the review!I went into the theater blind, not even having watched the first Top Gun (which I highly regret). I didn't really have any expectations - though I did presume that I was going to witness some awesome practical effects. And that I did.I loved the story. It felt classic, but not to the point of cliche. It felt like a wholesome and exciting story. The characters were all very stereotypical, which is a good thing in this case. A mix of all these stereotypes thus made for the perfect team. I was pretty much entertained throughout the whole movie and didn't once feel bored or anything like that.Tom Cruise nailed it once again. For those including sometimes myself who might have thought at some point that Cruise is a great stuntman but not necessarily a great actor - this movie proved me wrong once again. Obviously he's still a great stuntman, but his acting is also top notch. There were points that I felt really emotional. I also liked Jon Hamm's character because I hated the character but eventually respected him.The action was insane! Having filmed this in actual fighter jets and in the sky made this movie incredible for me. I felt real stakes and was at the edge of my seat throughout all the action sequences. The adrenaline rush that they must've felt definetely pushed through the screen into our bodies. The right amount of humor was inserted and it was nice.The cinematography was incredible. The visuals of the film were top notch and oscar worthy for sure. I also really enjoyed the soundtrack by Hans Zimmer (and others). Definetely one to save on Spotify.This movie surprised me in a very good way. Didn't expect to leave the cinema this flabbergasted. I highly recommend this one to be viewed on the big screen - as per usual. Finally, my rating of this film is 9/10.

I was really impressed about this movie it had really good VFX, and impressive flight scenes that just topped the movie, I enjoyed it very good plot, and so on the only critic is how they killed Iceman... it was not really needed... but it also kinda did get Pete to wake up...Overall amazing movie.

Spectacular movie, watch it on the big screen and feel the "g" force. Tom Cruise shines and yes he's a legend out making some real movies that shows American pride and greatness to the rest of the world. Just feel proud of our brave men and women who risk their lives in the battlefield.

This is My new favorite movie..
I have zero complaints about this movie, I rarely rate 10/10 but try as I may, I cant find a reason not to give it full marks.I recommend it..

I really enjoyed seeing Top Gun 2 last night. It was in fact better than the first one. I liked all the action they included to it. It was more action packed than the first one with all the jets they raced in with today's computer generated effects made it more realistic than ever and how Maverick got to know Goose's son.

No need for love interest, waste of time. No need for Val Kilmer. No need for playing football on the beach. No need for drinks at the bar. If they kept it to flying airplanes it would have been decent. I wouldn't recommend any serious movie enthusiast to go to this film. A popcorn movie and nothing more.

reviews.review_title: One of the best movies of the decade
reviews.content: This movie is easily one of the best movies of the last 10 years. Every aspect of the this movie is fantastic. Having seen this is the theater and at home, I can say it was better in theater but still a 10/10 at home. The visuals, sound, characters, story, everything works for this movie and has just the right amount of call backs to the first movie. The first movie works as a great foundation for this one but you could watch either one on their own and it would still work.The actors and the characters they play are perfect and absolutely believable. Because this is an action movie you sometimes do not get enough characters development but everyone feels fleshed out enough for the story to work and to really care for them.The action is unreal. The effort that went into this movie was 100% worth it because the result was near perfect. This movie will have you on the edge of your seat and have your adrenaline pumping. This is a no nonsense OG action movie.There is a reason this movie has made 1.4 billion. Easily the best movie of 2022.

I truly believe Terminator 2: Judgment Day to be the greatest sequel ever made.However this came damn close. Nothing is ever at this level.Everything about this movie was absolutely perfect. I as a fan of the first movie as well as Tom's work was blown away. Anyone who's followed the movie scene in the last few years have seen the reboots and so called sequels Hollywood has pumped out to try to cash on the Nostalgia. Some of the efforts are better than others, but most left a bad taste in your mouth and even tainted the first film's legacy.The technical aspects were amazing, excellent editing, incredible stunts, endless practical effects which is the way it should ALWAYS be done but unfortunately hasn't been for some time, and never on this level.Tom Cruise brings another killer performance as you'd expect, but everyone is on their A-Game.This movie is faithful to it's original as a sequel, I loved the plot points that were brought into the new film, as well as continuing on with Iceman and Goose's legacies. Rooster is a spitting image of his old man, and the way the story handled it was perfect. Just like the original movie, there was incredibly emotional scenes that you felt as if you were there. Many films cannot capture this lightning in a bottle and often come off arrogant or downright stupid.Growing up, I've always seen the greatest action movies (in my opinion) many times. But these were years and decades later enjoyed on VHS or DVD in my living room. I am truly glad to have been able to go see this the way it was intended, on the big screen. As of writing this, I have seen the film 3 times, in a regular theatre with Dolby Atmos, Ultra AVX, Ultra AVX D-Box. It was still just as awesome the third time. I am planning to see it again when it comes to IMAX in my area.If you're thinking about checking it out please do. But if you have just heard of it and haven't seen the original yet, make sure you catch up on it first as it contains a lot of things you'll need to know.

reviews.review_title: The Reason to Visit the Cinema
reviews.content: Tom Cruise is the reason we continue to visit the movies. Someone needs to come up behind him before he retires. Worth every penny, worth every second of my time with immaculate pacing and use of time to increase suspense.

Loved this movie so much. Character interactions were great.. action scenes were absolutely awesome too. I think it hit the nostalgic beats in right way as well. The movie was quite emotional too in lots of ways. Overall had a great time in a theatre.

I was not disappointed at all. Completely engaged the entire movie and not a single scene that was boring or too long. Loved the addition of all the new younger kids. Such a great movie. Jennifer Connelly and Tom Cruise still look Amazing.

reviews.review_title: I never expected the one franchise to do thing correctly would be Top Gun.
reviews.content: After seeing so many movie franchises get taken over and dragged out of retirement to make sequels and fail miserably to produce anything good I was not expecting much. Star Wars, Terminator and all the rest set the bar so low that I was just hoping for a decent 80's style action movie. After the fist three minutes however I knew I was in for a ride. And o boy did this movie take me on one.What I got was a well shoot, well edited, well acted action with a good story. All of the characters had a place and a role to play. The movie had a lot of fan service but it was all done well and did not fell out of place. The movie was respectful to it's predecessor and surpassed it in every way. I could talk about this movie a lot but I don't want to spoil anything. I will simply say it's well worth your time and money.On a side note. The movie had strong characters without any of them feeling forced. The two ladies where spot on and there was no woke garbage. This movie is a solid 9/10 for me but it gets an extra point for not falling into the pitfalls of woke trash like Star Wars and the rest did. So 10/10.

Saw this movie three times now, a very good story line with Tom Cruise as Maverick. A must to see movie cannot say anything about this movie becaus u have to see it with your own eyes. Opening music Anthem is just like the first top gun. When i heard the Anthem it brings me back to the fist movie that i also Saw in the cinema.
Great movie made with practical effects. Plot is simple, execution is fun and you smile through most of it. What an entertaining movie should be, without any agendas.

Story 6/10Directing 9/10Editing 8/10Design 8/10Costume 8/10Lead actor 6/10Second actor 8/10Support cast 9/10Lead adversary 0/10Sound 3/10Choreography plane 7/10Action 5/10Romance 3/10Sex 0/10Dialogue 7/10Make up 9/10Music 9/10Theme tune 10/10Trailer 7/10F/X 9/10CGI 9/10Worth watching on cinema? NoWorth watching on stream? YesWorth a sequel? NoWorth a prequel? NoWorth a TV series/film? NoOverall feel? Yawn and boredWorst bit? Dragging out another sequel of a movie againBest bit? End missionReminds me of? TV movieOriginal? NoBoredom 1/10Excitement 4/10Make a video game - NoWorth a novel continuation - YesWorth a graphic novel continuation - NoOverall one word comment - RubbishWorth mentioning - Nothing reallyHow I do it differently - Maverick just telling of his past missions over the past 30 years and deage Toms eyes in the helmet.

Don't go in thinking it will be believable in all ways. Go in ready to enjoy great cinematography, some laughs and some good nostalgia. Crowd was aged 10 to old with a few electric buggies parked in the hall. Pretty sure all ages enjoyed it. One of the better movie theater experiences I've been to in a while as it will elicit reactions from the crowd and I was right there with them!

Truly the best sequel ever made. The storyline is outstanding.A little tidbit that most of my friends missed is that Penny Benjamin, played by Jennifer Connoly, is not in the the first movie but her name is given a notable mention.In the first Act of the movie, Maverick and Goose are being chewed out by bald-commander -dude for "not landing his plane" to go after his wingman, Cougar. "MAVERICK! You are writing checks your body cannot cash. You have been busted as section lead THREE TIMES, and put in HACK twice ..... BY ME! With a history of low/high-speed flybys and ONE ADMIRAL'S DAUGHTER!"Goose looks over at Maverick standing at attention, "Penny Benjamin"This little piece is a bellwether on how much depth this movie truly has.

reviews.review_title: Great movie, better than the first.
reviews.content: I'm not a big fan of Top Gun, but this movie is great. I'd like to see it again even more than the first. It's hard to make a sequel to an 80's movie but the director did it, congratulations.

As other reviews have said a sequel either not needed or to long ago or (toms) to old. But wow what a movie, as the admiral said pilots will be extinct. Possibly true with today's drones & technology. But maverick shows one last time what ariel combat is all about, stunning flight scene's with the roar of jet engines,This movie is a must see in a cinema. Dont think just Do.

reviews.review_title: Navy guy says Better than the original
reviews.content: When the first Top Gun movie came out I was the only submariner in a class full of naval aviators in the Spacecraft Systems Engineering program at the Naval Postgraduate School in Monterey. It was fun watching my classmates' back-slapping after we viewed the movie together. (A few years later the roles would be reversed when The Hunt for Red October came out.)Fun fact: when we students would have to fly back-and-forth from Monterey to LAX back in my flying days, this submariner would be the pilot because none of my naval aviator friends were rated to fly the Piper Cherokee 6 we had at NPS.
