They loved that!In any case, last night we watched Top Gun: Maverick and it was simply terrific. Way better than the first one. Much more realism, texture, and nuance. (I don't think Tom Cruise did nuance when he was in his 20s.) And a whole lot of memorable lines. One of my favorites: Admiral to Maverick: "You're still a captain." Maverick to Admiral, "Yes, but a highly decorated one."Loved it. And I agree-- this is a movie that should be seen on the big screen.

I'm impressed. Great shots, good camera work and, for me the most positive thing, a good story with emotions! I like how they portrait Maverick and his ongoing conflict about the clash in part one. He gets a real character with great development. The lovestory also has it's moments. Still, some critic from my side: The beginning is exposition dumping and not well made. Mach 10 is completly unrealistic and maybe, it is a bit too much heroism in the end. However, I had a lot of fun watching.

I have to watch the original now to reel me back in.Having been 16 when the original was released this will be a biased review but deservedly biased. The original stands the test of time because the zero usage of CGI with a realistic storyline. If you were a teenager back then you'll recall the surge in recruiting the Navy had because of Top Gun. To the point they had recruiters at movie theaters. This movie probably had a negative impact on Navy recruiting.This however is nothing more than a remake, reboot or whatever the buzzword is they use today with bad acting and bad/forced dialogue. If a sequel were to be done it should've been 30 years ago maybe post Operation Desert Storm.I don't mind sequels but don't like remakes being passed off as sequels. Top Gun was an amazing military movie. Top Gun: Maverick is a cheesy military movie. It's made for all those born 10 years after the original and passed off as an original for that generation much like so many other remakes.I can watch the opening sequence of the original over and over because it got me hyped for the movie and still does but this opening sequence...well, it tried.The mission itself is Armageddon(select group) meets Star Wars: A New Hope(destroy Death Star scene) meets Top Gun(fly fighters) meets Behind Enemy Lines(evade capture).Recreated fast motorcycle scenes on taxiways.Maverick gets called onto the carpet by his superior for a mission after screwing up much like he did in Top Gun.Maverick sitting at a bar alone deep in thought. Penny rephrasing an original Charlie(Kelly McGillis) line reference not being happy unless your pants/tail is on fire.Goose's son, conveniently named Rooster, dresses just. Like. Goose. Rooster even plays piano like his waterfowl Dad, Goose. Same song too! With so many similarities shouldn't hos call sign be, "Gosling"?!Rival between Rooster(the new Maverick) and Hangman who also has a call sign similar to Iceman. They call him Hangman because he always leaves you "hang out to dry". They called Iceman "Iceman" because that's how he flew, "Ice cold".Instructor(Maverick) is not known to his students in a bar scene much like how Maverick tried to pick up Charlie then he walks in and they are taken aback with similar introduction. And all within the first 35 minutes.Volleyball scene replaced with a beach football game in jeans but replaced with a horrible song.See a pattern here?They broke a "major rule of engagement" for breaking the hard deck and disciplined for it. See original.And I'm pretty sure Penny Benjamin lives in the same house as where Charlie lived.And it wouldn't be Top Gun without a training accident with ejection.Jon Hamm standing around with pursed lips for two hours. The one liners didn't land like they did in the original.Being a Veteran my pet peeve is movies not doing something correctly that's considered the most important of all Military Courtesies and Customs...the hand salute. Miles Teller completely jacked it up.There's a lot of praise for this movie breaking from the norm and not being "woke". Sorry to disappoint but this movie, is in fact, "woke". You have to look for it.Now for the good. Kudos for being able to bring Val Kilmer back even if for a short scene and realistically use his illness. And, of course, what everyone came to see which is the aerial footage.Watch it. See for yourself. I'm a Top Gun fanboy but not a Top Gun: Maverick fan. Very predictable because it is a remake.

reviews.review_title: It was about Tom Cruise himself
reviews.content:
I assume what Tom Cruise wanted to tell us through this film now, is 'It's the time of streaming service and the film might be old thing. CGI has developed a lot and it'll end to do hard action by actor's body. I know, but it's not the time yet' The reason he stuck to show it in cinemas, must be same. He showed himself like that, but on the other hand he gave the way to the young people.I wouldn't say the first'Top Gun' was the best film but now it became one the important film
Story of film because of 'Top Gun Maverick' even the story was quite masculine, simple, sometimes rough and typical big budget entertainment film.It was great because those complicated flight actions were watchable enough. I was exited for them and all untwisted camera work and untwist music.Tom and Mills Taylor looked nice but I cannot forget mentioning Iceman a.k.a. Val Kilmer. He made me cry.I know it's not a war film, more like a sports film but I felt a bit bad the enemy. This could make audience's fighting energy high. One more thing I felt bad is the treatment of nuclear energy in this film, which was like James Bond series in old years. Although I know it's just a symbol.I don't really watch film because of the actors but Tom Cruises. I'm not asking about preference. He is one of the people who are creating the big history of films.It was a great cinematic experience.
What an unnecessary sequel. Waste of time and money. The rednecks and conservatives have all given it a ten though because they're can't see another hype job if it stepped on them.

In a time when it feels like movies and shows have become so political, it was nice to just go to the movies to see great storytelling without agendas or things trying to tell me how to feel or think. This film reminded why I loved movies and going to see them at a movie theater in the first place! This is such as iconic film and Tom Cruise and the cast definitely didn't disappoint. Tom Cruise has proved once again why he was such a popular movie star in the 80's and 90's. BRAVO to everyone!!!

reviews.review_title: Tom Cruise is still in Cruise control mode in this otherwise technically proficient sequel.
reviews.content: I enjoyed Tom Cruise in his early roles... but, as time went on, all I see is Tom Cruise playing the role of the actor, Tom Cruise.. Cruise's once relatable emotional vulnerability that he incorporated into his roles is no more. Cruise has successfully eliminated these human weaknesses courtesy of a team of powerful influencers whom he considers gods among men. Their painstaking role in removing the emotional side of the actor known as Tom Cruise has put him into the unenviable position of playing a much colder version of Tom Cruise who must be "on" 24/7. His handlers have played a pivotal role in ensuring the characters he plays reflect the emotional limitations that Cruise seems to have developed with intentions that defy explanation..Don't let the narcissistic, temper-tantrum prone actor who seems capable only of playing the same role, under the guise of a different character name, keep you from enjoying this sequel. The visuals are incredible, courtesy of a near seamless mix of incredible cinematography and CGI. The sound editing is spot on, and the other award-winning actors do well to add the relatable human element and depth of character that more than compensate for Cruise's self-taught trademark lack of motional range and humility. .It's likely there will be a Top Gun 3, and perhaps a four, five and six. They will likely be equally adored - just as long as the sequels are budgeted accordingly and Cruise can continue to portray himself as himself, while surrounding himself with powerful jets (with similar cool lines and dominant offensive capabilities). Most important will be the necessary number of tried and true award-winning actors who introduce humanity and vulnerability into an otherwise predictable storyline with a predictable lead. Given these conditions; these likely forthcoming sequels will certainly continue to be worth the ticket price.

Movie is lightyears better than the first. Insane camera angles and amazing action scenes. Straight forward and comprehensive plot. You definitely get the most of your money with film, and then some. If I could rate it higher I would. An 11/10 movie for sure.

How can you make something better then the original well this is the movie that truly is even better then the original movie from beginning to end not a dull moment 10/1 best movie of the year thus far.

reviews.review_title: Perfect Guide for making a great sequel from a movie of 36 years ago...
reviews.content: There has been lots of sequels in the past where it made things worse from the original film, especially this original film has been released 36 years ago. But Tom Cruise and Joseph Kosinski really understand and know what they want from the sequel...it's a really long waited for making a sequel, ( and also because of the pandemic for making this release date putting another year ) but they have done such incredible job for making it right.For the whole visuals and cinematography, hands down the flight sequences are the next level from the original film ( or any flying sequences in any film ) the long wait to the technology for capturing the actors and actresses inside the fighter jet is breath taking experience. The whole experience brings much more intensity in those flight action sequences. ( MUST watch in IMAX )The storyline is also quite convincing, even the story has been 36 years ago. This sequel really brings lots of connections in the story of the original film, such as Val Kilmer of Iceman, Miles Teller as Rooster who is the son of Goose ( Tom Cruise flight partner from the original film ), using few of the main original soundtrack of the first one, and some similar classic sequences from the first, etc ( you can probably see them from the trailer ) it brings lots of old memories back and they have done it right in this.The only thing I may complain to this film is also the similarities, where there's really been little too much similarities from the original film, which may not bring me any freshness in terms of story wise. But other than that, the whole excitement watching this film in IMAX has been amazing. So I won't mind with those little tiny complain. Overall this film really brings practical flying visual sequences into the next level.

Top Gun Maverick, 36 years after the original, Tom cruise come back to the role that made him the Hollywood star. The movie is piece of the 80's that shines a lot, the cast, the sound( is stunning), the Photografy. Everything works, the action scenes, the interection between characters, Jennifer Connely is the "Penny" that everyone wanted in the pocket, Val Kilmer made this 39 years man cry, and I would do again with pleasure.Tom Cruise is Maverick, Maverick is Tom Cruise.Love or hate him, Tom Cruise raise the game, that's the reason to go the theater... After the Movie, you'll see the need.... the need to watch again!!!

I am currently in the middle of the movie in an IMAX theatre yet I couldn't resist to write my review. I used to believe these type of movies are extinct but Tom Cruise proved me wrong and I am glad he did. This is an epic movie with all the right ingredients to make a spectacular great movie. Loved Every minute of it. MUST BE SEEN IN IMAX.

There is one scene where all the characters kind of awkwardly introduce themselves and give a two second blurb of their whole deal, but genuinely other then that this movie is actually incredible. It seems like so many of these sequels to old movies are cash grabs, but this not only feels like a fresh and new, but genuinely exciting!

I've seen a lot of movies but Top Gun Maverick is by far the best I've seen. The film never gets boring and both the prehistory, the main part and the mission have a pleasant duration. Nothing is too long, nothing is too short. Tom Cruise plays very well.

Good movie. Actor playing Rooster looks a lot like Goose. Tom Cruise is the greatest in the business. But one thing bothered me. The enemy planes were presented as spectacular, enemy pilots were bad ass to the core, yet they didn't manage to take one down? This is the part of american movie making world hates and this is why I give this movie 7. On the movie making perspective - amazing. Camera work is truly brilliant and I liked the romantic moment with old porsche and Gaga's song. It was 80's vibe we all wanted. Acting actually wasn't that great except mr. Cruise's. He really is one of the best if not the best in the business.

reviews.review_title: The best movie I've ever seen
reviews.content: Perfectly balanced movie. Casting was on point. Loads of action, humour, friendship and emotion. Just loved it! Honestly you need to see and experience this for yourself.

reviews.review_title: "Top Gun: Maverick" breaks the nostalgia barrier with its supersonic boom. In the middle of 2022 the guy with practical effects ..
reviews.content:
In the current cinema where everything is based on CGI .. Hats off to Tom Cruise!It's great to see a TRADITIONAL action movie, with an original script, and a flesh and blood hero, who uses ray ban and a fighter to fly, and not a cape (Marvel and DC, I'm looking at you!) be released these days! Top Gun the film that boosted Tom Cruise's career and at the time took many people to aeronautics.Fighters dominated theaters: Top Gun was the highest grossing of 1986. The US Navy saw enlistment increase by 500% the following year."Simple, ancient and incomparable pleasure". It was exactly what I felt, an immersion in 80's and 90's movies that wanted to entertain and bring lightness, give a break from life's problems. It's been a long time since I've seen a current movie with such a simple and delicious proposal, without that obligation to address social issues that afflict us every day.It's great to see a TRADITIONAL action movie, with an original script, and a flesh and blood hero, who uses ray ban and a fighter to fly, and not a cape (Marvel and DC, I'm looking at you!) be released these days! Top Gun the film that boosted Tom Cruise's career and at the time took many people to aeronautics.Fighters dominated theaters: Top Gun was the highest grossing of 1986. The US Navy saw enlistment increase by 500% the following year.Even better if it succeeds and inspires other movies to be released, we need it! I miss the 80s and 90s, when we had creative and original films being released around the world: Fight Club, Butterfly Effect, Sixth Sense, Matrix...etc, etc.Berlin - Take My Breath Away also has its share of importance in this 80s classicThe Patrouille de France, the French "Smoke Squadron", paid tribute to actor Tom Cruise during his passage through the Cannes Film Festival, one of the most traditional in the world. Air Force acrobats performed, last Wednesday (05/18/2022), low passes with smoke in blue, red and white as the cast of the film "Top Gun: Maverick" posed on the red carpet of the event. On Twitter, the institution published images of the flight, taken aboard an Alphajet aircraft, and said that the protagonist of the work "inspired a generation of pilots", as well as "awakened vocations".I love this movie, reminds me of youth, wonderful plot and soundtrack! If Tom Cruise said "I feel the need. The need for speed!", I feel the need to see this movie! The reasons are:1st has no sealing
2nd has no ideology at all
3rd has no political correctness
4th bonus: movie that gives hope for new movies, people don't care about ism and ist ideologies, the 80's are back.Thank you Tom "Maverick" Cruise.Grade: 8.4 / 10.

If this was a standalone film without tom cruise it would have made about £100 in the box office. Every 10/10 review is based solely on nostalgic reasons. By way of an actual movie it's ok, not much happens first hour, last 45 mins half decent action. It was fine and I enjoyed it but just calm down folks it's not the godfather.The movie poster review/tag line of 'you'll want to high five someone when you leave cinema' made it pretty obvious nobody was going to die which made me lose my interest towards the end a bit. Poor advertising.

Any film that uses blurry-cam get's an instant ZERO! All films should at least be watchable! That's basic!Instead today's directors have ALL chosen Fx that are unhealthy for your vision. You've been warned. Keep watching rubbish blurrycam filming like this if you really want to have to start wearing glasses in the next 10 yrs.0/10.Review must contain 600 characters in order to be published? Seriously? Quantity over quality? Lord help us.Ok.Film stars Tom Cruise , duh
It's the sequel to the 1986 movie Top Gun. Bet you didn't already know that!Also stars Val Kilmer.A lot of blurrycam because the directors don't trust the background scenery presumably.Blah blah blah.

reviews.review_title: A Rare Improvement on an Iconic Original
reviews.content: Rarely does a sequel live up to our expectations. Only a few come to mind like The Godfather Part II or The Empire Strikes Back.The Original Top Gun was like a 2 hour music video. It was visually stunning scenes set to iconic music tracks and it was like nothing we have seen before.Top Gun Maverick took all of those good qualities that made the original special but added heart and character to it.While In the original movie, Maverick did everything out of ego and put his own comrades at risk because of his ego. In this movie Maverick does what he does to protect his comrades not put them in danger.Top Gun Maverick is much more family friendly than the first moves with the sex scenes dialed down, more diversity. And a greater respect for women than just frat-boy objectification.And then what was done so well in the original movie with the actual plane footage was even taken to a much higher level in this movie with cameras out inside the cockpit and real footage of the actors pulling Gs and really feeling the stress of those high speed maneuvers. You can see the physical tool the pilots endure in that kind of flying that you just don't get a perspective for in the original.I'm so glad they kept some of the original music from the first that really ties in to this movie. Once you see the opening scenes of Top Gun Maverick, you already know you are in for the ride of your life!

reviews.review_title: It was good the way it was
reviews.content: Hollywood wishes they could recapture the magic of movies from the past but it can't be done. Guess they are going to remake every single movie ever made and modernize it, as if this time was so grand.

I really enjoyed this film. It's fast paced, exciting, well made and exhilarating. It has nods to the first movie, and there is scope for a Top Gun 3 to be made.The sound mixing, cinematography and editing are all on point too. It's a nine out of ten from me!

100% a cinema movie. I won't spoil it. Pay your money, sit down and enjoy. Have fun! If you do t have a very expensive cinema room at home then the cinema it is for you as it was for us. 2 hours odd whizzed by.

I'm sorry,
but this movie is, generally speaking, hollow and again: Full of hollywood (jewish) Propaganda.Thank you ..... Hollywood.. Tom cruise looks nice, but the movie is pretty hollow, unintelligent and lazy..

First I will say I didn't see the first one until very recently. I wanted to but never got around it until I decided I wanted to watch Top Gun: Maverick.Either way, I completely enjoyed this movie. First one is good, but for me, I liked this one a lot more. Action packed, good humor and great heart which is, in my opinion, definitely strengthened by the connections to the first movie.

I'm not a fan of the trend of flashback scenes from other movies. I think that's intended for a new audience. But, I expected a certain degree of perfection and that is the only thing that fell short. The dialogue was great, the pacing (rare to see a blockbuster with such a short runtime these days), and comedic relief was very appropriate and well timed. Of course the visuals and action scenes were on point which we could already tell from the previews. Very enjoyable movie. Must see on the big screen.
Was so looking forward to this, but came out disappointed.Lacked depth, story. Couldn't wait for it to finish. Went to the toilet near end. Got back, what did I miss? Nothing much!

In the early days of cinema, people would instinctively run away from a film of an approaching train. Audiences got more sophisticated and special effects got much more convincing. Top Gun: Maverick marks the point where a movie can, once again, consist only of special effects. The plot was totally predictable, the character development was trivial. They repeat the plot hole of having planes arm and fuel themselves only because the pilot wants to fly them - over and over again. An actual Naval Aviator wrote an exhaustive list of errors in the movie. For one, Maverick would have been discharged because he didn't get promotions on time. At best, he might have been a civilian test pilot.There is one good thing in the movie. The P-51 Mustang is Tom Cruise's own plane. He is an accomplished pilot in real life. For me, seeing him fly his P-51 was the high point of the movie.

reviews.review_title: There's a woman , a "hero" male, the bad ones and a country to be saved
reviews.content: There's a woman , a "hero" male, the bad ones and a country or planet to be saved for which the male must sacrifice. I just described all Hollywood movies in a sentence ... of course there are exceptions but this one is predictable and cheap .The pilots where payed a few millions for that mission ? Or is just patriotic hero crap ? To die for your president and fight in the air for free ?.Watching the movie I did not get what motivates them to risk their lives at the highest extent ?.That was one of the absurdities of this flick .

reviews.review_title: One of the best sequels EVER!!!!!
reviews.content: This movie is amazing start to finish, it balances the nostalgia and callbacks perfectly, it adds just the right amount of weight to the Roostwr storyline. This movie is AMAZING!!! Just go see it!

Top gun Maverick has absolutely everything you need and want for a perfect blockbuster movie. It contains comedy, action, romance, mistakes, brotherhood , etc. It is a perfect sequel to a perfect movie that has aged moderately well. It has a perfect storyline that makes me intrigued and curious of what is going to happen. It was aimed to the audience that watched the first one and also to younger people and both groups loving it, it's like the Wii, aimed for all ages, this is for a little older people but still is a fantastic experience and recommend 11/10, minimum. This is a blend of the best movie types ever and is so good, I believe it should be a 10/10.

Cheesy, overhyped drivel. I must've watched a completely different film to most people that have reviewed it.The actors in the film played classic stereotypical characters, which you couldn't take seriously and had totally unbelievable dialogue, which no real human that I've ever witnessed would speak like.If you enjoy films were you can just shut your brain off, ignore the cringy dialogue and just watch fast planes then this film is for you.I waited for this film to be released on normal television and I'm glad I did because it is not worth spending a fortune in the cinema for. It's kind for Mr Cruise to feature his poorly friend, but val Kilmer's bizarre plastic surgery is also very off-putting and could've been left out entirely.

reviews.review_title: Goodness gracious great balls of fire
reviews.content: Being from a generation that remembers the thrills and spills of the original Top Gun , to watch this , to be immersed in this amazing block buster, yet still be reminded without ever feeling like the movie was reliant on the original was an experience that for me personally had me in tears . So grateful for this experience ! Amazing! Loved every second.

This has to be the best movie I have watched in a long long time. This is real cinema. Marvel can have all the billion dollar franchises but this movie has heart, soul and is entertaining through and through. Highly recommend!
All I can say is , I could have watched another 2 hour without moving , storyline way to short, if you are an action freak this movie is specially made for you.

This movie is EVERYTHING! Exciting, Action packed, emotional, surprising and adrenaline full. I can't put to words how good this movie is. The music, cinematography and acting are unlike anything I have ever seen. Tom cruise proves why he is one if not the best actor in the business. Not because his acting, because of his dedication to deliver the fans an experience like no other by doing his own stunts. Miles teller gets his chance to prove why he is an amazing actor and part of an amazing new generation. I am astonished.

Tom Cruise = Perfection is probably the only way to describe this man.Extraordinary movie, you ride along in this immersive experience. The action sequences are unbelievable, if we have not seen the making of the movie, nobody will believe it.Performance of all actors are awesome. Watch it to experience the awesomeness of the forgotten era of 2D movies on theaters.
This is a fabulous movie. If you liked the first one, you will enjoy this movie even more. The visuals are stunning. See it in the IMAX theater, it's worth it. Fly Navy!

Good Things first: Nice soundeffects, really nice flying scenes with not much cgi. Sometimes even goosepumps when the planes fly by.Ok so now two the bad things: take away the first things.... think again.... whats left? NOTHING. Story is horrible. Makes no sense at all. Character development predictable and 2dimensional. Poor love story. How boring is fckn hangman? Maverick still didnt talk to goose son after 35years and is still sad about it? C'mon. John ham absolutely no authority or bad acting. Who are they fighting?? The last 5 to 10minutes i wanted to break things, but was in the cinema. Flying scenes make like 20% of the movie. The rest is a mix of a not reliable story, wrong nostalgia, poor acting and really sensless conversations. +4stars for the flying scenes, -6 for the rest.

reviews.review_title: WOW! Tom Cruise SAVING the movie industry!
reviews.content: This movie was an amazing technical achievement. From the Aerial combat to the characters to the nostalgia it all hits. The movie is for old fans and is so damn good it will create new ones. After living through years of CGI superheroes its great to get a down to earth old school blockbuster. Humor that doesn't feel forced and action sequences that are tactical.There are few people in the world that are as dedicated to the craft of filmaking, the only few I can think of on the top of my head are Christopher Nolan, James Cameron, Dennis Villeneuve (Blade Runner 2049 is another great modern 80s sequel) and Tom Cruise. Tom Cruise may not direct his films, but his fingerprints are all over the ones he produces and you can tell her really cares about advancing filmmaking in Hollywood. From the sound, to the editing to the direction, Tom Cruise controls so many aspects of this film and for him to be front and centre and command the screen at the age of 60 is incredible.To yourselves a favour and watch this movie on the biggest screen possible!

reviews.review_title: Even at 58 years old you can have an amazing life and even still find love
reviews.content:
In Tom Cruise's movies the line between acting and real life is more blurred than usual because Tom Cruise is simply badass in real life too.I loved the fact that even at that age he still performs tasks which are so demanding on the body.This man inspires a thought that getting older does not necessarily mean that you wasted your best youth days and that you are too late somewhere or that you can't catch up at an older age. You can still catch up with your plans at any age, or at least until you are very very old. Perhaps until then we should keep working and not stress too much.I also loved the romantic part of this movie. It seems finding love is also never too late? Oh my gosh, I can't believe Jennifer Connelly was around 50 in this movie. I thought she's like 40. It's interesting to see Cruise's character dating someone closer to his own age. Nice.But yeah, it seems that even at that age you can date a hot woman and have a good relationship. <3
She also was absolutely stunning at an interview with Graham Norton for Top Gun with that black hair laying to the side.This movie doesn't have any green screens and the characters were actually flying IN the planes.Great stunts, great acting, great movie, great inspiring thoughts with our golden gentleman Tom Cruise.

reviews.review_title: Best movie in a LONG time!
reviews.content: Patriotic, action packed, and an amazing cast. Paid excellent homage to the original. I appreciated the fact there was no nudity, no excessive cussing, no woke agenda. I hope they make a 3rd with the young Top Gun crew! Everyone should see this movie!

Let me start by saying that this was an entertaining movie, which kept me engaged throughout the sitting. However, it lacks too much for me to give a high score.The premise is that Maverick (Tom Cruise) after 30-something years since the first movie has not made much of a carreer. That in itself is an refreshing idea: it makes him more an anti-hero than the typical Hollywood hero.He is given a last chance in the Navy to prepare a group of young pilots for a dangerous mission. The catch: one of those young pilots is "Rooster", the son of Goose - Mavericks's buddy from the first movie who died during a flight accident. Rooster holds a grudge against Maverick for multiple reasons and of course this gives some friction.There is also some mild competition amongst the young pilots. They are just a standard mix of all kind of minorities so that every one can feel included, They are basically cardboard characters and it is hard as a viewer to relate to any of them.There is also an unncessary romance between Maverick and the local bar owner (Jeniffer Conelly), which does not connect to the rest of the movie in any way. It is nice thoughThe final mission is an air strike against an unnamed other nation. Of the enemy we only see the exteriors of their jets and face shots of the sun-visors of their pilots. This does not help in giving a face to the enemy. I understand how it would have been politically sensitive to name a country as the enemy, but the least the director could have done was give some hints what part of the world this enemy is supposed to be in, so that we could all imagine our favourite enemy from those parts.The finale is spectacular, but predictable. The flight scenes are very well done, but unlike the original where one could imagine how challenging.it could have been to shoot those scenes, here probably most of them were done digitally, which takes away much of the awe factor.In summary, I feel that this movie does not improve on the original in any aspect. Given the choice, I would prefer watching the original for the 10th time over watching the sequal again.

The sequel is better than the original. Everything in the film works, with a good story, good acting and great action sequences.It will be much better on a big screen and when it is available at home, with surround sound and the lights off.Tom (the Top) Gun very rarely lets us down. Glad too that the series won't be burdened by a third instalment which is often a flop.

reviews.review_title: A Film All Fans of Top Gun Will Love
reviews.content: Tom Gun Maverick is the long-awaited sequel to Top Gun from 1986. This movie was supposed to come out in 2020 I think but kept getting delayed due to the pandemic, until now. Now, this is a movie that nobody really asked for, including me. But hey if it's good I'll take it, and this movie was good. If you love the original Top Gun there's no reason you won't love this movie. I personally never loved Top Gun. I like it. I thought it was good, and that's how I feel about the sequel. I do think this film is a bit overhyped as being one of the best films in years. I'd say it's about on par with the original from the story, characters, acting music, etc. Though, I will say, the jet action scenes in this film are better than in the original. That final action scene blows the climax from the first one out of the water. It's all done practically from what I here. This film should be seen on a big screen for that alone.There's not much else I can say about this film. It's what every good sequel should be. It's very much like the first movie, honoring the fans of that film, but is also a logical progression as Maverick is in a very different place here than in the original. In the first he was a cocky recruit wanting to be the best pilot, and learning how to be a team player. Here, he's an instructor teaching other recruits how to be a team to do this impossible mission (see what I did there). Maverick also has family drama with Miles Teller's character Rooster, Goose's son from the first film. Those two are by far the highlight of the movie character wise, much like Maverick and Goose were in the original, while the other characters were just there. Jennifer Connally is the token love interest of the movie much like Kelly McGillis's character Charlie was in the first. Also, I find it weird that Charlie's character is not even mentioned in this film. They could've at least showed a picture of her.

If you are of my age and the first one was your go to movie. Then this is a winner. If this is not, watch the first film first .. this is a winner. There wasn't too much interaction with the lesser flyers but I can forgive that. Off to watch the original.

The movie was good, although I prefer the original over this one. I felt it was too focused on the newer model of Hollywood cgi and just big explosions and not as much on the acting. I enjoyed the movie but without getting into a spoiler, I just found it to be pretty corny for my liking.

reviews.review_title: Tom Cruise should get an Oscar
reviews.content: This is one hell of a movie and absolutely should be seen on the largest screen possible.This is real cinema, a real adventure that you can only really enjoy on the silver screen with a shared audience.I have never liked the politics/religion etc of Tom Cruise, but this movie is so extremely well done and he also works so hard in all his other movies, I really believe this man deserves an Oscar for his hard work.Of course the movie has many great actors, amazing scenery, mind blowing stunts and air action and fantastic script, directing, cutting. It captures you completely, you flow with the movie like the planes on their missions.Thank you everyone involved in production for this timeless jewel of a film.

reviews.review_title: Top Gun: Maverick is The G.O.A.T.
reviews.content: As a huge fan of the original Top Gun, I was worried a sequel wouldn't compare. I could not have been more wrong. This is why sequels were created. Takes a classically great story and flies off the charts with how good the next chapter is. Movie theaters were made for movies like this. If you haven't seen it yet, run to the theaters so you can experience it on the big screen before it's too late. And bring your wingman!

I was excited to see this, as I've seen good press and family have said it's really good.I was so disappointed I wanted to leave in the first 20 minutes. The person I was with wanted to stay. So I saw every last pathetic minute of this absolute trash that the studios are deadset on putting out just to make a buck.I was told it's better than the original. It's often worse.I remembered one of the great elements of the original was the aerial photography. I thought this would have waaaay more and better aerial photography. IT HAD LESS?!?! HOW DOES THAT WORK????This is another soulless cash-grab. Watching this movie, I wondered if a Transformers movie might be better.I hated this movie. The original is not great, but it's better.

Loved every minute if it, it really takes you back to the first film and goose. The movie had a lump in my throat thinking of the summer of my childhood in which I watched it. A must see, just seeing val kilmer made the whole movie for me.

This is truly one of, if not the best movies of 2022. The stayed loyal to the source material (which I recommend watching beforehand) and Tom Cruise actually thanked the fans before the movie started. That's something you don't see anymore. The movie itself is a direct sequel to the 80's blockbuster, with Tom Cruise reprising his role & Miles Teller playing the son of Goose. There are a ton of new characters & all of them add to the ensemble without overshadowing or belittling the main characters. And best of all, this isn't a tale of having the old dog retire so the young pups can take over. He is teaching them to be the next generation, but they aren't there to replace him in future movies. Also, many of the original cast reprise their roles, including a welcomed surprise I won't ruin here. If you haven't seen it yet, I highly recommend watching this instant classic.

This is one of those rare times where the sequel is BETTER!!! Really enjoyed this movie!!! Great cast of young actors and not so young :) It's really amazing how Tom C does not age and still at the top of his game.
While original was good, this one is even better!With Tom Cruise in the main seat leading the way for the new crew to step in I just hope there will be a next Top Gun to watch.

There isn't much of a story here, but the visuals are cool. It's a super basic concept that rehashes some of the scenes from the first movie. They don't add anything new to this movie. They even use original footage from the first movie. There's a mission, everyone is mad at Tom Cruise because he's such a maverick. Tom is a maverick doing things his way, playing loose with the rules, blah blah blah.The acting was just as bad as the mustaches. I'm surprised they didn't give the female pilot a mustache just to show off how much of a badass she is.The visuals were amazing. They should have just shown the title of the movie followed by a bunch of jets doing stuff, then rolled the closing credits. That would have been a much better film.

reviews.review_title: We flew alongside in our seats!
reviews.content: Possibly one of the best I've seen in a long time! We could feel all the G's the the pilots felt through in the edge of our seats. There's only a few moments in my life that I walked out heavily influenced by the movie I just watched... And this was one of them!

I wanted more from Rooster. Unfortunately his character felt a little thin to me. I think a scene with Rooster (Miles Teller) and his mother (Meg Ryan) would have fleshed out the animosity between him and Maverick.

Couldn't imagine a better first half to three-quarters of a movie. But true to form Hollywood went weird in the end. I came so close to leaving the theater happy as a clam, satisfied with a good movie sequel under my belt. But just like my overuse of cliches, Top Gun chose the dream over reality and a potential classic was lost. You can't help but notice the moment they crossed the line. It'll be the part where the six-year-old in them came out and filled the screen with every shiny, fluorescent, color in the box. In the end all the children will say "great movie, dad!" And all the adults will wonder where a 50+ year old man gets his hair dye and nerve to keep defying logic, making movies that are only believable to children.

Top Gun: Maverick was perhaps the biggest surprise of 2022 in movies. It bested the likes of Titanic and Infinity War at the US box office, has a 96% on Rotten Tomatoes, got an A+ on CinemaScore, and even got an 11-minute standing ovation at Cannes. That is what you call success. On the surface, it seems like any other revival of a popular 80s movie. Pete "Maverick" Mitchell is recruited to train a new batch of Top Gun students for an extremely dangerous bombing mission, or they will be replaced by automation. But what is the recipe for success? There have been plenty of revivals/sequels to popular 80s movies lately, but none came even close to being as popular or well-received as Maverick.Maverick is good because it feels like an actual 1980s blockbuster, not just a revival of a popular IP. It's a very optimistic film, where there is no obstacle that cannot be overcome. It's somewhat reminiscent of the original Star Wars in that regard. So many films, even popular blockbusters, try to be subversive and deconstructive these days. A lot of these revivals, including the Star Wars sequels and the recent Terminator movies, are contemporary blockbusters with the facade of a classic. Top Gun: Maverick has absolutely none of that. The main thing it does right as a sequel is that it honors the legacy of the original and its characters, rather than put them down to prop up new characters.The characters, old and new, are one of the highlights. Maverick still has that unusual cocky charisma from before, but he still feels the weight of Goose's death 35 years later. Between this and repairing his relationship with Penny, it really is a film about leaving a legacy, and it's done very well. Tom Cruise's performance in this movie is also quite good. If there's one person who steals the show, it's easily Val Kilmer reprising his role as Iceman. Having him come back was a real treat given his health issues. Rooster is the main new character, Goose's son. His distrust of Maverick because of Goose's death is the central conflict between the two. The turn from distrust into trust is a great character arc between these two. Miles Teller was great, as was the return of Jennifer Connelly. The rest of the cast is good, too. Any of them would've fit right in back in the day.There are a few issues with the movie. The dialogue is wonky. The story, while classic, is nothing that's never been done before. While it is nice to see something that really does feel classic, it's possible to do that and come up with a new story.As a production, the film is incredible. This is a top-notch action production, one of the all-time greats. It takes you into the cockpit, with over 800 filmed hours of in-flight footage. The flight scenes, both training and real combat, are an adrenaline rush. The best thing about this is that there's virtually no CGI here. This is all real footage of real planes. The actors went through real training to make this movie. That's incredible. The sound also really stands out, especially when seen in a theater. The shots and cinematography, both in the air and on the ground, are fantastic. And, of course, you can't forget the music. Danger Zone, Take My Breath Away, the classic Top Gun theme, it's all here.Top Gun: Maverick is the perfect blockbuster action movie. It has the best action scenes, the best effects, the best characters, and it's a real, successful sequel to a long-dormant franchise.
Last 30 minutes: pure adrenaline and spectacular action flights. Tom Cruise is never getting old... and as a producer of this movie once again he will crash the box-office.

reviews.review_title: One of the rare sequels that betters the original
reviews.content: Enjoyed this movie much more than I thought I would. Cruise confronts much more than the bad guys here, he actually fleshes out and becomes a human being as well. THAT is a significant accomplishment in any movie, let alone one that previously was a relatively mindless summer blockbuster.One actually sees the HUMAN side of the character "Maverick" and comes to actually like him despite his many flaws. In fact he grows larger as he continues despite his flaws. That resonates much more than one dimensional super hero type characterization because one realizes the price that has to be paid to achieve the extraordinary.There is great CGI in this movie interspersed with actual flight scenes. It's pretty seamless and will age well over time.Downsides? A few- knowing a small amount about aerodynamics and friction at high mach numbers lells us that hypersonic mach speeds are not ejectable and survivable conditions. The limiting factor on the SR71 blackbird aircraft was NOT the engines, but the fact that the leading edge of the airframe could not survive speeds much beyond mach 3. A bit of artistic license yes, but one that pretty much strains believability in any realistic scenario.The other downside is that one has to wonder, if the Navy possessed sufficient firepower to crater and render enemy runways completely destroyed they could not do the same for the surface to air missile sites that guarded the exctrance and exits to the nuclear processing site.Flaws aside it's easily one of the best from Hollywood in the last five years.

End of day it takes something to top the original... get it? Sorry.Yes they've managed to do it. With the ability of modern technology to put us as close as we are ever going to get to the experience of a jet fighter pilot. You have to admire the stunts they have been able to pull off to show their craft.From a story point of view it is everything you could want from an 80s reboot. The story actually fits well considering with the time that has passed working to its favour.You even get the Tom Cruise running scene as you would expect. End of the day this is vintage Tom Cruise at his best pushing his inner adrenaline junkie to the limits for us to experience.Hat off the the team for all the cinematography work etc it was stunning.This is the type of movie you want to go to the cinema for which does not feel as though it was a story built around CGI which most modern action is these days but more a compliment.

And Maverick is of course no one else than Tom Cruise. Top Gun: Maverick is really a great movie and worthy successor of the original Top Gun from 1986.In Top Gun: Maverick Tom Cruise returns as Pete Mitchel. What has changed during the past 35 years? Nothing much, Pete Mitchell is still reckless, "do not think, but do" and goes beyond the limits of what a fighter jet is designed for. The only real difference is Pete Mitchell is a captain now.In Top Gun: Maverick Captain Pete Mitchell returns to Top Gun with the impossible task to train America's best fighter pilots for an assignment which is even more impossible. Where the young team of fighter pilots convinced they are the best of the best, Captain Pete Mitchell proves them there is still much to learn. And all that in a timeframe less than three weeks.The built-up of the movie is very much similar to the original movie. The flight scenes on the other hand are just great, spectacular to watch and you almost get the feeling you are sitting next to Tom Cruise in one of his jets. But also for this movie, you have to use your imagination.Top gun: Maverick, the movie for 2 hours of great entertainment and much more!

Time is your enemy and that applies to the top gun movies AND especially Tom Cruise. He's a dried up crusty ol' has been and should have quit acting a long time ago. Tom cruise is not nor has ever been a good actor but it's especially evident with contemporary movies..... but I'll give him credit here..... "Maverick" didn't give him much to work with. The whole premise is flakey at best and it tried to bring about the cool parts of the og TopGun.... But it feels like it comes from someone who doesn't understand the og. Doesn't understand and love what the military can and does do. The whole plot line is from decades ago, just a nebulas bad guy using bad things and of course they must be eradicated...... the characters are boring and not all that interesting. I'm glad I didn't go in theaters to see it, this still comes off as a really expensive love letter from Tom Cruise to himself...... also I'm still here for the homoerotic oiled up men on men sports montage even if it doesn't do a damn thing for the plot. Also.... Can we also mention exactly how ducking bad it'd be if any American equipment /pilot were found in a foreign nation after a missile strike like this, let alone more than one? Absolutely ludicrous.

There are very few times when a sequel comes out and it's better than the first, this is one of those movies. The casting and acting were incredible, pretty sure Miles Teller makes any movie better just by being in it. In all honesty though this is a fantastic movie, action packed and fun to watch and just all around well done. I loved that they still included Val Kilmer and that they ended up being such great friends even though they didn't start out that way. I'm glad I got to watch it in the theater to get the full experience of how amazing the planes are. I definitely recommend this movie even if you haven't seen the first one because they go back and explain the important people and events with flash backs.

Top Gun is the reason that made Tom Cruise as the Superstar of the Hollywood and 36 years later in this Sequel he's proving why he is the Superstar of the Hollywood till now. Top Gun Maverick is one of the Best Sequel to come out by surpassing it's predecessor in all the aspects. The plot is similar to it's previous film.. an intense flight training in the Top Gun school and an incredible Ariel combat mission in the Climax. Top Gun is famous for it's insane flight action sequences, here in it's sequel it is even more Spectacular and adrenaline pumping. From the opening sequence to the last battle it was extravaganza.Every Scene flows so well and the little emotions it carried from the previous movie is so good and worked out very well. In the era of CGI's Seeing these kind of Stunts and actions made without green mat is so incridible. The Visuals of the Fighter Jet Scenes were Astonishing.. and the little Nostalgic moments were very neat and beautiful. Definitely it will be a action blockbuster of this summer and easily one of the Best movie of the Year.Top Gun: Maverick is one of those movie that you have to watch in the theaters not only because it's a great movie but the sound and the visual in a big screen is an incredible experience. Last time I've this much of Adrenaline rising moments on theatres was from 'Ford vs Ferrari', Now this gave more than I expected. Don't miss this in Theaters.

Watching the first top gun film in preparation for this film made me really NOT want to watch this film and was really not up for it. But i am glad to say that I was VERY wrong, this film was INCREDIBLE, it honoured Goose perfectly, it introduced great new characters, like Rooster and Hangman, and it had a really good and layered story. The whole final battle sequence was very nerve-wracking and exciting, I went from thinking that Maverick or Rooster could possibly die to be extremely satisfied and happy with the ending. A very good sequel/remake that is so much better than the original. 10 out of 10.

This guy is 59 and he's killing it so hard. I just finished watching the film. This one is meant just for the big screens. What an experience it was!!! The thing which I liked the most about this one was that along with intricately designed plane chase sequences, the film is also high on emotion.... Towards the end, you realise how wholesome it is.

I've always loved the original, so this had a lot to live up to. It exceeds all expectations, a true high point for Cruises already stellar career.Cinematography is incredible, story flows perfectly, had a real attachment to every character. Emotions flowed, can't wait to see it again.

I really love the original top gun and it worked at the time, but these days you need a little less cringy unrealistic moments and this one has so many it is not funny.Just happen to find an enemy F14 all fueled up with weapons they can fly back and have a dogfight in, really???Storyline was pretty average, flight scenes were good but I can watch planes on YouTube if that is what I am after. I still cant believe all the 10/10 reviews, am i watching a different movie or has the movie going public really lost the plot.It is ok but not film of the year and does not deserve all the 10 star reviews on here.

reviews.review_title: When is the last time you had a true cinematic experience?
reviews.content: Well done in so many ways. This movie did not try and compete with the original, nor do you need to see the first one to truly understand this movie. Actually, if you haven't seen the first one - go ahead and see this first and then watch the first one. Amazing cinematography. I hope this inspires our younger generations to become pilots or to make great movies. Go see it today...and tomorrow!

The movie is full of cliches and the script could any other day be the script for the Cars movie. Just that the movie Cars is about Cars and this was about planes. However this doesn't need to be A bad thing especially when Cars is good however this movie is directed against an older audience which makes it not that special, just A good film.

To begin this is probably one of or THE best movie of the decade until now, but as a great movie it isn't perfect but firstable let's begin for the good stuff:TOM CRUISE is an actor who is impossible to say is a bad actor and this proves it, it's amazing how this man being old as he is does this work really great, no one old as he is would do this work as he did it, the balls he had to have to do this performance it's admirable, i think he should got insured his Oscar.JOSEPH KOSINSKI deserves without any doubt the Oscar for being the best director of this year, it's an object for study how he directed this masterpiece, how complex are the cinematografic shots, the control and the passion he should have to control all of this huge staff what is even more the quantity of planes there are, believe me when i say the direction is the best this movies's got.Jennifer Connely did a good performance, it's great to see her in a movie again but being honest i don't think so she will win her second oscar, is a great performance but is incomparable to her performance in "A beautiful mind" it's possible she could be nominated but nothing else more to expect there's yet a big left of the year so it's obviusly there wil be more options.One of the things that makes this movie good is watch old staff from original movie which it's gotta be cherish and that's what makes this movie a great sequel, it keeps some songs from original movie, but i will regard that part later. It has to be take in care that there's no one who was a bad actor everybody was great in this moment but not perfect as Tom was.Music here fits as a great soundtrack has to do it, every music you listen on this movie goes perfectly with each scene chosen anyway let's remenber part of this great work was made by Lady Gaga who i don't think will win the Oscar because there's left Elvis movie wich obviusly has to have a great soundtrack however if this movie results has a poor soundtrack the clearly winner is Lady Gaga.Getting back to the direction every scene of planes is perfect but clearly stands out the training scene and the final battle where we can see how it plays with the people's strain and by part of the training scene it's the firts scene we see and wich starts to introduce this prefect work of direction.But as i said not everything is perfect in this movie like de history.Dont misunderstand me the history isn't bad, final's really good i'd say is a 8/10, beginning from the good side this movie started good and it ended AMAZING but the history isn't a marterpiece in fact to be honest is an easy script it's just about how Maverick becomes teacher and how he's gotta steer a team at the final to just destroy a military base is a bit lazy history it'd be great have a deeper script and dialogues, i repeat it's not a bad history it can be better; it's a 6.8/10 for the history.And to finish the final is beautiful but the final battle more when you think Maverick'd have died, no it really obviusly he won't and just try to give a intrigue moment but it isn't so severe it's okay in fact.Anyway no one of these "bad moments" it's enough to say this's a bad movie, no, and is what we're in front of a masterpiece gentlemen.Simply is a perfect work of direction and how a movie can make people feel like, and that's what makes great a movie the fact of make feel people this way with those shots. The best movie of the 2022 and i bet it's insured 9.4/10.

That movie is amazing and was so well made and made me sit at the edge of my seat so many times. I cannot believe they actually flew these fighter keys for real! Crazy movie and very deep! Highly recommended.

Just got to see a day before international release in imax. The pov action is amazing. Even better than its predecessor. Please watch it in imax. Eveey thrust felt so real. Its first of a kind thriller. Tom Cruise-lots of love to you.

reviews.review_title: Great sequel, if it were not for Miles Teller
reviews.content: It was a worthy sequel to Top Gun, but Miles Teller was completely miscast for his role. Overrated actor and that is cheesey line, "talk to me, dad....."

This movie's amazing. The story, the sound, the image.Everything.I wasn't expecting it to be so good since it was the second movie
I was wrong, soooo wrong.

reviews.review_title: Finally, thank you! This is why movies are made: love for going to the theatre restored.
reviews.content: Top Gun: Maverick has restored my faith in film! This is why cinephiles and movie lovers go to the theatre in the first place.This movie has heart, adrenaline, great acting, REAL stunts (just incredibly produced) and a sense of nostalgia so thick that you can't help but smile and feel emotional throughout the entire runtime. WOW, was this a fun experience. I haven't felt this way watching a movie in the theatre in a long, long time. People in the audience were genuinely cheering, laughing, clapping and standing up at the end. The pre-movie speech from Tom Cruise totally pays off: "we made this for you", absolutely you did.This movie comes at a time of serious decline in the filmmaking industry. It is a breathe of hot, fast, fresh air away from the current structure of pushing as much CGI/green screen on the audience whilst being accompanied with lacklustre plots, weak scripts and no character development. If Hollywood experiences box office success from terribly made cash grabs such as Jurassic World Dominion and the recent array of poorly made comic book movies... then they will be the films that will be shown in our theatres. We need more movies like Top Gun: Maverick... you know, the type of movies that have simple but well articulated plot lines; character and story development; emotion; heart; adrenaline; epic music; unreal cinematography; insane stunts; and yes... a nostalgic experience that not only pushes the envelope, but proceeds to surpass the original classic.I created an IMDB account for this to be my first review. For me, this is up there with recent classics like Blade Runner: 2049, Inception, The Lord of The Rings and other epics that do not fail to deliver. This will be considered a classic in due time and is incredibly rewatchable.Thank you to the team for this project after countless disappointments in the theatre lately. This is the 2022 Summer blockbuster that fans of the original, and fans of great movies needed. I am still smiling and listening to the soundtrack after that experience. Do not miss the chance to see this one of the big screen!!! Highway to the Danger Zone, Don't Think Just Do, I have the need...the need for speed and EPIC movies once again. 10/10.

It's been a while since I went to see an action movie at the cinema and left so satisfied
A really good modern blockbuster with nostalgic elements that make the whole movie experience magical.

reviews.review_title: So good to see real action
reviews.content: This might have been better than the first, but Goose was awesome in the first and missed. Story line good, fighter scenes were awesome! I'm sure some green screens but that's real camera cinematography and actors having to do things with amazing pilots. I'd see again and in my top 10 of movies to see in theater of all time.

reviews.review_title: Must see on the big screen.
reviews.content: Big screens are so much better for movies like this. Great sequel, story is okay. Tom Cruise delivers again. Highly recommend just for the action scenes. Great nostalgia feeling as well.
Touching storyline with an impactful and beautiful morale. Amazing stunts were pulled to make such an astonishing and awe-inspiring rare theater experience! Do not miss your last chance!

I'll keep this short, it lacks the excitement and thrill of the original, but don't let that stop you from watching. There's pleanty of thrills, a fair bit of impressive flying and lots of testosterone.What it lacks is the rawness of the original, that 'devil may care attitude', that 'youth' that made top gun......and sadly there was something else that was missing, (for me at least), that pounding soundtrack that just swept you up along with the speed of the film......where is the 2022 version of Kenny Loggins 'Danger Zone'?

This movie is an absolute beast!!! I love the way Tom Cruise hasn't aged a little bit, he's the best and I love the cinematography (very on point) the story is also very much chef kiss. Probably one of the best movie I've ever seen, I highly recommend it, don't think, just do it.
Just my "There is always room for improvement" motto makes me scoring this 9/10.Really fantastic in almost every way. Tom Cruise keeps delivering in this weird times. So thank you Tom.

The story itself is mediocre and predictable. You can see from the start you know there is only one way this will go.The same old ,he should be a higher rank but does not want to, teaching younger students who include one who hates him and others that are disobedient, then gets kicked off the job only to be given another and then typical all American hero comes out triumphed.Thr only think that kept you engaged was the stunts and flying which you could see cruise actually flying the plane compared to the other actors.Over all not the great film that it's been made out tk be but a decent watch.

Ever since hearing they were doing another Top Gun I was excited yet skeptical. Usually sequels do the original "dirty." But OMG this one was worth the wait and the hype. I'd have to say this is by far the best follow up to an original. I just may go see a few more times.

Predictable as I thought it would be, that simply didn't take away from the enjoyment. I did find myself thinking at times "come on get there" but again it was still the thrill of a roller coaster ride. The nostalgia factor was there, characters' behaviors mirrored the first movie, the action scenes were well staged ... it felt like going to a great high school reunion. Sound and video were stellar and scenes flowed well. This was a good example of how to do a remake the general audience will like. Admittedly, one really needs to see the first Top Gun to appreciate this however, anyone sour on this movie does not know how to have a good time.

reviews.review_title: Only watch if you are a fan of Tom Cruise, Top Gun or aviation or airforce action or a combination of these, otherwise this movie may not be for you
reviews.content: This movie is an unabashed love letter to Tom Cruise as well as to gung-ho hoo-aa style military action movies favored by the production houses of Tony Scott and Jerry Bruckheimer (the movie is also dedicated to Tony Scott).Tom Cruise is almost in every scene and the production goes overboard to ensure that everything - from the dialogue to the lighting to the dazzle of his smile to the whiteness of his teeth to the sun setting exactly so correctly behind him to the blackness of his hair to the agelessness of his physique - all of that continues to provide frame after picture perfect frame of more Tom Cruise than you can handle in a lifetime.In short this is the Tom Cruise production fanboy equivalent of what the Hallmark Channel does for romantic Christmas movies.You know exactly what you are going to get - there are ZERO twists in the story, no one gets so much as even a scratch, there is ZERO action on the ground, and there is not ONE villain you can see in the movie. All of the action takes place in the air, the climactic battle is a cakewalk for everyone and barely lasts 10 mins with just two enemy aircraft showing up to ignominiously bite the dust. And the ending is well....even romance movies could not come up with a better HEA ending!!!!!The entire movie is a stringing together of Tom's greatest hits moments - with every scene setup so that he gets to have the last word with the best punch or emotional line. Of course almost everyone is against him but secretly worships the very ground he walks on and of course everyone hides a golden heart with eyes ready to turn moist. Dialogues are corny puffed up and cringeworthy or make for a good laugh.So why did the movie work obviously? There is just one answer and it is the obvious one - because of Tom Cruise and because he is a superstar. THIS is what he does best and no one comes even close. He is the last great superstar from a forgotten era that no longer exists - that of the superstar action hero that the whole world immediately recognizes who channels macho action in a bloodless old fashioned Boys' adventure style movie making the way no one does. That is why Tom would never be in a movie like Braveheart or Saving Private Ryan.No one probably remembers the Boys action hero Biggles book series anymore (by Capt WE Johns) but for those who do Tom is the Biggles avatar. He is also the Hardy Boys come to life - that is the era and image he speaks to.And yes the Production has done a beyond awesome job of all the aviation and aerial action sequences and puts you INTO the aircraft - that is how good it is.So go watch it for your love of aviation and for Tom ......go Tom, you got this!!!!!

reviews.review_title: As great or better than the original
reviews.content: Much like Cobra Kai paid homage to Karate Kid while simultaneously creating something new and entertaining, this new movie effectively honors the original while remaining relevant. We loved the storyline and think Miles Teller is well cast as is Jennifer Connelly. As ever, Tom Cruise shows up and proves there is a reason he is the most popular movie star alive today. Thanks for honoring your fans. We are also glad you waited to put this on the big screen. It was worth the wait. Favorite part was with Val Kilmer. Definitely a must see!

reviews.review_title: I didn't think they'd allow a stinker sequel
reviews.content: And they didn't. It was actually better and far less formula than I expected. They did a great job with this. Had fear at one point they were going to kill off a main character and that didn't come to pass. Awesome cinematography. Nuff said.

As a 44 year old who loved the original and didn't think it could get any better I was blown away with the intricacies of this sequel. The last time I went to the cinema and people whooped and cried during a film was Rocky. Every moment of this film is a delight to watch. Tom Cruise met every hope and expectation and after waiting for so long I couldn't have asked for a more thrilling experience. Thank you to everyone who made this film happen!

reviews.review_title: The Reason Movie Theatres Still Exist!
reviews.content: BETTER than the original (thought I'd never say that), heart-stopping and heartwarming all at once: homages to the original "Top Gun" (Goose, Ice Man, original soundtrack), interwoven with modern-day, adrenaline-pumping CGI, a poignant farewell to Ice Man (beautifully done), and a satisfying resolution with Goose's story and his ultimate legacy, Rooster. Also, way more realistically this time, Maverick gets the RIGHT girl, and a sneak peek at a happy life.IMAX or bust on this one and-say what you will about Tom Cruise-he continues to completely kick cinematic A$$! Can't wait to see it again!

I know about jets, being from a family with pilots. I did not know that this film has maybe 5 pages of script. It is boring. TC is still TC. Nothing is fresh and new. It is all about money. I am glad people got work making this film. I appreciate the people who actually flew those F-18s. That is all.

I'm gonna preface this by saying I am NOT a fan of Tom Cruise. I don't particularly dislike him, he's just not someone I ever rush to see new movies from. This movie didn't change that in any way, shape, or form. I DID enjoy it despite him, though.The younger cast were excellent, especially Glen Powell as Bagman. Oops, I meant Hangman. I'm not surprised he had his role beefed up. Miles Teller was also pretty good, but I've seen him do better. It would have been nice if they'd been able to get a bit more screen time for the rest of the younger characters, but that may have dragged the movie on a bit too long and slowed it down, so I guess it was kind of enough that they didn't just sort of sweep them all to the side.The cinematography was excellent, too, and it took that feeling of excitement in watching the dogfights from the first movie and amped it all up really well, and I like that they were able to really expand on the cinematography of the actual flight scenes and make us feel a lot more like we were actually in the cockpits.The ending kinda let it all down for me, though. It almost felt like they decided to try to be something other than a Top Gun movie at the last moment, with the stealing the F-14 and all that. Otherwise, it was a damn good movie.

reviews.review_title: FINALLY a movie worthy of going to the theaters
reviews.content: This is the only movie I was really excited to make me want to go to the theaters. I hardly ever go to the theaters. Even with all the hype and positive reviews, it did not disappoint. This is the kind of movie you want to see in theaters!I wanted a premium experience, so I saw it at AMC Dolby Cinema. The seats literally rattled like I was on the jet.I'm so sick of the same old superhero movies and fake green screen coming out all the time, this was finally something older audiences could really appreciate.I doubt there will ever be another superstar Hollywood actor on the level of Tom Cruise - who really goes beyond entertaining his fans and so dedicated to his work. It's amazing he can sky dive solo, and really flying jets himself. That is true dedication. I'm also glad he's against green screen and understands story is just as important as the actions.36 years since the original Top Gun came out and it's definitely a worthy sequel that surpasses the original. The technology advances and actors aging to fit the storyline makes perfect sense.The original had the most epic perfect legendary soundtrack, that is impossible to top, so I'm glad they reused the original score in the beginning - that brought major chills. I wish they would have used Dangerzone though.There were some really intense action, I laughed, I cried a lot... everything you'd want in a great fulfilling movie experience.Is the script Oscar worthy? No. I mean, the original was basically a popcorn flick as well. It's basically Mission Impossible in the air. But it's not just mindless uninspiring action - it's action sequences that you can admire and respect from all the crews hard work (not just lazy green screen) - and the story has substance.Jennifer Connelly still looks good, but her character "romance" was definitely forced into the script. The intensity of the romance is nowhere near Tom had in the original.Also I don't remember any memorable additional music in the new one (Even Lady Gaga's song). The soundtrack definitely fails in comparison to the original... again, that department is impossible to top.Other than that, this sequel is superior.Time flew by fast and the movie didn't feel 2 hours at all.Watching the first Top Gun isn't necessary because they give you flashbacks, but I think watching the original will give you greater chills when seeing moments with Val Kilmer, etc.This is the kind of movie you'll be satisfied paying your hard earned money for - not repetitive green screen same old same old superhero junk films.

reviews.review_title: Mixed bag, putting my prejudice aside.
reviews.content: I will start by declaring my prejudice - I am not a fan of Tom Cruise as a person nor a fan of the American war machine. I put that aside to watch and enjoy this for what it is, a fictional story and I can say "WOW". When I started watching it was a bit slow, pulling on the old "top gun" movie which I remember because Im old. The movie improves and continues to improve, the characters develop, the mood and chemistry between the pilots blossoms and the ending was spectacular. And all this to my surprise. I rated it as a 9. I have some carrier experience too, and still 9/10. Worth watching. The highs and the lows are amazing, and the ending brought happy tears to my eyes despite my prejudices. It is a story not something real. Take it as a fiction and nothing more. Well done Tom Cruise and co. Well directed, great special effects extremely realistic enough to make any aviation experienced person enjoy along with the novice. Thoroughly enjoyable. I hope we see more of Cruise in the future because he is still an amazing actor as are all the others that appeared alongside him. I am trying not to drop any spoilers so this is as far as I go. Watch it for yourself, get past any prejudice you may have coming into it, and you will walk away from this satisfied !

reviews.review_title: Better than the first could easily spawn franchise
reviews.content: This movie is 1 of a few that I can say is better than the first, you will have all the feeling's but also this movie unlike most could actually continue with all of the new cast and without maverick be successful or even giving him a desk roll lol. Unlike fast and furious who cannot stand out on its own without the main cast or at least four of the main cast it sucked that we have to wait the two years but I hope everyone gets a chance to go see it or at least watch it on one of the apps through HBO or Amazon or whoever buys the rights to show it.

reviews.review_title: A very nice move post pandemic
reviews.content: I thought that there is nothing else to be added after "Top gun" but boy was I mistaken. It was a very nice surprise to see diversity without having an agenda pushed. Honestly it was a breath of fresh air and a very nice movie to watch after the end of pandemic.Tom Cruise played so many iconic roles and amazing stunts that I sart wondering if there is a thing he is bad at.

reviews.review_title: Don't expect a realistic film but still a fun ride.
reviews.content: This movie checks all the boxes. And depending on how you look at that might be a problem for you because this film really doesn't take any risks. People that know how this stuff really works might have a problem with the level of realism too. Some of the dogfights are technically outstanding. I enjoyed the score. As an 80s baby that loves the original they did a great job paying homage to it.9/10 for fans of the original. I won't bother giving it any other score for now, because that is very obviously who this film was made for.
Ok so some of it is a bit cheesy but from start to finish it's exhilarating and Tom Cruise adds something that was missing from the first film....a splash of humour!
Such a great trip down memory lane! Perfect mix between old and new! Had Goosebumps and tears in my eyes! Fantastic action sequences...a must see! Just perfect!

This movie surpassed the original in every way. The aerial sequences were ACTUALLY FLOWN IN REAL PLANES! That's crazy. Knowing this keeps you on the edge of you seat during any of the training assignments and also for the real mission. This perfected Top Gun.
I love it seriously it's one of best movies in the last years the story the drama just wow.Tom cruise made me fall in love with every single detail his acting just genius.

reviews.review_title: Top Gun 2 was so bad i walked out
reviews.content: As a Navy veteran I was kind of excited to see the sequel. Between the 20,000 extreme close-ups and extremely old people in uniform it was impossible for me to watch and I was in aviation in the military. I walked out halfway through because it brought me to tears. Not tears of joy tears of boredom. I most definitely would not recommend seeing this movie unless it is the apocalypse and there is nothing else to watch. I thought it was going to be awesome because everybody said it was the best movie ever. If you go and watch this I promise you you will be extremely disappointed.

Love this! All of the actions, actors, sounds, pictures and related scenes between the main characters. Not much drama. I don't watch a good action movie like this for a long time. That's so much fun. Prove it to yourself! Have a good time.

This movie was beautifully done. I felt so many emotions while watching this. I would recommend anyone who hasn't watched the original 1986 ' Top. Maverick' to watch that one first then this one. It felt great to see those who were in the original in the sequel. I was on the verge of tears so many times. It was so beautiful. I believe this will be remembered forever as a film masterpiece. I enjoyed the storyline a lot. It was interesting, unpredictable and anxiety inducing (in a good way). I have no complaints. It's obvious that everyone who played a part ( on or off screen), did their part well.

Flight scenes were intense but everything outside of the flying was bad. The movie spent so much time trying to remind the audience of what happened in the previous movie. Jennifer Connelly's part was unnecessary and the movie would have been better without her.The woman pilot was nothing more than woke agenda that goes with Fauxllywood. No thanks.I'll stick with the original. People today have been brainwashed by all of the stupid comic book heroes movies and they have no idea what a truly good movie is.

I probably have a very different view of this film than others. The beginning was absolutely brilliant and the music drew me in immediately. The pace was quite fast so it didn't always take too long for some action to occur or it just went by quickly because I was having fun. As far as the action goes, it's much better compared to the 80's one, which is quite logical considering the evolution of cinematography with better cameras and better effects. So hats off to the action scenes. Very nice show. What was also better in my opinion was the story. More interesting and, I would say, more suspenseful. It was all so cool and I enjoyed it so much, but there was one thing I missed terribly much and that was the song Take My Breath Away. I understand that they didn't want to repeat themselves and give it a new twist, but when the song Danger Zone was played, which put a smile on my face, the aforementioned Take My Breath Away would have made me even happier.
