All this time I was waiting and hoping in vain that at least for a moment it would be heard, but nothing. For me, it was an incredible shame. It very much brought the film down for me. To sum it up. Top Gun: Maverick will be better than the original 1986 one for many people. It was good. A lot of people will be excited and I definitely recommend it to fans of the first one. Just giving my opinion here. A lot of people will probably remember Top Gun for the fighter jet action scenes, which are plentiful and really great and sometimes very suspenseful. It's because they're I'd say better that this film has gotten so much positive feedback. But I had a different take on the original Top Gun and that was the 80s atmosphere, which was brought out beautifully by the song Take My Breath Away. This movie is not from the 80s anymore. That's a fact. But if they've done Danger Zone, I'd ask for Take My Breath Away. I'm repeating myself enough. This thing bothered me, unfortunately. Don't get me wrong. This movie is hilarious and like I said you probably won't regret going to see it. I just wanted to say that for me, unfortunately, the absence of the aforementioned song made it lose the charm I loved so much about Top Gun. Other than that, a good film for me and I recommend it.

It was okay and commendable even for not lecturing us on wokeness. Tom Cruise's love interest is even a real woman - they are not denying the existence of such a thing (although it would have been interesting to have a Black Transgender Woman in such a role- and for not allowing that one has to consider if Cruise is a chicken)...

Nice cgi + Tom Cruise are the only things this movie has to offer.Superficial movie with typical American writing, many plotholes , illogical writing...On the other hand some nice visuals and cinematography.If you don't care about storylines then it's your go-to movie, but if you're a person like me you will think it's a comedy movie for the whole 2 hours run.

reviews.review_title: Great sequel. Made me want to rush home and watch the original
reviews.content: I'm so happy I went to see this in the theatre. We went as a family and even my teenage daughters enjoyed it.Loud action packed and Tom cruise was awesome. Jennifer Connelly did a great job as well.Loved the actors who played rooster and hangman. My only complaint is that there was no character development of the new crew. I remember watching the original, I bawled my eyes out when goose died. I felt like I didn't care about any of the new characters.Overall is was a great start to summer film definitely worth seeing in the theatre.

reviews.review_title: Tom Cruise has made the best sequel of all time!
reviews.content: Just finished watching Top Gun: Maverick and I want to go right back into the cinema hall to watch it all over again. And when it comes to the film itself, it has left me speechless. Tom Cruise has given the best performance of his career so far. It's a blast of fan service and nostalgia, it's probably the best sequel ever made to any film...

Cruise shines in this follow up to the original - 36 years ago! Gripping story line, excellent character lineup, impeccable action and it all makes sense!My wife and I loved it. Terrific motion picture.

Big movie promotion = BIG LETDOWN. My review in a nutshell: TOTALLY BORING!Boring as all get out. Stopped after 45 minutes which was way too much time. Should have stopped after 20 minutes, as usual, for boring, no-nothing movies. Lots of extreme pilot closeups. Boring action (same as first Top Gun movie), boring dialog. Poor editing and acting. Poor direction. What else can you say about a movie that has absolutely nothing to offer us? Even the opening scenes were the same as the first Top Gun, with the same music. How creative. I thought I played the old Top Gun movie by mistake (which I recently started and stopped because it was painfully boring). I liked the first one, but I was very young and foolish. Produced by Tom Cruise ($$$) FOR Tom Cruise because no one else would.
Amazing sequel, didn't think they could pull it off!! Tom Cruise is unbelievable, and he is in the most amazing shape. Ignore the naysayers if there are any, go see it!!

reviews.review_title: Steeped in nostalgia and cliches, it's a reminiscing tribute to the cult classic
reviews.content: "Don't think, just do it"; was probably what the crew did while filming this movie. Steeped in nostalgia and cliches, it's a reminiscing tribute to the cult classic. Crows feet, baggy eyes and saggy skin in extreme closeup didn't help TC and JC to charm the viewers. Neither did the attempt at youthful romance by the ancient couple ignite passion. It's a family friendly entertainer. But it doesn't have any special moments or music to make it as endearing as the original or clinch a second viewing.

reviews.review_title: Nostalgic epic worth the time & money
reviews.content: An amazing resurrection of the Franchise. Tom Cruise always mesmerizes with his fantastic performance. Joseph Kosinsky has delivered a master piece here.

reviews.review_title: This is what movies are made of
reviews.content: This movie experience will not disappoint. Worth the 36 year wait and then some. From start to finish this movie delivers on just about everything it should. You'll laugh, you will cheer, you will get emotional and you will leave feeling 100% satisfied you waited so long to see it.

I know the reviews have been generally good so far. I also enjoyed the movie, but I had to ignore quite a bit in order to do so. Keeping in mind that I'm a bit of a movie fanatic and that Top Gun is one of my childhood faves, it is probably accurate to say some of my critiques are overkill.Nevertheless, here goes.... **spoilers**1. Super heavy on the Goose stuff. We get it. Goose died in the first movie and Mav is tortured by it. No need for the incessant call backs.2. Goose's son Rooster might as well have been played by a no name actor (Rather than Miles Teller... who I think is awesome) since the character's entire identity consists of being Goose's son and being slighted by Maverick in the past.3. Along the same line... no character other than Maverick has any depth whatsoever.4. Tons of lazy info dumping inserted into dialog to explain Maverick's past 30 years.5. Hangman is just a douchier and less interesting Iceman.6. Love story with Jennifer Connelly was kind of pointless.7. Dialog was cheesy throughout a lot of the movie and they went a little too heavy on the nostalgia IMO.8. The mission the movie centers around is kind of ridiculous. They basically were like "let's have Maverick and Rooster do the Luke Skywalker destroys the Death Star thing." I mean Rooster even had to basically use the force to hit the target in the end. And I'm not a military tactician, but why wouldn't they have used a stealth bomber with precision guided bunker busting bombs or any other option rather than what they chose? It just doesn't make sense to me. Is it really so difficult to invent a believable mission that would require skilled fighter pilots these days?With all of that said.... I thought it was fun to watch for the most part. The action sequences were enjoyable. Pretty much every moment involving a jet was exciting. Seeing Val Kilmer do his thing was nice.I enjoy it well enough.... I wanted to love it.
At the end of the twisty canyon I must hit a tiny hole in the ground. Oh no! The targeting system is dead, I have to use the Force. Wait a minute... is this Star Wars?

reviews.review_title: Good, but not as exciting as the first movie
reviews.content: I really enjoyed Top Gun Maverick, Tom Cruise & the entire cast and crew did an excellent job. The action sequences are really good and makes up for the lukewarm story.But growing up watching the first Top Gun over 20 times at least. I came to the conclusion that the first movie still has the edge.I think it's because Val Kilmer, Anthony Edwards & Kelly McGillis together with Tom Cruise made the first movie legendary, plus the soundtrack of Top Gun Maverick is no where near as good the first movie.So basically in my opinion, the first Top Gun movie graduates first place & Top Gun Maverick is a commendable second place.

I was worried about this movie because the first one was terrible in my opinion. This blew me away, fantastic camera work, captivating story, great acting, and cool planes. My complaints would be that the love story is out of place and random at times. They tried to restore nostalgia in a few places that could have been left out. Finally, the idea of Maverick being bullied by everyone seems out of place considering how accomplished he is. Other than that, I thought this was an amazing movie and was even better in theaters.

This movie was exactly what it needed to be and it was released exactly when it needed to be released. Im 41, and obviously grew up with the original Top Gun and original soundtrack as part the backdrop of my 80's childhood. Tom wanted this movie to be in theaters and he was right to wait ($1b box office and climbing still). Lots and lots of nostalgia and reach backs to the original. Loved it, loved it, loved it. They made the sequel right and for the fans. Go see in theatre. You won't regret it.
It deserves 11 stars. Better even than the original. Amazing Tom Cruise. Exactly how a movie sequel should be made. Direction, cinematography, screenplay...everything is on top gun level.

Don't normally write reviews But. WOW. My review needs more information or I can't post. But I planned to leave after the WOW.Anyway I have waffle on. Jennifer Connolly (51) that's another reason to go see she is fantastic ( wonder why Kelly McGillis wasn't in this movie as a love interest to Maverick I have my own thoughts lol) boy this is hard going. Folks just go and see it, I promise you won't be looking your money back.

Loved every minute of it. Although it has so many cliches to the old film and you can second guess what's coming most the time, it was an amazing watch. Tom cruise is still the best actor and portrays maverick exactly the same as the first film. Awesome film. Loved it.

reviews.review_title: Fly through a trench to bomb a design flaw - sound familiar?
reviews.content: Just a horrible movie. All cheese and pandering to nostalgia. But thank god an adversary with nuclear capability and advanced aircraft kept an obsolete F14 around.

The perfect sequel to Top Gun and it stands true to it's roots. It was an emotional roller coaster ride watching the film and reliving through all the nostalgic scenes. Only hoping for the 3rd part as there are still a lot of story left in Maverick and Top Gun.

If you are a fan of the first Top Gun, you'll like this. It absolutely does a wonderful homage to the OG, without being ridiculous or corny. Seeing a glimmer of Ed Harris and Val Kilmer was an absolute plus. Miles Teller did a great job. Overall it is worth seeing - you'll walk away having e joyed a feel good action movie.
This movie was mind blowing!Been waiting for that movie since forever and it just blew me away!Even to a non aviation lovers this movie will just blow you away!Well done for tom cruise and the cast!

With no mention at all to any "terror nation" or any other sign, story is about maverick ! And it is good very giod actually! It could be better if it was 20 min shorter with no romance or parties or anything like that!Tom cruise is the holy cow of cinema! Always better.

reviews.review_title: Best movie since Jesus was born
reviews.content:
I can confirm I was present at the birth
Lof Jesus Christ and I can confirm if I had to choose be there or watch this movie am afraid it would be Mavrick Everytime.Infact if a could do anything in my life I would travel back in time to when Jesus was born and sit down with Mary and Joseph and watch this movie on an 85 inch OLED tv while Jesus slept.

reviews.review_title: I just can't describe the feeling I had whilst watching this movie
reviews.content: This movie is just indescribable by words. I was on the edge of my seat. The emotions this movie put me through in different stages is just phenomenal and not many movies give off a feeling quite as this one did. Absolute masterpiece. The first one is obviously a classic but this one is an absolute, I say again, masterpiece... One of the best movies to be released in a LONG time. Man 2022 is just the greatest year for movies.

It was very high expectation about this movie. It failed big time.It was three years wait time.Aerial footage much worse than in the first movie. Too many face GoPro style cockpit shots. Not too many filmed from the outside.Soundtrack is basically very bad and non existent. Two only good tracks are taken from original Top Gun. It was one more but with the new performance but it was also old song.Similarity of many scenes in the movie is also very disappointing. Compare yourself the scene when Maverick visit Viper's home and talk to his wife, to his visit in to Iceman's house while he talks to his wife.I'm the big fan of Top Gun and aviation. This movie (Top Gun: Maverick) was advertised as something better than the previous one.It's still an action movie with some mental drama in the script, but absolutely not worth the hype. I will not give more than 5 stars. Disappointing.

I've never been a fan of the army/navy/whatever, quite the contrary actually, and I've never been much of a fan of the first movie either, which I consider utter army propaganda.But I decided to give this a shot, since everyone was saying it's a great movie, at least comparing to the conveyor belt garbage Hollywood releases nowadays.Boy, was my gut feeling right. I don't think there is something more boring than the army... I also don't understand why these guys have to be portrayed as obnoxious, arrogant a-holes... They must be thinking they are cool or something flying their dumb F-whatever planes and their stupid little nicknames but to me al least it's completely the opposite.Another thing I totally despise are the goofy, dumb Hollywood little jokes stuffed in which this does not lack of course.So to summarize, this movie doesn't seem to be for me. In my opinion if you don't find the army stuff interesting (quite the contrary in my case) you'll probably not like it, it is not for anyone like I was initially hoping. I gave it a 5/10 because it has some good actors and for the effort they put into making it I guess.Last thing I want to specify is that I recommend the old Charlie Sheen parody, I definitely found that a lot more fun.

reviews.review_title: Nostalgia, Fast and Nimble Aircraft, Great Cast, Impossible Mission
reviews.content: This movie checked all the boxes!! Fast paced, fun, nostalgic film. Tom Cruise really is the G. O. A. T. of this genre. Nobody does it better! Worth seeing on the big screen. See it, sit back, and enjoy!

reviews.review_title: Full of sound and fury, signifying nothing
reviews.content: I have rarely been so depressed by a movie as this one, not least that it finds 97% critical favour on Rotten Tomatoes.Clearly I'm in the miniscule minority, but for me the film - and its rave response - sums up all that's wrong with the human race: macho jingoism laced with toe-curling sentimentality. The only bright note was that my 13 y/o daughter found it equally cringeworthy.Shakespeare had it in one: "It is a tale told by an idiot, full of sound and fury, signifying nothing."

reviews.review_title: Shut your brain off and just enjoy.
reviews.content: Tom Cruise proves once again that he is one of the biggest action stars of all time. Capturing every bit of the nail-biting, edge-or-your-seat action that the first Top Gun had, the final (probably) installment delivers everything a great action film could deliver.

The first thing I want to do is explain how much I really wanted to like this movie. However, that was not the case. For the first time in about 5 years, I almost walked out of the movie theater. What prevented This was the fact that I was on a double date, and I did not want to make my friends upset.They should've just made a remake, and changed key plot points. The story could not have been more ridiculous. At one point, I actually thought I was watching a parody.As opposed to point out my problems with everything about it, le me simply state, It is a bad movie.

I didnt loved so much top guy 1 but as a kid it was good movie of it time but as adult I cared for it less so I was sceptic about part 2 after so many years but I really must say it's amazing movie !!!The vibe that is missing in today cinema really good ,the story line was good , all the connections to the first movie made you nostalgic and the amazing actor Tom cruise and even all the clishaes are comming together so good here .Yes many can say maybe cheesy or whatever but it is a very well build movie very good acting and maverick really deserve this kind of final .Usually part 2 movies are bad but this one way better then the first oneSo go see you will thank me.

Movie really captures the essence of the greatness of America. The charity for your fellowman, the quest to do your best at your work, the concept of making a team out of challenging assignments of our republic. Good job.

I was just 1 year old when first Top Gun was released but with a lack of newest releases in my country I watched it very late, since then Tom Cruise is my favourite actor and Top Gun is one of my favourite movies.When the Maverick trailer arrived I was very excited to watch it but had very low expectations from the movie and for some reason I was thinking that it will be another mediocre sequel from Hollywood, but I was wrong this one is even better than the original Top Gun, 2 hours just flown like a fighter plane.Watched it last night with 2 friends who are not into the movies that much but they loved it and we're already planning to watch it for the second time.
I would like to give this movie a 10, simply because Tom Cruise brought back something great to cinema. He should receive accolades.THE MAGIC HAPPENS TO THIS MOVIE....!!!!Thank you, Tom Cruise.

reviews.review_title: A rare 10/10 for me for a sequel after only 36 years!
reviews.content: Tom Cruise at his usual best. Maverick has to go back to Top Gun to teach. Teaching top gun graduates to undergo a dangerous, maybe even impossible, mission. There's a conflict in the group and within the Navy to be resolved. Maverick solves these in his inimitable way by breaking rules and pushing the envelope. There's a romantic interest too. The film builds towards the ultimate confrontation. Quite a few twists and turns and a climatic ending. Worth seeing again. I saw it in an Odeon "iSense" cinema. I intend to see it in an Imax.

No clear enemy. Is it Russia or China? No development of a enemy.... just a mission. I found the movie very cheesy and predictable. Would have been more interesting if Russia abducted the US President kid or something more clever than a unknown nuclear site of unknown origin.

reviews.review_title: Amazingly shot, but feels a bit shallow
reviews.content: First things first: the flying sequences are stunning indeed. Relying on mostly practical shots inside real jets, the movie immediately takes you into the Danger Zone, and the first five minutes with its opening montage and title reveal are basically perfect.However, there are some things that dragged the film down:The writing:Simplistic (which isn't necessarily bad) and very predictable (which is kinda bad) plot points drag this film down quite a bit. Some set-ups and pay-offs are downright cringeworthy. You could argue that this is an hommage to the 80s, but it just doesn't work that well anymore.The scoreWhen original music is being heard, it feels great and appropriate. But when Hans Zimmer's music cues in, things go south, mainly because it feels like Hans just opened up some old INCEPTION Cubase projects and re-used them almost verbatim. Also, the VI-IV-I-V chord progression is so incredibly overused and cringe by now that using it in an unironical way should be considered a crime.The dialogue editingIn a blockbuster movie like this, I expect good, if not great sound quality. Some of the dialogue was severely over-denoised and trashy, which is unacceptable.The film editingNot a big issue, but at times there were strangely unmotivated and jarring cuts in dialogue scenes which kinda took me out of the scene. I wonder if this was a little hommage to Tony Scott. Probably not.However, these points shouldn't discourage you from getting a few cold ones and enjoy one of the best nostalgia baits ever created. If you can ignore some flaws, you'll have a good time. The bigger the screen, the better.
Excellent sequel with a hint of blast from the past. This movie would have been made years ago I dont think it would have been as good. I enjoyed it from start to finish.

reviews.review_title: Is there a plot? Who cares? Film-watching & reviewing in the 21st century
reviews.content: I read the front page. I read a bunch of reviews. I still have no idea what the "plot" might be or if there even is one. Picture-perfect way to describe half of film-watching and reviewing in the 21st century.Today's films have either an over-the-top preaching agenda or almost complete disregard for a real plot. I guess this is the latter with some extremists thinking it is the former.

reviews.review_title: Top Gun - Maverick is a grandiose and intense action spectacle
reviews.content: Yesterday evening I watched "Top Gun - Maverick" in the cinema. Here is my personal impression of the film (spoiler-free and only minimal spoilers in the third paragraph, but I mentioned that again at the point):First, a few words about the original 80's film: I'm not a big fan of the film, because it lacks that certain something to be terrific. Especially the inner logic in the story is a problem of the film. But even otherwise it is only solid to good from today's point of view. The soundtrack, Tom Cruise, Val Kilmer and the others, however, were convincing and I liked the film quite a bit."Top Gun - Maverick", however, simply raises everything that made up its predecessor to a whole new level. Action, suspense, staging, sound mixing, camera technique and acting performances are all on a very high level. Only the story is extremely flat and only serves to justify the film and its extremely cool production. For me, however, this is completely okay.Briefly to the story (minimal spoilers): The enemy (not named/fictional) has a nuclear stockpile in a crater surrounded by anti-aircraft missiles and enemy fighter jets and a jammer. The Navy's best fighter pilots must destroy this nuclear stockpile. Maverick must train the pilots to do this and make the selection of which six of the twelve pilots will end up flying the mission. Goose's son is one of the twelve fighter pilots, which of course presents a personal challenge to Maverick. The enemy is shown only in the abstract throughout the film. There are no flags and there are no real visible people other than the enemy pilots. Therefore, the enemy image here is very abstract and impersonal. But this doesn't disturb the flow of the movie in any way, because the focus is just completely different. (end of spoilers)Despite the flat story, the film is very exciting and intense, especially in the last third, when it really gets down to business. Emotionally, the film was able to pick me up and let me sympathize with the characters. The film takes the necessary time to introduce the characters and build the relationship between the characters. The film never feels rushed, but also doesn't feel stretched out or too long at all. At 131 minutes, it has just the right running time.Tom Cruise plays Maverick, the eternal "Captain," better than ever. He convinces with his usual coolness, charm, self-confidence and charisma. He gets emotions across well in the film and shows more of them here than in his other film roles. As always, Cruise is simply THE star par excellence.Miles Teller plays Goose's son "Rooster" very convincingly as well. The conflict between him and Maverick comes across well and makes for one or two emotional scenes. It is interesting that Miles Teller looks very much like Goose at the time.Jennifer Conelly plays Penny Benjamin, a woman who seems to have known Maverick for some time, though she did not appear in the original film. There seemed to have been some brief flirtations between the two in the past. Conelly plays Penny very convincingly and is a kind of "anchor" for Maverick when he gets stuck or to give him courage.Even Val Kilmer plays a short part here, and the scene is really extremely touching. I won't tell you more about it. A great tribute to the old star, who is unfortunately plagued by illness today.The other actors/actresses are more supporting roles, but each of them plays their part well and believably.The camera work is just insane. The shots in the cockpits, outside the planes and also the brilliant aerial shots from a distance are just a hammering sight. Frequently, long shots are shown, both on the ground and in the air, and that is always an impressive sight. Especially the shots that are so far away from the fast F-18s that they can be easily tracked by eye are really impressive as well.The cuts are also good, if sometimes a bit too fast. But that's hard to do any other way in this kind of film, since things are fast and furious here, so it fits quite well.The flying and action scenes are just unbelievably awesome and raise the bar for future movies that are about flying battles and planes to an extremely high level. The flying and fighting maneuvers are expertly staged and really press the viewer into the seat.The sound mixing is probably on the highest level, but unfortunately our cinema can't quite keep up. It's time for an upgrade in the cinema in my country.The soundtrack mixes new with old. A lot of the old film was used and a little polished up. One or two good new pieces are also included, including a good song by Lady Gaga. Overall, the music is still great and supports the feeling and atmosphere very well.The style of the 80s was well preserved and cleverly combined with today. The film exudes the charm of that time as well as that of today.ConclusionTop Gun - Maverick is an action spectacle of a special kind. The flying scenes and combat maneuvers are simply a feast for the eyes and worthy of reference thanks to the terrific camera work, the sound is a feast for the ears (assuming a well-equipped cinema), the music is an ode to the 80s and the story is emotional on a character level. This film should definitely be experienced on the big screen with good sound equipment!9/10 points - Medium rewatch value.

If I could rate this movie higher I would! Top Gun has everything you want in a movie: action, humor, love, suspense, and more action. We've gone twice in the theaters - you have to see it on the big screen. Tom says they tried to create an immersive experience and they succeeded. So so amazing!!

reviews.review_title: True Blockbuster cinema is finally back
reviews.content: One of the best sequels ever made. Better than the original. Best blockbuster of 2022. This needs to be seen at the biggest screen possible. The 3rd act is absolutely phenomenal. Mind-blowing action, No CGI, all done practically on real aircrafts by real humans at real location.

It is the perfect continuation for what was one of the most important films of its time. The scenes are all fantastic starting from Mach 10, passing through the references to Top Gun 1, such as at the bar and playing the piano, up to the dogfights on the F18 Superhornets and the return in great style of what many consider the plane most infamous in the world: the Tomcat.
8.5/10.Good weekend watch.Actually liked it better than Top Gun 1.Tad unrealistic drama in the end but good action sequences and Goosebump moments.Go watch it, won't reveal any more.

I'm always pleased when I pay for something and I get exactly what I expected and I'm elated when I get more then what I expected and this movie did exactly that.I am happy that I want to see it on the big screen because I don't think that my home system would have given me the equivalent experience in immersion.The flight scenes alone are worth the price of admission the fact that I knew that they were in real Jets made the tension real.The movie had everybody in my group quite literally rocking from side to side from the flight action turn the tender moments were actually quite emotional.We all agreed that the exchange between maverick and Iceman really gave the movie heart.I am so glad that we have people willing to make such a spectacular film available for us to experience turn all I can say is well done to Tom Cruise and the group of people who helped create this masterpiece.

This will be a recommendation, not a review since my sentiments are the same as others who rated the movie 10. It is really that good.My recommendation... only watch this movie at a high def cinema, like IMAX !!

Who knew a sequel made 36 years later would not only surpass its predecessor but soar far above what anyone could have imagined. Tom Cruise has once again delivered a masterclass in the art of making a blockbuster with Top Gun: Maverick defining what makes a true cinematic experience. He felt the need-and though some may say it comes a few decades late-the need for speed never dies within all of us and this movie proves that right from its invigorating opening sequence.Cruise teams up with frequent collaborators, director Joseph Kosinski and producer Christopher McQuarrie, which told us we're in for a Mission: Impossible-level event film. Yet, all expectations were blown out of the atmosphere at hypersonic speed. The talent and dedication to the craft is visible from every actor's performance, every shot, every angle, and every heart-pounding flight sequence. This film is meant to be seen, heard, and felt on the largest screen with the most powerful sound system. It's sound mix is Oscar worthy, along with its inventive cinematography techniques that put the audience directly in the cockpit with Maverick.I have to admit I wasn't around back when Top Gun hit theaters and pop culture. But even I could feel the nostalgia through the soundtrack, callbacks, and tributes-and the many white-haired fellow moviegoers who all had an edge-of-your-seat thrilling time watching this rare movie. They really don't make them like they used to anymore.The visual effects here are minimal, of course, due to the very real practical effects as we see the daring young actors get taken up in the fighter jets with the adrenaline king, Tom Cruise. As he continues to age, he seems to be worrying less about his own safety and more about living in the moment and pushing past current filmmaking limits as much as he can. This makes for an obviously exhilarating filmmaking process which translates to nothing but pure entertainment at its highest level.Top Gun: Maverick cannot be hyped up enough because it's not just a nostalgic node to an iconic 80s movie. It's a breathtaking experience from start to finish that might be the last of its kind, just like it's main character. Still, it has made its mark-and hit its target-as a memorable summer blockbuster. It makes anyone want to come back to the theaters again and again, taking the highway to the danger zone.-TE (5.26.22)

What does one look for in a sequel? More of the Same? Perhaps just more? In my view, Top Gun: Maverick is rather more...."Less of the Same".The plot is fairly thin and predictable. In fact it's so stereotyped, someone's trying to sue Warner Brothers for plagiarising their ideas. So there's Maverick played by Tim Cruise. He's never followed the rules, and consequently, never been promoted. He's still defying rules, orders, the laws of nature, incredible to think he's survived this long. Of course, there's a 'special mission'. Its impossible. Suicidal basically, so Maverick is brought in to show the Young Guns how to ignore rules in favour of instincts, and use their top skills to save the day.This of course is great vehicle to bring in the generation gap issue between today's "Top Guns" and the older teacher. Confusingly, Cruise can't decide if he's old or young; great care is taken to color his hair, and even greater care is taken to have just the right amount designer grey stubble. Ed Harris and Val Kilmer look comparatively ancient. There's an interesting quote from Kelly McGillis regarding her absence; she basically says she looks her age and that is NOT what this film is about. But don't worry, when it comes to playing football on the beach at sunset, Tom's showing he still has abs like the young guys.So without giving anything away, there are very direct references to the original film in the storyline. It's an attempt to add irony and sentiment. It only partly succeeds.There's no doubt that the stars of the show are the jets themselves.Todays technology allows much better coverage of the flying sequences than before. Cruise stipulated that his involvement in the venture would be predicated on minimal CGI, and this was for the good of the final product. In the initial flying sequences there's a "wow" factor but 30 minutes later it gets a bit like "oh yeah another jet". For me, this is rather like the whole film.....it doesn't quite...take off.Again, without giving much away, the action in the closing 30 minutes actually adds something previously missing; tension. For this reason, I've given the film a 7 rating rather than a 6 (which is the level I use for "uninspired but watchable").So in summary, this film does not set me alight. It will appeal to those who like action over plot (or indeed acting), and is definitely going to lose something on the small screen. If you want to see it, go to a cinema for sure.

reviews.review_title: Best movie I've watched after the pandemic
reviews.content: Finally a movie that hits the right notes. Story, acting, duration, action - all perfect. Tom cruise has become one of the most dependable actors of our time. One star is cut because there weren't any surprises, the ending was all predictable. But its the perfect sequel, nostalgia value = 11/10. Thankfully I missed the IPL final for this movie, for which my wife was fighting and ended up loving the movie. Thank you tom cruise for the wonderful acting and direction. Val kilmers role was perfect, keeping goose's son as part of the storyline was the icing.

It's an OK movie. Average. Nothing special.Pretty superficial and boring at times. Some of the fight scenes are decent. I don't get why so many reviewers here give the movie a 10. Is scientology behind this maybe?

This is it. The best airplane war movie so far. A bit of nostalgic scene, songs, motorcycle. And then the story is predictable. But the song by hans zimmer making the build up tension from the training until the valley flying to the enemy bunker is perfect.The pilot scene from inside the cockpit is stunning. How the camera caught how the pilot moving the plane plus the scenery behind, makes me clapping a lot of times.Maverick, this is the perfect closing for top gun franchise.

reviews.review_title: Movie Of The Year!!! Arguably the best Sequel I've seen in a franchise
reviews.content: Nothing I would change about this movie. Absolutely amazing. Movie of the year!!! I understand why Tom Cruise decided to run it back and give it his all. The actors that were chosen for the characters were spot on, Storyline was entertaining, and Miles Teller has grown into a phenomenal actor and had nearly a role that was just perfect for him. I'm not getting my hopes up but I would love to see the Top Gun franchise expand and make more movies. Maybe Maverick can pass the torch down to Rooster and Top Gun can continue. People have no idea the amount of work put into this film. So much greatness in one movie. May be one of my top 5 movies of all time.

Exceptionally good movie, same atmosphere than with the 1st movie. Just Bravo! 👏🏼👏🏼👏🏼
It entirely reflects what a Hollywood movie should be, these unfortunately don't come every year.

Firat of all, amazing movie just to experience at the cinema. This, for me, is why these subscription based platforms never will take over cinema. Great visually and story wise.It really delivers on every point, some more than others. I feel like it is a bit cheesy, but it mostly gets away with it. The main mission also felt like an impossible job. It had a few moments that in my opinion would be pretty impossible to happen, with only one F-14 surviving the bombing for example. I guess it needed to happen for the story.Otherwise a great movie everyone should experience on the big screen.

reviews.review_title: I have never written movie review in my life.
reviews.content: This is so much better than expected, I am so pumped like i was a 15yo kid 20years ago. Loved absolutely everything, the small winks of director to the first part lovers, the shots, the well done plot, the way that they connected the dots wish the first part. Never felt that about any movie in my life, jeeez people of the internet, YOU HAVE TO SEE IT!

I honestly didn't care about going to see this movie but I had forgotten how much I loved the original. I absolutely LOVED that they played so much of the music that was in the original. It took me right back to 1986. I only wish I had watched the first one again before going to see Maverick just to refresh my memory. I loved it none the less. I just sat and enjoyed it without trying to pick it apart. Just go see it. If you were young when the original came out, you'll see what I mean about the nostalgia. Get it whenever you can. It'll keep you young at heart.

reviews.review_title: A sequel that will not disappoint
reviews.content: I will keep this short . At last a sequel that does justice to the first film. Every part of this is what you want in a good film. . I went in fearing the worst and left like everyone in the audience with a huge smile on my face . Enough said . Go and enjoy the film folks.

reviews.review_title: Top Gun - meets Bakugo and Midoriya of My Hero Academia - meets Drumline - meets Armageddon
reviews.content:
FINAL TAKEAWAY:
Overall #TopGunMaverick gives Top Gun - meets Bakugo and Midoriya - meets Drumline - meets Armageddon.* * *
Theme & Story: A
Pacing: A
Character: A
Overall "Paper" Score: A* * *
General Public: Worth the $$$
Experience Seekers (via Visuals & Score): Interesting Enough
Action / Adventure / Top Gun Fans: Worth the $$$
Overall "Viewing Experience" Score: Worth the $$$* * *
I've never watched the Top Gun franchise until this installment, and I must say... it's good. There was such a modernized 80-vibe to the entire film that I also appreciated, as well as some cinematography choices that brought about some beautiful balance to this "love story for the guys" if you will (LOL).OTHER THOUGHTS:
Highlights: Tom Cruise's delivery, the variety of beautiful men in uniform, Act Three, a few cinematography choices, Lady Gaga's song + her working with Hans Zimmerman on the overall score, and the training scenes in the sky.Could've Been Better: I honestly don't think I have anything from this film that was a misstep. It was a pretty straight forward storyline, albeit safe, but it also executed the simple well. If I had to say anything, just to nitpick, I would say the motorcycle riding shots weren't always necessary... but then again, I feel they added to aspects of Maverick's character that played a role in his inability to "let go and move on."

Simply a great, feel good movie with all the right 1980ies vibes, good music and most of all brilliant flight scenes. Another huge plus: No political correct wokeness, diversity, rainbow colours or taking a knee whatsoever!

Simply one of the very last old school actors of his kind from a now bygone era of filmmaking - Tom Cruise doesn't need to prove anything at this point but continues to show why he is indeed the last action hero the world needs in a current time of extreme partisan politics and extreme wokeism. This film while it was never needed after nearly 40 years since the iconic original had completed the short filmic story of "Maverick" saving the day and getting the girl at the end has under Tom's firm insistence that a return to "Fightertown" shouldn't just be a lazy cash grab like Disney Star Wars, but demand everyone be at the top of their game. A compelling enough narrative, while it does echo strands from the 1986 film is comfortable to get into it after several minutes. The whole cast simply didn't follow the trend of most of Hollywood's films today in bringing in the legacy characters to be humiliated and disgraced for the sake of a new younger cast that takes up the baton. It easily could've gone in that direction so many times, but thankful the direction and script thought better of it and instead the younger cast members were a very pleasant surprise. If I were to mark the film down somewhere, it would be the Jennifer Connelly character being the weakest part of the film and didn't need to be in it, purely there as love interest for Maverick at some point between the two films that was unseen. What would have been better and made more sense would've been to bring back Kelly McGillis, but understandably she isn't in the best of health and reports that she just wasn't even asked back which is very sad. Back in 1986 it was the legendary F-14 Tomcats that stole the show from a younger rising star with the dazzling smile, 36 years later it's the greatest action star of the past 30 years that now upstages the newer F-18 Super Hornet jets, as amazing as the aerial stunts are and they are real, the true star for two hours is Tom Cruise himself. No longer needs to prove it, he just turns up and shows why he's the best in the business. 10/10.

I think I can speak for most to say that sequel did not disappoint. It was very good, but IMO, it had some issues, which could have been fixed with ease...The bad:
Introduction scenes had no relation to actual movie...I would have preferred to see that Admiral catch him 'dating' his wife. It would have been more interesting...Love story had no real meaning or even chemistry. It led nowhere, except for having a good looking girl. It felt it was an after thought.Few slow mo, gratuitous shots in the cockpit could have been edited out.Development of other pilots was non-existent and felt almost wasteful.Ending was super unrealistic too,,,The good:
Val Kilmer scenes/references were great.Sound, action, excellent
Dialogue above averageOverall, enjoyable and didnt waste time. Fast paced as well.

reviews.review_title: Never been a fan of American military movies, and this reminded me why I'm not a fan
reviews.content: It was entertaining to watch, honestly I would have rated it 8 had it not been to multiple unrealistic scenes. It has scenes which you would only make up in your head as a child, every time the main characters would face strong adversaries they overcome them by having their friends save them at the last millisecond. It was fun when it first happened, but not when the whole movie is about that. This movie makes Marvel movies look good.

So, you want to know how to make a great movie with thrilling action, a good story, and a diverse cast without shoving it down your throat sideways? Here it is. Rewatch the original Top Gun first if it's been a while, then sit back and enjoy a well paced, emotional ride.
Just awesome. Tom Cruise is great. Beautifully shot. The story could be better, but everything else is spot on. I wish there was a third installment!!!
It's quite fun, but it's playing with so much nostalgia that if you're not already in love with Tom Cruise, theyrs not much here for you. Even the soiundtrack is rather forgettable.

reviews.review_title: I was smiling and fist-pumping throughout
reviews.content: Now I am a massive aviation fanboy so this movie was tailor-made for me, but still ... that was epic! The action was superb it had all the emotions and played just the perfect amount of nostalgia beats from the first movie. Granted there were obviously some unrealistic bits, but they never broke my emersion ... and cmon its a movie. Plus you got Tom Cruise in a plane, Tom Cruise on a bike and he even got his contractual running in. What more could you want?

reviews.review_title: Meant For The Big Screen... and Screen X
reviews.content: Short and sweet, no spoilers.Builds off of original, which I saw in theaters as a child, and adds to the story without being mucked in too much cheesiness. This time Tom brings his own flying skills, his personal P51, a good cast, Bruckheimer and director Joseph Kosinski, who Tom made Oblivion with. Already off to a good start.There is an undeniable sentimentality that comes with a sequel 36 years later. It has the requisite Americana heritage - his motorcycle from the original, aviator's, bomber jacket, Hard Deck bar, shirtless American sports scenes, Ice Man - and patriotic mission which pitches Maverick into the fold once again. I will ignore further story details, which I find rather unnecessary to disclose. That'll be for you to discover.What does matter is that the action and stunts in this movie were absolutely stunning. Kosinski did an amazing job capturing the scenes and translating the imagery in his unique stylistic and cinematic way. If you are a fan of Oblivion's artful delivery, you will not be disappointed here.Storywise, sure... I can bang on critical about a few things. One being that I'm not so big on what the particular political war aims were. BUT... in a perfect USA, where we actually defend instead of act as henchmen for the globalist system, I could imagine what America should be and that the enemy is a shadowy black helmeted robot. But, personal politics need no place here for any viewer. It's just plane fun (see what I did there?). I was so immersed, like the original, that I once again emerged ready to pump some weights, buy some toothpicks, and attempt to enroll in Top Gun.Was it better than the original you ask? Yes. On every level.It only made sense to watch this in Screen X which project peripheral imagery on the sides of the theater walls, bring the audience inside the movie and cockpits. So if your theater has it, don't watch it any other way.

I enjoyed this movie. Let's make that clear. Watching this in a cinema with Dolby Atmos really makes you tremble in your seat. Most of the voters for this movie probably like fighter jets or/and are a big fan of the first movie. And that will explain the high numbers of 9/10 voters.The story isn't very good. It's predictable and has cliches. And while i'm not a fighter jet pilot I am pretty sure that many of the manouvers they make or impossible or extremely dangerous. Flying upside down while looking into the cockpit of another jet? Probably impossible unless both pilots are actively trained into doing this manoeuvre. Flying up between to other jets who are close together in formation. Extremely dangerous. With speeds like that this would be a very tight spot to move your jet through without hitting anything. But hey, it's a movie so i'll buy it.The mission itself is a mysterie to me. Why send in fighter jets when you have tomahawk missiles who can probably do a better job. And why does the enemy place surface-to-air missiles like that? Sometimes 3 launch sites right next to each other and all in a straight line to the mountain where the actual target resides. So far for stealth operations, the missiles sites are practically pointing right at your important target. I would say, if you want to use jets for this operation then fly around and attack from the other side because there are NO missiles there.Dying is also not possible in this movie. Mach 10 breaking apart with your test plane? No problem. Flying back without flares to save your buddy? Just do it! And of course, when you are about to get shot down a buddy pops up to save the day. The enemy didn't notice that he was being target at all.

Plot: 8/10
Acting: 8/10
Cinematography: 7/7
Score: 4/5
Enjoyable: 1/1
= 85/100Favorite Character: Maverick (Tom Cruise)Favorite Scene: The MissionFavorite Quote: "It's Not The Plane, It's The Pilot." - Maverick.

reviews.review_title: I'll be seeing it more than once!
reviews.content: Just, wow! Brilliantly written with the perfect blend of nostalgia and new, and great actors for each role. It succeeds where many movies have failed over the years recently : that is, it tells the human story of friendship, devotion and vulnerability instead of relying heavily on special effects with a story void of anything real. Oh, and the flying scenes are kind of incredible too! Thank you #TomCruise for making this incredible movie, it was well worth the wait!

reviews.review_title: Tom Cruise back at his best
reviews.content: I waited a long time to see this film and was very sceptical about it being anything near the original. Well within 5 mins of the movie started I was hooked very very good film with loads of pointers to the original. The air shots were amazing and the story was good to highly recommend anyone to watch this movie. I FEEL THE NEEED THE NEED FOR SPEED :-)

reviews.review_title: Good fun. But it's just Star Wars IV
reviews.content: I suppose this movie did what it was supposed to do. It did get ludicrous towards the end though. Overall it was good fun, if not extremely derivative.I won't give too much away. But watch the movie with these parallels in mind;Tom Cruise = Obi Wan KenobiVal Kilmer = YodaRooster = Luke SkywalkerRussian Base (they don't come out and say it, but it's clearly Russian) = Death Star.

reviews.review_title: What we've been missing for the last few years...
reviews.content: 'Top Gun: Maverick' isn't an Oscar winning movie. It isn't some some deep and meaningful societal drama. It isn't a superhero movie filled with mindless effects, bland characters and social messaging... Thank goodness!'Top Gun: Maverick' is what has been missing from the cinema in recent years... A movie with great characters who you want to root for. Action and adventure, a dash of romance, a classic hero, and a patriotic story of good vs evil. No agendas, no lecturing, just good old-fashioned heroic fun with heart.It hits all the marks, from the nostalgia nods (without drowning in them), through to being a sequel that adds to the original without detracting from it. The character of Maverick finally grows up, but without feeling like he's been a useless man-child in the interim. There are touching moments, most notably with Val Kilmer, and an appropriate level of romance to round out Maverick's character arc. The side characters are all enjoyable clichés of the best kind, ergo the type that are established quickly and well, and that you like and enjoy.One factor that makes this all even more enjoyable is that Maverick is _still_ the best-of-the-best (With Iceman possibly equal...). He's not portrayed as the tired 'ace' who has to move aside for the newer, younger, superior hero. No, he's just the best. And that provides the film with a huge, grinning sense of satisfaction.The plot itself is nothing original, but it didn't need to be. It's a mix of inspiration from the original film, with a dash of Star Wars and even a little Iron Eagle thrown into the mix. The heart of it is Maverick finally finding a home, and dealing with the fallout from losing his best friend (Goose) in the original, and the repercussions it had on Goose's son.From a visual standpoint, the film is appropriately stylish and the hefty dose of real aircraft footage, mixed with the effects sequences, helps to sell the film far more successfully than if it had been done with digital effects alone.If I had one complaint, it would be that the music just isn't up to the original. Hans Zimmer does the job, and it works, but outside of Harold Faltermeyer's original main theme, only the 'Darkstar' music is particularly note-worthy. Meanwhile, the integrated songs don't capture the new era the way the original did, but how could they? However, the soundtrack is a minimal complaint.Ultimately, 'Top Gun: Maverick' succeeds by being all that it needed to be, without trying to shoehorn in anything else. It tells a new story but honours its origins and leaves the viewer thoroughly satisfied.

First, I haven't watched the original. Probably will now. Because I thought this was an excellent movie. I'm pretty sure half of the flying we see isn't possible and, of course, the last half hour includes a ridiculously unlikely set of events. But it's a movie, not a documentary. And this one stuck to the basics. I didn't have to groan through any of the usual bits of virtue signalling. In 95% of other movies, there would have been a compulsory gay relationship squeezed in, maybe a trans character, some comments about the evils of capitalism and definitely apologies for American history. Here we just got the movie, and just the movie. Maybe in some other era, back when all movies focused on entertainment rather than preaching, I might have scored this a respectable 6 or 7, but in a world of boring super hero nonsense and inane political lectures, this stands out as one of the best of 2022 and maybe the very 2022.

The Oscar's, it's a perfectly balanced masterpiece, I was completely speechless at the end of this film, it was so good on so many different levels, an emotional rollercoaster. I couldn't even consider rating this less than 10/10.

reviews.review_title: 9.9 There's no such thing as perfect, but this movie almost is!
reviews.content: A must see in Theaters! What a sequel should be!A total masterpiece!Usually I can always pinpoint something that could be better in a movie, but I'm finding it very hard here!The way the movie was filmed is also an amazing comeback to real honest to god, good old times, true, not only CGI, and green screens. The main actors were in actual real honest to god flying fighter jets, with real reaction to what is truly happening to them while flying.As a ex-pilot(single engine nothing comparable to these folks) I've rarely seen a movie that captures the beauty of flying like this movie has, and then some! I was seriously impressed.The way they were able to bring us a lot of similar shots and scenes as the 1st movie was beautifully done without making it corny like some movies end up doing, it had just enough to be amazing!The actors did a great job here, The scenery is beautiful, the cinematography is amazing, The action at it's best! The music just the way you need and want it!I don't know anyone that couldn't enjoy this Masterpiece!But for the immersion, the amazing "flying" feeling the movie offers, the music, Go see this in Theaters! And if they have them special seats, better sound, go for it.. this movie is worth it!Enjoy folks!

reviews.review_title: Only worth watching in the cinema
reviews.content: The characters are one dimensional, the script is poorly written, the dialogues are cliché, and the love line is unnecessary. The only time I empathised with the characters was during flashbacks from the original Top Gun.BUT all flight scenes and stunts are absolutely breathtaking. It's like you're in the cockpit with the pilots, impossible to look away. Overall, nothing like the first Top Gun but worth watching in the cinema.

reviews.review_title: The same original Topgun with a full cast and outstanding action sequences
reviews.content: The first movie is a timeless classic, but the sequel is seriously epic. I never see Tom Cruise with that incredible performance again even he's getting older, Maverick is on top of the movie because he's the main point.There is a lot of remarkable aspects of the movie after over 30 years from the first one, like the action scenarios, the plane flying scenes and the story driven which is truly amazing, and if you watching it at the cinema it really gives a cool feeling.

Special thanks to the Captain (Tom Cruise) Thank you Mr. And your team for demonstrating forgiveness especially the Captain (Tom Cruise) and his student Rooster (Miles Teller) you have given a extraordinary performance in terms of demonstrating the meaning of the word FORGIVENESS.I have picked up so much information in this movie, It can take the whole A4 size of a page maybe two or three.I do not mind watching the movie over and over until you come with the third Top Gun : Maverick 3.I do not have any excuses with this movie from start to finish the story line is perfect it does not leave you with questions but a good feeling thanks as well to the director, the producers, the characters and everyone who put their effort in making sure that this movie ( Top Gun : Maverick) becomes a BULL'S EYE.

reviews.review_title: Maverick's next tour-of-duty = Low Earth Orbit?
reviews.content: I enjoyed TG-M much more than I had anticipated. It exceeded the TG original in so many ways: character casting & depth, story-line, and of course aerial sequences. And I found myself after seeing it with a greater appreciation for our military - in all their functions.But now I wonder what will be Maverick's next tour-of-duty? I have heard rumors that Mr. Cruise may want to spend time on the International Space Station (ISS). So filming on that Low Earth Orbit (LEO) platform brings to my mind many different story-line possibilities. Of course, those could involve civilian and/or military Earthlings and/or extraterrestrials. And I'd be happy to discuss my concepts with anyone.

Top Gun: Maverick accomplishes exactly what it sets out to do, taking the audience on a 120-minute emotional thrill ride and surpassing the original film in almost every facet.Whilst there are clear elements of nostalgia, they do not detract from the story, in which Cruise's expertly-acted fighter-pilot ace "Maverick" must confront and overcome past trauma in order to perform his duty and mend his broken relationships.Though the script was not particularly notable, powerful lines were delivered and the actors seemed to sink into their roles, conveying a lot of meaning through non-verbal communication. It also helped that many of the supporting characters went through their own minor arcs. All this aided by a stellar soundtrack well suited to an epic blockbuster. In addition, I do not mind the presence of an acceptable level of old-school Hollywood cheese/cliche in the plot and script; we are reminded that this is a movie made for the purposes of entertainment, and boy does it pay off in spades.What can I say about that action that hasn't already been said? Go and watch this film. The final act is an absolute goldmine of all-time wide-eyed cinematic awe, and that's not to undersell the earlier action scenes.Full of heart and surely satisfying fans of the original whilst also forging a new path for the franchise, Top Gun: Maverick was an immensely enjoyable and satisfying experience. I will be re-watching it multiple times into the future.

reviews.review_title: One of the best blockbuster sequels in years and it's so much fun.
reviews.content: Director Joseph Kosinski has had an interesting career in Hollywood. He made his debut with the long awaited sequel TRON: LEGACY. I found it visually stunning but a bit shallow. His next film was with Tom Cruise and it was a sci-fi movie called Oblivion and I liked it fine. His third movie was a firefighting drama called ONLY THE BRAVE and it was shockingly good. Made my top movie list for 2017. And now we have his latest film TOP GUN MAVERICK which is also a sequel that was long delayed for reasons including the pandemic.And it is bloody brilliant filmmaking.This is one of the best blockbuster sequels in years. And I would argue that it is even better than the original TOP GUN. The 1986 movie is a nice slice of 1980s cheese and it proudly flaunts its brash machismo no matter how campy it looks today. And the sequel TOP GUN: MAVERICK does contain a lot of that same robust filmmaking but also it lends some depth to its characters along the way.Tom Cruise is in fine form as an older and wiser Captain Pete 'Maverick' Mitchell who is beckoned once again to the elite academy known as Top Gun. His task is to train a rowdy group of younger pilots for a top secret mission. One of the recruits is his deceased friend's grown son (Miles Teller) who feels some resentment towards Maverick. The other students are either too cautious or too arrogant but Maverick has to whip them into shape to meet an impending deadline.The supporting cast is uniformly good. Miles Teller is a natural fit for playing Goose's son Rooster. He even looks a bit like Anthony Edwards. Glen Powell is a riot as the cocky rival nicknamed Hangman. The other students are not quite as prominent but they're all likable people. Jennifer Connelly is basically the love interest for Tom Cruise to court but they have solid chemistry together. Jon Hamm plays Tom Cruise's snobbish superior officer but his shift to a more genial personality feels genuine enough.As has been reported, the highlight of the movie is the flying sequences. I am not exaggerating when I state that these are probably the most exciting flying scenes put on film in years. And it is elevated by the film crew actually using real fighter jets in these scenes. The dogfights and training scenes are directed in masterful style by Joseph Kosinski.One of the best elements of the movie that I did not expect is that it does not take easy shortcuts. You think something is being telegraphed or foreshadowed. But then the opposite happens and you feel rewarded for it instead of cheated. Well done to the cast and crew for making such a spectacular piece of popcorn entertainment.

Men i don't know how so many people found this movie actually very good!!It has all the cliche's of a happy ending story and propaganda, and with such a ridiculous scenario with many holes for example: Only the writers now how Maverick survived from the crash without getting hurt (even to break a finger :) ). Also it's impossible in reality for such an ancient airplane (F-14 Tomcat) to shoot down a more sophisticated plane.For my taste it would be a good movie if Maverick was killed at the end (i hoped for this scenario when he said goodbye before the mission but my hopes proved false). Does Hollywood stick to such scenarios for fear of upsetting the good American citizen or the US Pentagon?

After 36 years, Tom Cruise returns in one of his most iconic rolls in an effort to satiate our need for speed. Straight to the point. It's hard enough to get a hit film, putting together a sequel that equals let alone surpasses the original is harder still. Cruise and company (Jerry Bruckheimer produces again but also credits former partner Don Simpson who died in 1996) have done precisely that in "Top Gun: Maverick".In short:Want nostalgia?Got it!Well timed humor?Check!Amazing practical visual effects?Double check! The submersive cockpit camera is over the top. Tossing aside the green screen pays major dividends."Top Gun: Maverick" is a perfect blending of the original, from music, characters, and various call back/parallels and the next generation of Naval aviators. From beginning to end this film is a heart pumping thrill ride that keeps you on the edge of your seat combined with a high-stakes storyline filled with surprisingly emotional depth, heart, and relevance.Incredible direction, stellar pacing, fantastic acting, extraordinary cinematography and sound, "TGM" is a 2-hour 11-minute triumph. "Top Gun: Maverick" has enough heart and soul for two films and satisfies in EVERY possible aspect.So, dust off your Ray Ban Aviators, hit the highway to the danger zone and check out "Top Gun: Maverick" on the big screen the way it's intended. You won't be disappointed."Top Gun: Maverick" is a full throttle mach 10 film experience.

If you didn't see the first part, see it first before experiencing this one ,this part just does what a sequel should do - which in this case means Doubling down on the Incredible Visuals ,Thrills and Emotions that made the topgun so much Fun!And you just can watch it for one man the maverick himself TomCruise ,he is keep finding ways to entertain to the highest level and this role he just done it with heartwarming emotions !Excellent making and directions and background score is perfect to the story pacing and all cast done terrific job !!

Wow ! What the hoopla over the TG sequel ? I just dont understand given how cheesy this movie is. UNORIGINAL !Lets see: the mission is to fly trough a canyon and missle hit a small target, where have i seen that scenirio ? The only things missing from this movie is Lord Vader and the Deathstar !The 1st Top Gun was a great movie, only problem it had was that it couldnt tie its action to real world military combat. However, this Maverick movie is made in the backdrop of Afgan war, ya think this move would have awesome dogfight action. Instead we got the US military destroying the Death Star !There arnt many good lilitary movie aviation movies out there ! Even "Stealth" was a better movie !Tom and his really crew blew this one !!!

I really enjoyed this movie despite not seeing the first one until right before I saw this movie. Would see again. 10/10. There are a few minor issues with the technology, but it is not noticeable for most.

reviews.review_title: A Movie Made By True Cinematic Professionals!!!
reviews.content: An instant timeless classic made by people who know how to create the ultimate moviegoer experience. I LOVED every second of this extraordinary film and just like old school Maverick had to come back and show the kids how it's done - Tom Cruise, Jerry Bruckheimer and company showed Hollywood how it's done! One can clearly see a lot of time, patience and cinematic expertise went into crafting this masterpiece. If you have not already watched this movie hold on to your hat you're are in for a thrill of a lifetime as the producers, cast and crew knocked this one out of the galaxy. In a word EXCITING!

reviews.review_title: Old-fashioned but packed with forces, speed, dynamics!
reviews.content: It is a sequel to the 1986's Top Gun movie. Having watched the 1986's is an advantage to understanding the relationship between Maverick and Penny, and also the friendship with Iceman. It is still alright to watch the 2022's without seeing the 1986's. Basically, the plot touches on romance, friendship, or bromance (brother + romance) and passion!The flow of the first half is a bit slow and 'old-fashioned', but it picks up fast in the second half, and it just blows you away!The movie carries quite a bit of nostalgia effects, like an 80's movie, slow yet steady. Once all the characters are well introduced... the movie goes well and takes you on a speedy ride.The visuals of the fighter jet scenes are superb! To those who "NEED FOR SPEED", this is the one! I love the action sequences of low-altitude flights and airborne dogfights, they are exciting, and breathtaking! It's also smart to direct audiences towards a predictable outcome, yet it turns out to be a different ending, which is a good catch!The young-flyers (secondary characters) were made extra in this movie. Most of them play very small side-roles, and their personalities are NOT outstanding enough to impress audiences, except Rooster.The emotional value is there, BUT it's very much 'touch-n-go", not involving and engaging enough to touch one's heart.I gave 3.5 out of 5.0. It's definitely worth your money to watch it on the big screen, or I shall say.. you should watch it in the cinema, in order to enjoy the visual and sound effect! Perhaps D-BOX (motion-seat) will give you a better sensation when it moves with the fighter jet!

Unsure why this has been so highly reviewed. The action in it was great, but it's like they were trying to mesh transformers and the notebook together, whilst unintentionally making it a comedy. The amount of woeful advice quotes, truly awful acting and delightfully homoerotic football is astounding.

reviews.review_title: I saw the score and I thought it was going to be better ....BUT....
reviews.content: Its a good movie but at the same time nothing special to be honest. The story is what you'd expect from a Hollywood sequel.There were unanswered scenes and questionable things.No pilot would have ever done what Rooster did by going back and saving Maverick. That just killed his career by defying serious orders and losing a plane. They did not show anything of what his punishment ended up to be. This stuff happens only in Hollywood movies btw....Also I don't understand if its cheap writing or some American thing. But what is it with most American movies that there is always big family drama? There is always someone who hates someone else and blaming him/her for losing a family member and then they make up in the end. Its really childish and tiresome.The drama between Maverick and Rooster was so darn boring. It made no sense Maverick was still punishing himself for what happened. These pilots can't guarantee their lives either during training or in real combat. Just accept it and stop making boring drama.When Maverick choose Rooster over Hangman for the mission it was expected from the first minute of the movie that this was going to happen. Hangman was the clear choice. But Maverick went with feelings rather than logic. What is this a Disney movie for kindergarten?There were also not much back story to who is behind the nuclear target and how they found out. They could have focused on more interesting stuff rather than party and trash talk.Lots of boring party scenes and off course just like in the first movie there has to be two dudes who compete and hate each other. By that I mean Rooster and Hangman. I also wonder if this is an American thing or just Hollywood.Sometimes I think, 7/10 is too much to be honest. But just out of love for the franchise I'll let it be a 7.0.There are other things I could mention but I don't like mentioning everything.

I get the fan service and how this movie tickles all the same nerves the original did. I also get Tom Cruise's handsome mug and great acting.But if you leave it aside amd focus on the plot amd writing, this is almost a mediocre B-Movie.1. What's up with the plot? A team of fighter pilots needs to navigate a perilous route full of anti-air defenses and drop a bomb into a narrow tunnel leading to something very valuable to the enemy. Seriously? Me and my 15 yo son were laughing loud - thanks the authors didn't bring a Death Star into the movie.2. Trying to avoid mentioning who "the enemy" is or any motivation whatsoever for carrying out an air raid on a foreign soil makes it all look weak and cartoonish. "the enemy" flying both Russian SU-57s (like there's more than one country operating those now) and American F-14s is hilarious.3. Why would you fly training missions in a real canyon with a risk of losing a pilot or an aircraft if you have the software able to plot the course and track how close the plane is?4. The whole training process sequence is bland. The Navy brings in this super pilot, makes a big deal of his appearance, and what does he bring to the table? Drills one 2 min course with the team and delivers motivational speeches? Feels like a lost opportunity - can we not show what a military leadership would look like? Training a band of characters to become a team is such a theme to explore.
Watched this film 6 times in the cinemas! Can't get enough, well produced from Tom Cruise. However, one thing that I enjoyed was the character development. I definitely recommended 🔥

No CGI? Why? It certainly looked like CGI except of course the boring story, the less than believable mission, the endless platitudes, the matcho military disgusting attitudes, the boy behaviours, the wrinkled man without one grey hair but hey some great planes action. So Tom Cruise can fly an F-18 woa, bravo man!

reviews.review_title: A movie to keep at the edge.
reviews.content: You will be holding your chair or coach while watching this. Great cinematography, you get immersed in the movie and the moments of exhaustion and extreme pressure.While the original is an old movie and the same effect can't be replicated, Tom Cruise did the impossible by making enjoyable movie in the spirit of the first one.Memories of the old pass and living on the edge, Maverick faced his demons and come on top of his fears.I found few scenes not on point, but those are done as script, I'm sure Top Gun pilots knows more about how F -14 works, the only flaw was that they made the rest of the pilots inferior 0_o.

reviews.review_title: A movie that will bring back to the theaters
reviews.content: This movie was amazing and it combined heart racing actions scenes and heart warming moments. This movie will keep you on your toes. I loved the intensity in the actors performances, it really kept the audience engaged with the movie. This is definitely a movie worth seeing at least once.

Sequels seldom deliver. This one did and then some. The action was unmatched, but more so the story was fresh, the script showed how Pete Mitchell had grown and become human, capable of love and admiration.It was genius how they included Iceman in the movie, and truly touching the relationship that developed over the past 30-plus years between the two heroic pilots. That was my favorite part of the movie.I thought casting a near look-alike Goose was perfect also.Jennifer Connelly was great in her role. I liked how in her role she almost always referred to Pete rather than Mav, accentuating the fact that he was a human with feelings and not just some jet jockey chasing the next big thrill.We saw this in a movie theater meant for a movie like this. Do yourself a favor and don't wait for DVD or in home streaming. It just won't be the same.

Watching this movie three times in a row and possibly more times. I can truly say that this film checked all the boxes in terms of what the people want in a film. It had action, adventure, heart felt moments, excellent music and directing. In other words this movie had it all. The film was breath taking and honestly was awesome to watch again and again. This is one of the movies where in each time you watch it, you seem to always either learn something new or catch something exciting. Top Gun: Maverick is a movie that should be highlighted as a theme park attraction, or even an Oscar award winning film. This movie should go down as one of the best films of all time.

What a beautiful sequel! Truly a masterpiece that we needed. It is indeed one of the best sequels of all time.The first film was original, but this one is just beautiful. Every scene, every shot, every dialogue is carefully been taken care of.For a start the action sequences either in planes or not are brilliant! Every moment you can feel you're a character in the film involved in the situation and that you have to do something to help. It's simply amazing in that aspect.Also the characters are very diverse and funny, everyone has a unique style and personality that makes you love them.The magnificent relationships between all of the characters are interesting and important, specially those that involve Maverick.The acting performances are just beautiful. Everybody makes an excellent job. One of my favorite movies of all time.

This movie is MINDBLOWINGLY AWESOME! I wish I could give it 10+ rating! It's the best movie I've ever seen in my life so far. I went with my 80+ year old dad & mum and they both absolutely loved it as much as did! Not a single awkward moment watching with my family. Truly a fun & excitement filled movie!The story, the action, the stunts, the direction, the dialogues!!! MWAH!I want to kiss this movie's sound technician as they made the movie come alive with all the amazing dialogues perfectly legible even when the action was breaking Mach 10 levels!None of your typical boring run of the mill boring superhero stuff which is so common nowadays, it TOOK ME BACK TO THE GOOD OLD DAYS!KISS KISS BANG BANG ... TOM CRUISE HAS SURPASSED HIMSELF AND EVERYONE ELSE!!!

reviews.review_title: Was good, but a bit slow and cringey in places
reviews.content: Great cinematography, great flying, with a few comedy moments.But I felt a bit slow in places and too many references to the previous film. Volley ball scene (oh dear), great balls of fire on the piano, riding your bike next to the run way, talk to me "Turkey, or whatever your silly name is", film intro pretty much identical to the prior film, same guy who thinks he's the best, a level of rivalry between the pilots, who now love each other at the Cheesy ending.

I was worried because really enjoyed the first one and it didn't disappoint, I thought this movie was fantastic , best movie I've seen for a long long time and I've already booked to see it again . Nice to see it wasn't all CGI . Well worth a watch.
Amusing you don't get bored if you can sustain watching.I mus say something else to fulfill the mandate of writing at list 150 characters but don't bother to read it.

reviews.review_title: Same as original with deleted scenes
reviews.content: Well that was the Tom cruise show for sure. Zero character development. Should have made rooster main character. But literally the same movie almost scene by scene of the original.
Well constructed plenty of action.worth the wait lots of stunts been to see in the cinema a few times and still would see it again best in the big screen.

reviews.review_title: Fun but very flawed and overhyped
reviews.content:
OK to watch, but so many flaws... Too many Deus Ex moments and inconsistencies, eve straight out nonsense...
The mission is the copy of "Iron Eagle 2" movie. And what, the enemy can afford 5th generation fighters, but still uses 1960s Soviet SAMs? Get shot down and enemy sends one chopper for search? Oh, and there is also a conveniently parked F-14, fueled and armed with nobody attending it, not a soul?! 5th gen fighter uses thrust vector only once and then forgets he has it. Following an F-14 through canyon when he doesn't have to. Sneaking from behind on a fighter that has rear looking radar? Deploying flares to jam radar guided missiles?!And so on, too many utter nonsenses to count...
Still, it is entertaining to watch, no SJW messages shoved down your throat. It is a breath of fresh air.
I remember Top Gun bringing the shades fashion. A very young Tom Cruise.This one rises beyond expectations. Tom Cruise has delivered again. Great use of technology. Gripping and emotional altogether.

The film is undeniably a masterpiece. Beforehand I'd never seen any work from director Joseph Kosinski, although, after watching this it's fair to say I'm eager to see more work from him. The way he took a huge task like making a sequel out of one of the most classic 80's films out there and managed to make it as good, if not, even better than the first one is admirable and impressive. He made it feel like an 80's film, but at the same time had a modern-day feel about it too. The cast was certainly stellar and the performances from each and every one of the actors/actresses were phenomenal. Tom Cruise never fails to impress me and Miles Teller's portrayal of the son of Maverick's late best friend Goose was done to perfection. Although with performances such as War Dogs and Whiplash, it was expected. The cinematography and visual effects were stunning and you felt, not only, like you were in the 80s but like you were in a fighter jet!
