The pacing of the film was also terrific as well as the score.However, where it fails to meet the demands of the original film is where the soundtrack is concerned. Although it was nostalgic to hear the classical theme at the start and the end, as well as hearing a brief cameo of "danger zone", I can't help but miss tracks such as "take my breath away" during the romance scenes. This brings me to my second flaw. The romance aspect of the first film was spot on so the sequel shouldn't have been expected to live up to its predecessor. Therefore, I believe more of an attempt to develop the character of Peggy, would've been interesting to see. Although, it more than made up for it with the action scenes that were certainly more developed and exciting than the first one. And even if romance wasn't as developed in this film, the emotion was certainly still there and I believe it was more emotional than the first one.To conclude, the first one has greater aspects than this film in terms of the romantic development of characters and a more memorable and catchy soundtrack. However, it cannot be expected to be completely greater than the first film as it is a classic after all. Therefore to manage to make an action-packed, emotional, adrenaline-pumping sequel, was incredibly commendable and this is why it betters its predecessor and is a better-made film overall. I loved every minute of it and believe it cannot warrant anything below a 9/10.

I loved Top Gun when I was a kid. To this day it's still one of my favorite movies. I remember in 2019 when I heard about this new one I was so excited to see it. But then it kept getting delayed over and over until now. Let me tell you... the wait was worth it! I saw this on a 70' IMAX screen last night and loved it! It's a must see if you were a fan of the first one. 10/10 for me. Well done.

What is said after what was said, a cinematic masterpiece from a direector, a masterpiece. Thank you for this film. I brought back memories again. That's why, thanks to you, I don't know what to say, and with composer Hans Zimmer, what will we say?

reviews.review_title: A Movie that got to much hype
reviews.content: There's not much to say about this movie. It does have a good story, but it's another Tom Cruise movie. The first film is great; but this movie contains some of the old stuff that we've seen before. A bunch of fancy flying and character development that takes up most of the screen time. The scripting and the directing could've been a bit better. The flying scenes are all over the place, some look very realistic and other scenes look a bit cheesy. This kind of was shot in a Mission Impossible style, which I really wasn't crazy about. The acting was good, but the performances alone weren't enough for me to give this movie anything higher than a 5 and 1/2. This could've been a great sequel, if it was more carefully planned out and didn't have as much cheesy scripting. A lot of people love this movie and that's great. Like I said, this movie is good, but it's not something that I'm gonna jump up and down about. I only recommend this movie to viewers who love airplane movies and tv shows.

Wonderful film and existing. I have liked it .And I recommend anyone to watch this good film.Wonderful film and existing. I have liked it .And I recommend anyone to watch this good film.Wonderful film and existing. I have liked it .And I recommend anyone to watch this good film.

Top Gun: Maverick isn't great, nor is it amazing. It's absolutely EXCEPTIONAL. From the acting and stellar cast, to the fantastic visuals and superb soundtracks - this is a masterpiece. It's got the comedic moments and doesn't take itself too seriously and yet still manages to sustain that sense of thrill and excitement.10/10.

This movie is amazing! Genuine action and suspense. Great acting around the board. Make sure to watch in HD or 4K for maximum enjoyment. One of the few movies worth price of admission and more than once.

reviews.review_title: Don't be fooled by the high rating.
reviews.content: It was ok, but not a great movie. Predictable. Good flying scenes though. After hearing so much positive was really looking for a Forrest Gump, Shawshank. Not even close.

First off all i love Tom cruise acting and actions seen so if I love to see his movie.The seen and visuals are fantastic.I am highly critical of acting, screenwriting, scene transitions, cinematography, special effects, music, and directing. I watch movies for entertainment, and well, to critic. There have been few movies which I call great or amazing. That's how critical I am of films.However, after I watched it, here are my thoughts:I wish there was a way for me to give this movie 10 STARS.I was almost in tears watching it and thinking "This is the best movie I've EVER seen."Let me put this into perspective. I have seen the original 1986 Top Gun a few times throughout my life and LOVE it. The 1986 Top Gun is an incredible film and will be re-watched even today and loved over and over again. Top Gun 1986 has excellent writing, excellent screenplay, excellent acting, and nonstop suspense and drama!In other words, I LOVE Top Gun 1986.However, I somehow love Top Gun Maverick EVEN MORE.Love you Tom cruise waiting for MI:7.

reviews.review_title: One of the better Top Gun episodes
reviews.content: There's a lot of reaction shots in this movie. Indeed, half of it seem made of approving shots of its leading man mostly, but of the movie crowd pleasing trajectory itself. It would look ridiculous if it bombed, so good for Cruise, Bruckheimer and Kosinski that it didn't. It is probably a good thing that it made its Cruise against the requel concept idea very much the text as it gives the movie something to chew on over and not get annoyed too much at how it just twists the template enough to let the egotist at center fight against passing the torch. His winning over how time operate in Hollywood surprising more effective than it should. No one on the young cast besides Powell register much, the father/son drama barely hangs there, and I have no idea why the script goes through the charade of pretending Maverick wasn't going to lead the mission from the start. I do appreciate that while Cruise seems like a terrible teacher, the movie goes so much over the mission, it adds a lot to the actual execution. Kosinski empty calories formalism is put to good use in a context that it is all about praising the precision of film execution (I laugh a lot at how much Jon Hamm is there as the ghost of prestige television), at same time its precision is very much of the kind that never do anything even slight outside of it. Those final 40 minutes do deliver good on that, some very good plane action. I like that this foregrounds danger and death enough to make it feel weightier than most current Hollywood spectacle (it also knows how to use Connelly on this regard, in this very conservative movie the promise of well-earned domesticity matters more than father/son reconciliation). The movie action is exciting because it feels like it actually has something at stake besides cathartic third act CGI destruction as it has become the basis from the last 17 years or so of Hollywood blockbuster movies, it is good telling detail that a lot of Cruise does as a pilot through the final action set piece is defensive maneuvering.

I was onboard with this heroic effort right up to when the comical objective of "the mission" was introduced to the audience. The question is, if this was a 'catch-us-up-to-Maverick' film, complete with modern weaponry, why on earth was this nihilistic mission the only way to achieve the objective? Upon mission reveal, I felt the movie shifted to a point-earning plot found only in a computer game, which will probably be available shortly. Not to mention, the perceived enemy once again remains so opaque, you never get a glimpse of their anatomy below the neck in a cockpit.Given the 36-years of sequel gap of Top Gun Maverick, you obviously start with fixating on the associations with Top Gun. You piece who is who, and what ties they had to the original. The "hard deck" rears its ugly head a little too much for my liking. The story thoughtlessly tidies up some loose ends and establish others. The scheme moves in eerily similar ways to 1986, yet they insist on taking you through the archetypal storylines of aged vs youth, middle aged vs ancient, and very young vs aged. At some point one wonders how many Admirals the Navy has and exactly what is the age limit for such a rank.Top Gun Maverick is technically flawless with realism beyond the typical CGI. The realism extends to the actors, who are truly having their lunch floating to their tonsils if they still have them. Cruise sees to the technical aspects and gives this version a polish that was seriously lacking in the original. The dogfights are exceptional, and the ultimate camaraderie is inevitable. TG Maverick is a very good film, but with a plot hole bigger than the sun. Alas, the mission however, was one for Force 10 from Navarone.

reviews.review_title: Consider Myself An Alpha Male... But I Cried
reviews.content: Yes. This movie brought tears to my eyes. I never thought I would cry in a movie theater, but the way Tom delivered in this movie was GOATED. Easily a top 10 movie ALL TIME.The patriotism in this movie was amazing as well. I love seeing the American flag throughout this movie; just so wholesome. This movie had NONE of the woke, "in your face" non-sense we've grown accustom to from Hollywood over the last few years.I grew up watching Tom as a kid and this one takes the cake. From Vanilla Sky, Mission Impossible, War of the Worlds, Minority Report. This one was something for the whole family to gather round and watch together. Tom was so honest a true to this role, it was absolutely awe inspiring.I believe that the director deserves a great level of respect as well for the way this story was told and brought to life. Tom and the director, Kosinski, both need an Oscar, Emmy, and Tony.

This was a really good follow up to Top Gun, but it definitely has flaws. Everything is excellent except Hollywood has to stop trying to make Miles Teller a thing, he has zero charisma and just always comes across as douchey. The political correctness was also laughable. The enemy is simply called "the enemy". There was also ZERO need for them to try and shoehorn a love story into the movie, though they only committed about 10 minutes of screen time to that. All in all, a great popcorn movie with some minor flaws, and one huge flaw(Teller). If you liked the first movie, you'll love this follow up. I'm not sure a third installment is necessary, but it will happen for money.

reviews.review_title: A Sequel worthy of the Top Gun name
reviews.content: It is rare for a sequel to do its predecessor justice while managing to have its own identity. This is one of the rare movies that does such. This movie is a strong film on its own, but it pays homage to what came before with the utmost respect. The cast is an excellent mix of returning actors from the origin along with standout additions. It's impressive that each member of the next generation of pilots is able to be so well characterized with, upon rewatching, rather little screen time. This masterpiece is made possible by involved giving their all towards a unified vision. This movie set out to be a worthy successor to its predecessor, and I'd say it accomplished its goal.

reviews.review_title: Hollywood Finally Makes A Movie For Fans
reviews.content: Hollywood, or perhaps just Tom and Jerry (Cruise/Bruckheimer), have decided to give the fans what we want. Entertaining action and drama, an original story, good acting and writing, AND NO POLITICS! It was so great to slip away for a couple of hours into the Top Gun world and just be entertained without having some Hollywood hypocrite jam a political message down my throat.

What's with all these over the top ratings and reviews of this mediocre movie - it suffers from the same illness star wars suffer - no real plot, rehashing old original idea and lines, lazy writing - heck, even TC looks bewildered through the ENTIRE movie, like he doesn't want to be there but the money pull is just too strong, I guess.

reviews.review_title: 8/10 realistically, but it means so much more than that
reviews.content: We have been given remakes. Reboots. Crappy, shoddy movies that don't understand what their betters were.And now, we have a sequel to Top Gun. A sequel, not a remake, not a reimagining, a pure sequel. As a sequel? Glorious. A master work of how to make a proper sequel. This is what we wanted, what we needed.As a movie? A bit cheesy, and predictable. All the tropes are there, there's no plot twist. But the end result? It works. It works *very well*. And those flying scenes are about as good as they get - no CGI, it's all real. Props to cinematography and stunts, that's one hell of a job.So realistically this movie is maybe a 7.5 out of 10. But spiritually it's flawless. I average that to 9 out of 10. Sounds reasonable to me, at least.Finally, one last word for Tom Cruise. Scientology or not, this gentleman has been providing us with top notch entertainment for close to 40 years. You won't get an Oscar any time soon, Tom... but in our minds, you are one of the greats. Frack academy recognition, you have our admiration, love, and respect. Kudos.

Predictable. Every hollywood action movie is the same, its like they follow the same template.I knew he would pick rooster and the girl. Soft porn on the beach to keep things interesting. Hollywood cant make movies anymore, they will eventually run out of movies they can remake.

Well it's been a long time coming, put your brains to off mode and enjoy!Beat movie I've seen in years, no it's not The Godfather (1 or 2 lol ) just enough nostalgia and a predictable script but it is FUN! Sit down and enjoy a real cinema(IMAX if you can)
Feast.

reviews.review_title: Are we talking about the same movie?!?
reviews.content: Lets summarize: reckless maneuver, last minute order levels up playing field, macho group dynamics and cheesy music in bar, pissing competition in class room, aerial sensationalism, funeral, hero complex and glorifying military, predictable (fairytale) ending. Now, am I talking about Top gun or Top gun maverick?They are made in the same format (it's the same movie, with a few nuances). Even, many of the frames are the same in both movies (the teacher enters...).Is entertainment so sh... bad, that past successful clichéd movies (safe predictability) are now viewed as great? That would explain all the positive reviews...

Top gun:Maverick is based on a true story of Duke Cunningham and his accomplishments during the Vietnam War in the air force. Top Gun is the highest earning film of 2022.It is a high energy funny film that also has friendship and romance so mostly anyone can watch it. It is an action movie but it's more about the deep feelings between pilots.One thing that makes top gun unique is the camera angles and camera movement, the camera is clear and sometimes it's like you're in your own plane which is really cool.PS This movie is PG-13 so be careful if you take your kids to watch Top Gun: Maverick.

reviews.review_title: Summer blockbusters are back with a Mach 10!
reviews.content: Summer blockbusters are back with a Mach 10!It's rare for a sequel to surpass and top expectations laid out by the initial movie but Maverick does exactly that and that some more.A great storyline, an amazing ensemble of talented actors, nostalgic 80's opening theme music, and a trip down memory lane makes this a worth wait. Saw it in IMAX and loved the film ratio and shot.Highly recommend it.

reviews.review_title: Finally a movie worth going to the movies
reviews.content: I am glad Tom Cruise is still making this film, the movie is entertaining from the beginning to the end and no cgi. Beautiful screen and sound. Hollywood should make more movies like this. The movie feels real.

Before I say anything about this film I must confess to be a great admirer of Tom Cruise. A younger version of myself decided early on not to like him, but time and time again he comes up with amazingly entertaining movies. That is why I was a little disappointed with this latest endeavour.Was I entertained while watching? Sometimes, but I also got bored and actually feel asleep during the "climatic" assault run.As I see it the problem is first of all with the story itself. It has a few good moments, but a lot of drawn out repetitive bits. The reason I fell asleep during the actual assault run was because I had seen this run practised about a gazillion times before in the preceding 2 hours. Also the film lacks character development and the acting was not very good. I couldn't have cared less if all the newbies had been shot down at the end of this film. The "young" pilot actors all looked as if they walked out of some fashion catalog and behaved like total cardboard tools. Maybe this is how real Navy aviators look and behave, but it didn't make for interesting viewing. Give me a young Steve Buscemi any day of the week. Also I felt the editing was not very good. Lots of drawn out boring repetitive bits with the constantly annoyed upper echelons. To my mind they could have cut at least 30 min and gotten a better film or alternatively developed the story and characters more and put 30 minutes of interesting viewing in there. One more gripe is that it was not very believable. In real life if 4 F-18's fly nap of the earth over an active combat zone and they get 20+ Sams fired at them at almost zero range simultaneously none are coming home.The good bits. I thought the first 30 minutes were interesting and Tom Cruise was good as usual. Jennifer Connolly still looks Cliff-tastic and although she is an amazing actress she did not get a chance to show it here. I did liked the unexpected Tomcat surprise and the actual dog fighting at the end.If you liked the original Top Gun go watch it for nostalgia's sake, but apart from that I wouldn't recommend.

reviews.review_title: Maverick is THE greatest movie ever made.
reviews.content: There! I said it! And I don't regret it. Thank you to all involved in the making of this masterpiece. I've thought for several years now that truly great cinema was dead. Maverick resurrected every feeling I've ever felt in a movie that was great. Tom cruise, you may be beat shh crazy, but you sure have delivered something to cherish for generations. Thank you, sir.

reviews.review_title: Not really getting the 10 scores !! You must be aviators
reviews.content: I love Tom cruise but i must say i was really disappointed with the whole plot of training pilots at top gun and then go on a mission n get home safe ,just like the 86' top gun !!!I mean i was'nt really entertained and was after 1 hour 30 minutes getting pissed off paying money for this boring show .Great flight scenes that's for sure ,but i just feel they coulda done so much more with this movie ,than just copy number 1 movie plot .Jennifer Connelly 51 years old and Tom Cruise 60 WOW they look great together and they performed as expected ,doing there job on auto pilot combined with a bunch of one liners . Maverick steals the show and so does Tom cruise .

reviews.review_title: Excellent movie I really liked it
reviews.content: It's a really incredible movie. I love family life and it was very nice. Thank you for making this type of movie. My whole family liked it. I'd also like to point out that I'm a big fan of Tom Cruise, an excellent actor, he always shows it off throughout the movie where acts, a very exciting moment because my dream is to be a pilot of these planes that are seen in the movie, really for me it was very exciting, it revives a feeling in me.All in: a pleasent surprise. If the story ends here, it is the best finale they ever could have pulled off. Whatever happens in the future, this movie made its work so right and so enjoyable (with a truly emotional ending in which I cried) and that's all that matters. This is a joyful, emotional throwback call that must be seen!
I saw Top Gun when I was 16. They did a great job with this film, and o believe with the added additional time used to polish the editing and script, there was no disappointment! Enjoy!

reviews.review_title: A very good sequel, maybe even better than the first "Top Gun"
reviews.content:
I don't get it why this review was declined at first. Do the review-revewers just toss a coin? Is it not allowed to review this film positively (to the bigger part)? Or is it because I said something about "US world police prop***anda"?Anyway:
I enjoyed this movie a lot. It has a straight and simple and yet captivating story and a lot of very good top tier action, and wich was done by using mostly practical effects and filmmaking and was not a CGI overkill, unlike so many blockbuster action movies nowadays.The movie also stands out as an example for a very good sequel, which might even be superior to the first movie.If you can see past the blatant and yet relatively sparingly inserted "US world police" prop***anda (which was in the first "Top Gun" as well), this movie can be a very fun ride for you, especially if you are into a somewhat cons*rv*tive action movie experience. Thank you, Tom Cruise, for giving us such a movie in the 2020ies!A very good sequel, maybe even better than the first "Top Gun".

reviews.review_title: A totally unnecessary monstrosity of movie
reviews.content: I usually try to avoid those American heroic self praising movies, but watched it while there was nothing better to watch this weekend. The plot is simple; the bad Iranians dare to build an uranium enriching plant, and the good American Air Force (we have the best fighter pilots in the world) destroying the plant.The movie itself had the usual cheesy side story of hero meets old flame and falls in love again.This were 2,5h of utter boredom. A movie as unnecessary as the plague.

Hands down, one of the best sequels of all time. It did a perfect job paying homage to the original, without overdoing it. I can't remember the last time a movie had me on the edge of my seat with my heart racing like that! Unbelievable film. Stop reading reviews and just go see it!

reviews.review_title: Just got into Top Gun last week.
reviews.content: After my friends boasting how amazing Top gun 2 was, I was tempted to go and watch it without ever seeing the first one. I was forced to watch the first, which I'm so glad I did because I could appreciate this so much more. A fan for life. Cinematic masterpiece. Amazing story. Can't recommend it high enough.

reviews.review_title: The sequel what was worth the wait
reviews.content: A film finally made for the fans of the original film and not for the woke agenda. My favourite film of the year so far. A must watch if you loved the original.
Adrenaline filled 2 hours. It kept me on the edge of my seat the whole time. Love to see a movie about military US men and women who makes America so great!

Yes, entertaining but certainly doesn't deserve to be rated so much higher than TopGun which was just so good and a break away from all the movies of its time. The soundtrack alone deserves a 10.TopGun Maverick does well to continue the story even if the mission is a makeover of the 1964 movie, 633 Squadron.All in all, entertaining but not as good as the ratings suggest.

Given the mixed, to be generous, results of reviving long dormant movie titles how good could this film really be? Pretty darn good it turns out.Of all the films to bring into the modern era Top Gun is on paper one of the hardest to mesh with current sensibilities. The America is bad ass spirit and corny dialogue that ruled the roost in 1986 just shouldn't work in 2022 but the filmmakers inject just enough 21st century flavour to deliver a blockbuster experience for everyone.The films success is down to two things, the moviestar charisma of Tom Cruise and the practical effects. People flying around in planes shouldn't be so thrilling but after years of someone standing in front of a green screen pretending to blast tennis balls on sticks there is no doubt the air of authenticity takes the action scenes to another level.The main challange the filmmakers face is finding suitable real world bad guys and a modern day mission requiring expert fighter pilots. The movie goes to laughable lengths to obsure who the enemy is but it is probably the right call. We settle for some small unamed rougue state backed by one of the also unamed big boys. The actual mission is, if course, ridiculously precise in what it requires but provides the perfect conditions for dramatic tension.Cheesy but plenty of fun, Maverick is better than it has any right to be.

reviews.review_title: YES! It is, empirically, that good
reviews.content: If you really want to know why, watch the extras. It IS that good! I do not work for anyone who will profit from the previous statement.Seriously though, the filming and what the actors did just to be able to not pass out during a VERY intense shoot, is flat-out amazing. I'm no pro at this, but I do have to say something sometimes. What Tom Cruise did here was push a large group of people to do something none of them dreamt of. And they dream for a living...then put dreams on moving pictures and WE love it. And every god and God said it was good and that they all LOVE movies too! Minimum character limit met!

The first halve of the movies it's warming up slowly. Nice to see the F-35 in the first seconds. One admirals daughter is a nice touch. But the same house and the same brand of car a bit much.Maverick still is Maverick.The second halve is funny but also exciting. Is it better than the first movie? I don't know. Gotta let this sink in but I don't think I will see this one more than 50 times.But is it worth it to watch? Yes absolutely!

The original was great fun but the ultra realistic cinematography is amazing.Watch films for pure entertainment, amazing stuff!! Top Gun! Another action movie in this year. The deployment of flares and the missile scenes and the sound effects associated with those really boost that thrilling factor.There's just too many superhero movies these days but here Tom cruise who absolutely drives this movie with his passion and energy.I loved the music, excellent action scenes and A surprising twist towards the end of the movie which I didn't expect.So yeah overall I definitely recommend that you go and watch this movie because it is just amazing.I have to say, Tom is in great shape for 60 years old.

reviews.review_title: NOT woke!!! Will never go broke.
reviews.content:
I did not think it was possible these days to produce any kind of Hollyweird film that was not hopelessly woke. I am down to paying for just one or two movies per year. However, I put this movie at the second best movie I have ever seen in my life.Tips:
1) Do NOT read one single spoiler. Don't even watch the trailers before seeing this film. Your overall experience will be enhanced 100 fold.2) Drive hours if necessary to see this in an IMAX theater. I have one of the best in the nation one mile from my house. Just lucky. Sit more to the rear. Sitting off to one side like I did is just fine.3) When the plot just gets insane and unbelievable, go with it. You will be glad you did.4) Bring a hanky. This old guy found it very emotional. I have seen the first film many times.Remember.... NO spoilers before you see this!!!

reviews.review_title: When was the last time the audience were so invested in a movie?!
reviews.content: All the hype was true, this was truly a wonderful movie experience. The last 30 minutes will go down in history as the best third act ever. Tom Cruise the last movie star kudos to you Sir.Watch it with your friends and then watch again with your family.

reviews.review_title: Most Realistic Aviation Movie produced to date
reviews.content: In current era of heavily CGI loaded content, keeping things as original and real as possible deserves huge respect and praise. Watched this movie 2 times and going for 3rd time.Exceptional storyline with seem less continuation to Original Top Gun (1986).

I loved this movie. I wanted to give it a ten but think it may be that I loved revisiting the characters and story so much. This movie stands on its own and was beautifully written. Lots of excitement and love the new class of Top Guns. Honestly, I was really pleased with how Val Kilmer is included and loved seeing IceMan again. Good stuff.

I absolutely loved this film . Definitely one of the best productions ever . One of my fave aspects about this film is the audiography . The sound design is beautiful. The colour scheme is really well touched . My only con would be that we don't really get to know about who they are against.

What a direction 😍.This movie is a blessing for defence enthusiasts. Some scenes of the movie will give u Goosebumps. Tom Cruise is doing complete justice to the role of Maverick, He is Calm and composed but on the other hand he is an Ardent Personnel of USA Air Force. U won't get bored of this movie even if u watch if 5 times. 1st half of the movie is slow as it try to make the ramp for the 2nd half.We should appreciate the director because there are so many scenes in this movie that will blow your mind and u will be amazed to see such mesmerizing and real life experience moments.Request to future generation,Keep this movie alive. 😇

I went into Top Gun Maverick with a lot of nervousness because we know sequels rarely outshine the original, but to my amazement, Tom Cruise and his gang have actually managed to do complete justice to the Top Gun brand. Sequels often go wrong in three areas which I think Top Gun Maverick got right1. Nostalgia- Right from the very first scene, you are transported back to 1986 when the first movie came out..and it's done so well!!.. not the cheesy flashbacks or remixed soundtracks..but instead, elements of the first movie brought in at the right time and place ..nothing too over the top. If there was anything that was a tad pretentious, it's probably the scene with Val Kilmer.. but then again Top Gun wouldn't be Top Gun if there was no Val Kilmer right?2. The Premise- In the first movie, aside from the adrenaline boost, when it came to storytelling, it felt a little flat in my opinion...But not 'Maverick'.. in addition to thrilling Adrenaline pumping sequences, the storytelling kept me engaged throughout with some timeless dialogues and funny scenes3. The ending- So how did they end it? Did Maverick die? Well, I won't spoil it but suffice to say, it was a satisfying end and to be honest a bit unexpected. This is where the movie shines for me and really went supersonic over the first one (excuse the pun)
All in all, Top Gun Maverick immersed me into a time when watching movies on the big screen was for that special experience while at the same time not diverging from story of this amazing character- Maverick.

The sequel we needed. Tom cruise pulled this movie way up top. Brilliant, an absolute thrill to watch the movie. The sequences were too close shot as we were flying. Overall cast great, great chemistry. Watch it in imax.

A Real Masterpiece for the ages. This Epic Blockbuster it's by far one of the greatest films ever made with minimal or just the necessary effects. Tom Cruise one of the greatest actors @ almost 60 gives a hell of a good movie. Hans Zimmer masterful on the soundtrack & Jerry Bruckheimer once again it's the King!!...

reviews.review_title: Maverick outshines TopGun'86 ... what a Sequel !!! It took My Breath away !!!
reviews.content: Well generally I don't give a 10/10 that easily ... in fact I think I must've given it to just 2-3 films or intend to give. But Top Gun Maverick is Mindblowing, in fact it outshines Topgun ... what a Sequel !!! It Actually took My Breath away !!!Though We should never compare TopGun'86 with Maverick... Coz Top Gun Is a Cult and Maverick was made only because Top Gun was one of the Best movie that was ever made and it still rules our Hearts.Also Maverick is the Best Homage ever given to a Director. Yes, Sir Tony Scott U truly deserve this for the Masterpiece U've created almost 4 decades back.Maverick was Good, but No one can match Sir, Tony Scott's Stylized Direction... His Films were in fact are, Truly Stylish and Engaging... watch any of his Films and U'll second me on this. The opening Sequence in Top Gun'86, where planes are landing and Danger zone is played in the backdrop, is one of the Best and the most stylish opening sequences ever shot... Ohhh the Silhouette shots were out of the world. And one secret I just wanna share, It's one of the many reasons I became a Filmmaker. This is what true Inspiration is !!! Thank U Sir Tony Scott, fr being a teacher to Me. (That's why I call him My 'Sir')And to Sum up, 'This is How Cinema should be made... Just Pure Cinema !!! Where U cry, Laugh, Whistle, where Ur Heart keeps pounding on every Action Scene'. And the Best and the Last one, I still Envy Tom Cruise, coz His Smile Still can Kill Many Ladies. But Guy's I can Live with it ;)I had almost forgotten the feel to Experience Cinema in Real !!! So Thank U Team Maverick for making Us Experience and Emotionally Feel a Movie after So many Years !!!I Salute, Director Joseph Kosinski, for making a MindBlowing Sequel, by keeping the Soul & Nostalgia of the Original TopGun'86 intact.Also I would like to Thank... the one & Only Jerry Bruckheimer, for entertaining Us & Producing some of the Best Movies ever made, over the years.TopGun Maverick is Truly a Cinematic Experience !!!
Best movie of airplanes, best sequel or one of the best, excellent soundtrack, outstanding stunts.In the end, I hope for more scenes and sequel.Just brutal.
Far better than the original one from 1986. Exceeds it in so many aspects: story building, emotions, action scenes, suspense... Just being blown away by this true blockbuster! Highly recommended!

Flight scenes are amazing,acting was superb,dialogue and music was great,opening scene was amazing,it did a perfect job and balancing the vibes from the first movie with the beach scene and the opening to the bike scenes and also on the new story and the new characters that brought so much to the mix.

You can literally see the dedication that Tom has for film-making during the filming sequences- being able to see the physical pain that he is putting himself through for the role. Miles Teller also delivers a performance on par with the intensity he shows in 'Whiplash'.The action scenes are thrilling and the soundtrack matches perfectly, with some great 80's throwback songs.However, the love interest side-plot didn't feel entirely necessary and I would have liked to have seen more female characters in the film, it feels a bit too much of a boys club at times.Definitely worth a watch on the big screen!

reviews.review_title: If tom cruise doesn't get a oscar for this film iv lost faith in oscars!
reviews.content: What a let me say this fantastic film i'm not going to give in spoilers away but i have to say what a amazing film.But please watch with a open heart and with absolute no distractions amazing is all i have to say!
Best action movie i have watched ever , everyone must watch this action masterpiece , don't die without watching TOPGUN MAVERICK , this is the only way...

Totally worth seeing in theaters. I've done it two times myself. I brought my wife the first time and she absolutely loved it. Then I brought my dad and my two brothers and they also enjoyed it. Pure entertainment, no political wokeness, no nudity. Much, much better than the first movie.
This movie exceeded my expectations in every way. Great Story, The flying sequences kept you on the edge of your seat, the cast fit perfectly, etc... It was worth the wait.

reviews.review_title: Just another action movie full of fakes
reviews.content: 10/10? Really?The original Top gun had a little reality due to the old F-14 tomcats . This one is a complete bogus scenario which almost touches science fiction. Top gun pilots already know and live each day the g forces in their suit, they know their limits and don't cross them for stupid personal fights. Dog fighting is almost complete history. You can't avoid a missile with maneuvers and flares anymore. Flying a plane after ejecting from another one is impossible? Tomahawks to destroy an airfield? 5th gen fighters kill you miles away without need for guns. Aircrafts have terrain avoidance systems, and so much more... the movie is for 12 yo children max. Only some real aircraft shots (outside) are worth, along with the soundtrack which is half of the original one.

reviews.review_title: Oh just loved it. Watched twice in theatre
reviews.content: Top notch acting, direction, music, cinematography, tom cruise - woww!!!After a long long time loved watching a movie in cinema hall. Minus the avengers, finally had a good old style flick with a lot of feel good. Cinema without super hero movies is still alive. Thank you guys!!

It feels so refreshing to have something original, albeit a sequel that is neither remake or another bland comic book film. This is a movie where fans of the original and anyone new can enjoy. The cast work beautifully together, the on screen chemistry is truly felt here. And the fact that despite his illness, Val Kilmer is still able to reprise his role and is a real one for it. I argue his scene is one of the most powerful. The score stays true to the original but adds some new songs to keep it fresh. There's also no politics, or ideologies that say this is right or wrong. It's about a mission and a group of pilots training to execute that mission.

Absolutely stunning in every aspect. If you love the original 1986 movie, this will go straight to the heart. The story is spot on and the flight and fight scenes are just superb. A must watch on the big screen, I'd go see it again without question! Bravo!!!

Look I was expecting a let down, a cheesy America money making machine. What did I get an epic fast pace full throttle ride. Worth the weight. Brilliant. Hit all the right spots would highly recommend seeing it in the cinema.

reviews.review_title: Simply amazing - watch in theatre if you get a chance!
reviews.content: Best sequel ever made and possibly better than the first movie.I didn't do any research about the movie before watching it, and was pleasantly blown away by how great of a movie about jets could be.The soundtrack, cinematography, acting, and casting was really all we could hope for.Watch this in IMAX if you can. 100% worth it!Hats off, mr. Cruise.

reviews.review_title: A truely awesome blockbuster and perhaps better than the original
reviews.content: I saw the very first TopGun36 years ago which is considered by now a classic. At the end of the original Top Gun , Stinger says to Maverick: How's it feel to be on the front page of every newspaper in the English-speaking world, even though the other side denies the incident? Congratulations.Stinger: They gave you your choice of duty, son. Where do you think you want to go?Maverick: I thought of being an instructor, sir.Stinger: Top Gun?Maverick: Yes, sir.Stinger: God help us.So here is Maverick back as a pilot instructor at Top Gun. I was very pleased to see Iceman in the film and the scene between Maverick and Ice was touching. The new pilots played by new such as actors Lewis Pullman, Monica Barbaro, Glenn Powell, Miles Teller and Jay Ellis, were very interesting and rich characters. The most interesting among was Bradley "Rooster" Brashaw who is the son of Nick "Goose" Bradshaw and there is even a flashback in the film where Maverick remembers what happens when "Goose" dies in his arms."Rooster" considered "Maverick" as responsible of the death of his father but at the end in the last fighting scene "Maverick" saves him and then "Rooster" saves "Mavrick" when Mav's plane is downed before his is downed. Both will fly back and return to their aircraft carreer on a old F14A Tomcat which brings more magic to the film, since during most of the film and since 2006 the Navy flies exclusively on EF/18A Super Hornet andwhen the the first Top Gun was filmed back in 1986 , the Navy was flying the Tomcat and "Goose" was "Maverick" 's RIO. The flight and combat scenes were truely outstanding, intense and realistic. At the beginning of the film, Maverick also flies a prototype which is the sucessor of the lockeed SR71, the SR72 at mach10.2 but then ejects because the plane is uncontrollable. Tom Cruise brings an incredible performance as an actor and a director. He really outdid himself in this movie. Specially mention to Jennifer Conelly who plays Penny who is not missing to evoke or making us remember the original character played by Kelly Mc Gillis back then. Finally, a special mention to Jon Hamm which I loved as Don Draper in Madmen, but who here plays a very jealous and envious admiral of Maverick's unbelievable and top level know how. I highly recommend this movie.

The characters were awesome. Bringing back some of them from the first movie was a great choice by the director. Tom Cruise still got it. Overall: great action, great characters, amazing cinematic experience.Watch it. It is worth it.

reviews.review_title: Tom playing on the nostalgia, not hitting homerun
reviews.content: Top Gun came out in a period of a lot of great movies, but unfortunately like many of them, they are picked up for reboots or remakes since that seems to be the way of the world. Few original stories anymore.The movie is fine, but nothing special.If you remember Top Gun, and why you thought that was a good movie, you will probably be disappointed.If you never seen Top Gun, then this is an ok action/drama.Tom Cruise, with a lot of help from someone/something, manages to shave of 10/14 years and get to look like a guy in his late fourties, playing with the young kids.Val Kilmer, just a few years older than Tom, unfortunately does not.He just looks really old.

One of the best movies that I have seen. Anyone that rates this low, has truly unrealistic opinions of what a movie should be. Compared to any movie that has been released in the last 20 years, from start to finish this is better. Marvel could definitely learn a few things from this. Quantity does not outweigh quality. Well done!!!
Loved every second of it. It's right up there with "The Dark Knight" and "Return of the King." It was intense, breathtaking, and just an absolute blast. Defiantly see it!

reviews.review_title: BEEN WAITING FOR THIS FOR 40 YEARS
reviews.content: BEST MOVIE EVER. THIS KOVIE DID NOT DISAPPOINT. WORTH EVERY PENNY. IM GOING TO WATCH IT FOR A SECOND TIME THIS WEEKEND. STILL EXCITED. ID LOVE TO SEE A 3rd FILM.

reviews.review_title: Should END at Maverick got shootdown
reviews.content:
Openning sence was Great,
Tranning was interesting,
Mission Part was terrific.Then after Maverick crashed was tragic!The story become science fiction without brain.Maverick and Rooster ejector from half F/A-18 unharmed, then stole an F14, and the third-generation aircraft took out 2 5th generation aircraft with machine guns ?? The pilot of the third enemy plane was deaf? The sound of the F/A-18 locked alarm can wake up the person in black out, you tell me the 5th generation aircraft has not locked alarm warnning? It's more ridiculous than Ace Combat...When the Hind,aka MI-24 hellichooper shows up , the enemy country implied it too clearly.

The movie is good. But i expected more action. But they go with the story. Thats good. The movie has its own emotion. The character building is also awesome. Everybody did their job well.Tom cruise looks fantastic. Always in the hot an awesomeness. The movie showed love, emotion, friendship, brotherhood, past.... Etc.

After two years of Covid restrictions combined with a bombardment of Superhero movies, and movies that have underlying social justice themes, this is the movie I've been waiting for. A thoroughly entertaining pick me up. 10/10.

So, Tom Cruise decided to rip off Star Wars and destroy a uranium enrichment facility instead of the Death Star by flying down the canyons between the walls. Seeking out the sweet spot for attack just as Luke Skywalker and his crew did. Their laser failed so they used 'the force'. Shooting from the gut. Same story, different aircraft.Maverick was just a polishing of the old turd, Top Gun. Woo the girl. Get the girl. Have a pissing match with a fellow aviator. Piss off the boss. Get grounded. Fly anyway. Play on the beach. Again. Ride a motorcycle very fast. Again.And have a ridiculous cheering scene after landing on the carrier. I am just thankful I didn't pay any money to see this drivel. Nothing original. Except Maverick finally got naked (I presume) with a woman instead of with the guys in the locker room.

When i first heard about a Top Gun secuel i thought DO NOT RUIN IT. I hate classics coming back to life (especially 36 years later).I LOVED EVERY MINUTE OF IT. Great action, great filming, great use of the old soundtrack (had to be like that, well used).I'm glad Tom Cruise didn't take the opportunity justo to make a few more millions but truly was up to the task and did not dissapoint and he also pushed the rest of the cast to be up to the task as well.Just sit and enjoy the flight. I can promise You that You will.

reviews.review_title: Loved it, superb nods to original
reviews.content: I thought this was a brilliant movie. I Ioved the nods back to the original, but with enough flashback and details for a new audience to appreciate it. Yes in places the story is a bit rehashed - personality clashes during training etc but I liked the way it was handled. The Penny storyline was sensitively approached with respect to history, and her daughter.Seen it twice now. Look forward to watching again in a while. It will stand the test of time. Tom looks amazing.

reviews.review_title: Corny at the beginning, then heartfelt and adrenaline rush
reviews.content: Overall, really good action movie with heartfelt moments. Visuals are great and action and editing was stunning with great cinematography. I would suggest a refresh or intro by watching the first Top Gun to get the right setup.However, do expect some corniness and self-serving/glorifying setup at the start of the movie to establish or remind fans of the greatness of the lead character. The supporting actors were borderline B grade as they had to fulfill the 80s vibe interactions of fighter pilots in line with the 1st movie, but they did get corrected/refine as the show progressed.Would had hope there was a more prominent dedication to Tony Scott just at the start of the ending credits, but I heard there was one in the credits later.
Everything you want from an action packed blockbuster, I never stopped smiling from start to finish, a perfect sequel to a legendary original !!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.review_title: Just watched this exceptional film. This is the most pleasing film which I've watched in 2022.
reviews.content: I'm totally flattered after watching it. I know I'm little bit late but waiting for a long time to watch this adorable movie was worth it.I totally admire the visuals portrayed in this film and genuinely recommended this movie to you all.I totally loved and enjoyed all the Jet's Flying Sequences. I wish that I could join the Air Force of my country but I can't.I have to acknowledge that this Tom Cruise's best film which I've watched till now.

This film kicked all different kinds of @$*. It said that the meta score took a dive because the guy who thinks Billie Elish owns one of the best James Bond's theme songs decided to provide nothing useful. Anyone that believes the Arctic Monkeys are the best bands in the world has no place affecting the meta score of this film.Having said all that, Top Gun Maverick is exactly what you hope for. Then, just when you think the movie delivered everything, it adds more. Oh and then it adds even more after that. 13.2/10 highly recommend, would watch again.Oh and apparently I did not get up to enough characters... so let me just say that seeing so many of the original actors inclever callbacks was very nice.

I went to the cinema with a complete open mind, given how dreadful 'some' sequels are, but, Top Gun: Maverick was an absolute joy to behold.A fantastic story throughout, with constant reminders of the original: Top Gun. A lot of twist and turns, and Maverick (Tom Cruise) showing, that the Sky is literally, the limit!If you're apprehensive whether to go and watch this, in fear it wont live up to the original Top Gun, don't! It's an absolute blast! Plus, you're only delaying the inevitable.It was great to see Iceman (Val Kilmer) again, even if it was limited and the role of Rooster, (Miles Teller) was excellent; it brought a real connection from the original movie.

reviews.review_title: This is one of the best sequels I have ever seen
reviews.content: This is one of the best sequels I have ever seen. Surpassed the original in my book but I'm not old enough to cherish the first movie.This film had had more depth, cooler scenes, and greater suspense. It did everything you want in a fun movie. You walk out of the theater exhilarated.

reviews.review_title: Awesome. Go see it. I am no pilot, and don't know if the stunts are accurate, but they sure are fire to watch.
reviews.content: Not one to write a lot of reviews, but was overwhelmed by this movie. Solid story, great characters with good motivations and conflicts between them, pays justice to the last one and has awesome action scenes and beautiful maneuverers with the planes. I am no pilot, don't know if it's accurate, but it sure is entertaining to watch.
What a great thrill ride. They made it about the aviation nothing else. It was fantastic, completely entertaining great story. You were on the edge of your seat the whole time.

reviews.review_title: i feel the need.. the need to watch this film once a day in theaters
reviews.content: I genuinely cannot enough good things about this film. It had everything that anyone could've asked for in a sequel. I actually watched the 1986 Top Gun the morning that I went and saw the sequel. I had no idea WHAT to expect after the original.I watched the original with absolutely zero knowledge of the film or even Tom Cruise. Somehow, I had never seen a film where Tom Cruise was the main protagonist. I had also never heard of Anthony Edwards before in my life. I had probably heard Maverick & Goose at some point before I watched the film, but I didn't really do anything with that. I kind of thought the original was going to be bored when it started, but it hooked me within minutes and of course the tragic dogfight scene and everything after had me sobbing on my couch for a good 45 minutes.I had a few hours in between finishing the og version and going to see the sequel. I genuinely did not know how they would top (lol no pun intended) the original, but they did. They absolutely blew it out of the water. Every time there was a Goose callback in the film, I couldn't help but tear up. I absolutely lost it when Rooster made his entrance. Miles Teller has always been a star, and I'm glad people are appreciating him for the great actor that he has always been! The dynamic between Mav & Rooster took my heart on a two hour rollercoaster, but I would genuinely do anything to get more screen time with those two. Every interaction they had made me have an emotional reaction (sometimes heart-wrenching, other times heartwarming). Tom and Miles have such an incredible dynamic on screen, and I NEED another film with their characters. Miles did such an incredible job carrying on Goose's legacy and I swore that in the scenes after Rooster came back to save Mav after he had just saved him and they were in the F-14... that was Goose in the back. Like, it looked just like him. I am just so blown away by their performances. Then when they hugged at the end? "Thank you for saving my life." "It's what my dad would've done." I was in tears. I couldn't do it. Then right before Lady Gaga's masterpiece of a closing track "Hold My Hand" showed us the credits and Rooster hit the picture of Goose??? No. I could not see anything but tears after that. I have to have more!Digressing from the main characters, I think what makes a film good is when you can follow the main protagonists and navigate their stories/conflicts and then be satisfied at the end with the conclusion of said stories/conflicts. What makes a film GREAT is when the supporting characters carry just as much weight as the main characters. This supporting cast was nothing but captivating. I loved every second that every one of the supporting characters were on screen. Phoenix/Bob were such a great duo, and I knew they would become two of my favorites right from the get go. Payback/Fanboy were also two very great characters! I enjoyed their interactions with each other but also with the rest of the characters! And then of course... Hangman. I had never seen Glen Powell before and I've watched most of the things he has acted in, but I knew he would have some kind of redemption arc the second he showed up on screen and spoke. I loved the Mav/Ice & Rooster/Hangman parallel. Then when he pulled that little hat trick out near the end? My heart genuinely was about to stop. I could sit here and ramble on for paragraphs about each character, but I'll stop here.This film was nothing short of a masterpiece. I didn't have to wait 36 years for it, but the 7 hours between me finishing the original and then me seeing the sequel seemed like an eternity. It is hands down my favorite film I have ever seen. I don't say that lightly. It had me on the edge of my seat with my heart racing pretty much the entire time. If I wasn't in painful anticipation of what was happening next, I was moved to tears. All around, this film has everything that a summer blockbuster should. I'm sure everyone has probably seen a video of THE beach scene by now. The soundtrack was also absolutely amazing, so after you watch the film... go pay the soundtrack a few listens. I cannot recommend this film enough. Go see it once... and then twice... and then maybe even 10.3 more times.

We live in a world of DC,Marvel movies, whereas movies like marvel are getting worst day by day tryin hard to impress 5-10 years old kids! THIS MOVIE CAME FOR US! FOR ACTUAL AUDIENCE! No CGI sh-t! 10/10.

reviews.review_title: Not original but still well done and fun
reviews.content: Okay first observation, the flight mission in this story completely replicates the Death Star attack from the original Star Wars. Right?? Add that to the fact that this film not only has nothing truly original written in but it seems to intentionally try not to be original, which it isn't. Sometimes these "30 years later" continuation films at least try to create a new layer to the story, but this one doesn't attempt anything bold like that. From the get go you know it's gonna be the exact same deal as the first one. And it is. Altho, just like every other action film these days, it tries to go epic. The mission is nonsense and over the top compared to the first film where they just gotta take out a few MiGs. Having said all this, it is a fun film that everyone can enjoy and doesn't stray from the original feel of Top Gun. Impressive cockpit scenes to boot.

Just got home from the "movie of the year", "the God of action movies so far" and all those "call-signs".I'm gonna use a classic here: "not so faaaaaaaaaaast" (Bugs Bunny).The overall feeling after viewing this "Top secret" (more-like!) movie is this: DISAPPOINTMENT.OK, let me explain. You cannot have a quality movie without a true villain, or at least an evil force of some-kind.The movie is about evolution of the good guys to some ecstatic point and then...nothing.You remain with your mouth open and wide eyes and you then say: you mean that's it??The villain in this movie is, lets call it STUPID, or let's name it for what it really is: A HOLE IN THE GROUND. In a nameless country...
C'mooon people, IN THESE HARD TIMES IT IS NOT NEARLY ENOUGH!The movie make cannot be politically correct, impartial and memorable , all in the same time.It is about taking sides, about choosing, and about assuming a clear position.Let me give a few examples:
"First blood" - the villain was a fat redneck sheriff in "Jerkwater USA";
"First blood part two"- the Russian bastards (He's dead now!!)
"Star wars" - Darth Vader.... The Emperor...The Empire...The Dark side...Catching my drift here? Good.At least name the country for God sakes, there are plenty of declared enemies to the free World?! (Syria, Iran, North Korea, Russia, etc...).OK, if you do not want to upset the people there at least create ONE bad guy, and since this is a movie about aviation maybe they could create an enemy Ace with multiple air-kills , hated by everybody (and their families?). There!That is one aspect.The other aspect: the movie maker insisted on the VISUAL too much.The tech aspects that for the average viewers don't make sense (how many of the spectators really know what 1G is??) are described in detail. O this is not a movie for the naval aviators, is it not? Those guys are spending time in the gym, or learning procedures, or watching tactical videos, or FLYING MISSIONS.The cinematography looks good, maybe too good, but there is no real story behind it. Everything looks like a very well made computer game, with the difference that they are using real jets.Talking about jets: The movie begins with the biggest whopper in cinema history yet: you CANNOT trash a multi-billion $ hyper-sonic jet and make a career move after that, ANYWHERE ON THIS PLANET, Maverick or not, Tom Cruise or not (maybe that is the reason the Navy didn't cleared Cruise on flying solo). The only way you will go is towards a penitentiary...after a gigantic Court Martial or a live TV law-suit.Anyways...
What I am trying to say is: you do not need that much VISUAL to tell a memorable story. You only need a strong subject. And NO, enriching Uranium is not a good story, even the poorest countries in the world are doing it (Pakistan, India?). This subject is so OLD, literally.Nobody uses Uranium-based nukes since the 50's. Thermonuclear weapons were invented ? Helloooo?!?!You can achieve a monumental effect with so much less than IMAX cameras inside real life jets.By example: think of "Dogville". Totally unfair, not an action movie, so what? That is ART people, everything goes, and also "no points for second place"...
A very strong cast, and a FEW LINES painted on the ground, a very strong story, developed scene by scene and you have your masterpiece right there.From a military point of view the movie is a joke, never in 1000 years will The Navy risk the lives of the best of the best to hit a hole in the ground, people crammed in 30+ yo jets. NEVER.The cruise missile (interesting choice of words, ha-ha) was invented, or a tactical nuke launch from far away, or a submarine parked right into your backside. Or a team of SEALS deployed on site. Or just pay the local government for a revolution, (lately)...
Do not get me wrong, I am a fan of the original movie, I know it line by line, seen it dozens of times...but.... Maybe the cast was better in first part? Maybe the enemy jets had a red star painted on the tail (just about enough).Maybe the actors were stronger (James Tolkan, Tom Skerrit, Michael Ironside, even Meg Ryan, etc)..Maybe the script contained better lines for the actors, nothing from the first part can be found in the second part...
One exception: Ed Harris, which had an extremely short appearance, misused resources if you ask me.Sorry, besides the deformed faces and the pilot going sideways as an effect of G-forces , got nothing left to take home with me. Oh yeah, and maybe some push-ups :))And those images are not NEW to me, watched it already on the Discovery channel :)

I felt that need, the need for speed for the last 36 years ... And it was definitely worth the waiting! Thanks to the crew for this great picture... Thanks to Tom for creating the history.. And specially thanks to Val.

reviews.review_title: Without a Doubt This is Called "Movie"
reviews.content: I can assure during this era of OTT and Superhero/ Comics Movies ...this is the way better cinema to enjoy with your family/friends. So for me this is the best movie of 2022.Viewers like me just want a Classical Movie the movies which follows the standard definition of a movie.Our Hero Mr. Tom Cruise fullfills the heroic requirements and viewers enjoyed every bit of movie.Background soundtrack was really the level of the Top Gun.And Direction and script is 10/10.

reviews.review_title: The best Tom Cruise movie I have seen that also highlights his skill as a dramatic actor more prominently that his previous movies.
reviews.content: I remember watching the first Top Gun as a kid, and I did not enjoy it that much. But the scenes that stood out was Tom Cruise smiling on his motorbike, and the beach volleyball scene. In this sequel, we have Tom grinning a lot on his motorcycle, and a beach volleyball scene. There are nods to the past movie, and somehow Cruise seems so different from all his other characters. It seems that Cruise is aware that he is getting old, and that message seems to be be clear in the movie. Though he is a top pilot, he is clumsy and does not fall in a heroic pose like a superhero. He sits back to watch younger people play. He even seems vulnerable. Here we do not see a self confident Tom Cruise like in the Mission Impossible franchise, or any Tom Cruise playing action hero. We see an aging fighter who is aware of his age and unable to let go. Cruise's character has to train a group of top pilots for a mission, but his past haunts him when one of the recruits is the son of his former team. This drama drives the plot of the movie and works well for Cruise. Both Cruise's internal conflict, and his conflict with the recruit makes the movie enjoyable, as you care for the characters. The action scene, and flying scenes were exhilarating. It is filmed like you are there flying, but without getting nauseous. This shows how well the flying scenes were well filmed. The mission almost feels like the Rebels planning to destroy the Death Star, only here, we see clearly how dangerous it is through the training, and when the mission starts, we actually fear for everyone. I honestly think this is the best Tom Cruise movie I have ever seen because we get to see Cruise showcase his acting skills more. Besides that, Val Kilmer's appearance was great, and Cruises chemistry with the supporting casts makes you believe they have actually gone through a lot together. John Hamm was ok, since he was not given much to do. I wish they had more Ed Harris. Oh, I forgot they do have Tom Cruise running, because that is what he always does in action movies. So go ahead and enjoy. Definitely recommend it.

To me I thought this was better than the original even with the powerful female pilot who wouldn't be there spouting off. Flight scenes were amazing, the story of hate and forgiveness was an excellent sub plot.Although an encursion into North Korea and bombing it is..... starting WW3.

reviews.review_title: Use the Force Luke....err, don't think, do...
reviews.content: The film is almost literally a redux of the first Star Wars... flying down a canyon/ flying down the trench on the Death Star. Hit a small exhaust port....both films. Missile batteries on valley walls/gun emplacement on the Death Star. Don't think/use the Force Luke.....I mean, REALLY?The film is entertaining to be sure, and seeing the first one is not a prerequisite to seeing this one per se. But don't expect high entertainment...it is a good escapist film, nothing more.

That's an unreal and incredibly powerful blockbuster with irresistible and legendary Tom Maverick Cruise we really need right now! I thank you Tom, Jerry, Joseph and all who were attached making this action flight masterpiece. Because it's an immersive support for undefeated and strong ukrainian army and for us brave ukrainian people who'll never surrender and always will be going forward fighting for the right cause and our freedom. Thank you, Maverick, for unparallel and actual braveness and dignity we need over and right now.Kindest respect from Ukraine,
Vitaly.

This is one of the best sequels of all time and one of the best action films I have seen in years. Like, it's amazing by Terminator 2 standards! The flight scenes are so real opposed to the cgi crap that Hollywood normally pumps out. Kept me entertained from start to finish.

reviews.review_title: Wow Tom Cruise can actually act
reviews.content: I saw the original top gun when I was young, wasn't expecting anything special with this second version. But boy was I surprised. This was a great movie. My husband has been waiting for 2 years for it to come out and made me promise that I would go to the theater with him. I couldn't get over how well Tom Cruise does in a dramatic scenes. He's always done action movies, the whole while he could have been doing drama. The story is very good, and they didn't overplay the airplane scenes. They were careful in choosing which ones to do, building lots of tension and I found myself squirming in my seat. I even cried once or twice. This was a great movie all the way around.

10/10 this is the Summer movie we all needed! It hits on all emotions! Top Gun Maverick action packed, palm sweating hell of a time! If you love Top Gun you will not be disappointed! Sensational movie!

reviews.review_title: An incredibly good sequel.... Double thumbs up!!
reviews.content: Often as not as sequels set decades after the original classic's, can be a complete horror show... cough cough Matrix 4. This however did not disappoint... the action, characters, cinematography, script was all brilliant and with great homage to the original. I read about Val kilmers story asking to be in this, and the reluctance due to his personal medical conditions, but I'm glad the producers agreed... as even his small part was very enjoyably moving. I left the cinema completely buzzing.... At this outstanding movie.

reviews.review_title: It's not often the sequel is the best
reviews.content: I watched the original Top Gun yesterday and the new one today. I actually think the latest is the best, lived it. If you enjoyed the original you'll love this.

reviews.review_title: We don't get these kind of movies anymore.
reviews.content: Me and my cousin watched this movie together during the premiere about 2 weeks ago, and I still can't stop thinking about it. The story was just so good and the acting? Even better.This is Tom Cruise at his finest, and I had my heart beating fast by the end of the movie! It is also really heartwarming at times, and it's all around a great experience.

reviews.review_title: Fantastic movie if you love aviation
reviews.content: Highly recommend this movie to watch on the theatre.Cinematography, 5/5.Story, 4/5.Music 5/5.This is a sequel to the first movie.The entire scene in the cockpit is fantastic.

This movie takes the perspective of an elite pilot like no other. This is a delight and well worth rewatching for the pure enjoyment of everything this movie has to deliver. If I could give it a higher rating I certainly would.

I's so good maverick, is gorgeous and everything very good. ............
................................. Very good film you have to watch this. Maverick bro I'm falling in love with you I love you broo.

This movie was just incredible. It was one of the best movies I've ever seen in my life. It felt so good, like it was just absolutely perfect as it is, and nothing should be changed. Yes, it was that amazing to me. For starters, the story was really fun and it was full of just the right amount of humor that was funny, and NEVER cringey.

reviews.review_title: As good as the first one, because it IS the first one.
reviews.content: As an older moviegoer, it's hard to dismiss all the scenes and plotlines "borrowed" from the original, and other films. Geez, they stole the "Death Star" exhaust port attack from the original Star Wars series, and actually had the nerve to have "Goose's" son play the exact same song, in the exact same bar, on piano... REALLY? Having said all that, I enjoyed the film immensely, and expect it'll do well. I just wish Hollywood wasn't completely out of ideas... I'm only 52, and it gets old seeing the same movies from 30-40 years ago, with different titles and younger stars doing the same scenes. I still give it 8 stars, because while not original, it's so well done, you can't NOT see it, and the story arc is nicely finished off at the end.

reviews.review_title: Top Gun Remastered: A New Hope
reviews.content: Having rewatched the original in preparation, I can safely say this is a neat 2022 restoration. The plot slightly tweaked, each scene touched up and carefully put back in place, all with the exception of the main mission, which is essentially the same tactical plan Luke Skywalker and the rebellion had to destroy the Death Star.All this doesn't matter though, cause this film is a FILM. Loud, fun and intense. I had a fantastic time watching it on the big screen. The third act is what action movies are all about. Edge of your seat excitement.Top Gun (1986) premiered the same year my mum pushed me out into the danger zone. Tom Cruise may not have grown as much as me in 35yrs, but his balls certainly did!

As a 16 year old, watching the first Top Gun movie in 1986, it was memorable and enjoyable for all the right reasons. Watching the sequel 36 years later at 52, Maverick took me back to the feelings I had all those years ago, although this time more emotional and very nostalgic. A brilliant film and one I'll remember for the rest of my days. Thanks Tom!

reviews.review_title: Just a Killer, in every way!!
reviews.content: I got home from the theater about 15 minutes ago, had to catch my breath before sitting down to do this review.I didn't think any movie could possibly match the hype that was surrounding Top Gun: Maverick, but was I ever wrong!!I'm a 75 year old Veteran, and have been a huge movie fan for about 60 of those years, and I think that this might be the single best film I have ever watched.I don't want to give away any spoilers, because anyone reading this needs to get themselves to a theater (preferably an IMAX one) at their earliest opportunity and get ready to be transported away from the hum-drum of everyday life, and experience what it feels like to pull 8 g's in a modern jet fighter aircraft.Every facet of this movie, the acting, the action, the drama, & the musical score all knocked it out of the park.Go see this movie!!!!!!!!!

I started to score this movie an eight but decided it's more worth than nine considering the work put into it.If you've ever experienced negative G forces or heavy G forces, the movie will have you holding your breath.I kind of felt like the relationship between Tom Cruise and Jennifer Connelly was a little bit lame and the young lady who played the role of her daughter did not even get special accreditation at the end, which was sad although she had maybe four lines.

Had an absolute blast watching this movie. It managed to give call backs and replicate parts of the original Top Gun but rather than feeling like a predictable re-hash it kept me excited and just gave me what I wanted.It brought the Top Gun story and ethos up to date. Brilliantly filmed, the jet scenes are breathtaking. Love the familiar faces, love the new ones. The plot wasn't too complex - it just worked and left that feel good feeling. Loved it.

Hy Everybody!8/10 it is the real score.Tom Cruise....this name guarantees qulity.In the last scene, I was completely sweaty.:))
Respect for Val Kilmer, He is respectable!

reviews.review_title: This is as good as it gets
reviews.content: I've given a 10/10 to less than 10 movies in my entire life, this one deserves it. I have never had as much fun in the theater and I keep going back to see it more, I can quote entire scenes by now and it still brings me so much joy. Go see it.

Great movie, the plot was well written, great acting, filled with action and emotion. In an era where fans and movie goers are put second, Maverick is a prime example of what film making should be and intended to be. Highly recommended 👍

Top Gun Maverick is that rare sequel in cinema that delivers an on par or better experience than its original film with just the right amount of nostalgia. This will be one of the best movies you'll see all summer and reminds us all why we still go to the movies.
Wow, just wow. This movie was worth the wait. It has everything. But you need to watch the first one to enjoy it to it's fullest! Please watch it. Talk to me goose!

Tom Cruise has set new limits to action. The way the stunts were performed and captured, cinematography has reached levels beyond comprehension.This movie has sparked a cold shrill that will run through your veins. The suspense will keep you hooked at the edge of your seat throughout the entire movie. It is indeed a pleasure to watch Tom Cruise perform his own stunts just like a teenage boy.

Incredible film, story, cast, visual effects, music... everthing.Less blue screen, more real f-18 and fly escenes. Today this is very nice to see in a movie.I felt this movie like the first one or better, excelletn work of Tom Cruise and director Joseph KosinskiI hope disney don't buy this franquice lol.

This is one of those movies that when you finish it, you think that maybe in 10 years you will see again a movie that good.Miles: Outstanding performance!Great cast, music, screenplay, effects and script.I felt like it was Real and for sure I was there in that mission.I miss this feeling from Hollywood movies.

I loved this movie. It was one of my favorites from recent years. The special effects were amazing, and the storyline felt fresh and exciting to me because it didn't have the modern ideological or political agenda or unrealistic effects that are found in many comic films.

reviews.review_title: Somehow this one is better than the original
reviews.content: Perfect blend of nostalgia, new fresh faces, and technology. Old folks that grew up in the 80's will love it, and younger folk will also love it. Fantastic job Paramount.

My wife and I wanted to laugh through this whole thing- and it wasn't at the parts intended to be funny. Super cheesy. And it seems they had the bones of a story and a surface level exploration of character. They could have switched around many of the scenes and no one would be the wiser, because that's how insignificant they were to the story. The best parts were the flight scenes. But those made up about thirty minutes of the 2 hour movie. Wait til streaming or digital.

The main attraction of this movie was the chance to see the beauty and power of the modern fighter jet from a pilot's perspective. The action scenes were good but the opportunity to place the audience in the pilot's seat was lost. It was more like watching the pilots from the jet's perspective.The editing was too fast, as with so many action movies. What was the point of making so much effort to film so realistically when most of the action scenes are 1-3 seconds long?

Does what it says on the box. Simple easy to understand story. Bad guys are not identified because it doesn't matter. Flight scenes are hugely impressive. Some humor and some poignancy. Look forward to the next one when Tom is in his nineties.

reviews.review_title: Big fan of old / harsh judge of sequels
reviews.content: Usually harshly grade any sexual even if it the stuff of legends... Prob only put Star Wars & LOTR as 4/5 sequels but I must say, this one is worth it!You will get similar mode, vibe, couple of the same classic songs, sports team building chest flex scenes...But, you still get new action & feel the tingles again for the most part.....A lot of people will tear anything new, sequel or whatever they want because they will always do so.... Do yourself a favor & actually disregard the typically "I hate it!"This one is worthy of judging for yourself.

I haven't watched a new Tom Cruise movie in years.I was probably like a lot of people who thought there's some movies you just do not remake, prequel or sequel to.I thought this was one of them. When I finally saw a few seconds of preview I thought ehhh maybe I'll watch. Once I finish a preview I change my mind.I even watched original Top Gun night before seeing both times!A friend and I planned a few weeks back to see it & another friend and I made plans a week or so ago to see it also. I'm excited to see in theaters 2 days in a row. I have seen very few movies twice in the theater. This is going to be an absolute must buy.There was one character who could not have been cast more perfectly.This is one of the best movies I've ever seen and I like it even better than the original which I did not expect!!!

reviews.review_title: It had everything it needed to be greater than the first one but...
reviews.content: I just watched the film and truly enjoyed it. It as engaging, old school action fun the way they don't make them anymore. Tom Cruise was born for this role. The supporting characters, everything was perfect, but the disease of too long endings stroke again. The film was perfectly set for Maverick to die an honorable death and get absolution, go out guns blazing, a dinosaur in AI era, take your pick. The whole movie was perfectly set for an epic death and absolution to the character. But then he lives, and he stole an F-14 taking off from a 50m runway, only to fight fighter jets 30 years more advanced than his. Anyway I don't mind the extravaganza, in the end that's what the character is all about, but it really felt like the movie was about to finish and some executive just ordered another 20 minutes because of the potential for more sequels. Especially now that it's smashing the box office. Nevertheless, great fun, highly recommended. 8/10.

Man, that movie was excellent. Honestly, about halfway through, I was pretty disappointed, though. But man, by the end of the film I was blown away.Three actor observations from the movie.1. How on earth is Tom Cruise 59. It's been 35 years since the original movie, and he looks like he may have aged ten years.2. Miles Teller was the perfect guy to play goose's son.3. Too bad Kelly McGillis didn't age as well as Tom. It would have been cool to see the original girlfriend in this movie.

This movie was awesome! If you had told me i would enjoy a top gun sequel movie more than an mcu movie this year i would have told you "You sir are high." I was wrong however this movie was dope!! The only thing that stood out as a negative was Jennifer Connely's character felt a little forced and her story really isn't fleshed out, like how shes the Admirals daughter from the first movie etc. Go see it!!

reviews.review_title: A big Improvement over It's ok predecessor.
reviews.content: "Top Gun: Maverick" is directed by "Joseph Kosinski".It stars Tom Cruise, Val Kilmer, Miles Teller, Jennifer Connelly, Glen Powell and Monica Barbaro.The sequel to its 80s classic sees "Pete Mitchell" being called to teach a group of graduates on how to fly before sending them off on a dangerous assignment.I'm not a big fan of the original "Top Gun" but I still respect the impact it had when it was released and I do not think it's a bad movie.
