But this film is better than the original in my opinion and I thoroughly enjoyed it.The positivesThe story is simple but the characters are well written. "Pete" has a great arc about leadership and it also helps that "Tom Cruise" is doing a fantastic job. His characters likeable and "Cruise" has plenty of chemistry with the other actors. The romance with the character of "Penny" is believable and you want the two characters to get together. The graduates have their own distinct personalities and are all played by fantastic actors. The standout was "Miles Teller" as "Bradley" who is a very conflicted character but is arc is satisfying even if the ending is my biggest flaw. The action is thrilling. It feels real and that's all thanks to the stunts in this film. The cinematography is great but does slightly dull down when the movie gets going. The humour lands very well most of the time and the scene with "Val Kilmer's" "Iceman" was one of the best scenes in the film.The negativesThe only big problem is the ending. I did have a feeling halfway through if what could happen and the way the movie was going I was bracing myself for it. It didn't happen but I think the film would've been better if a more tragic but emotionally satisfying ending would've happened. Finally, while it is great that "Val Kilmer" is in the film and they used "AI" to let him speak was brilliant. It is really noticeable that "Val" isn't talking. It got kind of distracting when it happened but it still didn't take any emotional weight out of that scene.Conclusion"Top Gun: Maverick" is a straight forward story that emotionally hits you. It's well written characters, Believable romance, amazing stunt work and action, brilliant cinematography, excellent acting and Funny moments make the sequel better than the original. Just a conflicting with the ending and some noticeable "AI" are the only flaws for me.I'm going to give "Top Gun: Maverick" a:8/10.

The Top Gun (1986) never needed a second part, as the first part ended beautifully.However, I suspect that the modern-day fighter aircraft industry needed a movie, which could retain the interest of fighter aircraft in the era of drones, resulting in this movie.The plot is interesting (giving concession to the fact that it is a fiction), making it a definite watch at least once. The acting of the major characters befit appreciation. The stunt choreography is as good as the first part. In short, the movie lived up to the hope provided by the trailers released at least a year back.End note: - The movie was made to show the necessity of using fighter aircraft in modern day warfare. However, the mission undertaken by the hero and his team, can only be best executed by weaponised drones. That will be the greatest irony and a question that will haunt every military aviation expert long after watching the movie.
I literally cried, this sequel brings back so many memories, is a must see movie, Miles Teller's character was amazing, the action scenes will keep you on your seat for a very long time.

In the beginning i love the movie and characters. I watched in cinema and that was awesome the music is perfect everything was perfect expect tow things 1- the relationship and romantic if you cannot do it perfect don't do it 2- the hero never die i hate this in movies like fast and furious and others like this if maverick die i will give the movie 10/10 How many times did he fall from the plane? And guess what he never died or hurt. But still good movie i love it.

Was looking forward to watching the sequel but wasn't expecting it to be as good as the first film. All I can saw is WOW. Still buzzing the next day thinking about it.We watched on 4DX and the whole experience was out of this world. This is a must watch film at the cinema. Story line was good but the effects and drama throughout makes it one of the best films of all time.

The plot is simple and sometimes naive. But the action scenes make every movie worthwhile. The main character is reckless and irresponsible, but he is the only way to get a mission accomplished. Incidentally, the film does not show who the enemy of the United States of America is, it was shown without flags or colors, which makes the film more focused on action than on political issues. Val Kilmer's participation was respectful and fit the plot well. Maverick's love pair wasn't even needed and became uninteresting throughout the movie. Tom Cruise knew that it will be a blockbuster and save it to a pos-covid date. Recommend for the whole family.

I went in thinking I don't know if I care anymore it took so long To be released. But wow I walked out saying I don't need to see another movie for the rest of my life that was it that's the movie we've been wanting for so long. Loved it.

The best movie experience I've had since I saw "The Return of the King" (there's a metaphor in there too). My expectations were very high, mainly due to the trailers. They were far exceeded. Thank you Mr. Cruise (and all of the cast and crew) for giving us a wonderfully entertaining escape from all that has gone on in the country these last 2 years. Can I say that America needed this movie? I believe we did.The Godfather 2, Aliens and Top Gun-Maverick: Best sequels of all time.

Just to say:It was quiet a hard job to stay seated on your seat while intense scenes were pumping adrenaline all over your body !!As a person who spent all his childhood playing dog-fights games and flight simulated games with dream of being a pilot, This movie passed me what looks like to be a real fighter pilot !!The fact that actors have been training with IRL pilots and flew with F/18 Hornet to just make scenery as realistic as possible is insane!!All the efforts actors and filming crew put on this movie has paid off and they succeed in creating a masterpiece which we all flight lovers will watch for years till the next Top Gun.Movie had successfully overachieved and surpassed its predecessor on every single level.

reviews.review_title: Epic Epic Epic what a Blockbuster
reviews.content: Only thing I didn't like was maverick new love interest other than that it was amazing from the get go for once it's not a woke movie even though there's a woman pilot in that film there was mo political garbage all we want is a great movie and we got it a EPIC Blockbuster hardly any CGI definitely took a lot of time of care and attention don't worry I won't spoil it let's just say they used nostalgia but it handled it beautifully with fresh ideas and concept as for the flying wow only terminator 2 was another great movie sequel you probably won't get another Epic Blockbuster movie in the Modern day Era fantastic Thank you to the entire Topgun Team Highway to the Dangerzone and lady gaga her song Hold my hand is Epic deserves Oscar nomination for and Top gun deserves Best Picture Nomination.

Great follow up sequel to 1986 classic. Kudos to Tom Cruise for having balls to sport the Taiwan flag! Pairing of Jennifer & Tom is super cute too! Phoenix is super hot!!Dogfight shown is amazing!Screw the dragon!

reviews.review_title: Even worst than the first one!
reviews.content: A predictable story, same "gags" as the first one that it becomes almost like a rerun of the first movie. A true manual on how not to do a sequel and a profound disappointment.Still cannot believe Tom Cruise did this. The only reason I can think of is the opportunity to fly himself some fighter jets that he likes so much. Of course the money is not an issue for Mr. Cruise so I cannot think of a better reason.The first movie was terrible but acceptable by the time standards as a romantic story. But this sequel don't have a place on today's standard's.A true disappointment since I was betting on this film. My mistake.

reviews.review_title: Top Gun: Maverick Review (A MASTERPIECE OF A FILM IN 2022)
reviews.content: WOW! Just WOW! You have to watch this film in a theater before it leaves; this film is so worth watching and worth your time! And definitely on the big screen experience with big speakers!In a world that is fatigued with Marvel superheroes and funny (most times unfunny) and unoriginal content, Top Gun comes to bring a breath of fresh air with a new, compelling and realistic story that has nothing to do with superheroes or a franchise*, and still packs the action and high stakes of a Hollywood Blockbuster thriller! It is so refreshing, there's no man-to-man combat or hand guns, just the jet's missiles and bullets, but it's not an uncomfortable "army" film. This is a film of heart more than army. The army is but a small part, and the only thing you get to see are the jets and battleships, making this film focused solely on the characters, and the mission and training with the jet planes. The story is so simple and straightforward, but at the same time brings unexpected twists, and the stakes get higher as you move along. There is real peril, and it is very realistic, and yet, it takes you out of the boringness of the daily life and takes you on an epic mission and flight. Plus, you don't need to do any research; the film explains itself. No need to watch previous films, or need to know about the army, or jets; everything is explained in the film so you can enjoy it to the fullest. A wonderful experience.The characters are not empty slates, they are compelling, with their own realistic backgrounds and growth throughout the film, which makes you care and connect with the characters. Real relationships, real connection, and real growth. Straightforward goals, but incredibly difficult to achieve, which makes you journey through the story along with each of the characters, especially the protagonist Pete "Maverick" Mitchell. There are romantic moments, but not uncomfortable or cringy, they seem really good for the film, and the broken friendships from the beginning come to a satisfying conclusion. The connections between the characters make the stakes for the mission higher than ever and you actually fear that any of the characters will die.This film has one of the most impressive plots and action sequences I have ever seen! The mystery and difficulty of the mission is impressive as we travel with the trainees to master their given mission which is attempted in the climax. The training sequence was fun, fulfilling, with a few laughs along the way, along with scares and sequences that will get your heart pumping faster than ever and keep you at the edge of your seat as accidents happen. You truly feel the stakes and the pressure of the mission as the pilots leave for their mission, and attempt the mission. And oh my gosh!The jet scenes. JUST THE JET PLANE SCENES are a wonder to watch! You truly feel like you are in a jet plane taking on the G forces, and attempting crazy maneuvers. But the sequences are so well shot and cinematographically made, it is so enjoyable and fulfilling to watch. Many unexpected twists and challenges with the jet planes, but it is an absolute JOY to watch. The stunts that were pulled with the jets is something like I've never seen before.The heart of the film is something absolutely gorgeous. There's a backstory and a wrong that needs to be undone to restore the relationship in the film, and it comes to a beautiful conclusion at the end of the film. And the way teachers and students, fathers and sons dare to give their lives to save the other is something truly astounding. Something so beautiful AND satisfying to watch.And the musical score, was FANTASTIC! It elevated the emotion and epic-ness of the film! The cinematography was gorgeous across the entire film. You really feel people poured their hearts and work into this film. This film tried, and it did it.This film gets a 10 out of 10 from me. It is an absolute MASTERPIECE in a time where masterpieces are so rare in the cinema world. This is an amazing story and spectacle you have to watch, if possible on a big screen with good speakers. This film did not disappoint, it met with the expectations left with the trailer, and what you expect of a good film. Seriously, Jurassic World: Dominion is going to be around for some time, watch this film before it leaves the theater forever! Big screens is where you can truly experience the spectacle of the jet sequences and the mission and battle at the end to the fullest.Seriously, you don't have to be a jet fan, or army fan, or fan of anything to enjoy this film. You will love it!*(I'm aware of the 1986 release of Top Gun, but I'm not counting it as a franchise as it was ONE film of over 30 years ago.)

reviews.review_title: Visiting the past is rarely this good
reviews.content: Saw the movie on IMAX last night and felt I was back in 1986 all over again. Not because the film was so similar to the original but because of the emotion of seeing a proper movie, with no overt PC agenda (although everything subtly ticked the boxes), and for the sheer pleasure of being entertained for 2hrs straight. Hats off to Tom Cruise for delivering on this. Loved it!

reviews.review_title: "What were you thinking?" "You told me NOT to think!"
reviews.content: Watched this one right on the heels of watching its prequel for the first time in a while. It does a good job of picking up where the last one left off. Maverick tried teaching at the Top Gun school like he said he would in the original, but it didn't work out. In the meantime, Maverick has been doing what he does best (flying and satisfying his need for speed) yet only advancing from Lieutenant in the last movie to Captain in this movie, despite distinctions and accolades. The love interest "Charlie" changes to Penny, daughter of an admiral and former flame mentioned in the first movie, the victim of one (or more?) of Maverick's youthful escapades. Maverick is called back to teach at the Top Gun school, but past aches resurface when Maverick realizes that one of his students is Rooster, son of Maverick's former right-hand man Goose, who died when one of Maverick's risky maneuvers went wrong in the first movie. If you enjoyed the first movie, chances are good you'll like this one as well. (Then again, if you enjoyed the first movie, you've probably already seen this one. I'm a little late to the party again.)Tempted to give this one 10 stars. I might later. For now, the final star could be said to be missing because of the film being "too good," I guess. Dialog is crisper, snappier, and more Bottom Line Up Front in this one. With Tom Cruise, Val Kilmer, Jennifer Connolly, John Hamm, Ed Harris and more, this one packs lots of star power. Flight sequences are so panoramic and absorbing that I wish I'd caught this one in an IMAX. All this, though, meant that the whole time I kept reminding myself involuntarily that I was watching a movie. A very good movie, though.I felt a little more "lost in the weeds" in this one than the other. Think that's because I was a little tired when I watched. That lostness was just over details; the overall story is presented very well. Maverick is called back to teach at a top flight school. Maverick must whittle down a group of a dozen or so top students by about half to fly a dangerous mission. This worst-case scenario involves a tiny target in a remote, inaccessible and tightly defended area, which means fast and dangerous maneuvers in and out. Maverick culls the squadron down to the "cream of the crop" by pushing all his students past their boundaries, training hard to guarantee success on mission execution. (Training and execution are both very exciting to watch!) But Maverick must balance rigor with caution, especially since Rooster is still coming to terms with Maverick's role in his father's premature demise, which also weighs heavily on Maverick.This conflict (and others, as in the last film) between Rooster and Maverick resolves very nicely. The worst-case scenario's terrain robs the group of the advantages of modern technologies like GPS, so they're flying in planes not unlike what Maverick flew with Goose. Rooster learns the difficulty of "grace under fire" while making split-second decisions. I think they call the training in here Live simulation, since they're in effectively a dress rehearsal, using actual planes; think I would have like to have seen more Virtual (e.g. Computer-based) simulation, which may have helped accentuate the difference between planned and real-life missions.I don't know if more Virtual would have detracted at all from the realism, though. A lot of this movie seemed "truer to source" than the first, although there are still cinematic flourishes like the trademark flying upside-down over an opponent's plane. For example, I didn't notice until reading through the Goofs of the first movie that they were using "bogie" instead of "bandit"; I did notice they were using "bandit" more in this movie. These are the sort of "in the weeds" technical details I felt a little lost in. Was trying to see if I could spot Goofs of my own, but I'm still learning about the field.It's a great movie with a well-written story and stunning visuals! Good for piquing interest to learn more.
Full of action great visuals and heaps of fun. Best to see the movie on the big screen. Best movie for a long time with some memorable scenes go see it.

reviews.review_title: Watch the first movie to add context before watching Maverick!
reviews.content: So I had really high expectations for this movie.... oh man oooh man it delivered!!!Tom Cruise knows how he wants his movies to be and what an awesome movie it is!You really need(ed) to watch the first movie, Top Gun (1986) to get the full meaning behind the movie Maverick.I really liked the tribute to Goose and to Iceman in this movie.There is a lot of story to this movie and it really helps to have watched previous one.It's heavy on emotions, thrill, action to some extent, HEAVY and really awesome flight scenes...One thing I do not enjoy is the character 'Hangman' played by Jake.I don't know if it's a tribute or adding the same ¨vibe¨ as Top Gun from 1986, but having that egotistical attitude was dull and boring quite quick!That no one is a better pilot that me, you all aren't worthy etc etc... And then When the mission was about to happen it all of a sudden changed.If the pilots are the best of the best, best of their academy etc, why should there be such an attitude like it was a pissing contest.This movies goes into my Blu-ray collection of my favourite movies.Top Gun: Maverick set a new standard for how the story is told and how it's played out almost to perfection!If you haven't watched it, you really need to, this movie is the one to watch or you'll miss out on one of the greatest movies ever made.

I heard a lot about this movie for a few months! And I was so excited to watch the movie finally. While watching the movie, I was expecting to see some exceptional scenes, and I was waiting the whole time for something unpredictable, but it was a dull, predictable movie. Just showing how azaming the US Navy team is and how fool the enemy is!Also, it predictably shows how good the old teacher is. The team of 12 top pilots also very obvious !It includes very shallow romantic scenes as well.The flight scene was good.Overall, not a bad movie, but not what you expect from a very high rating!

reviews.review_title: Top Gun parody with video game elements
reviews.content:
It starts in the hangar scene, not on B but C movie level. Bad acting, childish dialog and strange behavior. At this point it makes you wonder, how something like this was accepted with such budget?!When Ed Harris arrives we get ET vibes of "military = bad", "adults = bad" "old adults = the worst", "old military members = evil!"
The scene when Tom passes "mach 10" and this nerd jumps up to give it to Ed with his silly Pentagon comment, was just pathetic. It must have been written for children.Then even stranger things happen. Tom the rebel "steals" the expensive plane, crashes it but instead of going straight to military court, he becomes instructor. At this point it's clear, this movie is pure fantasy.The bar scene makes no sense either. They act as if Tom's flying buddy was killed due to his incompetence, not 39 (?) years ago, but yesterday. The son looking like him, playing the same song was just embarrassing to watch.The mission itself was like a video game (although games are probably more realistic). The fact that Tom was brought there as the messiah with the only solution makes you wonder. I'm no military expert, but wouldn't it be better to send all the tomahawks straight into this "volcano", instead to the runway?If Tom was the only one who could barely simulate a successful outcome of this "mission" (with one second of time left), are we really supposed to believe that the other "elite" pilots (Tom smocked with ease one by one) are able to pull it off (under deadly pressure)? They must have honed their skills by doing pushups and playing beach volley.Speaking of the other pilots... They all appeared like cartboards with zero character depth! Why was Ice Ice? Because in the 80's movie he was portrayed with character.Let's talk about the scene where Tom and the copy of his buddy were shot down. What is the best thing to do for a pilot in this situation? Don't escape into the surrounding woods, because that would be boring. Run straight into the enemy base instead and capture one of their planes on a destroyed runway! You don't know if it's working, or if it's fueled, but that's OK. You care so much about your buddies son, but instead you have no problem to put him back in danger, in a situation with zero chances of survival? What a script...

This movie was surprisingly good.One of the better movies release in the past two years.There was more emotional depth to it, than usually there is in action movies.Characters were very well portrayed and the acting was good. Music helped to make the scenes believable.Action scenes were intense, but not too confusing like usually they would be in similar movies.I think I will watch it again later, because the action scenes felt like you were actually there, like in a roller coaster, but in a good way!

reviews.review_title: If this is exceptional, people have truly forgotten what great movies are like
reviews.content: This is not a bad movie by any means, but it's not transcendent. It's not extraordinary. I don't understand the rave reviews - perhaps the public has truly forgotten what real imaginative movies are like.Also, once again, the trailer is sortof better than the movie. Most of the best scenes and lines are in the trailer.

It seems that Tom Cruise has the Midas touch when it comes to making great films. Top Gun: Maverick is one of those films. It has taken 36 years that includes a 2 year delay due to the pandemic for us to finally see this film. Is it worth it? Absolutely.When you hear the iconic Top Gun anthem and then Danger Zone it took me right back to when I first watched Top Gun on VHS (remember that?) and seeing the crew working on F-14 Tomcats on the deck of the aircraft carrier for the first time and being mesmerised.. Only this time it's F-18 Hornets but the effect is still the same.What follows is 2 hrs 11 mins of pure unadulterated joy and flying by the seat of your pants. The third act of the film is by far the best part of the film and is a real adrenaline rush. The flying sequences are the best I've seen in a film and as we know the actors were actually taken up in F-18s to film these sequences and that's what makes this film so ruddy good.The only thing that made me go really? Was a part involving an F-14 Tomcat near the end. But, I guess they had to shoehorn one in at some point within the film. Other than that I'm ready to see the film again and most likely will. Or wait until later in the year when it appears on Paramount Plus.Seriously though, it genuinely is a great film and is best watched in the cinema.
A perfect sequel to the classic blockbuster. An amazing experience to watch in theater. Tom cruise did it again.Perfect cast, acting, story and direction.A Must Watch!!

I've not been inside a movie theater since very early 2020, and I could not have wished to break that (involuntary) hiatus with a better movie experience than Top Gun: Maverick! It was everything I look for in a Blockbuster movie; amazing, adrenaline-pumping action; epic cinematography; a charismatic lead character, and a great storyline with lots of heart. I thought it was the perfect sequel to Top Gun. I left the theater loving Tom Cruise a wee bit more than I did in 1986.

reviews.review_title: In contrast to the hype, this one is just okay.
reviews.content: Nothing groundbreaking in the film whatsoever as all the reviews have us believe. A carbon copy of the first film but with some more emotion rolled in. The faceless enemy is another downer and the russian Su-57 is disrespected severely. Not better than a 7/10.

I am torn with this movie. Yes it was an enjoyable watch but I scratch my head a few times as I just don't know if there should have been a sequel.Lots of cliches like being saved at the very last minute etc. Also, flying low between a valley to drop bombs down a hole reminded me of the Death Star scene in Star Wars, even the words "Stay on target" were used LOLFor me the character of Jennifer Connelly didn't really have much meaning and I felt the character was just thrown in as a filler.I will just say it's a good movie with action and the new generation will like it. Definitely a fine moment for Mr Cruise.

"Top Gun: Maverick" is the long-awaited sequel to the 1986 film "Top Gun," which starred Tom Cruise as Pete "Maverick" Mitchell, a young naval aviator who is sent to Top Gun, the Navy's elite fighter weapons school.The sequel, set 34 years after the original film, stars Tom Cruise once again as Maverick, now a flight instructor at Top Gun. The film also stars Miles Teller, Glen Powell, and Jennifer Connelly.The movie takes place decades after the original film, and follows Maverick as he faces the challenges of modern air combat, including the use of unmanned drones.Maverick is also mentoring a new generation of pilots, including Teller's character, Bradley Bradshaw, the son of his late wingman Nick "Goose" Bradshaw, who died in the first film.The film's visuals are stunning, with breathtaking aerial footage and state-of-the-art special effects. The dogfight scenes are particularly impressive, with a level of realism that immerses the viewer in the action. The sound design is also impressive, with the roar of fighter jets filling the theater.The movie has a good pacing and keeps the audience engaged throughout. It also has a decent storyline which is a combination of nostalgic feeling and new perspectives. The interactions between the characters are well-written, adding depth to the film.Tom Cruise delivers another strong performance as Maverick, showing the character's growth and maturity over the years. He is surrounded by a talented supporting cast, with Miles Teller in particular delivering a standout performance as Bradshaw.Overall, "Top Gun: Maverick" is a thrilling and visually stunning film that is sure to delight fans of the original. It's an action-packed film that will keep you on the edge of your seat with its high-speed dogfight scenes and state-of-the-art special effects.It also has a good balance of nostalgia and new elements that keeps the audience engaged. Despite some of the cliche and predictability, it's still a well-made and entertaining movie.
Take a bow Tom Cruise! 10% of me thinks its better than the first one. Great seen with Val Kilmar. The storyline is awesome and Miles Teller is awesome as Goose's son!!! 5 Stars.
For sure the best movie of this year, I can easily say this movie was better than the first one, What a wonderful movie. Nice flight scenes, great cast and screen play.

This movie is made to attract a large audience. Without trying to spoil, I would love to highlight some topics.* Lots of memories for those who watched Top Gun. They tried to reuse settings, styles and events. Gen Xers who watched Top Gun in their youth will have a 80ties flashback.* No named enemy. It is clear that they fight someone, but this enemy is very unspecific. That way, you are inclusive.* Diversity. We have a female pilot and every skin color is present (we might argue that we are missing a bit Asian American presence, but this is common in all modern movies, focus seems to be to include African Americans). The only thing missing was a gay person, but sexuality was not a topic in this movie (besides the one of Maverick)
* Maverick, the one and only, he is the hero. He and just he. It is difficult to write about it without spoiling something, but sometimes it feels it has been written also for Tom Cruise.* Still, the movie provides what every one wants. Suspense, emotions, conflicts to be resolved, friendship, sexual attraction, sentimentality.All in all, I see Top Gun: Maverick as a very good movie, just I do not see it as an elite movie. I assume this high rating is there because they do not piss off any group.

I saw Top Gun and this film it's not a remake, it's the second part of a fantastic movie!What scenarios, what emotions, what valors in this film!I like films where men are very men: strong people, with courage!The fight with F-14 and SU-57 at the end is fantastic!I like also the P-51D Mustang of Tom Cruise!

I've never reviewed a movie before, but this one deserves it. There wasn't a dull moment in this masterpiece! Story, graphics, acting etc were all top notch. Tom Cruise still looks like he hasn't aged at all.True, it holds a lot of nostalgic value for someone like me but modern moviegoers will enjoy it anyway. Just watch and enjoy the adrenaline rush!

If there's one movie that you should watch in the theatres this year, it's this one!The music score and overall soundtrack sets the mood perfectly!The movie is so wellpaced and the character development is great.Even if you haven't watched the first installment from 1986, you will still feel very connected to the characters.💯/10 would recommend!

reviews.review_title: Don't listen to any of the most recent negative reviews
reviews.content:
This is truly a cinema masterpiece. All of the most recent negative reviews are just sad negative people who didn't even pay to watch the film at the cinema. They waited to stream or firestick the film in there sad bedrooms. You can not trust these people and there opinions.This film is one of the best in recent decades. Amazing action. No crappy CGI. Great actors. Good old 80s action style. Tear jerking scenes and great nostalgia. A must watch. Literally anyone who slates this film I feel sorry you
you and you must live a sad a depressing live. There are no flaws in the story or technical aspects just viewers who just don't understand distances.Also, Not to metion the great soundtrack from Lady Gaga and One Republic and Hanz Zimmer.Please watch it and you won't be disappointed.

This movie was a well done continuation of the Top Gun story, in my opinion. It didn't try to be any more, nor less. I enjoyed it- I went to the bathroom during the Iceman scene, which was probably a good thing, so I can't comment on that- BUT I will say I was expecting a bunch of young actors to overshadow the original story.... Which they totally did NOT. And for me that was the best part about this movie. I think it bridged the generation gap very well! I clapped at the end but nobody else did ... 😞 .... and sadly there is the generation gap right there!!

I didn't expect much, but must say movie was absolutely great, my wife also loved it. I would only suggest to watch first part of Top Gun before going to the cinema. Absolutely great movie and I highly recommend it.

A feel good (blockbuster) movie
Combat scenes are super nice and very realistic
I still liked the first Top Gun better
I must admit
Tom Cruise still got what it takes.

reviews.review_title: Cruise is a poor role model
reviews.content: Great film, great plot although it's a bit like the Navy meets Star Wars, great flight scenes and a compelling story, if you don't think too hard about it.Cruise, and Connelly, both are in motorcycle scenes with no crash helmets or any other protective gear. This is a very poor role model and illegal almost everywhere. Theses scenes definitely detracted from the overall enjoyment.

It was well done and the action scenes were exceptional, but it was just a very close re-hashing of the original... with characters interchangeable with the originals.And some of the events near the end were more preposterous than the Mission Impossible series or James Bond.It was fun, though. And the attack on a 100 ft deck over the snow was amazing to see.

reviews.review_title: Broken the curse of sequel bad movies
reviews.content: Not every sequel make me feel amazed like this one left me. With no doubt this movie is the higher expectations ever. Amaginz as usual performed by Tom Cruise and the rest of time.Emotional colab too by Val Kilmer, hope he get better soon.

reviews.review_title: I feel the neeed, the neeeed for Top Gun: Rooster
reviews.content: Unreal. Nostalgia, sadness, happiness, suspense, surprises. I left the cinema wanting to jump in my car and ramp it up to Mach 11, then realised this isn't possible or legal so I'll leave it to these guys. Top Gun fans, film fans, if you can see, hear or just one of them go and be present for this film. Gimme more!

reviews.review_title: Long time coming worth the wait...
reviews.content: Tom always delivers, the movie has it all... Special effects were incredible and the action was great. A little sprinkle of nostalgia and romance to boot. Loved the movie. Buckle your seatbelts for the ride.

Two good songs from the earlier movie that were missed were lead me on and mighty wings....they make a good background score. In the earlier movie this music lent a good touch, keeping up with the situation and content.

reviews.review_title: One of the few GREAT movies coming out these days...a MUST SEE!
reviews.content: There are so few good movies being made these days that grab you from the beginning & hold your attention to the end.......and there are very very VERY few sequels that can hold their own with the original movie......this is one of the best I've ever seen in both categories. Kudos to Tom Cruise for producing a top notch piece of work & tying it in in so many subtle ways with the original TOP GUN...that takes real talent. There are so many talented actors in this movie & it was so wonderful to see Val Kilmer recreate the Iceman....watching this movie just whisked me back so many years to a kinder, gentler world...Best movie I've seen in years!! Don't miss this one!
Due to the rave reviews I went thinking that maybe it would actually be good, but it wasn't. It has a ludicrous plot riddled with unrealistic nonsense.

The original Top Gun was close to our hearts, our wedding song was Take My Breath Away, so let's say--we watched it more than a few times. My husband even learned to fly planes.I think this new version gave all the right hit-backs to the first, and it is an epic movie to be watched again and again. My only wish is that they had kept our song for another love scene.Miles Teller does an amazing job, just like in his remake of Footloose. The football beach scene was not hard to watch. He pulls my heartstrings.Jennifer Connelly has been a favorite of mine since Labyrinth. Her talent is beyond compare, and she is capable of anything.

reviews.review_title: Decent, but just misses the mark
reviews.content: While it seems that everyone is currently caught up in the nostalgia trip, this movie misses on a few different notes. First, if the entire movie is predicated on completing a mission that is seemingly impossible, wouldn't it make sense that there is at least one friendly causality during the entire movie? This movie would have cemented itself as an instant classic if Maverick had successfully sacrificed his life for Rooster, but instead what we got was another crash landing from Cruise and an additional 30 minutes of trailing off plot and a predictable ending where the audience could be confident that no one would die in this film since the moment for true greatness had passed. Aside from that, the build up was nice and the character development was decent. Still far better than the first film for sure.

This film has been over rated by the critics. It's just okay. The flight sequences are excellent but everything else is average at best. Not as good as the first film which I have watched several times. No character development and the love interest is totally unnecessary.Will not be watching it again and not a great film like a lot of the media would have you believe !.

A blockbuster for the ages. I totally agreed with and, understood each character. The storyline is solid. The action sequences are on another level and, it's a classy price of cinema drawn together by a nostalgic soundtrack and sound acting.

reviews.review_title: One of the best sequels I've seen
reviews.content: This film had a lot to live up too and it delivered. Almost all sequels never live up to the original but this did and went even further. Will definetly been going to see it again whilst it's in the cinema.

reviews.review_title: Blown away 35 years ago and again today !!
reviews.content:
Really good. Well worth it. Thought it would be a cheesy remake but was brilliant. Really emotional too - not the movie but it was the First movie I brought a girl to then when I was 13 and this time I had my girlfriend ( obviously not the same one but who is amazing BTW & I had my 2 daughters who were around the same age as me at the original !!! ) BUT..... They all enjoyed it.Great sequel. Great sound/ cinematography / well edited and BTW - sit at the front in an imax
A great day. Thank you Maverick 🙏 # legend.
Really enjoyed the film. There's something about Tom Cruise, is it his infectious smile? Unmatched charisma? Watching his movies are worth the time and money.

My god, what a movie. Just saw it yesterday in cinema. I am too young to experience the first one as it released, but I have watched it multiple times and always enjoy it. I am also a fan of aviation.Tom Cruise is the best movie star. He cares so deeply for his craft and puts so much effort in it. I feel that his movies are the only ones in which you always get your moneys worth in cinema.The sound and the scenery in the movie are amazing. It´s beautiful.All in all, ten of ten, was on the edge of my seat the whole time, loved every second of it, might go again. Truly a movie that needs to be watched on the big screen!

One of the hype movie that everyone is talking about today. This is the sequel to 1986's Top Gun. The movie tells a story of capt. Maverick who is assigned to return to Top Gun to teach the best graduate pilots for the important mission of the country . In fact, many people say that there is a lot of nostalgia in Top Gun 2022 with Top Gun 1986, unfortunately it's been so long since i watched top gun 1986's so yeah I've forgotten the details of the 1986's Top Gun . The conflict between Maverick and Bradley Bradshaw is a really strong chemistry . A lot of tense , fun scenes , especially if you enjoy the 4DX version , the fighter jet scene will certainly become more tense and exciting at the same time. For the acting of the actors , of course there is no doubt. Unfortunately, the chemistry between Maverick, played by Tom Cruise and Penny Benjamin, played by Jennifer Conelly, is not that stronf . Their love story is just like sweetener in this movie . But overall this movie is one of the best movie in the summer of 2022. The cinematography is a winner 9/10!! Superbb.

I have never had such an incredible experience at the cinema before watching this. Easily Tom Cruise' best movie for me. Basically everything about this is perfect. This is the type of movie you just can't miss. Please watch this movie.

You make a movie with well written characters, well casted characters, a basic yet intriguing plot, and you do NOT exercise in the box ticking, social engineering, woke-topia style of media making that Hollywood seems obscenely obsessed with now...you end up with the best film of the year, and (as of writing) the highest grossing of the year.It's good.

Cruise has come a long way since risky buisness and taps. Seen probably all of his movies. This one however, establishes Cruise as a legend not only as a pilot, but as a human being as his emotions of his long lost copilot, being rekindled with the presence of Gooses son.The mission and all of the side bars were tied nicely together as the ending reminds you of the first installment. Bruckheimer always makes a good action/drama.Hated to wait almost 2 years to see it, but it was a great movie.

Top Gun has always been one of my favourite films so I was worried when I heard they were doing a remake. But there was no need. It had the perfect amount of nostalgia without being cheesy. Perfect blend of original and new music. Perfect amount of emotion, from tears to laughs. Dare I say better than the original......Even my 14 year old stepdaughter who has never seen the original said it's one of her favourite films.A 100% must see.

reviews.review_title: Hours of butt-clenching action and nostalgia.
reviews.content: I went in expecting it to be a sub-par followup to the original movie, and boy was I wrong. The action sequences were like no other and a huge sigh of relief from the CGI-ridden movies of today. They also nailed the atmosphere as I felt the sincere longing for days of the past in small references.

Highly recommended this movie, IMO you couldn't have done better the actors where great, the details in the movie where pretty much spot on. Like the subtle Skunk Works signage on the prototype aircraft. Scattering of laughs thrown in made it also great. Loved seeing some of the legacies for the old Top Gun. Great work Tom...!

This movie is so well done that they have set a bar that is too high for anyone to be able to compete at when it comes to making Aviation movies.My hat is off to everyone involved with making this movie.There won't be anyone else who will want to make an Aviation themed movie knowing they can't compete with this.Everyone who is alive and seen this movie, you have seen the best Aviation movie ever made, and it will never be beaten.

I wanted to write a review to tell you this.... if you have a theatre with the d-box chairs (they move and vibrate)... spend the extra money. It was phenomenal! This movie was made for that technology or the other way around. One of the best movie experiences of my life! The movie itself is also really really good. Check it out regardless of the seats.

I'm really glad they still made it a Tom Cruise movie. They are marrying past story lines but the cinematography and dramatic pauses are all great. The special effects are all top notch, the view in flight the creativity in flight is all fantastic. There are no let downs at all any point in this movie, it's a just a really top notch film you should see in a movie theatre. It's not something we get much more of these days, maybe 1 to a couple a year. Just a great job done all around.

reviews.review_title: Could of been high score but...
reviews.content:
Over all I do enjoy it however here are my issues:
Too similar to the first that it feels like a reboot as appear continuation.Not enough character development for the team. I wouldn't remember who and what their call names are.Like every other Tom Cruise movies he comes out on top at the end. In real world scenario, fighting is not so staged.Everyone is perfect and good looking. Have you looked around your surroundings? When do you ever see that in the real world.Yes I realize it's just a movie, that's why I'm not giving it a 10.

Top Gun will always be a classic and you can't take that away. Sequels can often diminish the story when it's pushed for profit. Top Gun Maverick came out at a good time and didn't take anything away from the first film. I love how the characters developed over the past 30+ years. I was so thrilled to get some history from Penny Benjamin. People complain that "Charlie" was not brought back because of her age, but she was mature in the first film and her character should have moved on from the troublesome Maverick. The film ends as expected with cheers. I would see it over and over again, just like Top Gun 💕

Be prepared to suspend your technical disbelief to allow yourself to really enjoy this great romp which more than pays homage to the original film.Great story and great cast, the action is enjoyable if a little hard to swallow occasionally, but come on, why let technical details get in the way of the escapist fun!A great film from the start.

After a long line of mediocre and bad movies produced during the covid period we finally see a good one. I was worried that it would be all cliche and flat as most seconds parts of a successful grand ones are. But no. They managed to make it just as it should be.Watch it, it's worth it.

reviews.review_title: Maverick is back...and the beloved 80s too.
reviews.content: Top Gun Maverick is one of the best movies of 2022. With a beautiful story full of action and nostalgia, Kosinski succeeded making a film who has the best Tom Cruise ever and a powerfull background where friendship is the main reason for everything.The feeling of the 80's lives in the film and also has a perfect Lady Gaga singing probably one of her best song ever for the soundtrack.Top Gun Maverick represents the golden age of 80's movies and remind us that we should not forget that unique style.

I do not understand the raves. This is a
tired, paint-by-numbers rehash of the
original. This movie has no texture, no soul.The writing is terrible, and so is the
directing. The actors are phoning it in. A
cash grab if I ever saw one.

This is my first review . I watched this movie with my uncle last weekend and we enjoyed it! Full adrenaline and over the edge CGI .I've watched few of Tom Cruise movies in the cinema M:I 4 5 6 , Edge of Tomorrow, The Mummy .Looking forward for the next Top Gun .

⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐½/10More than thirty years have passed since the events of Top Gun, and Captain Pete 'Maverick' Mitchell (Tom Cruise) has found himself back in a familiar location-now in a new position. With a uranium plant violating a series of NATO agreements, Maverick has to be the one to to train a group of TOP GUN fighter pilots to execute a dangerous mission. Now, in Top Gun: Maverick, the ghosts of Maverick's past will come back to haunt him-and he's not sure that he has what it takes to be successful. On a new mission, with greater stakes, Maverick and his team are off to the races. [more...]Please check out my full review of Joseph Kosinski's Top Gun: Maverick, and my other reviews, by heading to my site, Bain's Film Reviews. Don't forget to subscribe!

This is the first review I've ever written - simply because I too must help compound the importance of this film.It's been a long time coming after a decade or so of CGI-sodden dreck. Its spectacle like this that will, as box office returns have shown, reinvigorate peoples interest in the communal viewing experience. (Outside of a comic-book context)Traditional storytelling using real ingredients.Upon leaving the theatre, a gentleman in front of me let out an sharp exhalation of air as if he'd just clambered out of a high end rollercoaster. His utterance summed up my thoughts and feelings exactly. The cinema should be visceral and have a tangible effect on your being. Bravo.(PS- I watched this film 10 days ago, however its cropped up in my mind pretty much every day since, so much so that I was compelled to write a review, and I wasn't even overly mad for the original. Will probably go again before it's finished its run)

reviews.review_title: A sequel that deserves to be made
reviews.content: A beautiful movie that able to carry the charm of the previous movie while bring in more depth and emtion. The action scenes are breath taking. The storyline is cohesive. The actors and actress were amazing.

Don't waste your money! The film is nothing new and has the same old story and bad acting as before. At least the original one had some storyline. I think Hollywood today has completely failed and needs better talent and to change form immoral movies to more family oriented production value!

reviews.review_title: How do you live up to a classic. This movie shows us how
reviews.content: WOW, the first one was incredible and revolutionary in its time.I was excited to see this movie, but pessimistic that it wouldn't able to compliment the first.It hits all the notes in a contemporary way that pays homage to the first, but not in any forced ways.The acting and cast are impeccable. Miles Teller as Rooster aka Bradley Bradshaw, Goose's sun, is true perfection. It's impossible not to go through every array of emotions watching this.I've now seen it 3 times and it still moves me.I'm amazed at the flight sequences they are truly breathtaking. As a matter of course I had to remind myself to breath numerous times.It was worth the 36 year wait.

Great flight action sequences makes it worth seeing (on the big screen) for that alone, but the storyline and conclusion became all too predictable after the fist 30mins. It was as much about the Maverick/Goose's son relationship as it was the mission for that a select group of Top Gun pilots are training for.It was great to see Val Kilmer back on camera given his health issues, albeit a short cameo.Anthony Edwards' image as Goose appears frequently in flashbacks and old photos - I wonder if he gets any royalties for this?Story 5/10, Action 9/10 = a 7/10 for me.

reviews.review_title: Prequels, sequels, spin-offs and insanely high budgets
reviews.content:
This is what Hollywood has become. I watched this movie on the big screen and it had amazing actions scenes, actors, special effects and nothing else.The plot was like a star wars parody with fighter jets:
storm trooper rockets flying away from the MC's planesridiculously designed enemy base with a hole exactly one rocket wide that leads to the center and explodes everythingcartoonish bad guys unable two notice two dudes stealing a plane right next to them.

This is a very rare example of a sequel far transcending the original. If it doesn't win an Oscar for best cinematography it will be injustice.An ode to the original with an authenticity that is sorely lacking in the movie industry that seems intent on using CGI everywhere. Finally we have live action aerial sequences which get increasingly more gripping as the film progresses.It's also nice to finally see Penny Benjamin in the flesh. One of the highlights.It's a frikin masterpiece and Tom Cruise deserves some serious recognition for consistently delivering riveting actions films in what is, in my opinion, a declining film industry with TV shows being as good as they are now. Tom Cruise entertains and in this film, he goes above and beyond delivering the best film of its kind.I was on the edge of my seat throughout.

Awesome movie. I love Tom cruise and it was great to see Val (iceman) back in. The only thing that concerns me is that isn't the plot the exact same as Star Wars?Pilot has to hit the impossible (death star). I feel like skywalker and maverick are the same character in this movie. They both are pilots with the impossible task of destroying the enemy with a one shot kill mission.Otherwise the acting was awesome. Tom was great. The cast was amazing. I loved the movie.

reviews.review_title: Why did I feel like I watch the first movie again?
reviews.content: I do admit, that VFX this time were great. But I don't know what's more special about TGM. It follows the same exact frame to frame formula as the first installment. Infact, I would say this isn't even required at all.

Top Gun Maverick is one of those rare sequels that is as good as the original! Well almost. ... Like Rocky II and The Empire Strikes Back. Maybe the original has a better soundtrack. I intend to see it again before it leaves the theaters.

reviews.review_title: Amazing movie I really like it
reviews.content: I really enjoyed this movie. I watched half of it tonight on the Epix channel. I liked rooster's character. Miles teller is one of my favorite actors. Tom cruise was great in it as well. I would recommend this movie to a friend. It's just an awesome story, it has great actors. It's got some funny parts. Overall I would watch it again. I hope that they make a 3rd one. That would be really cool. If you haven't seen this movie yet, you should give it a watch. You won't be disappointed. It's the Best movie of 2022. So that's my review on Top gun maverick. I feel like going out and buying the dvd so I can watch it anytime I want.

reviews.review_title: Mature Storyline Beyond All The Action
reviews.content: I was really impressed by the mature storyline between the two main love interests. I'm older so I likely related more to it. But it never felt cheap, and played very sincere. Yes - there's lots of action - but the love story and the chemistry is what really did it for me. I also loved the nostalgia that was both heartbreaking and satisfying with iceman and rooster's collective storylines. Tom Cruise made sure to give his fans exactly what they have been wanting decades for and this film delivered. It also felt complete in that it tied everything up really nice and left you with a sense of hope. Well done.

The movie is perfect in every sense either it would be the cast or cinematography or action. Watched it today and now I am planning to watch it once again as it is such brilliant piece of art! Must watch.It is worth the excitement.
Sequel is better than original. Last 45 min you won't want to blink and miss anything. Tom Cruise is an absolute legend. Whole movie is outstanding. One of the best movies of Tom Cruise....
Exactly what a top gun sequel should be. All the elements of a good blockbuster movie. Nothing that will make you think, or much of a deep story, but fantastic visuals and suspense.

Top Gun:M is the sequel that no one, certainly not I, thought would ever be made. Or that it even needed to be made. But having just seen it, I sure am glad they did.This film is both an artistic achievement as well as a technical achievement. Whatever accolades fall upon this film, they could not be more deserved.From the compulsory eschewal of CGI at the insistence of Mr. Cruise, to the incredible amount of training and demands placed upon the actors, it might've been very easy to sacrifice the soul of the film in favor of technical exploitation. And yet... this film has REAL HEART. The emotions linking the contemporary characters, as well as Maverick's to his past are palpable.The story is as simple as it needs to be, with the perfect amount of character drama, delivered quite expertly by the cast. I didn't even recognize Miles Teller, he was so great, and deep in character! What a transformation.Tom Cruise is a specimen to be studied. All his chops are on display here, and he makes you FEEL along with all the intense FLIGHT.No need to keep on writing, here. The movie far surpasses the original, in my humble opinion, and that's saying something.Of note: I've never been a big fan of war or military themed films, and this one kept me entertained and enthralled entire time.Two hours never went so fast.Bravo to everyone involved in this amazing feature.Enjoy.

reviews.review_title: This is why movies are made
reviews.content: No agenda. No political messages. Just an excellent story with exceptional actors.This was a perfect film. It was emotional and intense. It also didn't shy away from the original but instead leaned into it.One of Cruise's best. And that's saying something.

reviews.review_title: MISSED opportunity: Where's the other stars??
reviews.content: I was really looking forward to this! Movie ran the gamut of emotions, and was great, but why not bring back some old faces like Cobrai Kai did?Maybe I'm just old, but the original was insanely cool with a top notch supporting castThey did bring back Iceman and some middling support cast, but imagine if Meg Ryan came back, Kelly Mcgillis, Viper, Tim Robbins, Michael Ironside, etc.Does feel lonely at the end, with only Tom defying the wrath of old age & time.

From what I read, this film would only be made if the story was right. Well it delivered that in spades. It does beat the original and even stands on its own. The most amazing thing about this movie, was the end as seeing the buzz of the excitement of my family as they really enjoyed watching it and the discussion it created in the car on the way home. That is a moment I will remember forever. Thanks Tom and the rest of cast and crew, you all so nailed it.

reviews.review_title: Great Comeback, Maverick & Rooster, son of Goose!
reviews.content:
Nostagic Reunion - Top Gun 2022
If Tom Cruise was not shedding a tear, many in the cinema audience were getting misty eyed. What a reunion for the cast after 36 years! Val Kilmer did not age as gracefully (or disgracefully as some might say), as did Tom Cruise, who looks as physically fit as his trainees half his age! And sweet vengeance for Rooster, son of Goose (Maverick's ex-wingman who was 'killed' in the original Top Gun 1986). The passion of all the cast shines through and the story plot has pleasant surprises.Message: "Come back safe" - and take the villians out! Also quoting Maverick, "don't think, just do it!". Gut instincts for air combat where survival depends on split seconds flight manouevers. Sit tight for a breath taking movie!

reviews.review_title: Watched it SIX times so far!
reviews.content: I absolutely LOVED IT! It truly was the sequel we were waiting for.We have never watched a movie more than once, but we've paid to see it six times so far! (I do recommend IMAX, it was awesome)The action is brilliant, the tension builds through the movie. You truly feel like you're in the cockpit with the pilots.There is enough nostalgia that the two stories feels connected, but TGM feels current day - very relevant.I love the balance of "light and shade" - humour and serious moments, their timing is impeccable!Standout performances from all the actors. It was well cast. And finally, the musical score is stunning!It's a perfect 10 from me.

reviews.review_title: A great summer blockbuster it is, a 10/10 masterpiece epic it ain't
reviews.content: What's not to love about the original Top Gun? The homoerotic overtures, the age-old trope of Americans as mighty warriors for justice facing a malicious, peer foe flying nonexistent aircraft, plenty of military porn, cheesy dialogue and great music, and a rebellious yet capable and lovable hero. Oh and did I mention awesome photography of military tech?Top Gun: Maverick tries to stick to the same formula and largely succeeds in it. The good things I'll list here because unfortunately they are few. Great photography...and that's about it. To be fair, the references to Goose are more or less successfully and tastefully done, the supporting cast of Cyclone, Warlock and Hondo are good, and it was heartwarming to see Val Kilmer reprise his role with dignity, especially with the way his own health issues were integrated into the filmOther than that, the movie is not really good. The plot is a rehash of a Cold War mission that makes no sense today, the dialogue is bad to atrocious for the most part, Jennifer Connelly is wasted on her role and her lines, and the young pilots team is cartoonishly cocky and insufferable.My biggest gripes are doctrine and technology related. The Mach 10 aircraft may well be in development, but merely as a test bed, and definitely not something that would be pulled in favor of more drones (that still require pilots, whatever admiral Ed Harris may think), and would not require such a dramatic scene.The mission itself makes no sense since there is no mission an F/A-18 could do better than an F-35, except maybe dogfight (oooh now I get it!). Send in 5th gen aircraft to avoid all those SAMs and enemy 5th gen aircraft, not get detected, perform SEAD/DEAD (suppression/destruction of enemy air defense) like it is meant to, and perform the same laser guided bomb drop from a more secure position. Also, I'm not the first to mention that the mission is suspiciously similar to the Star Wars trench run, but hey, it makes for great flying shots.The mission itself also additionally makes no sense with what we know about peer state 5th gen aircraft (i.e., Su-57, NATO code name Felon) and the state of their military after the Ukraine invasion. But this is an old movie, really.Finally, the hero. US military has an up or out approach to personnel, meaning if you don't get promoted sufficiently quickly, you'll be essentially fired. That also means that Maverick would have been out by the time of the Obama administration and given his record, he may not even have reached captain rank, but he's such a lovable rapscallion and has the back of his more career-minded friend, 4-star admiral Ice.Tom Cruise's performance is just him being Tom Cruise. To the reviews saying he gets too much screen time - the title of the movie has his character's name in it. Whaddya expect? That said, he was fine, like he is intensely convincing and charming in his every role, as intense and borderline creepy as he is in his life off-screen.I did enjoy the movie. The flight scenes are the best part, and really are nailbiters. Plus, the nostalgia factor, heavily stressed on purpose, does its thing for all of us who grew up on its predecessor. But, this one will not attain the cult status of the original, nor will it provide excellent opportunities to mock and parody it. A great summer blockbuster it is, a 10/10 masterpiece epic like many reviewers here say, it ain't.

The real stars in this movie are the jetsI liked the movie despite all the huge plot holes, cliched characters, and stealing the plot line from Star Wars-A New HopeThey pay proper homage to the original movieIncredible action scenes, they are really flying and pulling those Gs. See it on the largest screen you can.Val Kilmer's probable last movie role was very good.I"ve seen this movie before on many occasions . Be original but steal from the bestThe first 15 minutes seemed familiar. It was "The Right Stuff" condensed into 15 minutes.It was followed by a few moments from "Eraser" when Arnold lands on top of a car and asks 'where is this' and the kid responds 'earth"We transition to a bald headed commander ripping Maverick a new one... again, just before sending him off to Top Gun...again...as an instructor.Maverick meets the new pilots at bar owned by the lady he left behind. Sounds like Indiana Jones and Marion Ravenwood from "Raiders of the Lost Arc"The mission should sound familiar. Its the same one from Star Wars-A New Hope" and the "Bridges at To-ko-ri"."You are required to maneuver straight down this trench and skim the surface to this point. The target area is only two meters wide. It's a small thermal exhaust port, right below the main port. The shaft leads directly to the reactor system. A precise hit will start a chain reaction which should destroy the station. Only a precise hit will set off a chain reaction." The Death Star blows upNot sure why they didn't call the mission "Operation Sleepy Weasel" as homage to "Hot Shots"I did expect Goose's ghost to appear and say 'use the force Rooster, use the force', just before he fights through his inner demons in the middle of the mission. Someone with inner demons should not flying to begin withOf course there is a scene where Tom Cruise is shown running. And another riding a motorcycle at high speed.I think i saw Jennifer Connelly's forehead actually move once.
Everything was perfect ,the cast ,script special effects EVERYTHING.Sit back relax and enjoy the master pieceIt worthwhile to wait for this movie.Lol we even forgot about our snacks durin the movie.

This movie has me excited 3 days after seeing it. They did such a great job continuing the story started so long ago. Had me at the edge of my seat! Cannot wait to see it again. I do not buy physical media anymore but will buy any box set that comes out for sure.

Theres no need of talking to much about it,
I could watch it 6 days a week
Way better than first
Just works
Love jennifer connelly shes so pretty
Miles taller dancing scene should be solely enough for this to win an oscar
Letsss goooo.

reviews.review_title: The Best USA Centric movie in years.
reviews.content: In a time where American history is being canceled..... At least we get to see a pro American movie that gets us back up on the edge of our seats! As a 30 year USAF Service member I can overlook the Physical implausibility of the story for great American Story telling!It's not the Rock surfing half a helicopter down a colapsing building ridiculus, but I can overlook the plausibility to feel good about life in this country again.
Bunch of the worst clichés I've seen in a long time. Predictable and boring. It is just Tom Cruise and his boy smile versus the world. Long live the American army!

reviews.review_title: Not the original, but good movie
reviews.content: Pros - Story (though I wish they'd have named the enemy country), action, sound fx (see it in the theatre!), nostalgia, Tom Cruise still has itEven - The acting was good except for some of the young Top Gun pilots were a little cheesy.Cons - Cannot compete with original movie in terms of side characters' likeability and the love interest of Maverick.Overall, good movie. 7/10.

reviews.review_title: This is one you will want to see more than once in theaters
reviews.content: What a movie! Great mix of nostalgia and updated storylines. Blockbuster that has you on the edge of your seat along with giving you laughs along the way and pulling at your heart strings. My 9yo talked about this movie for days afterwards (a rare feat) and then wanted to see it again in 4DX 3D. Great cast. Great visuals. Seen it 3x in theaters already.
This movie is a grand show for all.Tom cruise puts everything that he can do. I love the film so much. Every actor of the movie did great job.Recommended for every one.

I have always had something inside me that's made me want to not like Tom Cruise but it's annoyed me that I love all of his films however now that's all gone this film ( co produced by TC ) absolutely smashes it out of the park I can only think he should receive every award possible. Right from the start the hairs on my arms stood up and then I laughed, I cried , my heart raced as I sat on the edge of the seat - the subtle links to the first one are pure compass. I watched this on Imax and would advise others to do the same it's meant for the biggest screen you can find ! I will be watching again. I couldn't suggest anything they could have done better. Absolutely fantastic. Hats off Mr Cruise !

reviews.review_title: Suspend Your Disbelief and Strap Yourself In!
reviews.content: If you loved Top Gun, you'll really love Maverick. If you quite liked Top Gun, you're going to really love the last 40 minutes of Maverick. If you never saw Top Gun, strap yourself in for one hell of a ride!There are many types of sequels - this is one of those "make it again but better" types. The plot will feel very very familiar to anyone who's seen Top Gun. There's more and even better action scenes - the last 40 minutes are quite incredible - like Star Wars battle scenes but without most of the special effects.Aside from the action scenes there's some good acting, just enough humour without going too far with it and a touching cameo from Val Kilmer.What I didn't like was the slightly absurd plot you could fly a plane through, the wooden rivalry between the young pilots (which had none of the bite or credibility of the Maverick vs Ice Man rivalry in Top Gun) and the lack of the many killer lines from Top Gun that have since entered Cinematic Folklore.Overall it's a very entertaining watch for anyone who enjoys action films. It has loads of references to and much of the original cast from Top Gun to keep the "original" fans happy. And it's slick enough and good enough to create a whole new generation of Top Gun fans out there. As sequels go, they've done very well.

reviews.review_title: Very entertaining but 3/5s the first film again
reviews.content: This film is worth seeing and I really enjoyed it, but I don't think it really deserves the high scores it gets.If you have seen the first film then you have seen this one up to the "mission"at the end of the film. There are so many similarities ( e.g. Instead of the cheesey volleyball there is cheeky American football) But I suspect that everyone expected that.Anyway! Enjoy the cheese fest!But ..... enjoy!!!

reviews.review_title: Tom cruise is the best in his line of work.
reviews.content: Top Gun: Maverick is arguably one of the best action films of the 21st century. This movie gave us everything thing that a person would need to enjoy a movie and have a lot of fun in the theatre, from the first min to the last you would see your self sinking into the whole movie event's and having a lot of feelings. I have to give my whole respect to this man and what is he providing to the world. Tom Cruise may legitimately be one of the greatest action star that ever exist, this man doesn't care of the risks and the time that would take, he would do anything to make great senses and that's why this man is one of the best at his job and might be the best. I loved the whole casting of the film and it was really nice seeing Val Kilmer again on the big screen. Man ohh man the sound tracks in the inter film was crazy I loved every one of them they gave us adrenaline throw the scene's. What makes this movie unique it's the jet's throw the whole movie, they didn't use green screen they used really jets throw the whole movie. The angles of filming events, specifically the scenes inside the cabins of the jets were perfect.My rating of the film is 10\10.

The perfect sequel, in fact almost the perfect movie. Everything about this astonishing film is just pitched correctly, the flying sequences are amazing, the soundtrack is great, and Tom Cruise is still a top notch movie star.See it in IMAX. Then go and see it again.

reviews.review_title: This is a good flick in the tradition of the original
reviews.content: So much nostalgia! And so much consistency with the original. The only downside is that much belief needs to be suspended to follow this plot. I wish I could be 16 again and not care. That's really the only negative thing about this movie - it's a little over the top. But it's Top Gun! So it kind of has to be.The jet fighting scenes were amazing. You roll in your seat with Tom Cruise and it feels like you are taking those Gs with him. Unfortunately, their was a little bit of overeager editing done to keep this film at just over two hours. Honestly, it could have been another 4-5 minutes longer with a few more seconds in between some of the scenes. But this may be a generational thing - a lot of recent movies cut harder and move the story faster.

The artistry of the filmmaking is on full display, and the shots are absolutely brilliant. The film's content and theme is especially powerful and beautifully interwoven with the exhilarating fighter jet sequences. Brilliant!

reviews.review_title: Top Gun Maverick is just PURE CINEMA
reviews.content: This movie is just pure cinama. That's it. The best movie of this decade. It made me think how beautiful it's to go and watch a movie. A incredible movie just made for the biggest screen and the best sound system. Tom Cruise will go as the legendary movie maker of all time for sure. He is a madman. He does something for a few minutes in that movie that's just worth an IMAX ticket alone. It's not just about action. Top Gun Maverick keeps things simple and on the deeper side it's about human mortality, guilt and letting go. What a movie. Made me great to be alive.

reviews.review_title: I must have watched something else
reviews.content: First comment ever and motivated by the eyeroll rating of 8+ on this.The Top Gun: Maverick I saw was incredibly predictable and horribly cringe-worthy. The piano scene, the torn relationships, the overacted looks between actors, the dialogue, even Lady Gaga's tune that was featured. All cringe.In my opinion, boomers needed something from their past so desperately, that they held on to this and must have focused on only the great cameo by Val Kilmer, and wiped all the bad about this film from their minds.3/10 at most.Never mind. Now I see why it is rated so highly. The comments about being non-woke speak loud. It isn't that this is a good movie, because it really isn't. It's because the group that fills other pages with complaints about wokeness finally found a film they can use as a springboard for their message. While I don't disagree with it (House of the Dragon was the straw that broke the camel's back for me), don't fall for Top Gun Maverick being as good as the rating says.

reviews.review_title: A note to airplane landing clappers.
reviews.content: 'Top Gun: Maverick' is the only reason you should be clapping when a plane lands. Period.You rarely get a sequel that is at least as good as the original. Well, this movie is awesome! Once you get used to all the Marvel CGI, this movie feels like a breath of fresh air, reminding you it's still possible to do amazing things without the use of tons of CGI. #stillclapping.

reviews.review_title: An unapologetically fun movie. For once.
reviews.content: This is the standout movie of 2020, 2021 and 2022 for me.It is fun.It is funny at just the right moments.It has seat-of-the-pants thrills.The flight and combat sequences are absolutely amazing.It doesn't preach, or whine or ask you to hate yourself. It doesn't take itself too seriously and I loved every single second of it for that.This movie does one thing: Everything it can to entertain you.Top Gun: Maverick is the first movie I've seen in the last 10 years where I would have been happy to sit down and watch it all over again right after the credits rolled.Can't recommend it enough.Disney - take note. This is how it's done.

In jest, as a joke - this movie could be 15 minutes long if drones were usedSeriously - the movie is a B-Roll of cinematic and script cliches, which mostly work. I liked more of it, than what I didn't enjoy.I'd happily pay for this type of entertainment.Let me unplug, get wowed, root for a protagonist and best of all don't preach to me.Why only a 'medium' gun then ? The movie is predictable. If I dismiss that, then it's Top Shelf stuff.
Thank you for my childhood memory that comes back again as medicine for my thirsty soul.You guys are awesome!! Great storyline!! Great cast!! Great great great!!!Thank you!!!

We waited, sure we waited but boy was it worth it. For those of us that grew up in the 80s with Top Gun you have slight trepidation that , like many sequels, it would disappoint, we shouldn't have worried. If you're a fan of the original then you get extra out of this movie and would recommend being familiar with original before seeing this. The nostalgia, the tips of the hat to the original, the action, the humour in places and seat of the pants flight scenes all made for one of the best movies in a long long time, it was just what we all needed.

reviews.review_title: The best sequel to a classic 80s movie, that improves much during the modern era.
reviews.content: "I feel the need, the need for speed" Having just finished watching Top Gun Maverick, Tom Cruise returns to his classic role after 36 years as Pete Maverick Mitchell. I've been waiting so long to see this movie, and now it's finally here. I liked it from the beginning to the end, good acting, a good script, good directing, good dialogue, and good music from Kenny Loggins to Lady Gaga. Awesome action scenes and it will leave a smile on your lips when you leave the cinema, and you will shed one or more tears. It will probably win many awards at the Oscars, and I will crown it one of the best films this year. I recommend this movie to everyone and you will like it highly. I highly rate this movie 11/ 10😀😀😎

Not much on offer other than some decent action sequences which were well directed. The poor script, plot conveniences, moments of cheese and formulaic plot hold the rest of the movie back. The obvious and lazy Hangman Deus Ex Machina during the final dogfight was also eye-roll inducing. The final ten minutes were filled with so much melodrama and corny dialogue that it felt almost satirical. Tom Cruise and Jennifer Connolly were as great as ever and the film is well directed but It's hard to say that it is anything other than overhyped.

Of course, the war plan is ridiculous and looks like stars Wars going for the Moon base. But once you accept that, the show is simple incredible, you attached yourself to your seat and live every minutes with passion. Some plots are expected, but some still surprised us. We all really loved this movie. Go and see it on big screen!!

reviews.review_title: Top action movies defining the genre once again.
reviews.content: The main reason this movie does not disappoint is the fact that the action is real! No CGI but pure adrenalin. It brings back the memories of movies where action scenes were actually filmed and not butchered through a computer. The story is just right and does not try to artificially step up or overdeliver. It's just the right sequel to a story that deserved to be told.If you like action and thrill combined with good music and a story that is just right then this is the movie for you.

reviews.review_title: Not much to say apart from... brilliant. Doesn't get much better!
reviews.content: Loved the cast, the story, the action, the romance. Brilliant, pure movie-making. Saw it in IMAX, the only way to go. See it! Oh, review's too short? Um, hiiiighway to the... danger zone!

reviews.review_title: You will laugh and you will cry!
reviews.content: This movie, is THE movie of 2022 for me. I was not expecting much but, that made the whole movie so much more to me.I laughed and I cried in the theater. It was good. It was really good.This is how a sequel should be.
I absolutely loved this movie! It was full of nail-biting moments and brought back the perfect memories throughout. Tom Cruise did an outstanding job as always. Can't wait to watch it again!
Jumping head toy from Oblivion. Riding with motorcycle at the sunset with a girlfriend from Tron. IT'S ABSOLUTELY MASTERPIECE HOW JOSEP KOSINSKI PICTURE THIS DETAILS FROM OTHER HIS MOVIES.

They ripped off and remade so many scenes from the original top gun that it looked like a remake of the same movie.The singing scene, even the same song, the training accident, the volleyball scene, just changed to football but the exact same thing.

reviews.review_title: The film I didn't know I needed.
reviews.content: I'll admit, despite hearing and reading really positive things about this film, I had reservations. I'm not a big Tom Cruise fan, the original was super cheesy and borderline softcore porn, as enjoyable as it is. Oh how mistaken I was!This film is FULL of action, good humour, modern scenes and themes, attractive people, up to date with female pilots, and a really good story.
