Whilst a sequel, I felt this film could easily stand alone, as it tells you what happened, in a really clever way, so you don't have to have seen the original.This film was phenomenal in so many ways, and I absolutely loved it. 100% worthy of all the hype its getting.

reviews.review_title: The Most exciting film of the year
reviews.content: I went into the cinema as a Top gun fan, excited, finally 2 years of wait was over. The 2 hours in the cinema was an emotional journey, joy, tears, excitement. I almost jumped out off my seat. I wanted to jump up in the air and cheer for it. The excitement continues to top up until the last minute of the film. It has definitely exceeded my expectation, Tom Cruise has done it again!

Full disclosure - I love aviation, and I also love cinema.I used to love being excited to see what films were upcoming at the cinema, but now there is very rarely anything I feel warrants my time or money because of the state that cinema has become. Top Gun Maverick single handedly restored my faith.This film does not succumb to Hollywood "pressure", which I will not go into. The flight sequences are real. The actors feel the G forces for real and it shows (so to anyone who says they are "aviation experts" and s**t on this film then they are clearly missing the point). It pays homage to the original with a goosebump inducing opening sequence. The acting is phenomenal by absolutely everyone in the film. The flight sequences are draw dropping. The cinematography is mesmerising. The plot, whilst yes may be predictable and "inspired" by a popular trench run still really hits home as a breath of fresh air amidst the drivel that is churned out by Hollywood these days. It got me excited, it made my draw drop at the aviation, and it made me cry.Yes - Mav wouldn't have survived a Mach 10 ejection. Yes he would have been fired from the navy for insubordination years ago, but this is a fictional film, not a documentary on the US navy. It is a film with so much dedication and respect put into it that these minor points don't matter. This is a film, not a propaganda piece, not a message on how you should live your life, but pure joyous entertainment at its highest level, which I can't recommend enough. It really does deserve the hype.Think what you will of Tom Cruise but the man clearly works his ass off and it really shows in this film. He has my respect. He wanted this film to be released at cinemas rather than wait for a quick cash grab and go straight to streaming. This was 100% the correct choice as it's a feast for the senses (the numbers don't lie).Please please feel the need if you haven't already. Feel the need..... for speed!

I 100% geeked out to this, it was well written, linking the original nicely to this movie. Some funny bits and parts that make you want to tear up! I loved the new actors and thought the cast was well chosen. Absolutely loved that they included Iceman and it was done with class. Had me on the edge of my seat.

reviews.review_title: Doesn't Hold a Candle to the Original
reviews.content: You'd have to be a pretty lax romantic to prefer Top Gun 2 over Tony Scott's original. The imitations of it, as early as the opening credits, are not pale - but just imitations nonetheless. The action is sensational, of course, and the practicality of the actors actually manning the jet fighters should be commended. But the story isn't anything too impressive, despite it universally being lauded as such by critics and fans. Pete Mitchell reminisces, there's a personal feud between him and his best friend's son, Bradley Bradshaw (Miles Teller) and the passing on of skill and wisdom to a new generation... These are fairly basic plot elements, especially for a legacy sequel. Should it aspire to more? No. In fact, I don't think you could've gone any other route with it.Bradley still harbouring resentment towards Maverick for his father's death is stupid. There's no way around it. Logically, the blame shouldn't fall on Maverick, which is thoroughly examined and concluded in the first story. Maverick throws Goose's dog tags out to sea, and thusly moves on with the solace of truth. Why he's still holding on to guilt, nearly four decades later is unrealistic, narratively. I liked the nostalgic detail of Bradley playing the piano though, as his father Goose did in the first movie.Jon Hamm and Ed Harris go wasted as the Chief Admirals, offering little to the movie despite being excellent actors. Jennifer Connolly, a wonderful actress, turns out to be somewhat annoying as Penny Benjamin, simply because her character is presented as significant to Maverick. All she does is smile at him and recall off-screen memories which have no impact on us. Kelly McGillis's Charlie of the original goes completely unmentioned; a cardinal error on behalf of the screenwriters. She was the love of Maverick's life, and that's pretty clear by the awesome romance in the original. But no, forget all about her - now she's replaced. Try as it might, TOP GUN: MAVERICK cannot hope to tap into the same level of heart and atmosphere which made the original beloved. The soundtrack, too, which incorporates the talents of Harold Faltermeyer and Hans Zimmer, oddly doesn't thunder in as often as it should. It felt like it was in every scene of the original, and really elevated the overall iconography. The final action scene in the mountains is epic, and it's great to feel your seat rumbling with power of the jets. It's effective in making you fear for Maverick's life, or worse, a repeat of history with Goose's death. There's a short little set-piece which feels more something out of Mission Impossible, where an attack chopper chases Maverick on-foot. It's so over-the-top, and I love it. It's the only time where the movie embraces itself as a pure sequel and shows us something brand new. It's vintage action, and probably appeared in a draft for Top Gun 2 back in the early 90's. Side-note: it would've been beyond incredible to see Val Kilmer's "Iceman" swoop in to save Maverick and Rooster at the final second, instead of his rebooted counterpart "Hangman" (Glen Powell). Ridiculous, but incredible. Val's the best.In the end, though, I don't think there's any point in criticising TOP GUN: MAVERICK. It's like, why would you? It's better than 90% of the mainstream schlock Hollywood pumps out these days, and is, clinically, a good movie. Well produced, well acted and with some amazing aerial action to boot. It doesn't hold a candle to the first, but I guess people have "lost that lovin' feelin'"...

I didn't expect that the movie would be that good!!! Action, suspans, emotions, joy!!! I watched it on 4dx format, and i lived all the movie, all the flying scenes were absoluty amazing!!! Well, it really is a quality film!!! I HOPE AND PRAY IT WILL BE A "TOP GUN 3"

Just got out of the cinema, and figured I'd jot this down before I forget. Like the rest of you, I've been hearing about Top Gun 2 & had been looking forward to it for ages, and finally, it's here. I didn't care to watch any of the trailers, since watching trailers these days is equivalent to watching the entire movie. So, I was going to the cinema with no expectations whatsoever.It's superb really. The intro pays homage to the 80s Top Gun. I had always wished I'd been around when the first movie was released so I'd watch it on the big screen. The intro was so like the original movie that it felt like I'd time-travelled to the 80s and was watching the original movie on the big screen on release day. Goosebumps really! Like the original film, the story is not that complicated or filled with plot twists, and it doesn't spend a lot of time with throwbacks - I'm looking at you Wachowski - to the original, instead, it gets cracking and gets the job done.I had a couple of drinks before goin in, to offset the woke BS that's now part of basically every reboot or sequel. There's none of that in here, & nothing like 'The Message' being shoved down the viewer's throat in this. Do yourself a favour and go buy a ticket and a bag of popcorn and watch the movie. What that's going to get you is, compressed air mixed with jet fuel being lit, and then dumping even more fuel in for good measure. What I love about movies like this, is simplicity, executed with great attention to detail & practical effects. None of that superhero stuff peppered with endless green screen fakery.Watching movies like The Northman & Top Gun Maverick kinda gives me hope for the future of cinema. Or maybe, it's the last of a dying breed of films. But like Maverick says, "..maybe.. but not today".

Historically sequels never seem to be as good as the original. One of the things that stood out the most during this movie was the homage to the original movie. Even though goose may have died, he still had an eerie presence during the movie. Yes some of the flight scenes may have been unrealistic but this is Hollywood, it was highly entertaining. I feel the script was very well written this time around.Absolutely one of the best movies of 2022 and in my opinion one of the best sequels ever made.

I am not an aviation aficionado but the aircraft scenes were the only thing I really enjoyed. I don't know all the technicalities and if they were accurate with everything but they were very well done and exciting.The rest of the movie was another story.I am old enough to have watched the original TopGun back in the 80s. It was definitely a classic and I'm sure the highlight of Tom Cruise's career.So I was not terribly surprised when scene after scene was basically a shot for shot remake of the original. But I was very disappointed when I realized it was done in the most cringe worthy way possible. All the smirks that were trying to be flirty were so forced. They were also just spoonfeeding us flashbacks to make sure we remembered which scenes they were reenacting.It basically felt like a pet project of Tom Cruise's ego that wanted to show the world that he's still "got it" or something. I really wish they had given us something new. If I wanted to watch Top Gun I could just watch the original.

I saw Top Gun back in the 80s. At the age of 11, the perfect age to see that movie. Now i am 46 and have learned that my age does not matter when it comes to the themes presented here. Apart from micro gripes, this is a perfect movie in it's genre. If you have love for Top Gun, You will love Top Gun Maverick. Tom Cruise is my hero for how much he gives of himself. A must see on the big screen where sights and sounds immerse you completely.

1986 Top Gun movie was amazing. The new one in 2022 has fulfilled my expectations. I wanted to see a good seal to the story. Here it is, Tom Cruise and his team has perfectly done it.The effort of the casts and crews were amazing. Jenifer Connelly was perfect as a side charecter. Rooster was a carbon copy of Goose. This is the example of how perfect the movie is!

Let's be very honest, this is not a great movie and it should not be ranked among great movies. It's great dumb entertainment though. It doesn't have the originality of Top Gun 1, it's basically the same. But if you just want to be entertained, nothing too complicated, lot's of cool action, popcorn and decent fun, then go for it!

reviews.review_title: The best action film in years.
reviews.content: I'm not a big fan of Top Gun from 1986 so I wasn't expecting to love this film but it's a tour de force. Tom Cruise delivers a powerful peformance in a well rounded story with no darlings. It's everything a great action film should be. It's a solid 10.

This redux is a rebox/regift of the original. Same horrid Kenny Loggins tune overshadowing Harold Faltermeyer's catchy instrumental. Lady Gaga was lured for what reason?The F/A18 flight/fight scenes are average compared to the original F-14 scenes. How can that be 30 years later?The cast of fighter jocks is miscasted. Monica as the Alpha dog is cringe and farcical despite having some women As the underdog jock, that out performs, yes more believable.The cast did "train" & prepare in abbreviated pilot survival rescue/egress, but that doesn't translate to their acting, chemistry or believability.I had trouble finishing this movie after 3/4. It's was so predictable, derivative, boring & lackluster. They stole Star Wars redux plot which was a nearly identical retread of that original.The F/A18 sequences were disappointing. Perhaps because the F-14 was the fastest and a beast to dog fight with and was to be feared not like the slower, smaller more dual role superhornet.Jon Hamm isn't a character actor let alone a military one. Need some military bearing.

reviews.review_title: Much better than first Top Gun movie.
reviews.content: Non-stop action, totally different story, very good acting, same music, ... and a lot of humor.The end is surprising.I really enjoyed this movie.10/10 for me.

Not bad overall. Lots of excitement, good action sequences & nice link to the original. Did not like Val Kilmer's character although not much air time. Was expecting something way different for him. I did enjoy it though. Would've been nice to have a couple more of the original cast in it or at least some explanation as to where they all ended up. Maybe Michael Ironside or Tom Skerritt references. Either way, a good sequel.

Brilliant sequel! Thoroughly enjoyed it! Great nostalgia! Frim start to finish left a grin on my face! Script, acting, music score we great homage to the first film! The jet aerial footage is amazing and CGI would not have had the same effect!

I did not know anyone who wasn't raving about this movie. So, even though I didn't see the first Top Gun, because it was known to be a shallow teen flic, my girlfriend and I decided to go for it. It was everything shallow and cliché you could ever wish in a movie. I am neutral about Tom Cruise, so I am not a hater, but oh boy, was this bad. Normally the 1 star reviews are a bit unfair, but this time, they are so right. All of them. This is about as cliché American as it gets. We stayed, in the hope it would get better, but it is simply ridiculous and completely predictable until the very end. No need to hide yourself from spoilers, imagine the most obvious story and you nailed it.

reviews.review_title: Astronauts, move aside. Fighter pilots now have the coolest job ever.
reviews.content: We all know that sequels, almost without exception, tend to fall short of the original.Especially if the original was a huge blockbuster. Movies like Ghostbusters II, The Matrix Reloaded, Die Hard 2, all flopped because they tried to ride the coattails of their predecessors, but lacked vision of their own.Top Gun: Maverick, however, is on the same par as Terminator 2: Judgment Day. It so far outshines the original so as to eclipse it. This is the movie people will remember years from now, the one they'll keep coming back to.So, what's so good about the new Top Gun? The aerial scenes are incredible. So much so it's hard to believe they were not done in CGI. But, as it stands, the actors flew those fighter jets themselves. For realskies.The plot is clear, straightforward, and engaging. Unlike so many other movies where the storyline is confused and/or muddled by subplots and twists and turns, Top Gun 2 keeps it simple, in the best possible way.The cast is great. Whether it's someone like Glen Powell (Call Sign: Hangman) who portrays the "smug" fighter pilot who knows they're the best of the best, Bob (Call Sign: Bob), whose "boringness" brings a healthy dose of comic relief, Miles Teller (Call Sign: Rooster), who plays the role with much heart, or even Jon Hamm (Call Sign: Cyclone), who sells the "prick" of an officer who can't stand Tom Cruise's face.The scenes taking place on the ground as opposed to in the air are a bit of a hit-and-miss. Some are more interesting than others.However, as a whole, this movie is packed with action, heart, unexpected turns, and tear-jerking moments, and is damn well worth a watch.

I was not the biggest fan of the first one but I love the second one that contains more action and fun. I however am not a fan of how much screen time they gave to a Porsche 911 I think it would have been better spent on an American car seeing as to the movie is the American navy and all.

reviews.review_title: A much needed epic love story with an action twist
reviews.content: Top Gun: Maverick is one of the greatest love stories ever and perhaps the greatest sequel ever made (other than The Terminator 2). I haven't had such positively strong feelings about a movie in a long, long time. In my opinion, it is easily the movie of 2022. Perfect blend of classic and modern.Top Gun: Maverick is a love story about Pete Mitchell, call sign ''Maverick'' (Tom Cruise), a distinguished pilot/naval aviator who uses his tough life situation to his advantage in order to re-ignite the past love with a stunning owner/bartender of a local military personnel favored bar Penny Benjamin (Jennifer Connelly). Penny Benjamin was only referenced as a character in the original Top Gun, so bringing her on the big screen in the sequel was a great decision as is shown in the movie how much potential her character had.Due to the facts that Maverick and Penny have a shaky history and that Penny is now a single mom, meaning her priorities have greatly changed, Maverick realizes right away that he's going to have to really dig deep in order to achieve his goal, which is of course, to win Penny's heart again, this time once and for all. Thus he puts an epic, extatic and romantic plan in motion in order to achieve his goal.With the help of his old friend/wingman Tom Kazansky, call sign ''Iceman'' (Val Kilmer), Maverick gets reinstated back as the instructor in the famous Top Gun school in order to be close to Penny's bar and therefore close to Penny. He cleverly drops by to her bar and acts like he didn't know she owned it in order to keep things casual which doesn't go perfectly. Penny forces Maverick's hand with the bar rules and puts Maverick in a situation where he's forced to pay for everyone's drinks at the bar. Unfortunately for Maverick, his card gets declined which reveals to Penny that he doesn't really offer the financial security she, as a hard working single mom, deserves. However, Penny immediately shows why she got a hold of Maverick's heart by showing she doesn't mind and thus reveals, although very subtly, that Maverick still managed to lay a very much needed foundation for the achievement of his ultimate goal.Upon arriving at Top Gun school, Maverick enters the second stage of his plan. He uses Bradley Bradshaw, call sign Rooster (Miles Teller) - his former deceased wingman's son (who is also one of the top graduates at Top Gun school), to practice being a father figure and with it convince Penny that he's fit and able to be a good father figure, which is crucial as Penny has a daughter. Throughout the movie, Maverick goes all out and over the top to achieve this crucial part of the plan - he gets really into it to the point where he even saves Rooster's life at the end of the movie even though he didn't have to since Penny was not there to see it. By the end of the movie, Maverick and Rooster bond like father and son, thus showing Maverick's second stage of his plan is complete.And while completing the second stage of his plan, he also completes the third and final stage of his plan - the mission he was sent to do for the Navy which he manages to do in a spectacular fashion, therefore solidifying himself as the man Penny has been waiting for.The message of the movie is beautiful and clear cut - it's never too late for love or, if you want, all you need is love. Unequivocal 10/10.

reviews.review_title: Poor Screenwriting, Direction, Set design and same old boring story.
reviews.content: Bar scenes were so poorly shot that it took all the energy out of the movie. Chemistry between Tom and Jennifer was dull. Movie lacked flow and bad editing. Tom cruise was not as usual. Songs were odd one out. Action was quite good but that's all technical part. If one see it from cinema point of view, it lacks all of the essential parts.

Is this the US world view where they fight anyone who is a potential power that could threaten them.All the bad guys are faceless black helmets and the only threat they pose is they are growing more technologically advanced?So, tick, yes they warrant a visit from the world police, those crazy volleyball playing good old boys and girls.Meanwhile they are defending a country where Women's rights are moving towards Taliban levels and none of this is portrayed in the movie.So,,,who are the good guys with aircraft in this movie?

reviews.review_title: TOO Much GForce damaged my Brain !
reviews.content: Tom Cruise says to his audiences "don't think" ! .... I had too many questions about plot blackholes like why the mustache ? & why only one mustache why not Maverick w mustache ? Why can't we fly w hipster 5th generation beards ? I know US side but Why the Enemy don't have drones or any remote aircrafts ? & who exactly is the "allies" which we have been protecting since the Maverick wasn't even born ? & why they don't help us or improve their combats ? & If Tom Cruise resist aging why not pair up a younger chick ! ... so many childish military-aviation questions just itching my mustache-less brain ... Which made me Seriously to root for the 'Enemy' after the script cost me IQ points . Now I can watch it again and enjoy it , my shallowness has improved thank you !

With some parts some similar and some parts diverging Maverick some how blends the story into a roller coaster ride to the finish. An honorable and special adaptation of Americas danger zone action legend.

Such a great movie to watch!!! I think personally is probably Tom Cruise's best movie yet. The movie contains everything and the story is so well written!!! The story is lovely from the beginning untill the end, the movie doesn't let any second to take your eyes from the Tv!!! Every character has his own path and has an impact into the total product!!! Miles Teller also made a great job with his role. For the OG Top Gun fans i think this movie delivers in every part of it and the hype it's not only real but it also put high standards.Anyway, i had great timing watching it and i think everyone also!!!

Let me start with the positives. The action and sound is great. Thats it.Besides that this ridiculous bucket of american puke is just as slimy as it gets! USA USA USA high fiving smart asses, and of course the politically correct black dude and woman fighter pilots. NOTHING new here at all! The romance is a joke and the story is thin and watery. Eeew...

reviews.review_title: Is this a top gun or Tom Cruise career film?
reviews.content:
Is this a top gun or Tom Cruise career film?This film brings a nostalgic and amazing old feeling as it looks that we are watching a movie in the 80s or 90s. But why in 2022 Americans still look arrogant, coky and the best thing the world have to offer?I'm sure this movie was very very expensive to make and Tom Cruise is on it and he is probably the best action actor career still in active but is this movie so great that the entire world was crasy about it? "Oscar winner" and all...
Top gun was a movie about friendship, overcoming the impossible, confidence, competition, beeing American (40 years ago) with one of the best soundtracks of all time.And now? Is it a take 2, 40 years later with a complete disproportional notion of the American ideals and mentality of the 21th century. With Tom Cruise and a extence budget. It could be a cinema movie but it entertains very little, it could be fantasy but is not either fantasy or reality. General idea is a movie to watch one time in your lifetime and forget.

Top Gun: Maverick showed that sequels can be better than the originals. Top Gun will always be a classic but Maverick is a whole lot better, the action is superb and the acting is brilliant, the movie throws away all politics that Hollywood likes to add and they just made a great movie that everyone can enjoy and get lost in and forget about the problems of the world for a couple of hours. Tom Cruise's performance is one for the decade even though it has been 30 plus years since he last played Maverick he was able to portray him fantastically.

Ok -We may well of seen similar scenes of action in much earlier action films . Such as the opening , when we see
Maverick attempting to beat the elements as we saw
by Chuck Yeager in "The Right Stuff" in 1983. I believe that the The Right Stuff won a number of Academy
Awards .This Tom Cruise production may well pick up
one or two as well.Yes ,we are back to Top Gun territory ,right left and centre. But that Tom cruise smile is always infectious.See this great entertainment on as big a screen , with
the noisiest sound affects you can. It's terrific entertainment. And this old codger clapped at the end !!
Tom Cruise is the only actor of Hollywood who knows how to push limits.The movie gives everything at the very right moment.ACTION, EMOTION, STORY, ACTING all needed elements are well crafted.

I never write reviews but this has to be said: I saw this movie for the second time today and it's just perfect. An overall perfect movie. The looks, the action scenes, the music, the jokes, everything. I love it!

reviews.review_title: THIS is how you make a sequel, Hollywood!
reviews.content: This is how you do sequels. Thoughtfully! Decades from the original, work out a great script, excellent storyline, bring back original cast, and turn out a movie that was just brilliant.Exceptionally done. We loved it.
If you were Lucky Enough to have a Top Gun Childhood, prepare for some Good Feels. Hopefully this helps Navy Recruiting. Thanks Tom, for some Happiness in 2022.

Its been a while i got awed by a movie in a cinema. One of the very best lately. A must watch for sure. I loved every single bit of it. Tom Cruise was outstanding and did justice with his role to be honest.

It's an enjoyable film, but being way too over hyped. As corny as the first film may be, I feel it has way more heart and character than it's sequel. The sequel is worth seeing, but I don't feel it's worthy of the hype it's receiving.

Going into this movie i had never seen the original Top Gun(in fact i didn't even know it existed and that Maverick wAs a sequel!)
I thought i was going to hate it but i absolutely loved it.

reviews.review_title: Honestly the Best Sequel to an Original I've Ever Seen
reviews.content: This movie really is amazing. The quality of everything is a solid 10/10....and with ZERO CGI. It's great to see that great movies can still be done without all the computer crap. Gives me hope for the movies of the future. Tom Cruise at his best and the supporting cast was spot on. Go see it. You'll thank me later.

reviews.review_title: Not bad, but not amazing either
reviews.content: The climax is just not as thrilling as I expected. And as usual, Tom Cruise is just too cool to be true in this movie. Unrealistic.Or maybe, in any of his movies.

reviews.review_title: Save the movie industry, save America!
reviews.content: Over the last few years in particular entertainment has been garbage. It has either been poor a storyline or pushing an agenda. Top Gun Maveric takes us back to the Era of the first movie while living in the present. There are no agendas just a great wholesome American film. It paints a picture of some of what the brave men and women in our armed forces do. Movies like this can not only save the movie industry but maybe America too. It has been a long time since I have felt my movie ticket was money well spent. I also could go see this in theaters more than once! A must see!

reviews.review_title: Solid movie but a bit overhyped
reviews.content: The movie is a great combination of action and feel-good. The action scenes were very thrilling. Nice references to the prequel. Cruise does a good acting job.I cannot believe people who say this movie is the best ever.There are too many clichés that make the movie less than perfect. Also some unrealistic events. The cocky behavior in the bar. The driving on the motor without helmets on. The posing of the couple in front of a vintage car. Literally flying apart a plane at mach 10 and then stepping in a bar as if you fell only 3 meters. Being shot down and then meeting up with your wingman also being shot down in the forest after a short hike. Conveniently near an airbase that you can walk into without special equipment (don't they have at least a fence around the airbase?).An ancient plane in the airbase that is conveniently fueled and equipped with rounds and flares.Overall a solid movie, but nowhere near the best movie ever.

Wish we didnt have to wait 30 years for this . Its a fabulous sequal, really good story , brilliant . Really enjoyed it, although its not as fast pacing as Top Gun its more mature , but absolutely Phenominal , think its gonna be one of the best movies of this year perhaps .There are some similar characters,,and some remembered parts , and some very sad parts , but its well worth watching and very exciting and has some real nail biting moments ! Im glad i watched it . Tom Cruise is every bit as good as he was in the original Top Gun, and i must say for a male his age he looks incredible, he still looks as young as he did the first time around I really dont know how he manages to keep so fit ,? Amazing movie !

Awesome movie. I doubt It will win any Oscars, but a much better than than those anyway. I love the fact it keeps with the canon of the original top gun. It feel like the original 1986 TOPGUN without it being the original top gun. If you like the original, I'm sure you will like it. It is worth it to see in the theatre.
This is what movies are supposed to be like. What a fun time, never a dull moment. I would be shocked to see anything below an 8 for this movie. See it in IMAX!!!!
Top Gun : Maverick. What can you say about a sequel this many years later? All I can say is it brings it from start to finish. It is so good I might join the church of Scientology.

reviews.review_title: Star Wars Trench Run But In F18's
reviews.content: This was literally Star Wars: A New Hope but instead of a Death Star it's the inside of a mountain on Earth. Instead of X-Wings it Was F-18's.It involved a trench run, no missile guidance system, a "one in a million Shot", and getting out of Dodge before the whole thing blows, get back to base and have the entire carrier run up to them to lift them "onto their shoulders".The only thing it lacked in similarity was the rewards ceremony at the end with two droids shaking and making beeping noises.Tom Cruise is Obiwan, Miles Teller is Luke Skywalker, Jennifer Connolly is Princess Leia, and Glen Powell is Chewie.Save yourself the time and and money and just watch Star Wars: A New Hope again and pretend they're in F-18's.

It's rare that a sequel matches the energy and enthusiasm of the movie it's following. It's even more rare when it is as good as, if not better in some ways, than the original. Those movies don't come along very often. This is that movie!!!

I don't think I've ever found such an awful film so enjoyable! Let's remove the rose tinted spectacles for a moment and be truthful here; this film is terrible in so many ways, but the fact remains that it's really good at the same time. The plot is weak, the dialogue is really cheesy, and most of the acting is very average at best. What makes it great is the way it has brought in the nostalgia from the original, and thrown it together with some amazing visuals and a soundtrack that just has to be seen on a big screen to be fully appreciated. Right from the moment the lights go down, and then you hear the sound of those tubular bells ring out for the anthem during the opening credits, you're immediately transported back to 1986, and all those feelings come flooding back. There's lots of scenes that are basically a reboot of the original, and obviously lots of elements that try to continue the original story but the mix is well balanced. As long as you don't overanalyse it, because some of the decisions and basic physics don't make sense, and can get past the cheesiness of the whole thing, and don't get too bothered by the old 'USA saving the world from the (unnamed communist) bad guys' narrative then it's a thoroughly enjoyable film.
Really enjoyed the film. A slice of my youth mixed with modern VFX. I was white knuckled by the stunts. So thankful this finally came to the big screen.

What a great movie! As a fan of the original movie I could not wait for the release date, rushing from work to an early showing. The film took me on a rollercoaster of emotion the joys, the sadness and the laugh out loud humour. A film well worth watching, currently working out my nearest imax cinema to go see it in the full glory.

I had little interests in seeing this movie at first. Given the trailer, what I thought was going to happen, and the over-saturation of sequels/remakes, it seemed like a recipe for disaster. I am so glad to say that I was wrong. Tom Cruise still has the same charm as Maverick along with all the other actors, the story was engaging and flowed smoothly, and the movie had the right amount of tension that never broke and maintained it to the end. Few things did keep me from giving the movie a 10, but I'll let you see it to figure out why. All in all, a very good movie that gives a refreshing sense of pride in the USA and it's military (which can be good from time to time).
For me it is the best movie I have seen this year, excellent. I recommend it to all my friends. Go to the cinema to see this gem. Me and my family tryly like this movie.
It's really bad. I didn't watch the first movie so I was very confused. It's predictable and dumb. Don't waste 2 hours of your life watching a flying movie. Anything else would be better.

reviews.review_title: Home movie while banging left and right
reviews.content: Ever back in the day go to someone's house and sit thru home movies of their vacation? Maverick felt like sitting thru Tom's telling of his current personal movie with cuts of his old home movies. From the opening clip with Tom vouching for what you are about to see was not CGI, I got a bad feeling how it was a shot and who wad in it was more important than a story. Borrowing directly from Star Wars IV, Dambusters, etc we get a lame plot of gee can we hit a difficult target that's well defended. And after we're done shooting the hole we'll have aerial combat. The scenes of Tom bouncing first left and then right in his cockpit are shown over and over after we have to watch other pilots doing same. As for plot, we need pilots in planes because there is GPS jamming but that didn't stop a hoard of cruise missiles from flying thru the same airspace to bash the enemy airbase. An airbase that is home to scary 6th generation fighters we're told again and again. Later we find out those fighters are parked exposed on runways while a protective hangar is being used to shelter a remnant F14. Coincidence? I think the better movie would have been Tom training to kids for the attack only to have the timetable advanced. To save their lives, Tom flies overwatch in the skunk works plane from Scene 1 and engages the enemy's high tech fighters in the next evolution in air combat. Now that's Top Gun 2.0!

reviews.review_title: Wait Until It Is On A Streaming Platform
reviews.content: 36 years and fiver writers later they could only manage to come up with a mediocre movie that is over the top and does not come close to the original.The movie starts off good with Maverick testing an experimental plane and reaches Mach 10 (12348km/hr) doing so. Then he is sent back to Top Gun to train newly qualified Pilots to carry out a specific mission which is three weeks away. The mission involves flying F18s in a twisty valley at over 1000 km/hr at an altitude of just 100 feet.Why they used F 18s when the Navy has F 35s which are the latest tech boggles my mind. Also why they used fighters instead of precision guided missiles is also confusing.There are too many close ups of the action sequences. A movie of this kind with lots of action sequences requires wide shots which are missing.Why would the Navy send newly qualified pilots when there are more than a thousand F18 pilots to choose from?The two seater F18 is called the growler but they kept calling it the two seater.Since Kelly McGillis is not in the right shape to be a love interest, they hired Jennifer Connelly to be Maverick's love interest. Remember the bar tender from the og film? She is the one.There are just many things wrong about the movie.

reviews.review_title: Enjoy the Very height of Tom Cruise's career
reviews.content: There have finnaly come a film that surpassed Mad Max in the action stand alone movie genre since the turning of the century. It makes me ashamed to never have watched the first Top Gun so far. 007 industry wiuld take in consideration by the core this masterpiece if it wanted to put it's chicken's egg into a new revival of a continuing legacy. Thanks Tom Cruise!

If you have the simple intellect to enjoy productions like 2 1/2 men and friends, you'll be right at home in this movie. All others are advised to avoid. If I hadn't paid eight dollars to watch it I had walked out after the first 20 minutes. The movie involves ridiculous scenarios including Tom having to pay for everybody's drink in a large bar because of some simple faux pas! Really? How is that even believable! Tom never really tries to entertain in this, and there's a crew of the most unlikely team pilots that he has the training that you've ever met. Anyone who's ever seen pilots interviewed in the news knows that these are high intellect professional individuals responsible for flying planes each equal to a lifetime salary of 40 people. They don't put idiots in charge of them!

reviews.review_title: Is great movie reminds me of its predecessor
reviews.content: Maverick is a great movie it reminds me of its predecessor and the action is tremendous it also does not follow the leftist agenda as much as some of the rest of the movies out there today which is surprising which is surprising I myself cannot stand cannot stand what most of the movies are pushing these days.

reviews.review_title: This movie is worth risking getting COVID for
reviews.content: If you have chosen to get vaccinated and boosted and wear your mask in public to avoid getting COVID, this movie is worth risking your health and life to watch in theaters. Best modern sequel I've ever seen to any movie with top performances from everyone involved. Mad Max Fury Road comes maybe a close second but doesn't star the same actor from the 80s movies whereas this one does. The last 3rd pushed this movie into the masterpiece category for me. So, triple mask up, get your 4th booster, and brave going outside just to see this movie. It's worth all that.
This movie is probably one of the best movies I have seen in such a long time.I loved the original but this blew it out of the water.This is probably the best ever sequel to be made.

reviews.review_title: Reaching the pinnacle of his craft
reviews.content: When we walked out of the cinema, it was as if the pandemic never happened in the past two years. We knew this was going to be that movie that would remind us of the magic that can be created for the cinema experience. A movie for the ages.There were many things to remember about the movie. The feeling of being on the edge of our seats almost throughout the movie. The haunting soundtrack that brought back memories of the original movie almost 40 years ago. The satisfying development of the closest relationships Maverick had with the other main characters of the movie. The sight of the F14 back in the air, and the reminder that it was at one point the master of the skies. The fact that they managed to squeeze in the Tom Cruise run in a movie about fighter jets.But in the ensuing days of watching the movie, it was clear that even these memories about the movie would fade gently.Why 10/10 then? Because this movie was more than just that. It was put together by an actor and a team that gave everything they had to the process of making a movie. And we would always remember that - that we were presented a masterpiece by Tom Cruise, who is well and truly at the pinnacle of his craft.

There is only one person in this movie mattered and that is TOM CRUISE. He is rightfully the only true movie star presently. Every minute in they spent up in the air with those fighter jet sequences are magnificent and must be experienced in Big screen and it will give u a roller coaster like adrenaline tight experience.Now I don't live in US.. so the patriotic all americana tingle didn't connect to me. This movie was oozing with ray ban commercial (no pun intended) vibe through out especially in the middle part. And the most important thing this was such a dude kinda movie. My wife who is also not american and doesn't care about fighter jets , the movie offered her nothing expect for Tom Cruise. The enemy threat didn't actually felt very threatening. The whole cast has very little to do. There were these top pilots but in the 3rd act, we forget about everyone expect for Miles Teller.

reviews.review_title: Possibly the best movie I have ever watched!
reviews.content: I can see why Tom wanted to save this for the big screen. This deserves the full movie experience and reminds you what an epic blockbuster really is. Love the tie backs to the original Top Gun yet this movie stands alone as simply great movie.

reviews.review_title: Trying so very much, but no....
reviews.content: Die hard TopGun fan here, for more than 35 years. When I heard there was going to be a sequel, i was both ecstatic and terrified. What if it was bad?Is it bad? Well... it is so very predictable, sorry to say. I was hurting watching it. Probably it was a lot of fun for Tom Cruise to make the movie and we are all spoiled with super beautiful Jennifer Connelly, but the plot is just too weak. Any random movie star making a movie with this storyline would have flopped badly.I'm almost sad I watched it, this is definitely not a worthy sequel.I will watch the original anytime with a smile on the face, but will avoid the sequel. And I'm still one of the biggest TopGun fans, will be forever.

It's the clearest, smoothest, most beautiful, most entertaining movie I've seen in recent years. I think my brother Tom Cruise will definitely get the best actor Oscar.The director did such a great job...He has adjusted the dose of romance so beautifully that it is neither too little nor too much.The script and editing of the movie are the most important factors that make the movie great. The movie flows like water. The introduction, the development and the result are given in a great way. The movie is not boring, on the contrary, you want it to never end.It is also successful from a cinematographic point of view. Catchy scenes stand out.I trembled with excitement while watching it... Unfortunately, there is no movie that has given me this feeling for a long time.Miles Teller is a very good choice. Another factor that makes the cast movie watchable.Let me also mention that the first movie is ahead of the league.In my opinion, one of the best movies of recent years. Definitely a movie that should be seen in the cinema. He deserved my money down to the last penny.

Overrated.Well, If you watched Behind Enemy Lines and the first top gun you have already an idea about what is happening. While watching I keep having the taste of dirty cheap US propaganda.Taking out 2 SU57 with one F14. I understand the need for Yanks to boost their morale after so many setbacks and disasters, but dont insult our intelligence. And every action is so predictable. Maybe I grew up and I can no longer watch Yank movies without questioning the events or logic. These days you have to switch off your brain to be able to watch any movie produced in Hollywood.The good guys are talking and interacting and we don't know anything about the other side. We just know that they have a Nuclear underground facility.Dehumanizing the enemy is the first step for a war.If you're into pentagone propaganda movies so this is for you.From a technical point of view this movie is perfect. That's all I have to say.
A boring and predictable Tom Cruise vanity project. Ariel scenes are great to look at but that's all.The storyline is non existent and the characters are totally one dimensional.Dull.

reviews.review_title: Tom Cruise is American national treasure
reviews.content: It has typical blockbuster cliches, typical navy ego co.k measuring who's the best games, the bar with everyone Rock'n'Roll mode ON in it, the strong independent girl but too week for the hero, the cool old motorcycle together with the cool old propeller airplane and the coolest 80s sunglasses. But all this without Tom Cruise would be just another Jerry Bruckheimer movie who's name btw showed up 3 times before the first scene of Maverick movie even started. Not being American but growing up heavily influenced by that culture this movie took me out of today's 100% everything industry era and placing me in some different long forgotten life, the human 80s where everything seems like another planet. The Top Gun theme is a masterpiece and this summer brought 80s back in such a classy way along with Stranger things season 4 and now Top Gun Maverick that it was a joy to be back. Hope they keep up making movies and shows inspired by the 80s deep well vibe as it works like a charm. It brings a touch of soul that's missing in today's industry. Personally the 80s atmosphere America's for me is really best or true version of America there is. Love it. Miss it. Tom Cruise has such a hartfull, strong and charismatic appearance. He marked the lives of billions trouought his long career and he's still doing it especially in Top Guns Maverick without any signs of slowing down. Respect to the floor. He's the GOAT in what he does. Val Kilmer is a true legend and he got the recognition he deserves that got many emotional. Miles Teller really thumbs up, Glenn Powell, Jennifer Connelly and others also for such a good job. Musical score is strong, powerful and acts as a wingman of the movie. The action, direction and visuals are insane. All off it so impressive but bottom line Tom Cruise and Top Gun theme are so another level the move should be named Tom Cruise's Top Gun Maverick.

reviews.review_title: Unbelievable ... so nostaglic but wow what an epic movie!
reviews.content: Ya'll out did yourselves! This is the best movie I have seen in a very long time! If you haven't seen it, run to your nearest (preferrably IMAX cause that was wow) theatre. I barely ever leave reviews but I am still amped up over this movie hours later and just had to talk about it. Best two hours I have spent in a long minute. Thank you for bringing this to us! It was brilliant and I imagine has many an award in the future! :)
Must watch movie.A great sequel. A rollercoaster of emotions.Fully indulging movie, definitely enjoyed every minute of the movie.Story is predictable but the movie is worth the watch.
Like the final act clearly takes place in a snowy climate yet jon hamm is sweating his balls off in that control room. Predictable and cliche but gosh i still loved every minute of it.8.5/10.

Before reading on, I have never been a huge fan of "GOTTA GO FASTER"-films as Fast & Furious or Top Gun, and this film once again proves why I'm happy with that.The entinre film can be summarised as:
"We have a mission but a man and a vehicle cannot go as fast as this mission needs to!"
"You are wrong, Im fast boi and I can go fast"
"What no you cant, and if you try to prove it thats illegal"
*proves he's a fast boi*
"You will go to jail for this... maybe, and only after the mission"Tom Cruise is back at it with dialogue that only ever does one of three tings:
Praise him as a hero while he scoffs it offGive lazy exposition heavily directedShow masculine hostilityThe decent parts in this film is what made me stretch to 6/10 - and that is the flying sequences. If this film only stuck to that this would've been a great flight action film. Instead they've got a love interest that is dumbed down all the way to female roles from the 90's, where they 100% adore the action protagonist for little to no apparent reason while they do their own thing and show no real affection except the occational "I will never leave you.....again".
The right amount of nostalgia, the right amount of cheesiness, the right amount of gung ho, right amount of laughs, well done all involved in this superb sequel.

reviews.review_title: 100% a vanity project, but also a really good movie
reviews.content: This movie is way better, way more substantive, and way better executed than the iconic film it is a sequel to. And my praise is not just relatively speaking, the film is an actually good film. In fact, 90% of my issues with it all stem from it's role as a sequel and would be irrelevant if it was a standalone film. The story is tighter (though it still has a few blockbuster-sized holes -- and some intentionally vague stuff designed not to offend any potential viewers in any potential markets -- in it, you just go with them, as we do when it comes to blockbusters in America), the acting is strong, and the emotional stakes feel more authentic within the larger context.It's 100% true it's a vanity project for Cruise, and I justify those aspects (including a few unbelievable things if you know anything about the Navy, Navy pilots, or flying a plane--all things my dad and brothers did/do, giving me an inside view) by saying as a movie star, he's earned it and knows fans will go along with it. Tom Cruise isn't needed for this movie to be good, but he's needed for this to be a TOP GUN sequel and they make decent use of him.I have to join the chorus of folks who find that Kelly McGillis and Meg Ryan got shafted. Not because there aren't valid story reasons for them not to be there as the script was written (or in McGillis's case, even get a true nod) but because the script was written in that way, while still finding a way to include Val Kilmer (deservedly) who can't even speak anymore due to the ravages of his real life cancer, and touch up his appearance significantly. It's common industry knowledge that TOP GUN tested poorly but the romance aspect with McGillis tested well, leading them to do substantial reshoots to add more of McGillis, more romance, and a sex scene that wasn't originally shot. Sure, she isn't a conventional romantic lead anymore, having gained some weight and allowed her hair and appearance to deviate from Hollywood standards, and that's a real thing. But she was an essential part of the film's success. If they'd wanted to, they could have written a phone call, an interview on a podcast, or done any number of things -- same as they did to include Kilmer -- to honor her contribution and reward the many female fans who not only flocked to the screen for the romance but literally made Tom Cruise the bona fide movie star (not just rising star) he was after the success of the original. When Cruise & Co. Controlled all aspects of the film, they could have included McGillis or honored her (as they do, in a very substantive way, the absent Ryan) but choice was made not to. I don't think she should have been the romantic lead (who goes all the way to marriage and kids with the instructor they had an affair with while away at a training program--not many, so it's realistic they aren't still together) and I do fault the film for that.But at the end of the day, if you never think about the first film, you can't say it's not a great film, and enjoyable. I recommend.

reviews.review_title: Just ho see it! You'll be glad you did.
reviews.content: ONLY movie I've ever loved with Tom cruise is Top Gun. The original came out when I was born. LOL! And seen that as a kid multiple times and as an adult over the years. When I heard they were making another I was excited!I just seen Maverick in theaters today. It was really good! I loved that it wasn't corney and stayed the course to the original and wasn't extra with nonsense just to seem like another blockbuster sequel let down.I would recommend everyone see this movie. All the actors are great, and Val Kilmer also comes back in for this one even in his current health condition. Loved it!!

reviews.review_title: MOVIE OF THE YEAR 2022, BEST SEQEL EVER
reviews.content: This movie was fantastic. It included the nostalgia of the original but made an entirely different feel at the same time. I don't like all the CGI these days, and this movie 'felt' like there was none. I need to know how they did it because it looked like these actors were really flying. It's a must see for the theater as the sounds of the jets were absolutely thrilling. Goosebumps. Tom may be an odd duck (he might even think he's a duck for all I know) but man - he can make fantastic movies. I can't say enough. Go see it. I'm serious - like NOW. Are you still reading this? GO SEE IT!

Remember when you forgot about the world for a couple of hours and were transported, inspired, and uplifted by the movies? I used to leave the theater feeling good about the world and optimistic. Now when I watch a movie I'm debating 10 minutes in if I can really get through it. And usually by the time twerking commences, I'm already out the door. Well, this movie is what you've been missing for the last 5 or 10 years. Hey Hollywood, we get preached at in schools, sports, shopping centers, commercials, on bilboards, when eating breakfast cereal, and everywhere in between. Please give us a break! Hopefully someone is paying attention.This movie hits on all cylinders: a great mix or plot and action with a healthy dose of great character development. Probably would've given it a 9 in the past, but considering the bravery required to simply make a good flick these days, it gets a 10 all day long! Go see it and bring grandma and the kids!

Wow, the movie shows how cool airplanes are and how AI will change self-driving airplanes like how Alan Turing changed the future for chatbots :D. There are things that AI can't do today. The movie is fun and interesting. :D.

An action packed return for Tom Cruise which is very beautiful but ultimately falls short with the predictable story line and self indulgent presence from Tom Cruise which doesn't allow time for other characters to be fleshed out nor share screen time.Visuals are stunning, the direction when the fighter planes are on scene is incredible. The story about Maverick training young fighter pilots is mediocre, predictable in its sequence and ultimately drowned out by Tom's screen time. Character Development is almost nonexistent within the film which ultimately leaves the story feeling, as mentioned, mediocre and predictable.
If you don't like TG Maverick you need to get your head examined.This movie is an orgasm of adrenalin. If you can't afford coke, just watch this movie and you'll be flying.

reviews.review_title: Not the Movie We Asked For...But Probably the Movie we Deserve.
reviews.content: Have you ever been to Chilis, Applebees, or Pizza Hut and it was better than you thought it was going to be? You get dragged to these places because someone (not you) decided that it was the least risky place to meet another couple. The food comes, and you're dreading it...and then..blammo! The food tastes great.That is what this movie is. I have to say that a 30+ year gap between the original and the sequel did not promise much to me. I think of the shows that I stopped watching because they were on hiatus during the pandemic and I just couldn't get back into them--I'm looking at you Killing Eve. So 30+ years? I didn't have high expectations. Suffice to say...they were all exceeded.This sequel catches up to Captian Pete Mitchell (Cruise) who, in the intervening three decades, has accumulated a closet full of accommodations, achievements and feats that were distinguished...distinguished...distinguished (inside joke for those who've seen it). Now, "the enemy" (an enemy nation is never mentioned by name) has built a site to weaponize uranium that is in the bottom of this canyon rimmed with SAMs and only low-altitude fighter jets can fly in under the radar and blow it to smithereens.The brass want Cruise to train the latest crop of Top Gun graduates to do the mission. So he is given twelve fighter jockeys to mold into a team--this attack has to be done by four aircraft. And the predictable, contrived, and all-too-familiar devices come into play. Cruise meets his team the night before he is introduced to them. In a bar. Where everyone is singing. They embarrass themselves. Even tossing him out of the bar onto the beach. The next morning...The 2nd in command announces him to the class from a podium in front of the twelve aviators. Cruise walks up right through the middle of them just like Kelly McGillis did in the original. The pained expressions of the fighter jocks take place next. There is competition, humiliation, insubordination, passion, a beach scene where they are playing two way football at the same time!!! The brass isn't happy with Maverick, the fighter jocks aren't happy with Maverick...the new Penny (played by Jennifer Connelley) isn't happy with Maverick...So the mission comes up. The "graduation-cut-short" scene in this film is that the uranium enrichment plant is coming on-line early and the crews have to accelerate their training. The 12 jocks all try to fly a simulated run to knock out the enrichment site but can't get it done. Mav pushes them hard but they are not able to do it....tempers flare and Mav has it out with one of the fighter jocks. And because of this--Mav is grounded by the brass. Huh? Here is where the movie loses what little credibility it had to start with. Apparently the pilot who is distinguished...distinguished...distinguished enough but only got one grade promotion in the last 30 years didn't do anything egregious enough to get grounded. But somehow in this movie, he stepped over the line (where no lives were lost) and got grounded when "the enemy" is about to enrich uranium and destroy the world? Nope.So, what does Mav do? He, of course, steals a plane and shows that the mission can be done. So what does the brass do? Of course, they name HIM mission lead...the guy they grounded 3 scenes earlier.The logical fallacies in the move are too numerous to count. For example, the reason four planes have to fly this mission is because they are in pairs. One of the planes points a laser onto a target while the other plane fires the missile. The next pair do the same thing but actually blow up the facility. Somehow, high level bombers couldn't do this? The opening scene in the movie saw Maverick's program being shut down so unmanned drones could be funded. Perhaps they could have done this mission? The pathway they fly down to the uranium enrichment site are lined with SAMs (dozens of them) but "the enemy" didn't think to put SAMS right at the site itself? There are dozens more.Back to the movie. The rest is predictable so I won't go too much into it. To the shock of no-one, I'm sure, the mission is a success. What happens after the success of the mission though is straight out of Monty Python. Its almost comedic.The saving grace of this movie are the fighter scenes. They truly are spectacular. I'm sure there was plenty of CGI but, unlike a lot of films, you can't really tell the CGI part. Connelley and Cruise sizzle on the screen. I hope those two make another film together...there is some real chemistry between them.So I give this movie a 7 out of 10. Much like Chilis, Applebees, and Pizza Hut....sometimes they hit the mark just right. But, in the back of your mind, you know that there is better food down the street.

I'm sure I'm not alone in this, But when they're discussing the mission whereas they've got to launch a missile at a target 3M in diameter, didn't that sound way too much like Star Wars and the same shot to take down the Death Star?Overall, this was a great movie. Lots of action and I'm glad Cruise's character didn't die at the end of the movie.

I had no doubt that this film was going to be visually specatcular...and it was. My fear was always focused on what the script and plot was going to be like and my worst fears were realised. Jim Cash must be turning in his grave. I'd love to know what Jack Epps Jr thinks of this film. The "mission" that this film's story is centred around must be some of the dumbest writing I've ever experienced. If I find out that this was in fact written by a 10 year old I'll change my rating to a 9.

If you know a thing or two about fighter jets and their pilots training you're in for a disappointment.Especially near the end.Acting is nice. Airplane scenes are even nicer.Almost no CGI.Anyhow. Enjoy.

I loved the original which is one of my all time favourite films of the 80s so when I heard this was coming our way I was a bit sceptical as reboots often don't work imo! Top Gun: Maverick proved me wrong and I wished I watched this at the cinema. It really was quite epic. If you love a bit of nostalgia then this really does hit the spot. Nearly every scene was like the original but without it feeling like it was trying too hard to recreate the past, it had its own storyline. It was just good old fashioned 80s entertainment brought into modern times. There were cliches and corniness but that is why we all loved the original. It didn't even bother me that some of the original soundtrack was used because it just added to the drama and effect. Loved it. Good job!

Yes, I'm old enough for the original.While the jet scenes are amazing and there are plenty of nods to the original, the story is like a badly written James bond episode that would be more suitable for a video game. Suspend any realism to the real world, especially the opening and closing scenes!Dripping with American patriotism, the movie plays more like a defense recruitment ad.

reviews.review_title: Came with low expectation, come out surprised
reviews.content: I usually don't have high hopes for a sequel (And I think you know why). But this movie is great. As a normal person who loves to watch movies, this is the one this should be on top of your watchlist. Why? Because the storyline was great, the acting was great, and there was no cgi. (I recommend watching on IMAX). This is obviously on my top 10 best movies of 2022. If you love the first top gun. You should try to watch the second one! The second one has more action sequences and I love when they fly the jet, they change the aspect ratio from 2.39 to 1.78. It's better to watch in bigger screen (which come from a person who prefer 2:1 aspect ratio) because it wider especially if you want to watch on TV. I genuinely recommend you watching it. 10/10 full star.

I didn't expect such a good movie and storyline. My first time to go into a theater in 3 years and it reminded me what I've been missing. I never thought Top Gun showed any great acting but amazing action film. Maverick, in the other hand, I felt had some very good actingon top of amazing action.

Top gun Maverick was amazing. Great story, not political, and did not have tons of CGI. Most movies lately can't tell a good story, are too political, and have tons of CGI. This is action packed and has you on the edge of your seat the entire time. Has great humor sprinkled in without it being over bearing. Pulls on the emotional strings quite well. I only have one negative that is considered a spoiler so be aware. No one on the good side dies during the action scenes. Would have been nice appropriate to have at least one person die. But it was great either way!

The trailer looked impressive. The film doesn't disappoint. Whilst being utterly predictable, the film is emotional and action packed. Great music in the soundtrack too.Great fun and well worth a watch.

This is a great movie and not just because of 80s nostalgia. The cinematography is beautiful, the action sequences are excellent, and the acting is very good! Tom Cruise hasn't given such a vulnerable performance in years. Worth seeing in the theater for the sound and overall experience.

For a sequel 36 years later it's excellent. The main thing I did not like about this movie is that it just brought too much from the old movie out and it was a little bit cliché and predictable. Maverick let go of Goose in 1986 we know that because he threw his dog tags into the ocean and that should have been the end of that there. But they bring it back which they did not need to. Also the pilots were cliche as well which was sad, they had an opportunity to bring in a new perspective and it was 1986 all over again. I thought the the flight sequences were excellent, I thought the love interest was believable. However I thought the mission and the "enemy" was a little out there. It's an enjoyable movie and a solid effort you'll be entertained for sure. However overall I rate this movie a "meh."

While this Top Gun sequel is definitely watchable, entertaining by spectacular flight sequences, and maintains an overall "feel-good" attitude, it didn't left me thinking that I watched a good movie. I had to suspend all senses of reality through the entire movie. It would have been more fitting, if the characters were wearing spandex superhero suits. And why not, if it is a pilot and not the box that determines the outcome of the dog fight, then the pilot might as well soar as a superhero and knock out a couple of 5th gen fighters out of the air with his fist (pretty much what Tom Cruise has done in a museum-aged aircraft). It is then also fitting that the superhero would return to the millionaire bartender who drives a Porche, owns a waterfront house in San Diego, and spends her racing a million dollar yacht. Enjoy this movie, if you are into excess glamour and perfect characters that mold circumstances to them rather than challenging themselves with any hardships.
The best movie I've ever seen. Best to see at the theatre for the full experience. If you love Aircraft and their our power, this is the movie for you.

reviews.review_title: When it comes to Part II's or revamp movies, this checks all the boxes and more.
reviews.content: Ok, I grew up in the 80's when Top Gun first came out. Loved it then, still love it today. I have seen the movie more times than I can count. So after 30+ years of anticipation and teasing, they finally made a sequel. My only hope was that it wasn't going to be a Hollywood disappointment to try and milk more money off a good name. Time and time again we have scene remakes or sequels that had potential but the flubbed the opportunity and some make you ask why. Ie Ghostbusters (3) or Indiana Jones 4. With Top Gun: Maverick, I was putting my faith in Tom Cruise since he tries hard not to put his name on anything that is going to tarnish his ego as an actor. So when it was announced before covid that they were going to make the movie, I had as much anticipation as I did when they announced Indiana Jones 4, only this time I had some reservation because of the final project of IJ4. Then came the trailers and the interviews of the cast members on YouTube, and again my anticipation went back up.I have to say, I love movies but I have a love/hate relationship with trailers as most of the times the way they construct the trailers, it ends up being better than the movie, or gives you a preconceived notion of the the plot and kind of ruins it for the viewer. As for Top Gun: Maverick's trailer compared to the movie, I really thought it was going to more like a remake for the new generation, especially after watching the trailers and other clips. Boy was I completely happy that I was wrong.This movie surpassed even my expectations so much that I am actually writing this review. Top Gun: Maverick checked all boxes for a great movie. It had nostalgia from the original without being a copycat movie. It had romance like the original, short and not overly dramatized. (which apparently I learned after via IMDb is actually an Easter Egg). Breath taking action was a must especially since the original had it, but seemed to lack something but was masked by the fact that it was a good movie. Character development lately in movies seems to take forever, but here it seemed to lack that because it was really irrelevant and bits were added as needed to move the story forward.As for the movie itself. If you see this movie and you loved the original and if you don't feel it 5 seconds into the opening, then just get up and leave, If you do feel it, and you will know what I am talking about when you see it, then hold on to seats and don't eject because your about to get the ride of your life. You don't just get to see the movie, you will actually feel the movie. Other than Imax documentary or a 3D movies, I have never, and I say this true, I have never felt a movie to the point that I felt like I was actually in some of the scenes. This was all thanks to Tom Cruise and his push to have the actors train and then film in actual fighter jets instead of the industry standard CGI. It really made the movie because it felt real, because short of real war, it was real for these actors and actresses. The only thing they could have possibly done was take a note from Disney's Soarin" ride and pumped the smell of burning jet fuel and heat into the theater.Top Gun: Maverick is a part II.36 years removed, but could easily stand as an original. I personally think that this was a great movie, and actually makes the original even better. I don't usually brag about movies, especially sequels, let a lone write reviews this long. But after the movie, I could not stop telling people how good the movie was and they must experience it in the movie theaters. Some will say that TG:M is better than the original and if you take everything into account except with digital cinematography can offer, then I would have to agree 100% with that. Like I said before, Top Gun is a good movie, Top Gun: Maverick was a great movie that made Top Gun even better and can be easily seen as better than the original. At the end of the day, I will maintain that I thought the last Spider-Man had this distinction, but now Top Gun: Maverick is now my favorite movie that I have seen in a long time.

reviews.review_title: Alazing movie with great action and storylines
reviews.content: Realy loved the second top gun movie, amazing story line. Sit a whole time on the tip of my coach! And beside that a great reunion of the cast from the first one with amazing scenes great stunts and award winning shots.It's recommended to have watched first the first movie that you can follow the story with the second one! Tom Cruise made the movie really lit and showworthly! Never expected this kind of action at first sight but is a must see for you and your friends and family. The flying stunts and the temper and character of Maverick is authentic as in the first one! Together with iceman. Great flashbacks and romance is something you can expect!

I haven't seen the first Top Gun before watching this movie and I had a lot of fun. The visuals are outstanding and it's fun watching the squad bond. The romance feels very forced, but thankfully there isn't a lot of it.

Myfirst review... Well First Maverick came even before I was born. Anyway, I love this so much. It has it all, action, stress, plot twist, and now I know, I will not shave my mustard for a longer time.I want to see more. This is the film that will make the cinemas cool again.

This film was so overhyped and it was extremely underwhelming. As someone who has seen the first movie, I can understand the nostalgia behind these very high reviews. I would say this movie was truly a waste of my four dollars.But- as a collegiate athlete, I can say that this movie has been brought up in many of our team talks about leadership, competing and, courage. There are many moral takeaways of this movie that I do appreciate.On the flipside, terrible plot. I truly don't undertsand how this movie could get over five stars let alone 10. I found myself dazing off and not paying attention because I was so bored.

Top Gun: Maverick is a near masterpiece of a film that is emotional, powerful, funny, entertaining, and so satisfying! The wait was worth it following years of delay and how long it took for this sequel to actually happen. I watched this on Tuesday's early screening in IMAX and absolutely loved it! I had chills all over my body while watching the film. Sure it's nostalgic but what else does it have to offer? It has a great and unique story that's easy to follow. Characters in this film are written better and have a purpose to be in the film although there are some who are just "there". The action sequences are intense and breathtaking. All were done real and blows my mind how they got it done. Tom Cruise is just insane and the best actor of all-time! The pacing for this film is extremely fast and doesn't even feel like the runtime given. The cinematography is amazing as the film is shot beautifully! The ending of this film was good although it could've been written better. I don't have a big gripe on it but it still could've been better. Jennifer Connelly and Miles Teller are also amazing in this film as they're so enjoyable to see on screen. I hope this film gets Oscar Nominations as it absolutely deserves it. I believe this is the best film of the year after watching 14 select movies from this year! It's a great sequel and just an amazing experience. Go watch this film on the biggest screen possible and support the people who made this film for the audience! Another great Tom Cruise movie!Letter Grade: A.

reviews.review_title: This has no right to be this good
reviews.content: If you are a fan of the original this is a must see. If you have even the slightest interest in action movies, this is a must see. Everything in this movie just works so freaking well. Tom Cruise's insistence on actually being in the jets takes this movie to the next level. You can't fake the g-force the actors are going through. Whatever the increased cost for dolby/imax is, is 100% worth it for the last 45 minutes of this movie.
First 15 minutes of this movie is worth of your ticket money and the rest of the movie is bonus. The whole 3rd act of this movie is phenomenal. Tom Cruise is just legend.

What more needs to be said?Apparently IMBD needs me to write more than that though. I have to imagine this movie was written by bots who have only seen the first Top Gun movie and maybe some Michael Bay movies, because the idea of human people sitting down and writing a script this unoriginal is just sad.

Awesome.Mind blowing flight scenes
Better than the first one and an absolute adrenaline fuelled ride
Tom cruise is back to his best
Love this movie and recommend to everyone.Must watch
But you have to watch the first one to really enjoy it,
Loved HangMan.

I absolutely loved the 1st movie..favorite character Goose I now have a cat named Goose.The sequel was great. 1st movie I have been to since Star Wars 9 (can't remember name, because hated it!)..so it made us go back to theater.The action, fabulous, but I enjoyed the subtle ways tribute to old movie. Penny was "the admirals daughter" referenced in first. Rooster reminded me so much of Anthony Edwards Goose. Go see it at theater!

As someone who did not grow up with the first movie but has seen it recently, I thought this was great! It was a great movie in general, seemed to respect to first movie instead of doing any of the "the previous movie didn't matter and everyone's terrible" stuff that sequels are so fond of doing, and I think the plane tricks are cooler in this one.I didn't cry over this one though, so Top Gun (1986) does have that over this new one.

reviews.review_title: A blockbuster that blew away expectations
reviews.content: Top Gun: Maverick is hands down one of the best sequels ever made. It reminded all of us the reason why we still go to the movies. It exceeded the first Top Gun in every way possible and is the first movie to have me on the edge of my seat like it did in a long time. This movie is full of heart. Tom Cruise is excellent in this movie coming back as Maverick. Miles Teller is a force to be reckoned with as Rooster. Jennifer Connelly as Penny was the right choice as Maverick's new love-interest. I was very glad to see Val Kilmer as Iceman. The rest of the cast was also great in their own way. The visuals and real life effects brought to this movie is unlike anything you could possibly imagine for a movie and unlike anything I have ever seen. Definitely my favorite film of 2022.
It was fun but literally the same movie as the original. The cinematographers was outstanding. The dialogue was stilted and somewhat awkward. It was fun but I expected some depth. At least a little.

I really wanted to like this Film but I don't, it's like it's been made by a Fan. The only good part is the casting of Miles Teller as Goose's son. The Film has absolutely no Character development, you cannot care for Characters you know nothing about. It's virtually a Carbon copy of the first Film except for swapping the Volleyball scene for an American Football scene.
I really recommend watching this movie. Tom Cruise Did Good.. All did good. I'm not surprised about 1 billion $ because of course a movie like this costs a huge amount. I love it. CRAZY MOVIE!!

This movie was bathed in nostalgia and came out polished and fun. There were some parts that you had to just turn your brain off and accept as entertainment, but the movie was fantastic.To my surprise, I thought this was as good as the first one. This was by far the best movie I've seen in the theater in years and years and years.

Only three good things in "Top Gun: Maverick": the opening sequence with the hypersonic plane, the minutes of action with F-18 fighters without CGI in the planes, and the scene of football played shirtless by the seaside (it was a military training). In addition, it's worth a ticket on promotion day."Top Gun: Maverick" is a Tom Cruise whim that even generates a bit of entertainment for an audience that doesn't bother with a typical action movie with a very shallow script, which looks like it came out of the work of average students of a cinema course with the theme "Sequel Top Gun".

reviews.review_title: Everything you want it to be
reviews.content: This movie is everything you want it to be, without being too hacky, or corny surprisingly. It itches all your nostalgic needs without washing out the new story. It's not super woke, just modern, and well placed. One of the truest action movies I've honestly ever seen. I was on the edge of my seat the entire time. Do yourself a favor and see this movie in the beefy expensive theaters. This one is worth it.

reviews.review_title: Needed more air-air scenes to prop up a no plot flick.
reviews.content: I watched this movie for the flight scenes and the movie needed a lot more of them. The plot is heavy, dumb and predictable and without more air to air stuff, the movie just kind of limps along in search of a plot. There's lots of gung ho military jazz- but that doesn't help move it along. It just kind of gets stuck. There's a lot of "remember what's his name" -what a great guy Iceman was- and corny stuff like that.
