Have no idea the purpose of Jennifer Connolly's part is for-she's just there as the widow of the deceased fighter pilot Iceman, that Tom Cruise's character carries a torch for through out the entire movie. This movie is on a par with the first Top 'Gun flick-which was pretty crappy. I paid 3.99 to watch this and it was barely worth that. Can't believe this movie raked in 1 billion- so not worth it.

reviews.review_title: It's rare to see a sequel that's better than the original
reviews.content: Top Gun is a classic than can stand the test of time. I never go into a sequel with high expectations because most of the time it's just a money grab. Top Gun Maverick IMO is better than the original. They did an amazing job tying the history of the original Top Gun into this movie, without making it damn near the same movie. If you liked the first Top Gun there's no way you don't like this one.

reviews.review_title: Excellent beyond the first few painful minutes
reviews.content: The first few minutes are a little over the top with its practically-shot-for-shot homage to the original movie (down to the maybe-slightly updated Danger Zone song); the only redeeming quality was the occasional shot (sometimes very eloquently done, even) zeroing in on technical aspects of landing on a carrier that were absent from the first film. After that, though, the movie really takes off (no pun intended) and hits every note. I thought about even sneaking into another theater in the cineplex to try and catch the last 45 minutes (or so) again, they were so great! The emotional closure of the ending felt just ambiguous enough to me that it almost seemed like they were setting up a possible sequel but I'm probably just reading into things.

reviews.review_title: We love a movie like this!!!
reviews.content: Tom Cruise came to let us know that all of us people in our 50' 60' we are great!!! Fantastic, experimented, wise, good looking, smart and much more.My boys also loved the movie.A truly gem with beautiful message. We just love the movie.Don't miss it.

reviews.review_title: Top Gun on Afterburners! Must See in Theaters!
reviews.content: Literally the first 1-second of this movie made my heart pound. Once you see it you'll understand. We saw this on an early premiere and it was so worth it. This movie must be seen in theaters! It's perfectly written with great Easter Eggs paying tribute to the first film. There is far more flying in this move than the original. And all the characters make sense. Especially Maverick's love interest. Far better than Charlie from the original. The crowd was cheering though out the movie. And standing ovation at the end. Such an aviation MASTERPIECE!

reviews.review_title: Super cheesy start, but the last half saved it
reviews.content: I was ready to turn this movie off for about the first 45 minutes. Everyone delivers their lines with... such... extreme... intensity. They are all... so... super... cool. It's like soap opera level, not a shred of naturalistic acting. But then Miles Teller shows up, and thankfully he can act.Teller, Cruise, and the new cocky pilot are the only standouts, the other pilots felt very underdeveloped, like glorified extras. The love story was not set up enough, I did not buy it or care, it felt like an afterthought. Ed Harris is in it for like a minute, and glowers the whole time. It was good to see Val Kilmer, I'm glad Tom Cruise insisted he be in it.The movie is very cliche. My wife and I called out scenes before they happened, like who pulls a Han Solo at the end and shows up to save the heroes out of the blue. And a LOT of shots and little moments were lifted exactly from the original. All that said, the ending came together well for me, it got me inspired and on the edge of my seat.There are also some laughs throughout, and some nice emotional moments. All in all this may be great simply because there's nothing blatantly bad about it- except why did Maverick choose the team he did at the end? He ignored the top pilot and instead chose the dude who almost passed out earlier? Small quibbles. Great cinematography, a solid plot, great music (love the theme), and some nice emotional moments elevate it above the standard blockbuster. Not to a 10 in my opinion, but a solid 8.
I grew up watching top gun and the way the second is done is so good. It's heartfelt and follow's the first in a such a good way it's beautiful to watch. I feel the need the need for speed owe !

reviews.review_title: All the thrills and spills of a boring soap opera
reviews.content: So what is really happening here. Critical mission, wise butts and silly circumstances with boring drama.The big Z.Action is ok. And it is nice to be back on the DeathStar.The dramatic voice overs by Tom when he is describing the mission, are just not exciting. He's good but it sounded like he was reading from a prompter.If only they would use the force.I think the best part was the bird strike.I will give chops to those real pilots and stunt coordinators.So, drop the sappy dialog, the unrealistic circumstances and do a rewrite rather than a cake recipe.This good have been really done better.

Perfect.Most scenes are predictable but not in a bad way
Dolby Atmos for all the flights sequences is the best.If you haven't seen Top Gun, it's not a problem, you'll enjoy Maverick very much, but you'll want rewatch the first one or discover it if you haven't yet.It's definitely worth your time.

It's a special thing to have a great sequel, this was just that. Perfect combination of closing off my parents generation's Top Gun into my 37 yo selfs Top Gun revival. It was the perfect bookend. Full circle type coming of age. The stunts and action did not let down neither did Val <3 what a movie b.

reviews.review_title: Pop corn entertainment, but ultimately forgettable
reviews.content: And I mean that, about being forgettable.I think very few people - if any - would remember TG: Maverick in years to come. That includes those who gave it a 10/10 rating; was it cos' they came out of watching Wiseau's The Room? Usually, dogfights make the movie stay in audiences' memory long after it disappears from the box office (e.g Blue Thunder); unfortunately, Maverick doesn't give us classic battle scenes.The 80s Top Gun made an impact because it was a cultural statement, especially during the Cold War / east vs west thing. It was a time when the world by and large bought in to the Hollywood hype that only America could save the world and the Russians, Arabs were the bad guys. It was the era of Rocky vs Drago, Rambo vs the commies.TG also announced the arrival of the cocky screen persona of a young Tom Cruise as a global Hollywood brand, who went on to solidify that persona and his box office cred in subsequent movies. It also didn't have to compete with a generation of high octane, SPFX powered superhero movies, so a movie filled with somewhat bland dogfights could still get away with it. Then, there was also the evolution of Cruise as an actor who sought to move away from a teeny-bop poster boy, with movies like Born on the Fourth of July, Few Good Men. With the Mission Impossible franchise, he went on to achieve the near impossible - intelligent action movies that consistently satisfy both critics & audiences.Maverick doesn't belong in that league. It's a decent enough watch if you don't have much to do on a lazy Sunday afternoon, but beyond that, it doesn't add anything new as a sequel. Throw in the 80s soundtrack - and I'm guessing this was to attract nostalgic audiences who grew alongside Cruise's movies.As its predecessor, Maverick doesn't try to punch above its weight as pop corn fare. Where it fails to satisfy largely boils down to the fact that its dogfight scenes are nothing to shout about; old F-18s that attempt the impossible by approaching Mach 9/10. The camerawork and battle angles don't give you any edge of the seat moments. The only exciting scene was the opener, where Maverick pilots a B-2 bomber-like experimental plane to exceed Mach 10. If they had stuck with that same jet in the finale, then maybe I'd felt differently. But the F-18s didn't have that same punch in your gut sensation, so the finale turns out to be a lame bomb-the-enemy exercise.Couple that with cliched plot material & movie dialogue, or characters that occupy space to fill up time in between action scenes, and Maverick missed an opportunity to reinvent the dogfight movie. An unnamed enemy, hoo-ra dialogue, machoism, uptight admirals who always wanna clamp the hero, guilt & family ties - it's all there; evidence that the script went through the same run of the mill Hollywood factory. Well known character actors like Jon Hamm or Jennifer Connelly are pretty much A-list wall decos who's characters don't add value to the plot; especially for an Oscar winner like Connelly, you wonder why she accepted a pedestrian role with lame dialogue that could have been played by lesser known actresses. Guess the production team wanted big names to give credence to Maverick. Most of the actors' emotional projection - including Cruise's - seem laboured and unconvincing.Only Miles Teller manages to inject some emotional depth into his Rooster; the loss of his father and the tension it creates with Maverick, is well projected by Teller, despite the fact that this too, belongs to the cliched school of movie plots. It reinforces my sentiment on Teller and just how good he is as an actor - he always gives 100% - whether or not the movie itself stinks. I'm hoping that he'll nab an Oscar one day. My only issue with his Rooster was - what's with the 80s moustache? In any event, Teller's moustachioed appearance bears an uncanny resemblance to Paul Newman's Gen. Leslie Groves in Shadow Makers - check it out.To conclude, if you wanna a TC fare that you can constantly go back to, then go watch MI. Or even Collateral. Leave Maverick for rainy days streaming.

A rip-roaring action follow-on to the original Top gun --absent the 1980's tinge of anabolic Tub-thumpery-- but present the absolutely realistic, vertigo-inducing flight sequences. Maverick is a head-spinning, belly-sinking sequel which hurls you straight into the stratosphere within the first intense moments of the movie. In this superbly merged storyline, adrenaline charged, thrill ride action drama, Tom Cruise --as usual-- delivers 100% Tom Cruise.

Overwhelming feelings
music! Acting! Ed harris ! Val !!Even eyes only got me speechless!!I felt like am too old and longing to good old days while watching first too gun!Words can not describe !Super like!!

reviews.review_title: one of the best movie in 2022!
reviews.content: I really enjoyed if from the beginning - end, and now i have some unhealthy obsession towards glen powell a.k.a hangman. The storyline is perfect & you can feel the warmth between the candidates & their leader.

I admit I'm a die-hard Cruse fan, and to say I'm a Top Gun Fan is an understatement, but I did have my doubts about the sequel. I mean, "WE WANT TOM!" not a bunch of newbies. (Loud sound of buzzer thingy here). From start to finish, this film moved and grooved forward. It had my attention, but not in the frenetic sort of panicky way like some films. An excellent work of filmmaking, acting, sound, everything - It was Art.The only place it slowed down is probably where we needed to breathe - The B story. I think they could have done without some of the dialogue with back story that probably wasn't needed (we know this guy so we didn't need the minutia of the details shoved in) But hey, it's about Mav so I was eating it up. ;)Fave parts of the story for me were the relationship between Rooster and Mav, the flight scenes and some good ol fashioned heart tugging flashbacks, Additionally, they imparted some really good life lessons for us, the next gen. They are a class act; showing how people are infallible, forgivable and able to grow and learn and love. How honoring they were to all people throughout.Like Tom himself, Top Gun gets better with age.

These type of movies are the reason we should always go to the cinema: fun, entertaining, emotional, great action scenes. Tom Cruise is great, at nearly 60 he still has the capability of keeping you on the edge. The scene between Maverick and Ice Man, gave me goosebumps. The airplane scenes are incredible.

reviews.review_title: Great CG but fails in accurate dialogue
reviews.content: For me as a pilot and very long time aircraft enthusiast this movie has many inaccurate military descriptions. The first starts when center is clearing the plane to a flight level saying " cleared to 600" instead of "Angels 60". Once I hear these errors this I wonder how much the director pays attention to accuracy or just the ignorant paying audience. So many past military movies use wrong nomenclature such as in Jet using fuel information in gallons instead of pounds. The Red Tails in another loser . Those black pilots never had that attitude in WW 2 flying P 51's. My father met many of them. They were dedicated civil Air Corp men who knew their job and respected everyone they flew with. The bomber pilots loved them because they could truly fly that plane.

I don't get all the 10/10 films? I didn't grow up with the first one so I don't have nostalgia and the film was very rich in nostalgia. It copied a lot from the first one. The Penny character, who is she? It's like the film tells us we should know who she is? The film is missing music at pivotal times and lines that should have been included. Then it just got over the top near the end, I mean come on!Saying all that it's still a good action film, I just don't understand all the hype?

reviews.review_title: Good fun, but not as good as the original
reviews.content: While this was an enjoyable watch, the original was a better movie. It's not a bad movie, but lacks the substance of the first. The script borrows many themes from its predecessor and even recreates many scenes. While this isn't a bad thing, once you've stripped these scenes out, you're left with a fairly light story and an even lighter script.As it stands, this movie is currently (8.5 at time of review) rated higher than the following action movies: Gladiator, Leon, Avengers End Game and Infinity Wars), The Dark Knight Rises, Die Hard, The Terminator, Blade Runner).Seriously guys?You've either all lost perspective, or you are scientologists keeping Tom's career alive.

I did not care for the first Top Gun!I really didn't care for Kelly McGillis or her character..
I ha ve never cared for Tom Cruise portraying a Military officer, I feel that it is disrespectful.But I was totally surprised of Top Gun Maverick, I really liked it and Tom Cruise, I was Surpirised that we finally got to meet Penny Benjamin, I thought that Jennifer Connelly was perfect for the part, I do wish that they would do Epilog at the end of most, I would like to know if Pete and Penny end up getting married.I was glad that Val Kilmer reprised his role as Iceman, I was disappointed that he did not have a bigger part.I was also disappointed that Meg Ryan was not brought back but glad that Kelly McGillis was NOT brought back.I enjoy watching the new film several times now.

Wow. What a movie can't describe it in words the adrenaline through out the movie is just incredible I've never feel such a adrenaline in a film like this. Just incredible, they really really really nailed it.

Yawn! A totally predictable movie that stole every single plot element from a James Bond or Star Wars movie. Not a single thing happened that wasn't utterly predictable. The action sequences were corny and totally unrealistic (no, a warship cannot fire 2 dozen cruise missiles in under 5 seconds). The acting was poor; then again, the screenplay gave the actors nothing at all to work with.

reviews.review_title: Possibly the greatest movie of this century
reviews.content: I haven't met anyone yet who dislikes this movie. An absolute masterpiece. The acting, the dogfighting scenes were MINDBLOWING.Although the movie disappointed me with something. Throughout the movie I expected Danger Zone to play but I kept waiting and waiting haha. Its understandable why they didn't add the classic theme but a fan is a fan and we always expect some fan service.All and all, wasn't bored to the slightest. The amazing aerial combat sequences kept me attentive as hell.I'd also like to mention that the level of humor in this film is just PERFECT. Modern movies have a lot of humor but I'm glad it was kept to the minimum in this film. It is also a great lesson for other directors that a movie can be thrilling and entertaining without excessive humor.10/10!

Excellent, for me, this sequel is better than the original. Worth highly the ticket price. Maverick has not changed at all. Good story, flashback, action, romance... You will find everything. If you like the first one, you will love this one. 10/10.

Like it's predecessor did for a Reagan's U. S., Top Gun: Maverick gives an embattled society a hope and connection to what got us here. Dripping with a purposeful nostalgia while connecting all of the dots, closing all the loops and giving nods to those who came before... TG:M does it all and more. Even as Cruise's production team has been under the pressure of the Mission Impossible Franchise, as it shows in the Third Act, you are left with a warm heart and a peace of mind while being behind enemy lines. The specific detail to cinematography and charismatic cast line up well to close out a franchise 30 years in the making.

reviews.review_title: Nobody does it better than Tom!!!!
reviews.content: The movie was so much more better than what I anticipated. Climax after climax!!! You're in for a treat. Do go an watch it in the theatres. Tom always knows how to raise the level every time.. that's why he is the best.

I didn't see the first movie, but today I saw the movie Top Gun 2022 and I enjoyed watching it. Hans Zimmer's music was legendary again, the filming and photography were at a high level, the direction and editing were correct, the set design and costume design were also very good, but I have one criticism and that is the characterization that could have been done better for me, except for Tom Cruise. And Jennifer Connelly and Mills Teller, the rest did not have good characterization. Even Jennifer Connelly's character performance in the role of Penny was not perfect, but overall, I saw a good action thriller and I recommend watching it. My score for the movie: 8.7 10.

I loved this film. Well worth the 36 year wait. My expectations of the film had lowered because it had been delayed for a few years, Boy was I wrong. Within the first 10 minutes I could tell it was going to be good.

Wow, wow, wow!!!This was one of the most memorable sequels that is full of action and nostalgia! I applaud Tom Cruise for featuring in another intense, dangerous, and thrilling mission! Kudos to the production team! Bring on Top Gun 3!!!

reviews.review_title: Movies like this don't exist anymore!!
reviews.content: This movie was so worth the wait. Best thing of all? No Hollywood politics or new wave woke ideology being shoved down our throats. Literally just good ole fashion pure entertainment. It has all the feels of the first. We need this movie in our life right now. A breath of fresh air. For fans of the first, go see this movie!!! You won't be disappointed.

I have seen the first movie but this one is just way more action packed and suspensful. Overall this is my favorite movie because of the dog fights and explosions. Honestly, I recommend watching this movie because it is worth it.

I'm an aviation enthusiast and have watched almost all Tom Cruise movies. My go to movies are usually the third installment of Indiana Jones or Back to the Future ( yes I'm an eighties guy) I would watch them any day of the week at the theater. HOWEVER, TopGun Maverick is the best sequel I've ever seen. My kids who are now adults agree. I'm glad Tom waiter until after COVID to release it. This is my first critique of a movie on IMDB. I literally can't wait to see it again this week for a Fathers Day treat. Just absolutely amazing. Totally 10 out of 10.

2 hours of nothing. Oh yeah, i almost forgot, there's a singing piano scene, the most lame sex scene ever, and a gay/homoerotic game at the beach. Oh! And the most important, war planes scenes. Dude, this was the most boring movie i've seen lately. Overrated AF , i couldn't connect with any character, 0 substance, no chemistry between the actors, the script and the story is terrible. I really don't understand why this have 10 stars all over, it's just nonsense.

Nice movie
But in the beginning it was little boring. Thank you for these movie and i will watch it again and again and again i hope we will have new parts soon.

Top Gun arrived in 1980s while I was a college student. I thought it was terrific at that time, a bit innocent and predictable. Rewatched Top Gun before seeing this latest remake, and I stand by my memories of the original.During Top Gun Maverick, there was a sense of realism, if one can say that about a movie, with the current global problems. I thought I could predict the ending but I was wrong. Top Gun Maverick caught my attention, and the movie is exceptional! I liked it more than the original Top Gun!Best movie this year so far, and a great way to start the summer!!!I love how alone Maverick was at the start of the movie, and the symbolism.

If you've ever liked a good movie without the hassle of a bad plot lines this is your movie. From stat to finish you're on the edge of your seat with aww.The sounds, the raw of the jets all the scenes just draws you into this reality of top gun. You get this hype of awesome where you want to fly planes.I would 100% recommended to everyone.

reviews.review_title: Tom Cruise at his very best.
reviews.content: The perfect entertainer. The Original Top Gun had set a standard for filmmakers & audiences alike. With only Top Gun Maverick preceding it's reputation. Top Gun was a classic & had set high standards. But only Tom Cruise himself could have delivered the perfect sequel. Now Top Gun Maverick, is and will remain a trend setter for years to come. No one can outclass Tom Cruise except for himself.

Remember the last time you were in a movie theater, and realized that your jaw dropped for awhile? Or when a scene is so thrilling that you find yourself on the edge of your seat, holding your breath? Well, I lost count of how many times I felt like this watching Top Gun Maverick. A sequel that is superior in EVERY POSSIBLE WAY to the original film.Top Gun, from 1986, is a great action movie, no wonder it became a classic, but we have to admit that it has its flaws, a little relevant plot, which is basically two guys arguing about who has the biggest dick. Top Gun Maverick is arguably more polished, layered, tense, and emotional. We start the film with several established relationships between Maverick and other characters, such as his friendship with Iceman, and his relationship with Penny (Connelly), which doesn't need to be didactic for us to realize all its nuances and complexities. The mix between the old and the new is very present here, including references to the original flick, without ever seeming out of place, or mere fan service. I don't know if I need to talk about the action scenes, but they're absolutely mind-blowing. The sound effects and soundtrack will leave anyone with goosebumps. The CGI doesn't draw attention to itself, and a lot of the visual effects are practical, which brings a wonderful physicality to the action.The supporting cast is very efficient, with Hangman being an updated, and even more douche, version of Iceman, but without the same personality and presence as Val Kilmer's character. Miles Teller also doesn't shine much, but he does a good job. Tom Cruise is the absolute standout, no exceptions.Perhaps something that Top Gun Maverick lacks is the courage to let go of some characters. Despite having moments of life or death, literally, where we feel like anything can happen, there is no real risk, which ends up taking some of the weight off the mission.A film that really deserves the title of Blockbuster, which goes beyond the a mere action movie, and delivers us an exciting, mind-blowing and chills-filled adventure.

reviews.review_title: Should have stopped at the original
reviews.content: I was maybe to hyped for this movie but it was unbearably boring. I didnt really like much outside of the 20 minutes of aerial combat. Miles Teller is a stud and the dude put on like 30 pounds of muscle for this bad boy so if you're into him then it may be worth it. The story was pretty much garbage and there were parts that were so unrealistic that I found myself laughing. It's never a good sign when you're checking your fantasy roster during the main plot points. Anyways, it was fine but definitely not a movie I will be going out of my way to watch again. Id rather watch the original.

reviews.review_title: TOP GUN Maverick ( best of the best, only better)
reviews.content:
Must see movie on the big screen of 2022!.Surprised me how well the story blended with original movie ( being a hard core 1986 Top Gun fan).Incredible aerobatics and cockpit footage, characters and filming was outstanding ( not as many memorable one liners , but hey its 2022.)
Its shows the otherside of Maverick - courage, honour, grief, love respect and family.Not a dull moment ,some humour and plenty of action +. Congratulations to the film crew, cast and director Justin Kosinski.A respectfull tribute to the original director of TOPGUN in 1986 ,Tony Scott.Loved every minute ,glad they waited 36 years its was awesome!Strap in ! Youre in for one hell of a ride.

This is the first time I've given a 10/10, I honestly didn't bslieve I would give any movie above a 9/10 but a couldn't think of a reason to deduct that point. This is truly a flawless sequel which didn't skip a single beat. Only advice would be rewatch the first one before hand to truly appreciate this fully.I see one line reviews constantly so not sure why it is requiring 600 characters but I have nothing else to say so will just speak. Embrace life, be kind, and enjoy this flick.Ok not enough, let's just type randomly, and wonder when enough will be enough. Did you know that the key to a happy life is simply to.....
Wonderful movie. A wonderful and very beautiful movie, and it deserves to be watched and an excellent evaluation, thank you Tom. This movie deserves 10 stars out of 10 stars.

It was a good sequel but not that great or as outstanding as the reviews have suggested. It had a lot of missed opportunities with showing more cool footage of fighter jets etc. With a good soundtrack playing in the background. Only new song was Lady Gaga's but that was simply lame. Characters were ok but they, or Goose's son to be precise, didn't create too much attatchment. Luckily there were a couple of awesome scenes (like the liftoff of the new jet fighter in the beginning where you can feel the power of the aircraft and the end fight scene) which really made you feel the same tingling like in the original version. Also, I liked the new volleyball scene (I guess it was filmed better than the old one). All in all, a good first after-covid "popcorn" movie to see in filmtheatres.

reviews.review_title: Loved this movie not only for the nostalgia
reviews.content: I think the actors were really good. Diversity was clearly visible being 2022. This film releasing in 2022 was such a good shout as the re-shoots needed to be done. I think £500m could have been made if it wasn't for covid and released in 2019.The aerial scene and pilot angles were unbelievable. Seeing it from that view made the viewing experience that much better.Now the storyline was good. Blast from the past and they manage to bridge both movies well with little information. Growing a few seeds into this movie.Over all I think after 2 weeks I still think this is a great movie and would watch it again.

reviews.review_title: It is still possible to create a true blockbuster film!
reviews.content: I waited 4 days to write this because I couldn't find the right words - still can't. I'm not a Tom Cruise fan, or I wasn't. I now understand his on-set reputation. This was a thrilling and meaningful film. The fist one was good; this one was extraordinary. It did have that annoying "man-up" tension, but that's part of the story. Very impressive non-DCI scenes that were very refreshing. I've stopped watching many films because CGI has ruined them. Cruise is nearly ageless and is in top form in all respects. He's finally made me let go of his Scientology shortcomings and jumping on furnature on talk shows; we've all done some crazy stuff.This is a must watch movie. I saw it in D-Box and since I was the only one in those seats I was very self-conscious because my seat was moving and no one else's was. It was very distracting (my feelings, not the chair) but I'm glad I had the experience anyway. The only reason I don't give 10 stars is because while this film is outstanding, it probably won't last 100 years like, "The Wizard of Oz" will. It isn't revolutionary like "Avatar", although there is nothing to criticize about it. It really is a perfect movie in every respect for the here and now and on my personal scale, 9/10 is as good as it gets and is a score I gave to one other film, "Star Trek - The wrath of Khan" for the treatment of the death of Spock. And yes, I give "OZ the only 10/10 score because your great great grandchildren will see it, but probably won't see "Maverick".

Honestly movies dont get better! Great from beginning to end the story the action everything! Hats off to the writers n directors absolute homerun across the board!! Its rare a sequel beats the original but this blows it out of the water! Make sure you watch with a sound bar or surround sound so you get the full feel. Felt like a classic old school bruckheimer. Felt very much like the good ole days with The Rock, and Independence day. Now i have 162 characters left to type so here i am writing nonsense to add to this review so it gets accepted. Ok back to the movie anyone who didnt like the movie is a moron!

reviews.review_title: It looks incredible but is trying to please the audience a little too much
reviews.content: This movie will totaly blow you away, all the scenes in the movie looks incredible and all the actors that is part of this movie is perfectIts an inrcedibly profesional made filmI have some points that I felt stopped from giving this movie a 10/101. The first scenes in the movie I dont understand why it even needs to be in the movie, the scenes with the super airplane flying mach 10.It feels like there could have just been a shorter intro to let Mav get back to top gun.2. After this the movie for a long time feels right on point until u arrive at the scene where Mav and Rooster gets shot down.When this happens the movie loses its realism characteristics that it has built up thru out the entire movie as 2 people behind enemy lines, just got shot down, with no injuries run around a military base stealing a F14 who just also happend to be exactly there and not destroyed.I understand sometimes things just gotta happen for a movie because F14 is iconic but I was really hoping they would have done a different approach to get it into the film.3. The best song from top gun 1 was Cheap tricks Mighty wings. However they never used it in this film and god there was so many times in the movie it would have matched perfectly to take this movie to the next level.Other than this, bravo to everyone involved in making this movie .It blows away everything else that hits the theaters now a days.

As a movie fan, there is nothing like going to the cinema and enjoying a film that you have been looking forward to seeing. This was the best cinematic experience I have had in as long as I can remember. The tension that built throughout was intense and you really cared about the characters. Truly awesome experience.

For anyone that is a fan of the original Top Gun, this is a must see movie. In my opinion it couldn't have been done any better. The new cast is great and the returning cast is even better. Grab your snacks and take your bathroom break before it starts because you won't want to miss any of it. Kudos to Cruise and Bruckheimer for putting together possibly the best movie sequel to ever hit the big screen.

There are only some sequels that can impress the audience better than that of their predecessors. Top Gun Maverick is a case in point and. It blows the mind out of the audience and how! The edge of the seat thrills and the fast paced screenplay contribute to the experience and there is never a scene in the movie where you move your eyes off the screen.I watched this in IMAX and this is definitely the recommended mode of watching this movie. This is one of the sequel movies that has been made 20 years later, because there was a fitting story to take it forward, not just to make use of the legend of the first film and make quick bucks by creating unimaginative sequels and taking the audience for a ride.Hope Hollywood comes with sequels of the quality of this movie, if they ever choose to come up with sequels for yester year classics.

Against my better judgement, I enjoyed this a lot. Great action scenes, not-too-boring character arcs, and a good cast. Jennifer Connelly was underused and/or superfluous to the story but that's really only a minor quibble.

I really had low expectations about this movie, i thought I would be the secuel no one asked for, but actually is a great movie to shut you brain off and enjoy the spectacular dogfights wich to my surprise were real scenes in real aircrafts. Even tho you don't like aircrafts it's super enjoyable. 100% recommend to watch it in theaters, because you are going to need a BIG screen.
Amazing watch, with amazing music, amazing action scenes and right amount of drama. Didn't want to miss a single dialogue or scene.The music brought me back to my early childhood days.

reviews.review_title: Hands down the Best movie in YEARS!!
reviews.content: Can't say enough about how good this movie is. It's feel good, throw back full of emotion. Powerful amazing film. Tom Cruise did an amazing job he covered all the bases including the music. Coulda played "danger zone" during the mission but the silence added to the dramatic effect. This is definitely going to be taking a lot of awards. Keep bringing these types of movies back. Loved it and will see it again!!

Such a precious movie was the original so I had my doubts when they announced a reboot/remake/sequel but with all the great movies being released this year I think they will all struggle to keep up with this one. I hate to say it but it is better than the original has you totally engaged from the get go, loads of nostalgic moments throughout. From the opening sequence when you hear the classic music you can't help but smile and then you won't stop smiling gasping throughout and there is even a proper belly laugh delivered too. A truly breathtaking movie that is an instant classic.

reviews.review_title: It's Not the Plane, It's the Pilot
reviews.content: One of this best movies of the year. Tom Cruise does it again. His return as Captain Pete Maverick was incredible. Lots of Action, humor, and Drama, I would definitely recommend it to anybody. It's one of my favorite films this year, #2 to be exact. Val Kilmer's return as Iceman was nice to see. It's sad to know he has throat cancer so he really couldn't speak much. After seeing this movie, I think I'm definitely gonna own it. Tom Cruise is one of my favorite actors, alongside Neve Campbell and Bruce Willis to name a few. He continues to not disappoint and I can't wait for Mission Impossible: Dead Reckoning Parts one and two.

Everything about this movie is fantastic. It includes a perfect amount of content from the original movie, but not so much to where you wouldn't understand the story of you haven't seen it. The visuals and stunts are some of the best I've ever seen.The story has a perfect balance of emotion, drama, character development, action, and nostalgia from the first movie. You feel connected to the characters and want them to succeed. I was emotionally invested.Overall, this is definitely a 10/10. Despite it being a sequel, it feels very original. One of the best movies I have ever seen.
A perfect sequel to an awesome movie!!Seeing Tom on big screen that to in jets was really great experience. Listening the og bgm really felt nice. Loved this movie.

Am in love with the movie in general 😍 it was so perfect I can't take my eyes off the tv... its my fav movie 2022
From sounds, acting, effects and everything about this movie is just awesome 👌. The story is clean and well submitted to the viewers. This kind of movies is what we need in movie industry.This is a kind of movies that you wish it never end just keep watching, or you wish they announce part two. This is a kind of movie that u wish you were an actor and it's a kind of movie that makes you wish your where one of the navy.So do think just watch it I promise you, you will watch it over and over again just like I do right now posting this review. 😉

I'm a screenwriter, and the story structure of this film is perfect, which I why I gave it eight stars. I was 18 when the original film came out, and I liked it, but was not a superfan. I feel the same way about this sequel. Fun movie, but I am not inspired to go back and see it several times.Something that made the film feel a bit incohesive for me was the fact that we never knew who the enemy was when the pilots flew their near-impossible mission. Seeing them fight against some generic "guys" just doesn't give me the same thrill as it would if we knew whom the pilots were up against.

One of the rare sequels that surpasses the original. Tom Cruise seems to get better with age and his insistence of filming genuine flight scenes pays off big time. It adds such an authenticity that you don't see in all the CGI / green screen movies these days.If you are a fan of the original you will get all the feels from the opening sequence alone. While there is some similarities, it did a great job of tying to the first movie but moving on to hold its own.While there is some predictable moments, you will still feel like cheering when they happen. A special mention for the casting of Miles Teller as Rooster, an amazing resemblance to Goose.
Good fun. I thoroughly enjoyed it. Tom Cruise hasn't lost his touch at all! Stunts were excellent, and the cast well put together!Catch this movie when you can!

After Avengers End Game This Is The Movie That Made Me Cry . Everything Was Picture Perfect . The Music / Sound Effects / Story / Cimax Everything Is Just Added Sugar In A Cake . This Movie Deserve An Oscar In The Music Department .

I rate movies either a 1 I didn't like it, 5 it was okay, or 10 it was great. I rate this movie a 10. It had great acting, a great storyline, it was very suspenseful, very intriguing, very interesting, I'm talking clinch your butt cheeks suspenseful. It also had a great ending. I give this movie a 10 and two thumbs up. I really don't have much else to say about this film, but since I have to I will say this, it's been a while since I've seen a good movie start to finish and I've watched a lot of movies the newer ones and this recent crap that's come out over the past decade or so, they just really stopped making good movies. But I'm glad to see that this one was a great one I highly enjoyed it, and I highly recommend it.

Its a rare breed of movies. I feel so fortunate to have witnessed the brilliance of this film in imax. In the times of, green screen superhero movies, Top Gun: Maverick delivers such breathtaking real shots and can't admire Tom Cruise enough for what he's done for the art of filmmaking.

reviews.review_title: Really nice movie and a hommage to it's predecessor
reviews.content: I really liked this film with it's impressive flight scenes, good playing and really awesome jet sounds to hear in a cinema, where the base let the whole room vibrate 😁😝.Also the 80's vibe is nice. Only the put in love story could have been completely left out, because of being pointless and unnecessary.All in all for everyone who might be interested in action films, anyone who loves jets or flying or anyone who likes Cruise should watch this.

One of the worst films I've had the misfortune of seeing. Full of ridiculous over the top characters that wouldn't last a minute in todays armed forces.This movie feels like it was made in the 1980's with its outdated male characters. 50 year old men flying around on motorbikes, wearing skinny jeans and playing topless football is not something I want to see in 2022 and I most definitely do not want to see love scenes involving middle aged men.Surely todays kids are more enlightened than we were - leave this macho old man nonsense where it belongs, in the 1980's with Jeffrey Epstein, Jimmy Saville and Harvey Weinstein.

reviews.review_title: The Greatest movie of all time!
reviews.content: This is exactly the Movie, that can proudly bear the title «Film». It is not just a movie, it is a picture with huge meaning, it is the film that has value.God created the film industry to be shown like this, and most of the time in the 21st century it is not like it anymore.This picture shows every kind of audience beautiful relationships between the greatest actors, as well as the story, that touches the heart. A story like this would've been known, if not for the creators of the Film. Our world needs to know heroes, people who do such kind of job every day, without ever being acknowledged.This is proudly named "The greatest picture of all times".Every kind of audience from young to old must see this movie and think about life after it.Congratulations on the beautiful film!

Perfect thrillerAbove the expectation, director and crew deserves claps for what they had done . VFX was mind blowingBackground score and the classic touch that they keep up through out the movie make it more thrilling and visually amazing.

When you hear a sequel is in the works for a beloved 30+ year old movie, one gets nervous. But I was beyond thrilled with Top Gun; Maverick! The story was really good and the flying scenes were action packed! I was very happy the side stories were not dragged out. There was just enough tie in to follow along without overdoing it. Yes there were a few cheesy lines here and there, but overall it was a thrill! I've seen it twice in Dolby and would gladly go again. They pulled it off. Well done.

Absolutely blown away by this movie. Can't really say anything more than it is probably the best blockbuster I've seen in years. It has it all. The story, the cinematography, the action and the soundtrack all hit the spot. Unreal!

I went in with high expectations, which were quickly dashed when Maverick resorted to the old trope of trashing the flight manual (NATOPS) on the first day of training with his class.The flight scenes, which I had read were so much better this time around, were similarly disappointing. (Btw, you don't just "bail out" of an aircraft doing Mach 10 above FL600. That whole thing was glossed over in typical Hollywood fashion).The interplay with Rooster was formulaic to say the least. And the rest of the hot shots were just big bags of ego.Color me extremely disappointed.
This is what you call a cinematic experience! Emotional, touching, heartfelt and exciting. Great performances by the cast and they all had great chemistry. Tom Cruise is perfect!

Where do I even begin? I grew up watching the first Top Gun. It's a timeless classic and when this sequel was in talks of being developed, I was very skeptical since modern day sequels just don't cut it anymore. But omg this sequel has exceeded expectations. I held high hopes that it would at least be just as good as the first one and it wasn't good, it was GREAT! Every single person involved in the making of this film should be extremely proud. I can't wait to see it again!

Didn't get to see in cinema but on my 42 inch TV. I thought the acting was poor and along with the script over the top. The flying scenes were good but the writer and director were obviously fans of Star Wars IV?

You can't reproduce the 80ies, can't reproduce that feeling.Oh ... wait.You really can.See - "Stranger Things" season 1.It works.But with a mediocre script, this feels like a wannabe-show, to see known characters, but nothing more new.It tastes like Coke Zero - it looks like Coke, in some way it tastes like Coke, but more like a memory of what means to taste an ice-cold coke from a tin can.In the summer."Top Gun" is one of those movies you never needed a 2nd part.It was a piece of the 80ies, including the phenomenal soundtrack. You can't copy that, especially not decades away from the original.There are SO many really really great stories to tell - why to try to revive what is already gone?!WHY?!

reviews.review_title: A sequel far better then the original!
reviews.content: I am a part of the younger generation, but I had seen the first top gun a few years prior to writing this review, and I must say, my dad was incredibly excited after seeing the first trailer for this film In 2019. I was skeptical however, I have seen my fair share of soft reboots/crappy sequels, and I didn't expect much from it. The delays for this film just convinced me more that it would be a flop, boy was I wrong.I didn't expect anything from this film, I was hoping for it to at least be a decent directed movie with an ok plot, but I got more then I could ever imagine, the plot was a solid 10/10, one of the best written stories I've seen on the big screen, I am still In shock after a week from seeing the movie, and I am so excited for my next opportunity to watch it again.The characters of the film were great, and the returning cast were a complete fan service, Tom Cruise still hasn't lost his charm as maverick and they even managed to get Val Kilmer to act In a few short scenes. But I think the best characters of the film were by far the new additions, and I am talking specifically about 'Rooster', played by Miles Teller, this character bought some of the most emotional stakes I've seen in any film, mainly through him being the son of Mavericks deceased wingman from the original 'Goose'. The other pilots present throughout are also great, and feel like genuine people, bringing some strong comedic relief.The cinematography for the film is some of the most realistic and incredible practicality I've ever seen, those where REAL jets 99% of the time! I was amazed by how real the movie felt, being a huge step up from the original, which if I'm correct only used flight simulation for most of the climactic scenes.I can't say to much else without spoiling, so I will leave it at this, this movie is one of the greatest if not THE greatest sequel of all time to a classic film, everything about it will leave you either on the edge of your seat, or staring in amazement at the big screen, if I could experience this movie again for the first time, I would do so 100%, please see this movie, whether it's at home or before the film leaves cinemas, I can guarantee the movie will end up high in your ranks as it has mine, I give this movie a 10/10 and I would make that an 11 if I could!

reviews.review_title: Hands Down Best Movie In ManyYears!
reviews.content: About time a movie worth watching was made again, hands down the best movie in many years if not decades!I've not always been a huge Tom Cruise fan but he was excellent in this one.Wife and I loved it and thoroughly enjoyed almost every second of it.Also far more technically and militarily correct than the first with a few exceptions because it is a movie after all.

reviews.review_title: Two hours of my life I'll never get back.
reviews.content: A truly terrible movie. It was propaganda film for the military industrial complex. The script was idiotic with small sentences and monosyllabic words, and totally predictable. I could have told you in the first 10 minutes who would fly the mission and how it would turn out. The acting was terrible. Tom Cruise and his aging veneers got the lion's share of screen time. The only great scene was Miles Teller signing Great Balls of Fire, which you have to go to You tube to see, because in the movie it was muted and more camera time was spent on TC watching him. The only thing missing from this movie was a soundtrack of select patriotic songs sung by Toby Keith.

What a movie.A sequel that lived up to its billing. Better than the first and one that brought closure to this character of Maverick.I love the way the story was played out. There were a few over the top angles but hey it's a movie it's supposed to blend a little bit of fantasy with reality.I waited a whole year to watch this movie since I could not attend it in the theatre. And I must tell u that it was indeed worth the wait.Every characters story was introduced and context given, however I was left searching a bit for "who is Penny" that was the only area where this film faltered to explain. But hey you are so wound up in the story, the wonderful camera work to capture the stunts and flight movements, this minor blip is one I will forgive.

reviews.review_title: The first half is a little on the nose, but the second half is great.
reviews.content: It's a great action movie. It can be a little on the nose at times with some of the references to the original, but overall the action is really good, especially at the climax.

There are some very slow moments in this 2 hour and 10 minute movie. Tom Cruise is STILL TRULY 1 OF THE BEST ACTORS WORKING TODAY... However The Penny character is unfortunately completely useless in my opinion. If the character was nowhere in the film this movie would reduce its runtime and remove all the slow and in my opinion BORING moments. That being said there are some OUTSTANDING scenes and truly beautiful looking moments. Still definitely 1 of the best films of 2022 but not my favorite. I can't see myself watching this film all the time but it is worth watching at least once.My Grade: A-

If you're the sort who easily distracted from a trite plot full of worn out old macho jingoistic nonsense 80s tropes by some bright colors and loud noises, then this is the flick for you. It's a lame rehash that asks for even more suspension of disbelieve than the original. It is tedious throughout and the so-called emotional beats crash and burn either because the dialogue in them is horrible or because it's such an obvious play on emotions. Also, what do you think the over/under is on the number of scenes directly lifted from the original? 20? That's not an homage to the original; that's just lazy writing. That this is the movie loved by all the folk who whine on this very website about so-called "wokeness" in other movies tells you all you need to know about their taste: it's up their ass.

The movie is good. But from the perspective of a 33 year old not great. I get vibes from the new Star Wars movies, a large percentage is nostalgia driven. The flight scenes are by far the best, the plot very predictable. There is a underlying vibe that some people crave the old master apprentice principle and that young people should learn the wisdom of older. Very insightful into a perspective of how the world should be,what friendship is built on, and what a real man is and what is his role and what they want of todays world.

The reason I am writing here is because it was an unusually awesome action movie! That being said tom Cruise continues to defy aging and logic while maintaining practicality and being grounded in reality.

Can't believe some of the "fun" reviewers that give it a 5 or less. Great action, good story, amazing aerials. Some people thought there was too much talk at the beginning, but without it, these fun people would cry it was all action. Worth every penny period.
Perfect Sequel and and an awesome movie in itself. Really nostalgic to see some of the scenes recreated as they were in the original. The buildup has been great. Like the way it has been paced.

Comparing this with the classic in my opinion it's useless. I usually don't do reviews because my english is not so good. I couldn't help myself to say that this movie it's the best that I saw in years. TOP GUN: Maverick it's a must see. You won't waste your time.

Words can't describe how amazing the movie is, JUST GO WATCH IT!! Deserves to be viewed on the biggest screen possible, action sequences are so detailed and thrilling that you'll be on the edge of your seats the whole time. Tom Cruise can do nothing wrong, he knows exactly what the audience want and delivers it perfectly. Can't stop thinking the amount of work that must have gone into making this movie, cinema of its highest class. Not sure if there's been a better sequel in the history of film making.

Watched this on the small screen as missed it at the cinema. Despite this found it a highly entertaining film. Even on the small screen the action scenes were breathtaking and I'm sure would have been amazing in the cinema.Story moves along at a good pace and good acting performances with Tom Cruise delivering a reliable performance as ever.If I had one criticism is that the plot is pretty predictable and we were all stating out loud what would happen next. And the script is a bit far fetched However that didn't detract from our enjoyment.Whilst it is not a great movie It is a a highly entertaining one.

Wow- edge of your seat fighter jet scenes.Also Wow- this plot was 100% built off of nostalgic reasons.So...
Maverick picks Rooster for sentimental reasons, to be his wingman on a high stakes mission where they will likely die unless executed perfect; even though he could have picked Hangman who was clearly the best pilot for the job.To no surprise, the mission is barely a success and Rooster is very gun shy and under performs at first before rising to the occasion at the very last minute.The military does not operate like this- if they put Hangman in, its guaranteed they actually pull this off with less hiccups.Then Cruise takes a bullet for Rooster, and ends up behind enemy lines. Then Rooster takes a bullet for Cruise and they both end up behind enemy lines. (Nice...)Comically they escape by stealing an older fighter jet (for nostalgic reasons I'm sure), and just before they can be shot down, Hangman comes in and saves their lives.I wouldn't say it's predictable, but Goodness Gracious does it have to be so corny?Every time it was a moment for a character to come alive, they used the same quote "Dont think, just do!"I feel like the writers didn't think, they just did- and wrote the corniest most nostalgic plot they possibly could.It was very entertaining yes, and very pro-America. Which is just what we needed to keep us cheering for Brandon these days.Acting was believable sure, Teller, Kilmer, Cruise, etc. All great.Go and watch it, tell your friends, and carpool too because this high flying summer blockbusters still can't bring your gas prices down. Hopefully the voting booth will this year.Disclaimer: I never saw the first Top Gun.

reviews.review_title: An absolute package of entertainment and emotions
reviews.content:
Top Gun Maverick just like the name, the movie is all about our lead character Lt. Pete Maverick. Whom we all know from 1986 movie Top Gun.This sequal is master of all sequals, it keeps you riveted with its compelling story, characters, action and drama. Let's dig deeper;
Story: The has taken a leep from where it was eneded in the first part, now the Lt. Pete Maverick has been called to train an elite batch of Navy cadets for their next mission. The whole somewhat plays around this plot and keeps us moving forward.Actors: Everyone in the film seems to have justified their characters and makes an emotional connection with us as a viewer. Especially Tom Cruise, since we already know his past we get to connect with him on deeper level and even have empathy for him at some points.Direction: Jeseph Kosinski has done a wonderful job here, with choosing beautiful shots yet keeping us on the edge of our seats with those action sequences, it really make this movie stand out on presentation POV.To sum up my short review here, It's a excellent sequal to 1986 movie and absolutely worth the wait of all these years.

reviews.review_title: Not as good as I expected
reviews.content: I thought the first Top Gun better than this one. Technically, what was he doing riding a motorcycle everywhere in California without a helmet. Careless and stupid.Regardless, the story line is nothing new and I didn't think that well written. Actually, an episode (Season 1, Episode 22) from the 12 O'clock High TV series has the same themes and was better done in my opinion.You might want to watch this movie if you saw the earlier one. Otherwise, stay home and watch the 12 O'clock High TV series.
Wonderful movie in 2022 full of emotional moments from the imagery to sounds and story is perfect. I do recommend watching it ! Wonderful power and quick adrenaline.

Usually 2nd or 3rd movies are not as good as the originals, but this one was!! I wasn't actually a Tom Cruise fan (especially after his DIVA mask moment), but after this, I went and watch all the Mission Impossible movies, and can definitely say I'm officially a Tom Cruise fan. This movie was absolutely phenomenal! I wanted it to be longer!! I think it's greaat that Cruise found a spot for Kilmer. I hope his health gets better, though it probably won't. I don't remember seeing Kelly McGinnis, even though she's listed in the credits. I must have missed her somehow. This movie is definitely worth your time!!
The new completes the old. It does not overshadow, outshine or disrespect it. Tom Cruise is just one of a kind and the young cast is great. Very good cinematic experience. 👏👏👏

I've been waiting for this movie for a long time now. But my girlfriend wanted to see Doctor Strange Multiverse of Madness first and funnily enough the show fully booked. So we instead to see Top Gun instead. And boy did we made the right decision. It was the best cinema experience I had in a long time. The story has so much heart and it keeps us glued to our seats with incredible Cinematography and a Score that is out of this world (Courtesy of Hans Zimmer). The fighter jet scenes were unbelievably awesome. Tom Cruise delivered above and beyond for this movie. I heard a quote somewhere that Tom Cruise maybe the last real movie star we have. Every character in the movie was unique and not one of them felt out of place. Tom Cruise is a living legend and we are so lucky to have a superstar like him in our life time.After watching the movie, my girlfriend who didn't know anything about Top Gun before said "Thank God that the Doctor Strange show was sold out"

reviews.review_title: So much better than I ever expected.
reviews.content: It wasn't just the jets and beautiful photography that this movie is built on. It's the story lines all through out the movie that makes this movie a 10. And a few things I did not expect. WELL written screenplay. Great leading actors. Well made movie all the way around. I just did not expect the sequal to be so much better than the original. Well done movie makers !

reviews.review_title: Tom Cruise is fantastic and a credit to the film industry!
reviews.content: They don't make movies like this much! Firstly the flying and jet scenes are just incredible and put the audience right in the action! Filming this stuff in camera and not relying on cgi is what makes this film so so good.The acting is great, story is strong and a solid sequel to the original - which is always hard to do when the first film is such an established film.I think this film in particular has brought an insight to Tom Cruise I didn't know before! His acting, and especially his dedication to the film craft is inspiring!I'm a fan!

reviews.review_title: 10 is not hyperbole. Better than the original!
reviews.content: No spoilers in this review. Superlative filming, writing, visuals and acting. Unbelievable sequel. Tom is still at the top of his game 35 years later. I was transported back to 86 and it felt just right. Currently just wanted to send my kudos to everyone involved in this endeavor. I will provide a more in-depth review after it's okay to post spoilers. Got see it now!

reviews.review_title: Good, but the hype is ridiculous
reviews.content: Look, it's better than the first one, and it's a good action popcorn flick. Tom Cruise continues to stick the landing. But "masterpiece"? "Best movie ever"? Come on. Have these people never watched actual amazing films?The flight scenes (especially the beginning) are indeed very well done. The classic feel of the first movie is there and improved upon. The movie is an action roller coaster ride. The acting is solid, and the dialogue is funny and engaging. But the romance portion is weak, and some of the other interpersonal drama stuff is contrived too. The plot also gets a bit ridiculous and unrealistic to the point I was having trouble suspending disbelief.All in all though, it is worth the watch, and I do consider it an improvement over the original. It's fun, gripping, and intense. Just here to say the 10/10 hype is absurd and I can't believe it's currently sitting at #50 on the top 250. It's not THAT good.

reviews.review_title: Can be shrugged away like Kelly McGillis
reviews.content: The attempt started well with a Star wars new hope-esk bombing run, missed the deathstar core by a long shot.Action is lacking, the stakes are lacking. Very bland bombing run, ejected pilots run into enemy's airfield and escape with enemy plane and their chance of a good movie.

It was a surprise to see the poster of the sequel to one of my favourite childhood films, in a recently renovated cinema house in my hometown of Peshawar, a city that is an hour away from Pakistan's border with Afghanistan, its a city which for the longest part of the last decade post 9/11 had only seen blood,chaos and suicide bombings. So to see maverick's poster outside the cinema which was once shut down for a long time when it was almost war in my city, it was a breath of fresh air to buy a ticket to see top gun mav. The film is overall really beautifully filmed, the casting, the screenplay, the direction are top notch, the youngsters fit in their roles really well, however i must say i did not digest john hamm in his role as cyclone for some reason, i felt he was wearing a uniform but was a disconnect from the charecter, he acted more like his charecter from mad men tv show. Jennifer connely has really good acting skills, i think her role could have been of more substance and that could have also added a lot to the film apart from its high fidelity air combat sequences, connely's role could have had more meaning to it. The biggest turn down for me was how maverick easily slips into enemy air base ,easily finds a tom cat f14 parked, ready like a piece of cake ready to be eaten , maverick and goose's son run towards it and within seconds easily taxi it and fly off the enemy base, this made the film look like an indian film. Over all, i loved the film, its continuity from the prequel and how well the cast (except for hamm) have played their charecters. Two of the minor turn offs apart from john hamm for me have to be the absence of a new soundtrack song which i wish were there and as good as berlin's song in the prequel, and the second turn off has to be maverick still being a captain. With this review, i rest my opinion about the film, lots of love from Peshawar,Pakistan.

reviews.review_title: This movie will make you smile.
reviews.content: So as a person who did not see the first movie i gotta say it felt like i watched the first movie, what a rollecoaster of emotions. I did not know anything about this movie(did not see the trailer) i thought to myself oh wait this is gotta be another mission impossible movie cuz Tom Cruise plays in it , but i was wrong and i love it. This movie is beautiful when we got out of the cinema me and my friend were both smiling. Top notch music and choreography. Go watch it.

I get the negative reviews. Is it cheesy? Yes it is. Does it steal some of the epic lines, plot and character types of the first movie? Yes it does but, it's worth watching for many reasons and you might enjoy it.The co-stars shine here because Cruise can't carry this movie like he did the first one. The flying scenes are incredible and you can tell some of it is not green screened or CGI. These people flew in these aircraft and you can see it on their faces. I wouldn't be surprised if they all puked after shooting some of the scenes. Kilmer being in the movie was a nice touch too even though his screen time is very limited. Give it a chance folks, you might be surprised like I was.

I took my partner and 2 children to see Maverick today and it is absolutely amazing.Quite an emotional rollercoaster of a movie but very gripping all the way through.Would I watch this movie again, hell yeah!! I would love to go and see it in a 4DX cinema as that would be amazing.Would definitely recommend to anyone who loves the original movie I can't honestly remember how many times I have seen Top Gun it must be well over 100 times.

So have those who write this manuscript. A little tip; things like that you bust with a bunker-buster-bomb, which can be dropped from space, for that matter. You do not need to see it with the mere eye. But it worked in Star Wars, I suppose the thought, so it must be a good idea.This manuscript was so full of clichés, so predictable, so, so, enjoyable that my wife was smiling (and not because of Tom Cruise, she would rather go for Hangman, the man we should hate but at the end is a good American, but in real life would have been cancelled for being too white), and I therefore grant a '7'.For this is something as rare as a feel-good - movie, which does not preach beyond calling the enemy fighters 'generation five' and not MIG Something. But given the present climate MIG might have been considered kosher.

I would definitely say this movie was fun to watch. The flight scenes were great, and the characters seemed to have good enough chemistry to make the scenes really enjoyable. I do feel based on the flow and story that it was 100% intended to be just an entertaining sequel, and not a possible Best Picture nominee. I bet even the ones who made the movie are a bit surprised on it's success. I grew up in the 80's, so don't get me wrong here. I'm always open to a modern continuation of movies or tv shows from my childhood. I don't think it's the best movie I've seen, and I do feel like it's a bit overhyped (A 2nd release in theaters? Really?). I'm glad people truly enjoyed this film and see it as a 10. I just personally don't feel like it's that amazing, but again, was definitely entertaining.

reviews.review_title: One of the very best sequels ever
reviews.content: One of the best sequels ever. My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed it from beginning to end. Thank you US Navy for the part you played in making this film possible.

reviews.review_title: The best film I've seen in 20 years.
reviews.content: I'm 49 years old and I remember like it was yesterday sitting in the theater on opening night in 1986 when I seen the original. This film was worthy of the original. Maybe it's actually better than the original. There are no other films I can say that about. I felt like I traveled back in time to an age where I was watching the original.The plot really grip you.The authentic flying was amazing.You didn't have to see the first one to understand this film.To think that our Navy Boys do this every day without complaint says so much about the USN. America is not lost like people want you to think. You want to see a real "Maverick"? Look no further than our Navy. Hats off to you Naval Aviators.
I give this movie a 10 because it is exactly what I wanted. Just fun. The movie is an 8 the soundtrack pushes it to a 10. Foghat, The Who etc..,, We'll done TC and crew.

reviews.review_title: Haven't watched a great movie in a very long time!
reviews.content: Top Gun was legendary! Top Gun II was Epic!!American classic! Bringing back the 80s vibe with classic movie soundtracks. Will have to watch this again on Imax.Haven't watched a great movie in a very long time!

Probably the the most satisfying sequel I've seen in a decade.I LOVE that Maverick has some Tom Brady in him. The I'm still here (and I'm still the best!) - attitude was exactly what I was hoping for. I wanted to see Maverick, still at the top of his game, kicking butt and taking lead on whatever needed to be done. And that is what I got. So, so satisfying. Well done all the way around.

reviews.review_title: New all time FAVOURITE <=TOP GUN=> Maverick
reviews.content: If you liked the original this is even better, excellent movie great storyline and treated with respect being a 36 year sequel , visual action was as good as it gets everything was filmed inside and out of fighter jets minimal blue screen or CGI, my new all time favourite movie was worth waiting 3 years to watch it did not disappoint at all. Was great to see flash backs everything in the movie had a perfect purpose and made sense, can't wait to watch again. The introduction took me back to my childhood and got me hooked till the end Loved it.Cast was great and full respect to them once people watch the making of the movie and the intense training these actors had to go through to make this movie possible.
Possibly the best movie I've watched this year. The acting of Tom Cruise is top-notch and must be dully Applauded. This is one of the few movies which were better than the first.

In short, a more perfect Top Gun. The fights are more interesting and exciting, and this is mainly helped by a great camera. The music is great again. At times, the film is pleasantly moving. Too bad at the end of the film it becomes a really big farce that is completely predictable. But that doesn't detract from the beauty of the film. I can imagine a more perfect and touching end, but I still fully enjoyed the film. 10/10.

The world has practically changed since the first movie came out and I'm glad this movie too so long to make.Characters: There's a lot of karma/closure with most of the characters in the movie along with the maturity that the characters need. Top Gun was adolescent, Top Gun Maverick is middle-aged. The latter is a more complete movie than the former.Action: The mission of the Top gun team is quite challenging and entertains throughout. The fighter jet sequences, the backdrop, the dog fighting is out of this world in a realistic sense, if that makes sense. Tom Cruise is on fire here. His age doesn't show in a bad way at all and the co-stars match up well.The 'Americans as the savior' concept is where the movie fails. In 1986, US was not perceived as a villain by many in the world. Its different now. I wouldn't blame the moviemakers for that. The soundtrack of Maverick could have been much much better.In a nutshell, an outstanding action movie and a great sequel with sufficient drama. Tom Cruise doesn't disappoint. Thank you and cheers man!-- I'd like to add that I saw the movie thrice and it only got better, like aerated wine. There is so much fine tuning to the flight scenes! OST still felt dull.

One of the best movies I've ever seen. My friends told me it was great so I went to see it with great hopes and it did not disappoint. It was better than I could have ever imagined. It's sharp, concise and does not waste any time. There is not a single moment in the movie that feels out of place or that stretches out for too long. The plot is simple and straightforward. The overall tension, whether it is between the characters or in combat moments, is just perfect. The soundtrack is great and so are the sound effects but know your ears will be ringing by the time the movie is over! At the end of the day it's a great American film, the likes of which we haven't seen in many years.Tom Cruise is Tom Cruise!

reviews.review_title: Maverick was a bit too much
reviews.content: They amped up Pete 'Maverick' too much in my opinion. Some people might be attracted to the 'rules do not apply to me' character, but I guess I am not one of them. Some of the things that he got away with seemed a bit absurd from my perspectiveThey had so many plot holes in the story. Like how did he survive blowing up the plane in the beginning. How can Pete 'Maverick' pull another soldier's papers? I have heard the theory that it was because he knew iceman. Even if he pull his paper's, how did Rooster know that it was Pete who pulled his papers.The fact that they sent them out on the mission and none of them passed the simulation course training was weird. Yet when they actually flew the mission, they succeeded.Furthermore, Maverick steals a plane and did the simulation course in record time. Instead of reprimanding him for stealing the plane, they promote him to team captain?There were other plot holes like how did Rooster's mom die?I felt it was not a great plot. There were a lot of the same old school movie cliché like Maverick having a love interest.I appreciate they used real planes and avoided unneeded CGI to give it a realistic experience, but I wouldn't give it the same rating everyone else did.
Just what we needed. Don't care for Tom Cruise but god DAMN does he not make a great movie with this sequel! It's predictable but still a great journey and conclusion to Maverick.

reviews.review_title: Would have been better if they cut the sloppy bits
reviews.content: Adrenaline-fuelled Hollywood nonsense .. and all the better for it.If you overlook the insultingly blatant foreshadowing at the beginning and yet another display of America's willingness to violate the sovereignty of foreign nations under the guise of "saving the world", and the review title ... it's worth spending a couple of hours watching.

I liked the scene when ice man met maverick and say who the best of us
And mav said let we don't break this lovely feelings nowAwesome movie deserve 10/10.
One of the movie where the movie felt like real life story.There's romance, love, hatred, action, thrill and everything possibly a movie could have.

reviews.review_title: Fun movie despite the implausible plot devices
reviews.content: Tom Cruise is getting on now. He looks fit and has looked after himself but like me, now at the same age, he needs to become more of an actor than an action star.The question is asked, early in the movie, by Cain, played by Ed Harris, why he is still a Captain and not an Admiral. It is the most critical question of the movie. Ed Harris must be way past military retirement age himself.It turns out that Maverick is a test pilot. Still taking risks that should have killed him years before. Defying all the rules Hollywood style. This is a tale of miracles throughout.The problem of a sequel more than 30 years in the making is how to reference the old movie. There will be two audiences. One that saw the original, bought the VHS tape, maybe even watched on TV. The other is the younger audience that never saw or remembered the original.The callback was the subplot of being returned to Top Gun by Iceman. Played by Val Killmer and both showing and acting his age. Killmer is an Admiral and has progressed while Cruise is determined to keep his boyish charm.The tension in the new generation is Rooster. The son of his wingman that died in the original movie. Flashbacks follow. The son is even wearing his father's 1980s moustache. It seems out of place and distracting.It all felt out of place for me. The personal story was that you need to buy into the idea of redemption for the death in the original movie by way of the relationship between Maverick and Rooster.Your alternative was just to enjoy the action sequences. They were fun and thrilling. Once sitting in the plane with Maverick and his team you could forgive most of the subplot and the mustache. Enjoy the flying - which is what you came for anyway.It honours the original movie and is a good sequel. They did a great job on the flying and the action. I feel I should give it 10 stars but I could not quite take onboard the father/son dynamic and I felt there was better drama to be had with the Maverick/Hangman relationship that wasn't fully explored.

This is one of those instances when sequels are better than the original. They waited 36 years to make this movie. The wait was worth it. Had me at the edge of my seat and watching it on the biggest screen possible, made it even better. I can't recommend this movie enough. Tom Cruise is the king of Hollywood!

reviews.review_title: Basically remade the original plus an extra scene.
reviews.content: 75% of the movie was talk and scenes of Tom Cruise feeling bad. Then the last 30 min was cool and totally predictable. A remake that basically is the same story with the same characters (there is no younger version of Iceman, sorry kid - that was awful). I guess that's why they waited so long to make this - so many people wouldn't have remembered the first one.

Cruise ruins all film he has a say in. Stupid mission, stupid action and stupid result. He should retire for good. Not only there are no impressive aircraft maneuver, the target is not credible and the team effort is lame. Everything in this stupid script is lame. Very very and remake.

I have just recently watched Top Gun Maverick, and I have to say it was great. The acting was top notch especially with Tom Cruise, The cinematography was beautiful, all the action scenes was badass and it had a feel-good vibe that sucks you right into it.That being said it's a great film that people of all ages will enjoy.

This movie pleasantly surprised me because I'm not a fan of the first one so I didn't expect much from it, but in addition to having a very good and justified story, it guarantees a great cinematographic experience, with surround sound that makes you feel inside the movie. And an 80s soundtrack that resonates throughout the entire film.But the best thing about this film is that, unlike other late sequels, here it is respected and neither protagonism nor force is taken away from the main character. In addition, another remarkable thing is that it is not simply made to create sequels and spin-offs since it does not It's just a vehicle for new characters, it's a true sequel to the original Top Gun.Speaking of awards for everything great about this film, it should at least be nominated at the Oscars for best sound, best soundtrack, best photography, best film, best director, best effects, best editing, best song, best actor (Tom Cruise ) and Best Supporting Actor (Miles Teller/Val Kilmer).

reviews.review_title: YOU HAVE TO SEE THIS MOVIE!!
reviews.content: If you have not seen the first movie, You HAVE to watch it first to really appreciate the sequel. I too did not think the second movie was necessary and did not think it would be as good as the first. I was beyond wrong! Excellent sequel! I walked out of the theater and just said Wow, That was an awesome movie. The best I've seen in a while. Go see this movie!!!!

Take note film makers. You wanna make a sequel, this is how you do it.
