If you loved, liked or even just felt "meh" about Top Gun, you need to see this!I would however say that if you haven't seen the first movie for a while watch it first before this as it definitely is better if you go straight from one to the other. Even taking that into account though, the cinematography is enough to keep you on the edge of your seat.Another massive tick is for the pacing, it's spot on, never gets boring or overstretched it's perfectly on point. The movie tells you what you need to know and then moves on to the next section seamlessly. You don't have to work hard to enjoy it, you just need to sit back and relax.I Absolutely loved it and you need to see it!

reviews.review_title: There was no need for this movie
reviews.content: This movie looks incredible, it has great scenes and the action is cutting edge. This isn't a good movie though. It goes through identical plot beats of the previous movie and Maverick goes through the same development he went through in the first movie. His only development is in the form of not being so protective of Rooster. The fact though is stemmed from his previous insecurity of losing his old partner! The movie does nothing new and its really boring when characters start talking because none of them are interesting and none of the comedy landed for me whatsoever. The movie is just a basic action flick and doesn't take any new or interesting directions for any of its characters. The only time you will care is when the planes come on the screen and the action tries to take your brain away from the barebones story and characters.

reviews.review_title: Top Gun: Maverick delivers where it needs to
reviews.content: Top Gun: Maverick manages to create a sequel, 36 years after the original that, despite its occasional shameless use of nostalgia, creates a distinct, excellently paced, suspenseful movie that not only does the 1986 film justice, but surpasses it in many regards.

Wow!!What an awesome movie
Beautiful well done...It feels so personal from Tom Cruise, you can see how much he loves piloting..You gotta see it in cinema, if you can, just go in IMAXIt's an incredible visual experience, you can actually sort of feel what the "actors-pilots" are feeling.The manoeuvres are really a pleasure to watch..And there's no green screen!!!Gosh, hopefully the industry keep learning from Tom and his crew, that nothing replace what is done on reality.Then, the plot, well... is Top Gun
Is emotive, the movie got those easter eggs that makes you feel sentimental about the first part.. and there's actually a twist of how you think the movie it's going to go... so bravo for that.PD: Tom Cruise doesn't age at all, it's weird xd.

A truly worthy sequel to a much loved favourite!!!I don't necessarily agree that it was so much better than the original but that could be nostalgia talking.All I know is that I'll be watching it again and again!!

What a wonderful cinema experience. 10 out of 10 for all round enjoyment. A marvel sound and picture experience and all acting great. Please make Top Gun 3.From a movie buff.Thanks for the entertainment.Alvin
South Africa.
What can I say, it is a must see! So much better than the original, sorry Goose, but Rooster and Maverick blew it out of the park! Be prepared to want to see it over and over again.

I wasn't really expecting much from this movie, due to how many modern remakes or sequels fail to innovate or live up to the standards of their source material. However, after watching Top Gun: Maverick, that long streak of bad nostalgia trips is over. They did a great job with making it its own film without solely relying on the popularity of the first film, which in of itself had great qualities.

The sequel was bad, sorry but the silent moments of reflection and a disconnected appearance of Connelly was too much. No backstory on new pilots , and I was hoping the soundtrack would save it, no such luck. An overhyped video game of a movie! Wayyy overrated. Even a few more flashbacks of Cruise being a Top Gun instructor would have helped. And a bar owner with a Porsche hilarious! When film depends on CG and not good dialogue, your done. Even the scenes on the carrier in the original were more interesting. I'm a WW2 historian so maybe I'm jaded. Luckily I watched this on a free trial. Not enough heart!

This was a beautifully done sequel that nailed the flow from the first Top Gun to the second one. The way Val Kilmer's character was included was handled so well. Love the references from this one to the original, including the ones between Kelly and Jennifer's characters in the first and second respectively. Mike Teller did an awesome job as Goose's son and the writers did a great job creating this character's resemblances to his dad! Very impressive overall.

reviews.review_title: Absolutely loved it! Feel good film
reviews.content: Yeah there were cheesy bits, but the links with the first movie, the music, cinematography and casting was top drawer. Was expecting Maverick to play a sort of cameo role, but the film was so much better for him being the leading character. Great soundtrack, with a mix of newer music in there too. Have to be honest, it's right up there with the first film for me. Looking back 36 years, watching the original with my big brother (unfortunately not with us anymore to watch this one - but he would have loved it no doubt) and then watching this, brought a little (happy) tear to my eye! A must watch, feel good film.

reviews.review_title: just a really really good and fun to watch movie
reviews.content: I watched Maverick yesterday and simply enjoyed it. The movie is filled with lots of action, drama and many possibilities to identify with the characters. If you like thrilling realistic military movies, just watch it.P. S. Might contain patroism :)

Tom Cruise at its best. One-of-a-kind experience. It is not "another action movie" this is "a real action movie". Sound and visuals from the film are 10/10. Movie design for a theater not a streaming platform. Oh and the 80's are back somehow, so if you're from that decade, nostalgic feelings will get you.
I was expecting a classic action movie; and just saw one of the best if not the best action movies of all times. Top gun was good; top gun maverick is a masterpiece.

Didn't have high hopes for this as I didn't know how they could top the original but was vey impressed. It is a bot cheesy but so was the original. Only negative is that there were a lot of characters in the movie that didn't add anything to it or really even need to be there. Would still watch again and would strongly recommend to others!.

I love that this film has some of the original soundtrack, it gives a really really great nostalgic feel. There isn't as much testosterone as the first one but the second half had me on edge until the very end, smiles all the way through the film. It's that good I'm making my girlfriend watch it again tomorrow. Beat film I've seen the year, truly.

Best imaginable sequel to the original.So realistic... who needs special FX?🤓
I loved the feeling/music of the original movie that came back in this one.There was depth, emotion, drama, everything a good action movie needs to make it great.All was so perfect exept for one thing that bothered me through the whole movie: Tom Cruise was the only actor who hadn't aged like the others. Perfectly black hair, soft lighting to create that younger look. 30 years after the original and not one grey hair... come on.For such a realistic movie he was the only unrealistic element.Ageing is nothing to be ashamed about.

A movie that spends too much time reliving the original Top Gun (with all the same cliches) and that is predictable even down to the dialogue. I had expected something more from this given all the hype, I shouldn't have. This could have been so much better. Wait for it to come to the small screen and save your money.

reviews.review_title: If you loved Top Gun in 1986, you won't be disappointed.
reviews.content: I really expected to be disappointed by this movie, because so many sequels seem to be made just to squeeze a little more money out of work already done. Like so many others, I loved the original Top Gun and played the soundtrack (on cassette tape!) for decades. That movie entered our collective culture and stuck with us. Luckily, I was thrilled by Top Gun: Maverick. You already know the Maverick character from 1986, and it's fun to see what he might be like after 30 years of continuing to defy authority and get into and out of scrapes. Maybe he's not the most mature role model, but he's cool!Rather than waste time with a lot of character formation and plot, we get right to the action. We are in the theater to see screaming jets, feel the explosions of the rockets, and have our hearts lashed by unsubtle emotions. I found myself enjoying this film much more than I expected, actually captivated by it. I was completely taken in by the action and the adventure. Do I believe that the two pilots shot down over the enemy forest (in a mystical sunlit snowfall) would survive? And find each other unhurt? And steal an antique F-14 that they used to escape back to the carrier? No, that's ridiculous! But I don't care!
The flights how they did that was very Impressive, the story lets it down only action at the end. Shame about that, hope no more top gun films. Tom was just tom.

reviews.review_title: Entertaining but paint by numbers film
reviews.content: This is quite a good film. It's very American (not that that's necessarily a bad thing) and it's a very by the book crowd pleaser. There's nothing original about the film. It's much like the first film and it's quite simplistic.However, it's a very entaining watch and it definitely has its charms.

This is by far one of the best movies of the last decade. Just wow. The casting, the storyline, the soundtrack...this movie is absolutely spot on. It brings back all of the feels, and the throw backs are all on par. Yes I cried. Yes I laughed.

reviews.review_title: A sequel without it feeling like one
reviews.content: One of my biggest worries about sequels in general let alone ones made X number of decades later is that it will ruin the original and feel unnecessary. However, the way you feel watching this movie is as if it wasn't even a sequel, obviously it is but it feels like it's own movie with a bunch of references to the original, the use of actual keys in the making of the film just adds to the wow factor it brings. I personally enjoyed this more then the original. I loved this movie and if Tom cruises and Miles teller don't win Oscar's I'm going to be pissed.

One of the best movies for Tom Cruise,
His acting was beyond perfect 👌it showed how much Tom Cruise is talented in acting not just an actor for action movies.There is a scene where it showed how Tom cruise is brilliant in acting 'when he was invited to the Navy to teach and he was standing explaining his plan thinking he was going to fly then the commander told him his going to teach not to fly himself' the react of tomcruise was very confincing 'Tom cruise was shocked to know and sad but at the same time he didn' t want to overreact infront of them ' with few emotions on his face he just told whoever who is watching how he really felt.Many other scenea in the movie showed how Tom Cruise in very brilliant in acting and his feelings delivered it very well to the viewer.And without a doubt the action of the planes was very amusing and interesting to watch.This is a movie full of a mix of adventure, feelings, excitement, romance and action and a very good story!

We are a military household, & even though we know the mission itself was NOT realistic at all? This is one of the few movies we find ourselves watching over & over because of the intense flying, great piloting, & acting.I personally felt as if some of the lines were felt forced, over rehearsed, but after learning about the military training they had to go through for this film? It all made sense, they probably started adapting some of our traits which repetitiveness is one of them. But besides that? This was a really great movie, just at the right time.Who I was really impressed with, was John Hamm! We had to stop the movie to search his background, just to make sure he wasn't in the military at all.. That's how well he played his role, & I hope we aren't the only ones who took notice. He deserves so many doors to be opened because of this portrayal.Last, I just wanted to thank all those Real Fighter Pilots out there who do this job everyday, & all those who make their jobs possible. Thanks for all the hard work, early mornings, difficult training you've all had to endure just to ensure our freedoms! Thank you for your Service, no matter what Branch you were selected to fly for!

A flawless masterpiece. This film brings a lot of the feeling of that great classic, respecting its predecessor "Top Gun", the film while maintaining the essence manages to hit everything, there is nothing to complain, those who love the classic will love this film.The scenes in the fighters are wonderful, I mean it's very good to see a movie that doesn't just use cgi, but makes use of practical effects and it's worth saying that the main actor did the scenes in the fighters and that makes an absurd difference, if that were made on a green background using chroma key and cgi were very weak, so great movies like jurassic park are still good not only because they got everything right, but because they show that practical effects are good and should always be used, shark is a good example the original is just perfect.Well I think I've already made it clear how good this movie is.

reviews.review_title: this was exactly what I needed
reviews.content: Hear me outThis was the best movie ever.Even if you haven't seen the first one this sequel manages to make you feel as if you have known these characters their entire lives. I realize I might be exaggerating, but I'm still coming off the high of having an absolute blast in that theater.First off, miles teller is FANTASTIC. And to whoever made him tall, tanned, sweaty, and an absolute stunner in unbuttoned Hawaiian shirts and aviators... please let me shake your hand.This movie is exactly what you'd hope for in a Tom Cruise, 'one final ride', type of blockbuster. Action, romance, and him "passing on the mantle to himself (credit: @JeremyMonjo on Twitter)"I need to pause shortly, because I am still reveling in the glory of this movie.Going into every action sequence with high stakes, you KNOW that's they're already going to succeed so it shouldn't surprise you when they do. BUT IT IS SO COOL WHEN THEY DO IT BECAUSE EVEN THOUGH YOU KNEW IT WAS COMING YOUR JUST LIKE, DAMN THAT WAS COOL SO IT DOESN'T EVEN MATTER.This movie had so many unbelievable scenarios that I cannot thank it enough for having me in the theater thinking, "wait you're kidding me, since when did they do anything like this in a Top Gun movie?". And the fact is once again that it ends up being SO COOL that you just don't care.People don't love this movie because it gets them excited about America, it gets them excited about planes going brrrrrrrr and doing the dopest tricks.I am in lover with miles teller and Glenn Powell please don't tell my bf.

Excellent sequel. Many references to the original Top Gun, to the point it felt excessive, but the story was unique enough for an entertaining watch.The plot is coherent, as long as you accept what you're told by the filmmakers without questioning it too much. Fortunately you're not spoonfed every basic detail, but the constant narration during the flight scenes seemed unrealistic. The last act felt like an entire bonus.The movie focuses on Maverick, but all the actors were excellent.Excellent visuals and audio, even if the computer graphics were overstylized. The music was mostly a nod to the original score.

In my mind Top Gun hadn't aged well after watching YouTube video after YouTube video "but" the years of not watching actually had the reverse effect because Top Gun Maverick is a movie i didn't want but became the movie i needed. I will never be swayed by those negative know nothing look back reviews again. Thank you Tom Cruise for your years of service to the business i love,the business of escapism,the business of entertainment.. Top Gun Maverick is my movie of 2022 because it's a movie from another time,a time of no holds barred seat of your pants storytelling and it's from the time of my teenage years. I went back to revisit the original to find an old friend i never knew i had.

This film just blows your mind. This is arguably the best movie ever, really enjoyed everything with this movie. The script was amazing, the characters were amazing and last but not least Tom Cruise was amazing! Movie of the year, give that man an Oscar!👍🏼
This movie is the best movie I've ever seen in cinema , everything about this movie is great, the acting the story the soundtrack everything about this is just amazing.

For most cinematic enthusiasts, I believe most would agree when saying this sequel trumps the original 80's flick. This sequel was definitely worth the 30 year anticipation that I think most of us thought would never come. Thank God Lewis Hamilton turned down the role, because had he not I do not believe this movie would have come together as well as it did. I will not disclose any spoilers, however; I will say for those who have not yet seen the film in theater...
.I strongly encourage investing in before watching at home buy yourself a home theater kit! With atleast 100" projection screen. You can buy some for as little as $100 on Amazon.The cast did a phenomenal job, with what feels your soul with so much intensity & realism. Again an amazing cast, so I definitely hope I am around for the next Top Gun. Impossible to TOP this one but I am very hopeful. Those that haven't seen it, what are you waiting for.

reviews.review_title: Awful and ridiculous movie ,doesn't worth a penny
reviews.content: Watched this movie recently and one thing to mention is that it is not even a movie. It is barely a commercial for the US army with a simple and plain story, full of ridiculous dialogues. As someone who lives in the middle east, I can say that there is absolutely no natural environment as the one displayed in the movie in any of the middle eastern countries including Iran. It is obvious that they didn't do any investigation about there. Not worth a penny.

I have no clue why this movie was so popular!Hot shots and Charlie Sheen was the true sequel.Hot Shots part deluxe if you need a sequel.The flying scenes were spectacular I suppose. But is Top Gun Maverick even a movie?They are fighting against the country of Freedonia!?How can they steal the whole trench run from the Battle of Yavin? Was George Lucas one of the screenwriters for Top Gun Maverick?At the end they steal a plane from the olden days and outgun a modern jet fighter. They should have stolen a World War One plane- that would have been funny.Tom Cruise has made some crappy movies that nobody watched. But this one many people watched. Why? I don't get it.

If the Oscars don't give this film the best picture award, then it's viewership deserve to tank year after year? The first cinematic spectacle that brought audiences of a non Superhero loving demographic back into the theatres again. I'm convinced the momentum this film generated at the theatres amongst a certain demographic helped other movies which were released around the same time too (Elvis, Everything Everywhere All at Once etc). Whereas Avatar is just sinking every other movie in it's run right now, and yet apart from how much money it's making I don't see anyone talking about it. But Maverick was a marvel, created a similar cultural impact the first one did. Anyway the Oscars better give Maverick one major award otherwise will never watch that lame ass Hollyweird cringefest ever again.

This was a great movie . Tom Cruise did an amazing job and the way they used Ice Man was very thoughtful. The action scenes where shot in actual flying jets which is exactly what I wanted to see no CGI here ! The movie does a great job of tying in the original in a good way . Do yourself a favor and go see this on an imax or jumbo tron screen . It was spectacular in that kind of viewing environment... larger then life !!

Every film cliche you can think of you will find in this movie. I went to cinema with an assumption that the second movie will be full of references to the first one and that it will try to be funny.But it really surprised me in how pathetic and stupid the result can really be. It was almost like as if the creators wanted to test how low they could go.This is the worst movie I have ever seen in my life.Two stars for good cimenatics of the jet fighters, the rest is thrash.

At the beginning, let's admit that Tom Cruise is the gringo who can always deliver strong action movies like Top Gun. From directing (Joseph Kosinski) to writing (Ehren Kruger, Christopher McQuarrie, Eric Warren Singer) to soundtrack (Hans Zimmer, Harold Faltermeyer) to acting (Tom Cruise, Jon Hamm, Miles Teller, Glen Powell, Charles Parnell). The movie tells the story of Capt. Pete Mitchell (Maverick) who returns to Top Gun school again after 36 years to teach an elite group of fighters how to accomplish a mission. The story is actually good as the movie doesn't need you to watch the first movie. It's so emotional, you'll smile, sit on the edge of your seat, you'll feel the danger that they fall in. The soundtrack is as good as it can be. The cinematography is stunning and the whole movie should be seen in IMAX to enjoy every detail in. The acting is superior from everyone from Tom Cruise to every role in the movie especially that Cruise made the crew fly real real jets and they had extensive G-Force training sessions to withstand the physical demands of the G-force pressures during flights. At the end, the movie deserves the wait, the hype, and to be watched on the biggest screen available. My rating is 10/10.

To be honest, I thought they were going to do a horrible job with this movie. After seeing it, I can't believe how good they actually did. They did great at tying it in with the original, while still bringing it into modern times. I still got the same feel from it as I got from the original, and loved how they tied the story lines together. The flying scenes were absolutely breathtaking. Absolutely 10 stars.

reviews.review_title: Meh, it was a good watch but not the original
reviews.content:
Right off, I would watch any top gun sequel even though this one was long way overdue. Compared to a heritage of movie history like the first it was nothing, whereas a movie by itself it was just okFirst half of movie, it was a 4
Second half of the movie, it was a 7Character development was very poor, iceman was lame, Ed Harris need more time. Gooses son was the best addition.Throwbacks and special effects action pieces were great though.So overall, it was pretty good.

I didn't know much about the movie and watched it only because it was one of the best selling moviesI was very happy to see this beautiful and exciting movieIn some scenes, one's heart was really beating and this excitement was heartwarmingRegarding the movie genre, there is nothing about this movie being a biography, but if it was a biography and there really was a person named Maverick, the value of this movie would be much higher for me.The acting, special effects, music of the film were excellent and the director of this film was admirable and the script was written in a way that made the nation proud.Making such films is necessary for every country, whether in the field of defense and army, in the field of culture and science, or in the field of sports and history.

I really enjoyed this movie, just like I really enjoyed 633 Squadron, from 1964. Top Gun's mission and training plot is lifted from 633 Squadron, just swap Cliff Robertson and George Chakiris for Tom Cruise and Miles Teller. They even copied the bit where the good guys win in the end.

THIS is how you do a reboot Hollywood. Was it a 10 out of 10, no. But this not only paid respect & great homage to the original but also added in new stuff that wasn't too crazy that you'd roll your eyes; everything meshed well.Now I wanna see Tom Cruise do a sequel for the race car driving movie "Days of Thunder". If they write it as well as Top Gun Maverick was written I'll def go see that too.
Quite simply one of the best movie going experiences of my life. Filmmaking, script, cinematography all incredible. 10/10. Must watch, upgrade on the first in every way.

reviews.review_title: A reason to go back to the cinemas!
reviews.content: Haven't gone to the cinema in 6 years, as I might as well watch movies at home. But this was, as anticipated, an amazing experience from the beginning to the end. The audience seemed to agree as they applauded in the end, which is extremely rare where I live.You can say what you want about Tom Cruise, but he's a fantastic actor and a perfectionist in every way.Also a huge cred to the rest of the cast, as they all fit their roles incredibly well.In this age I can really appreciate the authenticity of not using CGI in the flight scenes, it really made the shots believable. You could almost feel the pain the actors went through pulling high Gs. So a huge thanks to all the crew behind the camera for all their effort and hard work to make this a truly epic experience.Also, I really appreciate the few subtle references to different niche communities surrounding mil aviation. Laser code 1688 made me smile!This was absolutely a love letter to military aviation! Thank you to everyone involved!

Awesome sequel and well worth the wait of 36 years. Brilliant storyline and some amazing flight sequences which you can tell are real rather than cgi.Yes, there are a few bits that stretch reality, but overall I really, really enjoyed it and will probably be heading back to the cinema next week for another watch.

reviews.review_title: Caught myself wanting to steer along....
reviews.content: After a long time out of service, Captain Pete "Maverick" Mitchell is called back to his old fighter pilot school. He is to prepare a squad of young men and women for a mission.This is the prelude to a film about cohesion, commitment to each other, overcoming one's own limitations and equally recognizing them, even if one has run away from them for years.Without saying too much about the plot, this film offers breathtaking aerial combat action almost throughout and yet remains believable for the most part. It's a difficult balancing act, but one that the cast and crew manage very well throughout the entire running time. A great performance, especially when you know the flying scenes are real.I've been interested in the subject of civilian and military flight for a while now, play the corresponding video games, and have often found myself wanting to take the controls...

reviews.review_title: Will put you on your toes the whole time
reviews.content: The movie is breathtaking....no unwanted dramas... No stupid dialogues... Everything seemed perfect... I will put it in my top 10 with no second thought.They have done a damn good job.

reviews.review_title: This is not Top-Gun, this is StarWars (and not in the good sense)
reviews.content:
The original Top-Gun was mostly realistic. But this is a Joke.Unless the Enemy was Canada, the operation is absurd.Let's suppose the enemy is current Russia:
1. The max-speed of a Hornet is 0.53km/s, so the hornet must travel between 90 and 200km before reaching the bunker. The detection range of the Russian Anti-air S-400 system is 400 km, and can track low-altitude targets at extremely long range (below the radio horizon).2. A Su-57 (5-Generation aircraft) has R-37 missiles (hypersonic air-to-air missile), the R-37 uses a Doppler radar, so flares won't be as useful as against infrared missiles.3. And the Carrier Group would be sunk with 3M22 Zircon hypersonic missiles even before the Hornets reach the destination. I said Carrier Group, a Carrier is always part of a Carrier Strike Group, composed of at list 4 major ships, plus logistic and supply ships, etc, roughly 7,500 personnel
4. Even the airborne early warning and control (AEW&C) system would be shot down in a real scenario.Etc
A barrage of missiles, directly against the Bunker, or even a sabotage operation (007 style), would be more realistic.

This is one of the best movies I have ever seen. The story line was interesting and well thought out. The flying scenes were exhilarating and exciting. The acting was top notch, especially Tom Cruise. Well done!

Top Gun is exactly the film I wanted it to be and by the end of it I didn't want it to finish. The film doesn't try to be too smart and attack the characters of the first film. Maverick is still the Maverick of the first film albeit older and struggling with his demons and guilt which gives the character much needed depth and maturity. The way the character plots come together is natural and they all have their parts to play. The treatment of Val Kilmer in the film is superb and the story of Goose's son and his relationship with Maverick is outstanding. Let's also not forget the cinematography and how all the flight scenes were filmed in real aircraft. Best movie I've watched in years.

reviews.review_title: An "experience gift" for TC funded by the masses...
reviews.content:
This is nothing but a self indulging joy ride for Tom Cruise in US fighter jets funded by the masses. I can literally see him sitting in his mansion going: "what other cool stuff could I do in life... hmm fly in a modern, operational military jet?? How to do that? Hmm lets do a TG sequal. And to be fair that would be all in all fine if at least he did his homework and made a decent movie.How this movie has gotten such good reviews is beyond me...
I work as a pilot, flying jet aircraft, and I can say that the realism, when it comes to the flying and military aspects, is non-existent. Period. In basically every facet of the movie. There are some crumbs of realism in there but they are obliterated by nonsense hollywood action for dramatic effect. This movie is about as realistic from a flying and military perspective as the worst XBOX flying game, mind you game, not simulator. The "Star wars rip off trench run mission" that the movie revolves around is simply and plainly, absolute nonsense... with too many unrealistic aspects to even begin to list... Ok, just one, the millions of SAM sites along the trench, but none in the trench? Or in the crater?One of the biggest pet peeves I have is that the so called 5th gen fighter (SU-57 in real life) is elevated to some sort of super plane, which the US military (the most ridiculously well funded military and air force in the world) is somehow incapable of matching...clearly they need more funding.... except that the US also has 5th gen fighters... two types even... one of which is in the movie in the beginning.. the F-35. But it is eloquently, very briefly discarded in the movie as not appropriate for the mission due to "gps jamming" but for some reason the F18 is unaffected by this...sigh... true reason: there is no two seater version so there would be no IRL shots of the cast. Which is fine I guess, but the whole underdog premise, which military technology wise the US would never be, is just nonsense.OK so the realism is about as present as Kelly McGillis in this movie. It could have still been a decent movie otherwise...right?? But no, between the terrible, juvenile acting, over the top Americanised/hollywood, "forced" comedy and drama, this is really just a cheesy, walk down memory lane for Tom Cruise, with throwbacks to the original movie (which was heaps better and actually more realistic than this one!). The only thing I remotely liked were the flight scenes and footage, however even that was dampened by all the edited and mashed together shots...This should not be called Top Gun 2, it should be called Fast and The Furious, aircraft drift....

There aren't many films created with this much love. From the heart-pounding action to entertaining characters, the story was just filled with emotion and made me smile.I haven't watched the first movie before so I was a bit hesitant to go into this, but thankfully I was because it was an amazing experience: visuals, camerawork, sounds and music, completely immersing me into the experience. The pacing was perfect making the 2 hour runtime seem like 10 minutes. I wish I watched this sooner when it first came out.

reviews.review_title: Soo Boring! Don't waste your time & money!
reviews.content: I regret that I followed the masses raving about this super boring film. So american cliche .. (yawning)I honestly felt great and fantastic when I left the movies after Top Gun probably 30 years ago and saved money to buy the 'must have leather jacket' what I dearly loved for many decades.Omg.. times must have changed quickly. Different.. or just easy to entertain Netflix/fb/selfie generation .. my guessing.

Such a great movie, I've never watched the first one but this one I loved it, haven't watched such a good one in a while! Thank you Maverick, you guys did amazing job! If you still hesitating if you should go in the cinema or not, just go for it, super good movie to watch in the big screen with a nice audio.

Finally a movie that made me feel something!! That hasn't happened in a while.I recommend this movie to everyone! Very well done movie. Tom Cruise is a dedicated actor to his craft, it shows in this movie. Amazing acting from the full cast as well.

Surreal picture and audio, Acting was breathtaking, Flashbacks and references to the 1986 original. Constantly has you on edge focused on every detail, Beautiful storyline and amazing characters. Am definitely going to rewatch atleast 5 times. Highly recommend watching. 11/10.

THIS IS ONE OF THE BEST SEQUEL.Though, I can blindly go for Joseph/TomCruise combo movie any day-anytime.If I talk about this movie, this movie is 100% a big-screen watch(don't wait for its OTT release, it won't do good justice).Screenplay: Outstanding
Action sequence: Outstanding
Fighter plane dog-fights: Never seen before
OST: Excellent (but still some scope to get to the level of awesomeness)
Dialogue: Very good
Direction: 10/10
Tom Cruise: 10/10
ADRENALINE PUMPING: GUARANTEEDDefinitely its not just one-time watch, it leaves you to crave more, and something you will add in your best movies list.
For Jennifer and the great flight scenes, worth it. IMAX screen is also great for it.For all the rest, not to much. But I didn't have high expectations for anything but, so it was good entertainment.

One more time Hollywood managed to squeeze last atom from the so much exploited topic. And this time in a good way. Though it is very entertaining I still don't understand why it is rated so high as there is nothing we haven't seen already . I rate it 7.

reviews.review_title: A good sequel, but a little late
reviews.content: This movie is certainly entertaining and very well done.The references to the original movie are nice but at the same time the new film has a life of its own.Nonetheless, to make the link with the previous movie, this one retconns some aspects of the previous film, specially the timeline. For instance, Goose's son should be in his late thirties instead of his early or middle twenties, and Iceman should be retired. Also, it's highly unlikely that Maverick could continue in the Navy after so many skipped promotions.But with those inconsistencies aside, the movie is highly enjoyable and it's a great nostalgia exercise.As it's usual with action movies, there's scarce character development (specially with the team of pilots) and although the action scenes are perfectly done, the plot is somewhat generic and the ending is pretty obvious.The romance and emotional moments are keep low, just like the original one, but this time the film is less pop-oriented and feels more mature.In the end, Tom Cruise confirm his star status and appeal with the audience.

reviews.review_title: When memory comes back. Knocking on your door.
reviews.content: Wow it's wasn't something i expected , even though we know they love to bring back memories. It really does the job to get it present with other actors and very good acting. I'm happy to see Val Kilmer played his role with his pains. Sadly he dies at the end which it is Hollywood but can't stop thinking of his courage, and if you have a chance to see his movie check it out!Blasting images and strong scenes in the aircraft gives you goose bumps. Amazing film with seventies music as the eighties one to remind the first movie.I am happy I saw this one and thank these guys to give us that brilliant movie.Just wow.

reviews.review_title: A purely good film with no hidden agenda!
reviews.content: So refreshing to have a film that is simply a well made entertaining film that isn't preaching to me. The movie hits all the necessary requirements, there is drama, good characters, fun twists and amazing visuals. I was blown away! 10/10!

Rarely does a sequel outperform the original movie. The way they have managed to give an excellent tribute to the original while holding a story on its own is amazing. The first Top Gun was a movie which can be easily watched countless times and the sequel is no less.The acting was spot on and the choice of casting was also good. The stunts were very entertaining and could not have been more realistic for a film.The only thing the first movie does better though is the song selection was hoping to encounter a new song on a level par with 'Take my breath away', 'Danger Zone' and 'Mighty wings'.But still, overall it was a fantastic experience. Hope more and more movies and sequels are produced like this!

Good movie for a 9-13 yr old kid. Not so much for a human adult. Every scene predictable and the reach for Cruise youth is beyond his grasp. The original is a classic...the sequel is just like most others...trash.

reviews.review_title: Flying scenes worth the forced nostalgia
reviews.content: Like many people my age (over 50) probably have fond memories of the first Top Gun movie. The farther away we got from that movie you would tell your kids how awesome it was even though you secretly hoped it still stood the test of time. Preparing for the sequel I watched the original again for the first time in decades. It really didn't hold up and made me anticipate this new one even more.I hoped the nostalgia and the scenes involving the first movie were few-not so much. Lots of throwback pictures, video etc of the 86 film. Luckily the ending truly made this film something other than an average sequel to something special. Similar to the first, I still don't understand who they were fighting or flying against and did they deserve to die etc etc. The flying scenes are amazing and even when you knew what was going to happen it didn't disappoint at all. So convince your kids to see it so they can tell their kids about how great Top Gun was to them too.

reviews.review_title: Pretty cool footage of jets, that's about it.
reviews.content: I haven't seen the original since I was 5 years old in 1991, so I may have missed out on some of the nostalgia and plot that connects to the original.That said, this movie was quite boring for all but the final act. Some of the aviation footage was spectacular. All of the characters were flat and the practice missions and conflict between Maverick and his students and superiors was boring as hell. The love story was also a snooze.I have enjoyed Joseph Kosinski's other films and he did a decent job for the most part, you could tell he directed this.I felt ripped off paying for a ticket after being tricked by all the hype and rave reviews.

If you're a nostalgic boomer and survived the first iteration without falling asleep, this is just the right movie for you. Tom Cruise is pretty good at playing Tom Cruise again. The very, very few action scenes are amazing. I don't know anything about jet-plane dogfights but this seems to be well done. Problem is, that the movie is 95% dull dialogue about nothing, you forget everyone's real name a minute after leaving the cinema. If you don't know or don't remember (watched it like 15 or 20 years ago) the first movie, none of the characters will make you feel ANYTHING. Exposition, surface level romance just to force it in somehow and seemingly incompetent new pilots, considering that they should be the best (why did they never fly fast before? Is that how it is?). You also never know who they're fighting against, the enemy and rogue nation talk is just irritating. Make some damn country up if you don't want to call it Russia. Gotta give them credit for straight up ripping the mission plot from Star Wars, bold move.

What is with all of the hype surrounding this turkey? I was really looking forward to this and was expecting a movie at least as entertaining as the original. But oh boy was I disappointed. Honestly I couldn't get through it.The characters were so wafer thin if they turned side on they'd disappear. I didn't like, hate, feel for or relate to a single one of them. I have met fighter pilots on several occasions and they have been impressive, engaging, disarming but mostly humble people. The polar opposite of these cardboard, yeeha all American clowns. At least the characters in the original were somewhat interesting.The script was not just embarrassingly corny and cringeworthy, it was boring. What has happened to script writing in Hollywood? If you're going to dump a 100 Million plus into a film at least employ someone who can write.The storyline was so lacking in credibility, it should have been classified science fiction fantasy. Come on, give me something that will at least suspend my disbelief for a while.The acting? What acting? Each scene was either hammed up or indifferently delivered. Nothing flowed. The scene between Maverick and a very ill looking Ice was difficult to watch. I mean, really? I like a bit of sentimentality as much as the next person but Val Kilmer, playing an Admiral of all things, just looked and sounded sad.Worse yet, the things supposed to be the stars of the show, the jets and the flying, were pretty awful. These scenes were mostly poorly directed and stuffed so full of CGI they looked cartoonish. All too often we were shown current Super Hornet jets doing things that they simply can't do to the point of monotony. This took away any authenticity the movie may have had, and "rendered" the whole experience one big yawn fest.But possibly worst of all was the disconnect between the age of the main character and the way he carries on. Lets face it, Tom Cruise ain't getting any younger and he's showing it, but it seems this Maverick bloke hasn't grown up at all.Crashed and Burned.

reviews.review_title: Best movie I've seen in a while!
reviews.content: Tom Cruise did it again.This is the best movie I've seen in years. Somehow he manages to captivate you throughout the film and keep you fully there! I teared, I laughed, I was sweating and gasping. Everything about this movie gets you moving.So happy he waited to release it to the big screen. You're all in for a treat!

I always enjoy a movie starring Tom Cruise. Why? Because every project he is a part of, you can tell he puts his heart and soul into. Top Gun: Maverick is definitely no exception to that. In fact, I don't think I've ever felt Tom's passion for filmmaking more intensely than I have after watching this movie. I can also tell through the performances of his supporting cast that he expects that same energy and commitment from them. I've never been more empathetic of the characters in a movie than this one. From the sense of brotherhood from the beach football scene and Mavierick's visit to Iceman to the intense feelings of duty, fear, anxiety, and hope during the team's mission, Top Gun: Maverick never ceased to make me care about the characters. I almost felt like I was there with them. I can't remember the last time I had this kind of experience. Congratulations to the cast and crew for creating this outstanding and extraordinary piece of art.

If you're into action flicks and able to ignore the impracticability of the whole premise, the impossibility of the presented scenario and to overlook the whole "We're the best in the whole world" (by world of course meaning America, only the part that matters), then yeah! You will be entertained. I guess.

Hangman reminded me of Iceman. RoosterMiles made the perfect son for Goose. It started slow but as soon as he climbed over that limit in the beginning and wrecked the jet it was like there's Maverick he knows he is going to get into trouble and unbelievable that his friend through it all Iceman was bailing him out. Would have been even better to see some of the pilots from the first movie.
Top gun the first one was a great movie this was so much better had so much suspense and the action just gives you goose bumps one of the best movies I have ever seen if not the best 10/10 for me.

Seriously? The mission was too far-fetched to be plausible on any level. Let's be honest here. It was a straight Death Star/X-Wing/Star Wars rip-off. Fly down a valley at stupid speeds and put a missile down a gopher hole. Goodbye Death Star/ Nuclear Factory. A couple of well-placed MOABs would have done the job with no fuss whatsoever. And let's not forget that in Hunger Games, they bombed a similar location, causing massive avalanches that buried the target forever
Then we have a bunch of kids pretending to be pilots who look like rejects from Village People or The Chippendales. All with perfect teeth and sun tans and more angst, insecurity, and maturity issues than you can throw a stick at. I wouldn't let them near a truck, never mind a fast jet.The whole thing started out with a rerun of TG 1s opening sequence, followed by a fun ride in something that looked like the SR71's replacement, which Cruise managed to destroy, when it would have been better used on the mission. What a waste.The dialogue was silly, that acting just about passable, and the script full of holes. That said, the action sequences were excellent, to be fair, and I did enjoy them... a lot. It could have been so much better though, and I think they missed way too many great opportunities. Worth watching once.

Best sequel ever made! Loved the respect shown to the original. Loved the pro America theme! Solid story line. Solid acting. Love story was a little forced but oh well. Would have like to have seen cameos of Meg Ryan and Kelly mcgillis.See this movie on the biggest screen you can!!!

reviews.review_title: Maybe my hopes were too high but I was let down
reviews.content: The original had everything. A believable story line, great characters, dog fights and whilst a serious script it had some classic one liners. I know it off by heart having watched it over 100 times.TG Maverick abandons all of this other than the amazing flying scenes - in fact that is the only thing that saves the film.Far too many nods to the original - it got cheesy by the end.The script was like something out of Mission Impossible. In fact that is what the premise of the film was - an impossible mission. But with this impossible mission everyone came home apart from poor Ice Man who's death and funeral only took about 24 hours - probably the fastest in US history.The first half of the film felt empty as we caught up with what Maverick has been up to for the last 20 or so years but in reality we didn't learn much. The last half was action packed but only just managed to save the movie.I'd have loved to have spent less time with the Maverick catch up, less time with the shoehorned Penny Benjamin and more time learning about the pilots. This could have been a perfect segway into a 3rd Top Gun with Rooster and Hangman taking over the Maverick and Ice Man rivalry.I desperately wanted to walk out of the cinema having loved it - I wanted to text all my mates saying how good it was but I couldn't. I rattled off a couple of sentences surmising the plot to my wife and realised how silly it all was:Maverick is a test pilot or a secret plane - he takes it up against orders and blows it up - doesn't get sacked as Ice Man conveniently phones up as it happens and brings him back to Top Gun for an impossible mission that no one else in the world can train people for - he trains them - gets sacked - steals a plane and completes impossible mission - gets his job back - flies impossible mission - gets shot down without parachute opening and is fine - Rooster saves him - gets shot down - they meet up and steal an old plane - shoot down 2 super jets and save the day - then they land and they then make up and work on planes together.I don't know, maybe I'm being harsh. Knock 30 mins off the start with all the Maverick and Penny stuff and it would have been pretty awesome.Will probably watch it another 99 times.

Two movies 30 years apart and they managed to link them perfectly as if it was all planned. For a person like me who liked Kelly Mcgills definitely more than Jennifer, I have still given it a rating of 10. While I was anticipating it, I thought that there could be Maverick's son from Charlotte but no, there was another twist. Won't call it better but yeah, they linked it perfectly. Best movie so far during the last 5 years.

reviews.review_title: A Tribute to our Navy Top Gun Pilots!
reviews.content: What a wonderful Movie. A much needed one for our Military and our Nation at this time. Our Navy Top Gun Pilots achieve excellence something many of us will never know. On the edge of my seat. The Flying sequences are Excellent! I watched it on 55 inch TV screen. I would loved to have seen it in the theaters. Tom Cruise knows how to make a movie as do the producers, directors and crew. I can't say no violence in the movie because of enemy pilots being shot down, but at least no torture of anyone, no blood and no women being abused. So this is my kind of movie. Old style with values and trust. I wonder how many people inquired to the Navy recruiters what it takes to be a Navy Pilot? A friend was offered to take a ride in one of the Local Air Show Jets. He refused. I wish I had been there, because even though I don't like to fly commercial anymore, I would fly with any one of these pilots in a heartbeat! Go Navy!

The first movie is a classic and a great movie but this one overcome the original, it has amazing and very dynamic action scenes, an extraordinary development of the story and great and very memorable characters, the interactions between the characters are great, specially between maverick and rooster, in general it's a great movie and, in my opinion, one of the best sequels ever made.

I think everything about this film was perfect ... almost.To nitpick, the main issue that prevents Top Gun from being perfect is the individual characters' motivations, and the main enemy. There is never a very clear establishment of the individual characters' reasons to put their lives at stake for this mission, apart from them being part of the navy. Even though that sufficed, I think it would have been better if there were a personal connection between the enemy and the main protagonists. Perhaps the enemy could have caused some past trauma, perhaps motivating the pilots further, just before they are about to fail.However, this is very minor in the face of how excellently everything else is executed in this film, with the cast being well picked, great directing and cinematography, as well as amazing visuals.Rating: 9/10.

reviews.review_title: This movie has resorted my faith in movie making!!
reviews.content: Genuinely one of the best movies I've ever seen. The stunts with the fighter plane are incredible, no crappy CGI for most. Unreal. Must see at cinema!

reviews.review_title: Great Formula with a little of the progressive sickness
reviews.content: Pretty good action movie, love rooster and maverick dynamic. Hangman obviously has some story to be developed, reminds me of a young you know who. The female pilot and her beta male co-pilot added nothing to the movie, was obviously a progressive quota filling situation. Only other glaring issue, if the cast of the movie is anything to go by, white people are the minority in America now.
This movies doesn't want to destroy our heroes or make a political point. Simple and plain entertainment. You get to still love the characters, get excitement and feel happy. No traumas here.

reviews.review_title: A Hollywood Block Buster Experiential Film
reviews.content: On paper Top Gun Maverick is the sort of film I despise. It is a Hollywood blockbuster film sequel of a beloved (though overrated) 80s pop corn film classic, yet I found myself won over. The original film itself does not justify a sequel so that justification needed to be earned by the film and it to earned it. On the surface it has all the makings of a rubbish film. Characters with little depth and a greater emphasis on action and spectacle. Yet those qualities are what make Top Gun 2 work. People have described films such as 2001 A Space Odyssey and Apocalypse Now as experiential films as they have a greater emphasis on the cinematic experience which is used to further enhance specific idea. I think this can be applied to some extent to Top Gun Maverick, though naturally any comparison beyond this would be practically blasphemous. Top Guns main appeal comes from the cinematic experience. It is an immersive film by design and this is where it it succeeds at. One of the problems with the the first film was its emphasis on character but given the characterisation was rather blunt and surface level, it resulted in a rather cheesy and corny film which at many points are rather laughable in execution with the flying being in the background. The flying scenes have always been the highlight and top gun masterfully makes use of it. Its by no means perfects as the character beats are fairly cliché and predictable and it does annoyingly repeat a lot of elements from the original. Overall it is an exciting and thoroughly entertaining film and a suggested watch if you want a nice piece of escapism.

Ok. Suspension of logic rules apply. I saw the first Top Gun in the theaters meaning I'm old (older) and seen my share of movies in the meantime. So here we go.Mav flies to many Machs with his special Navy jet with only a crew of 5? (Motorcycle helmets are required on public roads in California). Penny owns a bar, a sailboat, a Porsche and a beautiful beachside bungalow. Must be very rich. Admiral Iceman calls him back into the fold. And that's the first 20 minutes. Not much too realism in this movie but not unexpected.

reviews.review_title: That's what cinemas are made for !
reviews.content: One of my best experiences in cinema. A complete movie from start to end. Unfortunately, movies like this one is rare in the last couple of years. Thank you Tom Cruise & all the cast.

As an 80s kid, the original Too Gun was a "watch, rewind, repeat" necessity of my childhood. It inspired me to get into military aviation, as did a whole generation of members of our armed forces.To say that this movie surpassed all that would be an understatement. It had just the right amount of nostalgia while keeping the characters moving forward and introducing us to a new generation of naval aviators without disrespecting the legacy characters. This movie has found a place of honor in my movie cabinet along with the 1986 classic. When I sit down and watch it, I get the same feeling that the original gave me as a kid.

reviews.review_title: I had high expectations, and it beat them
reviews.content: Just that. I am 28 years old and have seen the original probably 10 times, I went into this movie with high expectations and left with my jaw on the floor.My gf and I saw it in IMAX on opening day and the visual effect was astounding. I've never seen a movie that realistic with such little CGI. I will be going back to see it again.As far as the story goes, it was good and actually made sense somehow. I liked the way they acknowledge that drones are taking over and digger pilots will be obsolete soon.There is one moment at the end that I thought was a little cheesy but otherwise the whole story was quite good. Also you have to love the opening scene on the aircraft carrier.

No faults. Has the best balance of emotions, the best film work I've ever seen. Just knowing that ever thing in the movie is real makes it 100 times better. Will watch this film again and again for the rest of my life.

reviews.review_title: Excellent action movie, see it in cinemas
reviews.content: A great, simple action movie reminiscent of its 80's predecessor, I haven't seen the original top gun and you definitely don't need to for this. It's just a fun adventure following tom cruise's return to teaching pilots and flying jets. Excellent cinematography and dogfight and combat scenes. Miles Teller plays a great role and highlights how short Tom Cruise actually is, this film is however much better in cinemas, with a big picture and surround sound to get yourself immersed in the experience, I imagine the enjoyment would deteriorate quickly if brought onto a regular tv.

This film literally carries no surprises. Even during the supposedly tense parts of the movie. At no time was I on the edge of my seat wondering what might happen as it was abundantly clear that none of the characters in this movie were going to suffer any kind of major mishap.Also every other character apart from Maverick had nothing to get your teeth into that even if something had happened to them, including Miles Teller's, I'm not sure I would have been that bothered.The original was ok and looking at the reviews here I was led to believe this was a major improvement over that, but not even close.
The movie story line can be predicted pretty easily but the acting and every line of the story brought so much emotion that the whole time I feel just like in the film. Every single second was great.
This is a throwback to the glory of what moviemaking should be and definitely delivers. Two hours of action packed escapism. MUST SEE! Then see it again!

This movie was just like the first one just worse on the script. I try to watch all his movies and when I saw the first top gun, I knew I couldn't watch another 80's movie for a while, felt like I was watching the room with how corny everything was. I literally fell asleep every time Jennifer c. Would go on screen, those scenes where so useless. Then just the story was poor. In 2021(that's the time the film was originally gonna be released) that is our big mission, compared to all the Middle East air raids we had. But I will say the jet scenes are great and best part is the end, where the action is and you don't have to watch that terrible love connection that tom cruise always has in movies.

Besides all the marvel movies that built up to a great conclusion with Endgame, this was the best movie I've seen in the past 15 years! When Maverick runs the course and gains their respect, still gives me goosebumps. Great story line and great cast! Tom is a legend on and off scene!

Everytime Tom Cruise breaks the rules he gets another promotion. "You're fired you have been too reckless and the team doesn't need you anymore." *Does exactly what he is told not to do* "God dangit maverick you are promoted because this movie can not be 20 minutes long." The love interest was completely unbelievable after she rang the bell and stuck him with a bar tab for 80 people. I would've been furious. Because he put his phone on the bar? Where else is he gonna put it? What are tables for in this universe? Overall the story was pretty middle of the road and predictable. I heard there was no CGI used on the planes so that's pretty sweet.

reviews.review_title: Standard Tom Cruise Movie. What's the big deal.
reviews.content: As a child of the 80s, I have fond memories of the original Top Gun. But as we all know Tom Cruise and his ego have long since over shadowed all the projects he stars in. Just like all Tom Cruise movies. Tom Cruise is a rebel. Tom Cruise has a heart of gold. Tom Cruise must save the world. Tom Cruise must run somewhere to save the world. Tom Cruise saves the world and gets the girl. Tom Cruises lives happily ever after. His complete lack of vulnerability makes it almost impossible to empathize with any character he plays. Movie is okay, but I don't see the reason for all the hype. I guess Covid 19 really lowered our standards when it comes to blockbusters.

Outstanding job making this movie look even more beautiful and cool as a movie nice work on making some aircraft planes come in this movie was cool thing to making a movie like this so congrats on making this movie the best top gun movie ever.

This truely is one of the most useless movies ever. The entire story is more or less copied from the original movie. The plot is absolutely predictable. Of course Maverick leads the mission and of course Goose Jr. Is at his side. As they didn't have a better idea they totally copied the mission idea from Star Wars V - hit the target through the ventilation with of missile after a difficult approach. I laughed out loud.Two highlights: Jennifer Conelly and the re-appearance of Val Kilmer.

Probably one of the best sequel movies I've ever seen. Emotional, thrilling, awesome sound effects. Must be seen on the big screen. If like me, you've seen the original Top Gun more than 20 times and know it inside out, you'll want to see this again and again.

reviews.review_title: Worth the Wait and what a way to go back to IMAX!!!!!
reviews.content: I was preparing to be disappointed as I didn't see how a sequel to Top Gun would be able to work. They somehow figured out how to portray an older and a little wiser Maverick, still exciting, larger than life, reckless and charming while not ignoring his age. It immediately felt like a 30 year later or so Maverick would be!The ties to the original were not too much and not too little, with a new group of hot shots sharing the spotlight with the past. The new characters, (Rooster and Penny in particular) were worked in seamlessly and perfectly cast. Jennifer Connely was immediately a perfect fit for the love interest as well.In summary, I am not a serial high-ranker and a 9 is high praise, which this film deserved. This was my first time in a theater in over two years and this is ABSOLUTELY one to see on IMAX, or at least in a theater!
One of the best movies I've ever seen from 2022 until now. Every thing is very good the soundtrack the action the director.Let's hope there will be new part.

reviews.review_title: Not often a leave a theatre grinning from ear to ear.
reviews.content: It's a mix of nostalgia, emotion, balls to the wall over the top action, sadness, joy, redemption, love, guts and glory all framed with an impeccable score, beautiful cinematography and some solid acting from Cruise, Teller and co. It's Top Gun grown up and on steroids. Can't wait to see it again.

Everything about it rang true. It was so heartfelt and real, seemingly not just between the characters, but between Val & Tom. Tom has come full circle. Started out as a huge movie star, went through the image crisis with the scientology stuff, couch-jumping, Katie Holmes, hiring his sister as his publicity agent, etc. Phase to getting rid of all that stuff and after a few hit mission impossibles and top gun maverick he's back. This scene between Val & Tom shows a return for both men. It makes me want to find footage of both guys interacting when the movie camera wasn't rolling. So moving. I can't wait to see it again.
Cruise, Kilmer, and so many others lit up the screen producing and inspiring greatness. Fantastic story line, great direction, and acting talent stretching the limits of human achievement.

reviews.review_title: One of the best movies I have ever seen, period.
reviews.content: This is one of the rare movies that I would go back and watch again in cinema. And I am not alone. All my relatives and friends I know have seen the movie, have not only seen it once, but at least twice or even three-four times. IN CINEMA!The movie is beautiful in itself , but the story telling and writing is even better.But maybe the thing that makes it work so well, is the real life time between the original and top gun Maverick. The movie plays insanely well of the almost 40 years between two films. The jokes inserted in the movie are also well placed and very funny.In conclusion: This is 100% (at least in my oppinion) the best movie to come out int the past few years.

Growing up, the original Top Gun was one of my favorite movies - one that I could throw on at any point and enjoy. When news broke that a sequel was making its way to the big screen, I was filled with excitement. Each time the release date got pushed back, it just built more and more anticipation. Well, I've now been to see Top Gun: Maverick on three separate occasions and the movie went above and beyond what I ever imagined it could be. It pays homage to the original, while creating its own unique storyline. The aerial sequences are top notch. It's emotional. It's exciting. It was worth the wait and did not let down in any way, shape, or form. Go see it, then see it again.

Watched Avatar The Way of Water a couple of days ago and i absolutely loved it, watched The Batman earlier in the year but this film beats them both to film of the year for me, it's just incredible. Yes it may be similar to the first but the cinematography, soundtrack and characters as well as the phenomenal returning cast creates nothing short of a masterpiece. In some parts it is predictable but that shouldn't take anything away from the incredible experience. Easily a 10/10, this also beats The Batman for me, you all need to watch this!Never got the chance to see this in cinemas but boy I wish I did.Thank you Tom Cruise you absolute LEGEND.

I'm 17, and I haven't watched the prequel before coming to the movies to see this one. Maybe it was a mistake, but it was certainly the best movie I've ever watched and I go to the movies regularly. Also seeing my father feel the nostalgia of his younger years (he's 52) was pretty cool as well.No matter the age, come watch - you'll enjoy.

"Maverick" is without a doubt a worthy and well-directed sequel to "Top Gun". Also thanks to the influence of Tom Cruise. Val Kilmer's short appearance makes you cry. However, the mission in the film is 100% the mission to destroy the Death Star in "Star Wars - New Hope". Pay attention to the details, the scenes play out almost identically, including the target monitor going out, torpedoes firing into a small hole and a "you have the force" moment. I would have wished for a Star Wars movie like "Maverick". That would take the Star Wars franchise to a new level where it's more realistic.Thanks for an old-school US blockbuster. I've been missing that in the movie world for a long time.

I will say I was never a super fan of the first film, it's entertaining and definitely a dude movie, with high adrenaline and cocky males. My favorite parts of the original movie was the romance and all the hot shirtless men lol.This film I feel surpasses the original film, and in today's remakes, reboots and sequels, I feel this movie far exceeded my expectations.I've always been a fan of Tom Cruise, besides him being good looking (even in his seasoned years), I definitely feel like he is one of our last true action stars. He still lights up the screen and keeps you entertained, and that's exactly what this did.The action scenes were great I felt like I was in the cockpit and it was extremely intense. This movie gave me more respect to our men and women in the military who fly these jets. I know if I was one of them in that jet i would either pass out or lose my lunch.Definitely 10/10 for me.
Tom Cruise is such a talented actor in Hollywood industry. This movies is really best movie i don't have words for this movie..........................

reviews.review_title: Not bad. But too much of a repeat imo
reviews.content: I'm not a big Tom Cruise fan, but I really like the original. When I heard there was gonna be a sequel, I was very annoyed and wasn't gonna watch it.Then I read reviews, how many people thought it was even better than the first etc. So I watched it.It's okay. Definitely NOT better than the first, it felt like pretty much the same story all over again. Had good elements (my favorite was probably his friendship with Ice) and let's face it, Tom Cruise is the perfect actor for this stuff. The other cast is great too. But I'm not loving it.

I go to movies alot and this is my favorite movie of all times. Tom cruise delivers it all. He is amazing! He should get an award for sure! There is so much action and a wonderful story with it I left with a happy feeling.

That's how you do a legacy sequel. From Tron Legacy to Top Gun: Maverick, Joseph Kosinski has earned a spot as a director of the fans along side being good at his craft. He & Tom Cruise work well together & I hope he gets to do more films with a wider appeal in the future.

On would imagine that storyline of a sequel of a legendary moview might not live at its expectations, but this one does. In fact goes beyond. If a viewer might not have seen the 1986 movie, still it will not be hard to catch up in this one.Now apart from an excellent story, as expected the mid air dog fight scenes with barely no FX gives an amazing experience especially in 4DX. I just loved it. But I do also want to watch this one in iMAX.

reviews.review_title: First Movie was Good. Maverick? A Masterpiece.
reviews.content: I've never been a fan of the first Top Gun movie despite being an aviator myself. Blood pumping action was good but that was more or less it.But the sequel, Maverick? Oh boy it was good. So good. First the character development was spot on, the movie answered the biggest question the audience had in mind, "how did everyone mature?" in a very classy and in a very specific way people would want to see.Technically the movie is top notch. Action scenes pushed aviation and overall stunt level to its limits, but never crossed the "impossible, bs" line. Cruise, being an aviator did everything to build the action scenes on a solid structure.Soundtrack is just as the way it should be. Danger Zone is there from the start. The iconic tune, "Take my Breath Away" was not in the movie and I am glad it is replaced to reflect the changes in Maverick's life, just the way it should be.I consider Top Gun: Maverick the true, classy return of the theatre after the pandemic. It just couldn't be better.

reviews.review_title: EXTREME YOUTUBERS with a sense of 80s
reviews.content: I am not a big fan of the series, but love Tom's innocent and creepy grinning shown throughout the first film. The new one contains tons of incredible camera work and realistic aerial combat scenes, which is definitely worth watching in a theater with blasting sound systems. Tom Cruise performs charmingly and more adorably than before mainly because he got old adding some kind of bitterness to his aura. The plot, however, is insanely naive and self-righteous. In other words, too much American. They just make a plan to sneak in other nation's(not named though) and drop bombs on their territory and bug out dodging from their self-defense missiles. The bandits pilots' face are sealed with full-face masks and made unidentified, and just killed by heroic navies. Aren't they going to become another Goose for their families? I cannot be ignorant about the indisputable fact as a person like it's repeatedly saying "don't think." The soldiers on shipapplauded two survivors who snitched an outdated(but ready-to-go) plane on their recklessness and brave hearts, but I cannot dismiss the following disastrous result. This is absolutely a "stringer's" logic as the U. S. always take, which is undoubtedly disgusting for people in other counties like me.

reviews.review_title: I don't go to the cinema often...
reviews.content: I don't go to the cinema often but when I do...Tom Cruise.This film was so good, so entertaining, and so emotional too, I was in tears in parts and moments later cheering in my seats. It was a rollercoaster of a ride, sometimes I felt as if I was in the passenger seat myself (I wish) as Russell Crowe once famously said in the middle of an amphitheatre, are you not entertained?! I really really am entertained...I don't care if critics still find things to nit pick about, I am not one of those people, for me... this is Tom Cruises world, and we are just living in it. Probably my favourite modern movie of all time, I'm going to reflect on that statement I'm sure, but right now, I'm not thinking.. I'm just doing...10/10.

The movie was well worth the wait. Great job by the entire cast & hats off for the efforts put in on this one! I should mention, that this movie is definitely for the big screen, so avoid watching it on your TV/home theatre!

Truly a great sequel. The way the fighter plane scenes are captured, it's unbelievable. The mission is very well planned and executed, and the story is paced very well. The best part is that no character is killed in action, and that makes the movie likeable to be watched. No one should miss this movie in theaters.

reviews.review_title: A truly epic movie. Hollywood isn't dead after all!!
reviews.content: Whoever is giving this a less than 9 doesn't have a clue about cinema. What a marvelous movie. Gotta love this man and the rest of the cast!! Love this movie. I have been getting disillusioned with cinema of late and thankfully I watched this one. I remember watching the original and enjoying it so much. This one actually topped it and exceeded all my expectations. I had to review it and give it a 10. Hollywood isn't dead after all. The overdose of Marvel and other CGI filled flicks still haven't snuffed the life out of Hollywood yet! Its movies like these that give me hope entertainment is still alive and kicking.
The beat movie of 2022.IT was the beat movie i have Seen in a Long time and IT was soo good.I have No criticem to thes film and IT is not om my top 10 movies og All time.
There are so many references to the original that I was brought to childhood when I had first seen it.The best cinematic experience of my life and a perfect gift to all Top Gun fans.

This film is one of those rare cases where the sequel destroys the original movie. It's an action packed experience that pays tribute to the original one and leaves viewers on the edge of their seat. It desserves all the love that's coming its way. Great balls of fire!

This is one of those rare films: a sequel that completely eclipses the original in just about every possible way (the Lady Gaga track is instantly forgettable... that's about as negative a comment as I can make about this film).Honestly, I expected a competent average action film which these days is really the best you can reasonably hope for in the era of incessant wokeness and overblown CGI visuals. Instead we somehow, against all the odds, got this: an unashamedly patriotic, unreservedly touching, mostly practically-filmed 2 hours of jets, pilots, sheer awesomeness, and a very light sprinkling of nostalgia for flavour.Easily the best film of the year for me. And for that matter, this decade to date.

Edge of seat not just because thrilling but nostalgic and gripping. Refreshing, yet classic. A perfect mix. It really was. The mission story was excellent. The ties to first one excellently written. I could go on and on. Very impressed.

Worth waiting. Excellently scripted , well written characters. It is an enhanced movie in comparison with the first one. Personally i believe is the holy grail of all air fighting movies out now. It aroused me a lot of emotions and especially the feeling of bromance...One of the best parts was the fine communication between the pilots surpassing all the personal differences when needed. To close i have to say that if i learned something from this movie is to pursue our targets because the power of will let us surpass our biggest difficulties and obstacles. SOLID 9/10.

I go to the cinema regularly and you have those boring films you forget about as soon as you walk out the doors, but this film oml it was amazing i think it's the best film i've actually seen in years. I really do recommend to go watch it!!

Yes you are correct I am associating Top Gun Maverick with Pop Music, you know what you want, they know what you want and that is exactly what you get with Top Gun Maverick and more. Maverick is the perfect character that everyone outspokenly wishes to be and they make this dream come true throughout. I love how they create it for the general working class, Maverick has a simple perception of life, while still having the need the need for speed. Rules, where Mavericks going he needs no rules, always fighting the man, and usually out playing them. While the story is quite simple it definitely does not skimp out on the complex emotions, one minute you will find your eyes tearing up, next minute you,re fist pumping the air in excitement!! If you love movies well this movies will leave you full to the brim for at least a week, obviously you get triple dessert. Go on watch this movie you know you want to, its fantastic.

reviews.review_title: Bruckheimer misjudged the allegiance of his audience
reviews.content: I was a full on teenager when Top Gun landed in my universe. I am that Gen X'er who is forever devoted to my generation. I LOVE everything about the 80's! All that me a that I LOVED this movie but with my two star deduction I want to send a message to Jerry Bruckheimer to get off his ass and his ego and welcome the voices and figures from 1986 that made this an amazing movie. How do you not invite such incredible characters like. Michael Ironsides, Tom Skerritt, Rick Rossovich, Kelly. McGillis, Meg Ryan (for God sake!), Tim Robbins! (are you kidding me? Where's the question? Write the check). Bruckheimer ruined what this movie could have been!Well done to Tom Cruise, Val Kilmer and the others who fought for what this movie could be.

reviews.review_title: Nostalgia beyond even the first top gun
reviews.content: I have to admit I shed a couple of small tears when Dangerzone kicked in, possibly for my own Gooses who are no longer with me.The mission briefing had me like 'oh wait, so TGM is just Star Wars for jocks??' But the fact that they briefly acknowledged this bought a warm chuckle.The dogfighting was ridiculest, so good and genuine mouth sick vertigo on the crucial part of the mission.

Taking me back in time and making me smile.This is the best movie I have seen in many years.Thank you Tom Cruise and the rest of the team for, making a perfect sequel to one of my favorite movies of my youth.

Can't wait to show my whole family. This was so much fun. It was just fun and fast and cheesy but in a good way. Everyone was hot and the music was nice.Lady gaga song was a let down but still got some of the original soundtracks.Had fun, would and will see again.

reviews.review_title: Great movie , more 80's 90's nostalgic ( in a good way ) than i expected
reviews.content: After the success of Original Top Gun 1986 , there.were a few other Military Fighter pilot films . Like Iron Eagle (1986) ,Into the Sun (1991) .
