They were OK for smaller budget film for the 80's and 90's period .Top Gun Maverick , the final 1/4 of the film , the story and plot element reminds me of the "Iron Eagle" and "Into the Sun" . All the nostalgic feeling of watching 80's and 90's fighter Pilot films .The Covid delayed the release for more than 2 yr , i is worth the wait .

It's everything you expect and not expect and respectfully... one hell of a supersonic ride.I enjoyed everything about it. It brought back a sense of American Pride I thought I lost. I loved watching it with the veterans and seeing how much they enjoyed it as well.Talk to me Goose.

If they had sent 30 tomahawks missile to blow up the actual venue instead of blowing up the airport runway, there probably wouldn't be a story that would need to make a movie like this. Lots of illogical old-fashioned story. The movie is overrated. It's time for Tom Cruise to retire.-If they had sent 30 tomahawks missile to blow up the actual venue instead of blowing up the airport runway, there probably wouldn't be a story that would need to make a movie like this. Lots of illogical old-fashioned story. The movie is overrated. It's time for Tom Cruise to retire.-If they had sent 30 tomahawks missile to blow up the actual venue instead of blowing up the airport runway, there probably wouldn't be a story that would need to make a movie like this. Lots of illogical old-fashioned story. The movie is overrated. It's time for Tom Cruise to retire.

A boring and uninteresting plot, I couldn't wait for the movie to end! If I wasn't watching it in the cinema, I wouldn't bother finishing itI didn't watch the trailer so I went in with no expectations, yet it flopped so badly in my eyes. They have a talented cast but I think it's the story that let this movie down. Tom Cruise is a great actor and I am aware that he trained hard to prep for this movie so kudos to him. There were a few great scenes/stunts hence the 4-stars but some of the acting was so cringey that I had to look away. Won't bother watching any of the other top gun movies after seeing this.

reviews.review_title: 1986 Top Gun was good. This one is much much better.
reviews.content: I really liked the first Top Gun movie. But then after I watched this Top Gun: Maverick, I re-watch the first one and find it not so special anymore.Top Gun: Maverick makes us feel the real fighter pilot experience, which we won't get if Tom Cruise only used green screen like other movie production.

Firstly if you haven't seen the first part, you should. Secondly, this movie is really great, the way they have made the transition between the 1st and the 2nd part is so smooth, how all the events are perfectly combined, without talking about the flying scenes which are magic. Definitely a MASTERPIECE.

I'll keep it short and simple; This sequel to the 1986 Top Gun is just as good, if not better than the original. It has everything you could ask for in a modern action movie without making it cringy or unrealistic. If you can, see it in IMAX format to truly get the full experience that will leave you on the edge of your seat all the way through the final act.

Right from the start to the finish, the movie keeps you glued to the screen and there is no moment where you would feel bored. It is entertaining, gripping and full of suspense. The flight sequence is such that it feels as though we are there on the fighter jets maneuvering it to complete a mission. One feels that way because the flight scenes looks so real and TC has made it to perfection. Have seen a good movie after a long long time. TC never disappoints.

Tom Cruise did a fantastic job in his return as Maverick. In an era of reboots this is best one as of late. He brings a team of young actors with incredible chemistry to a movie about teamwork and trusting your neighbor. Excellent movie. It has this classic 80s charm mixed with everything that the modern era of moviegoers will appreciate. This movie's practical effect is that the actor was in the planes so that you could see the G's on their faces, making this a truly unique experience. I would recommend this movie to anyone who loves a fun time and enjoys it.

The only thing that was not completely obvious in the plot for me was the amount of cringe I was about to see.I spent the majority of the movie cringing/face-palming because of the totally unrealistic, over-exaggerated plot and overall vibe, and the completely shallow characters.For the whole thing, half an hour would have been enough, so they basically did a short story over and over and over again.And ofcourse the heroes had !multiple! Clearly deadly incidents which they all magically survived.

Finally after 36 years, a perfect sequel is here. Perfect story, casting, direction and as always perfect Tom Cruise.A worth watch on big screen. An Amazing experience !!! A worth wait !!! A Must Watch !!!

Considering the original Top Gun took military aviation films to a whole new level. Where does Top Gun 2 take you it goes above and beyond once again. The flying sequences with the use of imax cinema cameras is breathtaking. My only criticism relates to the film without action sequences. Could the backgrounds of the other characters in the film been established better and the chemistry between them. Looking forward to seeing in imax. I feel the need for speed.

Our Maverick is coming back. I've never met such a fantastic movie. I enjoyed the amazing story and real flight experience! The story isn't only the pilots, it's including love of family and the aircraft, and strong bonds. You must cry at least three times.
From the opening shots to the end my eyes were glued to the screen. Not one dull moment, PURE EXHILARATION! We need more movies like this!I'm watching this one in the cinema at least one more time!

36 year of wait and Tom cruise smashed it. Everyone's taste of everything will be different off course but my opinion there is now 2 sequel is better then 1st movie terminator and top gun maverick. If you haven't seen 1986 classic top gun I advice you to watch it before you go to see top gun maverick.

reviews.review_title: Tom Cruise continues his one man mission to save blockbuster cinema
reviews.content: I'm sure people could wax lyrical about Tom Cruise being such a divisive character on and off screen. But what you cannot deny is his love for movies, the blockbuster specifically.I'm sure most people turned their nose up when he announced a sequel to a, let's face it, average 80's movie that lives through nostalgia and when the Pandemic hit and the film saw multiple delays I'm sure people were expecting the worst.What did we get? A hell of a blockbuster ride that took us back to the glory days of cinema excess but wrapped in a surprisingly tight plot, small on scale but big on action and character moments. You had a grown up Maverick.It's exactly what the world needed at the right time, pure escapism with great acting from a mixture of veterans and newcomers. There's not too much you really need to say about this movie other than it's a great time at the movies. Grab some popcorn, sit back and enjoy as it spills over you.It's also really lovely to see Val Kilmer back in a touching scene and huge kudos to Tom Cruise to putting his foot down to make sure it happened. Val Kilmer is one of my favourite actors and it's a shame we don't get to hear his silky voice but he will always be my huckleberry.Tom Cruise.... you may love him, you may hate him, but as long as that man wants to keep the magic of cinema alive i'm coming along for the ride and feel the need.... the need for speed.

It was worth the wait for this masterpiece! I've always liked Miles Teller and the dedication Tom has for this really shows in the movie. It was great to see parts of South Lake Tahoe in the movie and how they made the airport into a military base with a blowout runway. And yes it was real, all of it. No CGI. Can't wait to watch it again!!

An amazing come back to the old classic that brings you back all the good memories. Very emotional with action, laughs and everything you need to stay still for a good movie. Tom Cruise as always brings his best out. Val Kilmer's scene was very emotional too hope he comes out strong, great actor.

reviews.review_title: Wow Americans are so cool, I wish I was American
reviews.content: Wow Americans are so cool, I wish I was American. 😁Since I got error message that ' your review is too short' I have to repeat my review a few times.Wow Americans are so cool, I wish I was American.Wow Americans are so cool, I wish I was American.Wow Americans are so cool, I wish I was American.

The stars are for the cool airplanes stuff. And the story is okay. Top Gun Maverick is nice popcorn movie entertainment and they managed to get that asskicking FU fighter spirit out of the box again. Refreshed it a little bit with new tech. Who loved the first one will be pleased with this too.The big problem is Tom Cruise. He did not have much of an impressing charisma back then (in all his movies I only see a guy trying hard to appear like a cool guy but failing) and he has lost the rest of it since. Many actors of the 80's have aged well and put on more character. Not him. He still looks and acts like a "bubi". But what can you expect from a guy who believes in that scientology crap.

I guess i have an unpopular opinion. If you just watch the last 90 minutes and the final fight scene, it's a solid 9. All the other stuff is painfully cheesy. Way too many close-ups of Tom Cruise and him smiling at everyone. It was painfully predictable. No surprise, but it had a superficial romance angle. I hope they didn't pay a lot for the script!

reviews.review_title: Recycled and Star Wars rip off
reviews.content: Built on too many scenes from original movie. And what's with the Star Wars rip off flying as fast as possible through a ravine to no bomb 3 meter target? Was waiting for luke skywalker to swoop in.

Amazing movie.......saw Top Gun First part 4 Times and Maverick 2022 was quite a sequel. I would highly recommend to watch it with 4K video format on a big screen. Don't watch if you are not having a good print.

reviews.review_title: Good film, but it's a typical pop-corn film
reviews.content:
Pros : 1. Things from the original story line 2. Good mix of fresh blood and old-timers 3. Huge cinematic improvements- flying scenes etc 4. Tom Cruise
Cons: 1. Pretty much predictable 2 They used too much of a nostalgia 3. Too much of a what people wantOverall: Fast & Furios with pilots.

Iam really sad because the movie ended i hope to continue many hours more. The best movie this year until now. Unexpected events, you will laugh and angry and nervous and sad and wanna cry and afraid. The movie really achieved the impossible equation.

I find it borderline offensive that reviews on here state this surpasses Top Gun.For one, approx 30% of this film IS the original. Be it ripped camera shots or just straight lifting of lines, but not done with any class.It's cliche upon cliche but without the shine of the original.I will state unashamedly that the original is one of my personal favourite films.Clearly I have a bias but this is a good example of what's wrong with the creative drive of Hollywood in the last few years, a shame as I enjoyed Oblivion (a prior actor/director combo).If this is the script they had waited for for 30yrs, God help the film industry.

Good not bad but the sound is so high please any one ho wants to see top gun need to have very good ears . And the story is not that good it needs more and the action is not that much for tom cruise still the drama is very good in the film and some clips will let you cry.

Top Gun Macerick is everything you could possibly hope for. The action is amazing, Tom Cruise bringing an exellent performance as mentor/teacher role. This movie compared to its prodessor has better planr action because there actually doing the plane stunts(for the most part). The music while not fully beating the original top gun soundtrack is still amazing. There is two pilots one black one female who I feel I did not get enough time with, I really liked there performances and feel they could have really brought more to the role if given the chance. What this movie does that other films hqve failed at is depending on nostalgia. This movie does use it but to the films advantage instead of making the nostalgia the whole film. 10/10 Go see now sefinitley worth the watch.

reviews.review_title: truly one of the best movies of all time
reviews.content: Such an amazing film. I was scared it would ruin the first movie as a sequel but it was seriously the best sequel i've ever seen. The cast was amazing and it kept you off your seat the whole time!! I cried and laughed and got super nervous!! All the emotions that a film should bring !!! A++++ worth more than 10 stars !!

Warning, do not wait to watch this on a TV at home or on some dodgy stick with a terrible copy! You have to experience this at a cinema. Granted my local cinema is in a small town if Fife, Scotland and probably not close to an odeon in terms of audio or visuals, but jeeso does this movie still pop and some!As a 42 year old father with 2 boys at an age where I first experienced the original top gun, I was keen for them to see this. I had to convince them to watch the original yesterday and they were underwhelmed in all honesty. Not enough 'CGI' was my youngest son's comment 🙄....how that changed after top gun:maverick 😉For a 14 & 20 year old to leave the cinema buzzing at the real pilot acting and script motive moving through this movie made me emotional. It was awesome to see their reaction to this but at the end of the day I definitely enjoyed it that little bit more because I loved through the original years 😁Outstanding from Cruise.

reviews.review_title: They should have made a 3D version.
reviews.content: The movie is good but I'm giving it a 5 because they failed to do a 3D version which is the only valid reason to see it in theaters rather than at home. In my opinion, you should wait to see it at home since the theater version doesn't provide any added value.
Exceeded all my expectations! This is how sequels should be done. Great storyline that fit so well into the original. Thoughts and prayers for Ice. No need for a third.
One of the best I've ever watched . The action, the drama, the thrill, the emotions are unparalleled! I was never bored for a single second of this movie.. A COMPLETE MUST-SEE CLASSIC.

More than just a great movie. It is different from your typical military and war movies because this one doesn't juxtapose America against a particular nation. Yes, it's American, but it doesn't make a statement about America being better, just that America kicks ass. If there is a message here at all, it is that we need a "maverick." Someone who pushes limits, isn't afraid to take a risk and most importantly, values life over results.

reviews.review_title: An Adventure that Stimulates an Elevated Exciting Hollywood Blockbuster Feeling
reviews.content: An Adventure that Stimulates an Elevated Exciting Hollywood Blockbuster FeelingNava Medikonda : 3.5/5Top Gun: Maverick a sequel to the Original "Top Gun" film gives an audience exactly what people waited too see. 36 Years later, a second instalment to the Top Gun name entertains Flying, Action, Drama, and Romance. Tom Cruise's 46th Film is an Action Packed, promising delivered Hollywood Blockbuster awaiting to be seen from an audience on the big silver screen.Achieving what Top Gun: Maverick finalized is an extraordinary feeling. The Story carries itself with a calm opening staring Tom Cruise, and a trip down memory lane through portraits on a wall of Goose and his family from the first "Top Gun" Film. We are immediately introduced to the score as well as the personality of Maverick himself. After many years, Maverick still seems to be dedicated to flying, and going against commands just like his younger confident/reckless self.A new series of younger cast members is sweet, and faultlessly introduced. We meet a good chunk of prior Top Gun Academy graduates at Penny's Bar, exploring only a few piolets that have the chance to fly in a mission more complicated than any other mission Maverick has flown.Monica Barbaro playing Lt. Natasha 'Phoenix' Trace is the only female Top Gun Academy Graduate in recent years according to the film's cast and story. She brings a fresh satisfying performance, and perfectly shares the correct chemistry with the cast. Since she is one of the "more talented" piolets as introduced in her first flying exercise with Maverick, we get to know that her, as well as all the other piolets are very ambitious, and ready to impress even though it seems harder than expected.The films story is noticeably dull after act I, and easily identifiable during act II. Director Joseph Kosinski does a decent job trying to keep the audience hooked, as well as Claudio Miranda with the Shots, but the Top Gun franchise already having a specific theme and mood set, its harder to identify specific director elements since its a franchise film.The Shots in Top Gun: Maverick are beautifully crafted. The Cinematography from Oscar Winner Claudio Miranda does not disappoint with the use of interesting angles giving us an exact perspective of how the characters feel and certain times. The Lighting and Jet Shots are equally as interesting to watch.For a film in 2022, Top Gun: Maverick is easily one of the better pieces of Film shot using a Digital Camera (Sony VENICE) still delivering a natural movie look. Although the film started out interesting, and became dull, but later retained the audience based on the more interesting side of the plot, and the exciting score, Top Gun: Maverick was not entirely a bad film, but extremally pleasing for a sequel that has nearly took 4 decades to produce.

Apart from the last 30 minutes this film didn't live up to expectations. TG-M had so much potential, particularly with the political backdrop and the prospect of nuclear conflict but the director focussed more on individuals and personal relationships. This film was I'm guessing aimed at a younger. More woke audience and for chick-flick fans. Very touchy feely in parts. Top Gun with its all-star cast and rip-roaring soundtrack was far superior to this nonsense. The critical acclaim is all out of proportion so I give it 3/10.
I do not have words to describe the feeling of watching this icon. This movie brought us back to the golden age and the addition of Tom Cruise is the legendary Tom Cruise.

I have been fan of old top gun movie and this sequel is just mind blowing.I feel like this movie has topped in the Hollywood industry and there cannot be better movie than this. Every scene , every stunt is perfect in all angles.Hats off to @tom cruise , director and all cast members. Great respect to all of them
All movies of tom cruise are amazing. Thank you tom...for giving this experience.

Very entertains, even if it's a bit unrealistic. Tom Cruise would have died in the very first scene if this was real life. He's like a cat with nine lives in this movie, but hey that's what movies like this are for. Sequels can be tricky, because the new cast is almost never as good as the old cast. The younger characters were lovable enough to make it work. I almost wish there would have been more plot geared toward the dynamic of the younger cast. There was almost too much of Tom Cruise.

reviews.review_title: Created a IMDB account just to rate this film 10 stars
reviews.content: An absolute delight. This movie captures you from the start to end. In an age of superheroes and unrealistic action movies, top gun proves you don't need that to make a successful movie. Watch in theaters only!!!

reviews.review_title: One Million Times Better than the original
reviews.content:
While I was not a fan of the original Top Gun, Top Gun:Maverick brought everything that was great about the first one and made it about a million times better to tell the story that I felt the first alway wanted to and could have told.Similar to the first one, the plot is nothing to write home and I actually think it is hurt in the plot department because of how incredibly similar it is to the first one. There is a little bit of a carbon copy sense but it doesn't make it any less enjoyable. It is still action packed and told much more logically than the first one
Plot:1.5/2The acting also took a major step up throughout this film as well. Cruise is better than he was in the Original and his playful banter with Teller makes for wonderful chemistry between the pair and I believe better chemistry than cruise had with Anthony Edwards in the first one. The side characters also get much more changes to shine and have memorable dialogue and storylines attached to them
Acting:1.5/2The biggest improvement between the first and the second one has to be the storytelling. It never felt like the original Top Gun had any sense of direction but this one there was a clear objection and a clear target from the beginning that guided the entirety of the movie and this main objective allowed for the characters and the storyline to build from it
Storytelling:1.75/2As stated previously, there are many things that this one takes from the original which doesn't at all make it bad. It just makes it a little bland at times. There's no major plot twists and nothing to get you out of your seat but the pure enjoyment the film brings makes up for it in so many ways
Creativity:1.5/2Just the original, this film benefits from the use of sound and I'm sure an in theater experience makes this movie quite a spectacle. However watching from my bedroom I still felt the intensity of the plane shots and it also utilizes camera work so much more effectively than that of the first one as many of the shots are outstanding and put the watcher in a place the original did not
Other Factors:1.75/2Overall, Top Gun Maverick was everything I thought the top gun franchise would be when I watched the first one. It had high action, good acting but also moments that made you think and showed true meaning of friendship and family. I understand why it was such a major hit
Overall:8/10.

We live in a world surrounded by more TV/movies than ever before.. I quite often find myself laboring through Netflix/prime trying to find a decent film to watch and usually failing. I sometimes think it's me, but then when you actually watch a decent film you realize the whole process has just been diluted. This film is epic.. in the way that films used to be epic. Just an all round fantastic cinematic experience that contained everything. It was fun! I think watching this film alone might make me go to the cinema again a bit more. Maybe the art of making blockbuster films isn't dead after all.

Well, the original "Top Gun" was 50% watching fighter planes, 25% sound track, and 25% charismatic young performers. That sound track holds up, and Tom Cruise's career has held up almost as well. No new stars are likely to blossom from "TG Maverick"; there are brief pleasant moments with the well-established Jennifer Connelly (although her pasted-in character is nothing more than a flimsy attempt to provide a real human life for Pete "Maverick" Mitchell), and Val Kilmer is all too plausible as an over-the-hill ex-hero. Not much else in the acting department--the movie is clearly 75% Tom Cruise. That leaves 25% for the flying this time and nothing for a forgettable sound track. Some viewers will miss Kelly McGillis and Meg Ryan; I miss Kenny Loggins and Berlin. Cruise himself has lost a lot of his early brash appeal, but the weathered version has his own appeal. That and the zooming jets are about all there is to carry a movie that just doesn't have much reason to be made.

reviews.review_title: Just A Great Movie Is Exactly What The World Needed
reviews.content:
Movies like this are why I fell in love with going to the theatre. A classic heros journey that is well written. You leave the theatre with a satisfied yet inspired feeling.I used to go to the theatre 1-2 times a month but after hollywood went woke around 2016 I only go to 1 movie a year.2018 -> Tomb Raider
2019 -> End Game
2020 -> Sonic
2021 -> Shang-Chi / Free Guy 2x
2022 -> Rise of Gru / Top GunI will totally be buying Top Gun Maverick on 4K because Tom Cruise is one of the few Hollywood actors that hasn't gone woke.

reviews.review_title: Liked being a kid again, Cruise at his best!
reviews.content: The action, the nostalgia and the cast were bang on.Absolutely loved it and can't actually wait to see it again.Cruise nails it and the actor playing Rooster is so like the character Goose.

Totally well-made. Miles Teller performance was lit!! Only one thing i can't keep in my guts, the "Love Story" wasn't a must.. at all. You don't have to stuff a cheap love story inside an excellent action movie just for the audience cinematic vibe. The movie was about teamwork, a suicidal mission. This kind of love stories are kinda cheesy nowadays. It blurred me out a little bit, looking for it was just a few scenes that won't ever affect the plot. All i say, you don't have to build a love story to achieve a good-written movie, the movie was perfect enough. I loved this movie quite much, maybe the best this year, but could have been legendary and historical by adding some spices!

There were a couple of extreme conveniences with impeccable timing or things that didn't get blown up, and the soundtrack wasn't on-par with the original, but those are the only hairs I can split.Tom Cruise may have given his best performance.Maverick perfectly blends nostalgia with original material, forging a mostly believable, emotional thrill-ride. From the opening scene to the credits, it was perfectly paced.I don't know if I'll ever give a movie a 10, but until I find that one movie this ranks in my top-20 all-time.

reviews.review_title: Normies give titles a false high rating
reviews.content: A rising number of bad films make their way to the top 250 since smartphones became popular. This phenomenon is linked to easy access to internet and normies rate bad films 10 stars, making the rating biased and falsely high. We have a case of this phenomenon here.

reviews.review_title: No CGI Finally ! Best movie of 2022
reviews.content: The story was classic 80s and there was no CGI which is mind blowing !!! The scenes were gripping and had me at the edge of my seat during the final mission. You are certain to enjoy this flick as the entire cast and action scenes will keep you engaged from start to finish.

I saw a lot of good reviews, so my expectations where quite high... and it did not disappoint at all. On the contrary, it's a real blockbuster masterpiece. The action, the special effects, soundtrack, the life messages on growing old, letting go, finding yourself, the connection with a real life drama of one of the main characters, the love story, the jokes, the twists... well, it's the full package. Bravo Tom.

reviews.review_title: If you don't see this movie, tjen you would have regret lifetime
reviews.content: This movie was amazing . No single VFX was used , all the stunts were real.. Trust me you won't get bored for a single of second.Its whole of action thriller.

This is thrilling, emotional, beautiful, stunning, and set in moral fundamentals, not the innate jingoism from the first film. It opens with the same scene, same song, same caption. In many ways this film is the same as its predecessor, but is so much better in so many ways. Cruise's performance has increased in emotional depth and perception. Provides all the thrilling action and intense dogfights as expected, but still is plenty of weighty subject matter.Spectacular film, couldn't have been better.

If you enjoyed the first, then you should see this one. It is really difficult to imagine a better sequel. They did such an amazing job. If you haven't seen the 1st, then watch it, then see this one. I think this one is the better movie overall, especially if you are able to remove nostalgia (or maybe it's because of it). If you don't enjoy the 1st one, you're probably not the target market for this one either. Also, likely a different generation than I am. I'm looking forward to seeing this again. Expect a Top Gun movie and you will get a Top Gun movie at it's best.

A thrilling and moving movie that everyone should watch! Gorgeous cinematography, insane flying action sequences, thrilling, emotionally moving, and a sequel that absolutely surpasses its predecessor. Well-paced, executed & has that re-watchability factor. There's so much great action, incredible stunts, big laughs, and emotional moments that really send the viewer on a journey, which is exactly why we go to the movies. The film is lovingly dedicated to the late Tony Scott, who directed "Top Gun." and they were able to give justice to it! Salute!The opening text mentions how in 1969, the U. S. Navy established a school for fighter pilots. It is officially referred to as Fighter Weapons School, but the recruits call it "Top Gun". We see several recruits and Navy men on the ships where the pilots take off or make their returns.Captain Pete "Maverick" Mitchell (Tom Cruise) rides his motorcycle to a base where he is set for a scramjet flight demonstration, but he is told that Rear Admiral Chester "Hammer" Cain (Ed Harris) is on his way to shut the program down to redirect funds elsewhere. Not feeling deterred, Maverick takes the jet just as Cain arrives, and he flies it into the sky, taking it past its original Mach 9 projection and hitting Mach 10, to the delight of the crew. However, Maverick tries to take it faster and ends up wrecking the jet, but he manages to eject in time.Cain chews Maverick out for his actions, but while he wants to have Maverick grounded, Cain instead informs him that he has been called back to NAS North Island by his former rival/colleague, Admiral Tom "Iceman" Kazansky (Val Kilmer). Maverick heads to the base to meet Vice Admiral Beau "Cyclone" Simpson (Jon Hamm) and Rear Admiral Solomon "Warlock" Bates (Charles Parnell). Cyclone makes it clear that he doesn't see in Maverick whatever Ice sees in him, but he informs Maverick of the task at hand. A rogue nation is operation a uranium facility, and Maverick must teach a new group of recruits to find a way to make it to the base and bomb it.Maverick goes to a bar where he reunites with Penny Benjamin (Jennifer Connelly), an ex-girlfriend that he left a while ago, which pissed off her admiral father. She bears no ill will toward Maverick, but she ends up making him pay a round for everyone at the bar. At the same bar, the new class of pilots are there to drink. Among them is hotshot Jake "Hangman" Seresin (Glen Powell), who sees himself as the most likely to lead the new class. There is also Natasha "Phoenix" Trace (Monica Barbaro), Robert "Bob" Floyd (Lewis Pullman), Reuben "Payback" Fitch (Jay Ellis), and Mickey "Fanboy" Garcia (Danny Ramirez). Entering moments later is Bradley "Rooster" Bradshaw (Miles Teller), son of Maverick's late best friend Goose. After Maverick's card declines, Penny has Hangman and Payback playfully throw Maverick out. Outside, Maverick watches Rooster playing the piano and is reminded of Goose, but Maverick still feels guilt over Goose's death.Maverick later meets with the pilots to introduce himself and go over the mission. Since the facility is located deep at the bottom of a canyon, Maverick's plan to take it out involves having two jets destroy the entrance to the facility before hitting the base itself. Some of the pilots aren't onboard, like Hangman. Rooster resents Maverick because he pulled Rooster's application and set his career back by four years. Maverick then goes on with the dogfight exercises with the pilots, showing off his skills to mess with the younger crew. The pilots that fail their exercises are forced to do push-ups. Later on, Hangman discovers Rooster's connection to Maverick.Maverick goes back to the bar to pay Penny back what he owes her. He then spends the afternoon on her boat with her, and there is clearly still a spark between them.In the next round of exercises, Maverick explains to the pilots about how they may lose oxygen and consciousness if they fly too high, reminded them of how high and low they will need to go when they carry out their mission. During the exercise, Rooster is shown to utilize a more cautious approach in his flying. Hangman brings up Maverick's friendship with Goose, which provokes Rooster into nearly attacking Hangman, but the other pilots split them up.Ice requests Maverick go visit him. He is suffering from throat cancer and can mainly communicate through a computer. Maverick expresses his concern over working with Rooster, fearing that something will happen to him like with Goose. Ice tells him he must work closely with Rooster, and he manages to speak to Maverick and tell him that the young pilots need him more than he realizes.Cyclone steps out onto the runway to find that nobody is there. He finds that Maverick brought the pilots over to the beach to play volleyball as a bonding exercise, which appears to work since they are all having fun. Maverick later goes out with Penny and tells her that he pulled Rooster's application because his mother asked Maverick to look after him before she passed away.The pilots then undergo a training exercise to strike the target at a certain altitude and in a certain amount of time. Everyone fails to complete the task as needed, with Phoenix needing to eject before her jet crashes. Maverick chastises Rooster for how he handles his exercise, leading to them arguing over Maverick hindering Rooster's flying career. They are interrupted when Warlock comes in to inform them that Ice has died. A funeral is held for him days later, with Maverick, Penny, and the other pilots in attendance.Cyclone decides to take over instructional duties from Maverick. When he proposes an alternative plan, the other pilots seem to question him. Outside, the radars detect Maverick flying his jet to complete the exercise, where he is able to fire at the target on the ground with seconds to spare, impressing all the pilots, including Hangman.The mission is carried out, with Maverick picking Rooster as his wingman, and being joined by Hangman, Phoenix, Fanboy, Payback, and Bob. They fly toward the facility, with their nearby aircraft carrier firing Tomahawk missiles at the base to destroy the runway, causing enemy jets to scramble back toward the target. They manage to launch a missile and destroy the facility, but the enemy sends more pilots after them. The pilots start to fly back, but Maverick's jet is shot at, causing him to crash.Rooster turns around and goes to save Maverick. A chopper begins firing at Maverick while he is on foot, but Rooster shoots it down, just before his own jet is shot down, but he manages to eject himself in time. Maverick and Rooster reunite and devise a plan to get out of there. They spot an F-14 Tomcat and take control of it. They start to fly away and are pursued by enemy jets, leading to a dogfight. Although Maverick manages to take two of them out with bullets and flares, they run out of weaponry just as a third jet comes their way. Rooster is also unable to eject himself, so the two accept that they are about to die until Hangman comes through and destroys the last jet.Maverick and Rooster make it back to the carrier, where their crew congratulates them. Rooster and Hangman have a newfound respect for one another, while Rooster looks at Maverick the same way his father looked at him.Rooster helps Maverick work on a P-51 Mustang in Maverick's hangar. Penny shows up, and Maverick takes her for a flight in his plane. Rooster sets down a photo of himself and Maverick right next to an older photo of Maverick and Goose.

Amazingly enjoyable, a true action film of an increasingly rare kind. The visuals are great and they embraced the inevitable desire to indulge in a spot of nostalgia from time to time. Having loved the original from childhood, this did not disappoint!

I think the simplest way to go about reviewing this movie is this:
Fans of the original will absolutely love the sequel and people who disliked the original will dislike the sequel. The movie has all the same quips and drama (with plenty of frame-for-frame 'homages'), worse soundtracks, better character arc for Cruise and better secondary plots (in particular given Val Kilmer's health).That's it. A great sequel to a great original or a terrible sequel to a terrible original, depending on your tastes.
Not much of a story apart from redemption. Only for a trip down nostalgia lane. Unnecessary love interest. Unnecessary sailing scene. Unnecessary full stop.

reviews.review_title: "Top Gun: A Perfect 10/10 Must-See for Fans of the Original and Newcomers Alike!"
reviews.content: Top Gun is an absolute must-see for fans of the original and for those who have never seen it before. Directed by Joseph Kosinski, Top Gun honors the original while delivering an exciting and thrilling action-packed story with a compelling and emotional story. Tom Cruise proves once again why he is the most popular movie star alive today, and Miles Teller and Jennifer Connelly are perfectly cast in the lead roles. The stunts, visuals, V/SFX, and camera work are breathtaking and make you feel like you're in the cockpit of a jet. The soundtrack and score add to the intensity of the action and the 131 minute runtime flies by. The dogfights are real and not CGI, making the film even more impressive. This is a perfect 10/10 must-see for all fans of the original and for those who have never seen it before. It's an absolute must-watch that will leave you amazed and entertained.

Definitely Remember to make time for the action and marvelous action packed fighter aircraft sequel. During the beginning allow yourself to get familiar with each character and try not to ask yourself how is this movie going to be better than the first one.? Give the movie a chance to develop and then at the end make a decision about the impact it makes. Whenever possible, try to see the incredible amazing stunts and aircraft maneuvers that will only allow your imagination to flourish. Even though some of the scenes will keep you at the edge of your seat its incredibly realistic. Of course , these men flew without any fear and it obviously showed the ability for true American aircraft pilots to reach excellence and it showed how they can train to be the best in the world .Not only does this movie make you feel good about the American Air Force it also makes you feel proud about the American Air Force. We can encourage our future generations to reach greatness and true greatness can be achieved and emphasize that with training and practice and education anyone can become the best pilots in American world history. This movie showed the importance and the characteristic of having close relationship with the ones you spend time with training and showed how you can become the best . Humans work best when they have a team with plenty of training to reduce any errors and the movie showed the skill and education to fly a plane has purpose and the purpose is to become a better pilot and this interesting set of pilots ability to become the best comes with the ability to remain tactful and relaxed and precise and calm during their maneuvers. Truly believe that this movie will remind the younger generation that they can accomplish anything that they want if they place enough attention and whenever you try to break a new record you can expect America will come through. If it all possible one day we will have aircraft that will be able to accelerate and perhaps even have less propulsion and I would assume when America does reach that stage they still will need good trained responsible pilots conquering and becoming better. Another useful suggestion is to order your delicious popcorn and Diet Coke.

reviews.review_title: It's like a parody of a parody!
reviews.content: I can't take this story seriously and can't believe the actors were when they spoke these cheesy lines. It just seems like a episode of Tim and Eric or Trey and Matt from South Park. Just a paint by numbers cliche. I understand it was created to be a sure thing, nothing more than a nostalgia trip for those who loved the original. Hang in there, hang in there? Tom Cruise constantly talking to himself in the cockpit is worth the laughs. The cast are talented and have really shown their talent in other films and shows. But this film short changes the actors. The script couldn't be more trite and simplistic. It's just a commercial for Navy recruiters.

To fully enjoy this movie you need to have watched the original and lived a life in between! Don't miss an an opportunity to see this on the big screen. Brilliant fun.Tune up the volume enjoy the nostalgia, perfect!

reviews.review_title: Amazing if you even slightly enjoy the original
reviews.content: The special fx are amazing, especially in theatre. Pays tribute to the original while not overly relying on fan-service. If you even slightly enjoyed the original you will love this film. Dare I say... it is even better than the original? No political nonsense in this film in the form of woke politics at least. Just amazing visuals with a good story built on from the original. All I can say is if you like the original you will love this film. If you hated the original you might enjoy the visuals but not like the story.. but if your going to see a military based movie I'd assume you know the common tropes. Even the common tropes of military action films are done extremely well in this movie.

Top Gun Maverick starts like a sequel 36 years later should start like. The first incoming scenes, the sound even the movie fonts are perferct. By the way, the fonts are from the original.What then happens is exactly what should happen: Maverick is one of the last "best of the best" pilots and is being asked to help the Navy for a delicate mission. I'll stop here in order to prevent spoilers.The movie has a solid storytelling, the characters are well chosen and Tom Cruise, you know, is Maverick. The transition from the old to the new Top Gun era is spot on.And then there's the powerfull air-combat scenes which I honestly didn't expect to be that good. The merge between real flight scenes and CGI is simply brillant. As viewer you have no idea what was filmed in the air what's produced by the computer.Also, there's the right amount of homage to the spirit from the original and its characters like Iceman or Goose obviously. Even though at some point things get a bit sentimental, there's also always a portion of humour in it.I gotta say, I loved Top Gun - Maverick and think it's very worthy sequel. Congrats to Tom Cruise and everyone involved in this project.

reviews.review_title: It's time to take off the nostalgia goggles.
reviews.content: Top Gun Maverick is a movie that has been praised full heartedly by cinema goers, but what garners this praise and admiration for the film? The answer to that question is nostalgia, nostalgia for the original film.Now, as someone who has never seen the the first Top Gun, this nostalgia spell has not been cast upon me as a viewer, therefore, not obscuring my judgement, as a result, I went into this film with neutral expectations. So without entering the theater with rose tinted glasses, how was my experience? Quite frankly, the film was mediocre and at most times boring, the reason for this is the writing and cliche tropes that we've seen hundreds of times, particularly from cinema of the past. Tom Cruise's character, Maverick, is the skillful older character who is "Out of the game" but forced back in by a desperate situation, his task being to train top aviators, in doing this, Maverick becomes 'The reluctant hero'. The trainees are also cliches, they are "the best at what they do", and consist of 'Hangman' the talented jerk, 'Rooster' the brash secondary main character with a history to Maverick and son to his dead friend, 'Goose', finally, there is 'Phoenix', "the badass chick" along with other less notable characters. Other typical characters are Jon Hamm's 'Cyclone', the hard to win over authority figure and lastly, Penny, the old fling and love interest to Maverick.With all the information regarding the characters, the film goes pretty much exactly how you would expect it to, no twists, characters fulfilling their expected roles, it feels as though I have seen this film so many times because how many movies follow it's generic structure, with the film almost having nothing unique about it.Despite my criticisms of the movie, it does have one slight saving grace, that is perhaps it's USP and by far the best aspect. This one great ingredient of course has to be the visuals of the fighter jets, the action sequences and intense scenes involving jets. The feeling is visceral and small details like the Gs acting on the face of the pilots gives a realistic and an immersive feeling towards the scenes. One reason for the scenes being so great is the choice to use real US army jets, this being the instrumental for the realism and perhaps why many scenes involving jets can really be felt and captured the awe of movie lovers, particularly those that love action movies.Regardless of how great the facets of the films involving jets are, the rest of the film is mostly as dull as dishwater. Top Gun: Maverick is just a film with a few good scenes surrounded by drab and boring ones and there is nothing to be done to save this mediocre script from not being slightly below average. I understand that this is, in many ways, an homage to 1980s cinema, however, it just feels like any other American military film. This film is not good, it just reminds people of something they like, distorting the actual image it's projecting.

This movie is incredible, when i saw manipulation in air with planes i was like i want see same thing when they make robotech movie and tom cruise like roy caracter. Anyway, not to go off topic, but this movie should and maybe will put standards how not to use CGI non stop and actualy do a real thing. There is some scenes that acctualy put me in how the hell did they shoot this. Remarkable.

This film draws deep from the well of cinematic greatness. Astounding visuals accompanied by amazing sound.Must been seen at the imax or cinema. This film reminded me that the sheer thrill of edge of your seat blockbuster action cannot be achieved as well with cgi.Difficult to see how this film can be beaten for action in the future as an actor like Tom Cruise delivering the results in this film is the stuff of legends.Just don't think, stop reading this and go, now!

Great movie 10/10. Good story and characters. Good character development and good actors. Very funny I loved it very much. Go watch this movie if you can , it's very good for all ages and stuff. Idk what else to write tbh cuz I need 150 characters. Tom cruise is very hot too so 10/10 for me today personally. Also miles teller is also very hot.

reviews.review_title: Everything Topgun was more. Missed the TG OST
reviews.content: Topgun Maverick. From Dangerzone, to the Fighter Flip, to the iconic Runway Ride, everything about Maverick is what Topgun was only upgraded and more commercialized and feel good movie which it has perfected. The dog fights, the plane details, the explosions, everything is enhanced and shows how far the technology has come. Loved every minute of it. Noted geeks will identify that the main mission is a tribute to Starwars Deathstar attack but still immaculately pulled of. Kept waiting for Might Wings, Hot Summer Nights and Take my Breath away but guess Topgun OST will remain my all time favorite. Already thinking of watching again.

Well, I read that Tom Cruise said he did this movie for all the Top Gun fans and I am sure they will be super happy with this 2nd movie.I was dragged to the cinema by 2 Top Gun fans and I must say the movie delivers what you expect. Great action and still a non-aging. Super fit Tom Cruise! Of course, the plot is simple and the baddies always the same ones... I still think the first one was better, even though the special effects are much better in this second movie.I give a 8/10 as to be honest, a good action movie is good entertainment but it clearly lacks of depth and reflection or even emotion to make it a 9 or a 10...
Your brain will be at rest for 2hours, which is also good sometimes!A great movie, mostly for guys!

reviews.review_title: The greatest movie i have ever seen
reviews.content: When maverick and rooster return to the base and are congratulated, it was so amazing to watch, the explosion effects look so real too. 10/10 the greatest movie i have ever seen!

reviews.review_title: Full of American stereotypes / punchlines and too far over the top
reviews.content: So full of stereotypes and one-liners. Too much over the top acting which impedes any proper storyline to be discovered in this movie. Even though the original Top Gun was a good movie, this movie doesn't meet any of the expectations. Tom Cruise does do right to his reputation with a a performance of at best average acting. It feels a like a US propaganda movie from the very first second of the movie and it does not change to the last second. For US army movie enthusiasts this could be a comfortable casual watch but for anyone looking for a deeper storyline than that this is probably not the best choice.

For the soundtrack, for the nostalgia, for Maverick getting back in the saddle this as fantastic and best watched in the big screen with the big sound. For the story though, take Star Wars and it's trench, swap X-wings for f-15's and you may as well have James Earl Jones voicing a bad guy. I expected better.

This is how Hollywood should make movies. From beginning to end I was hooked. The acting, script, graphics, EVERYTHING was fantastic. I loved how the integrated the first movie to this one. Going into the movie I heard it was great and it blew past my expectations. They kept it clean and didn't have to add any unnecessary stuff to the film. The movie had a great balance from drama to action. This movie made me feel good about America again. A much needed boost with how a lot of the country feels about America. I actually threw my fist in the like my team won the super bowl lol. I would recommend this movie for any age. Great job on the movie!🇺🇸

reviews.review_title: Did not expect to like it this much...
reviews.content: I have to be honest. Im 41 and did not watch Top Gun back in the old this. Still don't know why.So... I watched this with no reference. And not being a fan of Tom Cruise. I have always been annoyed a bit by him.But man I love this movie. I have watched this about 10 times. It has the action, the effects, the stories. Due to my age I can identify myself with maverick. Friends who died. Friend with cancer. An old love that is now taking more seriously due to the realizations you get at this age.And then Tom his part in this movie. Not the typical hero we often see from him. He is real. Vulnerable but not in a tok obvious way. Great acting.I absolutely love this movie and it touches every time I watch again.Why not a 10/10. It's a bit because of Penny. I thing her part is a tiny bit annoying. Might be personal preference only.But... I can see this movie many more times.

Honestly, I've been thinking about watching this movie for months.Tonight I decided to watch it, although I never saw the first part (I don't watch legendary movies) - but THIS is BIG.Equally good story and good drama, perfectly blended even without watching the first part and I'm sure this will be great.A parallel good story of his career and private life, and on top of all that, a great reminder of the great Vil Kilmer.Impressions after watching last for hours.Excellent, excellent, excellent production, great acting.The point of this commentar - no movie has ever left me with the impression that it was as "real" as this one.TOP.

Like many... I wasn't sure if this movie was going to be good!! I was pleasantly surprised!! The movie was just long enough to build a good story line and to not drag it out!! Them picking Miles to play rooster!!! Omg he was a baby goose!! I've already seen it twice and will probably add it to my movie collection!! It was worth all the hype!!
Amazing movie! Enjoyed it a lot as an aviation enthusiast. Much better than the old Top Gun movie. The second half of the movie was breathtaking and very dramatic!

reviews.review_title: A total roller coaster second half
reviews.content: Overall a worthy movie, action and direction is awesome, Maverick Tom cruise is gem to watch , action sequences are better than mission impossible keeps you at edge of seat for last one hour.

Great movie and lots of fun but Tom Cruise wrote himself in as Luke Skywalker. Too many references to add here but it became so laughable especially near the end. This could have been a movie telling the story of the training before the destruction of the death star mission. Right up to the 3 foot opening of the vent shaft at the end of a narrow corridor they need to fly through. I swear, in one scene as they were entering the canyon, they cgi'd an actual x-wing in for a few milliseconds as they were banking left. The "enemy" pilots even looked a lot like tie fighter pilots. Still, a good movie to watch but come on lmao.

reviews.review_title: Here is the formula now go make the movie
reviews.content: Maybe my expectations were too high. Not that they should have been as I am not a big fan of the first movie. Maybe I have been spoiled with good dialogue material from recent shows like breaking bad, saul, bosch, etc....maybe i have outgrown popcorn movies...but I still expected the action sequences to grt me to the edge of my seat..they did not.This movie simply never got me to buy in to the characters or the plot. Too many cringy scenes.

First i thought it might not be that great movie seeing the kind of movies are made nowadays...
But i am totally under the awe of the movie after watching it...It really touched me at a soul level...
It really touches the sensitive emotional cords of relations...Tom is as beautiful as ever in his acting and his Maverick character...Great teamwork of the characters and great direction...Movie is a really positive one with lesser negativity...More stronger on the positive notes in the story with the touch of negatives n challenges in the story...
Excellent camera work about the jet manuvers was the outstanding part of the movie...
The skyfull of action will keep ppl glued to their seats...The sequel seemed to outshine even the original one...One must not miss this movie...

reviews.review_title: Entertaining but shallow, the movie that wants you not to think and just watch
reviews.content: A classic brainless blockbuster for the summer.You know that the enemy helicopter is going to blow up right before it opens fire, you also know that the enemy plane is going to blow up right as it fires a missile. You know that there is no way that the two downed pilots are able to meet up and then immediately waltz their way through the snow and forested area to the enemy base (amazing luck how the base got to be so close to their landings, I know). It's like they just teleported there, borrowed a plane, had a nice dogfight and got back to the plane carrier just in time for some celebratory beer and hugs followed by your applause.

reviews.review_title: A high-flying supersonic summer blockbuster that goes higher than it's predecessor
reviews.content: Top Gun: Maverick is a sequel to it's ancient predecessor, Top Gun. As a sequel, you would think that the movie would be absolutely terrible. Since the first one was met with an ambush of mixed reviews, it would be logical to think that whatever Top Gun did, Maverick would do worse.However, Director Joseph Kosinski (Tron: Legacy, Oblivion) knocks it out of the park and into the air, just like his jets. Despite the amazing cinematography, the movie makes great improvement upon the first, outdoing (and possibly even outflying, if that's a word) whatever Top Gun did good.Definite recommend. Feel free to watch in IMAX if you wish.Final Rating: 8.5.

reviews.review_title: Too far into the Danger Zone
reviews.content:
Hi guys! Do not be fooled by the high ratings everybody .. yikes what are your standards?... this movie is no dark knight or Jurassic park(original). Godfather... or any other classic...by far.Come back to earth people you obviously let cruise fly you too far into the stratosphere.Right to it...here ya go.As advertised... this is what you get.Lots of plane go zoom.. plane go boom
Dont expect much more than that .Egos... check
Models pretending to be pilots ... check
Pointless laughable story ... check
Uninspiring writing .. check
Poor acting... check
Cool dogfight scenes... check
Now all systems are a go..
You are clear to launch..
Get ready... cruise can fly us straight into mediocrity!Add a whole cast of new lame actors playing egotistical pilots and this is what you have.. another self indulgent cruise film with no point. His
Hubris is beyond words. Turns out, about 20 minutes in, you realize, its just a testosterone fueled snooze fest..If you are a fan of the first one you get more of what you want in this..shirtless guys.. models..planes flying at high speed...so please.. enjoy. I feel pretty bad for anybody that finds this mind numbing film entertaining..If you didn't really care for the first one...don't bother guys.. nothing world changing here.. yawn..In fact, you may find yourself wondering why they even bothered making a sequel to such a mediocre movie in the first place. Like I did... why? Money... chaching...Cruise do us all a favor and drop off the face of Hollywood or the world ...your movies are boring and ridiculous...
please give someone else a chance to disappoint people with movies that have no substance.In a word... if you wanted a sequel to the silly first one, You got it with everything you wanted probably..
If you want some mildly entertaining action in a ridiculous cruise package.. got that too..like oh so many times before.Beyond that...if you want more substance you could watch ...Zoolander
. What a joke . Trust me on this.

reviews.review_title: Meh... didn't live up to the hype for me
reviews.content: For background purposes, I'm 45, so I'm definitely of the era where I appreciated the heck out of the first Top Gun and was REALLY LOOKING FORWARD TO THIS ONE. I think hearing all the hype, I was expecting more and was a bit disappointed. There were holes in the plot for me... i.e. Where was this base they were targeting? I won't spoil anything, but some of the conversations between Maverick and Jennifer Connelly's character had me scratching my head and thinking "huh?? What are they talking about? Did I miss a movie somewhere?" Just a weird dialogue and disconnected side plot. Also, and I LOVE Jennifer Connelly, all the way back to Labyrinth, but man, she overacted the heck out of this role. I didn't believe their attraction for a minute. She's beautiful, 100%. But the romantic scenes were sooooo cheeesy. They weren't necessary. At all. And, for background purposes, I'm female. So it's not like I don't like romantic flicks, but wow, I just wanted them to get back to the action. Haha. Which by the way, those flight scenes were awesome. Kicked butt. Totally made the movie. But the cheese could've been cut and they could've nixed her character completely and made it entirely an action flick and it would've been way better. I honestly felt like the overacting was the fault of the director, because I don't feel like they do that in other movies. And it was only Tom and Jennifer at fault. I loved Jon Hamm, the Iceman scene, and the younger generation all acted their butts off and did a great job. Overall, worth seeing, just bring a barf bag for a couple scenes. And not because of motion sickness. ;)

reviews.review_title: Definitely a must-see for action fans
reviews.content: I really like this film, although I thought the interaction between the young pilots weren't as good as Top Gun (maybe because those actors in Top Gun were seasoned actors, and I've never seen any of these younger actors before). Here is my review from Rottentomatoes:This movie is a definite must-see for anyone who liked Top Gun or action movies. The only reason I didn't give it five stars was because I thought the interaction between the young pilots (naval aviators) wasn't as robust as the original Top Gun; the interactions weren't bad, I just felt they could have been better. Another user, who gave it 1 star, said the aerial stunts were not possible; well, this is a fictional action movie, not a discussion on aerial combat techniques. If you go in looking for logical aerial maneuvers, I suggest you not go to any science-fiction or action movie because this movie was just for fun action, not a lesson on actual physics.

Why the same same story in pretty much the same sequence?Awful dialogue. As clichéd and lame at times as the original - the maverick, the cocktail one, a bad moustache, the bike, the beach sport sweaty torsos, the angry rivalry, the tower fly by...I even said the baddies were all in black flying suits and helmets, and, er, they were.And yes Maverick did approach the class "of the world's best" (give over) from behind the students, just as Kelly Mcgillis did.And to cap it all the really annoyed whooping round the aircraft American nonsense at the end.Only saving grace were the flying scenes.Please do not make a third one.

reviews.review_title: Amazing film in terms of entertainment but...
reviews.content: I'm gonna have to take a couple stars off for nothing about the film making any kind of logical sense from a military tactics perspective. Even with my limited military knowledge I could tell there were a million better ways to destroy the target than sending 4 planes through a canyon to drop bombs.First of all, why were the SAMs even allowed to get a chance to launch? I'm pretty sure the navy has a thousand different ways to deal with them, from jamming to ARMs to just hitting them with the tomahawks they (for some reason) used to crater the runway.Secondly, why didn't the team have any support whatsoever? Where's the electronic warfare aircraft that would be jamming enemy SAMs? Where's the aircraft responsible for neutralising air defenses? Also why didn't they have any cover from the enemy fighters?There's also the fact that they could have just sent a B2 or some other stealth plane to take out the target but what fun would that be? I bet a missile strike would work just fine as well.Anyway, absolutely spectacular filmmaking and storytelling, great emotional and character moments, but you've got to switch off your brain; you can only suspend your disbelief so far before it starts bothering you.Maybe I just think too much about movie logic, but this definitely dampened my enjoyment slightly.

reviews.review_title: This is THE epic movie of the decade
reviews.content: A perfect action movie in almost every way, and nothing was done to film this the easy way. It is apparent in the final product that blood, sweat, tears and love went into making this film. I just watched it again and it deserves a real 10/10. I hope this film will inspire this generation to accomplish their hardest goals, like the first film did for many of us.I'm a firefighter and went through the academy in early 2000's and we were still quoting the original film while we were being challenged to our limits.I also work in film, and this should inspire every production to get on board with sfx or cinematography that goes the extra mile to produce a movie that truly makes the viewer believe what they are viewing is real and like they are there. This movie is an example of the harder to produce old school film style that we so desperately need to bring people back to the theater. Masterpiece. Thank you Tom Cruise and all involved for your passion.

reviews.review_title: That's what theaters are made for
reviews.content: I urge you to go watch it on the big screen. If you go to the cinema once in your life it should be for this movie.Just to make this perfectly clear for everybody: The plot is not about aviation. It's about teamwork in a competetive environment, heavily focussed on mind-over-matter. The planes are there for the drama and for the action, not for realism of any kind. This is not a documentary and it doesn't care about realism - which is a good thing, because the movie wouldn't be thrilling at all if that were the case.The mission is suicidal, the training illegal and the behaviour of Maverick would've caused him to be in prison or shot down by the military for not listening to anybody and violating basically all laws of aviation AND the navy. Nothing is correct concerning military regulations, piloting rules, aviation physics, weapon systems, you name it. And it doesn't matter at all.Fans will like the movie for the same reasons as the first one: Planes are beautiful and exciting and we all believe in Maverick, a Hotshot who breaks the rules (and laws of physics) to get the job done where nobody else can.That being said, even if you like your movies to be realstic, watch it anyways. The aviation scenes alone are worth the visit.As they said in the behind the scenes trailer: A movie like that has never been done and probably will never be done again.So take your chance and watch it now. Even if you wait 35 years again for a sequel, there probably won't be one next time.

It's actually a really good follow up to top gun, ticks all the boxes. Action romance drama however the scene between Tom and Jennifer was not needed it didn't add anything and was only an annoyance. The film was a good action film by with Tom cruise as actor it just didn't need a love story to be added in the idea could have been planted and then just left in the back ground not needing any more focus on the relationship between maverick and rooster that is more important for this film, a love arc is far from needed I hoped for so much more with this but should have guessed with Tom cruise as a part.

reviews.review_title: A Nostalgic Movie - A Time Recaptured
reviews.content: Movies today tend to turn to cheesy CG for these types of blockbusters. But, with this sequel, I was taken back to a nostalgic moment in 1986 when the movie was made before. The camera shots and angles, the intro music and soundtrack, even down to the vehicles. It's crazy to think 1986 is a time period that is lost now - we're in a different world today. So, it was quite amazing to me that Bruckheimer managed to capture it all over again, but with newer characters mixed with the aged characters.The only thing I would say is; I wanted to know a little more about the other characters in the movie. There needed to be a little more character development there. But the action was fantastic when it all came together later in the movie.

reviews.review_title: You are all Top Gun to me
reviews.content: I had already written something very long and it got thrown away by technology failure. I will try to summary it up.Tom Cruise or should I say Pete. Not sure. What an actor. You totally forget that this guy is Tom for a whole 2 and a half hours. That is how good he is.Tech stuff. Well I don't know. I didn't see any. It all seemed real to me. I was hanging on to my seat for some time there.Val Kilmer. Hands down coming to the set. I know this kind of sickness and it was so very intense seeing you in the movie. But it would not have been Top Gun without you.This is the best movie I have seen for a long time and I am counting in decades.You are all Top Gun to me.

reviews.review_title: The only thing missing that would've made this movie a 10 is...
reviews.content: Top Gun: Maverick is one of the greatest sequels of all-time that somehow manages to top its legendary predecessor. The storyline is intricate keeping you hooked from the start. It has the perfect mix of fan service and originality from the original that leaves you giddy throughout the watch. I thought it was going to end a few times before it did and every event that occurred managed to shatter every expectation that I had going in. Every scene in this movie has a purpose and is perfectly proportioned. The acting is incredible, noting Tom Cruise and Miles Teller, but everyone else is truly outstanding as well. 9/10 at this current moment in time... It would've been a 10/10 if Take My Breath Away was played at some point. This is a MUST WATCH MOVIE.

Our rose-colored glasses make us yearn for simpler times. But were they really simpler? A drug epidemic, political turmoil, Russian aggression...are we talking about the 80's or today? Although the cinematic enemy goes nameless, this film feels like it is retelling a true story. Delayed by the Covid-19 pandemic, its release seems to align with current affairs in a way that couldn't be more intentional, if not for the pure happenstance that pushed back the release.This film does not miss a beat. Literally from the word "go" you are thrust into a whimsical world of nostalgia competing for screen time against a modern day instant classic. This piece is a well calibrated dance that does not leave you feeling duped. It has all the hallmarks of past action films that we miss, such as cheesy humor, cocky characters, and the music that makes it all so beautifully palatable.From the title screen you're introduced to the aging Pete "Maverick" Mitchell who looks phenomenal for his age. Wearing his archetypal outfit to include the white T shirt, denim jeans and that iconic bomber jacket. He unveils the classic Kawasaki bike and makes his way into work. It looks as if nothing has changed in 36 years!Maverick is now a test pilot for the US Navy. He wastes no time at all getting into trouble as he deliberately disobeys orders to remain grounded on a upcoming test flight. This series of events sees him reprimanded by his chain of command. As it all looks dim for Captain Mitchell, an unlikely set of orders saves him from UCMJ uncertainty. He gets word that in lieu of traditional punishment, he has instead been reassigned by orders from a specter of his past: Iceman, who is now an Admiral.Upon arrival to the Top Gun facilities Pete is greeted by a whirlwind of emotions. He walks into his own shadow; of the past he shared with his classmates, including his deceased friend Goose. Maverick now faces the prospect of teaching among many other pilots, Goose's son, Rooster. Old wounds, old flames, and old memories come together and pit Pete against his own wishes. With only a matter of weeks Maverick has to cultivate a team of top performing Top Gun grads into a well oiled strike force in order to eliminate a growing nuclear threat.The film is a corny 80s classic that so many of us love mixed with a well-shot modern masterpiece. It is full throttle fan service for the older crowd with callbacks and nods to the previous film, but it is also a great introduction for a new generation to cling to. You are given the same Maverick/Iceman type of rivalry, along with a feast of other young alphas who undertook the role with no doubt in mind what was being asked of them.Sequels have a reputation for not living up to their predecessors. Sometimes they're hyped up too much for the sake of ticket sales. From a fan of the original film, take it from me. This film might be better than the original. It closes chapters that you never felt were left open. It has a few good laughs, and honestly it almost made me cry. For every predictable thing that comes to be, there's another one that is unexpected. This film is an instant classic and should be viewed while it is still showing in theaters. I highly recommend watching it in IMAX or a Dolby Certified theater. It will be great on DVD/Blue Ray, but you'll never understand it the way it was meant to be unless you watch it in a theater!

This is why you go to the movies: real actors, real jets, breathtaking, edge of the seat action that pulls G's in your movie seat.Tom delivers exactly the performance we want from him and deserves a heap of accolades for pulling this off. This was simply a blast and might have even topped Top Gun I.

reviews.review_title: So nostalgic and great on its own...
reviews.content: A great nod back to the original, great action and a fab cast. Love the nostalgia for the franchise....what next TG3 with Rooster and Hangman....?I went with my wife is we are l as the forties and both loved it.....a must see....

Nostalgia. Great characters. Good story. Laugh out loud moments. Amazing cinematography. Once again TC shows why he's an amazing 'movie maker'. The Goose story was handled with panache and class. Covid was a rubbish time for everyone but Top Gun: Maverick and Ghostbusters: Afterlife were certainly the standout films.Brilliant.

reviews.review_title: B+ but A because it brought us back to 2019...
reviews.content: Maverick would never have hesitated to take on the 5th Gen fighter jets, so that Goose should not have used Maverik's own cliche on him, and it was clear that Hangman would come to the rescue after the ejection system failed, no surprises there. Other than that, won't spoil it, watch it, it was a B+ movie, and an A+ if you take into account that it truly felt like 2019, like 2020 never happened, when you watched.

I really can't understand why everyone was raving about this movie. I was looking forward to it so badly but utterly disappointed. It's a complete rip off of the first movie, only done with cringeworthy performances - From the d-grade actors trying to emulate the original characters, to the unrealistic dog fight training, to the beach volleyball scene, - all trying to capture the magic from the original but failing miserably. You can't recreate a classic. Even the special guest appearances from original cast were just lame and sad. It felt like they were just trying to hold on to one last shred of stardom from a generation who have long forgotten them. Give it a miss. It's a complete waste of two hours.

What a great experience. Like I felt the G-force myself. A movie that puts you right to the edge of your seat.I had high hopes, after watching the first Top Gun just recently. I was wondering how good they could make the new movie, 35 years later with all available tools and tech.More action, crazy special effects & camera work, a good story, and Tom Cruise make this a must watch!
One the best movies I have seen in a decade! I usually don't write reviews but I couldn't help to write one for Top Gun! Go see it! Worth every minute!
The same energy in the second movie i loved the film all time action thrilling very good actors remember when i Was a kid ✨🙏penny Was the new good surprise i had to review the first One.

reviews.review_title: Made every expectation that built up over 35 years!
reviews.content: I joined the Canadian Air Forces after watching the first Top Gun movie. I had a blast as my first career. We all waited 35 years for that sequel. Today I watched it with my son on IMAX. I had so much expectations built up, and it made every bit of it. Thank you!

As always the actual plane footage is amazing but come on the story is the same as the original in 1986, lazy writing and soo predictable. Nice to see Val as Iceman considering how poorly he is in real life but that's it. The music from Kenny Logans at the beginning was a nice touch but everything else wasn't. So disappointed after waiting so long. So many scenes mirrored the original and wasn't even that good. Tom did his best but he ain't 24 no more and it shows. Story line was that great either a bit OTT but hey it's American. Tom needs to stop with these films now as they are not doing the ageing actor any good.
What a movie! I really think this is Tom's best film. Edge of your seat action and suspense! It's amazing to think no green screen or cgi was used in this film. Must watch!!

From the beginning until the end. The
movie had just want you wanted to see.It had the perfect amount of Nostalgia from the original.With a nice modern touch, to compliment the sequel .I thoroughly enjoyed the ride into THE DANGER ZONE ........
This is how you do a sequel. I just wish there was more of a team dogfight and n the end.But that is for the sequel... /trilogy.Great cast and story.

There is no story. And the bit of story there is was stolen from Star Wars IV. The ego-contest around it i don't count.The charakters are unbelieveable dumb and flat. This nonstop grinning guy ... wth. They are the definition of stereotype.Cringe dialoge.Flight scences and action are somewhat enjoyable. Sometimes really bad - those air defense system.If you are like 15-25 years old and don't want to think about anything for two hours than this movie is for you. There is no surprise no twist. All is as you would expect it.

reviews.review_title: Predictable? Yes, but fun to watch.
reviews.content: The script was not that great. This movie was definitely predictable. There were times I could predict the next line or action. No real character development! Full of movie cliches and cheesy one-liners or who can pull rank and slam another person the quickest or best. Some of the characters were interesting, but were not give the screen time to develop. I am not sure why they even bothered showing any of the relationship between Jack and Penny. Very boring. Although it was nice to see a relationship between a man and a woman whose ages were a little more closely aligned instead of 25-30 years apart. The best part of the movie was the technical aspect. I thought it was interesting that the enemy was never identified.

The magic of the old days of Cinema being made to entertain audiences and make them feel good has returned to the silver screen. The action scenes are fantastic, the actors are fantastic and the movie will have you on the edge of you're seat. Excellent wonderful film.

Very rarely do sequels outmatch their predecessors, especially ones where the predecessor is already deemed an iconic movie. Top Gun Maverick has delivered a cinematic masterpiece that has done just that, but did so in a way that honored the first film. Tom Cruise truly nailed his role as he steps into this new chapter of aeronautical combat. From the very first scene to the last, I was grinning ear to ear. The performances, the action, the history, and the magic that happened on the screen will not be matched for a very long time. Thank you for This movie, it was worth the wait.

reviews.review_title: A love letter to the first movie
reviews.content: I'll keep this brief. Massive fan of the original movie, I've seen it 30+ times and I know every line. The sequel.It owes a lot to the first film borrowing much of the story line from the first and it mirrors the plot very closely. Negatives first...I think the film was 15-20 minutes too long. I think the story dragged a little after a brilliant opening 30 minutes. There was no explaination of who the enemy was. The fighter pilots in training failed the mission everytime but then suddenly found the ability to complete the mission in real time. A good old fashioned montage would have been nice here. They re-used some of the one liners from the old movie which is nice but could have come up with new idea's.
