reviews.content: It's a real pretty movie with all of the practical effects but the story lacked any substance. The only story that I cared about was the one between Rooster and Maverick but I knew that they were going to be fine in the end. All of the sense of peril in this movie is all for show because anytime that the characters are in danger, you just know somehow they're going to get miraculously saved. It just didn't do it for me, it's nice too look at and it has so funny beats but this story was really lacking.

Some scenes and dialogues were pretty unnecessary, the love story didn't touch me at all. But the crazy flight scenes make the whole experience worth it. Didn't think I would enjoy it as much, I even held my breath a few times.

No fancy words or lofty comparisons.....Mixes, action, drama and love perfectly. Probably one of the best films I've watched in a long time. Does the original justice (if not surpasses it).In fact, its that good I'm going to watch it again tomorrow.

reviews.review_title: Great flying sequences but not a great storyline
reviews.content: For me, there are too many repeats of scenes from the original movie... the vast scene where Rooster plays the piano, the beach volleyball scene and the opening sequences backed by the Danger Zone track. But it's enjoyable trip to the movies. Not Tom Cruises worst movie but definitely not his best.

reviews.review_title: Is this cobra Kai? No character development, lots of 80s cliches and everyone loves it!
reviews.content: What's the backstory with love interest Penny? Who cares!Pianos and bar scenes, why? Who cares!Who are the new pilots? Who cares!80s Action music. Yeah!Football vs. Volleyball? Sure why not...What's the purpose of Mach 9, Mach 10 scene? Who cares!Cheesy love scene. We are want Better love /sex Scenes. Who cares!It's like watching Cobra Kai. All 80s cliches, no one cares. Just give us more! Somehow they made 2hrs "flyby" and seem like 1 hr. Somehow they pull it off and the audience goes to see this twice? Action scenes kick ass! We want more! We want more Top Gun! More Goose/Rooster! Why do I feel like I hate this movie but still loved it enough to give a 7-8 rating???

Definitely worth the 30 odd year wait 😊
Such a great date night movie.Massive adrenaline rush and on the edge of your seat often.Bit of an emotional moment here and there.
I didn't expect such a good movie, it's excellent, it draws attention from the first to the last minute, the sound of the f-18's are waiting and it's also an emotional movie. It's an easy 10/10.

reviews.review_title: Great movie with a lot of moment to cheer
reviews.content: I saw this movie at Camerimage and cheered with the crowd multiple times. It is an awesome movie to watch, though it doesn't really state who the enemy is, it is kinda obvious from the planes they used. But still it is a thrilling movie to watch especially knowing all the actors where really in the air and not just filmed on a green screen and it is quite visible and as you can feel the g force they are hitting.However I didn't give it a full mark, as I myself work as a first AC and notice some very off focus shots several times, which werent inside the cockpits but on the deck of the ship.Also the plothole of that Maverick was riding his old bike at the start of the movie and suddenly has a totally new bike.

reviews.review_title: 10/10 for Cheese! BUT just ok for me!
reviews.content: Absolutely loved Top Gun, however this one seems to play it safe and steal all the one-liners and 'best' bits from the original. I guess that is how to make a tonne of money at the box office. It does have great action and a totally predictable storyline, I suppose if you did not see the first one it may seem a better movie but for me way too cheesy. Very disappointed but action junkies won't be, lots of samey scenes but the worst for me is the 'Talk to me Goose' by Maverick...the guys dead, leave Goose alone, and then 'Talk to me Dad' Please poor Goose must be 'NO, leave me alone,'

My new #1. Been following the making on and off for 10 years. Great story, story overlap, drama and unmatched authentic action. Tom did it his way, again. No disappointments from this critic. We'll be seeing again soon.

reviews.review_title: If the first Top Gun Is a 6.9 - This is at least a solid 6
reviews.content: Great throwback to when a film was about entertaining the audience. The sales are likely due to this: people crave movies that entertain more than attempt to deliver a political or social message.Good performances, good story. Greatest movie ever? No, yet very entertaining and good. Well worth the watch. I checked on IMDB for the first Top Gun rating. As of writing this it is at 6.9. This is a great follow up. It's a must see for fans of the first. This one picks up well from the last. Though the first was better, so I'm going with a 6 rating here. Compared to other movies coming out lately though, it's much better than most.Nice to see:Cruise still delivers. Either the guy doesn't age or they have the best in the business making him look good.Great story arc with Goose's son and Cruise.Seeing Val Kilmer in the movie despite his current personal struggles honored the part he played in the last film as well as his career.Flaws:They could have easily trimmed 20-30 minutes off without story loss.Who was Jennifer Connelly's character? Was she even in the first one? Didn't he end up with the blonde? No discredit to Connelly as an actor, though something about her gives me a negative bias. Maybe she played an evil character in a movie and that stuck with me. Her acting was and is fine. Didn't understand her part and not much chemistry with Cruise. Felt like I was missing something here.I felt no immediate threat. What was this box they are trying to blow up? Who exactly is the enemy? Don't we have other tech that can get the job done? Drone strike? Missile barrage? Something? Why do we need these pilots to fly this crazy course? Maybe they answered this and I missed it. Movie was entertaining enough that I can suspend my belief and just go along.

A phenomenal follow up to the original. Every throw back was nostalgic. My hat is off to the accuracy of how we remember our fallen. The use of the original music set the tone from the very begining. Yeah, the script felt a little rushed to explain everything for those who haven't watched the first 100 times. However, this film hit me in the feels every 5 minutes. Exciting - action packed and tighted to neatly to the original. Jennifer Connley really stepped it up.WELL DONE.

Like looking the 'original' in a distorted mirror. A very predictable script does not sustain the movie. Dogfights and action scenes sometimes are confused, they were much better in the 1986 movie. But if one look for action, action is served. Too many 'machitos': the scent of testosterone is even stronger than 36 years ago, and the unique female presence in a masculine role is not enough to smooth its smell. Good cast, though, and very credible resemblance between 'Goose' and his son 'Rooster'. Credible performances by everyone. A very sad presence of Val Kilmer who's suffering from a throat cancer in real life, but I think that producers owed him a role in this movie. Young spectators who didn't watch Top Gun release in real time (iI mean, in 1986) will appreciate this release.

Incredible.Everything is just perfect
All the actors the story line
For the whole movie I couldn't keep my eyes away from the action.I would watch it over and over again.
Many sequels lose to the original movie. Not true here. This is as good or better than the original Top Gun! They pulled off a Mega Hit here! I will see it again.

reviews.review_title: Very good movie comparing to all of this years' movies
reviews.content: I wish they made it earlier, Top gun could have had series of excitement. It showed that the Nave didn't appreciate him when he was the best aviator, instead, they ignored his talent. I wished that at the end they will give him the right recognition. That would have been the right and cool ending of the movie, I think.

reviews.review_title: The wait is over and yes I love it! The best film period!
reviews.content: Action from beginning to end. Definitely the best!Tom did it again! Just speechless and wow! I will watch again and again!Flying, story line and obviously the character all matches with the first one.This fill will gross over 500 million plus.Bank on it!Well done!

I liked the movie and found it entertaining but that is about it. The central plot line is that of The Bridges At Toko-Ri for the most part with some picks from Firefox and finally closure of the old Top Guns themes. Not sure why Kelly McGillis didn't make the cut for this or didn't want to.Also not sure why there are so many 10 ratings. Lots of filler early and in the middle. A 10 says this is on par with say Lawrence of Arabia, etc. It is not by a long shot.

Yo be honest my dad and brother did like this movie very much, but note me.If we are alike (INTP), you'll predict the movie in the very first 15-20 min. I didnt watch the first one, but Tom Cruise's character is basically the same as in MI movies, he's always the hero.There is one action scene that is worth to watch, but if I could come back in time, I would just have watched it without everything else.I wonder why this has so high rating, even in Rotten Tomatos.

reviews.review_title: What a ride this movie was
reviews.content: Please go watch this in theatres. Mobile screens and TVs won't do justice to the cinematic pleasure this movie is.Tom Cruise is amazing as Pete Mitchell and the supporting characters are very well cast as well.The stunts were just out of this world!!!

I never thought I would say this, but definitely one of the best movies I've seen from Tom Cruise in a while.Intense, with plenty of emotions...
the plot was very well executed & the action scenes were pretty good, it gave me those old school vibesI also think the actors were pretty solid...I have watched the first movie like twice & I can't say I was ever a big fun
& when this one came out I was like what is with all the fuss,
but after watching it,
I was like okay,,
I am impressed & I am now a believerlet me just say it lived up to expectations and hype.Top movie & would recommend it especially if you love action movies.

reviews.review_title: I didn't hate it. Star Wars Episode IV redo?
reviews.content: Warning Some Spoilers.I walked out of the original movie way back when and never looked back. I couldn't stand Tom Cruise's character. I was dragged to this last night and kind of liked it. Cruise's cocky Maverick has been humbled over the decades which made him different. It was great to see Val Kilmer and recognizing his current health conditions, it was utilized in this portrayal. It was poignant.Okay, did anyone else see the similarities to Star Wars Episode IV? The mission was right out of the Death Star attack. The trench run and the target being only a few meters. The widened mentor who served with the dead father of the son who now needs to be trained and has some issues to overcome. The words of wisdom from the mentor that you think too much about it, just go with your feelings (Use the force Luke).

The movie is great, but the enemy section was disaster, they go to enemy base which surprisingly have no barrier and wall around, and see the runway and F14, they see the soldiers moving around and running around, but the first standard action in any airbase after bombardment by enemy is sending units to move undamaged aircraft to safe area,
but again these two gentleman just run all the way without raising anybody's suspicious with their totally different cloths and fueled the aircraft, and again surprisingly with that highly secret airfield there was no one to see and ask what are u doing!!Beside that they already destroyed the runway and the purpose of that the enemy can not take off the planes, so again surprisingly while the all enemy units was running like idiots, they could take off in such runway!!!,
the more interesting things that the airplane was already loaded with missile, while except the scramble one, all weapons are load just before take off,
the bottom line is that the enemy was stupid and idiots without any preparation for such attack in highly secret and full protected area!!!And the final shot was just stupid,
even the most oldest fighter jets have indicators which shows missile incoming, so how that highly capable 5th generation fighter just didn't have such simple alarms??
I usually get bored quickly watching most movies, but Top Gun Maverick was simply stunning, great acting, great story and fantastic action. This was one of the best movies I have ever seen.

Simply PERFECT! A truly masterpiece! They made something VERY HARD! Make it even better than the first! Very, VERY GOOD!!! Managed to make a perfect connection with the first and with excellent passages! Brilliant the participation of Val Kilmer as Iceman and the connection with the first one! Congratulations and thanks for bringing this movie to us!!!

Pretty good plot and action and drama was moving
There is no dull moment and the pacing is great
Tom, Jennifer and cast are treat to see and this movie is highly entertaining, the flight scenes are amazing.

I love the original Top Gun movie, I have seen it over 20 times. So I was looking forward to see Top Gun Maverick and I lfeft the cinema utterly dissapointed.The flight scences were great and better that the orginal but the storyline is so flimsy it is hardly believable. The characters are all flat there is no character building in the movie at all. Worst thing is the after 36 years Maverick still is not over Goose.Movie would have been better if started a new storyline instead of leaning to the past so much.

reviews.review_title: The best sequel ever made in history!
reviews.content: I was born in 1984 so I can't say Top Gun was "my time" but it's definitely my Mom's and my uncle's time (her younger brother and only sibling). Growing up I have noticed that my uncle owned a huge poster of Top Gun with Tom Cruise and Kelly McGillis together. It was pasted on his wall above his headboard. I have no idea who they were that time until Betamax player came, then VHS player, VCD/DVD player. My uncle buys a copy of Top Gun each and every time a new vcr system for home entertainment comes out in the market. That's how much he loves Top Gun- that I understood! It was really cool to watch it with the whole fam!And now that I've seen the sequel after decades! It didn't disappoint me, my husband and my mom. It even exceeded our expectations! This movie is truly spectacular! Loved the story, there was enough flash backs to understand what is happening now. The special effects! No CGI! Actors where all inside the cockpit of a flying F18. Even the scene with the old F14 was rad too! This is the highest level of effort and dedication! Made me really happy. How I wished my uncle's still here with us. He would have cried, he surely would have love this movie.So thank you Paramount and to all the producers of of Top Gun Maverick. You're all awesome! You all gave my uncle's favourite movie a beautiful ending that it deserves and you brought back one of my amazing childhood memories.
If it wasn't for the original, we wouldn't have this blockbuster we call Maverick. Paid a lot of homage to the original, but story was good enough to stand on its own two feet!

I watched this traditionally and then again in 4dx, which blew me away.Ignore the cheesy dialogue and feel the need, the need for speed.Likeable cast, back up an understated tom cruise and a wonderful turn from the ever reliable miles teller.Sit back and soak up the good vibes and some breathtaking fighter jet scenes.

An instant classic movie worth watching in theaters, it brought back the feeling that i was in 80s again, in a good way :)
Fighters scene 10/10
Plot 6/10
Acting 8/10
Chill and goosebumps 100/10.

reviews.review_title: One of the worlds best films
reviews.content: Really good lighting, top class acting and is not forced with identity politics stuff.Non fake story driven feel, has a sense of humour. Has a wide range of character.It took months to place the cameras on the aeroplanes. The film crew needs a ace for the work.Its colourful and not always dark.Mach 10 take-off scene was real (and done in one take.No CGI in the cockpit.The P-51 in the final scene is Tom Cruise's flying for real.Actors trained for 3 months which really helps.The U. S. military was involved in the film's production yet again give a real feel.Tom Cruise reprising his role as Maverick, Val Kilmer is back as well.

reviews.review_title: So much better than I thought it would be!
reviews.content: Absolutely brilliant. Perfect sequel. I have no criticism at all. So nice to see some original characters and the storyline was brilliant. I thought it was going to spoil the first film but it was the perfect sequel. Definitely didn't feel 30+ years since the first film and it wasn't spoilt with special effects!

My expectations for this movie were weren't very high since rehashes of old movies like this are always very poorly executed but this movie was one of the few exceptions to that rule. It was fantastic in every sense of the word. From the plot to the action, casting, timing. Everything in this film was spot on including the chemistry between Cruise and Connelly. Better than the original by a mile. Watch 4DX if possible.

I thought the sequel would be a bug flop, yet, i was witnessing history, it turned up to the best sequel ever made until now, what a movie, such an amazing masterpiece, this is how we do Blockbuster's movie.For 2 hours and 15 minutes, my heart was shaking and beating and especially with some scenes whereas i held my breath literally with them.I think the usage of the songs as well was perfect, with Hans Zimmer, lady gaga and so on, has given this movie another dimension of course.I believe this sequel is by far, better than the original movie that appeared before 3 decades and this is honestly a big success for the production, cast and especially the director, it is not easy at all to make a sequel for an astonishing movie after such long period, it is not easy at all.

My expectations were met. Fast planes, cool visuals and a mediocre story line. What more could you ask for. The movie is more enjoyable if you let your imagination run wild. And except some of the far fetched scenes.

Top Gun: Maverick does the perfect job of creating a new plot around the original movie. The characters are well developed and well incorporated into a new plot. The flashbacks to the original do a great job of jogging the memory needed to connect the two yet it isn't a distraction. The plot stands alone but it's connection to the original is flawlessly done.

Such a good feel good film. Flawless. I can't think of anything I would change.I have to make up 150 characters to write a review. I think I've said everything.I have never left a review for a film but I took the time to give deserved feedback for this one.

reviews.review_title: At last some closure from the trauma of losing Goose!
reviews.content: Ok so I've spent the last couple of decades watching and re-watching ER just to help my long-gone teenage self cope with the untimely and traumatic loss of Goose. Which may or may not have helped given the unfortunately demise of Anthony Edwards' character yet AGAIN.. but now at last, I'm equipped to deal with it and move on. Cue the arrival of Rooster, Goose's Naval aviator offspring who fits the bill in every way.Too Gun: Maverick surpasses all my greatest expectations in every way and made a mockery of the little nagging worry I had that a sequel could never live up to what so many of us wanted - needed! - it to be. But seriously - they've smashed it. Tom Cruise is on absolute top form as the remarkably well preserved - not a grey hair in sight - mature Maverick. The story line is brilliant.. it does a whole lot more than nod to the original but doesn't it without being cheesy.We get to explore our unresolved teenage angst about Goose because he manages to Be There in every part of the film - it's as much about him as is it Maverick and yet his son is a whole new character who is exactly who we need him to be. His ability to be a totally believable son-of-Goose is testament not so much to clever casting (it is clever for sure; there's some definitely facial similarities) or the carefully placed if somewhat, slightly unfashionable moustache, but rather to the talent of the actor who carries it off fantastically. Those were some tough boots to fill!I'll let others with far better technical knowledge them me wax lyrical about the breathtaking fighter jet scenes.. of which there are many. They are deserving of every compliment. The soundtrack rocks .. there's romance.. and there's even a purely gratuitous beach football scene featuring oiled male biceps for us all to enjoy. It honestly has everything. Go see it. It rocks.

Went to a 10.15pm session after being at drinks all afternoon. Big mistake! I napped on my bf's shoulder for a lot of it and he was horrified at me doing this, but the parts i was awake for, I loved. Will watch again!

Maverick is worth seeing in the theater. It has a well thought out storyline and it is visually amazing. Plus the sound effects are unreal. I now know why Tom Cruise wanted to wait to release it in the theater and not a streaming service. I give it a 8 out of 10.

This was a top notch film! I'm not a Tom Cruise fan by any means but for this role he is spot on. The flying sequences, both live and CGI are truly spectacular, the storyline credible in today's world climate. Plenty of nods to the original film so if you want to be 'in' on those nods, watching the original would help. It does work well as a standalone though. I went to see it with no preconceptions (i.e. I didn't read up on the plot or watch any trailers) and was hugely impressed. Watched in a Dolby Atmos cinema which was amazing.

The original was great. I'm an 80's kid and loved the original. This was a boring, jumbled mess. There was Zero character development. Tom Cruise and Jennifer Connelly didn't make much sense. They went from not seeing each other for 30 years to being in love in 1 scene.The generic mission with a generic enemy was lacking. I didn't care about the mission or the enemy.Mike's Teller was decent, but the rest of the cast was just their to make TC look better. But it's not there fault their was no plot.It was good to see Val Kilmer, but also sad to know this aweful movie will be his last.It you can make it until the last 20 minutes, the final sequence is fairly entertaining. But not worth sitting through the first 90 minutes of boring.
I can only review the first 15 minutes. Thats how long I was able to watch this movie. I know, my own fault, I should have stayed home that night but curiosity won. Lots of muscles but no brains.

I went into this with open eyes and hoping for more. I was left a little disappointed. In places I thought I was watching Star Wars! In fact I thought that I was watching a retelling of A New Hope! It's definitely worth a watch but if you think you're in for something new and spectacular you'll be disappointed. However the fact that the green screen stuff has been scrapped in favour of actual real life footage has to be and is a massive plus and bonus. All in all not a bad film just not great.

reviews.review_title: If you didn't like the first one ... Don't GO
reviews.content: I did the mistake of reading the comments and believing them.. wasted 2 hours of my life.The vroom vroom scenes were okey - would be enjoyable more in any VR sim more than a movie. Other than than it was the typical predictable yet unbelievable American military cliches.There was a mosquito in the theater that i thought i was more enjoyable.

reviews.review_title: I don't see the first one, still enjoyable
reviews.content: We start with a little background of maverick why he is where he is, it still kinda hard to believe what a big shot he was or is.. seeing that the navy can't wait to get rid of him. I mean the only reason that he still there is because iceman is his best friend.Anyway it has the drama, a decent background, few flashbacks.. and I usually don't pay much attention on the actions, most of the time i care more about the story and the plots.. this movie of course has it, and it's easy to follow and very entertaining. But i got to say the actions, that scenes where they do the mission has me on edge. And it's not even the people fighting on the ground (you know what i mean). It's a jet fighter, fighting and do fancy maneuvers!!!! And i love it !! Sooooo very good.So, i gotta say it's actually give you the perfect amount of what you need. Well, a little too much on cringe 90s banter on the beginning.. but i still like it, it's not changing the way I enjoy this movie.

reviews.review_title: Started ok then went off the rails....
reviews.content: The original Top Gun was my favorite movie growing up. Can't count how many times I've seen it in the 32 years of my life. The movie also propelled my interest in joining the military when I was young, much like many others. The movie started with some great throwbacks to the original which was great and the longer the movie went on...the more off the rails it got. Great scenes of the F-18 at times, but the end mission? Ridiculous. Just became almost cartoonish with the plot. Tried to do too much with it. Not that the original was "realistic"....but this ending....come on. I think Tom threw in a dash of mission impossible with it.

Im 46, and this is my 1st and last post i ever made on social media apps.I was 18 when I saw Top Gun 1.One off the best movies at the time.I was worried about the sequel, because in most of the times, they are bad. This one is even better than the first.Giving rate less than 10, just can be explained in my point of view like this:Rating 1, his from set o MI 7, Crew that Tom shout from.Rating 2 to 6, his from people saw wrong movie or bad quality download from Internet, whit Chinese subtitles.Rating from 7 to 9, his from people who thing they are experts or professional commenting on movies.Rating off 10 is from the real people, that real understand what this movie means.

It's a must watch movie. One of the best of it's kind. The story actions and the cast all are perfect.Can't believe at the age of 60 also Tom Cruise maintained to do such air actions sequencer. Hats off 2 him.

Long awaited after cancelling it at cinemas at the start of covid I've waited 2 years to see this movie and it did NOT disapoint at all. CGI was on point, characters were on point and the story line was on point. How they handled ice mans cameo was brilliant. Loved it.

After so many years of waiting
It was just total fun, amazing and surprising ,
didn't know what to expect,
Highly recommended,two hours of total fun and exciting!

Top Gun: Maverick ain't just a regular movie, it's a freakin' masterpiece of cinema that'll get your blood pumpin' and make you feel like a true alpha. With sick action scenes and dope visuals, this movie takes you on a rollercoaster of emotions that'll help you grow as a person.Everyone's been raving about it, man. Rolling Stone said Tom Cruise kills it, and that he's one of the few actors that can really take you on a journey both physically and emotionally. Collider talked about how Kosinski nailed the story, with themes like friendship, love, and sacrifice that'll inspire you to be a better person. And The Guardian called it a modern cinema masterpiece, giving props to the writing, directing, and epic soundtrack.But the real review comes from the fans, who've been blown away by Top Gun: Maverick. They say it's made them rethink their lives and choices, and given them the courage to chase their dreams. That's what makes this movie so special, man - it's not just about entertainment, it's about embodying those eternal values that built Western civilization and transforming your life for the better.

Have waited a long time for this. After seeing this sequel, I wish I owned a movie theater so I could watch it on the BIGGER screen a hundred times. Best way to see this action buster. Instead, I have to go back again and again until I run out of change in my pockets. COME WITH ME!

reviews.review_title: Overrated - video game dialogue and a predictable plot
reviews.content: The dialogue is insufferable. Every other line is a "clever" one-line zinger, and every character talks like a video game character. Constant cutting to multiple people for a second each just to show their reactions. There's not a single conversation that feels grounded and realistic, apparently in Top Gun world everyone is a genius conversationalist with a broad vocabulary and the ability to always come up with a perfect witty response.The plot is incredibly boring and predictable. Ooooh a super hard mission, oooh angsty relationship with his dead friend's son, oooh something goes slightly wrong, ooooh character development, oooh callbacks to the past. So amazing and unexpected /s.There's not a single interesting scene in the entire movie. The visuals are OK, but in this day and age, not special at all. Waste of time to watch.

Normally, sequels are poor imitations of the original movies. Top Gun: Maverick is NOT one of those movies. Aside from an occasional nod to the original movie, this movie has a different framework and plotline along with several new characters. I thoroughly enjoyed it.

I saw this same movie in the 80s when it was called Top Gun... The ego factor, insubordination, the rival pilots, the similar bar scene, surprised reactions when the instructor walks in (without the pantyhose this time), students getting smoked in the air, the shirtless beach ball game, exciting edge of seat mission accomplishment, cheering and back patting on the carrier, happy relationship ending with the lady. Regardless, it was a great movie. Diversification dyna to be a mandatory thing in the movies now, but it was mostly kept under control here. I'm grateful for that. If there's one good thing that came from this movie, it's seeing Iceman and Maverick together.

If you are looking for great aerial action this sure delivers. The special effects are really awesome. People complain about over-use of CGI, but after seeing this you will agree that it really makes this movie.The storyline is, as expected, formulaic. Lots of over the top US patriotism also. No, the US is not the best at everything, including the "World Series" of aerial combat.Cruse himself does a very good job as an aging top gun. Probably a better acting performance than elsewhere. Connelly is, as usual, very good also.Recommended for action movie buffs who can forgive a jingoistic storyline.

reviews.review_title: 12/10 if it was possible. Great sequel highly worth a trip to the movies to see.
reviews.content: In the netflix generation of internet subscription services, 4 & 8K tvs, surround sound home cinemas and superior sound right at home there are very few reasons that I will pay for the high expense of seeing movies at the cinema. Its too bloody expensive. HOWEVER THIS MOVIE IS A MUST SEE! Go as big a screen as you can see the movie in, with the best seats and sound as possible.The scenes are so incredibly shot, the sound, the pace, the acting and the overall cinema-experience for this is a MUST. I would gladly pay to see this again - but cinemas MUST KEEP THIS IN THE BEST CINEMA IN THE VENUENot only is this a sequel one of the rare movies that probably equals or surpasses its original in every way, but Tom Cruise shows that he is still worth the huge pay packet, and his desire for the best overall movie experience for viewers means that I will be watching this multiple times and will likely make my must watch when played/ go to movies.MY only issue with Maverick is the way the Penny character is in the movie. Where was Charlie and why didn't she make the cut. She is a fine actor and the continuity of the storyline should have had her in it. Smacks of agism in female acting roles and is an ongoing issue in Hollywood. My only complaint.

Top Gun Maverick !Phenomenal! Tom Cruise may be older but there is nothing stopping him! He was Maverick and 36 years later he still is! The story is well written and totally keeps the original storyline and expands it beyond! ! I like the relationship and respect that Rooster and Maverick come to form. ! It was worth all 36 years I waited! Tom Cruise definitely does not disappoint! The man is still Maverick! We saw it in IMAX and there was not an empty seat in the movie. Val Kilmer was phenomenal and hats off to Miles Teller and the younger cast who were instrumental in their roles!Please go see this movie!

reviews.review_title: Not a movie, a Tom Cruise commercial
reviews.content: I loved Top Gun. Watched the movie several times and enjoyed the mix of action and drama. It was basically a real movie, even if on the light side. To me this not a movie. This is a 2 hour advertisement for Tom Cruise. Story is extremely superficial, dialogues are almost non existent, the relationship between Maverick and Goose is not believable considering he aims to be like a father to him yet there is absolute no relationship between them, and furthermore the conflict between them is never resolved, no real conversation ever takes place. In reality it is all about Cruise. Top Gun in comparison is a 10 and this is a 1. Worst sequel ever.

I went into this movie with more wide-eyed optimism than anything I've gone into in the past twenty years, but I was bitterly disappointed. I'm sure I won't be able to sufficiently explain why, but I'll try none the less...People are so starved for good content in movies and television, that anything that even resembles "good", is praised. I'm not saying that it shouldn't be, with the trash we're subjected to now. I'm just saying that the bar has been lowered to such an extent, that this sub-par crap is all we have to look forward to anymore. And, it's a sad state of affairs to be sure.In '77 Star Wars changed everything we knew. In '86 Top Gun did it again. If you didn't live through those times, you'll unfortunately never know how impactful those films were and how over time, every action movie that Hollywood has produced since then, has been slightly more watered down and gentrified than the ones that came before them. Until, at the end, it all just becomes what we have now. Movies with no soul.As much as I love what Tom Cruise is doing and tried to do with Maverick, it still lacks the gravitas of the original Top Gun. It's hard to explain the differences between the two films, but if you've watched the first Top Gun, maybe you can grasp what I'm getting at. Top Gun, other than the horrible casting of Kelly McGillis (who looked like Tom Cruise's mom), was spot on for the time. The way that Tony Scott and all involved, did their research, got real fighter pilots to coach them and nailed the fighter pilot lingo - that's what made it work so well. An example from the opening scene...
________________Flight OP: "Ghost Rider this is Strike. We have unknown aircraft, inbound Mustang. Your vector is 090 for bogey."Mav: "Talk to me Goose."Goose: "Roger, I've got 'em, 20 left, 30 miles, 900 knots closure."Cougar: "Mustang, Mustang, this is Ghost Rider 203, I've got an inbound bogey, heading 270, at 10 miles, 900 knots closure."Flight OP: "Ghost Rider, take Angels 10 left, 30... (cut off)"Cougar: "Merlin, see if he's a single."Merlin: "Goose, you see a trailer?"Goose: "Negative Merlin. Looks like he's a single."Mav: "Uhh, Cougar, I'm gonna go head to head with him."Cougar: "Take it easy Maverick, I don't like this ####. I'm gonna break high and right - see if he's really alone."
___________________This is true fighter pilot lingo, or at least the best that Hollywood can do. We heard none of this in Top Gun Maverick. It was all just pretend crap with no substance and no accuracy to the true realm of fighter pilots. The original Top Gun had a base in actual military operations and that's what made it so compelling.Cheers, Sev.

reviews.review_title: Best non superhero action movie in a long time.
reviews.content: Every second of action in this movie is well earned and blood pumping. The references to the original movie are great and the tension between Maverick and Rooster is very real and tense. Only problem I can see is the dynamic between Maverick and Penny seems forced and makes for a lot of cringey moments and overacting by Jennifer Connelly.

reviews.review_title: Absolutely amazing, best sequel I've seen in years.
reviews.content: I can't really say more than has already been said. This movie is fantastic. I can't wait to see it a 2nd and 3rd time. It blew away my expectations. The story, acting, and excitement blended together perfectly. It's a rare film that everyone can love, children and adults alike.

reviews.review_title: It's the Death Star attack all over again! (or, Who are the real bad guys?)
reviews.content: This film succeeded with its impressive practical effects and very well-achieved aerial stunts. The predictable plot offers little in the way of surprise in the end. The new characters are one-dimensional generic types and provide little cause to care about them. Tom Cruise's performance is charming and is easily the best human element in the film.So much of the runtime re-hashes or reinvents familiarly favorite scenes from the original film (shirtless, sandy, athletic montage; "Great Balls of Fire" at the piano in sunglasses; Maverick on a motorcycle chasing a jet along the runway; surprised reactions to learning your Top Gun instructor was the person you met a bar the night before, etc.), that there is too little plot remaining to justify this film as a sequel rather than a remake. I would rather watch the original film for those scenes as that film had real charm. Additionally, the forced love interest with the ever-pleasant Jennifer Connelly character does not work well to advance the larger plot, and only adds to the run time. Tom Cruise has an urgent mission to save the world, but he has time in the evenings to rehash an old flame we know of only by a throwaway line in the original film? I don't buy it.It was nice to see in this Top Gun film more attention paid to enemy combatants instead of the pure training as in the original film. This was a nice concept which suffered in the end. The main difficulty with the plot is this film wants us to believe the bad guys are hidden in the mountains somewhere and only low-flying crackerjack pilots can save the day. (Flying in fast and low under a time crunch to strike an impracticably minuscule target while dodging overwhelming aerial defenses is the Death Star attack all over again...but without Porkins).And who are the bad guys? Considering the amount of attention they receive in this film, the main villains are the three Rear Admirals. There is no subtlety with these characters as they are contrarians for the sake of being contrarians. The only Admiral not a jerk is Iceman. The "real" enemy feels like an afterthought. Sure, the bulk of the film after the first 30 minutes serves to train to fight these unseen foes, but we only get to real action with the baddies in the last 20 minutes of run time. The rest of the time the Admirals create the conflict and tension with Maverick, and it never makes sense why they should care so much. And so I can't care so much.

Anyone else get star wars vibes?I liked it, forget the star wars vibes, it's was a great film.And with a great film, comes great responsibility of producing more great films, will we see more top gun Maverick? One can only hope.

Spellbinding dogfights, tense atmosphere with a twist of good humor, and a core story focused on topics of self-belief and trust, make this a wonderful watch. A matching score by Hans Zimmer and a believable dialogue pull everything together. This is Maverick's return to redeem himself with Goose, and find a way to forgive himself. It's more than just an action flick. The 80s nostalgia is well-captured. 9/10.

I Waited 30years for this and I was not disappointed.Stunning, superb and just perfect.Great story great acting and great action.Cinema photography is fantastic.I can not underestimate how good this movie is and I am going to book to see it again as soon as I can.

Say what you like about Tom Cruise the guy knows how to make film...wowIt's cheesy (maybe a bit too much) BUT the action sequences are outstanding. Natural camera movementsJust a great blockbuster movie - saving the cinema from possible doom.

I enjoyed the movie in spite of its simple plot and cartoonish characters. I can't recall any scene without Tom Cruise filling the entire screen. Some good laughs and impressive flight action.Just as in the 1983 original movie, there is a beach sports scene, this time no beach volleyball, but some kind of ball game - this scene demonstrates the obvious: in spite of a long history of female fighter pilots in US Air and Navy, the actresses do not appear to physically being able to cope with the natural forces of gravity required to be sustained later in the movie.For anyone that enjoyed Top Gun during the 80ies, this might well be the best movie hitting cinemas for the past 4 years. I rate it above average - and 3-4 stars better than all the hollywood movies that I have seen since 2018 ...

They have done an incredible job with this movie. Its stunning and is definitely the best movie I've watched in a long time. Definitely worth a watch especially if you've seen the original it's just amazing.

Top Gun Maverick is a precision guided cinematic experience. Do yourself a favor and see this in a movie theater with a giant screen and Dolby Atmos like we did. There is a lot of nostalgia and heart baked into the story and it really works. The actors are great and the beautiful cinematography and sound is just fantastic. Motorcycles, jets, and Tom Cruise with his hair on fire. It's movie night people.

So many reviews mention Top Gun as a context for Maverick. No, throw that silly 80s movie out of your mind when considering this awesome film!Characters names and some back story are the same. But this movie is as much a sequel as Fury Road was to Road Warrior!I was 7 when Top Gun came out, loved it! But now at 43, that movie is unwatchable. Maverick blew me away!I saw Maverick just last weekend and recommended to my family with the worst recommend ever; Guys plane rips apart at 8000mph, and he survived... Story is crap. Zero plot. But likely the best movie I've seen all year!At several parts was holding my breath with a clenched stomach. Then a huge sigh of relief!Amazing movie! Don't miss it!

I enjoyed this sequel. Best thing was it was not full of swearing like most modern movies. The plot was great, although I can't see the navy having to rely on outdated planes because modern ones are not capable.

Nostalgia from the start, brilliant throwbacks to the first film and an excellent way to bring Maverick back into the fold.Cruise plays Maverick like the original was made yesterday, Teller is a fantastic addition for the cast as is Connolly but the real winner are the action set pieces, what we really wanted was modern tech to showcase modern flight tech and it delivers massively.Whilst the story itself isn't much to write about, just sit back and enjoy every minute of it, you won't be disappointed.

The first is a traditional family classic for me now. The second has the right mix of nostalgia, action, story line and feels. With so many sequels, they are good but when you watch it a second time its not so special. Maverick, however, I felt just as excited, just as thrilled and it kept me fixed all the way through both times. Not many nowadays do that for me. I am no aviation expert but it feels as they kept it in the realms of reality for what is possible with modern technology even with the 6th generation plane at the beginning. Yes I would most likely watch it again but I am also thinking maybe they should stop with the second, although tempting to see another.. end on a high.

reviews.review_title: Huge disappointment. Should have spent my money and time on a different movie
reviews.content: Movie starts off with Mr perfection over 30 years later wearing a ton of hair dye and makeup. Unmarried, of course. Entire movie revolves around him training a team for an impossible mission (MI?) aerial attack on nukes via fighter jet. Cruise is constantly battling a lifetime of Gooses loss from 30 yrs ago. (Dude, you should have got therapy) constant clips throughout the film of the original Top Gun which weve already seen. Disgusted to see Kelly Mcgillis and Meg Ryan cut from film only to be replaced with another heavily hair dyed and makeuped Jennifer Connelly? Yes, we get it Mr Hollywood Producer, ones to heavy for you and one hasn't had good luck with plastic. Try doing a movie based on stripped down actual characters and what they should look like 30 years later. I'm sure their acting would speak for itself. Hell... why use Val Kilmer. He looked old enough to be your father with only 3 years of age difference. Val has had plenty of hardships over the years, but he wears it well. Oh wait, ya'll had to kill him off too after his brief debut. Watching Maverick smooching up with Jennifer Connelly looked sooo wrong. How stereotypical, and perfect and sexy everyone had to look the parts. Do we even offer good movies and storyline anymore? Or have we evolved into a society which has become so engrossed in shallowness that we dont care if we spend money on crap that will hit a regular TV channel fast. BTW this is not the real Navy. If everyone looked this good and ran this well, everyone would do 3 tours. Even the ending is reincarnation of the original. Girl at car scene, boy takes off with girl. Not much imagination there, is there?. Please, don't think about a 3rd sequel. The second was bad enough. The 3 stars I gave were for the performance played by Goose's son Rooster played by Miles Teller who's acting career has definitely spiked and caught the attention of many.

I had high hopes about this film because I like the first Top Gun and after reading very high score reviews. When watching on 4K bluray I was impressed by only one thing, the amazing low altitude flying in F18 Hornet by Tom Cruise. This was also the only good about the film and the rest felt cliche, predicable and the flashbacks to the first movie felt forced. It did not have anything adding to the story with the copy of "Great balls of fire" singing and beach volleyball playing other than showing some flashbacks to Goose which you get anyway from time to time. The love story felt thin without any tension and the "Iceman" scenes where dull and boring. Then when the mission starts it starts to be very unrealistic. One single aircraft carrier without supporting fleet is sent to a noname "terrorist state" to attack a nuclear storage in the mountains. Nearby there is an airfield with some Russian/China looking 5th generation fighters mixed with some old F14 Tomcats. Why any terrorist state would have that strange fleet of aircrafts flying is beyond understanding. If it were old MIG-29 it would have made more sense but the F14's where thrown in only so that Tom Cruise could capture and fly one of them. The entire film is focused on Tom Cruise and 90% of the story is made up only so he can show flying skills and some acting. The rest of the actors are forgettable without any remembering one-liners or acting that was the joy of the first Top Gun movie. Even the music is best when the old songs are played. Hans Zimmer does some good synth programming which sounds like outtakes from Inception or The Rock. If you like to see Tom Cruise flying F18, F14, P-51 Mustang and riding Kawasaki GPZ and Ninja motorcycle this movie is great but it does not hold for an over 2 hour long movie.

If you hate unrealistic things and cliches then this is not for you. Otherwise you can enjoy loads of nostalgia, roar of fighter jets and good feeling through the whole movie which is just as long as it should be.

Well. Maybe it was fun. But I was shocked by a lot of the imagery, seeming like movies in the 60's with posters at the background of the actors. Also Ed Harris' copy of his entrance at the base, as in "The Rock" (1996) was laughable. Not to mention his imitation of U2's Bono in "Beautiful Day" as Maverick flew over him. So cheesy.The acting is rather loosely done, they seem to have fun. Like they were doing some exam at the local acting school. Maybe Charles Parnell played rather good. John Hamm certainly didn't convince me.It did put a smile on my face when Cruise entered that pub after that first testflight at Mach 10. But god, his make-up was truly bad.The gratefulness of Rooster towards Maverick after granting him wingman, doesn't fit Roosters exaggerated remorse mentioned earlier.By the way, this whole flick leaded to a so called "clash" with the "enemy"? Who was the enemy? The enemy hasn't been mentioned one time during the film. The audience solely has seen one or two pilots with tinted glasses behind a yoke.And, after crashing on enemy ground (never seen such fake snow..), just taking two enemy jets from a hangar AND ultimately win the battle?Oh, come on America.

reviews.review_title: Better than the original and definitely worth the wait!
reviews.content: I was a 7 year old kid when Top Gun came out and the movie was the reason why I dreamed to be a fighter pilot! Waited 36 years for the sequel and I am telling you it's definitely worth it! I now understand why Tom Cruise wanted to release it in the big screen and not to any streaming platform and I 100% recommend to watch in theaters! The movie gave the fans what they are expecting plus more surprises and in my opinion the sequel is better than than the first. Highly recommended!
If I understand correctly, this movie is about a "special military operation" by the USA to a sovereign "hostile" country, right? It sounds somewhat familiar...
Proud grad of Top Gun. It's a great movie. Hits all the notes, nostalgia and present. Flying is amazing. Cruise is an old-school movie star. Go. See it.

Not a fan of this movie. Tom once again fakes poorly thought a nother unrealistic movie. Did it need to be made......NO it did not. Yawn! But it's better than anything marvel has s*** out in a couple years.

Well this re-assures me that there are so many movie-watchers/amateur film critics & professional ones.. that are either completely blind or just have no real idea what constitutes a 'Great Film'.. I seen trailers & possibly over 50 reviews/opinions from various different sources absolutely 'Hero-Worship' this movie.. so yep... this I was the other day and see it for Rent so I streamed it for me & my big brother.. - by the way we both Loved the first Top Gun movie therefore pretty excited to be entertained next cpl of hours watching this second...2hours or so later.. Was NOT Impressed...! Yeah had same old clichés same old story same old God Dam Planes... WTF... at least they could of used F22 or F35s... and story was like some-one just got a College Media&films Student go copy & paste script/story-line from original film and hoped no one noticed...!I mean WTF.. yeah Tom was Tom blah blah Blah.. nothing new or exciting just run of the mill re-do..People behind this film should be ASHAMED OF THEMSELVES...Wasnt Terrible but completely Forgettable.

If you are a 49 year old child like me, you will find the flight scenes outstanding and I have to admit to sitting through most of them grinning like a Cheshire cat. Even though the mission scenes are almost a straight rip of the death Star assault from Star Wars, they are brilliantly done. The dialogue however is another matter. If it was meant as a tongue in cheek homage to 80s cheesy blockbusters, it achieved its remit. If not, I really don't know what they were thinking. I tried desperately hard just to enjoy it but I have to say, when I wasn't grinning at the flying, I was cringing at the script. Take your brain out and enjoy. It is what it is.

reviews.review_title: I can't believe I stopped a Tom Cruise movie 60% in...
reviews.content: What in the holy heck did I just watch...This is not a movie. This is an exercise in how to make a really really bad sequel for the sole purpose of cashing in.What's with all the re-make scenes. Why? What's with all the eye rolling bad lines. Why? What's with all the cheesy overacting close-ups. Why?I have more 'why's' in the first 30 minutes than I have ever had in my entire 45 years of watching movies.Sorry Tom. Love ya, but this one was really bad.

Better than the first one. I am one of those people who usually hate sequels and went to see this reluctantly but still hopeful and optimistic. It exceeded all expectations and will be the top grossing film of 2022. Phenomenally written cast and executed. Can't wait for it to be out so I can add it to my collection.

reviews.review_title: A strong reboot, but misses the mark on being epic!
reviews.content: I thought the film was good but it was missing most of the iconic music score from the first film (Danger Zone, Playing with the boys, Take My Breath Away etc). I can guess the volleyball song just didn't fit the new narrative and mixed gender squad, but loosing 'Danger Zone' was a missed opportunity.They rehashed many key scenes from the original movie (Here are some): Carrier aircraft launch opening scene, volleyball game, piano (Great Balls Of Fire), motorbike runway ride past scene, Maverick & love interest on motorcycle, new take on the "You can be my wingman anytime moment" at the end etc.I personally found most of the pilots (Inc Miles Teller) were lacking in charisma, the chemistry between Tom & Jennifer also wasn't there despite both being great actors (You just cant act chemistry, it's there or its not).Kudos however for the use of practical movie effects and action scenes, the quality of this over CGI is appreciated and noticed.Despite some negatives this film came together and was mostly a good movie but not epic. In a era where most movies are average at best this was a bright light and stands out, but it doesn't really warrant its IMDB 8.6/10 score but its definitely a solid 6/10 (Above average).

An all American shmaltz fest, with obligatory weak, cliche riddled plot, donut dialogue, and a multitude of white teeth to keep a popcorn factory busy for a decade.The OTT dogfight action sequences seemed to have been lifted from some teenage video game, with predictable all-American outcomes that fell well short of the George Lucas brilliance in early Star Wars zap 'em ups. I'm sure these would have had the audience ducking and diving on the more immersive big-screen but, on TV, these lacked thrust and never really took off. That said, they were the highlight of a movie that regulary ejected a plethora of lowlights which parachuted down into the vast mire of a stodgy, US cornfield.

If you enjoyed the original "Top Gun" this follow-on piece will not disappoint you. It ticks all the boxes of expectation. It is an audiovisual feast and loud. The air-to-air sequences shone. - to be seen on the big screen and not at home through a TV display and tinny audio system. However, I will let a copy and paste of a facebook post convey just how much it meant to someone other than this reviewer. If anyone who reads this review and has the effective means to do so, could they take it upon themselves to convey this young guy's gratitude to Tom Cruise and the producers, please do so.QUOTE:
----------------------------------------------------------Dylan Harrison-Brady.Bush Flyers Down Under
·
Hi aviators. Me again..So after loosing Dad to his crash and missing a lot of things since, today, I put on my flight jacket and snuck Dads ashes into the Cinema with me so we could watch TOP GUN MAVERICK together. We were both so so keen to see it when it was announced in 2019, Alas Covid... and Loosing Dad. BUT it was well worth the wait..Mavericks was everything I wanted it to be, and Everything I needed it to be. If you haven't seen it yet, do it. If you have, and you have seen my posts about loosing Dad, You will know all the moments I cried, laughed and jumped out my seat and cheered like a idiot.. in the middle of a packed! Cinema.It was truly what I needed... Weird how today was also the 2year anniversary since I last saw Dad in person at the WA boarder.We met up to give him the Dragonfly Viking we built and he could finish it in quarantine for us to fly. Still shattered that he will never get to be my wingman, but its interesting how I ask for his help often like "Talk to me Dad"...
Anyway. Safe flying aviators 🙂P. S. If Anyone knows how to or has contacts of contacts to get this message to Tom Cruise. I want to say thank you too him. I didn't know needed this movie. Even without all the emotion I have, best action movie ever! 🙂
----------------------------------------------------

I like the movie but the love story feels like an add-on. His love interest has no real agency or role to play in the story. She does not help him to become a better man. She is just an icon. Her only function is to be his lover. That is not enough to make me care for her or their relationship.Also, the plot feels too mechanical. The team becomes a team too fast without overcoming real difficulties in their relationships. And there is the idea that you only have to learn all the steps like in a video game and everything is going to be fine. Something feels wrong about that idea.

Immediately moves towards the top of the greatest Tom Cruise movies list! Everything about this movie was great and well thought out. If you even liked the first one then you'll absolutely love this one!

Wow!If you want speed.. you've got it! Top Gun - Maverick romps along at pace and sees our Mav lead a team of the Best Of the Best on a mission to rid the world of an unnamed rogue states nuclear material whilst battling his inner guilt at the loss of Mother Goose and rekindling his relationship with a certain Admirals daughter when he's not going ballistic in his jet plane.Tom is excellent again in what is probably his most iconic role. He's matured but has not lost that rebellious, give authority "the bird" streak which earned him the Maverick moniker.In some ways, the human actors play second fiddle to the planes and there are some simply stunning live action flight sequences. I read somewhere that TC wanted to put the audience in the cockpit with him, and the film does just that, you really get a sense of the speed of flying along at Mach 10 with your pants on fire!There's plenty of nods to the 80s classic throughout and as a fan of that movie, was not at all disappointed by this one so I'd recommend you select zone 5 and get down to you local cinema on the double!
The sequel that wasn't needed delivered way past expectations. It's a heart tugging, heart pounding afterburner ride! Treat yourself and go watch it now.

MC = Main CharacterSo the amount of plot holes and stupidity were insane.Hard to take it seriously, if they intentionally make it harder for themselvesThe MC always disobey orders, that's alright.The superiors are dumb..So, Imagine having the US Navy, imagine having many planes,
but only using a few.Half of the plane crew were just display for 5 minutes.Only 1 ship shot missiles, the other 3 just stood.Why only the airport?Can't you try to hit those AA guns?If the target is so important, why not handle it with more force?And I have no clue how the enemy got such OP planes, but the mc managed to outplay them.MC rolls in snow, next scene he just changed clothes, while running.Buddy comes to resque but forgot about the height rule in a flat surface.So they managed to fly with that old plane, but the enemy had no idea of that?

If you forget teh last quarter of the movie, it's really good, for today Hollywood standards. It's proven (again) that Cruise can't make a bad movie.Soundtrack ( Gaga) is nowhere close to the original.

Why are they drivning motorbike without helmets? , why are all the pilots so arogant?, why are they flying so dangerous (stupid) in exercice? Why is there an pretty girl working in the bar?Why oh why did they do top gun 2??? Tom cant be happy about this movie.Lets be honest. The first movie was good. But it's an old movie and most of the movies from back then you shouldn't watch again. Let their just be some good memories. I don't understand why they did an number 2? The dialog is so bad and i am not sure this movie is for real or if this is an satire? So please, explain why some one is giving this movie an 10? What is so good about this movie?

reviews.review_title: Great sequel with amazing never seen action scenes
reviews.content: If Matrix 4 showed how a sequel is done very badly, decades after it's original, then Top Gun 2 showed how it's really done. It takes everything what we liked about the first movie and combines it with a modern setting and filming technology. The action scenes are superb and you never have seen such immersion in a movie. They take you right into the cockpit and it's just a bliss to look at and displays even more than the first movie, how amazing these people are who fly those jets and what it takes to do so. The great lack of CGi (it's still in there) is very welcoming, as most movies rely only on that today. It takes you back to old action movies and how these were done. You notice immediately it's real action and you also see how better real action is to look at. Beside that, not much needs to be said about the other stuff, as it's just like the old movie, only that time passed. It's basically what Star Wars 7 and Matrix 4 did, but way better. It's not even a bad thing it being almost a 1:1 copy, as it just takes the old formula to another level and slightly mixes it up a little. I liked all the references to the old movie and all the cheesiness. It's just what makes Top Gun be so fun and good. Fast machines, macho behavior, flight training, beach fanservice, flight action and so on. Things I definitely wanted to see as a fan and I didn't get disappointed at all. It definitely takes you back to the old days but let's you stay in todays time without feeling bad or disappointed like other movies did. Even without being a fan, it's well worth a watch as the action scenes alone make it so worth it. Absolute recommendation for any action fan. Tom did go to unbelievable lengths yet again. If you thought Mission Impossible Fallout was already amazing with it's action scenes then Maverick is even more amazing.

reviews.review_title: High octane action with a story full of heart.
reviews.content: It was the day of my birth when the original TopGun found it's theatrical release and oh boy have we waited patiently for this one.The movie kicks it up to almost 11 in the first five minutes and it truly sets the pace for the movie, and it doesn't skip a beat. 36 years later and the same bell can be heard pulling you back in and keeping Ng you engaged.It has rip roaring, high octane aerial combat sequences as you'd expect but you can tell the actors were put through their paces here.All in all it never stops giving and pays plenty of homage to the original while flying very close to the sun.In my honest opinion I'm giving this a 9.8 out of 10 and you should watch this with the biggest and beast sound system you can as everything about this movie fly's high.

reviews.review_title: Hollywood Is Tom Cruise And Tom Cruise Is Hollywood
reviews.content: This is the best aviation movie. Best If Seen On IMAX Screen. Again I would say Tom Cruise Is like fine old wine getting better with time. After watching Top Gun just waiting for the Mission Impossible that's going to be more intense. First I was not expecting this movie to be such a hit but after watching the movie i fell in love with it. Tom Cruise is doing things so gracefully in each movie I'm just out of words I don't understand how to praise him what an actor he is superb awesome loved it. Now i want to be a fighter pilot but let's just save it for the next life. Must Watch Must Watch. Adios.

I'm a fan of the original Top gun movie and i like TC as an actor. And This movie had great action scenes, but the characters were as flat as if it was a beer commercial. I had high expectations due to all the high ratings so i was i bit surprised at the end. Was it a bad movie? No it wasn't. But does it deserve the high ratings it got? No definitely not. The story, dialogue and character development was next to nothing and all the nostalgia consisted of scenes directly copied from the original movie. Sometimes even the dialogue was a direct copy paste and it still feldt more like a mission impossible movie than a top gun movie, so a 6/10 for me.

reviews.review_title: Top Gun is back better then ever!
reviews.content: Watched this movie many times growing up with my father and seeing the sequel as a grown man myself was exciting enough but once the movie started I was blown away! It's over 2 hours long and it went by so fast and it's so incredibly intense and perfectly filmed! Tom Cruise killed it again as Maverick of course, but Miles Teller and Jennifer Connelly were incredible as well along with the rest of the cast! 10/10 the summer blockbuster we deserved on the big screen!

reviews.review_title: Enjoy your ride to the danger zone.
reviews.content:
Top Gun: Maverick
Is the definition of a summer blockbuster.That's at least how I would describe it in a single sentence.The film centers around Maverick confronting decisions of his past that will allow him to choose his future. Around that center is flying, cocky pilots, dog fighting, shirtless beach scenes, and a bit of romance. All of which I'd say are a requirement for any Top Gun sequel.I found it to be a refreshing blockbuster that's not based off of comic book source material. Though, the title character Maverick is essentially Captain America in a fighter jet.It's impossible to discuss this movie without touching on Tom Cruise. Love him or hate him, you will be hard pressed to name a more iconic star of American cinema of the last 40 years. His star power and talent is on full display here.It's patriotic, American, and will undoubtedly boost recruitment numbers for the Navy. If you're desiring an artisanal film or perhaps something more ambiguous in nature, then keep looking. If however you're craving a quintessential summer blockbuster then "Top Gun: Maverick" is an excellent choice. Enjoy your ride to the danger zone.

I, traditionally, am not a Tom Cruise fan. As a matter of fact, I WANTED to hate the movie. But this movie gets you from the start and manages to hold you all the way through. Somehow you like Tom, ok love (but don't tell) him. They have done a phenomenal job with a movie that fans will never tire of. The flight scenes were edge-of-the-seat thrilling as well as funny when the flyers stomachs were churning. MUSIC? Lady Gaga puts the dot on the exclamation point with the song closing out the movie. But the photography was really spectacular. When Tom was looking off into space with that dreamy Tom-look, you could still see what was behind him, like photography was really important. The entire movie had a dreamy-calm to the background while ripping into you with speed. It is nice to see a film that you can take the kids to and really enjoy yourself.
Well, this movie is the most expensive propaganda movie ever made. American people should be proud.I only give this piece of boring propaganda 6 stars because of old good Tom Cruise.

In memory of Tony Scott (1944-2012), Tom Cruise, Jerry Bruckheimer and Joseph Kosinski shape the essence from the 1986 'Top Gun' original from the opener.'Maverick' is a joy ride for those who believe in a greater cause. The emotions are superbly well set throughout the two-hour editorial.There is plenty of flight action scenes and the showdown in a dazzling under-radar, no-fly-zone canyon keeps the audience in awe and excitement.But the most impressive scenes, I find to be 'Tom Cruise' reconnecting with his first major-movie-hit from the 1980s on any scale - human and professionally.08/10.

I'm a fanboy of the original TopGun movie. I watched it probably over 100 times (seriously). Inspired my love of aviation. So many epic scenes.Top Gun Maverick... just doesn't cut it. Fake fake fake fake. Come on... how can people be going on about it the way they are... I won't include any spoilers but I think people should dampen their expectations.

reviews.review_title: The best Sequel to a movie in sequel movie history!!
reviews.content: I rarely ever review movies on IMDB or anywhere, but i have felt that I need to put a review for Top Gun Maverick after watching it in theaters on it's Premiere on the 24th of May.It is an incredible movie with an excellent story and so many easter eggs to the first Top Gun !For any movie, action movie, TOP Gun Movie, or Aviation Fan, this is a MUST.Tom Cruise has done an incredible job putting this movie together, i have always been a fan of the original Top Gun but this sets the bar higher, much higher.What a great movie, can't wait to watch it again.
A blockbuster for the braindead! Horrible, gave it a 5 just for the action scenes. No characters, simplistic story, dumb humor, below average acting.Everything was sooooo predictable.....

reviews.review_title: did we just watch US commiting a war crime to a foreign country and being fine with it? :)
reviews.content:
Movie was great, no doubt but question:
Is not lunching hundreds Tomahawks on a base (killing scientist btw) and destroying planes on a foreign territory constituting a declaration of war? :)Still a great movie too. Safe writing choice. Perfect action, sound design, Tom is excellent, nice and smart integration of Val Kilmer to the story.On the minus side: The love story is useless, we don't believe in their relationship.The weird reluctance of Goose's son against Maverick. Mean, he was a child, there's no reason for such a hate.Jon Hamm is underused. A bit of writing regarding the rogue nation - from a US standpoint - would have added bit more consistency to the movie. Cause here, it's not more than a plane rodeo, nice one but only that.

Murica fanboying. Average at best, basically a fairytale, simpistic and also toxicly masculine. Though thr older actors have some good plastic surgeons as it was pointed out by my gf.YVAN EHT NOIJ.Also the end is basically SW A New Hope.

I love Tom Cruise and Miles Teller and Jon Hamm. "Top Gun: Maverick" is watchable because they're in it. Otherwise, it's U. S. Armed Forces porn and propaganda. The Oscar nominations are likely deserved for sound, editing, and visual effects. But best screenplay? Yes, there likely was one, I'll give them that. But surely there was at least one that was better than this. And then there's best picture. I think the word "best" must mean something different to me.Watching Maverick riding super-fast on his motorcycle, too macho to wear a helmet, is exciting when he's in his 20s, but when he's over 60-years-old? Kind of sad.

I usually refrain from writing movie reviews because imo this is as subjective as reviewing a music album but here we go.The first Top Gun movie was the first time I got to see movie on my own. It was 1986 and I was 12 years old.During TG:M for those two hours I was this 12 year old boy again and it's a great action movie. It's loud. Intense. Emotional. Funny. Cheesy. Whatever. I don't go watch this kind of flick to see realistic maneuvers and I don't question the script. I wanna be entertained and damn straight it was entertaining. For all you guys who want to be a kid again go and see it.

In the age of CGI and green screen cinematography, top gun II brings back old school filmmaking with stunts that are as real as it gets. The story and screenplay are kept clean to allow the flying sequences and action stunts to do most of the talking on the screen. All the supporting cast is near, precise and clean. The ending is really good and unexpected as you start thinking of different scenarios while the movie enters the climax sequence. I wish more actors and directors would go back to old school films where audience are not overdosed with CGI and chroma keying. If you loved top gun 1, I can guarantee that you will love this even more. I also think Tom Cruise will not do one more top gun in this lifetime.
Nice big slab of double cheese, which I can only guess the filmaker was going for, also entirely predictable, but enjoyable at the same time. The action scenes are quite fantastic. Would recommend.

Best film I've seen in years. Must be seen in the cinema. Tom Cruise was superb. A wonderful mix of action and emotion. Surely to be another classic of our generation whilst still being a lovely tribute to the original.

I gave this film 6/10 strictly and only because of the aerial photography! And for the sheer talent of the real life Pilots who flew in the film.Even 98% of the bombing mission looked liked it been copied from The Bridges of Toko - Ri with William Holden! Which is a better film! And better acted!They copied just about everything from the first film, and not in a good way.We were guessing what was about to happen long before it happened.Poor script, poor acting. To much copying went on of the first film, literally.Very disappointed. It is 2 hours we will never get back.Why Tom Why ?
Fantastic movie. Entire plot, cinematography, actors, direction every maneuvering of those badass jets keeps you engrossed. It's better than first part. Experience it in nothing but IMAX if you can.

reviews.review_title: Could've been one of the greatest movie of the 20'
reviews.content: Excellent aeronautical movie. Accurate, tough, fast-paced, expertly used 40 years of advancements in movie-making to celebrate the old 1986 movie.BUTit carries around the burdensome weight of that terrible plot. Can't believe anyone has been payed for that.
36 Years of top gun I feel so cool with it I feel really enjoy i lovethe movie script There's no mistake for me but just feel that 9 is ok ...............

As soon as it started I had a big smile on my face when I heard that familiar soundtrack. There were lots of nods to the original. Tom Cruise looks amazing in it. Could not say one bad word against it. I'm a big fan of the first film so was a little apprehensive about watching it. It did not disappoint, I absolutely loved it.

The movie was amazing! I loved the cast and how they tied elements from the first movie. To me this was as good or even better than the first movie. I don't want to spoil it for anybody but bring tissues!!! 😊😢

Just finished watching this at the cinema.This is cinema, this is filmmaking, this is entertainment, this is art, this is a heartbreak, this is a joy, this is coldness, this is warmth, this is old, this is new, this is emotional, this is nostalgic, this is modern, this is classic, this is a film that will touch u in a personal way, this is a film that will bring you down and lift you up, this is a film that can fire a missile into your own personal struggles, this is what you want and this is what you need.This is cinema and if there's one film or films that will save cinema especially after covid then top gun maverick is one of them.THIS IS ITThank you to the immensely inspirational legend mr tom cruise and everyone involved in making this event.

I've been referring to IMDB reviews for years but had to create an account just to write something myself for Top Gun Maverick!The movie is absolutely amazing, it delivered in all the right categories - nostalgia, cinematography, writing, storyline & of course, the cast! The cast & their chemistry was beautiful.There's a great piece at the very beginning that is very familiar & a real treat for all Top Gun fans. I was literally on the edge of my seat from the scene 1 to when the credits rolled. It's that good & it was very refreshing. The jets, the technology today & how they shot the sequences were amazing & felt very real.This movie is a perfect 10/10 in every way. It's apolitical & there is no signaling at all, which unfortunately has become rare in movies/Hollywood these days. So it was nice to escape reality for a while & enjoy a great movie, a follow-up to a very dear film from the wonderful era of the 80s! Enjoy!

Man, Haven't seen such a good movie in a very long time!Loved every second of it from the very start till the very last second.What also makes this movie unique is that everything is on point. The story, music picks, production, the tiny details .. everything is almost perfect.

reviews.review_title: The still do make them like they used to
reviews.content: This movie was an absolute blast. If you're getting tired of the usual run-of-the-mill blockbuster this is the movie for you.Thoroughly entertaining from beginning to end I really had no complaints. There were no forced messages or plots just pure fun and I'm all for it.Arguably better than its predecessor Top Gun Maverick is full of spectacular stunt work and has to have been my favourite theatre experience of the last few years I even made an IMDb account just to leave this review.
One of the best movie I have ever seen! Fans of the original will enjoy this one tremendously. Maverick is a total package that manages to sore higher than it's predecessor!

I loved it. I'm no Tom Cruise fan but I can truly think of no one better for the job. His performance is priceless. The movie, on the whole, is believable; the script well-written, suspense created and kept, direction: good, pace: good. I like the drama feel too because it wasn't overly done so it felt real. The cast was a good fit as well. I hope other movie makers will take this film and learn from it, because there's a lot of crap being made.THANKS FOR THIS FILM! I will watch it again.

reviews.review_title: Terrible storyline but great flying scenes
reviews.content: Storyline was mediocre... why did they have to have a romantic angle again for Cruises character? That took WAY too much away from other more interesting individual characters. SO Boring and although I totally get that cruise would be character lead, why does he have to save the day...again? And again? IMO just too much cruise and not enough focus on other characters.

What an awesome movie!Never have I seen a sequel beat the original like this does (and I have watched the original many times I could not even count it haha) but also where I have been to the cinema 3 times to watch a movie as it is that good! We were still as excited that we were going to see it again!Can see why there was a big hype to see it in the cinema as diffirent experience from watching it at home on the TV (although I still think would be fab!)
Even watching the 3rd time I had the same emotions as the first and it so gets you gripped! The flying scenes are epic and there are some really funny scenes too! And cannot forget the music!One of THE best I have seen and honestly would have gone back again to see it if was still on!

reviews.review_title: Loved it just a shame it took so long
reviews.content: Loved the movie it was a perfect salute to the original movie. I'm old enough to be a huge fan of the first movie.
