I just wish there had been a follow up much sooner to fill in the gap with some of the original cast members involved and then this version.I want to see it again in IMAX next time.
When you thought Topgun couldn't be "topped". Edge of your seat action, Bondesque humour, great characters and ties up the whole story brilliantly. It's that good I'm going to see it again.

I thought it was gonna be a so-so movie but really enjoyed it.. amazing work by Tom Cruise.Really like the way the director told the story and how it the story was connected with the previous movieTom did an amazing job which i didnt expected to be honest, his previous movie was really good and thought this one was gonna be something theyre gonna make in order to sell tickets, but this second part of Top gun was really goodWhat do tyou think about the movie ?Cruise, who took up acting in high school, made his film debut in Endless Love (1981). He had supporting roles in such movies as Taps (1981) and The Outsiders (1983) before starring as a high-school senior who turns his parents' home into a brothel in Risky Business (1983).5 ago 2022.

Top Gun is a different film, they mix many aspects to do the film, using old aspects, new productions, old actors, new actors, and this made a very different film.Top Gun successful film made in the 80's and in 2022 they decided to do Top Gun 2 using the old actors like Tom Cruise as Maverick, Jennifer Connelly as Penny Benjamin, and Val Kilmer as Iceman, they used the general history too, but with modern technology, some new important actors like Miles Teller as Bradley 'Rooster' Bradshaw and a different plot.In this story the principal, Maverick, was called for his old friend Iceman of top gun, the school for the best pilots of airplanes, to make a work.Maverick had to command a team to do a very difficult mission and the commanders made a plan and in this plan the team would complete the mission but this plan had little chance of continuing alive. Maverick didn't like this and he decided to do a new plan and in his plan they have more chances to be alive, but the mission is very, very difficult.The commanders didn't like Maverick's idea, but Iceman, the leader of leaders, approved the idea of his friend.Maverick didn't have much time to train his team and he had a conflict with rooster because rooster's dad was the duo of Maverick in the past, but he died as a pilot with Maverick.This is a very emotional film because Maverick has many conflicts with the team, his old girlfriend Penny, the commanders and the time.This film has a very good production, and compared with top gun 1, top gun 2 has so many battles and effects, and it makes a better film, because when the plane explodes the effects make us feel like the plane really exploded. And analyzing the plot, this film has a more interesting plot and with more surprises, principally in the final, when Maverick is alone at the island full of enemies and Rooster go back to help him and they escape from the island, the audience think that the conflict are resolved, but in the way back home they had another problem, and this surprize the audience a lot.Concluding, this is a new film based on an old film, but with a better production and a better plot. Additionally, this is a film with many surprises, so you can't say the finale of history if you don't watch it. Thats a nice film for everyone who likes action movies.

reviews.review_title: Reprising the old into a new ...
reviews.content: I expected a lot from the new movie. Yes it has its moments but most of the ideas are from the old original movie, like volleyball on the beach, goose's son singing on the bar.Fight sequences were very good. Patriotic is the movie. But does it surpass the original?Absolutely not. The guys who have written it surpasses the original do not even understand the first movie, which is a classic, which creates a legend, who creates a hero with a heart.Can't say too much but not disappointed but not at all impressed.
Simply amazing. Way better than the first one. The originality of the film speaks volumes. Great cinematography. I wont be surprised if it did well at the next years Academy Awards.

reviews.review_title: Brilliant sequel well worth a watch
reviews.content: Really enjoyed it, it's a film that probably won't be as good on the small screen definitely need to go the cinema for the full effect. If anyone can answer how maverick ejects from the test plane at Mach 10 and survives I'd love to know haha.

I walked into the theater with no expectations as usually the sequels dont do any justice, but boy i was wrong, i literally had goosebums to the sound of those jets, the director has done justice by not digging much in the past and followed a good story telling bringing the old and the new together. Tom cruise what can we say about this guy, he has been amazing in the past and he continues to smash it in this movie.Make sure to watch in IMAX, you wont regret a bit, i was almost held back everytime the jet sounds came onGood movie in a while:)

reviews.review_title: Exactly what I was looking for..
reviews.content: This movie is fantastic. It paid all the respects to the previous film but did not have to rely on it. I am taking 1 star off, and that is because I thought the last fight scene could have had some more dog fighting with the whole group like the end of the first movie.

reviews.review_title: Top Ham: Mayonnaise ### SPOILER! FIRST 30 MINUTES ONLY###
reviews.content: Tom Cruise is back as an older smugger Mayonnaise who, hasn't matured, gotten a promotion, or learned a thing since the original Top Ham. In the first 10 minutes, our "hero" directly disobeys orders, willfully destroys an experimental military jet by trying to turn the volume up to Mach 11, and impossibly survives a Mach 10.3 ejection. Rattled but completely unscathed, Mayonnaise appropriately finds himself in a roadside diner where he charmingly snatches a glass of water off a waitress' tray because exploding in the sky makes a hero thirsty.For his rebellious sabotage, Mayonnaise is punished just as the real U. S. military punishes-he is demoted from experimental test pilot to Top Ham instructor of an elite group of Junior Top Hams. Our entitled hero reluctantly accepts the severe punishment and manages to suppress a tantrum which we know he is capable of.Next, we are introduced to the most culturally diverse, whitewashed cast that this film's audience will tolerate. A co-ed fraternal order of affirmative action light, a.k.a. Mayonnaise's students. We make shallow acquaintance with these one-dimensional characters in a roadhouse-style Air Force bar that is conveniently owned by one of our hero's ex flings, Penny Benjamin. In this passive aggressive scene, Penny playfully extorts a bar tab out of Mayonnaise as revenge for past harms inflicted on her while the youngsters ostracize him for the crime of being old in America. Penny rings a bell three times and the Junior Hams gleefully throw the old geezer out on the ground. The whole scene plays out with the synthetic warmth of a Norman Rockwell illustration.The next day, the Junior Hams are introduced to their instructor. From the expressions on their faces, we see that they regret mistreating Mayonnaise. Not because it is wrong to disrespect the elderly, but because they are now in a position where they can be punished. Training begins and Mayonnaise predictably spanks all the toddlers via dog fight simulations and push-up contests.At this point, while holding back laughter and vomit, I chose to salvage the rest of my evening by revisiting the box office. Refund for Top Ham and re-ticket for a different movie. Always request a refund for unwatchable movies, so they don't profit from you. Vote with your dollars.There is a huge market for movies like this, and there are plenty of them. Many become top box office draws. I'm glad they exist, because every audience should have a movie that they can relate to. I'm just sick of hearing right-wing media complain about leftist Hollywood when what feels like a majority of theatrical releases glorify right-wing ideology. Hollywood is the Olive Garden of entertainment. Endless breadsticks, salad, and blandness. Patrons of Hollywood blockbusters and the Olive Garden vote with their dollars. It's the one true and pure universal freedom. The rest is all BS. Amen!

This is the movie I have been missing for so many years, not realizing I needed it.Best movie I have seen for many years. It's true to the first movie and is with out doubt the best sequel I have ever seen.
Just when you think they can't get any better, absolutely brilliant film potentially up there with my top 3 favourite films and that was hard to beat. But truly amazing.

First off...I love Tom Cruise films!Went into the cinema bursting with excitement after readying the reviews.I was expecting a bit of cheese in the film, but fresh cheese...ended up getting a stale stinking Bishop!Prepare for no surprises...no shocks...no suspense.EVERYTHING is predictable and sadly as you are expecting.The script...wow!Or should I say what script...I think the writers have to sharpen their crayons and finish school.The flying scenes were good...but again didn't live up to the hype.Yes they were in there, flying...but again...no surprises.All in all I was a bit disappointed and have to say bored!When going to watch this movie, leave your brains and expectations at the door and you will enjoy it more.I have high hopes for the new Mission Impossible movie though 🤞

Per 10 USC 8323, 10 USC 1370, OPNAVINST 1811.3A, the entire basis of the movie is wrong. US Navy Captains (O6) are forced to retire after 30 years of service. Maverick was already a lieutenant when he first went to Top Gun in 1986. He would have been forced to retire around 2014. There are no Captains in the US Navy on flying status after 30 years of service, let alone sixty year old active flight instructors.Hollywood is just running out of ideas, so they rehash old material. But movies like this are successful only because they like action and don't care if it's based on reality. And the clichés are tiresome.

reviews.review_title: Mediocre Recruitment Flick with Good Final Flight Sequence
reviews.content: The movie has a great final flight action sequence. But that is the only saving grace. The rest of the movie is just a corny drawn-out cliche with copy-pasted characters.It's also a blatant recruitment advertisement. If you join the navy, you'll work with cool looking dudes, good looking women, bad ass military hardware and you'll get the girl.You'll have some fun but ultimately it's completely forgettable.

reviews.review_title: Tom's memoir in his acting life
reviews.content: Tom tried to reflect how he love aviation, his love to be a movie star, and the 36 years waiting to create what his true passion to the acting life. Cry a lot for so many contexts to honor the first Top gun, and just like what Tom said in the feature interview. The technology in this generation can make his imagination come true for all these years' waiting finally. A truly great sequel, and thanks Tom to tribute his life to the movie industry. Thx!
ANYONE that's a fan of the original will enjoy Top Gun Maverick! I loved it! The tribute it shows to Top Gun are spot on. Do yourself a favor see it on the big screen.

reviews.review_title: This is why you go to the theatre
reviews.content: Haven't had this much fun at the theatre in a long time. Such a good sequel and hits every high note. Dare I say better than the original. I appreciate how much work went into this movie..well done.
The pot, characters, script, directing.The whole movie reminded me of the Death Star run made by Luke and the rebels. Drawn out over the whole film, it was bad.

I know I am in the minority here, but this movie was mediocre, at best. The original movie had chemistry, action and a plot that flowed. With this remake, it felt like they sat at a table and said "We have to have these elements from the original included" and then they tried to build the story around it. The result was a jumpy, uneven movie. In fact, I was so bored, I actually started checking my watch 40 minutes into the movie and kept groaning when I realized how much longer I had to go.Here were my biggest disappointments (MAJOR SPOILERS AHEAD):1) Too many of the plot lines were plucked from the original and too many of the flashback scenes seemed forced. The scene in the bar where the students throw him out of the bar, only to learn the next day that he is their instructor? Pretty much a rip off of the scene in the original where Maverick hits on Charley only to find out the next day that she is his instructor i Tom Cruise on his motorcycle racing the aircraft? I actually thought they had taken that footage from the original. The cocky, pretty-boy rivalry between Rooster and Hangman? That is Maverick and Iceman all over again. The love scene? I thought this was from the original as well, except with Jennifer Connolly and not Kelly McGillis. Team football on the beach? Oh, well, at least it wasn't volleyball. This is typical of Hollywood producers - if something worked in the original, let's rehash it and try to repackage it as something new and people will come to watch it because it is movie with an A-list actor. Frankly, I find this insulting that Hollywood thinks I'm so small minded that I don't know when I'm being shown the same movie in a glossy new package.2) There was much touting about the footage being more realistic this time because the actors were in the actual aircraft for the flying scenes. I am no pilot but, quite frankly, I did not feel that the realistic footage made the movie better. In fact, when I watched the original today, I was more focused on the fight scene and less concerned with the fact that the actors' faces weren't curling from the G-forces.3) The plot in the original may have been a bit of a stretch but it was still plausible. The plot in this one was completely ludicrous. The original "crisis" was far-fetched, but when they just happened to stumble on the enemy's fighter jet that they could just fly out on a destroyed runway. Really???? I know we go to the movies to be entertained with fantasy, but this is just flat-out laughable.4) Tom Cruise's ego - ALL of his movies are so ridiculously long and self-promoting. He is always the hero who can achieve the most impossible tasks. Yes, we all know you do your own stunts, Tom. You can stop trying to overcompensate for whatever it is that is driving you to seek constant adulation. It was entertaining a few years ago, but now it is quite irritating.5) Chemistry - there was NO chemistry among any of the characters. Even the Iceman/Maverick bromance seemed forced and none of the newbies seemed to click. The original characters had so much chemistry - even the ones that were minor characters - and this is what drew me into the original so much. There was so much forced banter and ribbing with this group that just seemed to fall completely flat.I am happy that many people were entertained by this because we all need some escapism right now. But, for those of you who, like me, hate when sequels are just a remake of the original, it is better to save your money and wait for this to come out on Paramount + (If Tom Cruise will ever let it.) Thanks for reading.

Pretty pathetic, full of pathos and cheesy one liners yet another Tom Cruise movie. Cruise did his usual thing, other actors were ok I guess, but the story line is dumb and boring. Val Kilmer looked ridiculous as a navy veteran.All in all you have to be really bored to watch this.

reviews.review_title: A truly epic film that you will watch many times
reviews.content: There are many references to the original film that I saw when I was in college. It is a time machine that will bring you back to the first film.A great cinematic experience. Top quality entertainment that you will watch many times over the coming years. A perfect sequel and a gift to all Top Gun fans.If you loved the first one, there's no way you won't love this one even more. It's absolutely perfect for those who saw the original in the theater and it's also great for newcomers.Overall, Top Gun: Maverick is a refreshing Hollywood blockbuster that saved Hollywood and the movie theater experience. It's a Hollywood action adventure movie in every possible way. What a terrific sequel.

Literally had me sitting at the edge of my seat.....both times watching!The live action was leaps ahead of CGI and effects... seeing their faces move from the actual G-force, was truly amazing.The cast and crew was absolutely amazing!I cant say enough good things about this movie!! Its not often the sequel is better than the original!Everyone involved in this film should be extremely proud of what they accomplished! You can tell everyone involved gave their all...bc there wasn't a single part of this film that felt slow or disconnected.I have no idea what they could possibly shoot for a 3rd movie, but I would be right back in the theater to watch!Amazing job!

One of the best films i ever saw.This one got evrything, every single moment is fascinating.Well done for that one no dout.Well scripted and dircted.Tom Cruise and Miles Teller at their very best prefomance.

Technically perfect, acting is good, as i said, nice to watch.That said, i admit that i like Tom Cruise movies, nevertheless movies like Top Gun always appear someway pathetic to me.Pathetic just because of the story, foreign country, nuclear plant to be detroyed, impossible mission, bla bla bla, i mean somehow all of this has been chewed through so many films before, after a while it feels like the stick of an ice lolly licked to death.Anyway, i do understand that, what other story could they have chosen filming an airplane-fighter-movie?A good thing is, you can watch the movie not having seen the original, even though it helps if you have an idea what happend in the original.My problem with that kind of movies remains, after Hot Shots 2 i simply can't take them seriously any more.

reviews.review_title: A pioneer in sequels to classic movies.
reviews.content: Top Gun 2 has officially done what few, if any, have done before. It is a sequel to a major classic movie that is as good if not better by an inch than the original. An endeavour that recently over the last few years, based on all the others, was thought to be impossible.It has everything you were hoping it would have and more.

reviews.review_title: Fast and Furious but with jets...
reviews.content:
Predictable shallow characters, predictable action with no regards to actual physics, predictable romance, bad editing with scenes that make absolutely no sense.Some questions:
Why did the command center screens shut down when they lost touch with the test jet at the beginning? And how did tom cruise survive that at mach 10?What's the deal with riding a motorcycle without a helmet, not even for your gf riding in the back?in what world does an enemy state have better planes and better pilots?what the hell is a Gen 5 fighter jet? Couldn't think of some smart way to label those jets?ok, i have too many of those. I felt like i watched Fast and Furious, but with jets. A ridiculous movie. Can't believe the hype and the rating here. Such a shame.

reviews.review_title: It's what you want and expect. I was entertained
reviews.content: The movie started with the cinema director thanking us all for filling up the cinema for the firste time since Covid. Some merch and drinks was given to the lucky winners in a raffle. Next, a small, but cool message from Tom Cruise, thanking us for seing the movie on the big screen. "We made this for you".Before seing the movie i avoided spoilers and trailers. I did see Top gun 1 a few days before to get in the mood. I had high hopes for Maverick.I left the cinema smiling. Maverick gave me just what i wanted. I was entertained, i laughed, i cried, i jumped in the seat, i cringed and i felt what i felt watching Top gun 1. When they wrote this script they must have done it with love for the original Top Gun movie. The discrete references and the dilaogue made me smile.Go see this movie and be entertained. Simple as that.Bravo.

I'm not sure if we watched same movie, but if you completely disconnect and do not think about idiotic plot it is entertaining.Even if you forget that this is basically a commercial for US Army, and as usual US Army is the best, the plot doesn't make any sense at all. You can use tomahawk to destroy landing strip, but not to destroy rocket launcher or the target itself, why??? Also why does the targeting system stops working like most of the time but nobody wants or needs to fix it. And flares, all the rockets missing the planes, Tom surviving all the time from impossible situations....wtf... it all loked like one the movies from Mission impossible where questions are not allowed.Is it entertaining if you disconect your mind, it is, is it dumb as he'll if you connect it, definitely it is.
I dont usually take the time to leave reviews, but Worth the 36 year wait! The aerial combat scenes were amazing! I loved it! Nostalgia with a modern spin! Just, awesome!
What an excellent movie going experience. Can't remember the last time I had this much fun watching a big budget blockbuster. Highly recommend to everyone.
What a an experience. One of the best film in the last decade.Story had heart, Characters were great.Tom Cruise did it again.The first top gun was a classic and this one won my heart.
10/10 Best movie 2022. Amazing in every aspect, tense, very good plot, action, sound, effect, all of it. Tom cruise still the best starring the maverick, cant be replace by anybody.
The movie is amazing, Tom Cruise brings back good old American movie. The actors' performance is chilling, it brings the movie lover into an immersion of emotions.

reviews.review_title: Finally a movie that deserves 10 Stars
reviews.content: It hase been an extremely long time since a true blockbuster movie has come out. Tom Cruise and the rest of the cast have done an amazing job.A film that will keep you entertained from start to end.

I was doubtful, I wasn't even sure if I wanted to watch Top gun: Maverick at all, for the reason that I watched the first part when I was 18 years old, and it didn't seem to me that the second part, after 36 years, could be nearly as good. I was wrong, it wasn't just good, but much better than the previous one. Phenomenal film, 130 minutes of pure pleasure.Tom and Val, "Danger zone", Kawasaki, jacket and sunglasses, a wonderful tribute to the previous first film. Brilliant young actors, great camera & direction, the feeling is incredible, as if you are in the cockpit with actors.I'll just say this: Fasten your seat belts, we're taking off!

This movie kept the rapt attention of my 6 year old all the way up to my retired AF colonel father in law (8 of us), my wife even liked it and that is exceedingly rare. The themes and messaging in this film were uplifting, and my kids are better for having watched it. This is a rare film in its appeal to a wide age range and its uplifting nature... thanks Tom (and crew)!The aerial footage and action scenes were stunning and the special effects blended in seamlessly. It was so fun to watch a film with my kids where everything wasn't just made up - from g-forces to starting sequences on the F14, thanks for keeping close enough to reality so that we can talk about the movie on the way home and have learned something and gained some small appreciation for our military and the men and women who serve.First and likely only review I will ever drop on IMDb, but just wanted to take a few minutes and appreciate what a great time our family had watching this movie and say thanks to everyone involved in this project!

One of Cinema's most impressive films. The passion and love for Aviation that this team have captured is truly remarkable. I would have never believed anyone could make arial combat as realistic as this film has delivered, don't think it could have been achieved without Tom and people who believed in him and his vision.

reviews.review_title: This is what we go to the theatres for!
reviews.content: This is what happens when people actually care about the movie they're making, and not just trying to profit from nostalgia.One of The best sequels.

Bland nostalgia and melodrama. Not as much a sequel as an unnecessary retread, complete with an childish 80s worldview that the good guys and bad guys are simple to identify. After 20 years of endless war, how can you take any of this seriously, or even suspend doubt for a popcorn flick?Some of the action scenes were still fun, and there were a few legitimately laugh-out-loud moments. But, the unnamed enemy was so lightly drawn as to be a parody. (We never even see their faces... who are these guys, Cobra?) The entire Penny relationship didn't add anything, either; that would've been an easy 20-30 minutes cut right there.If you loved the first one, sure, check it out. But if you didn't, don't expect a great action movie, particularly by Cruise standards.
One word..... AMAZING! I was on the edge of my seat the whole time. I was worried I would be disappointed because I was so excited to see it BUT it exceeded my expectations.
Great camera work, OK writing, decent acting, but refreshing. Refreshing to see a "clean" movie. Refreshing to see a total heterosexual movie. Refreshing.

reviews.review_title: This movie is a must watch
reviews.content:
If you haven't seen this movie, your are late!!The writing and execution is to applauded!.Laughter , checked
Tears , checked
Tension, check, check , check.

Didn't disappoint me one second. I waited this movie for a long time and it was worth the wait. Never ceases to amaze me how he held up so good over the years but the final product îs almost better than the original. Amazint scripted and amuzant executed.

reviews.review_title: Action Packed Along With Outstanding Camera Angles In The Cockpit
reviews.content: Usually sequels are nothing compared to the original, but in this case I'd have to contradict myself on that one.This film was a visual masterpiece. Action packed, intense, with blood curling scenes and compelling camera angles. The soundtracks bonded perfectly with the movie and really made you feel as though you were living through the entire thing. The acting was immense and Tom Cruise really enjoyed himself I could tell.The film editing... what can I say. Eddie Hamilton is truly a one of a kind at what he does and it's by no chance that he took over such a film. He is built for these kinds of movies and hopefully he'll always be editing the types as well.And last but not least... Joseph Kosinski.... Truly I don't think that any other director could have done a better job. Directing was spot on. This film is a real gem.Everyone should watch this movie. 100% recommended.

I do not understand the raves as this one is fairly predictable. Some of the plane Stunt and trick scenes were cool the first time or two, then they became repetitive.I had high expectations for this one but... another Mediocre movie for 2022.Probably a good movie for a teenager. I give it a 7 because it could inspire young people to became pilots.

Does this movie only remind me of Star Wars? Flying through the canyon, a single shot, air defense along the canyon. This is direct plagiarism, they are preparing the rebels for the destruction of the Death Star, etc. Only the main character is a little old.
Went to see Dr Strange and the fighter plane trailer for the training sequence was much better than in the movie. Why would they do this? Those were the best shots!

Overrated movie. Part 1 was decent. Here it gets really boring where hero is always the only one who gets it right and everyone else is not that good. All young actors were chocolate boy/girl types reminded me of Hindi movie Mohabbatein. Tom Cruise is Shahrukh and Val Kilner is Uday Chopra. The last few scenes were the only one perhaps everyone was looking for. I would prefer to watch a documentary than watch this movie.Overrated movie. Part 1 was decent. Here it gets really boring where hero is always the only one who gets it right and everyone else is not that good. All young actors were chocolate boy/girl types reminded me of Hindi movie Mohabbatein. Tom Cruise is Shahrukh and Val Kilner is Uday Chopra. The last few scenes were the only one perhaps everyone was looking for. I would prefer to watch a documentary than watch this movie.

From the very opening of the movie to the end it screamed something familiar but something. It was better then I expected and well worth the years of wait. Tom cruise did an outstanding job in his roll. Almost as if the feelings were real. There were some tear inspiring moments and wonderful ties to the past. The flight scene were out of this world. The cast rooster perfectly. Looks just like goose as if to be his son. I'm so thankful val killer was in this. Oh and when they brought in the f14 kickass from the past. Loved every moment of this movie.

reviews.review_title: I'm a pilot's wife and was a teen in the 80's
reviews.content: I really didn't want to be disappointed in Top Gun: Maverick, so my expectations were low. How many times has a movie disappointed us and especially how many times has a sequel been god-awful? Too many to count.I saw Maverick two days before the movie came out, at an early access showing at AMC. My husband loves aviation. He is a pilot and our son is a pilot in the Army. So, we went for the IMAX theater and paid more for our tickets, as my husband has anticipated this movie since 1986. So he wanted the full experience. Ha ha.Well, ladies and gentlemen, it was worth the wait! (And the extra money- hands down) I had not been to an IMAX movie for over twenty years. They used to make me motion sick.There have not been many movies that I have recommended my friends and family to go see in the theater. This is one of the few.All I can say is: do yourself a favor and go watch this movie while it's on the big screen. You won't regret it.(No spoilers from me. I don't want to take away from any aspect of this film. Don't read any spoilers or detailed reviews, just GO.)Oh and as the geeks we are, we dressed up a little for the movie. We are huge Top Gun fans. Aviator glasses and flight suitsOh. One final thing- this movie is classy and well done. It's nice to be able to go to a movie with your kids, have a great experience without excessive sweat words and nudity. This is how it's done.And IMAX was great. No motion sickness!

To anticipate it. The film grabbed me as an old TopGun- (and anyway aviation-) fan. The action scenes are just fantastic and even though a lot of CGI was used here despite many air combat scenes that were filmed in real life, you never get the feeling that anything is computer generated here, with the exception that certain flight maneuvers would never be carried out in reality. But optically it is shot perfectly and you are right in the middle of it. The gags don't fall short in a few scenes either. The window jump scene and its ending... Brilliant!But...
The story is appropriate in relation to the first edition around 30 years ago and seems authentic, but somehow too much is repeated here. Many scenes create a feeling of "didn't we see that in the old movie before?"
The piano scene in the bar, the motorbike rides... even the intro, apart from the better picture quality, could be almost 1:1 from the first film, with even the music being the same.Sure, for those who haven't seen the original TopGun movie, this can be helpful in understanding the story, but for the "old hands" this seems unimaginative. There would have been other ways to relate to the former story.That's why I can't give the film more than 7 stars.Nevertheless, it is very worth seeing. It's exciting and, like the first TopGun, almost unbelievable, in the truest sense of the word.If you don't take the film too seriously and just like great, action-packed flight scenes, and can ignore too many parallels to the old film, then it's worth going to the cinema or buying as a BD-disc!

I was six when top gun came out. Inspired me my entire life. The emotions, the jets, the characters.Top Gun Maverick at 41, same emotions, the jets, the characters. Thank you for bringing the most inspiring story back to life and knocking it out of the park. I cant wait to inspire my kids, 4 and 5 years old with the same emotions, jets, and characters as i was. 10 out of 10.
Just walked out of the IMAX theater. You feel and see al the love that is used to make this blockbuster. This is how you make a SEQUEL! Tom is the GOAT!
I'm not a big fan of Tom Cruise, but in this movie: HE ATE WHOLE MOVIE! I will definitely recommend everyone to watch, since all the graphics and movie's fragments are more professionally made.

reviews.review_title: Very poor. Only for nostalgic people
reviews.content: The story is poor, predictable and so implausible that at one point I was expecting aliens to appear. It's simply and old movie. The original Top Gun was ok because it was filmed and displayed in the 1980s but you cannot afford to do that same movie in 2022. The only thing they changed is that they made it politically correct. You know, to make sure nobody gets offended. I honestly can't believe people rated this with a 10. I can only think those are nostalgics that still want to live in 80s. I rated with a 2 only because I laughed at one joke. Don't waste your money. Watch it once is on TV and if you don't have anything else to do.

Like an American Idol hopeful standing in the shadow of a rockstar God, this movie had a lot to live up to. I came in with low expectations. At times, I felt like it couldn't quite think for itself, like a filtered down rehash of the original. And other times I was thoroughly impressed and totally blown away!!The highlights for me were the jet fighting scenes, especially towards the end and they totally make the movie. Wow! Gave me a whole new appreciation for their amazing ability and the pilots who fly them. This was something that the first movie couldn't quite deliver on. Thank you modern movie making technology!Really, that was kinda it for the highlights! I actually have quite a few issues with this movie. Mostly; the story is just plain not very good. Something that the first movie excelled at. And the cast of characters. In the first movie they felt larger than life, but this time they felt kinda boring and put on. I wasn't really buying into them.The character, Rooster, was a big part of the movie and while I thought Miles Teller did a fantastic job, they didn't develop his back story enough.Also, Jennifer Connolly's character; who is this woman and why does Maverick care? It's almost like they felt obligated to put in the love story angle but they did a horrible job. Truly disappointing, especially when compared with the fire he had with the Kelly McGillis character from the original.The "talk to me Goose" lines were just not working for me.A big part of what made the original movie so great was the AMAZING music! You've lost that loving feeling, take my breath away. But this time all the good music was sourced from the original and the new music was very pedestrian.With all its faults, you would think that I hated this movie, but actually it was worth the price of admission and I came out with a big smile on my face. Go see it and be entertained!

reviews.review_title: Wow - Just Wow! Best Movie in YEARS!
reviews.content: No movie has blown me away like this since Interstellar and I think this even beats it for me. As a pilot, it's often painful to watch aviation badly depicted on the big screen, but thanks to Tom Cruise and the help from the military, the flying parts were very accurate. Sure there were some dramatizations for example that bird strike taking down an F18 in such a dramatic way or that steep turn the Darkstar took at Mach 9 (would be a 30G+ maneuver). Other than that it was very accurate. We even heard "bitchn Betty" yell "Altitude, Altitude" which was awesome!This is a movie I will show my kids later to fascinate them for aviation. Thank you Tom Cruise!

I just got home about 30 minutes ago.and I was amazed how good this movie was. The storyline was amazing continuing the first topguns story 30 years later and the actors actually had to learn how to fly jets.

Time they would show the audience the intricacies of the chess game in the skies. Right? Math and tactics. Right? No. Story has nothing that would explain why to use these F18's and tactics chosen. Writers didn't come up with anything that would nullify the use of new armaments (stealth/drones/satellite guided weapons..)Movie starts strong. First part of the movie shows that with good storytelling they actually could pull off good sequels for epic movies if they really wanted. Now they just run it like a cheap soap opera for the lowest common denominator. Again the script is the weakest link in the chain. How hard is it to have good script before green lighting these hollywood movies?

reviews.review_title: Ok? Yes. Life-changing? No. Entertaining? About half of the time, yes
reviews.content:
Really expected to be just blown away, especially because we saw it in IMAX. Highly recommended, by the way.I went in thinking I would know exactly how it all plays out. And I was right. But then, everybody knows that.SPOILER ALERTS AHEADYou know Maverick is going to do stuff that's questionable and could cost him his career, life, etc. And he gets in trouble with the higher brass. But he gets away with it.You know you have to suspend disbelief at the door - surely, this isn't how things work in the "real" Navy.You know the flying scenes will be breathtaking (yeah, they were, but somehow I always knew they'd make it through)
You know there'll be an endless line of references, callbacks, etc. To the original movie. But no "I feel the need..." line. In a sense, it was like the original movie, but with mobile phones.You know he gets the girl at the end.I dunno. I enjoyed it, I guess? I don't feel compelled to rush back out to see it again, though. And I'm pretty much done with Tom Cruise's ego.

reviews.review_title: Possibly the best sequel I've ever seen
reviews.content: Now ill preface this by saying, have a couple of drinks so you get the full emotional experience. If you've seen, and enjoyed, the original, this one is awesome. I found myself laughing, cheering, and almost crying at times. I have no naval background, so can't speak for the realities of the movie, but for an action movie lover, this has it all. One of, if not the best, "remakes"/sequel to any movie ever done. Had me literally on the edge of my seat, and was so good to see all main characters survive for a change (RIP Iceman). Thanks for doing this movie, and I actually wouldn't mind seeing more!!

A young top guy turned into his middle age, and still be able to make the difference and being distinguished. That's the Topgun spirit!Moreover, good to see Taiwan ROC's flag is back on Peter's jacket. That's the representative of courage and democracy.

One of the best Movies i've ever seen !Hands down Tom Cruise is an absolute LEGEND !WHAT A COMEBACK that is !All Actors where at they're Best!This movie is at a very high Level of quality in choosing the cast, all Special effects where at extreme low in matter of noticing , the amount of work and dedication of the whole crew making this happend is at a whole other Level!***********************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************10 out of 10 !

I felt compelled to open an IMDb account just to give this film a review. I kind of knew what it would be like but also hoped it would have something...some humour, something original perhaps. But no. Predictable and back slapping, high fiving, ye-hawing. Mahoosive Stars and Stripes flags all over the place and Iranian fighter pilots that looked like Darth Vader. Hated it. 1 star for the flight sequences which were exciting. 1 star for Tom's excellent hair dye. No stars for anything else. Terrible script. Awful acting. No characterisation. Do not waste your time. I can't believe this film is so highly rated.

reviews.review_title: Jumping on the couch for Maverick!
reviews.content: It was so nostalgic seeing Maverick! We loved it! And Tom Cruise looks great for his age or any age!! I am a big Val Kilmer fan ("I'm your huckleberry"), so his part brought a tear to my eye, especially because such a charismatic, talented actor lost his voice due to throat cancer. I have always liked Cruise's movies -they are guarantee to be well acted and wntertaining-amd I have never cared about his personal choices (none of my business) --and if a man ever wants to jump on a couch out of love for me-go at it!! Jump Twice!! 😁🤣

reviews.review_title: Its like watching a movie a very rich 60 year old man has made for himself
reviews.content: This movie has extremely high production value and there are many shots and scenes worth watching in it. But in the end its just a very long commercial for Tom Cruise and exactly this kind of present a man like him is giving himself for his 60th birthday. Every other character in this movie is just a supporting actor for Tom Cruise and every shot with him could be on his personal highlight reel. And yet you will have fun watching it. I can't remember seeing anything like this before. Tom Cruise's was obviously the most powerful man at the set and behind the scenes. Its like watching football with Ronaldo owning the football club he is playing for.

Simply amazing, one of the best action movies of the recent cinema history. The fly secuences are just breathtaking. Just the perfect combination of Top Gun's nostalgia and a whole new era of fly real shooting.

Finally a sequal that is as good as the original. Maybe of taken 30 years but worth the wait even covid..
Well done to the team on this great film. Please don't make another or a spin off this has just it's justice.
It is a sad situation for all films of 2022 when so many people write 'Best film of 2022', and it is close to true. This film can be summed up in one word. Predictable.
Should've watched the 1st again even though you don't have too. I'm sure anyone who loved the 1st will and should give this an 8+. Definitely a good movie no matter what.

reviews.review_title: best military recruitment video of recent years.
reviews.content: Hollywood has triumphed in a masterclass of film making. The aerial sequences are truly amazing and believable, and had me on the edge of me seat the whole time. Altogether a very slick, professionally made, 2 hour propaganda video to entice those who are seduced by the victorious action sequences to join the military, all dressed up as entertainment. The film makers want you to believe that the resulting comraderie is only found amongst military personnel... Maybe I should explain my distaste for this type of 'brainwashing' in words of one syllable, so that those with limited IQ's will understand what i am writing about..

Thanks for the maker of this incredible action movie. I saw the movie last night on an IMAX screen. I was happy to get a break from way too many super heroes/ Dinosaurs movie with cheap CGI flying objects. I was blown away with almost every fighter jets scene.Aside from one bar scene in first few minutes which had some over the top moments, everything else was perfect. The setup of the movie, the cast, the reason of all that action, characters chemistry and ofcourse all the action scenes.If you haven't watched the first one, better to watch it first or at minimum listen/watch a recap of it on YouTubeCan't miss this one on theater. Go for it!!!

reviews.review_title: this movie didn't take my breath away
reviews.content: Damn.. don't believe the hype.. the plot is awful that hurts.. and the dogfights are ok to be very fair.. most of the movie is just nothing related to the main story.. I fell for the hype.. that took my breath away.

It is one of the best movies I had ever seen this year . Seriously it is 10/10 movies loved it . Tom cruise in this movie made an amazing acting and also as a production of the film is amazing and stunning.

reviews.review_title: Good action and effects but that's literally it!
reviews.content: Empty conversations and bad one liners, the action was good and there were cool effects but it didn't weight up the movie! Also not very intelligent because what was this mission really about, why did America just break international law and bomb this country?! Women did not have any real conversation except talk about other men, would therefor not pass Bechel-test! So many questions about how the crew never could succeed the mission during training but suddenly succeed when it was the real deal and nooo one died except the terminal cancer ill man ...+ reckless motorcycle driving without a helmet, why just why?

Don't think, Just Do! Top Gun Maverick, is one of the best movies I've ever seen. It is just such a feel good movie, that hits all the right spots. I suggest watching Top Gun first (just to have the back ground story, but it really isn't necessary). As far as sequels go this one blows most of them away, and all movies should take a page out from this book. What's really crazy for me is that I had no intention of ever watching this film, but my husband wanted to see it, and I know that he's watched movies with me that weren't his cup of tea. So I sat, knowing that I wouldn't enjoy it. Wow, how wrong was I. It forced me to change my perception. This movie is thrilling from the beginning until the very end, with a touch of romance thrown in. The flight scenes are amazing, and the story is truly engaging. I don't want to give anything a way, but hell it almost made me want to go and enlist. Tom Cruise is the Man! I wasn't a fan of his before but I am now. I wouldn't be surprised if recruitment into the armed forces goes up after viewing. Thank you, Tom. It's an amazing experience.

BruckheImer is back! Very cool to see the Don Simpson / Jerry Bruckheimer intro again.I am an American (in the correct sense of the word, as in everyone born in the American Continent), from Mexico City. I grew up watching Pentagon/CIA films and as a Former Film Student I must say: I was moved and excited with this programming about redemption, without having a USA passport, or a visa. In Mexico we don't have a National equivalent programming, almost as if it was forbidden: Mexican Programmers are seduced by Hollywood with Dollars and Oscars.The USA is the world Police we need, who else will discourage Chinese from further future Biological Warfare?The unnamed enemy in TOP GUN: MAVERICK, evokes the invisible enemy that has taken down by 2023: 6,805,186 humans. Communist China has got their hands so dirty, that German Guilt must be at record lows. Let's hope this necessary Military commercial, eventually rallies the USA to teach a Geopolitical lesson to China. Where is Harry S. Truman's spirit in the 21st Century? It could be in Joe BIden: let's wait and see.

Tom cruise knows how to make a blockbuster movie. The movie is perfect in every way. The acting, soundtracks, action, cinematography and everything are top notch.Tom cruise and his bike is already a better love story than twilight !The only thing that made me sad that i couldn't watch this masterpiece in a theatre. This movie is a 100% IMAX material !

Having reminded myself of the storyline of the original Top Gun (1986), I had high hopes for the long-awaited release of Top Gun: Maverick and boy.. it did not disappoint. The cinematography was flawless, casting perfect and most importantly the storyline (along with its effortless links to the prequel) gave me goosebumps. I would thoroughly recommend this film to anyone considering the experience.

Everything about this movie was predictable. I was literally calling out spoilers as the movies played out. I enjoyed the movie don't get me wrong but it was predictable. "Rooster" son of Goose saw it coming, F14 scene saw it coming, "Hangman" saving the day saw it coming, "Maverick" as part of the mission saw it coming from the get go. Hollywood really has nothing left in the tank just regurgitated BS. I did enjoy the film but it's been some time since Hollywood produced something original and groundbreaking, they just recycle old tropes and hope to fool the masses. B movies have to capture the audience with decent forethought but A movies get a pass because they have money thrown at them.

I love this movie! Firstly, you've probably already heard this a bunch of times, but the scenes when they are in the jets are amazing. There's something about doing it for real which makes it incredible. I loved all the new characters, but Miles Teller and Glen Powell steal the show in regards to the students. Jon Hamm and Jennifer Connelly are also spectacular, and of course Tom Cruise was also amazing. This movie still feels like Top Gun, while shining as its own movie. The one thing I prefer in the first movie is the love interest. I actually prefer Penny over Charlie, but I prefer the love story in the original Top Gun more, but either way Penny is still a great character. The best part of this film is definitely the 3rd act, it is spectacular. The track is also amazing, from Lady Gaga's Hold My hand to OneRepublic's I Aint Worried. This is an all around great film, and I highly recommend you watch it.Overall I'd say it's 9.5/10, it's not perfect, but it's close!

Not a Tom Cruise fan at all but this movie is flat-out the best movie I've seen in a decade and it is all because of his acting, his co-stars acting, the story and Cruise's insistence on no CGI. This movie was done so well that my family saw it three times in the movie theater. It was so much better than the first one as Top Gun was more of a romance story with the action being secondary IMO. Maverick was all out action/flying with a small secondary romance subplot. It was also very well done in the fact that you never see the enemy's face so this movie will stand the test of time and not dated to 2022 in regards to which country was the antagonist. Again, kudos to Tom Cruise in this movie and to his cast. Top notch.

Strapped in and catapulted straight back into my childhood. This film is a cinematic masterpiece and strongly proves that not every film needs to be defined by just CGI. Watch it now in the cinema for the true experience, even better in IMAX.Overall left the cinema buzzing and already arranging a re-watch. MUST SEE!

reviews.review_title: Great movie, just too much plot armor
reviews.content: Top Gun (1986) was a phenomenal blockbuster, and the second one, 36 years later, is Top Gun Maverick (2022) in theaters now. There are a lot of advancements in technology in the second movie. The Computer Generated Imagery (CGI) made you feel you were really there, and it also made you feel like the actors were flying the jets themselves, because they were! Let me explain. This "Flying" was a combination of CGI and the actors actually flying the jets, because the movie crew couldn't go out to the Himalayas or the Arctic and start shooting footage of the actors flying around mountains in Super Hornets, so they picked Lake Oroville, Feather River Canyon and made the place look like it was snowing. At the end of the movie, Maverick flies off into the distance while Lady Gaga's "Hold my Hand" is playing. However, the movie characters have too much plot armor. Maverick went crashing down at Mach 10 and survives, not to mention that both Mav and Rooster blew up, and both of them survived! Afterwards, Maverick gets targeted by a large enemy helicopter and every single bullet misses him! Overall, great movie, but could've been better.

reviews.review_title: I signed up to rate this!
reviews.content: Cheesy, predictable, awful - a Tom Cruise vanity project.There are no redeeming features to this film, a film we did NOT need.Yes Top Gun was a boys own film - with high octane, seat-of-your-pants sequences & a love interest to boot.Did we need it again?We all know by now that the inverted "bird" scene was impossible, so they decided to double down on the ridiculousness in this film.From the physics defying opening sequence to the ridiculously gung-ho ending this film refuses to suspend my disbelief.It is cheesy, far-fetched & just plain ridiculous.I can't believe I expected more.
Just what's needed. Superb action,filming and story. Better than the original in my opinion. Tom Cruise looks believable in the role and not too much cheese. Will watch again. 👍

reviews.review_title: Who couldn't they have come up with a more realistic story?
reviews.content: They could have come up with something more realistic premise for this movie ^^ So that this Iranian nuclear site being inside this crater and that the pilots have to do this unbelievable, UNBELIEVABLE to bomb this place. I mean there's so many real life stories they could choose from.

reviews.review_title: Respecting Its Source Material and Audience
reviews.content: In a time of soulless reboots and modern re-interpretations of beloved IPs, Top Gun Maverick appears to be the usual suspect and prime offender: An 80s cult movie, filled with antiquated ideas of masculinity and absurdly fetishized militarism worthy of James Cameron's wet dream. What a temptation it must have been for the studio and the creatives to board the en-vogue subversion-train and give Top Gun a 'modern' makeover that online trolls could go to metaphorical war over.Yet, Top Gun Maverick withstands those temptations and instead chooses to honor and respect its cinematic predecessor and give us a true to formula action film, with a refined structure, believable character development and state of the art flight sequences. All while remaining free of excessive misfires of comedy or the urge to make us feel ashamed about liking 'that sort of entertainment'.Tom Cruise fully embraces his aged hero figure while gracefully passing the baton to the younger generation, replacing the unintentional-seeming homo-eroticism of the original film with genuine themes of brotherhood, friendship and forgiveness. With Top Gun Maverick and following the reinvention of TRON in 2010, Director Joseph Kosinski certainly has established himself as the man to honor and preserve an IP while giving it a fresh new layer of paint. All these things combined make Top Gun Maverick is a standout in 2022's action film offering.
Enjoyed it! The original Top Gun was one of my favourite and had my doubts on how they can match or make it better and they did! Do try watching in Dolby or IMAX for a crazy fun experience!

reviews.review_title: Missed opportunity, overall hard to find anything worthy of praise
reviews.content: Raised in the '80s, I grew up wanting to join the US navy even though I'm not even an American. The US soft power was extremely efficient on my generation through movies like the original Top Gun. I re-watch the movie from time to time and once more before watching the sequel. It has its limits obviously but still, Tony Scott was an artist, the music was phenomenal, the characters were well written and it talked about real issues like friendship, pride, death and grief. And boy that sex scene was promising when you're a teenager.To begin with, I was quite pleased with how this sequel started. The intro sequence is full of potential and I started to think that we were going to explore what happens to a 1985 hero after the movie ends and time passes and he gets older and out of fashion. At start, Maverick seems lonely and a bit of a loser to be honest. One can't help but wonder what went wrong and how someone who seemed unstoppable ended up being a failure. It's such a missed opportunity to not have gone further in that direction.Instead of that exploration of deep questions about what it means to be a hero, the tragedy of that condition and the loneliness that comes with it, we get a below average action movie extremely badly written, with a completely improbable plot without real stakes, instantly forgettable characters no one cares about interacting through unbelievably bad dialogues.No one's hurt, no one dies, no one is really emotionally involved, no sex obviously, it all seems fake. And the worst is that there's not even an original score, the producers basically live free and make money on the original movie's qualities without any interesting input of their own whatsoever. As has rightly been said in many reviews, the Top Gun universe isn't richer with that movie, not even a tiny bit.Tom Cruise keeps repeating that he refused the idea of a sequel for decades until he read the script of this one. This is really hard to believe given its utter vacuity. He turned it into yet another and completely unnecessary Mission Impossible episode, which seems to be the only type of plot that resonates with him for quite a while now. He worked for many great directors and I'm sure he valued cinema at some point in his career so it's quite sad to watch him indulge in this type of intellectually-empty entertainment.What does it say about our time that Hollywood isn't able to top its basic hits of the 1980's ? What does it say about our time that people seem to thoroughly enjoy that movie without even noticing how it insults their intelligence ?

The original Top gun is not an easy act to follow. Not talking about the content but more the feelings this movie gives you. It will throw you back in time merge memories with a new storyline a portion of patriotism all in the same kind of package as the first one. And I must say it is a success. And not to forget Tom Cruise is the best action actor in his generation!

Didn't really want to see this! Went with husband because he did! It was actually good! The guy playing Goose's son looks like him! They did a wonderful job with this one! Loved when Maverick says "talk to me Goose". It is well worth the watch! Can't wait to buy this one! I don't even like tom cruise!

Just to clarify I am a fan of the original TOP GUN..It was a entertaining stylish blockbuster that made Tom Cruise a star.But I knew what the movie was a great entertainer and blockbuster but certainly not an outstanding feat of movie making.Well the sequel is similar..With better special effects and well Tom Cruise.It is a good, entertaining blockbuster...A very good watch..But 8.6!!!!

reviews.review_title: This movie is perfect in every aspect!
reviews.content: First of all, I just want to say "Thank you!" to Tom Cruise, the last Hollywood true star. You can love or hate him, but you can't deny that this man is way above others. We all know Mr. Cruise can do all his stunts, how he climbed up Burj Khalifa, how he catches the plane, or flying a helicopter, but what he's done here is mind-blowing. This movie gaves me emotions I've never felt before from cinematography, it's absolutely brilliant! It's something that we, or at least me personally wanted to see on a big screen. I am happy that this happened specifically now, it worth it to wait. That's how a blockbuster should look like! This is a true art!
More cheese than in the whole of Amsterdam! That said, it's a brilliant, well made film and although I never watched the first film I feel this is head and shoulders above that!

reviews.review_title: First film I've ever watched back to back!
reviews.content: After watching it at the cinema I couldn't wait for it to be released on TV.After it was released on TV I bided my time and waited for a night when the wife was out so she didn't ruin it with questions. I put the kids to bed early. Switched the sound bar on for full effect. Boom!The cinematography is absolutely amazing and flight sequences keep you on the edge of your seat throughout. Also some great throwbacks and references to the first film.Having the F-14 flying in the end was just the icing on the cake really.Was so good I had to watch it again as soon as it had finished!Great film!

It was just out of curiousity that I turned on this movie on a Sunday afternoon on my iPad. The only regret that I have is, that I have not seen it on a huge cinema screen. As someone who saw this film in his youth, I tried not to think of my expectations. There was just this one thing when it comes to making action movies, the dedication of Mr. Cruise! To Mr. Tom Cruise and to all the Creator's of this Filmcrew. You left me now time for thinking, but exposed me fully to the magic of your passion! 10.3g exiting and marvelous Movie Magic! Thanks to all of you, for your dedication and the expirience !

reviews.review_title: Patriotic, action packed and nail bitting.
reviews.content: Awesome doesn't say enough about Top Gun 2: Maverick! A must watch movie, it far surpassed the original immensely and the first Top Gun was awesome too! Definitely a must watch for any red blooded, white and blue patriotic loving American. It's going to be in every 4th of July party get together (and Patriot) celebration for generations to come. Great acting, great plot, great soundtrack. Did I say it was great? It's not, because it's AWESOME! LOVE, love this movie. Tgis movie deserves a perfect Top Gun 10 score. Keeps you wanting more. Maverick is truly one for the ages in its deliverance of a distilled summer blockbuster whose thrills are strong enough to inspire highs totally indistinguishable from narcotics. Beware, and welcome to the Danger Zone.

reviews.review_title: Worst 90min of cinema ever for 40min of fun.
reviews.content: Top Gun Maverick ends up being a slower and more boring movie than the first one (which even if it was very slow and cheesy, had the element of surprise and.some good acting / character development). The first 90min are sometimes very boring, especially the scenes with Jennifer Connolly (why on earth such an actress picked such a boring role ?). The whole movie is made to be ranked as a General Audience: good or bad I let you decide but that doesn't help raising the movie's interest.There is strictly no acting: it's a Tom Cruise "woaw how young do I look" and that's it. Jennifer is lame, John Hamm is awful, and the others (who ?) are ghosts. There is strictly no character development for the flying squad: the rivalry between 2 of them is not expanded, the female character (what's her name?) is there because she's a woman etc. Some scenes are truly third rate: the (very long) bar scene which is non sense and unrealistic and the beach one which is poorly trying to bring back an "all American 80s Rocky style". Finally the Jennifer / Tom love story is so lame : running into her again in the bar suddenly "he is not going to let her go again"Then comes the last 40min with the mission scene: well executed, sometimes funny but does it does make up for the rest.Poor scenario, poor direction, poor actors, lame movie.

reviews.review_title: Breathtaking masterpiece that sets the benchmark for emotive inspiration
reviews.content: From start to finish, the film captivates, closing a generation of time between the first film and this sequel. It defines its audience as participants in the Cruise era, linking the film's characters' evolution to that of the audience's actual lives since the first film. And so every ingredient of it is immediately impactful to the highest degree that Hollywood can achieve, making a mockery of its sparse negative critics. Its positive fans are every watcher of the film who is honest. It is as action-packed and memorable as any blockbuster could hope for. You know, watching it, that there is hope for humanity afterall, that history is being made here, that cinematic hype meets total vindication. It shows that it is fine to believe in oneself as in one's country and way of life as long as every test of human integrity holds up in defending these things. So Top Gun Maverick blows away much of the doubt of being mortal, inspiring countless generations of top achievers today and yet to come.

reviews.review_title: Full of Hollywood macho and romantic cliches
reviews.content: Full of Hollywood macho and romantic cliches but thoroughly enjoyable and well made movie. Cheesy but fun too. You'll either cringe or you'll love it.

Same movie with new characters and stolen scenes from the movie Behind Enemy Lines. Acting was stiff. Tom Cruise is working hard to be this year's summer blockbuster guy, not sure it's gonna work. Supporting cast was terrible. Expected a lot more from a movie that took this long to make.

I simply can not believe how good this movie was, incredible.I'm genuinely gobsmacked.The cinematography, the storyline, the heartbreak and the edge of the seat action all made it so perplexing.A perfect movie if there ever was one.Well done to all involved in creating this film
I will definitely be watching again..............................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................

I am pleasantly surprised that once again, it's proven that a fabulous movie can be made without lacing it profanity. So many movies I've gone to see in the theater had great actors and story lines that were filled with unnecessary swearing. Obviously, there are films out there that would seem unnatural if there 'wasn't' swearing but maybe, just maybe the film industry is realizing this. WELL DONE!!!

Pays homage to the first absolutely perfectly 10/10.The characters, relationships, storyline, stunts, soundtrack, nods to the prequel and Miles Teller as Rooster are all absolutely spot on.Won't spoil it, but these one will be watched as much as Top Gun.

I am a huge fan of the original topgun movie and this sequel has enhanced the already mind blowing action,cinematography and visuals of the original one. The story could have been better regarding penny just being introduced abruptly as in the original movie she was referrred to very indirectly. Lastly the acting by glenn powell,miles teller,monica barbaro and the evergreen tom cruise add the finishing touches to this movie.

Oh what a ride - memory lane - articulately done. Excellent story telling and the background score is heart wrenching. Good story introducing interesting new characters with a subtle balance of old characters. Some of the actions are beyond plausibility but what the heck we go the movies to defy science and enjoy. This, it is a full package that takes you down the memory lane with excellent sound track and absolutely fun performance by all characters. Generation X would be happy - but I guess without watching the first Top Gun and without understanding the context - the movie would be difficult to follow - 80's kid get ready for some tears.

Ive rarely seen a sequel which goes on the same tone/energy as the original, and this movie has outdone that!The story was beautiful, it wasnt just fighting or jets flying, was tactical, tightly knit with amazing energy.Its beautifully made, keeping the energy of the first one ( Even better ), and an amazing story!

reviews.review_title: Similar story, but ... soooo well made
reviews.content: The story has so many parallels to the original that it is almost a clone. However, the movie is fast, fun and thoroughly enjoyable!! If you've seen critical reviews, forget them and go to this movie to be entertained - you'll not be disappointed.

Definitely better than the original movie in terms of the script and stunts. Tom Cruise delivers again! My only flaw is maintaining the same taglines as the 80s movie. I don't believe pilots of today are still quoting what their fathers and mothers quoted 30 years ago.

This is one of those action films that don't exit your mind as soon as you leave the theater. It's an incredibly well crafted film with from a team that is passionate about what they're making. Tom Cruise delivers another great performance as Maverick. The supporting cast are all great and quite memorable. This is why we watch movies.
As much as I enjoy watching MCU movies, I can't really express how refreshing it felt to watch a movie with so little VFX. And, the story (or closure?) was great too. Certainly a must watch!

Honestly, you know when you're feeling a little peaky and you just want to throw up and get it over and done with and feel better afterwards.. just watch this movie and you will be vomiting continuously throughout. I've never watched such a cheese fest in my life. Do Americans truly have no concept of cringe? Clearly not. Sort it out and stop being so embarrassing to yourselves and others."The best of the best" has become such a tiresome cliche in American films that tend to involve the military its now become very boring and predictable. How can Americans be best of the best when they don't even know if they're male or female?

This is the movie of the year. As a matter or fact, my all time favorite. I don't remember the original Top Gun very well, but I certainly remember the 8 times I watched Maverick in Cinemas. This probably won't be the last time I go see it. I've been watching it all summer and means a lot to me. Absolutely insane stunts and camera work I have no idea how it was done! All the characters are so amazing and entertaining and don't get enough praise. It is still playing in IMAX, but not for long. So I recommend you go see it in IMAX ASAP! It truly made this summer worth it.Top Gun Maverick is perfect. No flaws spotted by me. Best movie in the world in my opinion. Phenomenal! See it on the BIGGEST screen possible!

reviews.review_title: Exactly what I wanted to see.
reviews.content: The pacing felt great and they delivered on all the things you would expect from a fast paced epic movie. There is very little wasted time and I think someone was cutting onions in the theater a couple times.
I literally made an account to post this. Easily a 10 out of 10. It's a must-watch for pretty much anyone! Action, nostalgia and Tom Cruise's acting at its finest.

This will exceed your expectations ten folds! An instant classic with style and substance. Cruise reminds us yet again what a gifted actor he is. Find the biggest screen, with the loudest sound and let go!
We haven't seen a good movie like that for a long time don't mess it its amazing movie you should watch it every thing is perfect about it and its not pooring at all fun to watch in every mints.

Even if you have a 60 inch screen at home, it is WORTH seeing in a theater with excellent sound.Everything about this movie was well done, and it felt like a love letter to fans and movie goers in general.The first Top Gun was okay. Not great, but not out and out terrible. It's rare that a sequel outperforms it's original, but this was amazing. The acting, the script, the score, costuming, EVERYTHING was on point. It had heart and action, love and comedy, and it was all seamlessly intertwined. Everyone involved with this project should be immensely proud.This was a movie that reminded me why I love to see movies in theater. Go and see it. You won't regret it.

The positive first: The effects are very good. Perfect camera work and a very good acting by Jon Hamm, who is the only person to believe in his role. The depiction of the planes is terrific and anyone who loves war machines will also like this film. Now for the negative: A boring story that has been seen 1000 times, typical army macho posturing, an embarrassing hero worship and a Tom Cruise who forgot that you also need facial expressions to act. What bothers me the most is the missing story, because nothing really happens after the two hours of telling and showing that the US Navy is the best in the world. The otherwise well-liked Jennifer Connelly also turns out to be the wrong cast, because there is zero harmony between her and Tom Cruise.

reviews.review_title: Screams out for a Director's Cut
reviews.content: I was glad I saw the original film first and, I saw it multiple times. I have it on an ancient LaserDisc format and watched it a lot after it was first released. Having done that, it made the experience of Top Gun Maverick a whole lot more complete and understandable.Making this movie required hours upon hours of film making and, sadly, much had to be cut out to make the movie fit the industry's 2-hour model. That is readily apparent. This movie could have been a whole lot more with some of that cut footage being restored.This was a school teaching pilots for their next mission. But, there wasn't a lot of school in the film -- on the ground or in the air. Aerial teamwork never comes into play until the grand finale to the story. At least the beach football game offered a glimpse but not enough. Like, when they climb out of the hole, why do they roll over to go down the other side? It has to do with G-forces but, that's never mentioned. Pilots will understand but the audience, well not so much.A lot of character development between Mav and Penny would have also contributed greatly to the film. Do people who never saw the original know who Penny Benjamin is and what her relationship to Maverick is all about? What about the other pilots? Anything there? There is a gaping hole in that regard.I have read that Joseph Kosinski doesn't plan on a "directors cut" but, I hope he seriously reconsiders this decision. Another half hour of material can transform this excellent film into a superior film easily.

As a huge fan of the Original Top Gun i was affraid that Maverick was going to be a flop and i was scared that Tom was going to slaughter it.Oh boy was i wrong. It has been a long time since i got sweaty palms and tense lile i did while watching this movie in a Dolby Atmos Sense movie theater.This is a movie that is impossible not to like.

reviews.review_title: He really meant it when he said he made this movie for us, the fans.
reviews.content: I gave this movie a 10/10 because it had the guts to do something, seemly obvious at first, but Hollywood is afraid of or not interested in at the moment, and that is to please the audience with good entertainment and solid story-telling.It does have some easy-to-predict cliche moments, but that does not reduce in the slighest this glimmering piece-of-art of a movie. The acting is flawless from all actors/actresses and please, the sound-effects and VFX team deserve a standing ovation, because the jet fighters scenes were breath-taking. I watched this movie in a Cineplex D-BOX and it felt I was with Tom Cruise on the jet's cockpit piloting that dawn thing!I'm going back to watch it a few more times, that's for sure!!

...for that cheesy moment where after being treated to several "Talk to me, Goose" moments by Tom Cruise, we have a "Talk to me, Papa" scene by Miles Teller.Other than than one moment where I chuckled out aloud, and deducted one star, this is a movie to watch more than once. Don't walk, run to the cinema and watch it.

The best movie to come out since Inception (2010). If Cruise doesn't win an Oscar for this, the entire Academy should be jailed for Robbery. This might be Tom's best movie in his career. I'm lost for words, I was weeping from start to end in the cinema.

The Movie was amazing, many references to the classic one as well as an amazing story, I won't give any spoilers. The experience is amazing with all the dazzling effects which are out of this world. Everything filmed was real and authentic which makes this movie an experience that you must try. It appeals to most people if not all. 10/10.

I'm in awe of the crew that made this film. What an incredible display of skill, love and craftmanship. They managed to not only make a worthy successor 30+ years later, but to also totally blow the first movie out of the water is something I did not expect. If you're sick and tired of superhero movies, go see this! What an incredible experience. Hat's off to Tom Cruise, here is a perfect example of why this man is still #1.

Funny how they entered iran airspace and got teleported to some arctic terrain 🤣🤣🤣 iran southern parts are desert with no mountain ... and why would Iranians build a nuclear facility 100km from the gulf and the US fleet ? And one more thing iran don't have 5th generation fighter jets and since 2010 they have upgraded the f14 tomcat jets with russian tech and weapons and they are fully operational.... and there is no way f14 would be a challenge for a su57 ... no way ...

No Spoilers here, trust the reviews and ratings of the majority book tickets and enjoy!This is a MUST watch in a cinema the cinematography and sounds are to good to be missed on a home TV.No CGI, flight scene's are real, which makes you appreciate the acting even more.They nailed this one, I'm not a huge Tom cruise fan but I will happly watch this again!
Woke, and cheesy. Lacked imagination. If you're looking for a decent remake, it's well made and the shots of the jets are special. Saw it in IPIC and that was cool. Cruise can do it all.

reviews.review_title: A worthy sequel deserving of its title
reviews.content: This movie is great, what an experience.From the opening we are greeted to the reminder of what top gun is, planes in the navy on a CV, followed with a scene that shows mav fly high to the sky, defying his superior as is his nature. Giving the viewer a massive "welcome back" impression after so long.However it is not as perfect as what the original Top Gun in my opinionIll break the review down in 3 segmentsFirst, The action, because this is what Top Gun is about. It is miles better than the original with much more aerial shots and real scenes. It justifies itself with the final segment of the movie where the action is really intense, the best dogfight scene for a movie i have ever seen with an impressive set of visual effects, both practical and CG, this is what DCS and Ace Combat dogfight will look like if they become a movie. However i do find that the "training" part of the movie feels off and a bit shallow compared to the original, the shots are gorgeous and impressive but it felt too dense and that moves to the next topic.Story, the pacing itself is fine, however it does feel like it is squeezed in compared to the first top gun, this is where i find the movie is most lacking. I understand the movie is around maverick himself but i cant help but notice the lack of deeper development on the other characters, it felt shallow and only touched on the surface, along with what looks to be plot holes that could have been explained better and some twist that really does not make sense.
