reviews.content: Appropriate choice of actors and a seamless sequel to the first movie, amazing action sequences and fantastic screen writing. Watched it at the theater and was worth every penny for the experience.

If you like action ,.if you liked top gun then this is a fun 2 hours spent counting the references to the first top gun while enjoying the flying sequences waiting for tom to get the girl and wondering if they will kill off any of the cast on the final battke do you need your brain ? No leave just leave it at home.and enjoy.

reviews.review_title: A Movie that Snuggles to have a Point
reviews.content: Laaaaaaaame and awful story, but everything else around it was very great and cool. It's visual stunning, all the characters are hot, and the acting was good for the most part, only occasionally limited by the writing. The movie feels like who the movie is about. Just like the pilots who don't get to fight other planes or really do anything besides train, the movie has limited reasons to exist at all. It also seemed silly for the movie to be panned as some patriotic film when there weren't really any stakes and the pilots, in reality, would probably just fly missions to bomb poor countries.
Absolutely one of the best movies ever! Loved every minute of it, then went back and watched it again. Even knowing what was going to happen, I still was on the edge of my seat. Excellent!!!

I can't imagine this movie being done any better than it was!!! Every single scene was amazing. The acting was great, the scenery was stunning, and the plot was well done. Everything clicked along so as not to be quite predictable, but left the audience with that feel-good feeling.

Watched today rented on prime not sure if wanted to buy . Do now. Watched original when was seven or eight got me into aviation and war machine love going to Duxford with my dad he into that kind of thing . Original had a big impact on me. At 37 now I badly wanted to see this. At start I thought they're pulling some the original strings that made the original so good. But then half way thought you realize I completely it own story. The plane scenes are amazing wish I watched it in 4k. Pulls at the heart strings like original amazing movie orderd copy on blu ray. Fully recemmend. Hopefully I can get my daughter off YouTube to enjoy this movie like I did the original film of the year for me.

This Movie was a pure joy to watch. The Story very well building up to greater and greater heights.In the first flight scene whit this futuristic jet where he flights over Mach 10 the sound engineering is world class and you are literally in the jet!The rest of story is so nice to watch and a real thrill towards the End. The sound engineering is so goooood and also the picture. I was seldomly so in the movie and enjoyed literally every minute of it!You gone love this movie 😉

I admit it, I grew up loving the 80s staple Top Gun despite its flaws and shortcomings. It's still a fun movie.Where the original is "just" a fun movie, the sequel Top Gun Maverick is an instant classic for everyone who loves a good action movie.Tom Cruise refused to do a sequel until the Navy would allow the actors in the real fighter jets during real dogfights in the air and until the technology was there to capture it on film, in camera. No CGI.And boy, does it show!The cinematography is beautiful and the action sequences are breathtaking, you're really sitting in the cockpit with the pilots and experiencing the g-forces.The story is simple but even just the training scenes leading up to the complicated and dangerous mission are incredibly intense and exhilarating.And the third act, the actual mission is edge-of-your-seat intense, anxiety-inducing suspense and wall-to-wall action.It's bonkers. Totally bananas.Add to that a surprisingly emotional story, a great cast of young pilots (Miles Teller and Glenn Powell being standouts), a lovely leading lady in Jennifer Connelly and a charismatic Tom Cruise who brings his absolute A-game portraying the charming daredevil pilot Maverick still haunted by his past mistakes and loss, and what you get is a seismic bomb of a blockbuster that brings everything a movie fan could ask for and then some.Kudos to Tom Cruise for fighting so hard to get this movie released where it belongs, on the big screen. It'a truly an experience.

reviews.review_title: Congratulations to all the actors of the film !!
reviews.content: I'm a fan of the maverick role, I've seen the first movie dozens of times and I've been waiting for this movie for about ten years now. All I will write is that it exceeds all expectations, takes the first film to the next level and leaves its own historical imprint on the cinema.
Stays true to the original while creating a new story. Action is amazing! Cast is perfection! This movie was made for the fans! You can tell Tom put his heart and soul into it!

reviews.review_title: Lazy writing makes over one billion dollars?
reviews.content: Gotta love the hype. The script for this movie is pieced together with electrical tape and rehashed scenes. It appears the film had to be finished before rewrites could correct bland storyline. Two wasted hours. Hollywood destroys an iconic tale from the 80s. Miles Teller looks like Goose's son. Enough said. Looking forward to a day when original content wins out on the west coast. The 1970s it isn't. One good thing was the return of Val Kilmer. Maybe Tom Cruise thought he was backing another Mission Impossible sequel. Cinematography was good. Creative shots on the big screen. Two years wait since the pandemic definitely not worth the streaming fee.

This movie was great it was a 10/10 must watch it was so nostalgic and a funny movie aswell it was great is all i have to say. Im gonna right random letters so i can submit this hshsksbdjrjdjd ddhdkdirnrbrndhdjdhdujrbdkdxbxkxidiend.

reviews.review_title: Just as awesome as I was hoping!
reviews.content: When the first trailer for Top Gun: Maverick dropped, I had not yet seen the first Top Gun movie. I could recognize the trailer easily enough from Tom Cruise and all the jets, but I wasn't as invested in it as people who have seen and loved Top Gun since 1986. Although, the trailer looked awesome and I thought it would be a cool movie.I saw Top Gun about six months after the trailer had been released, but the world was deep in the COVID-19 pandemic, so at that time, the movie had been delayed until November 2020. For the next two years, Maverick kept getting pushed back more and more, and I was wondering if this was actually a good movie or if the directors were just trying to delay the disappointment for as long as possible.Finally, in May 2022, Maverick was released and it was so much better than I thought it was going to be. Is it a perfect movie? Not by any means, but it did what it was supposed to do - be a fantastic sequel to the 1986 hit. It was really cool to see what Maverick still flying jets and getting into trouble, as well as how he handled Rooster being on his team. I really loved seeing the new characters, especially since they had included a female pilot. Even back in 1986, women were not allowed to go to the Top Gun school, so to see a female pilot who had not only graduated top of her class, but was now an expert flyer was really amazing.The plot is very similar to Star Wars: A New Hope, in that there is a dangerous machine that must be taken out by a skilled team of pilots - it even took two shots for each one to be destroyed. However, this allowed for some really cool stunts and maneuvers that you didn't see in the 1986 film. It was great to see Maverick as a teacher, but still be just as reckless and cocky. You could see him on the other side of the training, but still with that same pilot attitude he's always had. We even got the same style of beach scene and romantic love interest between Maverick and Penny Benjamin.As far as fan service goes, this movie really does it well and as a huge Top Gun fan and daughter of a naval aviator, this movie was everything I was hoping it would be!

When it's not following the outline of the original, TPM fills in with familiar and predictable tropes. Students go to Top Gun, Hotshot Ego Kid clashes with the others, everyone has something to prove, Tom Cruise has some kind of love affair, motorcycle riding, "the impossible mission," dog fighting, the mission, and (of course) Maverick is the best. The appearance of Val Kilmer is touching and he acts circles around Tom Cruise for his brief appearance (especially since he can no longer really speak), but the rest of the film is entirely forgettable.A good sequel should stand on its own, but without detailed knowledge of the original Top Gun, Maverick completely falls apart. Rooster's entire character is basically a walking reminder of Goose and he is only relevant because of how Mav feels about Goose all these years later.Outside of a good cameo, Iceman functions as a kind of Deus Ex Machina/Fairy Godmother/ Magic Shield for Mav, blocking any consequences from the number of illegal or unethical decisions Mav can't stop himself from making. In addition to everything that should have gotten Mav kicked out of the military in the original Top Gun (which was somehow pardoned with Iceman's influence) and everything since then he's done to get kicked out (also pardoned with Iceman's influence), Mav can't stop being reckless, disobeying orders, talking back to superior officers, breaking laws, and racking up a whole new list of ways to get kicked out. But the viewers know that Mav and his career will be fine - because he's the hero. There's no passing of the baton, no lesson learned, no development, no stakes, nothing we haven't seen before or couldn't see done better somewhere else.

reviews.review_title: This movie is breathtaking and phenomenal
reviews.content: I rarely say this to any other movie sequels but I can say this confidently; this movie is WAY better than the first one. It exceeds my expectations to the outer space. It is just an overall awesome and spectacular aviation-genre movie in a while. For the fans of the original Top Gun, this movie is definitely gonna blow your minds and fly you away in every possible way. And for the ones who haven't watched the first movie yet, you don't really have to. This movie is already good enough to not require you to watch the first one. 10/10 recommended.

reviews.review_title: Worth the wait and Tom Cruise delivers
reviews.content: I laughed, I cried and for a little over 2 hours Tom Cruise transformed into a credible, grown up version of his Maverick persona and was somehow even more endearing than the Maverick everyone swooned over in 1986.For me, this is the first movie in an incredibly long time that truly felt worthy of a trip to the cinema because flying fighter jets just doesn't hit the same in your living room.Further, this might be one of the best screenplay examples of an individual character arc in motion picture history and it took a span of 35 years and two films to accomplish.Two thumbs up.
Actually better than expected, but c'mon do Americans, let alone the rest of the world, believe this drivel? I never saw the original. Don't think I'll bother. In fact, I'm sure I won't.

Brilliant Brilliant Brilliant! Cruise took this to next level. I personally didn't expected too much from the movie but indeed it was worth the wait. Action sequences has been short with extreme precision and sound effects makes you nostalgic.What a way to begin your summer with and i wish they came up with TopGun 3 sooner than 30 years.

reviews.review_title: Go see it in an IMAX Theater - Feel emotion like old amazing movies like Die Hard, Lethal Weapon and Star Wars
reviews.content:
I absolutely love the first movie and remember being a little girl watching it and loving it. I honestly wasn't expecting too much, since sequels usually have a hard time beating the original movie.... But then a friend of mine watched it in Cannes (!!) and told me everybody was cheering so much after the movie was over and she loved it. So I got over excited, of course, and went to one of those special sessions before the opening night. It is AMAZING, you feel like you're in a cockpit and I cannot believe how the actors had to direct themselves inside those planes!!!! You can barely notice the little CGI and the whole plot is somehow similar to the original one. Yet... I don't know if there are any star wars' fans here, but there's a scene that reminds me of episode IV (shooting the tiny hole of the death star) and another that reminds me of episode VII (remember Rey and Finn finding the Millenium Falcon?) :)
Anyway, everything works. I love how Maverick deals with his gosts of the past, he is kinda treated like old stuff sometimes yet doesn't care and is the old Maverick we know - doing crazy stuff, being the best up there and showing who is the boss, the best of the best.I mentioned Die Hard, Lethal Weapon and Star Wars because those are action movies with emotion, laughter, romance and a true heart in the very end of the day and I didn't feel stuff like this outside (few) superhero movies for a long, long time (ago in a galaxy far away).Needless to say (again), I was in the first session, there were serveral 40+ guys with me in the cinema and we were all crying like babies... On top of seating in the edge of our seat. Guess this says more about the movie than any other review.Plus, I've seen it twice already and Tom Cruise made this special appearance yesterday just before the movie started and he thanked the audience for being there and going to see it in the big screen. Basically showing streaming services who is the boss. Say what you will about his personal life - you've got to admit he is an amazing actor, producer and truly cares about his audience. This movie should never be seen outside an IMAX theater.

Cruise did a great job with this. Just enough nostalgia to hook you in. It was fairly clean for a Hollywood film too. I wasn't cringing with my 9 year old with me. I thought the "mission" could've been a little more exciting. They had 30 plus years to come up with something. Lol. All in all, a really good sequel.

Well done all around! The story, comedy, visuals and intensity! Loved every minute of it. A good old fashioned Pro-American film that doesn't pretend to be anything other than what it is. The acting, writing and filming was top notch. Definitely one to see on the big screen. I ducked and jumped more than once. Lol.

reviews.review_title: I don't think I could say it better than the rest, A MUST SEE!!
reviews.content: *****May contain a spoiler*****I was in my mid-twenties and a few years out of the Navy when Top Gun hit the big screens. I loved the movie then and still do. I also loved the Awesome look of those F-14 Tomcats. Ah, but that's ancient history, and I'm not here to talk about the past.I saw Top Gun: Maverick last night, what a rush. I loved that they brought back the original opening music and the Kenny Loggins classic, "Danger Zone". The rest of the music was a true pleasure also.Everything about this movie is great. I especially liked the way that Mr Kilmer's "Iceman" was bought into the future. His part is very memorable, his medical problems not withstanding. Thank you Mr Kilmer. Thank you Mr Cruise, the rest of the cast and crew for this exceptional film. There is a new space waiting to be filled on my movie shelf.
Just watched this on midnight release a great homage to the original but modernised and a great story to link the old characters with the newI will always remember watching this on opening release.

Am I the only one that thought this was terrible??? Im sorry I loved the first one...but this was shocking.Tom cruise was terrible, even my favorite actor in the entire world Jennifer Connelly didn't saved this.However I thank the producers and the director for editing the love scene!!! Did not want to see too much of that. Lol! I am in my 50's and lived the way that Tom cruise was lying down when the camera was on him... I'm the same with my hubby, I hate the loose skin that we cannot get rid of i old age!So in my opinion not only the story was predictable, the actors were exactly the same as the first.I honestly think that the promotion of this movie was the ONLY thing that made me watch it.Thanks to this choice, my husband has banned me for 2 months from choosing the next one to watch.Grrrrrr.

Possibly better than the first! I was hanging on to every scene. All actors deliver great contributions to the movie. So many unexpected twists and turns. And the fact that they are using real Navy aircraft just like in the first one ads to the movie because there is no bad CGI. Highly recommend.

Just came back from the early access premiere (In a Dolby Screen).This is by far one of the best movies I have seen in years. Just enjoy the flight, absorb the emotions and let it go. I can bet you, every single human in the theatre was crying at some point or the other.Thank you Tom Cruise, Joseph Kosinski and all the crew involved for bringing this movie to life. Stellar acting by everyone involved.Watch it in IMAX, Dolby or equivalent for the perfect experience, you won't regret it. Please don't try to guess the story because it's simply about the journey.

Profanity : there were two uses of Jesus in the movie that we're not blaspheme, also one use of God at the very beginning. At the very end of the movie they used God D in a very inappropriate way which was blaspheming Him.

I waited in anticipation to watch this sequel. Top Gun is without doubt my favourite ever movie ....I could watch it over and over again and recite it word for word.Unfortunately my 3yr old autistic son dictated that we couldn't get to the cinema to see Maverick on the big screen so perhaps not being able to do so hindered my overall score but here we go anyway......
I had goosebumps at the opening scenes with the original background music and danger zone hitting the speakers at full blast. The film quickly set the scene that Maverick was still only at 'captain' status. I expected that tbh as we all kind of knew anyway that he'd be drawn back to Top Gun to teach in this film.The effects and overall blockbuster type scenes were nothing short of spectacular but I was hoping to get some sort of back story to some of the main characters.We all knew that Rooster was the son of Goose but never really got a good description of Maverick & Rooster's relationship over the years, however turbulent that relationship was. Some better context would have led the storyline a bit better here. Also the character of Penny wasn't described very well and how her previous with Maverick played out in the past....she kind of just appeared as a bar owner and Maverick seemed to know her from the past.The film was amazing but personally I would have preferred to have had an extra 15 minutes to watch where the producers have more of a backdrop to the main stars of the film.....it just left me wondering at the end rather than thinking 'Woah...what a great film'
Val Kilmers scene was essential for the movie I thought but once again left a lot to be desired...yes I know Val is not in a good place with his health but could have been done better.In summary then, I think it's a fabulous movie but would have liked to have seen Maverick play more of a mentor type role to Rooster and have Miles play the main role rather than Tom.Great effects but more character story backdrop would have been nice.

It is a very nice act movie, by the way it seems that the director of the movie has no information about Iran. In the south of Iran there is no snow and no pine trees.On the other hand, I think it's the time to Hollywood stop to destroying the other countries faces to show off the power of the US. Everyone know that the us was not such a dare to defend the Ukraine in the war. So it's enough to propagation and exaggeration.Apparently, the director underestimated Iran's military power. It is very fun to attack to a country and they just use some automatic homing rackets for such an important site.I'm not fan of Iran politics, but at least everyone knows that Iran is not like countries that have no war knowledge. Everyone knows the us NAVI and Airforce are not dare to come close to the Iran boarders.By the way the movie was nice, it had very good special effects.

Without the first one I don't think people would be hyping this up. Total nostalgia play. Redid the same corny scenes and lines (talk to me rooster! Lol wow). Fight scene at end was good but then it just kept going.

reviews.review_title: Wow. What a movie. A true return to glorious movie making
reviews.content: These days, sequels have all been wretched with political agendas and while I am a liberal Democrat I too have found the in my face smeared agendas with changes for no reason to be irritating. Movies like James Bond where is neutered in his own movie while some diversity color checkbox of non-heterosexual preference of low quality build rescues and saves the hero in his own movie. Also, besides the gender/race benders there's also the cringey dialogs as if we are too stupid to understand and dumbing it down to moronic levels (i.e. Trump level) so we understand by explicitly saying the things.Thankfully there is none of that in this movie. This movie's Maverick is Maverick and his char is intact and while he has matured, he still is a hotshot whose nature is the same and wants to prove himself and push the envelope more. The women are all strong smart women who do a fantastic job, whatever they've been given. There are diverse characters but it is not stupid over the top ratio and explicit with the checkboxed people occupying in your face positions everywhere with cringey dialogs.I found Tom Cruise, Jon Hamm to be stellar standouts. Curiously, I also found Miles Teller (Rooster) also a great addition and standout. The Hangman guy and Phoenix girl (she was so pretty but so perfectly cast as well) and Jennifer Connelly and her daughter were so perfectly cast and acted.The action stole the scenes with edge of your seat thrill. Tom Cruise's gamble of no-CGI is amazing imo and he's just so good at this. And yes, Tom Cruise does run in this movie ;)This is a truly great film. A must watch in the theaters and well worth the $$ I spent in the theater.

reviews.review_title: I wish the writers were braver, like the pilots
reviews.content:
I liked the first movie for what it was
I will not rewatch it today, because it would ruin the movie for me. It was too cheesy and predictable
Almost 40 years later and unfortunately nothing has changed
The same Tom Cruise that produces incredible mission impossible movies signs his name on this very predictable movie
It's kinda fun to watch, but that's it. A shame it's not more.

A fighter pilot's ride (feels like we are engaged in the flights and fights). I watched this at home and the audio was good and the visuals were awesome in the canyons when in flight. The movie was exciting and well connected with the 1st movie. The sequel stands on its own and the dogfights and strategy were outstanding. There is an authenticity with the flight team and the connections they share are felt.The characters are well-developed with emotion and substance. In the conclusion of the movie we understood the relationships and the meaningful connections with the first Top Gun.This is a must see movie (best sequel)!

For me this film could have been good if it was talking few years after the first one.1) What would you think if someone is wearing the same clothes and driving the same motorbike 36 years later even without helmet?2) In the pub really big coincidence that they sing the same song has Maverick and the other sang 36 years earlier.1) If military pilot destroy a billion worth plane for not following the orders, could walk away without any consequences?

This movie is simply a phenomenal job and i could see Tom's hand throughout the whole movie. He does things to a superior unmatched level. Blow me away how real it was. Every event was planned perfect down to the music, the scenery transitions, the lenght of the scenes, incredible footage from the air wonderfull execution!!! Love the balance between friendship, drama, growing closer as a team and resolution of conflicts. The footage of the aircraft carrier, the footage of the flight scenes all the low altitute flights, airborne dogfights is just a beautiful love letter to cinema and no doubt my favourite movie so far is phenomenal!!!

From growing up watching Top Gun over and over and over again, patiently waiting for years for the next but unsure it was going to happen.. it happened and it. Is. Awesome!Top Gun and Top Gun Maverick movies are the greatest of ALL time. There will never be anything to top these movies!
A good sequel after 35 years, produced by Hollywood? It's incredible how good this film is considering the tripe that Hollywood is consistently pumping through the pipes.

Best sequel I've ever seen, surpasses the original. Miles Teller is absolutely outstanding, and so is Tom ❤ The flying sequences were amazing and IMAX made it even better. The movie has been out for a week, but the whole movie theatre still cheered and applauded at the credits, that says something. GO WATCH IT NOW 😁

Really enjoyed.Like any laid back nester whose watch list plates were already full three months ago when the biggest aviator cinema phenomena was terrifically manifested by four worldwide generations of alpha action movie fans as the highest-grossing film of 2022, those young at heart now mostly in their fifties and beyond know it's better late than never to savour every adrenaline rush and thrill at their home theatre reimagined piloting inside the cockpit of a super hornet - Cher would sure want a ride with either or both Tom Cruise and Val Kilmer exclusively in the name of her boyfriendology.It is easy to settle with Top Gun Maverick if you are a sucker for airborne speeds, navy blues, military friendships and undying bonds plus a little drama of cockfights under the eighties vibe. Like its 1984's predecessor, Jerry Bruckheimer teamed up with the fellow lead cast and co-producer Cruise and director Tony Scott (who'd unfortunately passed away in the early production year) to restore the original bohemian, freewheeling soul of the eponymous character "Maverick" with decades of preceding reputation as a steadfast fighter aircraft diehard now summoned to perfect the hard skills of a budding team of special tasked pilots. Haunted by losing his late bestie, his training mate "Goose"/dad of trainee "Rooster" (a strikingly identical Miles Teller as the son of a 36-years younger Anthony Edwards) in the previous accident, "Maverick" went against the trial rules and pushed high risk altitude flying to make sure the team know how to make their way back in crisis.Fans can tell Cruise is physically on par resuming his ageless role, despite tucking away his small belly in two shirtless scenes, but genuinely not shortsighted and qualified still as an aviator. To counter his immortal charm at the best going rate, an equally dateless Jennifer Connelly starred as his interest of heart. Both Ed Harris and Jon Hamm stood out in their uniformed character; the kicking top gun graduates are added with a black-lives-matter conscious and, whether that really matters for any subtext observation, the co-ed team's beach valleyball game scene deliberately recreated and reprised as a famous homoerotic moment in the tradition of the duology films.And once again just for the fans, new director Joseph Kosinski worked out the Sonantic-enhanced voice of the post cancerous Kilmer and gave his character "Iceman" a much respectful departure.The only disappointment is the totally inappropriate, unnecessary and embarrassing closure soundtrack, I mean, why involved Lady Gaga?!! Her music even as to date is far too incomparable to Giorgio Moroder and Tom Whitlock's "Take My Breath Away" performed by Berlin.Produced by Skydance Media and Don Simpson/Jerry Bruckheimer, this high-octane sequel to one of the eighties' most memorable movies was first distributed by Paramount Pictures states-wide and available in IMAX, 4DX, ScreenX and Dolby Cinema experience.168 people found this helpful.

A perfectly nostalgic come back, sound tracks were brought in just at the right moments, great visual effects, totally worth it. Blown away... can't fly a plane so I ended up feeling like driving a stick shift. #TopGunMaverick #topgun #maverick #TomCruise.
First ever review on IMDB for Top Gun Maverick! Was truly amazing, kept me on the edge of my seat the whole way through and was a brilliant mix of old and new.

Super movie better then the last one.fantastic my wife like it too non stop action. Great acting. Really enjoyable. Honestly one of the best action/drama movies I've ever seen. Tom Cruise is at his absolute best here, with a supporting cast that really chews up the scenery. Still, the action sequences-all the low-altitude flights, airborne dogfights as well as Cruise on a motorcycle donned in his original Top Gun leather jacket-are likewise the breathtaking moments that come very often here. There is no doubt this is one of cruise's all time best films already in his long filmography. The authentic work that went into every frame generously shows by Kosinski. As the jets cut through the atmosphere and brush their target soils in close-shave movements that leave you in awe. It's one of the best films I've seen in years and it's worthy of my one and only flawless masterpiece review & rating to date. It deserves all the praise if gets & more. No doubt my favourite film of the year so far, (tied with "The Batman." As TGM is a beautiful love letter to cinema. Which absolutely deserves an outstanding & whopping 5/5 🌟stars from me.

The original Top Gun was a classic; Top Gun 2 is legendary.I watched the IMAX version yesterday, with the family, they loved it.Then, today, I watched the 4DX version, with the family, and my mum!OMG. 4DX version is next level. (My first time ever). The way the dog fighting sequences synchronised with the seat movement, the wind and water in your face - breathtaking experience.Story wise, absolutely amazing. Every scene followed through like a river of Gold. The nostalgia was magical.This is pure family fun. No sex scenes, no profanity, no violence, no blood, no drugs - just like the good old days of 80s action!This is one of those rare movies where the sequel is better than original.4K UHD Steel-book pre-ordered.

It's been a while. Today you just don't see that happening often enough: a movie that is actually up to the par with the old generation blockbuster like "Top Gun". But here - they did it. I watched it with the breath held for the better part of the movie. Air scenes are just insane. You can actually feel like an actual participant of the action. There's a few scenes that are a bit cheesy, but it just had to be there and it's not over the border. Cruise does his job exceptionally well in this film. His character also doesn't disappoint and feels really natural. All cast did a rather good job IMO. Very good cinema. Highly recommended!

It's not easy to make a sequel that dominates an original that is a household name. The creativity of the writing incorporating nostalgic elements from the original without being corny or cheapening the plot cannot be understated. The balance of serious scenes with comedic relief & a sprinkle of progressive humor was well executed. The casting was immaculate. As supporting characters, seeing Jon hamm and Jennifer Connelly in the same movie felt surreal. It's not often Hollywood gets it this right with so many opportunities to go wrong. A masterpiece.

reviews.review_title: One of the best movies of this year!
reviews.content:
It is Miles better than the first, that's how you do a sequel!This movie is such a nostalgic one to the old fans of the first movie,
Tom Cruise just comes in and captures our attention as he always has.SPOILERS AHEAD!This movie gave us Maverick making peace with Rooster ( Goose's son)
and it captures in in the most incredible way possible.It is a emotional, adventuristic, action packed with amazing parts of comedy
that just fit in perfectly.Maverick seeks to demonstrate just how powerful the old gear,
and the old ways, still are.The takeaway or the message of this movie that i personally got, is that
Sometimes you don't always have to think it through, sometimes you got to just do it,
and trust your instict.Maverick: "You don't have time to think up there. If you think, you're dead."It really makes you feel connected to the character journey's.The suspense makes it an amazing movie to watch, but sometimes it is just
to predictable which kinda feels like you are spoiling the movie for yourself.But overall it is an amazing journey and a solid 8.5 for me!

Usually remakes or second parts made so many years later tend to be dull, this is a hit, amazing takes and special effects, Tom Cruise and cast are awesome.I didn't expect much from this movie but it has a great story, effects and connects with the original Top Gun movie, great job, I'll gladly watch it a few more times in movie theaters.
I'm a fan of Top Gun movies. But this movie is focused more on one side. It similar to the earlier movies which has flight stunts & romance. That's it. They could have changed the storyline for sure.

36 years for the sequel, sad that this is the best they could come up with. I remember lining up on the Friday when the original was release in 1986. I've probably seen it 30 times over these 36 years. I own it in Betamax, VHS l, DVD and Bluray. This sequel does not do the original justice. It was like watching a remake of the original, same corny lines, the opening scene. The bar scene with Goose's son singing Great Balls of Fire. The Football scene Vs the VolleyBall scene.The only thing creative was Penny Benjamin, that's was only a name whispered in the first 15mins of the original.Was expecting a lot more. Maybe it's too long between movies for most people remember. But this Die Hard fan, who can recite the original movie line for line it was a big disappointment.Sorry total flop 😕

This Movie. Amazing. Excellent.Was long time I didn't see a nice movie coming out and this is the one.I sow this movie in Italy with a ScreenX so Center normal screen plus + additional to create a 720 immersive esperience and was very cool.The story is just perfect and not boring, nice mix of action and drama.Tom Cruise, always Tom Cruise. Its like a Garancy, well done!Do I suggest this move? Yes. I will buy also the Blu Ray when will come out.

I watched this movie 2 days ago and I'm still just blown away by it.This movie left me on the edge of my seat and just amazed by what I was watching. I really loved the story and loved how almost all the flying was real. I mean, just the thought about how those crazy and unbelievable movie scenes you're watching is not made on a computer just made the experience so much better.I loved the character development and loved how they also used stuff from the first movie.I can definitely recommend watching this.And if you're going to, then try to watch in a cinema with great speakers so you can feel the whole room vibrate when Tom Cruise flies across the screen.

I love the top guns movies I have seen both top gun1and 2 but overall I love Top Gun:Maverick more then top gun1. It's more action and more fun to watch the movie and it's about Captain maverick return to Top Gun academy to be a teacher and have a team of the best pilots that top gun have to offer, and once again Tom cruise is playing maverick and he is a great actor overall I've seen many of his movies such as mission impossible top gun and many many more. But in the first top gun movie we meet a young and wild maverick that not afraid of being judged by other people and in the top gun maverick movie and there is a older and more passionate Maverick.

Waited along time for this and was not disappointed. Love the first film and can say that the sequel will become one of my favorites. Being able to capture what this film did in the cockpit of a fighter jet was pretty amazing.

We went and saw this movie because it showed that there were NO F- Bombs and NO use of God's Name in vain. However, God's Name was used twice nearing the end along with the F-Bomb. I had my child with me and it's irritating to read the words listed in description and it not be accurate!! Movie was great other than that! I do not watch anything using those words, ever!' Do better at your scoring/info process...please don't hide mess like that! Hollywood needs to do better with making movies that don't curse at all and no sex scenes!!

I saw it in the cinema but maybe but maybe it was in a bad one becuase I was really disappointed by the sound.The history and plot is pathetic and sort of ruins the movie. Even the opening scene with Maverick unnecessarily crashing a million dollar test plane - is that to show that he learned nothing in 35 years? Fair enough he reched the mach goal but why continue?The fight scenes are not better than the original which is a real shame. It's mainly flybyes which doesn't really capture the speed and stress in the plane.There a way too many pilots to care for any. Why did they have to start with 12??There a few funny scenes and clips but thats all..

The movie gave everything a top gun fan was hoping for, it is the best sequel ever created, begining, plot and the ending were perfect.The fact that tom cruise did all the stunts him self, and some of the fighting jets scenes were shot without greenscreens, that gave the movie another boost.However I am surprised that not many people knew about the first top gun, and everybody knew about rocky. I hope this movie reaches the expected ROI.

Respect to Tom cruise for being a legit pilot and doing stunts and tricks in those crazy shot scenesThis film is enjoyable to watch especially visually. As far as dialogue and story telling nothing groundbreaking here.This film is a solid 7.8 for me and definitely not an 8.7 which it's currently at. The movie Dunkirk is 7.8 with alot of clear nicely shot aviation scenes and I wouldn't put this above that.

reviews.review_title: So many thing wrong with the movie.
reviews.content: When it comes to military accuracy this movie fails on many levels. I spotted at least 20 false or inaccurate items, I actually stopped counting at 20.

One of the best films I have ever seen in my life. The Sound Design was as amazing as the writing and the acting. Every minute just got better and better. This will be a classic alongside its original for generations. Cannot wait to see it again.

I was reluctantly dragged into the theater, thinking that they didn't need to make a Top Gun 2 and that the first one was where that story needed to end.I could write a couple paragraphs to summarize my feelings after walking out of the theater, but I'm going to leave it with just one sentence.I was wrong.

reviews.review_title: I FEEL THE NEED.... NEED FOR SPEED
reviews.content:
The film delivers what it promised, it's almost 40 years of time since the original Top Gun was released in 1986 and it surely blends in with the cinema and gave Tom cruise a instant fame. But the time has changed and Tom Cruise as well but he still has the aura or Audacity to give us the film that we expected or more than our expectations. The film itself is a positive factor to watch the film in theatre, whether it is Aerial scenes, dogfighting sequences and The misunderstanding between MAVERICK (TOM CRUISE) and ROOSTER ( MILES TELLER) who is a son of Late pilot GOOSE played by (ANTHONY EDWARDS) in 1986 film. But all feels Extremely Stupifying when Tom Cruise hits the screens and for no wonder why he insisted not to use CGI instead all actors were in a cockpit flying jets, because this film deserve to be seen big screen as possible and for it's outstanding Visual/Cinematography made you feel like you are in the cockpit. In the end this film is not only for fanboys or fangirls this is for every CINEPHILE/MOVIE BUFF
Rating for Top Gun Maverick is 10/10 "IT'S THE FEAST FOR THE SUMMER AND NEVERENDING THRILL FOR THE AUDIENCES"

reviews.review_title: A must watch in imax 3d for full experience
reviews.content: Better than the original by far in every aspect. I enjoyed it so much. Tom Cruise is really special, he will be remembered for sure. You don't want to miss the full experience imax can provide you with, go pay for it, it's worth it ! After so much marvel crap we got crapped on us, it's so amazing to get something like this, a real movie experience ! After watching this I don't think i will be stepping into cinema to watch another marvel or other hero crap for a few years probably. This masterpiece has shown me how awful movies are today actually. I enjoyed every second of this movie. Thank you Tom for making this even though you never had to considering you don't even need money, but this is what real movie looks like. I hope people realize we got feed bs movies and stop buying into it. Movie of the year, most likely, aside from being the best movie I watched since dark knight.

Scott Edwards nailed it in his post earlier ...
First post here & I'll join Scott at Fighter Town.Took me back to Donny for first watch.Shame, no hostess with ice cream & KiaOra ..Sit back & soak it in, Tom, Jerry, Don, Tony, Joe you made a film that brought back 36 years of my life @ Mach 10.3..
Ash xxx
.

Worth the wait...worth the hype
Best aerial combat movie.Perfect cinematics along with excellent plot. Haven't seen such a great combat movie in a decade.
Overall Good Movie. Story has some holes as it puts a hostile nation (implying Iran) having superior fighters than US does. But once you suspend your disbelief, its a nice action movie.

You have to love the first one. If you do, then you are in for a treat...up to a point. Good enjoyable movie which I will watch again. Not sure how the younger generation will feel if they have not watched the original first.

Pete "Maverick" Mitchell is a high reputed Captain, could've been a Senator like his mate Iceman who recruits him to lead this mission. The movie is very clear with what it is, and not trying to hard to overdo things. The characters are interesting, and Tom Cruise is phenomenal. The dogfights, the BGM adds to the already thrilling movie experience. A must watch.

reviews.review_title: It feels like Top Gun is reborn again
reviews.content: The original Top Gun came out in the year I was born.This is my first review and I have to say this is the movie that caught me the most in the last years.It made me exclaim in joy, frustration and rage.It is a seamless continuation to the first movie and the feelings it captured.The struggle of Maverick is still the same and he still is that rogue character we got to know and love from the first movie.It is great to see that he still struggles with the loss of Goose and the responsibilities he took for Rooster in the continuation.Every one who liked the first movie will love this one and won't be able to resist the urge to feel this movie down to their bones.
What a marvelous movie. Great story line, best acting and awesome sound track. Tom Cruise is the main attraction. Its amazing how he pulls out this character with less efforts.

reviews.review_title: Viva Tom Cruise! Viva! We are all unworthy.
reviews.content: Movie Review (no spoilers)Welp. My 18 year old son Eli & I went to see Top Gun - Maverick this evening. We were hotly anticipating it. Heck, I even watched the original Top Gun over the weekend in preparation. To say that I have been anxiously awaiting this, or, that I have been anticipating this to be "THE movie" of 2022 is an understatement.So, the question is: "How was it?"Hmmm. How should I put it?Well, to start with, I won't tell you whether or not I cried. No, you'd just laugh at me anyway, like Eli does when I cry in movies. No, I won't tell you whether I cried (or how many times). Instead, I'll tell you that Eli cried. Twice.How about the action? I'll refer you to the King-Schreifels article published earlier today in The Ringer. I'm serious - if you're planning on seeing this movie, that article is a must-read background piece to help you understand what you've watching. The TLDR is that Tom Cruise insisted that this movie have no CGI and no green screen shots of the fighter jets. This is the real thing, and it is adrenaline pounding, tension building, fingernails-clutching-the-seat-handles, get your heart pumping movie.How does it compare to other movies? Did Eli & I enjoy this? How can I best describe it? Let me say this: I'm filing a formal complaint against IMDB and considering even filing a lawsuit. You see, when I went to rate this movie, IMDB disallowed me from giving it the proper rating that it deserves. Oh sure, IMDB would allow me to give it a measly "10 stars" but that does not do this movie justice. It needs not 10, not 11, but 12 stars to do it justice.On that note, I've made a decision. I'm cancelling Netflix, Paramount +, HBO Max, and Amazon Prime. We have no more need of them. I'll also be purging my Vudu library of all movies except for Top Gun, and soon, of course, Top Gun - Maverick. I *might* consider keeping other Tom Cruise movies, simply out of respect for The Master.From now, every time I'm tempted to watch hot garbage like Braveheart, Gladiator, or The Dark Knight, I'll be watching Top Gun - Maverick instead. No doubt you're asking yourselves "What about The Godfather or The Shawshank Redemption??" Pshaw. There is no longer any need for watching those poorly made pieces of trash. The Shining or Avengers: Endgame? No! Disgusting! NO!!! Nothing else is worthy when you have an opportunity to watch Top Gun - Maverick.Thank you, Josiah, my 22 year old son, for suggesting that I purchase an AMC A+ pass. It will allow me to see Top Gun - Maverick for free multiple times this summer.Now the only remaining question is, will your mother still love me if I go to see it every single day all summer?Oh, and, finally, I suggest watching it in IMAX. It was shot with made-special-for-this-movie IMAX cameras.Viva Tom Cruise! Viva! We are all unworthy.

Top gun maverick is everything you could ask for out of a sequel. It is definitely a movie to experience in theaters. It contains a lot of nostalgia without relying on it to be a good movie. The movie and the action are all top tier.

The movie easily entertains us and considering that many of the movies that are made many years after the release of the first movie aren't successful, they did a great job making this one. Many people may judge me for this but I thought the movie was way too predictable. But congratulations for everyone involved on it and of course, it was nostalgic to see Captain Pete Mitchell on action again.

reviews.review_title: Outstanding sequel that doesn't get boring - watch it in 4DX if you can
reviews.content: Guys, what can I say? I have already watched the movie 3 times within 1 week and the movie just doesn't get boring.If you are wondering if you should watch the movie in 4DX? I can only tell you that it makes the movie even better. This is THE ultimate cinema experience. Everything was just perfectly tuned. You literally fly with Maverick.Top Gun: Maverick is an action film about the elite in the air. Nevertheless, there is this romance that gives the film life and an indescribably harmonious note that, in the end, one can only be glad that there are still people who want to AND can produce films for the cinema like this one.I haven't seen anything better in the last 20 years, let alone felt for a movie. 10/10Good day!

What a great heart warming story with great acting, great cinematography, fun to watch, great flash backs, no racism, no mixed sex issues, no foul language...just a great old fashion movie. I wish there were more like it. Tom C was fantastic! Loved it!!! Plus seeing it on the big screen was awesome too! Call me old fashion, but it was GREAT! PS - The theatre was packed.
The main mission is the same thing from Star Wars IV. They have to go through a narrow canyon, then shoot a torpedo into a very small space, and finally make it out alive before they die.

If there has ever been a film in history that nails character acs, nostalgic throw backs and a polished story line then TOP GUN MAVERICK is it!What a blast to the past with continual throw backs and OMG I remember that house, that bar, that bike, the F14! Holly crap moments! I'm only 30 and I feel like I've been waiting for this movie for 36 years, admittedly I have always been concerned with if or how they'd manage to pull it off, but the have in a truly spectacular way!Cannot wait to see it again, this is film of the year, film of the decade and film of the 2000's for me!LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE IT!

reviews.review_title: Three decent actors with a ton of C-listers
reviews.content: A great film should have three pillars to hold up to:A solid plotGreat actingAmazing productionSure, there is no doubt in anyone's mind that the production was there on such an expensive movie. But whatever amount of money was spent on special effects, real life fighter jet footage and scenery.....the ball was completely dropped on 90% of the supporting cast the Director forgot to connect the audience to.The other Top Gun pilots, bless their hearts, they tried. But they should have been kept in the Hallmark movie realm and not brought into a summer blockbuster alongside Tom Cruise. Will you care where this crew of Top Gun cadets are in 10 years? Nope, and neither will I. Nobody is knocking Cruise, Ed Harris and Jon Hamm....all of them do end up saving the movie somewhat from ending up in the dust bins of the $2.99 DVD's at your local gas station in a few years.The groupthink on this has been pretty annoying too. Post a take like this on social media and you get ripped apart. I'm just glad I was able to see other 3-star reviews here on IMDB that felt exactly the way I did. The campy plot, the Star Wars ripoff scene where they show how exactly the target will be hit, and every other cringe-worthy bits of bad acting, glaring plot holes and all around disappointment.I have no interest in ever seeing this movie again. Sad because I loved Top Gun growing up and have easily watched it 100 times. I wanted so badly to see that blockbusters were back post-pandemic, they could be well rounded, have some superior acting and even few plot holes. Sadly, there are few redeeming qualities to bring me back to this. I'm thankful I didn't drop $30 on this with my SO in the theatres.... I think I would have been rightfully pissed off. $2 Redbox on a Saturday night was enough for me to say "never again".I.

I didn't think it would be too great at first. Before interval it was good, but after the interval i was sooooo immeresed in it after a long time. It was breathtaking. I was shocked to see such pace gained by the movie after interval. I was a little bit disappointed that I didn't get to see the hand clap thet Maverick and Goose do in the first movie - Top Gun(1986)

This movie is everything one truly fan can desire. From breathtaking flight scenes, amazing soundtrack, unpredictable plot.. all the way to the amazing third act and a lots of other hidden gems.While sticking to its roots, this movie brings so much more. Everything that this movie represents fits in so perfectly together. I watched it yesterday, and I can't wait to see it again.For me, watching again the first movie will be now a much different experience. Better, for sure...

reviews.review_title: I was like a kid in a candy store the entire time!
reviews.content: Okay, let me start by saying I'm young, in my early 20s so I didn't see the original Top Gun when it came out. That didn't stop me from watching the original at least 100 times from childhood to now. I grew up with the original, that's for sure. Between Top Gun and the various video games about jets, I LOVED everything about it.Fast forward to about a year or so ago, when the Top Gun: Maverick trailer first hit the big screen, my eyes widened and my mouth flew open I was so excited. I had a stupid smile on my face the whole time that trailer was on screen. Now, the sequel is out and I can say without a doubt it was EXACTLY what I was expecting and blew past that line going mach 10. It played beautifully into the original, continuing the stories of Maverick and Goose, each in their own special ways. With almost 40 years passing since the original, and the technology that came along with it, they made an absolute masterpiece of a movie that will be sure to please anyone who loved the original. I know I was grinning like a fool for most of that movie, and when I wasn't, I was gripping my seat with anticipation. I'm going to see it again soon, that's for sure.

reviews.review_title: Increadably enjoyable although defenitly not true cinema
reviews.content: I recently went to watch the new top gun movie with some friends and below is what I thought. I thought the new top gun film (top gun maverick) was a very enjoyable film, the characters were good, the chemistry was quite good and the acting was alright for tom cruise. However, it is not true cinema. True cinema is stuff like Martin Scorsese, Stanley Kubrick and so on. Overall the film was enjoyable but should not go down in history as a masterpiece. Looking at the reviews now, I think the film is a little overated but definitely worth a watch.

reviews.review_title: Really Good, but like Original Better
reviews.content: Top Gun the original in 1986 was one of my all-time favorites. Maybe, it was because I was a Senior in high school at the time. I really liked the actors in the original and I am glad in the new movie several of the characters came back which was a good thing for me. I have always been a fan of Tom Cruise. I just wish they would have made it so Meg Ryan could have been in this movie as well.I really loved the actor they got for Goose's son really looked a lot like him from the original movie. I love that he got to get together with Peggy Benjamin which was just mentioned in the original since Pete's original fling in the 1st one couldn't be in this one.

With the original being incredibly iconic and a movie we all love, this is the sequel that we all needed sand although I love the original with all my heart, this may have been better. Not only was the cinematography amazing being that everything was real from the F-18's , to the real G's. Super Awesome's film, very intense, and super action packed. Easy 10/10 in my book!!!

If there's any movie that deserves to be seen in the theaters with big screens and immersive sound, it's definitely Top Gun Maverick.Such a nostalgic experience and movie to what h with friends and family.

Waited for this movie for 2+ years and boy, worth the wait it was! Superb storyline, creates such a magic and pull of the cult classic - superb! And Tom maverick Cruise shows still got a lot in him to give to his fans!!

Before watching the movie, I wasn't expecting much things from the second Top Gun. What a surprise! It was really good. Actually, the scenario was good and well introduced. I was scared that the scenario wouldn't make sense but it does. I can even tell that sometimes, you feel emotive aaaand there is a bit of humor which will make you smile for sure. However, a few things are pretty predictable. But still two good hours at the cinema! Of course, the effects are AMAZING and obviously, you feel the 36 years gap between the two movies haha. A real pleasure for your eyes, but also for your ears with Hans Zimmer's music and some old songs we hear in the first movie. Overall, I really loved it and I recommend it to watch something cool, with action and to have a great time without a headache.

I liked Top Gun from 1986, it's a cult movie and easy to enjoy.Maverick has 3 defects, two of them are medium and one it's huge.Till the moment that Tom Cruise starts to teach, the movie just doesn't work at all, is slow, confusing and it truly doesn't carry the plot. It's just a nightmare.(semi-spoiler) There's no goddamn way that the US Navy would command a mission like that, it's dangerous and bizarre for no reason at all. Who cares if you can destroy the """""enemy"""""" weapons if you expose them that way with 3/4 jets and 8 of your best pilots in their territory?And FINALLY, the most atrocious one. Every single scene with Jennifer Connelly it's absolutely cringing and anti-climatic. Nor that I dislike her or anything. But she and Mavericks look like two dolls trying to impersonate some Harmony book story, it's totally laughable and it really destroys the movie's credibility. There's no passion or chemical, nothing similar to Maverick and Charlie, everything it's bland and patinated.Except for these points, the film it's enjoyable and kinda funny. I loved the piloting scenes, they're really well-made and realistic. The nostalgic elements don't really bother me at all, I think they're just a little homage to the previous episode, trying to bring the attention of the older ones without boring the youth viewers.Tom was good, and his character didn't withered.It's unfortunate that they ruined a decent movie like this just cause of shallow writing.

reviews.review_title: Fell in love with Tom Cruise all over again
reviews.content: Heard the sequel was pretty good. That is such an understatement. This film was absolutely phenomenal! Not a single bad scene, IMO. I remember watching the original at a friend's house when I was probably around 12 years old. Have seen it many times since over the years. I would have called myself a fan of Tom Cruise up until maybe 10-15 years ago. But then reading about his personal life and philosophies kind of turned me off. However, this film...Top Gun: Maverick made me fall in love with his acting all over again. Another reviewer mentioned it brought back memories of childhood, same here buddy!Disclaimer: I'm a career active duty USAF fighter aircraft mechanic. Maintainers and probably pilots will pick apart pieces of the film as technically not realistic or whatever. All I can say is I thoroughly enjoyed every second of this film and I'd be willing to bet my fighter pilot friends did as well. LOVED IT!!!

reviews.review_title: Go See This at the Theatre
reviews.content: I struggled with rating this. I was between a 7 for story and an 8 for experiencing a movie going feeling I haven't had in years. I'm so happy I saw this at the theatre. It does not have as much charm and fun as the original. But, we are all in need of a popcorn big screen event and this delivers. You can tell there was a lot of effort put into the flight scenes which is why you should see it on the big screen. Tom Cruise is THE movie star of the last half century. They somehow made a war movie that stays away from any politics. The casting is great. The audience I saw it with on early access Tuesday made it fun. If you want an escape from the grueling topics of today, I highly recommend going to your local theater. I'd watch this by myself, on a date, or with the family. Go see it just don't set your expectations too high.

reviews.review_title: Best film in all of history
reviews.content: As the title says: Best film in history.They truly delivered: real F-18s, real Gs, real actions, it's like you are inside the cockpit what else can you ask?

I saw the original movie back in the days, I was a teen and it stuck with me since then. Even my nickname in emails, chat etc is maverick. My friends know me for it. You can imagine how long I have been waiting for a worthy sequel. I entered the cinema hall last night with very low expectations and I was completely blown away. The story, the nostalgia, the fighter jet scenes and above all "Maverick". It is simply epic.

reviews.review_title: Best movie I've watched in years
reviews.content: Tom cruise never fails to impress his audience. This was the perfect sequel the the top gun. Everyone must be scared that this movie will ruin the first one but guys trust me it made it so much more better. This also had all the iconic scenes from top gun and was the suspense was very butt clenching. I watched this movie on the second day and I'm dying to watch it again.

Am I the only one that thinks Top Gun Maverick is a let down after a 2 year wait and 36 years between the movies. Too much trying for a movie that only gets going in the last 30 minutes. It became so predictable I almost fell asleep. The original Top Gun is so much better...I thought the acting was bad. I never connected with any of the characters. After 36 years Maverick is still not over Goose.

Pacing, aerial cinematography, characters and cast are all perfect, great visuals have good attention to detail on fast jets (especially in the cockpits) and I forgot to breathe at points. My only minor gripe is how we didn't get enough time to appreciate the real aerial shots compared to the CG shots, and the music wasn't quite up to par with the upbeat guitar and rock of the original.Easily the best film in cinemas this decade, possibly even century for aviation lovers, and an important lesson to directors on rebooting a franchise.

Whole new level of aviation choreography, camera handling and just amazing from start to finish! Watch it in IMAX, please! I can't remember when I watched a movie like this ever, except for Dark Knight maybe with the same thrills walking out of the cinema!
I've missed these kind of movies, it was thrilling, emotional and a bit of romance on it. It's just a really great movie and I hope to see another sequel.

Didn't know what to expect, The original TopGun was one of the best movies of the 80. When i first heard that a sequel was coming almost 40 year later, It sounded ridiculous and i was sure it would be a failure. I WAS SO WRONG.......

reviews.review_title: This proved how a real good movie should be made
reviews.content: It filled that void I have been longing to see in films. The casts and production team are all amazing and graceful. It is action-packed, exhilarating, nostalgic, tearjerker and a remarkable work of art.
Heart pounding, emotional rollercoaster of a movie. Awesome story line and plot. Packed with action that doesn't take away from the story, only adds to it. Beautifully written. Amazing acting.

reviews.review_title: A MUST WATCH TO ALL THE AVIATION AND TOM CRUISE LOVERS!!
reviews.content: Then best movie this year for sure. Watched it twice at the movie theaters . Amazing performance by Sir Tom Cruise and Team, the best part in the movie was the movie itself. I created an IMDB Account just for rating this wonderful piece of art. The expressions in the actors face was damn real. The entire movie as usual was brought up by Tom! Thank you Top Gun Universe. Loved the entire movie.

reviews.review_title: The ending was kind of depressing plus the music felt depressing, would have been better if is had some better soundtracks like the prequel like some heavy metal
reviews.content: The 1st one in my opinion is better than this one it's ending is the problem. I would have given a 10 if it had mighty wings in the end instead of hold my hand. So has maverick just given up like no job no nothing ? No navel aveation. Another bug problem was lesser dog fights what the older one and plus there was not top gun in the movie like he was just training top gun graduates i thought he would train them in top gun and plus there were almost no navel aveation scenes and almost no danger zone and no mighty wings. I was excited for this one but everytime I think about it. It makes me feel sad.

Top Gun: Maverick, a remake of the original Top Gun with the added bonus of Star Wars: Episode IV.Cool modern warplanes, a P-51, and Porsche 911 are the extent of what's good.We're treated to the rehashes of Goose, I mean Rooster, playing piano in a bar signing "You've Lost That Loving Feeling", Mav speeding down a road on his bike while a plane takes off in the distance, and shirtless aviators playing on the beach.But for me the greatest issue is how the Navy is portrayed and the stupidity of the mission. On multiple occasions aviators simply disobey orders with no repercussions. An example is Rooster being ordered to return to ship but instead attempts to rescue Mav resulting in being shot down. Or Maverick being grounded and yet procuring a plane and flying.The mission itself is ludicrous. For some reason the U. S. doesn't want to use pilotless aircraft or missiles. So, the planes must fly under radar really, really fast to avoid detection. However, right before the attack a massive Tomahawk missile attack blasts the nearby airfield but not any of the SAM sites. There also was no plan as to rescuing any aviator who might be shot down or providing any combat air patrol for protection if enemy bandits should appear.I would increase my rating to five stars for anyone who has not seen the original but as a companion to Top Gun is thing is bad.

In my country Greece we call such movies "Americania". In other words "too much USA stuff". Nevertheless the flight scenes and combat shots were well done. Tom Cruise knows how a blockbuster is made and Jennifer Connelly is one of my favorite actress. That is the good points of the movie. The bad ones (or some of those) are that the film is too predictable, it's longer than needed, it's getting boring when no action takes place and you can skip some parts without losing the story continuity.If you are a Tom Cruise fan (really why this guy don't get older) or you like military stuff then you can go ahead and watch it. You might easily forget it but you won't regret your time or your money.

reviews.review_title: This is how you make a sequel
reviews.content: As omeone who really enjoyed the original Top Gun and ken that a sequel was in the works, i had fairly high expectatations, but what i got was much higher than any expectation, first of all i like how the movie acknowledged the world and military chagned in the 30+ years since the first movie and how Maverick fits in all of this, it's a movie that first of all respect the intelgence of it's viewers, beautifuly shot and with a lot of cool sunts, always reminding you of the risks and cost,of failure, it gives closure to a lot of topics of the orignal film and at the same time expanding a lot of topics, sound design is also amazing, it's worth watching in Atmos for that extra immersion, it's a worthy sequel for the original Top Gun while being a movie of it's own, this a movie that proofs that going to the cnimea is still an unique experince.

reviews.review_title: One of the best movies I have ever seen
reviews.content: I saw this movie before it officially came out to regular theaters, and my god that movie blew my mind away. The entire movie my eyes were wide open and I was griping the arm rests of my chair, the movie was absolutely incredible. I love the first movie, and to be honest, in some ways, this movie was even better than the first.I recommend this movie to anyone who loves action packed scenes and moments that will blow your mind.I have never made a review before on IMDb, however this movie was so good I just had to leave it 10 stars. Incredible movie.

reviews.review_title: If you already liked the first part, you will love the second part more than anything!
reviews.content: Just unbelievable!Still a little dazed from all the adrenaline, you leave the cinema with a big smile after this film.For the first time in my life I tried a D-Box chair in the cinema and it was the most sensible extra I have ever paid. At every point of the film, appropriate movements were generated synchronously with the film! This creates the impression that you are sitting in the cockpit of the jet and actually flying it. But you don't have to worry, because the movements were only used when it really made sense... Quiet and romantic scenes were mostly without movement and the flight scenes even more so. This film has everything you would expect from an absolutely terrific film; Action, love, wit, twists, drama, suspense, sadness and joy. Actually, I would describe myself as a very big Star Trek fan who would hate to admit that another film is actually better. But after this film I know better. This flick tops everything I've ever seen.It was definitely the best cinematic experience I've ever had!

reviews.review_title: The best sequel in a decade
reviews.content: Finally a director and producer that understands what makes a great movie. My opinion is one of Tom Cruises best movies. Wonderful story, love the beginning it has a throw back to the original. I thought the casting was awesome. Must see movie!!

The movie was great. The errors regarding the military, specifically the Navy, were distracting and disappointing. Besides covers (hats) not being worn outside, the Marines would NOT provide Funeral Honors for a Navy admiral. If you are going to make a movie about the Military, it is important to learn/follow military customs, rules, requirements.Great job with Val Kilmer's role. He's still sexy. Been my "free pass" since "Willow."

"Top Gun: Maverick" was enjoyable, but predictable. With borrowed lines, music, character arcs, and plot devices from the original "Top Gun" film, "Top Gun: Maverick" was heavy handed with its nostalgia. The flight sequences were an adrenaline rush for sure and the in-flight camera work was impeccable. However, the film seemed more like a reboot of the original with a new mission for the next generation and just another opportunity for Tom Cruise to show-off. I was really looking forward to this film, but came away feeling disappointed.

Very rarely is their a sequel as good as an original or in some ways better. This and T2 come to mind. Saw in 4DX and was not disappointed. This is why we pay and go to the cinema. It was well worth the 30 year wait! My only gripes with the movie were the survival of Maverick after his test plane explodes at Mach 10. I find it hard to believe you'd eject and survive that, and the Tomcat taking off on such a short runway (minus a carrier catapult) were my only 2 major gripes. But it's a movie after all and I loved every minute of it. Can't wait to see it again. Hollywood take note!

reviews.review_title: Amazing film with even better action.
reviews.content: Top gun: Maverick is a cinema masterpiece. It finds the perfect balance of action sequences and character development. The action is exciting and meaningful, it does not fall victim in the way many films do by overdoing the action with new technology, rather focuses on making it realistic and delivering it in a way that suits the film. The action in the film, of which there is a lot, is a complement to the overarching plot and does not hold the plot up on its own. The way the film carefully constructs relationships among characters allows for a compelling dynamic and for the audience to care about the characters. The acting is superb with an excellent casting selection. The way the film weaves in a love story without making it feel redundant or unmeaning-full is impressive, and it tremendously benefits the film by providing balance and a time for the audience to relax. Each part of the film felt distinguished and each part was exciting in its own way. The exposition was creative in the way the character was introduced, as it allowed the audience to rather than be told about Maverick by watching him in action, pushing himself to the limits and never giving up. What I would consider key parts of the character's identity. This method of delivering information about Maverick is exciting in comparison to many expositions which often focus on learning about the character in a past tense. The 3rd act had me on the edge of my seat the entire time, managing to stray from typical endings and give the audience something fresh and unpredictable. Complementing the fantastic plot and characters, the cinematography is breathtaking. From the first scene which utilizes creative shots to give the film a fresh feel about it, to the end action scenes which are beautifully captured in a way which lets the audience clearly understand what is going on. The action is captured so clearly it leaves no room for conclusion and makes the whole film flow perfectly. In conclusion Top Gun: Maverick was an unbelievable film, comprised of an amazing cast and inspiringly written. It uses creative cinematography to capture the breathtaking action sequences without feeling unrealistic, it is certainly one of the all time greatest action films.
Exciting from the first minute. This movie brings us the best of war aviation with the maximum adrenaline possible. I would see it a thousand times just like the first one.

Ok so my friend just told me that this movie is overrated so I came here to give THE movie 10/10 just to irritate him. On a serious note tough I really enjoyed the movie and Tom Cruise really makes a great appearance!

My new favorite movie of all time!! Everything about it is amazing. It will be a new classic. Had me on the edge of my seat most of the movie. The soundtrack was great as well. If I could rate it higher I would.

reviews.review_title: Great movie, had fun watching it
reviews.content: Even though not watching the first movie, i had a great time watching it. It did not have big connection to the first movie, there were some about the characters stories that i understood after watching the first movie. I recommend it will be worth your time.

This is the review I gave ;If you have an IMAX theater, go see it on that. I saw it on both different screens. The flat screen I saw first. It's awesome. On the IMAX screen, you get chills going down your back when the jets take off. The first time he takes off in the stealth it was so intense I almost peed my pants. I got a rush like I have never felt before in a movie setting. Ithough it was much better than the first. Obviously the dog fight scenes are absolutely better. It was the story and how they tied the first movie in with this. I liked this because it wasn't about the sex appeal of the characters. It was not aimed that way. The characters played age appropriate roles. Many movies have either entertainment value or a good story line. Not usually both. This has both..you feel your adrenaline rushing as the planes take off.. I just re saw the first one again.the second one has more of story behing it. The way they tie the first and second togwas done so well. I would recommend this to anybody who has dreams of flying. I would go see this. Tom cruise never ages and is fantastic.

I'm writing this literally 30 minutes after coming back from the theatre. No other movie has left me in such an awe, but, I might be a little biased too because I was REALLY looking forward to it, worrying that it would disappoint me somewhere.The movie accomplished absolutely everything it set out to do. I loved how well they tied everything with the first movie.I believe I experienced every emotion possible during these 2 hours. Simply magnificent, well done everyone!

reviews.review_title: Top Gun brings out the big guns and pays tribute to the past
reviews.content: As a person who really enjoyed the first film the sequel was a long time coming. It is often the case such a long wait fails to meet expectation but this was simply a masterpiece.It had sentiment paying homage to the original and joined up the past with the present. Well acted, well scripted and enough action to keep you engaged.For those old enough to have gone to the cinema on the first release of Top Gun 36 years ago you can relate to an ageing pilot who sees his vocation not as what he does but who he is. Being sent back to Top Gun to train the new generation of the best of the best for a mission we see there is life in the old dog yet.There is still scope here for another movie with a good enough script. Great tribute to past characters and the great Tony Scott who was instrumental to the success of the first film.Now go watch and enjoy the drama, action and sentimentality.

reviews.review_title: Tom Cruise goes on and on
reviews.content: The best sequel I have seen till now. The production was out of the world. It literary feels like you're in the cockpit of fighter jett. The top gun from 80's was little bit cheesy for me but Josep Kosinski just madr it like old wine, the flavour of 80's but very much modern movie.
The movie is like all the good action movies of the eighties, action, drama, challenge and a little bit of humor, the scenes of battle flight are amazing...

reviews.review_title: Great action film.....a lot of questions though !
reviews.content: After at long last watching the movie yesterday ( immediately after watching the original on DVD) I felt some sense of disappointment at just how much "cheesyness" I noticed. Don't get me wrong I enjoyed the film overall but ( as a ex aircraft maintenance tech) i found myself asking questions far too often . How do you eject out of aircraft travelling at mach 10 and not die....or at the very least suffer spine compression ? Why didn't the 2 dozen cruise missiles launched at the airfield instead target the main target in the mountain ? Why didn't Rooster remove his ejector seat safety pins before declaring the seat had "malfunctioned" when he needed to bang out? Why did Pete keep asking Goose to talk to him constantly ? A few other annoying gaffs I could mention but as I said, overall , a good old gung ho romp with plenty of American Hoo Raa moments to split up the excellent flying scenes . 8/10.

reviews.review_title: Shallow old style action movie made with new cinema shooting possibilities
reviews.content: This film indeed brings the spirit of action movies from 80's and 90's with shallow stories, tearful moments, fictional technology achievements and the mandatory happy ending with epic fanfares. I thought this style is far in the past but looks like 40-50 years old folks feel nostalgic about it. That's exactly the audience for this film: fans from the past. The rating should be the same as the old movie.

Avid original Top Gun fans won't be disappointed with Top Gun: Maverick. Action, suspense and awesome flying. Loved every minute. Loved all the references that only true lovers of the original will understand. Will be seeing a few more times.

reviews.review_title: The best action movie EVER. Ever? EVER!
reviews.content: I am 43, and after all the action movies i have seen, this is the best. Edge of my seat action, gorgeous views, great rock solid acting, right amount mix of drama, hope and awesomeness.Ps... watching it with home cinema dolby atmos or 5.1 setup takes you to another world with this movie. And preferably a kick ass tv too.Nonetheless, a 10. A breath of fresh air in a world where extreme left wokeness kills the movies and tv shows with its political extreme left agenda. But none of it here, thank god!!!!!!!

I was 15 years old when I saw Top Gun. It was a good movie. I'm not a huge fan of Tom Cruise. Never have been. Just saw Top Gun: Maverick. My first thought when it ended was: THAT'S how a movie should be made! Go see it. You will not be disappointed.
Absolutely the best movie of the year. Everything with this movie it's amazing i would say its the best movie of Tom Cruise. Everybody should watch it on Imax.

All the pilots in the Movie were wearing Captain Bars, which in the NAVY is a Lieutenant, yet they were all called Captains.
