To be a Captain in the Navy, you would have to have Colonel bars.I didn't see anyone that picked up on it.Otherwise, I loved the Special effects, and who cares if the stunts aren't real, it's Hollywood magic. The stunts were great.I never knew who Penny really was. I wish they went into more detail. I thought they would bring back the Kelly McGillis character , but they didn'tLoved the World War II war bird, he was working on, that was a real airplane, though it could not complete with Modern war birds today.

An inspirational masterpiece that could remind me of my childhood dream! When I was a kid, I wanted to become a fighter pilot, which is unfortunately forbidden for females in the country where I was born. So, I couldn't help but cry through the flying scenes because I finally got to experience being inside a fighter plane. I deeply appreciate that the movie creates such a feeling in the audience.Moreover, the storyline and the camera work perfectly indicate the precision behind every take. The thoughts and dedication to the details are beyond perfect.And this is how Tom Cruise ruined the other movies for me! :)

reviews.review_title: Best of the Best last few years
reviews.content: Definitely worth going to the theaters more than once. Worth purchasing on Amazon before it goes to Paramount+. Casted filled the roles nicely and the story was a perfect fit for the Maverick character. Definition of Box Office Blockbuster.
Was expecting more. The movie is fun, but otherwise quite cheesy and unbelievable. Like a Disney movie in a way. Didn't buy the romance, nor the rescue.

I just watched this movie and this is 100% hands down the best movie I've watched in yearssss, 10000/10 watch that movie NOWWW, greatest movie everrrr. Tom cruise has an astonishing role in this movie and the entire cast did amazing, showing true skill and dedication to each role, maverick has brought so much inspiration into me and honestly makes me want to go into the Air Force😂but all seriousness aside this was a really great movie and I recommend anyone that has the time to go watch this movie ASAP and experience this for yourself. Bring as many people you can so everyone you know can experience this, I will repeat this time and time again best movie of the 21st century, tom cruise looking beautiful as always, bringing a breath taking performance onto the screen for everyone to experience.

reviews.review_title: Definitely watchable even if you haven't watched the previous Top Gun
reviews.content: I didn't watch it in the theatre as I expected it to be another run of the mill boring action movie that is being sold off as entertainment these days but I have to admit that I was wrong about this one and regret not watching it before. The movie is as advertised gripping and inspiring with great audio and visual effects. Tom Cruise is one of the few actors left in Hollywood whose movies can be watched without feeling disappointed afterwards. Every actor in the movie plays their character very well including Jon Hamm and Miles Teller. The plot was interesting with exciting twists and turns and appropriate dose of nostalgia along the course. The only part I didn't like is that they didn't name the enemy country in the movie but that is understandable considering the current climate and yet the movie does not lose it's overall appeal. I would definitely recommend a watch for anyone seeking excitement and thrill from a movie.

Not gonna lie, there were a number of times during this film that I couldn't help but smile. It really does pay homage to the original in a number of ways. There are quite a few nods to the classic original and it most certainly felt like Top Gun. The action is very edge of the seat and caractersd are not to bloated for the type of film that that it is. My only complaint is the lack of use of a good soundtrack, they really should have used more of the original soundtrack to bring it all together as the current was mostly lackluster. That said, the film itself was rather enjoyable and as a fan of the original I'm happy to consider it a worthy sequal.

This film tells the story of pilot ace Maverick (Tom Cruise), who is apprenticed to the best pilots of his generation to complete a mission of a particularly difficult level.Joseph Kosinski is on my list of favorite directors and in this film with a set of actors, he definitely did not fail. Since he already had experience in many films with Tom Cruise, it was his best decision for this film. The blockbuster film which has not been on the screens of our cinemas for a long time is very distinguished. Joseph in my opinion wanted to rewrite this storyline with a good script and not lose the action. I think he did great.Every actor has his place. Lieutenant Bradley (Miles Teller) was especially distinguished for me. He well felt his hero who lost his father and perfectly conveyed the whole picture to the audience. In terms of aerial photography, the film was a success. This is especially felt on the screens of large cinemas, every turn of the fighter makes you empathize and turn your head for it, and in moments of overload, the pilots themselves seem to stop breathing.The film definitely appeared in the list of my favorite action films, but it is worth noting that it is necessary to watch it on the big screen, as the sound and effects are transferred there much better.

I thought this movie was very good
The beach scene had to be one of my favourites with the song it just felt so good. I must have watched the movie about 6 times watching it right now. All of my family love it to. Plus's there is so many nostalgic scenes with goose involved in it. When Rooster says talk to me dad broke my heart because it reminds me of when goose actually did die very sad moment by the way.Another of my favourite parts is the dog fight at the end when hangman came in and saved the day then they all got back safely.Also when Rooster came in and saved maverick from the helicopter shooting at him.

reviews.review_title: What a most craziest ride ever!
reviews.content: I FEEL THE NEED, THE NEED FOR SPEED IN THE DANGER ZONE!!! God, I been always want to see this since 2019 when the first trailer came out and I thought, "I want to go see this incredible movie and seeing an Tom Cruise movie in theaters. Saw this four freakin times in theaters and had a blast! This is has been one of the most greatest movie ever made with Tom Cruise as Maverick! Love the jets being real and not doing CGI, and really great characters and great plot where we left off since the first film! I never stop loving this movie. This will always be one of the greatest movie ever in the world!!!

As I write, Top Gun: Maverick has a rating of 8.6 whereas the original movie has a rating of 6.9. So, the collective wisdom of iMDBers is that this spin-off (it would be a stretch to call it a sequel) is better than the original. Better than one of the most iconic movies of all time? Does that sound right to you?Let's explore that. I recall a critic - I think Lindsay Ellis - noting that, "once you understand that Top Gun is a sports movie, everything makes sense." And of course she was right. Top Gun deserves to be judged not against Saving Private Ryan or Platoon, but against Bull Durham and (particularly) Escape to Victory.So, when I sat down to watch Maverick, I was expecting Rocky II - only set in the National Fighter-plane League. What I got instead was a quest movie. Cruise seemed to be playing some kind of Aragorn/Gandalf character - leading some mostly-indistinguishable Hobbits/Dwarves/Top Gun graduates to Mordor where they were to roll inverted, start their descent into the cracks of Mount Doom and fire laser-guided munitions at Sauron's uranium enrichment plant. And at the end, Cruise flew off into the Grey Havens with Penny Benjamin in a P51-D, leaving Samwise Goose in Fallon Naval Air Station where he would be elected as Mayor seven times. Or something.And that, for me, is a problem. I love a good quest movie. But the first movie was about Cruise's cheeky grin, Kilmer strutting like a rooster, bumping your head, shagging your teacher and winning the fighter plane cup. Top Gun: Maverick has none of that. It's got fighter planes in it, but other than that it has nothing in common with the original. It's not even of the same genre.Talking of fighter planes, the real star of the original was not Cruise, but the F-14. It's a spectacularly beautiful aircraft, but more importantly it can act. A sweep of the swing wing is as iconic as Roger Moore raising quizzical eyebrow. And as technically proficient as FA-18 is, its acting vocabulary consists of engaging and disengaging after-burner. That's fine as far as it goes, but it doesn't go very far. The FA-18 it lacks star quality.All in all, Top Gun: Maverick is fine. It's just fine. Visually stunning. I enjoyed it. But as no point did it make me grin from ear to ear like the original still does today.I am a devotee of the original movie - to the point that I reckon I could recite the entire script off by heart. And here's the thing: in thirty-six years time, there'll be nobody out there that can recite the entire script of Maverick. Or even think of memorable quote. Or at least not one that isn't directly lifted from it's infinitely superior original. Better than the original? Donnez moi une break.

Maybe I haven't read enough reviews, but I find it remarkable that not one of them that I've read talks about the parallel in the climactic scene of this film with the analogous scene in Star Wars Episode 4 -- Skywalker's attack on the Death Star. Maverick didn't have TIE fighters on his tail, but it's otherwise almost identical, down to the display on the HUD. Far as I'm concerned, Luke's got nothing on Maverick. Really enjoyed the film, even though it's summertime popcorn fare and I'm seeing it for the first time in the dead of winter. I'd agree with other reviewers here that it's better than the original. Cruise can feel the force....

This was an entertaining, theater film worth seeing "for old time's sake" despite its cringe-worthy acting, script and plot. Outstanding action scenes, well filmed there. The sailing scene was fun. Tom Cruise wasn't doing anything new but he's good and I like him. Like eating an In N Out burger. You don't expect fusion or intrigue, but it's still good every time.Shots of text message convos are poor cinematography. Panning over the photo of Mav and Iceman about six times is wasted space. Cliche shots abound. Character expressions and personalities are canned and might as well be CGI. "Dad and 'son' wrenching together" shot made me cringe-how cheesy can you get? There are countless scenes like this. Are we in the zombie apocalypse that so few others seemed to notice this? I watched this again with my wife recently and she, not a movie aficionado, cringed outwardly, without my prompting.Looping back around to the positives: no political agendas! Tom Cruise, way to go, you've brought all of America together around a movie by not clobbering viewers with divisive agendas. That alone brought this film from 5 to 7 stars. Hollywood take note. A distinctly subpar, cliche movie got ridiculously high ratings, and one of the primary reasons was that it united people instead of dividing them.But let's be clear. The original was groundbreaking. I'm in my thirties and I'm saying that. Top Gun: Maverick was like a nice daydream.

reviews.review_title: Overall good movie, but hoped for more flying scenes
reviews.content: I've just gotten out of the theatre and overall it's a good movie, but i would have hoped to have more flying scenes. The training flights for the mission were in my view a bit too short, only showing that Maverick hits target after target. I wished it would have a been a bit longer like the scene in the first movie with Maverick and Viper.The acting was good overall, maybe a third movie could be done with Rooster, Hangman and the rest of the gang being teachers at Top Gun.
Didn't think it was that good. They rip off most of A New Hope. Someone needs to do a mash up of this and episode 4.Not to mention how much they just riff off the original.

Really did not expect it to be that good.Great movie .I have to give 150 characters at least so...
the first movie was really good but this one is levels beyond it.

First of all, let me say this is my 1st ever review on IMDb... Absolutely one of the best theatrical experience's I've ever had! Perhaps my best ever! Perfectly casted. Beautifully written. And the cinematography was, well, literally breathtaking. The original Top Gun (1986) was classic. Top Gun: Maverick for me was, freaking LEGENDARY. To answer your question, "Did Maverick live up to the hype?" Umm...an understatement.

Like a lot of Gen Xer's, I was captivated and enthralled by the original. This had a lot to live up to, and some big shoes to fill. It did not disappoint. Just like the original, the viewer is immersed in spinning, plummeting scenes filled with action, tension and a bit of humor peppered in. Tom Cruise is at his best, and like all his movies, throws his heart and soul into the production. No longer the young, cocky colt, he is now the experienced stallion who teaches and leads the herd of wild pilots fearlessly and selflessly. In the first movie, his character was confident to a fault, taking risks for his own ego and chasing the ghost of his father. Now, we see him matured, wise and still full of amazing feats. With only one ghost from his past to face, he is the epitome of the hero's journey come full circle.I wasn't sure about the storyline at first, but it does commit to closure and yet continue the legacy of canon.Val's role is tear jerking and genuine.Bravo, this is what we were aching for to arrive. Even though we streamed this at home, we found ourselves clapping with joy at the end credits. A sequel is difficult to master, but this is polished, worthy of the original, and a true gift from Tom Cruise.
It is not bad but it is totally Star Wars. "We have to shoot an impossibly tiny target after navigating a treacherous pathway through heavily guarded bad guy territory ." What more can I say?

This is my first ever review on IMDB. I'm just gonna say, PLEASE see this movie in theatres and even better, in IMAX. As fan of top gun, this is more than you are expecting. Truly an incredible movie.

In the scene Rooster was doing the push up with Hondo standing aside, a F-18 in the background shows number "501" in the nose area. Then Hondo told Rooster to stop self punishment, after the angle switch back to push up, the number in that F-18 changes to "410".
The movie had everything you were hoping it to have. Good slice of Americana. Much appreciated the amount of effort to film it in the real planes and not do cgi.
Perfect in every way, the only thing I can fault is Lady Gayá's song at the end. Respected the previous film, acting was great.. and the flying scenes were breathtaking.

We'll have to say it was better then expected, I'm not a fan of Tom but he played his part well ( even though he probably demanded all the screen time)
Plot was as expected but so good to just see the jets, I do recommend but as my partner said Tom to egotistic to die lol.

I'm giving it seven for the story and one for the stunning aerial scenes. The sequel is better than the original, but nothing special. There is a lot of clichés, borrowed from other movies, including the mission scene that imitates Star Wars. The acting is mediocre, and I found Tom Cruise's pitch black hair, very distracting. Jon Hamm who looks younger than Tom has signs of grey hair to suit his age but Tom looks like an ageing old man trying to look like one of his students.It's a good popcorn movie especially for the visual effects but the story and acting is flat. Would I watch it again? No!

reviews.review_title: So many great memories of the original
reviews.content: Very few films with sequels where it's as good as our better than the first film. This one nailed it. Was great to see young actors taking up roles to the then young actors from 1986. Loved the fact that Iceman was included in the story line again!

reviews.review_title: Commercial version of classic " Dam busters"
reviews.content: This is actually a commercial version of 1955's classic " Dam busters". That was based on real events but this is just an action flick with commercial story line. Which we as viewers accepts even if script is not fully convincing. This has got Tom cruise, his action, his charm ( which still exists ) & what you need. Dam buster was made beyond its time. It is still equally watchable considering that times technology. A Great War movie. This is rather not classified as war since no war time is reffered. A regular action thriller with big budget & star cast. One time watch for old sake. It will not bore you but it is also not a special one!
I loved the movie. The acting is outstanding and the buildup is good. A good balance between action and other moments. Miles Teller does it again, what a great actor that is.
